first tome volume paraphrase erasmus vpon newe testamente enpriented london fletestrete signe sunne edwarde whitchurche last daie ianuarie anno domini cum priuilegio regali ad imprimendum solum ew moste puissaunt prince moste redoubted soueraigne lord edward sixthe grace god king englande fraunce irelande defendour faith yearth next immediatly vnder god church englande irelande supreme head moste humble louyng obedient subiecte nicolas udal wisheth al grace peace god long thesame moste prosperous reigne ouer v honour health condigne felicitie moste noble moste worthie soueraigne myght basse simple persone appeare small presumpcion write vnto emperiall maiestie cause publique gratulacions iust greate manne euer bee hauyng occasion wryte maye thynke hymselfe voyde cryme shoulde omytte declare testifie vnestimable comforte ioye whiche vniuersall moste louyng obedient subiectes daily doe take maiesties singuler good procedinges excellent towardnesse ye space many yeres vntil pleased goodnesse god sende vnto v earneste prayer englande might haue prynce tyme natiuitie whan god gracyously heard peticions eftsons prayed ye myght haue grace folowe godly steppe proceadynges moste noble father euerye man seeth nowe maiestee suche towardenes vertue godly zele haue conceyued lesse vndoubted hope yt ye wyll goddes gouernaunce ferre passe saied father daily wysshinges prayer thought enough haue eguall see highnesse suche liuely sparkes vertue christian regiment toward cannot thynke englande moste fortunate royalme euer whome god hath geuen suche kyng minoritye tendre babehood learneth haue mynde funccion considre whose mynistre royalmes saiyng plato neuer el blissed state whan eyther philosophiers saye suche knowe loue god doe reigne ouer thesame el kynges geue themselues philosophie saye due knowledge god disciplyne vertue vpryght execucion office towardes people howe happye englishman suche kyng whose chyldehood appereth perfeict grace vertue godly zele desire literature grauitie prudence iustice magnaniraitie hath heretofore found kinges mature age ful discrecion auncient reigne passing high estimacion suche goodnesse god people eagerly hongreyng thrysting iustice earnestly sekyng wayes trueth tendrely enbracyng moste holy woorde readily acceptyng grace ghospel wyllyngly conformyng themselfes sincere doctryne commaundementes forgeateth geue sapient kyng gouernour god hath singuler fauoure mercye towardes royalme englande sente youre grace reigne ouer v ye thyng selfe whole processe doeth declare summe whereof shal short discourse briefly touche passe ouer leste might seme rather haue sought occasio waye flatery extolle progenie present cause enforceth geue due testimonie trueth dede singular excellecie al kindes princely towardenesse yt place tyme cause booke person either publique audience el priuate coupaignie maketh mencion maistie thynketh hymself euen veray conscience boud powdre thesame wt manyfold praise incoparable vertues giftes grace al prayses magnifying though bee dede muche inferiour moste woorthye desertes hytherto yet maiestie muste take repute matter insolencie moste louyng faithful subiectes ministred vnto rather thyng wrought instincte god admonishe regal estate hath called vnto prouocacio wordelye gloriyng self instrumente admonicion continue remembraunce thankes geuing discharging youre office baites flatery meaning fede maiestie conceipte pryde rather glasse wherein beholde self ye ye ought continue pleasaunt ticleing clawyng adulacion rather caucion ye dooe nothing life whereby ye maye bee founde thought vnwoorthie laude geue finally nourishmente humam vanitie rather spur exhortacion onely beware hat ye goe backe ne degenerate decline godly trade religio vertue litterature prudece benig itie iustice princely regiment ye nowe entred also ye procede ye haue begoonne still goe forwarde encreasyng godlinesse procedynges consummacion maie bee aunswerable moste princely christian begynnynges neyther subiect worthie life whiche woulde ende purpose attempt magnifye thys tendre age hope ye bee alreadye come perfeccion propouned vnto ye wyll labour contende age maye suffre growe reache vnto philip macedonie ethnike pagane kyng whan railed muche euil spoken atheniens toke therof occasio well reigne gouerne people alleagyng bee enforced costreigned theruto yt might proue enemyes vntrue men reportes howe muche necessitie well doyng incumbent highnesse ye maye tyme comyng verifie praise comendacions whiche publyque consent worlde dooeth nowe attribute vnto howebeeit moste feythfull louyng subiectes dooe nothyng doubte god beeyng geuer good gyftes father mercie god coumforte infinite goodnesse hath prouided reigne ouer v wyll also suche wyse directe wayes wyll euydentely declare hymself eternall wysedome counsayll inscrutable haue purposely ordeyned appoynted dooe high thynges whome hath myghtifull arme woondrefully sent moste noble father famous memorie kyng henry eyght beeyng otherwyse al token natural constitucion man hable also likely haue chyldren alreadye twoo faire blossomes freshe floures world lady mary grace lady elizabethes grace maiesties moste noble moste dere sistur yet liuyng declared himselfe apte veray fruicteful procreacion yet continued eight twentie yeres kyng royalme ere soonne lawfull matrimonie begotten whome myght leaue succession emperiall croune sceptre meane tyme kyng henry moste vigilaunt pastour ceaseth perpetuall trauayll procure commodity wealth englande ceaseth moste politique moste holsome lawes prouide establishyng englande peace tranquilitie diligent readyng meditacion yf holy scripture founde obserued true blissynges god fountayne al grace prosperitie procede knowleage god due obseruacion lawes lyke moste christian prince true defendour fayth conuerted emploied al studie cogitacions redresse abuse relygion moste corupte doctrine romishe papacye degree crepte christes churche preuailyng throughe continuaunce yeres nowe confirmed established throughout party christendome romishe nabugodonozor held v forer subieccion euer israell holden captiuitie olde babilon haue stil continued pleased almightie god botomlesse mercie reise vp christian cyrus moste puissaunt father restore v agayne freedome christes bloud romishe nabugodonozor wrestyng peruertyng holy scripture god establyshing maintenaunce vsurped supremitie clymed high nowe content sitte chaire moses moste blasphemously exalted hymselfe aboue called god say made goddes woorde frustrate moste corrupte moste pestilente doctrine myght take place deiulishe inuencions caste foggie miste ignoraunce ouer goddes moste holy bible pharisaicall interpretacions suche wyse polluted sinceritie christes doctrine infeeted clere fountayne goddes woorde suddes humayne tradicions dregges vayn ceremony meane papisticall troumperie peruerted vnderstanding holy scripture defaced puritie faith beggerly patched cloke supersticious weorkes commaunded goddes lawe perplexed grace ghospell false feigned merites weorkes supererogacion mangled christian profession mo hundred soondry sectes counterfaicte cloystreers antichristes owne generacion liuing like idle loitreers vera dranes vnder pretence religion deuouryng common weales woulde maynteyn theim oppressed true religion wurshyppyng god wyth pilgremages dead stockes stone mannes handie weorke transferryng honoure whiche due god alone vnto sainctes feigned miracle wyth kyndes idolatry innumerable wyth purgatorye materiall fyer make ende speakyng matter selfe infinite clene subuerted al good godly conuersacion doctrine satan power worlde whan christe came downe yearth redeme mankynde religion nowe broughte oute frame tyrannye romyshe babilon god hys soonne iesus christe lesse founde whan moste buisily named spoken pulpites beeyng vnder title name christe moste eagre aduersarye christe ghospell ioyned hymselfe philistine beyng goliah nere sixtene sixe cubites high neither feared ne shamed shewe hymselfe playne battayl defiaunce ne spared open hys blasphemous mouthe ne drawe hys tyrannous sweorde ne shake huige murderyng speare agaynst true israelite christes litle selie flocke moste presumpteously braggue agaynst euer woulde professe syncere vpryght doctrine god woorde tyll pleased god reyse vp vnto v englishe dauyd moste noble father without anye armoure weapon yron stele without harnesse mannes makyng without displeighing banner araye humaine battaile shoulde slyng regall auctoritie cast corner stone goddes woorde whiche lyghtyng vpon forhead sayd goliah felled papacie stone dead crushed poudre neuer hable noye face englyshe israel sayd dauid kyng henry eyght learned boke deuteronomie whiche booke feithfull seruaut god moyses charged whomsoeuer israel shoulde make kyng ouer thesame tyme wer sette regall throne dayes lyfe haue continuall meditacion styll reade therin entente myght learne feare lorde god kepe woordes hys lawe ordinaunces dooe theim turne commaundementes eyther ryght hand left bothe child myght prolong dayes kyngdome hadde saie learned booke one syde blessynges god promysed suche prynces theyr owne party woulde loue feare god walke vpryghtly execucion sayde commaundementes woulde partly theyr good exaumple prouoke theyr subiectes dooe partly due execucion iustice make ashamed also afeard swerue declyne lorde god syde terrible malediccions plague god wrathe threatned suche neglected vpryght obseruyng preceptes wayes loued goodnesse god feared stroke sawe religion bee ferre frame sawe parte moste earnest trauailes endeuour sette englande moste quiet blissefull state fayl condigne effecte defaulte reformacion matter religion saw found experience owne manyfolde moste princely enterpryses onely cause christian royalmes plagued wyth warres derthes famyns pestilence mortall extremyties come god indignacion worlde ferre gone astraigh christe nothyng nowe weaxed odious detestable holy woorde nothyng reputed blasphemous christes holy ghospell nothyng lyght estemed christes blood passion sawe onely waye goddes fauour bee enbracyng holy scripture drounyng wherof enforced god power indignacion vpon christian worlde sawe well perceyued god mercie wylling ceasse wrath vengeaunce christian people woulde returne hym perceyued god offre grace vnto worlde openyng iyes leauyng theyr errour ignoraunce thei woulde enbrace clere lyght ghospell sawe moreouer moste louyng subiectes englande whome godly exaumple prouoked tendre seke glorye god dyd nowe houngre thirste righteousnesse god knowleage woorde playnly sawe waye reformacion onely meane yf autoritie vsurped supremitie see rome wer extirped abolished clene extincte sawe countreimen englishe israelite bee holden suche extreme bondage wythin romishe egypte hope deliueraunce onely power myghtifull arme god reysyng vp moses woulde face moste cruell pharao require israell myght bee freely leat goe huige seuenfold headed draguon simple inferiour people suche obstacle myght come christe christen prince suche terrour durste draguon besydes monstreous hissing curse excommunicacions besides contagious infeccion idolatry superstition wherewith whelpes cancarde papistes adblasted worlde enwrapped drowned christendome blindnesse errour hadde also mortall styng taill wherewyth ceassed kyndes deathes tormentes destruye mourdre manye woulde open theyr lyppes agaynste moste detestable moste blasphemous abominacions draguon ceassed continually persecute woman clothed sunne saye christes dere spouse churche england rampyng roryng lyon stoode euer ready watchyng mighte deuoure chyldren christian flocke whiche nowe groned bryng foorth christe englishe michael kyng henry eight taken hande fight agaynst sayde draguon strengthened god wyth hys aungelles lordes godlye prelate caste sayde draguon olde serpente aungels oute englande great harlotte sitteth vpon manye water wyth whome kynges yearthe haue committed fornicacion inhabiters yearthe made drounken wyth wyne fornicacion woman sittyng vpon rosecouloured tenhorned beaste full name blasphemye sitting araied purple rosecolour decked golde precious stone perles hande cuppe golde full abhominacions filthines fornicacion forehead name great misterie written great babylon mother whoredome abhominacions yearth whore drounken bloude saynctes bloude wytnesses iesus thys huyge monstre hydra whome poetes attribute seuen heades eyghte hundred heades whome aswell king iohn englande also soondrie cstristen prince attempted vanquishe soone cutte one heade three heades grewe vp euerye wounde geuen confirmacion encrease strength vntyll hercules kyng henrye eyghte perceyuyng power puissaunce weapon hable confounde hym sauyng onelye consumyng fyer goddes woorde prouided byble bee sette forth englishe tounge bee sette vp euerye churche myght bee read people long time endured conflycte betwene englyshe hercules romishe hydra ere could bee destruied fast grewe vp numbre serpentine heades whan one cut besydes manyfolde moste monstruous heades idolatrye pylgremages supersticions countrefaicte religion innumerable abuse mo whiche kyng henry cutte whelpes indurate generacion papistes deuised meanes possible kepe hys auctoritie styll englande ne lefte engin vnattempted staigh lette abolishyng hys vsurped power abusyng simple people wyth kyndes delusion iuggleyng countrefaicte myracles feigned vision liyng traunces rapcions euen vnto thyrde heauen sophistycall learning holy contestacions subtily inuented prophecy bolde comminacions threateninges voice auouched haue come heauen peruertyng sence scripture mainteine power wrytyng bookes derogacyon kynges procedynges ende shoulde lacke kinde wickedenesse saied hydra adherentes moonkes fryer cloystreers hable weorke founde meanes besydes many stormes forrayne warres conspiracy ferre abuse credulitie simple ignoraunte people brought theim halfe detestacion hatered god woorde seduced theim aduenture lytle blaste sedicion distourbe cogitacions suche noble good kyng beeyng moste ea nestelye yea maye saye onely sette studiyng establishemente continuacion peace tranquilitie royalme euer whiche terrours coulde appalle kyng henryes moste stoute courage wente thorough reformacion whiche spirite god wrought hys harte conscience sawe bee necessarie hymselfe bee chosen god bee instrumente therof whyle englande thoughe yet veray wyllyngly ne vniuersally receyuyng grace ghospell offreed vnto v together wyth moste heauenly iewell treasure goddes holy scripture mother language ye neuerthelesse oure partyes moste bounden dueties tenderlye consideryng moste vigilaunte care studie moste earneste trauayle oure moste gracious soueraigne employed behoufe daily bestowed fortifiyng party royalme agaynst malicious assaultes conspiracy said romishe hydra enemy procuremente englande saye ceassed continuall prayer beseche goodnesse almyghtye god rewarde godlye mynde dooynge kyng nowe wearyng oute hys bodye trauayllyng v spendyng lyfe procuryng wealth safegarde wyth soonne whome whan shoulde departe hence heauen myght safely committe leaue croune gouernaunce v moste dere beloued subiectes thus englande space many yeres persiste continuall prayer almyghtie god wyllyng shewe persones reserueth hys blyssynges soone throughe better instruccyons conformed selues expulsyng romyshe antichriste gladde enbracyng hys woorde receyuyng ghospell partyes immediately heard lamentable peticions sent noble mother quene iane famous memorie maie thoughte hys prouydence consailles vnscrutable purposely ordeyned prepaired caused borne none office myght bee moste dere wife suche kyng mother suche prynce soone moste lawful matrymonye brought foorth grace departed worlde thoughe haue saied haue dooen offyce yt borne nowe fare ye well freashe floure pure virginitie haue moste safely committed moste dere spouse kyng henry kepe moste feithfull louyng subiectes leaue behynde onely soonne iewell ye haue long desired sore longed often craued god log ye shal tendre welfare ye shall satisfye desyre whome broughte foorthe purpose maye please god sende hym longe lyfe haue full fruicte trauaylle haue deathe abundauntely recomp nsed roume emong euen mynde supplyed haue nowe dooe yearth haue demerited loue thanke handes bestowe wholly soonne whan gone thus departed moste vertuous ladye quene iane whose deathe haue lesse cause lamente hope assured gone peyne ioye care reste fro sorowe blisse fro trasitorie world immortalitie haue cause suppose god exceadyng great loue fauoure beareth towardes englande whan broughte foorthe worlde suche soonne tooke awaye immediately purpose rewarde wyth croune eternall whome temporall worldely rewardes incomparably ouer basse ne yearthly croune sufficient lamente rather enuye felicitie blisse beeyng nowe heauen moste desired ioye christe inuiteth requireth v beneuolente loue affeccion whiche muste haue deuided betwene maye bee wholy transferred bestowed highnesse whome bryng foorthe onely well contented also muche desyrous dye double bounde loue youre maiestie fyrste youre moste dere mother taken v ere myght receyue fruicte grate thankfull hertes bryngyng foorth coutrey suche soonne muche moste royall persone reposed al worldly ioye coumforte hope expectacion bothe v nowe liuyng truste grace shall surutue also posteritie neyther iiustely affyrme dead hath leafte behynde suche fruicte bodye whome bryng foorth dare auouche though death well bestowed case myght returne lyfe former state mayde quene woulde readily paryshe couenaut god thesame pryce bryng foorth grace vnto countrey greate ioye gladnesse englande natiuitie highnesse veray prouidence god thought necessarie temper immoderate mirth reioysing death vertuous mother neuer ye deceasse quene england lameted lest myght haue ben inebriate vnestimable felicitie yt thesame might haue made v proud percase haue brought v suche flaterye selues yt woulde haue forgotten perchaunce acknowelaged espied bee sente vnto v aswell mightie woondrefull power goddes hand also exceadyng mercie fauoure towardes englande myghte haue taken away ere cum bearing conceiuing wombe specially loued tendred good king henry v hande pleasure haue taken bothe whiche thynge god forbydde n leauing better twoo v willing bothe many festelye declare almyghtifull power ioyned wyth hys moste gracious mercie tendre compassion towardes england also bridle insolencie hauyng still wyth v suche mannes frailte readinesse swerue paraduenture foresawe would haue growen v god takyng awaye birthe plainlye ministre vnto v earnest warning also iust prouocacion vncessaunt praying life prosperous continuaunce grace nature condicion birth mortal mother birth maiestie swete long wished long loked long craued ere came great benefite muche sweter obteyned without great long suit pleasure good turne much diminished whan fyrst obteyned desirefulnesse myndes muche augmenteth encreseth pleasure admixtion also shoulde saye sawcyng pleasure kind misfortune either afore going middes adtempered graceth altogether maketh acceptable honey waloweish ouercasteth stomake plenteously taken selfe alone wyth vinegre made eagredoulce onely delectable plesaunt relice also comfortatiue holsome deathe moste vertuous lady moste woorthie quene iane mother beyng ioyned birth made mperature sorowe ioye together bothe mournyng whiche otherwyse shoulde scaree haue founde anye ende soone mitigated also moste tendre desire enioying maiestie much encreased long groned hadde long cryed god prynce excepte hadde moste desi ed birthe aspersed deathe mooste ere mother shoulde immoderate felicitee haue tempted prouoked hym take bothe v hys goodness woulde suffre v fall muche sooner sorer doeth immoderate ioye drounde mannes reason immoderate doloure thus haue sayd soone willingly applyed selfes aswell ye exiling al pap strie also thenbracing woorde god immediately fulfylled satisfyed desyres sending grace vnto v woondreful sorte shoulde playn wordes haue saide ye haue gladly receiued word ye shal haue whiche ye cannot gyfte obteyne wete prynce wyth al worldely coumforte ioye secu itie ye maye wel perceiue yt nothyng vnpossible god also ye abyde woordes abyde aske ye wyll shalbee dooen whan saye woorde god ye law preceptes ye comaundemetes god mene fantastical dreames mane inuencio thinges nothing lesse ye worde god mene true liuely worde god conteyned holy scripture mene holy gospel testament purely sinc rely taken without venomous corrupcion fylthie dregges soure leauen aboue rehersed pestilencies accordyng moste noble father late soueraigne lorde kyng henry eight vnestimable care studye trauayll mynded laboured haue sette foorth daily preached taught hys people without declynyng eyther ryght hande left whiche thyng could throughly accomplishe moste earneste hertes desyre truste ye almyght e god hath prouided sent v highnesse moste woorthye soonne succede suche woorthye father wyl especial grace illumine herte procede way trueth whiche father hath opened vnto wyl geue grace al thinges perfe cte whiche father moste godly begane handes although maynteine vpholde conserue yt kyng henry prepayred hath nowe lefte gouernaunce self muche matter immortall honour renoume yt wer enough kyng doo yet hath god prouided yt ye shall haue cause aie alexader great conque whan considered great manyfold actes father phylip kyng macedonie said father wil leaue nothing doe god veraie pietye kyng henry vncomparable vncea aut trauaylles publique behouf welth englande long yeres susteined tooke hym awaie troubleous worlde soone prepaired grace readinesse due successio inheritauce receyue hades ye sceptre croune royalmes dominion god special dispesacio breake ye course life ere al thinges wer brought ful perfeccio would declare hymselfe haue appoynted maiestie lyue altogether carelesse supmitie perpetual exercise al princely vertues yt ye might consumate finishe suche regall enterpryses begoonne partely worldly affaire especially cocernyng ye redresse abuse matter religio kyng hery moses god elected stoutly deliuer v hades ye romishe pharao conueigh v read sea waueryng iudgemetes troubleous sourges ye popishe generacio swelling rageyng agaynst wildrenesse beyng lefte alone destitute ye assistece coumforte christe prince whiche noble godly enterprise might laudably haue sette foote wt wildrenes coducte v ferre ye lade moab ye iosue god hath appoynted bryng v lande promissio flowyng renyng wyth milke honey sette v englishe men lande canaan sincere knoweleage free exercise goddes moste holy woorde moses goddes ordeinaunce dispensacion wrote booke deuteronomie wha caused holy byble bee turned englishe laied tabernacle wha comauded thesame bee aied al singular church throughout royalmes dominios chargeyng leuites yt byshops pastours curate time free yere yt al due conuenient season read declare vnto al ye people gathered together woman chyldren yea straungiers yt city yt might heare learne feare lorde god priestes sone leui last yeres iugleyng theyr false packyng playn sorcerie bewitched kyng henry wrong persuasion craftily coupaced conueighed matier yt vnder pretence coulour religion kept worde god fro iyes eares people beatyng moste faythfull louyng subiectes fro knowleage therof wyth mortal whyppe made sixe deadly knotted chordes meane tyme kept booke lawe hidde vntyll ferre obscured derkened oppressed ye worde yt thynges eplete errour insinceritie euidently appereth maiestie faythfull iosias whose tyme booke ye law found house lorde moste godly iniunccions read hearyng people couenaunt made lord yt shal walke lord shal kepe commaudementes wt al hertes al soules wherunto people moste willyngly dooeth consent glad receyuyng suche good ordre reformacion maiesties moste godly direccion mynistred vnto noble father dauid good hert zele entended yea made mocio build house lordes name trust ur highnes salomon god hath appointed special dispensacion elected build finishe house euer restoryng establishyng true christian religion thyng yt maiestie maye haue grace spirite doe ye lacke perpetual wyshinges prayer al louyng obedient subiectes world seyng moste princely begynnynges tendre yeres chyldehood confirmed sure hop expectacion yt maiestie wil proces time growe bee behalfe veray phenix emong christian prince mirrour spectacle vnto certes maiestie muche case kinges england tyme haue frowardnes fortune beyng suche moste parte thynges lyke aide fauoure easie bee achiued malignaunt wi kedenes easie lost deserueth lesse rather glorie wel kepe maintein thynges wel gotte acquyre moste woorthie progenitours haue eadye pathway renoume haue easie trauail succede folow ye prince nexte afore goyng laudable exauple politique regimente woorthye enterpryses marciall prowesse noble yet common actes chi faltie notable famous enterprise yet enclosed within coumpace mannes reache grace succeadyng henry eight shall hable satisfie aunswere earneste expectacion worlde onlesse ye doe excell nothing maie serue grace singularitie ye haue exaumple suche marke set vp vnto without sweat laboures hercules poetes feigne yt bore vp stayghed heauen self wt shoulder ye shall hable clyme vnto ye must surmount passe kyng whiche tyme pierlesse matter publique admiracion vniuersall world suche begynnynges alreadye aswell marciall chiefalrye also politi ue ordinaunce ciuile lawes home aswell destruiyng image baall rootyng vp al idolatry also settyng ferther good ordre matter religion wil suffice ye bee egual king hery eight besides felicitie luckie fortune al regal etreprises aswel marcial chiefalrie also politike gouernauce besides manyfold coquestes victory frauce scotlande irelande el besides vnestimable high triouphes voiages actes dooen bothe home beyonde sea besydes exceadyng great manye buyldinges palacies honour mainours castels fortress holdes blockhouse hauens aswel strength safegarde royalmes dominios also ye comoditie fredes arryuing ye annoiaunce enemy besydes defence maynteinaunce al hys porte narowe sea carikes barkes hulkes shyppes galies many high sumptuous deuises shypwright besydes aboundaunt furnishing singuler premiss al kyndes ordinaunce artillerie requisite prouysio besydes ye foudyng edifing erecting vncredible noumbre bishop see cathedral college lecture scholes college studentes bothe vniuersitees sumptuous endowyng euerye landes possession iewels ornamentes requisite furniture muche large euerye one premysses particularly myght bee iudged acte sufficient kynges tyme bee dooen besydes moste vigilaunt careful studie enactyng great volume ryght holsome statute lawes commoditie behoufe publique weale england dominion emong hys vnceassaunte endeuoure reformacion religion therin thyng moste necessarie common weales tendreing christes glorie extirpyng abolishynge detestable vsurpacion papacie rome rootyng vp sectes cloisterers countrefaicte religyon idolatrie together setting forth holy scripture vulgare englyshe tounge besydes premysses actes mo long tyme maye suffyse reherse king henry prince singuler prudence passing stout courage magnanimitee incomparable inuincible fortitude notable actiuitee dexteritee woondreful continual wellyng fountayne eloquence veray rare spectacle humanitie ciuilytie good nourture absolute presidente speciall paterne clemencie moderacion worthie exaumple regal iustice botomlesse spring largesse benignitie al honest artes faculty profoudely seen al liberal discipline egual ye chiefest kynd litterature vnexpert world ornamente countrey treasoure frendes coumforte foe terroure faithful louing subiectes tendre father innocentes sure protectour wylfull malefactours sharp scourge common weale good people quiet hauen ancore safegarde distourbers rocke exterminion hainous intolerable crymes agaynst publique weale seuere iudge lyke offence committed agaynst hymself readye porte refuge mercie except suche woulde persiste vncorrigible man al giftes nature fortune grace piereles shortly breake matter selfe infinite man aboue al praise suche king hath god sette vp maiestie exaumple spectacle paterne al princely vertues whome egually matche wil bee veray leste looked moste regall christia begynnynges thys youre tendre age mete lyke highnesse heire successour noble father croune treasure euen much bee ye heyre moste princely vertues like ye would employ al possible industrie diligence maynteine ampliate external possession empier euen augmente vertues mynde beeyng precious possession twayn neither behalfe party matestees moste beneuolent faithful louing subiectes lesse hope conceyued yt come doe already fele ioye coumforte see present suche excellent begynnynges beyng ferthered publique daily praiers al faythful true herted subiectes cannot haue stil better better degree continuaunce encreace especially hauyng suche noble sapient counsaillours hath pleased god prouide geue tendre babehood suche well dooynges young kynges reason therof prosperous successe thynges procedeth faithfull godly counsaillours maie euidently appeare notable exaumples twoo younge kinges israell manasses iosias whoso wyll peruse bookes kynges shall fynde begynnyng achabs reygne vntill tyme good kyng ezechias true holinesse religion ryght knowleage god yea veraye mynde weorke seke goddes glorye lay thyng oppressed reiected buryed vttrely extyncte stede godlinesse reigned al iniquitie lieu true knowlage possessed ignoraunce errour place true wurshyppyng god ferre preuayled idolatrye contempte goddes lawes israell passed gentyles onely theyr owne gentylitie wurshypping baal many false goddes also al kyndes theyr moste detestable abhominacions crafty subtile iugleyng baal priestes false prophetes aduauncyng owne lucre estimacion vnder coulour pretence holynesse religion litle litle allured enueigled coniured bewitched prynces yt vtterly blynded seduced condescende wicked couetous inuencions priestes perswaded prince theyr way policy bestowed theyr cuning clergie weorkema shyp peincted eloquence vntyll peruerted drawen clene straygh wayes lorde theyr true god well knowyng people loue feare exauple woulde without buisinesse folowe trace ledyng theyr king gouernour made kynges rewlers sure theyr syde well wetyng subiectes obedience sake theyr owne accorde would rest cruell diuises myght tyranny enforced drawe theyr prince line whereof auncient prouerbe sayeth euery kyng royalme subiectes eyther singuler precious benefite orels pernicious destruccion yt suche euery kyng suche wil people bee wherfore lyke werte molle standyng bodyes face blemyshe greatter deformitee wurse disgracing stode priuie place body eyther prouidece nature hideth mane reuerece good prouision doeth kepe secrete vyce eiuil qualytie fault greatter dishonour prince priuate persone euery saying doyng yea euery looke gesture taken vp publique exaumple paterne hys subiectes folowe kynges israel coulde ciuill veraie pernycious ensaumple corrupcion al theyr sely people length came good kyng ezechias scripture due commendacion testifieth pleased lorde al thyng lyke forefather progenitour dauyd well doynges begoonne redresse religion extirpyng idolatry vp rote whyle idolatry reigned nothing could doe ye myght pleasyng god fyrst therefore put awaye hil alters brake image cutte downe groues brake brasen serpente moyses made vnto dayes ye chyldren israel dyd burne sacrifice vnto itnume xxi trusted lorde god israel claue lorde departed hym kepte commaundementes lorde hym prospered thynges whiche tooke hande c thus duryng ye time reygne ye space twety nine yeres renewed religion restored lawe god perfeccion reduced people trade holy vpryght conuersacion syght god walkyng commaundementes lorde detesting al idolatrye abhorryng al suche abomynacions myght iustely prouoke wrathe vengeaunce whyle subtyl crafty false prophetes priestes baall dissembled played mum folowed necessitee time feare iron rodde worlde vnder suche kyng required soone good kyng ezechias dead leauyng behynde hyme soonne manasse chylde twelue yeres olde reygne succession ouer israel stede false prophetes priestes baall thought fitte propyes tyme shewe themselues theyr owne colour soone death gappe opened theyr false iugleyng theyr crafty practyse wyly dryftes theyr subtyle conueyghaunce shewed theyr affeccions leat slyppe theyr occasion reduce israell former trade dooyng sacrifice idolles whiche learned tyme wieked achab wherby theyr lucre aduauntage hadde long season come thicke vnder ezechias vtterlye decaied whose dayes force compelled haue lawe god honour onely vse eache people herte priuely styll cotinued detestable pernicyous fauourers maynteyners weorkers idolatrye though tyme hypocrisy feare punishemente intermytted thesame ye youth manasse beyng babe easye inticed allured trayned lustes sensualitie flatreyng persuasion beeyng destitute faythfull godly counsayllours might woulde protect tendre chyldehood bryng hym vp knowledge god way preceptes sayde false prophetes couetous priestes baall mete praye hym therefore enueygled wt many swete woordes flaterye doubte ye many woordes coumforte muche circumstaunce glorious peincted eloquence allegeyng many politique consideracions many ciuyll respectes ye state world yt many ga e solemne promise innumerable thesame right high commodity shoulde thereby ensue common weale many assured warauntises welth peace tranquilitie would vse counsayl folowyng wayes wyse achab beyng alleaged noble prynce polityque wise man folowing ye trade forefather newefound ade learnyng religion ezechias lately inuented brought vp israel great troublyng disquieting grieuous annoiauce vexacion subiectes extreme perill comon weale almanazar king assyria day ezechias come vp agaynst samaria besieged woonne carried awaye israel assyria sennacheryb kyng assyria coe vp agaynst ye strong city iuda take albeit god power deliuered ezechias people city augel lorde slewe proud blasphemous bragguig assirias hudred fowre score fiue thousand clappe meanes ye salse prophetes wicked priestes baall coupace weigh young manasse though succeded owne father beyng good godly kyng expresse testimonie holy scripture comendeth wt woordes hym none lyke hym emong kynges iuda neyther suche yet ye wtstading ye sugermouthed false prophetes couetous priestes baall defaulte good godly counsayllours whome doubte ye wieked rable founde meanes wring fauour remoue awaye kynges presence coumpacediiii kyng xxi weyghed persuaded woonne wytched peruerted fo seduced yt scripture recordeth eiuil syght lorde euen abominacyons heathen went buylt hill altares whiche ezechias father destruied reared vp alters baall made groues dyd achab kyng israell wurshipped hoste heaue serued builte alters house lorde whiche lorde sayd hierusalem putte name buylte alters hoste heauen euen twoo courtes lorde offered soonnes fyre gaue hede vnto witchecrafte sorcery mayntayned weorkers spirites teller fortune wroughte much wickednesse syght lorde angre hym put ymage groue made euen temple whyche lord saide dauid salomon sonne house hierusalem whiche haue chose tribe israell putte name euer manasse led waye dooe wickedlye dyd hethen people whome lorde destroyed chyldren israell wrought wyekedly amorytes whiche hym made iuda also synne idolles dyd shed innocent bloude excedyng muche euen tyl replenished hierusalem corner corner wyth bloude true prophetes many myght founde true worshyppers god sincere kepers ye lawe wicked father reigned fiftye fyue yeres hierusalem succeded wicked sonne amon beyng twety twoo yeres old whan begoone reigneiiii kyng xxi lykewyse dyd euill ye syght ye lord father manasse doen walked waye yt father walked serued ye idolles hys father serued wurshypped forsooke lorde god father walked waye lord c whan amo deceassed soone iosias stede made kyngiiii kyng xxi eight yeres olde whan enoyncted kyng reigned thyrtie one yeres begonne reigne young yet scripture plainelye mency oneth whiche right sight lorde walked wayes dauid forefather boughed neither ryghte hande ne selfe vndoubtedlye throughe speciall grace god helpe good gouernours well consyderynge ponderynge vngodlye lyfe dooynges manasse coulde theyr fydelytye fynde theyr hertes suffre suche innocent babe lyke sort seduced abused manasse beeniiii king xxi owne perdicion also vtter desolacion ierusalem iuda beholde sayd lorde manasse king iuda hath done suche abhominacyons c bryng suche eiuyls vpon hierusalem iuda whoso heareth bothe eares shall tinkle wil wipe hierusalemiiii king xxii man wipeth dish whan hath wiped turneth vpsyde downe c iosias thus aunswereth lorde prophetisse fowerth kynges thine herte melte thou hast humbled thy selfe lorde whan thou heardest spake place c beholde therfore wil receiue thee vnto thy father thou shalt put thy graue peace thine iyes shal see al eiuils whiche bring vpon place young kinges immediate successours one ezechias extirped idolatrie roote wurshipper false god otherwise also wicked man yet manasse peruerse enticers fel god naughtines iosias beeyng younger age helpe faythefull godly counsaylours apply himselfe goodnes thereby prospered twoo notable exaumples moste gracious soueraygne haue large propouned set foorthe maiestie partely ye may marke shall godly dooynges redounde youreselfe youre people royalmes dominyons yea youre posteritie also sake partely declare vnto youre hyghnesse nexte speciall gifte god grace owne good disposicion plyanne flexible much enclined vertue chiefe principall porcion suche good happe bee ascribed discrete gouernaunce sapient direccion vertuous trayning vpright guydyng godly aduertisementes holesome admonicions vncorrupt educacion vertue litterature ministred vnto yong king feithful woorthy counsayllours thing forasmuch happy blyssed maiestie god owne hande hath prouyded grace suche noble woorthy counsaylours time minoritie much feithful louing subiectes bound laude praise magnifie moste holy name daungerous tyme hathe mercifully graciously prouided v whose welth safegard worlde must wholly onely depende godly educacion vertuous trainyng extreme confusion contrarye certes innocent babehood tendre minoritie veraie time may euidently tried person dooe feithfully tendre welth honour godly procedinges aboue precious iewelles aboue worldely treasoures bee estemed loued regarded thanked folowed maiestie whiche thys mynoritie shewe themselues feithfull earnest diligent careful onely touching safegarde preseruacion royall persone also concernyng minde tedre youngth furnished literature due knowlege god discipline many confirme princely vertues honour welth renoume whan god shall make manne yetes stature moste noble moste honourable counsaylours doe true diligent endeuour make manne maniers learning wherein like philip king macedonie birth sonne alexandre great alleged himselfe two cause principally reioyce one sone borne succede croune sceptre borne time noble clerke aristotle whome tuicyon gouernaunce instruction alexandre might committed noble father doe al beneuolent subiectes yet stil reioice hap borne hauing two worthy vncles serue assist especially one dere vncle edward duke somerset whome aswel gouernaunce vertuous institucion training royal person also proteccyon roialmes dominion al v feithfull louing subiectes time minority might safly committed whose fidelitie long season aswel king henry time sence beginning maiesties noble victorious reigne throughly tried aswel peace also soondry warres approued neither home also fraunce scotland twise declared whose dexterity aswell marcial feactes also ciuile affaire ordring common weale whose fortunate luckie spede al worthy enterpryses whose happye prosperous successe thinges taketh hande whose passyng great clemencye moderacy towardes people euerye behalf whose prudence ciuill matiers whose feithful vigilaunte administracion vnder maiestie common weale whose indifferencie al cause iustice ministred people whose vpright integrity onely ciuil counsayles also matiers religion worde god purely sincerely set forth god glory welth honour emperial croune dignitie though manne hable say ouermuch yet wil rather absteyne say coulde iustly might doe fill eares troumpe owne particular prayses whiche knowe hym bee nothyng desirous ne willing heare onely shall pray almyghtie god al englande dominion publique vnceassaunt prayer doe preserue kepe vntil time maiestie growen full manstate absolute discrecion may rewarde condigne thankes long feithful diligent seruice thing also doe vnto al moste noble godly counsaylours blisfull state maiestie endeuoureth daily trauayleth assent consent set empiere enforceth many loue either god daily breake acclamacion happy king suche woorthy counsailours happy counsailours toward king neither doe beneuolent subiectes thing doubte maiesties godly beginninges prosperously earnestly set foorth god worde glory shal dayly occasyon al christian kinges prince onely spoyle romishe egipt resuming euery one owne due tightful title supreme head within royalmes dominion abolishing ye vsurped primacie papacie rome al antichristian tradicions issuing also publishing pure sincere worde god theyr people subiectes euery one doubted christian loue peace vnitie concorde whiche hath long many yeres malicious practising see rome exiled banished al parttes christendome shall vniuersally momente returne agayne great glory god quieting worlde benefite christen common weales confusion discoumfeightyng aswell turkes also al enemy god good people within maiesties royalmes dominion meane time nothing mistrusted gracious prouision knowlage god worde shal grow people shal al others perfeict ensaumple godly conuersacyon behaueour ezechias iosias mayntayned true religion vpright wurshipping god either owne time lenger trust grace shal confirme establish euer hertes bowel youre tendre louing subiectes wheruto certes cannot ready sure way publishing holy scripture gospel christ establishing vse therof holesome ordeinauces statute lawes iniunccions sincere preacher godly omelies exposicions vulgare toung behalfe common writer trifling profane matiers much high suit make meanes obteine vse fauourable acceptacion prince vnder whose name title proteccion weorke may commended better habled vnto reader much al bound highnes mere good zele accorde doe willingly set forth english toung suche fruictfull bookes wherby people may bee edified religion emong verely knowe one booke whome purpose briefly pithily sincerely familiarely expouning new testament may iustly compare leste wise preferre thys presente paraphrase erasmus whiche lyke moste vertuous ladie quene katerine late wife moste noble father ryghte derebeloued vnkle syr thomas seimour knight lorde seimour sudley high admyrall seaes ryght graciously procure translated vulgare toung maiestie graciously hath godly iniunccios willed read vsed studied euery curate pryeste vndoubted edifying aswell desyre knowe god shall eyther reade heare wynnower powereth chaffe corne boulter tryeth branne mele hath erasmus scoured doctours commentary vpon scrypture dregges faute time place whiche writer liued settled selfe amonge pure fine substaunce hath tried refuse cleued weorkes suche wrote whan doctrine began patchyng clokyng decline insynceritie trashe bagguage stuffe papistical tradicions founde waye crepe man hath sifted fro right doctrine aswel al clerkely wrytinges also specyally paraphrase vpon newe testament auncientely wryten cannot emended bringeth briefly compriseth pith l myndes meninges good doctours ye churche euer wrote iustificacion feith honouring god onely repentaunce puritie christen man life detesting imagery corrupte honouring sainctes opening defacing tiranny blasphemie hipocrisie ambicion vsurpacion see rome noting abuse al abhominable sectes rables counterfei te religion idle cloister bewraiing iugling sleightes fine practise poperie choice meates esteming differece day manifesting vaine ceremony vnder coulour pretence holynesse crept christes churche reprehending pilgrimage al circustances ydolatrie supersticion describing prince office teachyng obedyence people towardes ruler gouernours declaring pastours duetie shewing parte euagelical preacher doctrine ought scripture blasing antichristia decree poperie vnder name tradicions constitucios mother church decising right difference betwene spirite lettre finally al poinctes article religion hauing late yeres ben controuersie erasmus like ouer vehement euery sincere ful neither doeth wryter wittily earnestly ap ly finely substauncially piththily playnely describe peyncte vsurped estate preeminence pompe bishope rome doth aswel place iust occasion offereth selfe also directely though vnder preaty couloure eleuenth chapitur euangelist marke erasmus ferthermore wondreful comparing fygures olde testamente applying allegory declaring parable discussing doubtful question serching explicating profound misteries wherin euidently declareth himselfe man excellent witte much study exquisite learning profounde knowelage exact iudgemente notable diligence woorthy famous industrie singular peinefulnes encomparable memorie vnestimable zele towardes yt setting furth christes holy gospel yet doth prudence semely circu speccion teper stile enemy cannot lacke enemy enough whosoeuer wil opener teller ye trueth matiers religio canot lacke enuie satan brode whosoeuer wil endeuour himselfe ferther knowlage god word cannot lacke neither priuie backebiting yet open reproche slaundre bring credit deface trede vnder foote whosoeuer wil diligent help bring gospel light shal auoide opely burdened false crime whereby may vttrely diffamed whosoeuer wil trauaile manifest glory christes bloud shal haue enough write speake whosoeuer wil attempt discouer iugling caste practise poperie enemy say hated hated veritie could neuer yet finde geue foile take thaduantage holde whereby confound doctrine neuertheles whan mind make comparison three together erasmus writing paraphrase quene katerine procuring ye turned english highnes publishing godly iniunccions bee vse throughout party thys royalme semeth wel note erasmus haue doen lest act three erasmus fact helpe onely sene latin quenes goodnesse extendeth help vnlearned also haue nede helping foreward maiesties benefit maketh precious treasour comon many may take profit fruict thereby dede christian prince whome tuicion proteccion stablishing bookes weorkes concerne pure setting forth christ gospel doeth aptely duely apperteine excellent maiestie whome iust right deuolucion discente inheritaunce crounes england fraunce ireland title also defedour feith doth nerely peculiarely specially directly belong touching translatours bookes although haue present lesse say selfe haue small porcion weorke filled one roume man might haue ben hable better haue doen yet wish emong many maiesties moste umple bount ous exhibicions many godly actes doen daily brought offred gracious direccio highnes dere vncle gouernour royal person thys time minoritie vnder maiestie protectour honourable cou saillours thing also might peferred consideracions necessarie thing hable worthy mete person publique benefite comon weale translating good weorkes writing cronicles might good prouision meanes haue condigne sustentacion royalme almost englad excepted hath al ye good authours euer wrote traslated mother tong whereby people made prudent expert men tract affaire either touching discipline el ciuile matiers germany good weorke diuinitie haue laguage vnestimable edifying people ye due knowlage god hath ben common weale foundacion spreading abrode knowlage goddes woorde onely setting forth bible good godly tractises declaracion thing hath ye whelpes ye romish antichrist fiercely alwaies backed translating scripture bookes cocerning matiers religion vulgare tong vse ye people one thing whiche hath christen royalmes long might preuayle eyther sorer decree lawes inhibicions ordeined terrible execucion kindes tormentes deathes inuented deuised put vre againste setter foorthe bookes concernyng religyon one thing hath papistry countreyes eagrely conspired subtelly coumpaced earnestly practised oppresse coming foorth scripture diuine weorkes vulgare tong whereof rude multitude might gather knowlage thing hath laste yeres vntill christ like fier hidden vnder wood would nedes mounte vp appere abrode maugre ye head romish pharao al tiranny thing say hath eyther sorer thundreboltes shot deprauing accursing slaundreing defacing condemning burning bookes scripture matiers traslated writen mother laguage autours bible good traitises ye explanacio ye wer christian region turned set forth vulgare language kind idolatry supersticio poperie errour ignorance counterfeict religion reigne long candel light gospel kepte hidden vnder bushell king prince countrey people blind popish guide lede one blindfolde may led till fel pit whan whersoeuer hath pleased god special mercy grace prouidece shew open light gospel true doctrine hath popish troumperie euen selfe vanished away mist dispersed heate sonne smoke consumed aier duste blowen scattered abrode puffe winde nyght geueth place bright day darkenes vanisheth clere light sune contrariewise worde god yet geat entrie take place ne bookes holy scripture obtein published people iye doth see christian hert doth lament blede consider blindnes supersticion errour vnquietnes consciece trouble minde sely people doe liue therfore smal benefite suche person common weale willingly trauaillers kind writing newe bookes trifleing vanity profane argumentes nede none daily many writen haue weorkes made common publique vse ye vnlearned multitude principal best haue ben written noble clerkes vndoudted learning knowlage godlines therin consisteth publique benefite suspected demed hunt selfe mine estimacion worthy publique thankes regarde erasmus third booke apothegmes aswel sapient aunswer socrates also two preatie story one leonicenus thother william warham late archbishop cantorbury doeth declare muche good much greater benefit common weale doeth one translateth composeth frui tful booke traictise going abrode throughout whole royalme may profit pastours curate studentes al people vniuersally man hable preaching teaching geuing instruccions one copany alone one place countrey mo though neuer rightly neuer diligetly neuer cuningly doe besides translatour trauaileth hys priuate commoditie behoufe publique vse countrey besides thing must throughly occupie possesse dooer must haue attent apply exercise onely may season take hande trade busines whereby purchase liuing besides thing cannot doen without bestowing long time great watchyng muche peines diligente studye small charge aswell meate drinke bookes also necessa y labour selfe selfe peinful tedyous thyng manne wryte prosecute argumente hys owne inuencion man hath hys owne inuencion readie owne pleasure without lettes stoppes make suche discourse argument requireth translatour must force manier euery worde staigh suspend cogitacio penne looke vpon autour might egual time make thrise muche ca hable translate whether man shal apply hymself doe meane dooe nothing el cannotduryng season bestow himselfe occupacio liuing necessity also charge meane time neuerthelesse dooe growe aswel mennes wherof cometh passe noumbre suche would right willing diligent dooe good commo weale kinde seruice yet defaulte necessarie maintenaunce cannot certain hath liuing vacaunt time enough muche see paine trauile great hyre nothing al capciousnes maligner trueth readie depraue diligent laboure studious writer moste parte better contented according accustomed prouerbe plaie naught weorke naught meanes lye almoste good bookes hidden people al discipline vnknowen thus hauing vnder gracious sufferaunce correction maiestie shewed poore opinion su cesse ferther traict mater leste myght seme speake myne owne frende whiche dede doo muche hauyng maiesties benigne fauoure therunto mind entende lesse al life enduring either wryting translating employe simple talente according porcion whiche hathe pleased almightie god measure vnto albeit present weorke nothing doo iustely maye take vnto mine acte sauing translacion paraphrase vpon luke digesting placing text throughout ghospelles actes except ghospel marke thentent vnlearned reader maye perceyue processe circustaunce paraphrase aunswereth ye texte ioineth therwith rude grosse doyng may please highnesse respecte good wil honest zele pardone thanke confesse selfe haue worthily deserued none rude thing maiestyes benigne gracious fauour shall vnto suche encouraging spurre towardes ferther industrie emog riche iewelles better learned mennes study haue aboudaunce treasoures coferre bestowe publ que edifiyng ignoraunt people shall time lacke euen penurie scarcitie bring poore ferthing also cast comon boxe helpyng ignoraut multytude towardes knowelage god truly none good sure ne ready waye plante knowelage god mennes hertes engraue true loue obedience towardes prince rewlers rote vp idolatrie supersticio menes stomakes bring people ye good mind detest abhorre al kinde naughtines bring al folkes perfeict securitie cosciece christes bloud reduce people vpright trade christian religion fede gredie houngre thirst christes righteousnes bible suche godly omilies paraphrase like bokes wholsom doctrine maiesties zele deuocio towardes god hath alreadie moued yong grene foundacion yet newly laied thus much good edifying hath already growen person conscience blasphemie periurie mourdre thefte whoordome making affray abhominacions detested blinde worlde late yeres gone token christ beginneth dwel emog v christ groweth shal vice weare away egual degree shal loue vertue hatered vice grow hertes great mayny haue hated matrimony yet haue hated fornicacion inceste aduoutry begin abhorre manifestly flee like pestilence exercise contrary thing persones shal percase deny affirme otherwise truely mine opinion great numbre emended looke suche corrupcion stil remayneth doeth better notably appere straunge thinges commonly wondred al good godly folke doe wondre god worde spred abrode almoste euery body hand mouth common creature whome enormity afore mencioned shoulde reigne goddes grace maiesties holsome prouision hoped salue goddes woorde deuoute weorkes declaracion sette foorthe people shepe eyther scabby el doe yet ren astraygh shall right ledyng head belle weather theire prince whystle voyce good pastours reduced suche concorde vniformitie wil full whole goe streight pathway christes doctrine vntil according promisse shal v al one folde one shepeheard excellent maiestie setting forth suche bookes may edify people state degree knowlage goddes woorde innocencie life doth labour haue whiche godly purpose desire may gracious pardone saye myne opinyon verayly suppose creature suche wicked herte hindre except whiche thing god great mercy grace forbid would good wil haue highnesse wel prosper flourish growe honoure glory god coumfort reioysing wel willers terrour drede foe welth honoure royalmes dominion god thanked ye nowe dooe doubt moste excellent soueraygne long maiestie aduise assistence sayde dere vncle moste honourable counsailours shall tendrely seke setforth god glory framing trayning people walke preceptes long wil god prosper affaire false promisse ceasse bee god ye reade fifth chapitur iosue fifth chapitur iudith besydes many place moe aswell bookes kinges also bookes scripture ye shal plainly finde merueilously god protected saued prospered preserued people israel long walked preceptes truely sincerely wurshipping keping lawes againste force vyolence enemy neuer innumerable neuer puissaunt neuer well appoynted battayl neuer fierce fifth chapitur iudith emong notable testimony god tendrenes ouer israel example ouer al truely serue conteined whan worde came holofernes prince captain general warre assirians vnder king nabugodonozor child israel prepared themselfes make resistence armie royal demaunded many question prince moab captaines ammon concerning power israelite achior captaine ammonite whan long processe declared vnto holofernes wodrefully israel whan truly serued god euermore tyme tyme preserued preuayled againste enemy contrarie wyse howe god alwayes plagued whansoeuer fell hym wurshippe false goddes thus doeth conclude knitte vp oracion therefore lorde sayth make diligent inquisicion people haue doen wiekednes sight god lette v goe vppe doubtlesse god deliuer thy handes subdue vnto thy power yf people haue displeased god shall hable withstand god defend shal shame al worlde c therfore tendrenes herte beseche almighty god godly purpose setting forth worde glory god wherunto moste holy spirite first moued noble father hath strongly effectually wrought thesame maiestie may neuer slacke nothing doubt according earnest vnceassaunt prayer onely v feithful louing subiectes also good godly people shal al thinges prosperously continue noble gracious reigne ouer v pouring heaping vessel singular prerogatiue peculiarely chosen right true administracion lawes common weale hys special grace gaue vnto moses vnto iosue like testimony feithfulnesexod xviii deu xxxi iosua iii iiii c king xvii iii king xiii iii king iii par xiii iii kyng x ii parall xiiii xv manne chosen owne hert gaue vnto king dauid singular gift wisedome richesse magnificence renoume wherwith notably aboue al others endewed king salomon fortunate prosperous successe battayl necessitie war must come vnto sente vnto abia lesse integritie purenes liuing ioyned effectual taking way supersticion scripture reporteth good king asa grace set people good ordre constytute echewhere within youre royalmes dominion prudent vpright discrete magistrate minister iustice haue god al affaire therfore reade noble king iosophat like prosperitie continuaunce victorious reigning god sent vnto ioathan king israel like addicion yeres natural tymeii parali x xviii iii king xx ii parali xxviiiiii king xx ezechias finally luckie prosperous olde age god gaue vnto abraham semblable happe propagacion sede succession suche noble sara may condigne spouse coupled noble king wherunto al true englishe heartes shall fortune reade heare presentes doubte wil one voyce saye amen ientle christian reader nicolas udal wisheth health grace peace god father hys sonne iesus christ salueour thou hast good christia reader paraphrase erasmus vpon ye gospel say treasour manier ful library good diuinitie bookes whatsoeuer thing auncient doctours church left behind whatsoeuer catholike writer conteined whatsoeuer notable good exposytoure hath sette foorthe sincere playne declaracion new testament pith substance therof hath man clerkely iudgment compendiously briefly summe couched together one weorke neither euer weorke easy vnderstaded reader hath cunning shewed owne annotacions vpon traslacion new testament may euidently appere annotacions approueth declareth himselfe diligent obseruacion marking haue perused al library al writer al bookes studentes dooe vse reade labour one autour one particuler facultie discipline accepte autour therfore deuout reader glad wil enbrace profitable meane instrumet wherby thou maist without ferther trauail onely reading marking bearing away easily attain clere vnderstanding ye gospel reade pure charitable hert single iye void al maner parcialitie affeccion enuy thou shalt espy therin edifying may mete thy state knowlage aptitude capacitie euel like ye holy blissed testamet pappe youg inge feith knowlage god worde also sounde meate wel entred hable broke higher thinges euen auctour al thinges aptly tempered enduce traine grosse rude multitude aswel curate teacher also priuate reader fede ye weake doctrine hable receiue sharpen make eagre hungrie ferther knowlage minister vnto learned eloquet teacher matier sufficiet wheron groud much profoud right christia doctrine accept willingly rendre tha kes first god infinite mercy grace hath day set numbre suche good writer emong erasmus one chiefe principal onely geue clere light also open way vnto pure perfeict knowlage god worde moste excellent soueraine good king edward sixte emong princely christian actes doeth soone effectually begyn first promoting god worde glory fountain ground al good successe welth prosperitie thirdly quene katerine whose good meanes procurement present weorke hath soondry mennes labour turned vulgare toung wherby kinges maiestie whose principal desire trauail doe thinges possible wherby tedrely beloued subiectes knowlage may ferthered conscience slaighed sincere doctrine christ perfeict framing confirming good conuersacion life might hauing notable good matier redinesse better occasioned put forth fruitful exposicion gospel paraphrase plain setting forth text sentence large circumstaunce moe wordes may make sentence open cleare plaine familiar whiche otherwise perchaunce seme bare vnfruitful harde straunge ough obscure derke vnderstanded either vnlearned meanly entred kinde exposicio yea p hthie effectual sorte muche therefore art thou bound deuout christian reader especially ye priestes curate either haue ben brought vp studie letter diuinitie el haue store bookes may sufficiet mainteining study much al ye bound say vnto kinges moste exellent maiestie honorable worthy counsaillours speciall regarde cosideracion ignorauce defaute litterature hath reigned part ye clergie england aswel ye great detriment harme decay religion christian flockes spiritual charge comitted also owne intolerable peril daungier whan general day accoumpt audite made throne god shall bee required handes haue taught ignoraunt multitude whose solles touching institucion feith lawes god must answer rightful iudge whome shal hable corrupt beguile deceiue escape haue good policie founde meanes howe ye people may great dele lesse time study labour yea also charge e bestowed playing table boule cardes vnlawful game haue leaues whole library good doctrine priuate edifying euery one particularely also enstruccion teaching eche common whatsoeuer ignoraunt person desirous knowlage conteted learn whosoeuer hert indurate yt abide good bookes may christes doctrine whosoeuer extreme malignaunt stomake due setting foorth god worde whosoeuer enemie ye glory god enuieth benefit christes bloud vnto england whosoeuer eyther blindnesse cannot see trueth peruerse froward malice wil cancard obstinacie wil spirite conscience wilfully withstand resist al good thinges may induce men knowlage god whosoeuer doth hate light ye gospel whosoeuer herte fauourer trueth kinges maiesties godly procedinges hath lesse cause enbrace erasmus whose doctrine best parte al christia royalmes vniuersities hath euermore allowed iudged consonaut truth also boud immortal thankes pray kinges excellet maiestie gracious setting forth publishing present weorke vse haue nede therof sayd erasmus fer otherwise great nubre ye scholastical sorte vnlettred expositours last blind season hath written paraphrase ornate stile hath parte hys volume barbarous bloundreers haue safegard defence owne poore honesty alleged thing vnseming bookes holy scripture matiers diuinitie like loueth cloking loueth simple playn doth refuse eloquece come without iniurie violacion ye truth writeth ornately greke diuines basilius gregorie nazianzene theophilactus chrisostome laten elegauntly lactancius hierome diuers others albeit english paraphrase translatours haue purpose studied rather write plain stile vse elegacie speche partely canot al pointes expressed english tong grace laten much lesse self speake plesauntnesse stile erasmus man moste excell nt learnyng exquisite eloquence kinde thoughe dede altogether ciceronian yet feact pleasaunt swete elegaunt sensible partely special regarde rude vnlettred people perchaunce default atteigning high stile also thereby haue defrauded profit fruict vnderstanding sence thing might doe onely pourpose first translated kinges excellent maiestie willed read learned hable enough helpe themselfes without translacions al neither translacions depraued reader would perhaps otherwise haue turned soe thinges shal rede two enterpreters bee translating one tong would agree al pointes stile enditing best purpose may appere auncient father churche whose allegacions place holy scripture moste commonly varie wordes agree sense interpreter would haue translated part hereof better would poinctes perchaunce haue doen wurse therefore euerie ientilly take interprete others labour beare infirmitie consideracion studie trauail yet lestewise respect good zele godly entente ferther knowlage come handes suche wil without disdeigne arrogancie take penne emend thing good vncorrupt iudgement shal see mete corrected suppose besydes rewarde god publique thankes countrey shal also priuatly deserue receiue immortal tha kes translatours whose desire haue wel neither suppose mind would disdeigne greued see thing bettered great weorke thinges dede wise penned firste translatours wrote thys common weorke building hired many sondry men occupacion case man making doore windoore frame though occupacion put hande bettering perfeicting yet dooyng displeasure cause grutche rather beautifiyng dooing cause rendreing thankes partie good wille zele without presumpcion put hys helping hande good purpose sembleably commo weorke gospel vineyarde asmuch euery labourer hath iye directed onely marke setting foorthe glory god hys moste holy worde man meaneth rebuke derogacion felow whan emendeth something refourmed altered rather semeth craue like help agayn owne doinges euident man ferther see indifferent iudge mannes doinges owne geuing therfore firste laude prayse thankes god giftes moste excellent king edwarde sixth gracious accepting fauouring mainteining honest godly study leat euery man employ good talentes god hath geuen publique vse seruing prof ting countrey common edifying eche iesus christe lorde together father holy ghoste honour laude glorye worlde without ende amen moste vertuous ladie quene katerine late wife moste noble moste victorious king henry eight famous memorie nicolas udal moste humble seruaunt wisheth health grace consolacion lorde iesus christe euerlastyng excellent highnesse moste gracious quene katerine sen e time firste calling estate dignitie espousal mariage moste noble prince euer reigned king henry eight hath neuer ceassed possible meanes might lie minde auaun e encrease publique commoditie benefit common weale englande finde euery side great worthy matier gratulacion thankes geuyng vnto god cannot tell whose parte fyrste commence begynne whether owne behalfe whome god goodnesse singuler thesame notable vertues without expectacion hope soodainly putte kyng henry mynde chose call auaunce dignitie estate quene kyng henry partie whose good happe aptly choose suche one shoulde afterwarde bee feithfull continuall coadiutrice vnto hym hys moste deuoute godly procedinges concerning knoweleage god woorde bee sette foorth people el englandes cause whose publique benefite edifying true religyo vnc assaunte peynes trauayles doe finally redounde leauyng therefore prosecucion large mattier neither slendre witte wel contryue rude penne hable wielde shall thys presente onely thanke god god causing paraphrase desiderius erasmus roterodame vpon newe testament translated engilshe vse commoditie people earnest zeale deuout study doe houngre thirst simple playne knowlage goddes worde contencious bableing innocent liuing curious searcher high misteries feithfull executours doer goddes biddinges bee troubleous talker byble syncere folowers goddes preceptes therein conteined bee vnreuerent reason r holy scriptue vain setting r peincted sheathe bee humble lowly weorkers goddes glorie bee curyous dysputers ghospell defence mayntenaunce theyr inordinate lustes carnall lybertie bee vpryghte walker holy conuersacyon lyfe rule ghospell prescrybed kinde doctrine forasmuch one wryter hath laboured poynctes behalfes vncorruptely playnely ministre vnto symple reader thys authour perpetuall dyscourse continuacion texte doeth highnes vndoubtedly procuring turned english hath onely godly sorte bestowed charge also hath thingselfe doen vnto commen weale benefit many degree surmounting passing act great largesse benignitie soule better body spirituall edifying aboue temporal supportacion gostly foode coumforte excedeth corporall reliefe cherishing heauenly treasours excell worldely giftes richesse highnesse spedy expedicion moste godly purpose bring goddes woorde light clere vnderstanding distributed weorke porcions sondry translatours thentent might al finished ife deuout english reader long time defrauded fruitful profitable weorke ye haue therein moste gracious ladie right well declared much ye tendre goddes honour also earnestly ye minde benefit countrey whiche countrey able facte condigne thankes requite dooe euer moste bounden supply perpetuall commending highnes god prayer wh che thinke onely rewarde ye looke desire touching translacions soondry persones dooinges though appeare dyuersitie style endicting yet whole weorke contrarietie doctrine though euery translatour folow owne veyne turning laten englishe yet doeth none willingly swerue dissente minde sence autoure albeit goe nere wordes lettre vse libertie translating large precisely binding themselues streight interpretacion euery woorde sillable sence kept yet dooe agree euery one veyne serueth feithfully rendreing sence booke persones either high conceipte opinion themselues like mannes doinges owne el vinentlenesse wil well interprete simple mennes doynges whiche themselues moste parte sooner finde faulte withal emende el morositie way wardnes stomakes cannot beare mannes labour neuer honestly entended bestowed behalfe rather contemned left insolent dis eignefulnes either pacified aunswered vnto partes deuout reader immortall thankes receiue take fruicion honest godly study office learned men without deprauing derogacyon men diligence without arrogancie owne behalfes employ good talentes pu lique behoufe countrey furtheraunce godly knowleage office euery studious diligent writer haue iye directed oublique vtiliti onely thinke vpright wel doinges sufficiente price rewarde themselues without respect worldely rewarde thanke referre fruite successe labour god mocioner authour weorker goodnes touching erasmus doctrine bookes dooe sowe although haue time somewhat sayd aswel preface vnto highnes paraphrase vpon ghospel luke elswhere yet omitte thus muche say hys defence case anye person bee enemy erasmus wryting procedeth enuie vnquietnes minde hatered light grace ghospel clerely arisyng plenteously spreading selfe abrode faute iust deserte erasmus whoso wincheth kiketh gospel dede cannot spurne erasmus hath incomparable study trauail shewed himselfe diligent labourer christes vineyard truely whomesoeuer perceiue eagre aduersarie erasmus writinges poore iudgemente leadeth cannot suppose indurate enemy gospel erasmus doeth according measure porcion talente feithfully labour sette foorth promote lyke whan manne feure greuous infirmitie distempered better drynke wurse ta teth mouth whan herte corrupt malice hatred god trueth better doctrine offendeth sore iyes cannot abide bryghtenesse sunne corrupte hearte clere veritie god woorde person indurate woorse reading holy scripture neyther dooe thing take occasion slaundre offence conscience dooe holy scrypture whereby conscience shoulde edified suche malicious hardnesse herte abide neither booke ne teaching ne reading ne thing el may helpe emende ignoraunt people knowlege suche woulde lette stoppe goddes glory depraue good thinges pronounce naught suche behalfe bee passed ne hearde body corrupted yll humour disease better nourished good meates drinkes wurse cankarde stomake wieked hert holesome doctrine ministred vnto indurate doeth enuie publique vtilitie vnto men dooeth striue wrastle veritie pharao neuer eagre persecuting people god whan dayly plague miracle prouoked te conuerte pharisee neuer furiously swelled ensourged raged christ whan alleaged holy scripture vnto brought againste testimony theyr owne lawe coulde deny scripture god good godly yet like good spirite sure porte tranquillitie peace wieked conscience stumbling blocke stone offence one floure bee gathereth honey spider sucketh venome great diuersitie operacion good ciuill nature common faulte malignaunt persones doe allege publishing goddes worde mother tongue setting foorth holesome godly exposicions vpon suche bookes cause sedicion doctrine lay facte doctrine charge hath euermore hitherto ben practise conueighaunce romish pharisaical sorte also auncient enemy goddes trueth euen beginning neither haue malicious generacyon euer yet vsed way coulour deface trueth let good proceding god worde sliere prouoke indygnacyon prince magistrate agaynste publishyng agaynst true preacher teacher therof onely allegeyng wyll mooue sedicion teache errour dede goddes woorde ye would saye perfeicte touchestone whereby fynde trye suche cancard stomakes would fain rebelle moue sedicion would gladly haue bee otherwyse great wonder veraie straunge thing woord god paraphrase lyke godly exposicion ghospell whiche sense none doctrine christ apostle corrupt reader teache errour moue sedicion god moste holy woorde altogether peace vnitie concorde perfec e charitie goddes woorde teacheth none doctrine peace humilitie subiection muche obedience prince magistrate romishe babylonian would good willes haue put heades hertes ignoraunt people colour haue enemy goddes woorde euermore vsed suppresse ghospell martirs haue doen true preacher olde iewes auncient prophetes god ye old pharisee christ himselfe whose moste grieuous crymes drew al worlde hym taught sowed erroneous doctrine seduced people made hymselfe kyng malicious iewes layed paules charge begoonne sedicious moouer rebellion ceasar thyng dede thesame cockesure waie make al obedient people hate ghospell prouoke rew er magistrate suppresse lorde mercifull goodnesse hath late sent clere radiaunt sunnebeames holye woorde veritie shyne ouer christen region trust continue light simple flocke shall bee hable discerne spirites men liuely know vngodly maligner whiche cauiling deprauyng good thinges dooe wrastie strougle muche lieth kepe ignoraunte multitude blidnesse meane time simple englishe congregacion bound continually praye highnes haue theyr vse behoufe procured translacion present paraphrase vpon ghospell mathew vpon residue newe testament wherby may coumfortable pleasaunt readyng theyr owne mother tounge bothe encreace daye daye nowelage also continually bee edified true religion nouzeled right opinion trayned sincere doctrine confirmed walke perferct innocencie integritie true christen lyfe accordyngly pthe preface erasmus vnto paraphrase vpon gospell euangelist matthew moste victorious emperour charles fift name erasmus roterodame gretyng beyng ignoraunt charles emperour victorious howe muche godly feare reuerence also due congruence geuen partely vnto holye scripture whiche holy father throughe inspiracion god haue left vnto v especially vnto part scripture whiche maketh vpright faythful relacion suche thinges heauenly father eyther wrought facte spake woordes health saluacion whole world soone iesus ferther priuie myne owne vnwurthynes many yeares gone first attempted set hand making parahrase vpon paules epistle playner vnderstandyng thing doe came vpon time sodain pangue euen mine mind lesse think enterprise veral bolde presumpteous acte acte prouerbe sayeth right daungerous hazarde muche one twoo three chapiter taken prouf assaye worke well woulde doe vttirly mynded pulle downe sayles againe surcease course afore apointed take vnlesse wunderful consent frendes beyng men lernyng perforce constrayned procede begon neyther coulde earnest desire rest quiet vntil fully ended finished euer epistle apostolical whereas taken hand medle wt epistle whiche without controuersie doubte wryten thapostle paule hath al tymes framed wel ne come good ende haue ben ruled doe thynges mocions instaunt pricking forward frendes yet thing neuerthelesse litle proude selfe bolde auenturyng come muche happily passe loked well myne owne parte maker whome purchased least enuie grutche men al wurkes euer wrote also behalfe suche studentes suters atteigne philosophye gospell doe euery man geue tha kes meanes myne industrious labour haue better knowlage thapostolicall wisedome eyther moued stirred vp el furthered wha cleane dispatched great charge taske loked shoulde tyme afterwarde haue doe kynde writing beholde right reuerende father mathew cardinall sedune whose aduise instigacion afore made vp thepistles canonical time spake brurels welcome hym countrey according duetie returne counsell whiche holden citie wourmes eue first entring talke euen lyke man deuised vpon afore begynneth exhorte afore doen vpon thapostolicall epistle shoulde also doe vpon gospel mathew partie anon made myne excuse many thynges firste alreadye acte bolde ouerbolde attempted vpon writinges thapostles secondly apostle dede wer godly men yet neuerthelesse men maiestie christ great myght lefull auenture doynge suche thynge wordes though maiestie worke put dryue one awaye yet nature argument matter gospel refuse thyng suffre one go make paraphrase onely gospell person diuers sundry sortes vnto whome wordes talke applied euery rate degree maye best accorde commeth passe wryters penne kept shut within enclosure excedyng streyght grate debarred libertie whiche sortes commentary doe suffer receiue paraphrase also reputed kynde commentarie furthermore good porcion gospell consisteth makyng report acte doynge simple plain report without curiositie one shoulde thys parte make paraphrase shall seme nothyng el doe noontyde light candell prouerbe grekes doeth call nowe ferther wheras aunciente doctoures wryters doe expoundyng allegory partly varie declaryng one waye partely handle themselues seme oft tymes playe dallie myght expresse bryng allegory vnder persones eyther christ orels euangelist euidente well knowen narow streyghtes trauayle let passe saye nothyng christ suche wyse spake certayne thynges woulde haue vnderstanded time speakyng whiche sort ensuyng one destroy ye temple within thre dayes space wyll buyld vp agayne allso bying swearde phariseis leuen eschued truly talke foresheweth distruccion citie hierusale prophecieth ende world affliccions long ensue vnto apostle iesus doeth intermedle temper talke semeth pleasure darke vnderstanded onely apostle also vnto v also certayne place thinke almoste vnpossible expouned whiche sort one concernyng sinne holy goste shall neuer remitted concerning day iudgement reserued knowlage father onely vnknowen euen sonne selfe place suche lyke yf one wryte commentary maye pleasure without daunger reporte sundrye opinion sundrye expositours hath libertie frankly confesse acknowlege dothe vnderstand mening place one maketh paraphrase hath ye lyke libertie power moreouer certayne thinges suche sorte spoken touche concerne euen verai time tymes right many thinges ferre disagreyng institucions ordinaunces apostle suche thynges although euangelistes foreknew ye spirite prophecie yet certes vnder persones name apostle reported coldely also cuttedly yet also point moued minde case take bestow labour vpon mathew would would make instaunte earnest request haue lyke doen vpon residue euangelistes whose wyl desire folow muste cum passe yt must many tymes make repeticion one manier mattiers euery matter whiche euangelistes amonge themselues accorde othersyde shoulde tye linke together certayne continuall processe tellyng thynges make one whole tale together forasmuche declare open place euangelistes seeme disagre nothyng el coumbreously entangled wer certayne mase could neuer haue hable doen clerenesse light paraphrase ought haue whan verai many mo argumentes reason desired ridde charge layed vnto go hande withall wheras thought selfe haue good cause excuse might haue preuailed yet sayed matthewe vanquish eloquence got ouer hande reason hys autoritie wherby might commaunde takyng hymself daungier hasard whole matier neyther durste bee bolde longer striue strougle agaynst aduise councell hym whose counsailes maiestie customablie vseth moste high
