weighty affayres vnwyllyngly folowe yet euen plainly taken matier vpon onely promysed woulde one daye assay yf happily thyng would frame go forward iourneiyng towardes millayn made assured warantise vnto ye germaines behalf worke instant winter season cum foorth wherupon cummyng backe self againe vnto basile suche wise eche side continually called vpon maisters germaines crauers lest importune sort would wise discharge promyse myne honestie finished vp weorke litle monethes labour god graunte bothe comaundement hym obedience may person luckie fortunate trust wyll maiestie fauourablie acknowlage accepte slender gifte presente dedicated perchaunce man knoweth none title sauing onely name emperour wyl saye booke suche argumente matier thys prince secular whiche mete conuenient haue dedicated vnto abbottes bishop aunswer wherof first thinketh thyng aptlye geuen whatsoeuer thyng beyng honest put vp christen prince besides prince secular hath doe profession gospell emperours anoynted sacred purpose may eyther maynteyne restore elles enlarge sprede abrode religion gospell ergo wil man saye emperour teacher gospell defendour graunte meanwhyle mete ignoraunt maner thyng whiche one taketh armour defende forsoth wha consider herte mynde suche wise bee geuen vnto religion godly deuocion bishop abbottes may towardes studie godlinesse bee aswell rule also spurre seemeth dedicate gifte vnto man conuenientlye youre maiestie thyng whiche myght aptly haue dedicated christen prince aptlye christen emperoure doe moste aptly dedicate vnto charles muche lesse apte thynges doe bringe vnto geue great gyftes precious stone gayson bee found lustie fierce horse houndes riche hanginges come oute farre straunge countreyes moreouer forasmuche euangelistes haue writen gospel vnto folkes persone excepted see shoulde euery man bee read haue handled maye bee vnderstanded euen suche also vnlettered surely shall withe excellent good fruite read euery bodye shall take handes mynde entent bee made thereby better man afore apply scripture gospell owne affeccions contrarywyse refourme correct lyfe desyres according rule prescripcion therof haue present worke chiefly folowed origenes beyng singularly aboue others experte diuinitie chrisostome hierome catholique writer best allowed lorde prince heauen giue graunte vnto charles emperour emperiall suche thinges minde go principall beste sort lord well prosper endeuours behalf ende moste noble empier whiche ye haue hitherto without bloudshed ye maye semblably aswell enlarge amplifie defende maintayne poinct meane maye please merciful graciousnes fro tyme tyme haue remembraunce warre vpon iust lawfull cause taken hande good moderacion executed draweth huige heape abominacions also misery yea remembre also greatest porcion harmes light fine vpon persones bothe giltles also vnworthy thesame yeuen basile ides ianuarie yere lorde thousande fiue hundred twentie two p lyfe sainct matthew writen hierome one auncient doctours churche matthew whiche wyse also called leui beyng puplican made apostle first others composed wrote iewrye ghospell christe hebrue tounge theyr behoufe cause whyche beyng circumcision beleued whyche ghospell person afterwarde translate greke verai certaynly knowen truely verye hebrue selfe euen vntill presente daye librarye lesarea whyche librarye pamphilus martyr possible studiousnes set vp make selfe also ghospell matthew hebrue lente copye nazarites whyche beroea citie syria doe vse thesame booke wherin noted obserued whersoeuer euangeliste eyther owne person orels person sauiour doethe vse allegacions olde testamente doeth folowe auctorite septuaginta saye thre score ten translatours hebrue whyche sorte set two citacions ensuyng egypt haue called soonne nazarite shall called paraphrase erasmus vpon gospell saincte matthew pthe firste chapter men gredely embrace booke set foorth industrie man concernyng preseruacion restoryng health waye increace worldely substaunce touchyng facultie whiche maketh worldly commodity howe muche feruent loue desyer ought boke bee receyued men whose profyt comoditie belongeth indifferently men boke promiseth worldly commodity whiche laste whyle teacheth heauenly wysedome delyuered vnto mankynde heauenly doctour christe iesus promiseth al wonderfull rewarde ryches kyngdome pleasure true euerlastynge felicitie vnto whiche felicitie booke sheweth moste ready easye way men shewethe also author meane whome euery man hath health saluacion without whome man maye hope healthe saluacion man woulde moued prouoked sure hope suche good thynge neuer barbarous vnlettred thys wundrefull saluacion whiche neyther mannes indeuour paynfull labour philosopher supersticious religion gentile diligent obseruacion moyses lawe coulde fully perfourme geue god maker preseruer ruler restorer thynges visible inuisible dyd shewe declare tymes paste sayinges prophetes beyng replenished heauenly spirite vnto worlde moste specially people iewes whyche tyme wer figure christes churche whiche shortly shoulde enlarged throughout world signifiyng shewyng dyuers dark figure shadowes whatsoeuer hath plainly made open vnto world sonne iesus christe messinger free felicitie beyng ambassadour yearth god father suche wyse also teacher holsome philosophy ye example pledge promiser author euerlastyng rewarde god secrete counsell whiche mannes wit vtterly vnhable serche oute hath suffered mankind beyng disposicion lyke first parent pro e vice entangled false religion sondry vice life naughtie desyres intent time al time bee desired wished whiche goddes wisdome orderer thinges appoynted selfe al men shoulde desyrous agreable myndes enbrace philosophie beyng bothe holsome marueylous efficacie haue perceyued neyther commodity healpes whyche worlde promyseth chyefe many fine exquisite preceptes phylosophers many sortes religion scrupulous obseruacion moses lawe coulde actayne vnto true godlynes true felicite naye rather earnestly laboured cum vnto innocencie felicitie long trusted mannes help strength wer intangled vice filthy desyres therfore yf iewes behoued chiefly accept imbrace thing offered vnto beyng often promysed longe loked yf alone neglect greate godnes whiche frely offered men yf rather alone lacke haue common wt others impute destruccion nothyng theyr owne incredulitie vnbelefe sayinges prophecy holy prophetes prophecied thynges chiefely sawe christe iyes workyng miracle heard theyr eares doctrine gospell kyngdome heauen preached first trulye whosoeuer wearye theyr former lyfe many loue true innocencie godly lyuyng whosoeuer desyreth true perfect euerlastyng felicitie let receyue gospel pleasaunte mery tydinges mery cherefull hertes whether grekes iewes romains scithians gallians britans lyke god god iewes indifferently god ouer common lyke one sunne whiche common whole worlde iesus christe sonne god came saue menne dyed arose agayne ascended heauen sente holy spirite refusyng none neyther diuersitie stocke age kinde state lyfe al sinnes former life drowned death holy baptisme sinnes imputed neuer greuous cleansyng whiche blessed innocent dyed reste life passed ouer rule christ saye doctrine ghospell tyme baptisme man iudged taken christian perfourmaunce whiche high profession graunt fre succour ayde graunte also plentifull rewarde perseuer vnto thende requireth man burden moses lawe onelye requyreth lyuely fayth whiche maye redily beleue whatsoeuer shewed sure truste looke whiche promysed eternall veritie doethe deceyue god promiser disapointeth man lawe shall nowe prescribe doen christian charitie shall playnly tell booke generacion iesus christe sonne dauid sonne abraham abraham begat isaac isaac begat iacob iacob begat iudas hys brother hytherto haue trulye delyuered vnto ghospell mouthe haue made men partetakers thynges whiche haue seene iyes hearde eares nowe daunger thyng beyng spred abrode daylye leste tellyng passyng many mennes mouthes maye varye elles leste tale tolde mouthe well beleued whan written booke furthermore thintent thyng written maye easily cum vnto men voyce mouthe shall comprise booke summe whole matter muche shall sufficient obteynynge saluacion natiuite doctrine miracle deathe resurreccion fyrste shall recite geneologie pe igree iesus christe takyng oure begynnyng highe heade dauid abraham eyther memorye twoo verye ryfe common verye acceptable among iewes theyr glorye chiefly ahraham autour beginner theyr nacion dauid kynge beeynge muche praysed commendacion god styeketh theyr myndes memorie hym yet freshe newe elles christe whiche looked many yeares promysed chyefly vnto twoo bookes oracle hebrues whome euen directly agaynste christe gaue great credyt boke genesis god speakethe vnto abraham promysyng tyme come shoulde sprynge one hys stocke whose free benefit onely nacion iewes also people whole worlde beyng receyued ryght title loue chyldren shoulde obteine wyth christe felowshyppe kyngdome heauen circumcision whych setforth ye faythe gospel thus saythe god vnto abraham thy seed saye iesus christe nacions shall blessed dauid misticall psalmes speaketh thus fruite thy wombe shall set vpon thy seat shall doe chiefly iewes leste beyng rebellious nacion harde beliefe knowyng authoritie prophecy whiche sufficiently beleue messias whiche shoulde come promysed maye make cauillacions saye sauioure loked whome scripture promysed many mindes blinded wyth desire worldly thynges takyng aryght sayinges prophetes suche theyr carnall grosse affeccion loked myghtye glorious kynge valiaunt armes hostes weapon rich suche defence worlde shoulde promote hys people ryches honour emperie shoulde subdue whole worlde dominion hebrues christ althoughe lorde ouer came worlde entent enryche wyth worldlye gooddes one nacion whyche borne touchyng hys body yt toke intente auaunce nacions whole worlde vnto true ryches neuer shoulde decay make blessed euerlastingly wyth heauenly ryches ouercum tyranny deathe sufferyng diyng subdue enemy gentill deseruinges kill monster vice rebellious prouocacions concupiscence sweard spirite beyng ouercum fighte agaynst spirite god geue v righteousnesse innocencie finally spiritual weapon winne vnto v spirituall kingdome iewes cannot haue hereafter anything saye whan shall see thynges consent agre vnto hym whome knowe come constauntly preache thesame whyche thynges holy prophetes inspired heauenly spirite prophecied full consent agremente long holye bookes saye stocke familie manner byrthe lyfe doctrine myracles affliccions rebuke kynde death buriall resurreccion thascendyng heauen holy ghoste sente downe heauen wounderfull toungues apostle conuersion gentile thynges whiche sawe dayly see doen professe name christe finally tyme also doeth agree ye prophecied come thynges prophecied sayinges prophetes also wer signified actes dedes ye patriarch nowe seing thei know thinges thei copare whiche shewe haue doen shall vnderstande loke vayne messias th n speake came humble abiccte concernyng fourme mannes bodye esai prophecied come delyuer men deathe tyranny deathe shall cum againe thende worlde sauiour iudge bothe lyuing deade man excluded fro benefite man shal escape iudgement shal ioyfully see ye iudge dealyng euerlasting rewardes whiche doe despise hym meke sauiour easy entr ted therfore messias whose geneologie petigre shal forthwith shewed touching body whiche toke cause hym shoulde spring cum furth new nacion carnall spiritual rather replenish heauen yearth also shoulde encreaced multiplied seed man euangelical fayth whiche heauenly seed goddes worde faith autour father misticall fygure represented abraham law circumsicion yet publyshed deserued prayse rightuousnes men god kepyng law sinceritie faith wherby doubted nothing goddes promise although wer farre passing power nature trust confidence called father many nacions example hym beleue gospel iesus christe nowe body beyng decaied age wife also beyng weake barain begate isaac whiche promised vnto hym also figure christe vearyng wood sacrifice whereunto apoynted isaac begat iacob though wer younger brother yet set elder brother besyde purchased inheritaunce hymself wherin figure churche congregated gathered together gentile iewes excluded encreaseth daily receiuing grace gospell faythe iewes vnbelefe haue made themselfes vnworthy thus sayeth god haue loued iacob hated esau prophetes ofte mencion made name iacob begate iudas whome tribe name whiche christ prophecied cum whose name inheritaunce promised newe lawe gospel thus speaketh hieremie beholde dayes come sayeth lorde wyll dispose newe testament house iudas house iacob beget onely albeit deserued chiefly recited ye geneologie also begate eleuen brother iudas seuerally gaue name ye seuerall trybes nacion israell iudas begat phares zaram thamar phares begat esrom esrom begat atam atam begat aminadab aminadab begat naasson naasson begate salmon salmon begat boo rahab boo begat obed ruth obed begat iesse iesse begat dauid kyng dauid kyng begat salomon wyfe uri iudas two chyldren burden named phares zaram lawfull wyfe thamat hys daughter lawe whyche maryed eldest soonne iudas vnto whome iudas perfourme hys promyse saye myghte maryed sela brother vnto housbande dead accordyng order law woman passyng measure desirous haue chylde tooke habite common woman coueryng face crafte deceyte laye iudas father lawe afterwarde shewyng token whyche receyued hym woulde suffer hym lye wyth auouched proued hym father bothe chyldren otherwyse earnestlye woulde haue brente accordyng lawe thyng thus doen without offence blame yet mysterie hyd vnder thys vnhonest couerture maketh muche matter ghospell lyke also phares figure significacion churche synagogue whiche phares preuented brother endeuored goe furthe mother wombe puttyng foorth hande fyrste phares esrom borne esrom aram aram aminadab aminadab naasson hym salmon salmon begat boo rahab whiche though nacion iewes cananites yet preserued spyalles sent iesu captain guyde iewes betrayed citie hierico deserued place geneologie theym whiche throughe faythe made prayse worthie god exempted sorte order common woman chosen admitted emong people god maryed housbande nacion iewes signifying euen tyme synners heathen people beyng alienate religion god shoulde coupled vnto christe throughe merite faythe boo also hade soonne named obeth ruth moabite whiche also renouncyng countreye bodily affeccions rather planted emong people iewes say suche professe doctrine christe thus tyme fygures shadowes signified kynde men shoulde dryuen kept felowshyp gospell bryng hym faith desirous minde true godlynes obed came iesse whiche called also isai whose name esay propheciyng christe maketh mencion saying rod shall cum roote iesse hym borne dauid derely beloued god bothe kynge prophete buylder citie hierusalem noble slaughter goliad wicked kyng saul deposed comaundemente god pore shepeherd consecrate kyng ouer israelite oute whose stocke whole nacion hebrues loke christe shoulde cum prophecied men wer inspired god also represente many wayes fygure christe ofspring dauid begat salomon king peace buylder lordes temple begate hym bethsabee whome loued whome coupled vnto hym maryage uria former housbande stayne fraude gyle doen wythout great sinne yf man consydre nothyng besydes outwarde parte historie agayne without significacion thynges cum yf man serche misterie salomon begat roboham roboham begat abia abia begat asa asa begat iosaphat iosaphat begat ioram ioram people hebrues captiue babilon wer figure signifiyng tyranny deuill toward mankynde libertie restored thoroughe benefit christ nere narowe poynt betwene seru tude libertie whan people god wer restored iacob father ioseph vnto whome maried mary mother iesus promised sauiour men whome hebrues call messias saye christ anoynted onely beyng kyng ouer high priest ye sacrifice owne bodye hath pacified god father beyng displeased grieued sinnes mankinde tiranny death vtterly put awaye hath opened kingdome heauen vnto men cleane marryed clean moste chaste chaste thesame trybe familie dauid accordyng order goddes lawe leste man thinke ordre geneologie kinred litle profit concernyng declaracion christes stocke wherof came touching humanitie generacions abraham dauid xiiii generacions dauid vnto captiuitie babilon fouretene generacions captiuitie babilon vnto christ fowertene generacions man list herken tyme daniel described many yeares past certaine order degres weekes shall fynde sayinges ye prophetes agreable ye thyng cu passe sume ye wholle geneologie resteth three fowertenes ye counte fro abraham ye patriarche vnto dauid ye author ye storishing kingdoe ye shall fynde xiiii generacions agayne yf ye counte dauid vnto decaye kyngedome yt vnto exile babilon ye shal finde xiiii generacions agayne ye counte ye time vnto christe beginner finisher newe euangelicall generacion newe kyngdome ye shall fynde fowertene generatios hitherto haue shewed truly ye geneologie christ ye intent may appeare al men yt ye true sayiges ye prophetesi tymes paste promissed ye world many argumetes agre one cannot seme done chaunce withall maye euident verye man whiche came touchyng fleshe suche auncestoures wer notablie knowen byrth christ wise whan mother mary espoused vnto ioseph came together found child holy ghost althoughe man borne man whiche came redeme mankynde death yet borne common vulgare sorte borne seemely whiche came heauen whiche called vnto heauen whiche taughte promysed nothing heauenlye thynges finallye whiche many prophetes doctours made ambassadour thintent altogether make al thynges newe cum forth worlde bodye dede yet newe maner true natiuitie man bee declared suche orte shoulde thought vnsemely god esaie prophecied thing cum passe men dyd maner slepe common myracles nature reason custome god shoulde shewe newe myracle yearthe intente euident mennes sight vnderstanding borne verye man mortall yet god immortall borne man man yet virgin borne stocke ada whiche first makynde yet without spot sinne borne matrimonye woorke concepcion man holy gost woderfull meane fourmed fashyoned straunge maruailous fruite ye substaunce vndefiled virgin heauenly temple consecrated god ordered matter wyth suche maruailous wysedome couered hyd wicked thyng incredible persuaded vnto godly myndes moste certain sure argumentes whiche eloquece man vtterly able proue perswade wherefore whan holy virgin eternally appoynted great misterie mother iesus aduise parentes whose heartes ordered directed power god beyng spoused honest man tribe named ioseph kepte company house founde greate chylde came coupled together manne wyfe eyther true honestie hastie luste pleasure god dyd ordre thys matter maiden wombe waxyng daylye greater greater declared vnto ioseph beyng housbande whiche loued well insencible suche thynges fledde sighte housbande though conscience yelded self culpable neyther disclosed secret whiche learned angel eyether despayre ye thyng might yet bee beleued perswaded reserued vnto god declared tyme coueniet therfore cocepcion certayne true declaryng selfe manifest accustomed token especially vnto ioseph reason conuersacion householde marked easily spouse habyte fourme body young thyng came furthe imbracing man woman common lawe nature wonte conceyue holy ghoste whiche angell gabriell messinger heauen enteryng moste holy temple virgines wombe inuisible power fatherlye god hed imbracyng owershadoynge whole body mynde moste holy virgin without hurt detriment chastitie made great chylde pbut ioseph husband beyng righteous man would put shame mynded departe secretly furthermore ioseph beeyng yet ignoraut great mistery wha sawe euident argumentes token concepcion wyfe knewe well neuer ye mayde whereby myght becum great wyth chylde yet founde maners suche coulde suspicion aduoutry besydes true honesty neyther ready misdeme hasty reuenge began cast minde meanes myghte see good name life wyfe also co mit matier vnto god whereof himselfe coulde fynde ende yssue reason great familiaritie founde maners mayde vtterly without blame godly spirite whiche dwelled wholy harte dyd appere iyes countenaunce dyd declare selfe euerye goyng gesture communicacion espied certayne heauenly thing aboue common rate mortall creature yet sawe great chylde awaye fro home certayne monethes whyle went see cosyn elizabeth furthermore considered howe greate weakenes age kynde maydens busines would sum husbande haue made chiefely loue styred vp gelowsy whiche sore disease mynde proue matter true ioseph chosen witnes leste man myght saye chylde marye eyther another woman el vnlawfully gotten man well estemed menne manne knowen tried honestie wisedome man might suspect eyther notably naughtye woulde wyues bawde foolish pacience would nourysh bryng vp child knew aduoutresse none cruell wyues amisse whiche bee defiled many aduoutryes theselues ioseph innocent far al desyre vengeaunce dyd muche woordes fynde faulte leste discourage virgin harte sorowfulnes troubled secrete care mynde doth deuise gentle kinde diuorce might delyuered company whiche wt chylde suche wise myght beare blame ieopardie perill pbut thus thought beholde angell lorde appeared vnto slepe saying ioseph thou sonne dauid feare take vnto mary thy wyfe whiche conceyued holy ghost shall bring furthe soonne thou shalt call name iesus shall saue people theyr synnes thus farre god hath suffered innocent man troubled distracte doubtefull deuises expediente certentie fayth nowe tyme deliuered griefes minde worthy doubtles made partaker mistery greate honour dyd virgyn thus consecrated god approued grauitie sobrenesse suppressyng care hys mynde thought mere conteyne kepe trustely secret mistery whiche yet published peruerse frowarde suspicion iewes beholde angell gabriel whiche signified vnto virgin maruelouse concepcion apperyng great lyght vnto waking purenes whiche angelical beyng wel acquaynted suche kinde vision presenteth himselfe vnto ioseph sleepe musing sleepe suche like matter messinger heauenlye oracle spake vnto wyse ioseph sonne dauid carnall suspicion troubleth thy mynde art thou vexed doest thou wauer doest thou muse vpon diuorcement wilt thou dimissed whiche cowpled vnto great loue also kinred tribe familie none spouse worthy virgin appointed none ordynaunce god bu thou must know dauid author thy stocke vnto promised tymes past thyng nowe begynneth perfourmed done godly thou nedest feare thy wyues wombe rising without thy doyng shal steyne thy matrimony spot dishonestie thou doest suppose greate chylde doest suppose aright thou must therfore remoue thy companye conuersacion rather take adioyne vnto thou seest great vnto goddes ordinaunce thou art geue husbade intent hereafter thou maiest witnes frui tfull virginitie founde thy wyfe meane tyme maryed vnto may safetie agaynste suspiciouse crueltie iewes vnto whome misterie yet bee opened especially vnto bee yet worthye neither capacitie receiue matter shalbe communicated opened vnto intente thy wyues innocencie shall suffer none vnworthye thyng newe fruite wherwith thou seest thy wyues wombe dayly encreace lyke none mortall man angel brought message beyng goer betwene god makyng godly coniunccion father hath ouershadowed holy ghoste hath prepared wombe sonne god hath replenished newe newe chylde shall borne procedeth heauen thy wyfe shall bryng forth shalbe chaste also hath brought furth chylde shall beare sonne worlde meane season thou shalt called father thou shalt keper mayde rather housbande chylde borne thou father shalt geue name name thine owne fantasie name god agreably vnto thyng dyd destinate appoynt vnto hym creacion worlde thou shalte call name iesus say sauioure messias desired loked many yeres accordyng sayinges prophetes shall deliuer people theyr synnes sacrifice beastes owne bloude wil onely content geue freely great benefyt whan purged fro synnes former lyfe geue v also perfect eternall saluacion doen thyng myght fullfylled whiche spoken lorde prophet saying thus beholde mayde shalbe chylde shall bring furth sonne shall call name emanuel whiche interpretacion god v surely none matter brought passe chaunce fortune decree prouidence god thyng shewe bee doen tymes past lorde himselfe promised woulde speakyng mouthe prophete esay setting furth fewe wordes bothe straunge newnes ye greate fruite profit concepcion beholde sayeth virgin shall conceyue bryng furthe straungenes euer hearde mayden haue borne chyld without blemish hir virginitie nowe herken fruite profite name shal called sayeth emanuel soundeth hebrue god v one shal reconcile prople vnto god offended displeased shall make hym fauourable mercifull beyng conuersaunt emong men shall powre moste aboundant goodnes god last hauyng knowledge experience effectuall doctrine might miracle present efficacy strength vehemencie diuine spirite showyng selfe new sorte shall beleue shall crie without cause god v thou acknowledge prophecy truely thou doest acknowledge geue attendaunce honour mystery kepe close secrete priuitie whan ioseph awoke slepe dyd angell lorde ad toke wife vnto knewe tyl brought furth hir first borne soonne called name iesus whan messinger hygh god spoken thynges ioseph waking slepe merely cherefully dyd obey oracle setteth aparte al purpose discorde taketh wife nerely vnto hym yt man might suspecte discorde disagrement betwene perceyuing yt wholly dedicated vnto god heauen doeth honoure hir godlye mistery dareth touche hir whome god taken onely hymselfe diligent seruice forbeareth company hir hir husbande meane reason heaue lye fruite waxeth ripe holy woumbe virgin whiche cummyng furthe time mother virgin toke away integritie parente consecrate sanctifye ioseph commaunded angell bearing countenaunce father hitherto gaue name chylde iesus whan fashion countrey circumcised yght daye ii chapter whan iesus borne bethleem towne iewrye tyme herode kyng beholde came magians easte hierusalem saying e whiche borne kyng iewes sawe starre easte cum wurship hitherto ye see howe many thynges accorde agree godly sayinges prophetes borne auncetours tribe familie prophecy promised borne also supputacion counte wekes daniel prophecied shoulde cum dothe consente agreewhan iesus borne c also strange natiuitie dothe agree borne virgin without helpe man name doth agree sauiour promysed sauiour loked iesus signifieth sauiour furthermore name countrey towne doth answere fayth prophetes borne farre hierusalem litle towne called bethleem countrey iewry towne galile also name tribe zabulon borne time herode idumean birthe iewe obteyned kyngdom ouer iewes man neded doubte time messias borne whiche iacob patriarche many yeres prophecied cum passe saying scepter shall taken iuda ruler thighe till cum sent truely holyest whose entring anoynting iewes ought haue ceased geue place nowe ye shall vnderstande wonderfull meanes began litle litle knowe world would manifest open vnto whiche came saue bothe might knowen vnto good men theyr saluacion myght take awaye wicked excuse ignoraunce promised chiefely iewes borne firste preached vnto angel syngyng glory high vnto god yearth peace emong men good shepherdes beyng taught voyce angel told childe yt borne offered first fruites fayth maunger babe borne secrete inspiracion spirite knowen elizabeth simeon ann prophetisse firste shewed vnto poore humble persones knew pres redy receaue fayth proud woulde lightly receyue beeyng huble riche poore stoute beyng meke wer intangled desyres worlde woulde receyue heauenly promised iewes also gentile yea al nacions world would euen entery begynnyng knowen also thin ent might declare showe saluacio also offered vnto might styrre prouoke iewes example cum fayth beleue drawe men one meane knowledge himselfe allured euerye mane lytle litle suche thynges alreadye knewe well acquainted iewes gaue fayth vnto prophetes moued signes woonders therefore entised allurement thyngesbeholde came c persian caldeans dyd attribute muche starres menne muche geuen kynde philosophie throughe knowledge whereof perswaded themselues certayne wonderfull restorer worlde therfore knowledge birthe chylde prophete angell certayne straunge woonderfull apperyng starre trulye starre whiche prophecie balaam dyd shewe rise house iacob knowledge common fame king chiefly promised vnto nacion iewes meane kyng common sorte notable without comparison whose power whose wisedome whose goodnes far excedyng power wisedome goodnes man whole worlde shoulde haue experience yll man hath occasio made wurse wyse man hath occasion made wiser certayne magians name persian called notable science philosophie thintent might come nere learne exactlye thyng starre shewed vnto dreame beyng nothing afearde great iourney come vnto hierusalem star guydyng waye eyther dwelled scribe phariseis whiche verye expert law prophetes vnderstode king borne farre hierusalem knowyng certaynly borne inquired place yt made happy noble birthe thoughte natiuitie great prince could hid emong whiche loked byrthe many hundred yeares especially seing borne onely emong also christ later difficultie knowen riche city prince courtes emong arrogant profession wisedomefor saw starre east c ignoraunt thynges inquire simplye openly whiche lately borne kyng iewes knowe sure token borne farre hence easte sawe starre meruelous bryghtnesse bewty sawe starre felte inspiracion therfore know borne commoditie profite men though straungers yet come hither honour wurship geue first fruites honour due vnto newe kyng knowing well shall happy blessed shall haue power might mercifull vnto pwhan herode kyng heard thynges troubled citie hierusalem calling together bishop scribe people asked christ borne sayed hym bethleem iewrye written prophet thou bethleem land iuda acte least emong prince iuda shall haue captayne come shall gouerne people israell tyme suche communicacion simply men rumoure tidynges brought herode king whiche good feared trembled name borne fearyng lest shoulde set besyde kyngdome whiche beyng stra gier held great prynce borne stocke ye iewes herode dreamed nothing el earthly kingdome litle knowing christ brought another kynde kyngdom whiche shoulde perteyne vniuersallye men therfore hearde borne feared borne hearde magians men learnyng concerning worldly port despised truely troubled minde also whole citie hierusalem diuers men diuerslye either fearyng hopyng wisedome god ordered affection endeuours men simplicitie godly also rage vngodly set furth glory christ euery syde made thynges incredible vse beleued cause loode sterre waye left magians tyme entering hierusalem theyr enquirie might showe abrode fame childe borne yet place chylde borne kept secret cruell kingand said hi iury c therfore king herode blynded enuy anger beyng wholly bent destroye chylde borne pretended cloke godlines vnto wicked crueltie calleth vnto chiefe order priestes scribe people iewry whose speciall profession newe matter dyd aryse make answere sayinges prophetes theyr godly bookes professed exacte knowledge thintent nu ber authoritie make thyng credite therfore called together king muche wicked counterfeited godlynes demaunded place orasies sayi ge god promise christe borne yet rageing haired agaynste christe whome seen answered simplye withoute delaye bethleem iuda lest theyr authoritie haue little weyght beholde haue redines prophecie prophete mitheas thou bethleem lande iuda art least among prynces iuda shall spryng ruler whiche shall rule people israel herode priuily calling magians diligently inquired tyme lette app ted sendyng bethleem sayde g thither searche diligently chylde whan ye haue founde bryng woorde agayne maye come wurship also thynges answered priestes scribe afterwarde procured hym slayne bryght notable miracle good vnto men king fyrste greatly moued saying magians vtterly amased ripe ready answere chiefely prophecie promised manifestlye ruler bethleem whiche rule people borne wherfore priestes scribe beyng sent awaye despeyre deceyue calleth ye magians priuily vnto leste iewes might suspect crafte guile opening matter eche syde though purposed one thing inquired diligently long synce sterre appered fyrst vnto whose showing poynting passed ouer great iourney came hierusalem meaning purposing certeinly vse exercyse crueltie distruccion one new borne childe magias godlines suspictouse kepe hide nothyng thinking cruell fierce would shewe crueltie vpon infante yet skante borne neither furiouse would suppose suppresse mannes deuise thyng doen goddes might shewed tyme syde shewed place whiche learned scribe conceiuing sure hope childe might take two shewinges geueth commaundement owne name magians selues willyng go go bethleem seke childe great diligence found returne eftfones vnto hierusalem geue knowledge matter pretended verye godly cause nothyng displeasaunte myndes magians also maye folowe wurshyp hym himselfe woulde firste haue knowledge childe inten e mighte destroye hym people iewes cleare vnderstandyng borne god meane tyme made prouision magians returned safely preache christe owne countreyes otherwyse yf vngraciouse man bene deceyued hope would haue vsed extremely magians themselues brought vnlucky tydynges pwhan heard king went forward lot starre saw east went tyll came stode ouer place childe sawe sterre merueilously glad went house found childe mary mother fell downe wurshipped opened treasure offered vnto gyftes gold incense myrre beyng warned god sleape shoulde go agayne herode turned owne countrey another waye godly simple magians hearde king made haste vnto bethleem sterre called furth time forsake intente barbarouse people fyrst shew vnto iewes christ borne whome lokyng many yeres afterward put death passed ouer parte goddes ordinaunce agayne appered wonderfull starre whiche serued godly purpose suche wyseand whan thei sawe starre c shewed vnto onely bethleem also cotage selfe beyng lowe poore bafe therfore verye harde fynde yea hangyng nere ouer chyldes head shewe pointe finger infant feruently desyred therfore starre began appeare agayne shooke put waye carefulnes fro myndes nowe replenyshed sure hope ioye passyng litle vpon mennes tellynges folowing heauenly guyde espye palace newe kyng filthy vile cotage stable sincere godlynes nothyng troubled thynges enter fynde infante differyng apparaunce others fynde mother nothyng gaye gorgious loke theyr stuffe shewed testified pouertie simplicitie magians whiche worship fall downe herode magnifying hymselfe seate kingly pompe fall downe cradle cry babe adoure honour grouelyng groundeand fell downe flat worshypped hym hym could yet speake thei content godlynes take theyr box giftes purposely apoynted thinges increase whiche nacion persian chiefly enriched golde incense myrre lest shortly compelled flee lacke vyage fyrst fruites fayth gentile farre preuenting iewes thought next vnto god constitute christe theyr kyng side dedicate themselues vnto hym offeryng new sacrifice three kyndes thinges ryddell darke figure professed ineffable trinitie father sonne holy goste acknowlegyng also ne man mortalitie priesthode kingdome golde kyng incense prieste myrre hym shall dye borne mortalland beyng warned god c sacrifice crosse conquered rising fro death reygneth heauen iewes sawe many wonder knewe hym kylled hym magians sawe notable thyng co cernyng theyr bodely iyes reioyce fortunate iourney tyme deuysed themselues whether shoulde returne vnto herode satisfy mynde desyre admonished theyr slepe diuine oracle returne agayne herode neyther suertie vnto neither childe neither expedient weightie matter whiche tyme parsell meale promulgated published vnto world spedely obey thoracle returned theyr countrey another waye newe preacher newe kyng among theyr countrey men departed behold aungell lorde appered ioseph slepe saying aryse take chylde mother flye egypte abyde tyll bryng thee worde ode wyll seke chylde destroye whan awoke toke chylde mother night went asyde egipte vnto death herode might fulfilled whiche spoken lorde prophete saying oute egipte haue called sonne helth safetie magians prouided tranquillitie mother chylde might forthwith seen foraryse take thee ye child also vngodlines herode accordyng vnto desertes might exasperated greued glory christe thesame heauenlye messinger whiche sente awaye magians appered vnto ioseph slepe exhortyng hym beyng priuye vnto mistery would conueye awaye secretely mother chylde egypt whereby diuine counsel intended region also beyng wholy geuen monstreous worshippyng goddes while become hoste eyuer fled countrey touching hauing might prepared made redy entry beginning true godlines therfore angel spake vnto ioseph wordes aryse take thee chylde mother flee priuily egypte tary vntyll returne vnto thee shewe thee tyme come hither agayne come passe herode shall seke meanes destroye chylde harde vnto god sodenly extinct kyll herode preserue childe yf please ordre matter profitable confyrmacion establyshment faythe goddes wyll fury rage tyranne shall set forthe glory ioseph tarying toke mother mayde chylde flying night seaso conueyed egypte remaynyng tyll herode deade truely thyng chaunced feare man fortune god prepare establyshe kyngdome sone aduersities whiche worldly thynges worst decayed brought naught leste world take vpon thyng diuine matter thou mayest better beleue god would thyng come passe prophecied many yeares past mouthe prophete osee saying egypt called sonne herode whan sawe mocked magians greatly greued sent furth men warre kylled slewe chyldren bethleem coastes therof many two yeare olde vnder accordyng tyme whiche diligently knowen magians meane season kyng herode perceyued dede magians deceyued hym rageing anger caste away cloke godlynes bruste manifest rage sendyng furth minister madnes kylled thinfantes many bethleem many coastes compasse towne age two yeare youger folowyng supputacion tyme whiche magians tolde sawe fyrste starre chylde crueltie enlarged tyme place compassing al young chyldren supposing wycked counsell prouided surely ynough escape meanes onely desyred extincte slayne vayne trauayleth crafte menne againste counsel god thynges shewed manifest example suffer wycked prynces would beleue gospel preuayle crueltie traueyled extinguishe faythe gospell beyng yet tender springing vp harte godlye killed christ saued herode occasion repente rage yf gredines reygne beare rule blynded mynde owne default turneth al thinges matter greater madnes maliciousnes set foorth iustice god manifest al men innocent child slayne great crueltie worthy horrible distruccion wherewith afterwarde surely payde pthan fulfylled whiche spoken prophet hieremy sayeth voyce heard rhama lamentacion wepyng greate mournyng rachell wepyng chyldren would comforted lest manne might doubte thing came passe ordinaunce god harke prophecie prophete hiermy seeyng goddes inspiracion thyng though doen already whiche many yeres come passe voyce heard rhama voyce sore wepyng sorowfull lamentable rachel dyd bewayle hir child would receyue comforte wer slayne rachel bearing beniamin saye sonne sorowe vpon hir deliuery dyed buryed farre bethleem wherof prophet dyd expresse persone sorowe waylyng mother lamentyng theyr child whiche herode kylled whan herode deade beholde angell lorde appered slepe ioseph egypt saying aryse take chylde mother go lande israel deade whiche sought childes lyfe arose toke childe mother came lande israel meane season herode taken worlde punishment vengeaunce moste worthy hym angell agayne gaue counsell flye awaye apperyng ioseph slepe moueth hym leaue egypte bryng agayne childe mother lande israell sayed dead woulde haue chylde destroyed redely obeying thynges god conueyed mary beyng mayde mother together swete babe countrey israell behoued firste knowen vnto vnto whome chiefely sente thintente people harde belefe haue nothyng might make reasonable pretence vngodlynes denying hym theyr messias apoynted vnto gentile pbut whan heard archelaus reygned iewry roume father herode afrayde go thither beyng warned god slepe wente asyde coastes galile wente dwelte citie called nazareth mighte fulfilled whiche spoken prophetes shalbe called nazarite soone ioseph entred coastes countrey knowledge constante fame archelaus soonne herode deade hauyng one halfe father kyngdome reygned iewrye father place fearyng leste soonne succeded hys father cruelues lyke dyd kyngdome durste go thither agayne beyng establyshed aunswere aungell whereof nowe wholy depende wente aparte coastes galile whiche parte chaunced vnto herode tetrarche brother king deade aungell promised thing safe also loue countrey inuitacion counsell god wrought withall christ many occasion made common many whose cumming euery manne bethleem doeth glorye byrth hierusalem circumcised purified egypt happy noble geast nazareth maye well glory brynging vp countrey mother whiche conceyued sonne base poore vyllage galile countrey regarded dyspised iewes secrete corner muche meete child crueltie archelaus pointe herein god doth teache v nede helpes rich power partetaking nobilitie birth thinges doen wyll god nay thinges annexed put vnto rather obscure darken glory god among menthat myghte bee fulfilled c thyng came passe fortune maye appere prophecie long declared messias called nazarene whiche doen euen tytle doeth declare pilate ignoraunt prophecie commaunded set vpon crosse iesus nazareth kyng iewes daye professe christ therfore many called nazarene worde self hath mistery nazareth among hebrewes hath name floure godly swete floure sanctifier virginitie borne virgin lyke bethleem signifieth vnto hebrewes house breade whiche came heauenly breade whoso eateth shall lyue euerlastingly therfore yued certaine yeares one vnknowen mother foster father ioseph whose sonne thought menne vntyll tyme came vnto mannes state shewed hymselfe vnto worlde doctryne miracle death resurreccion beyng knowen notable nothing exc lyng menne went forwarde dayly encreased kynde honestie heauenlye giftes euery man loked great notable thyng chylde also meane season diligent obseruer lawe would geue none occasion vnto euyll wyllers euyll saying backe bytyng satisfye men thynges rather tyme kepyng lawe bring iewes perfeccion despysyng alienate withdraw theyr myndes cleane hym onely shewed himselfe hierusalem beyng twelue yeres age tyme priuely leauyng parentes founde temple sitting emong doctours hearing course questioning insomuche wonder euen godly disposicion desire vnto thinges whiche sent worlde praise redy mynde example moderation obedience tarry tyme prescribed father iii chapter pin dayes came iohn baptiste preachyng wylhernes iewry saying repent ye former lyfe kyngdome heauen hande whome prophete esay spake whiche saieth voyce crier wildernes prepare waye lorde make pathes strayght iohn garment camel heere gyr cii sky loynes meate locustes wylde houye went hym hierusalem iewrye countrey round nere iordane baptised hym iordane confessyng theyr spunes nowe worthy hearyng know lord iesus christ bega entred matier came thrust sodely men vnawares thought vpon first woulde mennes myndes shoulde preparedin dayes came iohn baptiste made redines vssher messenger iohn sonne zacharie man knowen allowed iewes themselues thentent thyng whiche euer beleued might lytle lytle stilled put harte men therfore whan tyme drewe nere decreed eternall ordeynaunce god whole worlde shoulde renewed doctrine christ iohn came furth sonne priest prophetisse whiche iohn iudged afterward prophet testimonie christ also euen byrthe beginning made men conceyue great hope hym came kinges courtespreachyng wyldrenes iewry commo resortes wildernes chyldhode led aungels lyfe beyng contente wt simple common diet clad garmet woue camel here girded letheren girdell dyet agreable vnto apparell lyued course meate easy gotten found wildernes saie locustes wilde hony suche dyet suche apparell suche place moste mete preacher penaunce whose wonderfull holynes amased men myndes many supposed christ chiefly many perswaded thought messias haue perished number infantes bethleem chalenge vnto glory others insomuche shewed christ openly al men sayed worthy leu e latchet shooes yet rushed furth owne swinge preache whan admonished heauen tyme playe preacher came chaunce office preaching sendyng man hefor prophet esay spake esaye prophecied many yeres vtter openly wyldernes voyce preachyng also set prepare harte men receyue doctrine christ perswading repentaunce former lyfe make able receyue grace christe baptisme shoulde pardon men theyr sinnes course thynges beyng sodeynly chaunged puffed vp vayne iustice moyses lawe folysh wisedom worlde haue combes cut brought lowe finally thei semed vyle abiect vnprofitable theyr ignoraunce hu blenes nowe made liuely strong doctrine ghospell ryche heauenly ryches thynges whiche rigoure lawe semed hard intricate throughe faythe grace gospel made right easy health saluacion opened publyshed onely iewes also nacions worlde thynges prophecied esay assured prophet lord prophecie voyce cryer deserte prepare ye waye lorde make pathes plaine euen euery valey shall fylled euery mountayne hyll shalbe brought lowe croked shalbe made strayght rough shalbe turned plaine wayes mankinde shall see saluacion god nowe certeyne rumor fame cumming christ secretly spred abroade many farther conscience theyr naughty lyues tyme sinfull fylthy finally certaine secrete inspiracion dyd cause brought passe many wery theyr life beyng desyrous certeyne sauour vnderstandyng simple though wer sodenly renewe kynde men theyr synnes clerely abolyshed bryng vnto kyngdo righteousnesse wherfore whan came flockyng vnto iohn onely citie hierusalem also whole iewry chiefly coutreis nere vnto iordane iohn himselfe cummeth approcheth satisfie theyr redy wyll desyre thyng preached wyldernes thesame doth beate people beyng thycke assembled gathered together nere vnto water iordane repentauce theyr former lyfe might prepare themselues messias hande offer themselues healed hymand baptised hym iordane c bryng helthe saluacion waye helth knowlegeth disease hateth sayeth kyngdome heauen moste fortunate moste desyred kingdo hand yea nere entrie suche pure cleane worldly filthines preaching figure toke filthynes mindes shortely clensed awaye many wer baptised water iordane condemning theyr former lyfe acknowlegyng theyr offence openly thought good vnto wysedome god iohn bound border moses lawe nowe ende grace gospell nowe cumming sygne token go abolishe synne whiche thyng christe properly reserued vnto himselfe prepare mennes myndes might able receyue benefite furthwith ensue whan sawe many ye phariseis saduce cummyng baptisme sayd vnto gene acio viper hath taught flee vengeaunce bring furth therfore fruites becummeth penaunce minde saye within selues haue abraham father saye god able bryng passe stone child shall ryse vp abraham euen nowe axe also put roote tree therfore euery tree whiche bringeth urthe good fruite wen downe cast fyer doen xv yeare tiberius cesar beyng emperour rome poncius pilate hauyng rule ouer iewry vnder hym herode brother hym dyed beyng tetrarche galile christ made abode brother philip tetrarche iturea countrie trachonisis lisanya tetrarche abiline anne cayphas beyng chiefe priestes thus realme iewry beyng deuyded vnto many ruler furthe came whiche call thynges power rule one prynce fyrste great numbre people flockyng vnto wha iohn sawe great multitude phariseis saduceis come baptisme ignoraunt kynde people arrogat fierce standyng theyr owne conceyte notable obseruacion moyses lawe semed themselues merites patriarch whome craked gloryed muche came enuying laying wayte hynder baptisme iohn beeyng vse reputacion sent craftye message vnto hym bethabaram iohn time baptise demaudyng whether christ forthwith would haue obiected christe promised tribe iuda wheras manifest iohn tribe leuy iohn protested plainly christ prophete especially olde aunciente prophetes thought woulde returne agayne worlde demaunde hym howe durst promyse remission sinnes baptysme whiche properly reserued vnto christ answered muche difference betwene baptisme wherby dyd stirre moue repentaunce forthynkyng former lyfe baptisme christ whiche forthwith folow wherby sinnes forgeuen therfore whan sawe many kynde men come runnyng baptisme othershe sayd vnto generacion viper biteth theyr conscience bitter wordes wherby might rather moue penaunce crafty malicious kynde men nay menne rather ofspring vypers murderer auncetours subtyll yll mynded towarde men seyng hytherto ye haue vaunted selues emong men vnder tytle name father whiche holines muche praise wurthy vnder false pretence righteousnes haue reigned negligently idelly though messias neuer haue come tolde put remembraunce ineuitable punishmente hande vnles ye runne others remedy penaunce ye desyre baptised sinner among whome ye appered men great holynes ye haue perceyued trust vayne vnles ye escape vengeaunce god beyng hande refuge penaunce neyther merites father obseruacion law deliuereth euerlasting punyshment euery mannes owne purenes lyfe maketh hym commendable vnto god seyng therfore yt ye repent former lyfe hereafter bryng forth fruite wt godly affeccions dedes may testifie ye haue truely repented hytherto grossenes menne fygures shadowes hath sumwhat made men pronitie naughtines compassed stayes might refrayned fallyng farther inconuenience hitherto enlarged phylactery long prayer washinges often mencioning father abraham holy patriarche buildyng prophetes shrynes whose posteritie ye desire appere counted ye haue obteyned vnto certayne coloure appearaunce holynes emong men hereafter shadowes shal vanyshe away light gospel ye must go truely sincerelye woorke ye obteyne euerlastyng health neyther brent sacrifice ne bloud beastes requyred olde sinnes onely e penaunce without counterfaytyng god wyl frely pardon offence messias himselfe wyl teache yf fynde apte willing learne fruites true penaunce meane season set ye aside vaine trust flatter selues thus holy come holy father abraham iuste abraham shall auayle nothyng come vnlesse thei folow faith obedience wer muche commended blessyng hand promised vnto abraha cosinage kynred neuer nere sufficiente obteyne blessyng whosoeuer distrustyng god doeth leane vnto soucoures world fallen kinred abraham hereafter posteritie abraha shall counted kynred bloud sinceritie feyth yet god shall therfore lacke posteritie abraham may perfourme paye blessing promised though ye swarue maners abraham nay ye ascertayned yf ye dispyse grace offered vnto god power yea stone rayse vp chyldren farre better ye bee frende abraham cause ye negligente cummyng messias hath differred hytherto nowe extreme parell cummeth vpon nowe matter euen vpon edge raser eyther ye muste come vnto kyngdome heauen withe cleane syncere myndes elles ye muste receyue eternall punishement saluacion present hande wyll enbrace wyll refuse presente payne vtter destruccion readye hande nowe axe sette tree boughes body rootes whiche shal vtterly cut downe deadly wounde cannot recouered vnlesse bryng furth fruite meete god muste lingering daungier nere hande haste muste made impedimetes lettes quite cut yet ye may chose ye wyll take axe wyll stryke yf ye wyll sodenly chaunge mynde naturall tree long hard chaunge iuyce wherof fruite taketh taste matter brought passe onely wil make haste partaker health linger al partaker peryll none shall deliuered hereafter neither rich neither noble birthe neyther wisedome many hitherto haue supposed euery tree beareth fruite meane fruite excellent good worthye kyngdome heauen cut downe caste fyer pi baptyse water vnto penaunce shall come mightyer whose shoe worthy beare shal baptise holye ghoste fyer whose fanne hande wyl purge floore gather barne wyl burne chaffe fyer cannot quenched hitherto god hath suffered wynked men sluggishnesse erroure ignoraunce deserued pardon mankynde maner deaffe law nature small profit came ye law moses thretninges prophetes set naughte theyr dreames vision hearde come whome none shalbe sent whose cuming leste sodeine vnwares sayeth iohn messenger set ye penitet yf ye knowledge disease yf ye receiue ye phisicion feruent desire wil profitable healthfull ye loke truth baptise intent ye penitent may meere learne redy receyue health wha shal come forthwith wil come yea eue cum behinde ye ordre preaching aboue passeth meanes yt ye thinke sum estimacio worthy drudge slauei baptyse water c either cary shoe leuse yt latchet shoe none thig preacher neuertheles trusty mine office god hath enioined ye prophecy prophet autor brigeth wt al might power forgeue sine cofer geue al kinde vertues let euery approche doctrine baptisme shal baptise wt effectual liuely baptisme wt water wt ye spirit fier ye spirit shal alter trasforme wt fier shal pluck vp vnto heauely thinges wil require nothing sincere penauce wtout couterfeyting wil geue good thi ge frely yl thinges displease hartily onely willeth yt colouringes shall preuail nothing wt nothing hid feareth thing shalbe doen seuere iudgemente whiche voided hereafter shalbe meane either ye muste throughly good throughly euil passe nothing vpo cloked holines hath fane seeth also inward secretes harte either ye must chaffe fyne wheatewhose fane hand meane season whether ye wyl hath partly put choyce shalbe vayne chaffe mingled among clean corne lucke hidde shall vtterly cleanse floore lay vp wheat granard shall burne chaffe fier neuer shall quenched wherfore either ye must endeuour herte high prycke vertue ye maye worthely receiued euerlastyng kyngdome elles yf ye despise goodnes god nowe offered vnto ye must nedes thereby extremely naught ye refuse great helthe offered without seking owne merite forasmuche ye reiect heauenly rewarde ye must appoynted euerlasting fier hell mindes common sorte moued sayinges holy man great numbre whiche hitherto put theyr trust obseruacion lawe came vnto hym tremblyng feare sayd thus sta deth case thinke ye best v dyd exhort ceremony lawe constitucions men phariseis wer wont vnto workes charitie saying first way pacifie god free weldoyng vnto neighbour hath plenty garmentes let geue vnto naked hath plenty meates let hym geue vnto hungry came vnto hym also publicanes kynde ye iewes abhorre comely either please prince satisfy auarice thei wot poul ye people demaude fearfully thiketh best doth reiect baptisme agayne appoynteth geue goodes long time wer wont violently take away mennes thintent might come nere degre vnto perfect doctrine christ comaundeth exact nothing people beside prescribed prince finally came also souldiours violent diffamed kynde people neyther put awaye declaring manifestlye vnto iewes dede christ would despise kinde men confesse nothing professe souldiour selfe confesse puddle sinke mischiefe demaunde also counsayle would geue teacheth beyng rude rather oughte auoyded shunned might lesse yll doen whereby thei might perfectly good abuse weapos ought styrred agaynst enemy commaundement captayn beate man stryke man violentlye syth hyred purpose diligence countrey quiet abuse familiaritie great ruler falsly blamyng accusyng man wherby filthy lucre gayne might come vnto finally content wage defraude spoile man prynces geue wage thintente man necessitie shoulde forced take mennes goodes easye preceptes accordyng euery mannes capacitie made al men redines christ come foreseyng christ spirite yet seen bodily iyes pthen cummeth iesus galile iordane vnto iohn baptised iohn forbade saying haue nede baptised cummest thou iesus answered sayth vnto hym let nowe thus becummeth v fulfyll righteousnesse suffred hym therfore rumour fame beyng spred abrode dayly encreasing diuers meanes angel sheperdes magyans cruel carefulnes herode prophecye zachary simeon anne litle litle secretely al iohns open manifeste setting furth beeyng ioyned great auctoritie inso muche yll also amased feare frame themselfe cumming christ thus declared set furth truly time cu furth sight world declare ye testimony others vertues yt might appere maner one mighty might obscure darken al men whose testimonie heretofore set forth commeded therfore iesus left galile secrete hitherto nowe goig father busines leueth mother cutrey nazareth maketh spede vnto iordan haue great copany gathered together diuers coastes iewrythen cummeth y witnes thinges yt spoke doen alone defiled wt spot sin yea alone take away ye sinnes world ye middes sinful copanies euen lyke sinner goeth vnto iohn requireth baptised hym alone doth sactifie euery baptisme iohn yet ascerteyned yt iesus high messias sonne god yet obseruing marking meruaylouse semelynes honesty apperyng iyesbut iohn forbad coutenaunce maner going doth excuse disordered office ministracion honoring dignitie worthines yet certayne commendacion onely saieth mete conueniet far beneth vnder thy vertues require baptisme cummeth passe thou doest humble adbase thy selfe lowe require baptisme sith man pure cleane fro al sinne thou thynges wer thus doen ordinaunce god thintet haue exaple merueilous modestie humilitie christ also might appere vnto men testimonie iohn christ without coscience sinne euil required baptised baptised like circucised purified teple wt mother scourged crucified suffered thinges v wherfore whe iohn declaring constatly vnworthines setting forth ye worthines christiesus answereth c refuse ye office baptiser christ sinister suspicion steine innocencie behoued knowen beleued al men euery parte busines hath time thou content meane season baptised thynke vn uly thou baptise thou saiest better thou certainly shal becu desireth bring al vnto fulfill iustice teacheth al teacheth perfeccio must see likelyhode apparauce vnrighteousnes neuer litle founde life maners must become thinges al men maye winne bring al vnto father iohn heard wordes descended iordane christ baptised appereth holsome example humilitie christe obedience iohn thyng effecte contrary order baptisme doth consecrate v holy touchyng body consecrate baptisme iesus whan baptised came straight waye water lo heauen open vnto hym sawe spirite god descendyng lyke doue lyghting vpon hym lo came voyce heauen saying beloued sonne whome well pleased thintent might declare vnto v ought baptisme felicitie geuen v baptisme iesus going water cherefully spedely though cast great burde sine teaching v tarry linger washinges oftetymes returne vnto sinning make haste dueties spiritual life sinnes former life cast buried baptisme kneled downe vpon knee lifted hades vnto heaue beseching father yt would vouchesafe matter sauing mankinde toke hande might happy fortunate men would commend set forth sonne vnto world fatherly auctoritie lest iohns auctoritie smal estimacio albeit ye time profitable grosse rude people behold father manyfestly auctorise sone presence suche multitude people heauens opened shewed furthe certayne wonderful light iohn also sawe heauenly spirite visible lykenes doueand lo heauen ope vnto descende heauen sytte vpon holy head thence came voyce father soundyng mennes eares saying derely beloued sonne delight mynde haue singuler pleasure heare hym expouder mynde distributer goodnes towardes time iesus vnknowen multitude great opinion iohn lest voyce whiche cuming fro aboue poynted man certaynely theyr vnderstandyng thoughte perteine vnto iohn therefore added visible signe heaue ly doue whiche sitting vpon christes head showed nowe playnely vnto al man would poynte fynger whome voyce dyd perteine whiche signe also iohn hymselfe playnely certaynly monished sonne god openly testifye sygne token promysed father intente suche multitude people might certeynlye knowe afterwarde baptyse men spirite fyer ceremonyes lorde iesus declared consecrated oure mayster whose diuinitie heauenly doctrine wyll followe shall truly blessed iiii chapter pthen iesus led spirite wyldernes tempted deuyll whan fasted forty dayes forty nyghtes last hungred wha emptoure came hym sayd thou sonne god commaunde stone made bread aunswered sayde written shal lyue bread onely euery worde procedeth mouth god yet entry beginninges made lepeth furth byanby preache although auctoritie wer giue heauen sodenly withdraweth fro sight people wildernes yt departure fro copany people increaseth auctoritie prouoketh desyre ye spirite prouoker yll doeth specyally assaulte leauyng desyres world fall meditacion pure heauenly life therfore iesus secretly teachyng v thesame goeth wyldernes doeth ye mocion instigacion moued spirite baptised hath cast carnall affeccions made spiritual regeneracion led moued cousell holy ghost remembreth bethleem retourneth nazareth goeth mother foster father vehemecy rauishing ye spirite goeth deserte folowyng exauple olde prophetes solytarines doeth quicken make lusty mynde christian souldier tyme sure man commit wylde beastes men baptisme taketh awaye synnes former lyfe man sure assaultes sathan whiche lyueth sluggyshly yet naughty desyres endeuour spryng agayne chiefely rude young lately entered cummen christ frowarde satan enuying muche mannes saluacion christe desyrouse styrreth prouoketh merueylouse engins sleyghtes fall awaye departe insomuche possesseth vseth relapsed tyranny dyd possesse vse hym whan agaynste perilles daungers christe sheweth chiefelye three remedy often harty prayer forsakyng company auoyding excesse kepyng abstinence without diligent meditacion holye scripture otherwyse maye daunger ydle solytarines deuill goeth deceyue chiefly whiche endeuour attaine vnto streyght angelicall lyfe christe hymselfe lyke good captayne encounteryng hath taught champion meanes maliciouse crafty olde syre maye ouercome howe lytle sober vigilant harte leane godly scripture also lorde iesus meane tyme wente aboute misterie mighte litle litle appere vnto worlde suche sorte sathan whiche desyred none purpose knowe certaynly whether sonne god whome heard father honour tytle name lette redempcion mankynde might bee holden suche doubte might certeynlye knowe messias sawe owne tyranny vtterly subuerted ouerthrowen christ also putteth v remembraunce manne mete preache gospell hath tryed hymselfe fyrme strong agaynst worldly desyres agaynst excesse companion bodily luste ambicion auarice suche lyke disease minde wherewith oure enemye beateth shaketh myndes symple weake violent engyns warre therefore whan christ fasted fortye dayes folowyng hely moyses whiche thing suche wyse aboue mannes power yet iewes beleued doen men laste shewe manifeste token mannes imbecillitie himselfeand wha fasted forty dayes made cou sayle shewed playne signes felte tediousnes hungre common nature mannes bodye lacke humour greued payned stomacke temptour camewhiche thyng whan crafty temptoure perceyued thynkyng hym nothyng man althoughe dede notable wonderfull man casteth hooke bayted ye enticement vayne glory therwith chiefly taken whiche seme endeuour hyest perfeccion thou bee sonne god nedest thou greued piened hungre commaund rather stone turned bread thy behoufe thou canste perfourme thy desyre beckebut answered ye maie well know olde thesame lyer wayte teptour whiche entice firste adam snare death vayte trayne gluttony christ latter adam beyng spirite heauenly auoided wordes craftie deceitfull waiter neither refused name sonne god yet hymselfe ouercome hungre common sorte men woulde take vpon hym aunswere owne authoritie layeth vnto hym manifest scripture saying written deuteronomi man shall lyue onely bread euery worde cummeth mouthe god deuyll taketh hym holy citie setteth hym vpon pynnacle temple sayeth vnto hym thou sonne god caste thy selfe downe backewarde wryten shall geue aungels charge ouer theyr handes shall holde vp leste tyme thou dashe foote agaynst stone iesus saide hym agayne wrytten thou shalte tempte lorde thy god satan beeyng eluded shaken doubtful answere doeth euen partye also abuse woordes scripture dooe hurte myschiefe deceyued fyrste parente mankinde baite ambicion promysyng hym eguall honor immortalitie wyth god lyke guyle assaylyng lorde toke hym vp holy citie whan sette hym vpon hygh pinnacle temple exhorted sonne god woulde fal doune hedlong alleagyng could take harme dooyng god hymself thus promysed mistical psalme wil geue aungels comaundement charge ouer shal take theyr hades lest thou shouldest hurt thy foote stone lord iesus laiyng scripture geueth secrete vnderstandyng howe peruers wrested sence holy scripture contraryewyse wryten deuteronomie thou shalt tempt lorde thy god scripture doeth exhorte v poyncte whan aduersitye daunger hande haue good hope trustyng vpo helpe god put selues rashely daunger miracle godlye men tryed sekyng perylles auoydyng daungers whan chaunce godly poyncte caste man headlong ryuer deliuering hym thou mayest seme man great feates godly thing plucke yt chaunce falle miracle donne euery thing emongest men iesus would vouchsafe speake herode desirouse suche thynges muche lesse would showe signe token hys godly power requeste satan often charitie inspired holy gost desyreth often glory god requireth power god shewed abrode agayne deiuil taketh vp high hil showeth al kingdomes world glory sayeth vnto hym wil geue yf thou wylte fall downe worshyp sayeth iesus vnto hym auoid satan writen thou shalt worshyp lorde thy god hym serue deiuill leaueth hym beholde aungels came ministred vnto hym nowe thintente christe myght teache suche geue themselues careles securitie hadde hygher hande twyse alwayes kepe watche redinesse assaultes sathan suffred also thirde tyme thinportune assailing temptour deceyued fyrst adam bayte curiositie auaryce promising hym knowlege good euyll likewyse setteth vpon latter adam toke pinacle temple ledde hym verye hygh hyll might loke libertye farre wyde see kyngdomes worlde woondrefull glorye pompe eche surely knewe experience menne nothing wicked sinful woulde take hande obtayne rule dominion albeit god ye authour maker al thynges heauen yearth deuil hath title interest vnlesse hath viciated defiled thing yet though lorde ouer affrayed thus speake vnto chryste geue al kyngdomes thou wylte fall downe honour blynde impietie vngracious spirite promyseth man gooddes asketh honour due vnto god onely iesus hitherto tooke reproche hymselfe wel worththa sayeth iesus vnto hym cannot beare father ignomynie hence sathan thy counsel farre doctryne holy scripture scripture sayeth thou shalte adoure lorde thy god onely shalt thou serue deiuil tempted hym lyke wayes finding hym alwayes valiaunte inuincible chapion agaynst inuencions ingins left hym last beyng disapoyncted purpose two wayesthen deuil leaueth hym fyrst perceyued christ inuincible secondly came searche whether sonne god departed vncertayne came thys conflicte made syght god hys aungelles whiche lorde iesus woulde haue vnknowen vnto thyntent myght knowe cumberous enemy haue doe wage rewardes would styrre prouoke ignoraunt vnware myndes dispayre diligetly watch take good hede christe ouercame hym shewe vnto v vincible taught v also myght geat victorye hym finally ouercame v hymselfe purposyng v ouercome thesame deserue haue hym presente v v shall heare christe saye hence sathan shall feare seruauntes whome ouercumme furtherlike worldly warreand behold angelles came thinges haue theyr course ordre labour bee eased rest sorofull thynges pleasaunt fore conflictes triumphes made warre christe sore stormes tentacion mitigated myrthe ioyfulnes cumberouse frowardenes filthye spirite aungelles ready serue wait vpon christ conquerour surelye exaumple teacheth v howe aduersitie shoulde staye oure mynde hope better trustyng vpon ye goodnesse god whiche doethe ordre al thinges nowe doeth exercise proue valiauntnes warriers trouble aduersitie agayne wyth sum solace dothe prouoke reioysyng thankes geuyng whiche tryumphe christen men affliccions thorowe helpe god inuincible prosperitie come vnto thei ascribe wholly goodnes bountifulnes god cummeth passe neyther discouraged aduersitie insolente proude prosperitie whan iesus heard iohn taken wente aparte galile left nazareth wente dwelte capernaum cytie vpon sea coast border zabulon neptalim myght fulfilled whiche spoken esai prophete saiyng lande zabulon neptalim way sea beyond iordayne galile gentyles people whiche sate darkenes shadow deathe sawe great lyght whiche sate region shadowe deathe lyght sprong vp therfore whan christe began auctoritie estimacion chiefly iohn manier deliuered hym commended hym disciple poynctyng fynger saiyng beholde lambe god behold taketh awaye synnes worlde hadde ouercum deuil fully inspired holy gost nothing nowe remayned take tyme place begynne enter preachyng iohn wrought miracle content preache penauce christ kepte silence long preached leste discorde myght ryse emong theyr discypleswhan iesus hadde hearde c beyng yet rude carnal geuen worldly affeccions surely ye parte good teacher conforme hymselfe capacitie hys audience afore entrethe office teachynge whan rumoure blowen abrode iohn caste prison herode tetrarche enioying rewarde wont haue dare boldly speake prince world wil rather speake holsum thinges pleasaunt tolde tetrarche vnlawfull mariage maryed brother philippes wyfe sumtyme euill prince desyre haue housholde men greate notable honestie woulde obeye counsell suche e seme ignoraunte people dooe theyr aduise counsell whatsoeuer dooe theyr owne lust appetite thynges lyght importaunce oftentymes ben obedient monicions oughte moste haue obedient foule request filthie daunling damsel desyre filthye mother cast good man pryson afterward cruell deathe suche greate man defyled feaste hys natiuitie iyes hys noble iesus therfore whan hearde feare hymselfe teache wyllingly put themselues daunger yf maye conuenientlye auoyde whan cummeth stoutely neglecte leauyng nazareth wente syde galile gentyles whiche salomon gaue vnto hira kyng tyrians xxv cytyeshe went aparte galile went citie capernaum therfore taken borderyng vpon sea nere standyng water genezareth coastes zabulon neptalim whiche two trybes fyrste galile seconde called galile gentile whereby christe figure manier thretned whan iewes dyd refuse persecute preacher gospell gospel brought vnto gentyles leste man myght thynke thys thyng doen chaunce esai beyng inspyred spirite prophecie prophecied long bethat myght bee fulfilled c saiyng land zabulon land neptalim whiche bordereth vpon sea galile gentyles people whiche heretofore dwelled darkenes hath seen great merueylouse light vnto heretofore thicke darkenesse suche hel lyghte sprong vp therfore cocernyng tyme iohn left christ beginneth clere lyght gospel shadowes moyses lawe vanishe awaye thys spoken directely concernyng misticall figure lawe expresse trueth gospell touchyng place fyrst affliccion trouble holy preacher name gentyles goen vnto lyghte whiche iewes blynded wyth filthye desyres coulde suffer picture declared passe ouer gentyles beeyng idolater suche sorte coastes neyther forsaken sydes trumpe voyce gospell maye hearde yet furthermore countrey vnprofitable auditorie reason commoditie hauens certen notable city standyng vpon sea syde reason course marchaundise wer frequented vsed also farre cummers straunge countreyes pfrom tyme iesus began preache saye repent kyngdome heauen hande nowe let v heare begynnyng preachyng succeded iohn begynneth doctrine whiche wel knowen familiar lest shoulde haue driuen awaye iohn nowe greate venecacyon fedeth weake mylke afterwarde might bryng foorth strong meate whan wer strength truely horder teacher desire rather profite heares set foorth magnifie themselues preachyng christe onely milde gentle iohn preaching maketh mencion neither axe fanne fyer neuer shalbe quenched also commended many benefites bestowed vpon men indyfferently iesus therfore folowyng iohn crieth sayeth chauge myndes repent former lyfe nowe kyngdome heauen hand whiche shall shut vnto man shall open onely vnto pure cleane seke heauenly thynges cut away al worldly desyres playne symple philosophy lette euery man displeased grieued owne naughtynes heauenly thynges redy hym hand frely iesus walked sea galile sawe two brother simon whiche called peter andrewe brother castyng nette sea wer fyshers sayeth vnto folowe wyl make fyshers men straight way lefte nettes folowed hym nowe tyme come iesus shoulde gather together companie disciple whiche famyliar witness doynges saiynges whome myghte teache afterwarde marke manier men chose philosopher phariseis priestes ryche men woulde glorie gospel defiled worldlye ayde succour walked neere water whiche sayed border bothe galilee espied twoo brother germaine name one symon called also peter named andrewe whose father name iohn tyme heard iohn whose prouocacion began folowe iesus lefte turned agayn theyr facultie crafte whereby wont get theyr lyuyng nowe bustlye occupied castyng theyr nettes sea sygne good lucke fyrste youth ready receyue newe doctryne agreablenes brother one readye helpe another agayn craft facultie whiche hurt wherby got poore liuyng common mere poole fynally fishyng put remembraunce newe fisshyng whiche serued take fish nettes feade belly wyth nette gospell catche men drouned wyth worldly care vnto desyre heauenly lyfe therfore occupied necessary theyr bodye christ speaketh vnto saiyng folowe ye shall learne science better euer ye learned father yet ye shall leaue science ye shall chaunge better fashyon make hereafter fysshers men ye whiche wayte fish destroye maye catche take men euerlasting saluacion knewe voyce hym whome beleue whose gentilnes hadde proued wyth familiar communicacion strength efficacie voyce brought passe foorthwith word caller thei forgat onely theyr fishe also theyr nettes lefte byddyng theyr acquayntaunce fare well folowed iesus euen walked sawe greate thyng yet iesus notwithstandyng stayed lingered nothyng careful howe gette theyr liuing hereafter ioyned themselues hym callyng hys onelye woorde folowed would awaie dye therfore whan gone foorth thence saw two brother iames sonne zebede iohn hys brother shyp theyr father zebede mending theyr ettes called furthwyth lefte shyp father folowed hym iesus going litell espyed two brother iames iohn sonnes zebedeus better please brother father agreed well together wer al one bot endeuoryng one thing euen fame peter andrewe aboute went spedely forwarde theyr businesse theyr nettes broken longe wearyng whiche token pouertye iesus therfore passing earnestly occupyed mendyng theyr nettes spake vnto bad folowe hym young men playne confidence truste without tariyng furthwith leauyng theyr nettes forgetting theyr father also bend themselues folowe iesus preaching iohn hadde framed fashioned deserued towardenesse redinesse theyr harte inspiracion christe drawen wholly breathed sauoured heauenly spirite wherwith replenished iesus wente al galile teachyng theyr sinagoges preachyng ghospel ye kyngdome healyng al maner sickenes al manier disease emong people fame spred abrode throughoute siria brought vnto hym sycke people taken diuerse disease grypynges possessed wyth deuils lunatike palsey healed folowed hym great multitude people galile decapolis ierusalem iewry fro countreyes lye beyond iordane ye see entrynges philosophye whereby thoughte good vnto god saue mankynde ye se pompe ruffling euangelycall schole poore iesus beyng accumpanyed fisher vnlerned common sorte poore men walked ouer galile nowe corner deserte theyr synagoges moste resorte preachyng shewyng kyngdome heauen whiche heretofore promysed nowe hande puttyng feare helle fyer lyke iohn dyd inuiting allurynge men free benefites wheresoeuer wente healed mennes disease indifferently freely refusing man neuer vile meanest sorte lyke easynesse chased waye disease neuer incurable thintent bothe set furth declare miracle power greater mannes also free benefites purchase winne loue menne hym gladly truste beleue whome loue yea euen wylde beastes also bee wunne benefit surelye benefite godly freelye restore health meanes came passe fame hym spredde abrode throughout syria manye brought farre theyr diseased folke incumbred diuerse dyseases griefes besydes suche possessed diuels lunatikes diseased palsey whome phisicyons commonly eyther take vpon cure el wonte cure vayne dysease passeth theyr arte cunnyng iesus healed easily mannes medicynesand palsey c wyth heauenly vertue wherwyth hable also rayse dead small matter hym take awaye disease bodyes whiche toke awaye disease myndes smalle matter hym prolong lyfe bodye whiche came geue euerlastyng lyfe vnto men came therfore thys parte parte wonderfull numbre people onely galile gentile wasand folowed hym c also galile whiche beyonde water oute countrey called decapolis tenne city whiche also hierusalem residew iewry place whyche beyonde iordane men haue nede runne benefit many moued wyth nouelties sum came malice mynde wayte displeasure iesus parte draweth vnto hym fewe bee mete heau nly philosophye teachyng deliuery chiefly came worlde people moued wyth care bodye desyrouse deliteth muche newe syghtes gasinges deliteth greatlye suche sightes seketh thinges perfeccion thynges farre sondre affeccions common sorte pthe v chapter whan sawe multitude went vp mountayne behan sette hys discyples came hym opened mouthe taught saiyng blessed poore spirite theyrs kyngdome heauen therefore iesus seeyng people flockyng aboute hym sortes conueyeth lowe place whither euery man myghte haue accesse goeth vp vnto hyll beganne nowe preache teache heauely philosophy declaryng highnes place woulde shewe furthe teache common meane thyng hygh heauenly thynges folowyng also exaumple moyses publyshing lawe vnto people reade wente vp hill disciple whome chosen specially vnto hym folowed hym goynge vp suche wyse yet common people lette folowe hym muche desyre strength therfore iesus whan came top hyll sate downe beeyng weary purposyng teache serious weyghtye thynges whiche required diligent hearer whan disciple perceyued compassed nere aboute none holye doctryne shoulde escape iesus therfore entryng begynnyng hys godlye holsome philosophye oute tower tabernacle golden seate suche one iarcas greate philosopher india beyng garnysshed precious stone proude pulpet philosopher arrogant chayre phariseis oute seate grasse casteth iyes vpon commen people vpon disciple openyng hys holye mouthe began shewe furthe lesson gospell whiche hytherto heard whiche bee farre opinion men appeared wyse vnto worlde men promyse blessednes whyche take vpon teacher wysdome menne estate condicion soeuer bee desyre blessednes muche controuersye hath emong philosop r muche errour lyfe men thynges felicitie man doth consiste forasmuche marke foundacion wisdome iesus fyrste doth open set furthe straunge sentence yet true therefore throughe myracles obtayned credite bee geuen hys saiyng thoughe semed sumwhat incredible soe founde power bee effectual healyng disease bodye myght truste also doctryne bee true whereby healed disease mynde yet fewe disciple heare enbrace blessednes let men heare spake shall bee made blessed happyblessed poore spirite false opinion spryng synnes liuyng therfore aboue al thinges muste endeuour plucke awaye fiercenesse arrogancie moste daungerouse disease mynde whiche suffereth manne receiue true doctryne yea verye fountayne whence manier spryng deadly offence iesus fyrste healeth saiyng blessed bee poore spirite theyrs kyngdome heauen whose eares coulde haue abiden incredyble saiyng manye testimony iohn father doue finally vnlesse hys authoritye set furth credite obteyned euident signes myracles manye made vile abiect humble broughte discourage themselues reason pouertye basenes byrthe lowenesse estate aduersitye truely bee nere blessednes ghospell yf folowe theyr harte called state thys humilitie spirite resteth inwarde affeccion outwarde thynges howe shal haue kyngdome whiche taketh nothyng vpon hym whiche geueth place offended hymselfe thrusteth man whiche hurteth man semeth nye seruitude asse kyngdome kinde men trode vnder feete euerye hurte harmed withoute redresse liueth lyke abiecte withoute regarde poore comfortles true trueth sayeth appertaynethe kyngdome kyngdome heauen thinkest thou fierce violente men doe reigne bee verye slaues bee vnder manye tyrannes bee vexed auarice angre hatred desyre
