vengeauce eare hope vnnethes lyue muche lesse reygne free vexacions trouble betaketh hymselfe innocencie cleane lyfe puttyng hys truste god lookyng rewarde worlde cumme verye quiete regardeth thynges thys worlde seketh heauenlye thynges hath goodlye kyngdome farre passyng kyngdomes worldlye kynges neyther filthye luste auaryce hatred anger worldlye infeccions mynde reigne ouer hym armed fayth often case requireth geueth commaundement disease thei flee away geueth commaundement vnto water styl geueth commaundemente deuils departe myghty kyngdome mynde whiche dystrustyng hymselfe putteth hys truste god distrustyng succoure man doethe depende wholye heauen dyademe oyntmente garde maketh kyngdome afore mencioned thynges make kyng dede bryng hym finally heauenly euerlastyng kyngdome shall disobedience rebellion worldly kyngdome gotten violence defended fiercenesse kyngdome gotten modesty sobernesse defended established humilitie mekenes worlde iudgeth none meete gouerne kyngdome suche bee notable spirite st ute courage god auaunceth vnto hys kyngdome chiefly whiche moste humble themselues pblessed meke shall receyue inherytaunce yearthe iesus goeth ioyneth vnto sentence harde beleued taken blessed meke shall inherite yearth bee meke vse man violently extremely whan haue harme redy forgeue iniuryes done vnto also rather lese theyr thyng contende striue regard concorde quietnes mynde large possession suche rather desyre quiet pouerty troublesome ryches kynde men oftentymes set beside put theyr goodes landes goeth aboute gredely get mennes rather driuen possession hys auncetry newe fashyon enlargyng possession mekenesse obteyneth geue wyllyngly theyr owne accord violence rauenye purchase obtaine right wrong stout fierce lord doth possesse thing hath meke quiete man wil rather geue place leaue hys goodes contende striue therfore possession place whereas fyndethe louers euangelicall mekenesse stoutnes stifnes hated men softenes mekenes fauoured heathen finally yf meke lese hys possession losse vnto hym greate gayne lucre hath loste hys lande reserueth quietnes mynde hath wel solde hys lande whiche hath auoyded trouble busines hath kept styll quietnesse mynde finally meke man put hath sure certayne possesse lande heauen whych thrust worlde lamenteth counteth vnhappie banyshed driuen theyr countreye christe pronounceth blessed whiche banisshed gospell sake made denisens heauen bee driuen libertie one cytie caste theyr house chased oute one countrey gospell man hath whole worlde countrey godly men sure heauen theyr house theyr countreye blessed mourne shall receyue comforte lacke chyldren parentes suche entierly loue commonly counted miserable thing insomuche sum lacking theyr desyres depriued theyr affeccions wife parentes brother chyldren sumtyme kyll themselues sorow cause frendes vse repayre vnto suche case comforte mitigate bitternesse theyr sorow blessed mourne loue gospel plucked awaye theyr wyfe chyldren loue see loue moste derely punished slayne reghteousnes gospell whyche also despyse pleasure thys worlde leade theyr lyfe wepyng watching fastyng heauenly spirite wyll present wyll theyr secrete comforter wyll recompence theyr temporall waylyng inestimable harte ioye afterwarde shal bee translated vnto euerlastyng blisse mannes comforte entending heale griefe doeth oftentymes make worse spirite whiche true comforter doeth inwardly refreshe mynde beyng cleare conscience ascertayned rewardes lyfe cum moste grieuous affliccions theyr bodyes thynke themselues infortunate rather ioyfully reioyce pblessed whyche hungar thyrste ryght usnes shall satisfied famyn hungar opinion al men grieuouse thing pouertie thyng endeuour auoyded euery man calleth fortunate blessed whiche notably encrease establishe theyr householde substaunce haue abundantly vse occupye ryches whorded heaped vp satisfieth mynde felicitye man measured fulnce belly thys kynde men christe calleth blessed blessed sayeth bee whiche hungar thyrst ryghteousnes thynges wherewith body nouryshed fostred vp oughte bee desyred lyghtly yet common sorte sore turmoiled care sumtime saturitie doeth vexe bee full hunger dyd trouble theyr saturitie thurste hunger retourne agayne must oftentymes repayred thynges present euerye godly whiche contente wyth litle desyre nothyng necessary without al carefulnes doeth geue mynistre vnto fedeth sparowes doeth clothe lillie happy whiche doe take thys hunger thurst bodilye casuall thynges applie desyre euangelicall iustice euermore hungred euermore thyrsted blessed sacietie fulnes one parte blessednes hunger breade mynde wherof whoso eateth shal liue euerlastingly thurst liuely water wherof drynketh hym shall spring well water runnyng euerlastyng lyfe blessed mercifull shall obteyne mercy common sorte supposeth blessed whiche holpen wyth mennes aide reioyce glad rather sake bee holpen cause helpe saye blessed merciful brotherly charitie counte mannes miserye bee theyr owne bee sory theyr neyghboures hurte doe bewayle theyr misery theyr owne feede nedy clothe naked monyshe amysse teache ignoraunt pardon offender fynallye soeuer gifte good thyng haue bestowe helpyng refreshyng others leese nothyng gayne mercifull beneficiall man towarde neyghboure shall fynde god much mercifull beneficial toward hym thou hast pardoned thy neyghbour sum lyght offence god wil forgeue thee thy synnes thou haste passed ouer thy neyghboures sake temporall vengeaunce god wyll pardon thee euerlastyng punishement thou haste socoured wyth thy substaunce thy brother pouertye god wyll restore vnto hys heauenlye ryches mercifull waxe poore concernyng worldlye thynges geuyng theyr rychesse consumed towardes god wexe ryche theyr worldly store beeyng consumed theyr harte heaped vp wyth fruites godlines pblessed cleane harte shal see god common sorte men calleth vnhappye bee blynde haue loste theyr moste pleasaunte sense saye bee longer aliue abyde darknes lyke deade men pleasaunte thyng semeth iyes loke vpon lyght beholde goodlye spectacle syght worlde bee thyng muche bee wisshed beholde sunne bodilye yes muche pleasaunt blessed thyng iyes mynde beholde god maker sunne thynges ye see howe leape ioye whiche haue beene blynd nowe see sunne agayne yea reioyce muche en deliuered hell howe muche blessed beyng destrusted blindnes mynde haue gift inwardly see god fountayne ioye beholde high felicitie blessednes sunne cleare iyes god pure cleane myndes matter skumme webbe iyes sinnes mindes therfore blessed thei whose harte pure cleane filthines shal haue thys gyfte desyred al pleasure worlde shall see god blessed peace maker shall called chyldren god common sorte men iudgeth blessed whiche hauyng theyr thynges good frame staye liue reste quie ne haue manne trouble iudgemente bee blessed whiche haue repressed theyr harte rebellion rage theyr fowle lustes studye endeuour make vnitie concorde emong suche bee strife variaunce reuenging themselues yf haue bene hurt bodye wyllynglye theyr owne accorde prouokyng peace whome haue suffered harme manne thynke harde bee doen let hym harken rewarde shall called sonnes god honorable title prayse yea blessed vayne title sonne must nedes heyre also vnlykenes manner declareth argueth bastarde folowyng father steppe declareth true naturall chylde god forgeuyng freely offence doeth stirre prouoke men whiche hath offended hym peace amitie offereth hymself owne accorde verye mercifull repent wyll knoweledge hys child whiche shewe themselfe theyr brother hath shewed hymselfe towardes carnall father disherit theyr sonnes whiche agree theyr brother heauenly father wil abdicate put away hater peace causers discorde thinheritaunce heauen blessed thei suffer persecution ryghteousnes ake theyrs kyngdome heauen blessed ye men te yle persecute speake falsly mane euyll sake reioyce glad great rewarde heauen persecuted prophetes whiche many frowarde euill men euery place peace cannot stayed continue wyth al men thorow sufferaunce displeasure part g dly men vtterly endeuour themselues thei debate man whether thei good euill muste moue allure men curtesy gentilnes pleasure much maie loue concord frowardnes sum wil bee stirred anger yea benefites also wyll vexe vse cruelnes agaynst wel doer count theyr enemyes studye preserue case peace cannot conserued bothe sydes yet blessed th r loue beare peace wicked persecute none cause ryghteousnes gospell hurteth none profiteth selfe thing prouoketh theyr hatred whiche oughte loue iniury none thyng whiche ought render thankes sum wil saye loue gentylnes requireth hatred ill doynges greate matter graunte greate rewarde rewarde crowne oke laurell bullocke goate suche lyke rewarde whiche worldly men vse geue suche get ouerhand worldly mastryes kyngdome heauen ye dysciples muste make ready wrastling ye esteme rewardes gospell ye muste feare cruelnes men man hurte yf ye sticke stifly ryghteousnes persecucion euil men shall take away innocencye shal increase blessednes midde stormes aduersytye ye shall blessed yea whan curse moste bitterlye whan shall assaulte kyndes hurtes whan shall rebuke laye offence agaynste falsely faulte hatred displeasure summe crymes whiche shall laye agaynst shal ye christen men lament bewaile selues men thrust afflicted beaten misreported infamed rather thynges glad reioyce fierfe persecutyng muche rewarde increased heaped vp heauen heauenly father god tourne theyr naughtynes good wyll tourne hurtes aduauntage luc e tourne ignominie rebuke reproche put euerlastyng true glory wyll tourne crymes reprofe whiche falslye laye youre charge title commendacions true godlynes wil tourne theyr malediccions curse prayse reioysyng party onely god yet please sufficietly enough yea though ye displease whole world also men rebuked wicked men godlynes prayse tormented hater god crowned glory sought men glory owne accorde customably doeth folowe true vertue wil ye haue redy playne example daie holy honourable memorye prophetes yet whan aliue wicked sorte persecute kyndes affliccions shall dooe persecuted prophetes hatred father ye shall persecuted hatred menne beare towarde bee vehemente thynges graunte passyng mannes weakenes muste nedes bee excellent notable thyng whiche myghte shoulde moue drawe whole worlde beeyng ouerwhelmed weryshe opinion vayne desyres whiche worldly men doeth abhorre tormenting bodye afrayed daunger lyfe styrred desyre auengyng whan prouoked sore checkes rebuke quietelye suffer name bee spotted hindred withoute deserte intente ye maye blessed require thynke youre selues blessed suche euill affliccions rather haue pytye youre blynde persecutours bee agreued saye well saye euyll offer euerlastyng healthe whiche goe ou destruccion high excellente vertue ye cannot perfourme vnlesse ye cum vnto degree whiche shewed ye caste away vtterlye swelling pride mynde ye put desire reuengyng yf ye dispise pleasure world embrace sharpe way yf ye extinguishe desyre worldly thynges thyrste nothyng greatly ryghteousnes godlynes yf ye full mynded succoure helpe greefes al men desyre furder commodity al ye haue minde sincere cleane vice filthye desyres regardyng thyng delityng thing god alone finally yf ye study deuise quiet harte nouryshe make cocord peace shall ye perfourme thynges whiche menne cannot yet attayne vnto dreame vpon yet curable vtterly desperate mynde musyng muche youre sufferaunce godlynesse shall well vnderstande counterfeyt thing shall well perceyue thyng mannes power beyng moued thorowe exaumple shall turned better thrifte ye salte earth salte vnsauery wherwith shall seasoned hencefoorth good nothyng caste troden men haue chose fewe entent woulde allure bryng knowledge euangelicall wysedome one twoo cytyes wholle worlde muste nedes bee liuelye pithye thyng sufficient saw e sauour lyfe mankyndeye salte yearth beeing weryshe vnsauerye thorowe desyres fond opinion vayne thynges haue chosen intent ye shoulde bee meane tollerable sorte ye shoulde salte yearth nedeth haue muche salte good strong whatsoeuer doethe touche maye season weryshe make sauoury yerth greate yet saltnes hath hath litle salte mixte ye see greate deale meate vnsauoury werishe litell salte sprynkeled vpon made sauourye must nedes great noumbres men many founde meane vneath tollerablebut salte vnsau ry c apostle bishoppes doctoures teacher quicke perfect liuelines euangelicall charitie muste nedes perseuer abyde otherwyse maners made vnsauoury loue prayse desire ryches luste pleasure gredin reuengyng feare infamye harmes death remayneth wherby vnsauoury lyfe multitude maye bee seasoned shall cum passe ye shall onelye bee vnmete season others also ye youreselues perfourming thing ye teache shal cum extreme contempt al men lesse bee regarded vnsauoury salte whiche serueth muche doung lande somuche yf cast grounde causeth barraines meanes men shall haue veneracion yea also whiche enuyously hatefully backed agaynste yf perceyue doctryne doeth sauour liuelynes gospell yf see lyfe bee agreable doctryne whan ye haue taken vpon professio eyther ye muste verye profitable vnto menne veraye vnprofytable eyther ye muste haue greate prayse emong men greate disprayse dispraise rebuke ought bee shunned deathe doeth redounde infamye slaunder gospell wherfore se ye euerye syde sincere pure verye perfect thende impuritie multit ye corrected thorowe puritie ye lyght worlde citie set hyll hyd neyther men lyght candell put vnder bushell candelstycke geueth lyght al house let light shine men thei maie se good workes glorifye father whiche heauen let life doctryne suche maye guyde rule good life men doeth behold loke vpon itye lyght worlde one sunne worlde thesame myghtye plentifull lyghte farre shyneth vpon dwell vpon yearth haue set high place whatsoeuer ye speake whatsoeuer ye doe muste nedes bee spred abrode thorowout whole worlde cloudes couer unne howe shall men haue lyght doctryne darkened errours yf lyght lyfe dimmed worldly desire thyng shal driue awaye darkenes multitude wherfore ye muste beware darkenesse folishnes ye cannot hyd though ye endeuour neuer muchea citye set hyll hyd consider wel ye haue parte playe stage whole worlde thintente carefulnes sharpen bee circumspect diligent small offence muche great crime ye citye set vpon high hyll may seene waye goets farre wyde hid thoughe woulde hyll highe ne beareth wylleth illeth maketh seene al men may shewe waye erte waye thys nature euangelicall doctryne suffereth professoures hyd vnknowen althoughe fleing fame men seke dennes hide shoulde ye hid ordeyned purpose good al men indifferently salt geuen season wt sunne geuen world geue lyght citie buylt toppe hyll sene men nyght men lyght candele house geue lyght al house therfore hide vnder bushel set vpon candelsticke lyght therof maye better cum vse one lyght maye extende reache manye ye ought seke howe purchase fame opinion amonge men onely bee ye rarefull ye darken lyght whiche haue lyghtned ye perseuer continue vpon candlesticke haue set salt cannot season lyghte cannot shyne therfore let lyght shynelet lyghte shine men yea rather lyghte light father vnto men considering lyfe vtterly pure blameles heauenlye maye glorifye youre heauenlye father whome due al honour glorye youre good workes miracle neuer woonderfull ye shall chalenge nothing vnto selfe ye shall referre glory prayse vnto hym whome cummeth whatsoeuer men doe worthy praise shal part haue none care manfully faithfully perfourme office committed vnto shall geue rewarde tyme conuenient great rewarde whose glorye ye doe seruice thynke ye come destroye lawe prophetes come destroye fulfyll truly saye vnto tyll heauen yearth passe one rote tytle lawe shall passe tyll fulfylled whan ye heare newe preceptes neither moyses dyd deliuer prophetes taughte suppose bryng lyke matter pharisee wonte theyr addicions mannes constytucions makynge lawe heauy sore pyth chiefe lawe vtterly neglecting abolishyng came diminishe abate lawe abolishe newe preceptes came rather fulfyl make perfect lawe doeth commaunde nothyng man complayne haue obserued kepte yf shadowes geue place whan lyghte cummeth foorth yf perfourme dedes whiche prophetes saide shoulde cum passe lawe nothing hindered rather made perfecte lawe time hadde honour dyd shadowe wyth certayne figure whiche nowe represented open worlde lawe dydde manner hedge aboute desire men ceremony carnall preceptes certayne barres shoulde fall without anye staye euery sinne thintente might apte take doctryne gospell nowe perfect shewed furth carnall grosse lawe profitable entent men myght acknowledge theyr synnes nowe grace whiche washeth awaye synne geuen vnto v without ceremonyes therfore lawe offended kyng hymselfe beyng alyue shoulde cum place image paynted allure men rather loke vpon hym vpon image elles yf weake chylde processe time shoulde growe manne yf rype fruite succede buddes leaues yf sunne springyng vp shoulde darken moone starres lawe promysed nowe perfourmed shewe nowe done dyd shadowe nowe made open al mennes iyes endeuoured perfourme coulde nowe broughte passe full lyght promysed vnto al men yet iewes haue cause complayne v grace gospel fyrste offered neither shal thei haue lesse therfore haue common many wyth certayn breake lawe wherein phariseis glorye muche leaste iote one pricke whole lawe shal perishe nothyng writen shalbe fulfilled folishe thing loke hereafter whiche nowe present mad thyng delyght shadowes ye dispise true thinges sticke imperfect thinges ye dispise perfecte thynges embrace carnal thynges ye looth spirituall thynges bee geuen worldlye thynges ye shoulde neglecte heauenly thynges whosoeuer therfore breaketh one least commaundementes teacheth men shal called least kyngdome heauen whoso doeth teacheth thesame shall called great kyngdome heauen say vnto vnles righteousnes excede ryhgteousnes ye phariseis scribe ye enter kingdom heauen among iewes regarded ne counted good keper law doeth omitte lette passe thinges whyche phariseis haue added theyr owne prescribing washynges handes pottes vessel yet addicions patch profit litle towardes perfeccion lawe thei oftetymes withdraw men obseruacion thesame ye kyngdome heauen whiche muche perfect breaketh one small preceptes whiche nowe adde vnto prescripte lawe moyses althoughe teache thyng bserued whiche hymselfe thorough weakenes frayltye doeth perfourme shall counted leaste moste spised much vnlesse profit goe forwarde vnto better thynges shall vtterly excluded felowshyppe gospell whosoeuer teacheth smalle thinges despised whiche dryue men farre thynges whiche lawe doeth forbyd doethe perfourme whiche teacheth hadde veneracion shal counted greate kyngdome heauen yet chiefe highest sinagoge despising suche thynges thinke enough yf dooe committe none thynges whiche punishable lawe yet meane season fauour flatter perdone themselues naughtye desyres mynde truely iustice whiche feare pain refrained il thei moued thinges perfeccion chariti heauenly spirite wyllynglye withdrawe themselues approchyng ill doynges doe onely forbeare hurte man hurt man ye maye perceyue difference betwene iewe true christian man betwene moyses disciple myne ascertayne yf ye dooe perfourme whatsoeuer lawe doethe prescrybe whatsoeuer phariseis yt nowe doe perfourme whiche nowe accoumpted thynke selues ryghteous yf ye adde nothyng perfeccion ye shall farre great profession entry shal geuen kyngdome heauen profession doeth farre excel thei chiefe haue muche least place ye haue heard sayd vnto olde tyme thou shalt kyl whosoeuer kylleth shall daunger iudgement saye vnto whoso angry wt brother vnaduisedly shal daunger iudgement whosoeuer sayeth vnto brother racha shall daunger counsell whosoeuer saieth thou foole shal daunger hell fyre therfore yf thou offer thy gyfte aulter remembrest thy brother hath ought leaue thine offering aulter go thy way fyrst reconsiled thy brother cum offer thy gyfte yet maye euident muche adde vnto pharisaycall iustice commaundementes repugnaunt againste preceptes lawe rather aide shall make matter manyfest certayne exaumples ye haue heard commaundemente geuen time paste vnto elder thou shalte kyll man doe kyll conuicted iudged shal punished therfore hitherto thinketh himselfe haue fulfilled lawe whiche hathe slayne man hath escaped threatenynges lawe thys manne iuste innocent manne shal receiued sinagogue nowe harken howe muche adde hereuntowho angry hys brother c truely ascertayne whosoeuer angrye wyth hys brother shall daunger iudgemente dignitie profession doeth encrese faulte muche homycide olde lawe newe lawe vehement mocion mynde reuenged firste degre homycide angrye suche one hath yet actually committed homicide beginneth go towardes homicide therefore willeth yll hys brother euen nowe hath committed greuous offence god iudge dooe furthwith represse fearce mynde beyng ouercome anger dooe burste summe woorde whiche toucheth brother dede wyth euydent plaine reproche maketh hym sad manyfeste token contempte yf shoulde saye racha otherlyke thyng whiche declareth yll wyll mind one nere vnto homicide onely daugier iudgemente shall suffre lyghter punishemente yet great homicide mencioned olde lawe deserueth also daunger counsell shal greuously condemned furthermore disobediet mocion minde doeth burst farre man strike brother manyfest certayne rebuke calleth hym foole suche lyke nowe shall daunger moste greuous payne saye payne hell fyer many wayes punished whiche yet cum vnto homicide murdre nere vnto homicide whosoeuer falle brotherly charitie whosoeuer wylleth yl brother anger thoughe hath plucked swerde yet hath strike minde whosoeuer hath rebuked angerbut whosoeuer sayeth thou foole c hath striken tounge peraduenture woulde haue slayne feared punishement therfore lawe ghospel punisheth angry man agaynste precepte ye lawe thou shalt kyl driueth putteth man ye lawe commaundeth punished safe farther murther vtterlye plucketh harte anger hatred oute whiche roote springeth homycide murthertherfore thou offer thy gyfte aulter c therfore whosoeuer hath gotten hymselfe charitie gospel whiche wylleth wel wylleth yl whiche recompenseth iniurye wyth wel dooyng hath litle nede thretenynges moses lawe auoiding murther vttermoste degree hatred kyl sleye vttermoste degre charitie wil well killer sleyer among iewes counted godlye deuoute whyche veryng ill brother bryngeth hys offeryng aulter sacrifice accepted vnto god without brotherly charitie concord wherfore chyefly ye must regarde peace mutual concord displeasure chaunce among brother ye weakenesse man nature doeth happen al thynges layd aparte se attonement concorde made muche yf chaunce thou makest redines gyfte offer vnto god beyng nowe nere aulter doest remember thy brother thou square eyther hath offended el amitie broken griefe party deferre linger leaue thy gyfte aulter make hast home bryng passe al thynges swe e amitie may bee restored made vp betweene thee thy brother done returne vnto aulter doe thy sacrifice gift acceptable godand come offer thy gifte consent agrement men god suffereth dammage gift differred much peril daunger hangeth ouer partes breache concorde displeasure prolonged deferred ingendre hatred hatred spryngeth homycide murther seruyce acceptable vnto god furnished charitie thou wilt say vnto haue offended nothing let hym bowe firste make suite hath offended thou arte heard commaunded loue enemy wil sticke restore make vp loue concorde though broken another man defaulte forgeue trespasse thine owne accorde ease thy brother heauines suppose thou angry hym thou shalt finde god mercifull vnto vnlesse thy neiboure fynde mercifull vnto hym thy gyft shall obtaine thanke ne fauoure al god except thou beare perfect fauour loue towardes thy brother agree thine aduersarie quickely while thou n te way hym le e time aduersary delyuer thee iudge iudge deliuer thee minister thou caste prison uerely lay vnto thee thou shalt come thence tyl thou haue payd vtmoste farthing concorde agrement men highlye estemed god suffre hymselfe defrauded hys gifte nowe redines hym concorde agremente may bee restored made vp howe muche meete conuenient man whome matter specially dooeth toucheagre thyne aduersarie redeme peace amitie losse hys substaunce perchaunce may founde vniust wrongfully owne accorde doeth drawe men lawe ready make ru elmg businesse vnlesse haue wil pray bent bo h side burnyng harte prepare accusementes runne iudges would knowe shoulde doe case shal purs e right lawe thou wilt folowe counsel way thou goest thy aduersary thou shalte spedely finishe make ende mattier eyther equal indifferent condicions el vnequal vniust condicions ende matter hym condicyons beeyng neuer vniuste yet thou shalte haue auauntage gaine shall losse money thyng conserued whiche moste precyouse peace amytie quietnes tranquilitie mynde conserued whiche thou haddest bought thy whole goodes yet thou haddest payde litle thou shouldest haue wayted vpon aturneys clerkes thou shouldeste haue runne busily vp downe thou muste haue sued fauour iudges thou shouldeste haue done suffered many thinges vnsemely vnmee e thee nothyng precyous time considre howe muche thereof thou shouldest haue spent loste wherefore marke well greate gayne auauntage thou shalte haue thou fynishe thy suite spedely seeyng issue lawe vncertayne hath better matter hath alway higher hande daunger leste thy aduersary hauing vpper hande deliuer thee iudge iudge deliuer common officer shal leade prison thou bee layde nowe thy power fynyshe matter thy aduersary thou shalte purchace onely affliccion punyshement body shamethou shalt cum thence c also thou shalte escape vntill thou haste payed whole euery farthyng whiche thy aduersary demaunde thou mighteste haue compouned hym lesse whan yet gentel lesse angrie makyng concorde amitie way sowrely extremely whiche faulte let thys onely bee thy endeauour yea though thou geue ouer parte thy right concorde amitie suffer dammage ye haue hearde ayde olde time thou shalte commit aduoutry say vnto whosoeuer looketh mannes wyfe luste hath nowe committed aduoutry herte thy ryghte iye hinder plucke cast better vnto one thy membres peryshe thy whole body caste hell thy right hande hynder thee cut caste better vnto one thy membres perish al thy body cast hell hytherto haue treated loue hatred whiche one roote al euangelical godlynesse pestilence poyson next vnto murther aduoutry loue tender streight loue matrimonythou shalt commit aduoutry let v therefore treate matter also law hath commaunded elder howe muche dooe adde eunto nothyng sayde vnto lawe thou shalt commit aduoutry thou dooeste thou shalt bee stoned people therfore hitherto among iewes hath ben couted holy perfecte content owne hath absteyned man wyfe lawe ghospell whiche bryng dooeth onely commit aduoutry whiche dooeth defyle another mannes wife embraceth body also whiche vnchaste iyes dooeth beholde mannes wyfe angrie hys brother nygh vnto mu herwho soeuer loketh man wyfe c bendeth toward aduoutry whose minde vnchaste whose iyes aduoutrous husband hath punish aduoutry god hath condemne thee aduoutry whome hath willed hath committed offece therefore murther bee angrie aduoutry luste say racha foole delighte iyes wantonnes intice mynde another mannes wife vnclennes carnal man say man forbeare lust desire harte thyng loueth loue mannes wife owne daunger iniurie husbande whiche bent mynde onely forbeare hurte harme hym innocent also require pleasure displeasure whiche hath hurte hym perchaunce say cannot shut myne iyes yea better plucke thyne iye take losse godlynes parte body oughte deare vnto man better cut awaye occasion thereof loose vertues minde muste make spede vnto high perfeccion ghospel whatsoeuer dooeth let iourney thitherwarde muste vtterly cast away bee neuer swete neuer wel beloued great lucre gaine purchase preciouse margarite euangelical charitie losse thyng whatsoeuer wherefore thy right iye let vnto behalfe consider dere thing iye consider precyouse thyng dooeth hynder thee without delay dygge thyne iye hindred thee aste awaye make spede thou dyddest begynthen thy whole body cast hell whole man daunger life beste saue reste whole body losse one parte thereof thou wilt say shall lyue hereafter one iyed manne rather wished liue one iye dye member deare necessarie many purpose righte hande thys deny yet b lette vnto maketh spede vnto high perfeccion wherof depedeth helth saluacion whole man cut thy right hand hindreth thee cast away burden thou mayest make spede expedicion thither thou didste purpose peril daungier farre better haue losse one membre though dere whole body fall distruccion hel fyerand thy right hand hinder men alowe pollicie none daungier bodye howe muche doone body solle peril thinges haue spoken teache similitude meane man shoulde cutte membre hys body nature membres yll abuse reproued meane membres mynde minde hath noysome membres godly thing spedely cut membre body bee cut besyde payne harme cummeth parte cutte neuer bee restored agayne noysome membres minde cut hatred angre fleshly lust ambicion auarice minde maymed made perfect reason monstruouse noysome partes cut away short griefe cutting foloweth continual pleasure wil speake playnly thentent ye may vnderstande meane thaffeccions membres minde affeccions owne nature leade vnto vngodlines yre hatred enuy desire mennes goodes yf begin spring minde furthwith must cutte vp yll beginneth spryng shall bee easely safely taken away againe affeccions themselfe vttrely yll yet occasion withdraw somtime good loue towarde oure countrey thaffeccyon wife chyldren parentes elles kynsfolkes frendes care good name cause cutte membres long serue make perfeccion gospell doctrine naturall affeccions doeth restore nature puritie case thaffeccion towarde thy parent wife child occasion doeth withdrawe thee loue euangelicall godlynes plucketh thee worldlines cut noysome natural affeccion like cutteth noysome thoughtes cutteth hart grow onely naughty desyres nowe beholdeth mannes wife chastely like looketh vpon sister daughter hath well cast noysome iye taken iye doue cleane single iye woonte exercyse hys hande robbyng nowe doeth labooure helpe nedines hath well cutte hys rauening right hande stede thereof myght haue beneficial liberall hande sayde whosoeuer putteth awaye hys wyfe lette hym geue lettre dyuorcemente say vnto whosoeuer doeth put away hys wife except fornicacion causeth bee aduoutresse whosoeuer marryeth diuorced commit eth aduoutyre nowe goe let v shewe exaumple lawe moyses doeth suffe husband bee offended faulte wyfe put away owne deuise geue writing diuorce wherby shee may bee marryed whereby former husbande may lawfully require agayne whome hath cast wherefore man hath satisfied lawe whiche hath caste hys wife cause hath geuen wrytyng dyuorcemente neyther shal taken aduouterer man shal note aduoutresse though law wisheth desireth perpetuall amitie concorde among married persones yet notwithstanding lawe knowing hardnes heartes iewes suffered diuorce vsed lest worse thing might chauncebut saye vnto whosoeuer putteth away hys wyfe c poysonyng murtheryng committed done wil haue matrimony obserued holily vndefiledly among professe newe lawe whosoeuer leaueth hys wyfe aduoutry wife lenger hath intermedled man compelleth dryueth violently aduoutry marrieth another marrieth husband aduouterer whoso taketh cast marryage taketh wyfe aduoutresse lawe moses punysheth none lawe ghospel doth condemne yet contrary lawe moses hath geuen husbandes libertie diuorce leste fierce cruell wyues hated yet restrayned libertie booke diuorce doe priuely shoulde requyre agayne often fantaysed wyues whome cast vnaduisedly lawe durst require matrimony durst commaunde thinges taught man indued mekenes gospel either soone correcte amende maners wife elles pacientely beare whan wil seke debate wife whiche enemy peace whan seke distruccyon hys wife whiche angrie whan harmed offended willeth man yll howe shall abyde hys wyfe whiche daylye company hym whiche suffereth enemy kyllyng hym purpose lawe bee thus matrimony shoulde bee holye diuorces commonlye graunted breake lawe helpe susteyne whiche woulde haue dyuorce except case aduoutry whiche contrary nature matrymony matrimony made thys intente woman appoynted husbande shoulde bryng forth child hym onely hym onely obey shee nowe turneth awaye husbande whiche hath geuen another man vse body therfore emong christia spouse let greuous displeasure offeces neither let seke diuorce separacion light displeasure one muste reconcyled vnto yf thing chaunce weakenes men agayne ye haue hearde howe sayde olde tyme thou shalte forsweare thy selfe shalt perfourme vnto lorde thin e thou sweatest say vnto sweare neither heauen goddes seate earthe footestolem eyther hierusalem citie greate kyng neyther shalte thou sweare thy head thou canste make one heate white blacke communicaty n shalbe yea yea nay nay whatsoeuer added cummeth euill ye shall heare another thing commaundement geuen vnto youre elder none otherwyse made othe shoulde perfourme forsworne nowe bounde god man onely wherfore emong iewes onely periurie punishable deceiueth neyghboure without othe made vnpunyshed yet law gospel condemneth ye sure periury doeth vttrely condemne al maner othes leful sweare neither god thinges seme common sorte thinges lesse religion neither heauen seate god yearth footestole hierusalem citie great king say hath made al thinges neither heathen sweare head another man wherof thou hast authoritie consecrate god whiche hathe made thinges woulde thou canste make one blacke heare whyte one white heare blacke thinges consecrate god maker thou oughtest feareful sweare thing nedeth othe emong man theyr symplicitie distruste man desire deceiue though might doe freely sinceritie perfectenes specyally thynges whiche declare themselues bee despisers therefore among playne simple speche oughte holy sure deuoute solempne othe emong iewes emong whose harte lippes ought agree vse speche expresse youre mindes eche bargaynes ye nede none othe ye nede execracion cursing suche like binde promiser assure whome promise madebut youre communicacion shall yea yea nai nay two woordes sufficient nay yea whereby thou denyest whiche thou doest promise whereby thou doeste perfourme whiche thou diddest promise playn woorde thou wouldest doe man lesse bounde simple bare woorde iewe swearing holy thinges whome thou makest thy promise vnto doth trust thee wel thou haddest made solemne othe yf moe besides must nedes come euil sinne sweareth eyther thynketh yll hym whome sweareth el requireth othe dothe dystruste none ought whome would haue perfect poyntes therefore vttrely forbid swearing doe abolish lawe whiche doeth prohibite periurie make lawe full withdrawe men farther lawe doeth punishe ye haue heard sayd iye iye toeth toeth say vnto resist eui l whosoeuer geueth blowe righte cheke turne hym also man sue thee lawe take away thy coate let hym haue thy cloke also compell goe mile goe twaine geue hym asketh thee turne hym desyrous borowe ye haue heard law hath graunted vnto forefather reuenging wrong doinges sayeth iye iye toeth toeth knew tha myndes full reuenging therefore hytherto hath brydeled desire reuenging faulte myghte bee recompensed like punishement deuice discrecion iudges put mannes iye shoulde loose iye strieken another mannes toeth shoulde punished losse toeth reuenging iniurie ben left mynde hurte oftentimes shoulde haue chaunced haue loste life stryking toeth therefore intent law vengeaunce goe farre doe abolishe lawe establishe doctrine ye shall case reuenge iniuries e neuer sore ye shall geue taunt taunt hurte hurte wrong wrong yea man geue blowe vpon cheke whiche counted commonly vntollerable rebuke ye shall requyte blowe rather offer cheke beaten desire rather suffer double displeasure requite lyke man goe lawe thee take away thy coate stryue hym rather euen thy selfe geue hym thy gowne agayne froward person wil force thee goe space myle walke hym two myles rather fall contencion hym gentilenes sufferaunce shal come passe redy hurte shall prouoked thou shalt soner deliuered griefe one eiuil shoulde spring another great thing made smal many matter one thou shouldest disquieted thy minde perchaunce thy gentilnes enemye thou shouldest make thee frende great matter ye enterprise ye must apply whole study thinges litle regarde tryfling thinges getting increasing auoyding whiche men doe bestowe theyr whole life vnto whome chaunceth oftentimes while hunte thinges lese heauenly goodes yet liue pleasantly heape vp griefes vpon griefes vnto selues intangling themselues sudry striefes hatred despising thinges whiche haue make godly whan haue make vngodly shall bothe auoide hatred also obteyne loue good cause youre doctrine authoritie better beleued therefore man doeth molest ee garmente vesselgeue hi asketh thee like thing wherof gredy would fayne haue thee rather goe doe displeasure wayes graunt request thou shalte bynde vnto thee thy good turne deliuer thy selfe molestacion griefe agayne man requireth borow money thee let greue geue yea though nothing shal returne vnto thee agayn neither vsurie stocke selfe lendeth money vsurie doth rather hunt mennes geue owne shoulde greue lende hym though thou shouldeste neuer haue againe vnto whome thou oughtest geue freely thou haddest plentie lacked example men shall learne vttrely neglect thinges whose sake suffer doe al thinges pye haue hearde sayde thou shalte loue thy neighbour hate thine enemie say vnto loue enemy blesse curse dooe ood hate pray hurte persecute ye may e child father whiche heauen maketh sunne arise eiuill good sendeth tayne iust vniust yf ye loue whiche loue rewarde haue ye doe publycans euen ye make much brother onely great thing doe ye doe also publicanes likewise ye shal therfore perfect euen father whiche heauen perfecte nowe herken commaundement whiche counted chiefe law thou shalte loue thy neighbour hate thyne enemie requireth good towarde well willers haue deserued well suffereth wil yll doe hurt vsbut saye vnto c considre doe hinder precept adde vnto content mutuall beneuolence emong fredes require ye folowers doctrine ye loue enemy ye hate hate prouoke good turnes loue farre frame vse good turne continually trouble prouoke yll sayinges yll doingesdo good yt hate yet see ye middeste trouble turne good minde pray vnto god may chaunge mindes repente yf ye vse thys gentilnes towardes men good eiuil ye shall declare selues kindely child heauenly father desiryng men saued geueth many folde benefites vnto woorthy vnworthy suffereth sunne indifferently shyne vpon wurshyp vpon despise suffereth rayne profit iust vniust prouoking yll benefit repent styrring good rendre thankes likenes maners shal bring heauenly fatherfor maketh sunne c men beleue doctrine cummeth hym espie notable goodnes yf ye loue loue ye doe dooe yf ye wil wel whiche beare good ye haue escaped blame ye haue deserued prayse requyte one good tourne another counted detestable vnkindenes euen emong heathen publicanes whose fashion euil spoken euen common sorte loue loueth thee doeth perteine vnto nature vertue ghospel ye shewe selues curteyse gentle speche towarde kinsfolkes countrey men onely disdayne salute othersyf ye loue loue though straungers great thing doe ye doth heathen men common thinges doe shew men good bee men onely thinges cannot seme excellent whiche doe chaunce also vnto yll men wherfore woulde ye perfect resemble heauenly father woondreful lighte goodnes omnipotent yet goodnes doeth good al men loking rewarde man meke gentle towardes men yet hable hande punishe men p vi chapter p ake hede ye geue almes sight men intent ye woulde seene el ye haue rewarde father heauen ther ore wha thou geuest thine e let teumpettes blow thee hipocrites doe synagoges stretes praysed menne uerely saye vnto haue rec yued theyr rewarde thou wilte geue almes let thy lefthande knowe thy ryghthande doeth thyne almes may secrete thy father whiche seeth thee secrete shall rewarde thee openly haue declared vnto thynges ye ought passe exeel righteousnes scribe phariseis yf ye bee disciple nowe shall shewe ought auoyded thynges whiche seme common belonging vnto bothe certayne priuie poyson whiche doeth infecte good dedes phariseis deserue vtterly prayse god holy thyng releue nedy godly thing talke god pure praier fasting deuout thing phariseis setting furth bosting thinges doe clayme obteyne opinion high holynes men wheras displease god doth beholde ye outward face inward harte doe worthely displease hart fouly infected vaine glory hunt vaine praise ye people rather good conscience god whyleste catche vayne rewarde disapoynted whiche onely ought desired poyson creping secrete vndermining lyeth waite priuely also whiche sumwhat entred rase vertue wherfore wil alfetake hede ye geue almes sight c ye beware circumspect ye goe doe godly worke ye desire rather doe openly secrete thintent ye might sene men hut prayse glory men ye ought alwaies wel whether men se se god doth euer beholde whome loke reward ye go get ye praise man good dedes ye lese rewarde heauely father good worke must alwaies kept priuie ye muste play pageaunt sight men like player stage doe play theyr playe whose desire nothing el please iyes eares people alwaies folow beste whiche dooeth apply hymselfe iudgement common sorte ye must please men suche sorte ye may allure maners fashion goe kinde fal though praise fled shunned yet foloweth vertue owne accorde sikerly true prayse whiche doeth chaunce without ambiciouse seking whole glory ryseth wel must wholly geuen god ye shall displease sone ye stande youre conceite please selues chalenging vnto selues wholly bounteousnes therefore whosoeuer thou arte wil folow lawe ghospell thou entendest thy liberalitie releue nedines pore hipocrites wont doe whiche men lyke player counterfeted disguised whiche appeare liberall mercifull harte couetous cruel misery theyr neighboures moueth nothing desirous glory renoume bye litle money praise people would geue vttrely nothing wer alone saw brother welnere dead hunger therefore oft geue thing poore seke secrete alone come abrode stretes men resortelet test pet blowe thee like player shoulde play pageaute call furth numbre people sounde trumpe toote gase casting poor miserable teeth miserye hunting themselues vayne folish prayse men wyll ye heare gayne let people prayse neuer much haue lost rewarde good dede goddes hande whiche doeth measure godly worke sincere affeccion minde geueth praise glory selleth good turne geueth truely thou must far affeccion men thou geueste almes thy leftehande must know thy righthande doeth thou must desyre loked vpon man yea wer possible thou thy selfe shouldest know whiche thou doest arighte shouldest forget thyne owne dede impate man thou hast done wel stande thine owne conceiteand thy father seeth secrete thou hast geuen thyne almes reioyce inwardly poore nedy refreshed men knowe yea succoured knoweth hym succoureth hym ynoughe thee haue witnes father whose iyes nothing hid wil rewarde thee although thou haue thanke man whan thou prayeste thou shalte hypocrite vse stande praying synagoges corner siretes may bee men uerely saye vnto haue theyr rewarde whan thou prayest entre thy chambre whan thou hast thy doore pray thy father secrete thy father whiche seeth secrete shall rewarde openly semblablie whan ye make prayer god doe folow guise vsage hipocrites whose special delite stande company men corner stretes often pray none entet sene men whose handes hunt loke prayse deuout holy conuersacion let please themselfe others also suche gloryous prayer assure nowe haue rewarde whiche loked vayne thys rewarde counterfeit false glory frustrate set theselues beside blessed rewardethey haue theyr rewarde god would haue geuen offred sight pure sincere oblacion theyr prayer doe thou therefore contrary wise thou prayest forsake multitude enter thy secrete chamber shut dores secrete vttre thy sincere prayer thy father ynough doeth beholde see thy godlynes whome nothing hid wil reder vnto thee ye euerlasting rewarde thinges haue setfurth teache playne homely exaumples yll geue almes sumtime men pray multitude men resort knoweth left hand right hande doth worke charitie defiled affeccion worldly vanitie thou art secrete thy chaumbre thou speakeste vnto god perfecte clerenes minde though man beholde thee prayeth multitude menne earnestely yea peraduenture vehementely alone prayeth secrete chaumbre ryghte hande lefte secrete chambre standeth thynges affeccions desyres har e whan ye pray ba le muche heathen doe thinke come passe shalbe hearde theyr muche bablinges sake ye therefore lyke vnto father knoweth thinges ye haue nede ye aske also must considered prayer affeccion harty desyre moueth god noyse lippes skilleth long loude prayer howe feruent syncere affeccion desire wherfore let example heathe men farre recite say long prayer ful many wordes redy framed prescribed vnto woulde say shoulde obteine nothyng excepte weried god bablyng many woordes repetyng one thyng oftentimes prescribing appoynting recitall many wordes howe woulde haue thyng perfourmed whiche pray yet oftentimes pray thynges noysome hurtefull ought aske god best thinges thynges ought pray often rather much vehemently rather long finally harte rather voyce neyther alwayes prescrybed purposed woordes custome heathen much feruencie minde rauishment towards god doeth styrre prouoke truely father loueth called vpon taught long prayer necessitie doeth require prouoked youre godlines geue thing whiche slothfull sluggishe deserueth knoweth necessitie doeth require yea called vpon maner therfore pray ye father whiche arte heauen halowed thy name thy kingdome come thy wil done yearth heauen geue u day oure dayly bread forgeue v trespass forgeue trespasse againste v leade v temptacion deliuer v euell thine kyngdome power glory euer amen therefore ye vnlike heathen men bothe life also maner praying ye haue fourme maner euangelicall prayer prescrybed set forthe vnto thys worthy prayer wherewith true naturall child ioyned brotherly charitie may speake vnto heauenly father father vnto men indifferently whome although ye haue thinges yet chiefely oughte requyred whiche make attaynemente euerlastyng lyfe thynges caste vnto euen hys owne accorde encrease aduauntage according desire child bounteful father whose glory ye ought regarde aboue al thinges whome al glory due heauen yearth perteine vnto kyngdome conquere tyranny diuell subiecte vnto hys rule reygne whose free liberalitie cummeth whatsoeuer doeth norishe reuiue men harte perfeccion ghospell heare vnlesse ye accorde agree one concorde agreement cannot lightly vnles ye forgeue che others offence without whiche men liue wo lde although endeuour towarde taynement perfeccion concorde ye shal safe ayde father aga nste frowarde temptoure yf ye watche well busily call helpe good father naughty one wherfore vaine calleth vpon father fourme prayer teache whiche thys sorte whiche neither feareth lou god liueth himselfe foloweth hys owne glory goddes whiche gape h worldely goodes authorytie whiche rather haue thinges pleasaunte owne appetite thinges pleasaunte vnto god whiche sueth earthely thinges heauenly whiche setteth lesse quality minde bodely commodity whiche varyaunce brother whiche ryot dyspleasures vseth hymselfe sluggishe assaultes deiuil maner prayer sorte father whiche haste regenerate v heauen vnluckiely borne adaour father arte heaue c prepared v forsaking earthely thinges kingdom inheritaunce euerlasting art sayd heauen thou doest replenish hast manner drosse earthly infirmitie graut thy name may honourable gloryouse emong menne v thy benefite perfect pure glory thy gift whatsoeuer well done v let tyranny satan abolished thy kyngdome dayly may preuayle whiche dooeth stande rich worldely strength mildenes chastitie softenes sufferance fayth charitie vice yll desire chased away thy heauenly vertues may florysh shewe themselues emongest men may come passe lengthe lyke heauen thynges bee pec able quiet creature doe obey humbly thy commaundementes lykewise none yearth whiche obedyent thy moste ly willgeue v day c euery man farre fur h weakenes nature doth suffer diligetly recording shal come passe perfectly life come father nourish thou hast brought furth see vnto v bread thy heauenly doctrine doe fayle v may bee dayly stayed growe vp made luslie taking thereof obseruacion kepyng thy commaundementes alienate thy minde away v offended trespass thy clemencie mekenes pardon offence whiche commit infirmitie weakenes may haue peace thee like emong selues forgeuing eche one hath offended conserue mutuall concorde amitie thou merciful feare nothing vnderset concorde made stronger againste common enemy unto whome beseche thee possible deliuer v tempted knowe malice know frowardnes craftines thou suffer v fall teptacion thintent trie constancie mynde thou merciful father deliuer v naughtie ciuil uouchesafe thy goodnes graunt make sure desire see therfore many thinges short prayer doeth comprise nedes must perfect whosoeuer doeth rightly pronounce praier doeth pronouce mouth hart affeccion agree vnto first teacheth depend wholly vpo none heauenly father ye owe ye made ye owe ye redemed sinne whome ye owe whatsoeuer vertues ye haue called father ye may vnderstande full mercye bounteousnes sayde dwel heauen ye shoulde lift vp harte thither despising yearthly goodes ye cal youres man v dicate thing propre vnto himselfe seeyng whatsoeuer haue cummeth vnto men onely liberalitie behalfe equalitie kinges seruauntes ye wishe onely glory man earth ribe vnto himselfe prayse thing whereof ariseth insolency stoutnes minde ye wishe reigne obeyed vertues doe worke doctrine whiche ye shall deliuer vnto men ynough persist abide hys vertues ye must dayly encrease goe forewarde goodnes ye aske hym woondrefull bread whiche shoulde dayly asked doeth daily geue willeth asked put remembraunce good thinges come finally ye shoulde bee ware fall charitie bounteouse father dooeth monyshe frowarde sathan whiche neuer ceasseth lye watche godly plucke backe hys tyranny therefore ye forgeue men trespass heauenly father forgeue ye forgeue men trespass neither wil father forgeue trespass wherefore ye speake vnto father prayer considre selues whether ye desire truely thing ye aske whether ye mete persones hearde youre father suche thinges ye pray chiefly ye must duely searche selues whether ye haue ami concorde neyghboures euen suche father shall ye fynde hym towardes neighboure findeth towardes hym wyll knowe hym hys sonne whiche doeth agree brother ye forgeue offende heauenly father wyll forgeue ye trespasse hym yf ye harde sore againste menne father forgeue youre offence wilte thou forgeue thy felow seruaunt whome thy behalfe one tyme thou hast offended requirest thou god forgeuenes thy trespasse whome thou arte hable meanes recompence forgeuyng agayne hys offence made thee whan ye false bee sory hipocrites bee disfigure face may appere vnto men fast uerely say vnto haue theyr reward whan thou dooeste faste anoynte thyne head washe thy face appere vnto men thou dooest faste vnto thy father secrete thy father seeth thee secrete shall rewarde thee openly nowe ye perceiue difference ought betwene almesse almesse phariseis betwene prayer prayer harken difference ought betwene youre fastes theyrs ye haue acceptable father profitable selues forbearing meate commendeth fastyng vnto god pure cleane affeccion minde feruently desiring please god onely wherefore often godlynes shal prouoke fast folow certeine menne whiche fasters counterfeyters fasting setting foorthe colour cloke fasting sower countenaunce intending dede wherefore fasting shoulde vsed say eyther pacyfie god chastice body wherby minde might free redy apply ensue holy thinges coulour hunt vaine prayse men whose sake despising god play pagent purpose disfigure theyr face palenes sowernes behauiour body menne may see doe fast certayne cause looke rewarde god good dedes haue rewarde attayning hunted theyr fasting often thou doest fast appeare rather faste appeare mery annointing thy head washing thy face leste men perceiue thou doest fast thinke fast vnprofitable whiche hid men suffiseth thee thy father seeth whome nothing hid seeth secrete stede vaine praise wil rewarde thee perfect rewarde againe say wicked men shoulde know thy fasting thy minde shoulde abhorre desire vayne praise man seeth thy fasting thou doest fast thintent scene man onely god doth see thy fasting thou dost fast entent thou wouldest gladly fast though man see thee thou doest faste play vp selues treasure vpon yearthe rust mothe doeth corrupte theues breake steale lay vp youre treasure heauen neither rust mothe doeth corrupte theues doe breake steale treasure wil hearte also common sorte men considering thinges while hunt smal visible rewardes men disapoincted inuisible true rewarde wel god doeth geue aboundauntly li ease whiche much thought care doe gather together heape vp rich hide ground losing albeit euen lose dede dealeth bestoweth rich rightly layeth vp surely thou hidest grounde profitable vnto thee daungier mothes rust theues thou hast nothing miserable carefulnes get kepe thinges must gotten neither carefully vnmeasurably gotten come chaunce must redily distributed haue nede el bestowed necessitie nature may holpen ryot maynteyned disease minde serued satisfied yet menne moste parte vnto thing apply theyr whole studie care though pouertie made men miserable ryches indued felicitie whyles folow false goodes shortely forsake theyr maisters forake eternall goodes whiche indue true felicitie taken away ye side hasting endeuour best perfect thynges whereby ye shall riche dede lay vp treasure heauen keping whiche trouble cumberous carefulnes neyther ruste mothe dooeth destroy suche maner rich theues doeth digge vp steale whiche chaunces worldely goodes daunger ye lay vp goodes father kepe safely minde shall sticke grouelyng grounde beeyng oppressed filthy care shall despise vile fading thinges rauished vp vnto heauenly thynges mannes treasour loueth entierely harte also therfore haue high heauenly thought hath gathered rich hid ground walke wander hither thither harte hole money hid minde corrupt either disease vayne glory auarice whatsoeuer done must nedes vicyouse light body wherefore thine ye single thy body shal ful light thine iye n ught thy body shal full darkenes wherefore yf light thee darkenes great darkenes first considered chiefely desired whereby may obteine doe aske furthermore candel house iye body minde man light minde bee faultie darkenes false opinion yll desire iye minde deeth looke none way true marke whatsoeuer done throughout life acceptable vnto god euery thing helpeth towardes heape felicitie like great candel house stumbling falling thine iye cleare whole geueth sight al membres parte stumbleth wandreth iye captaine guide againe iye body faultie membre doeth duetie well right iudgement whan parte oures faultie ye iudge therfore part thee geuen thee light turned darkenes great shal darkenes partes whiche haue lighte themselues reason blynded desire iudgeth good miserable iudgeth chie bee desyred despised regarded darkenes shal men drawen ambicion filthy luste auarice folishenes angre enuy hatred perturbacions trouble minde whiche theyr owne nature full darkenes therefore let youre iye bee cleane sincere may beholde beste let beholde looke vpon best thinges either onely chiefely manne serue two maisters either shall hate one loue el leaue one dispyse ye cannot serue god mammon therefore saye vnto bee careful lyfe ye shall eate drinke yet body garment ye shall put life worth meate body woorth ayment beholde fowles ayer sowe reape cary barnes heauenly father fedeth ye muche better thinke men woorthy bee hearde whiche deuide themselues betwene god men betwene yerthe heauen folowe thinges eternal wil dispise thinges temporall doe nothing el woulde catche bothe obteine neyther bothe thys heauenly philosophie like doeth promise great rewardes doeth require whole man emong men man shal find two getil codicions yt one seruaut hable please cumeth passe thone must forsaken el neither satisfied maisters contrary appetite square within theselues greuous debate must nedes seruaunt wil please one must onely forsake thother also sticke vnto one hate whome hath forsaken wil go againe vnto thother must nedes translate tourne loue seruice vnto onely dispise thother whome hath forsaken contrary one otherye serue god mamo god mammon one two whan commaunde diuers thinges god commaundeth thee geue thou hast neady mammon comaundeth take away men right wrong god commaundeth prouide thy brother danger mammon comaudeth liue thyself god commaundeth sobrenes mammon teacheth excesse ryot wherefore ye flatter selues vayne ye beleue thing may doone whiche vnpossible serue god mammon seruaut eche man whome wholly geuen ye see howe rich e possesse full whole trauaile great tumult busines defende kepe great carefulnes whiche forgoe great griefe suffer thinges dooe thinges whoso hath bound himselfe seruice seruaut god requireth whole manne cannot abide feloweship fowle filthy maister abide dimy seruant partaker aduersary common sorte ryche men wont excuse sore auarice pretence man necessitie say thynges men prouyde hunger nakedness speake doe depend wholy god put trust owne defence ayde wil ye voide carefulnes leste withdrawe desire better thinges necessitie nature content litle euery may suffice wil seruantes either liberalitie good menne alwaies ready shal suffice elles diligence laboure shall prouyde thyng whiche may ease necessitiewhat ye shall eate drinke c fynally yf none helpe father wil forsake geueth greater thynges caste smaller thynges whiche theyr harte desyre heauenly thinges although carefull worlde therefore lay vp hoorde long tyme bee vexed carefulnes meate without whiche ye cannot liue neyther carefulnes apparell couereth youre body kepeth colde lyfe precyous meate body precyous garment hath geuen better thynges hath geuen suche careful shall greue nourishe preserue hath geuen thinges lesse valewe estimacion ye desire exaumple looke vpon lyuyng thynges whiche maker thinges hath made youre sake hath prouyded lyuyng al thinges hath made consider birdes ayer sow reape lay vp barnes carefull tyme come liue day day without carefulnes whatsoeuer get take ioyfully yet heauenly father geueth meate vnto wil disapoynte whome estemeth farre aboue byrdes carefull ouer dede carefulnes vayne forsake shall youre carefulnes preuayle hath geuen body owne deuise geue liuing owne deuise p whiche carefull thoughte adde one cubit vnto stature care ye taymente co syder llies fyelde howe growe labour spinne yet say vnto salomon royaltie apparayled lyke one wherefore yf god appa ayleth grasse fielde whiche standing day morow cast furnace shall much doe oye sayth wil ye se vnprofitable ye carefulnes minde thinges man neuer carefull adde one cubite stature body euery mannes body though thynke nothyng vpon groweth certayne increase vnto quantitie appoynted god thou cast away care thy body shal nothing shorter thou vexed care thy body shall bee nothyng hygher therefore maketh body bigge strong without thy carefulnesse prouyde liuyng thee without thy carefulnes doeth withdraw thee care thinges whiche gotten without diligence great folishnes therfore feare leste ye lacke foode much ye see birdes prouided sufficiently leste ye careful prouision apparel body consider lil e whiche doe spring growe fieldes without care man labour spinne doeth prouyde apparellno salomon royaltie c semeth good hym heauenly father doth prouide neyther salomon notable ryche gay king euer apparelled whan chiefely et foorth glory rich one poore lily smally regarded set grow onely garden wher man bestoweth labour diligence grow also medowes accorde labour care make nothing elegant fit prouidence nature heauenly father doth ga clothe freshely vile gras e shortely shall perishe day freshe fieldes morowe cut downe dryed caste furnes haue ye litle trust sith hath geue thinges greater excellencie sith hath made immortal sith also hath specially prepared glory hys name ye thinke ye shall lacke apparell ye ought seke prepare adourning gaynesse necessitie nedefulnes therefore take thought saying shall eate shal drinke wherwith shal clothed thinges gentile seke heauenly father knoweth ye haue nede thinges rather seke first kingdome god righteousnes therof al thinges shalbe cast vnto ye careful morowe morowe shall care se fe sufficient vnto day owne trauayle therefore ye haue god father benignely prouiding birdes prouiding floures grasse whiche one lacketh reason hath feling sith ye se perceiue tendreth maketh much enduing body made merueylous prouidence soule reasonable like vnto angelical mindes disdaining ye shoulde called child chosing emong men free charitie whose pure lyfe sincere doctrine might knowen glorified mankinde hath appoynted thinheritauce euerlastyng lyfe cast away carefulnes vile filthy thynges saye doubtfully fearefully shall eate shal drinke shall put sayinges ye heathen christen men either beleue god el beleue carefull ouer men neither haue learned better life set mynde care vpon therfore distrustyng goddes helpe mannes felicitie thynges bodye prepare muche carefulnes thinges perteyne liuing apparel commoditie body leape ioy thynges chaunce vnto sounde feare thynges daunger vexed sorowfulnes sumtyme hang themselfes thynges bee taken awaye thus carefulnes cleauyng vnto corruptible thinges neither liue pleasauntly lift vp harte vnto study desire heauenly thynges emong men wicked father wil prouide child thinges necessary sustentacion theyr life ye haue father riche bountefull circumspecte sufficient enriche leue nothyng vnprouided neuer litle vile feare ye prouide child thynges without whiche cannot lyue laye carefulnes vpon knoweth well ye haue nede thynges harde wyl withdraw thinges necessary occupied busines sum wyll saye shall gette v oure handye worke whereby maye norishe selues wyfe child maye ease pouertie poore yes truely wythout carefullnes truely common people dothe double misery bothe laborynge body beyng also carefull mynde sowe beyng carefull leste whiche sowe shoulde cum vp mo e beyng care leste warrier take awaye whiche cut downe befor laied vp ba e lay vp theyr graner beeyng carefull leste infeccion shoulde hurte corne lest fyer shoulde rise destroy finally haue aniye plenty present necessitie heape vppe long time neuer haue ynough thought sure lyue longe wherfore matter requireth ye muste labour without al carefulnes yf ye chaunce haue money without fraude muche busynes take suche wyse carefulnes thereof wythdrawe nothyng fro busynes gospel ye firste kyngdom god c matter greater carefulnes lighte triefleyng corruptible thynges withdrawe let chefe care aboute good thyng comparison whiche worldly thynges value reputacion kyngdome god must set vppe saye doctrine gospell attayne vnto heauenly inheritaunce whereof haue chosen preacher setter furth haue showed excellent vertues nedeful doyng thyng bothe loue enemyes wyshe well vnto seketh destruccio thynges chiefe highest whiche come vnto youre father without diligence carefulnes ye must first chiefly seke smaller thinges whiche pertayne vnto necessitie life good gracious father wyll ca e vnto augmentacion owne accorde without carefulnes behalfe bothe cause ye shoulde render thankes vnto bountifulnes bothe hath geuen high thinges endeuoryng vnto also hath caste vnto thynges withoute carefulnes behalfe wyll haue greued care whiche troubled better busines ye take handebe ye carefull morowe great weighty requireth ye whole mynde ry voyded care wherfore men liueth daye daye beynge contente thynges presente hande greued vexed wyth carefulnes thynges cum lyke common sorte men dothe doublyng theyr affliccion doyng prouide present necessitie troubling themselues feare thinges cum whatsoeuer daie offereth vnto receyue thankes geuing let morow care self whatsoeuer bryngeth yf bryng good ye shall hange hope yf bryng yll ye shall preuent trouble feare yll cum life hath affliccions whiche nedeth double feare ynoughe suffer cum nedeful feare make presente cumme tyme doth alter bryng thinges mannes lyfe mynglyng ioye sorowe yet shall tourne vnto good yf ye take well worthe whatsoeuer shall chaunce sette care wholy vpon heauenly kyngdome p vii chapiter iudge ye iudged ye iudge shall ye iudged ye meete shall men measure thyng also wherin woulde ye shoulde farre manner scrybes phariseis pardon themselues great greuouse synnes agaynst theyr brother beyng offender moste vnmercyfull iudges yea falsely reprouyng thynges well sinistrally expoundyng thynges doutfull makyng muche thynges light small finally see manne fall greuouse cryme endeuour destroye hym heale saue hym yet hereof seke name ryghteousnes lowt sore agaynst mennes faultes whereas neyther lo e neighboures whome desyre rather destroied corrected slanndered openlyiudge ye iudged rather amended neyther hatred vice whereas maintayne pardon theyr owne vice farre greater others iudgementes ye haue must sauour euagelicall charitie whyche redily dothe forgeue misdeme man rashely wythout caus dothe expounde euery doubtefull thyng best whiche doth gently tolerate suffer many thynges whiche desyreth rather heale punishe whiche consyderyng owne infirmitie weakenes iudgeth mennes offence woulde iudged offendyng selfe finally taketh vpon high countenaunce chiding checking mennes faultes finde selfe gyltye lyke greater fyrst becummeth owne iudge blameth monishe h meane season chaunceth high minded menne example vntusi iudgement lighteth vpon iudges themselues finde like iudges ouer theyr life ouer others iudge ye therfore suche forte leste ye iudged like maner others el shall cumme passe ye iudge men men shall iudge ye measure men men shall measure like good turne prouoketh good turne mercifulnes prouoketh mercifulnes reprofe prouoketh reprofe cruelnes prouoketh cruelnes speaketh yll neyghboure shall yll spoken seest thou mote thy brother ye markest beame th ne owne iye howe sayeste thou thy brother suffer plucke oute mote oute thyne iye beholde beame thyne owne iye hou hipocryte firste ca e beame oute thyne owne iye thou shalte thou clerely see plucke oute thy brother iye men sore agaynste light offense theyr neyghboure swarme much greater vice one sladereth brother weareth looce garmente hymselfe full enuy speaketh euell brother ouercome weakens fleshe vsethe concubyne himselfe wholly seruaunt auarice ambicion abhorreth brother greate bibber whereas hymselfe hath harte numbre murder sorcery beyng blynde see bunch yette spye lytell warte neyghboure wrong waiwarde iudgemente euery ought sharpe iudge owne faultes milde mennes euery man ought loke narrowly owne faultes ouer busy mennes euery man ought fyrst hys owne physician laye handes man doeste thou see mote thy brother iye canste see blocke thyne owne iye face doeste thou saye thy brother lette take mote thyne iyethou hipocrite firste cast oute thou carrieste blocke thyne owne iyes thou hypocryte whiche doeste hunte prayse holynes emong menne thyne owne goodnes mennes uylies fyrste caste blocke thyne owne iye loke thy pure cleane iye whether anymore whiche thou mayest caste thy brother iye like iye iudge thynges body mynde iudge thinges mynde therfore must fault e wherewith iudge another mannes faulte must fyrst teache himselfe whiche taketh vpon hym teache others must owne iudge whiche entendeth gyue sentence muste mo yshe hym selfe whiche goethe monishe others geue ye holy vnto ogges caste pearels swine le e tread v der theyr feete turne agaynst rente thynges perteyne chiefly vnto whiche take cure charge people althoughe woulde ye shoulde prompte redy men good suffer wronge mylde gentyll indifferent towardes fall mannes infirmity weakenes finally suche towardes theim whiche peruerse frowarde ye rather amende distroye yet woulde mystery euangelicall wysdome shoulde vttered declared indifferently worthy vnworthy cast pearles swinefor iewes dooe esteme theyr mystery holy thynges kepe dogges whiche fylthy cattel yf ryche menne regarde theyr preciouse pearles wyll caste hogges lyke madde menne ye whiche haue possession holy thynges dede whiche passe preciouse pearles neuer hyghe pryce beware ye caste ryches treasure ghospell vnto suche vnworthye dogges whiche beynge wholy geuen prophane worldly thynges abhorre thynges sauoure holynes swyne whyche beyng wholy drowned fylthy pleasure deteste pure chaste doctrine ghospell rotten karcases fylthye vometynge pleasaunte vnto dogges sawse swete spice swyne rather haue myre preciouse stone therfore whosoeuer doeth openly despise holsome doctrine beeynge without hope anye good fruite ye ought put secretes heuenly doctrine leste occasion maye prouoked worse euer leste chaunce whiche happe yf man caste margarites swyne holy thynges dogges dogges wyll onely vn euerently vse holy thyng also beyng prouoked cast run vpo teare teeth swyne treade theyr feete preciouse stone like rubbell rubbishe dogge holyer holy thynge doth prophane defyle holy thyng swyne trymmer preciouse stone dothe defyle purenes lykewise men desperate malice skorne holy doctrine folishe thyng knowe falsely reproue wicked thynge dooe trouble putte busynes whiche dooe teache wherfore wisdome ghospell must communicated deliuered vnto desyrous leaste curable thinges must furthwith comitted men euery man weweth profe towardnes profiting certaine secretes must opened vnto aske shall geuen seke ye shall fynde knocke shall opened vnto whosoeuer asketh receiueth whosoeuer seketh findeth th knocketh shall opened man emong sonne askethe breade geue stone asketh fyshe wyll offer hym serpente ye han beey uyll canne geue youre child good gyftes howe muche shall father geue good thynges ye aske aske shal geue c excellente iewelles lyke ye ought comunicate men cum god father suche sluggishe ydell geueth thinges vnto suche gredely craue denieth thynges seke diligently restreigneth treasure knocke importunatly aske therfore father gemes golde true inestimable rich mynde aske saye ye shal haue asking seeke ye shall finde knocke shalbe opened vnto father riche bountifull denieth none enuieth none ryches wyll haue theyr pryce value knowen dothe knowe pryce whiche desireth fayntly therfore whoso dothe aske ought receyueth whoso seketh gredely fyndeth whoso knocketh doore instantly shall opened asketh well asketh holsome thinges whiche asketh sure trust seketh well seketh contynuall desyre knocketh well whiche doth prouoke moue goddes goodnes wyth good workes case ye receyue forthwith ye aske yet distruste bountifulnes liberalitie father wil eue whan nede shal require asmuche shalbe nedeful yf ye perseuer continue god sone entreated childrenif ye yll ca geue childre good gyftes c manne father intreated child father emong vnkynde yf sonne require profitable thyng bread wil geue requireth bread wyll geue stone aske hym fyshe eate wil geue hym serpent stede fishe truely woulde denye yf sonne shoulde aske hym stone serpente noysome thyng ye therfore whiche naturally geuen yll also thynges yll moste parte yet behalfe vertue throughe instigacion nature ye kepe honest naturall affection ye geue profytable thynges vnto child howe muche heauenly father beyng naturally good wyll geue vnto chyldren good thynges yf ye styrre call vpon feruent contynuall desyres bountefull goodnes ptherefore whatsoeuer ye men ye lyke also lawe prophetes touchyng lyfe manne whiche hurte holpen mut gentylnes iniuries bothe sydes long g e preceptes lesson seuerally wyll geue generall rule whiche naturally planted graued men euery man well aduised wylleth well himselfe common sorte menne loue themselfes wyll prouyde owne commoditie mennes hurte hynderaunce ye muste lyke ye woulde wyshe others towardes euen suche ye towardes others euery man ignoraunce desyreth taughte euery man dothe amisse desireth louingly secretly monished rather openly blamed euery edy woulde gladly haue ayde souccoure man woulde backebyted slaundered hindred good name therfore common witte vnderstandyng whiche geuen men let euery man take counsell hymself vse hym selfe towardes neyghboure let hym another would doen himselfe desyreth done hymselfe let hym doe another brief sum thinges whiche taught lawe prophetes whiche yf man lacke leysure lacke skylfulnes turne ouer reade ulye euery man hath rule home hym selfe maye directe ordre actes dedes desyre rather folowe ryght reason lustes desyres p enter oreyght gate wyde gate brode waye lead destruccion manye whiche go thereat streyghte gate narrowe waye whiche leadeth vnto lyfe fewe ynde thynges harde vnto loue thys worlde yf ye see moste parte men folowe contrary yet let nothyng trouble mindes better thynges harder waye consyder ye rather wh ther waye dothe leade easy entrye let two gate one narrowe gate man enter straite narrowe waye gate leadeth byanby euerlasting life another gate large brode men may enter brode playne waye leadeth byanby euerlasting destruccion enter ye therfore narrowe gate desyre rather goe euerlasting lyfe fewe euerlastyng perdicio many large waye restraineth man lawes godlynes fawneth vpon men wt thynges whiche delyght sens body doe please lustes myndeand fewe fynde therfore doth allure many vnto within short tyme sendeth intised throughe large gate miseryes canot told delyuereth deceyued false goodnes vnto extreme ylles howe narrowe gate howe streyght waye leadeth lyfe sheweth furth nothyng pleasaunt fleshe roughe displeasaunt many furth doth offer vnto thinges paynful nature pouertye fastyng watching sufferyng wronges chastitie sobernes gate receyueth swell glorye worlde gate receiueth puf vp pryde gate receiueth bolle excesse ryo gate receiueth drawe aboundaunce worldly thynges receiueth none suche naked vnburdened desyres worlde man wolde say theyr bodyes beyng put extenuated fined spirite wherby cummeth passe gate found fewe spyed cleare iyes clearly see thynges spirituall beware false prophetes whiche cum vnto shepes clothynge inwardly rauening wolues ye shall knowe theyr frutes doe men gather grape thornes fygges thistle euery good tree beareth good fruites rotten tree beareth yll fruites good tree beare yll fruites neither rotten tree beare good fruites euery tree beareth good fruites ewen downe cast fyer therefore theyr fruites ye shall knowe beware false prophetesbut touchyng suche men doe dayly lust excesse pryde auaryce suche fylthy desyres laughing lyke mad menne goe hedlynge theyr owne destruccion ye perill folowynge rather madnes errour ye muste rather beware companie hauynge cloke godlynes enemyes godlynes alwayes talkyng god father euangelycall doctryne kyngdome heauen theyr apparell course symple theyr chekes leane fasting theyr body worne awaye leanesse praye long geue poore teache people expound holy scripture disguised cloke thynges cum vnto apparelled though shepe skinnes whereas inwardly rauenyng wolues deuourers euangelycall flocke harde knowe wolfe shepe yf eche vtter owne voyce yf eche couered owne skynne shal man doe wolfe counterfeytyng shepe bothe shepes skynne shepes voyce crepeth shepe folde becumme shepe cruelly rent teare shepe wolfe chaugeth voice professeth name christe professeth doctrine gospell intent maye poison heresye vnwares negligent counterfeyteth godly workes thinten may rather abuse simplicitie hys desyres therfore ye whome haue chosen kepers feders flocke muste diligently take heede ye shall easely fynde counterfeyted iugglyng yf ye loke narrowly vponye shall know frutes tytle vesture verye deedes whiche doe disclose corrupte mynde albeit teache well yet dooe dede thynge teache euery tree hath hys peculyar proper fruit whiche taste dothe declare flocke ye obserue marke dilygently theyr lyfe manner ye shall fynde stande theyr owne conceyte loke theyr owne profyte proude reuengers enuiouse backeviters desyryng glorye geuen belly alwayes diligente theyr owne matter tha matter theyr flocke ghospel haue shewed frutes euangelycal tree say minde farre pryde full gentylnes desyrous vengeaunce minde despisynge pleasure worlde mynde despisynge rich gredelye desyryng godlynes ghospell mynde prompt ready dooe good menne mynde pure cleane lustes desyres hauing nother iye god onely minde refusing affliccion trouble maye promote sette forward doctrine ghospell mynde lokyng rewarde world well doynges neither glorye pleasure ryches mynde wyllethe well euen vnto yll wyllers doeth good whiche doe hurte whosoeuer trulye dede bryngeth forth fruites euangelicall tree therefore shewe themselfes prophetes boaste theselfes tytle feyne themselfes religiouse apparell shepe harte affeccio wolues must estemed iudged fruites regarde boughes barke oftentymes common growe fielde growe home holsome vnholsome fruite tasted dothe declare iuyce tree yf ye see auarice arrogancy enuy desyre vengeaunce dissemblyng whiche cleane contrary fruites euangelicall myndes thynke good fruite wyll spryng tree man mad gather grape thornes fygges bramble saye roughe wylde shrubbes moste plesaunte fruite lykewyse emonge menne good tree bearyng gentyll iuyce roote mynde bringeth furth good fruite syde yll tree leaues barke euer hatha good tre ca beare yll fruites yet bryngeth furth yll fruites turned chaunged seyng nature vtterly repugnaut hath cleane syncere mynde muste nedes expresse deedes syncerenes heart affeccio againe hath faulty infected minde expresse deedes thinges whiche declare good man although iuglynges colour holynes sumtyme deceyueth vnware men truely deceyue god therefore colourablie good let leaue theyr coloure become good dede emonge men yll tree maye made good yf continue frowarde counterfeytyng let hym fearetherfore frui te ye shall knowe lesse suffer lyke god reuenge vnfruitful tree suffreth tyllman dothe suffer cut caste fyer whosoeuer beyng kingdome god bryngethe furthe fruite suche fruite vncumlye profession vnlesse repent shall caste euerlastynge fyer therfore token ye shall knowe saye fruites yf ye fynde euyl ye shall remoue cure flocke shall receyue kingdome heauen coute christian enemyes thintent hurte beware leste hurte flocke beyng myngled among nothinge daungerouse vngodlynes getteth faythe authoritie thoroughe false coloure holynes pnot euery one sayethe vnto lorde lorde shall enter kyngdome heauen doeth wyll father whiche heauen many wyll saye aye lorde lorde haue prophecied thy name haue cast deuils thy name doen many miracle thy name wil confesse vnto neuer knewe departe ye worke iniquitie professe onely woordes shall counted worthie kingdom heauen tytle maketh christian man lyfe furthwith knowledge disciple whiche saye vnto religiousely lord lord dede serue diuerse lordes saye mammon ryches belly ambicion therfore shall thinke worthy kingdom heauen haue vtterly refused worldly desyres hartily obey father heauen whose preach vnto whatsoeuer teache cummeth truly name shal nothing profite lacke spirite workes specially daye whan rewardes shall appointed accordyng vnto euery mannes desertes man iudgement whiche oftentymes dothe fayle iudgement god shepe shalbe secluded goates thynges shal profite whiche nowe seme amongest menne certaine godly thing passing doinges manne shall see euerlastyng life prepared whiche folowyng doctryne ghospell haue declared themselfes true disciplesmany wyll say vnto c agayne shall see euerlasting punishmente prepared shall remoued companie godlye many beeyng sore aferde shall come desire nowe knowen god haue counterfeited menne chiefe moste excellent disciple christe preacher ghospell shall saye vnto lorde knoweste thou v thy seruauntes haue prophecied thy name haue chased waye diuels name haue reised vppe dead menne thy name haue put awaye poysons disease thy name haue wrought wonder thy name dedes glorified thy name haue declared v thyne many argumentes token nowe doeste thou knowe v shall heare answere truely neuer knew youdepart fro ye woorke ini quitie ye dyd thinges hearde say lorde lorde neuer perceiued ye harte faithfull seruautes heare muche speakyng name neuer felt spirite heare
