myracles whiche wer doen name heare speciall fruites whiche true disciple christ knowen wherefore seyng ye set furth selues amongest menne name ye myne dede vnder coloure professyon ye serued dyuell departe nowe awaye goe vnto hym whose spirite ye haue receiued whose wyll ye dyd obey title name soeuer yf weorke vnrighteousnes shall partaker kyngdome peuerye one therefore heareth wordes doeth thesame wyll lyken hym wyse man whiche buylt house vpon rocke shower rayne fell floudes came windes blewe berie vpon house ouerthrowen grounded vpo rocke euerye one heareth wordes doth shall likened vnto folyshe man whiche builte house vpon sande shower rayne fel floudes came windes blewe bette vpon house hurled downe fall great lyke fruyte tree haue good taste vnlesse roote haue good iuyce buyldyng neuer gorgiouse high galaunte outwardelye shall sure vnlesse stayed vpon sute sounde foundacion hath spirite saye sincere affeccion regarding nought elles glorie god tree good roote stayethe vpon vayne thynges worlde vpon true good thynges mynde doeth continue constantly verye polytikely buildeth buyldyng neuer shall falle therefore whosoeuer heareth woordes heareth onely reposeth inwardly harte thintente maye expresse deedes hath learned saye lyke manne wyse politike thintente maye buylde sounde sure buyldyng firste deuiseth loketh sounde sure foundacion whereupon maye sette buyldyng endure agaynst tempestes wether calme wether euery buyldyng standeth safely winter proueth soundnes buyldyng tyme aboundaunce rayne falleth downe beateth vpon sometyme fluddes increased rayne shake greate violencebecause grounded vpo rocke sometyme burlyng wyndes beateth agaynste beeyng beaten layed many wayes standeth styll moueth standeth vpon sure foundacion buylder dyd foresee thynges therfore sette vpon sounde rocke throughe whose ayde neded nothynge feare assaultes agayne whosoeuer hearethe woordes hearethe onelye dothe repose hearte expresse dedes lyke vnto rechellesse buyld whoe foreseynge stormes tempestes settethe hys buyldynge vpon sande whyche foundacion euer fletyng fayling nothyng trusty afterwardes falleth aboundaunce rayne violence ryuers runneth vpon storme windes runneth agaynste house leused plucked vp foundacion fallethe downe great crashe buyldynge goodly gaye see stode vpon vnprofitable foundacion therefore principall chiefe care consideracion must foundacion fasting almesse prayer simple apparell finally myracles lyke gay building minde hym dothe loke vaine praise men lucre pleasure shal fall sore storme temptacion draweth nere whose affeccion desire surely fastened doctrine promyses ghospel lokyng rewarde well doinges god onely shall able stande agaynst displeasure iniuries cruel persecucios wicked craftye assaultes heritikes fynally agaynst al engyns sathan death selfe shall hable stande styffely without discouragement vntill day perseueraunce conquerour euels shall receyue crowne pand came passe whan iesus ended sayinges people astonied doctryne taught hauyng power scribe whan iesus ended sayinges multitude mused muche newe trade doctrine heard suche thyng scribe phariseis whiche yf added thyng vnto moyses lawe bryng self estimacion people vsed brynge furthe certaine werishe constitucions wasshyng handes meate washyng bodye yf came home markete washinge cuppes paying tythes came mintes rue iesus taughte suche thing set furth miracle could dedes declared himselfe doctrinefor taught hauyng power forbydding wyth authoritie whiche lawe fauourably suffer requiryng whiche lawe require lawe suffered diuorce euery cause iesus forbade diuorces vnlesse aduoutry lawe forbade nothyng kill iesus required shoulde angry brother declared euidently onely interpreter lorde lawe also minister author finally certaine lyuelines perfecte doctrine certaine naturall strength truethand scribe touched enspired simple multitude whiche desirouse learne neuer experience lyke scribe phariseis pthe viii chapiter pand whan cum downe mountayne muche people folowed hym beholde came lepre worshypped hym saying lorde yf thou wilte thou mayeste make cleane iesus put furth hande touched saynge wyl ye cleane furthwith leprosye clensed iesus sayethe vnto see thou tell man goe shewe thy selfe priest offer gifte moyses commaunded offered wyttnes vnto therefore whan iesus spoken weyghtye highe thynges mounte euerye man chieflye hys disciple suche able folowe cherefulnes spirite dothe abase hymselfe agayne humylytie lownes common sorte whiche many vnweldy weake lame sycke thought allure desire heauenly thynges throughe corporall benefytes healyng dyd significacion whiche doctrine healyng disease mynde eyther thynges gaue credite autoritie beleue hym willingly loue loue wunne benefites sayinge weyeth well v see perceyue mightye dedes therefore iesus left hill came playne diuerse company men drew vnto euery side thintent many might beare witnes miracle shoulde wherfore greate numbre gathered together beholde cummeth furth certayne man geuyng occasion miracle teachyng withal figure whence faythe wer diseased wyth leprye soule seke remedy came forth certayne man hauyng body infected lepry disease emong iewes counted muche abhominable thought suche phisicion heale iudgement disease sacrate thyng appoyncted vnto priestes whiche searched meruaylouse diuers obseruacions whether bodye anye man wer infected wyth veraye leprye leful wer iudged haue disease cum companye men neyther lefull touche body defyled disease man therfore iudged pristes beyng fowle lepry durst yet cum iesus purifier clenser desyre health toke awaye shame fastnes approued goodnes iesus towardes men made boldelord thou ye mayest make cleane many example returned home beyng made whole made trust well therfore fel downe iesus worshypped hym sayed lorde yf thou wilte thou mayste clense woulde proude pharise one moyses priestes haue done case woulde haue abhorred vncleane fylthy man woulde haue disdayned haue talked wyth hym iesus playing parte good shepeherde hauing delight man faythand iesus put forthe hade c whiche ioyned greate modesty coldenes whiche also durst desire clensed vnlesse myght stand pleasure knowethe meete euerye man yet doubted able yf woulde iesus saye refused vncleane manne reched hande touched hym dyd neglecte lawe touching letter spake suche wordes wherby declared bothe goodnes greatnes power thou doest beleue yf wyll thou whole soone spoken skynne chaunged disease left hym people beeyng witnes thintente myracle myghte better beleued also priestes haue occasion reprofe reproue misconstrue take vpon auctoritie iudge leprye plucke vnto lucre gaine wunt cum vnto suche clensed lepryebut go thy selfe prieste c sayeth vnto hym see thou tel manne thou arte purged lepry thy parte iudge thy selfe take vpon office priestes therfore firste go vnto priest shewe thy selfe vnto declare cleane whiche heretofore hath declared leprose shalt thou offer gifte whiche moyses commaunded offered chaunced clensed leprye leste afterward lay vnto thy charge blame camest among multitude also coulde geue perfect health gift whiche receiue thee pure cleane shall reproue theim yf hereafter hatred begyn falsely blame done yf thou leprouse dyd remoue congregacion thou nowe cleane haue thei receiued thee thy gyft hym pourged clensed iesus would people testify muche profyte leaper faith howe lyghtly woorde toke awaye disease thintente myght geue eare vnto doctrine faythe whereby myght healed disease minde pand whan iesus entred capernaum came vnto hym captaynt besought hym saying lorde seruaunte lyeth home sicke palseye sore vexed iesus sayethe vnto hym whan come wyll heale hym captayn aunswered saied lord worthy thou shouldest cum house onely speake worde seruaunt shalbe healed also selfe man vnder aucthoritie another haue soldier vnder say vnto man go goeth another cum commeth seruaunte doth whan iesus hearde wordes meruayled sayed followed hym uerely say vnto haue found great fayth israell saye vnto many shal come easte weste shal sit abraham isaac iacob kyngdome heauen chyldren kyngdome shalbe caste darkenes shalbe wepyng gnasshyng teethe iesus sayed vnto captayne go thy waye thou beleuest vnto seruaunte healed houre therfore taught iewes thys facte dede waye vnto ealth easie sincerenes fayth forthwith teacheth captayne hundred menne waye vnto health stopped gentile haue fayth mete worthy ghospell whan entred capernaum whiche towne farre poole genesareth border zabulou neptalim came vnto hym certayne captayne whiche kynde men iewes abhorred two cause first vncircumcysed moste parte alienes moyses lawe secondlye kynd lyfe defamed commonlylorde seruaunte lieth home sicke palsey c good iesus whiche came heale men turneth hym awaye neyther captayne maketh requeste vnto hym saying lorde haue seruaunt home loue intierly faythfull profitable seruice nowe wholy vnprofitable lyeth vpon bedde diseased palseye onelye vnprofitable vnto meand sore vexed c also sore vexed rage disease deathes dore kynde disease lyke daungerouse greuous lyghtlye cured arte phisicians iesus delightyng fayth man whiche doubted worde hable heale seruaunte beyng absent thintente might declare vnto menne fayth truste man ioyned wyth greate humilitie harte aunswered wyll come wyll heale hym whereunto quod capitayne lorde iewe captayne abhorred iewes twoe cause therefor muche vnworthye thou shouldeste enter house defyled wyth companye nede thy bodelye presence onelye saye worde suche thy power myght furthwith seruaunte shall healed thou haste aungels messenger whome thou mayeste commit suche busines knowe selfe haue ruler whome subiecte obediente commaundementes neyther nedefull thynges sufficiente hym committe matter wyth authoritie agayne haue souldiers vnder rule whome dooe thynges whyche meete onelye geue commaundemente obey thesame commaund one goe whither goeth commaund another cum cummeth agayne vnto myne owne priuate seruaunte saye spedely doeth commaunded seruauntes obeye beeyng sinner ab ecte howe muche oughte youres obediente vnto youre commaundementes iesus hearynge thynges merueyled ignorante mannes faythe woulde cause men meruayle turnynge vnto iewes whiche folowed hym castyng theym teeth vnbelefe sayed assure hitherto haue founde greate faythe people israell haue founde straunger whiche neyther knowethe prophetes neyther hath receyued doctryne hath een miracle ye stande owne conceyte ye child patriarch whome god loueth ye peculiare people god whome healthe saluacion promysed assure tyme shalbe many shall come euery syde vttermoste partes worlde ye lothe abhorre straungers alyens whiche shall enter fayth sytte kyngdome heauen wyth abraham isaac iacob father shall acknowledge theyr euangelicall faythe theyr lefull chyldren shall take theyr table partaker euerlastynge felicitie contrarye wyse chyldren kyngdome whiche touchynge fleshly kynrede cummeth stocke abraham isaac iacob theyr vnbelefe shall onelye receyued goodlye happye feaste shall bee thruste outwarde darkenesthere shalbe weping gnasshynge teeth woulde see lighte offered shall punished theyr vnbelefe wepyng gnasshyng teeth hauyng intelligence nowe late grea e felicitie fallen theyr malyce enuye shall make theyr sorowe tyme shall se straungers alien receyued felicitie honoure whyche promysed vnto iesus spoken thynges vnto iewes intente geue credite vnto saying miracle turnyng vnto captayne sayeth go thy waye thou haste beleued done vnto clerelye declaryng helth geuen neyther stocke kinred neyther merites fayth onely whiche required founde lacke moste parte iewes sayed thyng folowed tried selfe time capitaynes seruaunte sodeynlye delyuered disease manne shoulde suspecte done chaunce helpe phisicians man sodeinly delyuered lepry course nature palsey forsaketh man sodenly pand iesus cum peter house sawe wyues mother lyinge bed sycke feuer touched hande feuer lefte arose ministred vnto whan euen drewe nere brought many possessed diuels caste spirites worde healed sicke might fulfilled whiche spoken esai prophete sayeth toke infirmity bare sycknes touched hande feuer lefte shewed furth certayne myracles withdrewe himselfe tyme multitude wente house common symon peter andrewe brother folowed iames iohn knewe peter mother lawe haddess greate feuer kepte bed beyng desyred heale taryed toke hande lyfte vp forthe whole feuer wente awaye lyuelines cherefulnes returned somuche ministred serued theim meate clerelye delyuered grudgyng ague truely parte feuer remained whiche healed arte phisicians bee troubled longe tyme theyr disease feblenes lothsumnes nowe whan night drewe greate multitude cummethe thycke swarmethe doores lokyng meate woulde retourne agayne vnto hys well doynge came furthe offered vnto hym meruaylouse number vexed wyth diuerse disease also demontakes whyche possessed wyth deuylies castynge oute spirites puttinge awaye disease healed wherein also agreablye vnto name none fow e horrible kynde disease whyche iesus woulde lothe turne away none vehemente incurable whyche furthewyth commaundemente dyd forsake man wyth worde healed frely healed doyng nowe selfe thyng takyng way indifferently disease bodyeand healed wer sicke whiche went aboute doe takynge awaye synnes whiche fyerce disease myndes truely came worlde esay prophecied many yeres paste toke infirmity wyllyngly vpon himselfe dyd beare disease p whan iesus sawe muche people aboute commaunded go vnto syde water certayne scribe came sayed vnto maister wyll folowe whithersoeuer thou goeste iesus sayethe vnto fox haue hole byrdes ayer haue nestes soonne man ha h teste hys head another number disciple sayed vnto mayster suffer first go b ry father iesus sayed vnto hym folowe lette dead bury theyr dead iesus sawe multitude woulde departe thoughe healed sycke diseased thoughe nyght hande nowe sunne gone glade came thicke aboute hym euery syde commaunded disciple prepare ship goe ouer water meanes myght bee delyuered multitude heard certayne departed home certayne importunate scribe folowed iesus vnto water syde desyryng bee receyued numbre disciple seen magnified people power shewyng miracle thintent would folowe doctrine lyfe might get renoune lucre miracle therfore cumming vnto iesus sayde master folowe whither soeuer thou goest woorde mete haue disciple yf woorde harte agreed put forth himselfe owne accorde offered hymselfe vnto thynges made pretence ariyng iesus neyther repelled mannes importunitie neyther layed nto charge corrupte mynde secretely monyshed hym vp mete disciple hym himselfe lykewyse mete mayster whosoeuer loketh commodity worlde ioyneth himselfe vnto hym folyshly whiche neyther soughte neyther rich glory kyngdome worlde imbraced extreme pouertie ignominy affliccion muche thynges whyche byrdes beastes lacketh notthe fore haue hole fox although haue house yet haue holowe dennes hyde byrdes fliyng wauoring ayer stede house haue nestes rest inbut sonne hath wher rest head sonne man destitute succour worlde hath place laye head yf manne desyre suche mayster yf wyll let folowe harte affeccio onely steppe feete scri e knowyng owne conscience dyd forbeare folowe hym agayne one whiche began noumbre disciple moued tray tie weakenes heard extreme pouertie christe kyng occasion sum coloare slippe awaye disciple iesus lorde folowe wholly whither soeuer thou goest suffer first retourne home burye father cause apperauce semed godly iesus willing teache thinges set part matter euerlasting healthe herein tariyng lingeryng daugerouse suffered yonge man beyng good mynde yet feble wea e e intangled busynes testamentes dead vnder pretence godlynes white prouideth vile inheritaunce worldelet ye dead bury dead fall inheritaunce heauen nay thou shalte ow nothing haue doe thy dead father whiche haste profest thy selfe heauenly lyfe ynow burye thy father suffer dead bury theyr dead lette put yearthe whiche loue yearthely thinges let burye whiche dead yearth whiche beeyng alyue dead also buried alyue men dead god thou carefull lyue departe companye dead yf thou wilt lyue dede whan entred shippe disciple folowed beholde arose great tempest sea muche ship couered waues slept disciple came vnto waked saying lorde saue v perished e sayethe vnto ye fearefull ye litle fayth arose rebucked myndes sea folowed great caulme meruayled saying maner man bothe wyndes se obey hym therefore iesus sent awaye multitude entred ship disciple wayting vpon rowed sodainly ro atempeste water moued waues ouerwhelmed ship iesus meane season slept vpon pillowe signifiyng figure perill thynges worlde often slepe beyng delighted comodities pleasure worlde whiche haue taken vpon stede christ tempestes amp trouble disciple shewe shoulde seke succour beyng amased feare plucke christe wake slepe lord loue u loste yet beleued man coulde safelorde saue v vnlesse awake therefore iesus inyodyng make holde without feare conquerours al assaultes sore vehement trouble rebukyng theyr great feare feare ye ye men li le fayth ye whiche haue seen manye miracle amp haue hearde doctryne ought put feare nothyng though helpe god woulde fayle place bee fayth trust neuer fayle whiche yet se muche ought bee iesus thus manis ed disciple rose thintent shewe hym fel e lorde elementes rebuked wyndes sea furthwith tempest seased folowed meruelous caulme myght appere doen strength manne power god nothyng disobedient vnruly sea troubled yet lordes commaudement sodainly turned great calme disciple whiche shippe muche musyng merueylouses matter sayde might ye man vtterly semeth man onely disease deuils also windes sea obey commaundementes aumple iesus good lorde hath taughte v often ormes teptacions persecucions rage againste v shoulde se helpe nother hym euery tumult trouble shalbe made caulme quiete awake v pand whan cum side water countrey bergesstrs met two possessed deuils cummyng graues measure sperce man might go waye tryng iesu sonne god haue doe ther tormente v belaze tyme good waye hearde mass swyne ecding deuils besought saying thou cast v suffer v go hearde swyne go waye hearde swyne whole hearde swyne sea perished water kept wence thei waye tolde thinges wha happened vnto ye demoniac e beholde wo k title came furth meete iesus whan sawe hym besought departe oute theyr coa e therfore iesus passed ouer water came countrey gergesites beholde offered matter occasion greater wonder met two men long time possessed wurst kynde deuilles eyther wandered wildernesse el hid themselues dead mennes graues whiche wont made set vp highe waye theyr rage great cheynes coulde holde breakyng theyr bondes rani e vpon waye goer man could safely passe waye man durste bring vnto iesus haue tolde dyuers secret might iesus drewe wylles wicked spirites wer sore ered could abide diuine power muche beyng giltie themselues felte certayne newe secrete tormente yea iesus spake vnto feared lest daye hande whiche sent dungeon hel punished eternally suffered hereafter molest trouble men therfore torment feare forced agaynst willeso iesu sone god haue dooe speake beare witnes diuine power christ cryed therfore mouthes miserable men iesu sonne god hast thou v arte thou come hither torment v tyme know misery wretchednes ydeth v accordyng merites suffer v tyme daye shall come v soone desyre delaye deliuered farre fro place thynges doen heard hogges feding deuils feling themselues sore vered power god lest shoulde departe without hurte great malice made peticion vnto iesus case thou wilt suffer v dwell abyde house suffer v lest maye departe hence enter hogges beast bothe filthye abhomynable soone iesus geuen libertie thought sufficient prouide helth saluacion man multitude diyels went furth heard hogges behold furth whole heard driuen fury ranne downe hedlong hill water perished water suffered iesus shewe notable malice deuils geue occasion myracle mighte bruted abrode swyneheardes seyng horrible sight ranne away feare went citie gadera tolde citezens seen happened demoniakes commonly knowen chaunced healed happened hearde hogges whole citie ye gaderenes amased tidinges went foorth meete iesus fearing lest come saw theyr hogges kylled saw two men naked appareled sawe healed theyr frenesy quiet theyr rage inso much sat iesus feete knowlegyng hym autor cause theyr helth e gaderenes grosse euill feared mighte iesus loued goodnes regarded losse theyr swyne health men went vnto iesus desyred depart theyr coastes throughly knowen would haue desyred instantly would haue vouched safe come coastes theyr countrey thesame thyng theyr harte two demoniakes hogges declare theyr lyfe ye deuilles desyred possesse stede men therfore iesus taughte nothyng content onely put feare notwithstandyng hath taught v exaumple pestilence poyson mynde sore despayre health yf chaunce come iesus ertayne desyres vnbrydeled vehement wilde driue force hym hath vnto withecraft manslaughter slaughter dearest frendes wicked dedes named sumtyme dryue hym vnto suche madnes killeth hymselfe meaues man heale helpe thynges onelye iesus geue healthe wyll vouchesafe come vnto despayre wyll vouchesafe yf agayne wyll come hym ix chapiter entering shippe passed ouer came owne citie beholde broughte man sicke palsey lying bed whan iesus sawe faythe sayd vnto sicke palsey sonne good cherr synnes forgeuen thee beholde certayne scribe sayde within themselues man blasphemeth whan iesus sawe thought sayde wherfore thynke ye cuyll harte whether easyer saye thy synnes forgeuen saye aryse walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgeue sinnes yearth sayeth sicke palsey arise take vp thy bed go home arose went home people marueyled glorified god geuen suche power vnto men iesus therfore minding geue holye vnto dogges cast preciouse stone vnto swine entred shyp went ouer water agayne returnyng citie called capernau house tyme entred house many gathered hym emong wer also doctours lawe came galile iewry hierusalem sat scribe doctours sitting taught came hym great number men house nowe litle entrye hable receyue greate multitude certayne whiche broughte vnto hym certayne man greued vexed vehement palseye carried foure men bed whiche rather karkas man man knewe iesus withinthey brought vnto sicke palsey coulde entre multitude clymed vp vpon house top remouyng tile house let rope hole bed sicke man feete iesus iesus offended greued importunitie seruauntes rather allowing feruencie faith albeit faithe sicke man ought lesse eyther commaunded let el wiilyngly suffred turning vnto manne bedred thintet might comede fayth muche stode good courage sonne thy synnes forgeuen first deliuering parte man disease fro whence disease body came yet meruelouse gently calleth hym sonne beyng man wretched miserable body soule priuely casting phariseis scribe teeth theyr pryde arroganciethis man blasphemeth multitude keping silence marueling certayne scribe whiche remembred god sayth holy scripture put awaye sinnes men wheras suche great resort fauourers iesus durst openlye murmur agaynst hym spake secretely themselues blasphemer god whiche beyng man taketh vpon power god iesus whiche somewhat declared godly power vnto phariseis forgeuing sinnes declareth also speciall signe openyng shewyng hyd euery man doth thinke therfore makyng aunswere vnto thynges whiche spake themselues secret thought sayeth ye enuy well doynges thinking ill harte suppose ye disease minde seen bodely iyes lyke health also take vpon vntruly promise vnto cannot perf urme whether thinke ye easy saye hym sinne sayed euen thy sinnes forgeuen thee el saye vnto man diseased palse ye see wholy bound disease aryse walke therfore thintent reason thinges ye see ye may also beleue thinges true ye see bothe indi erently easye sonne manne worde take awaye disease pardon sinnes wyll geue signe token manifeste open euery mannes sense vnderstanding case ye shall see wordes whiche shall speake nowe vayne haue theyr present efficacie strength doubt sonne man hath power yearth forgeue sinnes sacrifice holocaustes simple plaine woorde therewith turnyng diseased palsey sayed aryse take vp thy couche departe thy house whiche haue knowen sickearise take vp thy bed go home despayred thy health maye see perceyue thou art sode ly made whole strong insomuche thou art onely hable go vpon thy feete whiche litle wast borne iiii porte also course thynges chaunged thou art hable beare bed hitherto hath borne thee furthwith spake thyng came passe diseased palsey ryseth vp laying bed vpon shoulder departeth house manner fashyon pompe caryed litle whan multitude sawe euident manifest myracle playnly perceyued thyng power man god glorifyed god whiche gaue suche power vnto men yearth saying neuer sawe suche thyng doen whiche counted chiefe moste excellent men emong iewes scribe put silence styrred exasperate enuye sought theyr owne glorye glorye god whiche increasyng shynyng furth dayly iesus sawe themselues bee diminished darkened like sunne darkeneth candle glory god darkeneth causeth vanishe awaye vayne glory men enuy men profyted none ende resistaunce make glory christ manifest notable god vse malice men vnto glory renoume therfore iesus geue place enuy scribe departed thence returned vnto meere poole taughte multitude gathering euery syde pand iesus passed furth thence sawe man named matthewe sitting receyte custome sayeth vnto folowe arose folowed came passe iesus sate meate house behold many publicanes also sinner came sate iesus disciple whan phariseis sawe sayd vnto disciple eateth maister publicanes sinner whan iesus heard sayed vnto strong nede phisicion sicke bo ye rather learne meaneth wyll haue mercie sacrifice come call righteous sinner repentaunce passed custome house espyed sitting certayne publicane called matthewe whiche also named leuy sone alpheus kynde men filthy gayne great extorcion defamed slaundered many wayes especiallye emong iewes iesus whiche heretofore called vnto simon andrewe iohn iames homely meane kinde gayne yet honest lawfull declare openly despiseth vtterlye kynde men repent turne better called vnto matthewe commaunded folowe without arrying leauyng accomptes vnperfecte leauying lucre gayne beganne folowe iesus sodenly became publicane disciple voyce iesus certayne wonderfull efficacie strength certayne secrete power maiestie shining countenaunce whereby would allured drewe vnto euen lyke stone called magnes draweth yron matthewe desyred iesus would vouchesafe feast houseand came passe c thing iesus without griefe teache disciple shoulde forsake cumpanye wicked men hope wyll better theyr cumpany matthewe suche thynges made bounti ull great feast vnto whiche brought many sorte men publicanes sinner example communicacionbeholde manye publicanes c allured vnto admiracion loue iesus therfore whe phariseis sawe iesus disciple sitting meat seking matter euery syde blame reprofe dare speake vnto leste might heare whiche would indeuoure withdrawe disciple doth maister whome ye folowe one notably holye feast publicanes sinnersand wh n phariseis saw c whome forbeare filthye abhominable lyke soone flocke like commonly become suche whome lyue iesus heard communicacio taketh vpon hym defende disciple beyng yet weake teaching preacher gospel defiled cumpany sinner cumpany nother intent allure goodnes phariseis shunne flee publicanes whiche co monly counted sinner would defiled sinfulnes thintent themselues beyng wurse publicanes may counted holy among men udued holines ghospell desire cumpany sinner entent would take lucre vauntage enrich godlines enter house nother purpose good physicions enter house sicke men becumeth faithfull physicion bee often place among haue nede helpe physicions therfore turnyng vnto phariseis whiche thought themselues iuste men whereas indede infected muche wurse vice sayeth vnto cumpanye publicanes sinner physicion soules thyrste helth men purpose cumpany iust ye suppose selues sith nede physicion nede physicio ill ease phisicion profitable vnto knowlage disease willing healed therfore lothe despise holines pride succoure sacrifice muche acceptable god kind sacrifice whiche offered temple ye know scripturesbo ye rather learn meaneth ought ignorant god speaketh thus wyll mercye rather sacrifice agayn esai refuseth offeringes worke mercy neuer refuseth ye haue yet marked thing go learne worde god meaneth ye thinke good reproue doyng cotrary lawe agreable wil god refuse cumpany sinner whiche came purposely stirre prouoke suche maner men repentaunce former life many thinke themselues iust drawe self ought greued haue nede helpe vayn thing rebuke cal repe tance whiche haue nothyng repet talking iesus touched maner skorned arrogant pride phariseis whiche thought selues iust came disciple iohn vnto saying dooe phariseis fa e moste par e thy disciple faste iesus sayed vnto brydegromes chyldren moutnt long brydegrome dayes wyll cum whan bridegrome shalbe taken shal faste man putteth piece newe clothe olde garmente taketh away piece garment tent made wurse neyther men put newe wyne olde bottels bottels breake wyne tunneth bottels perishe put newe wyue newe bottels saued together thynges certain disciple iohn reaso certain carnall affeccion dyd enuye iesus magnifiyng iohn maister one excellent iesus ioynyng selues phariseis go vnto iesus feare falsely blame face vsed disciple ouer delicately brought vp hardly iohn whiche semed promise hard straite disciplyne phariseis sought fame opinyon holynesse among people two way chiefly fasting praier wherfore demaund iesus disciple iohn phariseis fast often pray ordinance aunceters whiche haue taught prayer commended set forthe fastyng thy disciple vse like faste unto manifest false reprose touched hym dysciples iesus answered gentelyand iesus sayed vnto brydegromes c neither reproued ordinaunce iohn neither plainly condemned fastynges men shewed gentlenes vsed towardes disciple negligence policie whereby brought lytle litle greater thinges euen wyse skylful teacher youth doeth furthwith feare tender age harde thynges inticementes allureth thynges difficultie taketh occasion answere yt reason witnes iohn bare hetestifiyng iesus thought iohn christ hath spouse spouse frende standeth reioyseth muche heareth voice spouse meanyng iesus bee spouse prophecye psalme promise cum lyke bridegrome chaumbre hymselfe nothing el frend spouse iesus therfore putting remembraunce saiyng iohn saieth childre whiche chambre new spouse whereas al thinges ought ioyfull troubled greued iewish lowryng fast chiefly seing spouse present enuy ioye whiche wyl long indure suffer led tedernes gentely swetely vnto thinges perfeccio haue spouse holy set haue leysure faste tendre cannot awaye meane season shall growe tyme shall cum spouse shalbe taken beyng stronger shal onely fast owne accord also shalbe able suffer sharper showres iewes put chiefest point religio ten fastinges log praiers thinges reproued yf doen vaynglory godlines doctrine ye gospel hath iye regarde vnto stroger thinges matter weight vnto whiche thynges frame fashion scholers litle litle therfore manner teachyng agreeth iohn newe teach doctrine new new maner teaching semely newe kynde doctrine behoueth schole mayster bee ouer hasty thing shal declare self time whose scholers better brought vp taught old thynges must mengled newe manne soweth patche new rawe cloth old garment way hole olde garmente onelye mended also hole made greater ill fauored newe cloth agreeth oldeneither put new wyne olde bottelles wyse polytike menne put newe wyne olde vesselles double inconuenience foloweth whilest wyne runneth vessel broken vtterly lost rather put newe wyne newe vesselles whiche maye beare strength wyne start suder boiling working wyne vesselles saued also wine wil disciple al newe fashion lyttell lyttell tyme cum maye bee strong styffe beare myghte doctrine euangelycall iohn durst put nother olde wyne olde vesselles fastyng far fro thinges men gospel must perfourm doe commit swete wyne doctrine vnto newe vesselles whyle thus spake vnto beholde came certayne rule wurshypped saiyng doughter euen deceassed cum laye thy hande vpon shall liue iesus arose folowed hym disciple also behold woman diseased ssue bloud twelue yeres came behynde hym touched hem garment said within self may touche vesture onely shalbe whole iesus turned whan sawe said doughter good cofort thy faith hath made safe woman made whole euen tyme whan iesus came ruler house sawe minstrel people makyng noyse said vnto get ye hence maide deade sleapeth laughed skorne whan people put forth went toke hande damosell arose rumor went abrode lande iesus speaking thinges came vnto certain warde synagoge called iairus falling hubly vpo knee wurshipped hym behement praier besechyng said daughter twelue yere age poynt death whan came fro home afeard leste nowe deadeand y arose folowed c cum pray lay hande vpon may recouer liue iesus ready good al men whiche asked plaine trust confidence whether pore rich iewes stragers forthwith arose vp folowed iairus whiche made haste home perhappes myght fynde daughter yet alyue disciple thicke multitude folowed iesus behold goyng befell occasion miracle amog great multytude people certayne woman whiche diseased bluddy flixe space twelue yeres spent whole substace vpon phisicions yet founde none coulde heale disease therfore double miserie pouertie ioyned sickenesse woman conceyued hart great truste cofidece iesus filthines disease durst speake vnto y many witness therfore though would steal benefite secretely came priuely behynd backe touched hem garmentfor said within hee selfe yf may c thus perswaded self touche vttermost part garmente shall whole garment touched flyxe stayed woman perceiued helth body restored iesus willyng suche notable exaumple faythe bee hid teachyng withall glory god ought conceled tent would haue benefite confessed turneth vnto ye multitude saying touched whan denied yet sum body touched feele power goyng peter disciple knowyng iesus mente saye lord thou seest thicke multitude thrusting euery side doest thou aske touched sith many touche whan iesus ignorant touched loked hym seking priuie toucher woma onely priuy thing perceiuing could hid fro iesus al shame fastnes set apart fearing trembling fell downe iesus feete confessed al matter disease many yeres sicke spent al substance vain vpon phisicios perswaded selfe onely touching skirt garmentand wha saw c myght healed howe touchyng felt perfit health body wil christ thiges declared multitude put woma shame neither purchase prayse men example teach sure confidence trust hable example woman establishe faith warden synagogue perceyued sumwhat waueryng withall reproue phariseis vnbelefe therfore iesus lest seme angry take away benefite againe comforted woman trembling feare said ughter good comfort thy faith hath obtained thee health depart peace quiet careles myndethy faithe hath saued wil benefite shal continue though thou hast stollen iesus speaking thynges certayne came warden sinagoges house tolde doughter dead cause trouble iesus toke y nothing el sum notable phisicion whiche hable facultie restore health alyue restore dead lyfe therfore thoughte vayne call phisicion bee neuer excellente dead iesus perceiuyng father maide muche amased tidinges comforted saying feare haue faith trust maide shalbe whole shall whole thee thy doughter may whole whan wer cum warden synagoges house iesus suffered multitude enter disciple besyde peter iames iohn father mother mayden al kinsemen frendes wepe countrey maner beate body bewailing criyng thinges men wente folishely funeral riche men greate menfor mayde deade slepeth iesus bad cease theyr wailing mayden deade slepe meanyng thereby mayden dead whiche coulde rayse vnto slept easy raise death rayse slepe whan familiar frendes warden perceyued thinges laughed iesus skorne knew certaily dead seing wha died therfore thrust forth funeral mourning multitude taking father mother maiden entred parler corp mayden dyd lye iesus takyng virgin hande said maide aryse furthwith whan word mayden rose walked also ye fayth miracle might certain onely restore lyfe sodainly also strength cherefulnes whe parentes maiden greatly amased gaue commaudement desyred instantly tell body doen myght auoid suspicion vayne glory chiefly ought doen heades nagoge al thinges possible obtaine praise men also myght shew furth greater faith credite ye thyng doen commaunded kepe silence yet would nedes tel thinges seen doen phariseis prelate synagoge knewe disposicion man minded vse profite others whan departed badde geue maide meate vsing part phisicio making though myracle whiche thyng established fayth miracle whan iesus departed thence two blynde men folowed criyng saying thou sonne dauid haue mercy v whan cum house blynde came hym iesus sayeth vnto beleue ye hable said vnto hym lord beleue touched yes saiyng accordyng faithe vnto iyes opened iesus charged saiyng see manne knowe departed spred abrode name al lande whan iesus left house warden sinagoge returned owne house two blinde men folowed hym whiche heard fame miracle therof conceyued hope obtain health especially hearing goodnes towardes al men wer neuer meane coulde neither see iesus cum vnto yet loud crie loue health feruentnes faith farre crie vpo iesus gentle praier saiyng sone dauid haue mercie vpon v y way aunswered nothing differring benefite miracle might manifest endeuouring alway allure iewes faith thynges many wayes reproue ye phariseis vnbelefe captain faith trust woman faith trust caried man sicke palsey beleue trust iewes phariseys dyd distrust wer also full malice enuy wha iesus cum home blynde men receiued house stiffe hope folowed hym iesus geuyng exaumple vnto others firste demaunded theyr faith beleue ye hable perfourme requestes without delaybeleue ye hable sayde lord beleue iesus touching iyes hande sayed ye beleue chaleging hym self restoryng sight imputyng theyr fayth trust declaryng chiefely vnbelefe made v vnmeete bountyfulnesse god whiche prest readye men assoue iesus spoken iyes blynd wer open saw clerely iesus willing warne v couertly although glory self foloweth good dede yet muste flee rather desire charged blynde menne verye earnestly man knowe dede ioying newe felicitie spred fame iesus whole countrey emong knewe olde blindnes went oute behold brought hym dumme man possessed deuill whan de uill caste umme spake people maruelled saiyng neuer seene israel phariseis said casteth deuils prince deuils iesus went city townes teachyng syngogues preachynge glad tidynges kyngdome healyng euery sickenes euery disease among people whan blynde departed miserable manne offered vnto hym vexed deuill whiche toke awaye vse tonge man neither wel wit wishe helth tonge aske therfore neede mannes fayth offered vnto iesus whiche withoute tarriyng cast deuil furthwith dumme spake multitude marueiling great spedines miracleshe casteth oute deuels prince deuils ready kynde disease beyng neuer incurable sayed among selues neuer manne emong israelite wrought many miracle easily cotrariwise ye phariseis blynded daylye malyce thynges doen sight menne could denyed yet entete myght withdrawe hym mindes people veneracion falsely slauder casteth deuils power god myght belzebub prince deuils tha vntrue slauder could mad thing say one deuill driueth say belzebub enemy mankynd gaue lyfe dead health sicke sight blynde speche dum illes cum oftentimes iesus goodnes hauing copassion vpon toke away suche corporall benefites might sesibly perceiued preparing capacitie spiritual benefites meke iesus offeded wt suche malicious reproch deuised health men sawe phariseis whome apperteyned see healthe people lyttell helpe succour also enuyed commodity others iesus therfore good shepeherde walked thorough al city stretes laboring heale soules body men teachyng cogregacions preaching kingdome heauen whiche none bee receyued suche voyd disease soule healing also al kyndes disease sickenesses whan sawe people moued compassion destitute scattered abrode shepe hauyng shepeherd saieth vnto disciple haruest plenteous laborer fewe pray ye therfore lorde harueste wyll send labourer haruest whan iesus sawe multitude swarming euery syde euery day thicke gredy health sincere doctrine co nsidered withall priestes phariseis scribe vpon people hitherto hang thing rather preserue people whole geuen g ory god owne glory owne lucre theyr bely pleasure wer religio coloured counterfaited noysome vnto true religion considered also people rude grosse yet way amendment lokyng healed body folowed simple plaine faithe glorified god although yet vnderstode doctrine gospel yet reiect contrariwise whan cosidered phariseis scribe prophetes law yet blinded worldly desire also resist doctrine ye gospel good shepeherde moued pitie compassionhe moued co passion saw lyke vnto wanderyng shepe skatered sunder destitute shepherd running vnaduisedly hither thither iesus therfore cosideryng phariseis whiche played wolues rather shepherd flocke hope people miracle nowe sumwhat prepared receiue doctrine gospell sayd vnto disciple well gathered togetherthe haruest plenteo laborer ar see great harueste laborer fame ye gospel spred abrode euerywhere feruencie many stirred vp whiche seme ripe redy heare wisedome gospel wil take vpon preache teache teache purely sincerely neyther sekyng glory man gayne lucre teachyng sincerely ye see teache truly suche cumpany men must neglected beyng kindeled desire heauenly doctrine done desyre require lord haruest thruste harueste ydle vnwilling laborer occasio lingeryng daungerous knowe pleasaunt tyme hand ye must shewe profe selues ye must begin shew forth saluacion whiche ye haue receiued x chapter pand twelue disciple called vnto hym gaue power vncleane spirites caste oute heale er sickenesse manner disease name twelue apostle first simon whiche called peter andrewe brother iames sonne zebedee iohn brother philip bartholomew thomas matthew ben publican iames sone alphe lebbeus whose syrname taddeus simon canaan iudas ischarioth also betrayed therfore iesus going vp vpon hill commaunded disciple specially folowed cum vnto ordeyned twelue chiefe vnto better learned strog committeth anthoritie office teachyng accordyng thexaumple sawe theyr maister teach people eche dry place leste doctrine fisher vnlearned abiecte men foorthwith dispised gaue also power vncleane spirites cast worde heale kyndes disease faultes bodyehe gaue power vncleane spyrites whatsoeuer christ father name owne name iesus christ whose roume iesus entred healing greuous incurable disease whiche benefite semeth vnto men godly myght allute rude simple thynges soule leste manne take false apostle true name twelue christ himselfe dyd ordein first simon sonne iohn whiche also called peter brother andrewe fyrste christ called secodly iames sonne zebedei iohn brother thirdly philip bartilmew fourthly thomas whose sirname didimus matthew publicane fifthlye iames sonne alphe iudas sonne iames whiche also called lebbeus thaddeus sixtly simon carianite whiche also called zelotes iudas iscarioth whiche afterward betraied maister maner ambassadoures beyng poore men rude abiect fisher sinner men knowen reputacion christ went tourn renue whole worlde vnto wisedome gospell lest prayse worlde myghte attribute thyng vnto selfe yf begonne heauenlye pourpose menne learnyng power tyche nobilitie piesus sente forth twelue numbre commaunded saying bee waye gentyles citie samaritanes enter ye go ather lost shepe house israell go preache saiyng kingdome heauen hande deale sicke clense leapres rayse deade caste deuils freely ye haue receiued geue freely possesse golde siluer brasse purse yet scrippe towardes iourney neyther two coates neyther shooes yet todde workman worthy meate worthy hearyng heare commaunded furnished ambassadours theyr iourney firste appointeth coastes limittes preachyng forbiddeth go iewry forbiddeth go eyther people next vnto city samaritanes iewes abhorre iesus count kynd men abhorred leste seme offended iniuries phariseis reueging selfe send disciple vnto straungers leste might geue occasion vnto iewes excuse themselfes saye wer despised gentile samaritanes preferred thebut go rather loste sheepe house israel againe knew iewes chiefly would rebell gospel would leaue maner excuse appeare vnto al put kingdome god owne frowardnesse gentile receyued plain simple faythe therfore forbeare tyme go rather lost shepe nacion israel may repent saued phariseis malice shepe emong erryng simplicitie ignoraunce whiche monished taught fone repent heare voyce good shepeheard ye shall beginne preachyng thus lyke ye saw mete expedient forth disclose secret misteries vnto ye rude peoplegoe preach saying kingdoe heaue hande muste made readines may hable receiue heauely doctrine first al therfore preache nothyng el kingdome heauen hande retournyng olde life may prepare themselues new lyfe first degree righteousnes abstayne sinne first degree health knowledge disease furthermore lest teacher men reputacion teaching newe thinges bee beleued make beleue doctrine mi cles lyke ye sawe doe heale sicke rayse dead cleanse leprose caste oute deuils thinges though great yet ye shall haue shall get fauour authoritie withall men first weake muste allured take hede onely tha ye abuse thynges eyther vayne gloryefreely ye haue receyued geue freely lucre lyke ye haue freely receyued freely geue defyle euangelical funccion least suspicion glory lucre thus men shall esteme greate dede yf shall see great might power yet haut proude desirous lucre stoutly dispise thynges como sort men suffre may haue light ready message laded burden encombred carefulnesse ye may whollye apply offyce committed vnto ye teache heauenly thynges set care vpon worldly thynges ye haue preparacio mete preaching teacheth meane thing wherfore take iourney burdeyn purse golde syluer carrye muche bagge abou e put vitayles neyther ii coates shooes staffe wel armed gyrded sweard worde gospell ye shall nede carefullfor worke man c ye beyng naked shall come necessaryes onely carefull office committed vnto shalbe geuen heauenly father matter ye haue hande wyll suffer workemen defrauded theyr hyer lyue daye daye according nature necessary soone prepared wyll ynowe whiche themselues wyll geue doyng teachyng suche thynges shall come passe neyther ye shall troubled suche care whiche maye diminishe youre auctoritie make suspected whome ye teache shall vnkynde towarde whome receyue farre greater thynges pbut whatsoeuer citie towne ye shall come enquire worthy abyde tyll ye go thence whan ye come house salute thesame house worthy let peace come vpon worthy let peace returne whosoeuer shall receyue wil heare preachyng whan ye departe oute house citie ake dust foot ue ely saye vnto shall easyer lande zodoma gomortha daye iudgement citie ye shall grieuouse man begging man shall caste teeth benefit hath made chaunge better thinges rather geuen thing shall nedefull tourne common innes citie strete entre firste enquyre yf honest man desyrouse heauenlye kyngdome wery worlde whiche godlye desyres sygheth nowe messias promysed whiche sheweth greate hope greater increase simplicitie innocencie lyfe liberalitie towarde poore suche one mete hoste ye shall meete gestes whan ye haue founde suche one turne house chaunge inne vntyll youre busines aboute gospelland abide tyl ye go thence causeth remoue another citie shall nedeful neyther comely oftentimes chaunge host light person person desyrouse deynty fare euery house euery fare oughte suffyse men gospell ye curteous gentill manner ye appere neither proude atterers whan ye enter house speake fyrste saye peace house youre prayer shall bee vayne yf house worthy prayer withoute delaye wyll receyue yf refuse salutacion shall loste whiche despise shall returne vnto truely woulde haue bowyng becking flatteryng man necessity yf house thinke muche receyue yf anye citie thinke muche haue geastes wyll theyr owne accorde receyue saluacion ghospell offred vnto ye shall leaue house whiche ye saluted leaue citie whereunto ye entred go stretes shake dust feete declaryng openly ye hunt none theyr worldly commodity caste ghospell god insomuche ye shall caste teeth vile duste sticketh vpon feete haue remembraunce holy thyng must geuen dogges precious margarites caste vnto hogges onely see ye laye vnkynde wyll nyll kyngdom god hande greate commoditie receiue great hurte refuse auyse whiche receyue worde gospell wo citie wherein none shalbe founde doeth repent yll lyfe desyreth amended assure countrey sodom gormorre shal gently handled daye iudgement citie though citie israel clemency god prouoke penaunce many myracles many benefites grieuously shall punished yf reiect pbeholde sende furth shepe among wolues ye therfore wyse serpentes innocent doues beware men shall delyuer vp counsel shall scourge syn goges ye shall brought head ruler kynges sake witnes gentyles whan deliuer vp take thought ye shall speake shall geuen euen boure ye shall speake ye speake spirite father speaketh brother shall delyuer brother death father sonne child shall acyse theyr father mother shall put death ye shalbe hated al men name sake endureth ende shall saued leue ye punishment god ye meke pacient iniuries endeuour profite good men whan ye prouoked yll men ye requi e iniuries sufficient bee garnished thinges wherewith ye maye good men iniuries men wyll haue vtterly without weapon ouercome none defence sufferaunce otherwise coulde make terrible feared expedient gospell violence doeth extinguishe violencebeholde sende furth iniury iniury pryde pryde rather couldnes gentilnes quietnes know phariseis men e stoute succoure world go sore displeasure none buckeler pacience cause feare ye sent lyke shepe without weapon simple innocent middes wolues ye sent would ye beyng prouoked naughtines shoulde turned wolues go meanes wolues asswaged gentylnes maye turned shepe great matter reuenge yll men turne hertes good veray great harde matter therfore ye must couple two certayne thinges together policy serpente simplicitie doue simplicitie doue shall cause desire good al men hurt man though ye prouoked policy serpente shall cause geue none occasion wherby doctrine might reproued chiefe point ambassade gospell maye entre mennes harte therfore ye must vtterly nothyngbut beware probable colour might withdrawe man harte doctrine gospell doctrine shall make great stirres tumultes worlde therfore ye must beware leste busynesse aryse defaulte whiche yf ye communicate benefites freely vnto men kepe pacience also towardes yll men desyre good therfore suche maner men yea wolues rather ye muste worke warelye nowe prepare mynde agaynst kyndes yll nothyng may trouble whan shall happen tyme shall come plucke ill doer theyr counsel conuentycles beate whippes like vngracious men subuerters publique weale ye shall brought ruler kinges desertes sake though may let yet wil suffer thynges doen maye witnessed open men peryshe theyr owne default beyng moued prouoked many myracles many benefites ready doctrine youre simplenes gentilnes spitefully reiect saluacion offered vnto therefore whan fewe shal brought furthe many weake vnarmed mighty vnlettered learned carefull howe ye shall pleade cause though ye rude skilfull iudgementes lawes lawe place also would ye run suche ayde succour whiche common sorte men wont haue higher hand iudgementes take vnto cunning well tonged aduocate flatter iudges fall downe humblye vpon theyr knee get fauour moneyfor shall geue c medle ye none ye onely go furth whan ye called aunswere whan ye commaunded haue iust cause cotumacy stubbernes aunswere playnly boldly deuised prepared oracion suche one hath boldnes ioyned wisedome mildnes like vitayle shall ready euery place speche shalbe geuen vnto vpo carefully muse appertayneth hym dependeth wholly vpon helpe god yea speche shalbe geuen vnto season whiche muse nothyng vpon garnished gaye wyse effectuall meete gospel mannes matter ye haue hand goddes wherof ye authours instrumentes ye shall speake spirite father speaketh mouthes trusting therfore vpon helpe ye must moued stormes aduersitie worlde aryse doctrine suche tumulte businesbut endureth ende shall saued brother forgetting brotherly loue bryng brother death yt father forgetting naturall loue wyl putte sonne daungier death sonne honoure dutie set aparte ryse father mother put death whome beginning lyfe briefly ye shall hated men hatred beare name world beyng corrupte euerye side ambicion pryde auarice lechery worldly desyres wyl beare heauenly doctrine contrarie appetite desyre shall greater offence christian man murtherer sorcerer hurly burlyes deuill shall rayse agaynste gospel distrust godly wysdome shall ouercome wyles deuil malice man ye busines comitted vnto bolde cherefull courage whoso among ylles doeth perseuer continue vnto ende shall saued ye must beyng discouraged feare leaue busines gospell pbut whan persecute citie flye anotherthe te te verelye saye vnto ye shall go city israel vntyll sonne man come disciple aboue teacher seruaunt aboue maister ynough disciple teacher seruaunt mayster haue called good man house belzebub muche householde seruauntes feare therfore nothing kept close shall opened nothyng hid shal knowen tell darkenes speake ye light ye heare eare preache ye house toppes peryll vnles stomacke meete worthy ghospell fayle lyke ye ought prouoke crueltie yll menne stirre vp persecucion resist might power whilest preachyng gospell newe young graunt libertie auoyde daunger peryll flying running awaye onelye ye maye safetie youre selfe also occasion fame ghospell maye spred abrode therfore yf persecute one citie geue place madnes flee another wise litle iniurie persecucion ye cease labour ghospell onely doen fame ghospell maye spred throughout palestine persecutor shall good shall suffre tarry long one placethe disciple aboue maister c tyme shall come whan ye shall auoyde persecucion flight nowe tyme shorte haste muste made kyndome god hande assure ye haue goen ouer city iewry sonne man shewe himselfe helpe beyng daunger exaumple shal shewed hym great aduersities preacher ghospell muste suffre whiche ought seme vnto tollerable ye se haue suffred al maner reprofes affliccions scholer better maister seruaunt better lorde suffiseth scholer yf bee equall mayster ought suffice seruaunte yf equall lorde haue vnworthely checked father house insomuche moste vile reproche called belzebub named sonne god name vncleane deuillfeare therfore meruaile bolde vpon seruauntes house knowe infamy semeth great ill almoste greuous death prayse infamye whiche cummeth wicked men gospell sake saye ye witch yll doer sedicious ignominy shame afterwarde shalbe turned glory sinceritie innocencie length shall appere vnto worlde whiche sinceritie men shall prayse cursing whiche haue dishonested false reporte prayse long suppressed breaketh commonly greater light nothyng couered time vncouer itfor nothyng c nothing hid come light endeuoure onely ye thynges worthy prayse seke prayse nothing therfore ye troubled feare infamy frely preache gospel kyngdome hath dishonest thyng nothyng kept close yea yf ye heare thyng darkenes preache ye cleare light haue tolde thing secretely preache openly doctrine without colouring desireth come furth men afrayde knowen man pand feare ye kyll bodye able kyll soule feare rather hym whiche able destroye soule body hell two litle sparowes solde minute one shall fall grounde without youre father ye heares head nubred feare ye therfore ye value many sparowes euery one therfore shal confesse men confesse father heauen whosoeuer deui men wil also deny father whiche heauen shall perchaunce whiche lytle passe vpon infamye ylles despise set lytle death mete feare yf could kyll whole man ye knowe body vilest parte man soule chiefe parte man cannot hurte neuer sauage cruell ye say nede feare hurte yf dyd sley folowyng theyr myndes yf kill regardyng wyll shewe feared feare like made ye whole man able condemne euerlastyng death deliuer hym hell fyre yet body whiche tiranne doeth kyll tyme doth vtterly peryshe selfe fame resurreccion shall restored far better wise hitherto therfore onely body daunger yf case ye killed constantly obeying commaundementes yf ye obey theyr commaundementes leaue bus ghospell nowe onely body doth peryshe whiche yf man kill yet common lawe nature must nedes dye also soule shall deliuered euerlastyng fier matter whether persecutor disease chaunce take awaye lyfe truely gloryous die ghospell sake whiche death though violent sore yet shall come daye whansoeuer cummeth shall come without prouidece god cummeth passe yf ye endeuour auoyde ye cannot god suffer slayne shall expedient die wherfore put myndes feare god also prouide whome hard geue immortalitie greater thyng despise death escape lesse value sparrowes whiche two bought farthing litle coyne numbre sparrowes great euery place yet much one loste yearth wyll sufferaunce father doe ye feare leste suffre emong hath chosen busines perishe tyme doeth neglecte insomuche kepeth numbre heares head seyng ye estimacion father innumerable sparrowes cause ye feare leste men able thyng otherwise shall thought hym hath continuall care ouer wherfore leaue care lyfe death vnto hym ye driuen open profession name neuer hated worlde feare displeasure men doe vnto men whosoeuer litle regarding rebuke men doe professe lyfe bee lorde maister hym wyll acknowlege bee seruaunt disciple heauenly father contrarywyse whosoeuer wyll ashamed men deny hym deny father whiche heauen daynteouse delicate profession doeth professe vnles doeth declare lyfe doth beleue sayinges hath denied whiche lyueth setteth sayng winning therfore bee yf maune lese noble euerlastyng prayse father angel feare false slaunder hece neither lasteth long slaunder dede ignoraunt folyshe menne god true glory great gayne lytle passe vpon thynges make haste euerlastyng rewarde whiche shalbe geuen due tyme haue deserued meane season good conscience great piece rewarde thynke come sende peace yearth came sende peace swearde come set man variauce father doughter mother doughter lawe mother lawe man e shall art household loueth father mother worthy loueth sonne doughter worthy taketh crosse foloweth worthy findeth lyfe shall loose looseth lyfe sake shall fynde profession ghospell weriche lyght thyng truely rewardes great ye must come vnto vehement continuall desyres mynde chaunce vnto yll menne lingerer must obteyned strength violence thinke ye cumme peace yearth emong men farre otherwyse nay come sowe peace concorde swearde war e inwarde domesticall warre ciuile warre onely doctryne ghospell shall hated moste parte sith requireth feruente desyre towarde affeccions men neuer great vnruly must geue place cannot great stryfe dissencion must aryse emong nere frendely whyles e vpon worlde wyll rage rather agaynst theyr derest beloued forsake theyr vice whereunto accustomed whoso touched great feruencye euangelicall charitie wyll suffre hymselfe maner affeccions plucte awaye thing whiche hath begoonne embrace make muche happy stryfe dissencion whiche doeth auaunce sincere good thynges cutteth awaye rotten thynges happy swearde whiche pareth awaye soule noysome lustes desyres lette tumulte hurlyburly layed vnto whiche haue geuen medicine troubled body stryue theyr beloued saye theyr nerest kinsfolkes hatred name ought impute themselues myght folowe whome persecute offer helth saluation men whyche yf men embrace shall stryfe dissencion truly ghospell selfe thyng peace quietnes sedicion raysed faulte others lyke medicine holsome thyng selfe body maketh rumblyng trouble while prouideth membres may quietfor come c expediente noysome thynges pared away true holy concorde may established emong pure cleane sweard therfore bring earth breake concorde betwixt sonne father deuide sure streight bande nature betwene doughter mother disceuer loue concorde betwene mother daughter lawe knot nature amitie sure swerde able breakehe loueth father mother c domesticall acquaintaunce hath made louers nere frendes swerde gospell shall set sundre ferre ferther shall batrayle extende farre shall warre go whiche syde shall onely despise enemy hurte asmuche lyeth saue also yf thus farre shall despising goe disgayne abhor e soberly make aunswere obey theyr wicked commaundementes ye must take hede meanes common state publique weale troubled slacke duty law nature sonne oweth father daughter mother brother brother husbande wyfe cosen cosen frende frende familiar familiar acquaintaunce abrogate put awaye lawe nature make perfecte ye must obediente thynges vnto publique magistrate minister vnlesse prescribe commaunde wicked thinges call lawe ye must go require accompte ye must make yf commaunde honour sacrifice ymages picture yf commaunde cease preachyng name ye ought obey yet must stirred checkes railinges must aunswered soberly mete obey god prynce ouer power man reason commaundementes god preferred comaudementes men yf prescribe vniust thinges yet make menne wicked yf obey must suffered leste beyng stirred fall rage exaumple take away vniustly thy garment money cast thee pryson scourge thee whippes thynges take awaye godlines rather occasion increase set furth vertue gospell lykewyse duetie naturall loue must perfourmed parent yf haue nede though heathen alienate ghospell yf authoritie parent withdrawe ghospell heauenly father ought obeyed yerthly father yet father must churlishly despised gently reuerently monished repung god lyke maner also must vnto owe dutie humanitie either nature el curtesy wil say heard master suche affeccions nature hath inwardly graffed v suche stronge manly menne profession ghospel doth require wyll moued heauenly busynes none affeccions ye shall see go waye must nedes folowe taken numbre disciple sonne loueth father mother mete agayne father whiche loueth sonne doughter mete loueth yf doyng hym pleasure neglecteth commaudementes wicked loue tendre thy parentes men thou offende thy parent god leste seme muche set wyll god mennes affeccions whereas nothing deare man life except despise also ghospell sake alwaies redines kyndes death punishmente take vp crosse folowe daylyhe findeth life c mete disciple haue maister lyke disordered loue parent childe hatred rather loue sith noysome vnto disordered care preserue lyfe verye destruccion life hath preserued life loste well hath loste hath kept naughtily forsakyng ghospel denying hath pacified iudge hath escaped prison hath escaped haging hath escaped death whereas semeth men haue wonne lifeand loseth lyfe c hath loste life dede agayne constauntly stickyng vnto ghospell putteth furth hymselfe boldely daungers deathes semeth vnto men loose lyfe dede winneth lyfe lyfe doth perishe taken awaye professing ghospell preserued euerlastyngly doth perishe dede bargayne haue short tarrying bodye vngodlines yet liueth body whiche liueth hatred god phe receyueth receyueth receyueth receyueth hym sent receyueth prophete name prophete shall receyue prophetes reward receiueth iust name iust shall receiue iust man reward whosoeuer shall geue one litle one drinke cup cold water name disciple verely say vnto shall loose reward neyther daunger leste chaunce forsaken parentes kynnesfolkes aliaunce frendes shoulde bee none geue houserowme vittayle gyftes wherewith doe adorne innocencye shall purchase euery house parentes chyldren kinnesfolkes frendes ye shall haue many chyldren ye shall haue disciple lyke shall euer wil despise persecute shalbe euer comforte entiere pure affeccion albeit ye reuenge wishe well god time come wil greuously punishe taketh selfe despised ye despisedhe receiueth receyueth others rendre great reward sake albeit ye requyte god willeth shoulde imputed vnto hymselfe yf gentilnes hathe bestowed vpon gospel sake whosoeuer receiueth receyueth whose name ye ambassadoures receyueth receyueth father sent whose matter haue hade therfore like riche liberall rendre great reward euery litle benefite whiche bestowed vpon menne shall loose theyr benefite vpon haue great auantage therby yt muche ought rendre thankes whiche gaue benefite receyued truely great gayne exchaunge corporall benefite induryng whyle spirituall euerlastyng ryches whoso receyueth prophete preacher nother cosideracion prophete preacher beyng sent preacheth promise god shall receyue rewarde prophete become prophete himselfe whoso receyueth iust man kinnesman worldely affeccion cause onely iust good man liuing rule ghospell shall receyue rewarde iust become iust man himselfe hath made happy chaunge whiche hath vsed hospitalitie wonne innocencye pouertie withdrawe manne gayne good wyll geuer counted gyfte value gyfte somuche whoso geueth cup colde water saye vnto vnto leaste onely disciple saye vnto certenly shall leese rewarde also shall become disciple poore bare whiche hable geue cuppe colde water thirstye skilleth howe great thyng geuen affeccion whose name geuen skilleth howe great vpon gentilnes bestowed sufficient disciple may excepte take great benefite p xi chapiter pand came passe whan iesus made ende commaunding twelue disciple departed thence teache preache theyr city iesus instructed furnyshed disciple commaundementes commission preache gospell lefte beeyng aparte theyr maister myght make triall themselues proue could doe went hill part might preache ghospell city iewes whan iohn beyng pryson hearde workes christe sent two disciple saied vnto art thou shall come loke iesus answered sayed vnto go shewe iohn agayne ye haue heard se e blind receyue theyr sight lame walke leprose clensed deafe heare dead raysed vp poore receyue glad tydinges ghospell happy offended tyme fame iesus reason miracle wrought many place reason wonderfull doctrine increase daylye throughout iewry countreyes nere vnto iordane iohn preached baptised iesus disciple iohn somewhat nowe enuying glory iesus yet great opinion whereas iohn thought somewhat manne tolde vnto iohn beeyng pryson good successe fortune came thinges doen lytle baptised iordane dyd beare witnesse vnto people iohn man perfecte holynes reioysing nowe came passe whiche spake name opinion hymselfe whiche greater dede decrease diminishe fame opinion iesus dayly increase sprede abrode perceyuing also enuious affeccios disciple intent might heale theyr weakenes abandone hym deliuer iesus chose two sent iesus say vnto name wordes arte thou messias whiche sayed come arte thou spake yet loke thus dyd iohn doubt confirme establyshe myndes hys disciple throughly abolyshe put awaye ouer great suspicion hymselfe supposing christe yf haue denied christe haue repeted whiche often spoken iesus messias disciple woulde haue imputed vnto humilitie haue humbled hymselfe greater opinion would haue hym knewe iesus hymselfe coulde best heale cure theyr weakenesgo shewe iohn againe ye haue hearde seen go vnto iesus tell hym iohn commaunded iesus knowyng testimonye whiche gathered dedes certayne whiche spryngeth woordes chiefly yf man testifieth himselfe made none aunswere first euen theyr face working many wonder newe haue heard healyng sicke chasing awaye vncleane spirites restoryng lame geuing sight blinde sayeth vnto nedeth shewe onely goe shewe vnto iohn ye haue seen iyes ye haue heard eares blynde receyueth syght lame walketh leper bee clensed deafe heareth demoniackes whiche troubled deuils deliuered dead ryse againe finally according prophecy esay poore humble doth embrace ioyfull tidinges euerlastyng lyfe whiche stoute arrogant despise workes declare sufficiently blessed vnto whose mynde suche great successe ghospell geueth occasion yll iesus spake also notyng modestly enuy iohn hys disciple suche wyse putte shame multitude knowe theyr faute secretely themselues temperyng answere meanes myght auoyde suspicion arrogancy disciple myght beleue hym better also myght rather heale theyr affeccion openly reproue departed iesus began speake vnto people concerning iohn went ye wildernes see reede shaken winde go went ye see man clothed soft rayment beholde weare soft clothyng kinges house went ye see prophete verely say vnto prophete written beholde sende messenger thy face shall prepare thy waye thee uerely say vnto emong borne woman arose greater iohn baptist yet lesse kingdom heauen greater dayes iohn baptist vntill day kingdom heauen suffereth violence violent plucke vnto prophetes lawe selfe prophecied vnto iohn yf ye receyue del e whiche come hath eares heare let heare departed iesus turnyng vnto multitude leste shoulde surmyse anythyng iohn otherwyse conuenyent supposyng demaunded thynges though doubt himselfe rather heale weakenes disciple beganne setfurth prayses iohn largely yet suche wyse woulde geue hym prayse messias nexte prayse onely yet woulde iohn testimony concernyng hym shoulde weyght expedient people shoulde haue good opinion iohn whiche testified notably iesus sonne god lambe whiche shoulde take awaye synnes worlde shoulde baptise fier spirite neither vanitie lying coulde suspected suche manne though falsely praysed christe waueryng inconstancye though beeyng chaunged afterwarde shoulde haue begonne doubte christe letter man suspecte iohn inconstancie yf ye thynke hym suche one wyll chaunge minde maner mutable menwhat wet ye wyldernes see c doubte thyng whiche affirmed cause dyd ye lately flocke together wildernes gase loke see reede shaken windes suche maner manne yf would nowe swarue dissente hymselfe become much vnlike vnto himselfe continuall hardnes whole lyfe doth lightly deliuer suspicion saye ranne ye together wildernes seebeholde softe clothing c manne gayly appareled silkes sight nothyng mete wildernes clothed fine lynnen silkes kynges palace vnto doth agree excesse riot delicate liuyng emong inconstancye flattery hath place liueth locustes wylde honye clothed camel heare gyrded letheren gyrdle thus suspected misdemed familiaritie kynges courte coulde alter ordre pryson doeth declare shewe coulde flatter must nedes great specta le sight whiche drewe thicke deserte therfore came ye beholde prophete commonly wunte leade theyr lyues deserte truly ye frustrate hope ye haue seen onely prophete excellent thing prophete malachias prophecied come messias beeyng nowe hande onely oracle tent saying promise come long bu also poynte hym finger hande thus prophecie lo sayeth sende aungell thy face prepare thy waye thy cummyng handei ye vnto c assure great excellencie iohn none greater emong hath borne woman yet whiche present estemed lesse many preaching ghospell onely greater promised doubtfull prophecy messias come shewed appoynted nowe cumming preached kyngdome heauen nowe hande hitherto heauenly doctryne looked whiche figure patryarkes whiche also oracle prophetes darkely promised nowe iohn excited stirred harte many desire euangelicall doctrynefrom day c begynnyng preachyng vnto daye breake vnto violence faythe sinner heathen people wyll nill plucke rauishe violently wyll longer excluded wyll longer detayned shadowes darke riddle olde lawe perceiuing light euangelicall trueth hand thyng nowe present whiche shewed signified former bokes perceyuyng also none prophecie ought loked touchyng messias shoulde comefor prophetes c fygures whiche lawe poynted messias come prophecy prophetes promysed messias come soone ihon came left promyse thyng come folishnes loke thing presente though come feruently gredely teache take agreablyte true sayinges prophetes nowe presently offered intente ye maye playnly see hereafter none prophete shall shewe messias come iohn whome malachias vnder helias name whome folowed austeritie hardenes lyuyng apparell whome folowed also franke reprouing f kinges prophecied come christe come wherfore yf ye receyue hym beleue ye messias long loked nowe hande ye haue seen lyfe ye haue hearde testimony ye heare also saye vnto yf haue eares receyue trueth let hym heare yf wyll stop eares let hym thanke hymselfe owne vndoyng nothyng omitted v may moue harte menne pbut wherunto shall lyken generacion lyke vnto child whiche sitte market place call vnto theyr felowes saye haue pyped vnto ye haue daunsed haue mourned vnto ye haue sorowed iohn came neyther eating drinkyng saye hath deuyll sonne manne came eatyng drynkyng saye beholde glutton wyue bibbet frende publicants synners wysedome iustified child yet see many obstinatly vnbeleuyng neyther afrayed austeritie iohn allured curtesye well doyng wyll receyue thyng whiche haue loked nowe long tyme promyse prophetes maner generacion shall call comparison may set furth lyke vnto child sytting market place whiche common song crye thus theyr felowes farre haue song plesaunt thinges vpon pypes ye haue daunced haue song sorowfull thinges ye haue wayled haue proued assayed one thing diuers way neither waie hath profitable vnto vnbeleuers sower vntractable iohn minding styrre vp nacion vnto penaunce sorowfull song came furth great austeritie hardnes lyfe fasting abstayning delicate meates forbearyng wyne drynkyng water lette saye possessed deuillthe sonne man c farre folowyng sonne man came furth minding styrre vp nacion loue heauenly doctryne merye song pypes myg allure gentilnes hideth himselfe deserte place weareth notable rough garment vseth notable sower meates framing hymselfe men despising cumpanye man eateth maner meates drinketh whatsoeuer set hym gayne picke quarels falsely reproue hym saying beholde great eater wyne bibber frende publicanes synners moued austeritie roughnes wont wonne fayre speaking gentilnes nacion euery occasion made wurse turneth euery remedy medicine matter greater disease sickenes moe wayes prouoked health saluacion euident shall men perishe theyr owne malice wysedome god whose councell thynges doen shall haue prayse righteousenesse emong child shall see appered great menne iust menne world repelled kyngdome heauen theyr vnbelefe contrarywyse shall see sinner publycans harlottes heathen people humble abiect receiued euerlastyng saluacion redines theyr fayth began vpbrayde city whiche miracle doen repented sinnes woe vnto thee chorazin woe vnto thee bethsaida yf miracle whiche showed doen citie tyre sydon repented theyr synnes long agene sacke clothe asshes say vnto shalbe better tyre sydon daye iudgement thou capernaum whiche ar lift vp vnto heauen shalt brought downe hell yf miracle whiche haue doen thee shewed sodome remayned vntyll daye saye vnto shall better sodome daye iudgement thee iesus musyng maner inuincible malyce certayne peoplewo chorazin feare example others began rebuke city whiche shewed many miracle healed men taught many thynges yet styrred repentaunce theyr former lyfe saying woe chorazin woe bethsaida yf wonder haue shewed seen tyre sydon whiche city ye abhorre heathen wycked long ago beeyng contryte would haue doen penaunce heerclothes ash meane time ye stand owne conceyte ye flocke israelwo thee bethsaida ye sacrifyce vnto idolles ye geuen riot excesse opely loocely ye wurship one god ye chyldren abraham ye haue lawe prophetes vnlesse ye repente thynges shall turne heape damnacion assure daye goddes iudgement euery man shalbe iudged god opinion hearesaye accordyng diserte tyrus sydon shall gentely handled shalbe easely punyshed styrred repentauce ye thou capernaum nowe standyng thyne owne conceyte art courage high heauen shalt pl cked downe hellbut say vnto c thou reioysest thy selfe though thou ryghteous doest abhorre dweller sodome whiche tyme paste horriblye punished theyr synnes daye iudgement theyr danacion shal easy thine miracle wrought sodome whiche haue shewed thee would haue satisfied penaunce god offended theyr city stande vnto daye tyme iesus answered sayed thanke father lorde heauen yearth thou hast hyd thynges wise prudent hast shewed vnto ba e uerely father thy good dinge deli ered vnto father man knoweth sonne father man knoweth father sonne whomsoeuer sonne reuele hym disciple returned vnto iesus theyr preachyng told cherfully matter came well passe teaching v whatsoeuer prayse worthy ought ascribed vnto god lifting hys iyes vp heauen saide thanke thee father art lord heauen yerth whose wysedome thynges gouerned thou haste hyd heauenly philosophie high mynded puffed vp pryde opinion theyr worldely wysedome polycie haste opened litle one meke fooles worldes iudgemente truly father thought best vnto thy gentilnes teache thou art pleased stout trust vnto owne iustice wisedome great simplicitie fayth worlde taketh fooles abiectes pleased thy godly wysedomeuerely father c condemne wisedome man drawe vnto thee good menne humilitie doctryne euangelicall turnyng stoode aboute sayed father author cause good thynges hath deliuered vnto knowe hym true felicitie doeth bowe hymselfe quiet meke myndes certayne secrete philosophie knowen vnto worlde manne knoweth sonne father manne knoweth father sonne sonne wyll manifest hym doth manifest proude high minded doctryne auayleth nothyng miracle auayleth nothyng without secrete inspiracion none worthy whiche distrusting theyr owne helpes commit themselfe wholy goodnes god thynke themselues wyse worthy wysedome thynke themselfes ryche receyued ryches thynke themselfes noble myghtie receyued priuities thynke themselfes iuste mete receyue iustice god pcome vnto ye labour laden ease take yoke vpon learne eke lowely hearte ye shall finde rest vnto soules yoke easy burden lyght iesus consideryng mynde great miserye calamitie mankynde opressed pouertie againe greuously tormeted care rich greued disease olde age vexed loue greuously troubled hatred many wander wauer sundry maze false opinion many afflicted greued inwardly conscience theyr synnes none whiche played parte faythfull effectuall pastour whereas innumerable whiche ke vpon priestes countenaunce hawtie behauioure whiche magnified themselfes name maister rabby whiche dyd exacte theyr tithe moued pitie compassion doeth inuite call vnto hym men promisyng owne accorde vnto menne comforte remedy syngle syncere harte cumme vnto hym shakyng moste miserable moste greuous yoke worlde take vpon yoke doctryne euangelicall cumme vnto sayeth many bee greued affliccions care conscience synnes many oppressed burden aduersitie refreshe geue solace comforte agaynste kyndes displeasuresand ease neyther ryches honour pleasure worlde bryngeth true tranquillitie quietnes mynde wysedome wordle religion phariseis deliuereth greuouse carefulnes worlde hath yoke firste apperaunce pleasaunte dede greuouse sharpe firste shake runne vnto gladly bowe neckes cherefully vnder yoke learne thyng onely truly doeth pacifye ease mynde fountayne whole cumulie trouble menne doeth spryng truely hawte fyerce mynde trusting selfe trustyng lytle god spryngeth ambicion desyre money luste reuenge debate enuy warre sedicion wickednes agaynste god whiche thynges canne tinmultuous troublesome yf ye deliuered illes take awaye fountayne euyls receyue doctryne folowe lyfe learne howe meke hawte hertefor meke lowly herte haue declared miracle canne doe yet desyre neyther ryches honour ambicouse gredy vtterly vpon nothyng whiche semeth worlde great goodly disdayne none neuer vile sinfull geue taunte taunte curse wyshe yll stryke hym agayne stryketh depende wholy commaundemente father wyll punishe yll doer wyll rewarde good dedes hym render whole glorye hym committe care obey simply playnly thynges muche study men hurte manne yf ye learne onely ye shall fele perceyue miserable tumultes trouble assuaged wherwith nowe ye tossed turmoyled without ende ye shall gette rest quietnes myndes whiche shall folowe mid tempestes aduersities trouble euery syde meke colde mynde fountayne mannes tranquillitie quietnes onely hauyng confidence howe downe neckes cause ye feare yoke semeth harde heuy vnto vnbeleuers vnto theyr harte trust vnto goodnes god whiche haue receyued fyer euangelicall charitie yoke softe easye burden lyght certen sure hope rewardes maketh yoke pleasaut inessable loue towardes god maketh burden light swete pleasaunte hath loue yf mynde haue good conscience voyde care yf haue certayne trust rewardes euerlastyng lyfe shall spryng ryse whiche canne trouble moue suche mynde p xii chapter tyme iesus went sabboth dayes corne disciple hungred began plucke care corne eate whan phariseis sawe sayed vnto hym beholde thy
