disciple whiche lawfull vpo sabboth day sayd vnto haue ye red dauid whan hungred hym howe entred house god dyd eate shewe breaddes lawfull eate neither whiche onely priestes haue ye red lawe howe sabboth dayes priestes temple breake sabboth blamelesse saye vnto place one greater temple wherfore yf ye wist meaneth mercye sacrifice ye would haue condemned innocentes sonne man lorde also sabboth daye vpon certayne daye iesus went corne disciple stirred hunger goyng hym plucked eares corne rubbyng theyr handes eate corne phariseis takyng occasion euery syde falsely blame sayed vnto seest thou thy disciple breaking sabboth day doest thou forbid sith vpon sabboth daye whiche lawfull iesus defended disciple coulde blame hym aucthour breakyng sabboth day teacheth withall suche maner ordinaunces ought cease often necessitie notable profite chaunceth sabboth daye fastinges suche lyke constitucions ordeyned man hurte vndoyng preseruacion health therfore doth obiect phariseis beyng skilfull lawe exaumple lawe man common sorte counted chiefly honest man blamelesse doe ye falsely blame disciple asswage theyr hunger smale thing easie gotten haue ye red holy dauid costrained necessitiehaue ye redde dauid c enterprised greater thyng fleyng saule came citie nobe dyd eate loaues whiche called leaues set furth shewed also folowers seruauntes vnlawfull man sauing priestes leuites eate loaues daunger hunger neyther priestes feared shewe hym loues dauid feared touched eate though prophane holy yf ye alowe doyng priest albimalech ye disalow doyng prophete dauid ye reproue disciple thing muche lesse regarded finale worke plucke vp eares corne hand eate corne rubbed hadesor haue ye ed lawe c besides lawe selfe comaundeth sabboth broken priestes temple killing ye beastes sabboth day exercising bucherly office gathering together pile wood setting fier plucking skinne cuttyng piece sethyng breake sabboth day lawe suffereth worke doen yet sacrate priestes doe exercise vse fowle workes holy place vpon sabboth day ye knowe thinges doen ye doe allowe thisbut saye vnto c make vse temple authoritie temple great worke bestowed vpon doeth breake sabboth daye saye vnto heare one greater authoritie temple doe seruice vnto hym ought excused blame breakyng sabboth daye breake sabboth day labour sacrifice moyses muche ought bee excused serue wayte vpon ghospell whiche sacrifice moste acceptable god ordayne sabboth daye may also take awaye sabboth ordeyned sabboth daye dyd ordayne man sake contrarywise made man sabboth daye mete therfore kepyng sabboth daye geue place profite commoditie man man perishe sabboth daye sacrifice made muche whoso attendeth vpon may blamelesse breake sabboth daye holde ye hym excused whiche necessari benefyte helpeth neyghbour vpon sabboth daye god confesseth estemeth kinde sacrifice yf man offer vp beast sayeth prophete oseewherfore yf ye w ste meaneth c desyre mercye sacryfice knowledge god brente sacrifice ye take vpon learned lawe yet wrytten lawe yf ye truely vnderstoode ye would neuer haue blamed blamelesse lyght matter noysome manne certayne ordinaunces good yll themselfes meanes profitable towardes godlines rather signifie bring geue holines kindes meate colour fashion garmentes stuffe muste made fasting holy dayes thinges must supersticiously obserue kepe omitte let passe thinges themselues euer good doe thynges whiche themselues euer yll aduoutrye homicide back bytyng enuye bee euer yll wicked yet bee pharisaicall religion doe lesse abhorre thynges b akyng sabboth daye helpe thy nedye neghbour euer godlye holy yet phariseis vnder colour kepyng sabboth daye suffre theyr neyghbour greued vexed departed thence went theyr synagogue beholde man hauyng withered hand ashed saying lawfull heale vpon sabboth dayes myght accuse sayed vnto emong shall haue shepe fall pit sabboth day take lift howe muche better man shepe wherfore lefull good dede sabboth dayes sayeth man stretch furth thy hande stretched furth restored vnto health lyke daungerous supersticion iesus christe studied clerely plucke myndes disciple therfore intent myght beate thesame myndes men manifest example departing place returned theyr synagogue mynding take witnesse knew chiefly infected disease behold furthwith geuen hym occasion miracle one multitude whiche lame wichered ryght handeand behold mane hauyng withered nowe phariseis lekyng honest quarell accuse iesus marked whether would heale man vpon sabboth day litle defended thapostles blamed breakyng sabboth daye iesus myndyng declare vnto men accusemente came religion enuy commaunded man lame hande come furth faulte myght appere vnto intent myght moued pitie towarde miserable man whiche membre dead vnprofitableand asked c moste necessary poore manne healed man ignoraunte phariseis thought demaunded question lefull heale manne sabboth daye whether tollerable emong doe good man yll saue manne destroy hym destroyeth hym whan maye saue hym doth saue hym helde theyr peace leste people thynke cruell yf saye lawfull helpe succour miserable manne sabboth daye leste lese theyr occasion blame iesus yf answered lawfull therfore saying nothyngwho emong shall haue shepe iesus hymselfe bryngyng furth example leused knot question whiche emong shall founde religious deuoute keper sabboth day yf chaunce one shepe daunger fallyng dyke sabboth daye wyll put hande furthwith plucke auarice muche ye rather breake sabboth daye diminyshe substaunce one shepe howe muche ought charitie preuayle obtayne helpe neyghbour sabboth day whiche farre better shepe manifest therfore reporte lawfull helpe neyghbour good turne vpon sabboth daye whan iesus perceyued theyr enuy woulde mitigated neyther woordesthan saieth manue syght miserable man would moued euident playne reason casting iyes taking greuously beyng sory suche great blindnes theyr heartes turned vnto hym drye withered hande sayed put furth thyne hande woorde put furth hande plyaunt nimble phariseis went helde counsayle agaynst hym howe myght destroye iesus whan knewe departed thence muche people folowe hym healed charged shoulde vtter hym might fulfilled spoken esay prophete sayeth behold sonne whome haue chosen beloued whome soule hath muche delyght put spirite shall shewe iudgement vnto gentyles shall stryue crye neither shall man heare voyce stretes shall breake broused eede shall quenche smokyng flaxe tyll sende furth iudgement vnto victory gentyles shall trust name phariseis driuen rage notable acte perceyued loste occasion accuse iesus departyng synagoge leauyng multitude perceyued beare good mynde vnto iesus consulted secretly herodians whiche also iohn disciple enuyed yr glory iesus meanes myght rydde iesus waye nowe toward murder nothyng lacked meete occasion iesus ignoraunte intended withdrewe himselfe place lesse myght seme haue geuen occasion extreme delyng rageyng furyous men myght haue spytefully represte myght haue ouerwhelmed miraclesand people folowed hym healed might haue destroyed also mynding shewe euangelicall mekenes gaue place theyr rage fury yf perhaps would relent repent thus farre gaue place vnto neuertheles place distributed heauely doctrine vnto multitude folowed thicke threfold many sicke men otherwise myserable brought vnto hym healed tyme yet come ghospell yet sufficiently spred abrode wherfore gaue place themand charged c prouyde hymselfe take occasion wicked dede teache withall wysdome ghospell ought defended disobedient threatnynges wyth checkes contencions mildenes mekenes therfore comaunded multitude yt folowed hym disclose hym leste rumour spreadyng abrodethat myght bee fulfilled spoken say c phariseis myght bee stirred neyther thyng doen chaunce prophecied nowe long prophete esay come passe ye wrytinges whiche prophete father doeth descrybe set furth victorye sonne obteyned thorowe mekenes saluacion ghospell translated gentyles pertinacye stubbernesse iewes sufficiently knowen men behold sayeth sonne haue chosen behold dere beloued soule delited geue vnto hym meke gentle spirite thinspiracion wherof shall shewe iudgement onely people israel also nacions shall doe tumultuously violently shall chyde shall crye con enciouse man shall heare voyce stretes wonte warre tong shall geue place inuincible malice shall endeuour bryng vnto saluacion shall geue none occasion yll theyr incurable destruccion shall sane yf meanes turne themselues vnto better wyll despise weake wyll despyse feble whome shall remayne good hope wyll cheryshe rather oppresse wyll breake browsed reede wyll quenche smokyng flaxe vntyll trueth selfe processe time haue hygher hand vntyll madnesse wicked theyr owne default breake farre men maye perceyue worthely repelled cast awaye gentyles shall enbrace doctryne whiche iewes despised put theyr trust hym whome iewes refused trust pthan brought vnto hym blynde dumme man vexed deuyll healed hym insomuche blynde dumme spake sawe people amased fayed sonne dauid wha phariseis heard sayed felowe dryueth deuils help belzebub prynce deuils whan iesus knew thoughtes sayed vnto euery kyngdom deuided selfe shalbe brought naught euery citie house deuided itselfe shall stand sathan cast satha deuided himselfe shal kingdom endure cast deuils help belzebub whose help child cast therfore shall iudges yf cast deuils spirite god shall kingdom god come vnto el one enter strong man house spoyle iewels except first binde strong man spoyle house chaunced meane tyme emong many whome healed offered vnto iesus one possessed deuyll whiche taken wretched man iyes toung iesus commaunded deuill departe departed forthwith moste miserable manne wholy restored wyse sawe spake multitude amased great master nowe suspectyng hym bee messias pake among themselues sonne dauid prophetes dyd promysethis felowe driueth deuils c whan phariseis heard voyce people set vpon iesus hymselfe alwayes wurse endeuour withdr harte multitude honoryng veneracion cannot sonne dauid ye suppose shall come borne vp mayntayned power godbut whan iesus knew thoughtes c casteth deuils helpe god sith wicked breake sabboth daye glotton drunkard companion publican helpe belzebub prynce deuils iesus although heard voyce yet knowing thought spake others turnyng vnto phariseis ordered hys answer manifest reason reproneth theyr madde raising rebuke yet rayseth agayne rather prouoketh louingly embrace theyr health saluacion euery kyngdome deuided inwarde deuision discorde muste nedes come naught euery house stryuyng selfe inwarde disagreing must nedes fall yf sathan driueth sathanand yf cast deuils c yf one deuyll dryueth howe shall kyngdome endure howe lykely greable deuilles beyng enemyes menne desiryng nothyng hurte destruccion whose health miserably doe enuy nowe fauour greatly health cause one deuyll stryue fighteth nowe yf cast deuils power helpe belzebub disciple chyldrentherfore shalbe iudges ye knowe whose helpe cast deuils also cast deuils yet ye reproue ye falsely blame yet haue might cast therfore canot chase awaye deuils power god might belzebub sith doe name therfore men vnlettered vnlearned able doe great thynges beleue simply power god chase awaye deuils therfore theyr godly belefe shall condene vnbelefe desyre rather vniustly reproue wheras ye might godly folowers thyng selfe declare doe cast deuils helpe ye deuill might god ye ought doubte sone dauid come kyngdom god sith ye see strength aduersaryes deeth vanyshe awaye whan whiche professe ghospell call vpon name therfore lyke concorde agrement emong deuils themselues destroye men whiche cum saue men haue concorde agrement deadl dissencion disagremente hitherto beelzebub hath exercised hys tyrannye vpon sinfull men geuen vnto fylthie desyres takyng way synnes men doe confounde destroy beelzebub prynce wyth hys whole garde doe restore vnto god innocencye possesse throughe vnryghteousnes thyng done force agremente betwene deuils feele confesse present power wherunto forced geue place el howe maye man myght enter tower myghty man take away stuffe vnlesse fyrst ouercum myghty man lay bandes kept vnder hable resyste wyl spoyle whole house carye awaye hys pray worlde house beelzebub thys claimed hym acerteyne kyngdome whole worlde geuen ambicion excesse fylthy lustes auaryce anger enuy noysom desyres whiche made myghty man power valiantnes haue entred kyngdome ouercuming haue wunne againe true prince whiche vniustly possesse therfore agrement betwene v prynces diuers kingdomes diuerse bande leage reconciled made one gathereth scatereth abrode wherfore saye vnto maner synne blasphemy shalbe forgeuen men blasphemye agaynst spirite shall forgeuen men whosoeuer speaketh woord sonne man shalbe forgeuen whosoeuer speaketh ye holy gost shal forgeuen hym neyther thys worlde worlde cumme eyther make tree good hys fruite good el make tree euyll hys fruite uyl tree knowen hys fruite generacyou vypers home canne ye speake good thinges wha ye selues euil aboudaunce hart mouth speaketh good man good treasure harte bryngeth furth good thynges euill man ill treasure bryngeth furth euil thynges saye vnto euery ydle worde men shall haue spoken shall geue account day iudgement thy woordes thou shalte iustyfyed thy woordes thou shalt ee condemned wyl grafte kyngdome god muste withdrawe hymselfe kyngdome beelzebub muste fight agaynst hym tentes man peace wyth god vnlesse war deuyll take goddes parte beelzebub therfore whoso tentes enemye aduersarye whoso healpeth gatheryng together agaynst scateryng abrode see ye ioyne youre selfe better parte better obteyne health kyngdome god euerlasting deathe kyngdome deuil ceasse seruyng synne deuil shall haue power ouer god wyll receiue hys kyngdome run hym wyll impute synnes former lyfe bee neuer outragiouse vnto penitent thys onely bee obserued manne blynded enuye peruetted wyth malice withstande glorye god agaynste hys owne conscience seeth hys lye diuyne power manifeste sygnes wonder opened worlde attribute spirite beelzebub wherfore thys assure whatsoeuer done woorde dede shall remitted vnto men repente god doeth easyly forgeue whiche anye meanes veniall pardonable reason frayltye mannes nature yf man speake blasphemye spirite god whose manifest power seeth hys playne weorkes shall scarcely fynde pardonne forgeuenes whoso speaketh blasphemy agaynst sonne man despyseth weakenesse hys fleshe shall bee pardoned errour ignoraunce mixte wyth hys dooyng dothe exclude peruerse set malice whoso speaketh blasphemy agaynst holye ghost shal vneth obteyne pardonne forgeuenes eyther worlde worlde come thyng spake iesus thyntente woulde feare phariseis theyr obstinate frowardnes whan sawe perceyued thynges whiche dydde coulde bee doene spirite myght god yet moued enuy resisted glory god ascrybed miracle vnto beelzebub whose spirite saide wroughte christe whan common reason saieth free knowen fruiteeyther make good hys fruite good c ye blame tree sythe ye cannot allowe commende fruite miracle whyche worke ease releue misery menne hurt man done vayne ostentacion glory gaine lucre good healpe man deny thys good freely doe affliccion therfore saye ye good selfe cummeth beelzebub owne iudgement al naught ye wyll hyde blindenesse myndes ye muste speake thynges may stande together nowe thynges whiche ye speake agree together common iudgemente menne therfore eyther make tree good fruite good el make tree ill fruite ill either graut moued wyth good spirite wheras ye graunte workes bee good el saye workes ill saiyng may appere probable ye saye haue spirite wicked beelzebub yf doynges suche ye muste nedes cofesse good ascrybe good thinges ill authour ye kinred viper yll men springyng yll pa entes coniecture iudge ye selues ye speake euen ye dooe weorkes declare spirite ye haue ye enuy glorye god falsely blame spirite whence cummeth pestilente fruyte euill tree bee wylde tree shoulde bryng furth genti fruite tree poysoned iuyce shoulde bryng furth holsom appulles euen ye speake well syth ye yll fruite taketh hys taste verdoure iuyce roote communycacion ryseth whiche hyd harte lyke good manne bryngeth furthe good thynges oute good tresure harte yll man bryngeth furthe yll thynges euyll tresure hys harte whose harte replenished godlines charitie speake wordes whiche sauour harte whose harte replenished wyth enuy pryde auarice vse suche communycacion whyche mouthe doeth vtter affeccion harte menne shall esteined god onely theyr dedes also theyr woordes ill thought pestiferouse noysome onely vnto thynker yl talking doeth powre poyson harte emongest many tonge therfore muste bee rescayned onely outragiouse blasphemy aolding rhiding backbityng vncleanly communicacion vtterly thinges wherof cummeth none honeste profite commoditie yea saye vnto man shall render count day iudgement onely filthy talkyng also euery vayne idle vnprofitable worde shall speake theyr wordes also shalbe taken accounted dedes thy wordes eyther thou shalte iudged good yf good woordes issue good harte thou shalte condemned vniuste yf yll woordes issue yll harte vnderstande ye perfecte iustyce kyngdome heauen far passyng iustice moyses lawe lawe punysheth onely manifest blasphemye agaynste god shall punyshed also anye reuylyng taunte agaynste thy neyghhour noysome perilouse saying also idle vaine woorde whiche vnprofitable tree burden tree fruyte therfore noisome occupieth time eares hearer without fruite profite whereas tounge geuen intent therwith profite selues neyghboure member celebrate magnifye glory god certayne scribe phariseis asked hym saiyng mayster see sygne aunswered sayde vnto euyll aduoutrous generacion seketh sygne shall sygne geuen signe prophete ionas ionas three dayes three nyghtes whale belly shall sonne man three dayes three nyghtes harte yearth men ninyue shall arise iudgement nacion condemne amended preachyng ionas beholde one greatter ionas quene south shall ryse iudgement generacion shal condemne came vtmoste partes worlde heare wisedome salomon behold thys place one greater salomon certayne scrybes phariseys whan hearde thinges dissemblyng rage theyr myndes go vnto iesus gentyl woordes though woulde nowe beleue yf theyr sake woulde shewe sum miracle worthye meete also hym chalenged hym spirite god alwayes mouthe heauenlye father maister whiche bee common sorte learned men desyre see sum notable sygne heauen whiche maye declare ye derely beloued god ye doe thyng whiche ye power myght iesus knowyng theyr subtill thoughte obstinate malice whiche required sygne none intent take newe occasion thereby falsely accuse hym chiefly sithe easye pycke quarell thynges whiche bee shewed heauen thynges whiche appeare iyesthe euyll aduoustetous c bee hearde wyth care touched wyth handes bearyng greate frowardnes maner turning taking angrely wyth hymselfe made answere saiyng naughtye counterfeit nacion whiche doethe glorye haue god theyr father whiche doeth crake progenitoure abraham foloweth rather whiche forsakynge god wurshypped golden calfe whyche styrred sedicion agaynste moyses whyche murmured deserte whyche kylled prophetes whereas declareth hathe beelzebub father whose spirite beyng replenyshed doeth rebell agaynste spirite god shall haue synge geuen heauen whiche maye calumniate reproue whiche vnworthye haue muche wholly sette geuen yearthe shalbe sygne geuen yearth whereby maye ouercum vtterly peryshe yf wyll conuerte nacion meruayled miracle prophete ionas whyche swallowed vp beaste sea restored againe aliue thre dayes thys shalbe sufficient sygne yf maye see hym reuyue agayne deuine powerfor ionas thre dayes c whome theyr malice haue slayne thys myracle shortly shalbe shewed vnto whiche wyll falsly slaunder lyke ionas wyllyngly deliuered hymselfe deathe receyued beast sea belly three dayes three nyghtes beyng paste hope menne healpe god restored alyue sonne manne shall bee deade harte yearthe three dayes three nyghtes thys fygure darke exaumple iesus syginfieth hys deathe buriall furthwith hys rysyng death added ionas niniuites tolde vengeaunce godthe men niniue shal aryse c destruccion theyr citye hande vnlesse would repent declare vnto niniuites whome ye despyse heathen idolater comparison shall ryse iudgemente god shall declare worthelye damned comparison although synfull yet beyng fearde threatenynges prophete humbled themselues vnto penaunce beholde one greatter ionas whyche preacheth vayne niniuites people farre wurshyppynge god ionas vnknowen symple meke came vnto man commended hym tolde hys cummyng shewed miracle allured vnto hym bodye benefite promysed great thyng onely threatned vndoyng destruccion preached lenger three dayes promysed thoracles prophetes often commended testimonye iohn testimonie father beyng countreman beyng cumme also parentes whome ye glorye crake haue taught nowe long tyme testifyng manye miracle doctryne vayne haue holpe manye wyth free benefites doe thunder sore threatenynges myne owne accorde promyse forgeuenes synnes offer euerlastyng felicitie heauenly kyngdome yet sayed haue spirite beelzebubthe quene south shal rise c layed deadlye deceytes farre ye bee bendyng bowyng true penaunce furthermore quene saba shall ryse iudgement reproche condemnacion generacion reason tidynges brought far leuing kingdome countreye toke longe iourneye vnto salomon moued feare desyre wisedome cum salomon also brought great gyftes beholde one thys place greater salomon lyke thyng dyd salomon thynges whiche ye see lyke thyng taught salomon yet ye put al kynde rebuke whyche myne owne accorde bryng vnto doctryne gospell wherby ye maye saued furthermore also ye go grieuouse displeasure whych beneficiall vnto greatter wonder benifites whereby ye bee prouoked vnto penaunce greuouser shall punyshemente bee vnlesse ye repent tyme pwhan vncleane spiryte gone man walketh dry place seking st findeth none saieth wyl returne house whence came whan cum fyndeth empty swept garnyshed e goeth taketh vnto hym seuen spirites worse hymselfe entereth dwelleth nd ende man worse begynnyng shall bee also vnto frowarde generacion thyng shoulde chaunce vnto blyndnesse people israell shoulde cum howe miserably handled prynces rome banished throughout worlde reiected despised nacions iesus rather signifie certayne darcke exaumple declare manifestlye taketh similitude man whyche possessed deuyll whereas deliuered restored hys ryght mynde afterwardes owne defaulte receyuyng deuill agayne grieuously vexed whan vncleane spirite goeth man beyng banyshed olde hospitall walketh dry baren place seking rest fyndeth none sayeth wyth himselfe returne hou e whence wente cummeth fyndethe decked clensed withoute anye geast yng place occupied anye beyng contente returne thyther hymselfe alone taketh vnto hym seuen spirites worse hymselfe whych entryng house together make theyr dwellyng cummeth passe man greuously vexed shall happen vngracious nacion thys similitude iesus noted obstinate wylfull malice pople israell falling backe oftentimes theyr olde maners tymes paste serued folowed deuilish vice desyres sumwhat deliuered lawe prophetes returned often agayne manner disposicion retourned idolles sacrifice woodes kylled prophetes redressed amended affliccions pharao egypte nabuchodonoser babilon diuerse calamity misery finally prouoked sonne god many way hathe onely renewed also farre exceded al wickednesse forefather araiyng harmelesse well doer wyth al kynde spitefulnes also driuyng vnto crosse passion false accusementes whereof certayne monstruous blyndenes seuen tymes miserable blindnes theyr father hath possessed theyr harte therfore shall cruelly handled destroyed haue hytherto pand yet talked people beholde hys mother brother stoode withoute desyryng speake wyth one saied vnto behold thy mother thy brethre stande without desyring speake answered saied vnto tolde mother brother put furth hys hand towarde hys disciple saying beholde mother brother whoso doeth wyll father whyche heauen thesame brother sister mother iesus spake thynges people came mother iesus wyth certayne hys cosens whyche desyred speake wyth hym coulde cumme vnto hym multitude beyng thycke standyng aboute doores house voyce passyng ouer one another certayne man interrupted communicacion iesus tolde hym hys mother hys brother doore whiche desyred speake hym iesus offended wyth importunitie troublesumnes wyllyng also teache affeccions passed litle vpon often matter gospel hande kinred myndes oughte regarded kynred body whyche gotten vertue nerenes bloud whych also large aunswereth whych interrupted mother brother occupied heauenly busines knowledge mother brother ioyned carnall affinitie wherof sum bee far perchaunce harte holdyng hand towardes disciple syttyng nere receyued gredely silence wholsome doctryne ye wil know true kinsfolkes moste dere vnto mother sister brother difference kinde age respecte kinred whosoeuer doth obey wyl father whyche heauen mother sister brother esteme hyghely spiritual bodily affinitie affinitie euery man may come euery like moste obedient vnto father wyl moste nere moste dere vnto xiii chapter day iesus went house sate sea syde much people gathered vnto hym insomuche went sate shyp people stood shoore spake many thynges simylitudes saiyng behold sowyer went furth sowe sowed sedes fel way syde foules came deuoured vp fel vpon stony place much yearthe anon sprong vp depenes yearth sunne vp caught heate roote wythered away agayne fell emong thornes thornes sprong vp choked fel good ground brought furth fruite hundred folde six folde thyrty folde whosoeuer hath eares heare let hym heare tyme whan iesus sawe place able receiue suche multitude went oute house water syde whan came thyther satte vpon banke teachyng people whiche gaped doctryne insaciablye sawe multitude great thicke thruste hym pressed hym thintente myght bee libertye people entred shyp spake pulpit people standyng vpon banke myght better seene better heard manyeand spake many thynges similitude sande bancke brincke bancke made though rounde auditory multitude euery man one mynde shewed sette furthe manye thynges vnto darke similitude eyther thys maner speakyng familiar commonlye vsed prophetes moste meete conuenient teache moue myndes people comparison taken thynges bee well knowen perceyued also vnlearned toucheth moueth euery one feare pleasaunte manner speakyng thynges bee spoken bothe crepeth mennes myndes pleasauntlye sticketh surely el thys manner monicion slau deryng manne secretly similitude touchyng euery mannes consciece wont commonly lesse offende fyrste letteth furthe parable signifiyng many euery side come runnyng preachyng gospell yet fruite springeth whiche chaunceth faulte teacher faulte hearer lyke fruite springeth hearer accordyng euery manne bryngeth mynde voyde worldlye care desyres fruite woorde heard hym greatest therfore exhortyng geue audience putteth furth thys parable saiyng sowyet went furth sowe sede casted sede certayne cornes fell waye syde ba e vncouered birdes came fliyng eate vp agayne summe fe rough stony place depely couered yea th stone etted coulde take roote depely ynoughe sprang vp shortelye theyr tyme throughe warmnes sunne muche yearthe kepe couered vnto theyr tyme deepe roote minister hun oure moysture agayne sum fell thorny grounde reason increase thornes kepte downe choked coulde ryfe spryng vp theyr libertye sum fel vpon good fruitful grounde springyng vp luckely brought furth fruite yet al alyke accordyng goodnesse grounde sum hundred folde sum three score folde thyrtye folde muche one sede sprang eare bare hundred cornes another bare three score another bare thyrty iesus speakyng thynges explicate declare darke riddel similitude leaueth euery manne coniecture thinke vpon hys mynde onely made exhortacion thei meete eares shoulde heare parable diligently disciple came saide vnto speakest thou parable aunsweryng sayed vnto geuen vnto knowe misteries kyngdome heauen vnto geuen whosoeuer hath shalbe geuen shalbe made aboundaunt whosoeuer hathe hym shalbe taken also whiche hath another tyme disciple hadde iesus alone wente vnto asked hym spake vnto people darke obscure similitude unto whome iesus aunswered thys wyse yet yelde themselues mete haue truethe opened vnto wyiche certayne emonge multitude bee onely better also bee pricked stirred worse wherfore vtter vnto lyke manner preachyng bryng harte heare wil vnderstand thinges moste manifeste doe inuolue wrappe language wyth darkenes suche meanes maye prouoke desyre learnyng searchyng ye whiche receyue symplye delicouslye thyng geuen ye worthye bee partaker secrete thynges concernyng wisedome gospell vnto hym hath shall bee geuen maye haue aboundantlye vnto hym hath nothyng nothyng shall bee added insomuche shall bee also spoyled whyche semed haue thynges cruell thyng spoyle hym nedy pouerty cummeth defaulte nedy mete rygh take vnkinde manne bring offer freely certaine principle heauenly philosophy accordyng capacitie simplicitie myndes castyng certaine seedes whyche whoso receyueth desirously truly prouoketh v commit mo thynges vnto hym contrarywise whoso despiseth reiecteth whiche geuen frely turneth occasion yll worthy spoyled whiche vnworthely therfore speake similitude seyng se thei hearing heare vnderstande prophecie esay fulfilled whiche sayeth ye shal heare wyth eares shal vnderstand seyng ye shal se shal se harte thys people wexed grosse theyr eares dul hearyng thei haue shut theyr iyes leste tyme see theyr iyes heare eares vnderstand theyr harte conuerted heale thys cause speake darke parable heare manifest trueth eyther profit el theyr owne hurt cumethe passe frowardnes thei haue iyes se manifest token yet beyng blynded enuye see whyche see haue eares heare trueth cannot confuted yet thei heare heare vnderstande ye heare although vnderstande truely saiyng esaie fulfylled men ye shal heare wyth eares vnderstande ye shall see iyes yet se harte thys people hardened dul hearyng haue closed theyr iyes leste myght se theyr iyes heare eares vnderstande theyr harte laste tourne vnto make whole truely men therfore infortunate pitied though miserable whyche witingly willinglye secke theyr owne destruccion reiect owne health blessed iyes thy see eares heare verily say vnto many prophetes righteouse men desy ed se thynges whiche ye se haue sene heare thynges ye heare haue hearde contrariwise youre iyes blessed see thinges doe eares blessed heare thinges yt speake harte blessed vnderstande wil father meane common felicitie truely many prophetes many iust holy men haue desyred see ye thinges ye se happened see heare thynges ye heare gifte heare truly dreame gessed thyng cum ye se also heare heare ye therfore similytude sowi whan one heareth worde kingdome vnderstandeth cummeth euyl one taketh away whiche yea harte sowen wayes syde receiued sede whyche cast stony place thesame heareth worde ano ioye receiueth yet hath roote hymself dureth season whe tribulacion persecucion hapneth woorde falleth also receyueth sede thornes heareth worde cate worlde deceitfulnes ryches choke vp worde made vnfruitful receiueth sede ye good ground heareth worde vnderstandeth also beareth fruite bringeth furth sum hundreth folde sum sixty folde sum thyrty folde therfore simplicitie desyre knowledge deserueth thys harke ye parable doth meane put furth sowier sowing sede thre sortes men sede woord gospel eyther bringeth furth fruite el bryngeth perfeccion fruit sprong vp fyrste moste baren whiche lightely negligently heare wordes heauenlye doctryne uffer entre theyr myndes fasten remembraunce thintente maye rooted theyr mindes beyng compassed fensed desyre care beyng armed purpose agaynst assaultes vaine thoughtes euery lyghte occasion suffer sowen spurned troden downe perceiuing yll naughtye one whiche lieth waite enuieth good begynnynges sendeth mynde certayne fleyng waueryng care whiche maye destroye seede spryng vp grasse haue roote better yf hearde signified seede fel hye waye go bothe menne beastes saye maner care affeccions kynred affinitie care common office loue hatred suspicion suche thinges chase awaye woorde gospell oute myndebut receiued seede c wel e e bee receyued agayne whiche receyueth seede woorde gospel hys eares gredelye putteth hys harte recordyng deuising wyth hymselfe frame hys life rewle therof prynteth vtterlye inwardes hys mynde fashion men doth doth lightly certayne affeccion tyme nourysheth seede hathe taken vntil growen vp grasse sheweth certayne hope euangelicall godlines absteynyng greate sinnes florishyng meane vertues storme persecucion begyn ryse yf gospell sake banishment offered prison punishement deathe whiche require stedfast strength mynde vehemente heate sunne wyther waye vtterly fainte decaye figure stonie ground whiche receyued sede brought foorth grassehe also receyued c able succour defend humour agaynst heate sunne throughe stone haue depe sure roote agayne whiche gredely heareth woorde gospell setteth depe ynoughe mynde kepeth long mynde intangled choked trouble care worlde especiall ryches certayne thicke thornes frely folowe loueth wyl suffer thornes whiche cleaue together intagled one another emong themselues cut away fruite seede sowen dothe vtterly perishe signified similitude sede whiche receiued grounde full thornes brier seede receiued good ground signifieth whiche bothe heare woorde gospell recorde wyth themselues fasten surelye theyr remembraunce doe powre thaffeccions theyr mynde swarue dye therefore also rydde delyuer themselues affeccions filthye care ryches whiche suffer mynde free liberty geue themselues wholy heauenlye inspiracionwhiche also beare c seede doctryne gospell vnprofitable suche myndes lyke one kynde wheate bringeth furthe lyke fruit groundes springeth lesse increase accordinge goodnes grounde godly desyre capacitie heare worde fruite godlines cummeth forthe aboundauntlye thys parable iesus taught v studye desyre heauenlye doctryne ought receyued yf desyre fruit spring thynges iesus dyd interprete declare vnto hys disciple aparte another similitude put furth vnto saying kyngdom heauen likened vnto manne whyche sowed good seede hys field whyle men slepte hys enemye came sowed rares emong wheate went hys way whan blade sprong vp brought furth fruit appeared tax also seruauntes housholder came sayed vnto hym sir diddest thou sowe good seede thy field whence hath ta e said vnto enuiouse man hath done thys seruauntes sayed vnto hym wilt thou go wede vp said naye leste whyle ye gather vp rares ye plucke vp also wheat let grow together vntil haruest tyme haruest wyl saye trapets gather ye first ta e bind together sheues bret gather wheat baru let v retourne vnto order former communicacion lorde iesus proposed vnto another parable shewe also another poyson mischiefe taken hede man wil laie vp pure fine corne hys barne ylles onely hurt ye sede latelye sowen spryngyng grasse doeth corrupte corne sprong vp well growen thys poyson whan sathan whiche coulde choke destroy seede euangelicall doctrine flying waueryng ydle thoughtes troublesome persecucions carefulnes rich honour lyke thinges wherewith mannes lyfe entangled goeth infecte false apostle wicked byshopes heritikes whiche wresteth wriethe subtyl interpretacion heauenlye doctryne theyr lustes desyres myngle true thynges false sincere pure thynges wyth vicious fawty parable sorte kingdome heauen like vnto housbandman good husband sowed good seede hys field seruauntes aslepe came priuely certayne aduersarye whiche bare husbande manne good wyl could night take away seede layed safely ground vseth crafte deceyte hurt scatereth mengeleth wheate sowen vnprofitable seede cockelles thys doen wente awaye fyrste man perceyued thys deceite whan seede nowe sprong vp grasse stalkes laden burdened eares lengthe cockels growyng vp together vnlykenes vtteryng shewyng began appere seruauntes merueylyng howe shoulde cum passe go vnto husbande man maister dyddeste thou sowe good seede fielde howe cokelles mengled mayster suspectyng authour shreude turne sayeth myne aduersary dydde thys whyche beareth euyl wyll hathe plasure hurte thoughe haue profite hymselfe therby spake seruauntes wyl ye go gather cockelles cleanse corne maister sayeth case leste peraduenture ye plucke vp cockelles vnaduisedly ye plucke vp also therwith wheate groweth nere suffer wheate growe together cockelles vnto haruest tyme wyll committe thys matter haruest folkes mowe cut downe shall fyrste gather cockelles bynde together parte bundels feede fyer afterwarde laye vp couche cleane wheat barne another parable put furth vnto saiyng kyngdome heauen lyke grayne mustarde seade whiche man toke sowed hys fielde whiche leaste al seades whan growen greatest emong herbes tree yt birdes ayer cum make nestes braunches therof agayne iesus mindyng shewe similitude howe philosophy gospell fyrste apperaunce abiecte homely ignominy slaunder crosse planted fewe vnlearned men litle litle strength trueth grow myghte power shoulde go ouer worlde shoulde embrac al kinde men proposed redell similitude kyngdome heauen lyke vnto musterde seede whiche certayne man toke sowed hys field selfe leaste among al pulse whan growne vp greater al kyndes herbes risethe vp bigge tree insomuche birdes make nestes bowes therof similitude spake vnto kingdom heauen like vnto leauen woman taketh hideth three peekes meale til al bee l auened al thynges spake iesus vnto people similitude without parable spake nothing vnto myght fulfilled spoken prophete sayeth wil open mouth parable wyl speake furth thinges hidden fro begynning world agayne iesus dyd inculcate beate selfe fame thyng doyng vnderstande meanes strength myght doctryne gospell secretly crepyng dispersed set abrode fewe apostle al te transforme al worlde nature whan shall seme consumed extinct chiefly shall set forth shewe strength kyngdome heauen lyke vnto leauen whych beyng litle quantitie woman put three measure meale three lefte vntill litle piece leauen changed litle litle whole quantitie meale turned owne nature thynges iesus declared vnto people riddelles cloudes parable spake nothyng vnto without parable thyntent might excite stirre mindes darke speakyng make desirouse learne yet geue holde though sought occasion busilye vniustly reproue hym soothe saiyng prophete tolde time paste wyl open mouthe parable wyl shewe furth thynges hath hyd hytherto sith worlde made pwhan people sent away iesus came house disciple came vnto hym saiyng expound vnto v parable tare field aunswered said vnto soweth good seed sonne man fielde world child kyngdom good seede tare child naughty one enemy soweth deuel haruest ende world reaper aungels tare therfore gathered brent fyer shal ende thys world sonne man shal send forthe hys aungels shal gather hys kyngdome al thynges offende whiche miqui ye shal cast fornace fyer shalbe wallyng gnashyng teeth shal ryghteouse shyne sonne kyngdome father whosoeuer hath eares heare let hym heare iesus departyng multitude went home folowed vnderstoode mente none occasion geuen false reprofe whan home alone hys familiar disciple came vnto hym requiryng hym expounde parable cockels mengled wheate parable seed diuerslye sowen declared gessed well themselues mente musterd seede leuen put meale iesus without griefe declared plainely good husband whiche sowed good seede heauenly father felde whyche sowed whole worlde onely iewry good wheat sprang vp good seede bee whyche doctryne gospell behaue themselfe worthily kyngdom heauen agreing profession lyfe dedes naughty cockels springyng yll seede mengled wyth bee yll men whyche professe purely sincerely doctryne gospell aduersarye whiche mengled hys seede priuely nyghte whereof spryngeth peructse yll doctryne deuill seruauntes whiche would gather cockel tyme whyche thynke false apostelles chiefe heretikes shoulde bee rydde waye sweorde deathe good man house willeth shoulde bee killed suffered yf happe bee repente turned cockelles wheate yf repente shoulde kepte preserued iudge whome shall punished time harueste ende worlde harueste folkes angel meane season therfore yll mengled good must suffered suffered lesse daunger peril bee taken away whan last tyme shal cum whan good shal seuered ill rewardes shall geuen euery manne hys dedes sonne man iudge ouer shall sende furthe hys angel clense hys kyngdome shall suffer none offence remaine neither good profite yll yll shall suffered trouble good whosoeuer liuyng emong good rather moleste trouble made better theyr cumpany shall gather together shedde others deliuer fyer hell shall punyshed worlde withoute ende shorte false lustes pleasure remoued floore churche caste darke den hel say kyngdome theyr father nowe ouer late vnprofitable penaunce shall force myserable people wepe waile gnashe theyr teeth cum spryng furthe good seede perseuer continue vnto thende although meane tyme appere vyle abiecte afflicted yll sorte vylenes mortalitie set aparte shall shyne lyke bryght sunne father kyngdome thinges great weighty thinges partes ought heard nigligently thei perteine either euerlasting felicitie euerlasting destruccion al men wherfore whosoeuer hath eare neyther deafe stopped desyres world let heare yt may auoide euerlastyng punishemetes obteine life euerlasting pagayne kyngdome heauen lyke vnto treasure hyd fielde whych man hath found hyd ioys therof goeth selleth al hath b eth f eld besyde thyntent myght kyndle stirre myndes hys desyre theuangelicall godlines added twoo similitude whereby teacheth professyon gospell thyng bee desired lyghtly common maner onely thyng ought laboured great studye thynges sette aparte thys excellent good thyng must purchased obteyned losse goodes whiche thyng thoughe chaunce easilye euery man yet whan found hath high felicitie althoughe meane season hyd emong men setteth furth selfe yet hath reioiseth secretly wyth hymselfe lokyng safely daye whiche felicitie nowe obscure darcke shall bee made manifeste open kyngdome heauen lyke treasure hyd fielde man perchaunce get blabbeth abrode others lest take hym ioying secretly reioysyng hymselfe goeth lorde ground sellyng al hath making asmuch monye byeth fyelde whiche knoweth greate precious treasure hyd thynketh hymselfe happye loose hys meane possession enryched wyth one notable grounde although know agayne kyngdome heauen lyke vnto marchaunte man sekyng good pearles found one precious pearle went solde al bought agayne kyngdome heauen ye lyke vnto marchaunte manne whiche deliteth goodly margarites hadde got notable good one byanby solde bought thoughte hym selfe poorer lefte nothyng hys olde ryches naye length thought hymselfe ryche priuie hymself secrete possession precious margaritie whiche though litle yet passed price value possession agayne kyngdome heauen lyke vnto nette ca e sea gathereth al kynde fish whych whan ful men drue lande sate downe gathered good vessel caste bad awaye shall ende worlde el shall cum seuer bad among good shall cast fornace fyer shalbe waylyng gnashyng teeth unto added also parable vnlyke vn parable wheate cockels exortyng hys disciple whome fyshers made apostle saye fyshers men shoulde studye endeuor allure drawe manye professyon gospell shoulde byanby caste awaye destroye yll mengled good saue kepe punished theyr iudge yf al thinges proued woulde repente againe kingdome heauen like net caste sea whiche beyng spred abrode dothe take embrace kynde fyshe whyche nowe perceyue full drawe banke nowe syttyng vpon drye lande choose good fysshes put theyr vesselles yll vnprofitable fish caste awaye shall bee thende worlde angel shall go furthe loke aboute net gospell dothe take drawe shall suffer good mengled yll one net shall esteme euerye man merites hys professyon shall seperate yll cumpany good shall lay vp one safely theyr maister shall caste burnyng fornace shalbe intollerable tormente whiche shalbe testified vp wepyng gnashyng teeth iesus sayeth vnto haue ye vnderstande thynges saye vnto hym yea lorde sayde vnto therfore euery scribe whiche taught vnto kyngdome heauen lyke vnto man householder whiche bryngeth furth hys treasure thynges newe olde iesus thyntente myght surely fasten saiynges myndes disciple asked whether vnderstode thynges well made aunswere vnderstode added yet parable wherby monished manye suche oughte learned surely remembred intent vpon euery occasion myght redily take furth whether hearer allured rewardes ell put feare feare punishemente breste euangelicall preacher ought certayne store house ryche plentiful treasure whence maye easely take diuers thynges sumtyme bookes olde testament sumtime oute euangelicall philosophy shalbe moste expedient theyr hearer one thyng muste spoken tymes one fashyon men moued thinges therefore haue nede certayne ryche treasure furnished kynde learnyng parable thus scribe iewes thei bee consul ed make aunswer bookes whosoeuer wil cunnyng scribe kyngdome heauentherfore euery scribe c sufficient hym bryng furth olde thynges vnles bryng furth newe also lyke certayne riche householder whiche hath thynges hys treasure whether man desyre ewe thynges whether woulde haue olde thynges satisfie contente men came passe iesus finished simylitudes departed thence came owne countrey taught theyr sinagogues insomuch astonied sayde whence cummeth wisedome power vnto hym carpenter sonne mother called marie brother iames ioseph simon iudas hys sister v whence hath thynges offended hym iesus sayd vnto prophete wythout honor saue hys owne countrey hys owne house dyd manye myracles theyr vnbelefe iesus taught sufficiently diuers parable bothe people hys disciple wente countrey nazareth often chaungeing place doctrine gospel myght farther spred abrode whiche countrey hys beganne hys preachyng leste shoulde seme thyng folowe mannes affeccion yet woulde passe ouer teache ought good vnto iesus therfore enteryng theyr congregacion began teache hadde taught thyng hindred matter gospel whyche oughte haue furdered comon sorte men rather enuy thinges knowen familiar fauour whereas make muche straunge thynges fondely foleshely esteming thing therfore goodly cummeth farre therfore whan iesus knowen certayne whyche knewe lowenesse symplenesse hys stocke pouertye hys parentes also arte whereby ioseph commonlye thought hys father founde nourished wife sonne knowyng also iesus arte neuer hearde saye brought vp learnyng thus mutter murmoure among themselues howe hathe thys notable wisedome fro whence hathe power shewe myracles thys iesus carpenter ioseph carpenter sonne hys mother poore meanne womanne amonge v whiche called marie hys cosens v iames ioseph simon iudas many hys nexte kinsfolkes dwell v howe sodaynly beyng made manne returneth vnto v preachyng myghty myracles doth thinke vnknowen vnto v kinred poore estate iesus dyd offend made stumble thynkyng yet nothyng hym man one common sorte people olde poorenes lownes hys lyfe enuying newe renoune honour iesus rebukyng theyr grosse ouer rude iudgement esteming man vertues fortune nobilitie birthea prophete without fauoure sau hys owne countrey sayeth vnto prophete lesse set owne countrey owne familye among kynsfolkes place redely beleued shewed many miracle dyd weorke none laiyng handes healed fewe sycke hys power straighted diminished hys chaunged theyr vnbelefe let like phisicion cannot profite sicke yf reiecte medicine arte phisician effectuall sicke man fault fayth vnto miracle geuen vnbelefe let shewe furth whiche lacketh neyther power might etted defaulte others therfore iesus reprouyng greate malice saied newe thyng ye vnto chaunced time past holy prophetes hely helisee whose tumbes ye haue nowe veneracyon whan rayned three yeares halfe therfore greate famyne throughoute countreye helias beeyng daunger hunger commaunded go wedow wheras many iewry vnto straunger sarepta countrey sidonians woma onely receiued found faith wrought miracle tyme helisee manye lazares nacion israell yet thys none healed onely naaman sirian whose fayth maner forced prophete shewe miracle xiiii chapter pat tyme herode te rarche heaed fame iesu saide vnto hys seruauntes iohn baptys e rysen dead therfore miracle wrought hym herode taken iohn bounde put prison herodias brother philip wife iohn sayd vnto lawful haue would haue put death feared people counted prophecie herodes birth day kepte daughter herodias daunsed hym pleased herode wherfore promysed wyth othe woulde geue woulde aske instruct mother sayd geue iohn baptist head platter kyng sory neuertheles othes sake sate also table commaunded geuen sent tormentours beheaded iohn prison hys head brought platter geuen damsell brought ot mother meane tyme herode tetrarche galile sonne hym whyche hadde slayne child bethleem hearde rumour fame doctryne myracles wonder iesus multitude hadde diuerse opinion sum saiyng helpe sum hieremye sum one thold prophetes said iohn restored agayn lyfe becum nowe myghty herode laughing skorne sayd dyd cut iohns head thynke ye aliue aliue also bee myghtye wyth miracle furthwith certifyed diuers manye notable wonder rumour nowe coulde appeare false said vnto seruauntes whome tell suche greate wonder iesus whiche la e kylled father noumbre chyldren bethleem iohn whiche risen deathe therfore nowe becum diuine godly notable myracles herode layed hades vpo iohn baptistfor herode taken iohn c cast hym prison although man estimacion many thynges hys aduyse counsell fauour tiraut turned hatred vnchaste woman whose fauoure loue obteyned fylthy seruyce coulde doe wyth kyng auctoritie iohn hadde taken vnto hym displeasure hys brother alyue herodias brother philippes wyfe whome also philippe hadde doughter iohn monished kyng frankly freely tolde hym mariage vnlawfull bothe hys brother alyue doughter alyue also whiche brother moyses lawe bade brother shoulde mary ye wyfe brother departedand whe would haue put hym deathe c chaunced hym dye withoute child herode louyng woman outragiouslye lesse lawefull hym loue greatelye offended lyberty insomuche woulde haue slayne hym feared styrring people knewe iohn greatly fauour bothe baptised manye manye disciple thought many messias truly euery man thought hym man indued spirite prophecy greate holynes afterwardes excesse ryote vnresonable loue towarde mayde hys neece shaked feare whan manner heathen dyd solempnisate daye byrth vpon al maner voluptuous pleasure vsed herodias doughter daunsed kinges table wyth wanton gesture pleased herode nowe warme wyth wyne swore woulde geue vnto mayden whatsoeuer asked yea yf woulde aske halfe hys kyngdome wenche leste shoulde leefe greate oportunitie abuse filthy lust kynges hart counselled mother bee asked fearyng leste kynges mynde beyng reconciled agayne iohn myght breake incest mariage counselled doughter aske nothing furthwith myghte haue head iohn baptiste geuen vnto dishe wenche counsell vngracious mother came feaste euery man loking woulde wishe desyre asked forthwyth myght haue geuen vnto heade iohn dyshe thoughe mother woulde esteme make thys dyshe halfe kyngdome whan heard thys otherwyse loked kyng counterfeyteth heuynesse hys countenaunce alleageth cloke hys crueltie feare hadde breake othe chiefly made many geastes leste shoulde seeme lyghte periured commaunded thyng whyche wenche desired shoulde doen executours death sente prison head innocent man cut brought dishe geuen wenche wenche gaue mother whiche chiefe deuiser doer matter thus luckely birth day herode celebrated rewarde geuen vnto moued called honest thinges sight iyes geastes fed whome king vouchsafe set table therefore vnchaste woman iohns head pand disciple came toke vp body buried went tolde iesus whan iesus hearde departed thence ippe vnto deserte place way people hearde thereof folowed hym foote lefte city iesus went furth sawe muche people moued mercy towarde healed sicke euen drew hys disciple came hym saying deserte place houre nowe pa e let people departe maye goe townes bye vitailes iesus sayde vnto haue nede goe away geue ye eate sayde vnto hym haue fyue loaues two fish sayde bryng hither commaunded people sit downe grasse tooke fi e loaues twoo fish lift vp hys iyes towarde heauen blessed broken gaue loaues discyples disciple gaue people eate nd filled gathered vp fragmentes remayned twelue basket e full eate fiue thousande men beside woman child disciple iohn caried away body buried whan iesus telling iohns disciple knewe cruel dede man suffered tolde vnto hym though knew wheras knew doen departed ship separate multitude might go desert secrete place shewing certain apperaunce manly feare dede cutting occasion wicked king shoulde heape murder vpon murder chiefely sith tyme iesus yet come therwith also teaching v geue place sumtime fury prynces leste beyng prouoked cha ed well doinges hurte innocentes themselues bee made wurse lawful shunne wicked ready dooe vngraciously maye profitte helpe good men going aside declareth notable faith certaine assoone hearde iesus left cityes abidyng desert feare herode thought went city wildernes whiche hid himselfe secrete place coulde goe bote wagon suche like ombrouse place folowed foote neyther feared discouraged hardnesse way daungier lacke foode gredely began hunger doctrine gospel iesus perceiuing cummeth darke corner came mete desirouse hym like withdrewe himselfe wicked whan sawe great multitude men flockyng thither whiche broughte many encoumbred dyuers dyseases moued pitye consyderyng perceiuyng faythe dyfficultie hardnes waye hys owne accorde healed dyseased greate feruencye multytude broughte wildernes sicke folkes child many wome yet brought vitail therefore nyghte nowe drewe nere theyr stomakes pricked hunger disciple whiche sene many myracles hauing yet throughly perfect opinion iesus thought good vnto diuine wisdome frame little little vnto perfeccion entent faith thinges done might firme sure teache withal meanes heale helpe infirmitie others put maister remebrance night hande multitude great high time take meate send away might goe nexte village euery man prouyde vitailesgeue ye eate c iesus intent myracle mighte euident open aunswered nede goe whither rather geue ye eate disciple though forgotten seene nothing awaked saying aunswerd grosly theyr wekenes set furth grea ne miracle shall geue supper many thirtene th noumber haue littel vytaile truely nothing el fiue barely loaues two fish case despyse lothe supper shall suffice whiche scarce suffice v iesus commaunded whatsoeuer brought vnto himand co mauded ye people sit downe c disciple obeying simply disputing ye matter thus ye kill v hunger ye geue thys lyttle haue broughte whole vitailes iesus exhibiting euangelicall feaste lyke behoueth none excesse mete shoulde equalitie al thinges commaunded sitte downe vpon grasse fyfties shoulde sitte together noumber geastes might better appeare also folowed maner whiche making feaste geuyng dole many deuide multitude company man lacke man haue muche doen iesus lengthe takyng vpon feaster feder body also whiche came feede soules teache dede disciple neuer lacke foode whiche geuen vnto gospell regarded litle vitaile tooke hys handes fiue barly loaues two fish first declaring vnto al men maner vitaile apostolical ambassadoures ought contet furthermore shewing plainly iye sincere faith multitude seeing howe litle vitayle ignoraunte howe many thousande men commaunded sit downe sa e downe therefore iesus feastemaker holding handes bread meate lifted vp iyes heauen shewyng whatsoeuer nedefull vse man cummeth heauenly father whan praysed bountifulnes liberalitie brake bread fish deliuered vnto disciple set people putting remembrauce darke figure sorte ye doctoures ought fede worde mindes simple christ loking vp heaue declared taught nothing came heauenly father apostolical men often see people depende mouth playne simple faythe shoulde delyuer nothyng vnto receiued christ propose vnto sundry deinties shop worldly philosophie neither bring vnto humaine doctrine owne affeccions shoulde distribute vnto simple playne euangelicall doctryne receyued theyr maister shoulde otherwise cut mince broken handes suche manner preparacion many bee refreshed glory redoundeth christe dystributour wouldeste thou know ende feaste disciple doubtyng nothing made distribucion doubting nothing fel meate al handes excesse sufficiency feast numbre lacked nothing muche wha supper done scrappes furthermore gathered vp filled twelue baskettes noumber menne fiue thousande beside woman child pand streight way iesus made disciple get vp shippe goe hym vnto side sent people away people sente awaye went vp mountayne pray alone whan nyght come alone shippe nowe middes e sea oste waues contrary winde fourth watche nighte iesus wente vnto walkyng sea whan disciple saw walking sea troubled saying spirite cryed feare streighte way iesus spake vnto saying good chere afrayde peter aunswered sayde lorde yf bee thou bidde come vnto thee water sayde come whan peter come downe ship walked water come iesus whan sawe mighty winde afrayde whan beganne sinke cryed saying lorde saue immediately iesus stretched furth hande caughte sayd vnto hym thou litel fayth wherefore diddest doubte thinges done iesus desyring teache necessitie body satisfyed oughte goe vnto wantonnes slepe vnto prayer vnto whiche prayer solitarynes moste mete forced hys disciple greued departe dere lord go mere row ouer water woulde come whan sent away people although departed hym againste theyr yet murmoure make theyr excuse nyghte hande aske whan woulde folowe obey symply hys commaundementes therefore whan gon iesus sendyng awaye multytude whome satysfyed meanes wente vp hyll pray alone taughte hys disciple pray therefore top hyll iesus alone good parte nighte disciple meane tyme theyr lorde beeing absent rowed water peryll entred vpon water arose contrary wynde ship tossed without perill swellyng waues water night made theyr feare double shoulde doe daungier whose helpe mighte call vpon iesus lefte disciple peryll almost whole nighte harden little little agaynste feares teache helpe god shall neuer lacke perill although come somewhat late therefore lengthe aboute fourthe watche nyghte almoste beeyng despayre nowe sore amased theyr mynde ready geue ouer oute hande iesus came bote walkyng vpon water sawe one walkyng darke knewe iesus well fearde sayde among themselues goste see man common sorte shippemen thinketh suche manner syghtes dooe sygnyfye vtter destruccyon rowe water therefore sore afearde beeing almoste beside themselues cryed feare iesus suffered daungier longer spake vnto might know hys spechepeter aunswered sayed c whome darke coulde see good chere feare thys woorde theyr mynde comforted peter whiche alway synguler loue towarde iesus thynking nothing harde woulde commaunde sayed lorde yf thou commaunde come vnto thee vpon water meruelled iesus walked vpon water thought hymselfe myghte likewise yf iesus would iesus framyng fashioning weakenes meanes vnto strengthe perfecte faith bad hym come whiche woorde peter nothyng lyngeryng leaped downe bote began haste iesus walkyng vpon water long hys fayth nothing wauered moyst element serued whan caste hys iyes little iesus began looke considre boysteousnes winde hurling waues owne feblenes afrayed agayn began sinke downe danger drowning feare came boysteousnes windes peril came feare feare distruste agayne greatenes peril raysed vp sparke faythe nowe almost ouerwhelmed waues cryed lord saue perish iesus putting hys disciple remembraunce perill whiche feared came waues windeso thou little fayth c whiche serued tourne weakenes fayth reaching hande catched lift vp saying thou yet hast little trusted diddest thou wauer inough haue strong faith time must continual constaunt thou must loke great peril thy strength hable beare hable doth trust beleue therefore furthwith entred shippe winde ceased shippe seying suche merueylouse wunder perceyuyng somewhat man fel downe feete wurshipped saying thou art sonne god came banke went countrey genezareth shewed many miracle knowlege seene come agayne sent throughout al countrey tel iesus preset sicke folke bring theyr fayth began increase myracles done therefore flockyng together euery syde offer vnto iesus many diseased desyring leaste myght touche hem hys garmente paynful touche one one speake vnto strong theyr fayth theyr fayth deceiued many touched healed p xv chapiter came iesus scribe phariseis whiche come hierusalem saying wherefore doe thy disciple transgresse tradicion elder washe handes whan eate bread aunswered sayde vnto doe ye transgresse also commaundemente god owne tradicion glory god thynges done phariseis fret enuie seyng theyr glory bee darkened thereby glory hitherto magnifyed selues among men huted euery corner quarel go agaynst iesus blase abrode owne blindenes manifest open people also spyed therefore certayn phariseis hierusalem arrogant proude goe together vnto iesus numbre might make false accusacyon bee beleued moyses forbade thyng shoulde bee taken away put wordes lawe phariseis might seme bee onely thexpounders lawes also maker added certayn tryflyng thinges man shoulde take meate vnpure handes whiche called vnwashed say handes defyle meate man shoulde say licour water shoulde washe away filthynesse minde agayne man retournyng market amongeste common people shoulde eate meate firste washed hys body shoulde saye touchyng men filed man shoulde say pure cleane whiche washed agayne theyr flagon pottes brasse stole beddes stuffe dayly occupyed shoulde often washed many lyke superfluouse tryfling thinges burdened simple people thynges woulde haue much made honoured preceptes neglected oftentimes comaundementes god therfore whe could way leye disciple charge transgression moses lawe fynde faulte mayster suffered disciple neglect mannes constitucions despised although worthy bee despised geuen seriouse earnest matter sometimes passed little vpon therefore spake vnto iesus sayde doe thy disciple kepe constytucions forefather washe theyr handes whan goe meate christ suffering maliciouse rebuking thing nothing payeth home sharpe rebuke nay face dooe ye picke quarels fles make muche mannes constitucyons whiche bring nothing elles paynfull supersticion yet ye sticke breake greatest commaundement god god commaundeth saying honour father mother shall curse father mother let dye deathe ye say euery one shall say father mother ifte soeuer shoulde haue come tourned vnto thy profit shal honour father hys mother thus haue ye made commaundement god none effecte owne tradicion god confirmyng law nature commaunded earnestly euery man shoulde honoure succoure father mother promising long life felicitie life vnto doer hereof threatning death doeth contrary folowing auarice ye may tourne owne gayne aduauntage shoulde haue bene bestowed helping youre parentes doe teache holyer better men enryche temple gyftes helpe theyr nedye parentes ye haue shewed caste child may mocke parentes asking helpe succour say thus father mother gifte offer temple thinke bestowed vpon offered god high parent rightely bestowed godlines sonne shal profite parentes crafte vnder coulour false godlines commaundemente god father forsaken priestes may bee better ease thyng cummeth helpe succoure parentes nothing cummeth wordes ye coulour wicked dede vnder pretence godlines arrogant preferre constitucions commaundementes god vnder pretence hyndre breake holy commaundemente god wi ked dede burden people maner constitucions ouer burdened burde law intollerable wickednes vtterly abolishe goddes law agreable vnto law nature owne inuencions p hypocrite full well dyd esay prophecie saying thys people draweth nygh vnto mouthe honoureth lyppes theyr harte farre vayn worship teaching doctrine man preceptes calleth people vnto hym sayde vnto heare vnderstande whiche goeth mouth de leth man cummeth mouth defyleth man counterfeite religion whiche nothing lesse appereth hipocrites esay worthely prophecied saying people honoureth lippes harte far wurship vayne teaching doctrine ye preceptes men iesus whe spoken though turned away fro phariseis whiche hunted nothing occasion false accusing commaunded multitude come nere saying heare vnderstade trifling thinges whiche phariseis prescribe vnto careful little thinges neglecting great thinges aukewarde iudgement put chiefe poynte godlynes outwarde thynges choyce meates neglecte thinges soule abhorre vnwashed cuppes neglecte vncleane soules washe handes skinnes oftentimes suffer theyr minde defiled maner vice whiche entreth mouthe maketh man vncleane whiche goeth mouth maketh man vncleane matter meate man eateth minde eateth came disciple sayde vnto hym knoweste thou phariseis offended saying aunswered sayde euery plante heaue ly father hath planted shalbe plucked vp rootes let alone bee blynde guide blinde blinde leade blinde shall fall diche iesus semed wordes haue geuen vnto phariseis iust occasion reproue toke away choyce meates god lawe prescribed whiche thing also disciple disagree phariseis thinking wieked thyng eate common vncleane meates truely christ yet condemne declared nature neither good yl incident cause therfore lesse estemed thinges alway nature godly vngodly declareth also maner preceptes law ordeined time much bring holines signify begin obscured darkened shortly shal vanysh away perish ye clere light ghospel disciple yet vnderstanding thing goe vnto lord monish secretly daunger saying know ye phariseis although dissemble matter offended comunicacion yt meate defileth man iesus minding teache th offece yll men riseth thinges nothing doer also oughte manfully despised chiefly whan obeying none good riseth increasing nourishing malice without vndoyng simple peopleeuery pla whiche heauely father hath planted c whiche trusting maner obseruacions neglecte deuocion true godlines answered thus vnto disciple sumwhat offeded also euery graffe heauely father hath graffed shall plucked vp rootes euery ordinauce yt men haue inueted theselues theyr owne glory true godlines shall perish come naught thinges sauour earth carnal made geuen time represse kepe vnder excesse outrage grosse folke law gospell spiritual heauenly resteth visible thinges thaffeccions minde therfore ought chiefely regarded without thother profit nothing vayne ostentacion seing therfore ye haue begu professe heuely philosophy ye haue nothing doe ye couterfeiting dissemblyng phariseis promise perfect holynes suche obseruacions godlynes surely litle shewe boast themselues doctours captaines true religion wheras knowe thinges true religion standeth therfore blinde leader blynde blynde leade blynde way shall happen bothe together shall fall dyke knowe teache take vnto folishe grosse disciple therfore let folishe phariseis goe theyr folyshe vnprofitable constitucions regarde care thynges whiche make man cleane vncleane say thynges whiche defile cleanse mynde rather bodye pthen answered peter sayd vnto declare vnto v parable iesus sayd ye also yet without vnderstanding ye yet vnderstande whatsoeuer entreth mouth goeth belly cast priuie thinges goe mouth come furth harte defile man harte come yll thoughtes murder aduoutries whordomes theftes false witness skoldinges thinges whiche defyle man take meate vnwashen handes doeth defile man peter made answere yet persuaded supersticion whiche depely receiued hys forefather constitucios could neglected without daunger wheras durst resiste sayinges iesus required gentilly would vouchesafe declare plainly thyng whiche spoken darkely people concernyng thynges goeth cummeth mouth iesus minding sharpen desyre disciple litle chidyng whiche haue bene cunnyng vnderstadyng parable one haue diuined gessed another sayde ye also yet without vnderstandyng vnderstande ye meate whiche receiued taken handes washed vnwashed entreth mouthe goeth downe stomake afterwarde grosser parte caste belly pryuye bodely thinges affect touche nothing body solle neyther helpe hurt vnlesse man misuse misuse faulte meates misuser thinges goe mouth bee thinges whiche men doe speake talking cummeth belly harte mannes harte dede pure cleane el vnpure vncleane fountaine doe spring noysom thoughtes wherwith go lye wayte hurt brother thence spring murder adultry rape theft fraude deceite enuie arrogancie strife false witnes blasphemie thynges though go mouth yet make men vncleane abhominable sight god burste maner pestilente breath filthy siege lyke declare man vncleane theyr infeccion blasting defile others also whether thou take thy meate handes washed vnwashed thou take vse nature maketh man vncleane neither drinke taken vncleane cup defileth man thou take mesurably vse excesse likewyse syt vpon vnwashed seate doeth defile minde man like washed seate doth make pure cleane hym sitteth therefore whereas phariseis teache obserue supersticiously folishe trifle yet dooe abhorre thinges wherby minde defiled dede lye wayte doeth good subornate prepare false witnes backbite fame neighbour seke theyr owne glory enuy glory god falsely reprouing workes done spirite ascribing beelzebub abhorre thinges woulde seme cleane dede aukewarde kinde holynes haue washed cleane handes haue minde tongue defiled many mischeuous vice p iesus goyng thence departed coaste tyre sydon beholde woman canaan whiche came coaste cryed vnto hym saying haue mercye vpon lorde sonne dauyd daughter myserably vexed deuyll aunswered nothing dysciples came besoughte hym saying sende away crieth v answered sayde sente vnto lo e shepe house israell came wurshipped saying lorde helpe aunswered sayde mere take childrens bread cast dogges aunswered sayde trueth lorde dogges eate crummes fal maisters table iesus aunswered sayde vnto woman greate thy fayth vnto thee thou wilt daughter made whole tyme iesus spoken thinges left countrey went coastes cyrus sydon maner prophecying dede iewes supersticion lawe expell doctrine gospel getiles sinceritie fayth take vnto cyrus sidon inhabited idolater iesus went thither preache iewry time yet come secret hid entred house desiring secret fame vtter done inuincible malice iewes leste mighte complaine wicked prophane getiles preferred therfore would ye miracle shewed seme sought done purpose offered chaunce maner extorted obteyned force therfore rumour spred abrode iesus present whose fame increasing litle litle went beyond coastes iewes certayne woman canaan cuming coastes durst come nere iesusand behold woman canaan lest beyng vnclean might seme defile clean far called vpon wt miserable crie haue mercy vpon sonne dauid telling daughter home miserably vexed deuil iesus merciful easy intreated wont prompt ready vnto al men thintent might make open vnto al men constat fayth woman also leye vnto iewes charge theyr styffe obstynate vnbelefe teache v efficacy power importune earneste prayer powred humble harte god despiseth peticyoner whiche cryed sorow harte insomuche woulde vouchesafe make aunswere shewing therby certayn fashion iewes arrogancie iewes couted cananees olde enemy wurshippers idolles abhominable defyled talke apostle time yet affeccion minde woman ceased although repelled sorowe faythe made importune foloweth hys backe cryeth lamentably haue mercy vpon lorde sonne dauid disciple yet vnderstanding dooyng moued shame rather pitie importune cry woman straunge countrey speake vnto iesus desyring hym haue mercye wretched woman importunitie sende away aunswere therefore iesus made answere sore harde former repulse shaking intent might make constancie coldenes straunge woman marueilouse also example charge iewes pride arroganciebut au ered sayde sent vnto lost shepe house israell iewes stode merueilously theyr owne conceyte title stocke israell woman weryed many repulse denial insomuche durste yet drawe nere vnto iesus falling downe knee sayde lorde succoure confute saying iesus often repeting prayer went wery layed righte iustice requireth nothyng mercy iesus contente goeth still trye sobre importunitie woman mete take childrens bread cast dogges calling fruite gospel fayth bread callyng child iewes glory god father calling dogges straungers alien fro religio wurshipping god iewes would haue bene stirred angred suche rebuke woman refusyng name dog enuieth iewes honourable title child calleth also lordes whome iesus called childre embraceth auswere rebukeful apperaunce taketh occasion repelled wherwith appered vtterly repelled deny israelite bee child dogges therfore vttrely repelled take away theyr fyne delycate breade whiche eate sitting theyr father table onely require whiche maisters wont deny theyr dogges table riche plentiful thinges sufficeth chaunce haue crummes whiche fal theyr table iesus maruaylyng insatygable greate constancye straunge womano woman great thy yth maner ouercome sayde woman longer resist thy prayer great thy fayth wherwith thou constraynest wherfore beit vnto thee thy desire euen tyme proued daughter deliuered deuil iesus goyng thence came nigh vnto sea galile wente vp mountayne saie muche people came vnto hym bryngyng lame blynde deaffe maymed many caste downe iesus feete healed insomuch people maruayled whan saw dume speake maymed whole lame walke blinde see glorified god israell whan iesus maner constrayned wrought one miracle border ye sidonians sirians prouoke stirre vp owne people went agayne iewry declare ready towardes owne countrey menne straungers might haue bene ouercome wunne benefites came vnto meere whiche called sea galile goyng vp vpon hill sate downe goyng asyde difficultye place might litle litle plucke vp fayth hys disciple make firme stable anon flocked many flockes men bringing dume blinde lame weake diuerse vexed diuerse disease whome great multitude cast feete iesus well perceyuing theyr fayth harde cumbrouse iourney healed al spedely healed many multitude whiche came vnto much amased seyng howe sodeinly blinde receyued sighte dume spake lame walked feeble whole lymmes gloryfyed god people israell whiche vouchesafe bestowe greate benefites vpon people p iesus called hys discyples vnto hym sayde haue compassion people continue nowe three dayes haue nothyng eate let departe fasting leste faynte way hys disciple saye vnto whence shoulde get v muche bread wildernes wherewith might suffyce great multitude iesus sayth vnto many loaues haue ye sayd vnto seauen fewe litle fyshes commaunded people sit downe grounde tooke seauen loaues fyshes geuen thankes brake gaue discyples dyscyples gaue people eate suffysed tooke vp broken meate lefte seuen baskettes full yet dyd eate fower thousande men beside woman child sent away people tooke ship came coastes magdala kindenes people caused heape benefit vpon benefite owne accorde whan iesus knewe multitude taryed byd three dayes theyr feruency towardes iesus knew also brought vitayle consumed spent good whyle many ieopardy hunger furthermore iorney long village townes nere called disciple vnto hym sayd haue pitie thys multitude thre dayes haue aried desert haue nothing eate sende away fasting leste faynte way longer hable goe fasting sayinges put disciple remembraunce former miracle fed certayne thousandes men yet rude forgetting former thynges beyng carefull doubtefull though ben commaunded fede suche greate multitude men doe make aunswere get suche deale bread may suffice suche great multitude simplicitie forgetfulnes disciple dyd sette urth greatnes miracle therefore beyng dispayre chryste taketh hande mater miracle asketh many loaues hadand co maunded ye people sit ye grounde answered seuen fish furth commaunded sit downe vpon grounde taking seauen loaues meate handes lifted vp iyes vnto heauen geuen thankes vnto father brake delyuered hys discyples distributed people euery man eate fill nothing lacking insomuch seauen baskettes filled gatherynges scrappes whiche remayned dyd eate numbre fower thousande besyde chyldren wemen iesus many miracle shewed mounte leste shoulde styrte people ouermuch haue veneracion honoure chiefly bodely benefites applied geuen none intent obtayne authoritie doctrine ghospel whereby soules healed fed sent away multitude went boate lande magedon pthe xvi chapiter pand phariseis saduce came tempted hym required shewe signe heauen bu aunswered sayde vnto whan euen de beginneth draw nere ye say fayre weather skie red morning bee troublesome weather skye glowmyng red ye hypocrite ye discerne face heauen ye dyscerne sygnes tymes frowarde aduouterouse nacion requireth signe shall signe geuen vnto signe prophete ionas iesus came vnto agayne certaine phariseis saduceis contrary sect notwithstanding one consente agreemente lye wayte iesus craftely require shew token heauen thoughe hereafter yf woulde haue done woulde haue beleued wente nothing el seke occasyon reproue hym iesus perceyued many miracle remained yet malice mourned spirite sayde ye hypocrite vtteryng one thyng mouth cloking another hart lesse thinges ye marke heauen ye tel weather shal folow day ye hypocrite cfor whan ye see sunne go glade ye say morowe shall fayre wether ayer cleare bright againe ye see sunne rise morning ye geue sentence shal foule boystiouse day lowring ayre red whan ye see fashion countenaunce heauen ye gesse whether time mete iourneing rowing sowing mowing thinges apperteyning vse body ye dul negliget knowlege time maketh soules helth ye haue scripture ye see thynges done ye see howe worlde renewed vnderstande ye yet tyme spoken ore prophetes looked long tyme nowe hande one signe ye geue sentence fayre foule weather many signes whiche ye see dayly doe ye perceiue thing present ye would haue bene made better wonder myracles ye would haue beleued long agon ye require signe token worse thereby naughtie adulterous generacion goeth farre kinde forefather whose tytles magnifieth selfe seketh craftely wondre heauen pycke quarell reproue tyme come shall haue signe shall feare reproue meane time shall haue signe wondre earth whiche shal frustrate disapoynte theyr endeuoures shall see hym alyue agayne whome thoughte bee dead buryed seemeth monstruouse thyng vnto whiche chaunced prophete ionas shall haue lyke monster wondrefull riddell darke fygure lorde iesus signified first slayne buried whome thoughte nothyng elles man furth shoulde ryse agayne power god p left departed whan disciple come syde water forgotten take bread iesus sayd vnto take hede beware leauen phariseis saduceis thought theselues saying haue taken bread v whiche iesus vnderstode sayde vnto ye litle fayth take ye thought within selues ye haue broughte bread ye perceiue remebre v loaues fiue thousand men many baskettes toke ye away neyther vii loaues iiii thousande men many baskettes toke ye away happeneth ye doe vnderstande spake concernyng breade ye shoulde beware leauen phariseis saduceis vnderstoode owe beware leauen bread doctrine phariseis saduceis iesus therfore leauing blindnes went ouer water ship disciple forgotten prouyde theselues bread entred shippe one lofe shippe iesus therefore put remembraunce saide take diligent hede beware leauen phariseis saduceis noting touching darkely iewishe supersticio thought great matter eate meates meates whereas taughte beefore man defyled thynges entred mouthe dysciples althoughe vnderstoode mente yet monished thys saying forgotten put vitayle shippe iesus therefore chideth beyng carefull thys thyng blamyng theyr dulnesse whiche taughte often sayinges dooinges vtterly cast theyr mynde carefulnesse vitayle yet incumbred carke care suche manner thynges ye litell truste dooe ye vexe youre mynde thys carefullnesse ye haue forgotten breade sayeth shall lacke thyngo ye lytel faith c althoughe ye prouyde dydde teache firste kyngdome god muste bee soughte thynges shall cast vnto haue ye seene twyse great multytude lacked meate many wayes taughte monyshed vnderstande ye yet remembre ye yet youre herte yet blynded suche manier care see ye phariseys fashyon whiche ye see youre iyes whiche ye heare youre care y yt though ye hearde haue ye forgot whiche lately done selues onely witness also minister fiue thousande men fully fed v barely loaues two fyshes numbre geastes greate preparacion small howe many baskettes dyd ye fyll scrappes whiche remayned feaste aunswere hym twelue agayne fower thousande men fylled seuen loaues fewe fish ye beeyng dystrybutoures howe many baskettes filled ye scrappes aunswere seuen doe ye yet vnderstande maner speaking whiche ye tourne
