care bodely thinges whereas talking studieth prouideth mindes rather body ye shoulde selues haue coniectured riddel ment sayde beware leauen phariseis saduceis nowe taught little skilled kynde meate eate nowe diuersly declared beaten vpon whiche haue hande matter ghospel shoulde vtterly cast away suche vile care disciple beyng attent diligent litle chyding vnderstode iesus ment take hede diligently baware doctryne phariseis whiche nothyng syncere clean corrupte ambicyon auaryce enuie vyces whereas doctrine ghospell tasted suche thyng theyr doctrine doeth rather infecte man fede hym therefore must taken hede dilygently bee woonte deceiue vnware symple men false cloke godlynes whiche poyson true godlines pwhan iesus came coastes citie called cesa ea philippi asked disciple saying whome doe men say sonne manne sayde say thou arte iohn baptiste helias hieremias one noumbre prophetes sayeth vnto whome say ye symon peter answered thou arte christe sonne liuing god iesus aunswered sayde vnto hym happie arte thou symon sonne ionas fleshe bloude hath opened vnto thee father whiche heauen saye vnto thee thou arte peter vpon thys rocke buylde churche gate hell shall preuayle geue vnto keyes kyngdome heauen whatsoeuer thou byndest earth shall bounde heauen whatsoeuer thou looceste earthe shal looced heauen iesus came coastes citie called cesarea whiche philippe tetrarche named honour ceasar folowing brother herode whiche chaunged name called cesarea whiche beefore named tower straton thoughte proue howe muche schollers profited hearing muche communicacion seeing many miracle whether higher better opinion vulgare sorte therefore demaundeth saying whome doe men talke sonne man say say iohn baptist herodians suspecte say helias taken vp suspect doeth appere according prophecie malachy say hieremie figure christ sayde hym beholde haue set thee thys day ouer nacions kinges plucke vp distroy plant dede fulfilled christ iesus hearing thentent would gette certayne hygher profession sayeth ye whiche shoulde knowe better say ye symon peter loued iesus best chiefe apostolicall ordre aunswered thou arte christe sonne god aliue speaking suspicion professing certainely vndoubtedly messias pronused prophetes sonne god certayne singuler manner iesus delighted chereful substaunciall profession sayde blessed art thou symon sonne iohn affeccion man taught thee word heauenly father put thy minde secret inspiracion man hath worthy opinion sonne inspiracion father knoweth sonne agayn lest thou shouldest adourne thankelesse suche noble testimony assure thee thou arte peter say sound sure stone wauering hither thither sundrie opinion vulgare sort vpon stone thy professyon wil builde churche saye house palace whiche beyng sette vpon sure foundacion fortifie power strengthe kingdome hell shalbe hable beate downeand geue vnto thee c sathan come vpon many engine rayse coumpany wicked spirites defence buyldyng shall stande imprennable onely lette thys sure sounde profession abyde kyngdome heauen churche kingdome deuil worlde thys man nede bee afearde bee peter saye lyke vnto thee keyes heauenly kyngdome deliuer vnto thee meete bee firste auctoritie whiche firste professyon faithe charitie truely kingdom heauen earth hath heauen wherof doeth depende wherfore entangled sinnes doeth belong kingdome hell enter kyngdome heauen shall enter yf professe whiche thou doeste professe losed sinnes baptisme thy leading thy opening gate shall enter kingdome heauen peculiar proper power forgeue sinnes thys power geue vnto thee maner whiche thou shalte lose keyes receyued vpon earth men shal losed also heauen god side thou shalte binde earth shall bounde also heauen god allowe thy iudgemente cummyng hys spiryte p charged dis disciple shoulde tell man iesus christe tyme forthe began iesus shewe vnto disciple howe muste goe vnto hierusalem suffer many thinges elder hye priestes scribe muste killed raysed vp agayne thyrde daye whan peter taken hym asyde began rebuke saying maister fauour thy selfe thys shall happen vnto thee turneth aboute sayed vnto peter goe sathan thou ynde e eme thou sauerest thinges god men whan iesus spoken thynges commaunded disciple yet kepe godly opinion secret themselues open others messias first sacrifice cro se must accomplished veritie manly nature declared resurreccion holy ghoste diuinitie muste bee declared although voyce sentence peter praysed christ setence whiche nowe began profi e spring vp little little vnto thinges perfeccion yet dreamed certayne kyngdome vtterly vnlyke worldely kingdome therefore iesus darkely riddle promised vnto peter ryght keyes delyuered yet mete vse yet suffycyently taught instruccion holy spirite therefore iesus calleth backe mystery crosse hys deathe whiche misterie kingdome must prepared deuil ouercome sinnes abolished mighte bee lesse troubled myndes whan se thinges chaunce knew come passe litle desyred rather glory mightie high sonne liuing god man truely glory hym whiche offended hys humilitie lownes iesus therefore began prepare disciple thys storme hand shewing must first goe ierusalem shoulde haue many griefes displeasure scrybes phariseis also chiefe priestes finally shoulde killed thyrde day ryse agayne whan disciple yet carnal vnderstoode fully communicacion iudged thynges vnmete vnworthy thorough many myracles declared hymselfe sonne god yet durst demaunde maister ment dye ryse agayne therefore peter special loue mayster bolder taketh hym asyde apostle though woulde tell hym thyng familiarly chyding hym abhorring speaking death afliccions sayd lorde good selfe thinges shall happen vnto come passe although peter pronounced hym sonne god alyue rather instigacion father hys owne reason wit yet farre vnderstandyng mistery iesus hys death shoulde redeme mankynde resurreccyon declare vnto worlde might diuine power therfore iesus refourme affeccion disciple turned vnto behelde whome knewe haue like mynde affeccyon albeit onely peter durste blame lord said vnto peter come behind sathan father thy parte folowe goe beefore nowe thou dooeste withstande endeuour leat thyng whiche bothe father willeth doen also behoueth doe health saluacion mankinde thou desireste bee felowe kyngdome thou arte againste making spede vnto crosse myne owne accorde thentente may winne get thys kyngdome father way ye see goe ye must goe also kyngdome heauen thou sauereste yet thynges whiche god led mannes affeccyons repyneste agaynst god resiste therefore thou vnprofitable counsaylour folow becum rather scholler maister p sayde iesus vnto hys disciple yf man folowe let hym forsake hymselfe take vp crosse folowe whoso wil saue life shal loose againe whoso loseth life sake shall finde doeth profit man win al ye whole world loose owne soule shal man geue redeme soule agayne withal sone man shal come glory father angel shal rewarde euery man according dedes uerely say vnto bee standyng whiche shall taste deathe tyll see sonne manne come hys kingdome sayinges iesus cut combe peter importune frowardnes turning disciple began declare large sayde peter come behinde whosoeuer bee disciple partaker kyngdome heauen let hym folowe steppe lyke seeth despysyng goodes thys worlde bestowe lyfe also willingly saluacyon menne glory father muste also refuse caste humayne affeccions ready kindes death gospel sake take crosse folow goyng crosse suffer blessed thyng bee rebuked gloryouse thyng killed winnyng lyfe know nothing dere life euery man must lose hys lyfe saue except lose shall lose dede loseth aduauntage loseth gospel sake loseth dede whiche forsaking ghospell prouideth thys temporal lyfe loseth life euerlasting man foolish woulde winne whole worlde losse corporal shorte lyfefor doth profit man wiue ye world c purpose serue rychesse yf owner perishe mad mannes parte make muche hys affeccions rychesse el body whiche within shorte time shoulde perishe yea though man kil mennes pleasure lese lyfe euerlasting whiche whoso hath hath vayne therefore nothing ought deare vnto man gain whereof woulde chaunge losse soule losse thinges may wayes recompeced losse soule cannot recouered loseth life sake dooeth lose commytteth auauntage shall receyue agayne lucre whan maiestie kingdome god shall appeare ye ought dyscouraged youre mynde haue shewed ye must suffer muche aduersitie ghospel shall haue ende shortely euerlasting glory shall folow temporal ignomyny rebuke sonne man whome ye shall see oppressed troden downe men counted wurmefor ye sonne man shal come c shall come lykenes shall shewe vnto men maiestie glory hys father beeyng garded accompanied aungels iudged condemned shameful deathe shall bee iudge menne bothe quicke dead shall yelde rewarde vnto euery man accordyng hys dedes shall bee appoynted euerlastyng deathe whiche regarded lyfe tha shalbe rewarded immortal life sake despised ye life body time tyme strife trauayle hereafter shalbe time rewardes truly felicitie shall made absolute perfecte shall bee seene good vnto father belongeth vnto knowe tyme yet mean seaso shalbe geuen certain taste glory ye assured sum stadyng whiche shall taste death see sonne man shewyng maiestie kingdome may seene bodily iyes surely death shal see kingdome god shewe furth power litle litle vanquyshe ouercum whole power worlde p xvii chapter pand sixe dayes iesus taketh peter iames iohn brother bryngeth vp high mountain way transfigured face shine sunne clothes wer white ligh beholde appeared vnto moses helias talkyng answered peter said vnto iesus lord good v thou w lt let v make thre tabernacle one one moses one helias yet speaking behold bright cloude shadowed behold came voice cloud saiyng welbeloued sonne delight muche heare whan disciple heard thynges fell face ore afrayed iesus came touched sayd arise afrayed lyft vp yes sawe man saue iesus onely sixe day iesus willyng sum meanes dreame shew vnto disciple sighte apperaunce whiche shall cum iudge worlde chose three numbre disciple peter iames iohn brother whan brought vp hye hyll farre sight men transfigured face shyned lyke sunne garmentes wer bryght whytenesse whyte snow fuller make vpon earth appered also moses helias talkyng hym glory death whiche suffer ierusalem thought good christ ye apostle confyrmed auctours iewes magnified moste shoulde suspect would abolish law sith moses stoode hym prophetes sith helias present neither abhorre death shameful thing whiche great men set forth shewed bee glorious thinges wer seen apostle men newely waked fro slepe iyes wer heauy grieued mortall feblenesse capacitie receiue greatnesse vision disciple therfore afearde amased suche woderful incredible sighte peter yet fully wel aduised rauished wholly pleasure maiesty sight semed farre mencion death said lord let v buylde three tentes pauilyons one thee another moses third helias thought vnto peter wisedom slain ierusalem peter yet ended comunicacio beholde bryght pleasaut cloude ouershadowed thapostles lest absorpte ouercummed highnesse sighte behold voice father sounded cloude witnessyng sonne wordes witnessed hym whe baptised iordane onely beloued sonne mynde hath delight heare whan disciple heard voice ful diuine maiestie borne mannes eares fell doune grouelyng vpon theyr face wer afeard wer afeard theyr lyfe learned god sayed thus man shall see liue iesus receiuyng agayn former shape touched handes lest shoulde suppose goste accustomed knowen voyce comforted saying aryse feare nothyng wer cum themselues lifted vp iyes sawe iesus alone euen lyke came vnto hill whan came doune mountay e iesus charged saiyng shewe vision manne vntill sonne man rysen agayn dead discyples asked saiyng say scribe helias must fi st cum iesus aunswered said truely helias shall first cum restore thynges saye vnto helias cum already knewe hym haue doen vnto hym whatsoeuer lusted likewyse shal sonne man also suf disciple vnderstode spake vnto iohn baptiste whan came doune hill came cumpany disciple comauded tel man thinges sene vntil sonne man wer risen fro death vntil time tale vnprofitable beleued disciple kept themselues conferred betwene themselues myght meane iesus said risen fro death hart wrapt entangled worde often hearde ould enter hart certain doubt rose myndes saw helias standyng iesus doubt propose vnto hym way meneth scribe teachyng tellyng cumming messias wonte saye authoritie malachie cummyng messias helias thesbites shal cum went thy cummyng daye seene hyll unto whome iesus makyng aunswer saied truly helias shall c lyke malachias sayed accordyng prophecie shall goe cummyng shall restore al thynges residewe people iewes conuerted vnto gospell leste whole nacion condemned cumming shall tyme cum shall againe maiestie father renderyng rewarde vnto euery man accordyng vnto dedes yet certayn helias went cummyng alsohelias cum alredy iewes despised euen dyd dyd vnto desertes whatsoeuer pleased sonne man shall handeled like mekenes disciple vnderstode called iohn baptiste helias lykenes lyfe freenesse reprouyng kynges whan wer cum people came hym certaine man knelyng downe sayed lorde haue mercy sonne lunatyke soore vexed oftymes falleth fyer oft water brought thy disciple could heale iesus answered said feithles croked nacion long shal long shall suffre bryng hym hither iesus rebuked deuil went hym childe healed tyme nowe iesus went vnto disciple sawe great multitude men scribe disputyng people meruelyng whither iesus gone ran vnto saluted demau ded matter disputed amonge themselues one multitude made aunswer maister brought sonne thee miserably vexed vnclean spirit often taketh childe beaten ground sumtime dryuen fier sumtime water fometh gnasheth teeth co sumeth awaye could haue desired disciple cast deuil could iesus heale vnbelefe men crieth maner angerly nacion vnbeleuing without faythe long shall among vayneo faythles croked nacion c howe long shall suffre vntractable froward maners haue doen many miracle profitte nothyng therwith comaunded chylde brought miracle might euident otable men brought seen y furthwith euen al spirite toke hym chylde hurled vpon ground tumbled fomed miserable sight see tha y declare ye greatnes disease asked father long sith chyld began vexed disease father made aunswer sayed infancy without daunger life oftentimes droue fier sumtyme water destroy know soore disease yet yf thou cast thing haue mercy vpo v help v y hearyng yf thou canst sumwhat reprouyng weakenes faith saieth disease wer greater might power god sayth vnto aske able loke thou art able beleue thou trust fully nothing hard may cum passe yt doth beleue trust word father conceiuyng trust sure hope plentifull teares criyng made aunswer lord beleue thing wat trust belefe supply thou thy goodnes help vnbelefe meane time iesus espied multitude people runnyng gase desyrous see whether thyng came passe ye discyples cum passe iesus threatened vncleane spirit saiyng thou deaf dumme spiritand iesus rebuked deuill c commaund go teturne gain vnto hereafter spirite went fro chylde howlyng yet first tore vexed vehemently lay dead many warranted dead strong tough violence disease iesus taking child hand lifted hym vp arose like father hardly beleue sone hardly heled pthan came disciple part iesus said could cast hym iesus said vnto vnbelefe verily say vnto yf ye haue fayth grain musterde seede ye shall say vnto mountayne remoue hence yonder place shall remoue nothing shalbe vnpossible vnto albeit kynde goeth oute prayer fastyng meane season disciple wer heauy mindes fearing leste thorough default lost power doyng miracle wheras gloryed deuilles also obedient vnto worde multitude kepe sylence shame whan iesus cu housewhy could cast hym c goe vnto maister demaund hym could cast deuill sith power deliuered vnto v fro thee iesus confyrme faythe trust disciple oughte great sumtyme myghte helpe distruste others sayeth weakenesse fayth partely cause violece disease vehement father fayth weake waueryng faythe mightie equall hable difficulty sumwhat werish mannes affeccions faultye reason leauen vaynglorye ye faythe lyke seede mustarde beyng vile litle yet broosed sheweth sharpe quicknes nature sowed grounde springeth vp large tree nothing harde word brought passe hande yea ye say hil remoue hence goe placeif ye haue faythe grayne musterd c would doe forthwith commaunded kynde deuylles wherewith chylde possessed cast vnlesse fayth confirmed strengthned prayer fastyng violence disease strong tough continuaunce time tourned nature agaynste suche maner faultes must fyght fastynges subdue body brought lowe vnto ye spirite also praier whiche obteyneth help god comunicacion iesus taught greuous vehement muche accustomed dyseases mind must driuen away strong vehemente remedy whan galile iesus sayd vnto cum passe sone man shalbe deliuered handes men shall kyll hym third daye shall rise againe exceadyng sory iesus whan galile entent might fortify make strong mindes disciple lest ouer much troubled death doth iterate beate sonne man must delyuered handes men killed thyrde day rise agayn death saiyng grieue mindes ye disciple aboue measure loued lord albeit theyr affeccion loue yet carnal eares could suffre mencion death coulde vnderstande moses helyas called death iesus glory renoume death bryng health saluacion whole worlde although like heuy fadde mencion death ought haue bene chereful glad mencion resurreccion yet mynd abhorred muche remembraunce deathe surelye vnderstode ment dye thyrde day rise agayn thought better vtterly dye seeyng hable doe whiche hable reuiue death whan cum citie capernaum vse receiue tribute money called didrame came peter said doth maister pay didrame saith yea whan cum house iesus preuented saying thinkest thou simo doeth kynges earth take tribute toll child straungers peter sayeth vnto straungers iesus sayd vnto hym chyldren free notwithstanding leste shoulde offende goe sea cast hooke take fyshe cummeth first vp whan thou hast opened mouthe thou shalt fynde state take geue vnto came citie capernaum demaunded tribute cesars name afraied speake iesus authoritie whiche gotten hym miracle went peter sawe maner next doth maister pay didram tribute peter wheras money would offende ye gatherer tribute made aunswer payeth iesus hitherto paied maner tribute whan nowe entred house iesus house peter perplexed thought mind speake iesus touching paimet tribute promised pay iesus ignorant peter harte preuented question symon thynkest thou kynges wonte take tribute subsidie childre stranger stragers peter iesus child free signifiyng therby though sumwhat darkly lorde land sea thynges oweth tribute subsidie mortal prince disciple childre kingdome bounde yet minding teache thynges whiche make nothing godlines obedience oughte geuen kynd men lest prouoked offend greuously added yet lest offend go sea take fish cummeth first open mouth thou shalt fynd piece coyne called statere whiche fower drames take geue dede iesus shewed power wherby subiect modestie wherby would geue place vnto mete stirre prouoke thing litle value set nothyng geue sorte greater ought geue yet geueth ought teacheth better sumtime geue ouer thy right striue thy right froward chiefly thinges whiche diminishe thy substaunce hurt nothyng godlynes worlde hath ordre must troubled case occasion libertie ghospell pthe xviii chapter pat tyme came disciple vnto iesus saiyng greatteste kyngdome heauen iesus called chylde vnto hym set hym middest saiyng uerelye saye vnto excepte ye tourne becum chyldren ye shall entre kyngdome heauen whosoeuer therefore humbleth hymselfe chylde thesame greatest kyngdome heauen whoso receyueth suche childe name receyueth whoso offendeth one litlennes whiche beleue wer better milstone wee hanged necke wer drowned depe sea woe world offence necessary offence cum woe vnto man whome offence cummeth thynges thus doen entered myndes thapostles certain worldlye affeccion prycke enuy ambicion hearde kingdome heauen sawe three apostle led parte mountayne heard keyes kingdome heauen delyuered vnto peter sayde vnto hym blessed art thou symon bariona vpon stone wyll buylde churche saw talkyng maister certain thynges bothe familiarely boldely euen sawe hym preferred thother apostle paimet tribute maner made equall vnto christe therfore sumwhat enuied peter vnto whome principalitie kyngdom heauen semed appoynted yonger yeares therefore go vnto iesus demaunde shoulde chyefe kyngdome heauen yet dreamed vpon certaine dignity see prince courtes iesus plucke affeccion vtterlye theyr myndes called hym certayn child sette hym middes disciple litle one yet farre affeccions ambicion enuieexcepte ye turne becum child c simple pure liuyng onely course nature ye sure vnles man wholy chaunged cast away vtterly suche affeccions transformed ye fashion simplicitie chyld shal receiued kyngdom heauen wyse preeminence soueraintie ought ambiciously desyred wherfore whoso doth submit becum lyke vnto babe humbleth least shalbe greatest kingdome heauen whoso modestie sobrenes maketh hymselfe leaste thesame greatest vertue prince loue lyke vnto amonge estemed preferreth hiself others delight lyke courtes world prince thinketh redound vnto rebuke man vse noble cotumeliously taketh gentilnes bestowed vpon hymself whiche bestowed vpo fauour true simple humble great whosoeuer receiueth one sake would counted done self euen though receiued contrariwise whoso hurreth offedeth one litle one trust depend wholy vpo shalbe greuously punyshed drouned depe sea milstone necke wicked offend beare man yll wyll whiche enuie man prefer themselues aboue manwoe vnto worlde office c whiche loue men indifferently ala woe worlde offendyng greuyng like litle one frowardnes menne cause offence must nedes chaunce shalbe men whiche stirred vp ennie hatred wil persecute doe wyll say yll wysh well kill bring euerlastyng health truly offence griefes shal profit shal suffer yea shal profitable world yet shall turne hym displeasure thorough whose defaulte offence shall rise wherfore thy hand thy foote hinder cut cast better enter lyfe halt maymed rather thou shouldest hauing two handes two feete cast euerlastyng fyer thyne iye offend plucke cast better thee enter life one iye rather hauing two iyes cast hel yer take hede yt ye dispise one litle one say vnto heaue theyr aungels alwayes behold face father whiche heauen therfore desire enter kingdom heauen let diligently auoid offence griefes litle one rather let helpe one ynough beware man offend another also take hede offend offeces dede whan man offence vnto therfore let affeccion dere vnto man forthwith cut yf offence lette hym hasteth kingdom heauen muche thy hande thy foote say membre necessary offesiue vnto must cut cast away better thee receiued life euerlasting maimed lame perfit handes feete cast euerlasting fierand thine iye hyndre pluck c iye onely necessary membre vsed also pleasaunt vnto man yet case offend plucke cast away better receiued euerlasting life one iye cast hedlong hell fyer iyes perfect whole iesus speakyng thus meant membre body cut affeccions cut whiche withdraw v fro care euerlastyng saluacion frend thou canst vneth forbeare wer man hand thy father vpo thou staiest thy fote thy wife thy child thou louest tederly thine iye therfore nothing ought precious nothing ought highly estemed man wherby ought withdrawen fro kingdom heaue man neuer poore base humble ought despised holpen rather cum forward better better ye haue example see therefore ye despise none litle one although ye world abiectes yet god greatly regarded tel certainly angel minister haue charge continually behold face father whiche heauen hereof ye may esteme muche regarded god sith hath appoynted suche kepers guide yet rude rawe may fall maye deceyued simplicitie worthy helpe punishement pfor sonne man cum sa e whiche loste thinke ye man hathe hundred shepe one gone astray doth leaue xcix mountaines goeth seketh gone astray chaunce find verely say vnto reioyceth shepe nintie nine wet astray eue father heauen one litle one perish sonne man came erth destroy man saue al many wil saued persecute willing saue worlde hath great veneracio hygh autoritie mighty ryches seme excel learnyng commended set forth certaine marueylous cou terfeityng colour false holynes truely suche must prouoked willynglye muste despised stoutely yf fearyng lest owne power decay oppresse power god sekyng glory enuye glory ghospell yf folowyng theyr lucre agaynst profytes men yf boastyng theyr vayne learnyng corrupt doctrine ghospel vnder pretence false religion go extinct true religion yf wexe fyerce cruel benefites good turnes maner men must thanke themselfes owne destruccion ought study endeuour suffer none perish litle weake one erre way recouery beyng lyke shepe woulfes coniecture selfes great care father whiche naturally good doeth take leste anye man peryshe made entente shoulde bee blessed yf true faythfull sheapherd lorde ouer hundred shepe one lost great noumbre would leaue nintie nine hylles seke wandered flocke greued lack one lost shepe would put whole flock besyde daunger chaunce finde certainly saye vnto wil reioyce one gotten al whiche wer lost wherfore man beyng shepherd beare affeccion toward flock doth possesse created much father wyl whiche heauen none litle one hath created perishe regardeth hathe apoynted aungels kepyng hath bestowed onelye sonne call saluacion p moreouer yf thy brother trespasse goe tell hym faulte betwene hym thee alone heare thee thou hast wonne thy brother heare thee take thee one two mouthe two thre witness euery matter may establyshed heare tell vnto congregacion heare congregacion let hym vnto thee heathen man publican uerely sayt vnto whatsoeuer ye bynd earth shalbe bound heauen whatsoeuer ye loce earth shalbe loced heaue agayn say vnto two agree earth vpon maner thyng whatsoeuer desyre shall haue father whiche heauen two thre gathered together name middest therfore away offence copany breake brotherly peace let mutual charitie wherby ye may louingly helpe heale others faultes chaunce way heale shalbe thy brother thing worthy loked vpon lepe forthwith vengeaunce neyther agayn suffer hym thy silence lost while sinneth frely large drunken affeccios first try getle remedy whiche shall muche put shame go vnto alone debate ye matter betwixt none beyng acknowlage fault reproue hym laye iyesif heare thou hast wunne thy brother muche hath erred fro dutie brotherly charitie let thy monicio yt may declare seke nothing el health restoryng olde amitie curable cum secret monicio cause thou shouldest reuege put open blame inough thou hast wun thy brother ye meane season thou hast gained thou shouldest haue lost frende god haue lost soule yf disease grieuouse cannot healed light medicine yet thou muste vtterly dispayre forthwith run extreme remedy yf wil heare alone go hym takyng ii eyther may ameded sum litle shame shalbe infamy vnto el may confuted ouercum testimonie two thre yf vntractable wyll moued neyther shame feare iudgement bring matter congregacio yt may reformed either cosent multitude thauctoritie ruler ouer multitude far past cure yt wil corrected neyther secret brotherly monicionif heare congregacion neither knowlage cosent two thre neither shame fault vttered disclosed nether auctoritie chief ruler leaue disease let hym cut fro congregacion take none wise heathe publicane let greuousest punishment emong whiche notwithstadyng vsed none purpose brother eyther cum vnto hymself shame consideryng shunned fled men el le beyng mingled flocke hurt infeccion man ought say vnto iudgementes thy kyngdome werish weake nay seuere sore yf man wyll contemne obstinately man lawes punish greuous offence death nothyng kill body sumtime kill hym god doth condene kil onely amend alyue amended condenacion although procedeth leysurely punyshmet yet cause seuere sore codened vnlesse repente punyshed euerlastyng payn meanes escape cesar doth condemne god sumtime doeth assoyle prince doth assoyle god sutyme doeth condemne prince doth assoyle leaueth cumpany make like killeth taketh cumpany men onely healyng making case cannot healed e man iudgementes rather necessary praise worthie sentece remoueth man vncurable cannot infecte good yet case may repent ye haue power saue destroy yet shal sinne vnpunished ye suffre haue theyr lyfe shalbe punyshed eternally god beyng iudge whose sentece shal approue confirme sentence vnlesse condemned person repente seketh reueging amendment brother ready forgeue iniurie doe willingly cumeth vnto sicke heale offended twise repelled yet ceaseth help heale trusteth iudgemet taketh one two vnto hym reuenge heale man sentence cummeth euangelicall minde god wyll allowe neuer wil breake vnles condemned person condemne hath doen although therfore iudgement hath apperace seueritie sharpnes iudgemetes prince haue yet feared sentence wherewith oftentimes best condened sinful assoiled terrible thing condemned god condemned hym whosoeuer condemned agreing together sincere mind ye iudge spirit god iudgement ye codemne man spirit man man iudgemet god iudgemet caste c pany forthwith banished fro cumpany heauen therefore strength auctoritie resteth affeccions god doth behold see truly keyes whiche wil geue vnto peter professing wherwith shalbe bound earth shall bound al heauen yt shalbe losed earth shalbe losed also heauen power though specially mete heades chief yet wil geue al men haue consente agremente among man name yea moreouer wil say vnto consent shal haue auctoritie pardoning condemnyng offence ye among selues agree also yf two bee found earth truly agree spirite saye moued affeccion man ioyntly louyng thynges god whatsoeuer aske shall obteyne father whiche heauen suche loue hath father towarde euangelicall holye concorde therfore forasmuch ye may doe muche prince almightye ye nede repent power authoritie although men ye appeare feble weake whiche asked ceasar forthwith obteyned able perfourme whatsoeuer asked hym cannot put away agewe make dumme speake nothyng hard incredible whiche father geue yf ye aske hym one consent agrement p came peter vnto hym sayde lorde howe ofte shall forgeue brother yf sinne tyll seuen tymes iesus sayeth vnto hym saye vnto thee vntyl seuen tymes seuenty time seuen tymes therfore kingdom heauen lykened vnto certain man king whiche would take accoumpte seruauntes whan begun recken one brought vnto hym whiche ought hym ten thousand talenies forasmuche able pay lord commaunded sold al payment e made seruaunt fell doune besought hym saiyng sir haue pac ce pay lord pitie seruaunt loo e forgaue hym det peter hearde thynges diligentlye supposyng iesus reasoned condemnyng assoylyng pertayned chieflye vnto hym conceyued mynde certayne doubte iesus saying thyrde reprouyng let hym vnto thee heathen publican semed appoint certain nubre passed although offended repente yet bee receyued vnto grace therfore exactly taught thyng went vnto iesus lord often shall pardon brother offend numbre faultes shal repulsed pardon seuenth fault noumbre peter dyd propose greate ynoughe wheras iesus made mencion onely thyrde reprofe iesus shewyng thynges whiche doen v must gentill easie forgeuenes doe saye ye must forgeue vnto seuenth faulte vnto seuenty time seuen shewing noumbre ought prescribed christian forgeuyng often hath offended doeth repent often euen hart offence forgeuen vtterly pluckyng christen mynde desyre reuenge leste thynke hard vniust iesus teacheth equall iust similitude muche clemecy recopence wha offende sumtyme agaynst neybour muche oftner greuously god often offend greuously sinne greater sinne ye greater benefites receyue hym vnworthy obteyn pardone either neybour god doth pardon sinneth thousand tymes yf repent thinke muche pardon brother offendyng much lesse chiefly sith god doeth forgeue v trespass condicio moued example gentle easie intreated towardes neybour therfore kyngdome heauen lyke riche myghtye man hauyng great familie thoughte take count seruauntes whan began counte founde one ought hym ten thousande talentes whan sum greater detter able pay ye lord commaunded wyfe child al sold creditour might cotented money made seruaunt falling doune meke suite lordes knee pray graunt sum respite processe tyme wil pay al lord hauyng compassion seruaunte whiche humbled himselfe hym graunted desyred onely bringe hym lawe forgaue hym whole summe seruaunt wente founde one felowes whiche ought hundreth denaries layed hande hym wrythyng necke drew sayde paye thou owest felowe fell doune besoughte hym saying haue pacyence pay would went nd caste prison tyll shoulde paye dette felowes sawe doen sor e came tolde vnto theyr lorde euery thyng doen lorde called hym sayd vnto hym thou vngracious seruaunte forgaue det whan thou de redst shouldest thou also haue compassion thy felowe pitie lorde wrothe deliuered tormentoures till payed due vnto hym lykewyse shall heauenly father doe also vnto yf ye harte forgeue eueryone brother trespass seruaunt beyng free libertie whan goen maisters sight chauce met one felow seruautes oughte hym lyttle money hundreth denaries forgettyng maisters clemency toward hym forthwith layed hand vpon hym ega plucke miserable man saying pay thy det felow seruat fallyng doune ye knee felow seruaut beseched hym many wordes besought lord maister deale paciently wil pay al creditour would intreated repelled humble sutour plucked prison tyll payed det felow seruauntes whiche seene meruaylous clemency maister toward seruaunt whan saw great crueltie felow seruaunt moued great grief sorow declared vnto maister matter toward felow tha maister stirred anger called vnto seruaunt pardoned al thou naughty seruaunt dyd beyng thy maister forgeue suche great summe none cause thou madest humble suite vnto mete therfore thou beyng seruaunt shouldest forgeue thy felow seruaut litle moneye haue compassion vpon humble sutoure lyke compassion surely great gentlenes mine towarde thee oughte teache gentlenes toward thy felow seruaunt maister sore angrye deliuered tormentours kept prison vntyll repayed whole sum forgeuen example heauenly father wyll deale euery det vnto much euery man often doeth offende men also trespasse agaynst men yet farre lesse vnlesse euery man forgeue brother harte lighter offence doen hym father wyll forgeue greater trespass doen also wyll reuoke call backe whiche forgeuen xix chapter pand came passe iesus finished saiynges departed galile came vnto coastes iewry beyonde iordan muche people folowed hym healed iesus communicacion instructed framed disciple vnto well towardes simple vnto gentlenes toward offender lefte galile went ouer iordane coastes iewrye goynge towardes death cum phariseis secretly went thither also folowed many flockes people bearyng diuerse sicke diseased healed phariseis came vnto tempted said vnto lawful man make diuorcement wyfe maner cause answered said vnto haue ye red whiche made man beginnyng made woman sayde cause shall man leaue father mother shall cleaue vnto wife twayne shalbe one fleshe wherfore twayne one flesh let man therfore separate god hath coupled together saied vnto dyd moses commaund geue testimoniall diuorcement put away sayed vnto moses hardnes hertes suffered put away wiues beginnyng saye vnto whosoeuer putteth away wife except e fornicacio maryeth another comitteth aduoutrie marieth hee whiche diuorced doeth committe aduoutrye agayne phariseis seyng many wonder loue multitude towarde iesus beganne renewe theyr enuye agayne craftilye subtillye came vnto hym takyng occasion communicacion wherewith taughte wyfe ought bee repudiate cast therfore propose question two pykes whether wer lawful cast wife euery cause answered lawefull seme contrary hymselfe wheras taught diuorce lawfull yf denyed seme haue bene agaynst moses lawe whiche doeth permitte euery cause geue boke diuorce sende away iesus doeth tempre ordre answere hurteth authoritie moses recanteth doctrine stoppeth mouthe phariseis whiche skilful law authoritie lawe haue ye red whan god made mankynde ordered fyrste matrimonie one coupled vnto one knot could broken made bothe man woman one piece imbracyng mankind spryng expressyng indissoluble knotte man wyfe moses god maker mariage said mutuall charitie man shall forsake father mother bee fastened coupled vnto wyfe couplyng shalbe strayt fast two maner shalbe made one person wer two therfore ioyned matrimonie two one bodie muche farre agaynst nature separate wife manne cut awaye membre bodye therfore whiche god hath knyt together strayte bonde let man separate phariseiswhy dyd moses comaud c thinkyng caughte nowe occasion catche iesus yf god meant thou doest say dyd moses geue husbandes leaue caste theyr wyfe euery cause geue boke diuorce durst permit god would doen iesus answered dyd permit ryght good nature knowyng hardnes hart suffered lesser ill ye shoulde commit greater doeth allow diuorce whiche rather suffer murdre boke diuorce doeth make diuorce right good witnesseth thy hardnes whiche wil e cast thy wyfe euery light cause prouydeth new husband takyng away libertie thou shalt cal agayn cast beginnyng whereas malice man yet increaced nature manne yet infected many vice cruell hatred poysonyng murdre feared lycence diuorce law shall nowe loced set libertie doctrine ghospell doeth renewe make perfecte synceritie nature moses wisshed doe teache maners bent ouer muche vnto murdre put hym feare durste require doe abolishe lawe make perfecte playnely saye vnto vnlawfull agaynste mynde god agaynste wyll moses whiche ye doe commonlye refusyng wyues euery cause therefore ryghte ye doe ye doe withoute punyshemente many myscheuous thynges god whiche punyshed mannes lawes therefore ye shall vnderstande whosoeuer casteth wyfe euery cause maryeth committeth aduoutrye hym selfe geueth also cause aduoutrye wyfe vnlesse doeth leaue hath deserued diuorcemente aduoutrye hath geuen manne lybertie ouer ceasseth nowe wife hath taken awaye selfe ryghte matrimonye fleshe beyng deuided whiche god woulde haue one vndeuided suche cause leaueth wyfe whiche ye oftentymes doe caste yf couple hymselfe matrimonie aduoutrye maryeth caste maryeth owne wyfe mannes therfore doeth marye committeth aduoutrye whole mischiefes doeth redounde hym refuser caster first stubburne cruell whiche neyther could beare wyues faulte would goe amend furthermore geueth driuen house whiche cannot lyue without husband occasion commit aduoutrye disciple said vnto matter betwene man wife good mary said vnto men cannot comprehende saiyng saue geuen sum chaste borne mother wombe sum chaste whiche made chaste men chaste whiche hath made themselfes chaste kyngdome heauens sake take let hym take disciple hearyng thynges say vnto iesus maryed menne case cannot dispatched theyr wyfe yf dysplease better forbeare matrimonie harde bondage suffer home waywarde brawlyng dronken woman elles paynful greuous sum lyke fault iesus reproue answer disciple desired free bondage matrimonie preachyng ghospell doeth vnderstand sa e sure thyng flee matrimonie vnlesse man fyrme stable mynde able vtterly abstayn acte matrimonie fewe doe affeccion body common men none affeccion violente inuincible therfore though greater fredome tyed matrimonie yet sure kepte within bondes matrimonie defyled liyng therefore iesus shewyng best prouokyng waye reward libertieal men comprehende saiyng dareth yet exactely require whiche maner excedeth mannes power men able receiue woorde onely vnto whome geuen god haue great feruencye toward holynes gospell theyr accorde willyngly neglecte affeccion chaste synglenesse hath prayse vnlesse taken loue euangelicall godlynes three kyndes eunuch one whiche borne abhorre wyues thorough defaulte colde nature sum secrete affeccion nature another kynde men hath gelded chastitie men deserueth prayse cummeth necessitie loue vertue gospell also hath eunuch blessed whiche geldynges nature gelded men gelded themselfes kyngdome heauen cutting membre body loue ghospell ouercummyng desire matrimonie ye see victorie set let hym trye wyl knoweth owne strength let beare awaye game contend valyauntlye willingly shal want fauour maister game comunicacion puritie virgin highnesse noble vertue whiche chaunceth fewe occasion brought also exaumple perfecte cleannes great modestie without whiche virginitie deserueth prayse wer brought vnto yong chyldren put handes theym pray disciple rebuked iesus said vnto suffre child forbid cum kyngdome heauen belongeth whan laied handes departed thence wer present father mother whiche desired offer babe vnto iesus might lay handes vpon pray thinking lykewyse saw disease driuen away touchyng touchyng iesus preserue disease fallyng house walles lyke thynges vpon euyll spirites hurtes whereby age oftentymes miscarieth disciple though oft tymes heard many good lesson great modestie coldnes yet vtterly shaken man affeccions thinkyng mete greatnes dignitie theyr master letted weried importunitie babe mother kept whan desired cum nere iesus marking intent might better imprinte euangelicall moderacio myndes disciple whiche doeth loth manne neuer lowe suffre child brought vnto let cum mesuffre child lyke vnto bee moste acceptable vnto whome though world doth hate despise yet vouchsafe haue none kingdome heauen nature doth geue vnto thesame must godlines geue vnto ye receiued kingdome heauen therfore litle babe wer brought vnto iesus put handes vpon themand whe laid handes c inspiring litle babe ye simple faythes sake theyr paretes secret power touching holy body doe iesus departed thence geuyng lesson facte litle babe must satisfied yet ought tary log make spede thynges perfeccion pand beholde one came sayed vnto hym good maister good thyng shall doe maye haue eternall life sayed vnto hym callest thou good none good one god thou wylt enter lyfe kepe commaundementes sayeth vnto hym whiche iesus sayed thou shal e commit manslaughter thou shalt commit aduenitie thou shalt steale thou shalt bear false witnes honour father mother thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy self yong saith vnto hym al thinges haue kept youth vp lacke yet iesus said vnto thou wilt perfect go sell al thou hast geue poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen cum folowe whan yonge man heard saiyng went away sorye great possession loe soone doen child cummeth nexte yong man talketh perfeccion iesus like litle babe shewed disciple exaumple simplicitie modestie yong man dede desirous perfect godlines ouer sore burdened rich setteth iyes harde geue rich cum forward ye perfeccio euangelical godlines muche ready cause gospell whiche possesse nothyng el littell goodes world yet pouertie rich stande muche possession affeccios mynde yong man deuout mynde heard christ certayne newe straunge preceptes went vnto fallyng doune knee asketh saying good maister good shal obtayn euerlastyng lyfe yong man called iesus good obteyn good wil fayre speakyng whereas yet toke nothing el although excellencie men afterward whereas demauded good meaneth euery good thyng certain notable good thyng whiche may deserue euerlastyng lyfe mortal man absolutely good worke men good maye deserue reward euerlastyng lyfe iesus therfore pricking forwarde yonge manne haue better opinion call hym fro trust workes cause put trust life rather free gifte benefite god naturally good freely beneficial towardes al menne aunswered maner callest thou good doest thou aske goodwhy callest thou good yet thou desirest receiued vnto eternall lyfe kepe commaundementes whan yong asked commaundementes heard hym teache preceptes moses lawe bee enough obteyne kyngdome heauen iesus plucke awaye men truste lawe aunswered thou shalt kyll thou shalt commit aduoutrye thou shalte steale thou shalt beare false witnesse honoure thy father mother loue thy neyghbour thy selfeal thi ge haue kept fro youthe c yong manne beyng sumwhat chered sayd haue kept chyldehode lacke besyde loked iesus haue aunswered thou lackeste nothyng lord shewyng difference betwene iewishe righteousnesse righteousnesse ghospel betwene good iewe good christian manne sayed thou wylte perfecte goe sell thou haste geue money poore thou shalt lese thy money though dispersed among many disperse laye vp stede worldly rich thou shalte haue better treasure heauen thou hast doen beyng libertie dispatched heauy cariage bare pore cum folow beyng also bare poore iesus sayth yf thou wylt shewed great matter added rewarde thou shalte haue treasure heauen anon moued hym loue perfecte godlinesse cum folow whan yong man heard communicacion wente awaye discouraged heauye mynde lorde muche possession thought hard leaue desired get euerlasting lyfe desired honour perfeccion thornes richesse ouerwhelmed choked affeccion whiche good seede therfore departed home heuily vnderstanding iesus condemne rich affeccion loue carefulnes rich ca scarcely lesse bonde haue woulde alwaies shoulde forsaken yet alwayes set lyttell yea forsaken also yf tyme withdrawe v loue ghospell p iesus sayth vnto disciple verelye saye vnto shall bee harde ryche enter kingdome heauen agayne saye vnto easier camell go thorough iye nedle ryche enter kyngdome god whan disciple heard excedyngly amased saiyng bee saued iesus beheld sayed vnto men vnpossible god thynges possible shall bee hard ryche cwhan yong man gone iesus tournyng disciple shewed sight shoulde tyme repente pouertie bee entangled loue moneye howe harde thyng ryche manne enter kyngdome heauen signifiyng desyre moneye desyre euangelicall phylosophye hardely agree together one requireth whole man taketh vnto almost greatest part make difficultie thing greater disciple musing muche said yea say vnto easy camel go iye nedle riche man enter kyngdome heauen gate lowe straight receiueth camel laden burden rychesse reproued couetous riche men vnto rich rather burden profit beare others rather tha themselfes saying well vnderstande apostels put myndes certayne heauynesse sory yt many men rich sake shut kyngdome heauen therfore whan disciple maruayled muche shoulde meane iesus spake camell iye nedle aske saued howe many men whiche cast awaye ryches haue wysh yf haue none iesus beholdyng thintent would asswage heauines conceyued mynde declareth sum hope ryche menne also cumme kingdome heauen men impossible nolesse camell goe iye nedlewith men vnpossible c god nothinge impossible onely chaungeth myndes ryche men wyll cherefully eyther cast awaye whiche possesse el possesse comon proper euen ready aue yf matter ghospell tyme require greue despise ryches greueth bestowe theyr lyfe pthan aunswered peter sayed vnto beholde haue forsaken folowed shall haue therfore iesus sayed vnto uerely saye vnto whan sonne manne shall sitte seate maiestie ye haue folowed generacion shal sit also vpon twelue seates iudge twelue tribe israel euery one forsaketh house brother systers father mother wyfe child landes name sake shall receyue hundred folde shall nheri e euerlastyng life many firste shall last last shalbe firste communicacion whiche iesus yonge man sell thou hast folow made peter haue sum good hope whiche although wer richebehold haue forsaken c yet left cherefullye bothe shyppe nettes folowed lorde lorde beholde haue doen thou requyredst yonge man haue lefte thynges folowe rewarde shall haue therfore iesus willing shewe highe prayse offered riche men onelye also poore men whiche gladly forsake whatsoeuer haue gospell sake much vertue estemed thaffeccion leauer greatenes thyng left reiecte saying peter although high stoute symple matter teachyng small rewarde shall rendered small thinges lefte forsaken good willye yt haue folowed c sayethe warraunte ye whiche haue forsaken nothyng sake boates nettes yet suche ye would haue forsaken greate richesse sake hither beeynge bare poore haue folowed lykewyse bare poore ye perseuer continue worlde cum dead shall ryse euerye man shall receyue rewarde desertes whan sonne humilite ye nowe see set aparte shal sitte seate maiestie ye fysshers beyng partaker honor whiche nowe partaker af iccions shall sit twelue seates shall iudge twelue trybes israel cumming stocke hauyng knowledge lawe prouoked miracle benefytes yet meanes coulde brought beleue whereas ye meane persones vnlerned simple bidding haue lefte yea thinges whereby ye susteyned life rewarde shal onelye whosoeuer profession name forsaketh house brother sister father mother wyfe chyldren landes anye possession shall lose whiche lefte sake insomuche shall haue greate gayne therbyeuery one forsaketh house rethren c worlde shall receyue hundred folde thinges hath lefte tyme resurreccion shall possesse euerlastyng life stede thinges hath left whiche bee casuall vyle possession shall possesse meane tyme precious margaryte euangelicall mynde whiche estemed compared marchandise worlde stede one house ye haue left doctrine ghospell shall make open vnto numbre house thorough worlde one piece grounde manye groundes shall serue necessity one father mother ye shall haue manye shalbe olde men olde woman whiche ye shall conuert vnto ghospell ye shall haue many brother systers sonnes daughter equal yongers shalbe whiche prechyng ye shall bryng euerlasting life shall geue vnto euery theyr owne accorde yf ye shall neede anye thyng theyr affection shall far passe thaffeccions onely kinred bloud hath ioyned vnto v kinred felowship ghospell nere fleshly affinitie loue vehementlie godlines hath coupled together carnall byrth hath ioyned together unto great rewarde shalbe added also whiche greatest thynges whiche shortely shall perishe ye shall possesse euerlastyng life say profession ghospell doth teach v despyse nature hath ioyned vnto v suche maner affeccions muste neglected often withdrawe v euerlasting saluacion great felicitie set furth indifferently men difference fortune condicion age person estimacion iudgement shalbe made god equall iudge many shalbe lastbut manye first shalbe last c whiche seme nowe first contrariwise many whiche seme vile reputacion men shal counted chiefe shalbe preferred common woman scribe publican pharisie heathen iewe poore manne ryche plough manne king semed nexte kyngdome heauen shall enter last semed farre shall enter firste heathen men throughe fayth shall goe sinagoge vnbelefe shalbe set besyde pthe xx chapiter kingdome heauen like man householder whiche went earely morning hyre labourer vineyarde whan bargayne made laborer denary daie sent vineyarde wente thirde houre sawe standyng ydle market place sayed vnto go ye also vineyarde whatsoeuer right geue vnto went theyr waye agayne went sixte ninthe houre lykewyse bout eleuenth houre went founde standing ydle sayed vnto stande ye daye idle say vnto man hath h ted v sayeth vnto go ye also vineyarde whatsoeuer right ye shall receyue semed darke riddell spake concerninge first last declareth thing spake parable whereby sheweth men called keping obseruing righteousnes diuers age yet al seruauntes righteousnes haue one rewarde euerlasting saluacion whiche called labour diligently vineyarde righteousnes haue lesse whiche called time christ whiche called time abraham moyses dauid haue lesse whiche called drawen seruice gospell aged whith child yong men one denary rewarde euerlasting lyfe geuen vnto al yet came late seme haue greater honour liberalitie lorde maketh equall whyche came iewes firste called yet gentile called afterwarde onelye made equall vnto also preferred vnbeleuing iewes parable sorte kingdom heaue like vnto householder whyche wente abrode earely mornynge hier workemen vineyarde getting certayne bargayning shoulde haue eche denary piece theyr dayes worke sent vineyarde wente agayne aboute three clocke e certayne stande idle markete saide vnto go ye also vineyard shall geue shall mete went oute agayne sixe cloke agayne aboute nine likewyse one three clocke againe going aboute three clocke towarde night founde certayne market whome sayed stande day idle saye man hath hired v sayeth go ye also vineyard pso whan euen cum lorde vyneyard sayeth vnto stewarde call laborer geue theyr yer beginning laste vntill fyrste whan cum came eleuenth houre receyued euery man denary whan firste came also supposed shoulde haue receyued also receyued euery denarie whan receyuyd murmured householder saying last hath wrought one houre thou hast made equall v whiche haue borne burden heate day answered one sayinge frende dothe wrong thou co enaunted denary take ha t thine go thy waye geue vnto laste euen lawfull mine owne goodes thyne iye euil good last shall firste first last many e called fewe chosen toward night lorde vineyarde geueth commaundement bayly call workemen pay theyr hyer thou begin last cum firste therfore came last aboute eleuen clocke laboured vineyarde leaste parte daye called firste denarye geuen eche whan called earely morninge perceyued came longe vineyarde thought ra e time shoulde receyue greater wage denary geuen vnto eche therfore sawe like space time yet made lyke wage departe murmurynge agaynste lorde vineyarde saye whiche came eleuen clocke haue laboured one houre yet thou makeste lyke vnto v wage haue continued whole daye laboure haue suffered heate daye whereas came lytle nyght heate nowe paste householder made aunswere one frende hast thou enuy liberall vnto others fre liberalytie towardes hurteth doe wrong bargayne thou shouldeste haue denarye thy dayes laboure thou haste done thy laboure thou haste thy couenaunte haue nothinge doe take owed vnto departe thou werte hiered hither wage doe thy labour appoynte shall doe thus thought good vnto geue came last muche wage geue thou doest lese none thyne geue man thyng liberalitie shall libertie thy iye therefore vexed enuy thou seest liberal toward pleaseth similitude iesus brought willing depely graffe theyr mindes god naturally beneficiall towardes al men ceasseth diuers wayes diuers age prouoke moue al men seruice true godlines whiche haue exercised themselues diligently shall haue rewarde euerlasting lyfe none excluded geuing eare whan called reward like case due vnto merites ye goodnes god yet cummeth without endeuour yet bound ca ler also cum seruice godlynes continue vnto euentide day called refuse go vineyarde disapoynte themselues theyr wage although among sayne e neyther enuy murmuryng god yet saynges expressed high honoure shewed last whiche first place rewarde whiche dignitie noble man might haue cause enuy yet good iewes also beginning murmured gentile cumming idolater straungers moyses law finally vncircumcised sodenly made equall vnto grace gospel admitted saluacion beeyng incumbred burden lawe whereas long exercised ordinaunces moyses nothyng better gentile whiche admitted profession gospell litle wicked life therfore gentile forgeuen iewes haue cause brawle god therfore sithe also maye attayne like felicitie rather enuy folowe let thanke themselues cast theyr vnbelefe gentile meane tyme obteining redines theyr faith thing iewes thought onely ought hauefor many called chosen therfore whoso called let furthwith make haste el shall called vayne excepte take hede also elected called deserue counted among elect therefore iesus ended parable thesame clause began shall last firste firste laste many called fewe chosen iesus goyng vp hierusalem toke twelue disciple asyde waye sayeth vnto beholde goe vp hierusalem sonne man shalbe betrayed chiefe pristes scribe shall condemne death shall deliuer gentile mocked scourged crucified thirde day shall ryse agayne iesus beyng whyle galile began drawe nere place death going towarde hierusalem whan instructed framed disciple many wayes concernyng despysing ryches neglecting parentes kinsfolkes chastitie great modestie rewardes haue also lyfe leadeth secretly aparte twelue apostle chosen thoughte mete commit mistery crosse vnto whiche multitude yet able beare yet tolde deathe vnto people spake ionas pulling downe temple making vp againe three day tolde vnderstode sayed sawe done opened mistery crosse vnto disciple strong able twyse speaking vnto playnly men forget lightly whiche glad heare doe lightly let sinke theyr harte thing whiche mynde abhorrethe lorde iesus confyrme hys apostle agaynste storme hande openethe vnto playnely distinctly onelye death nere also telleth mockes affliccions whiche oftentymes greuouse deathe itselfe beholde go hierusalem sonne man shalbe betrayed chiefe priestes scribesbehold dooe go vp c whiche nowe goe aboute laye wayte rest blame accuse vntill haue broughte hym condemnacion deathe shall deliuer vnto gentile mocke scourge spit vpon nayle vpon crosse whan deade buried thyrde daye shall ryse agayne came hym mother zebedes childeren sonnes worshippinge desyring certayne thinge sayethe vnto wil thou sayde vnto graunte two sonnes may sit one thy right hande lefte hande thy kingdome iesus aunswered sayed ye wote ye aske ye drinke cuppe shall drinke baptised baptisme shalbe baptised saye vnto sayde vnto truely ye shall drinke cuppe baptised baptisme baptised sit right hande left hande myne geue shal chaunce vnto prepared father meane season iames iohn sonnes zebede heard keyes kingdome heauen geuen peter heard also honoure twelue seates beynge yet rude dreaming worldely thinges supposinge kingdom honoures shoulde cum immediatly resurreccion sayde thyrde day shall rise get theselues nowe excellet dignitie sente furthe mother suiter vnto iesus sonnes done dutie worshipped requiring deny suite required would sayeth geue commaundement two sonnes may sit thy kingdome one thy right hande thy lefte hande iesus turning vnto child knewe mother sent furth aunswered ye know ye aske ye delight speaking kingdom whiche far sorte ye dreame presente muste rather talke debate affliccion crosse way kingdome ye require rewarde oute ordre whereas first ye muste traueile stryue haue opened vnto nowe muste suffer ye drinke cuppe shall drinke ye baptised baptisme shall baptised yet litle knowing strengthe gredines obteyne theyr peticion answere rashely rather valiantly iesus content sayde wer ready folow crosse touching rewarde vnderstode asked tyme commone sayeth geue ch dignitie shoulde chaunce vnto vnto geuen father deserue chiefe place notable excellente vertue truely encourage al men clime vnto highest sayeth ye shall drinke cuppe fit one right hand left hand geue vnto thone shall chaunce vnto shall geuen father euery man doeth traueill shall rewarded whan ten hearde disdayned two brother iesus called vnto sayed ye know prince nacions hath dominion ouer great men exercyse power ouer shall among whosoeuer greate among let minister whoso chiefe amonge let seruaunte sonne man came ministred vnto ministre geue lyfe redempcion many whan thother ten afterwarde heard thinges agreued two brother eqai ed great dignitie yet receyued holy goste ledde yet certayne affeccions men ambiciouse enuying one iesus suffered disciple troubled longe affeccions thintent would plucke vtterly mindes whiche shoulde succede roumes thapostles thought glad therfore lorde reiect request iohn iames dreamed carnall thinges spirituall kingdome hande required honoure aboue theyr merites whiche thought ought rather geuen therefore iesus lyke dyd represse ambicion folish sutours knew asked repressed enuy indignacion issewed thesame fountayne ambicion opening vnto ther farre diuerse kinde worldely kingdome kingdome gospell worldly kingdom lesse oppressed tiranny mightier primacie nothing elles greate desire good vnto men prouder man greater semethe meke harteye knowe yt prince c deseruethe chiefly higheste tha mighte fasten doctrine mennes harte called vnto hym thapostles ye knowe eare rule amonge gentyles vse lordlynes tyrannye vpon whome rule chiefe exercyse theyr power vpon theyr subiectes hurt people prouide theyr owne authoritie care thinges whiche profite multitude make stoutnes florishing theyr welth glory mete emonge whosoeuer beare rule emong let minister men vsing honour owne commoditie commoditie people ruleth emong haue first place let seruaunt lowest taketh vpon chiefe place nother intent loke commoditie al men hunting seking therof neyther honour profit ye thinke harde loke vpon wheras lorde maister sonne god ye ulye professe yet take vpo dignitie honour abuse power myne owne commoditie cum serue al mennes turnes wayte theyr commodity insomuche g eueth bestowe lifeand geue lyfe redeption manye losse one lyfe maye redeme many emonge therfore thus minded cause man shoulde seke honour neyther enuiouse mannes dignitie enuye whiche studieth nother thynge man good nede losse hys lyfe also honour geuen vnto take vnto themselues yelde vnto god departed ierico muche people folowed hym beholde two blinde men sitting way whan heard iesus passed cryed sayinge lord sonne dauid haue mercy v people rebuked holde theyr peace cryed saying haue mercy v lorde sonne dauid iesus stoode still called sayde ye shall vnto say vnto lorde iyes maye opened iesus compassion touched theyr iyes immediately theyr iyes receyued sight folowed whan went disciple ierico great multitude men folowed behold two blind men sate wayes side whiche whe perceyued noyse great multitude askynge shoulde knew iesus whiche passed whe could see sene coulde go vnto hym multitude spake vnto iesus loude voyce saying lord iesu sonne dauid haue mercy vpon v iesus made though hearde thintente theyr faythe feruentnes might manifeste men people seyng iesus made aunswere cry suppossing paynefull twoe blinde common beggers made clamoure eares rebuked bad holde theyr peace constante truste iesus heard saye beneficiall towardes men cried louder sayde aga ne lorde sonne dauid haue mercy vpon v iesus therfore sufficiently declared theyr fayth taught v theyr exaple beate eares god feruently constantly yf obtayne anye thynge stode still could folow onely cry commaunded cum worde cum iesus askethe would theyr great cry woulde shoulde iesus ignoraunte desired would disease troubled wyth knowen menne theyr owne confession faythe miracle mighte certayne lorde desire oure iyes maye opened helpe speakyng thynges great affeccion declare blyndnes great griefe vnto nexte vnto light whiche wery blindenes iesus shewyng pietifull affeccion countenaunce iyes whiche affeccion euery gospeller ought bee sory men harmes touched theyr iyes forthwith iyes beyng opened saw others folowed iesus iesus touching healeth mynde blinded worldly desyres lighte geuen ende maye folowe steppe xxi chapiter drewe nye vnto hierusalem came bethphage vnto mounte oliuete sent iesus two disciple saying vnto go towne ce agaynst anone ye shall fynde asse bounden colte looce bring man saye ought vnto saye ye lord hath nede streyght waye wyll let go done might fulfilled whiche spoken prophete saying speake ye dough er syon beholde thy kyng cummeth vnto meke sitting vpon asse colt fole asse vsed yoke therfore iesus goyng forwarde hierusale laboured diligently disciple fasten theyr mindes went death wittingly willyngly man shoulde hurte yf woulde resiste therfore beate often must go hierusalem suffre death wheras sumtyme semed wythdrawe himselfe perill feare kepe himselfe vnto tyme apoynted father whiche hande dyd onely hyde hymselfe willyngly put furthe hymselfe putte furth noueltie pompe styrred mindes whole cytie againste meane season ceaseth myracles ceaseth preachyng trueth also reproueth lyfe phariseis frely frankely casteth marchauntes temple whiche thinges knewe theyr myndes woulde bee vehemently styrred whome prouoked well doyng made vnfaultie gaue lybertie might thing would therfore nere citie hierusalem came mount oliues thought good frame new maner pompe cumming maner mocked pryde worlde spectacle somewhat comforted disciple beyng yet weake might quietly beare death theyr lorde therfore hill sente two disciple saying go ye village ouer agaynste soone ye enter ye shall fynde female asse tyed fole whereon neuer hath manne yet sitten looce bothe bring hither vnto manne saye thing vnto demaundyng ye looce whither ye leade make none aunswere lorde hath nede themall thys done c worde suffer furthwith brought thinges doen partlye shoulde vnderstande nothing hym vnknowen hath power commaunde woulde vse power partely iewes might know lest wise token messias sawe strauge kinde entring prophecied tyme paste prophete zacharie thus prophecie saye ye doughters syon beholde thy kyng cummeth thee meke humble sitting vpon asse vpon colte fole yoked beaste disciple went iesus commaunded brought asse olt put theyr clothes set theron many people spred theyr garmentes waye cut downe oughes tree strawed waye ferther people went came cryed saying osanna sonne dauid blessed commeth name lorde osan highest disciple departed found true whatsoeuer iesus tolde mencion lord beastes wer let looce neyther lorde presente disciple made countenaunce autoritie dede owner beastes knewe suche thing yet theyr hertes perceyued whiche lorde ouer commaunded disciple lord sit ease cast theyr clokes set vpon coltes backe whiche colte beare figure heathen nacion beyng vncleane filthy folowyng yll desyres whiche whan couered vertues apostolicall iesus receiued vpon backe ceassed longer bee vncleane ceassed folow old vice beyng made bearer purgeth sanctifieth thinges asse dame fole healthe redempcion cummeth oute iewes asse fast tyed lett e lawe bare euangelicall vertues lordes biddyng vntied couered apostle clothes apostle yet vnderstoode thynges yet whiche signified shoulde playnely vnderstanded afterwarde iesus come foote hill great multitude men came ierusalem mete hym yea multitude suche fauour vnto moost parte strawed waye theyr garmentes cut downe boughes tree strawed waye ferther company went also folowed declaryng themselues bee glad cumming sang vnto hym saying prophecie psalme osanna sonne dauid blessed cummeth name lordeosanna sonne c osanna high others cryed blessed kyngdome father dauid whiche come others cryed blessed kyng israell whiche come praysed god myracles whiche sawe done iesus honoure lorde iesus hadde euer fore liued humble lowe suffred geuen vnto hym whereby declared shoulde bee without glorye worlde case mynded haue rather despise embrace ende might bee muche shame shoulde sought suche professe themselues disciple despysed onelye deserued yet honor mere semely cummynge hym death shoulde redeme whole worlde whan cum hierusalem citie moued saying people sayd iesus prophete nazareth galile iesus went temple cast solde bought temple ouerth ewe table money chaungers seares solde doues sayd vnto wrytten house shall called house prayer ye haue made den theues blynde lame came vnto hym temple healed therfore iesus entred hierusalem straunge vnwoonte pompe whole citie moued vncouthe syght saying man multitude whiche folowed aunswered iesus prophete nazareth citie galile thought goodly prayse although farre vnder maiestie people yet coulde suppose nothyng hym aboue man christe dyd purposely ordre lyfe vttered openly godlye nature whiche shoulde haue persuaded vayne yf seene hym afterwarde suffer deathe therefore rufflyng iesus entered temple furthwith began vse certayne kyngdome sawe temple fashion market sum selling sum biyng changer money sitting iesus moued vngoodlines thing accordynge sayinge prophete zeale thy house hath eaten made whip litle coardes droue byers seller theyr marchandise temple cast downe table money changer scatered theyr money vpon grounde cast downe seates doue seller alleging furth esay iust cause griefe sayeth person god house shall called house prayermy house house prayer ye haue made den theues act iesus mente thynge temple polluted marchandyse bullockes shepe goates doues greatly moue hym hys mynde shewe auaryce lucre would deadly poyson vnto church time cum whiche figured temple whose religion shortlye abolished suche tyme temple consecrate offer vp god spirituall sacrifice turned denne theues whan vnder pretense religion priesthode people robbed nothing sincere holy loue money doethe reigne mischiefe thynge vntollerable vsed vnder roofe temple rauine couered shadowe religion sorte men agaynste iesus time shewed rigour dyd towardes yet hath reserued vnto himselfe cast outalso blynde lame c himselfe shall thinke best vnto iesus temple came blynde lame whome lawe barred entryng temple temple iesus receyueth whiche make spede vnto healthe blynde came hauinge theyr sight might see iesus whome hearde spoken lame came folowing steppe mighte come kyngdome heauen manye therfore came hym healed pwhan thiefe priestes scribe sawe wonder child cry temple saying hosanna sonne dauid dis ayned sayed vnto hearest thou saye iesus sayeth vnto haue ye neuer red mouth infantes sucklinges thou haste ordeyned prayse lefte went citie vnto bethallia abode chiefe priestes scribe thorough thinges wherby ought last repente kyndled burning enuye sawe people reioysing louingly euery syde sawe greate power healing lame blinde authoritie casting marchandise manne beeyng bolde resist child also cry temple o anna sonne dauid thei taking thinges greuously monished iesus cease cry el would cum passe shoulde seme acknowleage suche honour iudged vnworthy wher shoulde haue theyr partes rather gre ely prayse hym speake well whiche beyng auncient men skilfull law prophecy seeyng many miracle myght vnderstande messias loked long tyme nowe child instigacion nature rather inspiracion god spake thinge whiche could vnderstande lacke age therfore blinded enuy drunken anger saied vnto hearest thou child saye iesus stopping mouth testimonye scripture dyd ye neuer reade mauthe infantes sucklinges thou haste made perfecte thy prayse ye therefore shut mouthe whiche god hath opened prayse glory say vnto god suffer prayse silence enuye muche holde theyr peace stone wil crye whose hardenes ye excede therfore iesus leuyng enuy departed goyng citie ierusalem went vnto bethania tarryed pin morning returned citie agayne hungered whan spied fig ree came founde nothing theron leaues saied vnto neuer fruite growe hence forward anon fig ree wythered away whan disciple sawe maruayled saying soone figgetree wishered iesus answering sayed vnto ue ely saye vnto ye haue fayth doubte ye shall onely happened vnto figgetre also ye shal saie vnto mountaine thy selfe sea shall doen thinges whatsoeuer ye aske prayer yf ye eleue ye shall receyue mornyng waye returned vnto citie beganne wexe hungry sawe figtree nere waye came towarde hoping haue sum foode c founde nothyng leaues therefore beeyng greued deceyued hope cursed saying neuer man see fruite hereafter whan disciple returned agayne way seing figgetree whiche iesus cursed withered leaues fallen maruelled saied vnto behold figgetree whiche thou diddest curse withered iesus suffered doen purpose might inculcate diligently faythe vnto disciple withoute whiche knewe death shoulde vnprofitable menne thyrsted maruelouslye healthe saluacion mankinde desired longed death whereas founde apperauce religion iewes found fruite fayth hungered unto disciple therfore marueiling figge tree sodenly withered made answere wyse maruayle ye whiche greate matter figge tree wyther might faythe doe whiche yf ye possesse stronge constante ye shall onelye doe whiche ye sawe chaunce vnto figge tree also yf ye saye hill remoue thy place go sea youre commaundemente shall doen forthwith whatsoeuer ye shall aske prayer ye haue sure trust ye shall obteyne pand cum temple chiefe priestes elder people came hym teaching sayed auctoritie doest thou thinges hath geuen auctoritie iesus auswering sayed vnto also aske certayne thyng whiche yf ye tell also shewe authoritie thynges baptisme iohn whence heauen men thought themselfes saying say heauen saye vnto v th n ye beleue hym say men eare people men take iohn prophet answering iesus sayed cannot tel sayed vnto tell aucthoritie thinges entred temple taught people chiefe priestes certayne seniours people suffering kyngdome freely go vnto saye authoritie doest thou thinges gaue authoritie sith manne gaue hym authoritie either must say geue god el belzebub saied god shoulde haue saied trueth shoulde haue doen nothing prouoked theim aske beleue whiche might appere thing selfe falsely reproue blame iesus therfore ignorant thing requi ed question though man shoulde dryue one nayle aske certayne thyng ye answer answer question authoritie whereby iohn baptise whence came vnto heauen men toke deliberacion themselfes answere sawe question two pike must nedes fall vpon one thought mindes yf say heauen forthwith say vnto v ye beleue preached kingdome god witnessed yf saye men feared leste people make sedicion menne toke iohn prophete therfore leste shoulde reproued made answere coulde tell spake iesus wyll tell whence haue authoritie pand thynke man two sonnes came firste sayed sonne go day worke vineyarde e answering sayd afterwarde rep uted wente came e seconde sayed likewyse answered sayed sie wente whether twayne father say vnto first iesus sayeth vnto verely say vnto tha publican harlottes got kyngdom god iohn came vnto waye righteousnes ye beleued hym publican harlottes dyd beleue hym ye ye seen moued afterwarde repent beleue simple playne question could wryng oute confession truth iesus putteth forth question riddell vnwares shall geue sentence themselues thynke ye propose certayne man two sonnes came one sayed sonne go worke day vineyard answered frowardly wil strayt afterward repenting himselfe went vineyarde father likewyse came sonne sayed go labour vineyarde day answereth redily loe goe sir yet wente therfore two whether thinke ye fulfilled father wil vnderstanding ende went answered firste sone whiche repenting forthwith wente vi eyarde iesus turning parable vpon sayed certaynlye tell truethe publicanes ommon woman shall go kyngdome heauen beyng rebelles agaynst god theyr wicked life yet touched moued penaunce obeyed doctryne ghospell ye people god title profession ye whiche sayed time paste day say thinges whatsoeuer lorde sayeth vnto v whiche also haue euer mouthe preceptes god lordes temple lordes temple lordes temple beyng many wayes prouoked cannot moued penaunce iohn came shewyng waye ryghteousnes wrathe god hande axe set tree rootes vnlesse furthwith ye would repent ye sawe publicanes common woman desperate folkes iudgement obedient vnto hym ye could moued vnto penaunce neyther great holines iohn neyther holsom doctrine neither threteninges neither example publicanes common woman cummethe passe throughe faythe take kyngdome god ye vaynelye professing god mouthe shut vnbelefe mynde pheathen similitude certayne man householder whiche planted vineyarde hedged rounde aboute made wine presse builded wer let husbandman went furth straunge countrey whan tyme fruyte drew nere sen e seruautes husbande men receyue fruites husbande men takyng seruauntes dyd beare one kylled another stoned another agayne sente seruauntes mo firste dyd vnto lyke wise last sente vnto owne sonne saying haue sonne reuerence husbande men whan sawe sonne saied selues heyre cum let v kyll let v enioye heritage toke caste vineyarde kyled whan lorde vineyarde cummeth doe vnto husband men saye vnto sith bee ill e truelly destroy let vineyarde housbande menne whiche shall deliuer fruite due season put another parable euen darke doth recite se ely leyeth iyes notable vnkindenes whiche beeyng prouoked manye benefites god dyd onely amende also ruelly killed prophetes one another sente preachyng myght repente content herewith finallye would kyll sonne god hymselfe caste vineyarde shewyng waye place shoulde crucified whiche communicacion declareth yt inuincible malice vnworthye pardon seeyng nothyng omitted myghte call backe better mynde shoulde suffre nothing whiche knewe parable certayne householder whiche planted vineyarde hedged aboute digged cesterne receyue swete wine pressed cluster grape buylt lodge kepyng vineyarde whan well garnished set husbande menne trustely tyll tendre fruites vnto lorde doen wet far nowe tyme gatheryng fruite approched nere sente seruauntes receyue fruite husbande men dyd onelye deliuer fruites due also layed handes vpon hys seruauntes bette sum killed sum stoned sum death knowen householder furth punishe loking shoulde repente amende sente vnto theim greater number seruauntes dyd trusting beeyng kept vnder awe multitude woulde duetie handeled theim also gentely handeled householder suffered displeasure also finally ouercum softnes gentilnesse sent vnto owne sonne saying himselfe although haue cruell toward seruauntes yet leaste wil vse sonne reuerently whan see cum husbande menne prouoked repentaunce styrred vnto cruelty whan sawe sonne reuerence insomuche furthwyth consulted slea saying heyre cum let v kill shall take inheritaunce layed handes vpon hym plucked vineyarde killed therfore lorde vineyarde shall cum shall husbande menne phariseis answered ill men shall ill intreate destroy set vineyarde others may trustely render fruite tyme vnto lorde whithe lette deceyued ryddle condemne selues theyr owne mouth pronouncing themselues inuincible frowardenes mynde wurthy punishmente gentile wurthy receyued grace ghospel whiche till vineyarde trusttely dyd piesus sayeth vnto dyd ye neuer reade scripture oue b lders refused made head corner doen lorde uailouse yes therfore saye vnto kingdome god shalbe taken fro geuen nacion whiche shall fruytes therof whosoeuer falleth stone shalbe broken piece whomsoeuer falleth shalbe brused thinges iesus shewed frowardenes beeyng condemned reiected dye spitefull deathe resurreccion power father made notable thoroughout worlde shoulde sounde strong whoso stumbled owne destruccion declaryng might lesse offend bryngethe prophecie psalme neuer ye scripture stone whiche builder dyd refuse caste away made head corner doen lorde wonderfull iyes signifying builded synagoge castig christe without building sure yet ye stone reiected great estimacion price church ye gentile therfore iesus dyd adde therfore say vnto kingdo god shall taken fro ye despise offered vnto shal geuen people shal bring furth fruites meete gospel stone shal bring health obey ghospell shall bryng destruccion vnto disobediente throughe vnbelefe whoso stumbleth thys stone shalbe broken agayne vpo stone falleth shalbe brused pand whan chiefe priestes phariseis heard hys parable perceyued spake went laye handes hym feared people toke hym prophete iesus aunswered spake vnto parable sayd lengthe conclusion thys communicacion fyrste chiefe priestes scribe vnderstode spake former parable also againste whyche beyng deceyued gaue sentence agaynst themselues therfore theyr madnes set fyer woulde furth haue layed handes vpon feared people iesus made muche many taken prophete pthe xxii chapter pthe kingdome heauen lyke vnto man kyng whiche made mariage sonne sent furth seruauntes call theym bydde weddyng woulde cum agayne sent furth seruautes saying tell whiche bidden beholde haue prepared dinner myne ox fattewares kylled thynges ready cum vnto mariage made lyght went theyr wayes one farme place another marchandise residue toke seruau te intreated shamefully whan kyng hearde therof angry sent furth men warre destroyed murderer brent vp theyr citie agayne iesus added parable print surely ye mindes iewes yt came passe theyr owne obstinate malice yt reiected fro saluacion gospel yt gentile shal take enioye made selues vnworthy none excluded fro kigdom god honoure geue nacio iewes called fyrste gently called vnto sower vyle thynges vnto maryage yt honour delicates libertie ye gospel wer inuited onely prophete iohn christ himselfe also death shoulde called apostle preacher ghospell shoulde go gentyles theyr diligence well doyng bene arayed long iewes many mockes punishmentes ascribe man afterward shal punished many misery whiche despised goddes goodnes often offered vnto similitude page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate kingdome heauen made like certayne kyng makyng bridale sonne sent seruaunte inu e call many sonnes mariage called would cumme kyng sent mo seruauntes bid diligently make haste vnto weddyng redines say name beholde diner ready ox pultrie killed al thinges readines nothyng lacketh cumming geastes preparacion made vaine againe neglected bidder whan bidder called vpon euery man made excuse one sayd muste gose e manour farme place lately bought another sayde must go loke vpon ox bought another saied late maryed wyfe
