whome could departe men onlye madde themselues whiche preferred certayne vile fylthy care frail thinges feast suche felicitie ioyned cruelnes vnto theyr vnkindnes kinges seruauntes whiche dyd twyse inuite vnto great honour handeled vsed sore many rebuke length killed alsoand whan kyng whiche doyng kinge heard toke greuously turnyng gentilnes whiche despised rage sendyng furth men garde destroyed murderer content set theyr citie fyer also thinges spake iesus prophecying vnto couertly destruccion citie ierusalem geueth intelligence gentile shallbe called euery syde vnto gospell wiche wer better iewes pthan sayed seruauntes mariage prepared inuited worthy go ye therfore hygh wayes many ye fynde cal mariage tha seruauntes wente high wayes brought together manye coulde fynde good badde weddyng furnished geastes king came see geastes whan spyed wedding garmente sayeth vnto frede camest thou hither hauing weddyng garmente helde peace said kyng minister binde hym handes feete caste vtter darkenes shalbe wepyng gnashing teethe many called chosen sayed vnto seruauntes bridale redy called declared theselues vnworthy feaste whiche withstandyng prepared chiefly runne abrode euery stretes crosse wayes call bridale indifferently whomsoeuer ye fynd worthy vnworthy febie maymed blind lame till house full seruauntes went foorth broughte together multitude sortes gathered together place feaste replenished geastes iesus shewed iewes shoulde greuously punished whiche afflicted apostle callyng theim often length killed declareth also shalbe sore punished whiche professing lyfe ghospell returne againe filthines theyr olde lyfe king went see geastes sittyng table among others sawe one weddinge garment frende camest thou hither sith thou hast thy wedding garmente beyng put shame dumme nothing say king commaunded seruauntes binde handes feete remoue far feast caste great darkenes weeping gnashing teeth honour lyght feaste beyng chaunged vile pryson great pleasure beyng chaunged great tor ment though many called yet chosen al called freely bu none chosen obey calling vnto ude answere vnto goodnes god towardes continuyng study loue euangelicall godlynes went phariseis toke counsell might tangle wordesthe sente furth hym theyr disciple herodians saying maister knowe thou art true teachest waye god truly neither regarded thou man thou haste respecte persones tell v therfore howe thy likest thou lawfull tribute geuen ceasar iesus perceyuing malice sayed tempt ye ye hipocrites shewe tribute money toke hym denarie sayed vnto whose ymage superscripcion sayed vnto hym ceasars sayed vnto geue therfore vnto ceasar thynges whiche ceasars vnto god thynges goddes whan heard wordes meruayled left hym went awaye whan iewes perceyued touched parable yet moued vnto penaunce insomuche nowe mused theyr myndes nothing el howe iesus myght killed great mischiefe enuy ambicion wyll murdre lacked oportunitie feared god reuenger suche mischifes feared people thought therfore goe contrary waye doe thyng suche secrete vndermining enuy dede redound reste vpon ceasar officersand sent furthe c therfore tyme dissembled theyr anger went awaye consulting among themselues thought good certayne subornated setforth propose question vnto iesus take hym answere bryng hym prince daunger beeyng giltie treason author sedicion myght putte death phariseis hauyng nothyng doe matter theyr inuencion whan iewry began tributarie romaynes king herode sonne antipater made officer august gather tribute thyng euery man like opinion thought meete people dedicate vnto god pay tribute prynces idolatours opinion whiche helde phariseis agayne sum fauorers ceasar saied tribute ought payed mainteners opinion called herodians herode officer gather tribute lytle two theudas iudas whilest defende openly iewes people dedicate vnto god ought tribute prophane prince put death like sediciouse persones phariseis trusted christe fauoring religion ceasar beeyng prophane wicked woulde pronounce iudge according accustomed libertie ye herodians tribute payed ceasar furthwith accused vnto herode punished like da iudas yf pronounced tribute shoulde payed woulde haue layed charge flattered wycked prynces fauoured god religion therfore doe subornate sende furth certayne theyr disciple whiche herodians beyng presente great numbre men thing lacke witness colourably fayre speakyng entise theyr net great theyr blyndnes thyng often attempted vayne would rest neyther ashamed theyr inconstancye nowe calling maister layed charge possessed spirite beelzebub commende libertie feare offende herodians maister knowe thou art true thou flatterest manne thou liest nothing thou doest teache great libertie pleasure god phantasye men thou fearest mortall man regardest person tell v therfore ye thynke leefull people iewes whiche dedicate religion god paye tribute vnto ceasar shall geue hereafter iesus shewe theyr craftye flatteryng could deceyue ordered aunswere woonderfull wysedome endaungered hymselfe neyther faccions monished dyd moste appertayne vnto saluacion pay vnto god high princeis lawful tribute c tribute godlynes ye hypocrite ye tempte shewe coyne tribute went catche iesus woordes agayne catcheth theyr answeres therfore shewed hym dena ie whiche image name ceasar declare came purpose make lawes thynges whiche pertayne nothyng vnto godlynes whiche tyme maye well yll doen sawe coyne though knew suche letter image went onely heauenly thynges asked whose title image aunswere made ceasars sayed iesus rendre therfore vnto ceasar yf thing appertaine vnto ceasar firste rendre vnto godand vnto god c thynges appertaine vnto god meanyng hurte godlines man beeyng dedicate god doe geue tribute prophane prynce although owe desiring rather obedient prouoke stirre chiefly thyng whiche maketh man poorer vngodly otherwise yf doeth exacte maketh v vngodly nowe tribute ceasar deuill aunswer marueyled firste perceiued suttell deuise hid furthermore wonderfull wisedome mannes craftines wente deceiue bayne maruailed truely chaunged forsaking left prouoke syth thei could ouercome leaue hate hym ought loue daye came vnto hym sadduceis whiche saye resurreccion asked hym saying maister moyses sayed yf man dye hauyng chylde brother marry wyfe rayse vp seede brother v seuen brother first maried wyfe dyed without issue lefte wyfe brother likewise seconde thirde vnto seuenth laste dyed woman also therfore resurreccion whose wyfe shall seuen iesus aunswered sayed vnto ye erre knowyng scripture power god resurreccio neyther marry marryed aungels heauen therfore whan phariseis herodians departed sadduceis came vnto faccion emong iewes grosse lesse learned disagreing phariseis denye resurreccion somuche beleue aungels bee soules bee bee separate body thynkyng nothing bee whiche see whan heard christe make often mencion euerlasting life world come resurreccio iust come vnto trye whether agreed phariseis taught contrary might reproue orels laugh skorne agreed phariseis therfore obiect vnto hard questionthere seuen brother maister moyses made lawe man hauing maried wyfe departe without chyldren brother dead marry widowe lefte brother couplyng wyth rayse vp issue brother departed emong v seuen brother firste married wyfe departed without child nexte brother married also died without issue lykewyse chaunced thirde fowerth vnto seuenth dyed without issue laste wyfe dyed also whiche married seuen brother therfore resurreccion whiche shall haue wife canot common wyfe married indifferently question ignorauce malyce iesus vouchsafe make aunswere erreth ignoraunce woorthy taught propose questios mere malice woorthy aunswered ye erre whiche rede sciptures ye vnderstande imagining nothing aboue bodily thinges ye see ye knowe power god wonderfull thinges seen men course borne dye wedlocke vsed propagacion bryngyng furth mankynde nowe mortalitie shalbe swalowed vp consumed men shalbe spirituall whiche thyng shall come passe resurreccion whiche shall restore v agayne beyng thesame dede yet chaunged another sorte shall man marry woman shalbe married shall nede generacion death shall pertayne resurreccion iust lyue without matrimony lyke aungels god heauen recording mynding theyr power shall come resurreccion rather get soules god bodyes worlde pbut touching resurreccion dead haue ye red spoken god saith god abraham god isaac god iacob god god dead liuyng whan people heard astonied doctryne iesus notyng secretely folishe question spring false perswasion beleued resurreccion disdayned wede opinion also theyr myndes teachyng also taken bokes moyses whose authoritie apposed iesus haue ye yll opinion resurreccion dead though moyses taught openly whose wrytinges ye reade grossely nothing diligently haue ye red bokes god sayth god abraham god isaac god iacob peryshed wholy deathe bodyes would saye theyr god god yf theyr god truly theyr soules doe lyue wholy lyue maner hope resurreccion shall god lyfe god dead whiche nowe liuyng taught resurreccion suche sorte imagined bee whan proposed folyshe question seuen brother people sawe euery mannes mouthe stopped wyse aunswers merueiled effectuall redy doctryne pbut whan phariseis heard stopped mouth sadduceis came together one doctor lawe asked questio temptyng saying maister whiche great commaundement lawe iesus saied vnto thou shalt loue lorde thy god al thy harte al thy soule thy mynde first great commaundemente second lyke vnto thou shalt loue thy neyghbour thy selfe two commaundementes hang lawe prophetes phariseis displeased sadduceis put sylence chiefly matter wherin cleane cotrary one another therfore whan phariseis sawe put sylence rebuked also ignorauce scripture taking harte grace againe gather together set forwarde certayne doctour lawe whiche goe vnto iesus clerkly question eyther myght reproue hym ignoraunce orels hymselfe beare awaye prayse learnyng maister whiche chiefe commaundemente lawe iesus purposyng shewe crake profession lawe furthest keping greatest commaundement lawe wholy flame enuy hatred theyr neyghboure vice whiche haue none affinitie christian charitie man loueth god whiche vniust neyghbour aunswered thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy harte thy soule thy mynde chiefe greatest commaundemente whiche manne doeth perfourme kepe vnlesse kepe also seconde lyke vnto thou shalt loue thy neyghbour thy selfe doeth depende whatsoeuer commaunded whole lawe whatsoeuer prophetes teache comprysed two commaundementes whosoeuer loueth god hearte neglecte nothyng hath commaunded loueth neyghboure himselfe steale commyt aduoutry beare false witnesse desyre neyghbours substaunce finally nothing would doen himselfe pharisey become nowe almoste tempter disciplein twoe commaundementes c sayed maister thou hast spoken truely rightly one god nother onely ought loued aboue thynges power must bende affeccions towardes hym onely loue neyghbour selfe holocaustes sacrifice iesus seyng aunswered wyselye went forwarde lye wayte sayeth vnto thou arte farre kyngdome god perceyued best lacked onely folowe affeccion harte vnderstode meane tyme touched secretly conscyence certayne phariseis whiche layed deadly wayte iesus therfore whereas demaunded onely chiefe commaundement kepyng whiche falsly toke vpo purposely added seconde concernyng loue neyghboure yet supposed christe god theyr neyghbour one doen muche could deny agaynste whome notwithstandyng deuise man would haue come vnto hymselfe whan phariseis gathered together iesus asked saying thinke ye christe whose sonne sayed vnto sonne dauid sayed vnto howe doth dauid spirite call hym lord saying lord sayed vnto lord sit thou ryghthand till make th ie enemy thy footestoole dauid call lord howe sonne man able answer thing neyther durst man daye furth aske hym moe question nowe whereas greater company phariseis gathered together iesus beyng tempted many question proposed vnto againe question signifying vnto sumwhat obscurely darkely whiche lefte declared afterward apostle tyme conuenient onely nature manne whiche sawe vpon would shewe crueltie also nature god sum myght haue coiectured dedes vnles enuy hatred ambicion auarice vice blinded mindes therfore demaudeth gathered together thought messias whose sone whose stocke come answer furthwith dauid saied iesus meaneth dauid misticall psalme inspired heauenly ghost calleth lord wheras sonne wrytten lorde sayed vnto lorde sitte ryghthande vntyll make thyne enemyes stoole thy feete howe agreeth yf sonne dauid father calleth sonne lorde one coulde looce knot coulde yet thynke nothyng godly nature iesus christe sonne dauid touchyng body man touchyng diuyne nature lorde dauid onely manne durst question hym sawe baytes snare whiche layed hym redounded vpon theyr owne head p xxiii chapter spake iesus people disciple saying scribe phariseis sit moyses seate therfore whatsoeuer kepe kepe workes saye bynde together heauy burden hard borne laye mennes shoulder themselues wyll lyfte one theyr fyngers workes seen men therefore whan iesus put often sylence presence multitude leste authoritie vtterly decay people ouer sette doctours teacher declared ought hearde folowed although moste agreable taketh vpon office teacher get credite autoritie doctrine vertuouse liuyng yet expediente vtterly despise holsome doctryne naughtie lyfe doctour reuerence whiche maners doe deserue muste geuen vnto author whose commaundementes recite preache lawe god polluted though vttered mouth naughty preacher truly vnto hym vnprofitable profitable taker therfore iesus tournyng awaye phariseis sawe hope better lyfe speaketh vnto people disciple maner scribe phariseis vtter themselues corrupte myndes haue enuiouse couetouse gredy vayne glory yet authoritie office must hearde occupye chayre moyses whose lawe teache thinges teache holy reache doctryne owne lyfe farre wyde distaunce theyr doctryneal therfore whatsoeeuer thei hid kepe kepe doe c wherfore whatsoeuer prescribe pointe vnto thautoritie moyses kepe beware ye frame maners theyr lyfe liued teache ye ought wholy folowe nowe teache exacte lawe men great seueritie pardon themselues rigorouse towarde others gentle themselues bynde together hea intolerable bundels comaundementes laye vpon mennes shoulder whiche wyll vouchesafe touche finger lode lawe heuy ynough selfe constitucios get fame learning holines perfourme thyng accordyng commaundement lawe hart prayse fame people player disgised person playe parte counterfayte viser religion seen men man kepeth lawe doeth lawemaker would requireth chiefly pure sincere mynde men whatsoeuer hauke vayne opinion holynes simple people set abrode philacteries enlarge border garmentes loue vppermoste seates feastes sit chiefe place counsel gritinges market called men rabbi ye called rabbi one maister christ ye brother call man father vpo earth one father whiche heauen neyther ye called maisters one maister christ greate among shalbe seruaut whoso exalteth himselfe shalbe brought lowe humbleth hymselfe shalbe exalted whan god commaundementes lawe geuen added thou shalt tye thy hande shall bee remoued thyne iyes meanyng therby ought neuer forgette commaundemetes god rule frame doinges life men neglectyng vtterly kepe commaundementes god yet magnifie themselues among people false apperaunce walke vp doune bearyng brode philacteries go brode gorgiouse imbroderinges shewe furth commaundementes lawe written lyfe neuer appeare haue written theyr harte expressed theyr lyfe please iyes god vnto onely lyfe play pageaunt beholder loker despised seke vile praise rude multitude whereas becummeth teacher euery expresse noble vertue maners sayinges also countenaunce men nothyng el vayne also scant worthy mete manne called supper place themselues chyldishly ambiciously honorable place offered vnto synagoges common councels loue honour high seate whan marketand called rabbi reioyce saluted honorably set vp combes often heare people honorable title rabbi saith worthy honour wyse least estemed god seme themselues greatest folishe seme themselues wise honor due god great dede honoured praise wisedome due onely god authoritie due god thynges men certayne shadowe yf compared greatnes god cummeth also bountefulnesse god therfore yf men yelde honour vnto menne gyftes god whiche suppose geuen ought chalenge hymselfe yelde whole vnto hym hath yea freely yf hath goodnesse would ye disciple like vnto rather remembring exaumple doctrine flee arrogant name wisedome please selues yf manne call rabbies saye maisters one vnto name truely agreeth common maister comparison hym nothyng el felowe scholers brother together among mutuall charitie maketh lyke cumly man prefer himselfe another contencion farre contrary saye one geue honour one gentlenes duetie preuente therfore call man maister earth seyng whatsoeuer holsome doctrine ye haue ye haue god bounde hym hym teacheth whosoeuer teacheth rightly inspiracion profiteth whosoeuer truly profiteth yelde heareafter vnto manne yearth honorable name father sith ye haue professed heauenly father vnto ye bounde lyfe whatsoeuer ye haue vpon ye wholy depende let manne therfore chalenge vnto hym honour due vnto god let man geue man due god prayse honour thankes must geuen man teache well let wisedom god praised doth shewe furth communicate herselfe man doth parte father diligence carefulnes let goodnes god praysed hym doeth prouide lorde iesus spake thinges though wicked thing call maister name maister call parent name parent communicacion endeuoureth plucke vtterly mindes pharisaicall ambicion whiche chalenge vnto god requireth honour people doctrine god though authours rather minister furthermore noted simplicitie flatterye people whiche praysed immoderately though bound men godwhoso exalteth himselfe c perceyued sprang suche ambicion poyson destruccion congregacions therfore finisheth communicacion clause greatest among shalbe minister hath hath receyued el hath receyued freely hath receyued geue therfore greater gyftes god shall arrogante carefull bestowe lowly humble leste lese arrogacy goddes liberalitie hath geuen vnto let geue glory vnto god authour chalengeyng nothing vnto himselfe diligence humble minister great dede whiche least owne conceyte begynneth least god great owne conceyte crake auaunce himselfe free giftes god spoyled whereof maketh himselfe vnwoorthy greatest become leaste contrarywise doeth submit humble himselfe knowlegyng setting furth weakenes knowlegyng gyftes god wherby great el shewing vttering profite commoditie brother prouoketh goddes liberalitie modestie gyftes beyng increased great made greater pbut woe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye shut kyngdom heaue men ye neither go selues neither suffer ye yt come enter iesus turnyng scribe phariseis inueyeth speaketh theyr malice openly frankly thretnyng vengeaunce god eyther might repent shame el might turne better feare punishment couterfeityng holines set aparte might beginne seruauntes euangelicall godlynes woe ye scribe phariseis hipocrites professyng knowlege lawe therfore maner kepe keyes kyngdome heauen ye onely enter selues ye shut doores would come vnto ye ought open doores ye resiste redinesse themselfe yf slacke ye ought pricke forwarde whereas ye see lyght ghospell nowe present yet glory auauntage ye kepe people shadowes lawe excludyng trueth woe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye deuout widowes house vnder pretence long prayer therfore shall ye greuously pu ished woe scribe phariseis hipocrites vnder colour religion deuour wydowes house ye deceyue false cloke holynes ye counterfeyte long prayer openly wheras myndes meane time loke naught el praye folyshe woman whiche styll beleue meane season ye talke god pwoe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye wander sea lande make one pro lite become one ye make hym two folde chyld hell ye selues woe scribe phariseis hipocrites ye walke landes sea intice sum one gentile profession lawe whan brought hope learne lawe brought suche case supersticiouse doctrine peruerse maners made pure wurshipper god heyre kyngdom heauen also wicked iewe beyng heathen daunger hell ye cummeth passe maner scholers oftentymes passe theyr naughtie master woe ye blynde guide ye saye whosoeuer swereth temple nothyng whosoeuer sweareth gold temple giltie ye fooles blinde whither greater golde temple sanctifieth golde whosoeuer sweareth aulter nothyng whosoeuer swereth gyft vpon giltie ye fooles blinde whether greater gyft aulter sanctifieth gyft whoso therfore swereth aulter swereth al thinges vpon whosoeuer swereth temple swereth dwelleth whoso swereth heauen swereth seate god hym sitteth vpon woe ye blynde guydes whiche take vpon teacher knowe ye teache swaruing scope ende lawe wresting thing ende owne lucre ye saye whosoeuer swereth temple lorde bounde othe whoso sweareth golde temple bounde othe lesse esteming corrupt iudgemet thinges holy themselfe thinges make auarice el ye folyshe blynde aunswere whiche holyer golde doeth garnyshe temple turned lucre matter excesse riote temple selfe whose holynes causeth golde prophane place counted holy also ye saye swereth aulter bound religion swereth gyft sette vpon aulter bound othe blynde teacher whether ought estemed gyft aulter whiche sanctifieth gyft gyft holy nother meanes set vpo holy aulter corrupte iudgemente ye wyll haue gyftes estemed holyer aulter turne profite whereas temple aulter buylte wurship glory god whiche ye lytle regarde inuencions el ye subuerte lawe god whiche forbiddeth periury lyke glosse ye subuerte commaundement honoryng father mother ye teache periury high perfeccion vtterly sweare yet whosoeuer swereth thyng whiche estemed holy swereth periured vnlesse doth perfourme othe whosoeuer swereth aulter swereth also thinges aulter whosoeuer swereth temple swereth also god dwelleth temple whosoeuer swereth heauen swereth seate god foloweth swereth hym sitteth whosoeuer swereth mannes head swereth thyng consecrate vnto god wherof swereth hath power woe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye byeth mynte anyse cummyn haue left weyghtier matter lawe iudgement mercy fayth thinges ye ought haue done leaue vndone ye blinde guide whiche streygne gnat swallowe camell woe scrybes phariseis hipocrites whiche exacte leste thynges pertayne vnto gayne whiche make lytle vnto true godlynes ye supersticiouse requiring tythes ye wyll geather tythes herbes moste vyle pryce estimacion mynte rue anyse cummyne meane season ye sette lytle thynges moste value whereupon dependeth true iustice say iudgement mercy faith iudgement ye iniury man mercy ye helpe oppressed nedy faith ye deceiue man periury thinges lawe requireth would haue chiefly regarded thynges lawe added lesse value therfore thinges firste ought regarded ernestly syth thought good small thynges omitted ye obserued kept thinges vttermost might appeare religion nowe muche ye let passe thinges without righteousnesse care thinges light litle worthe hypocrisie religion yea destruccion religion tenthes ordeyned yet vprightnes well doyng fayth required pertayned vnto prayse righteousenesse blynd guydes whiche beyng aukwarde religion streyne g swalowe vp camell supersticiouse litle thyng negligent great thyng woe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye make cleane vtter parte cup platter within full brybery excesse thou blynde pharisey make cleane first within cup platter sydes also may cleane woe scribe phariseis hipocrites ye carefull clenlynes disorderly ye clense cuppes dish candelstickes often washinges outwarde thinges defile mynde man within ye leaue vnwashed saye mynde defileth mynd man yf drynke vnwashed cuppe drynke wine gotten fraude yf drynke wine excesse necessitie likewyse ye washe body thinges whiche apperteyne vnto body ye purge minde vncleane defiled rauine filthy luste fylthy thinges thou pharisey speake say thou blinde pharisey thy title religion doest boast thy selfe maister ouer people thou blynde fyrst procure whiche onely perteyneth vnto matter thou fansy true cleanes clense first within yf thou thynke good clense vtter thinges body apparell pottes cuppes seates stuffe el shewe furth cleanesse thynges neglecte whiche onely make v cleane vncleane god cleanes hipocrisye destruccion true cleanes constitucions ye corrupte myndes symple trusting vpon cleanes despyse thynges whiche onely ought regarded pwoe vnto scribe phariseis hipocrites ye like paynted sepulchre appeare beautifull outwarde within full dead mennes bone filthines ye also outwardly appeare righteous vnto men within ye full dissimulacion iniquitie woe scribe phariseis hipocrites farre true cleanes ye lyke vnto whyted graues fayre coueryng shewyng outwardly counterfeyted cleanes inwardly full bone dead karkases filthynesse euen ye long prayer brode philactaries large gardes palenes fasting lyke coulours couterfeytinges seme outwardly religiouse perfect minde full hipocrisye euery syde berayed kynde vice woe vnto scribe phariseis ye builde tumbes prophetes garnishe sepulchre righteous say dayes father would haue felowes bloud prophetes ye witness vnto selues ye child hilled prophetes fulfill ye also measure father ye serpentes ye generacion viper howe wyll ye escape damnacion hell woe scribe phariseis hipocrites false boasting holines ye build vp honorably tumbes prophetes garnishe graues iust men forefather hath slayne making though ye fauoured vertue slaine detest cruelnes slayne ye saye liued tyme elder would haue consented death innocentes whereas nowe ye goe cruell thynges agaynst hym excelleth prophetes tyme come ye endeuour lesse agaynst whiche shall open waye euerlasting healthe muche ye minde truely ye declare ye verye naturall child killed prophetes monished frankly freely ye would haue better yf chaunced lyue theyr time go like vnto elder lacking extreme crueltie fulfill ye nothyng maye wante kylled propetes ye kyll ye prophetes prophecied serpentes ofspring viper murtherers child murtherers sith malice inuincible sith ye amended benefites miracle gentle rough communicacion promise threatninges case ye maye escape meane season iudgement men howe wyll ye escape iudgement hell ye heape vpo ye frayed desire killyng wicked example elder many prophetes sent ye haue slayne many last came selfe agaynst ye knowe ye haue endeuored pwherfore behold sende vnto prophetes wysemen scribe sum ye shall kill crucifie sum ye shall scourge sinagoges persecute citie citie vpon maye come righteouse bloud whiche hath shed vpon yearth bloud righteouse abell vnto bloud zacharie sonne barachias ye slewe betwene temple aulter uerely saye vnto thynges shall come vpon generacion contente maye euidente vnto men ye moste worthy moste cruell condemnacion behold sende againe vnto prophetes wysemen scribe great gentilnes maye reuoke crueltie vnto better mynde murder former tymes shall layed vnto charge yf ye doe penaunce preaching ye fauour ye kill swearde sum ye wyll beate downe stone sum ye wyll crucifie sum ye whyppe synagoges receiue case insomuch ye persecute fro citie citie vntill ye compell vncurable malice go gentile thyng ye shall prouoke theyre god agaynst whatsoeuer manslaughter hath committed elder firste murther cain killed brother abel vnto slaughter zachary sone barachias ye killed betwene temple aulter beeyng nothyng afrayed murder religion place punishement beeyng put differed shalbe powred vpon head haue onely folowed also farre passed crueltie forefather therfore misery shalbe notable whole worlde shal vnderstand great cruelnes nacion hath vsed euery good man howe stiffe rebellion hath agaynst god sufferyng long suche gentilnes prouokyng often suche benefites vnto better thinges hierusalem hierusalem thou killest prophetes stonest sent vnto thee often would haue gathered thy child together euen e gathereth et chicken vnder hir winges ye would beholde house lefte vnto desolate saye vnto ye shall see hence furth tyll ye say blessed cummeth name lorde thynges spoken moste meke lorde iesus goodnes would manne vtterly peryshe consideryng miserable destruccion nowe hand citie hierusalem thinges present vnto iyes therewith also theyr inuincible stubbernes wherwith turne goddes gentilnes fury rage doeth bewayle lamentably destruccion nacion iewes geuyng incklyng seconde cumming last iewes shall repent ouer late acknowlege christ deny theyr profite nowe confesse theyr sauiour sent god syng hartely vnto whiche disdayne child syng blessed cummeth name lorde hierusalem hierusalem whiche killest prophetes stonest death sent vnto thee howe often haue trauayled gather thy child together lyke carefull henne fearing chicken doth clocke together noryshe vnder wynges thou wouldest nothyng let passe behalfe wherby thou mightest saued contrary wyse thou haste done thou canst bryng destruccion thee exclude saluacion thee freewill geuen cannot saued agaynst wyll wyll ought agreable vnto wyll behold miserable calamitie ouer heades dwelling place shall left de ecte ye shall left blyndnes vntyll beyng taught great misery ye fall repentaunce saye vnto hereafter ye shall see vntyll tyme come wherin ye beholding iyes fayth shall say blessed cummeth name lorde ye falsely accuse cummeth name beelzebub p xxiiii chapter iesus went departed temple disciple came shewe dym buildinges temple iesus sayed vnto see ye thinges uerely say vnto shall left one stone vpon another shall destroyed iesus represente certeyne sygne token temple religion iewes lawe shortly abolished departing churche began go awaie disciple heard sum mencion destruccio shewe lorde hougenes temple suche merueylous piece worke semed pitie destroied fyrmely buylte semed possible hurled downe iesus aunswered see ye assured none strong goodly holy shall throwen downe hurled piece one stone shall stande pand sate vpon mount oliuete disciple came vnto secretly saying tell v whan shall thinges shalbe token thy cumming end worlde iesus aunswered sayed vnto take hede man deceiue many shall come iny name saying christe shall deceyue many ye shall heare warres tidinges warres troubled must come passe ende yet nacion shall rise nacion realme realme shall pestilence hunger yearthquakes place beginninges sorowes thinges spoken iesus went mount oliues sate hauing temple sight fower disciple whome called first peter iames iohn andrew went vnto seuerally knowe certainly time whan suche great misery fall supposed byan destruccion citie hierusalem hurlyng downe temple christe would come agayne maiestie christe make vigilante ware tempereth communicacion willeth know tyme latter cummyng yet thorough rehersyng misery maketh carefull redines cumming misery disciple therfore saye tell v thinges whiche thou speakest shall come passe signe token maye knowe thy cummyng ende worlde hande iesus aunsweryng whiche demaunded turneth rather thynges whiche prepare theyr myndes continuall watche ghospell shall come dede henacio shall arise agaist nacion realme agaynste realme c beware leste man making lye touchyng cumming deceyue many shal come shall take vpon name say christe shall fynde deceyue folishe lyght belefe tumult hurlyburly thynges shall shewe certayne apperaunce ende worlde hande ye shall heare warres sundrye rumour warres sore cruell wonte thinges theyr selfe let thinges discourage myndes ye thinke latter time nowe hande troublesome worlde must nedes arise ende illes shall furth storme shall sprede farder abrode onely hierusalem shall destroyed whole world shall buckell together warres slaughter nacion shall rise agaynst nacion kyngdom shall skirmishe kyngdom greatest parte mischiefe miserie men shall suffer men furthermore god taking vengeaunce shall put vnto scourge pestilence famine diuerse place earthquake thinges yet certayne argumente worldes ende signes token ill misery breding last greatest storme wherwith worlde shall peryshe pthen shall put trouble shall kyll ye shall hated nacions name sake shall many offended shall betray one another hate one another many false prophetes shall arise deceyue many iniquitie shall haue vpper hande loue many shalbe colde endureth ende thesame shalbe safe ghospell kyngdome shalbe preached worlde witnesse nacions th n ende shall come ye meane season shall free suche maner illes miseriesand ye shal hated nacions name sake c tumulte hurly burly thynges men shall plucke diuerse affliccions finally kyll meane season ye shall hated onely iewes gentile ill dedes ye professe name meane time many offended greued aduersities ouercummed punishmentes shall swarue professing name one shall betraye one kinesman shall betraye one frende nature hath coupled bandes charitie shall hate eche shall also another kynde ill greuouse intollerable shall arise false prophetes false teacher counterfeiting preach ghospell shall see prouide owne glory owne lucre theyr owne belly instede spirite shall inspire theyr owne disciple spirite sathan stede kyngdome heauen shall teache kingdome worlde punishmentes tormentes could ouercome shall caught snare menne deadly enemy familiar fayned frende mischifes misery man shall loke muche comfort brother frendes multitude sinnes beyng great charitie many shall waxe colde yet perill ye perseuer continue vnto ende constant valiant courage greatnes aduersitie destroy man lacketh ryght mynde wyll suffer peryshe ghospell oppressed nay tumultes trouble strength ghospell shall encrease storme ylles shall able doe nother thyng agaynst make godlynes better tried appeare ende worlde shall come ghospell kyngdome heauen preached throughout al kyngdomes worlde hath come nacions leste would obey myght pretende ignoraunce shall doen shall come ende worlde whan ye therfore shall see abhominacion desolacion spoken daniell prophete standing holy place whoso readeth let hym vnderstande wherof ye seke token whan ye shall see abhominable idoll whiche shall endeuour vtterly subuerte religion ghospell whiche daniell tymes past prophecied vnto saying middes weeke sacrifice offeryng shall taken waie abhominacion desolacions shall temple vnto ende worlde ye shall see saye abhominable idoll set temple towre holynes readeth prophecie prophete let vnderstand woorde misticall requireth spirituall reader let iewry flee vnto mountaynes let hym whiche house toppe come downe take thyng house let hym fieldes retourne backe fetche clothes therfore storme shalbe hand city iewry let forsake city flee mountaynes toppes house let leape downe come downe take thyng waie house found fielde tyme let runne backe theyr house fetche theyr apparell shall leysure prouyde theyr goodes great matter yf saue theyr lyfe spedy flyght thother thinges may recouered lyfe loste cannot restored pwoe shalbe dayes childe geue sucke pray ye flyght ill wynter sabboth day shalbe great tribulacion suche hath begynnyng worlde vntyll time shalbe except dayes shortened haue fleshe saued electes sake dayes shalbe shortened therfore woman childe woman geue suche shalbe yll case dayes great cannot caste burden theyr belly flee awaye spedely geue sucke cannot caste theyr child loue tenderly themselues lyke doe caste money apparell shall lette neyther house neyther possession child ye must onely pray chaunce ye compelled flee wynter sabboth day ye must flee spedely farre wynter reason roughnes shortnes dayes commodiouse iourney sabboth day religion lawe letteth ye cannot flee farre time shalbe sore vehement affliction neuer synce worlde made vnto daye hereafter neuer shalbe yf calamitie continuall vehemente man lefte alyue theyr malyce deserue vtter destruccion electe neuer fewe dayes shalbe shortened yf man saye vnto lo christe beleue shall aryse false christes false prophetes shall shewe great signes woonders insomuche yf possible electe brought errour beholde haue tolde wherfore yf say vnto loe deserte goe ye furth beholde secrete place beleue lyghtnyng cummeth east appeareth vnto west shall cummyng sonne man wheresoeuer dead ca ra shall thyther wyll also egles gathered together confusion hurly burly thynges whan cumming shall loked men must take diligent hede deceyued throughe crafte deceyuers shall ryse many false christes whiche shall boaste themselues christe rather myne aduersaries whiche also shall saye prophetes rather teacher errours shall furnished craftes false cloke holynes also shall counterfeyte power woonders magicall meruailes shall take vpon person many marueylouse iuglynges electe also yf possible shoulde brought errour ye therfore monished beware haue told intent ye beware say christe deserte goe loe inner parlers goe loe beleue seconde cuming shall sorte ye see say softe milde humble sodayne compassing whole world sodayne light maiestie lyke lightnyng shynyng furth flasheth sodaynely east west shall cummyng sonne man ye nede feare shall suche confusion hurly burly thinges whersoeuer body shalbe thyther shal egles flocke gather head shall lacke membres p immediatly tribulacion dayes sonne shalbe derkened moone shall geue light sterres shall fall fro heauen power heauen shalbe moued shall appe heauen token sonne man shall kyneedes earth mourne shall see sonne man cumming cloudes heauen great power glory shal sende angel great voyce trumpet shall gather together chosen fro fower wyndes highest parte heauen vnto endes heauenly bodyes also shall feele greatnes calamitie sonne shall darkened sonne beeyng darkened whereof moone borowed lyght moone shall shewe lyght starres shall fall heauen power heauen shall shake beeyng daunger fallyng among great thycke darkenesse signe sonne man shall shyne heauen signe saye wherby ouercame sathan consumed al tyranny signe wherby sathan craked vayne hygher hande seen nacions whole worlde shall strike theyr brestes iewes shall see haue offended gentyles shall see maiestie crosse whiche laughed skorne shall see sonne man nowe despise humble simple cummyng hygh cloudes ayer great army aungels wonderfull maiestie glory shall sende furthe aungels gather together sounding trump elect fower wyndes high toppe heauen vttermoste coaste learne similitude figgetree whan boughes yet tendre leaues sprong ye knowe summer nigh lykewyse ye ye shall see thynges ye sure nere euen doores uerely saye vnto generacion shall passe vntyll thinges doen heauen yearth shall passe woorde shall passe day houre man knoweth angel heauen father onely tyme thinges shall come passe exactly determine yet aduersities whiche haue recited certayne preamble token ye maye gesse tyme far lyke figgetree doth declare certayne token summer hande whan blowyng westerne wynde boughes begyn reder buddes spryng fu h leaues desire sprede abrode ye also whan ye shall see thynges whiche haue spoken knowe ye well cummyng sonne god hande assure generacion shall passe thynges whiche spoken shall come passe heauen yearth shall perishe rather woorde shalbe vayne therfore inough knowe signes whiche portende shewe daye cummyng leste come vpon vnwares parte searche exactly daye houre whan sonne man shall come forasmuche knowledge thynges geuen aungels heauen sonne man knoweth father hath reserued vnto hymselfe alone expedien e uente ye may alwaye redines pbut dayes noe shall also cummyng sonne manne dayes went lud eate drynke marry maryed vntyll daye noe entred ship knewe tyll flud came toke away shall also cumming sonne man shall two e fielde one taken ye refused two woman shalbe grynding l one receiued refused two bed one shalbe receiued refused day shall cum sodaynly vnwares vnto others lyke tyme noe whan fludde tolde certayne yeares yet thinkyng cum passe dyd eate dryncke married furthe theyr doughters marryed wyues vntill last day whyche noe entred arcke beleued fludde shoulde cum passe vntill sawe nowe hande wherewyth destroyed example noe woulde prepare themselues agaynst day lyke fewe taken arcke preserued whyche leste without peryshed euen tyme sonne manne shal cum shall peryshe shall sodainly deuided shall saued shallbe two labouring one field felowes worke wage one shall taken shall forsaken shall two grynding one myll whereof one shalbe taken shalbe forsaken yea two lye one bed one shalbee taken shalbee forsaken woorke place manner lyfe affeccion good desyre shal make man blessed watche therfore ye knowe houre lorde wyll cum thys yet sure good man house knewe houre e would cum would surely watche suffer hys house broken vp therfore ye also ready suche houre ye thynke wyl sonne man cum wherfore seing thynges vndoubtedly shal cum passe cannot certainly knowen vpon daye shal cum wake watche co tinually leste daie cum vpon vnwares vnprepared menne watche theyr money peryshe muche oughte watche soule perishe householder negligent whych yf knew thiefe would breake hys house nyght season woulde sleepe nyght suffer hys house broken downe therfore ye muste wake lyfe ye certayne daye wyl cum whan ye looke ye must liue whansoeuer day dothe cum may finde duty furthwyth ye may receiued vnto rewarde faythful wyse seruaunt whome hys lorde hath made ruler ouer hys housholde geue meate season blessed seruaunt whome lorde whan cummeth shall fynde uerely saye vnto shall make ruler ouer goodes yf euil seruaunt saye hert lord wyll long cummyng begyn smyte felowes yea eate drincke dronken seruauntes lorde shal cum daye whan loketh houre ware shal hewe hym piece geue hym hys porcion hiprocrites shall wepyng gnashyng teeth wyll wyse faythfull seruaunt thesame whome maister going farre home hathe made ruler ouer hys familie geue meate due season maister doth poynte hym wyl retourne home leste shoulde bee slacke hys office whansoeuer mayster shall returne shal seruaunt happy yf hys maister finde duty certaynely saye vnto maister hauing triall trustinci e bee bolde truste hym greater thynges wyll make hym ruler ouer hys goodes contrary wise yf ill vnfaithfull seruaunt wil saye hys harte mayster longe awaye perchaunce wyll neuer returne vpon hope begynneth beate hys felowe seruauntes neglecting famylye eateth drynketh dronckardes howe vnhappy shall hys mayster shal cum daye loketh hym houre thought would returne shal onely set hym beside offyce also cut sonder myddest ioyne hys parte hipocrytes hath title name office ghospel doinges contrarye ghospell hys sensuall pleasure wrongshaped swetenesse wherewith beyng inebriate drounken awayted cummyng hys mayster shall punished intollerable torment laughyng shalbe turned wepyng hys songes gnashyng teethe p xxv chapter shall kyngdome heauen like vnto ten virgin whiche takyng theyr lampes wente furthe meete spouse fyue foolyshe fyue wyse foolyshe takynge theyr lampes tooke oyle wyse tooke oyle theyr vessel lampes whyle spouse taryed slumbered slepte midnight crye made beholde spouse cummeth goe furth meete hym virgin arose prepared theyr lampes foolishe sayed vnto wyse geue v oyle lampes wyse answered saying leste ynoughe v goe ye rather seller selues whyle wente bye bridegrome came ready went hym mariage doore shutte afterwarde cum virgin saiyng lorde lorde open vnto v answeryng sayeth uerely saye vnto knowe watche therfore ye knowe day houre whiche sonne man shal cum iesus put myndes hys disciple surely shoulde slacke sleepe thys life continuall seruyce godlinesse duty towarde theyr neyghboure shoulde get prepare thynges waye euerlastyng lyfe resurreccion shoulde seke late vnlesse shoulde prepare tyme sette furthe parable tenne virgin takyng theyr lampes wente meete spouse fyue fooles whych prouided oyle agaynste cummyng bridegrome thought woulde cumme sodenly myghte haue space gette oyle sumwhere wyse virgin knowyng tyme vncertayne whan theyr spouse shoulde cum leste myght bee found vnredy caryed theyr vesselles oyle theyr lampes whereby myght refreshe lampes began fayle therefore spouse differred hys cumming longe virgines beganne nappe length fel slepe dead nighte sodainly rose clamour noyse emong seruauntes callyng oute meete spouse beholde bridegrome hande goe furthe meete hym al virgines wakyng slepe prepared lampes fooles sawe muste departe sodainely middenight hadde oyle theyr lampes nowe faylyng lyght desyred wyse virgines geue parte theyr oyle made answere feare haue inough v go ye rather oyle seller meane tyme went bye brydegrome came ready entred mariage furthwith gate shut last come foolyshe virgin also knocke gate saye lorde lorde open gate v unto whome brydegrome made answere truely knowe wherfore example wyse virgyns faythful seruaunt politike householder watche ye prepare time stoare good workes ye knowe daye houre hys cummyng shall sodenly appeare shalbe nowe lenger time well doyng euery manne shall haue rewarde accordyng hath done likewise certaine man taking iourney straung countrey called seruauntes deliuered vnto hys gooddes vnto one gaue fyue talentes another two another one accordyng hys habilitie streyght way departed receiued fyue talentes went occupyed wyth gay ed fiue talentes lykewise also receyued two gayned two receyued one went digged yearth hyd lordes moneye iesus added also another parable stirryng hys disciple continuall desyre good woorkes shoulde suffer doctrine gyftes gaue bee barren vnfruitfull theyr negligence theyr diligence carefulnesse shoulde turne profite theyr neyghboure make themselues mete greater giftes hadde bestowed thyng hadde receyued theyr measure capacitie theyr maisters aduauntage desireth enriched suche gayne certayne man goyng farre home called seruauntes deliuered hys goodes spende lauyshe oute owne pleasure gette sum vauntage therof theyr mayster whome receyued stocke one gaue one talente vnto another two agayne another fyue thought euery man meete thys done furthwith toke hys iourney therfore hadde fyue talentes committed vnto hym ceased wente furthwith lente furthe moneye taken vsurye often laste vsurye gayned asmuche hys stocke came fyue talentes made tenne lyke maner two talen committed vnto hym soe occupied vsurye made gaine good stocke one talente deliuered went hys wayes slogisshenes hyd talente receyued grounde thynkyng ynoughe yf restored agayne stocke maister long season lorde seruauntes came rekened receiued fiue talentes came brought fyue talentes saiyng lorde thou deliueredst vnto fyue talentes behold haue gained fyue talentes mo lorde sayed vnto hym good faythfull seruaunt thou haste faithfull ouer thynges wyll make ruler ouer many thynges enter thou ioye thy lorde also receyued two talentes came sayed lord thou deliuerest vnto two talentes lo haue wonne two talentes lord saied vnto good faythfull seruaunt thou haste faithfull ouer fewe thinges enter ioye thy lorde therfore long iourneying maister returned home required accoumpte hys seruauntes deliuered layed came furth whiche receiued fyue talentes brought fyue whiche gayned vsury makyng accoumpt sorte ye gaue stocke fiue talentes lo haue gayned muche maister praisyng diligence hys seruaunte saieth good trusty seruaunt haue founde trusty litle money wyll truste mo thynges enter ioye thy maister came also vnto whome maister committed two talentes beyng commaunded make accoumpt sayethe syr ye committed vnto stocke two talentes lo haue gayned muche agayne vsury maister commendyng diligence seruaunte also sayeth good trustye seruaunt haue founde trusty litle hereafter wyll truste greater thynges enter thy maysters ioye whyche receyued one talente came sayed lorde knewe thou arte hard man reapyng thou haste sowen gatheryng thou hast strawed therfore afrayed went hyd thy talent yearth lo thou hast thyne lorde answered saied vnto hym thou euil slouthfull seruaunt thou knewest reape sowed gathered haue strawed thou oughtest therfore deliuer moneye exchaungers cummyng haue receyued owne wyth gayne take therfore talente hym geue vnto hym whyche hath ten talentes euery one hath shal bee geuen shall haue aboundaunce hath hym shalbe taken away whyche hath caste vnprofitable seruaunte vtter darkenes shal wepyng gnashyng teeth finally came also whyche hadde hyd grounde talente hadde receyued beyng commaunded render accoumpte doethe onelye acknowelege faulte slowthefulnesse also accusyng hys maister roughnes greate couetousnes doeth double faulte hys duetye neglected syr knewe ye roughe sore manne ye take haruest ye sowed gather gayne ye coste therefore fearyng leste yf stocke anye chaunce shoulde haue lost ye woulde haue cruell sore agaynste wente hydde youre talente grounde thys hadde rather doe goe aboute gette gayne vsury meane season daunger stocke lo thou haste thyne owne deserue prayse increase game yet haue prouided stocke shoulde bee safe sure communication maister turneth hys owne heade saiyng thou naughty slouthfull seruaunte thou knowest thou sayest desitouse gayne take harueste haue sowen gather gayne bestowed coste therefore oughteste thou haue committed moneye vnto exchaungers hunte gayne whereas haue done coste shoulde haue cumme required moneye gayne haue taken auauntage hadde sowen doone coste stocke myne thyne thou bounde diligent seruaunt vnto thy mayster turnyng vnto seruauntes sayed take awaye talente thys vnprofitable seruaunte geue hym hath tenne talentes meruayled commaunded geuen vnto hym whyche alreadye aboundantlye mayster sayeth shall cumme passe thys kynde ryches whoso hath worthye receyue maye abounde haue plenty slouthefulnes hathe gotte hym maner gaine shall robbed also semeth haue vnworthye haue furthermore take awaye vnprofitable seruaunte syght caste hym outewarde darkenes stede ioye hys maister whych would deserue shall pained wepyng gnashing teeth suche parable lorde iesus pricked forward disciple bothe greatnes rewardes feare punishementes vnto desyre euangelicall godlines also doe theyr neyghboures feare slouthfulnes boldenes yll doyng whan sonne man cummeth hys glory hys holy angel hym shall sit vpon seate hys glory hym shall gathered nacions shall separate one another sheperde doeth seperate shepe goates shall set shepe ryght hande goates lefte hande whyche thyng dyd also farre manifestly clerely last narracion layeth theyr lye bothe maiestye cummyng separacion good yll whyche nowe lyue churche mixte together also dyuerse desertes rewardes bothe partes shortly setteth theyr iyes whole maner latter iudgemente knowyng consyderyng day deathe nowe hande intente disciple instructed many lessos case discourage theyr harte shamefull death crosse comforte solace present affliccion shame consideracion felicitie glory cum also thei go withe vengeaunce yll wicked men forasmuche knew according theyr desertes iudgemente shoulde bee punished eternally sonne man whome ye shall see shortely low abiect shall cum maiestie company al angel gardyng shall sit iudge ouer seate hys maiestie al nacions whole worlde shalbe called hym man high low escape iudgemente thys shalbe done man coniectures exact iudgemente god vnto whose iyes thynges open first shall seperate good yll lyke sheperde numbreth hys flocke dothe shed shepe goates shall sette shepe innocentes well doer ryght hand shall set goates hurteful yll doer lefte hand whole number men deuided two rayes sortes iust iudge wil shewe vnto bothe iuste cause iudgemente good maie know well doynges haue attained vnto great felicitie yll may heare offence haue deserued euerlastyng punishemente kyng shall saye vnto hys ryght hand cum ye blessed father possesse ye kyngdome prepared begynnyng worlde hungred ye gaue meate athyrste ye gaue drinke harbou lesse ye toke naked ye clothed sicke ye visited prison ye came iuste shall answere saiyng lorde dyd see hungry fed thee athyrst gaue drynke whan see thee harbou lesse tooke thee naked clothed thee whan dyd see thee sycke prison came vnto thee kyng answeryng shal saye vnto verely saye vnto asmuche ye haue done vnto one leaste brother ye haue done salutyng sorte ryght hande mylde merye chere shall saye cum frendes whome worlde tooke vyle execrable father taketh honourable prayse worthye illes displeasure whych ye haue suffered sake take inheritauce heauenly kyngdome whiche diuine prouision counsell prepared god foreknower thynges world made great rewarde thought good recompence workes greate loue towarde leste ye myght thynke lost tymes paste hungrye ye gaue meate whan thyrsty ye gaue drynke whan straunger nedye harboure ye toke houles whan naked ye couered whan sycke ye dyd visite whan prison ye came comforte ye gaue youres suche nowe othersyde communicate geue vnto whole kyngdome whiche common father whan thynges shalbe hearde iust menne whiche doethe vse workes charitie maner knowe haue dooen shall aunswere hym saiyng lorde sawe thee hungrye fed thee thrysty gaue thee drynke whan saw thee straunger brought house whan dyd couer beyng naked whan dyd visite thee beyng sicke whan dyd cum vnto thee beyng prison kyng shall saye openly would accounted doen hym soeuer geuen one whome worlde despiseth theyr pouertye lownes yet despyseth insomuch vouchsafe honour name brother certaynely shall saye saye vnto althoughe haue nede man helpe whiche lorde ouer yet whereas ye haue doen thynges sake anye poore litle brother ye haue doen pthan shall saye shalbe lefte hand depart ye cursed tye euerlastyng whyche prepared deuill hys angel haue hungered ye haue geuen meate haue thyrsted ye haue geuen drynke haue bene harbourlesse ye haue taken haue naked haue clothed haue bene sicke prison ye haue visited shal also answere hym saye lorde see thee hungrye thirsty harbou le naked sycke prison minister vnto thee shall answere vnto saiyng verely saye vnto muche ye one least ye dyd shal go euerlastyng punishement iust life euerlastyng horrible loke turnyng shall stande lefte hand shall geue terrible sentence goe awaye ye whome worlde flattered praysed exectable cursed father go fyer neuer shall bee quenched whiche prepared begynnyng worlde deuill angelles vnto ye hadde rather sticke vnto whan hungrye ye gaue meate whan thyrsty ye gaue drynke wandred lacked harbour ye toke naked ye couered sicke prison ye visite shall aunswere iudge manye wordes iuste menne answered lorde whan sawe thee hungrye thyrsty wanderyng naked sicke prison serued kyng shall aunswere also whatsoeuer dutyes denyed one litle one litle regarded worlde yet brother counte denyed vnto nedy woulde haue refresshed sentence geuen whiche shall none appeale left hande shall gee euerlastyng fyer iust men euerlastyng lyfe xxvi chapter came passe whan iesus finished sayinges sayed vnto hys disciple ye knowe two dayes shall paaste daye sonne man shall deliuered vp crucified whan iesus ended communication many wayes established myndes disciple agaynst affliccions beyng hande vtterly dismayed whan shortly see theyr lorde caryed awaye shamefull punishmente laste bolde open vnto daye manner hys deathe mention whereof doth inculcate beate disciple myndes leste whan see amased thyng vnwares loked vtterly discouraged chiefly whan thei perceyue iesus came vnto hys deathe willynly whiche mough haue escaped coulde kylled day came whiche hymselfe apoynted death paasse daie emong ye iewes kepte wyth great deuocion renewyng yearely remembraunce daye whiche tyme paste amonge egypcians postes beyng sprinkeled bloude lambe deliuered kylling aungell passed ouer safely red sea remembraunce thys thyng offered yearely lambe one yeare withoute spot passyng angel lucky passyng ouer sea called p asse figure iesus christe whiche shoulde redeme whole worlde hys holy bloud tyrannye synne alone cleane spottes synne iesus putryng disciple remembraunce thyng sayth ye knowe two dayes paasse shall bee offered daye sonne man shalbe deliuered crucified assembled together chiefe priestes scribe elder people palace chiefe prieste called cayphas helde counsell take iesus deceyte kyll hym sayed holy daye leste vprore among people therfore holy chereful daye nere keping mete menne prepare themselues godlye woorkes chiefe priestes seniours people wer gathered together whose authoritie yf hadde bene rage emong people oughte furthwith haue pacified gathered together courte chiefe priestes whiche called caiphas chiefly conspired agaynst iesus feared leste yf shoulde bee preserued shoulde leese theyr luere authoritie therfore de red wicked counsell shoulde laye handes vpon iesus kyll hym openlye violently deceite gu le therfore greate men agreed emong themselues vngraciouslye murder consulted tyme although thyrsted sore innocent bloud beyng madde enuye hatred yet thoughte beste differ deathe tyme daye cheeflye holye festiual emonge iewes hande feated shoulde sette vpon hym day people wonte resort together leste tumulte busynesse shoulde ryse manye emong people whiche seing hys miracle hearyng hys meruaylouse doctrine markyng great sobernes gentilnes hys manner greate opinion hym feared people whyche feared god feared defyle holy daye murder whyche durst eate leauen breade sathan gaue counsell desyring kepe close sacrifice whiche shoulde bryng health saluacion worlde pleased otherwyse deuyne counsell semely sacrifice shoulde priuely caste awaye whiche father would offered onely saluacion iewes saluacion also whole worlde whan iesus bethanie house simon lepet came woman hauyng alabas er bore precious oyntment powred vpon hys head sate bourde disciple sawe disdayned saiyng nede waste ointment might haue wel sold geuen poore wha iesus knewe thys sayed trouble ye woman hathe w ough e good worke toward ye haue alwaies poore folke ye haue alwaies hath e oyntmente body burye uetely say vnto whersoeuer gospel shall preached world also hath done shalbe tolde memoriall therfore whan iesus bethania nere vnto hierusalem crucified sate meate house one simon called lepet certayne woman came vnto hym hauyng alabaster precious oyntement broke alabaster powred oyntment vpon hys heade disciple seeyng thing great price powred caste oute disdayned murmured knewe iesus wont vse suche delicacy shoulde haue bene appetite yf woman deliuered alabaster whole oyntmente beyng solde poore men myght relieued value hereof purpose leese suche precious thyng myghte haue bene solde muche value therof geuen poore thus sayde disciple vnderstandyng purpose iesus suffered done loue suche delicacy woulde haue deathe adorned suche honour whiche death would suffer necessitie hys owne wyll health whole worlde whereas hys lyfe behaued hymselfe lowlye yet honoured hys deathe certayne magnificence deathe ouercum deuil therefore caryed hierusalem greate tryumphe preuentynge honoure hys buryall embaumed swete oyntmente whan deade woulde bee buryed newe sepulchre grauen stone woulde bee wynded cleane shete would buried busy care noble man karkases ryche honorable men wont embaumed precious oyntmentes eyther honour elles preserue theyr bodyes corrupcion shoulde reuiue ryse agayne hys frendes shoulde hym thys honoure suffered pompe buriall bee bestowed vpon hym hys death intente myght imprinte manye meanes disciple myndes mention deathe honoure mitigate horriblenes therof therfore disciple beyng ignoraunt thynges murmured grutched costes expense iesus refrayned saiyng ye grieued woman hath done godlye office louyng benefite whiche shall shortly dye meete ye haue enuy thys last honoure poore men common sorte ye haue alwayes ye maie doe good ye shall euer haue oyntment lost woman gessing shortely dye offyce duetye hath preuented buryall hath powred vpon beyng alyue wonte powred vpon dead therefore depraue godlinesse whiche acceptable vnto god whereas gospell deathe shalbe preached throughout worlde woman also shallbe mencioned whiche godly holy duety hathe preuented sepulture one twelue called iudas iscarioth went vnto chiefe priestes sayed vnto ye geue deliuer hym vnto appoynted hym thiety denaries tyme furth sought oportunitie betraye hym communicacion hadde repressed disdayne others erred simplicitie knowyng misterye yet pacified iudas iscarioth whiche falsely pretended care poore ucre gayn pleasaunte vnto bare purse wount steie sumwhat ye thynges geuen liberall frendes iesus distributed emog poore hereof litle litle encreased money therfore whan wholy geuen filthy disease auarice myndyng recompense whiche counted lost oyntmente pryce lorde wente vnto chyefe pryestes offycers whome knewe bent myndes conspired deathe iesus nothyng lette myght taken withoute tumulte busines bring passe wer done mete tha sum number whiche familiare lord nexte aboute hym knewe certaynely whyther iesus wont go hys secret place praie one found chosen piked humbre twelue christ toke vnto hym bee chiefe ouer whiche loued better wycked gayne mylde beneficiall lorde greate poyson auarice possesse wholy mynde man iesus woulde signifye thys example beyng corrupt desyre money woulde betraye woorde gospell mischiefe shoulde chieflye cum beyng chiefe heades religion churche semeth priuy secretes theyr lord familiar wrong interpretacion betray doctrine wicked prophane ruler whiche seke nothyng elles destruccion truethe gospell iudas therfore goyng vnto officer sayd reward wil ye geue delyuer hym handes thei bargayne wyth hym thyrty denaryes litle wage could yered beastely cruell dede lyghtly vilelye precious bloude estemed whiche sufficient redeme whole mankynde therefore iudas gredye gapyng money promysed hym time forwarde sought occasion betraye iesus fyrst day vnleaueued bread disciple came iesus saiyng vnto hym wile thou prepare eate paasse sayde go citie suche man saye vnto hym mayster sayeth tyme hande doe kepe easter disciple disciple dyd iesus appoynted made ready paasse therfore whan first daye seuen hand whiche iewes accustomed abstayne leauen breade eatyng pa hall lambe disciple go vnto iesus saying lord wyll ye shall prepare place feaste kepe youre paasse greate scartenes neyther disciple house theyr go iesus shewe whole matter mistical doen chaunce necessitie thynges done prescience cou sell god answered god citie anon ye entre shall meete certayne manne bearyng potte water folowe hym wheresoeuer goeth ye shall go saye houesholder maister sayeth tyme hande thy house kepe paasse disciple shall shewe great fayre parlet prepare paasse disciple went founde thynges iesus tolde prepared hym feaste place commaunded whan euen cum sate downe twelue eatyng said uerely saye vnto one shall betraye exceadyng sorowful beganne euery one saye lord answered sayde dippeth hys hand dyshe shal betraye sonne man goeth written hym wo vnto man sonne man betrayed hadde good man yf bene borne iudas whiche betraied hym answered sayed mayster sayd vnto hym thou hast sayed towarde nyght iesus went thither sate downe suppe twelue disciple supper iesus sayeth vnto one shall betraye sayed declare nothyng hyd hym also conscience traytour beyng touched myght turned vnto penaunce woord al theyr harte began heuy euery man suspected distrusted hymselfe knowyng weakenes man desyryng therfore bee deliuered heauines began aske seuerally lorde iesus suwhat confirme establyshe others almoste dead feare touche conscience iudas sharpely yf perhappes myght moued vnto penauce pointed authour dede certayne sygne withal put hym remembraunce great familiaritye whiche ought haue withdrawen mad mischiefe faiyng putteth hand dishe felow onelye table also dishe shall betraye offyce familiaritye shal rendre vnto office extreme enmitie whereas communion felowshypp breade salte bee wonte ioyne men vnknowen vnacquaynted bonde amitie thynges chaunce sonne man ordeyned heretofore father prophecied prophetes yet wo man whose wickednes sonne man betrayed diuine wisedome dothe vse hys wickednes saluacion mankynde yet lesse fault owne malice brought dede whereas omitted nothyng whereby myghte heale hys mynd wherfore wicked deed shall cruellye punished vnlesse repente bene better neuer haue borne communicacion whiche shame might haue healed yll man payne myght haue feared wicked manne made iudas nothyng better insomuche ioyned impudencie vnshame fastnes hys wicked deed thoughe knowen nothing culpable asked lord iesus forgettyng wont tentilnes answered thou haste sayde geuyng incklyng rather expressyng playnly maketh though suspicion knowledge whan wer eatyng iesus toke bread geuen thankes brake gaue disciple sayed take eate body toke cup gaue thankes deliuered saiyng drynke ye bloud whiche newe testament shed many remission sinnes say vnto wyl drynke hencefurth fruit vyne tree vntil day shall drynke newe father kingdome therfore latter supper yt made disciple deathe dyd institute holye remembraunce hys death beyng often renewed perpetuall memorial emong great charytie whereby sticked bestowe lyfe redeme mankinde remembraunce godly sacrifice shoulde neuer myndes wherein pure immaculate lambe newe trewe paasse offered selfe aulter crosse v god father beyng angrye hath made mercifull v hys bloud sufferyng paynes himselfe offense whiche due sinfulnes iesus dyd institute consecrate secrete signe memoriall two thynges amitie emong men wont intertayned charitie christ gaue himselfe shoulde couple v together also oftentymes eate together one breade drynke one cuppe also shewyng certayne spiritual figure rite manner moses lawe whiche purgacion sinne bloude sacrifice furthermore signifiyng consecrate new league euangelicall profession misterie whan moses recited roll lawe wherin preceptes law conteyned people aunswered al thynges lorde hath spoken wyll obediente wyth parte bloude sacrifice whiche kylled receyued vessell sprinkeled people saiyng bloude league whiche lorde hath made wyth touchyng wordes truely thynges signifyed certayne figure shadowes holye sacrifice wherin lorde iesus delyueryng body willingly vnto death sheding bloud went aboute clense synnes whole worlde reconcilyng vnto god men freelye whosoeuer woulde professe league newe testament would sacrifice league shoulde commended set furth myndes hys disciple certayne misticall sygnes offered thyntente shoulde vnderstande death common idle effectuall sacrifice purge synnes onelye iewes also al nacions al tymes deathe christe oughte bee iterated leste greate abenifite myght go mennes mindes leste myghte forget holye league entred authour theyr health also institute ordayne often communion ye holye breade cup memorie renewed among professours euangelicall lawe would sygne holy among hys souldiers veneracionwhan eat c lyke much godly grace shoulde bee geuen whiche shoulde receyue body bloude lorde purely worthely take vnworthely cause grenous danacion therfore iesus toke breade hys handes offered sacrifice prayse vnto god breake distributed vnto disciple saiyngi wyll dricke hence furth c take ye eate ye thys body afterwarde toke cup hys handes geuen thankes vnto father drancke reched vnto saying dryncke ye thys cuppe thys bloud newe testament shalbe shed many forgeuenes synnes often ye shall thys doe remembraunce often ye shall eate breade dryncke cuppe ye shall declare lordes death vntil cum sauiour iudge meane time none sacrifice synnes shal loked one sufficient take awaye synnes whole world saye vnto wyll eate bread hereafter vntil shall eate complete perfect father kyngdome drinke fruite vine vntil shal drinke new father kingdom moste meke gentil lorde exclude iudas traytour thys holy memoriall thys great clemencie gentilnes myght refourmed receyued sygne league testament hauyng treason hys harte departed vncleane came whan song hymne went vnto mount oliuete sayd iesus ye shall offended nyght written wyll smite shepeherde shepe flocke al e scatered rysen againe wil go galile peter answered sa ed vnto though al offended yet wyl offended iesus sayd vnto hym uerely saye vnto thee nyght cocke crowe thou shalt deny thryse peter sayed vnto hym yea though dye wyll deny likewise also saied al disciple hadde song hymne prayse god arose went mounte oliues whiche place knewe bee well knowen vnto traytoure lest seme desyre hyd fearyng deathe purposelye withdrawed hymselfe solitarye place myghte bee taken without tumulte people thyng went loked telleth disciple agayne cum passe byanby sore troubled seing punishemet lord lest vtterly discouraged doethe coumfort prophecie resurreccion shoulde folowe furthwith poyntyng also time place nere hande see hym agayne ye shall troubled thys nyghte cause god ye father prophecied mouth hys prophete zacharye wyll strike sheperde shepe ye flocke shal scatered abrode ye nede despayre deathe shall trouble myndes byanby resurreccion shal comforte rise agayne thirde daye rysen wyll goe galile offer selfe bee sene iesus suffered al disciple thus troubled thintent myght teache dedes howe great weakenes man nature folish thing man trust himselfe hauing experience themselues myght learne helpe mennes weakenes peter therefore well knowyng hymselfe certayne manly worldly boldnes denieth shall cumme passe christe prophecie sayed shoulde cumme passe whiche poyncte rashenesse preferreth hymselfe bee troubled thy cause yet wyll bee troubled whome iesus aunswered sayeste thou peter wylt thou alone troubled nay tell suerty cocke crowe twyse nyght thou shalt denye thryse yet peter knowleagyng hys weakenes thys aunswered stoutly yea yf shoulde dye wyl denye apostle folowed rashenes peter would haue denied christ also yf bene brought lyke streight peter pthen came iesus vnto village whiche called gethsemany sayed vnto disciple sit ye whyle go praye yonder toke hym pe er two sonnes zebedee began sorowfull euy sayde iesus vnto soule heuy euen vnto death arry ye ere watche wente lit e farther f downe h face prayed saiyng fa yf bee possible let thys cuppe passe neuerthelesse wyl ut thou wilt iesus knowyng tyme drewe nere laste storme shoulde cum led aparte eleuen disciple iudas gone oute supper village called gethsemany commaunded eight tary whiche yet loth departe theyr maister loued hartelye yet worldly affeccion tary place while goe accustomed place praye durst make priuye conflicte sith yet weake l ste shoulde discouraged taketh hym thre peter two sonnes zebedee myght haue witness hys extreme manly weakenesse whome tooke hym mounte beholde hys maiestie teache often greater storme suche trouble man strength abyde hande vtterly distrustyng selues commit v wholy helpe god feare deathe whan cummeth vpon man bitter deathe selfe therfore horryblenes beganne cum vpon iesus felte great sorow heuines mynde would hys chosen frendes ignoraunt griefe mindtary watche myght playnly see man troubled affeccions bothe body mynde soule heuy euen vnto deathe ta ry watche time requireth slepe wakyng earneste prayer therfore iesus goyng forwarde litle hys three disciple hangyng downe heademy father possible c bowed face yearth prostrate prayed vnto father saiyng father possible take away cup death feele affeccion body much abhorring death notwithstanding let wyl weakenes body thou wilt health saluacion mankynde came vnto hys disciple founde slepyng sayed vnto peter could ye watche one houre watche praye ye enter temptacion spirite ready fleshe weake thus prayed returned vnto disciple found slepyng sayeth vnto peter thou diddest crake litle thou wouldest dye couldest thou wake one houre wake praye wake praye father ye fall temptacion ouercum victorye chaunceth vnto wake therfore must wake leste fleshe ouercum spirite spirite ste susteyned helpe god againe went second tyme prayed saiyng father cup passe awaye drinke thy wyl bee done came found slepyng theyr iyes heuy left went agayn praied third time saiyng woordes cummeth hys disciple sayeth vnto slepe take rest behold houre hande sonne man betrayed hades sinner arise let v going behold hand doeth betray hys disciple beyng raysed iesus went agayne prayed agayne many woordes vnto hys father father yf bee possible thys cup shall passe shall drynk thy wyll bee doone afterwarde returned agayne vnto hys disciple found slepyng theyr iyes heuy reason sorowe increasyng theyr slepe therfore leauyng wente alone thyrde tyme praye hys disciple weakenes fleshe ouercame prayed likewise thirde time teache v praye continually vehemently often storme temptacion hande angel present geue strength spirite afterwarde returned vnto hys disciple rebuked theyr slepyng tyme sith tyme required great watching nowe sayth tempest hande whiche shall fynde vnreadye therfore vnmete ouermatched nowe slepe take rest lo houre cum innocent sonne manne shall deliuered handes wicked therfore arise let v go meete hurte displeasure cummeth agaynst v beholde hande whiche betrayeth whyle yet speake lo iudas one numbre twelue came hym great multitude swerdes aues sent chiefe priestes elder people betrayed hym gaue token saiyng whomesoeuer kysse th laye handes hym furthwyth cummeth iesus saying hayle maister kyssed hym iesus sayed vnto hym frende wherefore art thou cum came layde handes iesu iesus ended communicacion lo iudas iscariote one numbre twelue came folowyng iesus capitayne lytle become ouer wicked cumpany wicked captayne great cumpanye souldiers folowed hym sweordes clubbes whome chiefe priestes seniours people sent thys intente yt iesus myght taken without tumult people althoughe hadde purposed differ matter vnto another tyme yet hauyng oportunitie traytour chaunged myndes therfore iudas chose bothe nyghte place whiche iesus wonte fewe praye finally leste fayle persone traytoure taught token shoulde knowe iesus whomesoeuer shall kysse laye handes vpon hym therefore iudas iscariote went went vnto iesus though woulde salute hym saiyng hayle rabby therwith kissed hym whiche tymes paste vsed salutacions honour duty iesus geue perfect exaumple mekenes euery place hys disciple dyd repell wicked disciple kyssyng dyd rebuke hym hys madnesse wyth gentle speakynge touched hys conscience saiyng frende cause art thou cum came wyth kysse suche sorte though woulde haue tolde hym sum newes token multitude came runnyng layed handes vpon iesus helde hym fast disciple myndes sore amased ruffling whome iesus suffered fall affeccion woulde vtterlye plucke oute myndes gredy desyre reuenge defende themselues beholde one iesus stretched hande drewe oute hys swerde stroke seruaunt hygh priestes smote hys eare sayed iesus vnto put vp thy swerd sheath al take swerd shal perishe swerd thinke ye praye father shal geue thou twelue legion angel howe shal scripture fulfylled thus muste peter eyther feruente euery elles hadde made stoute promyses hymselfe leste shoulde seme doe hys mayster plucked swerde stroke malcus seruaunte caiphas cutte hys ryghte eare iesus orderyng stroke bothe lyght wounde whatsoeuer hurte healed restored eare agayne peter erred reason certayne good loue towarde lorde errour tooke maner wordes iesus well perceyued commaunded sell coate swerdes whan thei aunswered wer two swerdes sayed sufficiente thynkynge spake swerde yron whereas iesus mente spirituall swerde supper tooke furthe theyr swerdes readye defende theyr lorde yf matter hadde required yf commaunded therefore plucke affeccion vtterly myndes hys disciple dyd chyde peter sharpely saying put vp thy swerde place dooe stryke wyth swerde peryshe swerde recompence vengeaunce turnyng backe vpon owne heade haue nede tence whyche doe get victory better suffering killing el thincke coulde lacke helpe pleased haue defence could make suite vnto father could send helpe stede twelue disciple twelue legion angel thus thoughte good father thus spoken prophetes none thinges done chaunce fortune houre iesus sayed multitude ye cum thefe swerdes clubbes take sate deyly wyth teachyng temple ye toke al doen scripture prophetes might fulfylled al disciple forsoke fled toke iesus led cayphas ye hygh priest scribe elder assembled peter folowed far vnto hyghe priestes courte went sate seruauntes see ende iesus turnyng multitude sayed nowe weponed swerdes clubbes ye cum furth take whan sate daylye emong teachyng temple healyng sicke diseased ye layed handes vpon nowe dead nyght ye seke beyng quiet styl secrete place al thinges done violence ordinaunce goddes counsell whereof scripture prophetes hathe prophecied long disciple hearyng thys seing hope asmuche iesus offred vnto deathetha disciple c left theyr maister ran away mynisters nothyng mitigate remembraunce doctryne benefite iesus ledde awaye lyke prysoner house cayphas chiefe priestes whyther scribe seniours dyd resorte peter alone disciple beyng afrayed fledde euery man hys waye although hys skirmishe came well passe yet coulde leaue vtterly care hys maister whome loued hartely yet durst present hym notwithstanding folowed might farre length darke vnknowen entred court cayphas finally entryng sate among minister warming cole whereas coulde defende iesus yet least myght see shoulde ende iudgemente yet peter sum hope hys mynde pthe chiefe priestes elder al counsell sought false witnesse iesus put hym deathe founde none yea whan manye false wytnesses came yet founde none laste cause two false witness sayed sayed able destroye temple god builde agayne three dayes chiefe prieste arose sayed vnto hym answerest thou nothyng beare witnes agaynst thee iesus helde hys peace chiefe priest answered sayed vnto hym charge lyuyng god thou tel v whether thou christ sonne god iesus sayeth vnto hym thou hast sayed neuerthelesse saye vnto hereafter ye shall see sonne man sittyng ryght hande power cummyng cloudes skye chiefe priestes whole counsel make sum apperaunce lawfull iust iudgement went suborne set furth false witness agaynst iesus whose innocecie greate harde lye lye myght haue colour truth many false witness came furththe chiefe priestes elder c suche sorte theyr testimony saiynges yll framed together confounded themselfes insomuche thought meete neyther iudges neither cumpany length cummeth furth two false witness whiche sayed sayed canne destroye temple god three dayes make vp toke occasion lye wordes christe sayed looce thys temple three dayes wyll rayse vp meanyng thereby shoulde slayne within three dayes lyue agayne witness make thing odious dyd depraue mystake woordes whiche vnderstoode sayed destroye looce ye sayed wyll build agayne wyll rayse vp appliyng hys body whiche slayne lyue againe therfore thys testimonye semed bee weyght nother found meete conuenient chyefe priestes roose vp counterfeityng person iuste iudge thought woulde geue iesus liberty defende hymselfe sayed doest thou make answere testimony whiche brought agaynst thee iesus helde peace knowyng whatsoeuer sayed reproued mistaken chiefe priestes desyryng wreste sumwhat wherby iesus myght condemned nowe hys madnes al tariyng semed long sayeth vnto hym coniure liuing god tel v whether thou christ sonne god crafty question wicked byshop denied sonne god would haue cryed takest thou vpon thee thing thou arte affirmed woulde haue falsely accused hym blasphemy holde hys peace required adiured shoulde seme despise god authoritie highe prieste dyd adiure hym wicked bisshop whiche boughte herode money annuall honoure assault sone god adiured god yet iesus shewing reuerence honour beare beyng demaunded whether christ sonne godies sayth vnto hym thou haste sayde aunswered thou hast spoken confessing himselfe yet auoyded faulte arrogancie added thing whiche oughte haue reuoked wicked bishop purposed wickednes yet thys say vnto hereafter ye shall see sonne man sittyng ryghte hande power god comming maiestie cloudes heauen gaue vnderstande lowe condemned wicked shoulde come power god iudge ouer worlde pthan high priest rent clothes saying hath spoken blasphemie nede ye moe witness lo ye haue hearde hys blasphemie thinke ye answered sayde worthy dye dyd spitte hys face buffered hym theyr fystes smote hym face palme handes saying tell v christe smote thee chiefe prieste beyng prouoked saying thyntente counterfeyted zeale religion myghte make cryme christe sore rente hys garmentes sayde speaketh blasphemously doeth vsurpe take vpon diuine honour wheras manlo ye haue heard blasphemie c nedeth witness beholde nowe ye haue hearde manifeste blasphemie thynke ye aunswered hath deserued deathe began handle hym cruelly mockes skornes though bene lawefully condemned whiche also iesus suffered moste mekely geue vnto perfect example pacience spette face coueryng hys face gaue hym buffettes blowes agayne stroke hym face theyr handes saying prophecye tell v christ stryketh skornes rebuke caste teeth woulde bee taken messias honoured people name prophete ppeter sate without courte damsell came vnto hym saying thou also waste iesus galile denied saying wot thou sayest whan goen porche another wenche sawe hym sayde vnto felowe also iesus nazareth denied agayne othe saying dyd knowe man whyle came stode sayde vnto peter surely thou art one thy speche doth bewraye began curse sweare knewe
