manne immediately cocke cr peter remembred saying iesus whiche spake vnto hym cocke crowe thou shalt deny thryse went wept bitterly meane season peter sate without courte beholding farre heauie sight loking ende matter durste come nere lest shoulde knowen minister certayne wenche came vnto hym whiche partely knewe hym sayde thou also waste one folowers galilean peter beyng amased wench woorde forgetting stout woorde spake christ dye thee wil deny thee denied lorde al saying cannot tell thou sayest furthwith cocke crowe prepared goe euen doore wenche spyed vttering hym minister standyng sayeth thys man also iesus nazareth agayne denyed swearing knew manne little certayne stoode knowing peter sayd truely thou arte one numbre onely thy face also thy speche doeth vtter thee galilean peter afrayde began onely abiure forsake iesus also execrate ban himselfe euer knewe manne furthewith cocke crowed agayne iesus dyd beholde speaking vnto iyes monished length peter cumming himselfe remembred iesus tolde craked hys boldenes valiantnes cocke crow twise thou shalt denye thryse sinned thorough weakenes man amased feare purposed malice deserued mercy christe suffered hys chosen apostle man offende nouer sore shoulde dispayre pardon repent washe spot mynde teares peter whiche besyde hymselfe looke iesus came hymselfe agayne repented goyng furth wepte bitterly pthe xxvii chapiter pwhan morning come chiefe priestes elder people helde counsel iesus put death broughte hym bounde deliuered hym pontius pilate devi ie therfore night throughly watched heades religion wicked cruell deedes day drew nere againe chiefe priestes seniours people went counsayl iesus put hym death therfore deliuered bound vnto pontius pilate president take punishment condemned man iudas betrayed hym seeing condemned went extremity moued repentaunce broughte agayne thirtie piece syluer heades priestes senioures people saying haue synned haue betrayed innocente bloud truely mannes confessyon haue moued prynces mindes confesseth doen infeccion auarice confesseth hath betrayed innocent vtterly raging thirsting nothing el innocent bloud aunswered v whether thou hast betrayed yll doer innocente looke thou p iudas whiche betrayed seing condemned repented hymselfe brought againe thirtie plate siluer chiefe priestes elder saying haue sinned betraying innocente bloude sayde v see thou cast downe siluer plate temple departed hong himselfe iudas repenting gayne desired breake bargayne theyr crueltie coulde meanes mitigated iudas therefore casting piece siluer feete departed away heaping increasing wicked dede wicked dede knowledged greatnes sinne knowledged greatnes goddes mercy peter wepte bitterly obtayned mercy iudas wept also desperate minde rather tha conuerted minde therfore went asyde hanged himselfe burst middes bowel fell chiefe priestes tooke piece siluer sayde lawfull put price bloude tooke coun el bought potter fielde bury straungiers wherefore fielde called fielde bloude vnto day fulfilled whiche spoken prophete hieremye saying tooke thirtie siluer piece price hym valued whome bought child israell gaue potter fielde lorde appoynted heades priestes went counsayl agayne theyr crueltie mighte better knowen menne dyd nothing without common counsell consulte vse thirtye piece syluer shoulde goe whiche iudas cast theyr feete menne aukewarde religion hauing religion feare killing innocente doone muche lawfull put money corbon emong gyftes temple whiche woulde haue estemed regarded religiousely price bloude holines temple must poluted bloud meane season dysclose theyr vngraciouse conscyence confessyng hym bee innocente whose betraymente boughte therefore shoulde bee partaker synne counselled together money bought grounde certayn potter godly v straungiers mighte buried though woulde haue recompenced sinfull dede ha de thys good dede yet thys meanes prouyded yll theyr good name coulde meanes blase abrode theyr wickednes thyng come suche common saying daye grounde called sirians acheldema saye grounde bloude neyther thys thing done chaunce hieremie prophecied shoulde come passe tooke thirtie piece siluer price prised whome boughte child israell gaue grounde potter lorde appoynted iesus stode debitie debitie asked saying arte thou king iewes iesus sayeth vnto thou sayest whan accused chiefe priestes elder aunswered nothing sayde pilate vnto hearest thou many witness laye agaynste thee aunswered hym neuer woorde insomuch debitie matuayled greatly therfore whan iesus stode president giltie accused hym busily many thinges speaking nothing meane season blasphemy relygyon temple defyled broken cummyng sonne man whiche thinges knew pilate passing litle suche supersticion woulde litle moued leye fayned faultes whiche mighte stirre presydentes minde agaynste iesus saying haue founde man goyng subuert nacion forbidding tribute geuen vnto ceasar saying christe kyng pylate hearing mencyon kyng thys semed touche ceasar demaunded iesusies stode ye debitie c arte thou kyng iewes iesus leste shoulde seeme proude yf shoulde make aunswere sayeth thou sayeste vtterlye denying king yet adding hys kingdome spiritual worldlye pertayneth nothyng ceasar herode agayne whan hys accuser called vpon matter pilate desiryng get hym wherby mighte bee delyuered heareste thou howe sore faultes laye agaynst thee vnto iesus aunswered vtterly nothyng insomuche president marueiled greatly innocent man daungier deathe kepe silence greate meekenesse pylate perceiuyng countenaunce behauiour iesus farre suspicion desiryng kyngdome sayeth vnto heades priestes theyr folowers fynde deadly offence man hote vehemente saying sedicyouse manne hath styrred people hys doctrine walkyng ouer iewry begynnyng galile vnto thys place pilate perceyuyng iesus innocente priestes scribe went theyr purpose enuie malice therfore seekyng occasyon delyuer iesus leaste sende hym courte whan hearde name galyle asked hym countrey manne knewe came oute coastes galyle herode rule imperie sente hym agayne vnto herode happened hierusalem truely herode seeyng iesus glad long time desyred see iesus fame wente wonderfull thynges therfore hoped wel woulde woorke miracle hym also whan herode asked hym questyons manye thynges iesus aunswered hym nothyng came purpose delight curiositie prince see prouyde health men wheras accused hym many cause aunswered nothing herode contenmed garde putting vpon white garment skorne sente hym agayne pilate occasion pilate herode made frendes wheras stryfe therefore pylate callyng together heades pryestes magystrates people protested founde none offence iesus whiche obiected againste hym herode also sente hym away innocente whiche woulde haue dooen yf iudged daunger capitall crime pacifye enuie iewes refourme let goe feaste debitie wont deliuer vnto people prisoner whome woulde desire notable prisoner called barrabas therefore whan gathered together pilate sayde whether ye geue looce vnto barrabas iesus whiche called christe knewe enuie delyuered whan could nothing preuayle woordes seketh occasion delyuer iesus custome emong iewes vpon holy day religion sake president shoulde set libertie one whiche kept holde fast holde tyme certayne notable famous theefe named barrabas whiche name knewe hated people therfore calling iewes vnto asked whether woulde haue geuen pardoned barrabas iesus hoping comparison famouse strong violente theefe woulde rather deliuer iesus pwhan sette downe geue iudgement wife sente vnto saying haue thou nothyng dooe iuste man haue suffered manye thynges thys daye slepe hym chyefe pr estes elder perswaded people shoulde aske barrabas destroy iesus presidente sayed aunswered vnto whiche twoo wyll ye lette looce vnto sayde barrabas pilate sayde vnto shall dooe iesus called christe sayde vnto let crucified president sayde eiuill hath done cryed saying let crucyfied president sitting agayne iudgement wife sendeth vnto one shoulde saye hym name shoulde contamynate hymselfe bloude innocente saying vexed nyghte horryble visyons iesus sake thys chaunced without cause ordinaunce god yet whome iesus haue testimonie innocencie expedient men knowe hys deathe freely bestowed redeme v wheras people doub e whether might desire geuen vnto came passe counsell priestes senyoures asked barrabas iesus place myghte bee kylled suche iudgemente thys kyndnes people thys counterseyted religyon pryestes elder matter religion enter courte pilate mighte eate theyr pascall lambe beeyng pure cleane matter relygyon suche ra g madnes put hym deathe whiche innocente throughly tryed many vertues benefites towarde pylate therefore proposed vnto agayne whether woulde haue barrabas iesus sette al libertie cryed vnto hym barrabas pylate agayne sayde shall doe iesus whiche called christe trustyng woulde bee content gentle punishement cryed greate consente voyces let hym bee crucifyed thys kynde punishmente bothe cruell slaunderouse shamefull agayne pylate shall crucifie innocente hath deserued fynde nothing woorthy death therefore chastice hym let hym goe woordes madnes people styrred cry vp vp crucify man whan pilate sawe coulde preuayle nothyng busynes made tooke water washed handes people saying innocent bloud iust person see people aunswered sayde hys bloud vpon v oure child let barrabas looce vnto scourged iesus deliuered hym crucifyed pylate perceyuyng prouyng wayes meanes preuayled nothyng tumulte people styred vp assoyled iesus condemned hym presence people toke water washed hys handes saying innocente bloude iuste manne ye authours deathe vengeaunce innocent bloude shall lyght vpon youre head yet vnhappie iewes feared thys saying whole people cryed altogether let hys bloude lighte vpon v vpon chyldren wished destruccyon theyr successoures chryste gentile towarde themselues hath repelled none pardone forgeuenes doe repente many afterwardes dyd wurshyppe crosse chryste whiche cryed multytude vp hym vp hym crucyfie hym therefore pylate ouercome theyr stiffe madnes gaue vnto barrabas authour sedicyon murderer condemned mennes iudgementes yea iudgemente maner rome whan iesus scourged deliuered crucifyed p souldiers president toke iesus common hall gathered al coumpany stripped put purple robe platted crowne thornes put head reede ryghte hande bowed knee mocked hym saying hayle kyng iewes whan spit hym tooke reede smote hym head mocked hym tooke agayne robe put owne garmentes toke away crucifie souldiers presidente receiued iesus courte gathered whole garde hym cruelly take theyr pleasure mocking innocent partely folowyng theyr owne naughtye disposicyon partely prouoked iewes hearde made himselfe king iewes manner hitting teeth abiect woulde proudely clyme vp kyngdome spoyled hys owne garmentes put vpon hym purple garmente saye kyngly robe stede dyademe sette crowne vpon hys heade made thornes stede scepter gaue hym reede hys right hande nowe salutyng theyr newe kyng kneele downe mocke hym saying hayle king iewes beyng contente despite spit vpon hym stryke hys heade crowned thornes reede gaue hym stede mace whan omytted manner despyte suffered thynges great meekenes shewe vnto hys perfecte exaumple pacience therfore souldiers satisfyed myndes iyes company kindes mockes skornes plucke robe agayne put hys owne apparell mighte better knowen menne came founde man cyren named syman compelled beare hys crosse came place whiche called golgatha saye place dead mennes sculles gaue vineger drinke mingled gall whan tasted ther woulde drynke bring furth iesus courte bearing crosse wente founde one symon cyrenyan whome forced beare crosse iesus came place shoulde crucified whiche syreans called golgatha place caluarie horrible bone sculles put death parte hys body shoulde bee free tormentyng mocking skornyng let passe offered cup drinke tempered vineger gall myghte fulfylled whiche written prophecye gaue gall eate thyrste gaue vineger drynke whan iesus tasted woulde drynke whan crucyfyed hym parted garmentes caste lotte myghte fulfilled whiche spoken prophete deuyded garmentes emong vpon esture dyd chep caste lotte sate watched hym set vp ouer deade cause hys deathe written iesus kyng iewes crucified two thenes righte hande another lefte crucified deuided emong garmentes iesus hys coate whiche wouen coulde bee rypped cast lotte saying prophet might fulfilled deuyded garmentes emong vpon coate caste lotte fyttyng crosse kepte hym man shoulde take hym awaye also title mockage sette vpon crosse thys iesus king iewes whiche notwithstanding honourable iewes coulde suffer hande pilate title might corrected shoulde put kyng iewes made hym selfe kyng iewes thys thyng onely suffered pylate haue higher hande also procured iewes two theues shoulde bee crucifyed hym iesus beyng myddest shoulde haue one righte hande lefte hande might taken men vayne himselfe deceiuer lyke vnto whome matched passed reuyled hym waggyng theyr heades saying thou destroyed temple god buylded three dayes saue thy selfe thou arte sonne god come downe crosse lykewise also hyghe priestes scrybes elder mocked hym sayinge saued hymselfe cannot saue bee king israell let come downe nowe crosse beleue hym trusted god let hym delyuer hym nowe yf haue hym sayde sonne god theues also whiche crucified cast teeth crueltie iewes yet sacyate filled greate mischieues scorne reuile beyng crucifyed passing railed shaking theyr heades mocked saying fie thee art thou hurlest downe temple god three dayes makest vp agayne thou didest promise healthe others saue thy selfe thou didest boast thee sonne god come crosse likewise also heades priestes scrybes semoures people mocked reuyled gaue health vnto others nowe cannot preserue himselfe king israel woulde appere let declare doe let come downe crosse beleue hym trusted god whome craked hys father loue let nowe deliuer hym euery side innocente iesus mighte arayed reuylynges theues also felowes hym punishmente lyke manner rebuked hym whiche iesus suffered stiffe strong pacience bring passe offer healthfull sacrifice kepte still diuine power sette furthe whole nature humane al maner paynes tormentes requited reuenge cruell reuylyng bestowed vpon hym dying beeyng bitter crosse selfe insomuche prayed vnto hys father souldyers iewes skorned hym one theues repentyng himselfe receyued paradise sixt hou e darkenes ouer lande vntill ix houre aboute ix houre iesus cryed loude voyce saying hely hely lamazabathanye saye god god haste thou forsaken stoode hearde sayde man calleth helias furthwith one ranne toke sponge whan filled full vyne ce put reede gaue hym drinke sayde let let u see whether helias come delyuer hym iesus cryed agayne loude voyce yelded vp ghost sonne felte punyshment innocente coulde abyde beholde wycked dede couered hys face blacke cloude countreye couered darkenesse syxe clocke vntyll nyne yet meane season darkenesse iewes harte coulde bee shaken aboute nyne clocke iesus cryed greate voyce saying thys sentence oute psalme hely hely lamazabathany god god haste thou forsaken certayne stode hearyng afarre hely supposyng called hely helpe sayde thys felowe calleth hely let v see whether wyll helpe hym iesus shewe true deathe whiche suffered menne cryed athirste thys wonte folowe vpon woundes sheding bloude whiche oftentymes punyshemente sore paynfull death one runnyng hym put vnto mouth hanged sponge full vineger putte vpon toppe reede iesus thirsted sore health menne iewes offered hym nothyng vinegar gall therefore dyd forbeare tasted saying consummate fynyshed sygnyfying nothyng omytted whiche pertayne manner sacrifyce anone declare lefte life hys owne accorde commended hys spyryte vnto father cryed loude voyce bowing head died beholde vayle temple rente two partes top bottom earthe quaked stone dyd rente graues dyd open manye bodyes saynctes whiche slepte arose went oute graues hys resurreccyon came holy citie appered many whan ce urion watching iesus saw earthquake thinges whiche happened feared greatly saying truely thys sonne god furthwith thinges dyd testifye effectuall death lorde iesus vayle temple whiche deuyded holye place parte temple owne accorde cut two partes declaring shadowes moyses lawe hereafter shoulde vanyshe awaye bryght light ghospell furthermore earth quake stone brake sunder reprouing iewes theyr inuyncyble hardnes hearte graues open many bodyes holy menne whiche dead reuyue liue agayne goyng graues resurreccyon christe came holye citie ierusalem appered vnto many beeyng preacher folowers resurreccyon iesus furthermore captayne hys seruauntes whiche keepe iesus perceyuing earthquake darkenesse breakyng stone wonder greatly afeard saying truely sonne god pand many woman beholdyng farre whiche folowed iesus galile mynystryng vnto hym among whiche marie magdalene marie mother iames io mother chyldren zebedee euen come came riche man aramathia named ioseph whiche also iesus disciple wente vnto pylate begged holy bodye iesus pylate commaunded body deliuered whan ioseph taken body wrapped cleane clothe put new toumbe whiche hewen rocke rolled great stone doore sepulchre departed marie magdalene marie sitting ouer againste sepulchre also many woman lookyng farre vpon thynges doen whiche folowed iesus galile minystryng vnto hym necessary among whome marie magdalene marie mother iacob ioseph also mother sonnes zebedee diuers nyghte drewe nere certayne ryche captayne aramathia called ioseph also dyscyple iesus wente vnto presidente askyng hym body iesus pylate marueyling dead man lustie age hauyng hys legges broken soone knew certaynely captayne dead commaunded body geuen vnto receyued wrapped cleane shete layde newe graue whiche grauen whole stone rollyng greate stone doore graue departed away thys done prouidence god shoulde vse crueltie vpon dead karcas man shoulde dygge vp graue steale hym awaye departed marie magdalene woman contynued syttyng ouer sepulchre markyng place layde body conuenient time myght doe dutie annoynting lorde styrred vp theyr great dilygence intente beliefe resurreccion might certayne pthe nexte daye foloweth parasceue hyghe priestes pharis came together vnto pilate saying sir remember deceyuer sayde yet aliue three dayes rise agayne commaunde therefore sepulchre bee made sure vntyl thyrd daye leste disciple come steale away say vnto people risen dead last errour shall bee wurse firste pilate sayde vnto ye haue watche goe waye make sure ye wente made sepulchre sure watche men sealed stone daye parasceue whiche daye preparacion agayne heades priestes pharis come vnto pilate confirming trueth resurreccion while goe lette saye vnto president sir remember deceiuer yet alyue sayde woulde rise agayne three dayes therfore commaunde sepulchre kepte vnto thyrde day leste disciple come steale away hys body perswade people risen agayne come passe shall preuayle nothyng latter erroure shalbe wurse fyrste pylate sayeth vnto ye haue watche goe kepe ye knowe while goe stoppe hym woulde ryse agayne encrease miracle faythe resurreccyon sette kepers made sure sepulchre sealed stone also whiche dyd shut mouth sepulchre leste mighte deceyte kepers also paraphrase erasmus vpon p xxviii chapter vpon euen sabbothes whiche spryngeth first day sabbothes marie magdalene marie came see sepulchre beholde greate earthequake aungell lorde came downe heauen came rolled downe stone doore sat vpon hys countenaunce like vnto lightening garment white snowe feare kepers astonied made dead men euen firste sabbothe daye come ende whiche mornyng daye folowyng whiche fyrste daye weeke next ensuing marie magdalene marie theyr swete spice prepared ouer night went agayne mornyng sepulchre see dooen enbaulme bodye iesus great yearthquake whan woman deuysed emong themselues howe mighte remoue stone doore graue greate bee remoued strength woman beholde aungel lorde came downe heauen remoued stone doore graue sate vpon countenaunce aungell lyke vnto lyghtening hys garmentes shinyng white snowe kepers sepulchre loking vpon afrayde amased laye astonied like dead men aungell made aunswere vnto woman sayde feare ye knowe ye seke iesus whiche crucified risen sayde come see place lorde layde go quickely tell disciple risen agayne deathe beholde goeth galile ye shall see hym loe haue tolde aungell comforted woman saying men worthyly amased glory resurreccion whiche doe perseuer continue styll theyr vnbeliefe feare ye know ye seeke iesus crucifyed nowe hath left hys sepulchre hath perfourmed promised morning third day therfore risen come see place whiche beyng voyde bodye hath yet sygne body laye hath also apparell bodye lynnen wherein wrapped lette thynges make beleue yf ye beleue spedely departe hence tel thinges ye haue sene discyples sadde deathe lorde rysen agayne whome ye desire see beholde goe galile like death promised ye may see hym alyue whome ye mourned dead loe haue tolde departed quickely sepulchre feare great ioye runne bring disciple worde went tel disciple beholde iesus met saying al hayle came helde feete wurshipped iesus sayd vnto affrayde goe tel brother goe galile shall see whan looked voyde graue whiche founde shut spedely returned partely fearefull greatnes miracle partely rauyshed greate ioye desyre hope see theyr lorde alyue agayne runne communicate thys ioye dyscyples iesus wente iesus met myghte tell certayne tidinges encourage fearefull sayde hayle seyng knowing lorde went vnto embracing feete wurshipped agayne iesus take feare mighte better perceiue thynges shoulde spoken sayeth feare goe tell brother thinges ye haue seene bid go forward galile shall see pwhan gone beholde kepers came citie tolde chiefe priestes thynges happened assembled together elder tooke counsell gaue muche money souldiers saying saye ye hys discyples came nyghte stole hym awaye whan ye aslepe thys come presidentes eares wyll perswade saue harmelesse tooke money taught saying noysed amog iewes vntil day departed thintent trueth resurreccyon myght confirmed also testymonie aduersaries certayne kepers leuing sepulchre went vnto ierusalem tolde heades priestes thinges bene dooen howe sepulchre beyng shut sealed body founde howe aungel merueilouse beautie remoued stone earthequake howe amased feare hearde aungell talking woman whan priestes hearde thinges kepers went counsel agayne seniours forasmuche thyng manyfeste bee doubted bye lye kepers money lyke boughte helpe traytour money paye laboure lyers traytoure keepe close thynges ye haue seene make brute abrode hys disciple came night stale away whan ye aslepe thys inuencyon fleyght brought vnto president perswade hym deliuer daunger matter therefore souldyers receyuyng money dyd instructed thys trieflyng vayne sleight beleued people thys rumoure bruted abrode vnto day emong vnbeleuing iewes pthan eleuen disciple wente away galile mountayne iesus appoynted whan sawe hym wurshipped hym doubted iesus came spake ying power geuen heauen yearth nowe eleuen discyples monished woman wente forewarde galile went vp vpon hyll whiche iesus appoynted shewed hymselfe saw knew hym theyr lord honoured high heauen notwithstandyng yet doubted vntil made beleue many certeyn argumentes albeit theyr doubting profitable certaintie oure belyefe therfore iesus drawyng nere vnto dyd onely offer hymselfe bee seene touched presently also spake vnto hys knowen accustomed voyce declaring death obteyned kingdome authoritie heauen earth heaue euer reigned father earth hereafter shoulde reigne tirannical power aide thorough fayth beleuers shoulde dispose office euangelicall kyngdome vnto disciple shoulde folowe steppe committing vnto office preache ghospell onely iewes also nacions also authoritie baptise holy ghoste forgeue synnes menne wyll professe euangelycal lyfe sincere hearte enstructe frame lawe moyses constitucions phariseis preceptes vntyll wexed grewe vp vnto perfeccyon wysedome ghospell nothing dystrust continually conuersaunt promiseth theyr felowship shal neuer fayle neuer forsake hys alwayes presente hys spirite power vnto laste ende worlde power geuen heauen earth ye haue sene reason weakenes flesh hungrie thyrstie weary nedy despised taken bounde spetted vpon condemned beaten crucifyed couered kyndes spytefulnes maner deiect vnder loweste sorte menne haue suffered thinges willingly myne owne accorde health man father hath raysed deathe rewarded glory immortalitie hath lifted vp felowship hys kyngdome hath submytted vnto power rule thinges heauen earth ye haue authour whome ye ought distrust ye haue lorde whome ye ought repente goe ye therefore teache nacyons baptise name father sonne holye ghoste teaching kepe thinges whatsoeuer haue commaunded lyke dyed healthe men nacion whiche belongeth righte shall youre parte get vnto muche lyeth kinde men ye shall gette weapon war meanes got vnto right wholsome doctrine lyfe woorthy meete ghospell free well doyng pacyent suffering illes goe ye therfore trustie ambassadoures trusting authour teache firste iewes nexte neighboures vnto afterwardes nacions whole worlde teache ought beleue ought trust first knowledge heauely father maker orderer restorer al thinges visible inuisible whose power man resist almightie whose knowledge man doeth deceiue hee seeth thynges whose iudgemente man shall escape whome fountayne cummeth goodnes worlde whome due honour prayse thankes geuing must knowledge also sonne iesus whome hys eternall vnsearchable counsell hath purposed deliuer mankinde tiranny sinne deathe doctryne ghospell open waye vnto euerlasting felicitie cause came downe earth borne manne virgyn marie beyng man long conuersaunt emong menne taught heauenly philosophy maketh menne blessed innocent afflicted punished sinnes whole worlde put death vpon crosse layde graue third day arose agayne according prophecy prophetes beyng conseruaunt many dayes disciple trueth resurreccion delared sure argumentes wente vp agayne heauen whereas partaker kyngdome glory father sitteth righte hande father almightie shall come agayne worlde lowe abiecte diuine maiestie sauioure iudge bothe whome day shall finde aliue whome nowe dead trumpe ghospell shall sodainly call agayne life ineuitable iudgemente euery man may receiue rewarde woorthy mete doinges must knowledge also holy ghoste whome haue nowe partely geuen vnto geue plentiously come heauen whose secrete inspiracion shal coumforte teache strengthen mindes trust powred harte men shall glue confeder together mutuall charitie many professe hartely fayth ghospell nacyon soeuer come man doth sinne thing weakenes shal obteyne forgeuenes sinnes doth seuer himselfe fro league felowship holy cumpany whosoeuer ioyneth himselfe vnto leaguebaptising name father c sinnes former life shall forgeuen freely finally lest man shoulde thynke rewardes good dedes desyred life shoulde goe aboute vengeaunce agaynst yll doer let knowe hereafter shall come passe whiche ye see dooen dead shall liue agayne euery soule shall restored owne body whiche soone shall bee doen whosoeuer shall belong holy felowship sticke constantly vnto shal translated vnto euerlasting life partaker felicitie felowes partaker affliccyons ye haue taughte thynges yf beleue thinges ye haue taught yf repent former lyfe ready embrace doctrine ghospell dippe water name father sonne holy gost wholy signe may trust themselues deliuered filthines al theyr sinnes freely benefite death nowe chosen number child god lette manne circumcysed let manne bee baptized name moyses manne let knowe whome bounde health vpon whome oughte wholy hang let bee burdened ceremonyes moyses manne lette token sufficient menne cumme profession ghospell whiche easye bee euery place leste manne myghte thinke sufficient saluacion baptysed professe faythe ghospell must taughte agayne meanes may kepe theyr innocencie meanes may goe forwarde perfeccyon euangelicall godlines haue omitted nothyng whiche may make obteining euerlasting health heauenly spirite whiche ye shall receiue suffer forget whiche ye haue learned therefore whatsoeuer haue commaunded deliuer ye kepte haue prescribed vnto ceremony moyses law whiche like shadowes must vanishe away light euangelicall trueth haue prescribed vnto pharisaicall constitucions thinges whiche onely bringeth true innocencie godlines whiche onely maye make derely beloued god truely happy therefore teache thynges professe name onely woorde also life whatsoeuer taught perfourmed ded while ye doyng thynges whyles ye bring mortall menne heauen worlde ryse agaynste lyke rose agaynste spirite agreeth spirite thys worlde doctryne wholy agaynst affeccions whiche loue thinges world ryse agaynste greate tumultes cause ye nede distrust though ye lowe abiecte vnlearned weake fewe haue ouercome worlde ye shall ouercome helpe myn exa mple ye shal ouercome might owne whatsoeuer terrible worlde p loe alway vntill ende worlde although shall take vp body heauen expediente yet wil neuer forsake shall ceasse bee body shall effectually spirite vnto worldes ende whan worldes ende shalbe profiteth behoueth know meane season commaunded euer ready agaynst daye whiche whansoeuer shal come ye also mortalitie layed aparte shal bee wholy felowes father kyngdome whiche shall neuer haue ende finis excellent vertuous princesse quene catherine wyfe moste gracious soueraigne lorde henry eyght kyng england fraunce irelande defendour faythe churche englad also irelande earthe supreme heade thomas key dayly oratoure wisheth perpetuall felicitie amoge innumerable benefites whiche haue receiued almighty god worthye excellent princesse none myne opinio whiche bounden vnto merciful goodnesse hath pleased hym clearely illumine v age knowledge holy woorde forefather elder knoweth long realme hath bene miserably seduced ignoraunce scripture euen amonge vplandishe perceyueth intollerable abuse haue bene vnder pretence true religion godlynesse mayntayned churche englande tyll suche tyme yt god infinite mercy sent v newe iosias whose righteous administracion godly policie light god worde many yeares extincte began shyne agayne vtter extirpacion false doctrine rote chiefe cause abusios iosias mooste redoubted soueraigne lorde kyng henry theyght prince garnished many excellent gyftes grace nature fortune dede therfore mooste worthely called perfite mirroure pearle christen prince wade prayse princely quality noble actes atchie ed god honoure publique weale realme purpose knowe enterpryse farre exceadyng compasse symple learning barrayne eloquence onely declare howe muche bounden chiefly vnto god nexte vnto moste excellent maiestie yt haue scripture mother togue cured olde blindnesse medicine veritie nowe hauing spirituall iyes opened daily receyuing cleare light god worde begyn see perfectly knowe onely sauiour iesus christ whome knowe euerlasting lyfe saluacio longe saide scripture hyd kept knowledge people fewe knewe christ aryght none lesse appeared chiefe professours christian religion el knowe christ knowe confesse onely hym cummeth oure saluacion h moure good dedes acceptable vnto almyghty god father father wrathe appeased enfraunchised captiuitie thraldome deuell shorte hym adopted chosen child god enherytours kyngdome heauen whoso knoweth christ aryght surely beleueth attayne saluacio onely saythe cum vnto ye trauaile charged shall refresh office christ saue therfore called high wisdome god iesu muche say sauiour saythe angell mathew shall saue people sinnes appeareth hereby greatly deceiued thinke saued waye meane christ make theselues quarter sauiours ascribing parte saluacio vnto owne workes deseruinges nowe howe could christ knowen aright say onely sauioure iustifier long scripture shut vp kept people legenda aurea like truperye lay open passe time withall reade stede byble cause chiefly also lacke good preacher preache teache truthe came passe almost cleane knowledge realme insomuche tyme great ignoraunce blyndes many thousand putte confidence soule healthe workes mennes phantasying pardon pilgrymages kyssing relyques offeryng saintes halowed beades numberyng prayer mumblyng vp psalmes vnderstand merytes called selfes relygious lyke thynges disalowed god holy word christe thonly auctor aforesayde mannes saluacion nowe gracious permission sayde soueraigne lorde scripture open euery man read soberly reuerently owne edifying vertue godly lyuing right well knowen foresayd abusions doctrine antichristes inuencion god al teache waye meane attayne saluacio hym sayth waye veritie false teacher seducer liers nowe commaundementes god lenger giue place wonte vnto man tradicios haue learned dutie god obedeice owe vnto price god chief minister supreme head earth churche cogregacion idolatry hipocrisy supersticion eane plucked vp rootes true religion euery planted nowe false doctrine exiled god worde truely setforthe preached nowe hathe england cleane forsaken antichrist rome greatest enemy god holy worde al moste vngodly deuices diuilyshe inuencios came mere mercy goodnes almygty god towardes v vndoubtedly thassercio holy word delyuerauce v people captiuitie ignoraunce blydnes hathe raysed vp oure tymes thi christen iosias ioyned vnto lawful matrimony youre noble grace lady besydes speciall gyftes singuler quality wholy geuen ye study vertue godlynesse wherfore england hathe iuste occasion reioyce youre grace honorable aduauncement yea rather hyghly thanke god moste gracious soueraigne hathe matched himselfe vertuous lady whome expresse resemblance maiesties excellent vertues specially grace ardent zele deuocion fauouryng setting forthe god word mother ioyful prosperitie manifest argument wherof besydes many grace muche desyreth haue paraphrase renoumed clerke erasmus roterdame vpon new testament worke fruitefull necessary true vnderstandyng parte holy scripture tourned englishe xploiture spedy accomplishement grace godly desyre hath sayde commauded certein well learned persos translate sayde worke paraphrase vpon marke excepted right worshypfull maister owen man muche lerning lesse honestie therfore worthyly phisician kynges moste royall person moued grace pleasure fyrst knowe go withall affirming thyng right acceptable vnto hyghnes would diligently trauell therin whiche thing desyrous gratify highnes pore seruice diligence much lay ye godly purpose right gladly promised trusting rather vpon benigne acceptacion gracious goddnes vpon slendernesse wytte lerning farre vnable worthely atchiue weyghty entreprise thauctour hereof man incomparable eloquece therfore possible person scarcely meane learning set euery thing specially english tongue barrain wordes phrase saye barbarous withall lyuelye like grace wrote fyrst latine wherfore mynded nothyng lesse contend ornate speache eloquence haue done diligent endeuour interprete sayde worke shoulde bothe plaine pleasaunte vnto reader onely also discharge chiefest office interpretour whiche faythfully translate expresse euery thing according true sence meaning thauctoure haue vertuous pricesse fayled thus hath bene rather lacke learning better knowledge good diligence speake thyng eyther praise thauctour present worke worke selfe myne opinion shall nedefull thauctour muche renoumed excellency lerning prayses illustrate set forthe glory candell common prouerbe giue light vnto sunne great vtilitie thother cannot well set man prayse commendacion shall euidently appeare vnto wyll diligently reade peruse good wil endeuour maye acceptable vnto highnes great fame bountye gracious goodnes putteth comforte shalbe wyll hereafter god assisting employ whole study labour suche wise yt fruite thereof shalbe worthy presented vnto noble grace rude translacion whiche bolde present throughe thaffiauce natural gentlenesse dedicate vnto beseche almighty god long preserue sayde soueraigne lorde grace moste confortable flower england noble prince edward continuall honour ioy prosperitie p moste christian prince frauncis frenche kinge first name erasmus roterodame sendeth greting haue tyll day christia kyng frau ci enioyed commoditee maiesties speciall fauour beneuolence towardes hathe nether thorowe defaulte negligece neyther yet ye cause thereof iustly ascribed vnto excellency among sondry lettes impedimetes hytherto hath chaunced hath none muche enuied felicitie hathe troublous vnquiet worlde haue euer loked long stormes tempestes warres woulde fayre wether clermes peace shyne vpon v oat one quarter neither haue thought selfe time lesse bounden hear vnto bountefull goodnes accepted whatsoeuer grace princely liberalitie offered trust ere loge haue occasion euidently testifye earneste zeale good mynde beare towardes hyghnes meane whyle vntyll oportunitie shall serue dooe haue thought good sende grace paraphrase vpo ghospell sainct marke earnest penny promise selfe prone ready thus dooe runnyng forwarde mine owne accorde fitues matier also lytle excite moue therunto dedicated mathewe vnto myne owne naturall liege lorde charles themperoure iohn vpon whome finished mathewe made lykewyse paraphrase vnto fardynande maiesties naturall brother luke whiche thyrde wente hande withall vnto kyng englande remained marke semed lefte behynde grace fower gospel shoulde dedicated vnto fower chiefe prince ruler worlde god sende grace spirite ghospell maye lykewyse ioyne heartes fower together mutuall amitie concorde youre name ghospell boke aptely conioyned whiche extende byshoppe rome dominion euen vnto hell purgatory geue impery power ouer aungels farre fro enuying pre minente auctoritie woulde wishe hym haue great deale yet woulde desyre withall worlde might fele power good holsome settyng christian prince one conseruing peace amitie whiche haue log season lesse dishonoure slaughter effusion christian bloud warred one agaynste nother vtter decay christes religion curse banne turkes pleasaunter sight vnto turkes yf nacio miscreauntes greater enemy vnto christes religion see thre moste florishing moste puissaut prince europe thus reason mischieuous diuision pursue eche mortall battaille scarcely sincke brayne cruell turke wysneth mischiefe vnto christen menne theselues weorke one whyle ariseth peace maker wt authoritie maye appeace vngodly busines ruffling worlde whereas lacketh prouokers setter ynowe suche poure oyle olde prouerbe vpon fyer parte make one title either better worse foreiudgement knowe ryght wel euery one thinketh owne cause moste rightful iuste knowe also iudgementes partye euer woonte haue fauoure defendeth himselfe iniury offred offreth wrong yet would fayne christian prince woulde debate matier ryght would well consider themselues much hathe gotten hereby whatsoeuer lieffer haue embrace vniust peace wage battaile neuer iust lawfull bryttle shorte full misery wretchednesse present lyfe speake many kyndes disease reigne worlde many iniuries many casualty many fatall calamity misauentures many pestilence many diuers kyndes lyghtninges many yerthquakes many sortes fiers many fluddes inundacions water like calamity measure numbre amoge euils mannes life vexed troubled withall none mischief hurte ensueth battaile yet doeth muche mischiefe vnto mennes maners doeth vnto theyr substance bodyes doeth lesse harme bothe bereaueth man life bereaueth vertuous good minde neyther battayle euer lesse detestable lesse abhorred moste parte euills thereof lyghteth vpon poore folkes neckes suche lowe state degree husbandman craftes menne waifaryng men lorde iesus christe shedde lesse bloude redempcion suche neuer bile rascal abiecte person dyd ye greatest kynges prince dreadfull daye dome shall cumme iudgement seate christ muste ere long presented potentate ruler worlde howe mightie puissaunte soeuer rigorous iudge require streyght accompte sely poore wretch wyll doe ruler great menne therfore thynke small losse vnto comon wealthe poore soules vnderlinges robbed afflicted dryuen house burned oppressed murthered dooe plainly condemne folyshnes iesus christe wysdome father heauen saue suche sayde person dyd shed preciouse bloud suffred passion wherfore mine opinion kynde people pernicious common weale suche put prince heades thynges maye styrte moue warre highe stomaked couragious soner deceyued amonge princely vertues highe stomake noble courage mynde rekened chief vertue iulius cesar olde wryters hygly commended noble kyng frauncis lykewyse extolled oure tyme full consent testimonie nacions nowe greater argument loftie couragious mynde able nothinge passe vpo iniuries doughtynes valiautise olde capitaines warred empire defence lyfe muche renoumed praysed gentyle wryters panyms gentile certes muche honourable glorious facte christian prince bye peace tranquilitie common weale losse parte dominion inheritaunce victory obteyned receyued muche goodly triumphe bought great displeasure people therefore haue incesed myndes prince desyre enlarge empire el haue inuented continual fountaine quicke spryng warres agayne much mischiefe dooe worlde minister vnto prince occasion matter wrathe bearyng hande thyng appertainyng vnto princely manhod couragiousnes auenged force armes folyshe worde spoken whiche happely vntruely reported lestewyse made great deale worse haynous spoken dede howe muche greater pointe noble courage consideracio haue peace tranquilitie common wealthe conserued nothyng passe vpon raylyng woorde yf hurte cumme thereof priuate hurte yea say truthe hurteth neglected passed matter concerning worldly affaire kynges peraduenture maye take summe vacacion nowe sequestre selues buisynesse leste wyse lawfull idle without busynesse vnto whose office specially belongeth watche preseruacion safegarde many takyng vpon daungerous enterprise aduentures warre forsomuche bryngeth whole floude great euylles mischiefes ought iyen heades watche circumspect possible leste decree determine thyng vnaduisedly neither speake thynges moste christen kyng entente plucke swearde handes prince peraduenture parte good kyng sumtymes make warre muste suche tyme thynges hauyng assayed vaine extreme necessitie compelleth dooe lorde iesus tooke away vse sweorde peter prince saincte paule also confirmeth authoritie commaunding suche citie rome professed christes religion wyse contemne thautoritie soueraigne ruler although gentile miscreauntes muche woulde haue taken ministres god neyther theyr customes theyr tax talages theyr honoure taketh sweorde sayeth beareth swerde naught selfe thyng doethe peter also teache beyng one ye chiefe apostle saying submitte selues therfore vnto maner ordinaunce manne lordes sake whether vnto kynge vnto chief heade eyther vnto ruler vnto sente hym punishment euil dooers laude prayse dooe well c christe woulde haue peter haue weapon saue sweorde ghospell whiche heauenly worde whiche saincte paul teacheth epistle hebrewes quicke mightye operacion sharper two edged sweord entrethe euen vnto deuiding asoudre soule spiryte commaundeth sweorde put vp scaberte taketh awaye doeth yf toke awaye doeth commaunde put vppe truely uangelyke pastoure shoulde case make warre doeth neither commaunde layde asyde yet forbid uerayly dooe v vnderstande yt ought much go aboute auenged power reuenge iniuties done vnto v wherfore conclude euangelyke pastoures haue sweord ghospell deliuered christ wherwith sleagh vice cutte awaye man carnall lustes desyres kynges also temporall prince haue theyr sweorde sufferaunce permission make euillmen afearde preferre good men accordingly sweorde taken vse therof prescribed haue defence couseruacion publike tranquilitie bolster maynteyne therwith theyr owne ambiciousnes two manier sweordes lykewyse two maner kyngdomes priestes bishop haue theyr sweorde also theyr kyngdome stede diademes helmettes haue theyr myters stede scepter haue crosyers staffe haue theyr brigandyne theyr souldiers girdle shorte al complete harnes whiche valiaunt warriour saincte paule describeth vnto sondry place euangelyke kynges called pastours lykewyse temporall kynges named poete homer pastours people bothe dooe one thyng yet theyr office ministery diuers euen lyke see enterlude play play one parte yf eche theym theyr owne sweord readines meane yf eche theim would vse power geuen aryght ought dooe thynke veryly rather christen men name dede would often time drawe wicked sweordes thruste theim belly christen brother nowe while bothe nothing regardyng theyr owne duetie haue eche one desyre entermeddle whiche wyse appertayneth vnto theyr vocacion cummeth passe neyther maintayne theyr owne dignitie accordyngly yet conserue publike tranquillitie hath kyng kyngly maiestie suche tyme sitteth iudgement ministreth iustice represseth iniuries endeth centrouersies helpeth oppressed sitteth counsayle studying aduaunce common wealth syde hath byshop hys dignitie suche tymes preacheth doctrine gospel pulpit euangelike king seate royall loke howe vnsemyng thyng emperour nero contende maisters musyke wyth harper stage proue maisteries wagoner lystes turneying place called latyne circus vnsemely thyng kyng meddle wyth lowe peltrie matiers perteine vnto priuate affeccios hurt prosperous state common wealth agayne loke vncomely thyng philosophier would cloke long beard scip stage play parte enterlude el holde bill net hande place swordplayers wonte fyght vtteraunce syng theyr accustomed song would haue woulde haue fyshe cocke flye thou euen lesse vnsemely thyng euangelike kyng playe warryer bye sell wyll speake thynges vnhonest lesse agreable vocacion howe chaunceth anye one byshop dayes thinketh goodlyer thyng hym haue trayne ccc horsmen well appointed wyth crosbowes iauelins handegunnes bee accompanied wyth good numbre learned vertuous deacon carry hym bokes holy scripture dooe thynk selues great pompous shewe setting foorth thynges contemnyng wherof suche succeded accompted great worthy person haue trumpettes horne sweter sounde theyr eares readyng holy scripture well kyng steade diademe robe estate put myter priestes attyre contrary bishop stede myter priestes attyre weare diademe kynges robe kyrtelwil appeare monstreous sight vnto v nowe vnright disordered vse suche thinges signes theyr office ministeries dooe greatly moue v greate deale moued see office turned cleane cam misordered certes either kyng bishop dooe thing priuately must haue respect nothing el health conseruacion people yf dooe theyr dutie aright either admonishe way correct suche haue done amysse coumforte dismayed kepe vnder proude hye mynded styrre vp idle person make variaunce frendes louers againe office kynges specially euangelike kynges wyse ought ambiciously desyre worldly kingdome forasmuche lorde iesus dede spirituall temperall kyng although expressed yerth spirituall kyngdom alonely theyr partes dooe lyeth counterfaicte followe theyr prince wholly gaue himselfe shame dare calleth hymselfe christes vicar lyue onely owne priuate wealth commoditie christe whether temple synagoges went abrode taried home seuerall house carried water continued wildernes dyd nothyng elles lyfe long playe parte sauiour comforter well dooer taught multitude healed diseased clensed lepres restored sycke palsey lame blynd chased awaye hurteful spirites raysed dead deliuered peryll filled belly hungry reproued phariseis defended disciple also synner lauishely poured oyntmente vpon hym coumforted synfull woman canaan taken adulterye peruse whole lyfe iesus shall euidently appeare neuer harmed bodye notwithstanding manye hurtes displeasure done hym others coulde ea ly haue auenged yf pleased hym euery played sauioure euerywere well doer restored malchus eare agayne whiche peter cut swe rd would haue safegarde defeded wyth ye least hurte displeasure might body made herode pilate one hangyng crosse saued one theues whan dead drewe captaine garison vnto christian profession office parte kyng men good hurte bodye example christian prince ought nygh thei folowe forasmuche grace called moste christian kyng name title selfe geuen highnes ought specially moue expresse doinges nere ye possible prince prince christe sparcle shame remayneth person albeit haue pleasure called vicar christe doe notwithstandyng require haue saye theyr lyfe dignitie theyr auarice pryde defended greate effusion shedyng christian bloud wryte ryght noble prince defame reproue bishop albeit woulde wishe god christian bishop whome wordes might beiustely spoken onely shewe wherein ye true dignitie kynges bishoppes consisteth ende bothe knowyng mayntening theyr owne dignitie maye happily passeouer transytorye lyfe goddes pleasure contentacion muche farder euangelike pastours doyng theyr dutye theyr parte make prince beyng debate variaunce one agayne owne accorde incense warre old prouerbe cast brandes vpon fyers flame battayle surely yf euer nedefull good pastour shepherde anye prouide safegarde flocke losse spendyng lyfe example chiefe shepherde christ whose stede expressed folowed chiefly ought haue one theyr duetie whereso greate sea mischiefes gusseth floweth worlde howe chaunceth amog great noumber abbottes bishop archebishops cardinal one steppeth foorth dare putte yea euen veraye lyfe hasarde make ende greate stirryng troublous buisynes worlde howe happily dyeth whoso deathe causeth many thousande mennes lyues saued crueller thyng fyghting hand hande bucherly manglyng cuttyng sweard player yet antiquitie fondly delyted syght moste naughtie detestable example remaynyng vse gentile continued long season euen emong christen men namely citie rome whiche coulde yet forget old paganitie manoure fyghtyng vtterly set asyde maye thanke wytnesseth historye called tripartite history one telemachus manne theyr order profession christian simplicitie desyre leade solitarye lyfe eschewe companye synfull multitude commonly called monkes solytarye person telemachus came purpose easte party rome entryng place whiche called theatrum saye place ordayned beholde shewes pastime sawe two armed men come fightyng place aboute sley one another leaped betwixt furye rage cry saying loude voyce dooe ye brethern go ye like wylde beastes murther one another make shorte tale while good man wente saue theyr lyues lost owne beyng stoned deathe people muche dyd dotyng multitude set thys cruelliye pastime pleasure came honorius emperoure assone enfourmed herof commaunded maner shewyng people pastyme couplyng matchyng together swearde player lefte vtterly abolyshed nowe marke well howe vnhonest pastyme many thousandes reason therof miserablye slayne murthered shal euidently appere much world bo den vnto one mannes death facte telemachus worthely canonized made saincte muche ryght reason shoulde deserue haue lyke honoure gyuen hym woulde aduenture lyfe parte mightye puissaunt prince thus warre fyght continuallye ne agaynst another common welth susteyneth great losse yf swerdplayer kyll sweardplayer one vngracious varlet sleyeth another yet prince cannot enemyes together without vtter detr ment annoyaunce whole worlde contrariwyse may lesse ieopardy parted telemachus parted sweard player fyrste bycause christen men secondarily noble courage stomacke tractable yf bishop el prelate churche go perswade without craft dissimulacion nowe yf anye chaunce vpon suche prince meanes intreated tyrannous cruell nature let consyder greatest hurt displeasure cruellest tyranne world able death praye shall successours apostle shewe exaumple apostolyke spyrite yf shewe case heresaye shall death preuayle yf haue desyre answere christe rewarde gyuer wyll see champion lose rewarde albeit many tymes death obteyneth lyfe could neuer bring death vertuous men small power efficacie wyll stande recitall olde exaumples whiche merable iohn baptist beheaded franke speakyng al prince herodes haue suche peramours herodias ambrose bishop myllayne shranke suspende theodosius emperoure churche cruell rashe sentence agaynst thessalonian sharply rebuked hym commaunded hym make satisfaccion put hym penaunce sorthwith maiestye myghtye prynce gaue place obedient vnto auctoritie bishop holy man babylas bishoppe antioche attempted vse lyke seueritie againste kynge whiche murthered innocent slayne laboure anon deade began feared onely heathen emperour also deuyles whiche yet dayes wurshypped goddes haue ryght excellent prince suche opinion emperours maiestes nature grace disposicion kyng englandes good nature vertuous inclinacion put doubtes would long ere haue folowed good aduertisementes suche counsaillour whiche would haue plaine franke discretion discrete franke plaines whyle lacketh great plenty suche incense myndes prince battayle namely persones whome behoueth forasmuche theyr profit lyuing dependeth therupon haue worlde vprore vnquieted warres one sayeth setteth maiestie naught gaue grace suche mocke another yf highnesse ioyne part vnto dominion may also pleasure easely ioyne vnaduised rashe counsaylour doest thou rather put head howe farre may extende boundes dominion put remembraunce howe narrowe lymites seignorie whiche hath nowe present olde tyme bounded doest thou shewe hym whiche way hath may well gouerned rather enlarged extending boundes endlesse therefore true seneca reporteth many emperours prince haue encrothed vpon others taken theyr march yet neuer none tyl daye hath appointed hymselfe lymittes content withall verye true commendacion prince standeth well gouerning alexander great come oecian sea wished another worlde conquere saye worlde litle satisfye ambiciousnes desyre enlarge empier hercules neuer went beyond yles called gades oecian gades bound insaciable ambicion howbeit pestilent wordes suche persones christian prince ought haue myndes diligently fortyfied afore hand decree sayinges christe triacles preseruatiues poison counsayles haue speciall regarde vnto rule gospell vnto marke peraduenture maiestie aske meane syng long song vnto highnesse sence moste occupyed aboute weightye affaire common wealthe yea desyre haue song songen menne cause el vniuersall calamitie worlde greueth sore also muche desyre see tranquilitie quietnes euery parte christendome speciallye realme fraunce whiche kyngdome wote whether anye excellent eyther true christianitye goodlyuing el worldly aboundaunce prosperitie yf suche rufflyng troublous busynes dyd seldome chaunce lyke great fluddes earthquake famine wont thyng tollerable worlde continually troubled neuer quiet reason suche discorde diuision physycians whensoeuer chaunceth newe bodely disease wittely searche cause maladie whiche knowen easly cure onely contented thus also inuent wayes let thesame plague maye often tymes begyn rage afreshe reigne agayne therfore great euils many tymes chauncing men great wisedome experience semblably searche welles troublous busines oft springeth worlde ende rootes therof beeyng cleane cut vp destroyed maye perfitely cure remeady thesame quycke syghted thynges litell weight importaunce none weightiest thing halfe blynde myne opinion battaile moste part springeth vayne wordes title inuented nourishe ma pryde vayne glory saie ambicion ynoughe worlde vnlesse fed maintened naughtie vice newly inuented title whiche vice owne propre nature groweth fast v suche lyke rootes chief cause battaile beyng cut awaye easie coclude establishe peace among christian prince lawes condicions woulde neuer suffre suche ruffling businesse hurly burly begyn agayne meanes prince encrease richesse beeing common bytwene reas n amitie frendship christian people lyue louely peace tranquilitie vnder moste wealthye prince would lorde iesus true king whole worlde fauorable vnto v cause thinges prosper goe forwarde v feared enemy christes religio againste haue much daye defend owne much lesse able discoumfite chase away far v albeit rather haue refourmed misbeliefe force armes chased away put flyght howe possible v reforme yf selues almoste sayed worse vicious conuersacion dooe esteme christian menne article fayth whiche professe mouthe theyr maners lyning wheresoeuer ambicion couetousnes pryde wrathe reuengemente desyre hurte reigneth say lacketh faythe ghospell nowe albeit pestilence haue infected euen vnto whose office chiefly apperteined see remedy decay christen religion yet haue good hope reformacion see bookes holy scripture specially newe testament taken hande laboured men yea euen much ignoraunt vnlettered sorte many tymes suche professe perfyte knowledge goddes woorde able matche reasonyng many reader bookes newe testament one thyng maketh beleue notwithstanding printer yerely publishe put forth many thousande volume yet bookesellers shoppes hable suffice gred e byers nowe dayes well solde ware whatsoeuer man attempteth vpon ghospell strong medicine receiued dronken canne worke put forth strength wherfore thynketh worlde case lyke mane body vexed greuous disease hath receyued herbe called ellebore strong purgacion together distempered quyet fareth though woulde yelde vp ghoste god sende grace euangelike ellebore haue searched entred veynes soule maye come vp agayne sedes vice beyng therby cast auoyded maye restore v made whole purged synnes vnto iesu christe maye also greate rufflyng almoste vncurable disease worlde bryng agayne vnto menne ioyefull muche desyred tranquilitie verily would hope better common prayer good men ende purpose shoulde made vaine chiefe estate worlde woulde lyke trustie faythfull physycians theyr endeuour helpe worlde euill case saye yf prince whome chiefly lyeth rule worlde wyll would call vnto theyr remembraunce shall shortlye thing present lyfe long continuaunce gyue accoumpt vnto moste soueraigne high prince haue gouerned dominion agayne yf bishoppes diuines ecclesiasticall persones woulde likewyse remember howe haue succeded place anna caiphas scribe phariseis whyles wickedly defended theyr owne kyngdome wente oppresse kyngdome ghospell whyles vphelde defended theyr owne glorye dyd theyr endeuour bury ouer whelme christes glorye finally while laboured approue theyr owne righteousnesse made god vnrighteous rather place apostle pleasure euen leesyng theyr owne bloude liues defende christes kyngdome christes glory christes righteousnes christe hath suffered arysen agayne death lyfe neuer wyll dye agayne suffereth thesame passion afreshe oft truethe ghospell condemned beaten spytte vpon crucified buried short reckeneth done vnto hymselfe whatsoeuer euell displeasure done vnto membres peraduenture moste christian kyng haue spoke frankely large became howbeit great loue beare towarde grace hath made lauishe woordes also bolde vtter minde vnto highnesse beyng christian man wishe well vnto christian menne generally yet haue certaine speciall loue affeccion moste noble florishyng realme fraunce beseche iesu thimmortall kyng whole worlde vnto whome heauenly father hath geuen power heauen yearth geue holy spirite people also prince ruler prince may haue grace happely passe ouer theyr lyues mutuall amytie concorde vnder theyr common kyng prince iesu vnto maye lyue reste peace vnder moste godly wealthy prince ende christian vertue godlinesse beyng well planted among v maye enlarged spred abrode muche possible inuadyng wasting others dominion countreys enemy become porer neuer better godly preaching euery doctrine gospell syncerely truely theyr ministery haue spirite ghospell ordering liues suche sorte verye many may allured professe religion euen swete smell sauour good lyuing ganne christian empire encreaced greatly enlarged established contrary see almost point come nothing considre greatnesse whole worlde wherfore loke aydes first beganne meanes encreaced established must repaire beyng decaied enlarge brought narrowe roume finally establishe againe beyng vnstable sure staye thinges wryte moste christian prince pure zele good mynde neyther reprehending man sence beare men good wyll neyther flatteryng corying fauoure seke naught mannes handes almightie god graunt highnesse well fare yeuen first decembre yere lorde mcccccxxiii pthe lyfe marke written hierome marke disciple interpreter peter beyng desired brother rome wrote shorte ghospell accordyng hearde peter preache shew euery thing mouth whiche ghospell peter heard dyd allow publishe authoritie red congregacion recordeth clement ye sixt boke worke entitled dispositiones marke papias also bishop hierusalem maketh mencion peter first epistle vnder name babylon figuratiue manour speakyng vnderstandeth rome hath wordes congregacion babylon companion eleccion saluteth doth marke sonne wherfore toke ghospell hymselfe written went egipt first men preached christ alexadria ordeyned churche congregacion suche pure doctrine perfite ly ing made professed christ folowe exaple shorte philo eloquentest wryter iewes perceyuyng first congregacion alexandria yet perseuer iewishe religio wrote boke conuersacion praise nacion luke sheweth thinges common among beleuers hierusalem dyd put wryting euer sawe done alexandria tyme marke taught preached dyed eyght yere nero reigne buried alexandria whose place succeded anianus paraphrase erasmus vpon gospell sainct marke first chapter naturallye gyuen men desyre felicitie felicitie many worldly men right politique wyse touchyng certain kynde wisdome haue hitherto promised suche lawes haue made written rule preceptes haue giuen teache men leade vertuouse godlye life much mene able perfourme promise neyther wi themselfes true perfyte felicitie man wherein stoode cause came passe stede true felicitie embraced certain deceyuable image shadowe therof infected errour beyng bothe deceyued selfes deceyuers therfore bothe lawe maker philosophiers brought v certaine gospell owne inuencion suche one partely false deceyuable partly werishe efficacie moyses prophetes wrote certain piththie gospell one nacion alone tyme required wrapped figure shadowes disposing men onely ye knowleage veritie vnsufficient giue perfite saluacion neuerthelesse sumwhat promoting therunto wherin goddes wisdome resembleth nature whiche bringeth v would say leadeth v hande knowleage thynges vndre corporall sight vnto knowleage thinges inuisible yet theyr gospell conteineth feare glad ioyful promise hath muche bewrayed wickednes man taken away rather beaten mennes myndes goddes might power set mercie goodnesse caused rather dreade emplanted loue could man feare tremble despayre learned law alwayes bondage subieccion sinne able refrayne therfro also knowe manne coulde escape iudgement god rigorous sore auenger synne vngodlinesse finde harte loue hym whome feareth ye dreade goddes iustice although many tymes beginning saluacion euen bitter medicine vexeth whole bodie manne entrey health yet thyng whiche maketh man haue perfite felicitie grace beneficiall goodnes god causeth man loue god loue godward thing aua ceth hym happie state felicitie therfore ye whole worlde sumwhat prepared wel prophecy foresayinges prophetes commaundementes figure moyses laste dayes opened preached vnto ye verye ioyefull gospell mene ought embrace louingly receyue whiche owne accorde without deseruyng man behalfe bringeth onely iewes also nacions worlde remission sinnes lest haply manne put doubtes ye certaintie promise god maketh manne neyther ambassadour moyses anye prophetes verye sonne god hymselfe iesus christe oure saluacion came downe heauen toke vpon corruptible fleshe thintent beyng giltlesse without synne might hys passion death freely geue innocencie lyfe beleue promyses put theyr whole affiaunce hym god proper nature gracious beneficial would meanes shewe excedyng great inestimable kindnesse bare towardes makynde great greater neyther desyred ne ought loked could sende honorable messenger owne onely begotten sonne shewe kyndnesse faythe onely freely release mennes offense neuer many neuer great heynous yea ouer holy spirite chose slaues bondman diuell felowes soonne whome hath geuen v al thinges heauen earth bycause nothyng could ioyfull message tydinges right good skyll called grekes euangelion asmuche saye englishe glad ioyfull tydynges comfort feare yoke burthen moyses lawe p beginning ghospell iesu christe sonne god written prophetes beholde sende messenger thy face whiche shall prepare thy waye voyce crier wildernesse prepare ye waye lorde make pathes streight iohn baptise wildernesse preached baptisme repentaunce remission synnes lande iewrye ierusalem went vnto baptised thy ryuer iordan confessing theyr synnes albeit summe menne leuer make rehersall thistorye gospell begynne natiuitie birth iesu christe yet thinketh sufficient woulde briefe take begynnyng iohn baptistes preaching lyke day starre goeth sunne came appeared vnto worlde christes preaching chaunce fortune goddes determinacion styrre vp myndes iewes looke messias would streightwayes cum yea poynte hym vnto theim wyth finger came whiche iohn prophetes many hundred yeares sythens prophecied told cum prophetes whiche prophecied spake christes cummyng spake prophecied also iohn forewalker christe micheas prophete god father speaketh vnto sonne wyse lo sayeth sende especiall electe messenger thy face shall make waye anon shalt cum take thoffice preaching ghospell lykewyse prophete esaye sygnifying preachyng iohn sayeth voyce cryar wildernesse prepare ye waye lorde make strayght pathes semblable wyse paciente monished cummyng phisician knowlage hys disease reuerently receyue hym whan cummeth thynges folowe counsayle therfore tyme approched iesus christe sonne god yet knowen vnto world begin take vpon hym ministracion whiche sent downe heauen earth iohn according prophetes prophecied tolde played forecurrour baptizing wildernesse dyd therby washe awaye sinnes onely styrre exhort men repentaunt former lyfe knowleaging disease shoulde gredely desire cumming whiche onely baptizeth spirite fyre takyng awaye fayth sinnes endowyng men soules heauenly grace whiche poureth hymselfe well fountayne therof freely deliueryng vnrighteousnesse freely geuyng ryghteousnesse freely deliueryng death freely geuyng lyfe euerlastyng greater loue kyndes god shewed vnto mankind greuouser shall punishment haue set nought thesame offred lest iohn came prepare dispose men carnall baptisme spiritual baptisme christ cause exhorting making afrayde forthinke hate former lyfe fynally geue forewarnyng messias kyngdom god hand iohn light shoulde lighten euery man whiche cummeth world messanger light anon appeare phisician whiche take awaye mennes sinnes geue health made inwardly tremble conscience declared vnto great daunger stode finally styrred vp mennes harte greate desire euerlasting saluacion preachyng vnto farre deliuer fro sinne ye brydgrome forewalker bridegrome wake call vp men meete bride grome cumming sonne god voice foreshewing sonne god anon disclosed vnto worlde moses lawe fearefull lawe somuche childern israell could abide voyce god spake vnto iohn limitte bordre set betwene lawe grace man mengled bothe dyd herein vse poynte olde law preachyng manaced men euerlastyng death damnacion vnlesse woulde tourne season synfull lyuing againe new moued people sacrifice burnt offringes vowes fastinges baptisme repentaunce former lyfe shewed moreouer moste mercifull messias already cum present shoulde freely forgiue men offence would put whole trust confidece hym former lawe written published wildernesse thence also cummeth beginning newe must cleane forsake worlde worthy partaker grace gospel whiche compendiously geueth thynges great city rich delicacy pleasure pride ambicio specially ierusalem famous temple reason wherof litle proud stately citie also carnall sacrifice wherunto people trusted furthermore holye dayes obseruaces sabboth prescribed choise meates ceremony wherby supposed man iustified made rightuous god finally highe minded priestes dissemblyng pharisee desireth baptisme gospel must v terly laye apart trust confidence thynges must forsake iewry ierusalem temple sacrifice priesthod pharisaicall fashion thece depart wildernesse may heare moste ioyfull tydinges sauiour straight wayes wil cum returne iohn cried vain made great many afrayed cry preaching forsoke dwelling place hasted water iordan alonely countrey iewrie also ierusalem selfe thither flocked great rablement souldiers publica also certaine phariseis iohn receiued taught many came without choise regard perso also baptise suche displeased themselfes theyr offence confessed expressing hereby certain corporall figure order newe lawe gospell first office ministerie christian profession teache ye christian nouice name vnderstande good reader suche one forsaking eyther iewish panims religion intending christened newely enstructed faith wiche state called thauncient father catechumenus saye christian nouice beginneth doctrine teacher know owne filthie liuyng also goodnesse god wholely displeased hymselfe perceyuyng el appeare hope saluacion hath strayght wayes recourse ayde succour beneficiall lorde freely extendeth mercy goodnesse towardes v great furtheraunce recouering health pacient knowe owne infirmitie preuayleth litle obtaynyng light manne perceyue present darkenes hath already much profited puritie lyfe vertuous lyuing whoso abhorreth owne vnclenesse preaching iohn figureth christian enstruccion fyrste teachyng mouthe christes religion baptisme representeth baptisme christe gentlye receyued euer came vnto hym betokeneth nothyng el lyke euery man nedeth grace gospell euen man degre nacion euer ought secluded phariseis wasshinges washed handes meale tyme whan shoulde take theyr repaste washed theyr bodyes theyr retourne home market washed oftymes theyr cuppes dish stooles table rest theyr housholde stuf though cleanesse puritie lyfe whiche god loueth alloweth v stode obseruacion suche triefles though litle quatitie phariseis water suche force vertue coulde make man euer cleaner sight almightie god suche maner washinges baptismes make man cleaner soule rather proud arrogant happy therfore haue vtterly forsaken moyses phariseis washynges al haste runne vnto bathe iordan hebrue tongue word iordan muche saye floude iudgement iudged lorde iudgeth himselfe thatsame purifying floude whiche issueth two foutaynes knowleage vnrighteousnes remembraunce merciful goodnesse god baptisme repentauce flood teares causeth streames bitter water flow inward vaines mannes hart hath suche stregth vertue doth sharpnesse saltpeter scower wipe awaye al spottes filthe soule phariseis also haue confessio owne one plainly declareth pryde arrogancie fast sayth proude pharisei twyse weke geue vnto poore tenthe parte goodes men iewes cofesse men sinnes owne prepare make thems lues ready receyue baptisme gospell neyther knowen owne good deedes make rehersal men faultes eche truly cofesse theyr poynt arrogancie man stand recitall owne good dedes euen discouer men offence procedeth malice euill shorte acknowleage thine owne sinne iniquitie glorify goodnes god piohn clothed camel heare gyrdel skynne hys oynes eate locustes wilde ony preached saying tha stronger cummeth whose shooe latchet worthy stoupe downe cuse haue baptised water shall baptise holy ghost thintent iohn lyke manier came first cummyng christe hely according prophecie malachi shall cum last might holy perfite lyuing resemble hely led lyfe wildernes vtterly exchewing sinfull company worldly people clothed silkes yet wullen clothes garment made camel heare girded oynes lether gyrdle strayght manour liuing shewed certaine euangelike christian perfeccion euen gospel published preached foode agreable dwelling place apparayle euen suche came hand easie gotten suche place accorde without husbanding tillyng gaue hym commonly certaine fly called locustes wild hony criar preacher christ great deale moses lawe required law made distinccion betwene sundrye kyndes beastes vtterly without commaundement abstayned eating fower footed beastes fowles fi he law forfeded clothing linsaye wolsaye cleane depriued himselfe bothe vse woll flaxe suche lyfe doubtles conuenient preacher repentaunce although sanctified mother wombe yet would neuer lesse leade straight life lest preaching shoulde haue bene litle estemed set liuyng doctrine point disagreed meanes gate hymselfe great renoume auctoritie among iewes manye supposed bene messias dede iohn albeit man highly fauour god endewed many godly giftes quality yet perceiuing great offence manne chalenge glorye whiche dewe vnto god one man put ayde saluacion openly preached presence sayde ye suppose doctrine base werishe doctrine baptisme effectuall nothing el manne ye conceyued sinne nothing elles hys messenger whiche strayght wayes cum gyue saluacion vnto men behynd tyme estimacion world muche lesse auctoritie surmounteth farre heauenly power ihe stroger c haue suche reuerence veneracion worthy serue office vilest drudge slaue worthy saye lye vpon ground vnleuse latchet shors oughte honoure ought intierly feruent affeccion desire cummyng preache vnto earthly thinges shall teache heauenly matiers haue hitherto baptised touching bodye water preparing myndes repentaunce nce cummeth abrode shall baptise holy ghoste whose secret vertue sanctifieth thinges man hath rightuousnesse himselfe euen man geue thesame must nedes power excellencie man whoso geueth thing whiche pertayneth god alone geue knowe difference betwene vnworthy seruaunt maister betwene minister auctor betwene criar kyng p came passe dayes iesus came fro nazareth galile baptised iohn io assone cum water saw heauen open spirite descending vpon lyke doue came voyce heauen thou art deare sonne delite iohn wordes lyke sentence moued styrred vp mynde great manie theym wayt messias cummyng furth came iesus tyme cum forsakyng litle village nazareth countrey galile educacio long continuaunce thesame men thought bene borne certes nature propertie euangelike thinges begyn baselye suche begynnynges litle litle cum length highest perfeccion whereas contrarily thinges euer world deuel goeth merueilous goodly beginninges sodainly cast brought nought lucifer while set feate northe ymagenyng equall highest sodainlye cast downe headlyng hell semblable wise adam thorough diuels instigacio desired equall god exiled cast paradise therfore thou considre high excellencie greatnesse iesu cause muche wonder singuler humblenesse mynd modestie came poore homely village galile vil st countrey iewrie purifieth thinges came one raskall sort humble lowly baptisme repentauce amog sinner souldiers brothelles publicas without seruautes wayte attede vpo hym ynough hym circumcised accordyng ordynaunce lawe purified tradicion moyses desyred also receiue iohns baptisme teaching enstructing v hereby whoso maketh hym selfe ready ministre preacher gospell muste omitte nothing whiche wyse perteyneth increase vertue godlines schew thinges wherwith weakelinges may offended iohn taught v lesso preacher goddes word shoulde get himselfe estimacion auctoritie gorgeous apparell popouse liuing honest behauiour godly conuersacio e saple christ shewed muche perfeccion farther iewishe fashion differyng nothyng neyther apparell yet dyet dyd neuerthelesse godlye lyning mekenesse beneficiall goodnes towardes men vtterly duske deface auctoritie iohn hygher perfeccion whiche geuen grace gospel whiche procedeth austeritie straitnes lawe whole intent lorde iesus make worlde know onely aucthour saluacion expresse set vnto v certaine fourme euangelike true godlynes cofirme truth certentie euer moyses prophetes v itte thinges past make v wer giuing earnest peny haue sure hope expectacion thinges yet come right gladly beleue haue conceyued meruelous good opinion vpon many witness consent agree wherfore procured prouidence wisdome god lorde iesus shoulde euery haue euident recorde testimonie deitie whole lawe moses prophetes angel shepardes wise men called magician scribe simeon anne iohn baptist father holy ghost finally pylate deuils miracle also wrought plainely declared hym ye sonne god dyd many thinges himselfe nede yt would set vnto v owne person certaine fourme trade lyuing fasted tempted oftentymes prayed came baptisme obeyed parentes paciently suffered iniuries wronges finallye came crosse passion perfourmed many thynges prophetes prophecied lest people doubt promise afterwardes accomplished baptisme receyued holye ghost lykenesse doue lightyng vpon croune heade arose agayne death lyfe wherfore came penitent iohn desired baptisme obteyned baptised iordane wherin baptised tanner publican souldiers sorte people sinful none blemished defiled w h sinne ye stately prince worlde ashamed haue nothyng common vulgare people kyng priest cummeth baptisme theyr pleasure would scarcely vouchesafe receyue baptisme bason golde preciouse stone nowe sauiour iesus fountayne puritie kyng kynges lord lordes disdayned common bathe wherin common sorte washed whoso humbleth hymselfe manand assone come c highly exalted god iesus baptised rest euerychone common people present father heauen disseuered hym fro residue certayne notable signe neuer sene ne heard sone come water iordane whiche halowed touche holy body vnto lande contemplacion prayer iohn sawe heauens open holy ghoste flie downe thence light vpon holy croune heade tarye pride adam closed gate paradise agaynste v humblenesse mynde modestie christe hath paradise opened v gate heauen visible signe shewed vnto mannes iyes taughte maner myndes heauenlye spirite loueth maketh spirite deuill worlde maketh loueth suche mindes haute puffed vp pride fierce heauenly spirite loueth whiche lowely meke peacible nothing harmles without gyle doue nothing whose nature wurse agreeth fighting raueny plainlye expressed set lord corporall figure spiritually wrought sincere pure faith receyue baptisme gospell body washed water soule throughly annoynted grace inuisible moreouer done abode still vpon croune lordes head signified holy ghoste geuen godlye men good lyuers atably measure proporcion faithe presently expedient iesus continuall fountaine al heauenly grace doue brought hym new grace whiche euidently declared howe full grace showed moreouer whence grace goodnes issueth cummeth vnto v iohn beyng stablyshed mynde euident signe receiued father heauenand ae voyce heaue c doubted pronounce iesus sonne god witnes gaue vnto christ great waight authoritie amog iewes much greater testimonie father himselfe whose voyce sounded doune heaues saying thou art derely beloued sonne whome minde delighteth wyse childe father ioy comforte heauenly spirit god ydle weake faynt feble nature fiery wurketh putteth furth vertue soone entred soule man spirite man slacke slowe thinketh vpon nothing whiche lowe vile worldly haue spirite fleash mortified led spirite god furthwith goe hande high thinges manly enterprise say doe fight vncleane spirite ghostly enemy deuil afrayed euen prouoke battayle men puttyng theyr whole confidence ayde succour heauenly spirite whiche muche vertue puissauce withstande gospell pand immediatly spirite droue wildernes wildernes fowerty dayes tempted sathan wild beastes aungels ministred vnto hym iohn taken iesus came galile preachyng gospell kyngdome god saying tyme cum kyngdome god hande repent beleue gospell wherfore iesus plainly expressing himselfe woulde haue v doe incontinent haue receyued baptisme brought force holy goste wildernesse made abode fowertie dayes many nyghtes styll continuyng prayer fastyng meane season tempted deuyll discoumfited ouerthrowen hym delyuered vnto v ouercum shewyng v also verye waye meane howe gette victorye ouerthrowen spirite christe continuall prayer sobernesse lyfe weapon holy scripture whyle christe continued thus wyldernesse lyued among saluage beastes vtterly abstayning comfort solace taken company man daunger hym yf bene conuersaunt multitude people shewed hereby howe expedient christian souldiour exchewe compainye conmon sorte vntill haue sufficiently tamed fleshe ouercome deuyl continuall recordyng goddes lawe deuout prayer made selfe strong ynough spirite many safetie lyue among beastes christ dyd conuersaunt suche mene noysome brute beastes lorde sauiour iesus christe kept company beastes while lacked ministery angel alwayes present serued hym vtterly despyse al pastime pleasure worlde neuer wante heauenlye pleasure solace v profite christ baptised v prayed v notably described testimony father holye ghost v went wyldernesse v fasted v tempted v gatte victorye
