ouer deuil consyder thou christian souldiour true right order thy perfeccion first instruccion teaching mouth christes religion causeth hatred former lyfe hope clensyng remission synnes capitaines thou runnest iordane throughe fayth christe washest awaye fylthynesse thy synnes anon thine owne praier peti ion praier churche thou hast newe spirite geuen heauen arte admitted number child god empla ted body iesu christ member hym heade churche meane whyle behoueth souldiour christe carelesse thou hast promysed thy seruice christe thyne emperour thou hast renounced deuill thou haste receyued holy ghoste gifte money bond earnest penye thy salarye thou must enforce thyselfe thy vtter endeuour get victory neuer chauceth negligente rechele e person thou must take thee armoure weapon leste thyne ennemie whiche euerywhere lyeth wayte cum vpon vnwa e thou arte vnarmed thou shalte incontinent assaulted world deuil fleshe thou muste alwaies fight thentent thou mayest alwayes gette victory battaile shal nde thou make ende thy lyfe yet oftener thou chaunce vanquishe thine ennemye weaker shall departe battayle thou stronger thou haste behaued thyselfe valiantly played manne lengthe addresse thy selfe ministracion ghospell specially yf thou feele spirite god driue therunto lorde iesus meete preache ghospell whiche ministerie none greater perfeccion euen verye lytle hylde ordeyned patarne example hymselfe v counterfayte folowe wherby taught ought profession rashely hasten ourselues high holy ministracion lawe moyses tyme also tyme behoued lyght euangelyke veritie beganne litle litle shine furth vnto worlde euen shoulde shadowes olde lawe vanishe awaye carnall lawe gyue place vnto spirituall puttyng furth vertue lyke transformacions naturall chaungynges thynges certaine meane whiche hath affinitie extreme intent thinges muche contrarietie maye easely trasformed rned one another eu n iohn came meane betwene carnall law moyses spirituall law ye ghospell ende men might soner transformed brought fleshe litterall sence lawe spirite true meanyng ayre sodainly immediatly made yearth transformacion water meane betwene whiche length litle lytle fined ayre pure element wherfore long preachyng iohn partly vphelde olde lawe muche also sumwhat helpeth bryng man christ floris ed sauiour iesus leste haue seemed eyther contende iohn el disanull law whiche came make perfect neuer preached openly ne declared diuine power fewe miracle gathered together disciple rather behaued hymselfe disciple iohn teachyng v hereby well exercise office mayster vnlesse himselfe haue beene obedient disciple iohn cast prison plaine frake speakyng dyd christ succede come place meete carnall fyrste latermore whiche spirituall gostely whiche vnperfect goeth perfect cummeth grace foloweth propertie nature corne fyrste grasse haue eeres mannes state foloweth infancie ceremony lawe notwitstandyng haue sumwhat shadowed figured christ yet nowe length drawe theyr ende light ghospell shineth abrode whose auctour iesus christe went first preache galile lyked hym newe lyght shoulde begin shyne oute parte iewry whiche counted vilest proude ierusalem deserued haue pre minence albeit dede blynde betell yet thought selfe haue perfect good syght cause vncurable thynges whiche came passe hasard fortune lyeth hyd certayne secrete significacio thynges doen keneth iohn closed shut vp prison forsoth law moyses shall appearyng moste cleare light gospell made darke vtterly loose lyght signifieth bounde truely carnall parte lawe shalbe bounde freedome l used set large grace gospel meaneth iohns heade striken certes nowe presente true heade whole congregacion shalbe assembled nacions whole worlde iesus preacheth kyngdome god galile undoubtedlye maketh foresigne grace ghospell shall forsake wicked iewes go gentyles iewes embraced styll olde heade whiche chopped ghospell contemned christe head whole lawe woorde galile sirian tongue signifyeth flytting chaungyng habitacion tyme grace laye hydde ceremony hyghest estimacion nowe gone iesus cummeth abrode effectuall auctour preacher grace gospell therfore accordyng misticall sence hereof whoso wil heare christ preache must flytte away olde vsages naughty lustes intent maye receyuable newe heauenly doctrine let iewe caste awaye perswasion sure beliefe hath conceyued owne holynes pharisey pryde taketh trustyng woorkes bishoppes glory temple sacrifice philosopher vayne aydes mannes wisedome let kynges tyrauntes cast awaye moste foolyshe truste whiche repose ryches let nacions laye aparte vngodly customes filthy lustes hearken vnto newe preacher iesus teacheth worldly heauenly thynges speaketh indifferently menne let men therfore heare hym alike expediente consider sauiour christ beginneth set furth doctrine worldly philosopher first teache audience thynges fruitfull profitable thinges may cause admiracio singuler wisedome minding nothing muche get themselues name dissenting opinion famous teacher lorde iesus woulde neyther disanull thauctoritie olde law doth truely interprete ye misse vnderstad rather making perfit destroying neither disproued iohns doctrine although vnperfit bega preaching selfsame beginning iohn vsed man would haue saied bene scholer disciple iohn dede maister auctour preacheth crye ye word sone euerlasting father maketh world far swarued fro ye right vsage law nature whiche god hath grauen planted al men hertes wisdome philosopher taught increased foly worlde religion gentyles vsed time moste wicked detestable law moses caused muche hipocrisy shadowes sacrifice fear lawe sygnified meant figure prophetes tolde prophecy one cum offer vnto nacions perfite saluacion promise long differred worlde beyng deafe gaue eare thereunto yet lorde graciouse goodnesse forgate perfourme time already fulfilled prefixed aforepointed vnto busines nede henceforth await fulfillyng figure mo darke sayinges ye lawe nede loke newe prophetes loe kyngdome god present steade shadowes eritie shall shine abrode steade carnall lawe spirituall shall succede cum place steade corporall ceremony true godlines shall raigne steade deuilles kyngdom god kyngdom shal enlarged cause lynger stay man shoulde looke backe vnto aydes owne rightuousnesse perhaps moyses lawe taketh rightuousnesse sum rightuouse sighte worlde new lawe requireth thesame men synners vnrightuous yet cause dispayre knowe disease receyue remedy onely repentaunte former lyfe stedfastly beleue gospel nowe brought vnto message right ioyfull muche desyred meane free remission trespass haue nede burnte offringes onely knowledge vnrighteousnesse repose youre affiaunce righteousnes almighty god doubtlesse perfourme promiseth ghospell man shal sufficiently deserue enioye promise therof whoso beleueth promiser pa walked sea galile sawe symon andrewe brother casting nettes sea fyshers iesus sayd vnto folowe wyll make become fyshers men streyght waye forsoke theyr nettes folowed hym gone litle thence sawe iames sonne zebede iohn brother whiche also shyppe mending theyr nettes anon called left father z ede therein hyred seruau te folowed hym lorde iesus suche wordes moued styrred vp myndes iewes receiue newe phylosophy doctrine ghospell lykewyse began ensample iohn gather certaine disciple fewe number suche vnlettered persones lowe degree entent theyr ministery conuerted whole worlde shoulde plainly appeare kyngdom kyngdom god worldly kyngdom therefore trauayled daye lake sea galile ispied symon andrewe brother labouryng together aboute caste nettes water fisherman occupacion gat lyuyng basenes theyr crafte made aduauncyng goddes glory concorde two brother sygnified consent agremente churche crafte fyshing bare figure ministracio ghospell vertue goddes worde plucketh vp lyght veritie loue heauenly thynges suche drowned darkenesse ignoraunce fowle stinkyng puddell worldly care thus fyrste fyshed two fyshers come ye folowe make begynne day forwarde fyshe men assone lord iesus spoken word two brethre leauing theyr nettes euen folowed without tarying iesus voice hathe certaine heauenly charme inchauntment goyng thence lytle forwarde sawe two iames sonne zebede iohn brother also trymmyng mendyng theyr nettes shyppe makyng themselues ready go fyshyng two notwithstanding myndes bent another waye sodeinly spake vnto callyng commaundyng folow hym thou mayest know young men euangelike faith made tarying leauyng father zebede hired seruauntes shyp streyght wayes folowed theyr caller thus beganne christe gather ciefe prelate minister churche cleane refusyng priestes phariseis ierusale pompe pryde pand came capernaum streyghtwaye sabboth dayes enterd synagoge taught astonyed learnyng taught one authoritie scribe accompanyed felowshyp came vnto capernaum capernaum citie muche florishyng substaunce lesse proud vngodly vicious welthy byanby beganne playe parte euangeliste preacher ghospell vpon sabboth daye entred sinagoge taught iewes openly vayne fable phariseis declared vnto true meanyng lawe dede spirituall carnall people perceiued newe teacher doctrine also new sort thei sawe lowe degre suche acco panied fewe numbre rascal men reputacion yet wondered greatly wordes breathed certaine godly vertue maner scribe teache triflyng costitucions men olde wyues tale genealogy pedegrewes wordes pith hy authoritie wonderfull great miracle wrought caused verity spake beleued thyng soeuer humayne worldly litle price estimacion goddes power begynneth put furth strength efficacie pand synagoge man vexed vncleane spirite cryed saying ala haue thou iesus nazareth arte thou cum destroye v knowe thou arte euen holy one god iesus rebuked saying holde thy peace cumme man wha vncleane spirite torne cried loude voyce came amased insomuche demauded one another among themselues saying thing newe doctrine authoritie commaunded foule spirites obeyed immediatlye fame spred abrode throughoute region bordering galile lo byanby occasion ministred worke myracle assembly certaine felowe whiche vexed vncleane spirite wicked spirite coulde abyde heauenly spirite speakyng christ beganne clatter agaynst heauenly doctrine cry aloude saying iesus nazareth hast thou v arte thou cumme destroye v tyme right well knowe thou arte certes selfe holy one whiche prophete daniel promysed long sithens god hath singularly sanctified aboue al lorde iesus eyther tyme yet cumme openly confesse el pleased confession beyng vndoubtedly true yet made hroughe constraint feare wicked spirite sythe hymselfe lyer delighteth deceiue man hearde presence people spake trueth lest manne woulde haue taken occasion beleue hym afterwardes lyed lorde iesus saye rebuked hym sayed holde thy peace departe man shalt thou better declare furthwith lordes comaundemet vncleane spirite forsoke departure tare cryed loude voyce euidently appeared thereby fled awaye wyllingly force constraint god power shewed fygure manne possessed spirite deuyll vexed wyth worste cruellest deuils whiche wholly possessed ambicion couetousnes rancour malice hatred pleasure body suche lyke deuilishe lustes appetite suche vexed spirites canne wyse abyde heare gospell preached yell crye oute agaynst deuill dyd saying haste thou v iesus arte thou cumme destroye v many ye spirite world possesseth thinke themselues vtterly forlorne whensoeuer constrayned forsake thinges wherein haue sette theyr false felicitie wherfore theyr myndes sore troubled would saye tugged haled sondrie piece whylest one syde feare eternall damnacion moueth vertue goodnes syde venimous swetnes vice thei haue long time accustomed vnto holdeth fast withdraweth theyr godly purpose yet manner deuill taketh faste holde wyll commaundement iesu flye awaye muche greater myracle make ambicious man temperate fyerce felowe pacient lecherous persone chast liuer extorcioner one liueth pollyng pyllyng lyberall man delyuer mannes body wycked spirite yet men wonder wonderfull meruailous dede seene bodely iyes therfore thus chased awaye vncleane spirite commaundement onelyand amased c iewes greatly wondered insomuche demauded one another saying new thing haue read euer prophetes dyd lyke castyng deuyls bare worde mouth onely new kynde doctrine hath great vertue power folowing preacheth kyngdome god putteth furthe god power treadeth vnder foote subdueth power deuill neyther sorcery inchauntment makyng long prayer vnto god yet laborious meane thus putteth flyght wycked fendes commaundeth worde onely theyr lorde conquerour incontinet whether wyll obey hym wonderful facte great fame iesu spred abrode throughout countrey galile shoulde appeare well spring godly power whiche neuer consumed one miracle dyd streyght wayes succede folowe another pand furthwith cumme synagoge entred house symon andrew iames iohn symos mother lawe laye sicke feuer anon tell hym came toke hande lyfte vp immediatlye feuer forsake ministred vnto euen sunne downe brought vnto hym diseased vexed diuels citie gathered together doore healed many sicke diuerse disease cast many deuils suffered deuils speake knewe hym anon departed synagoge came house symo andrew whither also iames iohn folowed symons mother lawe fortuned laye sycke sore vexed ague assone iesus aduertised therof went bedside toke woman hande lyfted vp forthwith feuer forsoke eue sodainly perfectly made whole sodaynly made lusty strong insomuche accustomed office house ministring vnto iesu disciple lyeth sycke perilous disease whose mynde burneth loue carnall pleasure reason superfluitie excesse leadeth ydle sluggishe lyfe woman lyeth sycke beginning fyrst woman deceiued pleasaunt alurement apple began sycke ague fleshe alwayes lusteth agaynste spirit eue happy whome iesus touche moste holye spirite lifteth vp loue heauenly thynges whiche tyme serued ydlenesse riotous liuing vncleannes maye sodeynly recouer olde strength lustynes made newe manne hereafter becum seruaunt clennes chastitie sobernes meates whiche christe refreshed delyghted withall ymagine house symon sygnifieth churche christ whiche conuenient anye feble weake spirite suche full euangelyke strength lustines yet many tymes peter mother lawe saye synagoge lyeth sicke membre synagoge vnto whose corrupte tasting vnsauery weryshe letter yet sauoreth tasteth well water pharisaicall vnderstanding wyse tast wyne spirite true meaning ghospell house lorde iesu desyred lyfte vp woman laye sycke bedde semblable wise let v bres churche desyre mercyfull goodnes humble praiers wyll vouchesafe put holy ryght hand therwith lifte vp also timerous person whiche clening letter scripture wholy geuen supersticious obseruacion ceremonyes dooe certaine vnright iudgement greatly desyre thynges hurtfull noysome contrarily hate abhorre suche thinges onely desyred lyfte vp saye fredome ghospell whiche serueth purpose libertie committe sinne pleasure intent gladly right good dooe workes euangelike christian charitie cherishe iesus membres lorde alwayes ready heale soule yf desyred called vpon loueth call vpo hym call neuer importunatly season nowe late euening sunne set might thought great point importunitee cal vpon physycian time great desyre healthe vpper hande shame brought vnto great numbre suche wer diseased kyndes infirmity among also whiche vexed vncleane spirites whole citie capernaum came thicke threfolde gate house see syght iesus without excuse healed many sundry disease cast many deuils quicke readye physycian worde cured disease moreouer put silence deuils cryed loude voyce christ vtterly despysyng testimonie enemyes whome woulde shoulde wyse haue suffered chyldren hebrewes fyshers descry hym admitted recorde deuils though true noughtines person telleth trueth doth hurte thesame doeth harme lie whiche hath gotten himselfe credence afore true tale tellyng done accordyng hystorie open secrete sence meaning hereof se many euen nowe adayes cum flockyng vnto simon peter house whiche sayde bare fygure churche citie capernaum representeth whole world setting sunne fygureth deathe christe gate house signifieth baptisme whiche beset repentaunce former lyfe truste obtayne soule healthe iesus sycke people sitte aboute gate saye publican sinner desyre receiued felowship churche deserue behealed except surely beleued iesus bothe could would geue helth churche christ conteyned small numbre long lanterne lyght world liued yearth death great multitude people began thither resorte al countreis world pand morning early iesus rysen vp departed wete solitarye place prayed symon folowed found hym sayed vnto hym men seke saied vnto let v go next tounes may preache also therfore cu preached theyr sinagoges al galile cast deuils thinges done lorde iesus came onely purpose cure corporal disease whiche sendeth many tymes intent maye whole soule saye sawe multitude greatly desyre healed bodely disease lyke affeccion couet heare heauenlye doctrine wherewith malady disease soule cured nexte daye though bene desyrous take ease rest deceyued roose verie earlye morning went capernaum solytary place made prayer father genyng hym thankes benefites wyche decreed geue vnto mankynde hym sundrye ensamples prepared instruccion fyrste teacheth v must assone haue done neyghbour good departe away leste seme loke mede reward haue done good vnto secondarilye taught manye tymes leaue teachyng holsom doctrine season styre vp desyre v aduaunce finally learne also ought refreshe quicken spirite often goyng asyde solitary place meane suche goynges aparte pleasure pastime prayer heauenly contemplacion maye retourne thence willyng spirite better disposed helpe weake euery man hath chaunged place goen wildernes hath cleane seuered mynde worldly care wholly bent himselfe studie contemplacion heauenly thinges simon peter reste disciple vnderstode iesus priuilye departed folowed til founde beseming true disciple iesu tyme awaye maister whome ought thynges folow meane season people whiche flocked early mornyng gate house also learned iesus gone awaye lykewyse folowed hym wildernesse many folow iesus none fynde hym oute saue alonly disciple haue founde shewe vnto wherfore tolde lorde great multitude citizen capernaum come thither seke lorde answered saying sufficient present haue layed foundacions among capernaites nowe tyme go like maner viset litle tounes village maye likewyse preache kyngdome god came preache one citie alone declare saluacion men cause lorde trauayled tounes village galilee preachyng synagoges curyng disease castyng deuils ignorant people shoulde reason mighty dedes myracles geue firme credence vnto doctrine came leper besethyng hym knelyng downe saying vnto hym thou wilt thou canst make cleane iesus compassion hym put furth hande touched hym sayth vnto thou cleane sone spoken immediatly leprosy departed hym sent awaye furthwith sayth vnto se thou saye nothing get hence shewe thy self priest offer thy clensyng thynges whiche moses commaunded witnes vnto assone departed began tell many tynges publishe saying insomuche iesus coulde openly entre citie desert place came hym euery quarter chaunced tyme whe iesus taught people certaine mou tayne many goodly lesson concerning perfeccion euangelike christian profession met came doune agayne certaine man infected leprosy disease vncurable abhorred men whome shewed corporal iyes figure thinges wrought inuisible operacion soules hearer leper hated filthy disease meruelous great confidence iesu thou seest figure sinner returnyng vicious liuyng entendyng amend nexte dore saluacion leper feared ye people although knewe right well abhorred company onelye regarded goodnes iesu wherfore ranne vnto hym fell downe knee woulde proude pharisey would crye hence ougly abhominable creature leste infect euen oure iyes would call water washe awaye noysome contagious breath would pharisey vncleane soule leper body doth moste meke gentill lord whiche onely pure cleane spot synne commaundeth hym sight remoued awaye knee vnknowen vnto desyred wil yt notable fayth ensample men suche lecherous person couetous full hatred enuy attached filthy lustes appetite body foule arayed horrible detestable leprosy herewith infected let heare marke wordes leper thintent maye folow hym thou wilt sayth thou canste make cleane knowlegeth disease doubteth power goodnes god wholy referrreth ye iudgemet lorde iudge whether worthy receiue great benefite handes readie geue thankes yf obtayne desire murmur grutche agaynst hym yf obtayne would saye thus able put awaie leprosy onely cureth kindes disease also casteth deuils wyll willingly helpeth distresse misery whersoeuer cummeth great myne vnworthynes alone deserue whiche obtain moste mercifull goodnes perfite belefe ioyned exceding humblenes mynde modestie procured hym mercy iesu sauiour shewing outwardlye euen countenaunce certayne affecte pitie compassion therby teache affeccion mynd ought v towarde synners heldeout hande therewith touched leaperand iesus compassion c vertue wordes hymselfe prescribed made hym cleane leper sayed thou wilt thou canst make cleane iesus answered thou cleane true fayth maketh many wordes neyther grutcheth charitie gospell good deede christ scarcely spoken wordes cleane disease quite gone man token therof remayned lawe moses forfendeth touche leaper spirituall meaning wherof cotayneth wholsome doctrine must abstayne company vncleane person synners leste infected contagiousenes vyces lorde iesus aboue lawe neyther defiled touchyng purifieth whatsoeuer toucheth touched leaper hys hande furthwith healed whole bodye let v therfore praye may seblable wyse touche soules holy worde therwith purifie inward vncleannes thou vsest haunt company harlot thou adulterer polluted lyke disease runne lyke manner vnto iesus cumeth downe height maiestie meteth knowyng thine filthines fall downe knee prostrate thy selfe lye flat vpon grounde crye call vpon crye moste stedfaste belife harte mynde lorde thou wilt thou canste make cleane anon thou shalt heare wordes agayne thy mercifull sauioure thou cleane thynges done maner rehearsed lorde suffered man folowe caused departe commaunding hym straytly disclose nothing matter creature lyuyng rather get hence shew thy selfe priest whose iudgemet accordyng ceremony lawe thou wast iudged leaper geue sentence thou arte clensed dede thy leprosy offer moses hath commaunded offered fortune deliuered therof thus shalt thou credece publishe god benefit towardes thou straight wayes tell euery body thou arte made cleane meanes shall appeare euen vnto phariseis themselues whiche depraue benefites thou wast verye leper hast bene clensed without eyther help phisicias el moses law bare worde mouthe touche onely shall know one present farre passeth priestes easely cure leprosy thoughe detestable abhorted wher haue muche doe truly dicerne thesame felow departed stede leper cleane bodye wente priest sene iudged cleansed leprosie anon conceled dede published euerywhere reportyng bothe many thynges iesu sum aske man commaunded one thyng nothyng regarde lordes commaundement truely one serued confirme certaintie miracle priest knowing yet healed man shoulde pronounce healthe restored iesu perfit health el peraduenture woulde haue depraued christes benefit yf autour therof bene knowen geuen verdite miracle confirmed sentence made muche god glory haue published abrode wherefore comaunded iesu thing kept secret dede blased abrode vttred forsoth monishe v ought seke glorye prayse man benefites whiche pleaseth god worke v goodlyer praise euer foloweth whiche refuse thesame procedeth high courage good turne yt thou wouldest haue thankes therfore yelden thou hast doen good pleasure vnto beyng contented lay thy lot helpe thyne euen christen necessitie holpen suche benefite hath receyued thy handes ought muche diligence publish set thy well euerywhere thy prayse comendacion christ daunger offende vainglory therfore ensample ordeyned instruccion whiche continually great ieoperdy fall therein neyther man contemne christes commaundementes great gladnes reason restitucion health certaine feruent loue whiche kyendeled withall towardes christe ye autour therof would suffer hym kepe silece nger uerely chaunceth parte best beleued tell thinges whiche rather dede kepe secret disclose matter selfe enforced v vtter lyeth hyd stomakes nowe came man thus blase abrode miracle truly reason therof euery man conceyued suche opinion lorde iesu could great throng prease people thyther resorted openly enter citie wont doe constrayned auoyde good tounes make abode wildernesse suche goe get name gaynes iugglyng caste woorkyng magicall miracle desyer city whereas moste haunt resorte people oure sauiour iesus ofte tymes shunneth muche assembly people plainly teacheth v ought able worke miracle gospell doeth muche desyer great multitude feruent mynde affeccion beholder great city many resorted vnto hym purpose delite iyes newe straunge sightes man foloweth iesus wyldernesse vnlesse long hym certaine vehement desire affeccion forgoeth al pleasure good tounes foloweth christ thorow rough cumberous place foloweth hym great commoditie loueth hym vnfaynedly doeth thinges folowe hym whome loueth reproche hungre despoylyng substauce banishmet imprisonment tourmentes death suche folowers christ figured came flockyng countreis partes galile vnto iesu kept hymselfe close desert solitary place ij chapter whithersoeuer man flieth vertue hath euer fame glory folowyng euen shadow foloweth body vnfainedly good ca neuer one maner man lyke himselfe alwayes light whithersoeuer body sune remoueth euen place soeuer true godlinesse remoueth alwayes great resort people wildernesse longer wildernesse lorde iesus true light world gon thither yet persone whome power worke myracles ghospell ceaseth asmuche lyeth auoyde place wheras muche people assembled beholde hym knoweth certainly perilous vice vainglory neuerthelesse feruent desyre hath helpe men good doeth oftimes cause hym though againste nature haue recourse thither againe meanes cummeth passe while good man compelled remoue place place moe receiueth benefite handes p dayes also entred capernaum agayne noysed house anon many gathered together insomuche roume receiue somuche dore preached worlde vnto came certaine vnto bringyng one sicke palsey whiche borne fower men could come nye vnto prease vncouered roofe house broken vp oofe de let downe bed wherin sicke palsey lay iesus sawe fayth sayd vnto sicke palsey sonne thy sinnes forgeuen thee wherfore iesus geuyng v ensample bothe flye vayne glory also continually doe good euen christen within fewe dayes returned agayne capernaum whence semed dryuen away reason great importunitie people whiche euen night tyme lay gate house wherin soiourned made bethleem muche renoumed byrthe nazareth famous educacion countrey egypt happy fled thyther preseruacion safegarde adopte choose capernaum countrey bothe ofte tarrying also shewyng many fayer miracle came agayn hyther maner stealth fyrste kepte hymselfe secrete house knowen citye cum sunne hyd lorde iesus kept close secret rumour whiche commonly seen rose person blowe abrode throughout whole citie iesus house furthwith thither flocked suche multitude people house fylled onely also porche al place dore sufficient receiue blessed house whither iesus cum dwell neuer departeth thence agaynt house churche capernaum beareth figure whole worlde wheresoeuer gentyles inhabite certes ierusalem iewes cast iesus temple among gentile kyngdome heauen suffereth violence multitude sortes people entreth certaine forcible fashion christian nouices sitte aboute ye gate greatly desyring admitted lordes house muche houngryng thirstyng rightuousnes kyngdom heauen verily iesus excludeth manne house neyther poore ryche whole syckehe prec vnto haue vehement desyre heare hym wherefore lorde teachyng v ought alwayes chyeflye care soule health afterwarde body fyrste ministred vnto doctrine ghospell wherwith disease malady soule cured cause disposed geue almes ye poore well yf geue fyrste bryefe exhortacion maye make better mynde soule departe theyr charitie common sort people suche disordered iudgement desyrous thynges whiche expedient body yt pertayne theyr soule health lord euidently declared vnto v ensample chiefe care oughte parte whiche chiefeste parte porcion man fyrste taught healed suche diseased nowe whyles iesus teachyngand cam certa vnto hym busye curyng disease theyr soules came vnto hym certain men bringyng theim one sycke palsey whose synowes resolued partes body violence disease could styrre bed fayne caried thither vpon fower mennes shoulder hast thou plainly set ymage fygure minde whiche worldly lustes desyres made womanlyke dissolute wise lift vp selfe doe thyng good godly lyeth styl bedde lowe filthy care neuer remembreth thyng hygh celestiall nowe sawe howe coulde prease people sate thicke gate porche bryng sycke man sight iesus lifted hym vp vpon house remoued slate made way let hym doune bed long corde layed hym feete iesu nothyng doubtyng great mercie goodnesse woulde help selye wretche assone cast pitifull iyes vpon hym beheld laye bed lyke quicke karkas impotent benummed lymmes iesus sawe miserable person euen broughte vnto presence knewe right well great faith brought hym could liked hym without leauig breaking tale haue sygnified pleasure vnto luste wise let sycke palsye aryse beyng sodainly healed cary home bed shewe al men present piteous sight also declare great strength efficacie true belief vpon hym wyth almighty god father disease vncurable long continuaunce cummyng christe cumberous yet gracious goodnesse lordewhe y sawe theyr fayth c ioyned lyke power put sure hope obtaine theyr request wherfore sawe theyr notable fayth perceyued man diseased soule body pitye compassion toke hym euery man thought hym miserable case thus lacked vse membres miserable soule beeyng subieccion bondage sinne loked nothing el poore wretche restored perfite health body thing farre aboue mannes power iesus beyng highly pleased notable faithe therfore willyng make hym euery part whole turned vnto hym sayed sonne thy synnes forgeuen pbut certaine scribe sittyng thinking hertes doeth speake blasphemy forgeue sinnes god onelye immediately iesus perceiued spi ite thoughte within themselues sayeth vnto theym thinke ye suche thynges heartes whether easier saye sicke palsey thy synnes forgeuen thee saye aryse take vp thy bed walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power earth forgeue sinnes spake vnto sicke palsey saye vnto thee arise take vp thy bed get hence vnto thine owne house immediately arose tooke vp bed went forth muche amased glorified god saiyng neuer sawe fashion present assembly certaine scribe knowledge scripture neuer godlyer better theyr liuyng rather enclined surmise matiers agaynst hym learned bokes prophetes moses perteyneth god alone pardon sinnes priest dyd release sinne made intercession vnto god men offence withoute sacrifice scribe knewe right well suche secrete thoughtes imaginacions themselues newe saying speaketh whiche neyther moses aaron auncient prophetes durst presume speake sayeth thy synnes released trulye blasphemous person god thus taketh vpon hym god power law comaudeth sum offeces punished death sum whiche satisfaccion made burnt offerynges diuers kyndes sacrifice mediacion intercession priest passyng nothyng vpon suche rite ceremony doeth forgeue sinnes bare worde mouth thing taketh vpon hym promyseth pertayneth manne lyeth goddes power alone perfourme surely offended imbecillitie weakenesse manhode sawe therefore coulde suppose nothing hym aboue state condicio man neyther vulgar people greater opinion whiche yet reason theyr simplicitie muche enclined pycke quarels spirite worlde putte thoughtes theyr myndes whyles stacke harde litterall sence moyses lawe farre fro spirite true meaning thereof somuch vnapte taught thesame thei thought themselues well skilled scripture somuche thesame thyng hath also place verified whiche see chaunce among paynters singing men wonte take lesse teachyng one altogether rude ignoraunt theyr arte science hath ben euell enstructed mayster reason teachyng ignorant one labour take whereas yf man take vpon hym instruct firste paynfull labour teache hym forget hath learned teache hym vngodly thoughtes certain worldely pollicie kepte theyr stomakes feare people whose presence muche aduaunced magnified themselues greate knowledge vnderstandyng lord iesus rather desyred declare diuine power deedesand immediatly whe iesus perceiued spir e c vtter thesame wordes woulde plainly shewe vnto scribe howe nothyng closely hydde mennes brestes neuer suttle craftie holy spirite searcheth throughly seeth thynges knoweth tourned vnto though spoken thynges whiche inwardlye thought theyr myndes sayed wise haue suche slauderous imaginacions hertes rather iudge weake feble body myne deedes gather workes see iyes cannot deny thynges trueth whiche wyse sene corporall iyes offended sayde thy synnes forgeuen deme vayne saying none effect see efficacie therof whiche putteth forth sheweth selfe soule man haue bodely iyes whole faultlesse haue spirituall iyes faultie blemished yf speake like wordes vnto make efficacie therof appeare vnto iyes reason beleue thyng whiche see beyng thereunto enduced thyng see nothing man easelyer speake contrarilye nothing harde perfourme spoke god alone ca easely one though hytherto neuer gaue power manne yet oute power geue pleaseth hym long sithens promysed prophetes would sende messias shoulde cure disease people israell abolishe cleane take awaye synnes therfore regarde symple bodye myne lyke poyntes neyther beholde ye garmente decked trymmed philacteries embroudered hemmes yet speache nothyng differyng mennes let thing selfe grounde foundacion iudgement maisterie man saye vnto synner thy synnes pardonedbut ye maye know ye sonne man c lyke easy saye vnto ye sicke palsey arise take thy bed wa ke haue hearde speake one saying fynd faulte therewith nowe heare ye ye cannot lykewise fynd faulte withall see euidently iyes thing ensueth immediatly wordes boast brag vpon power entent may perceyue god hathe geuen power vnto sonne manne appeareth vnto vnderlyng weake person release synnes worde power priestes neuer iewry alonely also region countreys worlde suche wise whatsoeuer releaseth earth released heauen whatsoeuer leuseth earth remayneth still bounde vnleused heauen haue cause picke quarels surmyse matter reioice glad singuler wealthe commoditie god infinite mercie haue encreased bounteous goodnes towardes saye god cannot thus derogate diminishe maiestie saye wyll offende goodnesse saye doeth albeit hath promysed make hym lyar finally yf voyde belefe suche thynges spiritual pertaine vnto soule wheras ye thwarte cauyll thynges see dooen youre iyes plainly declare obstinate malice spake vnto sicke palsey cwhen iesus spoken wordes diligently marked would tourned hym sycke palsey sayde saye vnto arise take vp thy bed go hence thy house scarcelye spoken wordes effectuall vertue therof manifestly ensued sycke manne began litle litle length muche moue hymselfe assone iesus spoken worde raysed hymselfe stode vp lustie couragious though neuer felte palsey lifted vp bedde layed shoulder went prease people shewyng al newe syght neuer bene sene yt day muche litle bedred caried lyke dead karkas fower mennes shoulder cranke lustie yea able ynough without anye helpe carrye great burden made hym roume go oute woulde geue none cum thinges right expedient doen fyrste people shoulde let hym haue entraunce make greatnesse faythe manifest ye roume made go middest prease euery body might see wonderful sight miracle scribe saw thinges onely neuer better therfore also enuious maliciously set iesu residew many present greatly amased strauge miraclein somuch amased glorified god geuen power man bare worde mouth forgiue sinnes also heale vncurable disease truly confessing among marueylous dedes whiche eyther reported doen holy men theyr dayes el suche liued theyr tyme none comparable vnto thys stand still many tymes see thinges wrought grauers painter diligently behold vew euery point workemanshippe alwaies espying newe thig sawe thinketh right expedient yt staye tarrie behold notable syght godly curiositie consydre euery thing whatsoeuer lorde dyd earth dyd purpose studying mystery therof shoulde picke instruction euer conduceth vertuouse godly lyuing shall doe muche profite first cosidre outwardly shewed vnto corporall iyes sygnified figure inwardly wrought men soules let v therfore fyrst pondre violence greatnesse dysease whiche lord iesus cured worde palsey nothing el noysom humour taketh astoyneth synowes body whiche instrumentes mouing sycke disease hath membres vse payne hym greuous burthen doeth almost appeare liue carkas lyuing payne torment parte disease either riddeth man sodainly world el chaunce doe long continuance maketh end cruell paynfull death one disease physician reck n vncurable cause wyll theyr good medle el assaye ouercome length haue great striuen therwith vayne weaker parte geueit ouer forsake theyr cure specially sayd disease haue taken one two partes whole body vncurable man disease plainly appeared kept bed continually borne lyke dead carkas fower men shoulder furthermore kinde disease manye time maketh man speachlesse also febleth dulleth quicknesse wyt fare semeth pacient albeit yuell takyng yet neuer desyred lorde helpe hard harted pitiefull sight woulde moue compassion woulde thinke suche one better case dead manoure aliue christian man beholde lytle whyle thy spiritual iyes consydre muche worse palsey mannes soule whose power altogether entangled moste triflyng care transytory thynges worldly vanity muche doe charitable dede work mercye altogether benummed taken palsey hath neyther handes relieue pore theyr nede feete goe iesus tongue desyre sauiour helpe hym one cleane dead iustice carried hither thither whithersoeuer pleaseth sensuall lustes appetite body whiche porter carry hym shall sely soule whiche altogether dissolute weakened superfluitie carnall pleasure inordinate desyre vayne glorye worldly rich hath strength lyfte vp selfe filthy care world loue heauenly thynges altogether fastened naughty bed carnall lustes therein lieth resteth beyng case farre passeth mannes power helpe iesus able almighty commaundement put awaye violence disease wherfore ought resorte vnto physycia vnto whome disease vncurable without greate faythe may doe muche pacient holpen euen belefe men prayed woordes yet earneste suters dede fayth hartely desyreth thyng christe request affectuall meruayle syth euen mortal men fele great carefulnesse mindes suche naturall affeccions man se one hageth vpon v harte mynde hath put sure confidence trust v god requireth synners neyther burnt sacrifice offered gyftes onely acknowleage thy sycknes truste thy phisycian yet man make able thus doe god alone inestimable goodnes hathe decreed heale soule taken palsey fyrst putteth certaine wonderfull heauinesse yrkesomnesse one selfe much yt sinner hateth himselfe wery former lyfe nowe seeth ignorauce darkenesse hathe ben long season greuous offence wonte comitte abhorreth himselfe woulde without doubte vtter dispayre saluacion vnlesse put vinegre sorowe dyd also giue hym oyle good hope iustice god ore troubleth synnefull soule threateneth vengeaunce punishmet due vnto synnes threatneth hell damnacion othersyde remembraunce goodnes great mercy god calleth backe synner desperacion god seketh death synner wylleth rather tourne lyue lorde iesus restored lawe nature destroyed moyses lawe made perfite also applye hymselfe common reason iudgement vulgare people pocion ministred faythfull phisician sore vexeth whole bodye bryngeth quiet specially ieperdous disease worketh troubleth pacient hope health euen nearer vnto despera cion penitent synner nearer soule healthe iesu phisycian marke well shamefast vnshamefastnesse shame commonly sayde vnprofitable neady man shame putteth awaye shame euen one nayle dryueth vnprofitable shame causeth man hyde kepe secrete sycknesse shame put awaye longe werinesse disease great hope manne hath recouer health nowe ashamed confesse sycknesse ashamed sycke manne yf greuously diseased bodye hathe regarde shame dooe menne suche case discouer euen moste priuie membres theyr bodyes suffer phisycian handle lyke affeccion minde hym hath begonne knowledge fylthie disease soule lewder pageaunte pranke cowld played clime vp vpon another man house cast downe tile make hole conuey doune aboue fowle lothsome syght euery body abhorred lay theyr iyes woulde ye proude pharisey haue sayde certes woulde haue cryed oh vilaynous dede ouer haue rayled measure agaynst theyr lewdnesse contrary common lawe made hole forciblie entred man seuerall house suche deadly syght bothe interrupted holy preachyng goddes worde also defiled iyes audience woulde haue commaunded karkaslyke sycke man away haue wasshed himselfe water thinges muche euident profe argument notable faythe towardes lorde iesus hyghly delyted whiche crake vpon righteousnesse moyses lawe woulde haue bene offended somuche yt lokyng desyred healed miserable creature fyrst cured disease soule whiche synnes forthwith deliuered body palsey many vice whiche haue taken theyr begynning body doe thence redounde soule chaunceth oftentimes body infected disease first bred ingendred soule lecherye whiche engendred humour fleshe defyleth sowle thence returneth agayne maladie euyll effect body causyng eyther palsey fallyng euyll el enuie whiche taketh begynnyng vicious soule dothe also wast body bryng cosumption onely able cure bothe partes man whiche made bothe also consydered howe greate largesse iesu forgeuyng synnes whe saithe thy sinnes remitted lewseth together neyther mencion made merites paste requiring sacrifice satisfaccion mencion faythe inoughe humbly haue cum foot iesus man hathe made sufficient sacrifice perfecte faythe hath shewed hymselfe vnto iesu whiche sacrifice none acceptable vnto sycke palsey wholy displeased himselfe bothe knewe owne synfull liuing also body oppressed miserable sicknesse trust mightye goodnes iesu made hym whole wholy committed himselfe vnto phisician cosidered vncurable disease regarded myghty good phisician vnto whome committed himselfe nowe hope recouery person cherysh make muche theyr disease flye physycians syght yea hate abhorre hym thou ashamed acknowledge thy syckenesse phisycian el yf thou haue mistrust hym peraduenture knoweth thy syckenes wyll rather hit teeth therwith cure yet hide christ discloseth mannes offence healeth men frelye thus thou thentent maye lykewyse chaunce vnto chaunced sicke palsey thinges turned cleane cotrary lyfted vp bed shoulder one ruling sensuall appetite passios whiche serued thing meant bearing crosse vnderstand crucifying fleshe vice cocupiscences neadeth fower porter carry hym walketh owne feete whithersoeuer ye spirite christe leadeth hym neither goeth whither commaunded go walke continuall encrease vertue styl goe forwarde euery daye wax better better retourne house fro whece came knowleage case came fro thence whose benefite returned thither againe soodainly chauged altered bothe body sowle propertie phariseis dwell without stretes market place whereas conuenticles vnlawfull assembles dwelleth home owne house whoso knoweth howe nought vertuelesse himselfe wholly ascribeth vertue goodnesse soeuer hath free liberalitie sauiour dismisse fro loger beholding syght haue rehersed vnto waye epilogacion persones seene pageaunt sycke palsey carrye hym made shamelesse theyr great fayth obtaine theyr peticion iesus muche delyted theyr faythe euen owne accorde desyred doubleth benefite symple vnlearned people discerning nothyng beleued nought el manne merueyleth power god scribe alone muttre softly themselfes agaynst iesu let v therfore eschew ensample saide scribe whyles studie aduasice theyr owne glorie goe duske glorye iesu let v ye simple sorte people glorifye god please hym tyme great mercifull goodnesse heale infirmytie soules also whensoeuer see saide bounteous goodnes forsake theyr olde vicious lyuyng cumme amendement pand went agayne vnto sea people resorted vnto taught iesus passed saw leuy sonne alphey sittyng receipte custome sayde vnto folow arose folowed hym came passe iesus sate meate house many publicanes synners sate also together meate iesus disciple many folowed hym scribe phariseis saw ate publycanes sinner sayd vnto disciple howe happeneth eateth drynketh publicanes sinner iesus heard sayde vnto whole haue nede physician sycke came call ryghtuouse synners repentaunce notable miracle wrought capernau iesu thentente might dooe good moe departed thence agayne went sea dyd conuey hymselfe awaye woulde helpe men doe good whyle forsoke vncurable scribe prouoked godly departure desyre presence likewise resorted greate number people vnto sea teachyng v ought lyke manoure forsake thynges folowe iesus whithersoeuer goeth euery sauiour whether resydent city trauayle thoroughe tounes village continewe ye wyldernesse goe vp mountaines come downe plaine el repayre sea water sawe therforeand iesus passed vp c great multitude people cumme thyther knew ryght wel cause theyr cumming taught shore walked passed certaine custome house wont syt demaunde custome towle suche sayle espied house certaine manne named mathew also called leuy sonne alphey sytting receipt custome publycane customer albeit sorte menne euery muche hated people yet specially among iewes counted abhominable vse bye office prince vnreasonable summe money therfore thentent theyr aduauntage gayne may moste parte take extorte menne without pitie conscience put maryners wayfaring menne muche busynesse vnto whome many tymes damage disprofite ynough otherwyse happeneth verye many among iewes denied iewes beyng holye people god ought pay tribute vnto emperour since heathen prince worshipper idolles cause greatly abhorred publican haue gaynes money whiche leuied ouer aboue due serued hym gatheryng toll custome lorde whiche imbrayded ye scribe theyr vnbeliefe murmured miracle whereas symple people gloryfyed praysed god therforeand arose folowed c woulde nowe eftsones shewe none farther true holynesse suche thynke themselues perfyte holy menne called mathew custome house commauded hym folowe mathew beyng sodainlye chaunged made newe man forsoke gayning seate folowed poore iesus thentent might enriched ryches ghospel men greatly merueyle facte yet dede wonderfull whiche muche merueiled lytle sicke palsey healed consydre well palsey hath whose mynde fastened couetousnesse neyther vnknownen howe intricate busye accomptes publican therfore sodeinly chaunged went custome house forsakyng euer hadde folowyng iesu merueyled sycke palsey whipte bed went home vnto house pharisey heareth iesus reasoning disputing many matiers seeth worke sundry miracle yet distrusteth murmureth agaynst hym publycane neuer heard ne sawe suche thynges obeyed thonly worde iesu beholde occasion wherby bothe wickednesse phariseis also bounteous goodnesse iesu maye better set forthe knowenand came passe y c mathew assured disciple iesu thentent myght commend maister moe bryng suche late companion felowes state condicion lucre ghospell afearde desyre lorde woulde vouchesafe geast home house iesus lightely condescended vnto request wyllingly obeyed called mathew supposyng obteyned small thyng prepared right gorgious royall feaste whiche shoulde suffice great many wete certaine disciple lorde gathered besydes diuerse folowed iesus went vnbidden geastes feaste many publican yea sinner olde familiaritie acquayntaunce mathew bidden therunto beyng nothing ashamed manoure companion sithe departed felowshyp trusted woulde cumme passe yt lyke called lorde throughe lordes mercyfull vocacion haue many scholefelowes learnyng doctrine ghospell whereby geuen aboundaunce heauenly treasure felowes vicious lyuing getting slaunderous gaines receiued great confidence gracious goodnes yt perceiued iesu towardes menne truly mete shoulde great feaste represented ye churche gathered together gentile feastes iewes small receyuable fewe person onely folowe fleshe litterall sence lawe spirite true meaning thereof dilateth selfe ample wyse receiueth al sortes people menne loue libertie haue neede mercyand scribe phariseis sawe hym eate publican c haue rightuousnesse yet phariseis chalege thesame notwithstanding lacked dede vnrightuous sawe iesus feasting publicas synners whome menne great perfeccion holynesse would vouchsafe muche speake vnto went vnto disciple symple ignoraunt person suche thought might easely plucked theyr mayster dyd hunt assaye wynne theyr venemous whisperyng doeth maister iohn forsaken folowe holy perfite manne eate drinke synners since communion table greatest token familiaritie maye hath hered scripture folowing holy thou shalte holy froward thou shalt froward doth cosidre reason thus familiar kepeth company sinner doeth encourage cotinewe still sinne whiche el peraduenture yf menne woulde auoyde theyr companye woulde amende theyr lyues disciple yet rawe theyr profession ready aunswere make onely symple plaine fayth hanged vpo theyr lordewhe y hearde saieh c iesus vnto neyther secrete wordes yet hid thoughtes phariseis vnknowen made answere wyse phariseis grudge murmour agaynst rather feaste whome take wycked abominable person priestes scribe phariseis physician praysed themselues good health go yet vnto ye sycke sent blamed going vnto acknowledge disease theyr soule desyre physycian cure suche good health quarell physycian saye visytest thou suche suche v whole haue nede physycian facultie phisycke muste alwayes ready euyll ease folkes acknowledge theyr disease right glad physician cum sawe vnto sicke palsey howe haue power geuen take away sinne thinke selues whole take vpon right wisemen haue cause quarell physicia cum vnto sent ye worlde take awaye sinne worlde whoso knowleageth sicknesse desyreth physycians helpe fayle nede nowe thynketh hymselfe faultles yf right beliefe neadeth nothing deceiued opinio el knowe right wel inwarde infirmitiei cam call rightwise sinner c yet dissembleth thesame paste hope recouery cause physycia lose labour wet vnto heale manne agaynst wyll therfore physycia vniustely reproued yf folow rule facultie vncurtuous theselues good healthe haue great disdayne enuy physycia present sicke facte ought seme straunge vncouth vnto whiche professe knowledge lawe reade therin foloweth mercy rather sacrifice god spake wordes prophete sygnifying therby carnall iustice lawe whiche standeth abstayning open offence obseruacion ceremony shoulde set asyde abolyshed neyther comitteth murther theft aduoutry resteth sabboth day fasteth vpon dayes apointed washeth maketh sacrifice righteous thestimacio man god requireth another maner righteousnes standeth free beneficence well doyng neyghbour forgenyng haue offended v mekenesse gentle demeanour farre prayse onely themselues helpe neighbour necessytie also haue great despite bable agaynst yf anye manne god promised sende suche messias excell phariseis sacrifice phylactery fastinges long prayer thobseruacio wherof magnify set themselues vnto people suche one shoulde beneficiall men lanterne way helper oppressed persos coforter suche aduersity phisicia cotrite herte finally suche one ioyne vnto god semed farre fro god contrarywise declare suche appered next god moste holiest verie far true godlynesse wordes lorde iesus bothe stopped mouthes phariseis also taught disciple charitably demeane themselues toward sinner cause much bound wicked phariseis oft prouoke lord expoune doctrine gospell pand disciple iohn phariseis fast cum say vnto hym dot disciple iohn phariseis fast thy disciple fast iesus sayed vnto chyldren weddyng fast whyle brydegrome long haue brydegrome fast dayes wyll cum brydegrome shalbe taken away shall fast dayes behold went also vnto iesu certain iohns disciple copany false accusyng phariseis also attached spiece humain enuie iesus semed deface great estimacion mayster iohn notwithstandyng life rule appered strayter christes mo disciple thother wherfore went vnto iesus moued vnto capcious question iohns disciple phariseis oft time fast thy disciple fast unto question assayled hym disciple lord made gentler aunswer litle defended disciple teachyng v hereby christian charitie whiche vseth myldnesse euyls displeasure doen vnto herselfe priuately diligent defendyng christian byshop must paciente meeke sufferyng iniuries doen vnto owne person yet ought diligent endeuour helpe flocke whensoeuer ieoperdie wherfore iesus sayd haue diligetly heard iohn baptist preache ought call remembraunce howe preached bridgrome bryde gromes frende mete heauinesse away brydegrome present moses seruaunt brydegromecan chyldren weddig fast c therfore fastinges conuenient hym doe cause sadnesse abate myrthe well doen fast whiche continue synagoge beyng seruaunt bride suche haunt brydegromes chaumber fre borne chyldren haunte weddyng chaumber cannot fast long haue brydegrome hymselfe present theyr myrthe great wyll suffer remembre heauy thynges dread punyshment doeth duetie wyse meary chyldren haue receyued spirite libertye perceyuyng dearly beloued cared brydegrome neuer carefull leste offende thynges whiche wer commaunded tyme men seruile nature ensample washinges thobseruacion sabbothe choyce meates apparell holy dayes sacrifice put theyr confidence myght goodnes brydegrome able without thynges geue perfite righteousnesse spirituall belefe taketh awaye fleshly carefulnes charitie maketh thinges pleasaunt causeth gladnesse brydegrome hath owne proper meate whiche companion abstayne worde god flesh brydegrome meat foode soule blood drink suche cleaue nygh page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate vnto euer desyrous eat theyr fyll meat haunt bride gromes weddyng chamber doe alwayes couet drunken wyth drinke lyke corporall meate causeth rightuousnesse euen fastyng maketh man iuste yea oftentymes seen whiche eateth meate rightuous faster suche fastynges commaunded lawe full heauinesse therfore displeasaunt almightye god loueth cherefull gyuer wyse merye chereful feareth trembleth whoso knoweth set lybertie thinges eyther doe doe yet mooued charitie fasteth thesame vndoubtedly fasteth wyth great myrth gladnesse fasting prescribed lawe charitie moueth hym doe whan disciple cum strengthe mynde nowe goe teachyng preachyng bryng vnto shall charitie cause doe theyr owne free wyll doth prescripcion eyther law orels iohn get compulsion yet cum strength perfeccion yet tender weake presence body letteth attain therto day shall cum corporall presence brydegrome shalbe taken away made stronger receiuyng holy ghoste heauen shal onely fast theyr owne accorde also gladly right good wyll doe thynges atchiuyng wherof strengthe constaunt courage mynde shall shewed fastyng forasmuche doctrine spirituall receyued theyr lyfe long haue enured themselfes wyth pharisaicall ceremony cause pyked simple ignorant yong men disciple shoulde lose labour dyd commit spirituall heauenly doctrine vnto theyr mindes supersticious keping carnall ceremony old thinges best agreeth old newe thynges newe whiche man myngle together dooeth onely labour vaine also maketh person wurse whome goeth refourme better stil continue theyr olde supersticiousnesse whyles man doeth endeuour bring freedome spirite prouoke feare transgression layed asyde committe sinne libertie doe teache suche one crafte occupacion hath conceyued wrong opinion hym selfe thinkyng hath good skyll therin hath none hym altogether ignoraunt euen hardest thyng maye teache suche person ryghtuousnesse ghospel whiche thobseruacion certain folysh carnall ceremony beleue surely haue attayned perfite ryghtuousnes doubtles cause fynde fisherman publican sinner vnchast woman ethnikes apt learn spirituall philosophy scribe phariseis priestes suppose perfit godlynes standeth thobseruacion kepyng man ceremony iohn meane betwene old law new wet myngle together two sundry doctrine durst commit liuely philosophy pure vnmengled vnto weake mynde nowe weake humayne carnall contrarily full lyfe vertue strength whatsoeuer godly spirituall heauenly wherfore vnto disciple whome chose rude ignoraunt entent myght soner enstruct strong pithful philosophy prescribe none thinges folowyng eate meates forbear rest labor vse suche apparel touch thing handle cause feare leste woulde alwayes continewe weake learned theyr maister put trust suche corporall thynges thyng vnprofitable ioyne thynges together whiche disagree one pno man also seweth piece newe clothe vnto olde garmentthe el taketh away new piece therof olde rent wurse man poureth newe wyne olde bottels el newe wyne doth burst bottels wyue runneth bottels mar ed newe wyne must put newe bottels man farre reason disposed amende olde garment wil sewe therunto patche newe clothe certes perceyueth yf shoulde bothe lose new cloth also make hole olde garment bigger beyng offended notable diuersytie betwene piece cloth sewed yll mended garmente strayght wayes plucketh piece sewed hole garment gapeth fowler dyd neyther man folysh put newe wine olde bottelsand pout h new wyne old bottels seeth sustain double losse therby new wyne wurketh feruently vehemencie fume therein enclosed breaketh ye bottels beyng weake reason age pie e bothe bottels wyne cleane lost spilt howe doeth prouide bothe safetie one trulye putteth newe wyne newe bottels euen whose mindes haue long time accustomed naughtie wine pharisa call supersticion wyse away newe wine heauenly spiritual doctrine lothe abhorre thesame stylle callyng taste wurse wine hath theyr accustomable drynke iesu spake truthe herein phariseis selues many tymes declared theyr deedes pand chaunced went thorow corn fieldes sabboth dayes disciple began waye plucke eares corne phariseis sayd vnto hym beholde sabboth dayes whiche lawfull sayed vnto haue ye neuer read dauid dyd nede hungred de hym howe went house god dayes abiathar hye priest dyd eate shewe bread whiche lawfull eate priestes onely gaue also whiche hym sayed vnto sabboth made man man sabboth therefore sonne man lorde also sabboth cha nced certaine season disciple trauayled thorough corne fyeld vpon sabboth daye whiche day matter conscience among iewes doe maner weorke wente iesus theyr mayster followed anon prouoked hunger beganne plucke eares corne chasyng theyr handes rubbe corne eate nowe heare howe olde bottels offended newe wyne libertie ghospell calling olde wyne kepyng sabboth hadde cleane lost verdure phariseis menne righteouse theyr owne conceyptes folowed iesus beholdyng disciple dyd wrongfully blamed lorde lyke vertuousnesse schollers great commendacion mayster euen theyr mysbehaueoure lewde tach reproched layed vnto instructed tolde lorde poynted vnto disciple thoughe doen greuouse offence brake sabboth daye ende shoulde cause leaue worke meanes approue pharisaicall supersticion orels yf woulde myght take occasion pi ke quarell surmise matter agaynst hym lorde defended disciple disproued learned lawe moses auctoritie lawe gentlenesse vouchesafed teache true meaning therofand said vnto haue ye neuer read c whiche dede deserued shaperly rebuked face ye accuse disciple thorough constraint hunger plucke fewe eares corne beeyng chaunce waye theyr reliefe sustenaunce sithe expresse mencion lawe selfe wherof professe selues teacher howe dauid lyke necessitie dydde thyng whiche soundeth muche breache lawe beyng almost famished great daunger perysh lacke foode fled succour vnto house god although laye man afrayed desyre abiathar chyef priestes geue moste holy loaues called shewe bread whiche lefull man eate priestes onely duryng litle whyle within precinct temple occupied makyng sacrifice abiathar ignoraunt lawe commaunded yet feared deliuer vnto dauid trayne sayed holy loaues eaten holy place knowe scripture orels yf haue memory howetha shame dare professe knowledge yt law know remembre doe lyke ease quite abiathar dauid yea allowe theyr facte yet accuse disciple giltie heynous trespasse rigorousnes lawe geue place vnto necessitye neyghboure lawe mooste force strengthe howe muche standeth nowe reason ceremony lawe geue place therunto whensoeuer charitie moueth man help euen christen moreouer lykewyse commaunded lawe euery man ought loue neyghbour lyke affeccion loueth hymselfe nowe synce moste principall greatest commaundementes whole lawe doe vnright iudgement breake whiche chiefest alwayes continueth obseruacion thynges whiche lesse value shall endure euer tyme hath sabboth holy daye tyme shall cum true godly men euery day shal lyke holy tyme neuer neuer shall hath shall holy dede man succour neyghbour nede law forbyddeth murder truely murthereth whoso lyeth power saue manne doeth succour hym lawe permanent shall continue euermore lawe forbiddeth also woorke vpon sabboth daye nowe wrong shapen holynesse yf man while feareth breake sabboth suffer brother peryshe wyll sticke plucke asse fallen chaunce dyche vpon daye without anye feare scruple conscience breake seuenth sabboth daye iesus theseand sayde vnto sabboth c suche lyke manifeste reason declared aukewardly deuout holy added generall sentence sabboth day instituted men cause men made sabboth daye sonne manne came destroye men saue cause hath power yea cleane take awaye sabboth ofte man health requireth whiche haue spoken sabboth thought demed like constitucios instituted season ende sturdye disobediente people shoulde little little accustome themselfes obey goddes commaundementes thintent might corporal figure brought ledde hande vnderstanding spirituall thynges breaketh sabboth daye godlily nothyng troubled euill lustes breaketh onely good zeale hath helpe euen christen fastyng godly thing thesame made vngodly detestable beyng instituted mannes soule helth abused destruccion body soule againe vowe holy thing thesame made vnholy yf man reason supersticious mynde hath perfourme bee withdrawen perfourmaunce suche thinges nerer appertayne true godlynesse doeth well lyke good holy manne whoso maketh oblacion aulter agayne vnholy gift manne offereth neighbour made one also well doen passe litle vpon coulour fashio apparell oft behoueth man man made garmentes sake garment first inuented vse commoditie man lyke manner meate ordained man cause man made meates sake wherfore lofull eate kyndes meate man necessitie requireth corporall thinges wherin put perfit righteousnesse temple sacrifice meate clothing holy dayes fastynges vowes offered giftes vnholily obserued yf obseruacion therof health euen christen wise hurt appair againe well holily kept charitie towardes neighbour requirig nothing regarde whatsoeuer carnall truly perfourme hertes whiche suche corporall thinges figure significacions manier constitucions moyses minister auctour seruaunte maister suche seruile minde cleue still vnto supersticiouslye keepe thynges comprised letter lawe sticke vnto sonne man lord ouer whole lawe teacheth howe thinges whiche figured corporall shadowes figure ought bee obserued spirituall sence meanyng free clene discharged conscience longer obseruing suche iewishe ceremony iij chapter pand entred agayne sinagoge man whiche withered hade watched whether woulde heale sabboth day myght accuse sayed vnto man whiche withered hande aryse stande middes sayth vnto whether lawfull good sabboth dayes euill saue lyfe kyll helde theyr peace looked rounde aboute anger morning blindnesse harte sayeth man stretche forth thy hand stretched hande restored euen whole suche wordes lord iesus walked way fielde disproued false reprofe phariseis also defended innocet disciple intent plainly learne none geuen pieke quarrelles suche haue conceyued wrong opinion theyr owne holinesse iesus entred synagoge teache people accordyng vnto accustomed maner occasion eftsones ministred bothe hym dooe good charitable deede also phariseis surmyse sum matter agaynst one present among people whiche pytifull syghte beholde withered lame hande therfore carryed hym dead member dyd hym slede muche miserable wonte hand labor fynde himselfe also poore houshold oh malicious wicked phariseis quicke syghted depraue finde faute christes benefites blynde vnderstand heauenly doctrine thinges sawe theyr corporall iyes knewe naturall man yet deedes miracle wrought perceyued diuine power sawe howe sely felowe miserable case knew ryght well iesus mercifull straight wayes gessed would cum nowe seke quarell agaynste disciple dyd pluckyng eares corne againste maister himselfe defended marke whether beeyng nature ready helpe distres misery dare presence syght synagoge heale man vpon sabboth daye yf may accuse breakyng sabboth muche shall haue people beare witnesse doe pitifull creature desyred iesus helpe hym yet saye trueth kynde desyre hym cum syght mercyfull iesu lord woulde haue take good heede vnto miracle entended worke called forth man lame hande sayed aryse stande myddes people arose conceyued good hope made wholle iesus turned hym phariseis whose secrete thoughtes priuey vnto sayed vnto theym opinion whiche take vpon knowe lawe howe thynges sabboth daye broken good deedes euill preseruyng man lyfe destroying thesame knewe right well purpose moued capcious question answered better reuerence solemnitie sabboth suffer neighbour perishe without scruple conscience helpe perill necessitie people coulde haue suffered vnreasonable answere cleane repugnaunt lawe nature agayne yf sayed might lawfully haue dooen brought themselfes case coulde haue charged false surmise theyr entente purpose therfore thought good holde theyr peace saye neuer worde yet while dyd plainely declared vnto people theyr malicious wilines beyng prouoked question amendement lyfe obstinate mynde still desyrous picke quarels nowe intent question shoulde easlier assoyled answered put furth another lyke questio asking whether among kept sabboth daye hygh holy shepe chaunced fall dyche daye woulde suffre peryshe wyse hardye drawe none blynde assembly knewe ryght well howe muche helth manne ought regarded helth preseruacio shepe truly killeth whoso maye saue thing whiche suffereth peryshe wherfore lorde loked answere perceyued howe phariseis lyke confederate ignoraunte trueth ostinate malice helde theyr peace loked rounde behelde wyng outwardly countenaunce howe wrothe sorye theyr vncurable wickednes toke vpon gydes blynde themselues heartes blynded worldely lustes willyngly refused see moste radiant cleare light veritie blindnes vncurable manne bothe wittingly willyngly blynde sawe dumme beast might lawfully drawen hole lest shoulde peryshe without anye violacion breache sabboth woulde wyse see lyke lawfull prouyde mannes helth vpon thesame daye therfore gracious lorde teache v ought withdrawe selfes helping neyghboure vncurable frowardnes euill phariseis contemned turned manne withered hande audience people desyrous see ende matter sayd vnto stretche thy hande voyce scarcely heard stretched sodainly chaunged seruing aswell euery thing withall whiche neuer lame whome would reasones haue conuerted brought erroure would euident miracle haue moued glorify god phariseis infected leuen enuie therby prouoked imagine mischiefe certes corrupt alwayes vnryght iudgementes phariseis passe vpon dumme beaste vpon manne vpon apparell body vpon meate lyfe vpon bodye soule vpon worldly thinges heauenly thinges vpon fleshe spirite vpon menne god true greater mischiefe worlde peruerse aukewarde holynes among men counted cum wonderfull vertue worde onely restore man lame hande make whole agayne much greater vertue benefite restore dead lame power soule pitifull lame hande hath dead voide pitie compassion seeth neyghbour necessitie doeth geue almes seeth erre stray right waye doeth teache refourme seeth oppressed iniuries doeth helpe hym seeth ydle doeth styrre hym good woorkes suche handes phariseis woulde rather enuy lord restored vnto helth theyr soules feble weake persones hath synagoge churche christ receiueth neither deafe dumme blynde feble halte lame whoso diseased vexed euils let cum syght iesu shalbe cured inspire v holy spirite whiche lame without lyfe shal made quicke alyne agayne true faithe wholy committe themselues vnto lorde returne home cured theyr disease contrariwise trust theyr owne righteousnesse made wurse mennes benefites good deedes puffed vp pharifaicall spirite wylleth well none themselues agayne suche haue receyued spirite iesu goe nothing el dooe good men textepand phariseis departed strayghtwaye gathered counsell theym belonged herode agaynst myght destroye hym iesus auoyded disciple sea great multitude folowed galile iewry ierusalem id ea beyond iordane dwelled tyre sydon great multitude menne whiche hearde thinges dyd came vnto assone phariseis departed temple albeit presence people durst speake one worde iesu yet sent suche belonged herode intente theyr conspiracy stronger none knewe better feate howe worke mischiefe herodians layed theyr heades together secretly debated matter betwene themselues howe myght destroye iesus sawe ferre excell myghtie dedes perceyued possible disproue wordes phariseis suche herodes retinue louers frendes together yet destroy author helth agreed one mischieuous concorde blyndnes muche deede lamented shall priuey traynes worldly deceite preuayle againste vnto whome nothyng vnknowen lorde teaching v ensample ought many tymes gyue place season vncurable obstinacie euill leste farther prouocacion becum mischieuous conueyed hymselfe thence wente asyde agayne vnto sea goyng asyde iesu kinderaunce ghospell encreasyng furtheraunce thesame yf pharise driuen hym awaye woulde haue cum multitude gentile therfore iesus forsaken enuious narrowe synagoge gone vnto sea came vnto hym euery quarter great numbre people onely galile also iewry yea ierusalem selfe id ea countreys lying beyond iordane moreouer suche place bordered city tyre sydon made foreshewe churche shoulde gathered together gentile synagoge vnbeliefe repell ye gospel place came great multitude people whiche moued bruite spred abrode marueylouse doctrine mighty dedes iesu drewe selues together assembled sea syde lorde bothe bounteous riche towardes men secluded man neyther doctrine fro receyuing benefite healthe people eagre hasty reason great desyre cured theyr syckenesses one thruste another place force preased iesus intente might leaste wayes touche hym onely touchyng garmente disease also cured put away difference neyther betwene disease person mightie liberall physycian whosoeuer troubled maner euils infirmity thesame furthwith deliuered therof yf chaunced go iesu selfsame thing wee se spiritually done euen dayes many nacions whole worlde detestable vice subdued vnto whiche flye vnto succour touche faythe healed furthermore vncleane spirites sene iesus coulde abide puissaunt vertue fel downe knee cried saying thou art euen selfsame sonne god whiche promised cum iesus wise woulde suffre wicked spirites disclose strayghtly comaunded kepe silence case discry hym tyme cum knowen vnto world humble poore person vnto said heareth heareth willeth v geue credence wicked spirites muche speake trueth busynes done auentures god high wisedom ordered euery thing certaine degree procedinges saluacion pand iesus commaunded disciple ship wayte people lest throng healed manye muche preased vpon touche hym manye plage whan vncleane spirites sawe fel downe cryed saying thou arte sonne god strayghtly charged make knowell wherfore iesus thrust prease people anon commaunded disciple prepare hym ship woulde disquieted disordered clamorous multitude rather desyred bodely health health theyr soules thronged hym rather touched hym suche confessing theyr disease go iesu syncere fayth touche hym made whole againe whiche troubled yet worldly lustes desyres cum rushing noyse hurly burly greue greatlye disquiete hym therfore disciple wonte familiarly conuersaunt lorde prepared hym ship pure congregacion iesus better pleased fewe cleane quiet persones great many troublesome vnquiet yet gat away neuertheles taught multitude ship thou seest iesus teaching oute shippe vnderstand hereby bishop preaching multitude sortes whiche contayneth christian nouices suche haue yet spirite cast baptisme iewes gentile happy blessed spiritually touch christ none toucheth whome first toucheth whomsoeuer toucheth healed theyr sinnes nowe vnquiet person made quiet shall receyued ship churche haue continuall fruicion companie alwayes sit table shippe wherin iesus preacheth narrowe roumles vncleane sinfull person contrarily moste wide large vnto suche cleane life purged theyr sinnes lord refused publicacion deuils auoyded sinfull vnquiet multitude people yet thinges euidently shewed kingdome god cum whiche worthy person vnworthy wete violetly enter therfore prepared himselfe certaine capitaines whiche shoulde ayde hym claymyng heauenly kingdome many numbre sufficient teache many nacions anon shoulde come full whole oute partes world professe philosophie doctrine ghospell haue prince worlde bene wont chose certaine head ruler capitaines clayme wynne enlarge gouerne defend theyr empire kingdomes requisite sayde ruler ryghte trusty wyse polytique diligent especiall knowe king theyr maisters pleasure pand wente vp mountayne called vnto hym whome woulde came vnto ordayned twelue might send furthe preache might haue power heale syckenesses cast deuils gaue vnto symon name peter called iames sonne zebede iohn iames brother gaue name bonarges whiche saye sonnes thunder andrewe philip arthelmewe mathewe thomas iames sonne alphe thaddeus simon canaan iudas iscarioth whiche also betrayed hym therfore iesus oftimes allure manye vnto doctrine humbled himselfe euen basenes common people shewing therby teacher ghospell ought lyke iesus say calling furth highnes euangelike perfeccion wente vp mountaine called vnto hym euery rascal multitude suche pleased hym specially chosen sorted office ministery called men greate substauce head ruler great estate priestes phariseis scribe poore men vnlearned person suche lowe degree mete folowe go vp mountayne whence whatsoeuer presente worlde hathe worthy admiracion contemned whence oute nighe place voyce father heauen heard short whence glory immortalitie euerlasting lyfe beholden called obeyed came iesus beyng high man mounte vp hill except iesus call himselfe mountaine vnto whome man cummeth vnles drawe hym king kynges lord ruler chose twelue head officer deputy whiche loyall faythfull garders personage shoulde neuer depart person intent affayres ghospell required might sende legate body preache suche thinges learned theyr kyng publish abrode theyr prince commaundement throughout whole world muche vyle fisher vnlearned person pooremen suche outwarde apparaunce shewed poynte kinglines notwithstanding promysed kyngdome god sauiour leste theyr aucthoritie shoulde haue ben nothing regarded gaue power prince world geue theyr ambassadoures whiche power shoulde name iesu heale maner disease also put flight vncleane spirites first legate messingers simon whose name chaunged called cephas worde implieth muche latine name petrus say rocke stone intent learne name selfe chiefe groundwarke foundacion doctrine ghospelland gaue vnto symon name peter c vnmouable stedfastnes fayth second iames sonne zebede brother iohn gaue also newe name bothe called boanarges whiche muche saye syrian tongue sonnes thundre theyr name prophecye declare shoulde tyme cum send euangelike hill worlde thunder preaching ghospell whiche shoulde moue styrre vp men mindes desyre heauenlye thinges lyke thunder soundeth high preacher ghospell soundeth preacheth nothing low carnall speaketh high heauenly penitent kingdome heauen hande saying thunder clap assone word spoken euery man feareth daunger lightninge folowethe shower beleue ye gospell shalbe safe fourth legate messinger andrew brother vnto peter fifth philip sixte barthelmewe seuenthe mathew eyght thomas surnamed didimus ninth iames sonne alphe tenth thaddeus eleuenth symon canaan twelfth iudas iscarioth whiche betrayed lord basely borne vnlearned weake person pleased lorde renewe whole worlde leste mannes wisedome power shoulde chalenge prayse heauenly busynes pand came house people assembled thither agayne leasure muche eate bread belonged vnto heard went laye handes vpon sayde mad scribe whiche came downe ierusalem sayed hath beelzebub chiefe deuill casteth deuils called vnto sayd vnto parable thinges thus doen mountayne monishe v chosyng ministres ghospell ought wi e moued led low priuate affeccions iesus came downe elect head officer together came house nowe familiar frendes shoulde god exaumple shewed teache v howe teacher god word grutche descend theyr highnes perfeccion abase selues euen lownes weake therby winne many theyr lorde let v also folow iesus house intent may perfectly know ought hope wherunto prepare theyr mindes take vpon syncerely preach heauenly gospelland ye people assebled together agayne c multitude went vp mountayne thing pertayneth lorde hath chosen purpose assone christ disciple cum downe lower al whole rablement people resorted vnto hym importunately cry calling vpon partly heare doctrine partly deliuered theyr disease apostle leasure muche eate theyr meate pleasaunter syghte vnto teacher ghospell people desyrous learne disquiet priestes great multitude christen nouices sytteth round churche doore roume ynough church receyue maner folkes resorteth vnto bishopes sermon dedes great bruite therof brought kinsefolkes cosens eares knew right well thinfirmitie fleshe wheras grossenesse vnderstanding could suppose thyng godly might power say heard tell wandred vp downe sort rascall slouens vile felowes folowing heles heard say also howe caused muche people folowe taughte newe learninges suche bene hearde put away disease caste deuils ascribed fury madnesse offended weakenesse body could wise referre thinges vnto godly power knew father mother knew house family knewe thinges differed nothyng perceyued also howe reported hym farre exceded compasse mannes power wherfore asmuch kinsfolkes thought accordyng mannes lawe theyr parte duetie binde hym cheynes one distraughte wittes possessed sum euill spirite sayde becum furious madde truely whiche contemnyng erthly thyngesfor sayde mad c yea life selfe embrace theyr harte heauenly philosophie doctrine appeare besyde themselues person vnto whome nothing sauoureth whiche earthly transitory spendeth liuelode helpe poore theyr nede semeth mad vnto hym hath reposed ayde presente lyfe worldlye ryches willingly ghospels sake vpon hope rewarded euerlasting blisfulnesse bryngeth hymselfe banishmente pouertie emprisonment tormentes death starcke mad opinion beleueth blisfull lyfe presente lyfe ordayned whiche good liuers vertuous person setteth naught honour geuen prince people thend may purchasse himselfe glory god heauen semeth witte vnto suche mad dede while bribe gyuing craft deceyte hoke croke right wrong desyre lordship soueraigne rule dignity whiche anon muste nedes forgoe lorde suffered kinsfolke haue wicked opinion leste disciple offended chaunced time afterward heare lyke wordes howbeit wickednes phariseis manifest themselues witness great myracles wroughte kinsfolkes erred rather certaine grossenesse vnderstanding naturally giuen vnto common sorte obstinate malice wickednesse phariseis whiche came ierusalem knowleage prophetes oughte haue knowen dedes miracle saw hym worke thing already cum present whiche promised prophetes also soueraigntie theyr religion reason wherof highlye estemed themselues ought haue honoured goddes power whiche men proued helping holsome phariseis say blasphemously spake iesus saying dedes doeth farrre aboue mannes power howbeit doth vertue power god hath sum mightie notable diuell whose ayde worketh hath vndoubtedlye spirite beelzebub maister diuell helpe putteth diuels flight whiche strong mightie shamelesse blind blasphemy onely spoken aaginste iesus whome reckened nothing el man god hymselfe whose glory enuying ascribed miracle wrought diuine power vnto vncleane spirite diuel lorde earnestly reproueth vseth also certaine
