parable thintent men shoulde clearly perceiue mattier phow sathan driue sathan realme deuyded agaynst selfe realme endure yf house deuided selfe house cannot continue yf sathan make insurreccion himselfe deuided cannot continue hath ende man enter strong mannes house take awaye goodes except firste binde strong man spoyle house uerely saye vnto synnes shalbe forgeuen vnto men child blasphemy wherwith soeuer haue blasphemed speaketh blasphemy againste holy goste hathe neuer forgeuenesse daunger eternall damnacion sayd hath vncleane spirite sith whole kyngdome diuels saith kyngdome god maye sathan casteth sathan except peraduenture fiendes make battayle go together eares among themselues though like true whiche serue one prince warresand realme deuided selfe c violently put one another holde fortresse among mortall men realme whiche deuided sedicion inward discorde shortly cummeth ruine like vnitie concorde chiefe keper patronesse realme euen discorde bringeth anye thyng destruccion neuer strong well fortified shall kingdome beelzebub endure yf one diuell cast speake realme wheras sedicion raygneth euery thyng vnstableand yf sathan make insurreccio agaynst sathan c muche priuate house long prosper continewe yf thinhabitauntes therof square one hate wherfore cast oute diuels helpe beelzebub falsly report laye vnto charge sure profe kyngdome shall shortely cum ruyne desolacion kyngdome deuilles destroyed remayneth becumme goddes kingdome yf whiche thing moost true doe chase awaye deuilles enemy god mankinde goddes vertue power euident kingdome god presente whose power findes compelled maugry theyr heades geue place vnto geue place willingly haue couenaunted leage couenaunt betwene god deuils warre continually together wyse reconciled fareth chaunceth battayle betwixt two doutye couragious capitaines whiche mortall enemy vtter defiance one another neyther suffereth himselfe taken vnlesse strength ouerthrowen batayle couragious bolde capitayne suffer enemy enter forciblie house righte strong well fortified vnlesse sayde enemy win violent assault caste ouercum vanquished prison meanes shall rifle house carye awaye hym spoyle praye ye see deuils crye make greate noyse caste expelled yf see also many forsake theyr synnes wherewith serued deuill cum fredome innocencye good lyuyng take glory god conquerour geue vnto beelzebub conquered ouercome doeth beelzebub enemye mankinde chaunge olde condicions prouide health preseruacion manne manifeste blasphemye agaynste god righte well assured kinde blasphemye may pardoned god blasphemy eyther ignoraunce el weakenesse frayltie man nature leaueth place obtaynyng forgeuenesse blasphemouselye hath spoken agaynst holy gost shall neuer obtayne pardon man speaketh blasphemy agaynst holy gost hardened obstinate malice ascribeth workes vnto spirite beelzebub seeth plainlye cannot otherwyse done spirite god erroure ignoraunce pardonable howe possible purpensed malice againste goodnesse almightye god prouokyng v saluacion shall get anye pardon weakenesse man bodye shall excuse suche blasphemy committed sonne man ascribe goddes power whiche plainelye apppeareth dedes healthe saluacion mankinde vnto beelzebub enemy god kynde blasphemye whiche amendes satisfaccion made wordes spake iesus vnto defending father glorie nothing meane whyle passyng vpon owne meant theyr offence myght better excused borne withall whiche euill opinion hym kynnesfolkes cosens sayed becum furious prepared cheynes binde withall wickednesse phariseis certaine vncurable malyce ascribed woorkes vnto spirite beelzebub whiche coulde wyse fynde faulte say worthye procede god yet perceyued diuine nature christ would yet haue vttered knowen certes god hath oftimes vertue holy spirite ministery good liuers wrought miracle willing therfore glorifyed among men yf man reason ignoraunce malyce ascribe suche miracle vnto spirite beelzebub peruerse malicious naughtines past hope amendementfor sayed hath vncleane spyrite wherfore might haue bene excused yf sayde christe bene nothing el man bene kyng messias depraued spake yll workes offended god holy spirite asmuche spirite god worke whome soeuer lusteth nowe sawe manye myracles merueylousely wrought people glorify god manye holpen theyr infirmity many deliuered vncleane spirites many turne viciously ing godly desyre lyue well vertuousely ghospell preaching christ yet obstinately sayde hath deuill spirite god pthere came also mother brother stode without sent vnto call hym people sate hym sayed vnto behold thy mother thy brother seke without answered saying mother brother loked rounde aboute disciple whiche sate compasse sayd beholde mother brother whosoeuer dothe god brother syster mother lorde iesus many wordes defended glory heauenly father wicked blasphemy phariseis imbrayded iewes theyr obstinate incorrigible vnbeliefe perseuered notwithstanding thorow faith alonly al synnes ewsed forgeuen meane time befell occasion also declare high ministracion ghospel ought regarde humayne affeccions whiche mattiers muche moued counted thing prayse worthie right commendable came vnto hym kynsfolkes companye mother way entre prease people stoode without theyr voyce passyng man man came vnto sate aboute iesus shewed howe mother brother cum desyred speake hym sum euen among nere kinsemen whiche euill opinion yea many supposed bene witte yet thought reason kinred might lawfully tyme woulde call hym oute speake lorde teache v busynesse gospell whiche done spirite father man saluacion goddes glorywho mother brother c ought left affeccions humayne aunswered though angrye great fume saying mother brother kinsfolkes busynesse whiche haue hande knoweledge fleshlye kyndred ghospell hath spirituall kinred frowne whiche ioyneth together men mindes streighter bondes doth theyr bodyes loked round disciple sate compasse nexte hym teaching sayde behold brother mother ghospell maketh new birth doth also new kinred whoso beleueth gospel therein obeyeth wil heauenly father although fardest fro touching kinred stocke familie also ye strangest alyaunte oure nacion thesame brother sister mother kynred estemed degree bloud degree ye spirite acknowledge none kinred except borne afresh heauenly father fayth naturall sonne doe obeye father calleth hym euerlasting thinges euery man moste perfecte wise perfourme shall take nerest kinseman iiij chapter pand began againe teache sea syde gathered together vnto muche people greatly entred ship sate sea people sea syde shore therefore iesus forsoke house bare figure sinagoge wherin blasphemed phariseis interrupted throughe thimportunacie kinsfolkes eftsones went vnto water one desyred large roume gentile ofte time expelled iewes maketh oftetimes foresigne gospell shalbe tran sted iewes vnto gentile longe house saye iewry sticke vnto hym none onely whome calleth brother systers mother many muttered againste hym many rayled vpon hym many lay wayte nerest kinsfolkes interrupted teachyng iesus loueth suche house loueth multitude ye standeth theyr owne conceyte phariseis vseth backebite make yll report theyr neyghbour kinsfolkes grosse capacitie fleshly wisedom interpreted heauenly wisedom nothing el fury madnes moued worldly affeccions doe cause man leaue godly enterpryse busynesse mother kinsfolkes loueth multitude whiche desyrous heare ye ghospell word godand gathered together c wholy hangeth vpon eliefe therof wherfore whan lord iesus cum vnto sea taught thither assembled great numbre people insomuch constrayned noyse hurly burly made thrusting one another place take aboate whiche bene pulpet taught sytting thicke together shore bene round stage place ordeyned men behold sightes shewes learne thou art preacher teacher gospell meant fygure auoyde thou rablement clamorous vnquiet people yet thou cease thy duetie preachyng teachyng goddes word ieopardy leste thou thrust downe ouerwhelmed ye trouble worldly busynesse thou canst teache get ship gospell whiche knoweth maner earthly rufflyng pulpit thou shalte quietly teache weake rude multitude go farre shore nigh vnto alwayes atteperyng thy se asmuch thou canst vnto ye capacitie people yet able folow fyrst thou must attempre thy doctrine according theyr rude ignoraunt myndes awaye withall tyll suche tyme haue well profited therin dyd iesus teache boate rude vnlearned multitude sortes people pand taught many thinges parable sayed vnto doctrine herken behold went sowier sow fortuned sowed sum fell waye syde fowles yer came deuoured vp sum fel stony ground muche earth immediatly sprang vp depth earth assone sunne vp caught heate rootyng widred awaye sum fell among thornes thornes grewe vp choked gaue fruite summe fell vpon good grounde yeld fruite sprang vp grewe brought forth sum thyrtie folde sum sixtiefolde su hundred folde sayed vnto hath eares heare let heare put furth vnto parable saye similitude thinges moste knowen menne playnest manour teachyng moste conuenable rude insomuche appeareth firste syght wyse worlde chyldishe thing laughed yet manoure teaching pleased euerlastyng wisedome philosopher made thinges darke vnto theyr hearer argumentes fourmed great arte subteltie rhetorician enforced mennes myndes meruaylous plentifulnesse eloquent speache phari gathered together certaine hyd misteryes farre excedyng capacitie vulgar people lorde chose vnto hym kynde doctrine plainest farre manour playerlike ostentacion intent glorie gotten renewing worlde ghospell shoulde wholy appertaine ascribed might power god wherefore moued many parable receyue sincere beliefe cleane myndes doctrine ghospell whence begynning saluacion procedeth behoued haue thing fast setled printed theyr myndes began teache commaunded diligently attende heare would saye harken yf anye haue eares harken withall fable parable except man geue eare therunto neyther hath euerye manne care heare parable ghospell whiche subtelly plaine wyselye folishe darkely manifest hyde heauenly wisdome vnderneth vyle folyshe coueryng neyther thought iesu sufficient yf gaue diligent eare woulde also shoulde beholde see theyr iyes thinges purposed saye blessed haue pourged eares cleare iyes iesus speaketh beholde sayeth wente fielde certaine sowier sowe sede whiche pure good while desyrous plentifull increase caste euery chaunced sum fell hye waye syde whiche ioyned vnto fyelde sede remained still aboue grounde reason way harde seere foules thither came anon picked vp deuoured agayne porcion therof fell vpon stonye grounde whiche laye manye stone vnderneth couered litle moulde duste sprang vp tymely warmenesse weather brought grounde anon heate sunne waxed feruente corne thus sprang vp due season hurte partched therwith coulde stone take rootyng lacked rootes drawe moysture deapth earthe therwith nourishe defende againste heate sunne widdered awaye came earing againe porcion sede fell vpon grounde whiche dede ranke fertyle yet ouergrowen thornesand sum fell among thornes brier nowe thornes growen thick heigth breadth came passe yong corne whiche sprang therof smothered appeared syght wat moysture lacke ayer cause neyther sowier profit hereof yet labour sowier vtterly frustrate vaine summe sede light vpon good grounde therof sprang grasse grewe waxed vntill came full ripenesse sede one vnfruitfull grayne notwithstanding al yelded like increase many eares whiche one grayne yelded thirtie summe thre skore great sorte hundred pand alone twelue asked parable sayed vnto geuen knowe misteries kingdom god vnto without thinges happen parable see may see discerne heare maye heare vnderstand leste tyme tourne theyr synnes forgeuen sayd vnto knowe ye parable ye know parable lorde spoken wordes intent forgotten euery man searche himselfe meaning parable sayed moreouer hath eares heare let hym heare declaring vndoubtedly hereby heard thing whiche heard nowe twelue specially chosen disciple themselfes vnderstode well reason yet raw ignoraunt similitude meant yet durst openlye aske hym question gotten alone holde desyre hym would vouchesafe expounde misterie secrete meaning therof geuen knowe misteries cthen iesus putting v remembraunce thinges disclosed person doctrine ghospell ought dispensed according time serueth capacitie hearer away withall sayed vnto disciple prince world make priuie vnto theyr secretes none suche pycked felowes tryed persones whome maye safely make theyr counsayle haue secrete thyng kepe knowleage comminaltie geuen vnto sorted piked among commune people knowe misterie priuitie kyngdome heauen familiarlye conuersaunt vnto commune sorte suche familiar companion courtebut vnto without al thinges c whether doe speake anye thyng parable neyther haue meete eares meete iyes heare beleue see depraue fynde faute verified prophete sayed shoulde cum passe see best yet see heare best yet heare vnderstand truly vnderstandeth whoso beleueth nowe sinnes released suche beleue sinnes freely released vertue gospell therfore vnbelefe cummeth passe turned god tourne themselfes away god deliuered theyr synnes refuse medicine wherewith synnes healedand said vnto knowe ye c wordes iesus signified person whome litle vnderstoode grounde sundrye cause barrayne vnfruitfull make disciple apt receyue doctrine chideth litle theyr dulnesse doe yet sayeth gesse mente parable sith sence therof easie coniectured howe boulte true meaning rest since neyther speake thyng hath significacion sum secrete matier wyll expounde vnto parable intente maye lykewyse accustome selfes searche secrete meanyng lyeth hyd pthe sowier soweth worde wherof sum rehersed way syde worde sowen heare sathan cummeth immediatly taketh awaye worde sowen theyr harte likewise receiue sede stony ground whiche heare worde receyue gladnesse yet haue roote themselues endure ryme anon trouble persecucion ariseth wordes sake falle immediatly also receyue sede thornes suche heare worde care world deceiptfulnesse rich lustes thinges entee choke worde made vnfruitefull haue receyued sede good ground suche heare worde receyue one corne doth bryng forth thirtie sum sixtie sum hundreth fielde worlde wherein many vnmete hearer doctrine gospell sowier sonne man came downe fro heauen earth sede woorde doctrine ghospell whiche god declared vnto worlde men distrusting owne strength trust harte minde promise ghospell saye fayth men sinnes forgeuen trueth knowen giue themselfes studie true vertue godlinesse therfore seede whiche saied fell hie way side vnderstand signified slightly otherwise occupied heare ghospell like woulde heare anye fable phantasie man inuencio amog none heareth goddes worde lesse profitand lykewise receiue sede c anon haue heard cummeth satan putteth thoughtes imaginacions mindes meanes plucketh sede haue gotten roote fastened therin yt muche remembre haue hearde nowe sede receiued stony ground betokeneth persones gredely ynough heare ghospel gladly deuoure thesame perceyuing true holsum ley vp theyr harte depe cogitacion letted affeccions wholy possessing theyr mindes wise geue place vnto ye worde god continue feruently couragiously began neyther bring forth fruite euangelike christian godlinesse suche fruite alonely lasteth season haue rootes cummeth passe prosperitie beleue gospell grasse newly sprog vp cause men haue good opinion theym wil proue well assone anye aduersitie persecucion profession goddes worde doeth arise assaulte byanby offended therwith vtterly forsake former purposethere also c seede fell vpon thornie grounde signifieth diligently heare beare mynde wordes ghospell loue deceitfull rich inordinate desyres thinges whiche allure toile men vnto false apparaunce vertue enter myndes dayly theyr propertie encreasyng length ouergrowe seede neuer spring vp cum corne finally sede light vpon good ground betokeneth geue good eare vnto doctrine ghospell beleue heare conuey moste inwarde corner theyr harte vntill spring vp bryng forth worthie fruites ghospell euery lyke diuerselye according diuersytie soyle disposicion heauenly spirite men bringeth forth fruite meanely man plentifully greatest aboundaunce therof lyke one grayne bryng foorthe thirtie three score thirde hundred bringeth forth greate plentifulnesse fruite hath cause rendre thankes vnto god almightie cause stande owne conceipt bringeth forth meane store hath cause repyne whiche muche happier bringeth forth aboundaunce god bounde debtour man doeth bounteous liberalitie geue euerye man giftes liketh encrease soeuer cummeth thesame due vnto hym firste sowed grounde whome fruite soeuer brought foorth dayle encreaseth desyre haue corne grounde whole worlde sowen tyme shall cum sede doctrine whiche nowe secretely teache fewe persones may thorough diliget ministerie enlarged spredde brode asmuch may ye intent also may shewe selfes like good groud yf distribute haue receiued many ye possible fruite god better pleased ye must therfore bee well ware sede sowen myndes peryshe forgetfulnesse negligence ye ought diligently laye vp memorie may spring vp due season bring forth fruite moste plentifully pand sayed vnto candell lighted put vnder busshell vnder table lighted put candle sticke nothyng priuye shall opened neyther hath secrete shall cum abrode manne haue eares heare let heare sayed vnto take hede ye heare measure ye meate shall men measure vnto agayne vnto heare shall geuen vnto hath shall bee geuen hath shall taken awaye euen whiche hath monicion depeliar printed theyr mindes added parable thinke sayed yt haue thing doe nowe secretely commit vnto alwayes kept secrete doth manne light candell hyde thesame lighted vnderneath busshell vnder table elles doth rather light intent may bee set candlestickefor nothyng priuie c geue light house ghospell sede whiche therfore committed vnto maye bryng forth fruite great encrease haue light candell ministerie maye put awaye darkenesse whole worlde present hyde many thinges multitude yet apt receiue though tyme yet cum assone tyme shall cum nothyng hid amongst v must discouered thyng secrete muste openly preached men must nothing feare fro spreading abrode preachinge gospell thinges set apart thing onely muste go bothe day night wo man hath multiplied ye good sede betaken vnto hath hidden light geuen hym therefore haue eares heare let hym heare wordes hath hearde let hym beare well memorie agaule left wordes spake shoulde forgoten said moreouer marke wel thyng heare take hede heare vaine heare vaine fable phantasy n inuencion heauenly doctrine whiche ministerie must spread abrode throughout whole worlde preache truelye doctrine haue receyued teache nothing desagreable therunto shall auayle muche heare thinges retayne well memorie diligently distribute heare heare greate perill yf strike either feare humaine el delited commodity pleasure present worlde suppresse kepe haue receiued ye niggishand vnto yt haue shall geue c slouthful distributours doctrine giue giue put forth lauishly liberalitie shal nothing diminishe rather encrease haue make treasure gold siluer length wasted liberalitie liberally distribute heauenly treasure greater shall heape thereof neither foloweth lyke poorer giueth way goodes vnto neadie like manour wurse learned whiche distributeth doctrine gospell manye possible carrieth light manye hath therfore whit lesse light selfe euen preachynge doctrine gospell openethe waye menne cum knowleage trueth doeth onely loose light whiche alreadye hath also hath greate deale gyuen thentent maye profite dooe good vnto mooe treasure haue none youres gaue distribute distribute large measure gaue stocke principall parte also like measure geue encrease therof god loueth haue giftes prodigallye layed cleane contrarie manoure worldlye ryches waxeth richest whoso lauishest laying beneficiall goodnesse god whyche gaue v muche eth moste ample wise augmente giftes righte well percei whatsoeuer geuen distributed bestowed great vtilitie manye therfore let hym whiche hath gifte bountuouslye distribute thentente maye haue aboundaunce manne doeth well geue goodes hym aboundeth rich suche liberall dedefor vnto hym yt hath c wonte geue vnto poore neadie cleanen contrarye vnto hym hathe hathe thynge whyche hath owne vse commoditie alone liberallye departeth therewith hym saye trustie distributour shall gyuen maye abounde haue muche plentye hath suche one hydeth treasure kepeth himselfe thesame shal alonely neuer whit richer therfore also thing whiche thought owne vse man el shall quite taken neither let make euer slacker worse wyllynge distribute gyftes faythe yf people vnkynde aunswerable diligent endeuour wage shall safe wyth god euery one hath trauayled settyng foorth ghospell bounteously rewarde hym worlde cumme albeit neither shall meane tyme vtterly defeated rewarde whiche daylye enriched rich ghospell pand sayde kyngdome god euen yf man shoulde sede grounde shoulde sleape rise vp night daye sede spring growe vp aware earth bringeth forth fruite selfe first blade eare full corke eare ut fruite broughte forth anon thrusteth sickle haruest cumme moreouer lorde added another parable whereby taughte disciple care nothing el onely go al might haue gospell spred abrode preached thorowe whole worlde tellyng haruest time shoulde cum whe please lorde kingdome gospel sayeth manour yf manne shoulde sowe sede caste vpon grounde daye tyme anon sede putte earth sowed slepethe carelesse taketh reste meane thus slepe sede groweth neuerthelesse nyghte daye secrete encreasynges without mennes laboure nowe springeth ye corne shoteth vp hasting vndoubtedlie owne accorde certaine priuie operacion nature bring forth fruite certes nature hath degree whiche alwayes seede sowen kepeth course without husbandmannes laboure firste sede putrified groud springethe vp grasse firste hope encrease blade shot vp therunto groweth eare suche one hathe yet corne lengthe huskes eare fylled full wheat cornes thinges secretely wroughte procurement nature man perceiue growe yet senublye perceiue haue growen encreased therefore corne ripe sowed sede thrusteth sickell reape come vp knowethe harueste tyme already come darke parable lorde couertly taught disciple begynnyng goyng forwarde consummacion perfit code al ye whole gospell whiche thre partes woulde openlye perfourme bothe ye firste laste visible bodie saye goyng forwarde ordre inuisible grace holy ghoste prince sowed abrode sede gospell thorowe iewry anon done slepte firste dyinge afterwarde risinge agayne euerlasting quietnesse thus farre foorthe springeth sede gospell while firste sowed slepe secretly encreasethe bothe daye night saye prosperitie aduersitie oc asion soeuer ministred eyther theyr befalfe promote aduaunce el suche resiste cannot chosen seede muste nedes cumme vp whiche sowed whose man resisteth moreouer nothinge worlde vnknowen vnto hym yet suffrethe worlde make businesse agaynste ghospell apostle persecuted slayne semethe vnto faythlesse knowe done maner aslepe whereas dede doeth euen inuisible power holy spirite effectually worke thinges visible forme retourne worlde vntyll tyme ghospell beynge firste muche enlarged spreade abrode hath determined onelye knowethe shalbe men shall see hym cum agayne vnder selfe forme lykenes ascended vp heauen deuide godly good people wicked laye vp godly good corne barne euerlastyng quietnesse see howe small begynnynges kyngdome gospell spronge yf manne esteme thynge appereth vnto worlde manne woulde saye grasse sprange sede gospell whiche phariseis scribe priestes elder ruler prince kynges philosophiers dyd coulde oppresse kepe vnder neuer cum vp while stroue agaynste streame sede began sowen partes worlde cease growe worldes ende vntill corne ripe sickell iudgemente auoyded shall thruste entente cut downe maie deliuer cockel vnto fire safely lay vp pure wheate parable althoughe specially pertayne vnto iesu auctour promotour finisher kyngdome gospell yet doeth also touche apostle successoures willeth wholy binde themselues hereunto goddes worde maye sowen brode preached muche maye seedetyme lasteth euen tyl worldes ende also helper iesu christe sowiers saue alonelye sowe owne sede suche christe deliuered vnto sede celestiall wyse ouerlayed oppressed pharisess also philosophiers sede owne sedes coulde meanes world fauoured growe prosper seede heauenly doctrine waxeth euery daye stronger euen worlde puissaunce aydes hathe assaulteth therefore apostle lykewyse sowe fashion purpose sente oft remouing place place go aboute nothing el haue gospell muche dilated spred abrode possyble god geueth encrease asleape foresayde sede hath euerye one euen christian grasse eare haruest hym christian nouice corne yet vnperfite lacketh naturall shape lately borne agayne christe baptisme sede sprongen grasse whiche ye grenenes innocencie puttethe euery manne ioyefull hope wyll proue well come good nowe growen vp higher goyng forewarde christian vertue godlynesse eared eche rype manoure cutte downe sickle sickle deathe whiche wheate neyther waxethe ne lesse neyther made worse better barne signifieth life celestiall pand sayde whereunto shall lyken kyngdome god comparison shall compare lyke grayne mustarde seede whiche sowen earthe lesse seedes earth sowen groweth vp greater hearbes beareth greater braunches fowles ayre maye make nestes vnder shadowe manye suche parable spake worde vnto might heare without parable spake nothing vnto alone expounded thinges disciple daye euen cumme sayed vnto let v passe ouer vnto side lefte people toke hym euen shyp also hym shippes furthermore lorde iesus shewed another parable figure successe prosperous going forwarde gospell entente vnderstoode sayinges shoulde afterwarde knowe ende profe matter thynges dooen aduentures worldlye policie prouidence goddes wysedome woulde make hearer take better hede vnto wordesit lyke graine mustarde seede lettynge thoughe stande doubte vnto thynge myght beste compare kyngdome heauen sayed unto thinge shal saye kyngdome heauen lyke comparison shall vse wherby maye expresse nature vertue therof vnto perceiue nothynge saue alonely see theyr iyes lyke safethe gra e corne mustarde seede whiche sowen lesse seedes hearbes sowen earthe muche yf man marke quantitie forme therof loketh greate thynge shoulde come soone spronge vp gotten grounde draweth nature tree waxyng harde stemme stalke spreadyng abrode braunches beyonde quantitie measure al hearbes muche geueth shadowe vnto fowles also conuenient place buylde make nestes many like parablesand wt many parable c lorde iesus shewed rude grosse people figure successe gospell shoulde haue attemperynge wordes vnto capacity spake nothyng vnto tyme darke parable receyueable playne communicacion yf sayed shoulde shortely haue beene slayne iewes woulde anon reliue spreade abrode glorye throughoute worlde seemed loweste mooste abiecte person shoulde righte well knowen soueraygne gouernoure whole worlde mann neuer hyghe dignitie shoulde fynde quietnesse sure harborowe vnlesse fled succoure vndernethe hys boughes braunches yf saye spoken thus plainelye vnto one woulde haue abyden hys woordes geuen anye credence thereunto yet verye expediente dreame remember thynges afterwarde thynge selfe shoulde teache meante parable shewed secrete communicacion secrete vnderstandynge euerye parable spake vnto thus daye spente nowe almoste nyghte commaunded disciple rowe hym ouer syde water bicause faythe towardes christebut went alone c christe godwarde originall cause encrease gospell lorde perceiuing disciple yet rude weaklynges dyd geue tredence vnto doctrine attempted many wayes brynge forth stablishe fayth whensoeuer nyght saye storme worldlye trouble aduersities cummethe vpon v haue chiefelye nede stronge stedfaste faith towardes christe therefore disciple obeyed commaundemente people coulde folowe sente awaye accompanyed certayne boates beganne rowe hym ouer farther syde shippe taughte preached apostle carye ouer iesus whensoeuer goe place place sette forthe preache ghospell knewe righte well suche minister goddes worde shoulde tyme cum much sore businesse trowble stirred vp loue better vanity worlde thynges appertayne euerlastinge saluacion arose great storme wynde waues dashed shyp full sterne slepe pillowe awaked hym said vnto hym master carest thou perishe rose vp rebuked wynde sayde vnto sea peace still wind ceased folowed great calme sayde vnto ye feareful happenethe ye haue fayth feared exceadynglye sayde one another bothe wynde sea obey hym wherfore harten strengthen disciple agaynste suche persecutours teache also power neuer cruel terrible oughte feared full harte mynde put theyr affiauce lorde iesu suffered daunger euen desperacion sayled farre shore sodainely arose greate storme wyndes whiche set water suche rage waues enforced violence tempeste dashed shyppe great daunger leste shyppe already filled great fourges sea woulde haue soncken meane whyle iesus layed heade vpon pillowe slept shyp fayned slepe slepte verye dede beyng weryed trauayle watchynges one naturall bodye man subiecte suche passion oures subiect vnto ignoraunt would betyde wyste well would tempest aryse knewe apostle would sore afrayed waken slepe could effectuallye teache nothyng drad stedfastly beleue disciple therefore pinched hym slepte awakened hym sayde maister slepeste thou soundely whyle perishe thynkest thou maketh matter yf drouned argumente faythe daunger death fled vnto iesu succour vnperfite faythe muche beleued sufficiente safegarde long lord aslepe iesus wakened bicause woulde dede declare lorde elementes rebuked wyndes commaunded cease saide vnto sea peace still two elementes whiche obediente mortall man knewe voyce theyr maker wynde alayed waues fourges water left ragyng fell downe folowed greate calme lorde tourned hym vnto hys disciple rebuked vnbelefe ye afrayed haue yet yt haue sene worke many miracle confydence nowe disciple wyth hym shyppe sawe thys straunge wonder sea beyng dumme vnruly element wynde likewyse violente elemente forthwith rebuked ceased ragyng still perceiuyng thinge passynge state condicion manne sayde one another whose co maundementes onely disease diuils also dumme elementes obey vnto ye sone man touchynge naturall appetite man worlde reste head eue dying crosse whe hadde nothynge laye headen caste downe yelded vp ghoste shyp dyd onelye take reste also layed pilowe vndernethe heade slepte theron anon storme arose shoulde knowe great daunger hangethe ouer churche oft christ sleapeth v slepethe verily shepeheardes pastours christes flocke delited wyth comodities pleasure worlde sounde slepe yf man pynche crye vpon er muche yet wakened howe fast aslepe byshops beynge altogether geuen vnto sensualitie dronken wyth vnlefull desyre rule playe lordes wholy set heape vp money neyther take anye care flocke committed haue anye remembraunce theyr owne soule health yet moued whit comon peryll awake theyr slepe thinke thus themselues mad man lordes flocke comitted vnto fed shortely muste cume ye iudgyng seate ye euerlasting iudge shed precious bloud shepe whiche put ruste withall answere shall make hym shoulde ensample good lyuyng haue caryed lighte euerlastynge saluacion naughtye sinnefull lyfe haue bene theyr guyde hell damnacion shoulde haue fedde doctrine ye gospel dyd feede whit plucked woolle rootes spoyled hadde slewe stede father behaued selfe lyke tiran byshope wolfe robber meane whyle tempest disordereth thynges maketh greate confusion iesus true heardman church congregacions slepethe dissemblynge matter sufferyng storme aryse slepeth streighte wayes wakethe crye calling shyppe christe pertainynge body caried one hath mo accompanyinge one catholike vniuersall churche agayne manye church christe lykewyse manye cleane vnto heade ne congregacion shyp drouned foloweth christe neuer muche tossed ye waues water neuer much ieopardie drownyng yet haue lengthe good ariuall cum safe vnto hauen tempeste nyghte plainly teache v haue maner ayde succour owne strengthe hope saluacion christ onely man full hart minde put trust deuel causeth oftetymes suche tempestes priuately aryse euery mannes soule nighte doth darken myndes wyth errours light faith doth faile strength theuangelike spirite ye would saye slepe laid rest v windes naughtye lustes arise greatly disturbe calme mynde soule selfe great hasarde helpe neyther rowing sayles remedie muste nedes perishe go wrecke yf christe wakened slepe feruente importune prayer heare streight way called yet cease thou pricke pinche hym tyll wake onely calme quietnes mind shall continent restored p v chapter pand came ouer side sea countrey gaderenites cum shyppe immediatly mette hym graues man possessed vncleane spirite whiche abidyng amog ye graues man coulde bynde hym chaines often bounde fetter chaynes plucked chaynes asunder brake fetter piece neyther coulde man tame hym alwayes night daye mountaynes graues cry beating hymself stone spyed iesus far ranne worshypped hym cryed loude voyce sayed haue iesus thou sonne moste hyghest god requite name god thou tourmente sayed vtuo hym come oute man thou foule spirite asked hym thy name aunswered sayed vnto hym name legion many prayed hym instauntlye woulde sende awaye oute countrey tepest hath taughte v trouble businesse whatsoeuer world woulde stirre vp agaynst gospell oughte ayde christe suffered constat courage mynde trouble one tyme another turned greattest tranquillitie quietnes folowed therein co tinent figure whereby fignified yt summe partes world vplandishe cruell people woulde fyrste brunte reason naturall crueltie refuse abhorre doctrine gospell yet cum passe processe tyme also shoulde waxe ientle cyuille louingly receiue swete yoke lorde knewe wherefore assone storme alayed whyche fygured storme persecucion prince stirre vp raging againste gospell iesus suche accompanied hym arriued side water countrey called countrey gerasites famous town arabie named gerasa ioynynge vnto mounte galaad tribe manasse farre fro lacke sea tiberias nowe lorde iesus maketh foreshew brutishe cruell barbarousnesse certayne nacions whome maye doubtedand cum oure ship c whether deserue haue name men yet none fierse saluage crueltie ought despaire wherfore iesus cummen shyppe entred countrey sawe sight whiche playnly declared maners naturall disposicion nacion hearde cummyng starte certayne felowe vexed spirite passinge vnclennesse crueltie wretched creature woulde come resorte people liued solitarye place lurkynge hydynge hymselfe dead mennes tumbes highe waye syde neyther assayed bynde hym bene ofte tymes bounde alwayes plucked cheines asunder brake fetter piece neyther anye violence could reclaime hym beyng case able rule himselfe would gad abrode libertie whithersoeuer wicked finde enforced go cause vnbound wandered vp downe night daye among dead men tumbes wylde mountaynes criyng beatyng stone nowe yf anye reken verye dede miserable terrible sighte lette considre hymselfe muche miserable sighte iyes almighty god hath nothyng el man name onely say marde caste waye riottous liuinge woode vpon harlottes madde vpon dise besyde himselfe reason dronkennes brauler robber praye taker breaker peace violent felowe suche one neyther restrayned goddes lawe ne mannes neyther let brideled sensuall wilfulnes shame reuerence feare bolde doo hym lyketh small wage hired go warfare soeuer sley murder suche knowethe neuer dyd hym harme burne vilages good tounes rifle church fynallye destroye euer holy holy put hereunto periuries blasphemyes inceste whiche vice suche leude ruffian sorte well acquainted put hereto treason poysonynges practise arte magike sorcerye shalte thou euidently perceiue howe muche lesse furye man thus vexed deuill wretched vnthriftie caytife ought despayre suche one truely yf maye chaunce anye tyme see iesu sene faith wretched felowe noyse straungers made come denn violently assault according vnto accustomed maner anon afarre espyed iesu drawen heauenly power sodaynly chaunged ranne vnto hym wurshypped straight wayes fiende began cry loude voyce mannes mouth saye hast thou iesu sonne higheste god require thee name god thou tourmente notfor saied vnto c iesus voyce vnto deuill tourmente sayde thou foule spirite departe man greate malice deuill greatest tourmente might nowe lde lenger suffered vexe tourment sely wretche felt iesus voyce effectuall almyghty whyche constrayned obeye vnto whether would nowe reporte whether lyke affeccion mynde suche extremely malicious persones haue great delyght menne harme yea thoughe owne displeasure yf restrayned theyr wilfull desyre suffered dooe mischief woulde sore vexed mynde iesus demaunded foule spirite name spirite made aunswere name legion manye thou knowest good reader thys worde legion worde terme warre whiche implyeth foule rablement ruffions confedered together destroye power multitude preuayleth agaynst might iesus easelye puttethe legion flight one man capitayne deuill spake reste greatly besought iesus whome acknowledged conquerour woulde cleane exile hym countrey peruerse malice deuil desyreth forgeuenes benefite whereby maye better ease counteth pleasure benefite maye suffered continewe whereas moste occasion hym harme euen thoughe sorte snap haunses set mischiefe enforced greater power prince commaunded breake garison forsake theyr hold fortresse would make peticion desire wage grace suffer v raunge abrode countrey robbe reaue owne peryll ther nigh vnto mountaynes great heard swyne feedyng al deuilles besought hym saying sende v hearde swyne maye enter auon iesu gaue leaue vncleane spirites went entred swyne bearde caryed headling sea almoste two drowned sea swineheardes fled tolde c ie fieldes wente see happened came iesus sawe vexed find legion sit clothed right mynde afrayed sawe told howe happened hym possessed deuill also swine began praye hym would depart theyr coast vnto requeste peticion deuill iesus made aunswere farre great hearde swine nighe vnto mou tayne feedynge fieldes thou knoweste good reader beaste abhorred righte iewes wherewith gentile people geuen idolatrye chefly delyted therefore deuils desyred myghte suffred leaste wyse enter swyne yf maye saye destroy man thou delyuerest v yet geue v leaue sumwhat wreake oure malice destroyinge vncleane beastes iesus graunted without stycking cared safegard preseruacion swyne men teaching v hereby saue euen one man ought passe vpon losse worldly thynges neuer greate legion vncleane spirites forsoke man remayned purified spirite christe went heard swyne whiche forthwith caryed headlong greate violence doune stepe hill lake sea drowned swyne almoste twoe thousande number lette menne beware bee founde like vnto swyne suche soules diuels ryght glad enter nowe swyneheardes sene wonderfull facte dyd helpe theyr swyne fled awaye feare nexte citie countrey aboute shewed euery body sene good shepehearde helpethe hys flocke ieopardye pastoures shepeheardes themselues bad theyr naughty flocke paste grace goodnes flocke goeth wrecke vtterly perishethe shepeheardes nothyng el flye awaye feare assone thynge noysed abrode people came runnyng thicke threfolde oute toune countrey desyrous see theyr iyes hearde theyr eares semed vnto incredible swyneheardes tolde wherfore came themselues vnto iesu sawe manne whome knewe vexed spirite exceding cruelnes wont reason great fury madnes braste al chaynes fetter piece rent teare soundre clothes beate hymselfe stone violentlye assaulte passed make place aboute ryng furious cry roring sawe say sit quietly iesus feete clothed right mynde nowe whiche presente sawe doue recounted suche came thyther whole history befel euen beginning howe legion diuels caste man also hogges drowned water wherfore mattier diligently examined tried throughlye persuaded truthe bene tolde swyne heardes afraied beganne desyre iesu departe theyr quarter wicked grosse nacion knew iesu throughly perceyued power marked goodnes manifestlye declared restored man ryght mynde greate deale moued theyr myndes losse theyr swyne glad mannes health recouery feared ox theyr ass theyr hogges toke great care bely none al soule yet al certayne begynnyng saluacion sum stande dreade god power come shyp deuyll prayed hym might hym howbeit iesus would suffer sayde vnto hym go thyne owne howse thy frendes shewe greate thynges lorde hathe done hath compassion departed beganne publishe x cyties howe great thynges iesus done men dyd meruayle lorde teachyng v dede rose goddes worde gospell oughte anye wyse caste vnto hogges reculed vnto water syde toke shyppe meane whyle felowe whyche deliuered deuil perceiuing authour health departe beganne desyre hym might one trayne lordes pleasure shoulde rather publisher mercie goodnes one accompany iourneys expediente soule health many get hence rather vnto thy house thy kynsfolkes acquayntaunce shewe howe muche god hathe done howe toke compassion vpon manne pitied yet demed paste remedye countreye conteyned ten city therfore called greke language decapolis man obeying commaundemente iesu departed tolde city bothe case case nowe made againe throughe benefite iesus euery man beleued wordes true reason many countrey knewe hym also shewed outwarde behauiour power iesu perfitely restored vnto ryght minde ashamed speake olde calamity whyles wente aboute set furth god glory heare thinges thou wurshypper idol thou whoremonger thou dyser thou ryotous folowe thou waster thou ertorcioner thou robber thou house burner thou warryer thou poysoner thou murtherer dispayre onlye runne vnto iesus consider multitude greuousnes thine offence regarde iesus came saue men able dooe thynges becke legion deuiles hathe forsaken thou arte restored thy ryght mynde againe blase especially amonge thy frendes acquaintaunce great mercy god towardes ashamed confesse thy former lyfe also shall make greately aduaucyng settyng furth mercy iesu knowen many maye possible howe abhominably thou ly eddest knowledge confesse thou haste bene thou arte nowe sodainly chaunged become another manne ascribe vnto thyne owne deseruinges vnto free mercye god takethe mercy compassion vpon whomsoeuer pleaseth muche debtour bounde manne pand iesus cum ouer agayne shyppe vnto syde muche people gathered vnto nighe vnto sea beholde came one ruler synagoge whose name iairus sawe hym fell doune fete besought hym greatly saying daughter lieth poincte deathe praye cum laye thy hande maye safe liue wente muche people folowed hym thronged seede man maye call sowen among gerasites ye lord iesus passed eftsones ye water oftetimes chaugeth place maketh aduauncyng gospell varietie miracle monisheth v teacher gospell ought busyly deuoure whe soeuer occasion serueth bryng whosoeuer saluacion nowe brought ouer ye side thither resorted afreshe great multitude people like lodestone draweth vnto yron dothe benefyeence well allure men vnto while lorde water side came vnto hym one ye ruler ye sinagoge called iairus iairus moued fame iesumy daughter lieth pointe dethe came thither wt reste multitude thing greued heart sore wherein muche desyred ye presence iesu therefore whe sawe yt iesus brought againe vnto ye shore set al ad right ioyous euer lowly crouchinge whiche greatly desyre thyng although ruler synagoge primate among stately felowes yet fell downe fete iesu besought hym saying lorde daughter mayden twelue yere olde whome reposed chiefeste solace myne olde age greate perill lyfe may lyeth mercy god cumme laye thy hade vpon thorough thy touchyng maye safe lyue iesus perceyuing well wordes weake fayth yetand hym asmuch made mencion extreme ieoperdye thoughe bene able reliue bene deade deede required presence also touching hande thoughe coulde beeynge absente yea wyth becke make whole whomsoeuer hym liste iesus saye promised hym come folowed hym goynge homewarde good pace geuynge thereby ensample howe readye pastour christes flocke oughte procurynge soule health al men bothe grekes barbarous nacions whiche descended noble parentage base linage riche poore learned vnlearned wente occasion geuen whereby reforme vnperfite faithe sayde ruler synagoge ensample woman whiche lesse knewe christe lawe borne excused vnbelefe folowed iesus wente ruler synagoges house merueilous greate multitude people partlye bicause possible disseuer partly behold miracle whiche shoulde wrought nobilitie suyter made desirous beholde wherefore eche preased nexte iesu payned throngyng people pand certayne woman whiche bene diseased yssue bloude xii yeares suffered many thynges many physician spente felte none amendement rather worse worse hearde iesus came prease behynde hym touched garmente sayde maye touche clothes shalbe whole strayght way fountayne bloud dried vp felte body healed piage prease woman fylthy shamefull also vncurable disease bene sycke thereof space xii yere bluddye flyxe whiche muche worse takynge whyles put great hope recouery physycians mader manye faire promise whyles disapoynted one wente vnto another boote put assuraunce healthe hym agayne another beyng continually fed good hope comfortable wordes spente euer vpon yet lytle holpen physike muche worse case shoulde haue bene chaunced medle phisicians whyles made manye large promise payned poore wretche seruiceable diligence bothe encreased olde griefe also added thereunto newe saye vnto bloudy flyxe pouertie suche vndoubtedly commune sorte professe humaine medicine oft tymes seene healthe gotten vtter despairing healthe began distruste physician perceiuinge nothynge lefte geue length geuen sentence hope recouery began nerer vnto health god helpethe none wyllyngly suche one cleane destitute forsaken worldly succour woman hearde tell iesu furthwith conceyued wonderful greate confydence hym preased among thyckest multitude bashefulnes womanhode fylthynes disease woulde suffer dooe ruler synagoge dyd came behynde iesu lengthe wyth muche wounde selfe prease people whiche thruste thronged one another touched hys garmente suche confydence hym sayde secretelye herselfe wise maye touche onelye hemme hys garmente shalbe deliuered disease phisicians whiche toke muche moneye put payne geuen ouer happened mete physician sodaynelye restored perfit health naughte deceyued truste assone touched lordes garmente yssue bloude staunched humor beeynge sodaynlye corrected whyche wonte yssue well hadde bene quicke springe moreouer felte nowe agayne selfe strengthe lustines bodye wonte haue euer began sycke disease lette suche effeminate persones made woman lyke throughe excesse worldely delicacy pleasure haue recourse whitherels succoure saue vnto iesu truste philosophiers lawyer arte magike pharisaicall ceremony shall bothe tyme wytte consumed dooe nothynge el encrease theyr disease wynne pouertie excepte peraduenture suche pouertie lesse grieuous vnto reason age nowe spente wytte cleane decayed gone woman highly reioyced stollen benefite christe thoughte mighte man deceyued kepte knowledge thynge done el yf could trusted verelye woulde goodnes pardon shamefastnes womanhood pand iesus immediatly felyng hymselfe vertue proceded hym turned hym aboute prease sayed touched clothes disciple sayde vnto hym thou seest people thruste aske e thou dyd touche toked rounde see doen thing woman fearing tren dlyng knowynge done within came fell downe hym tolde hym truthe sayed vnto daughter thy faith hathe saued go peace whole thy plage lorde hauyng regarde god glory healthe greate manye shamefastnes one woman knowynge righte well touched woman receyued benefite health therby turned hym multitude preasynge behynde hym sayed touched clothes disciple thynkynge nothyng vpon befell answerede lorde agayne sayde thou scest greate prease people thrusting throngyng euery syde yet askest thou toucheth reade gospell touche christe suche consecrate receyue hys holy bodye al healed whiche touche hym wom n alone touched hym stronge faythe healed iesus required reward benefite onelye confession disease knoweledge god mercy therfore woman constrayned shamefastenes helde peace trustynge mighte styl haue beene vndiscryed looked rounde aboute people thoughe bene desirous knowe touched hym lokyng iesus gesture hym courteously requyred confession benefite receiued woulde vtter name lefte shoulde haue semed haue hit teethe wyth good turne dyd woman woman lye shamefastenesse vnthankfullnesse helde peace prycke prouocacion geuen make put awaye vnprofitable shamefastenes wrynge holsome confession looke iesu able dooe wyse beheld peter furth came vnto hymselfe agayne woman knowyng case came vnto iesu greate benefite receyued hym durste dissemble matter womanlye bashefulnes layde aparte came fearynge tremblinge hym stode greate dreade leste woulde haue rebuked leudnes fell downe knee audience shewed whole matter euery poynte without anye dissimulacion colouryng howe longe disease hanged vpon howe physicke beene practysed vayne howe touched garmente priuily greate truste conceyued lorde iesus loueth suche confession causethe synner knowe himselfe geue glorye vnto god restitucion healthe fynally maketh prouoke many mo haue like fayth puttyng v remembraunce onelye cummeth free health saluacion make matter howe manye howe abominable mannes enormity howe muche confidence one hath either power el goodnes almightie god disease thy mynde secrete vnknowen yet confesse vnto iesu neyther vttereth agayne imbraydeth yt therwith maketh whole thou haue openly offended make thou open confession like thou haste entised manye thy naughtye ensample vice synfull lyuynge contrarye wyse beyng turned synne thou mayste prouoke many amende theyr liues shamefastnes vtterly putte awaye bothe enuyeth god hys glory neyghboure hys soule healthe assuredly thou shalt well apayed thou art rid therof thou felest thy selfe quiet coscience thy confession thou waste though thou haddest hearde selfe wordes lord iesu woman hearde hearde daughter fayth thou haddest hathe restored vnto healthe whiche physike able geue departe wyth ioyfull quiete mynde wyll thou enioye benefite continually thou ruler synagoge seest thou hearest thou wordes done enstructe suche thou art woman sicke vncurable disease waxed dayelye worse worse yet notable fayth iesu healed onelye touchynge garmente thou casleste one woulde saye physician home thy house thou commaundeste hym laye hys hande vpon paciente requirest haste pwhile yet spake came ruler sinagoges house certayne whiche sayde thy daughter deade diseasest thou mayster asson iesus hearde worde spoken fayde vnto ruler synagoge afrayde onely beleue suffered man folowe saue peter iames iohn brother iames came vnto house ruler synagoge sawe wundring wept wayled greatly went sayde vnto make ye wepe damosell dead slepeth laughed scorne put taketh father mother damosell entreth damosell saye taketh damosell hande sayth vnto tabith cumi one enterprete damosell saye vnto arise straight waye damosell arose walked age twelue yeres stoned measure charged straightly man shoulde knowe commaunded geue meate whyles iesus aunswerynge woman came messenger ruler synagoges house saide vnto thy doughter deade doest thou put mayster paynes vayne wordes spoken ruler synagoge doubtfull hope mengled muche feare beeyng nowe manne despayre durst make farther suite vnto lorde messangers put hym despaire sayinge deade manye wonte speake person whiche haue fallen committing haynous enormitie ensample aduoutrie inceste thefte manslaughter sayinge poynte paste goodnesse surely iesus sufferethe none fall desperacion suche one refuseth beleue hym propertie iewes despaire good christian knoweth goodnesse lorde bee g power neuer despaireth christe therefore holpe lyfted vp fayntyng hope ruler synagoge swete confortable wordes sayinge afrayed althoughe thy doughter deade dede onelye haue belefe skylleth howe euell case howe stronge stedfaste thy faythe thus spoken came vnto ruler synagoges house entred leauyng rablemente people without dores sufferyng muche disciple goe hym saue alonely simon peter iames iohn iames brother folowynge hym entred ruler synagoges house founde al thinges ryght gorgiouslly great pompe prepared buryall mayden besyde manye kynsmen kynswomen lamentably bewaylyng ouertymely deathe common sorte wounte take death young folkes much greuouslyer olde wher dede nothing desyred god age dye moste pleasure lyue euer soule blemished manifolde euyls present lyfe litle forceth howe longe man liue howe well vertuously iesus therfore teaching v oughte bewayle deade vayne funerall songes caused mourner cease theyr noyse aythe make clamoure noyse house wepynge waylynge mayde deade slepe truly vnto hym dyd slepe could much easlyer wake relyue worde mouthe one v wake another oute slepe slepe euery point resemblaunce meditacion death bryngeth reste power sowle taketh awaye sence continuall verye deathe dede suche stode died perceyuing iesus meante wordes laughed hym skorne beleued yet aliue sithe euidently appeared deade iesus droue folkes doores whiche fylled house full noyse dynne theyr vayne wepyng waylyng dyd onelye nothyng profyte deade bodye therwith also encreaced woefullnesse parentes laughed hym aucthour healthe skorne nedethe presence suche people soule beeyng dead throughe synne bee called agayne lyfe innocencie vertuous lyuyng thyng dyd iesus nother mannes seuerall house woulde nowe doe yf sawe great pompe vse funeral euen madnesse certayne persones hiered fayne mourninge weping crye teare heare manye tymes none theyrs knocke themselues breste scratche theyr face caste wordes frantycke manne woulde speake lyke full distruste vnbelefe set mylke deade karkes therewyth allure soule strayinge wandryng abrode body agayne oftetymes crye call vpon dead body name phylip cum againe come agayne v good phylip chyde braule saying hast thou forsake thy frendes wouldes thou kyll v mourning thou lackeddest nothyng liue pleasure neyther ryches nobilitie honorable aduaunceme te beautie age thou cruel felowe wretch c nowe put hereunto trumpettes sounde vnto deafe syngyng menne syng vayne funerall songes vnto deade bodie whiche hearethe dooe thereby take awaye sorowe lyuinge encrease furthermore put hereto long rowes torchbearer raye clad blacke mournyng apparell yea summe also whiche cause horse trapped blacke bee brought pompous shewe cary deade mane flagge cootearmoure theyr downe lokyng theyr neckes fast bounde vnto theyr legges make though sought maister descended gone downe hell shall rehearse great feastes solemne bakettes wonte make magnificke costlye buildynges tombes thoughe litle pompes super uite vsed life excepte dead folkes dyd also declare themselues attached wyth vice nowe sythes euen wysest sorte heathen suppose mad fonde customes howe muche oughte vse amonge christen menne whiche dooe slepe rather dye shal awake agayne last daye sownyng aungels trumpet therefore retourne order processe thy storye iesu put folkes doores toke parentes mayden wente secrete chambre whereas coarse laye pleasure shoulde witness miracle whiche entended worke lord toke mayden hand though woulde haue wakened slepe sayde vnto tabitha cumy whiche syrian language muche saye howe mayden aryse suche depe sounde slepe cannot many tymes wakened althoughe manne call ofte tymes loude voyce pinche neuer muche called vp yet doe awake beeyng good halfe slepe drousy gape stretch theyr armes nod theyr heades many tymes chynne stryketh brest man call styll vpon fall aslepe agayne deade mayden arose furthwith walked voyce iesu beyng relyued also mery iocunde soule throughe thenforcement disease forsaken bodyeand asto ed measure c knewe voyce maker without delaye retourned againe house went sorowfull death reason yong age twelue yeare olde greater myrthe ioye made relyuyng father mother greatly amased straunge wonderfull syght iesus neyther required reward mede yet thankes laboure onely commaunded geue meate bycause myght thereby certainely appeare restored life catyng onely sure token lyfe also welfare good healthe lykewyse charged shoulde blase thyng abrode whiche priuely done presence person eyther would haue rather published suche putte doores ruler sinagoge haue bene enuyed lesse beleued bene publisher hereof eyther commaunded kepe thyng secrete whiche knew ryght well would teache v good dedes dooe ought vtterlye exchewe vayne glory worldly prayse man wade deper herein serche secret learning lyeth hid miracle euen doinges iesu parable shall appeare dead mayden twelue yeare olde scarcely yet mariable sygnifieth man whiche frayeltye nature hathe fyrste fallen committing priuie cryme synne therfore yet past regarde honestye long custome rooted synne maye medicine shame easlye holpen cured therof suche offendeth beco meth curate pastours folow gentle demeanour iesu without makyng great doe raysed mayden home presence fewe witness shall sufficient rebuke suche haue thus offended done amisse secretly leste theyr faulte beyng disclosed eyther sette shame aparte el pyne awaye throughe ouermuche sorowe heauinesse fyrst offence happen throughe frayltie weaknesse sone amended muche harder cure hym whose wickednesse cum knowledge people hardest heale suche one hardened rooted synne long custome synnyng therfore rayseth mayden vertue bare worde father seuerall house sufferyng fewe present thereat maketh doe young springalte whiche borne vpon mennes shoulder buryed restored lyfe agayne mother people go make great mene lamentacion yong man burying fyrst mother heareth christ saye wepe christ toucheth coffin causeth porter staye anon calleth dead man loude voyce saying say aryse fyrst rayseth himselfe sitteth coffin afterward begynneth speake length whippeth coffyn deliuered vnto mother christ commaundeth lazarus graue shewed hym thoughe knew wepeth twyse troubled groneth spirite commaudeth graue stone remoued calleth lazarus loude voyce dead man cummeth bounde length vnbound falleth meate maisterie christ rayse vp karkas whiche layne fower day deade bodie newly deade daye dome voyce thaungell rayse call lyfe agayne mennes body haue bene buryed many thousand yeares thys fygure wyll shewe v howe muche doe turne sinful lyuing long tyme haue bene accustomed vice ende despayre suche person endeuoure amende oure lyues season earnestly goe bryng suche case amendement moreouer thynke also worthye noted iesus woulde haue hys benefyte publyshed gerasyte possessed deuyll yet commaunded ruler synagoge kepe sylence enuyous synagoge went aboute al meanes ouerwhelme oppresse glorye lorde iesu whiche synagoge also afterward beate apostle charged hardy speake name theyr enuye preuayled nothyng went aboute oppresse holsome name preached amonge gentyles priestes holden theyr peace phariseis crye speake agaynst scribe rayle vpon herod laugheth skorne wurshyppers idolles theues extorcioners attached vyces inceste aduoutry sodainly delyuered grace ghospell theyr olde synnes fell cruell dyuels doe magnifye prayse hym vj chapter pand departed thence came owne countrey disciple folowed sabboth day cum bega teache sinagoge many heard astonied sayde whence hath thinges wisdo geuen vnto hym suche vertues wrought handes carpenter mary sonne brother iames io e iuda symon systers v offended hym iesus sayed vnto prophet despised owne countrey among owne kinne owne housholde could shewe miracle layde handes vpon fewe sycke folke healed merueled theyr vnbeliefe occasyon soeuer christ haue goe whyther alwayes one fashyon lyke hymselfe euer bryngeth healthe teache disciple accompany hym christian ought neuer cease doe busynesse ghospell still goe aboute whensoeuer occasion serueth thereunto make euell men good good better whether happen v continew leade lyues home owne house el foreyne straunge countreys publyke place pryuate moreouer vnfaynedly indewed suche vertue goodnesse belongeth christian profession whether chaunce hym shyppe wagan haue familiar talke communicacion el present feaste banket yea make shorte tale euen bourdeth maketh game pastyme demeaneth hymselfe euer depart awaye hym muche amended theyr maners conuersacion reason companye therfore iesus whoe attempted go vnto gerasytes forsoke place nighe vnto waterside returned backe owne countrey leste shoulde haue semed readyer dooe straungers foreyners good owne countrey men nazareth deserued haue honorable name called countrey fostred continued long seasonand sabboth daye come went hym disciple whiche folowed euery continually sabboth cum vpon whiche day iewes wonte according auncyent right laubable custome assemble together woulde passe holye time saye lose beholdyng folyshe syghtes tellyng vayne vnfruitfull tale vsyng vnholy pastyme syngyng ydell balades songes holy communicacion eyther learne goddes law themselues el teach iesus entred sinagoge lyke maner dyd gyue ensample wherby men perceyue great shame dishonestie shoulde v christian menne sithens iewes earnestly laboured throughly learne know carnall lawe neyther perfite ne shoulde continewe euer written moyses mortal man yf woulde semblable rather diligence study knowe phylosophye doctrine ghospell whiche sonne god owne selfe taught set forth vnto worlde wherefore iesus teaching temple authoritie lesse estemed many ryght well knowen vnto pertayning vnto fleshe knewe poore parentes symple homely house came neuer supposed thyng heauenly father euerlastyng house whence came downe cause knew father occupacion wherwith ioseph mayntayned founde house whiche science hymselfe also practysed fyrst yeares arpentoure conuenient occupacion hym heauenly father made whole worlde carpentour makynde created madeand many heard hym astonied c carpentour mete man repayred therfore knew iesus vntil almoste thyrtye yeares olde lyued among frendes neuer appeared haue knowleage phariseis learning heard hym teache great authoritie suche thynges neuer heard excellently well learned phariseis wondered greatly saying one another felow sodainly chaunged becum another man whence hath thynges newe kynde wisdome geuen hym whence hath mighty effectuall power worke miracle great neuer heard like haue bene prophetes sythe hath bene v short whyle cummeth passe cum againe sodainly altred cleane chaunged selfe iesus carpetour sonne ioseph wright mary poore symple woman know hym kynred progenye next kyn saye brother sister dwell among v halfe disdayn iesu longe taken vnderlyng persone reputacion sodainly exalted highe estimacio authoritie offended wt thimbecillitie weaknes flesh wherof ouer much knowleage iesus said vnto prophete despysed cwhen lorde iesus perceyued sayed vnto prophete despysed owne countrey among aliance kinnesmen familiares ghostly busynesse yll agreeth fleshlye affeccions neither anye wyse besemyng true prophete preacher ye ghospell teacheth v set nought worlde promyseth ioyes heauen teacheth muste newly borne throughe baptysme christ iesu teacheth also w ought mortify membres haue vpon earthe thentent maye lyue ghostlye heauen besemyng saye suche one know either countrey house acquaintaunce kynred frendes neyther maruayle yf earthly citizen knowe hym agayneand could shewe myracle c synce nowe made denisen countrey wherfore iesus thoughe almyghtye desyrous saue many myght yet could among countreimen worke many myracles letted dooe vnbelefe acquayntaunce kynsfolkes whereas among alyauntes easely cured many kyndes disease caste dyuels healed leaper owne countrey onely healeth fewe sicke folkes laying handes vpon pand went townes laye euery syde teaching called twelue began sende furth two two gaue power agaynste vncleaue spirites commaunded shoulde take nothyng theyr iourney saue rod scrippe bread monye purse shooed sandaies put two coates cause one merueylyng great vnbelefe countreymen departed thence trauayled throughout tounes borowes sowyng euery wente sede ghospell hereby disciple couertly monyshed thynges concerning preachyng settyng forthe ghospell shoulde wyse truste vnto worldly affeccions selfe thing whiche chaunced vnto iesu countrey shoulde afterwardes betyde iewrye goe wheresoeuer sawe hope lykelyhode plentyfull encrease preaching ghospell bryngeth forth fruite aboundantly wheresoeuer hearer enclined beleue suche inclinacion beleue neyther among kynred phariseis kynges kynred despiseth phariseis haue disdayne enuye kynges laughe skorne folyshnesse crosse nowe hyghe time apostle whiche christ apoynted ministracion ghospell already good whyle folowed hym continually shoulde make flourishe theyr offyce ministerie geue theyr captayne saye theyr diligence loyaltye wherefore called vnto hym twelue whome moste worthye person specially chose pycked take charge vpon beyng assembled hym enstructed one sermo lesson thentent sent one maister hauyng like commaundementes gyuen wyse disagree theyr preachyng one another profite edifie sent two two puttyng v remembraunce couplyng together brotherly charitie without cummeth profit ghospell lymited vnto euery couple bene certaine deputy lieutenauntes theyr prouince verye expedient done enlargyng kyngdome ghospella gaue power agaynst c sent weaponlesse leste man aydes shoulde chalenge thing heauenly busynesse leste theyr authoritie haue litle estemed muche fisher vnderlinges simple folkes vnlettered gaue power wiche worldlye prynces able geue theyr ambassadours deputy gaue power deliuer men disease caste diuels like thing ye emperour geue geue abou daunce golde syluer hoostes men battayle ax manoure artyllarye engynes belongyng warre whereof hath great store ple tie heade officer deputie hathe great vertue calling vpon themperous name heale much mennes iyes bleared gaue power vnto disciple vnder condicion therewith freely without rewarde takyng helpe neded thentent better prepared take hande execute office whiche requireth suche ministre quicke spedy luskyshe loyterer sluggerde charged carry manour baggage vitaile weapo iourneye saue rodde scrippe put theyr vitayles somuche breade whiche maye carryed without scrip gyrdels laden money neyther weare bootes vpon theyr legges hod sadals kepe sol theyr feete neyther stone shoulde hurte thornes pricke fynally content themselues euery manne one garment entete iesu gaue enstruccions nothing el grosse manour inculke beate heades disciple yet rawe ignoraunt howe suche one taketh hym ministracion gospell ought disburdened free care corporall thynges leste sodaine chaunce befall maye hyndre encrease procedyng heauenly doctrine busynesse farre diuerse worldly affayres euen kynde ambassade legacion new suche one bene vsed receyued fourme doctrine leste shoulde presume teache thyng whiche theyr maister taught thyng helde commune legacions manne death passe limites commaundementes commission sent one lorde lyke power leste disdaine priuye malice shoulde aryse among sent two two together shoulde remember brotherly charitie one brother ayde another sent sundry place countreyes thende mo take profite gospell haue power geuen heale disease name iesu lyke receyued another mannes lerning dispence teache faithfully theyr owne knowe goddes power theyrs wherwith cured disease forbad carry eyther scrippe bread money two coates full affiaunce hang vpon promise theyr maister haue sure confidence safe force violence theyr enemyes helpe perfitlye knowe prouidence shoulde want nothyng pertayning temporall necessitie bodye nothyng able suffice sensual ie pleasure leaste thing maye sufficeth necessitie nature neyther dyd lorde speake wordes meaning therby thoughe shoulde neuer belefull minister preacher ghospell carry necessary litle fardell money since apostle byshops tyme afrayed yea paraduenture prayse worthy yf man woulde owne propre coste charge teache ghospell suche manoure figuratiue speakynges called grekes hyperbole entente plucke oute disciple myndes yet grosse rude carefulnesse thynges wont hinderauce let vnto minde whe goeth heauenlye enterpryse el wist well would forget speake foloweth thou sendest v countreyes know makest v naked weaponlesse many wayes ieopardye liues shall fede v hunger cum vpon v shall defende v anye violence vsed againste v shall clothe v chaunce colde weather thou wylt haue v teache frely thou wylt cure men naught liueth straunge countrey neadeth many thynges pensyue filthie carefulnesse parte springeth distruste earnestly went wede theyr mindes thyng besemyng greatnesse weyghte suche busynesse deputed vnto furthermore figuratiue manour speakyng vseth serueth hereunto suche thinges teacheth maie depelier fastened theyr rude ignoraunt myndes teacher ghospell shoulde nothyng offende yf ware shoe two coates amogest barbarous people called etae el yf dyd take vitayle good summe money beyng gate sandes afrike summe nacion ientle entertaynement receyuing straugers thyng euer hyndreth procedyng gospell vtterlye renounced nowe considre great burthen goe charged ministracion ghospell carrie aboute princely ryches dignity promocions worldly pleasure gredie desyre auenged yf thyng happen griefe displeasure fardell christ speaketh rather mynde carying scrippes superfluous clothing wyll cast awaye fardelles meane mynde meete messenger ambassadour iesu christ likewyse figuratiue speakyng thinges whiche licenceth vse geueth leaue vse eche one wande payre sandal lightest manoure shooe sandall saueth feete takyng anye harme letteth man make quicke spede iourney therfore one thing monisheth whiche permitteth vse sandal forfendeth weare shooes forbyddeth nothyng el slacknesse doyng theyr dutie exorteth vse spedinesse therin agayne one thyng warneth whiche geueth leaue carie wande taketh awaye vse staues wande socoureth stayeth walkyng manne nothyng hyndreth iourneye rather causeth make quicker spede nowe staffe burtheneth manne beare wont caried againste violence therfore permitteth vse weapon wade forbyddeth carye staffe willeth vndoubtedlye preacher gospell ayde safely fensed agaynst assaultes yuell menne onelye helpe christe wande mete wayfairing man staffe fighter moreouer hath hadelyng gospell must alwayes goe forwarde thinges higher perfeccion fardest desyre reuengement pand sayde vnto wheresoeuer ye enter house abyde styll tyll ye departe thence whosoeuer shall receyue heare ye departe thence shake dust vnder feete wytnes vnto uerely saye vnto shall easier sodome gomor daye iudgement citie went preached men repent caste many deuils annoynted many sycke oyle healed christe hadde plucked carefulnesse oute myndes apostle went shewe waye howe shoulde cum passe shoulde neuer nede carefull suche thynges take ye thought sayth neither harborough ne sustenaunce ye entred village citie wheresoeuer chaunce receyued house neuer poore homely abyde till suche tyme thynke meete departe sum whither el moued throughe desyre set forthe aduauce ghospell beyng fewe number contented litleand whoso euer shal receiue heare c shall chargeable geastes anye man manoure impossible good towne citie farre past grace goodnesse wherin one manne founde wyll glad receiue suche geastes ye synce manye whiche sticke wage phisicia large salarie send great waye yf chaunce cum vnkynde citie house inhabitauntes therof wyll receyue notwithstandyng bryng owne accorde heauenly gyft present wherewith body soules healed yet cease fewe harde harted persones th businesse haue taken hande yet departe citie season city ere go awaye embrayde suche person would receiue theyr great folye madnesse gette streetes shake dust styckyng youre feete maye call remembraunce howe came summe vnto freely offered health sauetie brought ioyfullest message coulde maye perceyue lyke excellente good thyng cannot manoure rewarde worthilye recompensed euen suche precions ware marchandise oughte thruste anye whiche lotheth thesame wyllyng receiue thintent maye blame themselues theyr owne damnacion woulde rather perishe might haue saued also know perfectlye howe soughte nothyng el among onely healthe saluacion neyghbours insomuche would endamage muche losse litle quantitie dust becumeth well ynoughe ambassadours vse manour proude demeanure againste frowarde disdainfull person departure speake vnto one thyng folowyng althoughe wyllyng heare knowe whether receyue v receyue v kyngdome god cumme receyue v cum greate wealth commoditie yf receyue v yet shall cumme great euyll confusion christes messenger furnished necessary iourneye toke leaue theyr maister geuen commaundement moued exhorted men repentaunte theyr former lyfe shewyng kyngdome god already presente whiche fayth gospell would bring vnto men perfite ryghteousnesse chiefe principall parte preachyng gospell man geue faith vnto doctrine heareth beleue promyses whe lorde iesus many lyke lesson diligentlye enstructed disciple thesame twelue headman kyngdome heauen toke theyr iourney mattier went forward good successe preached vnto menne shoulde penitent former sinnes man truste vnto owne dedes merites onely haue sure belefe promise gohspell founde sum lystened gaue diligent eare vnto theyr preachyng lacked ready power worke miracle whiche made theyr wordes beleued thoughe themselues neuer symple person vnknowen anoynted sycke people oyle healed commaunded hurtfull spirites go name iesu wente oyle medicine heateth manoure disease one medicine sacrament skynne outwardly anoynted visible oyle body made whole theyr soules whiche anon shoulde delyuered disease vice synne anoynted oyle grace inuisible anoynted iesus christe wherfore vertue suche prayer enchauntmetes witch magician vse cast dyuels wordes piththy effectuall euangelike fayth vndoubtedly power kyngdom heauen abiect vile lessere garded apostle lesse theyr power manifestlye appeare euer done came passe might power god neyther rich learning office garde defende nobilitie fame authoritie shorte nothyng el plaine symple faythe iesu whome yet knewe perfectlye pand kyng herode heard name spread abro said iohn baptist risen agayne dead therfore myracles wrought hym saide helias saied prophet one prophetes herode heard sayd iohn whome headed tysen dea h agaynt herode hymselfe sent furth nne warre layed handes vpon iohn bounde hym caste hym pryson herodias sake brother philippes wyfe maried iohn sayde vnto herode lawfult haue thy brother wyfe herodias layed wayte hym would haue kylled hym could herode feared iohn knowyng iust man holy gaue hym reuerence hearde hym dyd many thynges hearde hym gladlye thynges iesu waxed euery daye famous name nowe knowen euen vnto kyng herode late ere kynges knowe iesu whome behoueth firste chiefly knowe hym neyther know worse lesse theyr soule healthe iesu wrought many euident miracle man could cauill saye fayned thynges myracles done many menne good manne coulde sclaunderouslye reporte say done power operacion euill spirites diuerse menne diuersly spoken theyr myndes conceites thoughte hym length herode shewed also opinion iohn sayth rysen death therfore hath power worke myracles agayne taking coniecture prophecy malachy sayed howe iesu helye whiche promysed scripture cum againe great terrible daye lorde sum whiche denied hym hely greatest authoritie among iewes auouchyng one meane sorte prophetes reliued rysen agayne herode hearde theyr opinion yet stacke styll vnto owne sayd yea selfefame iohn whose heade caused striken alyue agayne beyng nowe made faynete worketh suche thynges passeth mannes power none whiche beleued body shall reliue yet manye daye beleue christe rose agayne death lyfe thentent thou mayest perceyue vnright iudgementes wicked beleued iohn neuer hadde name workyng miracle aliue agayne moste stifly denyed resurreccion iesu whose godly power many wayes declared consydre also fodnesse wicked kinges herode affirmeth iohn alyue agayne cofesseth hath greater power firste alyue yet manour maketh vaunt howe caused hym deputte death ready slea hym afreshe yf laye power expedient heare occasion herode hadde committe haynous dede prouocacion vnchaste woman commaunded iohn taken layed yrons anye offence committed behalfe gratifie herodias daughter kyng areta whiche herodias notwithstanding maried vnto phylyppe one fower ruler countreyes iturea trachonitis kyng hee father reason certayne debate befell bewixt toke awaye sonne lawe philippe daughter maried herode brother vnto sayde philippe yet enemie iohn thentent might better resemble helye verye frankely rebuked achab iezabela could abyde vnchaste filthye matrimonie sayde vnto kyng herode lawfull kepe still house thy brother wyfe synce barrayne yet alyue lawfull cherodias diuorced former husbande fearyng leste iohns procurement lykewyse diuorced wet aboute entrappe sought occasion make awaye euer went came none effecte albeit herode loued iohn hartely yet feare hym true vertue suche force kynges mightie prince feare herode knewe right well iuste manne holy lyuer therfore hym awe reuerence folowed counsayle manye thynges gladlye hearde speake thynges letted wicked womanne destroye hym according purposed entended mischiefe occasion woulde serue therunto whiche thing onely lacketh vnto yuell folkes harme pand conuenient daye cumme herode byrthe daye made supper lordes high capitaines chiefe e ate galile daughter herodias came daunced pleased herode sate borde also kyng sayde vnto damsell aske thou wylte geue sware vnto whatsoeuer thou shalte aske wyll geue euen one half kyngdome went foorth saide vnto mother shall aske sayed iohn baptistes heade came streyghtwaye haste vnto kyng asked saying thou gyue charger head iohn baptiste kyng sorye howbeit othe sake theyr sake whiche sate supper also would caste immediatly king sent hangma commaunded head brought went beheaded prison brought heade charger gaue damsell damsell gaue mother disciple heard came toke vp body layed graue nowe herodes byrthe daye come tyme verye propise meete worke vngracious dede besemyng natyue daye wicked kyng shoulde polluted death man moste holye lyuyng godly conuersacion ddes excessiue banketting courtlye delicacy shoulde distayned cruell murtheryng innocent gyltlesse person wherfore honoure byrth daye made souper gorgious excessiue furniture prince capitaines great estate galile shoulde moo present beare witnesse crueltie came place feasted young damsell daughter vnto herodias philippe make geastes myrth pastime vncumly waten dauncing vngoodly daunced delited geastes kyng specially twise mad besydes amour vnchaste womanne herodias also distempred set furye wyne wherfore sayed vnto damsell ryghte magnifycentlye became kyng aske whatsoeuer thou wylt thou shalte haue denyall therof make bolder desyre wouldeaske thou wylt c bounde dronken promyse othe whatsoeuer sayeth thou shalte desyre though thone halfe realme wyll geue oh fonde folyshe saing worthy cum oute folishe droken kynges mouthe young damsell began playe parte prouocacion setting mother whiche diligently awayted daye place howre trymmed daughter purpose daunce durste tell kyng woulde demaunde departed feasting chaumber asked mother counsayle saying kyng father lawe hath bound othe wyll geue whatsoeuer wyll desyre hym shall therfore aske vndoubtedlye iuste occasion doubte take good deliberacion leste great oportunitie haue loste vnchaste woman mother vnto whome nothyng deare death moste holye innocent man without deliberacio takyng answered desyre iohn baptistes heade oh wicked daughter soone taught ready obey mischiefe returned strayghtwayes kynges priuie chamber mother priuily aduertised make haste speake herode great heate princely courage cooled againe went vnto kynges presence desyred rewarde wanton lasciuious dauncyng saying desyre one messe alonely wyll thou geue withoute farther delaye iohn baptistes heade charger marke well aukewarde conscience wicked kyng nothyng suche kynges oftener wont breake bondes leages couenauntes religion yet thinketh hymselfe bound conscience thyng agaynst conscience performe moste foolyshe othe especiallye syth made audyence many witness wherfore leste menne would haue thought hym haue manne credence yf refused perfourme promised othe doand immediatlye kyng sent ye hangma c swearyng perchaunce eyther diademe spirite gouernaunce body heade damsel daunced hym el leste shoulde haue seemee vncurteous voyde good maners yf eyther let mayde departe hym heauy sad cloude heauinesse abated myrthe solace gestes pleased pastyme worshypfull fayth conscience good maner curtesie worthye put chronicle leste saye thynges haue chaunced hangman forthwith sente
