holy head moste innocente person broughte vnto kyng messe meate charger kyng toke vnto damsell mother vnto derer present thone halfe herodes kyngdome deadly syght folyshe dotyng mad kyngand gaue damsell c dyd gratify vnchaste woman celebrate worshyp na iue daye kyng caused hym slayne hangman brought head kyng damsell obtained conclusion deadly rewarde geuen mother worker well mischiefe oh worthy geastes mete suche feaste maker none al frendely king would go let hym mischieuous dede shall hereafter maruaile yf kynges while fearde commit outragious enormity yf disposicion lyke vnto herode saye enflamed vnchaste loue geuen riot sensualitie ouer haue suche dayly companion eyther fearfull person el fauourers theyr crueltie whan disciple hearde bruite haynouse dede cum eares iohns disciple toke awaye carkas buried honorablye howbeit thynges lyeth hyd mystery secret meanyng iohn although bare figure lawe sygnified yet muche forecurrour gospell rewarded rewarde therof glorious death yet farre diuerse death christe iohns head priuily striken hadde layne whyle fast gyued pryson christ openly lyfted vp vpon crosse darkenes prison agreeth well shadowes fygures lawe mete shoulde geue place vnto lyght gospell whiche beganne appeare shyne abrode conueniente carnall ceremony shoulde diminished entent spirituall freedome encreased lykewyse nedeful whiche proceded feare bounde fayth charitie gospell farther spred abrode extended finally mete mannes heade shoulde striken least churche shoulde acknowledge head saue alonely iesus lawe beyng maner slayne honourably buried gaue place vnto lorde iesu began preache spirituall philosophie doctrine beleue ghospell muche bounden vnto olde testament whiche many yeares agoe drewe iesus christ vnto v shadowes figure promysed described prophecy darke sayinges prophetes pand apostle gathered themselues together vnto iesus told hym thynges bothe done taught sayde vnto cu ye alone waye wyldernesse rest manye cummers goet leysure muche eate went ship waye desert place people spied departed many knewe ranne foote thither city came thithe came together vnto hym iesus went sawe muche people compassion like shepe hauyng shepeherde began teache many thing while thinges done apostle finished message drewe themselfes together returned iesus heade whole busynesse thynges procede hym thynges must referred hym receyued commission departed al one mynde accorde thentet whatsoeuer fortune doe likewise name hym returned semblable concord myndes desyrous haue done approued retourning recouted vnto ye whole historye processe theyr legacion seuerally rehearsyng euery thyng hadde taught done greate ioye gladnesand said vnto c shewing also howe matter successe euen themselfes desyred lorde alowed theyr syncere faythe yet restrayned glorying reioycing actes toke awaye hym solitary place wildernesse towne bethsaida thentent theyr great trauaile laboure reste whyle sumwhat refresh themselfes goyng aparte wyldernes recreacion pastyme quicken renewe strength spirite secrete contemplacion prayer yt myghte bee able sustayne suche trauayles paynes soone put vnto afreshe teacher gospell must little care body moreouer muche exerciseth office apostle preacher goddes worde compelled haue weake strong learned vnlearned good bad chosen muste while greatly wrasted perfite quietnesse tranquillitie mynde whensoeuer chaunceth must seuer mynde worldly matter wholly geue hymselfe secrete deuout prayer purest contemplacion heauenly thynges beyng made stronger spirite therby maye soone returne godlye meditacion helpe comforte euen christen vnto place season found lorde iesu resorted vnnumerable multitude peopleand wet shippe waye c semed bene ebbing flowyng cummers goer whiche would suffer apostle weary reason theyr iourney take reste muche eate meat wherfore people sent away toke shippe sayled syde nighe bethsaida thence went lorde solitary place neyther chaunced long kepe themselfes close secrete light angelike veritie wyse hydde going aparte nothing el make people gredy folowe diligently marked whyther wet howe toke gate wyldernesse marchyng citie bethsaida byanby noysed abrode christe woulde make hys abode great multitude sortes people resorted thyther foote tounes aboutes made good spede iourney many came thyther soner foote christ disciple whiche vauntage water manne would haue sayde tyme bene alredy present people woulde goe forcibly enter kyngdome heauen iesu perceyued howe vnnumerable multitude people assembled together whiche muche payne difficultie trauayled thyther foote true gate waye commaunded departe theyr importunacie came secrete place manoure meete goyng teache disciple sundrye wayes meanes howe tymes willing ready set forth gospell moste gracious lorde iesus came forth sawe great confuse rablement sortes people men wemen child moned compassion shewed iyes countenaunce commonly say euen verye forehead vnfayned sorowe mynde fashionyng thaffeccion ought teacher gospell people thirsted holsome doctrine plainlye declared quicke spede made also paynes toke iourney loue made theim swifte foote sort shepe wandring hither thither lacke good shepheard priestes phariseis scribe nothing regarding theyr flocke fed owne belyes therfore iesus takyng compassion simple disordered people began exercise thoffice faythfull shepheard firste al refreshed theyr myndes great aboundaunce meate holye doctrine immediatly healed sycke folkes brought pand day nowe far spente disciple came vnto saying deserte place tyme farre passed let departe maye goe countreye round townes bye bread haue nothing eate answered sayd vnto g ue ye ate sayd vnto hym shall go bye two hundreth peny worth bread geue eate saied vnto howe manye loaues haue ye go loke whe searched sayd fiue two fyshes commauded make sitte doune company vpo greue grasse sa e doune rowe rowe hundredes fiftyes taken fiue loaues two fish loked vp heauen blessed brake loaues gaue disciple set two fish deuided among dyd eate satisfyed toake vp twelue baskettes full therof fyshes dyd eate fyue thousand men muche tyme spent herein thing selfe gaue watche worde multitude lykewise nede fedde corporall foode disciple folowing mercy pitiefulnesse maister aduertised therof saying lorde thou seest great number people cum thus far without vitayles purueyance deserte place meale tyme past desyrous heare thy doctrine forget themselues wise seuered wherfore let depart thentent maye repayre countrey village nexte eates eate iesus teachyng disciple multitude fedde made answere yea ye rather shalbe shepheardes tyme cum accustome selfes play shepheardes geue owne vitayles eate disciple perceyuing purpose spake wordes answered agayne according vnto rude capacity saying thou commaundest v thing vnpossible thou knowest right well slenderly prouided vitayles necessary iourney shal goe bye two hundred penyworth breade multitude ynough suffice insomuche euery man shall scarcely haue lyttle morsell sauour mouth iesus preparyng theyr myndes little little vnto myracle sayed howe many loaues haue store answere ready go ye sayed loke howe well ye prouided vitailes loked shewed hym yt fiue loaues two fyshes vnknowen vnto ye lord wasand co maunded c haue ye apostle perfectly know smal oore vitayles ther thentet might ye acknowleage goddes power ye miracle myght better discerne great multitude compaignie ther commaunded bydde people sitte doune vpon grene grasse deuyded compaignies euery copaignie sitte hundred person el fiftie together apostle lord bad lykewyse people obedient vnto apostle greate confidence theyr guyde shepeheard iesu toke fiue loaues two fyshes lifting vp iyes accordyng vnto accustomed manour heauen gaue thankes vnto father thorough whose beneficiall goodnesse busynesse gospell dyd well goe forward n brake loaues gaue vnto disciple shoulde sette multitude like maner deuided fish sundrye porcions gaue vnto sayd disciple likewyse distributed among people refreshed dyd eate theyr fylland eate c none lacked inso muche feast done apostle lordes commaundement gathered together reuersion therwith fylled twelue baskettes furthermore number people whiche myght easely knowen reason thus deuyded compaignies satte rowes fyue thousand men besydes child wemen thys myracle iesus bothe prescribed vnto disciple fourme rule howe feede multitude foode gospell also pulled oute theyr myndes pensyue carefulnesse prouide corporall sustenaunce therfore whosoeuer thou arte bishop curate pastour christes flocke thynke thus thy selfe doctoure diuinitie excellent cunnyng expounder holye scripture haue great store learning wherwith enstruct people may take inough riche store house stuffed cunning feede al neuer hungry yea rather loke acknowledge small store vitayles thou hast home whiche whatsoeuer thou arte debtoure vnto lorde bryng suche store thou haste vnto handes iesu desyre hym vouchesafe handell breake done hath deliuered thee dooe thou euen toke minister vnto people ye lordes meate thine minister mistrusting puttyng difference betwyxt meat trusting thine strength conclusion shall euangelyke banket mindes faithfull shalbe refreshed filled holsome foode thus ministred simple person supersticiouse pharisey arrogant philosophier eloquent rhethorician would aduauncyng settyng forthe selfes make vnto people artificiall oracion sermon whiche diligently studied long tyme prouided aforehand much comauded disciple cum vnto ministery gospell without prouision corporall foode hath declared dede howe shall wante nothing while myndes wholly set vpon kyngdome god righteousnes therof passe vpon temporall thinges common sorte people taketh great thought care yf lacke syncere true faith lorde iesu pand strayghtway caused disciple go ip go ouer sea vnto bethsaida sent away people soone sent away departed mountain praye euen cum shippe middest sea alone lande saw troubled rowing winde contrarye vnto fourth watche night came vnto walking vpon sea would haue passed sawe walkyng vpon sea supposed bene spirite cried sawe hym afraide anon talked sayed vnto good cheare afrayed wet vp vnto shippe winde ceassed sore amased themselues beyond measure maruayled remembred loaues theyr harte blinded small benefite filled hungry belies respecte benefites whiche daylye receiued bounteous goodnesse procedeth greater liberalitie fede mynde soule bellie yet grosse common sorte people wonte suche vnright aukeward iudgement set store whiche leaste price value therfore iesus knowyng would cumme passe would nowe bellyes fylled imagine howe make kyng compelled disciple muche sunder liuely amiable lorde take ship go ouer water vnto bethsaida while meane whyle sent awaye peoplehe departed amountayne praye c beyng dismissed conueyed himselfe priuily mountayne pray alone make peticion vnto father lyke affaire ghospell begun well properously might lyke successe go forward meane time night approched disciple sayled myddes sea without maister sayling arose tempest chosen must nedes night su ne light world iesu present chosen ship must nedes ieopardie wherin christ lacketh chosen apostle must nedes troubled comforter men iesus awaye chosen contrary wyndes must nedes staye hynder successe man diligence iesus helpe forward many time awaye yet doeth forsake sucke vnto thende semeth sumtymes forsake season exercise aduersyties learne theym haue sure beliefe confidence hym cum doune mountayne stode sea banke alone without company disciple sawe hym neuerthelesse sawe wherfore muste despayre trouble distresse soeuer oure harte conceyue stedfaste belefe lorde although appeare shewe hymselfe vysyblye wyll fayle helpe hys tyme requirethhe came vnto theym walking sea c nowe standeth shore seeth laboure payne take rowing wynde therfore thus striuen pretye whyle waues bousteous wyndes worlde next doore desperacion fourth watche nyght litle daunyng daye iesus came vnto theim shippe quietlye walkyng water element knewe maker made semblaunt thoughe woulde haue passed doeth while suffer continue aduersytie tribulacion thoughe passed vpon theim whereas dede neuer stynteth care apostle spyed darke walking vpon water forgetting many miracle sene hym worke beleuing vnpossible liquid clement beare massy bodye man supposed sum spirite ghost whiche deceyued theyr iye sight vayne phantasticall illusion wherefore sore afrayed feare cried oute sawe verye shape likenes iesu yet beleued lord euer terrible vnto beleue auengerand anon talked c knowe sauiour neyther possible knowen great darkenes worlde vnlesse brynge himselfe knowledge wherefore suffered disciple lenger dismaide feare straigth way spake vnto voyce whyche knewe right well sayed good chere feare ye came vnto shippe furthwith tempest ceased nowe feare past gone beganne maruayle howe mannes body might walke vpon water dull rude forgetfull remembred muche miracle whyche sawe hym worke litle filled manye thousand folkes belies fiue loaues two fish theyr harte blynded thought thyng muche bee wondred see iesus walke vpon water wheras deede muche wonderfull facte suffice muche people litle meate lord suffered brutishe dulnesse continue disciple entent also enure themselues beare dulnes simplicitie weaklynges till cum perfeccion pand ouer water came l nd genazareth drew vp hauen assone wer cum ship strayght waye knewe anne furth throughout region rounde aboute began cary aboute beddes sicke heard whither soeuer entred tounes cittes village layed sicke folkes streates prayed myght touche hemme vesture manye touched hym safe daunyng daye came vnto shore arriued hauen appoynted arriue lande called genazareth iesus scarcely entred lande thither cum diuers inhabitauntes knew sunne disclosed night gone whiche darkened myndes disciple manye marked whithersoeuer went besyde knowen vnto many euen phisnamye great mayny mo knewe hym fame doctrine miracle sawe knew byanby though cum spyes departed awaye hym wente throughe regionand began carye beddes c shewed howe iesus landed sone rumour noysed abrode many beganne cary aboute sicke folkes beddes whithersoeuer iesus went whether wer countrey tounes city euer present greate number importune vnquiet people carefull delyuered theyr bodily disease cured disease malady theyr soules whiche layed stretes pitifull sightes sicke folkes diseased diuerse sickenesses besoughte sus passed might touche euen hem garmente suche busines hurly burly amonge harde scarce one could suffred came daungerousnes difficultie behalfe coulde touche grutched touche handle leper ensample theyr fayth highly pleased whiche pleasure haue set forth commended men good cause manye touched healed disease soeuer payned withall perfite beliefe touched hemme garment whiche afterward person chauced haue crucified put death touching therof rid theyr corporall disease muche ought men endeuour themselues touche iesus himselfe harte minde intent maye healed infirmity soules touchynge auayle nothing without faith cruell iewes buffeted bound scourged nayled crosse touched bare bodye touched nothing profite thou readeste ghospell doynge thou toucheste iesu thou readeste ende disproue el thou readest negligentlye takest heede ther unto therefore thou touchest iesus vayne reade pure syncere fayth shalt thou anon healed thou must sue vnto iesus prayer peticion thou maiest touche man neuer better touchyng hym whome hath foretouched thou able attayne secrete wysdome whiche paul speakethe amonge perfite hem garment touched thy faythe perfite wall shall restore health hemmes phariseis garmentes neuer brode power vertue lyke nothyng lowe lorde iesu fayth geueth healthe pthe vii chapiter thus went ghospell forward among simple lightly beleuyng people lyke successe amonge scribe phariseis thought theyr owne conceiptes theyr keapynge castle pure religion true doctrine scantly estemed vnlearned ignoraunt sorte commo people men priestes scarcely mencio made iesus put deathe therefore lyke comedy playes diuerse sceanes pageauntes intent comparing together sundry person matter euery thing maye playnlyer appeare thys euangelyke busines lorde iesus ordred thynges doen tyme tyme shoulde playnlye appeare men sawe howe ready simple people gentyles beleue howe vncurable theyr froward obstinacy congruence ought haue refourmed hard beliefe vnlearned common sorte sufficient recoueryng theyr health touched hem christes garment phariseis neuer better neyther vnderstode prophecy foresayinges prophetes neither oftetymes heard iesu preache vnto th heauenly doctryne many miracle sene woorke pand phareseis came together vnto diuers scribe whiche came ierusalem sawe certayne disciple eate bread comon saye vnwashen handes complayned phariseis iewes excepte washe theyr handes ofte eate obseruing tradicions elder cum market except washe eate manie thinges whiche haue taken vpon obserue washyng cuppes censes brasen vessel table nowe doen thither came certayne phariseis scribe companye together forsoth worshypfull sorte gentilmen worthy greate reuerence greate deale came ierusalem bare men hande well godlynes holy doctrine whereas deede verye well springe head ambicion hipocrisie vngodlynes felowes thought themselues ryghteous men well learned came hither learne thing christ neither healed picke quarels loe byanby ready occasion doe occasion beyng much desirous therof toke supersticious obseruacion ceremony whereof rysen almost quarelinges wrongfull accusacions amonge christian men iewes call common whiche vncleane vnholy abhorryng impuritie endeuouryng wyse seme haue maner vncleane filthye thyng cleanesse measured puritie mynde whiche onely true puritie god corporall ceremony ceremony fewe commaunded moyses lawe ende shoulde earnestly obserued euer partly entent ignoraunte disobediente people meanes accustome theselues obey god commaundementes partely suche mauer manne would say shadowes rudimentes litle title en tructed thinges belong vnto true godlynes soule man nowe sum contented ceremony commaunded lawe added thereunto constitucions owne makyng numbre whiche phariseis rigorously compelled people kepe suche thynges commaunded god alwayes euery obserued suche folishe trifle chalenged prayse holines brought people fonde beliefe made holy therby finally whiche muche wickeder deede wente aboute forge matter vngodlines heresy neighbour breache suche ceremony thobseruacion wherof conduced nothing vnto true godlynes saw certayne disciple eate meate vnwashed handesand sawe certayne dysciples c vse speake commune vncleane handes rebuked wicked person theyr maister naughtely instructed condemned facte either owne proper nature vicious el forbidden almightye god disagreed vse custome assuredly wurst rule iudge disalow thyng thou vsest chaunceth many tymes folishest thinges grow commune custome whiche ought wyse made rule godlines asmuche puritie estemed custome thynges whiche true commaunded god scribe phariseis yea almoste whole packe iewes folishely iudgeing puritie mynde stande corporall thynges dyd contrarie supersticiously obserue maner taught god theyr forefather elder suche wyse yf daunger sterue hunger woulde haue eaten meate vnlesse first washed theyr handes yf compelled take theyr repaste ofte tymes daye washe ofte tymes therfore suppose cumme cleane vnto table retourne home market though gathered sum filthe touching people washe theyr whole body afreshe eate meate wheras hauyng theyr soules moste polluted hatred enuy ambicion couetousnes hypocrisye manye detestable vyces neuer haue anye mynde washyng suche like tradicions taught theyr forefather besydes constitucions law wheras law expresly forfendeth anye thynge eyther added taken awaye god commaundementes neyther thought sufficient ofte tymes washe theyr body therby appere cleaner washed also theyr crus theyr brasen vessel thei table p asked hym phariseis scribe walke thy disciple accordinge custome ordeyned elder eate bread vnwashen handes answered sayed vnto well prophecied esay hypocrite written people honoreth theyr lyppes theyr harte fat howbeit vayne serue teaching doctrine commaundementes men ye laye commaundement god apart obserue constitucione men washing crus cuppes many suche lyke thinges ye nowe coulde lenger kepe foule scabbe false reprouyng yet quarelled disciple assayled maister though committed sum haynous enormitie say thy disciple folowe hang vpon thyne instruccion teachyng kepe custome begon elder eate meate vnwashen vncleane handes iesus intending teache v noysom mischeuous kinde quarrelling man vnder pretence godlynes fyndeth faute well doynges neyghboure sharpely reproueth theyr malicehe answered sa ed vnto c coloured righteousnes deedes sayeth playnely declare prophete esay prophecied hypocrite full well worthely whyche make outwarde shewe holynes wheras inwardly ye replenished withall sinne wickednes prophete god complaynethe wyse people honorethe theyr lyppes theyr heart far theselues liue enstructe passe nothing vpon cleanes theyr body houshold stuffe require inward puritie cleanes soule serue vayne wyth coloured kynde godlynes auauntyng magnifying thoughe thyng great worthynes wherein perfite godlynes stande teaching man tradicions whiche make man commemdable prayse worthy god supersticious mynde haue obserue thesame tradicions nothynge passynge vpon god commaundementes looke howe muche differ nce betwene god manne muche differenc oughte betwene men constitucions god commaundementes god spirite whiche spirituall ghostly continueth euer oughte neuer bee neglected agayne thynge soeuer corporall thesame lastethe season lawfull passe litle vpon ceremony whiche god himselfe hathe commaunded kepte whensoeuer charitie towardes neyghboure exhorteth doe howe muche lesse meete breake commaundementes god kepyng man tradicions wrong shapen godlines vnholy holines bee supersticious kepyng suche ceremony forefather instituted taught theyr owne mynde meane litle regard thinges god himselfe hath commaunded obserue thinke one chiefeste pointes godlines washe handes cuppes crux obserue manye lyke thinges whiche doinges reason haue certayne counter ayte apparaunce visure holines doe highly set furth make seeme prayse worthy vnto worlde prayse gotten coloured holynes set goddes auctoritie loue selues neyther seke goddes glorye soule health people whose guydes teacher professe selfes pand sayed vnto wel ye cast aside commaundement god mayntayne owne constitucions moyses sayd honour thy father thy mother whoso cursethe father mother let dye death ye saye man shall say father mother corban gifte soeuer cummeth shalbe thy profite ye suffer ought father mother make worde god none effect owne constitucion whiche ye haue ordayned manye thinges ye therfore maruayle yf ye disanull cleane take awaye god hath commaunded obserued men euer thentent mannes tradicions whiche procure great gaynes authoritie maye still continue doth worlde see thus dyd god geue law moyses honour thy father mother curseth father mother shall dye death god commaundeth one place doth oft time repete put euerye man remembraunce thereof child shoulde theyr power helpe theyr parentes olde impotent fallen pouertie otherwise ofte oppressed maner necessitie meanes paye home agayne benefyte theyr nourishing thing lawe nature commaundethebut ye saye man shall say father c whiche likewise emplanted manye brute beastes storkes hauinge iye owne peculiar vauntage doe fayned doctrine make god commaundemente none effect require lawe whiche god woulde fayne haue euery body kepe shoulde geue place vnto sayed coloured doctrine god himselfe cryethe honour thy father thy mother ye bolde saye contrary honour thy father thy mother crye wordes dede muche detestable wickednes cloke ymage colour godlynes intente treasury wherewith excesse pride mayntayned maye filled craftely alure whomsoeuer bringe many giftes vnto temple defeatinge euen theyr owne parentes shoulde according god commaundemet succour theyr nede perswading meanes commaundement fulfilled thoughe thynge whiche dedicated vnto temple geuen god god naturall father menne wherfore vnto hath caste anye moneye treasurye saye nowe nedethe geue anye thynge reliefe poore parentes commaundemente otherwyse fulfilled meane feare parentes vayne supersticion dare require theyr child anye thinge whiche semethe dedicated vnto god leste doynge shoulde brynge themselues daunger accused sacrilege doubtles god hath nede moneye neyther employed glorie turned owne priuate commoditie thoughe bestowed vpon buildynge temple yet god temple holy maynteynaunce therof would haue child forsake theyr parentes theyr n de suche fayned doctrine ye deceyue chyldren refuse helpe theyr parentes also feare parentes dare touche anye thynge consecrated vnto temple dooe saye while thus stablishe vpholde owne commaundementes dysanull put place goddes commaundementes thinge haue broughte forthe ensample whiche ye cannot denye offend herein alonely many thynges doe lyke nowe doe goddes commaundemente thou shalte loue thy neighbour thy selfe trifling washinges taughte men goe boute surmyse mattiers bothe agaynst disciple nothyng regardyng goddes commaundement thys behalfe p called people vnto sayde vnto herken vnto euery one vnderstande nothyng without man defile hym entreth hym thinges procede man defile man man haue eares heare let heare came house away people hym disciple asked similitude sayd vnto ye also greatly without vnderstandyng doe ye yet perceyue whatsoeuer thing without entreth man cannot defyle entreth hart belly goeth draught purginge meates phariseis wordes vnto priuately spoken rather put sylence cured theyr maliciousnesse eftsones called ye people vnto pleasure haue monished premiss leste shoulde anye time afterwarde haue bene pharisa call tradicios withdrawen puritie gospell heare saith vnderstande wordes sawe howe accused heresie vngodlynesse disciple dyd eate breade vnwashen handes saye eateth suche meate polluted made vncleane god cleanes vncleanesse manne standethe outwarde inwarde thynges neyther canne soule manne bee defiled corporall thinges therefore nothinge without man entreth bodie make vncleane god suche thynges within man cummeth hym declarethe bee vncleanehe yt hath eates c darcke saying lorde iesus gaue people occasion diligentely ensearche meanyng wordes make diligent sayd moreouer whoso hath mete eares heare let hym heare meanyng foresayed songe songen vaine deafe phariseis multitude sent awaye gone house disciple desyred hym aparte expounde parable difference betwene thinges entring cumming man iesus folowinge sample faythfull diligent scholemaister gyuen litle checke meanes made take better hede vnto wordes teache misterye secrete meaninge thereof sayethe also whome haue specially chosen teache voyde vnderstanding trulye ye selues oughte haue gessed meant parable manye expounded heretofore perceyue man cleanesse vncleanesse neuer knowen externall thinges whiche enter hym whatsoeuer entreth mouthe conueyed hartewhat uer th fro without entreth c stomacke anon bely thence yf anye thynge vncleane filthy auoyded priuie eater euery meate cleane nature purgeth whatsoeuer vncleane filthy sayed whiche cummmeth man defileth man within euen heart men procede euell thoughtes aduoutry fornicacion murther theft couetousnesse fraude deceypte vncleaues wicked iye blasphemy pryde folishnesse euel thinges cum within defile man thinges cum inward partes man tho make declare bee vncleane seate soule minde heart soule true cleanesse vncleanes cause forthwith cleane whoso hath washed handes whoso hath washen cleane harte therefore cummethe thence doethe verely declare manne cleane vncleane moste secrete corner harte yssue euel thoughtes aduoutry fornicacion manslaughter thefte couetousnesse gyle falsehode vnchast lyuinge naughty enuyous iye raylyng wordes pryde folishnesse meate whiche eaten vnwashen handes bringeth none enormites springe euen man himselfe saye harte cum doe playnly declare bee vncleane dede whose harte defiled manye fylthy vice kept hid yet man neuerthelesse vncleane sight iyes almighty god throughly seeth entrayles bowles harte yf fortune come eyther wordes dedes onely testifye person whome procede vncleane also many time defile mo while eye eares enter crepe myndes hearer sears wherfore let chiefe care kepe harte cleane shall skill whether eate meate washen handes vnwashen pand thence rose went border tyre sydon entred house woulde man shoulde haue knowen could hid certayne woman whose doughter foule spirite assone hearde came tell fee e woman beeke nacion syrophenicia besoughte woulde caste deuill daughter iesus sayde vnto dee let child first fed mete take childrens bread caste vnto whelpes answered sayd vnto euen lorde neuerthelesse whelpes also eate vnder table childrens crummes sayd vnto sayinge go thy waye deuill gone thy daughter cum home house found deuell departed doughter lying bed thynges thus doen iesus signifying euen chaungeing place howe wery iewish honouring seruice whiche almoste altogether estemed thovseruacion folishe corporall ceremony coarcted within verye narrowe limites iewry signifiyng also much desyred large among gentile honoured spirit trueth gat himselfe thence went border tyre sydon priuie geste enuious iewes reason counted tyrias sidonians dogges abhominable people woulde haue suffered haue translated awaye doctrine ghospell vnto wherfore beyng vsed conuersaunt open common place wont among iewes went house though bene desyrous kepe hymselfe secrete vnknowen albeit coulde wise greatly fame wordes dedes spred abrode stretched forth selfe euen beyonde bondes lymites iewrye though deuised ouerrunne whole worlde wise glorye prayse gotten leadyng godlye lyfe ghospell best spred abrode owne accorde foloweth hym exchueth shunneth thesame certain woman canaan rumour bruted noysed abrode iesu came oute coastes countrey anon conceiuing greate confidence hym hasted place muche doe let house fell downe feete womanne iewishe heathen religion iewesse borne syrophenisse thou seest fygure churhe whiche anon assembled gathered together gentile iewes droue iesu theyr countrey thys syrophenisse forsoke countrey wente mete lost labour cum iesu vnlesse thou haue first forsaken thyne olde vice beyng familiar houshold thou must flitte thyne owne house thentent thou mayest cum vnto house iesus abydeth woman daughter home vexed yuell spirite whiche daughter vnderstand people geuen ydolatrie wherfore desyred iesu woulde vouchsafe delyuer spirit muche perfyter fayth heathen woman ruler synagoge iesus woulde make faythe woman apparaunt men shaped aunswere though bene iewish minde saying suffre child first filled besemyng take breade child caste dogges iewes glory make theyr vaunte alone child god esteme gentile contrarye relygion theyrs dogges calleth vertue ghospell bread whiche heauenly doctrine pure faythe healeth disease expelleth kynde diuels menn sowles woman nothing offended rebuke tourned woordes argumente obtayne peticion whiche spake semed shake shoulde make suyre requeste vnto herein thou sayeste well sayeth lorde heathen people haue disdain iewes child doe honorably sit table theyr exceding rythe father eate theyr fyll holye loaues yet dogges permitted eate crummes whiche fall downe vnder feete childrens table iesus though bene ouercum great faith pacience humblenesse minde constancy woman answered sayd reason answere thou obteyneste perforce whiche yet tyme geue get home thy daughter nowe deliuered spirite woman gaue credence vnto wordes departed thence greate ioye gladnesse proued thinges true iesu tolde founde daughter reste bedde nowe cleane deliuered vexacion fiende assuredly faythe mother enforced iesu heale daughter assone euill spirite put flighte folowethe incontinent quiet minde conscience euer foloweth innocency cleane life daye congregacion godly folkes resorteth vnto iesus maketh intercession suche lesse vexed idolatrye ambicion wrathe couetousnesse furious desire make warre yf vnder thraldome foule spirite iewes thoughte beseming whiche litle enforced doe mischiefe pleasure diuels shoulde daynlye throughe grace gospell receyued dignitie felowship child god cause reason perceyued howe high preeminence oughte bee estemed consanguinitie kinred feruentnesse constancye faythe towardes lorde iesu christe promised vnto child israel posteritie successours abraham posteritie abraham folowethe fayth abraham child israel require heauen gate opened vnto theyr merites sake goe aboute violently entre force euangelike faith israel muche saye hebrue tongue man strong valiaunte againste god gentile tyme blemished wyth kindes vice good dedes whereby mighte make anye iuste title clayme vnto kingdome heauen iustice god cleane excluded shut oute brake windowe mercye made themselues waye constaunte faythe toole weapon violentlye breakynge vp walles kingdome time yet come shoulde openly called felowship kingdome heauen yet lorde maketh many foresignes theyr vocacion one desirous preuente thing whiche chiefly desireth pand departed agayne coastes tyre sydon came vnto sea galile thorow middes coastes ten city brought vnto one deafe impediment speache prayed put hande vpon taken aside people put finger hys care spit touched tongue loked vp heauen syghed sayde vnto ephat saye opened strayghtwaye eares opened string tongue lewsed spake playne commaunded tel man forbad muche great deale published saying hath done al thinges well hath made deafe heare dumme speake sede priuely man would saye stealth wen amonges tyrians sydonians cananites lorde reculed wente agayne vnto ye lake galile leauinge sydon passinge alonge countrey decapolie ten city wheras healed man vexed spirite hither cummen brought pitifull sight wete manne bothe deafe dumme muste nedes dumme whoso nature deafe miserable deafenesse lacketh meete eares heare ye worde god worse dume hath tongue confesse owne filthie liuing god merc e hearing fayth beginneth saluacion confession mouth perfeccion soule healthe iewes albeit dayely hearde iesus speakinge yet hearinge hearde folowinge sample serpente called aspike whyche stoppethe eares againste voyce wise enchaunter woulde geue credence vnto suche thinges hearde therefore tongue backbyte make yll reporte none professe holsome faythe christ shall sely poore wretche doe hath neyther tongue desire lord geue health eares heare voyce iesus whiche reysethe life euen deade bothe tongue eares holpe brought vnto iesus besought gracious goodnesse vouchesafe laye hande vpon plesethe moste mercifull lorde helpe sinner euen contemplacion mennes faythe christian nouice broughte vnto iesu hath made ende bothe yll doinge naughtye speakynge yet hathe learned dooe well yet hath learned confesse goodnesse ghospell howe doe vnlesse iesu laye hande vpon men laboure vayne yf iesu put secrete power vertue lorde coulde euen bare worde mouthe haue easlye healed deafe dumme felowe fourme healing set enstruccion like ye wordes iesus moste commonlye parable misteries euen many time doinges toke hande led aside multitude people safe whomsoeuer iesus hath taken seuered ruffling troublous vnquiet worlde put finger eares touched tongue spittell nowe health verye nere iesus vertue spirite whiche finger god vouchsafeth touche eares minde spettell heauenlye wisedome whiche himselfe cumminge mouthe higheste father dayneth touche tongue soule thentente godly thynges maye rellise sauiour vnto v without humour tast mannes spettell fautie maketh wrong iudgemente tasting spettell dothe onelye leuse tongue also open iyes blinde borne person often mingled earth iyes therwithall anoynted wheras spettell philosopher phariseis doethe rather put iyes altogether christe manour doe teacher gospel take men leade away multitude call backe brode waye many walke vnto damnacion felowship litle flocke true christian put finger theyr eares perswadinge put trust thinges transitorie styrre exhorte embrace heauenly doctrine laye spettel vpon tonges exhorte men professe euangelike christian fayth lay handes geue holy gost baptised whome theyr sinnes taken awaye innocencye conferred teacher doethe vaine outwardlye excepte christe worke within sende downe godly vertue heauen iesus willing shewe v certayne fygure hereof taken man firste put finger eares spitte tongue lifted vp iyes heauen sighed sighing came anye mistruste cure manne passion poynte yf greuously bewayled mannes calamitie thinge iniserable wretched whose inwarde eares occupyed encumbred worldly lustes cannot heare worde god whose tongue entangled inferred wyth naughty affeccions sauour heauenly thinges altogether dumme confesse theyr owne sinfulnes dumme set mercy god therefore sighinge iesu putteth v remebraunce case loking vp heauen taketh away desperacion shewing v whence cummeth ready succoure also ought recken selues bounden vn whiche open eares heare detraccions ribaudry fond tale pharisaicall doctryne opinion philosopher suggestion diuell haue nowe opened heare heauenly doctrine ghospell whiche tongue infected spettell fleshe lothed delicate foode heauenly philosophie tied diuels bondes coulde neyther knowledge offence serre goddes glory confesse howe nothynge due vnto v desertes onelye hell howe cummethe whollye bounteous goodnes god chosen bothe name also thinheritaunce child god wherefore let prieste inlyke manour rather mourne rage againste mennes sinnes rather sorowe angrye neyther lette hym chalenge vnto hymselfe power geue absolucion loke vp heauen confessingeand saied vnto ephata testifyinge thereby euer doen sacrametall rite ceremony done goddes power alone mannes iesus sayed vnto man ephata whiche woorde signifiethe hebrewe tongue opened worde ensued vertue anon eares opened bande tongue lewsed spake redily open eares lorde saied vnto come forsoke euer folowed readye tongue receyued holy goste spake sundrie language wonder god aunswered ruler charging shoulde thenceforthe hardye preache name iesu wise whether oughte rather obey god men iudge thinges doen aside people muste make wicked multitude witnesse bearer firste professing gospell leste haue derision yet beleue therefore iesus charged shoulde tell nobodye hereofand e commaunded c woulde haue miracle disclosed knowen thinge selfe dothe beter declare power god publycacion settinge forth man knewe deafe dum person nowe hearde conge blase euen spake neuer woorde mattier greate benefite receyued iesu iesus world conuersaunte vnder shape likenes man woulde enstructe menne teache shoulde doe thinge soeuer manne dothe excellence prayse worthye lette couete haue wordes made thereof thentente maimes glorye maye vtterlye suppressed onely goddes glory aduaunced ieopardy magnify ertoll manne power goodnesse god euermore moste worthely praysed albeit neyther glorye prayse man anye due vnto cleane suppressed yea oftetimes auoyded folowethe christian teacher muste mynde desyre muche lyeth knowen god alone worthy praysed euery body whoso destrethe glory prayse among men thesame desirous therof deserueth haue none wherfore iesu badde whiche broughte dumme manne vnto tell anye bodye done thereby prouoked publish tell abrode menne muche greatnesse excellencie admiracion bothe able doe wrought dede suche feates among onely require anye mede rewarde laboure also woulde somuch take fruicion glorye prayse moste worthely deserued notable miracle propertie beneficiall dede require prayse hys benefite agayn part thankfull perso much earnestly render hartie thankes authoure benefite loketh none therfore felowes reported euery iesu saying hath done thinges wellhe hathe done al thi ge wel c hath restored deafe theyr hearing dumme theyr tongue speache praise agreeable none god alone earthly manne doeth thinges aright miracle iesu wrought vndoubtedly benefites whiche miracle man wey pondre outward apparaunce corporall thynges dede many farre passed wherewith made deafe dumme speake according spiritual meaning hereof sume christen mannes felicitie standeth poynte eares may heare wordes gospel tongue vttre speake hath learned geuen credence vnto pthe viii chapiter pin dayes greate companye nothing eate iesus called disciple sayde vnto haue compassion people haue nowe bene thre dayes haue nothing eate sende away fasting theyr owne house shall faynte way diuers came farte disciple answered shoulde man haue bread wildernesse satisfie answered howe many loaues haue ye sayde seuen comaunded people sitte downe ground toke seauen loaues geuen thankes brake gaue disciple set set people small fish blessed commaunded also set eate sufrised toke vp broken meate left seuen baskettes full eate fower thousand sent away lord iesus exhorteth disciple diuerse ensamples continuall beneficence well doyng chiefeste parte wherof feede ignoraunte people wyth doctrine ghospell therefore repeteth sample feadyng thyng ofte tymes prynted theyr mindes case memorie fortuned certayne season greate multitude people came vnto hym wyldernes bryngyng many sicke folkes payned diuerse disease moste gracious lorde cured theyr corporall sickenesses fedde theyr soules heauenlye doctrine reason readie good wan harte multitude could meanes seuered hym while theyr myndes wholelye fixed vpon kyngdome god remembred make prouision vitayles somuche theyr body healed soules fed great daunger sterue hungre assuredly honger sore thing especially chaunceth among multitude iesus mindyng teache apostle dede selfe suche shall want nothing cleaue vnto hym sincere fayth sayed vnto haue compassion vpon multitude lo haue nowe three dayes haue nothyng eate sende awaye fasting ieopardie leste faynte tyar waye gette home sum came greate waye hence wordes iesus prouoked disciple attend vnto miracle whiche purposed worke howebeit yet rudeand disciple aunswered c ignoraunt cleane forgotten howe fedde greate numbre people fiue loaues two fish therefore answered wyse shoulde man haue breade wildernesse satisfie great multitude houngrye withall reason two dayes fastinge althoughe lacked money ynough bye thou hearest answere forgetfulnesse distrust iesus asked agayne howe manye loaues haue loked vpon theyr vytayles aunswered seue doubtlesse true euangelike breade barly wheate like loaues mencioned wherwith chyldren fedde whiche caste dogges barlie hath proper fioure couered rough huske couering fiue bokes moyses called pentatenche haue also spirituall vnderstanding thesame wrapped couered darcke figure nubre loaues multiplied couering taken awaye token grace encreased ceremony diminished nowe whereas disciple thought vitayles would haue sufficient greate multitude people iesus notwithstading commaunded sitte downe vpon grounde blessed feaste hungrye multitude sitteth downe iesus commaundemente doen whensoeuer people desirous heare goddes woorde cum temple heare iesu speaking mouth good preacher many cum deuocion sermon common sorte wonte goe vnto stage beholde playe enterlude sum vnghostly mattier haue belye filled loaues iesu must sitte downe vpon grounde muste cum hither quiet affeccions de erue fed meate whiche lye pleasure beddes phariseis philosophiers doctrine thou arte yearth ash art thou proude art thou puffed vp vayne glory reason thy vayne philosophy putteste thou confidence thingesand toke seuen loaues c wherin safetie knowe thy selfe humble caste downe thy selfe vnto grounde whence thou camste let fleshely lustes bee setled quiet shalt thou filled christes meate speake doen whole multitude sate doune vpon grounde beholde marke well iesus doeth toke seuen loaues shewe cummeth god whatsoeuer conduceth vnto mannes saluacion lifted vp iyes heauen dwelleth father commaunded breade dayly craued gaue hym thankes takynge vpon himselfe authoritie ministerie leste pure manne shoulde take ought vpon might iustly haue taken vpon aucthoritie equal father albeit concerning also diuine nature whatsoeuer hathe debtour thesame vnto father thensample shewed expediente enstruccion geuen thankes brake loaues broken deliuered vnto disciple euen receiued shoulde sette people mannes wordes pythy effectuall excepte handeled christes handes thou haste eloquence thou haste knowleage pilosophie thou haste good witte thou haste knowleage holy scripture lawes ciuill canon whatsoeuer thou haste firste deliuer vnto christes handes let blesse halowe lette hym breake thou minister thesame vnto people thyne owne receyued deliuered whyche breake bread holy scripture ought writhing wresting lustes man wyll pleasure iesu iesus doethe breake hungry multitude maye fylled ambicion couetousnesse prynces maye therewith bolstred maynteyned whoso teacheth ghospell gayne get glorye prayse el worldly affeccions receyueth loaues broken christ therfore preaching worde god christes ghospell let v folowe disciple christ commaunded set loaues ready broken theyr handes multitude manne saye meate onely breade feasteand fewe smal fish c must muche added vnto loaues ghospell nothyng vertue efficacie nothyng swete pleasaunte tasting yet bounteous liberalitie feast maker added vnto thesame fewe small fish paraduenture apostle put hereto certayne epistle howebeit theyr puttinge muche small matier trifle respecte euangelike prouision addicion permitted lothsomnesse certayne persones must require oughte contente selues meate alreadie prepared leste yf would styll put owne prouision whatsoeuer hym lustethe shoulde become feaste menne iesu christ iesus lykewyse halow litle fish albeit small commaunded set downe people whiche thing yf doen haue set atall h e complayne frugalitie slender prouision meate el thou wil permit knackes iunckettes rhethoricians royall dish philosopher vnsauerie potage phariseis serued shall ieopardie leste bread gospell sauer vnto mouthe infected brought taste many sortes diuerse meates may depart full belly euangelike feaste let teacher apostle likewise people multitude apostle receiued meate ye lorde set downe people without doubting reasoning multitude also quiet receiued without murmuryng grudgeing theyr minister toke well worth whatsoeuer geuen conclusion besides euery one ynoughe also seuen ba ettes fylled meate remayned euerye man eaten filland eate c moreouer people whiche manne may meruayle satisfied filled drue almost numbre fower thousand person certes largesse goddes worde ghospell whensoeuer cummeth proud teacher fournished small prouision furniture well liberal science good learning lawes constitucions hath thynges excedyng greate skill knowleage cry ofte shall haue tyme ynough prosecute matier audience receyuable high misteries drowned copie matier standeth doubte maye best begin see cum passe audience departeth away hungry muche lesse remayneth ought feast ended frugall sparing feast iesu lefte seuen baskettes full broken meate vnspent aboundaunce plenty euangelike feast standeth multitude science sundry kyndes meates many numbre sight take awaye mannes appetite prouoke hym lothsomnesse sauce made mengling together manour humayne secular learnynges vertue worde deliuered v god truly ministred without fraude couine iesus thus fed peopleand sent away c sent awaye also sumwhat happely depart feast banket iesu sent awaye render hartie thankes laye vp benefites theyr soules digeste meate whiche haue receyued cum home body beyng well fedde good workes practise suche thynges haue learned panon entred ship disciple came partes dalmanutha phariseis came furth began dispute sekinge signe heauen tempting sighed spirite saythe doth generacion seke signe uerely saye vnto shall signe giuen vnto generation left went shippe agayne departed ouer water thynges doen iesus forthwith departed thence hasted waye heardman muste neuer conuersaunt flocke holpen hath healed sicke taughte people fedde ieopardy perishe hungre benefites sti tarrie semeth bee pointe suche one loketh summe thankes gramercies necessitie multitude whether bodily ghostly manour meanes holpen nature ye people suche least good tournes wonte geue moste hartie thankes smallest benefyte canne feede nourishe body greater heale greatest heale feede soule holy doctrine none made kyng doctrine preached disease cured meate gaue kyngdome leste woulde nowe haue done like agayne departed straighte wayes themand ye phariseis came forth c takyng disciple chose shoulde alwayes accompanye toke ship came vnto coastes border dalmanutha magedan vnbeliefe phariseis may oftener appeare came likewyse hither theyr countrey healed pike quarels enuy miracle enuied also people whiche holpen manye benefytes cause began reason mattier though miracle shewedand began dispute hym c wrought heauenly power sayed base common cast wherfore case would haue men far aboue commune sorte would saye heauenlike felowes beleue hym required hym shewe signe heauen moyses obteyned manna thence helye brought passe prayer fyre sodaynlye discended thesame place consumed burnt sacrifice wood shorte al water trench cesternes altare lorde knowing right well whatsoeuer done would haue quarell therfore wonderfull signe token shewed aboue wheras prince darkenesse raigne might much apparaunce trueth haue ascribed vnto beelzebub thynges whiche saw theyr iyes hearde theyr eares handled theyr handes chiefly commune practise among experte arte magikeand sighed c cause sodayne shower dasshes rayne thunder lightnyng hayle tempest lorde saye perceyuing sighed spirite shewyng thereby wofull theyr obstinate vnbeliefe though fume chafed anger spake vnto himselfe wife froward nacion whiche manye miracle seneuerily saye vnto c yet neuerthelesse requireth signe thoughe neuer sene none tourned phariseis sayed one thing assure shall signe nowe geuen vnto nacion whiche onely tempt requireth heauen shall haue signe geuen loketh beneath shall bee signe ionas ionas swalowed vp space three dayes beleued haue dead deliuered againe whale bely man thought euen sonne man hath hid thre dayes space belly earth shall rise vp alyue agayne contrary expectacion wening left cwhen phariseis vnderstode wordes iesus departed desperate person retourned vnto shippe passed ouer water thus lorde iesus desirous mannes helth ofte time chaungeth place seking sacrifice wherof long agoe fyl true faith scarcely found worlde yet euery rather among priestes scribe phariseis head men people yll doth faith gospel agre haue world pand forgotten take bread neyther shippe one loafe charged saying take hede beware leauen phariseis leauen herode reasoned among selues saying haue bread iesus knewe sayth vnto take ye thought ye haue bread perceyue ye per neyther vnderstand haue ye er e yet blynded haue ye yes se haue ye care heare ye also remember brake fyue loaues among fiue thousande men many baskettes full broken meat toke ye vp sayde vnto hym twelue brake seuen among fower thousand many basketes leauing broken meate toke ye vp said seuen sayde vnto howe happeneth ye vnderstand sailed disciple called remembraunce forgotten prouide themselues breade hadde one loafe shippe iesus perceiuing howe carelesse reason forgetfulnesse faith gaue warning therof meanes caused carefull afreshe albeit carefulnesse came muche distrust humaine negligence forgetfulnesse hauing theyr myndes wholy fixed vpon woordes deedes iesu thei hadde remembraunce breade expedient v oft tymes forgatte howe greate numbre people suffised fiue loaues thentent shoulde deplier fastened oure mindes howe personnes shall wante nothyng pure harte mynde continuallye cleaue vnto christe shippe sufficientlye prouided hathe one loafe christe iesus wherfore pleasure sturre vp carefulnes woulde heale therof purpose gaue charge saying loke diligently beware leuen phariseis herode woorde leuen thei hearde wiste meat therby caused nowe late carefull take thought afreshe howe shoulde make prouision vitailes therfore began whisper saye softely haue bread one thyng brought another memorye hearde make mencion leuen straightwayes came remembrauce forgotte bye thesemselues bread matter talked softely one another though thei made faute forgetfulnes bought breade howbeit forgetfulnes pleaseth iesu well whensoeuer great desire haue heauenly thinges forget corporall worldly matter feared lefte shoulde haue bene checked negligece thei rebuked vaine superf uous carpe care wherfore saieth lorde doe thus reason matter amog youre selues beyng carefull haue breade haue yet haue enstructed many preceptes taught many ensamples ofte warned perceuerauce vnderstanding harte yet blynded case haue iyes see eares heare leaste wyse remember thing whiche twise done late iyes sawe long ago howe fiue loaues broken handes dealte suffised fyue thousand people suche wyse euery body fyll howe many baskettes full broken meate dyd take vp sayd twe ue afterwarde whan seuen loaues lykewise suffised fower thousande persones howe many baskettes fylled reuersion meate lefte aunswered seuen sayde iesu howe chaunceth sithe haue bene oft manye way taughte doe perceyue howe care foode liuing superfluous monicion whiche gaue auoydyng phariseis herodes leuen perteineth nothinge bread thesche wyng theyr doctrine leste likewyse deceiued deceyue many one small piece leuen maketh al ye dowe sower sauery leuen naught dowe marde make shew semblant godlynes notwihstanding farre true godlines dissent opinion among theselues wheras dooe shamefully erre way herodias many time erre reason ignoraunt holy scripture beleuing body shall rise agayne beleue nothing se iyes phariseis although haue scripture theyr finger ende yet blinded euill lustes desyres doe withstande true godlynes muste chiefly ware doctrine leste youre selues infected therwith also mo hereafter contagiousnesse infeccion embrace breade made sauery leuen gospell maye likewise distribute pure bread pand came bethsaida brought blynde man vnto hym desyred hym touche hym caught blynd ue hande led hym towne spitte yes put handes vpon hym asked hym yf sawe ought loked vp sayde see men perceyue walke tree put handes againe vpon yes made see restored sawe euery man clerely sent hym home house saying neither go toune tell meane arriued came bethsaida behold howe euery ready matter occasion ministred shew mercy certaine strete brought hym lynde manne desired touche blynde body desyred nothing hymselfe intercession made men man desyreth health lorde iesu suche one toucheth first touche bringeth man knowlege himselfe man pore blynde littell appayred decayed sight bysome possible yt blind haue neede ledde iesu men whiche prayer maye procure theffectuall touche holy hande iesus coulde becke haue healed blynd manne soeuer hym luste restored hym fight woulde vnder figure shewe disciple muche ere suche person brought knowledge truethe long tyme haue continued theyr errours suche blyndnesse blindnesse painims getiles many hundred yeares embraced wurshippyng idol steade great godlynes suche one also blindnes iewes whiche coulde made forsake supersticion receiued theyr elder whereunto many yeares accustomed therfore bishop preacher god worde shall chaunce mete suche blinde man muste marke iesus dyd firste toke blind man hande blessed guide whyther dyd leade hym lead towne manne setteth iyes worste ensample patarne ca whoso foloweth trace steppe multitude fauour themselues theyr owne perill saye thus thyng alone euery man doeth well hadde leauer playe vnwyse manne multitude wyse fewe suche blynd diuerse wayes ieopardy log among company laughed scorne runne vpon runne strike thruste place haue manye fall therfore firste blind manne must leade place whereas much company resorte people walketh safely hath guide lorde moreouer spit iyes putte handes touched neither iyes yet opened great blindnesse iesus asked whether sawe ought spoken wordewhen spit iyes blynd man lifted vp iyes conceiuing sum lytle hope restored sight sayd see men walkyng like tree haue yet perfitely receiued light gospell whatsoeuer see worlde seemeth muche greater dede see ryche man semeth plane tree see heade officer prince thynke see apple tree cypresse tree see stoicke philosopher greate bearde pharisey trimmed brode hemmes phylactery beleue fygge tree nowe iyes clensed thinges would shewe appeare vnto propre lykenes dede shoulde perceyue maner trifle vanity suche thinges semeth greate vnto hym whiche halfe blind lorde quencheth smokyng flaxeafter putte handes agayne vpon iyes forsaketh hath halfe syght vntill seperfitly dyd eftsones put handes blynd man iyes foorthwith began haue clearer sight length attayned suche perfitenesse therof sawe thinges clearely blessed hauing iyes harte lightned christe seeth euery thyng plainlye unto hym thynges seame leaste whiche vnto worlde appeare greatest unto hym thynges seme fowle filthye make goodlyest shewe vnto worlde unto hym thynges appeare greatest whiche seme vyle nothyng worth vnto whosoeuer thou art teacher gospell despyse weakenes whiche newe beginner learning phylosophye doctrine gospell firste time ynoughe brought ye towne saye haue departed olde synnes must doctrine gospell straight wayes put foorth preached vnto whereby iyes maye lightened first rudimentes first principle euangelike perfeccion taught vpon professing wherof suche entre christes religion nouices may receiue sacrement baptisme anone muste taught secrete pithy doctrine whiche shall make see perceyue euery thyng clearly thinges shall minister iesus christe doe iesus himselfe wyll vouchesafe touche blynde man iyes hyd secrete vertue maye receyue sight agayne sent hoe houseafter lorde done good dede man retourne home house forbydding hym tell bodye done ofte commaundeth fac e conceled teacheth priestes thereby howe ought seke prayse glorye amonge menne yf haue done thynge well prayse worthy ministracion ghospell agayne tyme commaunde facte publyshed tolde abrode monicion hym healed synnes bothe knoweledge owne filthynes also displa e set goodnes god vnto whome onely debtoure chaunged made newe man nowe retourne owne house nothyng el time hathe receiued grace heauen forget inconuensence shall fall agayne yf preserued thoroughe grace beneficiall goodnes almightye god chaunce retournyng homewarde cum towne say among sinful wycked multitude people whiche rather laughe christes religion scorne beleue christe ought vndiscretelye bable misteries fyrst profession iesus sayde vnto hym goe vnto thy house thou enter towne tell bodye healed one whiche bothe deaffe dumme felowe heard worde ghospell spake redilye nowe hathe healed blynde man notwithstanding sight good perfite yet commaunded kepe sylence amonge vngodly person synners forasmuche cum home thynge selfe shall open myracle suche knewe hym blynde tyme behoueth man professe mysteryes ghospell agayne tyme better concele thesame pand iesus went disciple townes belong itle called cesarea philippi waye asked disciple saying vnto dooe men saye aunswered saye thou art iohn baptiste saye helyas agayne saye thou arte one numbre prophetes sayde vnto whome saye ye peter answereth sayeth vnto thou acte christ charged oulde tell manne began teache howe sonne manne muste suffer many thynges reproued elder hye pristes scribe killed three dayes arise agayne spake sayinge openly peter toke hym asyde began chide hym tourned aboute loked disciple rebuked peter saying go satan thou sauer st thinges god thinges men nowe maketh triall howe muche disciple haue profyted ghostly prouing whether suche thynges done spiritually haue bene wrought corporallye darke fygures therefore departed bethsaida went company sayd disciple ye litle tounes belonging citie cesarea surnamed philippi wente waie asked people supposed hym nowe manye myracles wroughte euen common sorte ought haue conceyued maruaylous great opynion hym iesus ignoraunt common opynion hym intente purpose shewe v whiche true euangelike faith saueth faithfull howe muche di ereth inconstante variable opinion common people saythe men saye disciple answered plainly hearde men suppose thou art iohn baptist relyued take helye thesbite whose coming promysed malachy prophete agayne whoe thinke thou art heliewhom doe men saye ye olde prophetes risen againe death lyfe opinion men greatest opinion themselues men could suppose nothing aboue state condicion man supposed hym man great excellencie yet beleued howe messias sonne god sauiour worlde yet rudiment first principle suche euangelyke christen profession mystery wherof yet disclosed common sorte discouered man saued saue whiche beleueth iesu authour originall cause healthe saluacion well ye euangelike saluacion sure belefe iesus christ sonne god inspired v heauenly inspiracio wryng belefe apostle sayd comon people perceyue wauering theyr fayth hauing constant opinion yet haue greater opinion sayed nothing el carpentours sonne said furious madde sought thentent haue bounden cheinesbut say ye suche sayd spirite beelzebub say household familiar acquaintaunce haue bene alwayes witness euer haue done taught saye peter chiefe professoure ghospell made answere name sayde thou arte selfe messias long agoe promised prophetes sonne lyuing god onely halthe saluacion promysed vnto world lord greatly allowed open cofession inspired god geuen thereunto worthy testimony blysfulnesse pronounced foundacion churche euangelike citie whiche puissaunce deuell shoulde euer able shake charged theym strayghtly shoulde wyse discouer knewe thinspiracion father time cum behoued people awaite messias beleue shortely cum howbeit yet expedient knowe iesus messias thus necessary one instruccion glory spring base humble estate disciple humain affeccio abhorred displeasure theyr maister muche desyrous haue hym greatly estemed taken ioly felowe euery body pleased euerlasting wisedom obserue order therfore iesus began teache suffer would haue greatnesse excellencie knowen vnto worlde sonne manne sayed whome haue conceiued hyghe opinion muste suffer great reproche many paynes tormentes condemned felon scribe priestes head men people conclusion putte shamefull deathe euyll doer somuche among wordly men possible manne counted vile abiecte desperate cause ye shoulde despayre kepe stedfastly mynde youre confession whiche ye haue made haue persecuted deathe wyll ryse alyue agayne thyrde daye nowe sumwhat darkely monyshed premiss present spake mynde playnly appered coulde nowe awaye suche communycacyon sith geuen noble verdicte sentence theyr maister coulde yet abyde heare mencion death although shoulde thoroughe hope resurrection haue taken comforte agayne loue wherwith enbraced iesu great yet thesame worldely loue humayne affection yet receyued holye ghoste whiche make perfyte whatsoeuer vnperfyteand peter oke hym syde c wherfore peter hearde suche fell cruell wordes condemning tourmentinge sleing afearde take iesus asyde thoughe would secretly monyshe hym thinge whyche shoulde weale profyte forsoth man wisdome whiche oft e studieth go wysdome god yea bolde rebuke lorde thoughe bene well aduised woulde dye sith might auoyde deth albeit beleued woulde aliue agayne ye third day yet thought muche better hym dye deathe reliue le de tache peter althoughe proceded certayne harty loue towardes iesus yet dyd christe openly sharply reproue thentente shoulde learne thynges obediently folowe wyl god fonde iudgement go determinacions man parte take iesu aside rebuke hym feare leste doe hath determyned doe ought reuerently beseche hym wyll vouchesafe take lead v whyther soeuer please hym therefore woulde clea e wede theyr myndes naughty affeccion fyrste tourned peter disciple beholdyng whome knewe right well dyd dissente opinion theyr spokesman though bolder presumptuous reste afearde speake mynde rebuked peter agayne rebuked saying lettest thou satan worde syrian tongue signifieth aduersary saye doeste thou art disciple assaye goe thy mayster thou art man attempt go god folowe rather behynd man busines whiche hande thyne affeccion loue yet wordely affeccion neyther sauerest thou thynges whiche god thou wylte disciple becommeth folow deathe wise hinder alone albeit chiefely thee whoe haue specially chose also ye professe themselues disciple p called people vnto hym disciple also sayed vnto whosoeuer folowe let forsake hymself take vp crosse folowe whosoeuer wyll saue lyfe shall lose whosoeuer shall lose life sake ghospels shall saue shall profite man wynne worlde lose owne soule shall man geue redeme soule withall agayne whosoeuer therfore shall ashamed wordes aduourteous synfull generacion hym also shall sonne man ashamed cummeth glory hys father holy angel iesus thus spoken commaunded whole multitude present disciple leste suppose wordes pertayned onely specially chosen person nowe together iesus spake vnto audible voyce wyse many folowe rather feete imitacion lyfe neither men come one cause purpose enticed hither noueltie straungenes miracle desire bodely health greate desyre heare doctrine whoso wil true folower yf intend associate blisse glory let thesame meane tyme dispose hymselfe felowe partener sufferyng affliccions death let hym vtterly renye himselfe reseruing nothing vnto himselfe thys worlde cleane renouncyng thynges euen contempt lyfe finally let euery man take vp crosse folowe let disciple ashamed folowe teacher seruaunt folowe maister neyther let intende come glory way meane whiche shall se goe thither hym whoso thynketh hath himselfe wherby able attayne saluacion shall perish contraryly whoso distrustyng owne aydes wholly putteth himselfe mercy shall saued inough sake lytell passe vpon landes tenementes parentes wife child lyfe selfe preseruacion whereof manne forgoeth euer hathe must likewyse forsaken ye good comforte neuer perysheth whiche geuen rather ye shall preserue losyng whiche shoulde otherwyse lose dede euill kepyng faythe gospell men geuen lyfe euerlastyng therfore setteth thys present lyfe grace ghospell althoughe seme tyme wynne thesame yet doeth dede lose manne prolong lyfe beyonde tyme appoynted albeit saye truthe neyther meane tyme deathe liueth manne dede excepte liue well vertuously lyfe whiche men short transytory shalbe condemned euerlasting deathe nowe whoso sake stedfast professour gospell putteth life hasarde death shall preserue whiche el verely peryshe therfore yf nothyng dearely beloued manne worlde wyll content raunsome temporall life losse thereof debatyng matter selfe wyse shall auayle haue house landes goodes precious stone wyfe chyldre preserued yf selfe peryshe shall enioye owner though thinges safety yet perishe ward yf fortune dye thing dearely beloued muche set man yt contemned preseruacio lyfe one woulde offer another great rich treasure euer mydas cresus beautye absolone monarchy empyre whole world fynally sortes kyndes pleasure therewith say take thynges dye woulde thother byanby refuse offre made hym suche condicion answere agayne loue lyfe alone better thynges sythe saye euery manne doethe wysely consyder thynges selfe ofte imminet daunger bodely lyfe earenestly loke vpon examyne waye matter whensoeuer concerneth lyfe inestemable nowe euerlasting lyfe profered vnto thy soule wilte thou exchaunge therfore shorte wretched life body especially sithe euery manne shall another daye receiue owne body agayne restored blessed life men must necessitie dye profession ghospel yet euery manne ought ready wyll mynde doe intent yf case requyre maye passe nothyng vpon corporall life lyfe soule may saued whensoeuer storme persecucion aryseth must crosse taken vp albeit neither euen thynges quyet persecucion ceaseth shall manne without crosse vnlesse counted easy thing renounce naturall affection al worldly pleasure inticemetes cut inordinate lustes flesh brydle excesse represse sensualytye pleasure bodye subdue hastines lette passe reuengemente thynges also muste euery manne doe wyll disciple euen tyme worlde moste quiet without busynes trueth worlde shall maner engynes ryse agaynste whiche professe name threten reproche banyshement imprisonment tormentes attayndour deathe naughtye nacyon shall euer haue moe reprouable naughty disposed persones good menne among shall counted greatest offence maye professe name manne worlde thus set bent wyll ashamed confesse disciple vngracious conterfeite nacion shorte afflyction foloweth euerlastyng blysfulnes hym sonne man wyll requyte lykewyse ashamed take hym hys disciple shall eftsones cum lowe contemned wonderfull merueylous royaltye glory father accompanyed fewe poore disciple enuironed innumerable companyes holy aungels ix chapter pand sayde vnto verely saye vnto among stande whiche shall taste death tyll haue sene kyngdome god power shall partaker glory wyll nowe suffre infamy crosse iewes loked merueilous kyngdome child israel supposed begyn assone messias come therfore coulde beleue iesus messias came poorely lyke outcaste worlde muche wer offended mencion passion death vnderstode wer two cuminges messias ye fyrst estimation world lowe reprochfull another full maiestie glorye shalbe ende worlde thenten may ioyne vnto whole body deliuered euils glory father throwe downe sathan membres fyre hell woulde daye latter cumming vncertainne menne yet woulde haue euery man readynes againste therfore forasmuche among people whiche inward imaginacion sayde thus selues shall tyme glory cum promiseth peraduenture many beleued euer cum iesus stablished wauering myndes suche wordes ensue ye ryght well assured thyng told sonne manne whome ye nowe see humble lowe shortly shall see abiect shall appeare father maiestie holy angel chosen disciple neyther tyme farre companiethere certayne among de c whoe euer dye shall perceiue kyngdome god already come power therfore let euery man make himselfe redy thentent maye founde worthy kyngdome wordes lorde spake apostle themselues vnderstode double vnderstanding death resurreccion ascencion sending doune holy ghoste heauen vertue corne musterdsede saye euangelike doctrine began shewe putte furthe selfe pand sixe dayes iesus taketh peter iames iohn leadeth vp hye mountayne cut waye alone transfygured rayment dyd shyne became whyte euen snowe whyte fuller make vpon yearthe appered vnto hely moyses talked iesus peter answered sayd iesu mayster good beinge v let v make also three tabernacle one thee one moyses one helyas wyste sayd afrayde cloude shadowed voyce came cloude saying beloued sonne heare hym sodaynly loked rounde aboute sawe man iesus onely nowe disciple put doubtes woulde perfourme promysed concerning maiestie second comming pleasure geue taste thereof death farfurthe mannes nature able receiue awaie withall wherfore syxe dayes iesus toke vnto three twelue specially chosen disciple chiefe worthyest person vnto pleasure shewe fight thei woulde make wordes thereof tyll time come thei might lawfully disclose peter iames iohn onely toke awaye highe mountaine thei muste farre carefulnes lowe yearthly thinges whome iesu vouchesafeth shewe suche syght vnto dayneth euen day geue secrete inspiracion vnto certaine elect persones enhauced mountaine pure contemplacion taste syght euerlasting blissefulnes people whiche abyde benethe plaine knowe nothing therof manne tell beleue lorde disciple come toppe mountaine fyrst fell theyr pray r prayer thynge whiche chiefly prepareth iyes heart maketh meete beholde suche sight loe iesus prayer shape body sodaynly chaungedand transfigured c face whiche semed diffre common physnamy shone bright sunne clothes glister whytenes surmountyng whytenes snowe suche fuller crafte make like vpon clothe neyther iesus sene thus alone hym hely moyses talkyng together moyses office talke god rede howe hely taken vp caryed heauen fyery charyotand appeared vnto hely wt moyses doubtles theyr communicacion iesu signifieth agrement lawe prophetes lawe shadowed drewe christe misticall fygures prophetes shewed theyr prophecy howe christe shoulde come suche one lyke poyntes iesus came yet iewes woulde beleue matter wherupon talked gloryous death departing whyche shoulde shorte space fulfill ierusalem vpon crosse mencion deathe dyd lykewise assuage excedynge greate pleasure wherof man mynde wyse receyuable peter raui hed vnspeakable syghtand peter answered c therfore well able rule affectes brake theyr communicacion begonne deathe saying maister speake nomore ierusalem good beinge v therefore lette v make iii tabernacle place one thee another moyses thyrde hely wordes peter partly proceded feare death whiche depely soncken minde partly great pleasure beholdyng sight wherewith dronken lyke man besyde hymselfe rauyshed wyttes wyst sayde great feare wherewith mortall menne yet receyuable ye diuine maiestieand cloude shadowed c astonied therfore ouercome passyng great bryghtnes arose cloude whiche ouershadowed tempred vnsufferable light might awaie taste diuine maiestie geuen theyr corporall iyes also somewhat geuen vnto theyr eares sounded cloudes father voyce likewise full maiestie whiche sayde moste dearly beloued sonne geue care vnto hym nowe howe shame dooe iewes present daye speake agaynst christ sith bothe moyses hely whiche greatest authoritie among beare hym wytnesse sith father woulde bee sene deuoutly serue worshyp gaue hys voyceand voice came c whole authoritie onely begotte sonne apostle delighted glory let hym wyll come therunto heare iesu whan exhorteth imitacion crosse peter doe thou henceforthe rebuke thy lord doe thou go god determinacio thou heardest father voyce said heare dearely beloued sonne say hitherto haue heard moyses prophetes prophecying christ haue nowe played theyr partes alredie cum promysed hereafter geue eare vnto suche promise thinges cum heare present speaketh wyll pleasure man shall speake truer thinges whatsoeuer disagreeth wordes vtterly refuse anone voice father hearde thynges sodenly chaunged agayne another shape lykenes loked reude aboute themand sodainly loked rounde c like menne awakened theyr slepe sawe one iote al euer sawe saue alonelye iesus whoe present againe hauing selfe shape wonte haue shewed greatnes onelye cloude able behold would haue done shewed hyghnes maiestie euen dede therfore iesus eftsones humbled himselfe theyr lownes forsakyng toppe mountayne came downe reste disciple multitude remembre thou art preacher ghospell howe muche becumeth humble abase thyselfe capacitie weake whiche wast lyke weake yf thou haue hygh excellent qualitye thee christes none thyne pand came doune hyll charged shoulde tell man thynges sene tyll sonne manne risen deathe againe kepte saying demaunded one another rising fro death againe shoulde meane asked hym saying say scribe helyas muste fyrst cum answered sayd vnto helias verely cometh fyrst restoreth thynges sonne man wrytten hym shall suffre many thynges sette naught saye vnto helyas come haue done vnto hym whatsoeuer would wrytten cummyng doune hyll ere camme multitude lorde iesus forbad three tell bodye hadde sene tyll tyme sonne manne rysen agayn dead heretofore lykewise commaunded holde peace much blase abrode thinges whiche charged disclose iii bycause heard father voyce saying heare hym c commauded kepe secrete se e insomuch disclosed residue apostle time appointed wyste matter meante yet supposed earnest cause iesus woulde haue published vnto people resurreccion knowen good shoulde haue done tellyng abrode made themselues la ghyng stocke vnto faythles woulde haue beleued haue matter dede iesu appeared wyse syth menne shoulde se hym sone putte muche shame villany conclusion suffer death vpon crosse disciple whoe durst hearde father voyce distruste wordes iesu vnderstandyng meante wordes ensuing sonne manne shall ryse death c fell reasoning matter among themselues supposed verely inco tinent resurreccion glory kyngdome shoulde begynne whereof nowe taken saye howbeit certaine scruple doubt whiche made muche death hande whiche ofte tymes warned promisyng would relyue thyrd daye thesame learned prophecy malachy howe hely come great daye lorde coulde assoyle doubte among themselues moued question iesus lord say thou hast perfourmed thy promise haue seene brightenes kyngdome godand demau ded one another therefore beleue thy resurreccion thou wilt cum semblable likenes suche one thou diddeste whylere appeare vnto syght cause scrybes takyng theyr authoritye prophecy malachy doe saye daye shall come vnlesse hely thes ite come make people readines agaynste cumming therof leste lord smyte al menne cursyng certes hely whome sawe mountayne yet come neyther yet anye thynge done hym therefore eyther kyngdome god shall come byanby thy resurreccion el sence meanyng prophecy scribe doe teache unto question discipleshe answered sayde vnto lorde iesus made doubtfull aunswere yet receyuable whole mystery hereof abhorryng thynges whiche pertayned greate deale vnto theyr saluacion dreamed onely vpon glorye kyngdome whereof taken taste perceyuinge howe also kyngdome god holy ghoste ghospell beeing sprede abrode euery preached subduethe puissaunce bothe worlde also oure ghostlye enemy deuyll kyngdome beganne appeare tyme lame walked blynde sawe dumme spake leper clensed deuils caste nowe whan kyngdome shoulde come whereof litle taken taste lord would haue knowe yet thintente pacyentely take deathe loued measure suffred dreame whyle bryghtnes kyngdome shoulde shortelye cumme whereof saye geuen mountayne therefore temperethe hys answere discretelye approueth prophecye yet dothe altogether condemne interpretacyon scrybes reproueth theyr vngodlye argumentacyon wherby concluded kyngdome god yet come helyhelyas verely commeth fyrst restoreth c whiche promysed long agoe prophete malachy appeared worlde nowe spyrytuall kingedome god whiche thynge proude scrybes phariseis vnderstode began come nowe hely mysticall vnderstandynge alredy come therefore iesus sayde bothe whiche malachy prophecyed hely also whiche prophetes spake sonne man shal come doubtles reade hely shall come great dreadfull daye lorde tourne harte father theyr chyldren heartes chyldren theyr father thentent yonger sorte posteritie maye perceyue howe already come perfourmed whiche theyr forefather elder awayted therefore hely goynge restore thynges amendethe whatsoeuer right leste lorde come great mischief vengeaunce men fynde vnpreparedand ye sone man written hym c like prophecie malachy speakyng hely forecurrour true euen prophecy prophetes like true whiche foretell howe shall cumme passe sonne manne euer shewe hys maiestie shall suffer many thynges shalbe sette naught mocked conclusion putte death yea saye truthe whatsoeuer prophecied hely cumme already accomplished fulfylled whiche thing beyng yet vnknowen vnto scribe phariseisbut saye vnto helias cumme disclose vnto deare frendes hely already cumme whoe shewed kyngdome god present moued menne repentaunt theyr former lyfe yet notwithstanding whiche boaste crake vpon perfite knowledge prophecy knewe whiche loued better theyr owne kyngdome kyngdome god delte deserued lyked camme accordyng prophecy esaye malachy cry wildernesse great terrible daye lorde present howe axe alredy put rote tree euery manne shoulde spedely endeuour selfe auoyde vengeaunce god cumming hely openly without regarde person rebuked euery mannes vice despised put deathe neyther wyll gently entreate messias haue done forecurroure hereby iesus declared howe iohn hely body similitude spirite whyles neyther spared kynges ne phariseis caste prison beheaded dyd forewalker wyll doe lorde thyng wyll lykewyse doe apostle shall folowe hym whosoeuer hath sincerely preached goddes kyngdome cumme thesame hath suffred many affliccions vngodly whoso syncerely preacheth already come must nedes suffre lyke wordes iesus called backe disciple fro ye dreame glorye remembrauce storme cum hanged ouer theyr heades saye pleasaunt thynges necessarye pand came disciple sawe much people scrybes disputyng ayghtwaye people beheld hym amased ran e saluted hym asked scry e dispute ye among one company aunswered sayed mayster haue brought vnto sonne hath dumme spirite whensoeuer taketh hym teareth hym e someth gnasheth teethe pyneth awaye spake thy disciple caste hym could meane whyle thus commoned together come sight people seaso great multitude gathered disciple whome iesus left beneath playne sawe also scribe reasonyng ye mattier wot wherupon disciple people espyed iesus vnloked theyr behalfe forasmuch preuely conueyed himselfe awaye fewe disciple astonyed met cummyng full whole saluted hym iesus ignoraunt scribe disputed yet asked mattier vpon reasoned thentent euery
