body might knowe doneand c ye disciple scribe helde peace shame disciple assayed cast oute diuell coulde bryng passe presence disciple depraued name iesu thyng vertulesse efficacie one multitude ministred occasion asoning shewed whole matier euen vnto iesu mayster sayeth brought hither sonne vnto thee vexed dumme spirite whome pitifully tourmented whensoeuer spirite teketh hym dasheth hym agaynste grounde childe fometh mouth gnasheth teeth cryeth whyle pyneth consumeth awaye reason thus vexed thou wast desyred thy disciple would chase awaye spirite deliuer sonne assayed doe coulde phe answereth sayeth faythles na ion howe longe shal howe long shal suffer bryng vnto brought vnto assone spirite sawe ta e fell downe grounde walowinge fominge askethe father howe longe ago sence happened saye childe oftetymes hath caste fier water destroye yf thou canst thing haue mercy vpon v helpe v iesus sayed vnto yf thou couldest beleue thinges possible beleueth strayght waye father childe cryed teares saying lorde beleue helpe thou vnbelefe lorde heard shewe feblenes fayth verye cause yonge man delyuered spirite makynge thoughe wrothe fume sayed faythlesse nacion whiche yet canst many miracle haue done brought belefe howe longe shall lyuynge earth striue vnfaythfull obstaclenesse howe long shall beare wyll come forwarde thynges spirite wyll beleue thynges see syth beleue thynges whiche see corporall yes bryng hym hyther brought hym vnto hym sinne cleaueth fast wherunto synner hath chyldehood accustomed brought vnto iesus wurse vexed reason conflicte arose betwene spirite desirous amende sensualitie tollyng alluryng hym agayne accustomed synfull lyuyng anon fiende sawe iesus feelyng contrarye power tooke younge manne soore vexed hym insomuche beeyng dashed agaynste grounde rolled fro fomed mouth pitifull syght people muche pitifull syght sinner possessed greuous su e long continuaunce lykewyse vexed soule howbeit synne vncurable vnto iesu lorde shoulde also knowe howe euyll case asked father howe long since sonne fyrste beganne bee thus vexed answered againe infante spirite doth onely sayeth thus vexe hym thou seest also casteth hym oftetymes headlong fyre many tymes water destroy hym thou hearest sore cruel malady tourned naturebut thou canst thing c therfore father feared leste vncurable sayed moreouer yf ou bee able doe thyng haue mercye v helpe v dyd well desyre mercy iesu could alleage merites howbeit thou hearest waueryng faythe sayeth yf thou bee able doe thyng c faythe iesus refourmeth saying doubte thou able doe yf thou couldest beleue nothyng strong stedfast fayth may obteyne assone iesu sayed father better hope comforte declaring great desyre minde teares weping sayed beleue lorde yf belefe vnperfite healpe thou weakenesse pwhen iesus sawe people came unnyng together vnto rebuked soule spirite saying vnto hym thou dumme deafe spirite charge cum oute enter hym spirite cryed rent hym soore came hym one bee deade somuche many saied deade iesus caught hande lift vp rose cum house disciple asked secretly could caste saied vnto kynde cum forth nothyng prayer fastyng meane season people came runnyng together euery syde see sight iesus sawe come wyll haue bee witness miracle putte furthe almyghtie voyce wherwith calletth life pleaseth euen dead threatned foule spirite handle hym accordyngly vnlesse would incontinente departe saying thou deafe dumme spirite charge gette man thou neuer henceforthe enter iesus fume spirite may shewe mercye vpon man geuyng v lesson ought doe healyng sinner man must rebuke vice may seme loue soule health person knowe man laboureth speaketh vayne vnlesse iesus speake hym secrete vertue power disciple commaunded spirite go vayne iesus awaye awaye oft fayth colde wauering fayth wyll obtayne thynges doen emperious voyce iesu spirite went entent appeare wente agaynste wyll cryed vexed sely wretche sore departure nowe laye vpon grounde dead somuche many sayed dead dede thou seest figure penitet person turneth great accustomed synnes amendemente nowe hathe hatred synne delyuered hym synne howbeit next doore despera ion whoso knowleageth owne filthinesse also hath god iustice remembraunce yet lyeth happily deade deade synne remaineth nothyng elles begyn lyue agayne righteousenesse benefyte geueth also bounteous sauioure iesus without whome safetie caught felowe hande lifted hym vp laye traunce furthwith seemed deade recouered hys former strengthe throughe benefite christe rose vp stronge lustie vnlesse iesu nowe geuen hym newe grace leade godlye lyfe purpose deliuered dyuell contemplacion father fayth nowe heareth deafe manne whiche eares stopped worldely lustes agaynst doctryne woorde gospell nowe speaketh dumme felowe tongue tyed speachelesse reaso passion wilfull pangues fleshe nowe rest quiet styred wt furious rage sumtime sensualitie pleasure body sumtime ambicion desire worldly aduaucemet others while wrath nowe enuy nowe couetousnesse rauished caryed constraynte sum vncleane violente spiri e thinges saw apostle saied nere worde durst interupt lorde scribe also helde peace assured thing selfe howe reason name iesu vneffectuall vertulesse felowe sooner ryd spirite weakenes fayth chaunced vnto yonge manne bodely chaunced pharise spiritually healed sinnes bicause beleued woorde onelye v rtue wherof mighte haue healed iesus cum house disciple beyng alone asked cause could cast deuyl syth afore cast many name disquieted mynde certayne humayne carefulnes leste vnwares offended lorde meanes loste power whiche gaue worke miracle iesus wont take awaye agayne hath geuen encreace yet wyll haue gyftes negligently kepte rechelesse sor e nowe hath sufficiently declared father hym healed weaknesse fayth impediment deuyl wente forthe whiche faythe yet strong disciple ought congruence haue iesus saye aunswered certayne speciall kinde dyuels coulde otherwyse expelled praier fastyng two engynes moste force agaynst wicked spirites prayer strength fayth renued quickned chaunced vnto yonge mannes father sayed lorde helpe vnbeliefe fasting bycause contayneth certaine forbeatyng carnall pleasure rebellion fleshe subdued muste haue cleane spirite himselfe whoso goeth caste vncleane spirites iesus thre disciple newly retourned prayer reste kepte compaynie multitude dyd neyther faste ne praye cause able ynoughe caste dyuell whiche faste holde familiar trust selues encreaseth v power worke miracle decreaseth power fleshe mortified v stronger holy goste whose onely power soule spirites expelled muste therfore ofte tymes praye strength fayth may v encreased muste also mortifie fleshe continually thentent spirite iesu christe may liue v shorte christe doethe nowe prepare disciple againste houre shall commaunded watche praye leste fal temptacion toke nappe supper weake fleshe vpper hande pand departed thence toke iourney thorow galile would man know taught disciple sayed vnto sonne man shalbe deliuered handes men shal kil hym kylled shal arise agayne thyrd daye wyst sayed af ayed aske came capernaum cum house asked ye disputed among youre selues waye held theyr peace waye reasoned amonges themselues shoulde chiefest set downe called twelue hym sayed vnto yf desire firste shalbe laste seruaunt toke chylde set myddes taken hym armes sayed vnto whosoeuer receiueth suche chylde name receiueth who euer receiueth receiueth ut thinges doen maner rehearsed iesus beyng accompaignied disciple began take iourney iewrywarde pryuily stealth passed countreye galile feared death whiche dede moste feruentlye desyred lefte haue semed prouoke priestes phariseis cospyre death tyme appointed outwarde apperaunce feare shewed would cleane delyuer disciple feare also declare weakenesse frayltie nature whiche taken vpon hym went waye repeted vnto thesame thing whyche diuerse tymes hearde hym speake sayed foloweth must nedes cum passe whiche haue oft tymes told sonne man shalbe delyuered handes men taken condemned mocked scourged slayne must make selues readye mynde cumming thinges whiche vndoubtedly hande vnpossible doe vnlesse thesame free worldly affeccions also stablished strength spirite knowe mingyng death troubleth sore must good comforte take mennes harte vnto wyll long forsake aliue agayne thirde daye disciple dull feble wytted vnderstoode wordes withstandyng plainly spoken supposyng sum darke mysterie came theyr remembraunce sumtymes deceiued suche figuratiue manour speakynges commaunded beware phariseis leuen neither could yet conceiue mynde misterye crosse gesse purpose would slayne yf would soone death relyue agayne syth canne relyue hym luste also yf please hym dye therfore albeit greatly offended woordes yet durste aske hym questionand wet af ayed aske c feared sample peter displeasure questioned lord herein heard christe say vnto hym go satan yet sauoured worlde goddes determinacion reconciled mankynde pardoned offence thorowe fayth sacrifice vnspotted lambe disciple dreamed vpon certaine worldly kingdom therfore trauayled waye fell reasoning among themselues shoulde haue prem nence vpper hande kyngdome god whiche hoped shortly begyn sawe litle howe three disciple preferred afore reste goynge vp mountayne sawe howe peter preeminence keyes kyngdome heauen deliuered yet sum theym auncientes yea besydes kynne vnto lordeand cam capernaum c cum capernaum lorde asked aparte matier whereupon reasoned secretlye betwene themselues went way holding theyr peace ashamed make hym aunswere knewe well authour modestie humblenesse mynde would disalowe theyr ambiciousnesse iesus woulde cleane wede oute theyr myndes moste damnable naughtie affeccion sate downe one woulde teache sum earneste mattier authoritie commaunded theym twelue cum vnto hym sayed desyre fyrst chief man kyngdom heauen shalbe laste seruaut far wyde kyngdome heauen ought estemed worldly kyngdome anon woulde depelye fasten doctrine myndes called vnto hym litle childe sette hym myddes embraced hym signifying therby howe muche defyed proude person loued suche humble meke spirite sayd vnto see lytle babe abiect vile estimacion worlde yet suche humblenesse minde simplicitie godly lyuing age doe set moste store reason wyl loue best whiche lykest vnto selfe prerogatiue estemed rich reuenues power statelynesse violence suche haue thinges moste resemble heathen prince euen highliest estemed thesame lyke earthly kynges beleue eyther honoured dishonoured theyr great estate euangelike kyngdome thinke selfe eyther honoured dishonoured suche lytle babe whome worlde setteth naught innocencie simplicitie humblenesse minde know humble low hym counte ye chiefe manne kyngdome heauen yf ye fynde none take soueraigne euery man moste resembleth con mning thinges whiche great men sue prince courtes iudge hym moste soueraigne persone therfore whoso receyueth one suche litle babe name receiueth reioyseth receyued loue lyke agayne whoso receyueth beyng lowest men estimacion worlde receyueth hym sent maister honoured dishonoured scholers father lykewyse dishonoured honoured sonne wordes iesu toke awaye authoritie suche prelate haue charge ouersyght lordes flocke plucked disciple myndes desyre worldly auauncement lownesse sorte lytle one estemed quantitie strength bodie humblenesse suche mynde claymeth nothyng worlde highe trusteth anywhit owne strength syncere fayth hangeth vpon christe iohn aunswered hym saying maister sawe one cast deuels thy name foloweth v forbad foloweth v iesus sayed forbyd man whiche yf doe miracle name lyghtlye speake euil v parte whosoeuer shall name geue cuppe water drinke ye belong christ verely say vnto shall leese rewarde occasion wordes arose doubt among disciple whiche iohn propouned wyse mayster thou sentest v preache kyngdome god sawe certaine felowe caste diuels thy name yet thesame neyther numbre twelue seuentie whome thou dyddest afterwarde chose sende none disciple whiche folowe v wherfore hym one secte none thy felowship forbad whether dyd well wot iesus answered forbyd ye none suche wyse good sprede abrode preache ghospell must disdainfull receyuing whiche goe aboute endeuoure soeuer auaunce worde god must consydre whether folowe disciple whether preache name cast diuells callyng vpon name cannot lyghtelye speake yuell yf doe thing selfe reproue shall said vnto hym howe darest thou shame backbyte name whiche thou hast proued mightie effectuall working miracle therfore ye vpon light occasion suppose worke naughtie purpose whoso doeth godly dede resisteth ghospell poynte furthereth aydeth whiche take part whosoeuer againste maketh newe doctrine must beeset forth whensoeuer occasion serueth synceritie mynde promoted mattier preacher doe manour meanes busynesse whiche goe onely shall rewarded furtheryng gospell whiche shall caste diuels name also according theyr abylitie put theyr helpyng handes neuer litle aduauncyng therof whoso wyll geue euen cuppe colde water name say respect ye disciple doe busynesse right well assured thesame shall lacke rewarde pand whosoeuer shall offende one litle one beleue better yf mylstone hanged necke caste sea wherfore yf thy hand hinder cut better enter lyfe maymed hauing two handes go hell fyre neuer shalbe quenched theyr worme dyeth fyre goeth yf thy fo te hyndraunce cut better go hal e lyfe hauyng two feete cast hell fyre neuer shalbe quenched theyr worme dieth fyre goeth yf thyne ye hinder plucke better goe kingdome god one iye hauing two iyes caste hell fyre worm dieth fyre goeth againe shall chaunce let whome ghospell aduauced truly aduaunced world counteth great litle one simple person vnderlinges men reputacion anye say offend litle one haue reposed theyr affiaunte true shall auoyde punishment shoulde muche eassier punished mylstone tyed vnto necke cast sea prince world cruelly punishe suche let theyr deputy put thynges execucion whiche haue commaunded done hange ieobet also many tymes quarter cast downe headlyng sum high rocke el drowne sea stone tyed vnto cumming vp agayne true haue theyr great men offended vse minister tyrannie say oppresse people god wyll muche greuouslyer punishe suche let litle one would haue handelyng thaffayres heauenlye kyngdom mennes saluacion cannot put theyr kynges commaundementes execucion albeit shall seeme tyme doe vnpunished yet leangth shall escape punishment hell tyrauntes worlde could inuent kynde deathe comparable punyshemente whereby bothe bodye soule shall seme dye continuall tourmentes yet neuer dye therefore studye howe reuenged doe businesse god shall punishe let nowe aryse anye lette impedimente persecutoure theyr behalfe whiche appeare frendes oughte nothynge deare vnto youwherfore yf thy hand hynder thee c loue therof maye cause leaue ministracion gospell admitte thy ryghte hande saye thy father verye nere frende whome thou canste spare put case thy ryghte eye wete thy welbeloued wyfe swete child admitte thy foote saye thy seruaunt factour whose seruice thou canst lacke thexploiture suche affaire thou hast doe worlde cut thy hande plucke thyne iye chop thy foote hyndreth thee doe busynesse ghospell thou canste brynge euangelike saluacion thy father thy mother thy brother thy systers doe yf tender affeccion thou bearest towardes withdrawe ministracion ghospell againe shoulde come passe while refuse saued thee thou shouldest also perishe damned cast awaye naturall affeccion let charitie gospell ouercumme charitie mane doe thesame thing perill thy sowle thou woldest doe ieoperdie thy bodie thou suche exigent thou shouldest eyther slayne el thy life saued losse thy hande thou wouldest sticke case choppe thy hand losse one membre neuer necessarie redeme thy lyfe thyng wished attayne saluacion thy parentes frendes ghospell brought passe muche better forsake thy parentes doe onely refuse saued themselues also goe bring thee lyke confusion enter lyfe euerlasting man would say maymed thy sayd parentes frendes cast hell saye fyre whiche neuer quenched worme repentaunce gnaweth conscience wretched creature dieth liue onely theyr tourmente payne fyre wherwith damned soules tourmented neuer put shall bothe thy parentes thou repent late vayne thou thou folowedst theyr vnlawfull affeccions thine owne damnacion would aduertised thou exhortedst saluacion neither shall calamitie helpe thy torment thing release diminishe theyr payne moreouer damnacion parent would saued shall layed vnto charge hastened doe busynesse gospell lykewyse manour cut thy foote consydering thy selfe better cume halt lame lyfe euerlasting whole feete throwen hell neyther fyre canne quenched worme dyeth nothyng dearer man iyeand thy foote hinderaunce c nothyng pleasaunte wyfe chyldren thou brought strayte eyther thou must nedes theyr pleasure forsake ghospell damned el forsake whome touchyng worldly affeccion nothyng deare vnto case stycke plucke thyne iye caste awaye reckening muche better enter one iye kyngdome heauen lyfe eternall haue thyne iyes whole throwen fyre hell lette wepyng waylyng thy wyfe swete wordes thy child whit moue fooles wepe forsaken sith myght haue folowed would worldly affeccions muste set aside goddes commaundement compelleth loss corporall thinges ought counted gaynes whensoeuer euerlasting lyfe purchased delicate pleasaunt thing professe name persecucions worldlye affliccions shall arise euery syde maie withdraw purpose suche take hand ministracion gospell muste vanquishe thynges mete ministre preacher euangelike doctrine muste wholely yelde selfe god thentent maye wise neyther feare persecucion reason corrupted enticementes fleshely appetite swarue pure veritie god worde gospell peuery man shall salted fyre euery sacrifice shall seasoned salte salte good salte vnsauery shall ye season therewith haue salte selues haue peace among selues one sacrifice lawe moyses lawfull saue alonely whiche salted eyther fyre salte el euen whosoeuer professe phylosophie doctrine ghospell muste nedes pourged fyre worldly affeccions also poudred salte maye wyse corrupted infeccion contagiousnesse yuell menne worldly wysdom vertulesse vnsauoury neyther preserueth hath worldlye corrupcion yet force preserue nowe must teacher gospell doo saye bothe fynde meanes without corrupcion hymselfe also take awaye thesame canne neither done phylosophers wisedome phariseis doctrine vertue euangelike philosophie whiche tartenesse truth byteth awaye consumeth thing soeuer man daunger corrupcion thyng doeth also fyre spirite god whiche lykewyse consumeth carnall affeccions purgeth men soules therof yea manour transformeth god thing soeuer hathe caught muche whoe tyme entangled care worldlye vanity nowe thesame vtterly contemned together rauished lone desyre heauenly thynges whoso seasoned salte manour inticementes corrupted fall puritie spirite ghospell pourged fyre despyse whatsoeuer persecutoure threaten withall nothing better fyre yf man vse aright nothyng profitable saltesalt good c yf fyre colde salte made vnsauery vertulesse remaineth season vnsauerie symple people professe spirite gospell frayed threateninges menne doe forsake theyr profession feare displeasure feede vpholde theyr flattery folye prince whome theyr dutye boldely rebuke hope remayneth suche professe salte gospell doe heale corrupte affeccions tartenesse truth also fall themselfes theyr parentes frendes pleasure obtaine earthlye vanity hope kyngdome heauen winne hell expouning wrestyng doctrine gospell whiche greatest offence thaffeccions lustes man left season mannes folye sithe thei ought haue seasoner theim selues corrupted thyng also tainted whiche onely left worlde bryng one time amendement haue ye salt seluestherfore thentent maye bothe ouercum cruell persecucions also contemne wordly affeccions gospel sake thentent also maye bothe prouide owne soule healthe bryng many maye saluacion lette eche haue falte gospell lette peace mutuall amitie among salte shall make without corrupcion concorde stronge myghtye whereas variaunces raygne salte gospell vice ambicion neyther peace salte therfore philosopher contencion braule one haue salte cause also phariseis cannot agree saduces herodias corrupted naughtie affeccions lacke salte gospell doctrine shall season folye worlde yf people perceiue nothing affeccions corrupted rotten eyther desyre glorye loue money gredinesse reuengemente feare death desyre lyfe short worldely affeccion also perceyue lyke lyfe doctrine shall agree semblable wise wyll agree one undoubtedly shall agree vtterly abandonyng ambicion wherwith suche persones attached desyre rule play lordes world syncerely preache teache heauenly doctrine whiche haue receiued x chapter pand rose thence went coastes iury regio beyond iordan people resorted vnto hym afreshe wont taught phariseis came asked lawfull man putte away wife proue hym answered said vnto moyses bid sayd moyses suffered write testimoniall diuorcemet putte away iesus answered said vnto hardenesse harte wrote precepte vnto first creacio god made man woman therfore shall man leaue father mother abide wyfe twayne shall one fleshe twayne one fleshe therfore god hath coupled together let man separate howse disciple asked agayn matter sayeth vnto whosoeuer putteth away wife marieth breaketh wedlock ward woman forsake housband maried committeth aduoutrie lord iesus lesson sufficietly prepared mindes disciple ye storme hand departed oute galile went parte iewry lyeth beyond iordan wheras iohn first taught iesus much renoumed place could hid therfore anon cummen people came flocking hither like manour wot doe place neyther tyme wery men good curyng theyr bodyes enstructing theyr sowles lacked phariseis euery one manour menne like themselfes multitude sought health desyrous heare doctrine desired take hym trip healed proue rather learne while coloured maliciousnesse visure holynesse cloked theyr disceitfulnesse pretensed desire learne oh wisdom vnapte receiue doctrine came iesus bodie whome farre mynde put forthe vnto hym captious question saying thyne opinion maisteris law ful put awaye wyfe c lofull husbande forsake wife captiouse question deuised among themselfes trusting thend would answering therunto shoulde driuen graunt eyther one inconuenience pronounced blessed gelded themselfes kingdom god therfore fauourer chastitie giuen sentence bene leful man cast wife mary new iewes vsed communely doe haue semed haue taught cotrary doctrine againe yf answered bene wise lefull doe would haue layed howe made law none authoritie whiche geueth husband libertie put away wife lord would take crafty felowes theyr owne craftinesse prepared snare law asked agayne nede aske question synce yourselfes professe ye knowleage lawe comaundement hath moyses giuen touching matiers answered moyses suffered husband yf thing wife yt offended libel diuorcemente geuen vp put awaye mary pleased doe phariseis interprete sufferaunce lawe thoughe men dyd well euery trifling cause woulde diuorced theyr wiues marie agayne vnderstading mind lawe maker whiche might haue perceiued beginning boke genesis iesus therfore sayd vnto themand iesus answered sayd c moyses gaue libertie forsake wyues fauoured diuorcement suffred husbandes doe carnall desyre sensualitie moued vnto would rather permit lesse yuell open wyndowe greuouse enormity would rather suffre vnlawfull separacion manslaughter poysoning detestable murthering wyues knewe hardnesse harte vnto vice thing geuen remeadie lest greater mischiefe shoulde haue ensued paradise nature man fallen wickednessebut first creacio god made c matrimonie instituted yt diuorce made sensuall pleasure husband euer continue betwen man wife neuer dissolued first time god ioyned one one saye man woman betwene whome would haue great loue charitie separacion might chaunce cause saith man shall leaue father mother sticke vnto wyfe bothe shall becum one fleshe conioyned bodie soule lenger two person one thentet maie mutual participacion weale woe betwene wordes plainly declare god pleased diuorce el would disanull fyrst ordinaunce moyses permitting diuorce besydes god prouided seaso ye hardnesse harte supposing aduoutry smaller offence murthering wiues gentle permission moyses please know also cause compelling hym geue libertie therfore god himselfe hath conioyned begynning yt shoulde alwayes continue vndissolued let man parte asunder put awaye hardnesse harte shall nede diuorce shall separacion manne wyfe haue place suche sobre discrete answere iesus defended goddes commaundement yet neyther condened moyses minished prayse chastitie finallye brought himselfe daunger taken phariseis snare rather snarled theyr owne grinne came purposely entrap apostle cumme house alone asked opinion herein plainly condemne diuorcement whosoeuer saith putteth awaye wife marieth committeth aduoutrye herward agayne wyfe forsake husband marye committeth aduoutrie former husbandward mete christen men hard harted neyther awaye theyr wiues condicions wyll faire meanes correct doe amisse euery tryflyng cause conceiue displeasure ymagine theyr death except departe get away iewishe minde whiche disciple must wise haue iewe putteth awaye wife stenche breth blearnes iyes like fautes whereas among christen men one cause onely whiche dissolueth wedlocke breache fayth promise matrimony wife whiche hath letten manne haue vse body nowe longer wife although yet diuorced husbande whiche hath letten woman haue vse body nowe separacion made husbande fyre fyre vnlesse hotte wedlocke wedlocke excepte two made one cannot one fleshe made thre fower pand brought chyldren vnto touche disciple rebuked brought iesus sawe displeased sayth vnto suffer child cum vnto forbid theim suche kyngdome god uerely saye vnto whosoeuer doeth receyue kyngdom god chylde shall enter therin taken vp armes put handes vpon blessed spoken wordes certaine person cum thyther brought vnto yong chldren thentent shoulde lay handes vpon blesse sawe howe disease wer put away vertue touching therfore beleued thesame touching also good holsome sucking chyldren againste manye suche inconueniences weake tender age wonte indaungered disciple supposyng sitting theyr lorde somuche occupied waightier affaire shoulde weryed suche triflyng matter kept awaye child coulde approche hym rebuked suche brought though disquieted importunitie uerilye litle praysed lytle babe vnto themsuffre child cum vnto c therfore perceiued howe would suffer child cum vnto hym theyr remembraunce said suche little one put vnto silence saying suffre ye chyldren cum vnto kepe away touchyng vnto suche belongeth kyngdome heauen haue ensample innocencie simplicitie patarne wherof proude malicious persones must forged newe yf desyre admitted kyngdome heauen let man thinke set naught theyr weakenes symplicitie one thyng assure unlesse man borne agayne wilynesse couetousnes ambicion hatred wrath desyre reuengement enuy put awaye becum suche one minde age shall receyued kyngdome heauen thentent might commend vnto men simple innocencie toke eche armes layed handes vpon euerychone blessed teachyng hereby howe bishop ought disdayne simple vnlearned people neuer bery vnderlinges abiect person estimacion worlde cherish euery halfe til cum forwarde better state perfeccion aboue thinges ought desyre lord iesus vouchesafe laye holy handes vpon suche person blesse vndoubtedly geue vnto little one wilinesse wherby may escape diuels snare geue tongue goddes prayse maye made perfite mouthe infantes suckelinges pand gone forthe waye came one running kneled asked good maister shall maye inherite eternall lyfe iesus sayed vnto hym callest thou good man good one whiche god thou knowest commaundementes breake matrimony kyll steale beate false witnes defraude man honour thy father mother answered sayd vnto maister al haue obserued youth iesus beheld hym fauoured hym sayd vnto hym one thyng thou lackest go thy waye sell thou haste geue poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen cum folow take vp crosse vpon thy shoulder discomforted saying wente awaye mournyng great possession nowe thinges done house gone forthe waye came vnto hym certaine yonge spryngalte bycause childhode commended age shoulde lykewyse called good beginninges thinges hygher perfeccion fell doune feete sayed good maister shall doe purchase eternall lyfe askyng question smelled sumwhat vice wherwith suche attached stande theyr owne conceipt gentle teacher wonte wynke fa te yf meane tollerable great hope lykelyhode age cum forwarde desyreth muche taughte lorde ought praysed thinges hath already done calleth hym goodwhy callest thou good c beleueth nought el man saye man good thing hymself therfore iesus though offended arrogant name saith vnto doest thou call good name farre aboue state condicion man none verily good saue god alone cause arrogat person whoso taketh name vpon hym euen geueth vnto man geueth hym becummeth hym proheme iesus discouraged yong man whiche owne conceipt thought himselfe muche vnworthye haue goodly title name geuen hym forthwith asked question knowest thou commaundementes hym demaunding answered recityng common commaundementes folowyng keping wherof iewes chalenged praise goodnes iustice thou shalt commit aduoutry thou shalt kyll thou shalt steale thou shalt beare false witnesse thou shalt begile thy nighbour honour thy father thy mother yong man hopyng haue bene greatly commended answered agayn glad ioyfull hart maister haue euer kept since litle child iesus beholding great towardnes cloked matter dyd phariseis naughty mind proude stomacke stand owne conceipt iesus say signified yt delited euen thonely endeuour age therfore made semblat godly affeccio albeit vnperfit dyd neuertheles highly please hym embraced ye great li elihode espyed hym profit cum forward ye doctrine ye gospel age seldo applyeth godly lyuing ye study therof right comedable ye teaching v hereby g wise ouer sharply rebuke yong folkes see inclinatio theuagelike christe godlines meanes cause withdrawe theyr yong tender mindes fro gospell sum ouer wayward schole maisters wont doe reason crueltie toughnes wont teache good wittes hate learning ientilnes set forward bring better thinges commending diligence yet neuertheles shewing must endeuour theselfes attain vnto iesus tepred ye gladnes yog man reioiced ouertimely saying thou hast obserued thinges comed perfite righteousnes stadeth thou supposestone thing thou lackest c h rin thou lackest yet one thing merueiling ing yt lord answered returne home make sale euer thou hast deale ye money thou makest therof among poore folkes thou shal lose e earthly possessios horde vp great treasure heaue lighted thy burden fre encumbraunces cum folow knowledge disciple gospell yong man wanted many thinges iesus entended shewe touchyng one soore howe farre yet perfeccion ghospell heard say went waie mournyng disapointed prayse righteousnesse whiche well hoped haue man great substauce therfore semed vnto hym soore thing sodainly forgoe thesame yet departed one vtterly despaired neyther wrothe murmured christ went waye mournyng chere silence comended verteous godly endeuour mourneth cummeth man frailtie weakenes vnderstode iesus woordes meanyng wherof man would much forsake goodes affeccions whoso redy willyng leaue hath case require hath forsaken thynges pand whe iesus loked roud said vnto disciple vneasy shal haue money entre kingdo god ye disciple wer astonied wordes iesus answereth saith vnto childre howe hard trust money enter kyngdo god easier camell go rou e ye n le riche entre kyngdom god astonyed measure saying betwene themselfes saued iesus loked vpon saied men vnpossible god god thinges possible ensample iesus frayed disciple couetousnesse therfore yong man gone awaye sadde heauy iesus loked round disciple done theyr instruccion sayd gone howe much doe shall haue aboundaunc money enter kyngdome god wordes greatlye amased disciple supposed vnnethe one could founde whiche woulde sodainly lashe great rich kyngdome god although themselfes forsaken fewe small thinges little price value therfore iesus repeteth thynges whiche spake mittigating sharpnes therof pleasant wordes expouning darke saying whiche vnderstode child sayeth hard haue great substance trust vnto common sort doe enter kyngdom god leste seme sore saying yet speake much sorer wordes moste true withal easier say camel go thorow nedles iye riche enter god kingdome disciple heard say muche disquieted myndes reasoned thus amog themselfes man saued vnlesse enter kyngdome god manne enter goddes kyngdome excepte haue forsaken rich sith see men inordinately loue seemeth ease forgoe riche man saued carefulnes disciple smelled godlye charitie theyr lord desyrous many might possible entre kyngdom god yet vnderstode nature vertue christian profession whiche commaundeth v nothing passe vpon wife child parentes life case require easiest thing may yf man waye pondre thyng selfe contemne set naught richessewith vnpossible c moste greuous thyng regard manours people therfore lord perceyuing disciple carefull heauy reason wordes spake vnto nexte doore desperacion recomforteth agayne fyrst loketh vpon wonte ofte speake notable thing great importaunce despayre ye sayth saluacion riche men thynges whiche require muche difficultie muche harder thynges perfourmed nothing harder set naught life ye gospel sake herein shal haue capitain shall sum founde vnto whome ghospell shall deare life despayre shalbe sum set lesse rich gospell thinges seme vnpossible humaine affeccions al easily brought goddes helpe god requireth hard thynges suche farre aboue strengthe power man thesame putteth helping hande man may able accomplishe commaundementes cummeth passe man god almighty helpe whiche himselfe case able whoso wt harte body trusteth shalbe able thynges hym therfore passeth vpon goodes kyngdome god sustaineth losse therby hath great profite vauntage know thing pertainyng man wisdom faith geuen v heauen whosoeuer harte minde beleueth goodes forsaken whiche hindred v doyng busynes saluacion hundreth fold much geuen v world world cum lyfe euerlasting right good wyll make suche exchaunge pand peter began say vnto l e haue forsaken haue folowed iesus answered said verely say vnto man hath forsaken house brother systers father mother wife child la de sake gospel shall receiue hundreth folde nowe life house brother sister mother child landes wi h persecucions world cum eternall lyfe many first shalbe last last first way going vp ierusalem iesus went amased folowed afrayed wordes wherby iesus broughte disciple despaire receyued courage boldenesse shoulde haue done nowe peter coparyng himselfe yong man departed away heauy mourning began stand muche owne conceipt saying loe haue forgone euer thy sake folowed haue done thou ere requiredst yong man thou promisedst treasure heauen rewarde ought hope man regarde valuacion apostle goodes forsoke muche especially peter fysher man muche doe gate lyuing daily trauaile labour vnto euery man owen propre substance greatest forgoeth muche whiche forsaketh goodes ryches hathe nde neyther restore encrease agayn hath cleane put away affeccion gredy desyre rich thesame hath forsaken onely muche worthe also muche myght haue desyredthe man yt hath forsaken house brother c lorde rule estemyng goodes forsaken apostle right good also forsake suche thynges muche dearer vnto theyr parentes theyr wyues theyr kynsfolkes answered wyse tell suretie onely shall defeated reward also shall none sake loue gospel hath forsaken house brethre sister father mother child landes shall receiue euery thinges forsaken hundreth folde muche euen presente life stormes persecution neuer great muche shall encrease charitie gospell taken awaye crueltie persecutours one carnal brother sister forsaken shall haue many brother systers felowes professing ghospell affeccions spirite behemete pleasanter withall thaffeccios nature one father mother shall haue many father teacher one house forsaken shall haue euery house whersoeuer theuangelike christen charitie shall raigne doubtles maketh al thinges common litle piece land forsaken shalbe partaker landes whiche true professours ghospell haue possession thinges came passe yet losse temporall goodes shalbe sufficiently recompenced ghostely giftes soule man hu dreth time leue haue thinges receiued thinges forsaken comparison betwene thinges transitory sone perish although take away rich soule whiche man geue god alone take away geueth seme small gaine shalbe added therto possession eternall life world cum sayinges lorde stayed weake mindes disciple leste eyther forthynke forsaken suche thinges thy forsoke el fall againe time cum loue worldly rich goyng enriched vile thinges waxe miserable poore touchyng goodes rich soule naughtie chauce whe man falleth againe loue goodes soule desyre goodes body true rich vayne deceiuable rich euerlasting commodity fading transytory leste praysyng disciple forsaking theyr goodes maisterynge theyr affeccions haue geuen occasion careles spake litle sentence lyke tenour ensueth many nowe seme first shall last neither despayred yet able perfourme vertue strength christian perfeccion requireth neyther ought suche truste themselfe haue profited certain degree therin sum haue done like haue yet shall fall againe mischieuous couetousnesse sum presente cannot contemne set naught goodes whiche sorte yong man one whiche tyme cum shall excell suche appeared haue forsaken worlde finally shalbe found poorest iudgement worlde semed richest contrarily suche appeared contemne al worldly thinges moste gredy desyrous therof prayse commendacion standeth thinges affeccions poorer man possesseth suche goodes fortune hath lente hym though ready departe therwith ofte neyghboure holpen reioycynge ouer muche yf anye encrease pynyng awaye sorowe yf anye thing taken hym setteth great store litle hath neuer maketh ende augment encrease thesame hereby seemed meane iudas albeit forsoke euer dyd folowed iesus yet afterwarde perceiued naughtie couetous wretche iudgement worlde rychest way goyng vp ierusalemwith suche woordes iesus framed myndes disciple lytle litle greuous storme hand mencion wherof vtterly abhorred nowe began goe vp ierusalem whiche name disciple hated bycause hearde saye theyr maister suffer muche shame vilanie place ghospell oft tymes mencioned howe went beyng hungry plucked eares corne vyage coulde doe painfull iourney goe vp ierusalem valiant courage strong spirite suche world hath naught therfore iesus nowe goeth disciple folowe heauy murmuring hym would willingly put himselfe manifest daunger lyfe maruayled minde also feared owne partes leste woulde bring lyke daunger suche disciple grosse weake withall suffered iesus doth greue v sith weake selfes beare dulnesse weake gaped kyngdom desyred partaker glory reasoned haue chife place preeminence vtterly abhorred thing whiche moste necessary theyr saluacion p iesus toke xii agayne began tell thinges happen vnto beholde go vp ierusalem sonne manne shall delyu red vnto hie priestes vnto scribe shall condemne hym death shall deliuer gentile shall mocke scourge spitte vpon kill th ede daye shall ryse agayne iesus therfore geue v ensample ought instructing neyghbour teache rather necessary thinges delectable rather holsome thinges pleasant called vnto hym xii whome onely witness also pointes partaker storme iesus say printed theyr myndes first couertly anon plainly foreshewed vnto saying loe tyme nowe cum haue ofte told go vp ierusale thentent maye perceyue willinglybeholde c wittinglye suffer tourmentes passion soeuer shall put vnto must flye syth tyme appointed god present sacrifice shalbe made ierusalem place appointed thereunto sonne man shall deliuered handes chief priestes scribe phariseis elder people shall condemne hym felon wicked person legthe haue accused hym diuerse crime iudge hym deathe incontinent shall deliuer hym notorious misdoer heathen people may mocke hym spitte vpon shorte shalbe scourged slayne thyrde day shal arise death lyfe nedefull knowe remembre thynges specially twoe cause partly leste ye thynke beyng altogether wrought accordyng god determinacion done hasard fortune vnknowyng againste wyll partly leste storme whe cumme trouble measure men thought nothing thereon mete shoulde take greuously wyll willingly suffre cause according father hath determined shall doe neyther conuenient dismayed thyng whiche hath chaunced vnloked sith haue ofte time warned hereof pand iames iohn sonnes zebede came vnto saying maister woulde thou shouldest v whatsoeuer desyre said vnto would ye said vnto great vnto v maye syt one thy right hand thy left hand thy glory iesus said vnto ye w ye aske ye drinke cup drinke baptised baptisme baptised sayd vnto iesus sayd vnto ye shall dede drinke cuppe drinke baptisme baptised withall shal ye baptised sit right hand left hend rayne geue shall happen vnto whome prepared apostle dumpes like men amased reason wordes durst counsayll hym cotrary two wete iohn iames sonnes zebede came vnto hym alone ii heard hym speake resurreccion conceiued good hopethey sa vnto c kyngdome oft tymes promysed cumme shoulde shortly begyn yet cleane cast mindes desyre worldly aduaunceme set mother worke desyred haue summe preeminece soueraigne dignitie geuen thesame kingdom euer vttered theyr minde coulde get faythfull promise hade haue theyr requeste graunted lawful deny lord makyng though woulde deny nothing whatsoeuer demaunded bad tel hardely great thing thei sued semed would desyre weyghty thyng hygh promocio lorde saye oure peticion suite haue honourable preferment thy kyngdome may sit nexte one v thy ryghthand thy lefte iesus askyng question plainly bewrayed theyr ignoraunce rudenes yet dreamed vpon certayne corporall kyngdome yet theyr myndes vpon primacy howbeit time rebuke theyr grosse ymaginacion yet bryngeth agayne remembraunce death whiche muche abhorred sayeth ye perceiue maner thyng kyngdome god therefore ye wo te ye desyre seke vaynglory consydre meanes true glory kyngdom attayned open waye yf lyke trust ye verely haue glory desyre saue alonely shall true glory suche one dreame vpon imagine drinke cuppe make selfe ready drynke ye baptysed baptisme shall ere long baptised withallca ye drike ye cuppe c gredy desyre haue theyr peticion graunted folyshly desyred preeminence euen rashly promyse theyr behalfe saye could notwithstanding yet knewe themselues righte neyther moste gracious lord rebuke great foly forasmuch tyme yet cum shoulde receiuable mystery yet whatsoeuer heard heard dreame yet neuerthelesse diligence teache instruct euer attempering wordes theyr weakenesse beyng afterwardes man would say wakened slepe manifestly perceyuing truth holy ghoste shoulde entire affeccion loue theyr lord beyng suche one would iently beare wt suche maner disciple also growen perfeccion agayne folowe ientlenes bearyng weaknesse theyr euen christen happen instruct hauyng alwayes theyr remembrauce ignoraunt howe forgetfull dull also themselues sometime ambicious saying let v sit nexte thy kyngdome vnaduisedly spoken sayd doe spoken would soone deny theyr lord maister feare suche error springeth malice obstinate euylues symplicitie must either rured el borne withall season therfore iesus answered truely ye shal drinke cuppe shall baptised baptisme baptised tyme cum yet ye able thyng whiche ye beleue ye therfore prepare mindes hereunto leaue ye iudgement rewarde god father let endeuoyr counterfaite folow trace hath euery peculier rewardes already prepared distribute thesame shal please matter ordred kingdome heaue prince courtes wheras alwayes chief dignitie whiche deserueth whome prince kyng chiefly fauoureth sumtimes fauoureth naughtyest person father regarde person neither parte regarde measure multitude merites deseruinges sith able nothyng selues considre far ye passe must endeuoyr accordinge power god hath geuen folowe ye shall defeated reward although thinke theron fighteth rewardes sake would el fight vnlesse thought rewarded labour cleane disapointeth himselfe reward let man owne iudge remitte whole iudgement vnto god pand ten heard began disdayne iames iohn iesus whe called sayd vnto ye knowe sene beare rule among people raygne lordes ouer greate among exercise auctoritie vpon neuertheles shall among whosoeuer wyll greate amog shall minister whosoeuer chief shall seruaunt sonne man also ame ministred vnto minister geue life redempcion many loe howe one euill sprang another simplicitie two disciple bewrayed greater rudenes ignoraunce rest cum others knowledge two brother althoughe theyr request graunted desyred lorde maner disdayning hereat angry theyr toppe regarding theyr simplenes meane estate presumed desyre ye first chief place rather due vnto none hoped haue preferment himselfe accordyng eche fauored owne gyftes desertes doubtles affeccios suche person leade theyr lyues prince courtes euery man highly estemeth hymselfe euery man warraunteth hymselfe moste honorable aduauncementes hath great heart burning disdayne others preferment saue ambici n courtier spiced malice disciple ambicion nothyng el mere ignorance symplicitie whyles straue thus preeminence primacy cleane forgotten wordes iesus spoken least greatest kingdom heauen imitacion folowyng lytle one man aske question lord suffered great ignoraunce long continue disciple whose ministerye purposed haue doctrine gospell preached taught throughout whole worlde truely chiefe cause would litle lytle cleane weede theyr mindes suche naughty affeccions therfore doeth suffre oft fall againe affeccion say ambicion desyre dominion prefermet euen soone delyuered ague soone forgetteth bothe disease also benefite physician cured agayne ofte tymes recidiuyng fallyng disease agayne length muche doe rid healed therof doth hate disease also knowledge benefite healing shall better knowe cure lykewise diseasedbut iesus whe called c therfore iesus perceiuing fonde peticion ye two disdaynfull wrathe yssued bothe one well called vnto would ministre phisicke vnto one medicine oft sayth ye heare speake kyngdome heauen whiche verely spirituall kyngdome differeth lesse worldly kyngdom yerthe differeth heauen vayne phantasticall ymaginacion fayne likenes apparaunce thinges see yearthlye kyngdomes ye knowe whiche seme hiefe ruler among heathen people world play lordes ouer suche vnder obeysaunce subieccion whiche great men among heathen exercise power authoritie ouer haue rule gouernauce beware suche thyng among desyre helpe neyghbour maketh man greater ye desyre worldly prefermet therfore haue also taught tyme whoso desyreth bee great dede among let ye minister let say exalte himselfe beare rule humble himselfe men goodfor sone man also came c whosoeuer chiefe among let seruaunt rest let chalenge soueraignitie preeminence serue thende may men good sekyng hereby honour referring whole prayse glory vnto god serueth mebres let greue counterfaite ensample whiche see plainly expressed sonne man came world rule lay yoke bondage vpo men neckes minister euery man saluacion onely serue men wealth comoditie also geue bestowe himselfe enfranchisyng bodmen ende death losse one great many shoulde saued truthe euangelyke chrystian soueraigntye whiche whoso desyre let hym desyre doe loke rewarde suche one appoynteth vnto himselfe suche shall please father geue hym lyke without condicion obey father commaundementes euen crosse wholy referryng rewarde myne obedience vnto wyll godly arbitrement shalbe great shame desyre dignitie see worldly prynces doe seke rewarde father heauen eyther desyre kyngdome heauen loke heauenly rewarde el desyre worldly kyngdome require ye rewarde kyngdome heauen suche lesson monicions hande instructed taught went christ ierusalem cleuer euery man affeccions better appointed go ye battayle crosse pand came hierico went citie hierico disciple great numbre people blynd bartymeus sonne timeus sat hye waie syde beggyng hearde iesus nazareth began crie saye iesus thou sonne dauid haue mercy many rebuked hold peare cryed great deale thou sonne dauid haue mercy iesus stode styll commaunded hym called called blynd saying vnto hym good comforte ryse calleth threwe awaye cloke rose came iesus iesus answered saide vnto wilte thou doe vnto blynd sayde vnto hym mayster might see iesus sayde vnto hym goe thy waye thy faythe hath saued immediatly receyued hys syght folowed iesus waye nowe cum citie hierico whiche farre ierusalem hierico syrian tong signifieth mone mone figured present life whiche nothyng el common course worlde borne dye sycke whole growe towarde man state draw age sometymes chaunceth glad thynges sometymes heauy cause iesus came downe heauenly tranquilitie yet wyll tarry hasteth ierusalem desyrous mannes saluacion hitherto disciple great multitude people folowed marke well howe iesus euery called eyther teacheth healeth el restoreth lyfe agayne deathe shoulde cause beliefe ghospell preached shewed nowe plainly corporall fygure mankynde blinde ignorauce trueth poore beggerly lacke vertues unlesse iesus passed v bene hope lyght certaine blynde begger well knowen people called bartymeus sonne one timeusblind bartymeus sonne tymeus sate hyghe wayes syde perceyued hym cum began crye saye iesu sonne dauid haue mercy vpon fyrst bruite preaching ghospell sheweth v iesus passeth great confidence whiche straightwaies conceiue hym suffre v holde peace goeth synner knowledging confessyng wretched lyuing cryeth vpon mercyfull sauiour desyreth hym take mercy compassion vpon hym nexte dore lyght whoso knowleageth owne great blyndnes saye lorde haue mercy vpon saying phariseis thought themselues men perfite syght euagelike christian saying neither vse phariseis saye thou sonne dauid say carpenter sonne blynd man sawe greatdeale darke iewes present day whiche boast bragge vpon knowledge lawe professe themselues guydes blynde multitude people impediment hynderaunce sely wretche thus cry calling mercy thyng disturbe trouble conscience also cryeth hym one voyce many offence knoweth hymselfe giltie saying hast thou doe iesus whiche art defyled many synnes lawe cryeth barketh hym saying thou cryest vaine god iust loke punishement thyne offence ruler synagoge crye againste hym commaundyng man preache hardy name name iesu saying healthe saluation iesu moyses shorte thyng doe philosopher heathen prince man may knowe euangelike christen faithe blynde man gaue ouer people thus cried hym insomuche rebuked commaunded holde peace cryed louder saying thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon people offended cry iesus alone nothing offended herewith stode styll commaunded hym called vnto hym hearde hym crye passed made though heard hym came daungerousnes iesus behalfe acte went wryng man notable faythe ensample pleasure teache men blinde man howe meanes light maie extorted gotten perforce iesu fyrst hope obtaine light haue iesus stand still cry secode called vnto eyther teacher ghospell el secrete inspiracions holy ghost blynde man could go vnto hym vnlesse bene led guided holy scripture ought wise despise although ministred apostle preacher ghospell happily call blynde call comaundemet iesu nowe adayes call without comaundement vnto aydes humaine philosophie heathen learning thobseruacion moises law ye comodities pleasure preset lyfe assuredly allers make blinde blinde apostle obeyng maisters comaundementand called blynd saying called man vnto iesus true yt dyd crie brable people put hauing good hope already hope comforte saying good chere aryse iesus calleth thee blinde man conceyued great hope herewith cast awaye cloke whiche defended hym againste cold weather skypped place sate ranne iesus staye lytle good reader thou mayest marke greate readinesse myndeand threw away cloke feruent courage blynde begger howe ofte arte thou called vnto iesus doest neither caste awaye thy cloke matell skyp thy dene misery run vnto hym ye calleth thee tournest thy backe lingrest day day castest doubtes dest cauillacions fayned excuse waxest luskyshe thy fylthe darkenesse haddest rather aske almes ye worlde foule beggerly cloke receiue light iesus wherein conteyned summe felicitie goodly faire vesture garment innocencie cleane lyfe foule mantell hath yt clothed lechery couetousnesse excesse ambicio howe vile wretched begger whoe small corporall commoditie croucheth kneleth vnto world howe miserablye blynde neyther knoweth himselfe almightye god maker ofte thou arte called miserable wretchednesse vnto iesus either thou readest ghospell hearest thesame preached el whan thou art drawen certaine secrete inspiracion holy ghoste doeste thou thynges layde aparte wonte let hinder man attaine great felicitie leape vp vnto hope better life runnest thou moste sure faythe vnto iesus whiche onely able geue light geue men iesus cometh vnto calleth doest thou thy part grutche mete hym thou pynest wyddrest away euen tyll thy dying day thy darkenesse thou shalt euer haue iesus passing certes death calleth manne saluacion iudgement passeth worlde heareth cryeth haue mercy vpon standeth still calleth giueth light begger hath made ashamed thy slouthfulnesse vnto lord cumen vnto sayd ayleth crye wilt thou haue vnto knewe iesus cryed knew shoulde doe done custruccion many beleued blynde man loked almes lorde begger nowe day many crye vnto iesus lorde haue mercy vpon beyng demaunded sue desyre haue one sayth graunt maye riche maye gette office man maie haue wyfe good dowrie geue bodilye strength geue long lyfe graunt may auenged enemythe blind sayd vnto hym c thinges iesus many time taketh awaye frendes behoueth saluacion euangelike begger desyred none thinges knew right well ought desyred iesu therfore let v heare folowe hym rabbone sayeth muche saye maister make see careles thynges desyred nothing el light whereby might see god sonne iesus knowe euerlasting lyfe scripture knowe god nothing el see god euangelike christia praier fewe wordes hath great faith doubtles short prayer whiche pearceth heauens therfore iesus answered go thy way thy faith hath purchased helth byanby man vndoen cast awaye whiche seeth awhit bodelyiyes whoso seeth nothing iyes soule thesame cannot saued haue recouered iyes life euerlasting heare saying thou pharisaicall felow whosoeuer thou sayest ascribe safety myne oft fastinges long prayer mine almesdedes sacrifice cause thou criest begger haue mercy sayest geue reward due vnto deseruinges iesus doth contrarily ascribe saluacion vnto faith vnto woorkes blinde man streyght wayes recouered sighte deserued beleued commaunded go waye folowed iesus lighte geuen freely thy blindnes taken awaye naught afterward thou art left thyne owne arbitrement whether thou wilt vse gift god aright thou art compelled folow thou hast onely power geuen see iesus go whither thou wilt thyne owne auenture blessed blinde man heretourned backe agayne beggerly cloke mantel retourned olde beggerye forgote thinges folowed iesus waye auaileth litle haue knowen iesus vnlesse thou thy deuoire folowe thou seest iesus goeth straight crosse hither muste thou folow hym thou hast recouered thy syght gain long thou art blynd thou maiest crye iesu haue mercye vpon thou canst folow way thine iye syght restored would folow willingly geueth soule death onlesse saw fayth worldly reproche waye euerlasting glory bodily tourmentes affliccions waye euerlasting ioyes death way lyfe eternall thinges quicke syghted world see perfitely onely theyr iyen loke rule rich honoures pleasure long life also endeuoyre themselues get thesame vnlefull meanes counsayling astronomiers soothsayer inchaunters necromanciers thinges saye onely see whiche beleue doctrine gospell haue sure truste shall receyue enioye reward promised thesame xi chapter pand came nie ierusalem vnto ethphage bethany besides mounte oliuete sendeth forthe two disciple sayth vnto go waye towne ouer assone ye entred yt ye shall find colte bound whereon neuer man sate lewse bring hither yf man saye vnto doe ye say ye lord hath nede streyght way send hither went way found colte tyed doore without place two wayes mette lewsed diuers stode sayde vnto ye lewsing colte sayde vnto euen iesus commaunded let go broughte colte iesus cast theyr garmetes sat vpon many spred theyr garmetes waye cut downe braunches tree strawed waie wente folowed cryed saying hosanna blessed cummeth name lorde blessed kingdome cummeth name lorde father dauid hosanna highest thing yet wrought mindes disciple whiche iesus expressed set figure ye blind man yet sawe perfitly inward iyes happy death yt folow christes deathe yet dreamed vpon worldly kyngdom lord therfore woulde better faste mindes folow ought wise desyre kingdom world shewed spectacle wherby derided laughed shorne worldly pompe glorye thing lasteth season soone shall perish yet plainely declared could haue commaunded whomsoeuer woulde pleased hym saue pleasure rather obey wil heauenly father finally woulde haue menne know howe selfesame persone whome iewes awayted cumme many hundred yeares according prophecy foresayinges prophetes saluacion whole worlde therefore approched nye vnto hierusalem bethphage bethany whiche two litle townes mountaine called mounte oliuete whence manne might haue sene ierusalem sente oute thence two disciple geuing commaundement foloweth go ye saith towne whiche see yondre directly ye entred shall finde ass foale tied gatego youre waye towne c whiche yet broken whereupon man hath ridden vnto day leuse bring hither vnto man aske question vntie say lord hath nede straight way shall send hither disciple went way bidden came found ass foale tyed gate place wheras two wayes met leused meane stode thei sawe straunge ment vntie foale saide vnto syrs meane vntie foale disciple made aunswere lorde commaunded make saying lorde hath nede herof notwithstanding vnknowen vnto called theyr lorde yet let foale goe without anye questioning reasoning matter disciple vntied broughte vnto iesus woulde haue earnestly monished good reader onely wordes whiche iesus christ spake also whatsoeuer lyfe long doen auentures counsayle wisedome god mannes erudicion nothing hath itand brought coalte iesus either ensample set thentent moue styrre v vertue godly lyuyng representacion olde prophecy fulfilling fygures wherwith lawe dyd bene certaine darke misteries riddle sygnifie christe el sygnificacion thinges afterwardes shoulde happen cum passe wheras misticall sence euerye thing diligently searched yet approched vnto tyme death busynesse oure saluacion shoulde chiefly wrought holyer mystery thynges full nowe tyme hand whiche greatly thirstyng desyring mennes saluacion spake saying shalbe lifted vp earth draw thynges vnto roume ynoughe iewry charitie fruite ghospell dyd counteruayle labour diligence tiller cause christe sent wilde vnbroken ass foale wherupon man sytten foale signifieth gentile neyther obeyed lawe nature vnder moses lawes vpon ass saye synagoges backe moses prophetes ridden certaine newe disciple nowe sent call gentile call moses iesus woulde lacke whiche woulde brable speake saye vntie foale foale many also vncertaine maysters tyed stode two wayes met whoso obedient vnto goddes commaundementes hath manye maisters hath vice serueth subdued vnto tyed hath house standeth sight two wayes mete readie euerye manne wyll take hym iesu calleth man hathe power resiste iewes cryed sayde saluacion oures promyse heathen idolatours ioyned v unto aunswere made lorde hath nede suche foales nowe wery labouring vayne among iewes desyreth reste hym vpon vnbroken foale foale vnbroken doeth displease hym lacke obedience fayth newe ryder hath nede newe beaste ryde vpon disciple yet wot matter meaneth neuerthelesse diligent ministerieand caste garme te helpe forthe matier couer foale mantel ride vpon bare backe whosoeuer thou art preacher teacher gospel folow diligence ye disciple whersoeuer thou shalt see vnbroken ass foale tyed two wayes mete ignoraunt law ghospell subiect many vice foly simplicitie rather malice obstinate euelnesse suche one obey yf man leade awaye loke thou vntie bryng vnto iesu caste vpon mantell holsome doctrine iesus lorde vouchesafe ryde vpon backe folow thou also diligence christe shoulde ryde forth couered way garmentes ensample uagelike christian godlynesse many also whiche decked way boughes cut tree especially palme tree whiche beare figure virgin martyr iesus lorde thought royall thyng ryde suche waye vpon suche beaste nowe staye lytle whyle good reader compare spectacle sight one chiefe amonges iewish priestes fyrst regarde manour personage howe great whiche rydeth vpon ass foale sonne god vnto whome father hath geuen power heaue earth sauiour gouernour whole worlde authour lorde kyng thynges created made priest euer order melchisedech becke able whatsoeuer would whose maiestie order aungels adore worship sitteth right hande father almightie ith dignitie compare bishop one teple whiche hath bought ye priesthode prelacie lasting one yeare wicked heathe kyng filthy summe money compare bare heade iesu tyare myter glysteryng shining golde precious stone compare sobre mylde countenaunce iesu face puffed vp pryde grym forheade frowning browes stately loke contencious vncharitable mouth compare bare handes iesu fyngers laden ringes precious stone compare course homly garment iesu tragicall masking apparayle weareth nothing courser clothe golde purple sylke compare disciple mantel golden sadles couering clothes cry masyne sylke byshop rome pompe couertly described syluer styropes ouer gylte compare commune ass foale caried iesu manye mule trapped sylke clothe golde many royall courser great horse manye palfrayes great pryce many wagon many chariottes many chaires estate prepared cary one man compare fewe poore simple disciple iesu ye solemne pompe passyng pompe worldly prince suche go bishop hensemen trumpettes sundryetune suche enuiron garde personage bende horseman footemenne amonge whome euery moste proude hye mynded statelye nexte byshoppes owne proper persone greatest fauoure conceipte hym compare ioyfull cryinges child went folowed iesu inspired holye ghoste song sayinge taken prophecie dauid hosanna say make v safe blessed cummeth name lorde blessed kyngdome father dauid cummeth hosanna highest compare saye ioyfull cryinges vnghostlye acclamacions wherwith multitude flatterer crye vpon vngracious iewishe byshop saying god sende moste holy father god long lyfe god graunt hys hygheste prieste victory praye god moste blessed chiefe prelate religion may raigne prosperitie howe much iesus defieth suche byshops one thing plainly declareth commaunded coloured stately priesthode temple therof vtterly abolished destroyed whome euen nowe dayes iesus wyll onely head priesthode slayn mebres seketh minister maye bryng vnto hym asse maye couer foale tels maie strowe waye palme boughes godly acclamacions cryinges knowleage kingdome ghospell promised prophetes come presente neither geueth eare phariseis muttring contented ioyfull cryinges people sayth stone shall soner crye goddes glory conceled pand lorde entred hierusalem temple loked round vpon thynges nowe euentyde come wente vnto bethanie twelue morow wer come oute bethanie hungred whan spred fygge tree farre hauyng leaues came see yf mighte fynde thyng theron came founde nothing leaues time fygges yet iesus aunswered saide vnto figge tree neuer man eate fruit thee hereafter whyle ye world standeth disciple heard suche pompe kyng iesus entred royall citie hierusalem heauenlye priest entred temple beseming kyng priest taught people healed sycke made strong weake feble one vsurping violent rule another mannes kyngdome meane whyle wycked priestes phariseis headman people freated mattier symple people easye enstructed cryed ioyfully vpon hym iesus thoughe woulde haue restored decayed religion temple whiche phariseis thought tyme chiefely flourishe behelde euery parte therof diligently bewyng marking yf anye thyng done therin besemyng house god passed muche done temple whiche knewe well shoulde within shorte space destroyed pleasure declare certaine corporall fygure maner churche woulde haue whiche buylded lyuely stone among stone mete christian bysshop conuersaunt walke hauing alwaye diligent iye seyng nothing among whiche maye defyle temple dedicated vnto god thinges defile ambicion filthle gayne couetousnesse falsehode abhominacions lord iesus doth suffer templeand nowe euetyde cum nowe euening drewe nighe returned bethanie riche royall citie coulde fynde place harboured flower religion whiche cannot awaye chiefe prelate religion oh misnamed hierusalem whiche blynded worldely lustes knoweth pacifier happye bethany whiche without woorkes lawe onely obedience faith deserued haue iesus geast nexte daye morning earlye retourned bethany hierusalem trauayled waye beganne waxe hungrye dede hungred mannes saluacion swetest bread vnto hym coulde redeme mankynde accordyng vnto father wyll determinacion albeit also touchyng nature manne whiche taken vpon hym veryly pangued bodely hunger felte griefe thereof menne reason drieth bodye therfore sawe farre figge tree whiche full grene leaues appeared haue fruite ranne thereuto se whether thing asswage hunger withall sore payne man hungrye hath nothing eate muche greater griefe one see miscarye vnbelefe whome desyrous saue came vnto figge tree deceyued allurement leaues found fruite thereon cursed saying neuer man eate fruite hereafter whyle worlde endureth disciple secretly meruailed betwene themselues thus cursed tree especially sithe time yet cum whe kynde tree wonte haue fruite corporall honger hath proper angre theuangelyke spirituall honger hath sharpe bytyng testinesse christ thought euery tarying ouer long whereby mannes saluacion prolonged tree haue due tymes appointed nature bryng foorth fruite maie appeare vnreasonable pray might bee euermore baraine brought furthe fruite due season furthermore purpose ranne iesus figge tree shake downe fruite yf bene anye sythe knewe right well none arte whiche outwarde apparaunce semed fonde vnreasonable occasyoned disciple onely attent take better hede also ensearche mistery thereof lorde iesus moste hungry desyrous mannes saluacion foude frute barrayne tree hope fruite saie common wemen publican sinner heathen folkes womanne canaan samaritanes onely priestes scribe phariseis whome menne conceiued greatest hope shoulde sweatest fruit ghospell founde none kepte fortresse religion continually temple knowleage lawe prophetes loked pa e fastinges vsed long prayer gaue great almes besydes theyr robe brode philacteries made wonderfull shewe thoughe ben altogether giuen studie vertuouse godly lyuing truly leaues whiche promised worlde tymely ripe fruite euen due season lordes entent shewe nothing farther paste grace goodnes vngodlynesse couloured counterfaite shewe visure holynes fygge tree deserueth bee cursed iesu leste manne deceyued goodly shew leaues would hence forth hope haue sorte people sweate fruite theuangelyke christian charitie p came ierusalem iesus went temple began caste solde bought temple ouerthrew table money chaungers stooles solde doues would suffer man shoulde cary vessell thorow temple taught saying vnto wrytten house shall called house prayer vnto nacions ye haue made denne theues iesus went temple ctherefore departed fygge tree whiche deserued yll came ierusalem wherein moral figge tree bene long time nourished dunged vaine yet brought foorth nothing el leaues entred teple shewed againe another figure whereby declare puritie besemeth churche ghospell also cleanesse cummeth hart dedicated vnto spirite christe scourge whippe cordesand taught salyng c draue whipped te ple rablement bier seller also ouerthrewe table money chaungers stooles doue seller suffred none carrie prophane vncleane vessell thorowe temple lest shoulde haue semed haue bene angry causelesse alleaged testimonie prophete esaye sayth wrytten house shall called house praier vnto nacions ye haue made denne theaues deceitfully thyng therein vnder couloure pretence honoure seruice god theaues wayfaryng men iourneys lord cared greatly puritie temple whiche destroyed rite ceremony therof set forthe vnto v notable puritie new temple whereof himselfe would chief workman builder couertly sygnifying priestes scribe phariseis worthely deposed principalitie religion defiled euen auncient figuratiue religion couetousnesse falshod hipocrisie kyndes filthynesse neuer reade euer iesus moued neuer vsed like crueltie woulde nowe sawe spousesse churche whiche wasshed owne precious bloude make cleane vnto hymselfe without spot wrynckle arayed polluted defiled manour fylthynesse bishop ruler haue onely catell pigyons sell also holy thinges whiche dede neither bought sold money seeth vndoubtedly although winke rat season neyther shall suche persones therfore escape vnpunished god great lenitie gentlenesse suffreth thend repent cu amendmet day daye shal cum terrible scourge shall made whippe fyre hell defiler holy temple pand scribe hye priestes heard sought howe destroy eared people meruayled doc e e euen cum iesus went citie morning passed sawe figge tree dryed vp rootes peter remembred sayd vnto maister beholde figge tree whiche thou cursedst withered awaye iesus answered sayd vnto haue confidence god maye appeare great mischiefe couetousnesse priestes phariseis chief priestes scribe greatest porcio gaynes saw thinges sought meane might destroy iesus oh figge tree barayne cursed dede boast aduaunt themselues chiefe prelate p religion yet name god sore displeased defiler temple driuen dores lacked wicked minde ready commit haynous murdre thei sought occasion might safely accomplishe theyr desyre alone coulde fynde theyr harte loue louely amiable iesusfor thei feared people c hurt body men good feared onely people meruayled doctrine conceiued high opinion miracle seen worke oh wrong shapen holinesse professours holinesse purposed wicked dede afrayed leste god vnto whome nothing vnknowen would auenged yet stode dreade people leaste wise feare iesus himselfe bothe seen hearde tell greate numbre miracle wrought euident testimony goddes power presently hym oft would hymselfe able chase away diuels put flighte muche easlyer put bare worde mouthe rayseth dead calleth life againe muche lesse difficultie take awaye lyfe beleue gracious mercifull though able yet wyll hurt body go put suche one death beleue also able euen verye feare punishment vengeaunce refrayne wicked purpose doubtelesse vncurable blinddenesse thought owne conceytes none iyes could haue sene nighte eftsones approched iesus bene daye temple fasting without meate departed ierusalem ofte forsaketh citie offended obstinate vnbelefe inhabitauntes oft cummeth thyther find sum fruite would goodly shew leaues would god cursed figtre bene nothing el barain brought foorth deadly poyson iesus time death passion hand suffered time passe away fruitlesse spent day temple bestowed nighte praier priuatelye animating encouraging disciple agayne whan early mourning retourned bethany hierusalem passed figge tree disciple perceiued withered euen rootes highest top peter called remembraunce iesus done day knewe righte well howe cursed tree yet meruayling sodainly withered partes rootes sayd lord maister loe figge tree thou cursedst withered peter meruayled withstanding oft tymes seen hym farre greater thinges surely forgotten lesson howe nothing harde faith able bring passe fayth springeth fruite gospell sinagoge wanted faith see howe cleane withered churche gentile blossometh brauncheth wt many crownes martirs many precious stone virgin many ensamples vertue side paste grace goodnesse abiect vile barayne iewes auctoritie law becum merueilous shewe religion holynesse temple stately scribe phariseis figge tree withered therfore sayth yf ye blossome bring foorth fruite put confidence owne strength god puerely say vnto whosoeuer shall say vnto mountaine remoue cast thy selfe sea shall doubte harte shall beleue thynges sayeth shall cum passe whatsoeuer saieth shall haue therfore say vnto thinges soeuer ye desyre ye pray beleue ye receyue ye shall haue ye stand pray forgeue yf ye haue oughte againste anye ne father also whiche heauen maie forgeue trespaces assure one thing yf man hauing sure belefe god commaunde figge tree wither whiche thing meruayle done onely shall foorth cum passe also yf saye vnto mountayne auoyd thy place cast thy selfe sea albeit seme thing impossible yet yf speake worde nothyng doubting mistrusting hart haue conceyued sure beliefe mind whatsoeuer say shall dede cum passe vndoubtedlye whatsoeuer commaundeth shall done beliefe towardes god shall cause ye shall desyre nothing vayne therfore trust ye wa randise whatsoeuer ye demaunde father mistrusting graunt request shall obtain mindes fre desyre reuengement condicion ye desyre shall expedient soule health distrusteth obtaineth nothing one beleueth father either cannot acomplish desyre whereas dede able thinges becke least wise let haue lawfully asketh man also obtaineth request beleue faith naughty shamlesse fayth whoso desireth father pardon trespaces hath committed againste maiestie whereas againe parte release vnto christian brother suche offence sayd brother committed againste hym wherfore ye settle selues prayer forgeue hertes body haue ought offended vnder condicion shall father heauen release trespaces forgeue youre neighboure fault whiche hath committed againste neyther father heauen pardon offence wherby ye haue trespaced goodnesse pand came againe ierusalem walked temple came hye priestes scribe elder sayde vnto hym authoritie doest thou thinges gaue authoritie thinges iesus answered sayd vnto wil also aske certaine thing answere ye tell auctoritie thinges baptisme iohn whether heauen man answere thought themselues saying yf saye heauen wyll saye dyd ye beleue hym yf sayde men feared people men counted iohn prophete answered sayd vnto iesu tell iesus aunswered neyther tell auctoritie thinges thinges done waye came againe ierusalem iesus according accustomed manoure went vnto temple presence iesus temple soule health churche neyther besemeth suche christes stede oftener temple temple whiche entermeddle thinges pertayne god vnto worlde maketh bishop cape amog warriersand walked teple c hath theatre yt saye stage place ordayned people behold sightes enterludes maketh prince courtes phariseis scribe priestes elder bodily presence ofte temple touching ye spirite great waye therfore hye priestes ioyning vnto scribe headman people matter shoulde seme done lawfull counsaile sawe howe iesus multitude temple diligently harkening listening vnto doctrine also howe reason miracle raygned played kyng ben another prince kyngdom droue ut marchantmen suche carried vessel temple went interrupted hym preachyng renuing olde manoure false reprouing saying authoritie doest thou thynges hath gyuen licence thus able disproue doctrine neyther coulde denie miracle many euident fynde faute sithe wrought mannes preseruacion freely sought occasion authoritie whereby mighte haue quarell would wise glory haue geuen vnto god whole dryft haue owne authoritie euery highliest estemed iesus whome beleued nothing el man taken vpon hym goddes authoritie would thei haue made matier blasphemy seke forged matter sedicion laye againste hym owne priuate authoritie without leaue licence priestes elder presumed suche thing temple neded moue question authoritie sith dedes declared done done might power god sithe thyng selfe plainlye shewed god prophetes promised long ago cumme sithe father baptisme declared owne voyce singularlye beloued sonne whome obeye nowe authoritie priestes whiche misused good nothing el lette god glorye howbeit frowarde wilfulnesse dyd also make muche aduauncyng setting forth power goodnesse iesus therfore ignoraunt wente aunswere soeuer made would haue found faute ther yet time cum disclose confesse iesus saye auoyded deceitfull question another wise demaunde condicion sayth make aunswer vnto question yf aunswer firste vnto mine baptisme iohn whether heauen men soyle question marke howe easlye goddes wysdome snarleth mannes wylinesse whiche vseth crafte policie maye againste hadde harte replenished worldlye subtiltie deuised gylefull wayes could inuented yet whyles made traines entrap hym perceiued snare prepared layed themselues thought themselues cfor thought thus mindes saye heauen replie dyd beleue bare witnesse saye men stande ieopardie assaulted people iohn great authoritie among people memorie reputed blessed holy man doubted prophet dede cause albeit proud felowes haut courage yet thought better litle ashamed openly reproued stoned death therfore vnto iesu required aunswere sayde cannot tell iesus paying home againe lyke aunswere sayd vnto know warde ye know neither shew authoritie thinges compare dedes iohns waye ponder selues whether mete ye doubted authoritie doubte mine xij chapter pand began speake vnto parable certaine man planted ynty compassed hedge ordeined wynepresse bustded toure let hier vnto husbande men went straunge coutrey time cum sent husbandman seruaunt mighte receyue husbande ne fruite vyneyarde caught beat sent awaye emptie mor ouer sent vnto another seruaunt ca brake deade sent awaye againe reuiled againe sent another hym kylled manye beatyng sum kyllyng sum hadde yet one beloued sonne sent hym also laste vnto saying feare sonne husbandemen sayde among themselues beyre cum let v kyll hym inheritaunce shall toke kylled hym caste hym yney rde priestes scribe head menne hadde reason perceiued traine made auoyded well woulde inconuenience question lorde iesus put forth vnto another question waye ridle darke parable whereunto while vnaduisedly aunswered bothe condemned theyr owne wickednesse also graunted authoritie whiche hytherto somuche bragged boasted ought worthily taken awaye geuen vnto parable suche certaine man planted vyneyarde hedged round lest open man beast runne digged therin cester e receiue newe wyne builded also tower defende wyse sufficienty furnished necessary therunto belongyng let hier husbandman anon done went straunge countrey grape time cum sent seruaunt husbandman vnto whome set receiue fruite therof conspiracie toke seruaunt beat hym sent hym home agayne emptie notwithstanding ye ientle landlorde sent againe another seruauntesand sent c made worse throughe lenitie gentlenes cast stone hym brake head sent hym likewyse awaye agayne reuiled without anye fruite laden iniuries yet thesame moste gentle lorde wet haste auenged nowe thyrde tyme sente another seruaunt also slew agayne sente diuerse seruauntes one anotherand whe yet one beloued sone c ende conclusion eyther bet el slew left onely sonne loued te derly therfore wonderfull gentlenesse woulde proue wayes meanes myght reconcyle laste sent hym also vnto thynckyng thus himselfe although haue despised seruauntes yet least wyse wyll reuerence sonne malice husbandman conquered lordes clemency goodnessebut ye husbandman sayd among themselues c sawe howe sonne cum fell conspiracie together mischieuous purpose sayd heire cum let v kill hym meanes whole herytage shall layde handes cast vineyard slew pwhat shall therfore lorde vyneyard shall cumme destroie husbandman let vyneyard vnto haue ye red scripture stone whiche builder dyd refuse become chief stone corner lordes maruaylous iyes went also take hym feared people knew spoken parable agaynst lefte hym went theyr waye lorde made ende parable asked priestes scribe shall therfore lorde vineyarde vnto suche husbadmen markyng whereunto parable similitude tended answered lorde gaue sentence directly themselfes shall cum say punishe husbandman set vineyard vnto faythfull trustie persones iesus alowed answer added testimony ye p e seekyng interpretacion professed knowledge lawe haue ye read saythe scripture folowyng thesame stone whiche builder refused made head stone corner lordes meruailous iyes awakened perceiued theyr mischieuous purpose vnowe vnto iesus vnderstood also theyr vncurable malyce plainly described darke parable god committed vnto people vineyarde diligently fournished thinges belonging discipline godlynes well husbanded though bene strange countrey suffered doe therwith
