liked husbanded owne profit commoditie nothing lordes behoofe ought ryght haue receiued fruite therof slacke neglygent duetie warned therof diuerse prophetes waxed euery day worse worse length w redy expulse iesus sonne ierusale put hym death perswadyng themselfes slayne onely lordes proprietary vineyarde contraryewyse cum passe moste iuste vengeaunce punishment god thei many time ofte despised temple soueraigntie religion shoulde taken quite geuen apostle afterwarde iesus naughty stone cast building synagoge contrary theyr expectacion chosen wyll god head corner stone building church shoulde builded bothe iewesthey went also take gentile thentent beyng middle vnmoueable stone hold together two people bothe walles churche one euangelike christen faythe vnderstoode parable knewe prophecye yet blinded obstynate malyce would tourne wickednesse feare people stode rounde aboute went theyr waye iesu entendyng bryng aboute pryuye traynes subtyltie could openly doe surely none mischeuous kynde manslaughter whiche cloked colour iustice holynesse sent vnto hym certayne phariseis herodes seruauntes take hym wordes assone cumme sayde vnto hym maister w knowe thou art true carest man thou consydered outwarde app rance men teachest waye god truely lawful pay tribute ceasar ought geue ought geue vnderstode theyr simulacion sayd vnto tempte ye bryng peny maye see brought sayth vnto whose image superscripcion sayd vnto hym ceasars iesus answered sayde vnto geue ceasar thynges belong ceasar god thynges whiche pertaine god maruayled hym wherfore makyng thoughe themselfes quiet medlers set worke certayne notable wicked personnes phariseis herodians whiche dissented doctrine among themselfes hatyng iesus agreed oh folysh wysdome worlde haue oftymes put worse dooe ofte tymes cumme assayle hym thentent may appeare sayes vanquished conclusion depart waye vnequal match cope encounter goddes wysdom nowe tyme satan late assayled lorde went away losse victorie garde mynisters bring forth artyllary engins therfore set vp playe partefor thou considerest c goe vnto iesus propoune vnto capcious question seke occasion wordes answeres therevnto whereby maye haue hym condemned themperours deputie begin flatering proheme thoughe could deceiued faire wordes ofte time declareth howe nothyng knoweth maister say knowe right well thou art teller trouthe fearest man frankely speakest truthe without regarde persone neyther art thou whyt moued dignitie hygh auctoritie manne many b flatter coury fauoure potentate great menne menne contemned thou trewly teachest god hathe commaunded therefore tell v also praie lawfull v pay tribute vnto themperour lawfull phariseis helde stifly iewes beyng people dedicated vnto god ought tributories vnto heathen emperours worshyppers idolles syde herodians defended themperous right deceitfull proheme tended hereunto yf geuen sentence pharyseis haue accused herodians authour rebellyon insurreccion againste themperour iesus vnto theyr craft wylines vnknowen beyng contented came learnebut e vnderstoode simulacion tempt aunswered doe tempte bring forthe peny maye see byanby brought theyr seruice seke making traine whiche came purposely take trippe loked peny sayd whose image superscripcion answered themperours knewe iesus vnto whome nothyng vnknowen image title themperoure phariseis herodians knowe yes verily knew well ynoughe loked thereon sought occasion make conuenient answere vnto theyr deceitful question ensample geuen declare howe ought knowe nothyng prince affairesand iesus answered sayde vnto whose duetie asmuche professe themselfes christes vicar earthe preach teache heauenly matter heare answer worthy cum christes mouthe yelde ye saith thinges pertaine themperour themperour thinges belong god vnto god disaloweth suche dedicated vnto god giue vnto themperour neuer vngodly wicked prince whiche due vnto hym gouerning common weale otherwise violently exacteth losse money doth make men vngodlye monisheth v occasion seruing thyng whiche purpose howe ought yelden god due vnto god vile piece coyne grauen title ymage themperoure thou knowest title art content geue vnto duetie howe muche oughtest thou yelde vnto almighty god whose image euery manne beareth ought duetie haue thou receyuedst baptysme goddes image printed grauen thy soule doest thou geue vnto deuell thou gloryest name tytle chrystian manne yeideste thou vnto christe thou west hym reason thy profession present maruayled discrete wyse aunswere two sectes iewes nowe put sylence one saying pthere came also vnto hym saduceis whiche say resurreccion asked hym saying mayster moyses wrote vnto v yf mannes brother dye leaue wyfe behynde hym leaue chyldren brother shoulde take hys wyfe rayse vp seed brother seuen brother fyrst toke wife dyed left seede behynde hym seconde toke dyed neyther lefte seede thirde likewyse seuen lefte seede behinde laste wife dyed also resurreccion therefore shall ryse againe whose wife shall seuen wife iesus answered sayde vnto doe ye therfore erre ye vnderstande scripture neyther power god shall ryse agayne death neither marrye marryed aungels whiche heauen touchyng deade ryse agayne haue ye rede booke moyses howe bushe god spake vnto hym saying god abraham god isaac god iacob god dead god liuing ye therfore greatly deceyued came secte saduceis denied resurreccion bodyes auouchyng manne wholy peryshe deathe neyther beleued spirite aungell wherein dissented opinion fro phariseis grosse felowes also capcious question wherwith tempte goddes wisdome iesus take vpon person vnlearned ignoraunte person thyng whiche hym loweste hygher excellencye whiche menne hygheste assayled hym wife mayster moises booke entitled deuteronomium hath lefte v lawe yf maried manne dye without issue next brother age marry wydow beget chyldren beare dead man name yf deceasse without chyldre next vnto hym succede place roume wer seuen brother chaunced seuen brother eldest maried wyfe dyed without issue came nexte brother age according prescripcion lawe maried widow beyng lykewyse departed without child thyrde brother succeded hym course vnto seuenthe last manne eche one another marryed eche deceassed without issue length woman also dyed therefore tyme resurreccion shall cumme seuen brother woman shall reliue shall chalenge wyfe lyfe tyme like wyse maryed vnto seuen saducies thought woulde thyncouenience inferred case make resurreccion dead apeare fonde thyng disagreable reason specyally yt shoulde ryse strife debate among brother wyfe whiche common vnto iesus grutched teache grosse felowes saying doethe thys question playnly declare wrong belefe altogether waye asmuche ye neyther vnderstand scripture yet perceiue power almighty god scripture spirituall god made manne naught canne rayse hym agayne pleasure death lyfe wyll onely make deade aliue agayne also rewarde lyfe euerlastyng nowe wedlocke inuented among menne purpose thyng meane mankynde whiche selfe owne propre nature contyneweth euer myght procreacion encreasyng worlde multipliedfor shal aryse agayne c preserued contynued whereas menne neyther dye borne common course world nedeth matrimonye resurrection dead neyther shall manne mary manne geue daughter maryage angel god heauen among mortalitie knowe vse matrimony shall shall relyued generall resurreccion made lyke vnto aungells theyr body beynge spyrytuall immortal furthermore thinke disagreable reason beleue dead shall aryse agayne haue ye redde holy scripture auctoritie wherof counted among holy inuiolable god sayed spake vnto moyses bushe saied god abraham god isaac god iacob dead yet doth call himselfe theyr god therfore euen dead verily lyue soules remayne styll aliue theyr sowles remayne great maystrye god call agayne theyr olde bodyes wherein dwelt yf dead vtterly perished nether bodye soule remayneth alyue standeth reason called god deade man glorieth king god god liuyng deade wherefore saduceis farre deceiued imagyning shall nothying lyfe cumye therfore greately deceiued otherwise see present life thinges doubt haue true blessed beyng whiche vnder man corporall light whiche seene bodelye iyes nothyng truly god yet seene felte perceyued pand came one scrybes hearde disputyng together perceyued aunswered well asked hym whiche fyrste commaundementes iesus answered hym fyrste commaundementes beare israell lorde oure god lorde onely thou shalte loue lorde thy god thy hatte wyth soule thy mynde thy strength fyrste commaundement second like vnto thou shalte loue thy neybour thy self none commaundement greater ye scribe sayde vnto hyme well mayster thou haste sayde trueth one god none ut loue hym harte mynde soule strength loue mannes neyghbour hym selfe greater thynge burnte offerynges sacryfices iesus sawe answered discretely sayde vnto hym thou art ferre kyngdome god man durst aske hym question yet wicked felowes made ende tepte christ saduceis came pharyseis scrybes encouraged take hym hand hit saduceis teethe ignorauce law scribe phariseis auaunt themselfes great knowledge pretende haue ye dissenting opinion saduceis beleue angle spirites men soules remayne aliue bodyes dead finally dead shall ryse agayne felowes beyng right glad saduceis put foyle blancked iesus aunswered mindes dyd lyke learned men propoune putte forthe vnto hym one scribe set vp none playe parte notable question moste inward misteries law asked hym chief greatest commaundement whole lawe iesus straightwayes answered boke entyled deuteronomium written wysehe asked whiche first c heare israell lorde thy god one god thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy harte thy soule thy mynde thy strength chiefe greatest commaundement next vnto foloweth thou shalt loue thy neyboure none otherwise thyselfe commaundement greater two comprise summe effect whole law whe scribe heard saye sayde againe thou hast wel truly answered one god none loue harte vnderstandyng soule strength thing whiche passeth burnt offrynges sacrifice iesus perceyuyng ryght discretly aunswered sayd vnto thou arte far kyngdom god euangelyke godlynes standeth sacrifice beastes cleannes spirite farre meaning whoso preferreth commaundement whiche spirituall simple plaine preceptes whiche rather figure token true godlines thyng selfe comon sorte iewes beleue verely chiefest parte vertue godly lyuing standeth visible thinges washinges kepyng sabboth daye choyce meates offred giftes sacrifice holy dayes fastinges long prayer whoso harte loueth god god self whiche neuer loued enoughe neybour goddes sake thesame hath made sufficient sacrifice iesu thus wisdome euery confouded ouercum ceassed tempt hym lest haue departed greater shameand man durst aske hym question styll reproued presence people counted iesus ignoraunt person anaunted set themselues among simple vnlearned people magnifike hye title theyr tragical maskyng apparell thoughe almost god almighty peeres howbeit euangelike godly wysdom stadeth multitude science purenesse spirite iesus reputed among scribe phariseis priestes head people afterwarde apostle taken rude ignoraunt person among phylosophers ruler prince pand iesus answered sayde teachyng temple howe saye scribe christ sonne dauid dauid himselfe inspired holy ghost sayed lorde sayde lorde syt right hande tyll make thyne enemyes thy foote stoole dauid himselfe calleth hym lorde howe sonne muche people hearde hym gladly although scribe phariseis ceased tempte iesus yet ceased teache propouned vnto assembled altogether question asked whole sonne messias whome wayted answered againe prophetes sone dauidnowe saye scribe c moued doubte none could assoyle saying standeth messias sonne dauid since dauid himselfe inspired holy ghost speaketh psalme foloweth lord sayde vnto lorde sitte right hand till make thyne enemyes thy footestole sith thauctoritie progenitoures greater thauctoritie spring neuewes reason dothe dauid call hym shal borne seede lord lyke thing thoughe father would call sonne lorde scribe phareseis spirite fleshe yet vnderstode misterie dauid inspired ye holy ghost sawe christ whoe borne thing farre aboue nature manne himselfe nothing el man nowe scribe phariseis helde theyr peace coulde make aunswere hereunto moste parte people fauoured iesu great delite heare dispute reason matter pand sayed vnto doctrine beware scribe whiche loue goe long clothing loue salutacions market place chiefe seates congregacions vppermoste towmes feastes whiche deuou wydowes house vnder pretence make long prayer shall receyue greater damnacion wherefore iesus perceiuing curable knowing also priestesand said vnto scribe phariseis purpensed malyce perseuered vngracious purpose began openly disclose theyr naughtynes thaudyence people backbyte slaunder toke visure counterfaite vertue holynes lest shoulde fro thenceforth deceyue people nowe tyme required therfore putting forthe preaching vnto owne doctrine say francke doctrine suche one flattereth coureth fauour manne saied beware leste royall shew scribe phariseis deceiue youwhiche deuou wydowes house c studye soule healthe theyr owne glorye couet go long roabes doune ancle thentent maye appeare men geat perfeccion seke salutacions ye market place preferment chiefe seate assembly feastes bankets first place vppermost roume table vse also long prayer bycause maye seeme holyer reason souche coloured holynesse crepe fauoure blessed godlye wydowes symple withall whiche diuers cause apte deceyued eyther bycause weakenes theyr sexe kyndeth se shall receiue greater cio wydowes lacke husbandes defende el bycause ryche wealthy cum owne swinge vnder pretece patrones defendours theyr counterfayte holynesse deuour vp house litle shall hipocrisy profite theim shall greuouslier damned god muche couered naughtynes coloure holy vertuous lyuing therfore take ye good hede leste ye deceyued iesus sate ouer treasury behelde howe people put money treasury many riche caste muche came certaine poore wydowe threwe two mite whiche make fart yng called vnto disciple saieth vnto verilye say vnto poore wydowe hath caste whiche haue caste treasurye dyd caste super uitie pouertie dyd caste hat euer hadde euen lyuyng thinges done iesus went parte ye teple treasury wherin offered gyftes kepte sytting directly behelde made oblacionand manye riche cast muche caste giftes many riche folkes caste great giftes priestes woulde therefore shoulde bee counted holier measuring godlynes rate measure gifte offered meane season came also certaine poore wydowe threwe two little piece coyne whiche made ferthing none among preferred ryche folkes poore woman iesus iudgement farre differeth iudgemet scribe phariseis whiche thyng woulde haue disciple ignoraunt tell sayeth certaintie widowe neuer poore hathe geuen treasury whiche seeme haue geuen mooste lauishely gaue abundaunt superfluitie gaue muche howbeit reserued themselfes woman lyttle poore substance hath geuen together reseruing nothing vnto selfe god doeth esteme gifte measure value thyng geuen thaffeccion minde geuer iesus pleased suche wydowe dayneth bee spouse conforter synagoge like proude housewyfe boasteth craketh vpon rich righteousnes boasteth vpo ryche ornametes good workes glorieth housebade moyses vnto neuer obedient auaunteth herselfe prophetes sonnes whome eyther slewe wicked murther least wyse persecuted hath euer mouth lordes teple lawe god patriarch abraha isaac iacob israel goeth garde priestes scribe phariseis churche like poore wydowe hath nothyng boast vpon knowledgeth lacke good workes yet litl hath wholy dedicateth offereth vnto god nowe poorer suche wydowe leaueth herselfe nothyng knowledgeth moyses husband knowethe circumcision abhorrethe sacryfices beastes beeyng contented wholely haue offered vp selfe vnto almyghtie god lorde spouse inasmuche hath forsaken yearthe returned heauen semethe haue forsaken wydowe whiche nowe like woman destitute succoure spoyled banished imprisoned afflicted oppressed bothe iewes gentyles heareth dayly thy spouse semethe wyll starue hunger whiche hauinge small substaunce hath cleane forgone lyttle lefte herselfe nothynge semethe wyll dye shortly wt reproche baraines whiche hath lost housband widow iudgement world past health vtterlye vndone prophete esaie comforteth wyse thou glad thou barayne bryngest furth fruit breake furth cry thou ye trauailest desolate hath many mo chyldren hath husbande doe se prophecy fulfilled synagoge hongry dyethe churche encreaced spred abrode triumphing martyr florishing virgin reioysynge many thousandes confessours hath one farthing owne proper rich spouse rich hath tried golde fine pure hath precious stone inestimable throughe sincere pure fayth towardes riche spouse whatsoeuer hath hath thesame synagoge albeit semed geue much vnto god yet dyd reserue vnto selfe sufficient wylt thou see synagoge geuing giftes heare pharisey praying thake lord saith one men nowe marke much reserueth vnto himselfe saith fast twyse weke geue tenthe part goodes vnto poore people syde marke fashion wydow knocketh brest dareth lift vp iyes heauen warde doth nothing crye god mercifull vnto sinner sinagoge while craketh vpon owne iustice hath neyther owne yet god iustice churche while renounceth putteth awaye glory righteousnes knowledgeth owne vnrighteousnes enriched iustice righteousnes spouse xiij chapter pand went temple one disciple sayed vnto mayster see stone buyldinges iesus answered sayed vnto hym seest thou great buildinges shal left one stone vpon shal throwen downe sate mounte oliuete ouer temple peter iames iohn andrewe asked secretly tell v shall thinges signe thinges shalbe fulfilled iesus aunswered began saye take hede lest man deceyue many shall cumme name saying christ shall deceyue many nothyng temple pleased iesus saue poore wydowe whiche temple nothyng el counterfayte deuocion fayned holines let v also professe selues disciple iesu departe iewish temple let v sette asyde truste carnall workes embrace ryghteousnes euangelike chrystian fayth therfore sauiour departed thence builde temple whiche holy spirituall dede buyldyng substanciall sure strongone disciple sayed vnto gate hell shoulde neuer able preuayle agaynste gone one disciple sayed vnto mayster beholde howe greate houge stone temple strong buildinge couertlye meaninge stronger piece worke coulde processe tyme fall decaye ruyne oh iewishe iyes outwardly maruayled stone couched heaped together man hande thoughe iesus bene delited suche buyldyng iesus answered againe seeste thou greate curious edifice shall time cum shall one stone remayne vpon another vnthrowen downe muche lesse shall buyldyng continue euer nowe iesus lotheth contemnethe euer seene bodily iyes greate desyre hath ghostly spyritual temple sate part mount olyuete chose lodging nyght whence temple ierusalem myght bee seneand sat mo oliuete disciple called againe theyr remembraunce wordes wherby tolde howe shoulde cumme passe sayd temple shoulde bee destroyed bothe stycke stone euen foundacion supposed kyngdome god whereon ceased yet dreame shoulde cum immediatlye destruccion thereof therfore fower wete peter iames iohn andrewe went priu lye vnto sate entet lyke shewed vnto fewe person apart misterie transfiguracion lykewyse disclose vnto beeyng fewe secretes concerning time kingdome cumme begin whiche thing woulde perhappes open vnto cause sayed vnto hym tell v thinges shall cum passe token maye knowe yme already cum present lord already weded disciple carefulnes sustenaunce desyre reuengement prouidence lyfe forecastyng howe lyue woulde also wede theyr myndes suche curiositie maketh man ouer busy inquisitiue knowe suche thynges nothyng appertaine vnto saluacion therfore tempreeth woordes thesame sygnifieth onelye citie ierusalem shall one day destroyed also departure greuous stormes persecution shal rise preacher gospell finally ende worlde dome day shall cumme expedient men knowe howe shall one day make ende present lyfe thentent may euer make themselues redy againste pleasure haue disciple fullye persuaded tyme shoulde lykewyse cumme would returne worlde agayne iudge bothe quicke deade time shoulde come expedient woulde wyse haue knowen therfore began speake matter suche wyse ensueth beware sayeth lest manne deceiue shall manye come wyll chalenge take vpon name euerye theim wyll fayne hymselfe christe craftie delusion deceiue manye vncircumspect person ye shall heare warres tidynges warres ye troubled suche thynges must nedes ende yet shall nacion ryse agaynste nacion kyngdome agaynst kyngdome shalbe pearthquakes al quarter famishement shall trouble beginning sorowes take ye hede selues shall bryng vp counsayles synagoges ye shalbe beaten yea shalbe brought ruler kynges sake testimoniall vnto gospell must first published amonge nacions great busynes rufflyng world shew cuming approcheth worlde nighe ende muste strayghtwayes warres moued terrible bruite rumoure warres moued dismayed therwith though thesame time wer already present thinges shall cum yet shall thende world furthwith ensue shall prelude ende yt come euen olde man bodye disease oftetymes thauncing foretoken body shal shortely decay perishe temperature quality thyng whiche preserueth bodely health reason thesame quality stryue one agaynste another whole body distempered argumente destruction thereof approchethe shall nacion ryse agaynste nacion realme agaynst realme one go great power hostes menfor shall nacion aryse agaist nacion destroye moreouer yearthe selfe thoughe content norishe wicked vngodlye people shalbe shaken yearthequakes shall sondrie place worlde greate dearthe famyne shall deny men theyr naturall foode sustenaunce furthermore ayre though angrye thesame vngodly folkes vnworthy life breathe shalbe noysomme deadelye ye see manye signes token yet loke ye byanby dome daye euiles shallbe onelye begynninge calamitie come neyther shall youre selues free suche euils trouble therfore loke well aboute ye leste ye bee clapte neckes creye ware men shall accuse brynge councels synagoges yee shalbe presented kynges ruler aunswere cause lyfe deathe offence euyl dede doen behalfe onelye profession name shall worlde maye knowe howe worthely caste kyngdome god sithens persecuted preacher thesame lette thynges muche trouble myndes cruelnes wycked person shall brynge nothing passe agaynst proceding gospell neither anye man slea tyme dome daye shall come gospell preached throughout worlde pbut leade present take ye thought neyther ymagine afore hande ye shall saye whatsoeuer geuen houre speake ye speake holy gost brother shall delyuer vp brother deathe father sonne child shall ryse agaynst father mother shal put death ye shalbe hated al name sake whoso enduceth vnto ende thesame shalbe safe nede therefore prepare worldly succour agaynste violence tiranny persecutours take thought escape iudgementes accion commensed agaynst loke ye goe appeare leste ye seme despise publike authoritie thinge also shall make much enlarging spreading abrode gospell ye goyng appeare carefull studying selfes answere make tell tale ye sene ye lawe men ignoraunt ciuill plees common sort people wonte carefull suche case make oratours rhetorcians theyr atturneys proetours pleadinge mattersfor ye speake whatsoeuer cumme vnto myndes speake selues shall authours suche wordes shall speake instrumentes onely holy ghoste shall speake youthe brother shall deliuer vp brother c suche thynges shalbe expedient busynes gospell suche persecucions must ye onely looke alyauntes enemyes also frendes kynnesfolkes one brother shall take lawe accuse hym deathe worthye crymes naturall loue affeccion cast aside father shall likewise accuse sonne contrary naturall loue kyndnes furthermore child shall also rise agaynste parentes cause suffer death ye hurte body brynge tydinges saluacion men yet shall ye hated loue world onelye dyspleasure malyce beare name whiche shall preache euils shalbe nedefull armed perseueraunce constancie minde whoso continueth good beginninges ende shall safe calamitie able destroye constant harte mynde beleueth gospell moreouer ye see abhominacion desolacion wherof spoken daniel prophet stand ought let readeth vnderstand let iewry sie mountaines let n house top go ye house nether enter therein fetche thyng house let fielde turne backe agayne vnto thynges whiche lefte behynde hym take clothes woe shalbe childe geue sucke dayes praye ye flyght winter shalbe dayes suche tribulacion beginninge creature whiche god created vnto time nether shalbe except lorde shorten dayes fleshe shoulde saued electes sake whome hath chosen hathe shortened dayes ye requyre sygne geue knowledge extreme calamitie hangeth ouer heades ye shall see abhominacion maketh desolacion standing ye place beseming stande let whiche readethe daniel prophecy vnderstande shalbe hyghe tyme euery man al thynges omitted lefte vndone shyfte hymselfe flyeng awaye saue lyfe wordelye aydeslet hym readeth vnderstand swyftnesse flighte lette al iewrye nourishingeste moste famous parte countreye flye vnto deserte wylde mountaynes calamitie take man house toppe lette hym goe downe house enter parloure chambre fetche thynge thence founde lette gette hym awaye begone season anye manne labourynge fieldes naked without clothes let hym runne home againe fetche waye cloke mantel flye strayght waye whither el swifte shall floud ye miserie calamitie whiche shal ouerflow coutreye therfore wofull case shall whiche great chylde also haue chyldren sucking bresteswo shalbe wt chylde nature wil let suche wt child cast away burthen natural kindenesse suffer flye awaye child onely way saue life shalbe flye without anye taryinge therefore desire god calamytie chaunce wynter season vpon sabbothe daye ye muste onelye flye awaye fast legges beare also greate waye winter season daye shorte yll tyme flye far law fendeth trauayle far vpon sabboth day youre flightall lorde hitherto sayed spoken suche wyse semeth partlye pertayne destruction citie hierusalem partelye tymes persecution whiche moste sharpe vehemente season stephan stoned deathe partely laste ende worlde dome daye yet included woordes morall sence whiche teache v howe beyng deliuered worldlye impedimentes encumbraunces oughte alwayes wayte cummynge daye shalbe presented almyghtye god receiue dome iudgemente canne neuer prepare agaynste thesame eyther loue temporall thynges el thorowe thenforcement carnall affeccions saye parentes wyfe chyldrens sake called backe agayne daunger losyng euerlastyng saluacion laden vessell beeynge ouercharged letted worldly ryches ceaseth thynges pertayne eternall health burthened mantell takinge hede vnto bodye regardeth soule slowe foote carying infant reason naturall affection refrayneth thynges whiche knoweth ryght well maner meanes exchew dme hasteth tayning whiche knoweth ought lettes impedimentes set asyde greatly desyred wynter taketh flying lytle lyght theyr weake fayth geueth charitie colde faynte doe finishe iourney manfully goe thorowe whither beganne goe moreouer supersticious obseruacion sabboth bryngeth person dauger reason vnright aukeward iudgement tremble quake feare cause feare ought chiefly feare dede feareles manne bolde transgresse commaundement god fearelest breake mannes constitucions lorde himselfe taught openly iewes sabbothe well contemned broken man health preseruacion furthermore wordes ensue seeme rather pertayne last day worlde day great businesse hurly burly shall vniuersally happen cummyng antichristfor shall day dayes sayethe shall full misery euerye syde hath beene lyke tribulacion affliction creacion worlde vnto daye hereafter shalbe affliction shoulde long continue shall fell cruel season shoulde one man saued god infinite mercye goodnes hath prouided storme shall shorte whyle endure sake hath chosen lyfe euerlastyng suffer none perishe storme euils soeuer shall arise wherfore cause man shoulde feare himselfe perseuer abyde still euangelike christian fayth nighe vnto shote anker surest refuge puissaunce shall cast downe whiche haue constant beliefe man say christe lo beleue false christes false prophetes shall ryse shall shewe miracle wonder deceiue possible euen electe take ye hede behold haue shewed thynges onely take heede stede embrace another christe shall bee ieoperdy deceyuers persecutours shall aryse dayes false christes shall vntruly chalenge take vpon name person shall aryse also false prophetes whiche vnder cloke coloured shewe holynes shall fayne themselfes prophetes working magical wonder miracle cloked craftie illusion diuelsloe c folowe prophetes euen electe power coulde preuayle agaynste god maye deceyued suche ligierdemayne iuglynge caste therefore anye man shall saye vnto loe christe beleue call backe another place saye loe place apperaunce thinges maner honour seruing god soeuer shewe beleue hym christ hath forsaken worlde cannot shewed pointed fyngers lye hid men soules shallbe signe token knowe anye dothe lyfe conuersacion expresse doctrine put execucion howebeit wyll cumme dome daye nowe cummethe wyll sodainly vnloked shewe himselfe hygh maner flashe lyghtening dreadfull wicked shall cast euerlasting fire againe amiable louelye godly persones whiche shall called felowship heauenly kyngdom therfore chaunce liue dayes bee ware ye embrace stede sum counterfayte christe loe haue tolde thynges beforehande remayneth behynde retayne kepe woordes memory pmoreouer dayes tribulacion sunne shal ware darcke moone shall geue lyght starres heauen shall fall power whiche heauen shall moue shall see sonne manne cumming cloudes great power glory shall e send aungels shall gather together elect fower windes endes yearth vttermost parte heauen nowe forsayed calamity warres persecucions famyne pestilence earthquake paste shall also ensue manye wonderfull signes token heauen elementes beyng yrefully set take vengeaunce vpon wicked people sunne fountaine lightand shall see ye sonne man c shall wexe darke therby embraiding vngodlye theyr blyndnes woulde see euerlastyng sunne lanterne worlde neyther shall moone whiche wonte shine night put awaye ye darknesse therof geue light yt boroweth sune furthermore men shall see starres fal doune firmament earth haue bene many hundred yeares fastened man behoue commoditie besides power heauens vertue whereof merueylouse body haue cotinued euen fro creation worlde course office appoynted god shalbe moued great shall feare dreadfull day dome approching thinges done aliue shall sodaynly twynkelyng iye see soonne man whoe nowe taken vnderlynge regarded appeare hyghest cloudes greate puyssaunce glory father innumerable multitude aungels sende aungels wyll let none chosen awaye wyll assemble altogether fro euery quarter whether quyc e el dead must sodainly reliued wyll send say gather membres misticall bodie vnto head thentet haue bene partaker affliction persecution gospelles sake maye lykewyse companion partaker hym euerlastynge ioye blysfulnesse skylleth whither good men soules haue gone neyther place karkases haue bene throwen aungeles shall fynde gather together fower quarter worlde againe hyghest pole heauen low moste euery soule shalbe ioyned vnto owne proper bodie electe chosen people shall lykewise conioyned vnto theyr head learne similitude fig tee braunche yet tendre hath brought forth leaues ye owe summer nere lyke maner ye se thynges cum pa se vnderstand ye euen doores uerely saie vnto generacion shall passe tyll thynges doen heauen earth shall passe wordes shall passe daye tyme knoweth man aungels whiche heauen neither sonne himselfe saue father onely leste day cum sodaynly vpon ye nothyng prepared maye gesse certayne foresygnes coniectures nere hande euen ye may coniecture gather fygge tree summer wil shortly cum braunches tree begin waxe soft tender bring forth first fruite called grossi leaues alreadye budded ye knowe sumer farre muche certayner day shall cum certayne summer foloweth wynter thyng auouche vnto age shall passe till thinges shall happen among corporall thinges nothing stable sure heauen nothing vnmouable earth yet heauen earthe shall sooner alter chauge nature wordes vayne none effect ye careful knowe certeynly laste daye shall cum forasmuche geuen vnto ye angel know yet sonne himselfe ye father hathe reserued secrete knowledge alone perceiued expedient soule helth moste certaynly assured shall cum aske ye leste meanes ye becum careles ptake hede watch pray ye knowe time man goen straunge countrey hath left house geuen substance seruauntes euery man worke comaunded porter watche watche ye therfore ye know mayster house cum euen midnight whether cocke crowyng dawnyng lest cum sodaynly fynde slepyng saye vnto saye vnto watche beware alwayes take good hede watche praie continually since vncertaine dreadfull daie shall cum vpon shal take good hede wyll truste vnto worldly aide neither put confidence worldly creature wholy hang vpon comaundementes ye shal watche refraining fro superfluitie bodely pleasure wholy bend youre selues holynes spirite vertuous liuing shal pray wil feruently desire thinges promised vnto stil perseuer cotinue profession gospell sata hath craftes deceiue euen wise circuspect person craftes must vse wysedom policy serpent world flesh haue entisinges wherwith delite mindes recheles folkes maye cal slepe securitie forgetfulnes thinges eternall crepeth vpon ere ware thinges spryngeth eyther contept el desperace kingdom heaue god wil cleane forsake chose loueth wakefull heedefull person yet whe haue done may done man endeuoyre diligence neuertheles cease pray fully persuadyng theselfes god yt geueth beginning proceding consumation euerlastyng blisfulnes watche thoughe god wyll forsake time praye thoughe whatsoeuer ye go shall cum none effecte without put helping hande lord y woulde depeliet fasten doctrine ye mindes disciple added similitude fit purpose shall forsake sayeth demeane selues faithful wyse seruautes woulde vnto lord make voyage strauge coutrey hath geue auctoritie ordre guide house hathe assigned eche theym workeas man whiche gone straunge coutrey c office furthermore hath commaunded porter watche feare nyght theues seruauntes vncertaine theyr lordes returnyng home still endeuoyre themselues theyr office dutye whensoeuer shall chaunce cum home agayne may finde theym watching certaine shall cum againe theyr lord shall eftsones returne vnto maye sum chaunce befall miscary while home straunge countrey sure god heaue cum againe albeit daye vncertaine therfore good thriftie seruauntes wont euer watche loke retourning cannot tell lorde cum euen mydnyght whethre cocke crowyng dawning daye lest yf cum sodainlye wyll cum verye dede fynde sleapyng slacke negligent doyng duetie speake speake shalbe borne vntill worlde ende watche euerye man muste watche saued euery man must worke lorde hath committed vnto hym especially aboue behoueth porter watche watcheth safegard whole familie although people doe sumtymes take nappe yet hath shepeherde leasure slepe nowe present lyfe wherein certaine differece betwene good thinges bad wherin exceding muche ignoraunce blyndnesse litle lyght lyfe saye comparison lyfe cumand saye vnto c nothing el nyght albeit thende worlde lord cum men generally yet commeth also euery man seuerally houre death therfore euery man particularly ought watche cumming euen vncertaine cummeth vnto sum late euenyng growyng age sum mydnyghte flower beste lykyng sum cockecrowyng wete olde age ye muste neyther truste youre strength age tyme houre death lyke vncertaine menne xiiij chapter pafter two dayes easter dayes swete bread hie priestes scribe sought howe might take crafte put death saye least daye leaste businesse aryse amonges people nowe moste holye solemne feaste easter drue nyghe say phasc whiche worde signifiethe hebrue tongue passing ouer whiche daye holy bloud vnspotted lambe delyuer v vengeaunce sleying swerde beynge brought egipt red sea wildernesse world bring v vnto heauenlye hierusalem countreye flowing milke honye iewes passeouer whiche yearelye celebrate kepe moste highe holye nothing el figure shadowe sacrifice like ceremony day forbeare leauened breade exhorting v hereby suche puritie cleanesse lyfe becummeth professour ye gospel two dayes expired daye called preparyng daye chiefe priestes ribes deuoutly prepared made themselues readie celebrate corporall passeouer like vnwise felowes wickedly make haste offer vp thatsame trewe lambe whiche solemne sacrifice many hundred yeares figured nowe full poynt slea iesus durste openly feare people thought good laye handes vpon hym put hym death gyle treason purpose daye moste conuenient thentent thyng newe testamentbut say ye east daye c shoulde agree fygure old themselues dyd chose day foreapointed vnto sacrifice eternall decree ordinaunce father counseylyng gether slea iesus saied feaste daye leste arise busynesse hurly burly among people doubtlesse iewyshe feare stande awe menne whyle nothynge dreade god iesus knowyng tyme cum whiche father wyll haue euerlasting sacrifice made departed ierusalem leste shoulde haue semed haue fayled place foreapointed vnto businesse pand bethania house symon leper euen sat meate came woman hauyng alabaster bo e oyntment called narde pure costly brake bo e powred heade sum contented within themselues sayed nede waste oyntmente myght haue bene sould three hundred penny haue bene geuen vnto poore grudged therfore feasted bethany frendes house symon surnamed leper one geastes feasted hym lazarus thys house presenteth vnto v agreyng frendly felowshyp churche whiche vncleane washed purified preuous bloude beyng dead sinne vnrighteousnesse made alyue againe death passion suche persones iesus loueth sit table rather priestes phariseis thought themselues leane alyue notwithstandyng suche soule symon lazarus bodye thus feasted came certaine woma hauing alabaster boxe full pure good precious oyntement called oyntment ryght narde whiche brake boxe powred al ointment vpon lordes heade sate table iesus neuer delited pleasure delicacy worlde loueth anoynted suche manoure oyntment spirituall meanyng churche lauishe prodigall bestowing oyntment vpon dere welbeloued spouse precious thing soeuer hath thesame reserueth herselfe powreth vpon iesus heade vnto honour glory due house ye churche ample wyse enlarged spred abrode throughout ye whole world swete sauour fragraut smell ointment hath filled euery corner part therof swete sauour allureth causeth many one desyre maye admitted house wherin iesus sitteth meate frendes sum spite enuy speake delicacy iesu iewes rather seke theyr profit glorie comoditie glory honour iesu christ certaine disciple yet sauoured flesh specialy iudas iscarioth contented mynde muttryng againste womannes fac e sayed thys wyse neded wast cast away pure good oyntment myght haue sold thre hundred penny money many poore body haue relieued losse oyntment greued muche made great murmuring agaynst godly prodigalitie woman thyng well loste employed vpo christes glorie yea saye trueth nothyng lesse perisheth sinagoge sparing christewardwhat nede waste oyntmet c wastefull prodigall owne person contrarilie churche regardeth price valewe hath receiued christe breaketh vessell rashlye powreth euer hath vpon spouse heade poore wydowe whiche cast farthing treasurie pleased christ hyghly doth woman content hym also whiche loue sake hath lost precious oyntment widowe knowleagyng pouertie broughte forth poore substaunce caste treasurye beyng riche wealthie lordes liberalitie onely geue euer also sustained lose vessel one gaue goodes lyuyng gaue euen body soule yf perishe whiche geuen vnto iesu grudge murmoure prodigalitie whiche pleasaunte acceptable aucthoure grace christ geueth owne plentifully thentent good sauour liberalitie maye spred abrode requyreth rewarde anye thynge geuethe onely ambicious desirous honour willeth knowleage well benefites hath nede suche prayse commendacion hath pleased hym thys meane geue v gyftes rich iesus sayed let alone trouble ye hath done good worke ye haue poore alwaies whensoeuer ye wil ye may good haue ye alwayes hath done could came aforehand anoynt body burying uerely say vnto wheresoeuer gospell shalbe preached thorowe whole world also hath done shalbe rehearsed remembraunce lord whome alone sufficient alowed defendeth godly diligence woman agaynst disciple muttryng murmuryng herfor ye haue poore c saith make busines woman suffer take pleasure hath done good turne whereas cloke couetousnesse pretence socour pore knowe ye whatsoeuer geue thesame geue poore body commune poore folkes beggers shall euer haue maye good vnto helpe oft ye wyll ye shal alwayes haue present wyn fauour corporall benefytes haue lyfe tyme thus honoured thing done done thentent many take ensaple therby vse manour bodilye refreshinges men spirituall sence meaning doe like woma wotteth doth yet godly endeuour diligence doeth muche lyeth death nere hande desyre anoint body muste bee buried shall haue tyme preueuteth tyme yeldeth honour while aliue canot geue whe dead true godly endeuoire whiche speake murmour shall lacke condigne worthye prayse death shall preaching gospel renoumed spoke throughout al whole world shall lykewyse bee remembred spoken honoured wyth suche gyft present dyed pand iudas iscarioth one twelue went awaye vnto hye priestes betra e hym vnto hearde glad promysed woulde geue hym moneye sought howe might conueniently betraye hym wordes lorde caused disciple cease muttring iudas iscarioth one twelue vntruely dispensed common money geuen reliefe poore could wyse suffer losse oyntmentwhen heard glad went streightwayes vnto highe priestes betraye iesus vnto vnknowen vnto hym studyed take deceyte treason highe priestes hearde ryghte glad pleased well one householde iesu shoulde bee chiefe worker mischiefe agreed sum money iudas shoulde haue labour mutuall faith founde wicked counsell conspiracie whiche seldome kept honest leafull couenauntes iudas beleued bare promise priestes without eyther wrytyng witness surety ymagined himselfe whiche waye might betraye iesu vnto sayed priestes scribe sorte desyred saye tyme place conuenient leste anye busynesse insurreccion ryse hereof condicion expressed couenaunt meane time whyles iudas hye priestes counsayled together destroye iesu went businesse mannes saluacion p fyrste daye swete bred offered passeouer disciple saied vnto wilt thou go prepare thou maiest eate passeouer sendeth forth two disciple saith vnto go ye citie shal mete man bearing pitcher water folowe whithersoeuer goeth saye ye goodman house maister saith geste chamber shal eate passeouer disciple shewe greate parloure paued prepared make ready v disciple wente forth came citie founde sayed vnto made ready passeouer nowe fyrst daye feast swete breade cum daie iewes wot offer vp easter lambe therfore iesus disciple said vnto whither wilt thou go prepare thee thy easter souper iesus sent two make prouision therfore saying vnto go ye citie assone ye bee entred shall meete man carying pitcher water folowe ye house soeuer entreth saye woordes good man house name maister saith soupyng chaber maye eate easter lambe disciple shall straightwayes shewe large souping chamber paued already prepared feast shalbe made therin prepare v easter souper marke simple obedience apostle suche obedience also shewed sente fetche ass foale marke also nothyng hyd vnknowe vnto lorde manifest plaine hereby foreknewe willyngly suffered whatsoeuer suffered cause marke authoritie naming worde lorde maister asse byanby let go againe naming thesame worde soupyng chamber furthwith shewed appeareth hereby power whatsoeuer woulde could becke haue restrained priestes phariseis went cruelly tourment hym put death disciple went theyr waye came citie founde one carying water pitcher folowed entred house went declared vnto goodman house maisters commaundement without tarying shewed soupyng chamber wherin disciple prepared theyr easter lambe saye last mysticall souper whiche represent fygure olde lawe also sacramentally present exhibite vnto sacrifyce newe lawe gospell nowe euentyde came twelue sate borde dyd eate iesus sayed uerely saye vnto one eateth shall betraye began sory saye one one another sayd answered sayde vnto one twelue euen dippeth platter sonne man truly goeth wrytten wo sonne betraied good neuer borne euentyde iesus folowed twelue disciple chosen felowes pleasure shoulde witness shoulde bee doen moste holy feast maundye set table takyng repast iesus sayed vnto theim assure one eateth shall betraye sayed eleuen stryken great sorowe pensiuenesse none knewe himselfe fautie saue iudas yet durste truste weakenesse frailtie man nature therfore eche desyrous delyuered pensiue carefulnesse lordes discrying traytoure sayed vnto hym neyther iudas knewe hymselfe culpable ashamed saye rest maister iesus shewe vnto disciple perfite ensample leuitie mekenesse thoughte better suffre troubled heauinesse bewraye traytoure vsyng wayes meanes coulde cause hym returne wicked mischieuous purpose therfore sayd shall one twelueit one twelue c familiare dippeth platter rewarde whiche geue gentle familiar entertainement nowe iudas perceiued vnknowen vnto lord aboutes wet sawe also suche mekenesse hym lyke heard iesus would discrie anone moste falsly betrayed vnto death vnto residewe disciple would peraduenture treason opened haue cruelly handled hym theyr maisters sake oh vncurable malice stone diamod would great gentlenesse make relent specially hym could hurt displease becke thesame ge tlenesse encouraged wretch wicked mischieuous dede went iesus foorth tale wyse howbeit concernyng nothing shall doen otherwise selfe prophetes haue sayed prophecied sonne man shall expedient great many delyuered betrayed death yet woe bee hym throughe whose malice wickednessebut wo man shalbe betrayed procureth thing shal soule health himselfe vtter confusio better neuer borne howbeit wicked mynde purpose iudas neuer whit refourmed neither great mekenesse lord yet dread great horrible punishmente whiche threatned withall great michiefe couetousnesse pand eate iesus toke bread geuen thankes brake gaue sayd take eate body toke cup whe geuen thankes toke dranke sayde vnto bloude new testamet shed many uerely saye vnto drynke fruite vyne vntill daye drinke newe kyngdom god sayed grace went mount oliuete iesus sayth vnto al ye shall bee offended night wrytten smite shepheard shepe shall scattered risen againe wyll go galile peter sayd vnto hym though men offended yet wyll iesus sayeth vnto uerely saye vnto daye euen nighte cocke crowe twise thou shalt deny three time spake vehemetly shoulde dye denye likewise also sayde furthermore souper iesus commended vnto disciple moste holy sacrement signe death perpetuall couenaunt made would continue euagelike christia faith cause toke bread thankes geuen god father brake gaue eche saying take eate body also toke cup thankes geuen gaue drake therof said vnto bloud newe testamet shall shed many well assured shall tell henceforth wil drinke fruit vine tyll daie drinke new kyngdome god souper done grace sayde laude praise god according manoure custome nighte departed ierusalem vnto mout oliuete must euer thanke praise god weale woeall ye shal offended c iesus knowyng frailtie weakenesse disciple prepared stregthned theyr myndes myght able suffre storme persecucion hanged ouer heades ye saith shall troubled night cause thyng esay also prophecie wyll smyte saith shepherd shepe shall bee scattered abrode dispayre ye death shall trouble cause disperse scatter abrode shal resurreccion recomfort gather together wil reliue said thyrde day reliued go galile ye haue sene shall put away sorowe heuinesse peter yet knewe owne weakenesse heard say answered manfully yet rashely withal saying although residewe offended thy death yet truly troubled therwith whit iesus desyrous cleane wede plucke myndes truste selues sayth vnto peter thou deniest thyng shalbe done whiche prophetes selfe bene thy parte beleue wise gainsaye contrary wordes haue tolde shall cum passe thou rashe promiser yea stronger thou thynkest thy selfe notably shalt thou troubled aboue thyng assure cocke crow twise night thou shalt thrise deny yet presumpcion peter nothing abated herewithbefore cocke crowe twyse c insomuche maketh stoute greater promise himselfe dyd saying yea remedy must nedes euen dye yet wyl neuer deny peter sayd sayd rest disciple thentent erring together shoulde bee refourmed together theyr errour knowe howe vnable thyng owne strength power finally perceyue possible thyng bee vaine vntrue came christes mouth litle al agreed together co fessing truly christ comune opinion al praised peter agree altogether rashe confidence trust theselues peter alone rashenesse rebuked peter denied iesu rest would haue doen like occasion geuen would haue denied yf fled awaye bolde stomacke peter whiche constaunt hym brought daunger none thynges chaunced vnto disciple set malyce happened iudas onely man imbecillitie weakenesse therfore iesus vsed obstinate wickednesse iudas saluacion would haue weakenes frailtie apostle diuersely declared teache manne shoulde warrand hymselfe ought owne strength whensoeuer storme yuels aduersities aryseth wholely hang vpon heauenlye ayde socoure whiche muche presently helpeth man distrusteth owne strengthe power apostle coulde yet bee reproued worde time would cum experience matier lengthe make knowe themselues came place whiche named gethsemany saieth disciple sit ye whyle go aside praie taketh hym petre iames iohn began waxe abashed agony sayeth vnto soule heuy euen vnto death tary ye watche went foorth lyttle fel downe flat gound prayed possible houre myght passe sayd abba father thinges possible vnto take away cup neuerthelesse wyll thou wyll doen therfore came place called gethsemamy gethsemany valey lying foote mout oliuete man mounte vp crosse iesu vnlesse first cum downe vnto valey vnlesse huble abase himselfe renouncyng aydes socours man pride loftinesse commaunded eight tarrie takyng vnto hym three saye peter iames iohn gate awaye farre woulde geue himselfe praier contemplacion behold engine artilerye gospell violence persecucions two thinges iesu moste contrarye wete diuine maiestie whiche nothyng higher excellencie humayne weakenesse whiche nothing vile lesse reputacion vnto three disciple giuen taste highnesse diuine maiestie wyll pleasure shoulde nowe witness greatest abasyng hymselfe humilitie thentent christe learne ought counterfayte ensue also hope nowhere appeared face shynyng glisteryng lyke sunne apparayle whyter snow moyses hely comunyng hym bee shortemy soul heuy eue vnto death hearde father voyce man vtterly forsaken destitute helpe socoure beganne bee soore troubled feare dismayed great anguish agony mynde naturall man notably expressed hymselfe wont chaunce vnto persones nothyng el men whensoeuer suche storme hangeth ouer neyther dyd cloke dissemble thing amog frendes thorowly sayde feele minde sorow heuinesse lykest vnto death sought comfort euery found none yet certaine kynde solace comforte complayne vnto fredes calamitie though helpe v therfore commaunded also three tarry watche done went forth litle one cleane destitute worldly comforte vtterly forlorne paste helpe touchyng man helpe fled vnto father socoure yet byanby eased griefe wherfore fell flatte grounde lying grouelyng prayed father possible tyme battaile might passe awaye nature body feared tourment death nye hand abba father sayd thou canste thinges take awaye cup drinke therof neuertheles let doen thy hath decreed whiche wylleth nothing moste expedient best weakenesse body desyreth pand came founde sleping saith peter symon slepest thou couldest thou watche one houre watche ye praie lest ye enter temptacion spirite truly ready fleshe weake agayne went asyde prayed spake thesame wordes returned found aslepe agayn yes heauy neyther wyst answere came thyrde tyme sayde vnto slepe hence forth take ease enough houre cum beholde sonne man betrayed handes sinner ryse ye vp let v go loe betrayeth hand mediatly whyle yet spake climeth iudas one twelue greate numbre people swerdes staues hye priestes scribe elder betrayed geuen general token saying whosoeuer kisse take leade hym away warely sone cum goeth streightway hym saieth vnto hym maister maister kyssed hym layed theyr handes toke hym one stoode drue swerde smote seruaunt hie priest cut eare thus prayed returned vnto three disciple whome left behinde found nowe sleping called peter litle made stout promyse saying simo slepest thou couldest thou watche much one houre tyme admitteth sluggishenesse slepeth goeth destroye v watche praye lest ye entre temptacion ye shall bee ieopardy bee ouercomen therwith cum vpon ye nothyng prepared perill like commune vnto v watche praye health safetieand againe went asyde c doe like wyse watche praye maye ouercome spirite ready wyllyng fleshe weake spirite must stayed stablyshed watchyng prayer leste fleshe haue vpper hande iesus thus spoken went eftsones place fro whece came made prayer vnto father like tenour wordes dyd desyring hym might drinke cup hand anon returned disciple founde agayne slepyng napped beholdyng maiestie insomuch peter wiste sayde like manour slepe beholdyng infirmitie weakenesse knowe well answere make hym rebukynge iesus returned third tyme prayer vnto sayed disciple thirde time founde slepe bothe perished vnles iesus watched prayed v al therfore wakened rebuked would styrre vp awaken slewthfull person slepe ye sayde henceforth take reast haue slepte ynoughe thing selfe waken whether point momente tyme already cumme lo sonne manne shall anon betrayed delyuered theyr handes set mischiefeand immediatlye yet spake c ryse vp let v go mete lord iesus prayer made strong mynde storme affliccions hand neither shewed time afterward token feare werines gaue v ensaple moste costaunt stedfast pacience vnto last houre sooner spoken wordes iudas iscarioth one numbre twelue chosen disciple amonges taken chiefe cum hym great bende souldiers fensed sweardes staues iesus without armour weaponlesse neither lacked authoritie hie priestes scribe head men people sent power marke good reader notable conflicte euangelike christian godlynesse againste fayned counterfayte holynesse thus truthe ghospell daylye assaulted thus doeth alwayes ouercum get victorie none meter betraye professing hymselfe preacher teacher thesame teacheth thinges fleshe muche ieopardie false doctrine swerdes staues souldiours notorious open misdoers yet dyd iudas well trust owne strength policie betraye lorde ioyned vnto hym great bende souldiers wel weaponed besydes authoritie state saye spiritualitie teporalitie thynges dyd night hauing awayted well oportunitie place tyme muste nedes moste horrible darkenesse iesus bound taken power darkenesse satan suffered whyle seme haue vanquished ouercum christ greater blindnesse could go mannes policie betraye hym vnto nothyng vnknowen swerdes staues assault becke hym luste iudas dyd openly shewe hymselfe captaine vngracious compaignie gaue firste token saying whomsoeuer kysse iesus laye ye handes vpon hym leade hym charely lest scape fro priestes well ware money disbursed vnlesse iesus handes custodie began iudas go prety waye souldiers though goen sumwhat el yet went euer sight anon cu vnto iesus saluted kyssed according vnto accustomed manoure neyther dyd iesus abate parte ientilnesse towardes traytour nipped conscience saying frende entent art thou cumme knew right wel howe would neuer tourne wickednesse yet vsed meanes myght beand tha rayed hym geuen c refourme hym teachyng v hereby vse gentlenesse fayre meanes possible towardes synners vncertaine whether one daye tourne cum amedment amend haue wun soule health euenchristen yf amede yet shall gentle demenure vnrewarded kysse sygne mutuall loue charitie charitie declareth v disciple iesu wherfore greater point enmitie fayned kysse certes kysse false prophetes e e dayes gyue vnto iesu whiche vnder pretence christian godlynesse serue belyes seke prayse world stede spirituall fredoe teache iewishe religion token mous kysse souldiers layed handes hym bound hym disciple sawe rufflyng busynesse waxed fumishe angrye nowe peter cleane forgettyng ye lorde tolde hym thought tyme cum wherin shoulde part summe worthy feate according right couragiouslye lyke bolde man promised drewe swearde strake high bishop seruaunt called malchus fierse restand one ode c first hasted laye handes iesus howbeit lorde ordred stroke right hande dyd malchus harme saue alonely cut right eare whiche thesame moste gracious lord anone rebuked disciple restored agayne made hym amendes hurt small daungerles wounde beneficiall iesus men ought ashamed haue muche wyll entente reuenged vpon man saye hurte suche hath deserued displeasure pand iesus answered sayde vnto ye cum vnto thefe swerdes aues take dayly temple teaching ye toke thinges cum passe scripture fulfilled forsoke hym ranne awaye folowed hym certaine young man clothed lynnen vpon bare young menne caught hym left lynnen garment fled thence naked iesus awaie hye priest came hye priestes elder scribe peter folowed hym great waye euen tyll cumme palace hye prieste sate seruauntes warmed hymselfe fyre iesus defended aydes swerd gospel whiche pearceth innermost partes men harte wil armed company souldiers know could haue apprehended puissaunce power man vnlesse willinglye wittingly put hymselfe handes takeni dayly temple therfore turned vnto sayed sir ayleth cum hyther midnight sweardes stanes vnto thefe woulde stand defence lyke weapon daylye ierusalem priuely openlye euery body might see place moste haunt resort people meane temple healyng sycke folke teachyng trueth euer weaponlesse acco panied wt small number disciple wer likewise without armour weapon dyd ye take surely might haue done lesse businesse decreed tyme insomuche may goddes sufferaunce nowe ye luste shoulde scripture whiche ca notlye haue foreshewed many yeares sithens whan sayd might firste lay handes hym anon disciple fearyng themselues forsoke theyr lorde rane awaye sum one place another lawfull weake person flye yet able suffre persecucion albeit chaunceth tyme flye nothyng el deny christe must flye euen accorde hasten dye thy death gospel taketh disprofite commoditie flye awaye hyde thy selfe thesame ghospell hath muche profyte contrarily greate disprofite hinderaunce thou auoyde daunger therof sticke go mete hangmanand folowed hi certayne young man among twelue certayne young strypplyng loued iesus rest folowed hym led armes boud like captiue prysoner whose ba e bodye clothed one finelynne garment hym knewe toke caste lynnen vesture escaped theyr handes sauing lyfe losse garment flyeth spirituall sence flyeth happely el bodye vesture garmente soule ofte satan layethe hande vpon soule passe vpon linnen garmente saue thy selfe escape daunger nowe beholde howe theuangelike veri ie handeled betrayed wicked disciple eruell garison souldiers leadeth bounde chiefe menne bothe state co spiracie destroye fyrste brought vnto hyghest priest mortall enemy vnto iesu wicked byshop nowe matter seme done auctoritie thither assembled priestes scribe elder authoritie world whiche conspiracie aganste poore symple playne veritie yet inuincible withal al peter hert fayled howbeit folowed iesus loofe nowe cloked disciple meruayle sithe tyme drewe nere would deny man bolde stomacke good nothing el selfe make synner outragiously offende therefore preased palace highest priest sate amidmog lewde vngracious companie seruauntes warmed himselfe fire one would rather beholder lordes passion folower pand hye priestes councel sought witnesse agaynst iesu put hym death found none many bare false witnesse hym witnes agreed together arose certayne brought false witnesse hym saying hear hym saye wyll destroye temple made handes within three day builde another made without handes yet theyr witness agreed together meane season suche priestes chiefe dignitie amog euery one higheste authoritie wicked residue counsell leste shoulde haue semed rather murtherers auengers heresye vngodlynesse sought sum witnesse agaynst iesus wherby might put death desired nothyng el death destruccion freelye offered men life euerlastyng yet could mete witnesse found iesus onely man craftines coulde fynde couenient witnesse nowe came many iudgesfor bare false witnesse deposed hym witnesse simple sleder appeared moste vniust felowes themselues sufficient condemne whome hadde dede codemned alreadye among themselues brought vnto arraignement length rose vp certain person gaue sore euidence hym saying denounce vnto suche thynges knowe certainly bee true hearde hym saye eares destroy temple made mannes handes three dayes expired builde anotherbut yet theyr witness shall made handes manne woulde saying shoulde appeare blasphemye spoken lordes temple yet witnesse albeit aggrauate haynousnes crime conteyned sum truthe seme lawfull sufficient man would haue sayed iudges taken conscience matter fauoured defendaunte howbeit diligence priestes nothing el bicause iesus meanes quit escape iudgement pand hye priest slode amongest asked iesus saying answerest thou nothing beare witnesse helde peace answered nothing agayne highest priest asked hym saied vnto hym arte thou christ sonne blessed iesus sayd yet nothyng doen agaynst hym nedeth helpe highest priest bishop destroye iesu therfore perceyuing matter wet easily forward rose vp middes cou cel began speake vnto iesus sekyng sum occasion wordes wherby might condemne hearest thou sayth crime layed vnto thy charge haste thou answere make hereunto iesus held peace gaue hym word answere purpose shoulde haue answered thynges themselues iudged light matter wayght therfore highest byshoppe styll sought occasion questioned hym saying art thou selfsame christe sonne god euer praysed iesus confessed parte denye thyng whiche behoued men knowe pand ye shall see sonne man sitting right hande power comming cloudes heauen hye priest rent clothes sayed nede witness ye haue hearde blasphemy thinke ye condemned hym worthy death sum began spyt couet face beate fistes saye vnto hym areade seruauntes buffetted hym face knewe woulde beleue hym leastwise woulde contemne reason weakenesse body added sentence feare withall shall see sonne manne sitting right hande diuine maiestie cummyng hygh cloudes heauen great glory many aungels waytyng vpon meant seconde cumming retourne lykewyse lowe diuine maiestie iudge quicke dead wicked priestes ignoraunt lawe yet mighte haue learned phariseis cumminges messias prophecied prophetes one regarded passed royall dreadfull leysure compare iesus dedes prophecy foresayinges prophetes euer wente aboute nothyng el bryng hym destruccion highest priest clokyng wickednesse vysure godlynessethen hye prieste ret cl thes rent tare clothes therby make blasphemy appeare haynous detestable nedeth saieth witnes yourselues haue heard open blasphemy wicked bishop desyrous set forth owne glorye coulde abide heare christes glorye aduaunced supposyng glory prayse soeuer geuen christ thesame shoulde haue great derogacion minishyng maiestie oodnesse caused litle ryse place yet doyng gaue reuerence vnto sonne god doeth rente clothes prophecying hereby shall cum passe true bishop raignyng carnall figuratiue bishophode shalbe cleane abolished set aside glorious sinagoge rent christes coate remaineth still whole farther blasphemy set forth glory sonne god testifie shall come passe whatsoeuer prophetes haue prophecied cum yet vngracious bishop iudgeth suche blasphemye nedeth witness saith thinke one cosent gaue iudgement saying offence worthy death forsothe mete worthy councell suche priest nowe considered howe theuangelyke veritie entreated councels wicked priest faine would taken godwhat thik ye c cannot abide haue glorye sonne god auaunced scribe vtter thei haue learned prophetes head men elder people conspiracie chief prelate temple suche waged seruauntes hyred souldiers beare stroke theyr owne naughtie disposicion enclined mischiefe began spitte iesus thoughe lawfully condemned couered face vayle buffeted hym sayed prophecie arrade hath striken thus reprochefully scorned hym suffred people take hym prophete furthermore priestes seruauntes dyd lykewyse beat buffet hym thinges fell cruell death ensample ordeined enstruccion sufferyng reproche vylany none passed iesus workyng myracles went beyond hym p peter benethe palace came one wench highest priest saue peter warming loketh sayeth waste thou also iesus nazareth denied saying know hym neyther wot thou sayest went porche cocke tem damosel wha sawe hym bega saye stoode one denyed agayne anone stode sayde agayne peter surely thou arte one thou arte galile thy speache agreeth therto began curse sweare saying know whome ye speake agayne cocke crewe peter remembred worde iesus sayed vnto cocke crow twise thou shalt denye three tymes began wepe thinges doen vnto iesu peter beyng fearful beholder sate neyther parte palace among wicked bishop seruauntes conuenient place hym sithe woulde denye iesus hither came certaine wenche ye highest priest whiche espyed hym warmyng himselfe fier hadiyed hym diligentlye began knowe shape phisnamie sayed vnto hym yea thou wast iesus nazareth peter frayed wordes denied saying know man wote thou meanest conueniente stoute promiser might better know frailtie made afearde wenche thentent afterwarde boldly professyng name iesu ruler prince knowe boldnesse constant courage mynde came mannes strength holy ghoste therfore beyng afearde halfe mistrustyng place gate hym hall yet departed byshops palace while abode cocke crewe peter heard yet remembred iesus tolde hym greatly afrayed certaine damosell sawe hym began detect hym stode saying one theyr number peter eftsones auoyded saying lye denying flat apostle anon seruauntes whiche stoode whyles damosell knewe discryed themselues well vewed fauour appara le lykewise began knowe hym sayed uerily thou arte one thou arte galile firste detected hym woman oh peril christes disciple knowen bishop prince courtes unlesse vtterly denye hymselfe bee christes disciple standeth ieopardie lose life peter also ieopardie reason mother tongue countrey language suche manour courtes abyde syncere pure veritie nowe shall peter length made right courtier vp downe begynneth sweare depelypeter remebred worde curse withal neuer al lyfe tyme knew iesu spake spoken word cocke crewe agayne peter came hymselfe agayn iesus loked vpon hym therfore length callyng remembraunce wordes iesus spoken vnto saied cocke crowe twise thou shalt thryse deny wente forthe cayphas house braste wepyng yet went hange iudas bycause fell obstinate iuelnesse mannes frailtie weakenesse sufferauce god bycause fal instruccio showre teares braste iyes quenched lyghtning goddes wrathe anger wept goen caiphas palace naughtie packe euery one estemeth fauoureth himselfe xv chapter anon dawnyng hie priestes helde counsaile elder scribe whole congregacion bounde iesus led awaye deliuered hym pylate pylate asked hym arte thou king iewes answered sayde vnto hym thou sayest hie priestes accused hym many thynges pylate asked hym agayne saying answered thou nothing beholde howe manye thinges laye vnto thy charge iesus yet aunswered nothyng pylate meruayled al ye nyghte spent cayphas house destroying mockyng skorning iesu mornyng earlye cousayled together afreshe hie priestes elder scribe whole assemblie led awaye armes bound deliuered hym vnto pylate iudged theyr foreiudgement already condemned iudges becum accusars pylate accusacions complaintes heard called iesu asked arte thou thatsame kyng iewes iesus answered thou sayest couertlye knowledgyng confessyng selfsame yet pilate whit moued aunswere bycause appeared nothing wherby semed desyrous worldly kyngdom furthermore hye priestes lest meanes haue quit gathered together diuerse criminall artycles thetent amongest many matter ye least wyse sum thing fine would moue iudge vniust parcyall geue sentence hymand pilate asked hym pylate perceiuing howe doen priuate displeasure malice sought occasion discharge suche matter arrayned therfore whe came vnto iesus iesus woulde geue neuer word ausw sayde vnto makest thou answer sith thou art great daunger lose thy lyfe se many artycles felowes laye iesus thenceforthe made answere desyred escape iudgement leste vtilitie death shoulde haue let hyndered thereby also bicause knewe right well ye malice priestes woulde yet haue ceased althoughe waye preuayled hym cause wyll pleasure dye might appeare died willyngly emperours deputie albeit paynim yet dyd abhorre murthering man iudged innocent gyltlesse person therfore vsed wayes meanes coulde possible delyuer sawe well healpe behalfe whereby myght doe pat feaste pylate dyd delyuer vnto prysoner whomsoeuer woulde desyre one named barrabas laye bounde made insurreccion committed murther people called vnto hym began desyre would according euer doen vnto pylate answered saying wyll ye let leuse vnto kyng iewes knewe hye priestes deliuered hym uye hye priestes moued people rather delyuer barrabas vnto custome among iewes feaste easter one shoulde lewsed whiche laye prison anye death worthy offence whomsoeuer iewes desyred geuen vnto season induraunce certaine notable felo muche spoken vngracious dedes named barrabas stirrer vp sedicion citie busynes hurly burly made committed manslaughter pylate determined hymselfe vse occasion saue iesu therfore people cummen together accordyng theyr auncient custome desyre haue felon pardoned token theyr safe deliueraunce scapyng egypte pylate answered wyse haue two prisoner barrabas whome ye know iesus men cal kyng iewes ye therfore lewse vnto iesus pylate perceyuing coulde haue ayde helpe priestes went vnto people bicause haue ayde assistence trusting theyr fauour iesus shoulde haue delyuered without fayle malicious byshops neuer weary worke mischiefe moued rather desyre haue barrabas pardoned iesus pylate aunswered agayne sayed vnto wyll ye vnto whome ye call kyng iewes cryed agayne crucifie hym pilate sayde vnto euyl hath da cryed feruently crucifie hym pylate wyllyng content people let lose barabas vnto deliuered iesus scourged crucified thyng chaunced contrarye deputy expectation heard say christ highly grace fauour people yet ceased helpe hymand brought place named golgotha c muche laye sayed ye kyng iewes loking haue heard fauourable gentler sent nce wylye bishop circumspect hande infected myndes comminaltie theyr wickednesse neyther auctoritie suche bishoppes good thyng el moue prince people agaynste trueth gospel people therfore cryed agayn crucifie hym bishop also beaten heades shamefullest kynde death al chosen hym bycause name shoulde hereby counted detestable cursed among iewes lawe pronounced hym cursed whoso hanged wood studied onely bereaue hym life also vtterly extincte abolyshe hys good name facte muche crueller death coulde abide man name shoulde counted holy saue theyrs neyther pilate yelde vnto theyr furie spake har e againste saying emperours deputie lawful put man death vnlesse duely conuicted offence hath dooen wherfore oughte crucified deputie nothyng preuayled cryed outemore uriously crucifie hym yet al pylate shranke christes cause tyl layed vnto charge treason emperour conuenient iesu shoulde doen death excepte emperours authoritie serued fury byshops pylate perceyuyng daunger hanged ouer head one syde emperour clamarous people albeit knewe righte well iesus innocente harmeles person yet willinge yelde conforme hymselfe mortall hatred byshops scrybes elder people gaue sentence deathe agaynste hym thesame entence bothe cleared innocent crime also condemned priestes people pronounced hym innocent giltles whome let haue crucifie suche maner pylates shal truth gospell euermore haue would god dyd aryse among v byshops farre beyonde bishop mischeefe vngraciousnes therfore iesus condemned death fyrst beaten scourge whe iewes satisfied pylate deliuered hym garison ye souldiers crucified pleased high wisedom god iesu foutaine al glory put kyndes vilany al sortes people entent dismaide wt mane worldly euils aduersities iudas betrayed bishop scribe headman people counsailed together seruautes toke hym cayphas highest priest chiefe worker mischief condened hym councell theyr seruauntes scorned condemned person people cryed agaynst hym like mad folkes emperours name maketh iudge afraid herode despiseth emperours deputie geueth sentence al cayphas hym deuyl souldiers led awaye comon hall called together e ultitude clothed purple platted croune thornes croun withall began salute hym hayle kyng iewes smote head rede dyd spit vpon hym bowed theyr knee wor ypped hym nowe remayneth behynde wicked garison souldiers lykewyse playe theyr partes amog also cayphas al shame villany iesus put vnto destruccion maye sayed yt destroyed came caiphas vnwares wrought thing moste blessed holy made sacrifice without whiche manne coulde haue attayned saluacion therfore iesus caste iudged dye pylates seruauntes led hym hall palace iewes desyrous seme holy durst entre palace panim would come pure cleane celebrate theyr passeouer yet theyr mindes myddes palace verye handes souldiers owne enclinacion readye mischiefe prouoked incensed therunto pylate deliuered handes iesus thought made great force doen death herode fauour vertue goodnes iohn requeste peuishe wenche caused head striken howbeit fauour pylate constant yet conclusyon deliuered hym crucified doen leste professeth trueth ghospell trust vpon worldly ayde succour souldiers woulde take theyr pleasure hym puttyng hym shame villany called together whole garison theyr companion kage clothed garment purple kynges robe put head croune platted thornes stede diademe thus disguised began one voice salute hym saying hayle kyng iewes furthermore strake head rede whiche gaue hande ye stede scepter dyd also spit vpon hym bowyng theyr knee wurshypped iesus helde peace paciently yelded al theyr dispitefull doynges transportyng vnto owne persone shame villanye whiche due vnto offence aduaunce v vnto glorye pand mocked hym toke purple put owne clothes led hym crucifie hym compelled one passed called simon cyrene father alexader rufus came felde beate crosse thei brought place named golgotha man interprete place dead men sculles gaue drinke wine mingled mirre receyued thynges doen toke agayne purple garment put owne clothes thetent carying crosse amog misdoers might discerned knowen euery body malycious priestes caused done would ali nate withdraw menes mindes hym goyng place execucion met certayne felow called simon cyrene father alexader rufus cumyng ferme whome makyng refusall beare christes crosse souldiers notwithstandyng ryche man theyr acquaintaunce souldiourly malapertnes compell maugre head beare fauour ease iesus spedier finishyng execucion men necessitie constrayneth embrace crosse iesu blessed necessitie driueth man saluacion apostle enforce go christ souldiers vsed compulsion howbeit violence naughtie packes hath bene many mannes saluacion broughte hym place slaunderous reprochefuland brought place named golgotha c reason suche trespaced lawe suffred execucion called syrian tong golgotha latine caluaria whiche word implieth englishe place dead me sculles gaue wine mingled myrre drinke wyne customablie geuen men passyng howbeit wyne much corrupted bitternes iewes iesus receyued whan offered hym lytle dranke disciple would drynke agayne fruite vine tyll drinke newe kyngdome god hated bitter wyne whiche vyne iewyshe synagoge brought hym furth becum bitter vnto lorde tiller stede ripe grape yelded fruite wilde vine hated vine wycked person thirsted another kynde wyne newe wyne spirite gospell whiche spirite ascending vp heauen moste plenteously powred vpon disciple crucified hym parted garmentes casting lotte vpon euery man shoulde take thyrde houre crucified hym title cause writte kyng iewes crucified hym two theues one right left scripture fulfilled whiche sayth counted among wicked iesu lifted vp crosse crucified parted clothes among coate whiche wrought suche wyse yt could deuided caste lotte whose fortune shoulde haue whole nowe considre pouertie iesus hadde nothyng left yearth hangeth middes betwene heaue yearth must bee naked must lyghted burthen must high wyll encountre enemy mane saluacion dauid fyght goliad caste awaye al armour weapo saule whi dyd rather burthen hym hym stede thyrde houre daye nayled hym crosse set vpon crosse tytle cause wherfore suffered king iewes written thre language saye hebrue greke latine hym crucified two theues suche wise one hong right syde lefte eyther syde enuironing hym hangyng middes doen procurement wicked priestes make name shamefull prophete esai prophecied saying reckened among vniust wicked went ayled hym waggyng theyr heades saying wretche thou destroyest temple buyldest three dayes saue thy selfe come downe crosse lykewyse also mocked hym high priestes among themselues scribe sayed saued men himselfe cannot saue let christe kyng israel descende crosse may see bel ue crucified hym checked hym also neyther could malicious bishop scribe yet satisfied great euyls manyfold displeasure fyrst iewes passing crosse rayled hym hong theron vpbraydyng hym ouercum sayde vnto hym derision mockage waggyng heades withall wretche thou destroyest god temple buildeste agayne within three dayes nowe shewe thou canste doe put furthe might power wherupon thou braggest saue thyselfe thou able cum crosse neyther dyd hyghe byshops priestes vse gentler language vnto hym scribe skorned hym among themselues saying hath saued himselfe able saue hath made vaunt christe bragged kyng israell promise true let v see hym owe cum downe crosse beleue n hym priestes entended reprochfull wordes cleane withdrawe men beliefe iesu martyr euen daye ofte tymes scorned lyke reprocheful wordes rayled martyrdome corporall tourmentes veritie gospel verated laughed skorne miscreantes whiche many tymes hardly handled semeth vtterly oppressed yet ceased outragious raylyng iesus two theues wer crucified hym rebuked innocent honge crosse also dyd iesus accordyng vnto name saued one sixt houre darcknes arose ouer earth vntill ninthe houre ninthe houre iesus cried loude voice saying eloi eloi lamaz bathany whi h one interprete god god haste thou forsaken sum stode hearde sayd beholde calleth helias one canne fylled sponge full vineger put rede gaue drincke saying let hym alone let v see whether helias wyll cumme take hym downe sixte houre arose darknes whiche couered lande endured tyll nynth iesus destitute mannes helpe cryed vnto father loude voyce reciting psalme prophecy whiche spoken hym heloi heloi lamazabathany whiche wordes interpreted area muche saye englishe god god hast thou forsaken stode heard hym speake wordes vnderstode well hebrue tong sayde calleth vpon hely many suche false prophetes interpreter scripture euen tyme euer shall tyll worldes ende expounde wordes iesu better scorner cried agayn thyrst ranne one vnto aught sponge ful vineger fastened rede saying let hym alone let v see whether hely wyll cu take hym crosse eftsones tasted vineger woulde drinke therof thyrsted another wyne whiche woulde geue hym refused beleue gospell iesus cried loude voyce gaue vp ghost vayle temple rent two piece toppe bottome whe centurion stode hym sawe cryed gaue vp ghost sayde truly manne sonne god also woman good waye beholdyng hym among mary magdalene mary mother iames litle io mary salome whiche also galile folowed hym ministred vnto hym many weomen whiche came vp hym vnto ierusalem iesus thynges fulfylled gaue great skryke therwith yelded vp ghost byanby vayle temple disseuered thynges iewes counted moste holy syght multitude comon people rent vppermoste parte lowest shadowes cease vanishe away assone veritie cummeth light neyther nedefull priest entre sanctuary sacrifice offred vp made whiche alone sufficient pourge synnes whole world nowe whe capitaine stode right iesus minister witnes death sene manye one put execucion sawe howe contrarye manoure yelded vp ghoste dyed immediatlye geuen great skrike sayd truely man sonne god see fyrst fruites
