gentile confessing vertue power christe confesseth hym bee man sonne god confesseth bee god manne albeit captaine yet vnderstode sonne god man notably beloued god marke also sauiour euery sauiour dying crosse saued one theues anon deade drewe captaine vnto profession christen fayth also woman stode good waye behelde doen among whome mary magdalene mary mother iames lesse io mary salome whiche iesus continued taught galile folowed hym ministred vnto hym substaunce besides diuerse whiche likewyse folowed hym voyage ierusalem euen come daye preparyng goeth sabboth ioseph citie aramathia noble counsailour also loked kyngdom god came went boldly vnto pilate begged body iesu pilate meruailed already dead called vnto centurio asked whether anye deade knewe trueth centurion gaue body ioseph bought lynnen clothe take hym downe wrapped hym lynnen clothe layed hym sepulchre hewen rocke roled stone dore sepulchre mary magdalene mary io beheld layed euentyde drewe nye forasmuche preparing daye called eue great sabboth came one ioseph citie aramathia noble right worthy senatoure likewise hoped kyndome god man good opinion iesu bolde throughe affia nce nobilitie go vnto pilate desyre hym body iesu pilate meruayled yf iesus beyng youg man already deade manye wonte lyue two three dayes theyr legges broken therfore called vnto hym capitayne stodeby crosse demauded whether ready dead informacion well ascerteined ad dede gaue body ioseph iesus long lyued suffred hymselfe bee beaten spit vpon wycked person anon deade claymed dignitie would bee handled godly person somuche bee seen disciple apointed lyfe euerlasting teachyng therby man shoulde chalenge dignitie worlde let manne honour dishonour glory reproche onlye endeuour himselfe finishe businesse gospell dignitie beginneth neuer floryshe tyll death ioseph beyng right ioyfull hadde obteyned precious gifte bought piece fine linnen clothe therin wrapped bodye layed newe sepulchre hewed free stoone rolled great stone doore entry sepulchre man lightly conuey awaye body stealth woman whiche behelde lorde dyed two folowed hym vnto sepulchre wete mary magdalene mary ioseph markyng body layde thentent might time conuenient thither repaire honorably perfourme solemnity ceremony belonging vnto burial accordyng manour vsage nacion xvj chapter sabboth paste mary magdalene mary iacob salome bought swete odoures might cum anoint hym early mornyng first daie sabboth came vnto sepulchre sunne risen thei sayde amog themselues shall rolle v awaye stone doore sepulchre loked sawe howe stone rolled awaye great one went sepulchre sawe yong man sitting right syde clothed long garment afrayde preparyng daye daye lord buried litle euentide immediatly sunne setting lawful worke reuerence highe solemnitie sabboth woman ceased time make prouision spice began awaytyng ende nexte daye folowing anon sunne gone glade time come agayne men might lawfully returne theyr businesse came mary magdalene mary iames salome spice readie prepared enoint iesus early mornyng vpon fyrste daye sabbothes whiche folowed next sabboth ended thyrd daye preparing daie well disposed woman came sepulchre tyme element waxed faire bryght sunne rysing sayde one another shall rolle v awaye stone fro dore sepulchre stone great houge passed woman strength remoue loked aboute yf could get body helpe ye meane thus loked backe sawe stone already remoued theyr handes anone entred doore sepulchre sawe yong man sitting right syde clothed long white garmet sight though right ioyfull syght token good lucke yet appeared sodainly vnwares amased sayth vnto afrayed ye seke iesus nazareth crucified rysen beholde place put hym go yonte waye tell disciple peter goeth galile shall ye see hym sayed vnto went quickly fled fro sepulchre trembled amased neyther sayed thyng man afrayed byanby aungell recomforted swete pleasaunt wordes saying haue nede afrayed seke iesus nazareth nayled crosse risen beholde voyde place put body therfore haue prepared honour reuerence hym superfluous get hence rather shewe vnto disciple beyng greatly dismayed lordes death especiallye vnto peter denied hym thryse twyse sory rest get hence saye shewe iesus wyll go galile thither let folowe shall see hym alyue whome ye nowe bewayle dead wemen great ioye gladnes feare reason straunge sight fled sepulchre spake one worde long greatly afearde pwhen iesus rysen earlye fyrste daye sabboth appeared fyrste mary magdalene oute whome caste seuen dyuels went tolde hym mourned wept hearde alyue appeared vnto beleued appeared vnto two straunge figure walked went countrey wente tolde remnaunt beleued also yet iesus appeared bodye rysen appeared fyrst mary magdalene whome caste seuen diuels appering fyrste daye great sabboth early incontinent shewed disciple wept mourned theyr lordes death sene heard tell howe aliue herselfe sene hearde hym speake gaue credence vnto wordes cleane memory thyng ofte tymes promised saye howe would ryse againe thyrde daye daye appeared vnto mary magdalene appeared also vnto two disciple likenesse straunger wayfaryng man went hierusalem countrey knowyng length lorde retourned hierusalem shewed vnto resydew disciple sene neyther suche thynges tolde beleued moste parte pafterwarde appeared vnto eleuen sat meate caste theyr teeth theyr vnbelefe hardnesse hart beleued hadde sene rysen againe death sayde vnto go ye worlde preache gospell creature beleueth baptised shalbe saued tha beleueth shalbe damned laste readye departe hence returne heauen appeared vnto eleuen apostle sate meate iudas dead hit teeth vnbelefe hardenesse harte woulde beleue person sene rysen agayne death requisite se death resurreccion sufficient fayth certaintie gospell thyng nce proued mete conuenient witness el shall heathen geue credence thinges doen yf would likewyse discredite apostle reporte thomas begynning iesus sayed vnto thinges length proued right wel knowen sure argumentes profes go waye world preache gospel nacions therofhe beleueth baptised shalbe saued dyed men lykewyse men haue risen agayne nowe nedefull kepe ceremony olde lawe nedefull vse mo sacrifice burnt offeringes pourge synnes whoso beleueth gospell whiche thorowe death offreth beleue free remission synnes beyng washed water receyueth signe token grace thesame shalbe saued beleueth gospel truste obseruacion moses lawe heathen learning philosophie shalbe damned waye open euery manne go saluacion one waye onely token shall folow beleue name shall caste diuels shal speake newe toungues shall dryue awaye serpentes drinke deadly thing shall hurt shall laye theyr handes vpon sicke shall recouer leste preaching shoulde beleued shalbe ioyned therunto power worke myracles lacke euangelike faithin nae shall caste diuels thing selfe require myracles chiefe power vertue euangelyke grace lyeth hyd mennes soules yet aduauncyng gospell shall nede miracle thesame shall lacke weakes sake beleue shal cast diuels owne name mine shall speake newe tongue dryue awaye serpentes yf drynke deadly thyng poyson shall anoye shall laye theyr handes vpon sicke shall whole thinges wrought done mennes soules muche greater miracle wrought thesame hid sene couetousnesse pleasure body ambicion hatred wrath enuy poysons deadly disease soule disease shall cure put awaye name continually weakes sake suche harde belief miracle shall also oft time wrought thentent grosse sorte people maye perceyue disciple spirite puissaunte mannes strength power lorde spoken vnto receyued heauen right hande god went foorth preached euery lorde workyng confyrmyng worde myracles folowyng lorde iesus spoken mo wordes disciple ascended vp heauen sitteth righte hande god father disciple receyued holy ghost preached commaunded iewry also region countreys matier went forwarde notwithstanding world resisted bent lorde iesus puttyng furthe mightye power holy spirite theyr ministery euerywhere confirmyng ready miracle whatsoeuer promysed wordes finis vertuous ladie gracious quene katerine wife vnto victorious moste noble prince henry viii kyng englande fraunce irelande c nicolas udall wisheth prosperous health long continuaunce grace peace ghostely coumforte lord iesus christ lyke maister christ ghospell moste gracious quene katerine whan woman liued wickedly beyng grace called fro hir sinnefull life perfite repentauce amendmet came vnto sittyng repastein house simon lepre washed feete teares hir iyes wyped thesame yt heare hir head poured forth vpon head precious swete oyntment also anointed feete therewith well allowe hir deuocion hir earnest zele hir tendre copassion whiche oumfor onely among cumpany declare hir preset mfort forgeuyng hir euen hir offence wickednes afore paste also promised lese condigne reward renoume hir te dre gentilnes shewed muche afore presece openly protested wheresoeuer throughout al world gospel wer afterward preached suche wise al occasios mind remebraunce hir good hart thankefulnes towardes neuer dye forgotten luke euangelist paule othe apostle christ holy writinges onely make mecio suc men preacher faithfull worker minister christes vyneyard also whatsoeuer good matrones deuout wemen sawe foud eyther god glorified honour ad auced ye ghospell preferred word god furthered preacher mainteined yonglinges faith cherished true chri ia pouertie refreshed nede faithfull releued vnf ed beleuers aduersities coforted succoured suche godly wemen forget ne let passe geue loude praise comendation aswel due reward party selues also good ensau le encouragyng others doe lyke cause doeth luke gospel make mecion marie magdalene iohana wife chusa susana marie mother iames actes neyther forgetteth ne omitteth comend priscilla tabitha lydia damaris consideracion paul comedeth vnto romains phoebe marie eryphena tryphosa persis others respect hierome waite whole treatise entytled noble famous weme whose nobilitie also renoume estemeth measureth none thyng godlines deuocio zele endeuour setforth christes holy ghospell theyr godly conuersacion ioyned moste studious diligence readyng scripture wherfore gracious ladie although nowe renewe memory prayse manifold excellent vertues ardent zele highnesse towardes promotyng knowelage god holy word ghospell bee thyng due moste worthy de er e easy rude penne expresse apperteineth duetie standeth myne habilitie power accordingly sette forth yet present haue thought partely thyng nedelesse excellencie doeth ferre ounte passe praise whiche slendre vtteraunce hable geue shoulde therein seeme much lyke thyng would bring forth smouldring smokie fyerbrand bright sunnie day purpose helpe augment clerenes sunne partly super luous one syde men doe already know incomparable vertues one accord magnify thesame side yt highnes doth muche tedre seke god glory ye euidently declare nothyng lesse mynde desire vaine prayses commendacion worlde yet lyke shadow doth remedilesse folowe accumpanie bodye sunne lyght glory renoume doeth ineuitably folowe associate excellent vertue desertes true vertue great iust canot chosen glory renoume must aryse much highnes muche lyeth doeth flee glory sayeth phylosophical p isee nature crocodile whiche beeing beast floud nilus egipt hath propertie one pursue suppresse fleeth ide yf ye flee crocodile folowe ouertake forasmuch glory ph losoph er ined constaunt perpetual praise geuen partie common consent good people excellecie vertue euidently shewyng selfe partie dede vertue cannot hidden appere ca possible renoume dye whose manifold excellente vertues day day encrease prayse de whose artes monumentes consecrated immortalitie thinges builded vpon sand ambicious fekyng like bubles rayne water puffed vp vnce tain blast worldly vanitie founded vpon sure rocke god worde whence issueth lyuelye euerlastyng fountayn true glorye dede neyther may highnesse case refuse mannes woordes prayse commendacion muche matter l dable knowelage good thynges whiche dede v praise worthy vncommedable vayne arrogancie take vp v haue though grace farre fro ambicion also affec ion worldes rewarde ye haue iye mortall mane recompence yet cannot good folkes extolle magnifye inestimable noumbre diuine gyftes grace plentiousely heaped couched noble princesse though ye would haue well doynges hydden vnspoken yet cannot gratitude people hold peace passe silence though gracious benignitie require thankes yet cannot honest hertes people forbeare refrayne open protestacion acknowelage daily receyue incoparable benefites though modestie nothyng lesse seketh fame good actes blowen abrode yet canot duty brast woordes testifiyng howe muche thynke selues bound vnto highnes although great manifold benefytes whiche haue priuately receyued grace handes dyd moue yet could iust occasion publique gratulacio hold peace vertuous liuyng ue tedre yeres enbraced folowed still continued pregnaunt wictines ioyned right wonderful grace eloquence studious diligence acquirynge knowelage aswell humaine discipline also holy scripture edifiyng also godly ensauple enst uctio others incoparable chastitie moste precious iewell haue auoiding occasion idlenes contenyng prouocacyons vayne pastime kept fro al spot also al suspicion stainyng singular modestie coupled passyng great integritie innocency behauiour manifold vnestimable giftes grace among principally studious seekyng promote glory god holy ghospell haue thynges haue moued noble renoumed moste godly prince vniuersall worlde gracious soueraigne lord kyng henry eight iudge esteme grace e spouse maiestie among many woman nobilitie honour muche high pryce worthinesse alone picke moste deere beloued moste lawfull wyfe neyther doubte moste gracious ladie prouidence god hath fourmed aptised grace worthy mete spouse suche housbande hath speciall eleccion deputed prese ued sum high notable benefite como weale instrument glory towardnes likelyhode wherof lyke men opinion vndoubted doeth already begin shewe selfe noumbre thynges whiche otherwise bee loked procede woman muche lesse woman nobilitie brought vp courte kyng fortune commonly noureeth cockereth pampereth hir derlinges suche hir wil myndeth laboureth corrupt wealth idlenesse vanitie leaste al quene set place would becum fortune wanton might without controllement swimme delices prosperitie might occasion hir dote worldely felicitie forget god psalmes conteplatife meditacions highnesse lieu place vayne courtely pastime gaming doeth bestow night day studie whiche ye haue set forth well incoparable good exaumple al noble woman also ghostly consolacion edifiyng many reade doe well declare onely thyng true whiche socrates affirmed e woman yf doe apply theyr myndes lesse apt lesse wittie lesse hable lesse industrious lesse actiue lesse frutefull piththy acquiryng handlyng kyndes discipline men also godly ye bestow time howe littell ye set worlde muche ye thirst righteousnesse howe carefully ye seke kingdom god middes thousand occasios whiche otherwyse might withdrawe high estate therefrom ye muche tendre g ory god accordyng lesson christe ye doe first thynges principally seke kingdome heauen therfore hath according promesse thesame place conteyned doeth still owne prouision encrease vnto kyndes necessary coumforte consolacion muche better wise grace could deuise muche larger maner self woulde wishe ferre sorte ye could imagine loke blessinges hath eternal truth vnfallible promi se perfourmed vnto highnes ye seke hym worlde ye mynde godly contemplacion courtly solace ye tendre glory temporal comodities ye esteme knowlage word precious perle golde treasoures subiecte corrupcio ye preferre adua cyng holy word aboue al thynges ye ceasse power dilygence industrie sette foorth mennes knowlage holy ghospell testament onely foode coumfort soules doeth grace ernest zele first houre daye twelfth labour vineyarde christ susteinyng burden al e daye parc yng smouldring nonetide youre er e ut al e eding great cost charge hire workemen labour ame vineyarde christes ghospell ende thesame may fruc fy pletuou ly bryng forth al english people maye health ghostly con olacion aboundauntely replenyshed frute therof good captayne partly encouraging forward ouldiers partly shaming dastardes false ha ted loyterers ledeth guideth armie g eth grace ferre otherwyse weake vesselles woman sexe loked doe shewe vnto menne notable exaumple forwardene e settyng penne boke par ely great coumfortyng suche faine would doe good yf durste partely shame consumelye sluggardes hauyng good talentes dooe kepe faste lapped vp napkin liue idely meanes doth highnesse ryght well declare delite al studie endeuour al possible meanes enploied publique commoditie al good english people kynges moste louyng obedient subiectes bee nou led trayned readyng god woorde meditacion moste holy ghospell ghospel thesame treasour hidden vnder cloddy hard grounde field letter grace ye found ioye selle ye bye thatsame fielde withal wel may person sayed haue solde al sette lesse al worlde ghospell aswel obteining knowlage themselfes also desire helpe make thesame common others doth spare spend oute treasoures golde substance precious margarite christ speaketh grace seekyng great desire whan ye founde solde al ye bye thought treasoures wel bestowed mighte fortune ye myght fynde meanes make english men whiche would reade heare bee partaker grayne mustardesede whiche whan fine litle vnlearned sort english could scarce possibly fele see ye excedig charitie zele towards countrey folkes wise helpe sowe field englande cherishe fa e atleing yearth paraphrase iyes vnlet red least al sedes shot vp growe muche larger bredth herbe ye field spredeth braunches suche coumpact al englishe reader may therein fynd many place lyght bylde nestes whiche soules conscience may theyr ghostely coumfort quietly repose themselfes spirituall leauen whiche grace beyng ghostly housewyfe behoufe whole royalme england kynges maiesties dominion hath suche wyfe hydden whole fower peckes english meale east west north south benefite meane paraphrase al made sauoury pleasannt ice al english people taste texte gospel afore sum partes though alwayes speciall good holsom foode restoratiue suche able brooke yet coplexcio grosse rude grene stomaked englishme disagreeyng harde digestion yet ye procuring whole paraphrase erasmus diligetly translated englishe haue min ed made euery english man meate though stomake neuer weake tedre afore sum partes agayn seemed light meate grossest make dyd lesse child israell dyd manna deserte whan sayed soule qualmishe ouer meate beyng toto light readie cast vp godly cure conseruyng paraphrase erasmus englishe hath made ounde substanciall meate complexcions people may euery body lyke aboundaunce quailles rainyng downe wildernesse heauen suche best stoode euery bodyes stomake appetite desire pleteously fedde withall self meate pure simple therfore su defutie mouthes vsed none fine termes painted colour exornacions rethorike semeth drye vnpleasaut ye eagredulce sauce paraphrase made liquide rune pleasauntly mouth man whiche muche infected indurate blindnes herte malicious cancardnes muche peruerse iudgemet erasmus lyke doeth workes excell passe parte al writer worke paraphrase vpon new testamente passeth hymselfe therfore gracious ladye althoughe demerites ferre aboue al praise man fer soeuer made magnifiyng vertuous disposicion deuout study endeuour good thinges shalbe sure incurre suspicion flatery yet present omittyng al thynges onely englandes behalf make one emong rest rendring publique thankes highnesse well godly trauaile furtheryng knowledge goddes worde also specially settyng men worke translate paraphrase erasmus vpon newe testament wherein ye young olde well high low lesse ye ryche poore shew muche bounteous liberalitie deling makyng common vnto good englishe people heauenly iewels christes doctrine ye shoulde open inge cofers worldly treasure deale euery one suche abundaunce might make al welthy riche euer world ye haue herein doen dede worthy suche thankes rewardes lieth none god repay dede v louing obediet subiectes beneficial hert esteme muchelesse tongue pen expresse doubte ye haue doen good thyng regal spouse kynges maiestie acceptable wil suffre lye buried silece wyll one daye whan godly wysedome shall thynke expediente cause paraphrase published set abrode print vse highnesse hath ment say publique commoditie benefy e good english people long tyme foore thirstyng houngrynge syn ere playne knowledge god word excellente maiestie beyng man hert lord right dauid chosen destroy goliah huge cumbreous enemy israell without armour none weapon stone god word cast yng diuine spirite workyng lawes made england elected instrument god plucke downe idoll ye romishe antichrist folowyng steppe father lucifer hathe onely vsurped kind supremitie tyrannie ouer prince earthe aswell christen heathen also hath ensourged heauen hath lifte vp exalted hymself aboue al thyng called god making void plain commaundementes aduauncing pharisaical tradicions peruertyng true sence holy scripture wiestyng maintenaunce abominacions beyng afore god manne detestable hyghnesse beyng ezechias prouidence god deputed sent destroier onely al counterfait relygio swarmed amog v like disguised masker mummer mumbler vnder cloke holines seduced ye people deuoured house riche widowes mainteners al supersticion idolatry rebellio also roote vp al idolatry doen dead image stone tymber vnto god committed creature steade treatour directly expresse woordes precepte thou shalt haue mo goddes excellent maiestie say first daye wore emperiall croune realme foresaw executing premiss necessary people reduced sinceritie christes religion knowyng goddes worde considered requisite subiectes nousled christ reading scripture whose knowlage easily induce clere espiyng al fleightes romishe iugglyng therfore soone myght bee highnesse holsome godly lawes prouided myght leful al faithful louyng subiectes reade word god rule christes discipline whiche professed prouided holy bible setforth owne vulgar language ende englande myghte better attayne synceritie christes doctryne whiche might draw clere foutain spring ghospell running euermore clere without mud rather ye muddie lake puddle purposely infected ye filthy dregges philistine papistes stopped spriges driue v poysoned muddy gutter forowes maiesties godly prouision hath cum passe people long time led errour blindnes blind guide moke fryer chauons papistical preacher plainly see clere light willigly abhorre idolatry supersticion know dutie towardes god prince enbrace veritie verity sake see leauen papistes hath continuauce time default scripture soured whole batche christes doctrine see howe led blynd guydes pastours derkenes ignoraunce fel daily depe pit e manifold errours thesame guide thei see lyke olde phariseis time christes vpon earth corrupted sincere doctrine god word pure vnderstanding lawe teachyng people leaue poore father mother destitute contrary playne commaundement rather let treasurie enriched whiche kynd offring themselues e couetise inue ted dyd apply thesame mainteynaunce themselfes gluttony sensualitie wicked papistry deuised meane picke riche folkes purse poore vulgare people clene dengur vnder colour goyng pilgremage stocke man handy makyng vnder pretence sekyng health soule remission sinnes handes peter iames iohn marie could geue whan suche thinges asked blushed beare god tho ly autour gener good thinges blasphemed see lyke ye couetous phariseis passed lesse violacio breakyng god preceptes tradicions put justice washyng outesyde dishe cuppe innocencie life puritie conscience within offryng myntes rue lucre perfourmyng office charitie neyghbour sooner wynke owne blasphemy god remit small trespace committed weake brother fond ceremony lawyer deuised added besides lawe beaste romishe abominacion clene subuerted true interpretacion christes ghospell mere tiranie ioyned crafty delusion inuected christes church holy congregacion al thinges contrary christ wete stede pure faith christ requireth faith lapped patched cloke beggerly workes ceremony owne dressyng settyng forth stede religion supersticion offrynges stede charitie buildyng chauntries place releuyng mainteining liuely temple image god poore encensyng image stede pure sacrifice innocet life stede trusting god mercy trusting tre tals mass scala cell stede heaue purgatory consisting material fier thesame redemed wt money geuen stede declaryng free redempcion christe christ sealed precious bloud antichrist rome seduced simple people putte affyaunce remission synnes obteinyng ioyes heauen pardones conteined piece parchement paper lumpe lead ha ging bought generacion monkes fryer money stede holy bible legenda sanctorum miracle ladie martiloges whiche themselfes deuised neuer durst sette forth vntill partie made hundred yeres dead feare beyng taken lye stede obeiyng liege lord soueraigne subiect forein potentate abuse innumerable tyme wordes may suffice declare reken vp blindnes englad still continued god infinite goodnes bottoles merry reised vp vnto v new ezechias confoud al idol destroy al hillalters supersticion roote vp al counterfait religion restore muche litle time maye true religion wurship god syncere preachyng god word booke lawe say christes holy testament read people vulgare toung litle time hauing helpe mere texte bible people goodnesse god instincte holy spirite haue iyes hart soule opened haue onely espyed abuse afore mencioned thousandes mo whiche romyshe babilon hath certain hundred yeres holden christendoe captiue thrall also haue coformed themself syncere doctrine christe glad wyll earnest zele studious diligence enbrace truthe abhorre errours wherin afore drouned detest supersticions wherwith afore delited hounger thirst syncere knowlage god word goodnes god gracious prouision moste noble ezechias kynge henry eyght nowe daily minystred vnto likely would profite godly knowlage sum godly exposicion declaracio sum good syncere writer vpo new testament ferther edifiyng whiche sorte truely cannot one manne picked apt mere erasmus especially paraphrase highnesse moste godlye zele hath thus procured tourned englyshe whose doctryne poynte poore iudgemente corrupte dooeth without violence extremitie wordes vtter doctryne edifye conscyence declare many abuse detecting enemy goddes woorde supplanter ghospell suche true liuely markes maye easilye knowen cannot bee doubted bee vncredible furtheraunce towardes rypyng knowelage goddes woorde yf myghte shall stande pleasure one fayde moste gracious soueraigne lorde beeyng nexte immediately vnder god supreme heade whiche thyng verily would wishe praye god myghte frame two consideracions one people hauyng paraphrase erasmus shall haue pyth doctours good writer haue thyng sette foorth declaracion ghospels actes epistle erasmus may stand one alone good stede great numbre expositours setfoorth together herte dooeth wyshe ye setting forth god glory destroiyng idol confoundyng defacing popish trumpery publishing bible gospell christe godly highnesse entended stoutely entred luckily begon might thesame gracious soueraigne wyse prosecuted brought effect whan heauen loger willyng spare worlde must geue place nature shall call receiue croune immortalitie desire therof shal willingly surredre geue vp emperiall croune worldly dignitie moste regal impe sonne noble prince edwarde may deliuer thesame people well framed trained hande may al ease prosperous successe without let stumblyng blockes layed way papistrie continue godly trade nowe daye well begonne thankes god luckily proceding would wish dede hope lesse might nede put ferther trauayl cure wel coserue kepe thinges thesame stay ordre noble father mindeth leaue vnto dauid henry theight hath alreadye substancially cast foundacion reised buildyng temple trust shalbe burden young salomo consummate fynyshe whan tyme shall cum nowe perceiue selfe entre opening desire praier herte haue entered suche large fielde talke experience kyng henry exaumple concernyng trade religion hope prince edwarde right folower right ledyng father doth minister vnto except sodainly breake drawen wade fer praise hable long tyme fynde way omitting therefore present moste worthye moste lustely deserued prayses bothe shall tourne style sum treate luke whome pleased highnes commit vnto translated whiche comaundement whan came firste vnto grace name although knewe litle could kinde yet glad co maundemente dyd iustlye concurre determinacion myne owne minde purpose long time afore mature deliberacio also aduised eleccion apointed self traslate paraphrase vpon luke assoone suche libertie might make vnto grace testificacion duetie thankefull remembraunce manyfolde benefites afore doen mere bountie two thynges moued take prouince specially hand ye e luke longest euangelistes al men noted haue written gospel moste exactely aswell relacion ye apostle present conuersaunt christ liued earth also instruccions paul moste earneste full iustificacion feith piththy iustificacion wordes albeit al poynte doctrine throughly conset agre secod erasmus paraphrase bestow diligece others specially dedicated thesame vnto noble king henry theight thought could deuise apter gift preset dere beloued wife withal beyng like zele affeccion godlines deuocion thesame worke traslated englishe whiche certainly knew maiestie singularly well allowed moste graciously accepted latine perusyng thereof daylye excedyng muche delighted nothyng doubt gracious lady readyng therof cause lesse delectacion mind yf ye thing well doen sum learnyng perchauce coulde haue doe behalf none refuge haue benigne fauour pardone well accept mine honest herte mine earneste zele willing labour touching translacion selfe though iudge plainly confesse self many degree inferiour knowledge facultie others heare highnes hath appoynted translating partes though cannot self promesse hablenes take prouince hand yet hart better seruyng hereunto perchaunce hande hath doen whan sawe grace resolucion pleasure helpe minister courage myne hertes desire conceiued boldenesse attempt enterprise thing thought expedient shew mine obedience prompt good wil commaundement trusting though haue hable behalfes pointes requisite fully discharge ye office good traslatour yet haue expressed ye sece meaning autour grace latine tonge thinke vnpossible liuely expressed autour doth latine reason sundry allusion diuerse prouerbes many figure exornacios retoricall metaphores innumerable whiche cannot ye lyke grace rendred laguage latine greke besydes infinite sorte wordes whose full importyng cannot one mere englishe worde equiualently interpreted imperfeccion haue litle power laboured redoub trust poynte piththie significacion conteyned whiche haue one place sentence sum meanes throughly touched muche consider paraphrase say playn settyng foorth sence texte many woordes circumstaunce therof better linking one sentence doth require haue precisely bound self euery woord sillable letter haue take respect thexplanacion declaring sece noumbre latine syllable translatyng texte thinke requisite vse sum scrupulositie translatours altogether precise sum regard expressing sence thinke iudgemente doe better paraphrase selfe kynd exposicio comentary thinke nothing nedefull precise wordes sence kepte dare auouche yf interpretour shoulde sum place bee breefe english translacion autour latine make thereof darke piece worke onely thyng maketh text selfe derke appeareth luke haue sum businesse latine exemplaries thorough whose defaulte negligence vncertayne vary well agree sum hauing lesse others sum hauyng woorde copye hath sum beyng otherwyse poynted rest whereby haue sum place driuen vse myne owne iudgemente rendrynge true sence boke speake nothyng great noumbre sentence whiche reason many membres parenthesis digression haue cum place long vnlesse sumwhat deuided woulde haue hard vnlearned braine coceiue much hard conteyne kepe still touching stile iudgemetes reader diuerse sum loue length sum desire breuitie sum well awaye elegaunte speache sum ha e curiositie sum commend eloquente style sum thynke nothyng plaine enough sum wyll busie iudges men writinges nothing themselfes may please moste gra iou pacience suffer say poore iudgement satisfiyng reasonable first would haue euery reader require euery writer like owne witte conueyghaunce style phrase speakyng rather consider euery man hath veine owne eyther imita ion confirmed long vse rooted desyre playne clere growen habite cannot otherwyse write doeth sum wryters hate breuitie sum thynke al long thinges tedious yet neither two sortes reproued ye er good making fine termes apte stile flowynge ut curiositie affectacio like cicero copious nothyng might added vnto demo henes brefe nothing might taken away thesame latine betwene cicero saluste tully would leaue till iye eare also mouth reader wer full euen euery sentence saluste loth tyer wt whole oracion laco could abide length sophistes grece coulde copiousnes make elephaunt lye mountayne molle hill speake rather commendacion eloquece copie elegan ie stile clayme suche ou de tullie erasmus could haue proceded inuencion eue infinitely sum wittes coulde sum loue whan style like sum care bare sence eloquence selfe copie say shift termes vertue oracion thing chiefely geueth b kes latine men call genium life continuauce euery hundred yeres set store esteme worth many time readyng ouer thyng commendeth chaucer causeth woorkes set thousandes freashe hastye bokes hastily shootying forth lyke may floures wythering vtterly diyng first readying neuerthelesse man tyme englishe toungue none selfes vse muche passe writeth ornately hath sundry woordes phrase sum smatche natiue countrey phrase borne yet notwithstandyng sum whiche haue mynde renew termes almoste worne clene vse whiche disalowe bee doen iudgement sum others would ampliate enrich natiue language mo vocable whiche also commend aptely wittily assaied doe innouate bryng vp woorde afore vsed heard would disprasse attempt bryng vse another man cauayle easy thyng depraue small glory one man matter nothing laboure deface muche beste ought rather thus thinke one man hath seen haue see man barrain able sum woorde helpe garnishe mother tongue like saiynges proceding humanitie fauour encourage suche studious one labour enrich countrey laguage tullie glorieth amplify latine tonge therfore blamed rather commended thus muche say defence wryters style generall touchyng mine owne stile present worke ould straightly examined greke prouerbe saieth like case hold fa woulf are yf hold still hath shrewe handelyng cannot continue euer let goe ieopardy matter stad straite rake eyther incurre suspicioun arrogantie maintein mine standyng defence therof denied opi e ambicious singularitie orels must driuen graunte errour perchaunce lettyng passe therfore suche kynde trauersyng shal remitte whole cause tullie dooeth booke whiche entitled de iudgement first highnesse whome yf la r doe shall better like self others others saye resteth humanitie take interprete thynges best whome moderation rather pardone sum faultes condemne thyng whiche though wyll amend facultie knowlage iudge right resteth fauour wynke litle eippe stoumb ing long piece woorke learnyng skilfulnesse doeth woorke indifferecye affeccion finally dwelleth reasonable consideracion mannes infirmitie best learned doeth sumtimes erre man tymes doeth thynges right vnto suche one e ere heauy iudge man labour hymselfe eyther would bee would haue others bee say nothing part better could would case ye either respecte publique benefite whiche ment herein orels one towardes el iust consideracion take pene amend fault ye shall see shall onely thinke wrong doen also shall hert geue thankes ye muche tendre eyther poore honestie thing selfe ye would put helpyng hand make well thus surceasse vayne talke longer deteyne highnesse frutefull readyng erasmus whereof may redounde suche edifiyng encrease knowledge thesame labour readyng maye well bestowed boke grace commendacion bee one day set forth publique vtilitie benefite whole deuout congregacion churche englande yeuen london last day septembre yere lord mdxiv preface erasmus vnto paraphrase vpon ghospell luke unto mooste puissaunt victorious prince henry eight king england fraunce ireland defendour catholike faith erasmus roterodame wisheth long health honour prosperous continuaunce moste regall princely kyng henry sende vnto youre highnesse luke physician luke ye heretofore thesame luke speakyng somewhat plainly also large vnto eares suche vsed good latine neyther suppose thyng nedefull nowe matter spende laboure appeacyng satisfiyng kynde people commonly allege vnto suche sentece right great learned wel taught geuing giftes presetes menne ought haue speciall iye regarde thynges whiche geue bee apte party geuen vnto parte dyd thyng long sence tyme dedicated paraphrase vpon matthewe vnto charles emperour yea tyme also hath ryght excellent clerkes prescripcion aunciente custome vsage plainly declared kynde argumente euer bee rightly well dedicated vnto prynces though know neuer read yet thus muche vtilitie benefite gotten therby vnder title name worke better ha led fasies studious person according plinius finely wrote certain thynges euen suche onely respect reputed precious dedicated iewels temple certes waywardnesse sum personnes towardes bokes cum newely forth greate wyll bidde away bokes sight ere take assay tast meanes perisheth aswel wryter ye feute whiche hoped haue thereby also reader due profite vtilitie suche men hades one thing least wise shal title noble prince obtein whan set first frount booke wyll geue sentence vtterly naught wil disdain wil spet haue red albeit eue otherwise also godly zele affeccion sum prynces doeth make whoso sendeth ghospell kyng present shall seme good reaso men right good credite suche vse lye hath repor ed vnto well charles emperour case vacat tyme leysure maye great vnquietnesse troubleous state worlde bee gotten doeth gladly bestowe thesame readyng ghospell boke also moste renoumed prince ferdinando brother thesame charles muche often haue handes paraphrase vpon ghospell saincte iohn whiche long agon dedicated vnto hym yea furthermore ye right noble kyng denmarke christie e thing maye highnes also well knowen hath bokes christian religion often tymes handes greate desyrefulnesse vseth reade paraphrase vpon ghospel matthew shoulde ghospel seme vnaptly sent vnto whiche handler louers ghospel whiche ghospell certes vsed hades persones many remembre thinke themselfes christyans nowe although rate worldely dealyng suche thyng moste chiefely bee geuen partie hath nede sent yet rule ghospell whoso hath already hym muste nedes geuen may haue plentie wherfore thought myght best stande congruence sende euangelical physicion vnto highnesse asmuche thesame farre disdainyng holy scripture owne writinges dooe testifye ye haue aboue meane rate profited yf man geue vnto grace thing holy scripture apperteinyng shall seme muche geue gifte make amendes recompence pleasure receyued moreouer thyng specially aboue others haste prouided kinges emperours courtes may tyme tyme physicions ready prest hande beyng men exactly learned approued fidelitie take charge prince dye preserued kept health howe muche doeth stande congruence luke physicion reslaunte doeth scammony ellebour preserue healthful state body doth heauenly pocion deliuer soule fro disease violently hale men death euerlastyng yt vnknowyng truthe mistrustfulnesse vnbelefe towardes god loue worlde ambicion auarice riottous excesse hatred enuye suche others disease life mortall men subiect vnto dayly daunger falling iohn thapostle sayeth bewayleth whole worlde set naughtinesse neyther thing el reigne therin cocupiscence flesh concupiscence iyes pryde lyfe muche peril hasard said disease prince stand others made wanton derelynges fortune haue lybertie withoute checke controllemente fullfyll owne sensuall lustes appetite nowe seemeth shall spende labour vayne good purpose shal fewe wordes commend sette foorth vnto highnesse first luke physicio pocio medicine bringeth hym albeit put doubtes yt well one already dede ought vnto godly zee deuocion best wyse accepted forsoth excellent man luke antiochian coutrey nacion borne antioche citie whiche old tyme great fame power muche parte al countrey syria reacheth vnto cicilie butteth vpo name geuen thereof sayed antioche behalf happie fortunate verye rome self yt peter ye apostle first see citie antioche paule barnabas dyd citie receiue dignitie charge funccio apostolical present purpose luke familiar acquaintaunce comiersacion apostle specially folower disciple paule also companion peregrinacio neuer separated deuided coumpany linyng coumpany apostle wrote ghospell thynges whiche paule wrought luke beyng presente witnesse theim wrote booke whiche entytled actes apostle hystorie actes continued vntill second yere paul abydyng rome say vntill fowerth yere nero emperour wherof men gather consecture boke writte citie fully agreed amonge learned menii cor viii verye luke paul apostle doeth often tymes make mencion e aumple second epistle corinthian thus saith haue set brother whose lande gospel throughout congregacions writeth collosstas sayth dere luke physicion greteth youcolloss iii tim iiii agayne secound epystle timothe demas hath forsaken louing preset world departed vnto thessalonica crescens gone galacia titus dalmacia onely lukas yea point moreouer leaft v auncyent writer often paul calleth ye name gospell doeth timotheii tim ii saieth remembre iesus christ seede dauid arose death accordyng gospell c neth ghospel luke like marke wrote history gospell peter woorde settying dyd luke word biddyng paule hierome opinion iudgement luke expert greke tongue reasoaso therof wrote discourse processe story e act gromidely sort others dyd takyng entraunce first concepcion iohn baptist makyng relacion verye muche ter touchyng natiuitie concernyng babehoode ea certayne poyntes furthermore concernyng childhood iesus making also rehersall many parable miracle whiche eua gelistes loue briefnes let passe thing spoken one others went wh ferther tyme ye lorde iesus beyng assumpted heauen man alone seconde boke make continuacio story concerning churche howe first sprang vp grewe sprede shew self thus muche moreouer wryters affyrme lyke matthew wrote ghospell peter epistle chyefely vnto iewes dyd luke wryte gospell specially gentile one disciple paules paul teacher getiles write epistle vnto gentile except one epistle hebrues eaufou writer wherof hath euermore doubted whether paule wrote ghospel marke yet iohn e reason wherof beyng disciple set iohn apostle conclude written long lyued manne whiche thyng physicion euen congruence ought folowed ye cousa le paul wrote good touche liued single man fower score fower yeres bone dead wer remoued conueied achaia constantinople together bone andrewe apostle twetieth yere costancius ye haue nowe phi icion soule physicion body man familiaritie conuersacion apostle habled mo testimony one paul apostle commended praysed wholle consent faythfull congregacios allowed gospel many reiected refused luke consent al congregacions voice receyued make vp holy mistical quaternitie moses old tyme limyted whan expouded vnto v fowerstuddes riuers welling vp one spryng paradise whiche studdes water al earth vniuersall whiche quaternitie prophet ezechiell afterward saw wh playnly set vnto v picture fower mystycall beastes fower wheles one nowe thought good let v fewe wordes sumwhat speake pocion medicine hath geuen v wonte hyprocrates take medicine wherewith remedie disease body medicine ghospel wherwith cure heale soules toke apostle whiche seen heard christ yea rather veray holy ghost among physicions olde time certain kind medicine passyng great efficacie vertue whiche medicine called greke chr say god handes lyke nowe confeccion called manus christi yet neuer medicine inuented phisicions able remedie al disease body though make neuer muche vauntes boast call pa medicine affirme effectual muche vertue knowen u man sicknes olde age geueth place phisike medicine ghospel true dede manus christi whiche thorough syncere faith doeth altogether take away disease soules geueth immortalitie thing apperteineth onely vnto god certes thyng vnfearly ne vnskilfully spoken prouerbes grekes woordes talke physicion mynde beyng dyseased sicke yea sum hath beleued disease body also myght driuen away certayne hartie wordes aduysedly spoken hauyng certain magical vertue efficacie lord y phisicio liued earth wordes put awaye disease body neuer sore neuer log continuance rooted yea wordes raysed dead folkes lyfe agayne woord woord magike almightyful word omnipotet father christ also word driue awaye disease soules whan sayd sonne thy synnes forgeuen place goe thy wayes thy fayth hath made whole cosideracion hereof prophecy afore promised christ physicion sayeth booke sapience neither hearbe ne supplyng plaister hath healed thy word lord whiche healeth thynges thissame verily true phisicious speake afore sayd also mystical psalme hath sentence sent woord healed vtter peryshynges liuelye woorde father christe sent moses prophetes nacion iewes taken cure loked vnto clene healed onelye woorde father sufficiente vertue efficacie heale disease man onelye lighte dyseases also mortall deadly sickenesses marke whereby know speaketh deadly sickenesses whan prophete addeth theyr vtter perishynges suche tyme stomacke clene fallen awaye abhorreth refuseth kynde meate groweth sicke partie wardes death suche manier disease whole vniuersall worlde sicke cumming heauenly phisician whiche thing psalmiste litle tofore spoken solle abhorred kynde meate drawen nere euen gate death bene manye soondry dren he tempered philosophiers exaumple secte pythagoras academikes stoikes epicurean perepatetikes promisyng perfect healthe myndes yea heauens blisse moses tempered many pocions prescrybyng appoyntyng soondry ceremony religion seruyng god prophetes also made muche many temperynges thesame ende purpose reason disease growyng strong preuayling phisicke medicine auailed ne dyd good sauing encreased disease bewrayed might appere stomacke soule beeyng corrupte naughtie desyres beene euell hurtefull humoures dyd one syde turne theyr face awaye moral preceptes lesson philosophiers composed greate labour studye syde ordinaunces prescripcions moses made supersticious nothyng better men bittur chydyng whiche prophetes ministred good relice ne taste theyr mouthes therfore credyte geuen theyr promise whiche thyng father heauen whan sawe woulde haue thyng perishe created sente foorth woorde heauenly medicine delyuer people disease theyr soules onelye requiryng v acknowleage disease put assured trust confidence phisician lyke louyng frendely phisicias time cannot styll remayne bee euermore present theyr pacientes doe commonly vse leaue boxe receypt phisicke whereby party sicke maye theyr owne phisicians case shoulde require lorde iesus returned heauen leafte vnto v apostle medicinable electuarie gospell bothe easye readie euery bodye wyll take great vertue effecte man receyue ought certes take one profite benefite chiefe thyng worketh assured trust affiaunce phisician neither enough haue taken stendre taste assaye thereof muste receiued conueyghed veraye bowel soone receyued within stomacke vertue therof maye haue full course renne euery waye throughout veynes suche tyme neuer till begynneth roumble shake partie toppe toe hatred former life great troublyng confusion immediately ensueth greate tranquillitie mynde quiet conscience phisicians bodyes haue practicioners poticaries dooe ministre theyr arte vnder theimselues prescribers appoyneters must bee geuen sicke christ alone none el hath prescribed medicine euerlastyng saluacion apostle successours bishop minister temper due proporcion fyne beate powder laye place diseased receiptes theyr owne christes baptise water christe washeth soule cleane teache thynges whiche taught deliuered vnto theim christes owne selfe whiche maketh theyr wordes maye take effecte corporall phisicians dooe often tymes varie aswell iudicials disease also appoyntyng medicine thesame yea many tymes stede medicine appoynte thynges beray poyson sickenes accordyng saying greke poete many medicine good wrought many theim sterke staryng nought phisicke medicine euangelicall onely one receip whiche ought mortall creature bee either corrupted altered fynally conclude confect mo one simple althoughe whose parte duetie minister woulde bee slacke dooe theyr office euery man maye take ministre vnto hymselfe haue mynde feithfully trustyng mynde syncere desirous health euen chiefe head phisician alone none power hable heale whole manne season geue health hymselfe owne persone many tymes also ministerie apostle disciple ferthermore whole facultie arte phisicke hath two markes principally shoteth one maye deliuer bodye disease suche thynges doe brede disease parte phisicans terme called therapeutica saye arte curyng healyng disease secondelye theyr arte preserue continue healthfull state bodye encreace strength parte phisicke place ordreing diete phisicians dooe euermore sere hote yrons cutte doe euermore geue pocions scammonie consume waste fleashe men manier sleaghyng martiring bodye kepe lyfe sometymes ministre suche thynges maye make herte lyghte rie yea also geue bodye sustinaunce large firste ministred vnto v pocion faith whiche troubleth soule conscience repentaunce emptying v dooeth discharge vnlade v oure synne immediatly therupon geuen electuarie consolacion exortyng perfeict doctrine phisician soone hath made bodye emptie purgacion soodaynely geue vp sicke pacient leat hym alone hazarde ieopardie leste whan destytute strength power rage greater sickenesse maye take example paulsey generall taking dissolucion limmes senewes wherupon men lye bedred consumpcion repentaunce hath cast downe combe hath well shaken disease wha baptisme hath scoured pourged v made v emptie voyde al synnes bee suche thinges ministred geuen v maye holsomlye replenishe soule agayne beeyng well clensed made voyde wrathfulnes voyded tentilnesse mekenesse stede thereof infused enuie sucked taking thynges best put picling pollyng voyded place therof succedeth liberalitie feruent desyre makyng warre consumed awaye earnest zele peace cometh loue sensuall pleasure fleshe expelled stede entreth loue thynges celestiall wyll ye heare ammonie euangelicall dooe ye penaunce axe nowe alreadie sette roote tree euerie tree bringeth foorth good fruicte cutte vp paule lyke manier mortifie membres whiche vpon yearth whoorehuntyng vncleannesse wanton lust euill concupiscence auarice within fewe woordes foloweth spoysyng selues olde man actes hathe voyded ill humoures doeth fill vp emptie place agayne dooe vpon youre selues sayth saintes elected god bowel mercie bounteousnesse submission humilitie pacience supportyng one another forgeuyng selues emong persone haue querele agaynste lyke lorde also hathe giuen aboue thynges haue ye charitie whiche bande perfeccion seat peace christe reioyce heartes suche mannier house swap cleane broomes replenished euery syde suche ornamentes eiuell spirite shall eftsones entre vpon whan returneth seuen wurse himselfe thus euangelicall medicine hath wyne owne wherewith scoure mattier oure woundes smarte agayne auaunt come behynde satan thou sauourest tho thynges whiche god whiche men see suppleyng oyle thesame haue ye perfecte trust confidence haue ouercommed worlde heare heade shall perishe ye earde litle flocke kyngdome heauen paule hathe meate wherewith coumforteth cherisheth suche newlye conuerted christe maye fal agayne disease forasmuche yet weake hath also sounde substanciall meate maye kepe theim perfeicte strength growyng forewarde daye daye vnto measure fulnesse christe persones gathered perfeict strengthe whome thus wrytten actes apostle went reioycyng oute sight counsell reputed worthie suffre reproche name iesus man also gathered perfeicte strength whiche layed dooe thynges hym maketh strong consideracion lorde iesus ghospell exhorteth menne eatyng breade come heauen eatyng whereof geueth immortalitie exhorteth men eatyng fleshe drinking bloude meanyng vndoubtedlye doctrine whiche beyng breade soule dooeth make thesame lustie strong effectuall strong wyne doeth inebricate men bryng godly kynde drounkennesse euen contempte worlde lyke maner fleashe hath sound nourishemente bodye lyke bloude hath vertue effecte vnto lyfe though scripture god haue medicinable vertue power yet hath none effectuall electualye receipt pertaineth ghospel one thesame spirite scripture god yet ghospell especiallye pleasure thyng ould remaine wherin might speciallye shewe foorth owne power shoulde appere difference betwene seruauntes maister betwene puddels litle gutter spryng fountaine truely labour well bestowed considre great thyng vertue medicine euerie common weale ye woulde saye certayne body pestilent disease sickenesses common weale euil maniers againste whiche disease men haue excelled others wysedome haue soondrye region deyned set lawes certayne medicine remedy thesame exaumple emong atheniens solon made lawes emong lacedemonians lycurgus emong people crete minos emong romaynes tenne commissioner called theyr toungue decemuiti yet one men hable bryng passe nacions also would enbrace receiue lawes made neither dyd muche attempte thyng leste besides spendyng labour vayne shoulde also haue wonne opinion shamelesse acte doyng solon fa liue tenne yeares banished man thrustyng lawes citie athens alone vsed plato man well learned eloquent coulde neuer bryng people athens mynde receyue lawes yet doubtes bee made euerye one theim perswaded theimselues lawes whiche hadde made true wisshed yf myght possibly haue brought passe world haue enbraced receyued thesame lawes moses neither ipr abrode receyued ferther within onely one nacion although dede pharisets great highe suyt hunte wynne geat vnto fewe proselites saye foreyns alien wonne religion fynally violent autoritie emperours neither hable vyolence compulsion obteyne theyr lawes might haue weight force nacions thyng whiche sayed persones lawes made endeuour bryng thesame also philosophiers attempt theyr morall rule lesson great iudgement incomparable diligence labour wryten published al neuerthelesse one hath eloquente well learned hath hable bryng one nacion mynde woulde haue theim werishe vneffectuall vertue medicine phisicke broughte onelye trueth euangelicall dyd processe fewe yeares possesse perswade ouercome nacions worlde full wholle drawyng vnto grekes barbarous people learned vnlearned inferiour common people kynges pith hy effectuall electuarie trueth many thousandes people forsakyng lawes owne countreyes renouncyng religio theyr forefather vsed leauyng aswell sensuall pleasure vice whiche cradels accustomed vnto enbraced new forein doctrine diuerse toungues ordinaunces contrarie sorte consente receyuyng certaine lowe basse philosophie especiallye suche tyme neuer lyke sorte furnished armed either maintenaunce supportacion learnyng eloquence power autoritie prince suche time ferthermore wha al worlde al strengthe fought trueth ghospel beeyng vnarmed naked yet neuerthelesse could possiblye bryng passe sayed trueth firste ntred possession vpon countrey grece inuaded also citie rome veraye courte ner foorthwith spred self abrode throughout singular prouincies empire rome euen vntill isle called gades lying ferthest parte beyonde spaigne vnto indian vnto people afrike scithians isle britannia called englande beyng countrey vttrelye diuided cutte rest worlde nacions people dyd verye muche differ one another theyr language lawes rytes vsages ordeynaunces goddes religion facions anon beeyng suche great discorde broughte generall vniformitie begonne syng one song extollyng laudes prayses iesus christe onely lorde salueour worlde spoylyng goodes banishementes empriesonynges tormentes deathes none thing good procedyng goyng forewarde ghospell persone hath euer founde hath content suffre death lawes solon morall preceptes zeno simple playne doctryne christ many thousandes men olde young many thousandes matrones vyrgins haue willyngly offered holden neckes bee chopte yet muche wondrefull abhorryng commune reason thinges whiche ghospell teacheth whiche paradox saie straunge opinion philosophiers dooe teache sayd philosophiers doctryne one prince euer make anye dooe destroye suppresse yet owne accorde vanyshed awaye lyke also theyr lawes arte magicall rite sacryfices creature dooeth daye sacrifyce vnto god heathen slaygheth beastes sacrifice iewes persone dooeth knowe zoroastes man setteth heare misticall riddels pythagoras readeth lyfe apollonius tyaneus otherwyse certayne dreame yea rather vouchesalueth reade al aristotell dayes greate name fame scholes leat hym neuer thanke owne f cte therefore christian euen perished yf made medley christe hym together schooles diuinitie philosophie euangelical beeyng yet tendre euen newly spryngyng vp worlde arose first chop force power meane iewes vnder pretexte coulour religion fightyng agaynst fountaine religion meane philosophiers beeyng hable muche doe kyndes earnyng meane sophisters beyng felowes vnpossible bee ouercomed stiffenesse holdyng argumentacions meane rhetorician beyng meruaylous force eloquence tyrannes beeyng armed sortes shewyng crueltie meane kynges lieutenauntes magistrate suche cunnynng magike sorcerie perfecte sleyght castyng mystes ouer mennes iyes sens meane eiuyll spirites beeyng lordes worlde suche tumultuous buisynesse sea eiuils swellyng vp ouerflowyng dydde power trueth euangelicall receiue endure breake throughe vtterly ouercome lighte ghospell whan came reason counterfaictes worldly power clene vanishe waye shot ghospell shewed selfe beeyng plaine lowe whiche men w great doe endeuoured ouertrede kepe downe bokes suche persones singular high witte woondrefull learnyng exquisite eloquence wrote agaynst ghospel vanished awaye theyr owne accorde certayne dreames insomuche day remaynyng bee neyther excepte fragmentes small piece haue saued christian reason wrytyng agaynst confuting kynges prince dooe nowe bough downe honoure thyng fore wet destroie power magike vanished awai gone euill spirites cast howle rore agayn philosophie hath confessed ignoraunce geuyng ouer foolishe wisedome world hath enbraced wysedome crosse rethoricians write oracions prayse iesus christ poetes hisse olde goddes place lieu place goddes innumerable song composyng nowe iesus christe alone thissame great chaunge world begoonne within fewe yeares christ putte death made generall common al whole worlde withoute maintenaunce supportacion encreaced tyme tyme still vntyll piece leauen beeyng miengled three pe kes meale auen turne al whole batche vntill graine mustard seed beeyng digged yearth ferre wyde spleygh boughes abrode ouer asia ouer afrike europe ouer besydes persones layed theyr battrey agaynst trueth euangelical cast owne destroye onely diuerse sondry kyndes terroures wherwith euen manly stomakes also might haue quayled e open comaundementes proclamacion consistory place iudgemente forfaityng al theyr goodes prince attaindres depriuacions banishementes priesons tormentes burnyng plate scourgyng oddis ax wherwith choppe theyr heades ieobettes fiers burne wylde beastes cast thei might deuoured deathes also diuerse soondrye allurementes wherewith herte though wer right co tinent might bee corrupted ceasar would saye one rencague thou forsake christ thou chiefe emong pier except thou thy gooddes shall forfayte behoufe wyll shewe extremitie rigour towarde thy wyfe child thyselfe thyne part shalt bee cast wylde beastes denne suche case perswade many thousandes bryng mynde reioycyng take whan theyr promocions dignity taken whan theyr gooddes spoyled whan sawe party haled violence huige tormentes execucion death nexte god moste derely beloued vnto geue thankes god finally themselues whan might easly haue escaped whan might haue enioyed suche high commodity theyr owne voluntary wylles e themselues bee cruelly martyred power humayne eloquence could haue dooen godlye power trueth hable whiche laye hidden graine mustardsede neither philosophiers doctrine lacke alluremente stoykes promised libertie fredome true rychesse health reigne thynges magnificent royall spoken epicurean made highe woordes promise pleasure care men peripatetikes dyd couple good giftes bodye vertue doctrine ghospell drawe body vnto worldly terrours contrary parte fe hauyng thyng commendable outwarde shewe see naye rather howe many thynges conteine vttrely vncredible telleth newes one iesus nailled crosse death deliuered mankynde iesus bothe god man borne virgin one returned agayne death life nowe sitting right hande god father thesame iesus man taught suche persones bee blissed case profession name mourne warle suffre thirst hungre put affliccion wer euill spoken putte death men shall time come arise life agayn godly sorte daye thesame veray iesus beeyng iudge shall haue immortalitie lotte wicked shall haue peines hell euer without ende endure philosopher durst haue entreprised propoune suche thynges ferre contrarye mennes opinion thinkyng thynges vntouthsome menne bee fond make anye great countenaunce vnto yet thynges neuerthelesse dyd law talke ghospell dyd suche wyse perswade suche one taken mad cleane wittes dooeth beleue manye thousandes people sooner forsake life profession trueth euagelical maner felowes last dyd great chaunge worlde firste come vp meane fewe disciple beeyng menne vnknowen men lowe degree men pouertie vnlearned purpose speake rest whan peter chiefe fisher ferther knowlage bare mother toungue paule leather sewer one man rychesse man power ientle man either nothyng worldes case thei aforetymes clene forsooke wayes possible suche men bryng great matier passe erres brought medicine vi e boxe godly vertue medicine great power efficacie talke euangelicall playne homely sorte eloquent composyng whiche case manne examine trye storie thucidides greke titus liuius latine shall fynde lacke many thynges many poyntes shall offended noumbre thynges dooe euangelistes leat passe howe manye thynges dooe touche three woordes many place dooeth ordre disagree many place dooe appere one contrarie vnto another possible suche thinges haue turned awaye mynde reader readyng haue caused neuer beleued contrariwyse haue written story worldly affaire carefull wherof make first begynnyng matter labour diligence bestowe thei maye tell anye thyng otherwyse semyng maye tell thyng vnlykely maye tell thyng standyng together thynges contrary vnto reason ferther euidence dooe laye thyng playne mennes iyes swete pleasaunt knackes conceiptes contente reteine reader mynde pointe tediousnesse maye come stealyng vpon hym monumentes sorte wryters hauyng composed great labour studie great porcion lost remayne reade neither persones yet withoute geuyng credite vnto persone light belefe wyll auouche waraunt titus liuius poynte co teyned telling vntrueth many thousandes people haue found whiche would better tenne time suffre death admitte graunte one false clause bee conteined writinges gospell haue premiss euidet marke whereby know matter worldly auctoritee wisedome vertue power god secrete vertue efficacie lying hidden medicine whiche whan poured body spred selfe abrode ouer vniuersall nacions worlde resemblaunce throughout membres haue nowe cause veritie euangelicall within fewe yeares men lowe degree sprede selfe abrode world ouer whan thesame worlde rebelled kyndes extreme crueltie maie come mannes mynde greatly meruaile reason hath come passe later season whan worlde christian prince bishop men learnyng welthie riche persones endued great authoritie dicion christe shrounken together narowe roume cause matier beeyng well knowen remedie might perhappes sooner founde hauyng good sence forgotte self passe limites boudes preface therefore returne phisicion luke whome lyke doubte right acceptable vnto grace woulde good wyll haue hym meane thesame grace made acceptable vnto people wyse ecclesiasticus speaketh manier honour thou phisicion necessity sake muche ought condigne honour shewed phisicion hath ientilly geuen v effectuall receipt phisicke whiche euery creature necessary except suche persone bee whiche withoute faulte hath nede waxe better man certes also bee effectuall beeyng vttrely wery disease infirmity shall oftentymes byte medicine shall continuallye chawe shall conueye passe stomake botome oure herte shall vomite vp agayne hath taken therof shall kepe thesame still stomake oure soule vntill cast brode vertue hath chaunge v altogether selfe poynte experience haue founde myne owneselfe litle fruite commeth gospell man reade sluggishely superficially renne ouer case diligent exquisite meditacion kepe hymself occupied therin shal fele certaine vertue pith suche shall fele lyke bookes nowe preuente makyng myne aunswer vnto suspicious demynges menne haue dedicated euery particular paraphrase ghospels seuerally particular prince veray chaunce anye ambicion sekyng behalfe thyng hath fortuned vnto matier fortuned epistle apostolicall whan wrote paraphrase vpon matthewe loked nothyng lesse iohn bee earnestly required immediatly hym lukas nowe thentente shall glasewyndoore gappe bee seen emong eua gelistes wyll adde marke also vnto three albeit dedicateth sondrie ghospels sondrie men maie seme neuer whit contrarie reason sayncte hierome dedicated yea euen lesser prophetes vnto seuerall persones haue elswhere geuen aduertisemente eftsons geue warning vnto reader esteme auctoritie paraphrase myne woulde geue commentary wryters suche purpose wryte paraphrase would shake strike gospell mennes handes thentente maye read commodiouslye mannes mynde fruite lyke meates sauced ende maye taken better delectacion yea one ferther poynte also must warne reader somewhat grosse vnderstanding whiche bee myne owne woordes speake paraphrase leste thyng whiche vnder persone euangeliste humbly truely spoken maye seme bee arrogauntlye spoken vnder myne owne persone lord iesus geue spirite vnto moste noble kyng ende vnder proteccion beeyng true christian prince dede veritie gospell maye daye daye reigne flourishe yeuen basill xxiii daye august yeare lorde mdxxiii life saynt luke written hierome luke phisicion borne antioche ignoraunte greke toungue wrytynges shewe folower disciple apostle paule companion peregrinacion wrote volume ghospell whome paule sayeth maner haue sent brother whose praise ghospell throughout congregacions agayne colossian moste dere luke phisicion greteth timothie luke alone sette foorth also anothe speciall goodlye booke whiche entitled actes apostle storie wherof came euen full paules tyme beeyng tarying two yeares rome saye vntill fourth yeare nero emperour whereby well perceyue sayde booke made citie therfore circuites paule tecla virgin tale leo hym baptised rekon emong scripture called apocrypha manier thyng companion whiche neuer went elbowe shoulde emong mat er bee ignoraunt thyng alone tertullian whiche nere vnto tyme reporteth certayne priest beeyng affeccionate fauourer apostle paule couicte iohn beeyng authour thesame booke priest confessed selfe thyng loue bare paule booke reason therof escaped hym wryters deme often paule epistle saieth accordyng ghospell signifyeth woorke luke luke learned ghospell onely apostle paule conuersaunte lorde fleshe ut also rest apostle whiche thyng luke himselfe also declareth begynnyng owne worke saying haue deliuered vnto v whiche beginning sawe themselues yes minister thynges declared gospell therfore wrote hearde actes apostle composed seen liued lxxxiiii yeares hauyng wife buried constantinople vnto whiche bone remoued conueyed achaia together bone andrewe apostle ix yere constantius emperour paraphrase erasmus vpon ghospell luke prologue p asmuche many haue taken hand sette foorth declaracion actes come passe emong v lyke deliue ed vnto v first sawe themselues minister woorde thought good also gotte knowlege thynges begynnyng wryte diligentlye vnto ordre good theophilus ende thou mightest knowe trueth woerdes whiche thou art enfourmed history worldly affaire vpon consideracio lytle aswel delectacion also profite take knowlege thynges customably required vpright trueth reporting thesame muche oughte vpright trueth makyng relacion ghospell whiche onely doeth muche delite mynde hauyng litle el commodious profitable vnto transitory lyfe also necessary vnto true godlinesse without man atchiueth eternal saluacion blisse neuer shal decaye lyfe euerlastyng matier daungier thoughe manne knowe man hannibal alexander actes epaminondas scipio hath doen mat er solon lycurgus draco haue writen doctrine socrates plato aristotle taughte albeit knowleage thynges also rate man state case world hath fruite whatsoeuer person shall knowe father sonne holy ghoste whosoeuer shall learne actes soonne god iesus christe hath dooen yearth saluacion mankynde hathe taught hath promised vnto suche doe constauntely cleue doctrine ghospell hath threatned vnto suche persones doe either litle regarde el doe playnely despise thesame suche one shall possibly bee hable auoyde beeyng excluded coumpanye god child shut ioyes heauenly lyfe shalbee adiudged wicked tormentes diepe pitte hell whiche neuer shall haue ende dede first meane thapostles beeyng therunto chosen lorde hymselfe residue disciple beyng enspired holy ghost ghospell dede liuely voice mouth onely yet moost vpright certaintye assured trueth begonne bee spred abrode throughout coastes countreyes worlde dooeth daylye yet still ferther ferther renne abrode yet forasmuche synceritie reportyng whiche goyng man man mouth onely issueth successiuelye great noumber lightlye corrupted suche reporte sette left one another writyng therefore mathew apostle one twelue lorde iesus beeyng yet couersaunte yearthe specially appointed chosen office also marke disciple peter apostle inspiracion holy ghoste admonished put summe whole story ghospell writyng myndyng ne goyng preuencion take awaye others libertie write matiers rather leste person beyng craftilye deceiued false apostle shoulde folowe iewes facions fonde fable stede gospell notwithstandyng lyke euery manne tyme eguall synceritie purenesse preache ghospell write dooe euery man lyke faythfulnesse trueth handle storye ghospell many one hath attempted like sorte patche make medley discourse reportyng christes ghospell wryters woonte mortall mennes actes entremedlyng ofttymes false thynges emong true tellyng matiers approued certaintie suche thinges afore taken onely vncertaine rumoures voyces common people yea many tymes inuentyng owne braynes thyng tell eyther delite lust lye el beeyng corrupted affeccion mortall mennes matiers nature apte readie bee corrupted shall perchaunce hereafter also persones sterte whiche makyng lye actes doctryne christe disciple shall cause true matiers shall credited neither therfore spirite iesus hath nipped herte also litell twynge mathewe marke whiche two possible trueth vprightnesse wrote muche tyme iudged bee sufficiente yet neuerthelesse sette purpose entente left vnto others certain thinges written supplying meane tyme office liuely voyce lacked theyr writinges others whiche haue sembleable vprightnesse attempted thesame whiche persones haue euerye entermyngled many poyntes muche contrary doctryne gospell many haue rather iye fyll vp hole story fable tale vnseemyng grauitie ghospell tell suche thinges holy ghost hath iudged auailable towardes blisse euerlastyng luke also composyng certaine ordre processe storie euangelicall bothe supplye suche matiers haue omitted others also debarre authoritie persones whiche eyther heretofore haue written hereafter shall wryte mattiers certaynetie matiers euident trueth eyther fatasyes owne imagining el thinges none otherwyse knowen rumoure bruite people commonly authour brynger vp thynges fynest yet selues frame processe storie leatte passe manier poynte al thynges haue sayde doen make relacion suche thinges onely know concerne godly deuocion gospel fruicion lyfe euerlastyng infinite endelesse matier throughly write euery thyng iesus hath doen taught poyntes bee whiche without preiudice saluacio maye bee vnknowen thynges agayne bee knowelage wherof bryngeth muche profite zele desire perfect godlinesse poyntes finally bee maye bee vnknowen withoute anye perill saluacion without greuous empechemente hinderaunce christen mannes perfeccion dede exaumple euer knowe diuine matiersof actes coe passe emong v litle litle porcion respect comparison knowe therfore neither wyll touche treate euery matier vttermoste yet tell recite thinges vncertayne thynges onely wyll declare whiche hath moost assured euident certaintie shewed vnto v vndoubted apostle disciple christ whiche onely theimselues owne iyes seen great parte thynges tolde vnto v hadde hearde thesame owne eares handeling doyng muche parte therof theyr owne handes also hadde theimselues parte thesame actes reported doen men doen many thinges commaundemet lord suffered fewe thynges sake matiers inseparable companion folowers iesus christ almoste neuer presence neyther ought lesse credite bee giuen vnto wryte suche thynges haue seen selfe haue learned others requisite matier beyng ferre vse straunge vnreedible feith first acquired woonne sens body thesame feith confirmed euident wondres miracle kynde token prouffes cannot euermore continue ne endure one syde christe didde long exhibite himselfe bee seen worlde syde miracle thynges time geuen ne hardnesse belefethat mighie bee denyed hadde seen hearde felte thynges afterwarde ceasse haue ende sufficient rudimentes first principle feith proceded suche beginninges thomas apostle sawe christ resurreccion hearde hym felte hym handes beleued oure lorde maister christe pronounceth suche persones bee blissed whiche although haue bodyly seen thynges dooen yet neuerthelesse dooe geue muche credite woordes gospell personally presente dooyng thesame otherwyse onely iyes bee beleued euen veray bodyly conuersaunt lorde doe reporte many matiers dooyng whiche themselues presente learned persones beeyng substanciall credible true theyr reporte exaumple natiuitie petigrewe christe wyse men called magi whiche came easte see christ beeyng newe borne flying ioseph marie christ egipte satan tempted christe euangelistes though sawe begynnynges thynges yet haue seen sequeles endes haue seen apostle al euer oure lorde promised gospell haue seene theim beeyng enspired holy ghoste geue thesame holy spirite god persones also beeyng baptised laying hande ouer yea owne selues haue found felt effectual power strength holy ghoste haue seen diuilles drieuen name iesus haue seen disease put away haue seen poysons voyde al effecte force dooe harme haue seen maiestie gospel men slendre substaunce worldely rychesse men lowe degree borne men priuate saye men hauyng seculare autoritie al yet neuerthelesse fewe yeres famously notified throughout whole vniuersall yearth great mightie prince worlde haue vaine striued wrastled suppresse verayly euen thesame thyng also lorde spoken afore prophecied whan shall lifted vp yearth sayed shall drawe thinges selfe suche autours auouchers thinges growyng thesame thynges suche ende proufe afore sayd doth suffre v doubte neither tho thynges haue passed tyme ne yet suche thynges many hundredes yeres come promysed whatsoeuer long tyme afore foresayed godlye sayinges prophetes iesus cummyng worlde perfourme fulfyll whatsoeuer thyng christ toward departure hece vp heauen sayd afore thapostles come passe hath dede come passe neither doubted semblable vprightnesse trueth accomplishe thynges whiche hath differred vn l second coming bee perfourmed concernyng resurreccion bodyes concernyng rewardes godly persones wicked therfore ordre processe gospell matiers haue earnesse studie throughly bou ted mouthes suche whose woordes vndoubted certain write vpon haue pieked suche pointes semed moste effectuall moste helpyng fayth deuout godlynesse gospell geuyng litle touche nouers men gather floures one aueture come hand folowyng ordre tyme due course processe matiers haue diligently compyled storye yea euen somewhat ferre fettyng matier firste grounde wete concepcion hym whiche went commyng salueour lyke byrth preachyng also death furthermore treate straunge concepcion christ within wombe virgin byrthe childe circumcision puri icacion marie sodrie prophecy spoken vpon childe certayne token godly towardnesse whiche euen already like certaine litle sparkes appere chylde whiche thynges euangelistes vpright trueth certaintie wrote touched almoste nothing al iohn baptised preached baptising iesus beyng tepted doctryne wondres wrought death beeyng layed graue arisyng fro death lyfe returnyng vp heauen thynges well set ordre eche moste conuenient place shall another treatise addein actes apo le howe sente holye ghoste firste rudimentes principle primitiue churche whan firste came v begonne also grewe time tyme greater greater chiefe apostle peter iames paule barnabe didde taughte myracles affliccions glorifyed name oure lorde iesus suppose thynges wyll bee strange vnto thee moste honest theophilus partelye entente thou mayest eftesones peruse ordre tho thynges whiche thou haste piecemele learned others partelye thende thou mayest perfecte assured credence throughly perceyue wrytyng thesame thynges whiche thou haddest hearde others afore tymes theyr liuelye voyce woorde mouthe mayest refuse fablinges great sorte whiche dooe present vnder false counterfeicte name ghospell set theyr owne peynted sheaththeophilus greke english louer god thou alone theophilus dooe wryte thynges one sole person onelye also personnes either presente tyme beyng hereafter come whiche either shalbe dede thou arte called name wete louers god whiche renouncyng vttrely geuyng vp deuyll dooe prest readinesse beleuyng godlye applying theimselues sue frendeship god whiche despising aswell eiuilles also good thynges transitory world bend al desyre thynges euerlastyng heauenly fyrst chapter whan tyme purpose appoyntemente god prefixed soondrye sage sawes prophetes afor tolde promised space many hundred yeres greatly wished holy deuout people come sonne god shoulde take vpon hym nature manne redeme mankynde death aswell doctrine also exaumple doyng enstructe v towardes knowledge trueth earnest loue desyre godlye trade ghospell finally promyses set vp oure hertes towardes hope lyfe euerlastyng heauen bee doen straunge lyke heard age tyme afore wysedome god secrete wayes meanes ordreyng thynges leate passe poynte token euident signes whiche mighte matier selfe incredible purchase credite cause bee beleued among men hath euer heard man haue borne woman earth euermore reigne god heauen history euen gentile also full straunge thinges haue happened comon course nature bokes olde testament learne fyer hath cast downe heauen learne sea haue opened deuided selfe twoo partes water haue gotten foorth drie stone touchyng long rodde deade menne haue restored agayne lyfe hath euer hearde virgin haue brought foorth chylde without man helpe yet dede chiefe article saluacion point persones throughly perswaded wete iesus thesame messias whose cummyng foretellynges prophetes promysed lawes moses waye shadowe expressed whome onely person muste hope truste haue theyr saluacion pthere dayes herode kyng iewry certayne prieste named zacharie course abia wyfe doughters aaron name elizabeth wherfore high wysedome prouidence god one prepared whiche beyng owne parte also borne worlde woonderfull straunge sorte shoulde goe heauenly chylde bearing virgin marie noblenesse linage suche holynesse liuing afore tyme bene hearde auctoritie rare gyftes grace gotten among people might vnto christ beyng yet borne procure fyrst knoweleage faith among iewes whiche harde beliefe euen doctrine gospel wherof christ heade
