firste founder firste brynger vp firste beginnyng made acceptable vnto worlde testimonye olde lawe figure whiche olde lawe zacharie iohn represent shorte processe tyme course thynges beeyng chaunged contrarie waie lyke christ whan vertues giftes grace shewed foorth derken glorye iohn brightnesse maiestie ghospell soone opened selfe vnto worlde dyd ye woulde saie clene abrogate autoritie moses lawe iacob patriarke litle shoulde dye beyng endowed spirite prophecie foresaye veray many thynges afterwarde come passe whan come mencioning namyng iuda whose tribe lorde iesus shoulde issue procede lineall dissent spake wordes prophecie folowyng sceptre sayed shal taken iuda ne head tewler thighe hym vntyll come must sent veray shalbe expectacion nacions prophecie euidently enough betoken messias suche tyme come whan people iewes whiche afore tyme tyme euermore rewled gouerned capitaynes iudges kynges priestes owne nacion subiecte prince borne foreyne countreye thesame prophecie al vnder one geue toke grace gospell whiche iewes would despyse sette nought shoulde passe go theim vnto gentylesof herode kyng firste others herode sonne antipater whereas neyther descended bloud iewes yet besides orth vngodly wieked person onlye enfraunchised called honour denisen coutrey iewrie also fauour ceasar augustus emperour rome obtayned kyngdome rewle ouer iewes therfore euen vp token alone though mo scribe pharisee whiche tooke vpon exacte perfite knowleage lawe might haue geassed tyme come whan man bee borne defacyng vanquishyng terrene yearthly kingdomes bryng worlde heauenly kyngdome whiche place stede tyrannes create pastours stede lordely maisters make tedre father furthermore whereas dignitie iudaical priesthoode excedyng high honour wondreful estimacion mong al persones holy ghost prophetes declared afore priesthood also iewes abrogated abolished come whiche beeyng enoynted men materiall bodelye oyle beeyng enoynted god spirite oyle celestiall shoulde sacrifice beeyng dede mo one sole sacrificea certayne priest thesame neuerthelesse sacrifice moste absolute efficacie vertue take awaye synnes world feyth gospell bounteous geuyng spirite god sanctifie make holy thynges daniel prophecieddaniel ix weekes seuen double yeres say seuen time seuen yeres god prefixed come passe holy holyes enoincted thenceforth hostes sacrifice olde lawe ceasse whan thynges eternall shall come thynges transitorye shall haue ende whan ghostely thynges shall come thynges carnall shall cease whan trueth shall come feyned counterfeytes shall geue place whan lyght shall come shadowes darkenesse shall vanishe away whan christe shall haue begonne speake voice grosse lawe shall playe mum vntill openly professe hym vntill nowe rather saye certain token becking nod poynte vnto expresse wordes pronounce declare suche tyme therfore herode beyng first foreinour aliene borne secondarily wicked person many manslaughter hainous murder polluted vnder rewle obeisaunce emong iewes authoritie god fauour ceasar augustus time religion iewishe temple consisted externall figure ceremony moste chiefly flourishe emong men time extreme wickednesse vngodly facions face god reigne emong scribe phariseis elder bishop vnder false pretensed colour cloke holinesse euen dyd coming lord iesus sorte shall tel begyn first knowen worldenamed zacharie vnder wicked king godly prieste euen ye would saye last remaines left olde ordre priestehood beeyng yet corrupted many vice priestes name zachary ordre lotte cuming course present time call ministryng sacres holy rite temple dauid sorted whole ordre priestes two principall family wete eleasar ithamar family subiect vnto two deuided fower twentie lotte euerye ordre one theyr course minister sacres temple eight day space piece absteining thinges rite moyses prescripcion semed make vnclene refrayning also fro cumpanying wiues cumming within owne house abydyng still temple ende myght chastitie puritie handle seruice god residue priestes besides whose course minister weeke lefull meane space attende wiues childre occupied owne secular affaire thynges necessarie requisite done whyle ordre thus deuiding lotte emong fower twentie family eight place fell lotte abia zacharye lineally descended whose place zachary course succededof ye course abia thissame though semed doen mere chaimce auenture yet one poynte therof wrought high wysedome prouidence god yea muche veray numbre course purpose consideracion lyke numbre seuen many cause hath figure significacion olde lawe doeth numbre eight well accorde grace ghospel asmuche euerlasting blisse heauen nowe geuen workes lawe freely frankly feithand wife daughter aaron zacharie also wife named elizabeth better estemed respecte noble birth came ye stocke bloud aaron first prieste people israell also worthie reuerence wurship hir integritie perfecte goodnesse behaueour intente suche holy man zacharie without wyfe accordyng pthey righteouse god walked commaundementes ordeynauces lord man could fynde faulte childe elizabeth baraine well stricken age veray dede holy wedlocke knitte made vp somuch copulacion body lykenesse theyr mindes hertes felowship godlines veray good folkes iust iustice phariseis whiche phariseis vnder false couiour counterfaite shewe holynesse sette foorth theyr prynted sheathe iyes men lucre worldely prayse defourmyng face makyng vnsightly nons troumpette blowyng suche time whan gaue almes sekyng estemed holy reason long prayer made corner stretes whan herte drouned fylthinesse hainous offence trespaces godthey righteouse god zachary elizabeth vncorrupt hertes dyd suche wyse obserue kepe thynges whiche lord commaunded lawe neyther gaue vnto men holde tytle fynde faulte yet poynte small difficultie also puritie clenesse liuyng shewe themselfes pleasyng sight god yea veray poynte also wrought high wysedome god speciall prouision ende suche one afterwarde geue testimonie vnto christe cumming might owne behalfe maner degree worthy acceptacion emong people iewes first noblenesse linage descended ordre priesthood aswell father syde mother syde secondarily linyng parentes beyng vnreprouable thirdly vertues giftes grace owne selfe beyng wonderfull suche fewe persones found finally gloryous death whan suffre truthes sake suche cryar veryly mete yt haue came allure hymselfe whole worlde sauor good fame opinion spryng hym ferthermore prouidence god poynte alo wrought straunge maner natiuitie stiere vp myndes men haue speciall regarde iohnand childe suche common matiers facions folkes looked hande whiche borne worlde common course nature onely benefite god although holy conuersacion zacharie elizabeth specially well approued allowed person yet one poynte godlynesse semed haue hard happe veray ferre growe age without hauing issue childe tyme emong iewes lyke fruitfulnesse matrimonie reputed certayne thyng great royaltie barainnesse muche reproche thyng rekoned numbre chiefe missehappes euils lyre moste parte people interprete take person bee reiected cast fauour god whiche fortune happe kynde issue encrease multiplie people iewes beeyng people specially chosen dedicate vnto god iewes beyng altogether grosse carnall yet learned spirituall ghostely people whiche god would haue heauenly generacion styll tyme tyme multiplied continuall succession issue yet heard blissed tho person whiche gelded themselfes kingdome heauenbecause elizabeth barai mattier dyd lytle grieue bothe theyr mindes especially elizabeth euen already muche reprochefull name euery bodyes mouth called baraine rekoned numbre woman hard happe one suche barainesse nowe past lykelyhood hope haue chylde veray many yeres hauyng passed coumpanie wedded house bandeand bothe nowe well stricken age yet brought foorth fruite matrimonie reproche barainnesse woont moste specially light wome despaire hauing chyld old age encreased bounteous goodnesse god tendre fauour geue vnto deuoute prayer desire theyr hertes thyng strength power nature dyd geue coumpanying theyr bodyes came passe whan zacharie executed priestes office god course came accordying custome priestes office lotte fell burne inc nse wente temple lorde whole multitude people without prayer whyle incense burnyng therfore whan zacharie executed office prieste ordre coursewhan executed whiche haue sayed course abia continuing within temple sight god attended ministryng sacres lyke pure chaste man accordyng custome maner one chosen goe innermoste priuiest place temple called sanctum sanctorum god say holy holyes principall holy place chaunce lotte fell chosen entre principall holy placehis lotte fel burne incense leefull person entre except bishop suche one appointed bishop stede altare stood secrete inner part temple lay holy incense made certayne swete odoures olde lawe appointed wete balme onycha swete galbanum frankyncense clerest sorte kinde sacrifice estemed emong iewes moste holy aboue othersexod xxx insomuche seeyng sacrifice whan doyng lay people admitted come yet leuites neither al residue besides priest execute taried without beyng separated diuided place vaileand ye multitude people without prayer makyng theyr deuout prayer meane whyle god would vouchesalue ratifie offeryng helth safegarde whole people remained without vntill prieste sacrifice inner place copleted came forth againe people finish residue thinges ordenarie obsequies rite sacrifice apperteine priest pray people also himselfe according vnto prescripcion lawe one beeyng mortall man himselfe aswell others daunger falling errours vice worlde appeared vnto hym aungell lord standyng rightsyde altare incense whan zacharie sawe hym abashed feare came vpon hym therfore whereas zacharie many yeres afore often tymes moste earneste desire cryed vnto god deliuer well wyfe reproche barrainesse also hymselfe griefe pensifnesse beyng without issue yet notwithstanding certaine despaire hauyng child many day sence conceiued minde euen present tyme moste ardent prayer require god though present face publike redepcion people many hundred yeres looked dede fume incense mounting vp altare cast abrode aier euery syde desire deuoute bishoppe perced vp euen god aungels carrying whose office conueigh vp almightie god prayer godly agayne bryng downe v bounteouse largessethere appered vnto hym angell aungell therfore sente heauen stood ryght ende altare swete sauours incense burned one ready declare glad tydinges thynges chaunce ryghtsyde haue commonly luckie significacion good happe comewhan zacharie sawe abashed feare came vpon hym zacharie whan soodainly espyed aungell shynyng celestiall brightnesse came openly bodily fourme men vse soodainly vnware shewed himselfe visible truly sore dismayed minde taken great feare aungell made shewe maner thyng feared infirmitie mannes body able abyde maiestie spirites aungels heauen aungell sayed vnto hym feare zacharie thy prayer heard thy wyfe elizabeth shall beare sonne thou shalt cal name iohn thou shalt haue ioy gladnesse many shall reioyce birth hym shall great syght lorde lyke poynte mannes weakenesse fall tremblyng quakyng soodaine sight aungell propertie great goodnesse ientle familiar speakyng vnto v take awaye feareand aungell sayed aungell therfore gracious looke ientle faire woordes speaking vnto zachary saied wyse zachary cause thou shouldest afeard cause thou maiest glad ioyfull bryng glad tydinges bothe vnto thee people thou art nowe makyng intercession god hath graunted thy deuoute godly peticionfeare thy praier heard thesame messias deliuerer sauer hys people whiche long many dayes gonne hath promysed many hundred yeres already looked nowe hande come dede thyng whiche thou haste made peticion obteyned thyng also doeth goodnesse god adde heape thy desyres thyng thou durst bee bolde askethy wife elizabeth shall beare sonne thou nowe cleane hope myght possibilitie come passe thou madest peticion redemer worlde thou shalt receyue also one shall declare publyshe redemer vnto worlde fruitefulnesse thy wyfe elizabeth hathe hitherto wysedome prouidence god delaied put shall bryng vnto smal increase ioyes generall gladnesse al people shalbe coupled particular reioycing thyne owne priuate householde hir fruitefulnesse folke despaired shall haue commoditie good purpose person maye vnderstande thissame chylde bearyng common rate chylde shalbe borne borne god beyng worker dooer dede thy wyfe shall bryng forth thee child shall bryng forth child thee alone shall bryng forth whole people generall shal bryng forth god e prouidece matter euery whyt tempered wrought muche wondre worlde shall bryng forth ferre past tyme age ere bryng forth muche pleasyng reioycyng party suche hope muche good happe fortune shall bryng forth sonne sonne aduentures great publisher foregoer say husher maker way purseuaunt moste great messias comeand thou shalt calle name iohn office suche high preeminence free franke fauour god pieked deputed cause shalt thou call name iohn people may euen therby leste wise aduertised shalbe veray well accepted god plenteously heaped many heauenly gyftes grace therfore sorowe whiche barainnesse thy wyfe hath hitherto brought vnto thee shall redubbed plentifull ioy muche reioycing neither shal ioy kept inclosed within walles precincte thyne owne houseand thou shalt haue ioy c shall thy ioy great many thy frendes reioyce whiche sorowefull afore thy sorowe shall leape ioy byrth thy sonne suche thirst cummyng messias messias beeyng sunne skye thy sonne shall go certayne day sterre geue knowlage afore woonderfull brightnesse arisyng euen hande shall euery syde put awaye derkenesse whole vniuersall worlde dede shall comparison moste greatest yet thy sonne lyke shalbe muche inferiour shall dignitie excell passe reste prophetes hitherto haue shall veray dede great opinion men also iyes lorde vnto man great vertues gyftes grace whiche himselfe doeth frankly geue shall great worldly richesse ruffleyng porte lyfe worldely dominion rather contempte despisyng thinges make certayne persones great iyes men lesse shall desyre commodity welth worlde somuche plenteously shall couched full gooddes heauenly pwyne also strong drynke shall drynke shall bee replenished holy ghost euen mother wombe many chyldren israel shall turne lorde god shall goe hym spirite power helias turne hertes father vnto chyldren vnbelieuers wysedome iust men make ready perfecte people vnto lorde kynde excessiue delicate fedyngwyne strog drink shall drinke withall obiectacions pleasure body shall muche abhorre wyll tyme drynke wyne delicious strong drynke ne liquour hable take awaye briete manne distemper braine filthy delites sensualitie haue place one whose breste holy ghost hathe taken possession afore dwell holy ghost shall replenishe mynde soule thy sonne euen whyle lyeth secrete within enclosure mother wombe may play parte prophete gesture able haue vtteraunce woordes speakyng short processe yeres whan gyftes spirite god shall haue growen yeres age shall shall worke wondres one syde exaumple moste holy life syde suche preachyng men shall maruayle accordyng prophecie malachiasmany ye child israel shal turne lord many child israel beeyng fallen fauour god reason whyle bearyng themselfes bolde carnall lawe tooke regarde thynges whiche figure lawe signifie shall conuerte theyr lord god preaching great frankenesse plainnesse kyngdome god hande exhortyng repentaunte emendyng theyr former lyfe makyng withoutwarde baptisyng water foreprofer abolishyng synne whiche abolishing synne come messias finally vnto person openly shewyng manne god purpose would shortly send worlde hym alone onely euerlastyng saluacion come vnto menand shal goe hym c thissame messias shall first come poore humble lowe degree ende may conferre geue euerlastyng saluacion vnto person putting trust affiaunce hym afterwardes shall eftsones come maiestie geue rewardes vnto euery one accordyng dedes good godly euerlastyng lyfe vnbeleuyng wiked person euerlasting death lyke malachias propheciemala iiii helias shal foremessagier second cumming prepare heartes preaching agaynst great terrible daye lorde ryght shall thy sonne foremessagier former cummyng whiche god sonne messias shall descend downe yearth lure prouoke person generall without excepcion iohns preaching vnto knowledge loue himselfe poynte shall great many thought helias neyther shall without good cause sayd heliasto turne ye heartes father vnto child shall spirite power helias come cummyng lorde ende prophete malachias hath wrytten maye turne harte father child wherby iewes haue farre growe kynde fallen holy trade forefather may amende come agayne better grace thesame iewes beleuyng woordes messias god shall speake vnto may truely deserue bee called child abraham folowe prompte readynesse beleuyng whiche abraham also suche person whyle cleaue fast outwarde rynde barke lawe vnderstand minde effectuall pith lawe may conuerte bryng vnto wysedome iust whiche haue learned vnder vtter playster pergetyng lawe lyeth hydden higher pointe holyer matter whiche shall ere long vttered abrode preachyng messias shall perfeitely accomplyshe fulfyll lawe right kynde ought thy sonne beeyng waye leader vnto heauenly preaching thissame messias shall prepare heartes menne may deliuer vp vnto messias cummingto make redy perfe ct people vnto lorde people vtterlye vntraded vnentred discipline somewhat prepared already instructed therunto agnisyng knowledgyng theyr owne synfulnesse expectacion kyngdom heauen feling great misse lacke messias come thought best vnto almyghtye god castyng fyrst certeine entreinges principle bryng man whiche fallen vtter ignoraunce wickednesse lytle lytle degree vp highest poyntes godly perfeccion zacharie sayed vnto aungell vp token shall knowe olde wyfe well stricken age aungell aunswered sayed vnto hym gabriell stand presence god sent speake vnto shewe glad tydinges beholde thou shalt dumme hable speake vntyll daye thynges come passe thou diddest beleue woordes whiche shalbe fulfilled theyr tyme aungell vsyng thissame frendely talke zacharie hath nowe putte awaye feare forbecause great high poyntes aungell promysed course nature credible zacharye bothe maner vse iewes also representyng figure theyr synagoge requireth haue matter weight annexed promise euidente token ende one miracle shoulde obtayne assured credite vnto wherfore aunswered spake vnto aungell sorte presente token nowe hande maye knowe thissame whiche thou doest promyse come matter perfeite certayntiefor old wyfe wel strieken age c otherwyse felyng nature sayeth contrarye parte already veray aged man wyfe also alreadye ouer ferre strieken yeres haue chyld bearing hoped bodye howe shall thyng nowe chaunce vnto beyng v olde past hauyng fruite whiche dyd chaunce vnto v whan young perfeite lustinesse bodyes sayed aungell agayne mortall man beeyng sent another mortall man promise vnto suche thynges thou mightest well without good cause doubt promyse graunt thissame thyng whiche promyse aboue man power aboue common ordre course nature neyther possible aungell bryng message vanitie thyng vncredible among menne god easily perfourme vnto beleue promisses thesame aungell gabrielli gabriell stande presence god many yeres gone sente prophete daniell whiche tyme tyme stande sight god among seuen pryncipall seruitours heauen readynesse maner obedient seruice wyll pleasure god present tyme especially deputed appoynted god vnto office bee messagier betwene god man present matter whiche neuer tyme acte done greatter meruayled therfore thou maiest maner distruste god maker promise messagier sent thesame make rela ion matter vnto thee bryng thee glad tidynges sence thou dooest muche require thou shalt haue geuen vnto theeand behold thou shalt dumme shall bee true token promyse tyme cummyng bee perfourmed also punishemente thy mystrustfulnes presente declared behold thou shalt soodainly eue instant become dumme shalt haue power bryng woorde thy mouthe vntyll thy sonne beyng borne worlde shall haue discharged credite promise ought doubt haue made thy behalf tyme nowe hande synagoge whiche harde brought belefe shall kepe silence person shall haue tong speake libertie sauyng onely suche ready towardnes beleue shall obey folowe preachyng ghospell people awating zacharie merueiled taried temple came furth could speake vnto perceyued seen vision temple beckened vnto remained dumme whyle thynges doyng betwene zacharie aungell within innermoste tabernacle temple whole body people stode awayting lokyng priest come forth accordyng maner execute ministre rest rite yet bee done abrode presence multitude truely strieken great wonder made suche tarying tabernacle longer space wonte vse length furth cummeth zacharie countenaunce dede shewyng vnwoonte gladnes vse speache cleane taken whiche thinges people rightwell vnderstood vision appered vnto within presence beyng together parte maiestie god aungell heauen wonte make great alteracion state moode mortall man face countenaunce olde tyme chaunced also vnto moyses whan power speake tongue wrought signes token poyntyng noddyng head whiche sacrifice done contentacion god god highly pleased therwith therfore rendre thankes vnto hym graciously heard deuout prayer seruauntes dyd zacharie euen dumme remayne still within temple executyng office ministryng sacres vntyll numbre eight day completed ended people iewes meane duryng prieste could speake incling token lawe shorte processe tyme afterward ceasse geue place vnto whiche bryngyng trueth abrode lyght putte awaye shadowes thynges make vanishe whan dayes ministryng expired departed owne house dayes wyfe elizabeth conceyued hidde selfe fiue monethes saying thus hath lord delt dayes wherin hath loked vpon take awaye reproche emong men dayes wyfebut ordinarie tyme ministryng temple beeyng expired zacharie returned home owne house vpon confidence trust aungels promise enbraced baraine aged wyfe elizabeth case geuyng themselues wanton desire fleshe great lacke desire ye child bryng glory god light knowledge lyfe preachyng whiche foregoer hauing long seaso loked laste bryng perfeite saluacion vnto creature chaste enbracinges housebande wyfe whiche promyse god doeth couple wanton lust bodye holy compaynying together man wyfe seketh nothyng el fruite issue godly loue desyre suche issue borne owne pleasure appetite publique benefite welth creaturesand hid selfe fiue monethes nowe whan elizabeth accordyng aungels promyse conceyued hidde selfe companie kepyng matter close syght people space fiue monethes dede lesse glad woman conceyued childe yet vertuous disposicion shamefastnes commonly go together halfe ashamed suche person dyd yet knowe thissame matter bee done god worker doer already aged woman might seme wholly geuen herselfe yet still vnto satisfying wanton lust body ignoraunte howe muche inclined moste parte folkes well misdeme wurst also speake naughtily prudent minde woman also ferther iye regarde vnto poynte vauntes ne braggues made among people gyfte godsaying thus hath lorde delte vntill assuredly past doubtes leste thing afterward quailled gone awaye behalfe reproche baraines double beyng fer strieken yeres conceyued suche vayne hope haue childe neuerthelesse whan sundry assured token perfeitely knewe herselfe childe suche wise time shewe herselfe glad happie chaunce matter euery whit soeuer referred vnto onely goodnesse god haue hitherto sayeth diffamed reprochefull name baraine woman one neuer haue childe among people israel whose opinion barainnes body thing dishonestie shame naughty disposicio mynde lord see well hath purpose made delay fruitfulnessein ye day wherein hath loked vpon c childe borne nowe whan man looked onely might deliuer reproche barainnes also cause vnto aumple ioy plainly free gyfte god suche time best pleased himselfe hath vouchedsafe cast fauourable iye simple handmaide suche sorte reason chyld though beyng one alone borne whan almost past season yet neuertheles childe specially marked regarded haue borne god behalfe shall hencefurth folkes communicacion bee reported bee mother muche happier great many others whiche great sorte child piece enriche housebandes sixth moneth aungell gabriel sent god citie galile name wherof nazareth virgin espoused man whose name ioseph house dauid name virgin mary aungell came vnto sayd ha e thou full grace lorde blissed art thou among woman thinges thus done remained holier greater piece misterie shoulde bee procured aungell wete sonne god beeyng god immortall virgin beeyng creature subiecte vnto death bee borne man mortall like wherof neuer afore sence creacion world heardand sixth moneth ye augell gabriell sente god ne last ende world bee heard therfore whan tyme without begynnyng god prefixed drewe nere god father would sonne deliuer whole vniuersall worlde tyranny death synne sent selfsame aungell gabriell broker procurer maker vp godly copulacion andioynyng sayed virgin done sixth moneth elizabeth conceyued iohn unto heauenly matter specially deputed tendre yong virgyn set furth worlde aboundauce rich possession famousnes name portlynesse lyfe ne thynges whiche worlde vseth haue high regarde endued excellente vertues minde whiche make manne acceptable sight god saye puritie lyfe vndefiled maidenly demurenes godly deuocion habitacion homely basse litle toune galile called nazarethinto citee galile c people nothyng regarded ne set emong iewes virgin espoused vnto man fame ne porte behalfe worldes estimacion vertues mynde man accepted afore god carpenter occupacion name ioseph beyng lineally descended stocke dauid stocke dauid espoused virgin also progenie ende case might disagree prophecie whiche promised messias borne stocke dauid kyng israel name virgin mary god nons picked two person lowe degree small porte thentent worlde myght heauenly matter clayme chalenge selfe poynte part therof also pieked person moste faultlesse moste pure behauiour ende poynte cryme myght layed theyr chargeand name virgin marie pieked person coupled together chaste leefull matrimonie thentent partely priuetie childe bee borne pure virgin myght secrete vntyll due tyme therof partly case beyng otherwyse vnbeleuable whiche virgin without coumpaynying manne brought furth chylde myght lacke witnesse conueniet tyme whan virgin contemplacion within priuy closet virginitie loueth secrete aungell gabriell apperyng visible muche bryghtnes came vnto hayled straunge sorte salutacionhaile thou full grace rest thou well sayth reioyce virgin beeyng full grace highly fauour thou hast lorde ryght fauourable vnto thee muche thy frende therfore shalt thou siggularly renoumed laudable name among woman pwhen sawe abashed saying cast mynde maner salutacion might aungel sayd vnto feare mary thou hast found grace afore god beholde thou shalt conceyue thy wombe beare sone shalt call name iesus shalbe great shalbe called sonne highest lord god shall geue vnto seate father dauid shall reigne ouer house iacob euer kyngdome shalbe none ende virgin sodayne sight aungell agayne also fourme tenour salutacion beeyng straunge suche neuer heard afore forasmuche owne behalfe conceyued great opinion selfe right muche dismayed minde fore adrad entreyng one likenesse young man loked poynte certaine veray true maidenly tendre shamefastnesse made answere hande cast herselfe mynde thyng straunge high salutacio might meane partely poynte wysedomeand angel said vnto feare mary c partely demure softenesse forasmuche aungell right well knewe casting mynde would suffre longer stande doubt perplexitie toke away feare speakyng ientely vnto also declared large cause vnquod straunge gretyng mary sayeth cause thou shouldest afeard iewell thy virginitie maydenhood thou art sigularly loue withall safe vnto without daunger lesyng neyther come please set agog vaine salutacion come vnto messagier matter passyng ioyfull also veray great ponder thine owne desertes mere fauour god offered vnto thine owne merite euen veray poynte thou doest please god thou standest conceipte thy selfe let suffice thou haste atteyned grace fauour god hand nowe herken thing neuer heard aforebeholde thou shalt conceyue thy wobe yet true thyng thou shalt conceyue babe thy wombe shalt bryng furth sonne shalt call name iesus shall bryng saluacion vnto people although shalbe borne homely place mayden estemed lowe degree yet reason heauenly gyftes grace shal euery waye moste greatest insomuche shall knowen worlde shalbe called name prophete sonne hyghest surname shall greater manne maye haue forbecause chylde must borne shall ferre surmounte common rate degree mortall mannes state chylde certes wyll lord god perfourme accomplishe thyng prophecie thee vnknowen hath promised man borne stocke dauid shall sit throne fatherand kyngdome shall ende shall ayde maynteinaunce worlde vsurpe take vpon hym transitorie dominion reigne worlde heauenly father geue heauenly reigne dauid shal reigne ouer people israel euer without endesay vii neither shal euer come ende reigne prophete esay hath prophecied sayed mary vnto aun howe shall come passe seyng knowe man aungell answered sayd vnto holy ghoste shall come vpon thee power highest shall ouershadowe thee therfore holy shalbe borne shalbe called sonne god hearte virgin dyd high promise aungell weaxe whit haulte take vpon neither dyd highnes matter conceiue distrust conceyued mynde suche presumpcion whan sonne kyng partie also made quene neyther vnknowyng nothyng suche high difficultie bee done whiche god hable mere becke bryng passe care thought onely iewell virginitie whiche muche set loue therfore doeth requyre token aungell zacharie donethan sayd mary aungell c doeth maidenly shamefastnes also according wisedom enquire knowe aungell maner thing wrought doen maketh answer vnto maner meane waye shall come passe sayeth shall bryng furthe sonne forasmuche suche sorte espoused good man nowe lyue withall yet neuerthelesse haue conuersacion bodye suche wedlocke requireth continencie lyketh v bothe poynte blysfulnesse yf myght would full faine haue perpetually endure betwene v aungel answered sayde vnto cthe aungell therfore teacheth howe doen taketh awaye virgin doubtfulnesse concernyng virginitie virgin sayeth aungell nothyng shall matter doen wrought common course nature heauenly chylde bearyng shall heauenly worker shall firste ende last executed thou shalt continue chaste loue towardes thy chaste spouse fruitefulnesse issue happiest euer maye shall come thy lotte without detrimente violacion thy virginitie thou hast housband geuen vnto threfor suche purpose either make thee mother el thou make father prouidence god hath thought good meanes make sure waye thy safegarde preseruacion thy good name fame thy virginitie maidenhood thy conuenient quietnesse goddes pleasure vndoubted witnesse straunge chyldebearyng present assistente thyng would wyse thou shouldest haue one chaste continente lyuyng thy coumpany poyntes feithfull seruiceablenesse geue diligent attendaunce aswell thee chylde bee borne finally pleasure deuise pretence misterie bee kept secrete vnbeleuing sorte also kept secrete wieked spirites holy copulacion diuine nature nature man shall violate thy chastitie shall make altogether holy father heauen hath determined straunge sorte eft sone gette sonne thee neither shall sede manne mortall bee requisite nedefull diuine concepcion holy ghost shall heauen come downe thee thy wombe heauenly workehouse shall accomplishe working holy babe stede bodelye carnall embracing houseband highest shall ouershadow thee wyse tempering qualifying infinite power vertue measure capacitie mannes nature maye hable abyde metyng together conioyning therofand power highest shal ouer shadowe thee filthy lust carnall copulacion man wife whatsoeuer borne borne vncleane thrall synne shall borne thee shall conceyued moste holy embracing highest shalbe coceiued workyng holy ghost maketh thynges holy shall conceiued virgin moste pure woman god hath purposely heretofore pieked clere spotte sinfulnesse shall immedatly holy soone shalbe conceyued first reason humaine body taken substaunce thy body shall rightly called sone virgin sonne man mistery byrth perceiued vnderstanded shall called sonne ioseph sonne god truly common guyse iust person beyng purged sinnes iustified free fauour god adopcion called sonnes god shall syngular reason maner called sonne god veray true dede double begotte without beginning time eternall eternall father time mortall mortall mother veray naturall man veray woman lyke ioynyng together diuine nature shall vnited knitte nature humayne shall chylde resemble nature bothe one parent whiche god also whiche man misterie goddes deuise conueyaunce higher sorte may perceyued euen veray aungels thee sufficient shewe mynde beliefull ready obey residue shall accomplish bryng effecte power whatsoeuer pand beholde elizabeth thy cousyn also hath conceyued sonne olde age sixt moneth called baraine nothing shalbe vnpossible god mary sayed behold handmayden lorde vnto accordyng thy woorde aungell departed nowe ende thy ioye may bee aboundaunte thyne affiaunce certaintie take fresh example euen veray nere hande beholde thy cousyn elizabeth aged woman beyng nowe long tyme barainnesse vncurable hath euen selfe beeyng messagier otherwise euer hoped aboue power nature conceiued sonne whiche shall troumpette opener thy chylde bearyng beyng conceyued chylde good sence vndoubted certaintie bealy vp chylde quickened stirreth within sixt moneth sence hath conceiued comonly called name barain euen ferre strieken yeres yea nowe ferther growen agefor nothing shalbe vnpossible god myght hope haue issue although fore barain almighty god hath thought good thentent creature maye vnderstande nothyng vnbelieuable emong menne whiche power god able bryng effecte yf bee pleasure easile shall geue conception thee virgin hath geuen beeyng barain sauyng hathe pleased hym thy example singulare pierelesse thy chylde must alone without piere certayne barain woman haue heretofore special gyft god brought forth childe thei haue brought forth nothing mere men neuer hath virgin yet vnto daye brought forth childe neuer shall thee beyng one person shall himselfe comprehende nature god nature man bee borneand mary said behold handmaide lorde gabriell sayed maiden made aunswer fewe woordes woordes sorte might bee witnesse excedyng great demurenesse coupled passyng great affiaunce zele towardes god know saieth haue promysed mouth esay maiden conceiue bryng forth sonne haue doubte god hable thynges wyll false promise hath pleased executyng misterie choose depute beeyng mayden lowest sorte degree others nothing hereby chalenge claime vnto selfe either merite el grace shall euery whit come goodnesse god shall euery whit come myghtie power god nothyng willyngly offre selfe handemayden lordebe vnto according thy woorde vnto altogether dedicated ready commaundementes beleue thou doest promyse wyshe spede may fortune vnto thou doest promyse euen woorde speakyng thatsame heauenly conceyuyng chylde without felyng perceyuing accomplished wombe sonne god replenished holy ghost anon aungell leafte holy communicacion virgin aungell wyll god begynne matter restoryng mankinde thatsame first pestiferous talking virgin serpent brought worlde grounde matter mannes confusion mischiefe pand mary arose vp dayes wente mountaynes hast citie iuda entred house zacharie saluted elizabeth whan elizabeth heard salutacion mary babe lepte wombe elizabeth filled holy ghoste cryed loude voyce sayed blissed art thou emong woman blissed fruite thy wombe wherof happeneth vnto mother lorde come loe sone voyce thy salutacion sonned myne eares babe leapeth wombe ioy blissed art thou thou haste beleued thinges shalbe perfourmed thee whiche haue olde thee lorde mary beeyng reason gyfte god become sad womanlye also ientle readie thyng ought aungels woordes learned elizabeth bee chylde nowe bee sixte moneth therof lefte owne house tooke waye vppe high countrey great spede came citie iuda zacharie dyd enhabite entryng house offred gaue vnto cousin elizabeth woordes greting muthe reioyce veray glad elizabeth chylde true godlynesse doeth rather reioyce happie fortune bodye set mynde make vauntes bragges owne uirginitie loueth secrecie cummeth foorth inmoste partes house callyng vnlesse duetie moue therunto beeyng abrode maketh haste doyng poynte duetie taketh laysure mary iourney visited ne saluted one bodye wayeand saluted elizabeth vntyll come elizabeth neither salutacion greting common sorte good happe blisfulnesse dyd gretyng eyther encreace vnto efficacie spirite god dyd bothe plenteously abounde mary carryed wombe fountayne ghostely gyftes grace inspiracion babe bealy nowe altogether case nothyng came harte mouth onely god therfore came passe soone salutacion virgin mary souned eares elizabeth babe whiche beyng aged woman bealy dyd leape spryngand wha elizabeth heard salutacio marie c ye would say skyppyng ioy gladnesse iohn yet beyng borne felte diuine power lorde euen afore conceiued within enclosure tabernacle mother wombe doth gesture magnifie afterwarde set forth magnifie voice neither elizabeth without fruit perceiue fele holy leaping litle babe within babe enspired heauen mother also inspiredand elizabeth filled holy ghost altogether full whole sodaynly taken happy blissed kinde infeccion voyce mary heauely power god perceth babe within wombe elizabeth babe sodayne blastyng taken mother adblasted suche sorte partie also beeyng replenished holy ghoste nowe kepe ioyes herte although afore kept selfe within doores talke one would shame acknowen conceyued chylde mighty great voyce voyce mighty great affeccion zele worke cryed vttered suche thynges mocion spirite neither could deme swellyng bealie ne yet learned mortall manneblissed art thou emog woman c euen though heard aungell talkyng mary thus doeth begynne gratulacion happy blissed mayden sayeth thou shalt haue enioy chiefe prayse emong woman worthy commendacion holy fruite also thy virginly wombe whiche shall come forth woondrefull floure voyce nacions shall preached throughout whole vniuersall worlde long many day gone prophetes haue prophecied shal haue chiefe laude prayse emong thynges bothe heauen yearth acknowlage bee greater thyng excellencie mortall man thou bearest enclosed within chambre tabernacle thy wombe age yeres estemed v twaine vnmete young damisell mayden come aged woma dignitie worthynesse babe go withall compared duetie haste come visite thee truly parte happie fortunate enough benefite god go chylde whiche shall tyme come person small dignite estimacion deserte great happinesse chaunced vnto whiche muste bee mother lorde shoulde thus owne accorde take paine come mefor loe soone voice thy salutacion souned c vndoubted toke haue felt cumming hither lorde loe immediately whan voyce thy salutacion souned mine eares felt young chylde stiere leape vp wombe one shewyng earnest desire gladnesse go mete lorde vnto bounden duetie reuerence homage thou forsouth beeyng mother doest vnlyke chylde thy bealie beyng lorde maister doeth vouchesafe come set hys seruaunte purpose sanctifie hym replenyshe hym holye ghoste thou beeyng ferre superiour dignitie doest thynke peinfull come thyne inferiour muche lowely behauyng thy selfe thou doest surmounte excelle heauenly gyftes grace whiche gyftes thou doest veray well thou doest impute thyne owne merites forasmuche thynges geuen thee free bounceousnesse godand bl ssed art thou thou haste beleued certes behalfe art thou much happie thou diddest mistrust promisses aungell though semed neuer muche vnlykely beleued thou haste conceyued without helpe man doubt none residue thynges whiche aungell hath promised vnto thee lordes name shal sembleable trueth suertie perfourmed vnto thee pand marie sayed soule magnifieth lorde spirite hath reioyced god sauiour whan elizabeth spirite prophecie spoken woordes mary also maydenly shamefastenesse hitherto coceled ioyes harte sodainly rauished holy spirite god full good whyle erst could longer temper herselfe ne forbeare himne reioycing thankes geuing must braste lande prayse god whose goodnesse attributed whatsoeuer high especiall good thyng doeth chaunce manne woman worlde elizabeth sayeth without good cause doest thou reioyce behalfe yet cummeth euerywhit gyfte god yea free gyfte one iote presumpteously impute myne owne desertesmy soule magnifieth lorde therfore tongue onely also soule acknowledging owne weaknesse doth euen botome harte rootes magnifie exalte lorde prayses howe muche lesse merite acknowlageth selfe mouche vehemently doeth meruayle greatnesse goddes benefites haue cause wherfore geue hym thankes haue cause talke largely beneficiall goodnesse cause haue none wherfore reioyce selfewarde yet neuerthelesse spirite beeyng enflamed spirite godand spirite hath reioyced god sauioure doeth ioy possible vttred woordes skyp leape within body selfe god person onely cause worker saluacion hath loked vpon lowe degree hande mayden behold henceforthe shall generacions call blessed myghtye hathe done great thynges holy name wheras moste abiecte woman yet owne mere goodnesse hath cast mercifull iye poore handemayde beyng lowe degree hath vouchesaued geue suche great high gyfte time foorthwarde accordyng woordes aungellfrom hecefor shall generacios call blessed shall folkes talke called woman moste happie fortunate onely iewes nowe present daye aliue also al yeres age come nacions whole worlde sauiour shall happen borne bodye maye truly called happie blissed suche thyng bestowed vpon v meanes owne industrye owne merites free fauour god laude prayse therfore happie fortune shall redounde hys lande commendacion hath frely conferred geuen thesame shalbe reported happie blissed yet happie mere bountie goodnesse ecause c shall nacions whole worlde processe yeares come talke verayly whiche excedyng great power hable doe thynges hath beeyng meanest maydens wrought perfourmed thyng wonderous neuer tofore hath hearde therfore shall name numbred emong wemen good happe name shall euerie bee holye adoured worshypped name euery knee thinges heauenly yearthly also infernall shal humble selfe bough downe name onely saluacion shall come vniuersall worlde profession thys name shall perfectlye geue saluacion holinesse vnto creature callyng thys name shall disease driuen awaye venomes shall leese theyr strength deuils shal flee dead bodyes shall reuiue agayne hys mercy endureth generacion generacion vpon feare hym also shalbe thyng free gifte mere gratuitie bette duetie shall bee mercie merite whiche shall moste largely poure foorth onely nation iewes hath looked hys cummyng themselues mo ne one age alone mercy shall sprede abrode euery waye issue nacion nacion vnto fertheste endes worlde age age vntyll laste daye thys world dede israelite loked saluacio whiche promysed prophetes whatsoeuer person nacion soeuer hath forsaken vice beginneth haue feare god shall reconed felowshyp brotherhod ye israelite saluacion shall extende vnto suche myslykyng themselues shall submitte feyth vnto lord whether thei grekes frechemenne englishemen scithians contrary wyse suche persones puttyng theyr affraunce trust owne dedes shall proudely sette vp themselues agaynst greatnesse god shallbe repelled put away felowshyp partakyng benefite yea though shal descended euen abrahames ownselfe el dauid benefite god bestowed geuen eyther valuacion substaunce rychesse estimacion kynred woorkes lawe anye desertes ablyng mannes power commendacion humble herte herte sory selfe corrupt suche herte syncere perfect feyth dependeth goddes mere mercye hath shewed strength hys arme hath scatered proude imaginacion theyr owne harte god beyng mynde wyll caste downe arrogant presumtion worldly wysedome power hath stretched foorth strength puissaunce hys arme throughe sonne beeyng nowe brought state fourme humilitee wisedome worlde hathe made folyshe vanquished declaryng hymselfe euen whan doothe humble hymselfe moste lowly yet neuerthelesse myght puissaunce hygheste state emperiall worldlye power whiche hym semeth folyshe bee wyse anye wysedome worlde neuer wonderfull greate yea persones bearyng themselues bolde theyr owne wisedome trustyng theyr owne power haue sturdely lyfted vp theyr neckes agaynst god hath wonderfully disperpled scattered theyr veray owne deuises appoyntmentes accordyng long afore promised prophet saiyng wyl take ensnare wyse owne wisedome whyle subtyle wylynesse striue agaynst purpose workyng god haue bewrayed theyr owne foolishenesse also vnawares renoumed sapience god whyle mayntenaunce supportacion thys world attempt labour oppresse ordinaunce god thei haue declared howe much vnhable worlde thyng doe puissaunce god whiche rebellion haue established made strong euer hath put downe myghty seate exalted lowe degree course thynges beeyng chaunged contrary way suche persones foretymes sate lyke men hyghe estate theyr throne puffed pryde theyr worldly wisedome feared touchyng power authoritie man hath plucked downe theyr high seate suche worldward low degree hath bounteous goodnesse god exalted vp sette alofte appered bee top castell godlinesse manifestly found wicked semed bee suche nothyng dooe god god sodainlye made child sonnes god hath fylled hongry good thynges ryche hath leat goe emptie seruaunte israell hath taken hym remembraunce hys mercye euen spake vnto father abraham seede hym euer suche persones acknowelageyng theyr owne vnryghteousnesse honger iustice god hath god plenteously filled hys heauenly treasoures goodnesse syde suche owne conceiptes thought themselues great ryche men hyghly abounde good weorkts therfore dydde nothyng hungre grace gospell hath cast houngresterued circumcision turned vncircumcision vncircumcision hath succeded glory honoure circumcision israelite borne trustyng hymselfe shut parte debarred kyngdome god gentile elected taken honour child abraham proude pharisee refusd cast harlotes lowely publicane receyued taken stif stander sturdy holder vp theyr snoute hath cast downe layt outcaste nothyng regarded peryll miscarrying puttyng foorth hys mercifull hand hath reised vp holden suche theyr syght hath made blynde lamented blindnesse hath opened iyes acknowelage infirmycye sickenessehys ser unte israel hath taken hym hath geuen health suche theyr coceiptes semed bee perfectly whole hath euen leaft theyr disease vaunted themselfes child abraham hath plainly declared bee child deiuill suche poynte kynred abraham touchyng fleashe hath throughe fayth gospell made veray true chyldren abraham dede vaunted theimselues glorious name israell hath reneagued put away inheritaunce promisses made vnto israellin remembraunce hys mercie spake vnto father abraham c whatsoeuer persone whatsoeuer nacion whether beeyng bond beyng free dyd willyngly offre hymselfe ghostely seruyng god hym hathe god taken vnto hym euery suche hath perfectly shewed hys long delayed mercy mercy fore promysed woorde beeyng vttered mouthes prophetes people israel people derely beloued fansyed euen hys owne tooth doeth holy scripture call hys seruaunt neuer forgetfull promysse reason long delayeand sede hym though forgotten despayre creped vpon men hathe euidently declared hymselfe poynte vnmyndefull hys people veray true succession abraham true israell nerenesse bloud dooeth make acceptable god sinceritie purenesse feith feith onely god seen thynges wrought ne dooen chaunce casualtye thyng shewed facte long many yeres past god hath promysed vnto father abraham hys succession abraham sayed thy sede shal nacions blessed dauid saied fruicte thy body wyll sette vpon thy seate thinges long time afore promysed good men looked manye one despatred hath pleased god nowe dayes perfourme vnto true posteritye abraham stocke kynted whiche posteritiefor euer shall neuer decaye ne fayle vnto ende worlde marie abode aboute three monethes space returned owne house thynges wer yet come marye dydde spirite prophecye speake foorth playn wordes euen though come passe effect already muche lyke aboute space three monethes dyd make abode cousin elizabeth coumfortyng olde woman bothe holye vertuous communicacionand retourned agayne owne house also withall louyng frendly attendaunce euen litle tyme sayd cousin deliueraunce marie returned home dwelling place one syde helpe playe midwife parte woman laboure fitte decent office maiden neuer borne childe syde gote awaye great resorte weomen come shortely elizabethes chylde bearyng elizabethes tyme came bee deliuered brought foorth sonne neighbour kynsfolke heard lorde shewed great mercie vpon reioyced full tyme come elizabeth shoulde bee deliuered chylde sonne dede borne assuredly verifie promisses god matter common bruite noyse spred abrode meane neighboures kynsfolke whome euen lyke barainnesse elizabeth grieued afore dyd reioyce thesame greate mercye god reason manchylde borne name mother hadde happened vnto olde woman barainnesse desperate seemyng bee paste recouerye happye chaunce haue brought foorth wenthe muche luckie happe haue brought forth sonne euen thys poynte also appered promyse aungelland reioysed hadde saied come passe manye one shoulde bee gladde birth childe thither came renning many one declared themselfes reioyce well sped hadde brought foorth sonne good reason many shoulde reioyce byrth hym hadde borne hygh benefite veraye great maygnie fortuned eight daie came circumcise child called hym zacharye name hys father hys mother makyng answere said shall bee called iohn sayd vnto man thy kynred called name made signes hys father would haue hym named called writing table wrote saiyng iohn name meruail immediatly hys mouth opened hys toungue also spake praised god feare came vpon al dwelt nyghe vnto al saiynges noysed abrode throughout whole countrey iewrye al heard layed vp theyr heartes saiyng mance chylde trowe ye shall thys childe bee hand lorde wyth hym nowe come eyght day elizabeth deliueraunce whyche day priscripcion appoynetemente lawe chylde must bee circumcised haue hys name geuen hym kynsfolkes therefore resorted thyther whiche order course kynred thought partes see childe wer duely circumcised ought bee chyldes father hys speche taken hymand thei called hym zachary name father commonlye vseth hys pleasure appoynte howe chyld shall named kynsfolkes supposyng demyng father mynde wyll haue commonly woont bee moste mennes cotentacions called zacharie name hys father hys mother contrary wyse beeyng taughte thynge inspiracion holye ghoste whyche house bande beeyng dumme could learne contended called zacharye iohn wherin holy ghost signifie borne publisher newe lawe whiche newe lawe shoulde abrogate tradicions men old time turne carnal vsage therof grace spirite zacharias souneth hebrue myndefull lorde iohn hath hys name grace ryghteousnesse law consiste woorkes prescribed appoynted ryghteousnesse ghospell consisteth grace feythe kinsfolkes geue place authoritye mother contrarye parte contended ought rather called zacharyand sayde vnto man al thy kynred called name al stocke zacharie one called iohn many childe common vse remembraunce eyther father graunde father vncle father syde nere kinsman bee renewed yea yet thys present daye suche bee name zacharie dooeth delite name iohn tha wete suche persones cannot yet well abyde circumcision newe chaunges moone washynges holy dayes fasles chose difference meates sacrifice abolished euen men dede facte criyng open mouthesand made signes father howe would haue named name iohn none olde zacharye wil haue forasmuche therfore woman laie childbed kynsfolkes could agre requisitie haue autoritye father ende contencion father yet vse hys toungue althoughe nowe muche necessarye hym saye hys mynde sorte therefore myght hadde beckes sygnes made vnto hym declare meanes name pleased hym haue geuen sonne zachary soone vnderstoode matteriohn name made sygnes haue writing table thentente myght dumme letter writyng signifie vnto thyng whiche yet power liuely voice expresse whan table brought wrote wyse iohn name signifyng meaning name geuen vnto aungell conceyued dyd euery one muche woondre aswell straunge newe found name dyd lyke hym also mother whiche toungue libertyand immediatly hys mouthe opened toungue also father coulde speake agree vpon childes name nowe tyme draw nere lawe moses begyn speake whiche hytherto onely figure dum paternes sorte poynted marked grace ghospell tyme come beliefe open mouth zacharie whiche hardnes beliefe hadde accordyng promysse gabriell shutte vp soone therefore writen table also tiyng toungue looced first power speakeand spake praised god dyd none thyng begyn praisyng godde whose free bounteousnesse great heape ioyes chaunced vnto onles iewishe tounge kepe silence beyng bothe doctrice auauncer carnall obseruaunces also auoucher mannes righteousnes euangelicall toungue hath power speake preacher setter foorth grace feyth charitee preacheth workes law whiche lawe doeth recouer geue vnto man prayse reighteousnesse hys owne factes preacheth ryghteousnes god innoce ie frely conferred geuen ferth al thinges first aged woman bearing chylde straungenesse chyldes name soonne borne promyse aungell father chylde fyrste made sodaynly dumme coulde afore speake wel inough agayn dumme man soodaynely made eloquent praisyng god al thissame bruite common rumour spred abrode emog kynsfolkes neyghboures onelye also throughoute coaste iewry called hylle countrey inso muche onelye greate woondreyng also certayne kynd beyng amased tremblyng feare conceyued reason many vnwont miracle possesse hertes al folkes partyes preaumbles gathered theyr myndesand al hearde layed vp theyr hertes c thys chylde whiche nowe borne lyke processe tyme doe greate thynges thynges afore hearde forasmuche concepcion birth soone made notable woonders miracle saw hys father ferre stryken age veray vnlyke haue geatter child hys mother besydes olde woman sawe bareinnesse euery body thoughte paste hope euer shoulde haue brought foorth childe considered myracle zacharias speche whiche soodaynly taken soodainly restored heard aungel gabriel worker doer matter wel perceyued insperacion holy ghost father mother childe perceiued euerywhit matter aboue common rate sorte birthe chyldren euery parte therof haue great token vertue power god poyntes euery bodye theyr owne herte earnstely consideryng weighyng saied secretlye within themselfes man yet one thys chylde lyke bee daye one prophetes borne suche woonderfull straunge sorte veraye myracles thynges haue wrought birthe dooe euidentely declare thissame geare bee dooen power god whiche shal assiste chylde beeyng one specallye appoynted god executyng dooyng veraye hyghe thingesand han e lorde neyther without good cause thus reason matter themselfes hand god dyd veray dede extende shewe foorthe heauenly power chylde chylde parentes myndyng lesse due tyme shewe thynges greatter woondre pand father zacharye fylled holy ghoste prophecied saiyng praised bee lorde god israell hath visited redemed people thentente altogether myght bothe full myracles also replenished ioyfulnesse iohns father zacharie also beeyng altogether enspyred holy ghost brast hymne souning wholy honour prayse magnifyng almyghty god openly shewed spoken sayeth goodnes god kyndes praisynges bee magnifyed whereas e god people yet pleasure speciall purpose called god israell though wer lord al nacions also hath pleased hym people israel shal figure heauenly people whiche renouncyng despising yearthlye thynges thys worlde dooe laboure atteyne come vnto eternal citie hierusalem god wurshipped thinges inuisible al countrey soeuer lyue nacion soeuer bee borne god praysed long processe time hath laste vouchsalued suche sorte hath sene afore visite hys people great agonye almoste lene tyred tedyousnes careful long continued bondage beyng euen veray poynt vtter despaire agaynst whiche people sathan synne worlde mightilye preuailled maner hope remaine neyther phariseis philosophiers yet ceremony moses lawe hathe nowe caste hys iye lyke mercifull lord vpon hys sayd people hath freelye redemed al euils hath reised vp horne saluacion vnto v house seruaunte dauid myghty tirane whiche hauyng trayne houge coumpaigny souldiers garde ruffle playe king ouer al sortes men whose clawes possible power manne recouer deliueraunce israelite onelye god beeyng puissaunce ghostely enemy gaue strength vnto yt wer weake sending capitayn victorious ye puissaunce godlye mightinesse shoulde ouerthrowe ye power strength aduersaries ouercumming deathe frely feith geue vnto al persos euerlasting saluacionin house seruaunte dauid c thys sure warat fortres saluacio hath reised vp v house generacio dauid truly serued wurshipped vnto ye dauid afore made sure promisse yt sede benefite assuredly come vnto suche persones spirite deserue bee chyldren dauid growyng kynde sweruing tendre loue yt said father dauid towardes god dauid valiauntly luckely foughte forein nacions agaynst enemy people israel se blablye vnder captayne must fight agaynst enemy muche pernicious hurteful enemy destruie leagh mennes soules sathan hys armie wieked spirites enemyes also corrupt affeccions naughty desyres mynde prouokyng busilye stieryng men suche thynges odious hatefull afore god suche enemy also persones whatsoeuer haue loue desyre thynges worlde thynges godlye whyche persones instrumentes tooles deuill putteth hys strength vre peuen promised mouthe holy prophetes whiche sen world beganthe te te saued enemyes hande al hate v neyther dooe thinges chaunce al auentures come thus passe thyng god doeth nowe perfourme thesame many longe yere sen promysed mouthes al prophetes endewed spirit many haue prophecied sen first creacio world made promisewhiche wer sen world began c captain might puissauce one day sent saued enemyes deliuered oute handes whiche beare v suche extreme malice continually wrastle laboure drawe v vnto deathe euerlasting would deale mercifully father remember holy couenaute woulde perfourme othe whiche swore father abraham geue v deliuered handes enemyes myghte serue hym withoute feare suche holines ryghteousnes accepted dayes lyfe yet thys meryte deseruyng v nowe preset date liuig god hath perfourmed hygh benefite yet deseruing oure father afore promised thesame thing hath doen vnto v thus hath pleased gracious goodnesse bounteously geue greate thyng vnto v deseruyng thesame thus hath also semed good vnto ryghteousnesse suche time best pleased hymself perfourme thyng promised thentent might thereby creature bee perceyued bee onely mercifull beneficiall also true iuste kepyng hys promisse besides earnest promisse also make plain bargain couenaunt father beeyng delited woondrefull affiaunce truste oure chyefe father abraham towarde hymand reme bre holy couenaunt c whiche soe greate bearyng hymselfe bolde vpon goddes promysse made manner bone ne stickyng wente hande offer vp onely sonne isaac sacrifyce swore hys owne selfe abraham saiyng wise make othe sweare veray self thou hast dooen thys thing respecte commaundement hast spared thine onely begotten sonnegene xxii shall blisse thee shall multiplye thy posteritie issue sterres skye sandes liyng sea shore thy sede shall possesse gate theyr enemy name thee shall na ion yearth blissedthat deliuered oute ye handes enemy c thou hast bene obedient vnto voice verai dede ye true posteritie right sede abraham whiche obedient vnto god ceremony lawe obedience beleuing god meane ghospell dooethe speake vnto world vnto v geuen promysed victory ouer enemy deliuered tiranny sinne deliuered errours deliuered yoke deuill haue grace happe renounce former naughty liuyng ende hensfoorth beyng care feare vnder ye wyng safegarde captayn may nowe serue mo maisters hym alone whome onely bounden debtours al goodnesse euer haue tymes past bene bondeseruauntes ambicion desire worldelye honoure pompe glory bene bondeseruauntes carnall luste concupiscence couetise vnto deiuill therefore muste truly serue said captayne oure forefather dyd idle solemnisyng holye daiesin holines righteousnesse accepted god supersticion honouryng fyrst daye euery newe moone absteinyng one meate killing beastes sacrifice thinges haue nothing outward semblauce shewe holinesse syghte men purenesse conscience perfeict clennesse lyfe whiche seruice acceptable syght god hath regard vnto carnal oblacions vnto godly deuocion herte one louethe haue sacrifyce dooen vnto hym gyftes neither must seruyng god shewed doen day owne ordeinaunce therunto prefixed appointed hitherto customably hath vsed continually lyfe throughe tyme shoulde bee ceassyng slackyng dooyng suche sacrifice loue zele god warde beeyng ons freelye geuen v ought holy conuersacion deuoute appliyng selues tyme tyme styll encreased pand thou childe shalt bee called prophete highest thou shalt goe face lorde prepayre way geue knowelage saluacio vnto people remission synnes tendre mercy oure god whereby daie spryng high hath visited v geue light sate darkenesse shadow death guide fere waye peace happy therefore free goodnesse god blessed whome according saiynges prophetes nowe thus geuen mighty redemer salueoure whome power maye vanquishe withstand free goodnesse god happye blissed arte thou also litle babe whiche arte thus specially chosen appoynted foregoer messagier great captayne lyke day sterre goeth arisyng sunne causing men awake lye sluggyng slepe loke clere day lyght whiche draweth nere euen comming lorde beyng nowe hande hathe fullye decreed entended onely sonne come visite presente worlde thou shalte goe afore hym prepaire men hertes receiuyng greate saluacion lest comming lord fynde hertes men slouthfully singgyng vtterly vntowarde ye helth nowe offred might percase bee turned manyfolde castyng away perishing soule truely thy baptisyng thy preaching thou shalt bryng passe men shal wel perceyue themselfes synnersfor remission synnes yt shall know themselfes haue neede phisician shall knowe hym present alone fayth ghospell bounteously geue vnto al persones euerlasting health saluacion freelye remittyng pardonyng synnes cause death soule frely conferring geuing righteousnes vnto v vnto true beleuers shall come possible merites thexceading great mercie ye lorde godthroughe tender mercie god c woulde haue perishe created almyghty created moste merciful restored vtterly bene loste onlesse accordyng goodnesse propre nature rooted extended mercie vnto v onles manier bright sunne arysyng v heauen euery syde dryuen awaye darkenesse ignoraunce onlesse put away dimme miste synne enkiendled colde hertes feruente burnyng fyre dere loue charitie wer liyng darkenes hadde power lift vp iyes towardes hubled himselfe doune v sending doune bright shining beames vpon hertes gaue clere healthful light vnto vsand shadowe deathe c afore sate derkenesse sinne despaire recouery blacke shadowe death vtterlye blynded manyfold idolatry al derkened ouer ouer worldly desire ranne wickednes wickednes groping foggie mistines enbracing earthly thinges stede heauenly shadowes thinges stede thynges selfes thynges carnall stede ghostely thinges pestiferous full poyson stede holsome loe botomelesse nyght dispayre nowe arisen vp vnto v euerlasting sunne direct set fete oure hertes waye ghospell whiche waye peace throughe faythe charitye maketh perfecte agreemente vnitye betwene god man breakyng stryfe enmitie afore betwene knittyng nacions world together profession one name one fayth finally wise qualifiyng appeasing troubleous affeccions mynde euery man may perfect staigh quietnes attonemente within hymselfe chyld grewe waxed strong spirite wyldernes tyll daye came whan shoulde shewe hymselfe vnto israel e thynges godly olde man pronounce propheticall breste folowing exaumple olde auncient prophetes dyd playn sort declare sette forth ye thinges thei came though together euen eray presente houre alreadye dooen woonderfull begynnynges matter procedinges dyd moste beste wyse agree chylde iohn whiche bene woonderful straunge manier borne like grew body according rate yeres euen inspiracion god time time prosper stil better better stedfastnes strength spirit neither log time kepe home father mother theyr houseand wildernes euen byanby fro childhood withdrewe hymself away common haunte people entente myghte take soe much least spotte fylthinesse maye bee coumpaigniyng multitude forasmuch bene sanctified mother wombe neuer dronke wyne strong drynke wherby distempered neuer tasted worldly pleasure neuer tasted worldly honour worldly desyres carnal appetite passed vpon vtterly reufsed liued emong saluage beastes locustes wild honey wede clothyng camelles hydes silkes veluettes hys gyrdle hearie thong leather hys communicacion continually god forsouth suche lyfe comely hym ordeyned preacher repentaunceuntyll daye came shew vnto israelite place pieked accordyngly agree prophecy calleth voice one criyng wildernes thys place kepe knowelage space manye yeres lyue silence ende whan hys due tyme might shewe speake authority hys owne head hastily steppe forth office preacher tyme spirite god putte hys minde shewe forthe lyghte open vnto people israel howe greate man dyd streight way begynne dooe parte foregoer smal autority seconde chapter pand chaunced dayes went commaundement augustus emperoure worlde shoulde bee taxed taxyng fyrste excuted whan syremus lieutenaunte syria euery man went vnto hys owne ci ie bee taxed ioseph also ascended galile citye called nazareth iewrye vnto citye dauid whiche called bethleem house linage dauid taxed marychys spoused wyfe whiche chylde thus haste thou hearde woonderfull birthe iohn whiche foregoer christe messagier afore hys cummyng nowe shalte thou heare muche woonderfull birthe iesus christe hymselfe shoulde afterwarde bee onely prynce whole worlde shoulde moue nacions yearth profession name meane threatening putting feare benefites holsome doctryne workyng therefore prou sion god conueighed vnder emperoure augustus tyme lorde manye countreyes realmes party worlde thynges beeyng euery perfeic peace tranquilitie held gouerned empire romaine al prouinces coutreyes many helde empire rome shoulde surueighed noubred polles thentente myght acknowleage augustus lord king cal englande myght sworne true liegt people themperoure augustusthere went oute commaundemet augustus emperour successours emperours rome whyche thyng god wroughte euen purpose myghte appere howe much wyder circuite larger dominion christ reache dominion ceasar howe muche quiete ientle christes manier reignyng ouer men taketh nothyng awaye v yet geuethe v heauenly thynges ye reignyng ceasar although lye hys power geue heauenly thynges yet neuerthelesse catcheth awaye worldly commodity extort power enforceth men take hym theyr kyng whereas heauenly emperour christe doth ientilly allure men vnto hym hys beneficiall goodnes towardes regystred booked emong subiectes ceasar thyng dooe acknowlage verai state seruitude bondage daily find worldly substaunce pared away diminished registre themselues seruauntes newe prince receiue perfecte freedome sure waraunte euerlastyng saluacion fewe woordes make emperoure octauius augustus althoughe emong emperours rome manne moste good policie conueighaunce passing affayres yet many nacios wer could subdue al great army hys valiaunt men warre oure capitayne christe hathe without force armes without anye garrison worldlye puissaunce gathered together one churche one kyngdome whole vniuersall worlde many sundry language many sundry rite many sundry sectes seruyng god god men owne deuisyng soe manye barbarous nacions liuyng sundrye priuie corner nowe goe forth matter executyng general surueighe taxe shoulde taken countrey syria sent aswell thautoritie ceasar augustusand taryng first executed whan quirinus lieutenaunte syria c also decree ye whole senate rome one quirinus rewler lieutenaute prouince euen veray fyrst taxe euer rewler toke syria diuerse sundry others taken afterwarde thesame prouince within tyme thesame mane lieutenaunt comaundement tha ceasar whiche quirinus caused euerye proclamed persos take theyr iourney goe euery one theyr owne tribe kynred came citie proprelye belonged thesame tribe thither resorted euerye one acknowlage augustus emperoure rome theyr lord head gouernour earth custome ioseph spouse virgin maryebecause house nage dauid c whereas tribe iuda hys wyfe marye thesame trybe also yet neuerthelesse dwelled nazareth whiche poore litle citye galile ioseph therfore shuttyng vp hys doores leauyng house resorted towarde owne tribe wete iewrye towardes litle preaty citie called bethleem kyng dauids buildyng bothe ioseph also virgin marye onely belong tribe iuda also liniall descente come progeny stocke dauid whose seede promised christ al thynges one poynt chaunced mere casualtye euery whit procured purposely dooen prouidence determynacion god thentente thende conclusion alltogether shoulde euery behalfe agree holye saiynges prophetes whiche diuided glory great high matter betwene two city kyng worlde conceiued bred vp nazareth thesame king borne bethleem according prophecie place dyd virgyn marye also beeyng great childe nowe euen veray nere time accompaignie spoused houseband ioseph virgyn thoughe greate bealye yet refused trauaill suche great iourney houseband forbore come ye sight men knowyng herselfe owne conscience bee clere spotte synne thought scorne obedient seruiceable houseband though ye tyme hande whan mother bryng foorth god disdayned taken vsed wyfe poore carpenter though woman full whole consecrated god pand fortuned whyle wer time come deliuered broughte foorth first begotten soonne wrapped swadlyng clothes laied maungier roume ynne whyle occasion hereof made abode certaine day remained citie bethleem fortuned ful monethes goiyng chylde expired time deliueraunce come whiche thyng god wrought thentent myght euidently bee knowen seen persones borne naturally veraye man dede lord heauen yerth pieked himselfe bee borne slender basse litle toune whiche neuerthelesse house chose parentes pooreste loweste sorte also pleasure borne straunge place fro home entente ashamed pride also oure auarice might leste wyse exaumple learne man felicitie bee measured estemed common gooddes thys transitorye worlde whiche bee taken awaye v yet fyrst last taken awaye blisse man bee estemed suche good thynges treasure endure euer yea myght ferther lesson v gather laye vp treasure countreyward ende maye continuallye without ende haue fruicion yf wyll vpryghtely make comparison matter true iudgemetes dignity high estate power maiestie moste humble poore birth christ pompes triumphes solemne shewes royaltie emperours euer thus bethleem called house bread holy yog virgin bring foorth vnto vsand brought forth first begotte sonne heauenly breade whiche whoso eateth doth neuer dye onely chylde bearyng virgin like presidet ensauple wherof neuer afore neuer folowed chyld mother onely sonne respect v first begotten respecte v saye hath spirite ioyned made v bothe hys brother also partaker hym hys euerlastyng inheritaunce would come alone father fyrst begotten sonne owne partie would bring many mo brother besydes hymself felowshyp partakynge euerlasting saluacion whan litle babe borne mother put forth nourcing woman one syde tender motherly loue bare would none nources herselfe sydeand layed hym maungier roume inne reason pouertye none veray owne self owne handes lapped vp swadling bade cloutes suche hadde common ynne hostery lodgyng kept reason great resort welthier geastes none roume ne place void beyng new deliuered child layd doune youg babe maunger stede cradle geue eare thou proud ryche man euer thou heapeste together possession landes vpon landes art euery corner builder house offer holdes mainours palacies bothe lorde also maker heauen yearth whome thou thy selfe haste baptisme professed acknowlaged thy selfe disciple seruaunt borne straung place owne home hath ne canne geat muche litle corner good roume common hosterie thou acknowleage thy soueraigne lord maister whose commaundementes thou hast faithful othe bound thy selfe obey fulfyll leate g eue folowe exaumple rather bee thou ashamed thyne owne proude mynde thesame region shepeherdes watchyng kepyng flocke nyght loe aungel lorde stoode hard bryghtnesse lord shone round wer sore afrayed aungel sayd vnto afrayed beholde bryng tydinges great ioye shall come people vnto borne thys daye citie dauyd salueour whiche christ lorde take sygne ye shall fynde chylde wrapped swadlyng clothes layed maungier streyght way angell multitude heauenly souldiers praisyng god saiyng glorye god hygh peace yearth vnto men good wylle ken nowe sorte humble poorenes birthe altogether full princely royaltye tour ferre bethleem called hebrue toungue toure ader yf ye shoulde saye englishe toure flocke soe named reason good pasture groudes laie inthose party veray great store shepe cattall pastured dede thys toure ader doeth prophete micheas also make mencyon lyke doeth bethleem therfore quarter diuerse shepeherdes watched abrode ye night season safegarde theyr flockes ueryly euen thyng selfe geuyng good lesson thyng byshops ought theyr bounden duetye doe helth people committed theyr spirytuall charge yf wyll folow ye ensaumple steppe christ prince head shepeherdes night time thatsame bright sunne righteousnesse borne euery syde put awaye darkenes worlde pleasure fyrst al haue hys byrth knowen rather men low degree borne poore soort shepeherdes hymselfe ghostly pastoure emperours kynges ruler deputy cou treyes phariseis scribe byshops loe sodainly aungel gabriel stoode high derectely ouer theyr heades besides also certain straung light sodainly flushed shone round shepeherdes neyther lyght sunne moone ne candle although thissame thyng semed lesse betoken good luckye thyng toward yet shepeherdes reason vnwonte soodain miracle wer ons throughly taken veray great feare aungel anon taketh away feare speakyng amiablie vnto themfor vnto borne daye citee dauid saueour christ lorde dooe awaye feare sayeth cause ye drede come vnto messagier moste gladdesome matter suche ioye neuer yet hath bene hearde bryng onely also al people israel godly mouthes prophetes long many yeres gon promysed salueour many long yere hath messias bene loked night thatsame messias borne borne vnto veraye true messias prynce lorde king priest anoynted god fro aboue dede borne citie dauid called bethleem accordyng holy saiynges prophetes eu thissame veray nyghte go ye enquire hym wyll geue whereby maye knowen go ye common inne shal ye find litle suckyng babe lapped swathyng cloutes layed doun rest maungier assone gabriell thus much sayed immediatly heard great multitude heauenly souldierspraysyng god c say aungels minysters seruauntes lorde beeyng myghtye puissaunt battaill also warre fyght v agaynst prince worlde aungels suche heauenly armonie melodious swete noyse tongue expresse dyd syng songes prayse vnto god magnifiyng settyng furthe hys vnspeakable loue towardes mankynde declaring great ioye gladnes conceiued behalfe mankinde great blisfulnes goddes mere fauour mercie happened hymne forsouth heauenly quier aungelles swete tune syng together one charme thys glorye high god yearth peace men good vville whiche song aungels dothe muche effecte signifye vnto v verailye thys matter poynte al glory due neyther aungelles ne yet manglorye god high al whole glory laude therof due vnto onely goodnes god hys mercye loue towardes v hath created doeth wondrefull wayes conueighaunce prouide v heauen entent wel perceiue whatsoeuer thing either honoure anauncement el helth saluacion dooeth happylye chaunce vnto v cummeth vpon v heauen ought yearthe wishe desire none thyng peace whiche maye abolyshe synneand peace ye yearth men good wyll bryng v fauour god whiche maye knit v together mutual loue charitie one towardes another thissame truely peace worlde god whyche dooeth excede passe al compace r ache ma vnderstanding ferre weigheth poyntes degree blisfull state may present world peace freely offred vnto v reconciler maker atonemente betwene god man anye meane helpe oure owne merites desertes ready willing goodnes god towardes v whome hathe pleased thys woondrefull maner prouide recouerye sauyng mankynd pand fortuned assone aungels wer gone awaye heauen shepeherdes sayde one another let v goe nowe euen vnto bethleem see thing heare say happened lord hath shewed vnto v came wyth hast founde marye ioseph babe layed maunger whan seen published abrode saiyng whyche told chylde hearde woondred thynges whiche tolde shepeherdes marye kept saiynges pondered heart shepeherdes returned praisyng laudyng god al thynges heard seen euen tolde vnto themthe shepeherdes said one another aungels assone thei moste ioyfull gladsome noyse begonne vnto shepeherdes synging song honour childes birth returned agayne heauen done shepeherdes sort good homely plain folkes came laied heades together counsail doubtyng wordes angel spoken coueting fully knowe thing heard thus therfore spake emong selues sayde one another leat v dooe aungel hath aduertised v leat v goe hence euen streight bethleem thing haue oure eares heard happenedlet v goe eue vnto bethlem see thy thyng c maye euen presentely see beholde iyes entent may readie perfect truth credite speake declare vnto others thyng lord hath vouchesalued geue v knowelage aungels godly deuise lyked furth theyr way go shepherdes haste deuocion godly zeale spurre theyr heartes pricke foreward anon come bethleem come ynne appoynted euen angel promised finde marie newly deliuered childe ioseph witnes virgin deliueraunce babe also bound vp swathyng clothes layed therby maungier deuout godly shepeherdes nothyng offended neyther bare pouerty tender young virginand whan sene c housband beyng syght estimacio world man meanest bassest sorte ne yet poore litle babe defaulte commodious place parentes wer faine laye doune maungier thynges would haue made ye proud phariseis scribe take vtter scorne disdayne matter ye shepeherdes thynges better confirmed beleue matter stedfastly whan witnesse theyr owne iyes perfeictly knew founde wer fable ne lye aungel tolde tydynges maye note tender loue zele towardes god hath persones neuer slender lowe degree certain wisdome worldly cast owne thynges shepeherdes dyd euen byanby publish abrode thyng heard assoone perfectely knewe thyng certayn doubt thei feare talke thing heard abrod also emog coumpanies christ loued haue talke birthe cummyng fyrste aryse begynne suche reporter publisher wer men suche simplicitie plainnes man would suspect mystrust eyther fablyng lying el clokyng counterfeycting hadde suche wit inuent lye theyr owne braines could skylle deuise put thyng trueth hat seen thyng heard seen euen heard seen euen none otherwyse dyd shewe tidinges vnto good heartes disposicions among smal number menne wordes shepeherdes fynd credence inso muche made great maynie veraye desirouse fayne haue syght chyldeand al hearde c thys behalf marke thou consider wise sobernes demurenes holy tender virgin mary learneth shepeherdes newes aungels tolde song quier heauenly souldiers syng alone owne partie holdeth peace keping close brest diligente consideracion weighing conferring owne heartebut marie kept al sayinges c thynges fortuned aswell present also afore whan aungell appered vnto selfe kepeth secret vntyl due tyme come open misterye beeyng conceyued chylde yet pure virgine maketh vauntes ne bragges coumpanye emong folkes happy fortune hadde afore vnto aungell gabriel promysed herselfe readye handemayden god worke hys wyl vpon euen lyke humble handmayden vseth herselfe maketh woordes depelye considereth mind straunge course goddes weorkyng drift thys matter considereth thynges bee full straunge miracle seeth euery parte two extreme contrary myngled together wete worldes behalfe exceadyng lownes pouerty abieccion goddes behalf vnestimable highnes maiestie young babe conceiued wombe aungell messagier holy ghost worker chylde borne mother mayde laied mau gier aungels beeyng full godly reioysyng doe syng heauen honor lyeth
