vnknowen blynde corner regarde heauen bougheth downe wurshyp maiestye assoone borne nowe thynges thus beyng done sheperdes returne backe agayne flockes glorifyng praysyng god concernyng thynges heard aungels truely found euery thing euen heard afore aungels pand whan eyght daye come chylde circumsised hys name called iesus named aungel conceiued wombe assoone eyght daye deliueraunce come whiche eyght daye lawe moyses commaundeth euery man childe circumcised say haue foreskynne flesh pared away roud thys thyng form abraham furthwarde pleased god ye sygne marke suche shoulde bee reputed taken bee hys sede generacion lawe satisfyed thys poynte alsogene xviv consideracion come breake fordooe lawe fulfyll neyther dyd disdeigne take accustomed remedye appoynted lawe euen though subiect sinne parentes wer wheras alone none fre clere corrupcion sinne alone take awaye al synnes world chose vnto hym newe people whiche haue hearte well clensed desire fleshe wyth kniues blounte stone sharpe sweorde woorde euangelical whyche purgethe clenseth thynges fayth yea name geuen hym custome ye manier others called hebrue iesus souneth englishe sauiour thys name casual thauce al auentureshis name called iesus c orels mannes wylle geuen vnto thys childe authoritie commaudement god bene appoincted geuen afore aungel gabriell ere conceyued virgin wombe whiche done ende men myght euen firste veraye woorde name aduertised doen wete thissame veray throughly geue vnto persones true health saluacionmath suche wyse represent true guyde capitayne iosue whan people cleane pourged al filthines vyce synne shoulde conueyghe bryng lande heauen flowyng moste plentiouslye wyth ioyes euerlastyng pand whan tyme theyr purificacion lawe moyses come brought hym hierusalem presente hym lorde written lawe lorde euery manchilde firste openeth matrice shall bee called holy lorde offer sayd law lord payre turtle doues ii young pigions hitherto say vntyll circumcision iesus eyght daye hys birthe done nothing making signes profers vnto ghospell vnder certayne fygures gospell necessytie bee preached fyrste vnto people iewes fifth day circucisyon came three magians say philosophiers hygh learnyng priuyties astronomie scyences mathematical magians shewing poyncting certayne new sterre bene halfe enforced come farre place east countreys purposely see thys childe kneled downe wurshipped newe borne soueraigne worlde honoured thesame misticall presentes gyftes signifying certayne shewe semblaunce thynges suche myghte bee made gentile shoulde tyme come embrace grace ghospell whan iewes manquillers murderer iesusand whan tyme theyr purificacion c wilfully caste forsaken agayne whan xl day mary deliueraunce come whiche xl daye law moses willeth biddeth manchylde first borne childe woman bee presented vnto lorde ferther appoynteth gyfte presente offered purifying aswell chylde newe borne woman lay common childbearing deliueraunce woman haue without muche vnclenesse bodye thys tender young virgyn beyng one moste syngular demurenes myldenesse refuseth thys behalfe neyther seme lyke vnto woman whiche common course nature doe bryng furth chyldren ne auoydeth doe doe whereas chyldebearyng nothyng al defiled spot vncleanesse euery parte replenyshed heauenly puritie holinesse poyncte vnpurenesse coulde woman haue bearyng chylde without muche touchyng man conceiued power vertue god embracing working holy ghoste touching childe pray possyble spotte fylthynesse bee suche chylde beyng borne heauen come thys worlde euen thys onely purpose alone onely might pourge mankinde filthynes sinne partely pleasure god suche notable exaumples sobrenes humilitie bee breake pryde manne partely conuenyente whiche come pergette close vp bothe broken walles saye come ioyne knytte people iewes people gentile bothe together one professyon ghospell shoulde behalfes poynctes satysfie lawe moysesthey brought hierusalem preset hym ye lorde whiche firste fayth authoritie afterward procede come vnto ghospell mother therfore ioseph determinate aduised working god yet stil thought supposed euery manne father iesus brought theyr young babe vnto hierusalem ende might temple bee presented sighte lord whome dedycated halowed thoughe god lorde true owner thynges mystycall fygure teache v suche hertes none others bee throughlye accepted afore god subduing vanquyshyng inordynate desire fleashe whiche reigneth naught corrupcyon nyce tendrenesse dooe mannelye strengthe spiriteexod xiii xxii stoutely sette furth towardes thinges heauenly euerlasting law moyses meaning thing prescribed appointed euery male kinde sone opened matrice dame come world reputed taken halowed consecrated lordnume viii b whether brought furth woman brute beastes entente euen also firste fruites shoulde allotted vnto priestes yet vnder suche condycyon fyrste borne mankynde myghte bee redemed small offreyng boughte priestes handes excepte chylde trybe leuileuit xii lawe selfe doeth openly discharge deliuer holy childe wife bande lawe whan sayeth thyrde boke moyses entiteled leuiticus woman haue conceiued borne manchilde c exod xiii afor thys mother neyther properly called woman forasmuche knew parte mannes body broughte furth chylde receiuing seede partie agayne whan sayeth euery one male kinde first openeth matrice c doeth sufficientely declare selfe meane common mannier delyueraunce mother haue theyr child whiche mother reason seale theyr virgynytie broken vp afore manne doe bryng furth chylde neyther withoute muche vnclenesse yet without certayne kinde put shame heauenly childe neyther whan entred whan came furthe dyd anye meanes pollute enclosure tabernacle maydenlye woumbe mother rather consecrate thesame seale vp hencefurthe neyther bodye beyng temple euer dedycated vnto god ne yet soule ye woulde say closet holy ghoste replenished odoryferous swete sauours mighte bee open receyue stayning corrupcion wordely fylthinesse therfore whiche lorde thinges bothe heauen yearthe presented offered temple one subiecte bounde vnto lawe agreed redemed priestes handes agayne small price whiche shoulde afterwarde redeme whole vniuersall world price bloude lawe prescrybed parentes mighte bye first borne manchilde lambe one yere olde geuen bee burnte offeryng besides lambe shoulde bee broughte male pygyon turtle doue pourgyng dooyng away sinne spotte thereof bene gotten eyther carnall copulacion begetting chylde elles afterwarde ought euery side bee pure whatsoeuer thing bee offered vnto lorde penurie lacke substance parentes behalfe coulde wel suffer lambe bee geuen stede lambe geuen turtle doue young pigion redeming bying chylde byrde offered pourgeyng sinne offred therefore gyfte poore folkes doubte woulde haue geuen bountifull offreyng theyr pouertie beene lette thereof hadde hertes ryche good loue zeale towarde godde ensaumple prepared v folowe theyr profession open knowlagyng theyr pouertie expedyente serued better thinges dispensacion god ordinauce thus executed doen partely many cause consideracions specially cause purpose veraye truethe oure humayne nature myghte manye euydente proufes token bee declared bee chylde marie ene greate bellye ynne within lytle space soone broughte furthe chylde greate bealy gone agayne childe euen new borne knowen found shepheardes soughte oute wurshypped magians circumcysed solemne custome vsed nacion eftesons brought temple openly presented vnto pryestes thinges came passe neither body might doubte birth yet litle litle came notice knowlage mo mo moste chiefly meane folkes yea none godly deuoute person onely meete suche thyng shoulde neyther fewe proufes bee enforced yet onely common poynctes euydence bee confirmed credited beleued shoulde vnto al age time wel past come person bring euerlasting health saluacion beleued shoulde contrary wise bring euerlastyng death aungell therfore cummeth message god bryngeth woorde thyng afore vnto marie spouse ioseph ioyned vnto afore ende maye true witnesse mattier elizabeth whiche liued barayne tyll aged woman bringeth furth childe zacharie whan long time contynued dumme restored vse hys tongue hathe hys speche agayne bothe well zacharie elizabeth sodaynelye rauyshed spiryte prophecie iohn leapeth hys mother woumbe ioye virgin without mannes helpe conceyueth chylde magians beyng straungiers farre countrey come renning haue sighte childe doe wurship theyr knee shepheardes talke abrode declare openlye come suche greate noumber euidente token many straunge wonder miracle newe birth child approued aucthorised p beholde man hierusalem whose name symeon thesame man iust godly loked consolacion israell holye ghoste aunswere receyued holye ghoste shoulde see deathe excepte firste sawe lordes christe came inspiracyon temple whan father mother broughte childe iesus dooe hym cu lawe toke vp armes sayde lorde nowe eattest thou thy seruaunt departe peace according thy promise myne iyes haue seen saluacion whiche thou haste prepared face people light lighten gentile glory thy people israell nowe entente shoulde bee sexe age state degree menne profession christ haue testimonie witnesse euerie one neyther one bodye lefte behinde might assuredly promyse vnto hymselfe healthe saluacyon handes christeand man iuste godly c time hierusalem certayne man named symeon manne reason olde age colde hys bodye spirite feruente hote bodye feble impotente soule quiuer lustie yeres drye withered perfectenesse good lyuyng freshe floures wete veraye iuste vpryghte man verye dede deuoute manne full godlynesse huntyng aboute glorye lucre handes menne exaumple phariseis ryghte desirouse muche hungryng health saluacyon al mankinde generall whome delite pleasure dyd make willing continue thys life sauyng onely myghte hys owne iyes see veraye selfe messias whome wholy sayinges prophetes promysed come veraye entente purpose recomforte people israell whiche people hadde bene long tyme afore many wayes muche distresse dyd euen veraye lyue greuous afflyccyonand ye holy gost c thys symeon dede good manne assured knowleage afore inspiracyon holy ghoste day tyme nowe alreadye come whereas moste ardente prayer besoughte lorde geue hym gift mighte euen hys bodelye iyes beholde messias nowe manye hundred yeres loked secrete closet hys godlye breste receiued aunswere holye ghoste shoulde sure depart presente lyfe shoulde firste see bodely iyes blessed babe whome seene manye daye afore iyes eyth ende myghte wytnesse hym bee come dede whome dyd nothyng doubte come shoulde blessed chylde saye whome south god hath singularely aboue al menne enoynted mighte haue enioye bothe kyngdome euer endure also priestehood neuer bee abrogated abolishedand came inspiracio teple therefore whan tyme shoulde come chylde iesus shoulde bee broughte temple haue sayde blyssed olde manne afore named secretly warned mocyon spirite came euen litle temple whan marie mother chylde ioseph yet styll beleued bee father broughte babe temple execute doe suche thinges vnto accustomed rite purifycacion dyd appertaynethan toke h vp armes sayed soone chylde offered vp pryeste receyued maner blessed godlye zeale olde man coulde longer forbeare also woulde nedes take hys armes litle young babe whome greately longed euen furthwithall hys voyce case long continue fayle reason age sodaynly brast praysing god singing swete melodious song muche sorte ye lyken poetes philosophiers writtenlorde lea este thou thy seruaunte departe peace swannes vse litle shall dye thus sayde desyres lord nowe fully satisfied nowe willing glad dye nowe thou geuest thy seruaunte leaue departe restfull quiete mynde felyng ne hauing ferther wante al lacke life euen desirouse fayn nowe passe feble olde carkas vnto blissed company felowshippe godly persones whiche haue long afore nowe loked thys dayfor myne iyes haue seen thy saluacion c yet neuer happe see spirytuall iyes theyr faythe prayer nowe aboundauntlye satysfyed haue happe euen bodely iyes also see whome hath beene geuen myne olde armes embrace thyne sonne whome whome hath pleased thee geue true healthe saluacyon onely people israell also nacions vnyuersall worlde thys babe litle bodye though bee homelye symply borne syghte worlde acknowlage lorde thy vertue power acknowlage babe bee lyghte worlde promised holye sa ynges prophetesa light lighten getiles c acknowlage thys childe bee brighte sonne whiche thy holy pleasure haue spring vp arise vnto worlde myght euery side dryue cleane awaye darkenesse gentyles thy people israell mighte haue whereof without good cause glorye thy people israell saye beyng true dede thy veraye owne fleshe onelye wherehence dede begynnyng thys saluacyon hathe proceded spirituall kynred whiche acquired purchased throughe faythe ghospell suche one veraylye bee called name israel whosoeuer earnestly fixeth deuout godly iyes vpon lyght violence faythe forceablye breaketh kingdome heauen tymes paste hitherto people iewes hath gloryed made vaunte vpon abraham isaac iacob haue gloryed made great vauntes moses theyr temple prophetes hensforth gostly israel sudry place dispersed throughout worlde shall glory thy sonne whome thou hast vouchsalued sende others mencyoned one greatnesse vertue power ferre aboue nowe thys presente dede lyeth hidden corner knowen ought bee veraye fewe person tyme come lighte hym shall blase abrode shall hys bryghte shynyng beames lyghten quarter coastes worlde father mother meruelled thinges whiche w spoken simeon bl ssed saied vnto marie mother beholde childe set bee falle vprising many israell signe spoken moreouer sw orde shal perce thy ule thoughtes many hertes may opened nowe mother infaunte ioseph seeyng thys bee spoken olde manne simeon inspiracion spirite god conferring also thinges gone afore said neuer worde merueyled theyr myndes olde mannes wordes might meane symeon whan blissed chylde also prayed god sende parentes muche ioye hym turnyng hymselfe vnto marie sayde vnto sonne thyne although hath bene geuen v god ende may geue vnto person euerlasting saluacyon yet defaulte manne shal chaunce lyke shall lift vp hope euerlasting health great maignye whiche shall willingly enbrace gifte god euen greate number people israell vtterlye despysing bounteouse goodnesse god cummyng towardes offreyng itselfe vnto shall bee cast downe eternall damnacion whan trueth shal thys thy sonne opened published manye shall fall whiche afore seemed standeand signe spoken c many shall aryse vp seemed lye duste hath bene looked israelite shall bee receyued shall set vp vnto signe suche one neuer hath yet beene set vp sence beginning ye world yet shal one shal haue many man speake agaynst deny phariseis ye scribe bishop shal make much murmuring prating vnbeleuers heritiques shall make muche clamouring roryng agaynst hym muche sediciouse brablyng shall euery place bee reysed agaynste hym euen thou thy selfe shalte bee withoute parte euilles shall comethat thoughtes manye hertes may bee opened c crueltie shall lyght vpon suche persones onely shall beleue thy sonne also thy verye owne hearte soule shall sweorde doloure gryefe perce suche sygne hath pleased god shewe furth iyes al menne cleare light trueth shewed furth shine abrode thoughtes men might discouered afore laye hidden theyr heartes course thinges shoulde suche wyse turned contrarie waye thyng selfe might playnelye declare ferre true ryghteousnesse sight iudgemente men semed sit euen high chaire righteousnesse suche bee manifestelye founde wieked gotten taken theyr owne handes doctryne teachyng true relygyon towarde god contrarye wise suche afore reputed men ferre waye true religion godlinesse might playnely declared haue bene muche nere vnto true relygyon others suche semed vnto worlde bee reiected paste grace hope recouery suche shoulde vnfeigned readynesse beleuing god admitte leatte firste kyngdome heauen scribe phariseis haue contynually messias theyr mouthe haue lawe euermore theyr mouthe haue ryghteousnesse alwayes theyr mouthe keepe often muche temple tarrie long theyr prayer faste often walke vp downe notably besene theyr brode phylacteryes hide theyr heartes thyng ferre contrarye shewe outwarde semblaunce wily wicked thoughtes suche light trueth ghospell whan aryseth shall playnely fynde detecte publicanes harlottes sinner counterfaictes holyenesse debarred sacres holy rite temple suche shall god receiue firste kyngdome heauen gentile whiche haue bene geuen idolatry sodaynly chaunging theyr life shal gredy zeale affeccion enbrace doctrine true godlynesse phariseis bisshops whose handes power keye awe relygyon dyd reste shal obstinate endeuoure resist agaynst night hath perfect iudgemente thinges ofte time stede thynges selfes sheweth iye onely shadowes vayne counterfaites thinges sunne whan vp geueth cleare lyghte dryueth awaye blinde casting mistes mennes iyes shewing euery thyng owne likenesse geuing euery thing hys owne coulour dyd godly olde manne speake reioysing making glad chere botome hearte whiche holy ghoste throughly enspired p propheti e one anna daughter phanuell tribe er whiche greate age lyued housbande seuen yeres virgynitie bene wedowe fower score fower yeres whiche departed temple serued god fastinges prayer nyghte daye came furthe houre praysed lorde spake hym looked redempcion israell lorde iesus receyued witnesse cumming world aungels virgyn marie spouse ioseph neuer hadde zacharie prieste young babe iohn yet mother woumbe vnborne elizabeth maried woman shepeheardes wyise menne called magians scribe gaue vndoubted sentence iudgemente oute prophecie place christe shoulde bee borne herode drede feare leste eiuyll shoulde growe christes natiuytie symeon neyther pryeste ne leuite vpright liuyng man nothyng el nowe remayned myghte haue semblable testymonie wedowe greate efficacye vertue thys young babe yet shewing furthe full mighte power rauyshed thynges spiryte god enspiryng humble poore sorte holye ghoste stryekyng proude sore trouble mynde feare preamble thinges might without anye dyfficultie bee gathered chaunge worlde lykelye tyme comming whan childe come full age would openlye vtter foorthe godlye voyce hys whan shoulde miracle daily weare famouse wha dye arise agayne lyfe whan shoulde plenteouslye power furthe holye ghoste heauen vpon suche beleued hym nexte olde manne long tyme liued withoute anye wife foloweth olde woman many yeres liued wedowe without housbande certayne woman called anna whiche name geuen thyng saye grace hyghlye endued spyryte prophecye daughter phanuell beeyng manne good fame muche commendedand prophetisse one anna c tribe aser whiche trybe beyng eyght order emong twelue dooeth vnder certayne pryuie fygure sygnifye blyssednesse resurreccyon whiche solemnytye doctryne ghospell hath added hallowyng sabbothes iewes dydde vse aser hebrue muche saye englyshewhiche greate age blissed thys anna ferre stryeken age seemed haue beene delayed dying preserued thys lyfe none purpose olde woman mighte according afore tymes moste feruente prayer wyshed desired see young babe promysed whiche shoulde bryng healthe saluacyon people israell holye ghoste put h r minde alreadye borne euen suggestion spirite god whiche symeon tofore bene enspired withall came thys anna vpon euen veraye houre whyle thynges whiche haue alreadye tolde doyng within templeand liued houseband seuen yeres virginitie anna tyme whan virginitie yet honourable neto bee gloryed emong iewes liued housbande owne space seuen yeres maydenhood muche tyme contente custome bestowe hauing housbande brynging furthe chyldren resydue lyfe consecrated onelye seruing god contemplacion contynued state wedowhod space fourescore foure yeres assayed wedlocke although yet lustie age veraye floure tyme yet manyer mynde ne thoughte marrye agayn eue woman dead worldwhiche departed fro te ple c wholy dedicated vnto god almoste neuer departed temple busilye sacrifice vnto euangelical oblacions day time also night offering herselfe vnto lorde liuely reasonable page duplicate page duplicate acceptable hosteand came furth houre c bodye offered often fastyng soule deuoute meditacyons prayer euen aforesayde rytes ceremony purificacion within temple veray houre whyle symeon hys prophetycall talke veraye momente whyle thinges full holye godlye wordes reioysing thankes geuyng thys heauenlye young babe thys anna euen god woulde haue commeth emong also might witnesse childe borne myghte ioyne affeccyons hearte ioyfulnesse others extollyng hyghelye praysyng bounteouse goodnesse god caste mercifull iye vpon people neyther whan coumpaigny presence others kepe secret thing seene iyes whiche hadde learned goddes inspiracyon woulde euermore bee speaking talking thys chylde vnto suche hierusalem loked redempcion people israell thys enough womanne wedowe onelye temple talke auouche christe come entimate disclose vnto fewe persones abrode beeyng desyrouse hungrie tyme yet come reserued apostle whan shoulde bee replenished holy gost whiche apostle sayde psalme dauid yearthe theyr sonne gone furth psalm xix wordes endes worlde throughout p whan perfourmed thynges accordyng lawe lorde returned galile theyr owne citie nazareth childe grewe waxed strong spirite filled wisedome grace god vpon hym thinges last fully ordrely executed muche lawe moyses prescribed purificacyon woman late delyuered childe returned bethleem chylde borne whan king herode beeyng doone wete magians newe king people israell borne commaunded infantes bee flayne many within two yeres daye next afore passed bene borne bethleem circuite lordeship countie ioseph aduertised warned slepe doe conueighed awaye prieuelye bothe childe mother bore itinto galilee theyr owne citie nazareth egipte made abode vntill death wieked kyng thyng done eftesons returned warnyng aungell bethleem leste occasyon shewing ferther crueltie mighte perchaunce thereby haue bene geuen sonne herode tyme succeded father porcion kyngdome returned countreye galyle vnto cytye nazarethand ye child grewe c babe firste conceyued hys mother woumbe minde liue corner way time dede keping himselfe poore citie nazareth easy thing beguile crueltie dredde arising newe king thus hitherto oure heauenly soueraigne lorde prince oure sake adbassed humbled hymselfe downe euen swadlyng cloutes cradle cry swathing bandes child doe strengthlesse babehoode bodye preached declared worlde onelye testymonie folkes talkyng hys age litle litle growing vp dyd tyme tyme encrease bygnesse hys stature strength body whiche body tabernacle clearely appered certayn wonderful towardnesse natural inclinacion vertue euidently declaring somewhat man strength also spirite continuallye encreased hym daylye shewing selfe foorthe hys countenaunce hys passe hys talke hys doinges whiche muche one poincte euen full spiryte myldenesse humylytie chastytie amyablenesse godlye zeale nothyng subiecte vice whiche yeres childehood commonly woonte bee encoumbred weteand filled wisedome fondenesse speaking doyng thinges wantonnesse inconstauncie foly heauenlye wysedome wherwith replenyshed tarying yeres age discrecion oughte bee dyd euen already wise shewe selfe wheras afore commended set furthe testimony others nowe owne vertues giftes grace suche fewe men made bothe wonderful persones also worthy loued wisedome holynesse perfeccyon liuing ripenesse discression hym suche greate cannot man right aunciente yeres founde made wondrefull vnto men delectable swetenesse conuersacyon ientle familiare facyon towardes folkes hys humble softenesse made hym vnto men able neyther fauoure men dyd beare hym fauoure common sorte lytle season suche age chyldehoode doeth ofte tymes gather humayne quality exaumple respect beautie welfauourednesse otherwise aptitude quickenesse taking taught whiche chyldren beefore theyr time hym shined certayne godlye wondrefull grace mightily drawing men loue hys vertuousenesse pand father mother wente hierusalem euery yere feaste estur whan twelue yere olde wente vp hierusalem custome feaste daye whan fulfilled dayes returned home childe iesus abode still hierusalem hys father mother knewe supposyng haue bene compaygnye came dayes iourney soughte hym emong theyr kinsfolke acquaintaunce whan founde went backe agayn ierusalem sought hym fortuned three dayes founde te ple sitting middes doctoures hearyng opposing hearde astouned vnderstandyng aunswers although nazareth somewhat ferre dystaunce hierusalem yet neuerthelesse parentes iesus beeyng folkes muche deuocion wente thither euery yere festiuall daye estur whiche feaste emong iewes kepte highe holy al possible deuocion solemnitie daye whiche lambe knowing manier spotte synne marked appoynted offred vp sacrifice due tyme chylde also beeyng vnder guydyng mother fosterfather euen younge accustomed himselfe deuout seruing god ensaumple putting father mother remembrauce theyr dueties bounde restreigne theyr child come wantonnesse euen first daye yes euen theyr veraye cradle enure holye conuersacion earneste applying true godlynesse whyle theyr age yet tender theyr naturall disposicion yet ientle softe plyaunte vnto manier traynyng vertue childe iesus neded scoolyng ordreyng anye persone exaumple ordeyned parentes howe bryng vp theyr chyldren chastelye vertuouslye also fourme trade shewed vnto young chyldren oughte vse themselues obedient theyr parentesand whan twelue yeres olde wente vp hierusalem whan exhorted aduertysed thynges holye godlye whan hys chyldehood reason noumber yeres nowe growen litle strength begoon drawe wel towardes stature younge strieplyng beeyng full age twelue yeres olde hys patentes accordyng auncyente custome gone hierusalem day estur chylde awaytyng theyr compaygny soone al thinges finyshed solemne obseruyng feaste dyd appertayne dayes throughlye expired whiche due attendaunce muste bee geuen dyuyne seruice temple whereas mother ioseph returned homewarde towarde nazareththe childe iesus abode still hierusale childe iesus remayned styll hierusalem euen beefore full age shewing hymselfe glad ready accomplyshe commaundemetes message father doyng wherof bene sent worlde hys parentes knewe nothyng hys tarying behynde whan sawe came home agayne nazareth accordyng common rate care parentes take theyr child greatly mused wondred befallen dede firste demed hanged compaignye felowes kinsfolkes reason therof bene slacker cumming geat therefore backe agayn euen way come mountenauc manyer one whole dayes iourneye makyng searche hym emonge theyr acquayntaunce kinsfolkes coumpany whome suche litle chyldren often time woonte make taryaunce lyngeryng affeccionate desire theyr kinsfolke alliaunce doth commonlye kepe backe maketh taryand whan found wente c emongst al iesus found taughte men euen alreadye young suche one willing take vpon hym profession teachyng heauenlye doctrine muste renounce clearelye forsake worldlye carnall affeccyons bothe father mother also kinsfolkes theyr hope therfore beyng beguyled sekyng iesus emong hys kynsfolkesand fortuned three dayes founde temple c nowe carefulnesse theyr childe somewhat earnestely pricke vexe theyr stomackes tender parentes wil doe backe wente agayn hierusalem deming supposing bee possyble enoughe remayned styll house frende acquayntaunce theyrs whan chylde vayne sought also emong theyr acquayntaunce kynsfolkes three dayes space chaunced hys parentes whan suche hope founde hym temple ydle playing thys childishe toye sitting still middes emong doctours whome childe course bothe heare teachyng also appose course opposed agayne make aunswere nedefull hym demaunde mortall creature learne ende wisely ministring opposicions might rightely enstructe teache professed perfecte knowelage lawe wheras dede knew strength pith effecte law vnder one enflamyng v vnto earneste zeale take good instytucyons also geuyng good lesson age ouer younge ouer soone putte learnyng suche thynges maye auayle serue towardes godlye perfeccion artes occupacyons bee whiche euerye age apte ouer young learne onely deuocyon godlynesse bee learned cradle earneste dilygence applying bee slacked releassed tyme vntyll veraye laste daye mannes lyfe higher degree hygher growe vntoand al hearde astouned vnderstanding aunswers long mannes life dooeth endure iesus although vnknowen bothe doctoures also people stode yet make merueyle hym beyng chylde smal age stature coulde sayinges aunswers shewe furth certayne woonderfull wysedome yea ferre excedyng wysdome sage olde menne sawe age bodye bee tender ferre vnrype haue great wisedome hearde young chylde singular humilitie sobrenesse vttering furth speakyng thinges great doctoures auncyente yeres semed high wisedome menne myghte bee thoughte tedyouse learne yet hym pryde ne haultenesse hym malapertenesse cockyng geuyng tauntes hym mannier hosting vaunting himselfe vice wont lacke boyes whose wittes rype beefore theyr tyme woulde question one desyrouse fayne learne beyng demaunded anye questyon woulde aunswere possible sobrenesse yea also excellent wisedome thys mannier taughte without anye spyce semblaunce arrogancie saye presumpteouse takyng autoritie vpon hym thynges came passe well doctoures whome disputed also partyes stode rounde witness disputacion veraye muche astouned onely respect chyldes wisedome suche afore bene hearde whiche demaundyng questyon shapyng aunswere dyd playnely declare also syngulare sobrenesse countenaunce hys gesture hys tongue whiche thynges gaue ferther grace acceptacyon vnto hys vnderstandyng yet thys poyncte neyther withoute fruictfull mysterye iesus coulde seking founde emong familiare acquaintaunce kynsfolkes fleshe sodaynelye founde chaunce hierusalem within temple sayde citie hierusalem greate name fame reason worlde conceyued opinyon god serued beste place represent aswell churche militaunte yearthe also triumphaunte heauen hierusalem countrey make sighyng bee forasmuche dooe well vnderstande thys transytorye worlde lyue place exile banyshemente hauing citie wherin dwell euer whersoeuer therefore goeth carnall affeccyons manne wheresoeuer earneste studie minde applyed vnto thynges perish dye worlde suche place neyther hierusalem whiche hebrue woorde say englishe sighte peace neither temple dedicated lorde therefore iesus suche place bee soughte altogether heauenlye wheresoeuer brest herte whiche despyseth tho thinges pertaine carnalytie fleashe bloude panteth haste maketh towarde blessed tranquilitie quietnesse mynde whiche bounteouse goodnesse god dooeth faythe ghospell assure warraunte euen presente life maketh perfecte heauenlye hierusalem aboue suche place hierusalem suche place temple iesus delited suche place bothe propounyng questyons aunsweryng enterchaungeablye concerning howe rounde circle maye made iust fower square whiche aristotle philosophie called eria prima ye shoulde say englishe first originall stuffe wherof whiche thinges worlde produced made aristotle doe call primum mobile whereby meane hym gouerneth worlde rolleth skye aboute without begynning ending naming god estemyng bee naturall thyng selfe whiche thynges manne may ignoraunt yet come heauen well enough suche place speake opposycyons aunsweres concernyng knowlage holy scripture god sheweth vnto v way wherby may attayne euerlasting saluacion suche place slayne hostes sacrifice moste acceptable vnto god wete carnall luste enuie wrathe desire worldely auauncemente auarice suche place godlye peticyons pure prayer contynuall burnyng swete sauoures incence moste hyghe contentacyon pleasyng god therfore parte euery body see prouyde haue hierusalem within hys owne breste make readye temple mete holy ghoste ende may bee woorthy haue iesus geaste whan sawe merueiled mother sayde vnto hym sonne hast thou thus deite v beholde thy father haue soughte thee sorowyng sayd vnto howe ye sought wist ye must goe aboute father businesse vnderstoode saying whiche spake vnto went downe came nazareth obediente vnto hys mother kepte sayinges together hearte iesus prospered wisedome age fauoure god men beholde euen meane tyme whyle sayd merueilouse chylde iesus doeth foundacion entreing make preparatiue executing heauenlye businesse restoring mankinde saluacion whiche doe come downe heauen hys father mother commeth sodaynely place whome mystery god intente purpose yet fully knowen yet still remaynyng litle spyece humayne affeccion although naturall louing carefulnesse soughte aboute chylde ioseph hys parte holdeth hys peace knew veray wel consciece right ne title childe hys spoused wyfe bornesone hast thou thus delt v mother thoughte mighte well doe autoritie maketh halfe querele hym sonne sayeth dooe ye handle v suche sorte thys dyd ye prieuelye steale away v loe father beyng nowe space two three day greate care heauynesse haue bene seeking fearing behalfe daungier peryll suche misaduentures naturall tendernesse parentes dooeth commonlye vse feare chauncyng vnto theyr child loueand said vnto howe yt ye soughte whan bee absente wordes marie whiche proceded affeccyon dede right tendre naturall yet somewhat humayne worldelye respecte whereof conueniente interrupte breake godlye talke hande iesus aunswered halfe roughelye anye fume indignacion hys parentes shewe affayres ghospell doe sente hys heauenly father mannier autoritie man euer ought haue place auctorytie parentes ouer child hathe certayn due lymytes boundes howe ferre maye extende whiche autoritye lawefull also necessarye renounce vtterly forsake often matier eternal saluacion commeth place mete thynges worldelye geue place vnto godlye thynges respecte regarde god whome bounden debtoures aswell bodye soule whose bounteouse lyberalytie looke inherytaunce lyfe euerlastyng aboue whome fleshe borne broughte vp succede porcyon good substaunce worldely dede greatly bounden euen oure parentes greate deale bounde god whome bounde euen euer father mother lykewyse time made aunswere ientyleste manyer vnto hys mother whan mariage spake vnto hym moued hym wyne feaste dydde certayne autory ie motherluc viii math xii matt iii require hym shewe miracle wheras miracle bee shewed glory hys heauenlye father dyd also tyme snappy shelye make aunswere vnto preachyng gospell called furth throng presse people name mother kynsfolkes aunswere made thys tyme manier fourme folowyng cause ye dyd suche pensyfe carefulnesse seeke aboute dyd ye remember myndes muste nedes bee aboute father businessewist ye must goe aboute father businesse often calleth office function appoyncted vnto thyng wordes iesus myghte meane parentes dyd euen veraye well vnderstande expressed hym certayne excellencie aboue common rate man especially suche tender age childehood albeit likelyhod thinges afore passed loked common trade ne yet meane thing handes theyr chylde yet dyd fully throughly vnderstande highe excellencye maiestie power godand vnderstoode saiyng whiche spake vnto didde yet perfectely knowe woonderfull dryfte conueyghaunce god father determyned redeme mankynde owne sonne hearde woordes iesus namyng father veray surely knewe father thys worlde yearth heare speake father affayres businesse whiche affayres neuer spoken worde ne made mencion afore day thoughe parentes hushte speake worde doe reuerently take woordes whiche vnderstode iesus seeing thys humbled hymselfe shewed hymselfe obedyente mother ioseph foster father oughed vnto duttie obedyence hys owne goodnesse submytted hymselfe season theyr weakenesse bee ruled ordred therewithall also gaue vnto chyldren fourme exaumple earneste endeuoure greate reuerence oughte bee theyr parentes commaundemente forasmuche chylde iesus oughed seruice ne obedience bodye sauyng onely hys heauenlye father dyd suche wise obeye father counterfey te hys mother bore hym withoute harme dyspleasure empayryng chastytie maydenhood thereby thus lorde iesus thinke good suche wise temper hys sayinges doynges nowe woulde shewe furthe ye woulde saye certayne lytle sparkes hys godlye power tyme agayne would humble hymselfe lowe degree man poorely borne worlde uerayly doyng expediente v ende myght mannyer wayes perswaded vnto mankinde veritie true substaunce bothe dyuyne nature nature manne bee coupled together hys one persone feloweshyppe nature beeyng common v greatly make purchasing loue doe earnestly also fruictfully loue thinges nere oure owne nature family deale euen olde prouerbe whiche sayeth lyke euermore vnto lyke puttyng oure affiaunce truste dooe safely put god forasmuche lye cannot power thinges dooe may manyer wise bee doubted wyll perfourme whatsoeuer dooeth promyse dede oure loue towardes christe doeth firste spryng vp cousynage lykenesse oure nature beginninges groweth better better loue thynges beyng hygher aboue v lyke common sorte menne firste begynnyng onely seeyng beautie one bodye enflamed sette fyer beare hys good wyll partye shortely whan kepyng coumpanye talkyng wyth partye good qualytyes beautyfull mynde soule lying hydden hys beautifull bodye throughelye perceyued begynne truelye also ardentelye bee loue thyng see thyng see euen feloweshyppe equalitye oure humayne nature hym vnto v ye woulde saye lure conceyuyng loue towardes lorde iesus thys loue growe vp hygher loue hys diuyne power hys godhede therfore whether humble himselfe oure weakenesse el mounteth vp owne hyghnesse aboue busilye attendeth labouryng working oure health saluacion iesus wente temple hierusalem obeying gouernaunce paretes returned home agayne nazareth let chyldren yong strieplinges whan heare ashamed many make lyghte good lesson counsayles theyr parentes exhortyng honest wayes seeyng iesus dyd space leaue dooyng hys father busynesse woulde shewe exaumple disobedyent sonne let priuate commoner parisheners blushe vse rebell agaynste theyr godlye pastoures beyng theyr spirituall father seeing iesus greater dygnytie contente bee ordred inferiours beyng god submytted hymselfe gouernaunce creature mortal mother agayne parte forasmuche perceyued founde certayne power goddeheade glittre shewe furthe hymbut hys mother kept al sayynges together herte well contente folowe minde ordering sonne myndefull owne wise discrete sobrenesse dyd yet make blabbyng abrode thing weomen vse bee full clatteryng bablyng ne take vpon geue anye sentence iudgement vpon matiers whiche rather merueyle vnderstande misterie mente euer chaunced begynnyng aboute concernyng chylde euer sayde dooen gathered conferred altogether layde vp safe breste coniecturyng castyng wonderfull begynninges ende mattyers lyke ensue neyther dyd leaue one poyncte vnmarked ende myghte afterwarde perfecte truethe assuraunce make reporte thynges vnto dyscyples shoulde tyme cummyng preache lyfe iesus worlde throughoute meane whyle iesus beeyng yet hitherto knowen vnto fewe folkes continued dwelling ye poore citie nazareth liuing ye myghte saye vnder gouernaunce hys parentes vntyll tyme shoulde come sette hys father whiche shoulde myracles preaching shewe furth himselfe abrode vnto worlde geuing v meane lesson owne exaumple man shoulde vnaduisedly vndyscretely el tyme wythoute due occasyon come rushing make presse take hande thoffice preaching gospell doe sufficyente groweth yeres throughe vnculpable behauyoure throughe due learnyng knowleage holy scripture goddes vocacyon gather vnto hymselfe good autoritie become teacherand iesus prospered wisedome age iesus vntyll mannier full thirtie yeres age neuer anye notable acte sauyng aboue rate mortall men like grewe prospered stature bodye strengthe groweth yeres heauenly wisedome styll plenteouslye shewe furthe selfe hym dyd manyfolde gyftes grace also throughe whiche lyke moste highlye accepted god dayly growe fauoure estimacion menne vnlyke manne veraylye muche contrarie sorte vnto scribe phariseis counterfeite pretence holynesse wysedome vsed sette themselues iyes menne whereas syghte god full myghte swarme filthe vnclenesse vyce neyther onely auayleable saluacyon mankynde redemed straunge conueyghaunce suche lyke hadde beene hearde afore also good instruccyon traynyng oure lyfe iesus litle litle certayne degree shewe furth knowledge men hys heauenly giftes grace aboundauntly replenished withall thing verayly dyd geue v lesson first preceptes rule righteousenesse ought euen streight way young cradle child drinke continuall going forwarde vncessauntly doe al oure possible endeuoure atteygne vnto thinges perfeccyon lyke bodye hath degree growing bigger bigger full rate stature hys full strengthe shootyng vp firste infancie babehood stature young strieplyng stature striepling degree yong man degree youthe full perfeccyon mannes state euen hath godlynesse hys degree encreasing vntyll may full growen vp perfecte substauncyall strengthe fulnesse christeand fauour god man chryste groweth bygger bygger v shooteth vp mannes state whan fyrste enstruccyons article fayth doe encroche forwarde depe hydden wisedom scripture god whan forsake milke fleashe begin haue stomake appetyte sounde stronge meate spiryte leaue vnsauerye letter thirste mystycall sence meaning whan nothyng esteme ne regarde thynges yearthly mounte vp take flight thinges celestiall euen playne settyng cart horse yf body shall course nature growe tyme tyme forewarde better beter soule shall oure sluggyshenesse continually renne headlong backewarde wurse wurse thus see commonly come passe big laddes strieplynges grow quite awaye purenes babehood boyishe wantonnesse youth againe groweth forewarde pace brabling lawe making affrayes manstate emendeth ambicion couetise cummeth passe euery manne nerer draweth state age muche ferther goeth backewarde innocence liuyng person haue put christe theyr backes oughte according exaumple christe theyr strengthe heaue forewarde vnto better better ende maye bothe pure clenesse soule make themselues acceptable syghte god also vncorruptnesse theyr liuing geat themselues honest fame reporte emong men p iii chapter pin fifteenth yere reigne tyberius emperour whan poncius pilate lieutenaunte iewry herode tetrarche galile hys brother phylip tetrarche iturya regyon trachonytes lisanyas tetrarche abilene whan anna cayphas hygh pryestes woorde lorde came vnto iohn sonne zacharie wyldernesse came coastes aboute iordane preachyng baptysme repentaunce remyssyon synnes wrytten booke woordes esaye prophete saying voyce wildernesse prepare ye waye lorde make hys pathes streyghte euerye valley shal filled euery mountayne hill shal broughte lowe thynges croked shall made streight tough wayes shal made playne fleashe shall see saluacion god thou haste hearde good theophilus begynnynges bothe iohn forerenner also lorde iesus made way preparatife vnto office preaching gospel nowe heare meanes successe enterprised entred mattyer ende thou mayest well vnderstande nothing doen happe casualtie ne mannes wisdome euery whit prouidence god tempreing ordreyng hys owne mattyer newe manier facion hys owne nowe tyme already come heauenly kingdom beyng reuealed published worldly kingdom shoulde abate decaye spirituall priestehood beyng disclosed shadowie priestehood wherin iewes vntill time made many glorious vautes braggues themselfes shoulde vanishe cleane away ceasar emperour rome surnamed augustus ended life whose proclamacio whole world afore surueied name euerye bodye within empire registred bokes tyme reygne iesus christ borne wicked herode also deceassed sought y infant haue slain archelaus herodes sonne behauiour ouermuche reseblyng father wicked prankes exiled fro kingdom coutrey tiberius cesar succeded augustus ye empire fiftenth yere reigne poncius pilate romain president iewry herode ye brother archelaus eleccion apointment said tiberius emperour galilee allotted vnto philip rule gouernaunce part syria whiche called ituria called also tra honitis roughnesse mountain ye countrey full vphilles dounhilles almost part euen plain chaumpian grounde goeth al alongst hilles dale fro libanus fro ye moutains idumea vnto ye west coaste syria tha moreouer ye part yt called abilena abila principall citie region assignement cum hades lisanias porcio afterward chaunged name therof called lysanio augustus time would sowhat breake enfeble puissaunt force kingdo made diuisio distributed amog foure brother herode philip antipater lysanias therfore called tetrarches say english foure prince foure head ruler name kyng long afore abolished lawe romaine woulde haue kynges token rather figure kingdom iewes shortly vanishe awaye accordyng prophecie holyest parte iewrye wherin hierusalem temple stoode whiche lord al borne one ponce pilate romain administracion gouernaunce beeyng figure plainly betokenyng euen verye case thing stode gentile breake kingdom heaue iewes would reiect vtterly despise likewise priesthode thyng soone ceasse haue ende wente wandrynge shifting one due ordre bought solde made eue market mater wherin time two notable vngodly anna caiphas highest chefest roumes emiddes matter diuiding mangleyng countrey sundry rewlers handes middes troublesome state thinges emonge iewes kingdome heauen new priesthode sprang vp wherof iohn soonne zacharie chosen specially appoynted bee open preacher proclaymer iohn laye hydden emong ye wylde beastes passed life wonderfull streightnesse cladde camel skine girt belt rough leather thong feeding vpo wild honey grashoppers countrey muche tasting wyne stronge drinke entent might mete preacher repetauce might teache people life teache wordes might clere without al crime frely reproue faultes transgression beyng inspired holy ghost admonished ye came dennes wildernes gat teple place reserued vnto christ al quarter coastesand cam costes iordan c lye riuer iordane end mighte haue plety water shuld baptised preached kingdom heaue exhorting people prepare theselfes saluacio approched thorough repentaunce former liues baptisme water perso gaue foregoer messeger christ make selfes mete baptisme ye spirit whiche spirit geue whose cuming approched thinges tha doen inspiracion holy ghost log prophecied mouth esai ye prophet maner speaketh iohns preaching voice crier ye wildernes lord approcheth prepare way make pathes streight ieste offeded wt vntoward crokednes condicios behauiour spedily stert backe away fro cumeth al al must goe forth mete thinges must made plain eue euery valey shal filled vp euery mountain hill shalbe brought doun made flatte whiche wer high emong great opinion estimacion righteousnes wisedom shal abate stately proude coutenaunce may hable apte receiue righteousnesse wisedom god idiotes knowlage ne regard sinner wer al reputacio vtterly despised abiectes amog shall sodainly obedience ghospell reysed vp vnto felowshyp communion kyngdome heauen suche thinges also tofore wer warped writhed sundry way stoode croked shal moment made euen streight wt squiere ghospel place wer rough reason thornes manifold vice naughtie desire lustes shall nowe made verye smooth plain wayes suche mindes dooeth lorde loue walke suche extreme contrary shal course thynges cummyng hym bee chaunged despaire shall set vp coumforte hope suche trusted themselfes caryng healper saueour shalbe cast away perish vnpossible recouered thei tymes esteemed reputed wyse shal become fooles suche accoumpted fooles shall bee endued gyft heauenly wysedome whiche fore idolatres shall becum true seruers wurshippers lyuyng god whiche outwarde semblaunce appered true wurshippers god shalbe found idolatres wrathefull shall bee quiete mynde beneficiall others suche serued lustes concupiscence lecherie shal loue enbrace chastitie whiche pollers catcher away men gooddes shal frely without sparynge geue awaye owne manne therfore shall make suche alteracion chaunge thynges prepare selues lorde wyll euen within litell whyle present world ye iewes shall see hym nacions whole worlde shal iyes faith beholde autour geuer saluacion god maketh free offer blisse heauen vnto person godly promptnesse readinesse beleue correccion amedment former lyues shal receiue hym whan cumeth said people cum forth baptised hym ye generacion viper hath taught flee wrathe cum bring ye forth therfore due fruites repentaunce begin say selues haue abraham father say vnto god hable stone rayse vp child vnto abraham also axe layed vnto roote tree euery tree therfore whiche bringeth foorthe good fruite hewen downe cast fyer esai many hundred yeres prophecied iohn nothing end came passe proued agreable vnto prophecie euery behalf euery pointe iohns preachynge great multitude people leauing house declaryng plainly spoken wordes ernestly mindeth desireth attain saluacion must doe away forsake carnall affeccions hath home house herte heapes resort vnto shore fluime iordane mighte diepped water iohn forgeuer sinnes could doe beginyng preamble prepare folkes hertes mindes vnto redepcion saluacion cuming good great part towardnes health acknowlage one self sick great auauntage foredele towardes recouerie hath persone whiche apte willyng take maye bee remedye disease forasmuche first steppe degree amendment springeth oute feare godand said people c first feare iuste punishment handes righteous auenger loue liberalitie bouteous lord iohn cryed great boldnes plainnesse ye proude phariseis scribe tofore euer sticked fast contynued steppe wicked father false persuasion righteousenes wer puffed vp pride though wer strog enemy vnto true religion setting naught standing highly owne conceytes none cause muche respect wer descended abraham lynage discent fleshe thoughe god esteemed men kinred linage rather accordyng vertues godly quality mindes ye generacion viper saith moste vicious corrupte child descended moste vicious corrupt auncestrie whereby haue ye perceiued foud vengeaunce god hangeth ouer vnlesse ye season amend liues person hathe geuen warnynge watche woorde flee moste sharpe punishement scourge god whiche shal spare age whiche shall pardone nacion shall shewe fauour degree estate men highe lowe lyke remedie offered vnto suche yelde themselfes cured healed dooeth punishement abide persones indifferently without excepcion many refuse amend olde naughty behauiour conuersacion dyd entier loue towardes god allure hither well feare dread punyshemente doeth violently hale hither nowe present mindes harte yet nothyng chaunged wherefore yf ye without feynyng dissimulacion bee penitent sory wicked life past chaunge condicions ye sort conuersacio heretofore ye haue declare plainly doinges ye reformed emended ye haue vnto day hitherto lyke wylde tree brought forthe soure pestilent fruites euyll workes wete pride wrathfulnesse auarice enuie hypocrisie contencio ye dede tourned euil tree good tree bryng ye forth good fruites suche maye testyfy hertes truly altered better frame requisite thing material ye chauge garmetes leaue take kind meat ye must chauge euill lustes hertes dede roote tree roote haue bitter venemous sape tha spring none euill fruites ye brauches contrariwyse roote minister sende vp pleasaut holsome sape boughes grow forth vpon braunches fruites spirite semely god worthy acceptacion wete entier loue instede hatred bitter frouning godly ioye lightnes hert discord peace fiercenes sufferaunce snatchyng polling liberalitie lecherousnes chastitie deceitful craftines simplicitie plain dealyng presupteous taking vpon humble sobrenes supersticion true godlynesse thynges whiche declare true vncounterfayted iewes thynges declare circumcysed ought verye true chyldren abraham dede sacrifice god delyted withal begyn saye youre selues wee haue abraham oure fathernow lyght hande let shadowes passe awaye truthe place away al counterfait hipocrisie doe away vayne confydence whiche fygures ghostely thynges haue nouryshed thinges selfes exaumple whan ye say way gloriyng hierusalem holy citie lordes teple lordes temple lordes teple also figure thinges foloweth wete slaughter bruite beastes sacrifice ordeining solemne halowing sabboth dayes obseruyng newe moones choice difference betwene one meate brode border vpo vesture ye call philacteries fastyng abstinence heuinesse louring countenaunce resydue obseruaunces great manye whiche eyther lawe tyme prescribe apoint figure thinges referred mynde el ye phariseis haue inueted vain pretense holines al thynges euery one circumcision self altogether shal ceasse abolyshed suche one shall hensfoorth bee esteemed iewe right sorte whatsoeuer shall confesse acknowelage whose comyng shall ere long seen world suche one shall bee taken man rightly circumcised shoulde bee whosoeuer shall haue herte pourged fayth inordinate lustes desire let therfore enter hertes thynke selues vaingloriously heritage succession child abraha none el inheritaunce saluacion hathe promised lorde wyll forsake v people naye say vnto like wickednesse forefather shalbe nothing preiudiciall hurtful case ye amend take better way euen shall holinesse progenitour abraham nothyng auayle yf ye wyll still continue olde vngodlinesse ye caste away ye surely bee disherited ye vtterly perishe eternall damnacion onlesse beeyng conuerted turned better life ye bryng foorthe suche fruites maye semely worthily stand ghospell neither shall abraham destitute posteritie successiongod able stone ceise vy child vnto abraham god want people bee condignely wurshipped serued performe inheritaunce promised though ye shrinke fall awaye dare bolde auouche assure vnto god vnhable hath power enough euen stone reise vp chyldre vnto frede abraham promised issue successio like noumbre sandes sea sterres skye time herafter cum child abraham shalbe estemed accepted kinred bloud euery one shall folowe resemble abraham faith abraham shal acknowelage accepte child euen sogdias gotthyans wylde scythian embrace messias shall coumpte repute alien straunge borne bastardes onlesse ye turne faith beleue god hath hitherto shewed paciece sufferauce towardes though ye haue eue brought forth ye outward fruites lawe wer say sacrifice vowes fastiges washinges difference meates paryng away foreskin circucision thinges superficially outward apparaunce religion leaues tree detestable afore god except ye fruites spirite bee ioyned therewith nowe hensfoorth shal euery body estemed according true treasure hert soule euen shalbe founde good euill cum streight precise iudgemente god cum isnowe also layed rote tree seeth botome depest secretes herte axe euen ready set hard ye roote tree hath long time suffered abrahas people shalbe hewed away fro stem therof heathen many prompte readynes beleuing shall resemble abraham shall graffed place moses eare geuen vnto prophetes harkened vnto whome great many ye slew put death voyce lawe ye haue hitherto dull deaf eares nowe cumeuery tree therfore c whose greater none set none bee loked utter peryshing euer hangeth ouer whole nacion israelite except ye repente betime grow goodnesse euery tree whiche shall bryng foorth good frute faith shalbe felled downe cast fyer meane none respect none either true godlynes make haste vnto euerlastyng saluacion doyng remediles vtterly damned euer people asked saiyng shal auswereth saith vnto hath two coates let part wt hath none hath meat let likewise common multitude iewes beeyng sore adrade terrible manacing woordes iohn saied vnto ye saie thynke ye good v dooe wherby auoyde escape wrathe god atteyn saluacion beganne waxe sumwhat curable toward healed whe acknowlaged disease earnestly desyred remedie iohn therefore sheweth remedye perfecte strength efficacie assayes calleth ne exhorteth sacrifice beastes suche iudaicall meanes pourging sinnes vnto workes charitie god sacrifice world sooner pacified beneficiall doyng neighbour god hath nede benefites oures suffereth rekened doen whatsoeuer bestow vpon neighbour beyng necessitie nede hath two coates sayeth iohn let hym couer naked brother one thehe hathe twoo coates c hath asmuch meate may suffise twayne let geue halfe therof hungrie two exaumples iohn taught people grosse blockishe ignoraunt multitude strongest effectuall meane appeace god beyng offended v meanes frake bountiful doyng good neighbour whatsoeuer thyng hath nede whether bee apparell meate drinke harbourgh ayde succour violence coumfortable wordes time sorow doctrine instruccion good exhortacion counsayll bounden bee helpe present necessitie brother part thi ge wherof selfes haue superfluitie neede also ought cut litle share suche thynges myghte otherwyse stand v good stede v occupiyng often neyghbours necessitie requireth present helpe hand remedy geuen iohn common multitude whiche remedie neuertheles serueth men indifferently came publican also baptised said vnto maister shal doe said vnto require whiche appointed vnto came also publican saye customer taker vp tolles beeyng semblably stryken great feare iohns preachyng whereas otherwise kynde people geuen pollyng rauine getting might owne singuler aduauntage lucre others mennes losse dammage hinderaunce nothig passyng religion feare god ready obey commaundementes worldly prince preceptes god whiche sorte men haue euyll name among nacions bee commonly ill spoken yet among iewes wer specially aboue al sortes men abhorred repu ed abominable yet ye sore sharpe preachyng iohn stryken suche horrible great feare theym euen euill came iohn requiryng baptisme desiring learne way thei might appeace wrath god iohn ye true foregoer messenger would driue back put away man neuer muche spotted defiled sinne made soft ientle aunswer euen publican also yf ye cannot yet saith fynde hertes geue poore nedye sum parte propre yet lestwise make ye one steppe towardes better life fro hensforth ye holde handes pollyng catchynge awaye goodes men ye haue annuall stipende ordynary fee cesar rated vnto playne rule howe muche litle ye ought require people duetie pthe souldiers lykewyse demaunded saiyng shall sayd vnto hurt ye man neither trouble man wrongfully bee content wage publican came souldiers also vnruelye vngodlye kynde people hauyng regarde ne care lawes heady hastye wrong felowes vsed sell life solle money setting al delite felicitie catching robbing fro fierce presumteous ouermuche libertie sufferaunce neuertheles feare god vengeance fell vpon therfore also came iohn acknowlaged wicked state soldiership vsed desire baptisme require moreouer enfourmed possible meanes might make haue god appeaced wardes surely kynde men great point furtheraunce towardes healthe would acknowelage dysease pricked desire better life therfore iohn would first day aduenture require suche wereand said vnto theim hurte ye man shew beneficiall liberalitie towardes theyr neyghbour thought bee steppe sufficient great enough first settyng forwarde towardes god yf suche wer would honestly refrain kepe themselues mischief aboute place thei cae speake sort dede thei woont noysom hurtfull thre poyntes especially wete violent oppression laiyng men charge burdenyng false crime pillage robberye oftentymes weapos prynces haue delyuered vnto defense maynteynaunce publique tranquillitie tourne hurte countreye men true subiectes auenge theyr owne priuate malice weapon wherewith safetie wholle people general ought haue defended oftentimes goe theuing booty spoyle countrey burne driue away mennes cattell thei ranishe weomen breake vp mennes house turne good man ye house haue lodged intertained thei turne cleane owne doores pumble pa e dooe oftentymes play partes haue nothynge sayd dooen thynke may doe lawfully agayn sum promote false playntes honest simple men beefore prince captain none purpose sauyng porcion ye party gooddes beeyng seased forfayte maye cum snapshare rewarde false accusacion maliciously slaunderously prepesed suche vngracious prankes prince oftentymes wynke whyle ernestly tendre gratifiyng theyr seruauntes furthermore sum sorte people whan prodigally cosume waste vpon harlot vpon dice bankettyng reuellyng wyne euer theyr prynce dooeth name fee stypende allowe theym make vp losse agayne pillyng pickyng dooe onelye leaue suche duty owe styll vnpayed also doe playne extorcion pull fro poore house handmen duetie vnder name colour warre thynke nothyng euer bee vnlawfull wheras dede due lawe armes seruing battail warre dede vtterly disallowed case attepted iust rightful cause saye made ye defence maynteinaunce publique traquillitie realme countrey yf case stand cannot auoyded yf bee enterprysed godly prynces yf consent whose behofe expedient necessary ye warre made yf haue denounced proclaymed rytes circumst unces accordyng lawe armes yf iustice moderacion vsed say warre kept asmuche sparyng bloudshed possibly may fewe loste may especially neuer gaue cause warre vnaduysed witfulnes hastines souldiers brideled captain buckling together two army sauing souldiers armes haue geuen othe afore ought neue otherwise without signe b e geuen commaundement capytayne whan shall buccle together fight euery body immediately hold theyr ha de fightyng assone euer trupe te haue blowen retraicte also soone possibly maie warre ended breake vp unto sorte men therfore dooeth iohn nothyng shewe accustomed vse thing hensforth ought eschew mynde escape vengeaunce god stryke ne beate ye manne saieth accuse manne falsely lucre sake bee ye contented ordinarie wage allowed people doubte men mused harte iohn whether christ iohn answered said vnto baptise water one stroger shall cum who shoe latchet worthy vnlooce shall baptise holy ghost fier whiche hath fanne hand pourge floore gather corne barne chaffe wil burne fier neuer shal quenched many thinges exhortacion preached vnto people suche great authoritie premiss handled doen iohn people begoonne halfe bee opinion messias whose cummyng preached vnto great many theym secrete thynkynge caste theyr hertes though iohn behalfe reason singular humilitie hert much could hide owne greatnesse lyght cockebrained fashion common multitude suche persones haue speciall mynde regarde vnto sette pryce cause reason suche beare hatred agaynst suche mooste slaunderously report finding fault thinges earnest good fauour opinion people well declare verye perfite humilitie holy man ferre taking vnto aduauntage ma praise stoutely refused beeyng geuen vnto people voluntary offre wrong opinio people wer muche good one pointe dignitie worthynes christ yet knowe alowed substanciall open testimonie face worlde iohn assone inspiracio holy ghost wel perceiued secrete thoughtes people spake maner sir sayth ye esteme outward thinges may seen exaple meat ye se eate wede minister baptisme vnto thynges seen great deale effectuall euen rate man vertue minde whiche seene muche dignitie worthinesse power body whiche seen men iyes behalfei baptyse water thoughe baptise water yet remitter sinnes preparer baptisme efficacie vertue ye shall receiue handes whose cumming preache vnto dede sum elder time suwhat afore ordre course preaching power great way inferiour vnto cummeth ferre better ye beleue sum great hygh manne price vnworthy vnbuccle larchet shooes seruaut felow foregoer vnto euen muche like rate ye day sterre goeth sunne shal anon darkened drouned ye greater light sunne cumeth eue haue haue bounteous goodnesse doctrine washe yf bee compared vnto doctrine baptisme vertue yf set baptisme cum heauen wyll teache heauenly thynges beyng yearthly creaturebut one stronger shall cum c dooe speake yearthly thinges lowe matiers diepe body water shal diepe soules baptise holy ghost fyer loke muche spirite strength tre perce water loke muche fier strengthe effecte water muche power shal baptisme bee mine hytherto hath vnknowen true folowers godlynes easye thyng bee washed wt water light matter kyll beaste sacrifice easye poynte forbeare eatyng swynes fleshe dooeth suche doctrine cum light suche tymes doe approche euen hand longer vnknowen bee good folkes dede bee otherwise cum thing hath oftentimes thretened prophetes precise streight iudgement disclose perfite difference betwene ye godly wicked wyll haue hande fanne vnto man geuen power heauen yearth fanne whiche man shall bee able auoyde shall make cleane floore winnowyng place winno euery creature triyng wynde crosse affliccions suche persones chaffe saye pretense holynesse merely gaye withinfoorth voide emptie deuocion shall flye way waye whyther soeuer carnall desyre affeccion shall carry suche good wheate hauyng within substaunciall true godlynes shall scattered abrode al wynde whan chaffe tryed waye shall declare substaunciall stedfastnes theyr mynde whiche nothyng could moue tempest shall make persones euill shall shewe openly knowen euen seen like sorte clere light dooeth make persones blynde deformed sheweth deformed blynde trueth gospel bright light shall abide away withall dyd afore shew forth theyr peynted sheathe vnder counterfait cloke holynesse wheras afore god wer men wickednes contrarywyse shall embraced muche made whiche whereas vnto worldewarde reputed abiectes yet neuertheles perfite zele godly deuocio breastes person strog force doctrine god whan heare shalbe moued stirred doyng mischief slaughter shall fyrst bee made wicked suche occasion beeyng geuen shall openly appere maner felowes afore occasio doth make folkes wicked dooeth discouer theim shewe theim suche one whan losse goodes set iyes wha perill crosse death shewed hym wyll fall professynge trueth forsake shall euen first beginne wicked shall suche tyme playnly declare maner one afore neither shal euery one byanby dipped water endure throughout examinacion trial suche one hath fully receiued spirite god hath throughly conceiued fier charitie loue vnperishable suche one shall bee moued storme mysauentures euils shall rather bee better pourged tedfast lyke sort wheate grayne pourged made clene fanning wynde gold scoured vertue fyer leat therefore euery bodye prepare theimselfes rygorouse precise tryall trustyng whit noblenesse birth puttig none affiaunce holynesse auncestrie putting trust carnall ceremony moyses law arming fesing solle fortress wardes piththie substauce truste shall smalle poynt matter sort euery bodie founde health euerlastyng euerlasting damnacion shall trye diuide sound fro lyghte one puffesand chaffe shall burne right borne israelite bastardes well clensed corne shall laye vp barne heauenly lyfe chaffe shall burne vp fier neuer shall bee quenched iudgement shall sum piece bee shewed present life wicked receyue affliccion endlesse peyne tormente many saiynges mo iohn exhort people repetauce theyr former lyfe desire messias shortly cum puttyng feare peryll nowe styrryng goodnesse promise rewardes ye would say awakenyng myndes people vnto earneste zele euangelicall godlines gladsom newes redempcion saluacion herode tetrarche whe rebuked herodias brother philip wife euils whiche herode added aboue laied iohn prison boldnesse speakyng plainly common vulgare people consideration notable holynesse man coulde abide wel publicanes could suffer well inough ye soldier also toke good part al wha thei wer reproued willingly acknowlage disease beyng brought feare sought remedy herode could wise away withal haulte stomake kyng woulde haue thynges lawfull hym stoode lust fansy yet beare good fauour loue iohn verye wel sawe also lesse allowe perfeccion lyfe beeyng suche fewe menne yea many thynges also woulde bee rewled counsail iohn yet point chefely expedient behoueable geue vnto iohns sayinges onely doe counsayle also caste hym pryson geuing hym good aduertisement brought iohn destruccion whan iohn diligent call backe destruccion sorte oftentimes ye hertes suche prynces wysedome ghospell hath throughlye wonne ne recouerrd dominio abominable lustes sum suche lordes ruler ouer others owne behalfes bodseruautes violent strong affeccions suche thinke themselfes euen poynte specially kynges bee slaues bond men abominacion sayig blacke iye many tymes cal vnto theyr seruice men well approued knowen holines liuing haue many tymes priuate communicacion counsail aduise suche many thynges haue delite true godlynes may cloke purchase theselfes opinion perfite liuyng may somewhat mollifye meanes repining grutching naughty doinges ende whan piele polle people wha eise wicked battail wha play tiranuous partes towardes sum beare good herte wyl common weale may seme doe thynges counsayl approued honest men euen like sorte herode abuse ye pilche camel hyde wherewith iohn clad lyke sorte abuse leatherne belte wherwith iohn girt abuse spare diet iohn vsed innocencie iohns whole life lykewyse dyd authoritie iohn whiche mighte doe muche people altogether maintenauce tiranny thys cause lorde iesus dooeth afterward call foxe wily craftines euill prynces worlde vnto whome shall tyme fortune right professours ghospel called seruice either ye gospeller muste eschewe coumpany conuersacion suche maysters whose house shall sooner marred broughte naughtinesse party shal turne others better way orels thei muste prepare mindes aforehande like rewarde shewyng trueth without dissimulacion iohn fortuned get labour whan herode nothyng growyng kynde maners facions father others auncestours plaied many wieked tiranous partes pillyng pollyng people pulling away libertie oppressio punishyng others thynges whiche common offender hymself vsing office magistrate vnder sale ware money vsyng also sell ministracions priestehood kepig within house openly face world one herodias wife phylyp beyng brother force strong hand taken away sayed brother yet beyng aliue together doughter philippes holy man coulde abide suche incest vnnaturalnesse mariage kynges house whens especially aboue al place conuenient example keping lawes procede aduertised refrain suche wicked misdede deiulish king deiulishe request gierle beyng minion dauncer together suggestion deiulish woman weighed holsome aduertisement vncorrupt man whiche good aduertisemet nothing better remained stil ferre way ame ded vnto hainous enormity afore past added one dede myschief vngracious euer wete casting iohn pryson procedyng ferre laste outragious woodnes caused heade moste innocent man bee chopt gaue wenche reward vicious wanton dauncyng pand fortuned whan people receiued baptysme whan iesus baptysed dyd praye heauen opened holye ghoste came downe bodely shape lyke doue vpon hym voyce came heauen whiche ayde thou art beloued sonne thee delite returne discourse storie lord iesus would entre buisie office preachyng entended coumpasse short tyme accoplishe bryng perfite ende entent would leaue one poynt humilitie righteousnes vnfulfilled thought disdain cum residue folkes vnto baptisme purified whiche neded consecrate halow lauacre fount eternall saluacion behofe baptisme hubled notwithstanding aswel voice iohn also clere testimonie eternal father ope ly comended face people entent might knowe eue face sight prophetes aforetymes spoken muche prophecie iohn openly witnessed time great numbre common people wer baptising cumpany iesus christ cuming one emong mo instantly desired iohn haue baptisme though like subiect sin iohn would haue refused baptise acknowlagyng ye autour geuer puritie ought rather baptised hymself thissame testimony geue first iohn dignitie iesus personally place eue al multitude people heauely father euident marke disseuer sonne y ye residue ye cupany wer baptised vnto al rest wha baptising appered signe ne token al immediatly ye lord y baptised makingg deuout praiers god teaching v thereby whan state innocencie perfitely renewed baptisme ought immediatly couert bestow selues study exercise spirit emog deuout praier hath first place heauen opened baptisme set wide ope v vntil day shut vp fro v fro then came doun ye holy ghost b ing hiself dede inuisible time enuested clad figure likenesse visible seene iyes men likenesse doue bird beyng sygne represent innocencie simplicitie many hundred yeres afore brought braunche oliue tree arke noe toke wrathe god pacified also caucion pledge warratise floudde end dede said floudde noe whiche ye worlde time scoured pourged naughty creature conteine misticall figure baptisme wherby sinnes drowned vp body soules bothe beyng preserued perfyte safetie lykenesse dyd holy ghoste descende downeupon hym reste vpon holy toppe lorde iesus head openly betokenyng god father plenteously anoynted heauenly giftes grace whiche gyftes woulde afterwarde poure vpon al person many puttyng affiaunce truste himand voice came heauen wer afterward bee graffed brotherhoode bodye thoroughe baptisme came also vnto besides likenes doue euident testimonie father voice declared ye prophetes moses angel publyshed father selfe father may verye owne lykenesse bee either heard seen sence body coprehended perceyued lyke holy ghoste beeyng inuisible openly shewe hymself iyes men visible signe euen heauely father sending doune voice ye elementes aboue sesibly pearce ye eares voice souned high wordes thou arte mine owne onely dere beloued sonne throughly pleased satis ied none al holy euer olde time euer testimonye suche lyke sorte geuen doue cumming pointed certainlythou arte beloued sone delite whome voyce apperteine thentent man deme iohn commended sayd poysee whiche iohn greate manye folkes coceyued high estimacion verilye thought messias selfe many testimony pleasure christ bee commended vnto ye world ere would addresse enter high charge preachyng geuyng meane tyme lesson v exaumple hymselfe man presse toumble himselfe suche high office dainlye vnreuerently ere made himselfe mete priuately testimonye geuen aungels elizabeth simeo anna magians open face worlde iohn whose authoritie ryghte great wayghte force among iewes holy ghoste father owne selfe pand iesus hymself began thirty yeres age supposed bee sonne ioseph whiche sonne h ly sonne mathat whiche sonne leui sonne melchi sonne ianna whiche sonne ioseph sonne matatthias sone amos sone nau sonne helly whiche sonne nagge whiche sone maath sonne mathathias sonne semei sonne ioseph sonne iuda sonne ioha na whiche sonne hesa whiche sonne zorobabell sonne salathyell whiche sonne neri whiche sonne melchi whiche sonne abdi whiche sonne coosam whiche sonne helmadam whiche sonne whiche sonne ieso whiche sonne helyezer whiche sonne ioram whiche sonne mattha whiche sone leui whiche sonne simeon whiche sonne iuda whiche sonne ioseph whiche sonne ionam whiche sonne heliachim sonne melcha whiche sonne menam whiche sonne mathatha whiche sonne nathan whiche sonne dauid whiche sonne iesse whiche sonne obed whiche sonne boo whiche sonne salmon whiche sonne naasson whiche sonne aminadab whiche sonne aram whiche sonne esrom whiche sonne phares whiche sonne iuda whiche sonne iacob whiche sonne isaac whiche sonne abraham whiche sonne tharra whiche sonne nachor whiche sonne saruch whiche sonne ragau whiche sonne phalec whiche sonne heber whiche sonne sala whiche sonne cainam whiche sonne arphaxat whiche sonne sem whiche sonne noe whiche sonne lameth whiche sonne mathusala whiche sonne enoch whiche sonne iareth whiche sonne el whiche sonne cainam whiche sonne e o whiche sonne seth whiche sonne adam whiche sonne god vnto thynges aboue mencioned also annexed autoritie full yeresand iesus began thirtie yeres age fitte suche purpose time whan lorde iesus came vnto baptisme well toward pointe thirtie yeres age ye age estemed afore god coueniet whiche drawe persones vnto satisfie creature behalfes neyther suche persone one poynte bee whiche creature myghte thyng lykelye depraue fynde faulte withall age therefore due rypenesse chosen thereunto taried vntill came ouer young age whan one striplyng towardes young man authoritie regarde among men generall opinion people suche one vnexpert vnskilful side olde age lighter esteemed passed reason power habylitie witte muche decayed suche one greatly suspected dotyngso supposed sonne ioseph bleamyshe one linage doeth soore abate greate piece autoritie amonge common people poynte also prouided iesus long tyme verylye thoughte beleued soonne ioseph vntyll gospell thoroughe myracles preachynge sufficiently brought light made famous thyng dignitie christe bee borne vyrgyn muche materiall shoulde euen fyrste daye cum lyghte knoweledge abrode yet thoughe woulde haue harde matter bee persuaded worlde vsed wrong opinion people waye good purpose maner thyng meane tyme diminyshe autoritie preachynge yf myghte maner lykelyhood haue sayed bee borne aduoutrye pleasure cum worlde borne oute symple meane house yet suche house spotte yll name fame tyme stayned verily teacher ghospel fault self also al likenes apparance fault must auoided teacher ought duetie man good comendacio ye vertuous quality hath also without infeccion sparke suche thynges people vseth conceiue mistrust euil comon opinio moste men scarcely time doeth euill parentes cum good chyldren therfore christe shunned reproch pouertie shronke borne meane house yet eschewed ye simple reprofe slaunder might haue cum age descent althoughe ioseph father iesus nature thorder ye law spoused housbande iesus mother yet neuerthelesse maried wife tribe house hiself haue thought beste begynne reckenyng lordes petygrewe hym ende may euidently appere manne dede body behalf naturally borne whome foresaiynges prophetes cummyng tolde borne shoulde higher nature godhed heauenlye father selfe acknowlaged openly protested iesus owne soonne ioseph spouse virgin marie mother iesus fourme lawwhich sonne heli called sonne heli beyng vncle father side trueth naturall generacion sone iacob whiche iacob reised sede vnto brother heli beyng borne oute yesame bealy thesame heli deceassed issue vpon wife diyng left widow iacob beegot sonne called ioseph heli sonne mathat leui father leui borne melchi begotte ianna sonne ioseph sonne matatthias amos father nau beget sonne helsi helsi borne father nagge nagge issued maath sonne matathias matathias cum seede semei sonne ioseph begotten borne iuda iuda father ioanna soonne rhesi beyng sone zorobabel zorobabels father zalathiel borne self neri sonne melchi descended linage addi sonne cosam begotten helmada lineallye descended sonne ieso borne heleazer soonne ioram father ioram mattha beyng hymselfe borne leui sonne simeon borne iuda sonne ioseph iona begotte beyng sonne heliachim sonne melea borne mathatha beyng sonne nathan man kyng dauid begotten barsabee restored stocke salomon whiche failed afore decayed ozochias dauid begotten iesse sonne obed beyng borne booz father salmo sonne naasson beyng borne aminadab aram father aram sonne esrom begotten phares sonne iuda iuda came lineall discente patriarke iacob sonne isaac abraham aged man accordyng goddes promyse begotten olde wife sara abraham borne tharra sonne nachor beyng begotte saruch sone ragau phalec father father heber begotten sale sonne cainan cainan sonne arphaxat whose father sem sonne noe noe sonne lamech sonne mathusalah beyng born enoch whose father iareth desceded malalehel sonne cainan begotte enoch sonne seth whose father adam begotte seth lyued hundred thirtie yeres adam head al makind hauyng none autour ne progenitour generacion onely god created claie yearth beeyng wer stede mother mankynde infected tayn ted synne yearthly father resemblynge inclynacion fyrst father fallen kynde viciousnesse sente lord iesus restorer redemer mankynde whan extremely fallen end thesame whiche ful whole falle doun ye disobedience one might recociled obedience one ende lyke whiche folowed step earthly father became therby subiect vnto deathe whiche beyng exempted kynred synner thorough baptisme graffed heauenlye adam iesus christe cleue fast vnto steppe attayne euerlastyng life heauen dede begynnynges mankynde whan fell restorynge dooe many behalfes answer taunt pour taunt one contrary nothyng doen matier blynde chauce casualtie whole processe discourse thynges tempered ordred wisedom ordinaunce god almightie talkyng eue serpent whan virgin begynnyng deadly perishyng talkyng virgin marie gabriell begynnynge healthe recouerie eue beeyng corrupte lure apple laughyng cast awaie housbande also brought death worlde marie beyng virgin euer euer vncorrupted constauntly despysynge alluremente fleshe simple plain faythe willingly yeldyng self vnto god brought foorth man brought helth saluacion worlde adam also tempted ouercomed christ beeyng tempted ouercame temptour adam folowyng mynde wyfe whan corrupted caste paradise laboure christe obeiyng father euen vnto death sette waye heauen wide open sensuall pleasure tasting
