apple adam made bonde seruaunt vnto deuill christe settyng kyngdomes delycate pleasure ye world naught deliuered enemie handes subdued oure owne pleasure one thoroughe eatyng apple lost al posteritie succession abstinence meat restored afore lost one driuen awaie paradise yearth replenished miserie liyng al desert ye hath made waye vnto heauen safe strongly fensed al desertnesse ada ye vain desire proude knowelage plucked successio vnto death christ huble obedience faith restore life yea besides al bothe party woode tree one syde serpent meane tree ouercame beguiled adam side christ meane tree beguiled also ouercame ye deuill meane tree came death meane tree came lyfe head chiefe captayne destruccion made yearth beeyng virgin head saluacion borne virgin marie adam created lykenesse god christe beeyng true lykenesse god tooke hym bothe lykenesse nature manne adam deceyued wyfe eue christe hath called backe spouse churche deceiptefull errour deuyll one partie woman whyle seketh bee made wyse vttred furthe begynnyng foolyshenesse partie woman sheweth herselfe voyde al suche presumpcion bryngeth furth vnto v fountayne wysedome firste adam hath desyre wyse obedient brought folishenesse worlde new adam wheras wisedome father contente made foole sake ende might made wise pryde came fall humilitie came settyng vp agayne adam serpent made bare good quality mynde couered hymselfe leaues plucked tree christe riche giftes celestiall desired maner thing worldes figure also olde testament veray well accorde storie ghospell moses guided led israelite egypte christe hath deliuered derkenesse ignorauce bodage vice passage water baptisme haue ready waye saluacion freedome pilour cloude fyer father sendeth voyce downe cloude spirite baptised fyer first lawe occasion death lawe ghospell called agayne lyfe olde lawe dyd throundreynges lyghtenynges make sore afeard lawe ghospell doeth ientilnesse benefites call v forth saluacion moses terrible seen wyse constreyned couer face christe mylde full courteous humanitie puttyng hymselfe companie emong thickeste people moses went vp hill talke god christe came downe v intent god speake v hym fyrste adam coueteth equal god compared brute beastes voyde vnderstandyng seconde adam whan humbled himselfe godly maiestie downe bassenesse humaine nature wheras abiecte vile euen brute beastes helyf ed v vp participacion brotherhood godhed nowe conclude iesus sonne naue returnyng lande flowyng wyth mylke honey iesus sonne virgin returnyng agayne paradyse let v therfore goe awaye disposicion first parentes duely folowyng lyfe lorde iesus let v wyth pure myndes enbrace benefite let v al godly zele endeuour folowe exaumple best power hymselfe ayde v therto helpe whiche goodnesse hath geuen example let v enbrace merciable vnwrathfull maker lawe euangelicall lette v folowe guide none hable bryng nacions whole worlde home vnto lande whiche continually without ende doeth moste plenteously flowe kynde ioyes pthe iiii chapiter p iesus beeyng full holy ghoste returned iordan ledde spirite wildernesse fowerty day tempted deuill day eate nothyng whan ended afterwarde houngred deuill sayed vnto hym thou sonne god commaunde stone bee breade iesus aunswered saying wrytten man shall lyue bread euery woorde god iesus vpon whose head doue lighted baptisme beeyng voyde signe holy ghoste hymselfe lykenesse although nowe full holy ghoste yet would enterpryse office preachyng ghospell would thinges approued tryed euen vttermoste ere woulde take suche office handereturned iordan departed iordan geuyng therby lesson baptisme menne shoulde endeuoure themselfes higher exercise godly lyuyng withdrewe himselfe coumpanie people familiar muche conuersaunte doeth many tymes corrupte manne also doeth cause autoritie teacher lesse estemed regardedand ledde spirite wildernesse spirite god wherwith wholy rauished possessed moued led furthe wildernesse whence iohn fore come furthe emong people iesus euen one mynded bidde enemie mankynde quickely come make readie hys craftes ingiens verayly purpose shewe declare vnto v deuyll hitherto conquerour ouer mankind holden captiue maye bee vanquyshed subdued also fynger poynte vnto v waye howe wynne victory ouer hym place sought found apte mete temptours purpose wildernesse occasion ministred meanes hounger iesus doe parte moses behalfeand day eate nothyng nowe went geue vnto worlde newe lawe doctrine grace ghospell fasted moses doen fowertie dayes tyme sayed fowertie day touched maner meate passed ouer tyme holy prayer vnto god geuyng laude glorye thesame geuyng continuall thankes vnto heauenly father paterne saumple president certayne rare vnwoonte vertue manne neyther ignoraunt craftes subtilties satan meanes possible neuer earnestely pitcheth setteth snare grinnes whan perceyueth mynde soule man notable endeuour encline drawe towardes heauenly lyuyng satan heard one shoulde come whiche shoulde discoumfeight destruie puissaunce whether mightie conquerour alreadie come stoode doubte manne iesus could tell satan beguiled mankynde fore subtile craftes wyles nowe contrarywyse bee beguiled politique wysedome god heard iohn openly confesse saye christe wherfore seeyng perceyuyng many thynges christe whiche ferre surmounted compace man power syde agayne seeyng hym bee houngred great affliccion defaulte takyng bodily susteinaunce wheras read moses helias fastyng absteinyng meate space lyke noumbre dayes hungred supposed iesus nothyng el manne yea suche manne craftie conueighaunce myght corrupted nowe wilie subtill deuyse temptour wete eyther ouercome wynne hym dede leaste wyse hunte whether sonne god whiche promysed prophetes whiche thyng yf myght haue perceyued bee would bende strength force ende purpose one waye myght hindre lette redempcion mankynde crafte hable take place effecte againste wysedome god whiche suche sorte tempered ordred doynges dyd onely subdue conquier moste subtile craftie enemy also defeacted hym purpose woordes leauyng hym muche doubte vncertayntie infirmitie fleashe mocked disapoynted hym purpose stoutnesse puissaunce spirite together sure fence holy scripture vanquished subdued hym hauyng foyle ouerthrowe great shame drieuen awaye departed muche vncertayntie whether sonne god first cummyng satan therfore layed agaynst iesus effectuall darte artillerieand whan ended afterwarde houngred firste vsed agaynst firste parentes mankynde adam eue therewith ouerthrewe albeit onely enticed lure faire apple laughed vpon iesus case houngre also beyng euill manne endure withall strong helper forwarde thynggen xxvv temptour wente aboute esau bieyng compelled hounger solde title interest birtheright haue eldership solde messe pottage lorde iesus yf pleasure myght diuine power eyther haue kept awaye hounger cummyng hym el haue drieuen awaye whan come neuerthelesse woulde doe full pleasure wyll lay baite temptour vse wherwith thesame teptour bee taken owne selfe weakenesse bodie beeyng suche men laied satan waie secrete baite vse purpose temptour stumbled hit hooke power godhead sawe body man witheryng drying clene awaye hounger great affliccion paine none lyke shortely ieopardie perill death men playnly affirme kynde death peinfull famyshed death sawe hym wildernesse ferre towne village whence meate myght bee gotten ministred vnto hym susteinaunce takyng therfore boldenesse thynges spirite wickednesse assaileth lorde iesus beyng replete spirite holynesse biddeth bace begynneth firste hym subdued biddeth hym come furth strong valiaunte hym matche withall attempteth take snareif thou bee sone god commaude stone bread one ferre wyser warie hymselfe nedest thou sayeth satan bee thus tormented houngre thou bee sonne god whiche promised bee sente redeme worlde commaunde stone turne breade thy behoufe wyll bee euidente token declare thou art sonne god dede thy father vndoubtedly wyll behalfe geue deafe eare sonne beyng thus distresse ieoperdie death houngre seeyng created thynges naughtit wrytten man shall lyue bread onely euerye woorde god bee acte great matter sonne god turne stone breade iesus beeyng ignoraunte temptour herein hunted tempered aunswere neyther consented temptours counsayle yet disclosed nature godhead enemy nowe newe straunge conueighaunce infirmitie weakenesse iesus bodye bee beguiled also bee conquered denyeth sonne god power turne stone breade ne disalloweth asswage houngre body meate whiche ordeyned therfore autoritie holy scripture god plainly sheweth lyfe soule muche bee regarded lyfe bodye spirituall meate whiche requisite desired meate shorte tyme prolongeth bodily lyfe whiche lyfe neuerthelesse must necessitie perishe within shorte space afterwarde eyther meanes sickenesse age casualtie meate spirite geueth lyfe euer endure meate woorde god firste assaulte therfore deuyll iesus auoyded aunswer wrytten sayeth booke deuteronomiedeut vii manne liueth breade onely euery woorde procedeth mouthe god purpose doeth lorde nowe take woorde diuine scripture staigh first teache v humilitie sobrenesse ought precisely affirme thyng without autoritie scripture geuen vnto v god secondly declareth vnto v weapon effectuall strength agaynste instinctes mocions wicked deuils autoritie holy scripture sayed scripture true meate soule bee sought gotten manne mynde lyue god warde warde whoso liueth thesame already deadman yea although iye appeare bee alyue first parentes adam eue eate died labour yf geuen temptour aunswere whiche lorde iesus present tyme gaue regarded lordes commaundemente due kepyng wherof geueth lyfe euerlastyng appetite lust mortall apple endaungered themselues succession death damnacion thus much ferther doeth exaumple salueour teache miracle bee shewed lust pleasure men suche tymes onely whan glorye christe doeth call el charitie loue towardes brother doeth necessarily require eyther worke feigne sightes woondres vainglorious boastyng shoulde saye doe satisfie curious lust pleasure looker whereby neyther goddes glorye aduaunced profite groweth vnto neyghbour nothyng el propertie condicion witch iuglers ensaumple brennyng fyer brande bee diepped water quenched therwith fearefull lykenesse hector achilles bee made appeare sight rush strawes goe crallyng aboute house seemyng bee snake iesus tyme shewed miracle glorye father sette furthe thereby also necessitie menne relieued el tyme vnbeliefe menne shoulde thereby bee moued stiered feith whan multitude people wanted wherewith bee fedde multiplied fewe loaues thesame suffised many thousandes somuche woulde vouchesalue fede iyes herode miracle woulde muche open lippes speake vnto hym lyke purpose consideracion doeth presente denie miracle satan pand deuill tooke high mountayne shewed hym kyngdomes worlde euen twinckelyng iye deuill saied vnto power geue euery whitte glory deliuered vnto vnto whomsoeuer wil geue thou therfore wilt fall downe wurshippe shall thyne iesus aunswered sayed vnto hym hence satan written thou shalt wurship lord thy god hym onely shalt thou serue dieuill though vanquished firste bickeryng yet ceassed trying maisteries iesus exaumple leste beeyng conquerours shoulde geue selfes sittyng still voyde feare care haue euermore tyme tyme mynde readye well armed fensed agaynste newe assaultes suche haue profited growen meane degree euangelicall philosophie doctryne doe easily contemne disease vice gluttonie riottous excesse thyng beeyng filthye beastely albeit euen temptacion also afore godyng wanted grynne snare mouyng iesus presumpteouse vsurpyng takyng vpon hym whan satan sayed thou see sonne god suche nature arrogaunte proude desirous glorye doe ofte tymes attempte reache suche thynges ferre aboue theyr power wyll lese parte opinion estimacion menne haue craftie couloure counterfaite glosse take vnto thyng huntyng glorye fame among menne sorte doe many deceiptefull craftie feastes vsurpe vnto themselfes gyfte prophecie whiche haue many make vauntes crake hauing vision aungelles whiche yet neuer sawe lorde iesus contrarye wyse although greattest worlde yet page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate wyll acknowen greatnesse hydeth shewyng furth warde countenaunce infirmitie weakenesse bodye ne tyme sheweth furth godly power whan doe expediente health manne ende father glory maye bee renoumed troumped abrode sonne satan therfore malicious wyll neuer haue dooen ne bee reste dooeth eftesones inuade lorde sette vpon hym thesame darte dooen afore soondrie matter assaying whether coulde bee ouerthrowen hounger myght possiblie bee corruptted rychesse honour worlde ambicion whiche desyre honour aduauncemente soore mischiefe bothe pestilente also maner vnpossible bee ouercomed eiuyll stealeth manne euen moste excellente vertues quality crepyng acquaintyng selfe hertes laboure clyme mounte vppe vnto thynges high difficultie muche neyther aduersitie pouertie ne sickenesse haue hable breake neyther riottous excesse leacherie hath hable corrupte dooeth earneste desire affeccion glory ouerthrowe bryng quyte vnder foote thyng mischeuous wicked whiche mortall menne wyll refuse bothe doe suffre yf maye therby beare rewle bee authoritie oftetymes croune royalme bought poysonynges murdreing nerest kynred incestuous mariage within degree forbidden goddes lawe vilanies bee named slaughter murdremente howe many persones seigniourie one citie nowe gotten mennes handes possession honoure swete gaye thyng bee rewler royall matter excell passe others reignyng dooeth vtterly behalfes seme bee certayne poynte godhed emong menne swete flatteryng poyson firste parentes adam eue caught lure flatteryng apple delectable theyr iyes high perfeccion knowlage falsely promysed vnto serpente dignitie beeyng equall state goddes muche delectable theyr myndesand deiuill toke hym high mountayne c engein therefore dyd temptoure assayle iesus whitte shrounke backe vnrestefull malepertnesse thesame temptoure ende woulde vanquishe hym behoufe woulde teache v facion howe gette ouerhande hym dieuyll tooke iesus vppe high mountayne thesame mountayne beakon high place spyall sodaynlye momente layeth kyngdomes worlde iyes wicked spirite permission sufferaunce god maye muche doe represente vnto mennes iyes lyuely semblaunte thynges certayne straunge woondrefull maner euen thesame momente also looke whatsoeuer poynte high estate royaltie route ruffleyng great kynges prynces hath within courtes otherwyse belongyng vnto thesame dooeth satan certayne sleight iugleyng cast sette iyes iesus exaumple richesse seruauntes palayces army troumpettes seruyce attendaunce menne crouchyng knelyng vnto shewes royaltye whan goe abrode tryoumphes ambassades power commaunde haue thynges dooen becke thynges greate maygnye wherewithall flaterye people dooethe wurshippe exalte mortall prynces worlde beyng oftetymes foolishe vngodlye howesoeuer thynges bee ywisse frayll hauyng anye long tyme lyue yet people vse veraye goddes yea prynces selues beeyng sette pryde throughe prosperouse fortune thynges transytorye thynke themselues better god almyghties felowes certayne spectacle thynges woonderful beholde imagine dyd craftie iugler soodainly moment represente iyes lorde iesus cannot bee deceyued anye sleyghtes iugleyng forasmuche nothyng hydden vnknowen vnto hym vnto thys royall shewe thynges dyd lying malaperte satan sette oute paincted sorte wordes stately gloryous thinges selues wereall power geue c thynges sayeth goodlye ryche full royaltie bee deliuered power dysposicion geue graunte vnto whomesoeuer lyketh soueraygne god thys worlde thou wilte acknowlage soueraygne godlye power fallying downe flatte knee wylte bowe kneele vnto meif thou wilte fall downe c whole vnyuersall power possessyon realmes kingdomes thou seeste deliuer vp thy handes thou seeste howe greate name ceasar euerywhere yet howe small porcyon worlde acknowelageth hym theyr lorde soueraygne thou alone shalte haue enioye euerye one without excepcyon shalte bee wurshypped god yerthe thou wilte acknowlage autour geuer greate blysfulnesse thou knoweste sure good christen reader liyng moste presumptuouse sayinges hym sayde vnto vnfortunate firste parentes mankynde adam eue ye shall wyse dye ye shall bee goddes knowyng good eiuyll lorde iesus damned wicked woordes satan woordes goddes holye scripture saying iuaunte satan thy deceyptfull promyses hurtfull gaine full hyndreaunce boughte losse due loue deuocyon towardes god thyng thou wouldeste couenaunce endente haue wicked thyng thou promyseste vayne written booke deuteronomiedeu vi c x lorde thy god shalte thou wurshippe thy lorde god shalte thou wurship c onely shalte thou serue god suffer hys glorye bee putte ouer hymselfe suffer haue anye partener true god lorde thynges whatsoeuer heauen yearthe vnto true wurshippers hym freely promyseth inheritaunce kyngdome heauen hys saying muste men bee rewled rather thyne lyke thou dooeste wickedly require haue thy selfe honoure due god alone doeste thou promyse onely thynges vanytye thynges shall long tyme endure also perteyning mannes possession thyne lorde iesus mighte haue aunswered wherefore doooeste thou promyse myne owne alreadye face dooeste thou require fall downe thy knee sence god whiche crea ed thee whiche expulsed thee thy pryde caste thee downe heauen ready hable euen nowe caste thee downe hell soone shall thynke good ouer veraye kingdomes whiche thou offerest power ne title thou haste wrong iudgemente vngodlinesse mortall people geue thee power autoritie ouer theyr folye thou arte power true loue deuocyon towardes god shall reuyue agayne shall thy kyngdome bee thus myghte iesus haue sayde satan presente beguiled enstructed ne taught neyther worthy bee tolde faulte forasmuche could manier meanes refourmed oure behoufe pageaunte played whome thys lesson geuen whatsoeuer thyng hath dyshonoure god ioyned profytable soeuer seeme bee greate stoutenesse bee refused defyed thoughe rychesse themselues yuyll bee kyng selfe eyuyll bee publyque magistrate hyghe autorytie selfe eiuyll manyer manne maketh hymselfe waye thynges naughtye meanes conueyghaunce thynges enioyed ne possessed withoute sore daungyer forgettyng bounden duetie loue towardes god subiecte hasarde ieoperdyes perylles innumerable truelye whatsoeuer persone beeyng corrupted inordynate desyre thynges dooeth make lyght goddes commaundementes vseth fraude falsehoode stealeth forsweareth sleagheth vseth ryghte wrong one suche one hath euen nowe already kneeled downe dooen wurship prince thys worlde hath denyed god league made goddes aduersarye often mynde christen manne enticed encreasyng substaunce obteynyng rewle autorytie purchasyng glorye renoume trueth maye bee forsaken wickednesse receyued place thereof let hym thys exaumple christe hys capytayne make aunswere without feare auaunte satan al thy deceyptfull promisses onely god bee wurshypped boughed vnto whoso hath hym hys good lorde thesame lorde thynges hym pand carryed hierusalem sette pinnacle temple sayed vnto thou bee sonne god caste thy selfe downe hence w en shall geue aungels charge ouer thee kepe thee theyr handes shall beare thee vp thou dashe thy foote agaynste stone iesus aunswered sayed vnto sayed thou shalte tempte lorde thy god soone temp acyon ended iuyll departed season neyther doeth endlesse malapertenesse satan although thus also put hys purpose yet neyther geue ouer succeasse temptyng setteth vpon iesus enemye ofte bee vanquished ende shoulde vnderstande selues haue life contynuall fyghte oure aduersarie neyther anye thing much agaynst goddes bode whereunto dareth presume prouoke entyce true seruauntes god yet good menne nede feare whose behoufe christe iesus hath vanquished haue dartes weapon enough strength vertue holy scripture wherewith malaperte importunitie temptour maye momente bee faced quaylled al aduauntage getteth tempting none poynte ministring suche good occasyon make vertue good men greatter better tryed therfore leadeth way lorde iesus hyghe mountayne vnto citye hierusalem sette hym euen vpon vppermoste pynnacle temple eftesons prouoketh hym temptacion ende eyther beeyng ouercomed vayne glorye shoulde cast himselfe downe headlong breake hys necke el token shoulde descrie himselfe bee sonne god defence maynteyne fraude withall stole wholy scrypture albeit vnderstanded taken wrong sence applyed suche purpose ought behe shall geue aungels charge ou e thee c lyke meanes doe wieked persones heritiques many tymes abuse scrypture god deceyue vnwarie whan depraue turne wrong sence rule goddes woorde theyr owne affeccyons sayeth declare thou whether thou sonne god cast thy selfe downe headlong case thou shalte haue harme thereby maye bee open euident vnto creature thou arte sonne god neyther daungier misadueture befal theepsal xxic writen psalmes touching sonne god shall geue charge aungels concerning thee see thee preserued shall theyr handes beare th e vp thou mayeste stumble thy foote stone prophecie shewed directly christe alone godlye manne whateuer bee trusting boldelye goddes mightie helpe ought bee fearde owne behalfe anye eiuilles worlde according lorde iesus selfe bidde apostle bee oute feare care harte muche heare one theyr heades shoulde peryshe contrarye mynde pleasure theyr heauenlye father iesus makyng countenaunce thys whyle naturally sonne god onely made aunswere folowing whiche myght haue bene made good man whateuer bene texte holy scripture rightly alleged conuynced texte scripture whiche satan falsely cyted one shoulde haue dryeue one nayle bourde contrarywise sayeth written booke deute onomie thou shalte tempte lorde thy god thou shalt tempte lorde thy god helpe shall bee readye whan anye casualtye whan mattier concernyng goddes cause shall bryng daungier whan thou shalte vayneglorye b agge prouoke require high power god bee shewed neyther dooeth tendrenesse god towardes v serue mayntayne glory carnall pleasure manne time declaring owne glory man doth succour man destitute ayde helpe world vnworthye persone goddes helpe owne vayneglorye dooeth wilfully caste hymselfe manifeste daungyer hys lyfe neyther propertye true godlye man appoyn te vnto god whan howe ought deliuer v peril asmuche certayne whether delyuer v delyuer v thyng entendyd wrought hym moste oure healthe safegarde oftentymes oure benefyte good happe bee sycke bee health dye liue bee affliccion haue prosperitie presente godlinesse depende syngle hearte wieked thyng mannes curyous searchyng temple hys power may extende dooe power doe thynges dooe beste wayes moe oure head maister iesus suffer himselfe tempted satan immedyately maner baptysme ende shoulde thynke bee sufficyente oure synnes haue bene forgeuen v lau cre baptisme muste take hande enter sharpe battayle oure enemie satan leaue nothyng vnattempted drawe v backe agayne oure olde bondage oure bap ysme monster behoufe oure captayne promyse watre vnder hys banner agaynste armye satan enne thys worlde haue nothyng dooe withall waye anye querell forasmuche christe ommaundeth v loue yea euen oure enemy haue dooe wicked spirites fight agaynst v hygh fierie daries muche pollicie iesus oure soueraygne hath discoumfeyghted theyr power therfore hath delyuered oure handes easye enough bee vanquyshed yea eftesoones subdue v yf folowe trade fyghtyng whereby christe broughte vnder subieccyon assaulte v whyles themselues putting vngodly thoughtes oure hertes many tymes eyuell menne theyr souldyers assayle v whan procure make messagyers maye prouoke v sensuall olup ousenesse braullyng raylyng woordes maye moue friere v wrathe manslaughter baytes wherwith catche v som while fette thys worlde promocions rychesse pompes whereof doe heapes cast oure iyes many tymes euen owne selfes take baytes v bee v certayne affeccionate pangues nature whiche able cast awaye v onlesse shoulde vtterly shake humayne nature exaumple appetite meate drynke desyre fulfill luste carnall concupiscence nature hathe made v full age thereto although moderately vse carnall copulacion lawfull wyfe none enormitie agaynste high pleasure god allaie thirste hounger meate drynke yet behalfe dooeth subtill wylye enemye lye wayte v eyther maye geue affeccions bridle takyng suffisaunce nature necessarie el appeace rage suche wayes conueniente whiche sorte exaumple folowe may bee one touche mannes wyfe vse owne wyfe immoderately doe acte facions vnsemely yf one offending christe brother eate thinges offered vnto idolles whan maye auoyde slaundre yet otherwyse well enough relieue necessitie bodye bee also euery v certayne speciall inclinacions bothe bodye mynde certayne vice whether bee thesame firste taken parentes haue sticked still v whether haue taken custome el whether haue meanes come vnto v exaumple one manne nature prone couetise glottonie leacherie another wrathe ambicion doeth enemie leaue one thyng vnwatched whereby maye drawe v damnacion must agaynste lying waiteand soone al temptation ended deiuill departed fro hym bee bothe stoute also diligent watchyng spirite christe shall geue v bothe strength witte agaynste ingiens holy scripture shall minister vnto v armoure weapon enough suffereth v bee tempted wyll suffre v bee ouercommed wyll ordre fight ende fielde battayle shall turne benefite enemie beyng putte wurse ceasse haue enuy v wyll length ceasse inuade oftener shall come muche often discoumfeighted weakened shall tymes departe agayne howe case afterwarde stande v christe dyd nowe expresse exaumple hymselfe deiuill dispeched spente fractes craftie poyntes coulde agaynste lorde yet sawe neuer whitte nerer purpose beeyng onely ouercomed also deluded defeacted wordes departed awaye howbeit season say returne againe tempting whan myght seke procure occasion therto sence tyme coulde gette iesus professe sonne god hable goodly shewe thynges corrupte afterwarde laboured helpe hys souldiers phariseis scribe priestes putte hym death yet euen behalfe also dyd iesus godly policie mocke defeate wylinesse aduersarie thynges satan strength laboured bryng passe castyng awaye thesame dyd christe turne saluacion yea moste especially dyd satan perceyue tyrannie bee cleane ouerthrowen assured hymselfe moste vndoubted victory firste came baptisme whiche geueth state innocencie afterwarde came wildernesse continuall prayer fastyng therewithall battayle satan agaynst moste chiefely armed auoydyng coumpanie resorte people emong place wantyng matter enough prouoke stiere weake myndes vnto vice moe one prayer fenseth gardeth soule fastyng abateth strength bodye encreaseth strength soule pand iesus returned power spirite galile wente fame hym throughout region taught synagoges commended menne nowe nothyng remaynyng iesus addresse hymselfe office teachyng veray true office moste specially belongyng byshoppes whiche office manne doeth ryght sorte take hande onlesse bee many wayes tryed proued onlesse bee founde conquerour subduer naughtie appetite whiche doe corrupte peryshe woorde god maye bee hable teache others meanes maye resist satan enough teacher ghospell pure vice muste also bee stoute vncorrupte neyther lucre ne sensuall pleasure bodye ne ambicion ne feare eiuylles wyll declyne vpright streightnesse trueth ghospell whiche trueth satan doeth tyme ceasse assaulte suche persones loue worlde loue glory god lorde iesus beeyng mynded teache v premiss finyshed dooen returned nowe agayne galile great power vertue spirite whiche replete withall temptacion aforesayedand iesus returned power spirite galile gathered strength spirite spice newe power growen vnto hym fore thyng mynde dyd vtter shewe furthe selfe settyng vnto v therewhyle playne picture charge care euangelicall teacher ought bee ought looke pleasure begynne firste preachyng ghospell galile beeyng moste abiecte basse region iewes partely agree iustely prophecie esay whiche foresayed aboute coastes zabulon neptalim saye nere galile gentyles lyght goddes trueth shall spryng vppe partely entente parte prosperous procedyng ghospell imputed ayde maynteinaunce worlde case ghospell hadde taught brought lyght learned menne ryche folkes menne power case sprong vp region beeyng thyng famous god purpose choose picke thynges vile abiecte worldely estimacion ende whole glorye marueilouse matter redound vnto hymselfe euen nowe already fame iesus vnspoken emong people galile reason miracle priuately shewed worlde knewe come knowlage many yea euen baptisme fewe disciple euen tyme gathered vnto hym pleasure haue witness whole lyfe doctryne euen veray time lytle lytle withdrewe hymselfe affeccionate willes hys kynesfolkes would doyng reache v kynesfolkes also doe oftentymes hurte synceritie purenesse doctryne iohn cast prieson duryng tyme iohns preachyng iesus dyd maner altogether holde peace spice contencion growe aryse betwene disciple one whether shoulde haue preeminence great courage entreth buisy office preachyng ghospell openly face worlde nowe tyme lawe beeyng restreigned kepte vnder bandes figure whereof iohn dyd beare libertie ghospell shoulde putte furthe head shewe selfe enpriesonyng feriers moste mete lawe beeyng full shadowes beeyng derkened mysticall doubtfull sayinges mete sette light ghospell vppe hygh entente myght bee open syght region coastes worlde without excepcion aswell greatest leaste aswell learned vnlearned soone lord returned galile power spirite god whome filled whiche power nowe aswell doctryne also miracle partely vttred fame fore ye would saye flighen abrode among fewe persones comparison concernyng iesus published bruited abrode throughout al region vnto teacher ghospell famouse name requisite suche one ought seke glory emong men honest opinion teacher doeth purchase vnto bothe credite authoritie sayed honest opinion desired maner way acquired gotten let teacher ghospell accordyng exaumple iesus lyue whereas maketh vaunt e voste hymselfe may yet neuerthelesse aduaunced testimonie heauenly father power vertue holy ghoste voyce ihon saye euery honest good man grace god resteth let hym lyue maye perfeccion liuyng behaue turne iyes folkes vpon hym bee short let hym suche feith constaunt affiaunce god yf case require may glorifie god euen shewyng myracles howbeit worlde nowe miracle great great enough suche one neyther richesse neyther sensual pleasure worldly promocion ne dreadfull offering tormentes ne feare death selfe whit turned purenesse veritie eua gelicall nowe emong iewes customeand u theyr synagoges often season moste specially sabooth day people assembled together temple theyr synagoges thentent tyme restyng lawe enioyned filthie secular workes spen e dycing cardyng harlottes banquettyng reuelyng chydyng brallyng veray naughtie vice bestowed thynges perteynyng soule saied temple synagoges talking one concernyng triflyng matter worlde lawe lorde messias come moste ardent prayer looked good godly folkes euery man could conferred declared amonges presence state degree soeuer whosoeuer made countenaunce teache vnto people deliuered vnto hym booke lawe god wherhence parte duetie teacher ghospell fette wherwith fede soules people dreames men whatsoeuer thyng place audience done coulde priuie hidden stocked thither great multitude sortes degree people iesus therfore willyng doctryne knowen vnto creature walked throughout city galile vsed accordyng lawdable custome iewes come synagoges shewyng furth euery thesame wonderfull piththie doctryne kyngdome heauen beyng muche power force doctryne phariseis preached naught vtter rynde lawe constitucios menneand commeded men wyne stronger herre operacion water neyther dyd lacke emong people galile mindes apt desirous learne whiche marueiled newe kynde doctryne whiche dyd reuerence wonderfull teacher therof highly praysyng manifying hym came nazareth nourced custome went synagoge sabboth daye stode vp reade deliuered vnto booke prophete esai wh opened booke found place written spirite lord vpon hath enointed preache ghospell people hath sent heale broken herted preache deliueraunce captyue sight blynde freely sette libertie bruised preache acceptable yere lorde closed booke gaue agayne minister sate downe hitherto verayly ghospelles cause dyd sufficiently well procede vntyll came kynsfolke knowelage familiar frendes acquaintaunce becau vnderstande whiche teacheth heauenly thynges ought muche maye estraunge hymselfe fleashe blond kinred whan passed certaine litle townes city galile last came nazareth whiche place reason brought vp young nourcechylde long tyme liued parentes kynsfolkes supposed many borne thesame cause also comonly called nazarean thentent nazareans fynde themselues grieued thought skorne kinsfolkes aliauce one mynde desyre go hunting glory emong people straunge party none kynne dwelt came thither also nazareth beeyng nowe manne great fame muche spoken whereas tofore suche fame quarter would declare nowe renounced geuen vp priuate busynesse affayrs worlde came accordyng accustomed maner common synagoge ought suche man conuersaunt temple whoso consecrated profityng folkes generalland stoode vppe reade heard others treatyng reasonyng moses lawe also arose vp signifying gesture others vsed doe also beeyng inspired holy ghoste thyng mynde willyng speake multitude beeyng assembled whiche custome euen daye endureth church ordinaunce paul menne shall speake heare course case man haue thyng opened vnto reuelacion woorthy mete bee knowen spake afore shall leaue shall geue place partie succedeth hym troubleous noyse confusion speakyng one maye bee heard shall aryse holy congregacion whiche decent thynges bee doen peace tranquillitie booke deliuered vnto iesusand deliuered vnto hym booke c accordyng custome vsage v enstructed taught therby whece doctrine saluacion ought procede e inuencions men posicions philosophiers booke holye scripture whiche hath reueled vnto v secrete instincte operacion spirite god iesus treasoures knowlage wysedome hidden nede booke yet tooke booke woulde commende vnto v ear est settyng myndes readyng holy scripture minister synagoge reacheth furth booke vnto hym tooke hym shutte iesus alone hath key openeth layed vp hidden olde lawe whan taken booke openeth turneth iesus himselfe laye secretely hidden diepely hidde lawe truly mete iewes selfes geue thyng wherwith anon conuinced booke deliuered vnto iesus auentures though forced nothing booke booke ye prophete esay neuer man eyther clerely el euidently prophecie christeand opened booke c doctryne ghospel neither thyng blynde chaunce happen conueighed goddes prouidence booke beyng opened abrode leafe turned veray place came chiefly fyrs e hande whiche dyd moste erely plainly talke christe whiche christe mouth prophete speaketh himselfe maner spirite ye lord hath enointed bryng glad tydinges poore preaching ghospell hath sent heale contrite saye throughly broken herte preache remission free deliueraunce suche captiuitie syght vnto blinde set freely libertie suche bruysed preache yere lorde acceptable muche wished preache daie retribucion whan lord iesus owne voyce pronounced woordes standing vpon feete redelieuered booke shut together againe receyued vnto minister signifying obstinate vnbeliefe iewes sittyng still beatyng letter lawe dyd neyther vnderstande ne woulde acknowleage christe beyng soule lyfe lawe nowe immediatly taketh hym parte office teacher sate hym downe quietly expoune sentence read touchyng read texte prophete standyng feeteand sate downe thing doen authoritie scripture god wherunto mete dignitie manne reuerently humble selfe touchyng taught sittyng downe declaracion expouner preacher goddes holy scripture ought bee voyde altogether clere troubleous vnquietnesse carnall worldely desyres pand iyes synagoge fastened began saye vnto day scripture fulfilled eares bare hym witnesse wondred gracious woordes whiche proceded mouthe sayed iosephes sonne sayed vnto ye vtterly say vnto prouerbe phisician heale thy selfe whatsoeuer haue heard doen lapernaum lykewyse thyne owne countrey sayed uerayly saye vnto prophete accepted owne countrey partely newe fame whiche nowe already begon spred abrode iesus partely authoritie teacher first toke vpon finally certayne heauenly grace shyning veray countenaunce dyd cause iyes people whiche present congregacion earnestly fixed suche audience doeth lord iesus loue kepe sabboth resting troubleous desire affeccions worlde suche mutuall concorde one gathered together one place haue iyes theyr minde loking none way streight vpon iesus streight towardes euerlastyng saluacion dayly speaketh vnto v misticall scripture god speaketh euangelicall prophetes saye enterpretours expouners holy bookes scripture happy blissed lord iesus speaketh geuyng suche earnest iye eare vnto hym suche doeth vouchesaue open mysterie depe hidden sencethis daie scripture fulfilled eares soone sawe iyes presence caste full whole fixed hym alone begonne saye vnto ye haue nowe heard prophete esay inspiracion holy ghost promising vnto certaine excellent mightie teacher worldly spirite teache constitucions vaine fable seruing good purpose aboundautly enoynted replenished spirite god bee sen e thesame bryng glad wishable tidinges saluacion suche meke poore spirite reason therof apte receyue holsome doctrine heauen whiche teacher power habilitie perfourme thyng whiche bryng tydynges one endewed heauenly vertue power whiche teacher also shoulde freely bryng saluacion vnto creature many acknowlagyng theyr owne naughtinesse offence dyd wyshe saluacion whiche teacher moreouer manier sinnes beeyng frely pardoned helpe suche theyr hertes corrupted many sondrye disease vice naughty lustes whiche teacher ferthermore preache deliueraunce setting libertye vnto persones either beyng geuen idolatrie kepte fast deuill captiues prisoner el beyng thrall supersticion lawe mighte reache ne atteigne libertie spirite whiche teacher besides faith open iyes vnto suche blynde soule abode moste diepe myste manyf lde errours suche wise theyr sayde iyes hable behold looke vpon light eternall vecitie accordyng prophecie whiche thesame prophete wrote another place sayth people satte darkenesse hath seen great light teacher ouer aboue premiss shoulde restore vnto theyr first state fredome suche persones semed bee crushed bruised piece satan kyndes euilles teacher finally declare open preachyng true iubilee lorde come tyme lyke bee hertely wished al creature euen moste ardent myndes bee accepted enbraced people without excepcion moses gaue tradicion sabboth dayes whiche commaunded euery seuenth daye rest sloumbreyng vnclenly occupacions gaue also tradicion sabboth yeares whiche enioyned euery seuenth yere bee rested tillyng yearth neyther thyng bee requyred thesame sauyng woulde bryng forth owne selfe gaue ferthermore tradicion yere called restorer fyrste state libertie vnto whiche propertie thyng geuen name iubilee emong hebrewes yere iubilee came course agayne vii tymes seuen yeares euermore fyftieth seuen tymes seuen maketh xix yere iubilee moste hertely bee wished israelite eyther bonde seruice el debte thyng oppressed like sabboth moses refreshed mennes body onely beeyng reste quiete seueth yere onely prouide resting yearth tillage nowe shewed vnto knowelage perpetuall sabboth neuer bee interrupted broken whiche mynde soule beyng free vacant troublous vnquietnesse eiuil desyres ought wholly attede quiet applying exercise heauenly thynges pensife earefulnesse prouide altogether yearthly thynges forasmuche loue god manier thyng wantyng yea moreouer iubilee moses helpe others onely israelite gaue neither free deliueraunce ne yet full deliueraunce yea thatsame veray thyng whiche geue exteded ferther bodye enduted shorte tyme yeare lorde dooeth vnto persones whosoeuer endebted deuill synne whosoeuer bee bonde seruauntes subiecte euill spirites whosoeuer ignoraunce trueth blynde whosoeuer bee kyndes naughtinesse farre paste yt vnhable euery good worke vnto suche dooeth iubilee lorde bryng perfecte free remissio deliueraunce libertie sight health complete perfeccion euery behalfe muche therfore ought ye prompt zeles endeuoures enbrace offered thyng ye haue hearde promised prophecie ye maye ye wyl dede selfe fynde true ye haue hearde eares ye haue nede readie desyrefull hertes yf ye wyll bee apte receyue great blissefulnesse euen highest thing possibly maye bee wherof free offre made vnto woe vnto shall despyse bountifull gracious goodnesse god wyllingly offreing selfe vnto yeare iubilee freelye offreyng deliueraunce saluacion vnto suche mekenes submission readinesse beleuyng shewe theimselfe wylling bee taught apte receyue healing yeare iubilee must succede folowe yeare retribucio redresse shal adiudge ministre euerlastyng peynes hell vnto suche shall haue refused goodnesse god woordes dyd lorde iesus humble sobre manier signifie hymselfe bee thesame man prophecie esaie make promysse whereas mooste parte belieued sayed place prophete concerne messias concerne esaie hymselfe whan iesus baptisyng holye ghoste slydyng downe heauen visible likenesse doue lighting vpo heade people wete thissame euen veraye whome prophecie ment enoyntyng betokeneth certayne mylde ientill still thyng nothyng ientill supple caulme oile wherof euen name messias geuen greke christon latine vnctum englyshe enoynted preachyng iohn sharpe soure full threatyng christe mildenesse courteous familiaritie beneficial good turnes continually moue praye people receyue saluacion whan iesus dyd moste highe auctoritie lesse myldenesse speake treate premiss many great estimacion therforeand albate hi witnesse wondered ye gracious woordes whiche proceded mouthe merueyled talke beyng veray ferre vnlyke talke pharisee wete caulme mylde meke amiable poudred muche grace hauyng spice haultnes pryde poynte soure looke presumpteous takyng vpon hym yet neuerthelesse suche sorte conteyned condigne auctoritie woordes pharisee issued foorth hearte corrupted ambicion auarice enuie many naughtye affeccions moste tymes smacke spryng gushed wordes whiche proceded mouthe iesus welled foorth brest replenished heauenly spirite god onely amiable swete vnto good folkes also piththy effectuall towarde saluacion yet neuerthelesse emong nazareans whose myndes opinion meanesse iesus kynred familie came outwarde acceptacion worlde made auctoritie heauenlye doctrine bee lesse regarded consideracion euery one dyd yet beleue hym bee sonne ioseph marie slender habilitie substaunce aswell ioseph marie bothe also theyr aliaunce kynsfolkes vnknowen consideracion also hadde seen hym many yeares euen chyldehood learned noue schoole sauyng onelye father occupacion carpentrie ne tyme haunted schooles pharisee experte lawiers taughte misteries holye scripture bookes muche highe solemnitie haultenesse countinaunce muche meruayle soodaynly gotten great vertue power whiche fore shewed foorth city diuerse soondrye myracles mused gotten wondrefull knowlage diuinitie bookes wondred gotten great eloquence speake sorte auctoritie yet vnderstad muche power effecte enoyntyng spirite god doctrine phariseis estemyng hym therefore thynges whiche knew fleshe sayed felowe sonne ioseph carpenter knewe heauenly father wrought soonne iesus wrought ferre fewer miracle citie nazareth shewed city certayne kynsfolkes beeyng halfe fume indignacion therewith detracted reproued hym thoughe eyther power ready serue hym euery el oughed owne kynsfolkes suche despite woulde shewe myracles emong theim wherin thei hunted certayne worldely prayse glorye theimselues warde suche matierwhatsoeuer haue heard doen capernaum c glory wherof altogether due vnto god vngodly murmuryng persones iesus rebuke alaie suche sayinges folowe ye haue hearde sayeth haue elswhere emong others healed kyndes disease verayly ye wyll saye vnto woont saied common prouerbe thou phisicion heale thine owne selfe haue heard saye thou haste wrought certayne woondrefull thynges aboue course nature citie capernaum thou straungier hauyng nere bloud kinred vnto thee conuenient thou shouldest bee beneficiall moste chiefly thyne owne kynsfolkes thou dooest thy countreymen kynsfolkesno prophet accepted owne countraye thesame thou dooest vnto thine owne selfe therfore vertue power thyne bee appropriate vnto thee contynuall thee whatsoeuer thou haste dooen emong capernaites straungiers euen lykewyse emong thyne owne kynsfolkes beeyng moste nere vnto thee doe thyne owne countrey unto wieked murmoure theyr hertes beeyng disclosed vttreed lord aunswered manier dede phisician readye heale disease creature anye partie shewe hymself apte healed phisician neuer well learned ne neuer well willyng good hable helpe cure sicke cast medicine away offred mistruste feythful phisician dede affeccio moste common sorte men esteme phisician muche come man vnknowen ferre coutrey region suche place doeth fynde truste affiaunce bee put hym estemed none thyng arte name phisician dede touchyng cu nyng whiche carryeth hym euer goeth time euery place one manier manne fyndeth men full mystrustyng contemners cannot cunnyng doe good many hath suche place lesse wyll el power owne behalf party whome mynde wyll relieue wyll none benefite healthe despite grutche beare theyr owne selfes thesame chaunceth phisicians dooeth muche chaunce vnto prophetes cunnyng phisicians dooeth ofte tymes helpe yea whether prophete dooeth moste chiefly cure soules hath lying power though woulde helpe suche refuse saluacion whan offered refuse doeth whosoeuer mystrusteth many none cause mystruste prophetes esteme thesame power god werkyng weakenesse body whiche see lyke mortall men turne ye story olde prophetes ouer ouer ye shall finde bee thyng moste vndoubted certayntie nowe saye vnto whiche neuer yet anye prophete price within natiue countrey emong owne kynsfolkes lesse hable willyng dooe good theyr owne frendes straungiers foreine persones vnbeliefe kynsfolkes maketh theim vnwoorthie suche benefite goddes hande tell frueth many wedowes israell dayes helias wha heauen shut three yeres sixe monethes whan great famishement throughout lande vnto none theim helias sent sauyng sarepta besydes sydo vnto woman awedowe many lepres wer israel tyme heliseus prophet none clensed sauyng naaman syrian benefites god geuen respecte kynred good herte man cousynage fleashe promptnesse spirite nacion feyth affirme vnto matter oute doubte tyme whyle helias lyuyng whan continuall space three yeres full six monethes hadde fallen downe rayne heauen baraynnesse yearth reaso therof oppressed quarter great famine many wydowes nacion israelite yet sayed prophete beeyng nere poynte peryshe hounger sent one bee fedde vnto wedowe sarephtha countreye sydon rather sent wedowes hierusalem multiplye steane mealeand manye lepres weri israel tyme heliseus iiii reg v pitcher oyle shewe notable miracle one restoryng dead chylde vnto lyfe agayne forsothe emong israelite one wedowes coulde egually matche compare sincere feyth affiaunce god sayd heathen barbarous woman beeyng desyred gaue hym water readilye withoute styckyng whan promysed steane meale pitcher oyle waste beleued made hym pottage bydden dooe forsothe mynde herte israelite woman beeyng israelite ferre good herte regarded estemed afore god bloud kynred muche lyke thyng befall tyme heliseus prophet succeded helias doubt emong israelite manye lepres whiche found great misse bodely health neuer one made cleane heliseus naaman syria beyng time ydolatre aliene borne nacion israelite could prophet haue hable doe thesame emong coutrey folke hable dooe aliene heathen man trowe ye quicke readie dooe good suche wer goddes religio yet borne foreyne countrey men owne people nacion feith man deserued benefite goddes hande sure feith god hable true seruauntes dooe great thyng whan bidden plounge hymselfe seuen tymes fluime iordan obeyed yf lepres israell thesame feith eue haue felt beneficiall goodnesse god synagogue whan hearde th nges wer filled wrathe arose vp thrust hym citie led hym euen edge hyll whereon citie builte might cast hym headlong departed wet waye euen middes whan iesus sayinges plainly without flaterie colour laid countreymen nazareth theyr vnbelefe respect wherof thei made themselues vnworthie goddes benefites vnder one geue halfe significacion thende would free gift power ghospell shoulde passe awaye remoue onely countreymen nazareth beyng vnbeleuers woulde turne feith also iewes general vnto wedow sydo saie ye churche gentile naaman syria yt saie gentile afore tyme wer idolater wurshippers false goddes enuious grutching murmour ye nazareas turned manifest indignacion fuming ye hertes euery one brought ferre oute pacience bolde speake suche wordes open synagogue preferring people sydon syria israelite whereas saied people wer vtterly abhorred detested emog iewes yt making plain vprore sedicion droue hym banished hym citie nazareth beyng therwith satisfied brought hym euen brough edge mountaine vpon whiche thesame citie buylded verylye myndyng purposyng tumble hym euen headlong vnnaturall countreyme fauour yt waueryng mynded people great madnesse sodainly chaunged doen meruaile saluacio cometh wheras themselues banishe away worker geuer saluacio thei disdeyne haue godly beliefulnesse heathe praised yet emende owne wicked vnbelief verai eagrely desire haue phisician yet cannot abide swallow downe ye holsome pille veritie beeyng bittur theyr mouthes thei wyl nedes haue body made hole nothing regarding ye disease minde medicine solle beyng sicke true plaine speakyng whiche true thought sharpe byting haue mynde pleasaut flatreyng poiso though worke death bitter medicine yt might bring health require haue miracle shewed emog vainglorie world christ neuer shewed health men goddes glorie neither cuming world purposely heale bodyes within short space decaie perishe cure soules liue euer cosider peruersely ouerthwartely ye nazareas wurshipped serued god ye sabboth day rekoned thyng al godsforbod yt day sewe seame shooe whan countreyman theyr owne ientilly calleth vnto saluacio thei accoupte wicked dede sediciously al theyr force driue place might breake necke forsouth sata busie cure instrumentes accomplishe thyng fore owne selfe tempted iesus vnto founde bailliffes seruauntes gracelesse myscheuous satan part durst presume ferther moue iesus would caste hymself downe headlong high pinnacle temple felowes swarmyng together plumpe hale drawe stiepe edge high mountayne muche lyeth toumble downe place countreyman tounesman thesame citie themselues beyng knowen emog one doen good wicked wyll asmuche euer hable wieked suche power tyme yet come whiche expedient v iesus shoulde dye dede come suffre death v till owne tyme heauenlye father appoynted anye kynde death whiche specially chosen euerye sabboth like hym purpose sabboth easter whiche seemely lambe redeme world offreed vp sacrifice neither stiepe edge rocke moutaine purpose high exalting vp crosse lucifer toumbled headlong heauen pryde therefore buisie prouoker others sodayne ruine downfallyng sonne god disposicion leat himselfe fayre sobrely yearth ende beyng hoighced vp crosse mighte drawe vp thynges vnto hymselfe might exaumple hymselfe lift vp heauen humilitie prince head captayne pride laboured toumble headlong hell presumpcion vnbelief neither nazareth place conuenient executing sacrifice hierusale iesus therefore suffred hymselfe bee drieuen oute citie auoide bestowing preaching vpon people vnworthie self thyng taughte apostle also bee toubled rocke headlong would suffre pleased hym willingly owne accorde suffre death turned hymselfe byrde serpentebut departed c lykenesse made sleyght iuglyng legerdemayn thetent escape wtout hurt passed fayre softely middes whiche tofore violently haled pulled hym cast hym headlong wherin openly declared ye malice haue power hym vnlesse would willyngly owne accorde delyuer hymselfe taken putte death onelye kynde auegement moste mercifull lorde iesus cotented forsake leaue perfeictlye knewe vncurable otherwise pleased hym laye power eue mere becke haue drieuen breakyng theyr neckes haled thither thesame purpose desyre rather haue lyue yt emedyng themself co tinuaunce tyme might malefactours made innocent caste awaye wurste whan offender oftetymes yf men bee restreigned theyr benefite maie haue theyr willes wha would readye haue maketh better fele misse lacke hym readye good certes myracle might haue moued aswel reuerence acknowelage power vertue whereof conspiryng furious multitude hable thyng dooe also loue goodnesse hym attempted vttermoste mischiefe agaynst laye theyr power yet rather willyng reserue tyme repentaunce cast awaye wurste eternall punishemente pand came capernaum citie galilee taughte sabboth dayes wer ouned trin p achyng power synagogue manne whiche vnclene spirite deuill cryed loude voyce saying lear alone hast thou doe v thou iesus nazareth art thou come destroye v knowe thee thou art euen holy god iesus rebuked hym saying holde thy peace come hym whan deuill hadde throwen hym middes came hym hurte hym feare came spake emong themselues saying manier thyng auctoritie power commaundeth soule spirites come fame hym spred abrode throughout euery place countreye round iesus therfore forsakyng proude citie nazareth beeyng rebellious agaynst doctrine ghospell came downe toke waye toward citie galilee called capernaum beeyng citie great rychesse therfore drouned r ott u excesse al vesuptuousnesse ambicion pryde vice whiche customably compaynyons rychesse volupteous sensuall liuing vsed familiaritie carnall conuersacion emong whiche familiaritie hath euermore breder contepte hath vsed make menes autoritie lesse regarded wherfore also capernaum custome elswhere wente teple vpon sabboth daye preached wickednesse nazareans beyng great goen wilfully murdre hym best frende could weighe hym beyng offended haynous dede mischief would forsake coutrey ye iewes foorth putte ouer gyft gospel vnto gentile fulfylled dede thesame thyng whiche afterwarde taughte wordes disciple whiche whan wer drieuen one citie flee vnto another settyng theyr mynde ne deuisyng auenge theyr iniurye sette foorth gospell ferther ferther suche wyse malice droue awaye theyr tounes myght profite expedicion settyng forewarde profession ghospell capernaites although wer men geuen worldly affaire muche abhorred maniers heathen emong whome reason trade bying sellyng one vsed often conuersaunt found muche ientil honeste taking interpretyng woordes dooynges founde owne countreymen nazareansthey astouned doctrine neuerthelesse well knowen throughly tryed continual perfeccion lyfe ought haue derely beloued caperna e greatlye woondred doctryne iesus consyderyng washe miengled geare peynted glossed doctrine pharisee washynges truely paying tithe mynt rue castyng gyftes offryng boxe god suche lyke thyngesfor preachyng power whiche rather conteined supersticion vertuous doctrine whiche layed vpon simple people mayteyne glorye luc e pharisee whereas theimselues taughte thynges kept muche chief commaundementes lawe doctrine iesus found substaunciall full auctoritie first whatsoeuer taught moste certaine trueth also agreable naturall reason secondarily selfe muche materiall vnto true godlynesse eternall saluacion ferthermore singular perfeccion liuyng caused doctryne bee regarded accordingly ouer besydes al many miracle wrought shewed hym suche power vertue hadde neuer vsed ne seen whiche euidently declared doctrine taught bee god mannes spirite lorde iesus myracles lucre vaine glory firste succoured wofull necessity suche person extreme distresse ende doyng benefites might winne theyr hertie loue secondely miracle tyme shewed bodely iyes ende miracle myght learne beleue thynges whiche though inuisible yet earnestly corporall benefites bee desyred lastely fygure representacion thynges wrought theyr soules sabboth daye people religiously great deuocion rested fro workes forbidden whiche yet theselues euill exauple go iourneye kiendle fyer grynde theyr corne presse theyr wynes otche vp theyr garment beeyng broken seamerent without foorth dede sabboth daye saye daye reste within theyr myndes great trouble vnquyetnesse whiche spirite satan reyse woondrefully tossed vexed theyr myndes dyuerse mocions co e ise pryde wrath auengyng displeasure envie el true sabboth spirite lorde quieteth mynde reste vicious inordinate lustesthere vnclene spir e thing euen presente certain figure theyr sinagogue whiche certayn man whose bodye possessed vnclene deuill exaumple v halfe warning puttyng remembrauce muche miserable piteous case whose myndes possessed eiuils vires yea foule ilfauoured deiuill deiuill vnclene noysome lecherous concupiscence wrathe ambicion gredie desyre moneye enuie hypocrisie deiuils suche others lyke iewes moste parte possessed dwelt synagogue whiche synagogue yet receyued spirite christe vexed many deiuils reygned vice neither hable receyue moste mylde spirite gospell vntyll lorde iesus expulsed droue euill spirite satan helde possession wherefore sayed partie possessed satan beeyng hable abide newe vertue iesu whiche priuely vttered selfe began crye horribly roryngwhat hast thou doe v thou iesus nazareth oh haste thou v thou iesus nazareth art thou come destroye v tyme knowe tormentes abydeth v last daye nowe thy presence tourmenteth vexeth v daye require saluacion thee aske release peyne onelye praye thee delaye deferre vntill neuer felte lyke tormentes presence prophete wherupon vnknowen v thou art doubtlesse thou arte thatsame onely holy god shall conquier vngodlynesse drieue worlde vnclenesse lawe hath holinesse lawe hath clenesse thou arte onely god sanctifyed declared holy heauenly holynesse lorde iesus would suffre hymselfe bee praysed spoken wicked spiriteand iesus rebuked hi would glory prayse bee referred father onely come hym knowyng right well confession deiuill came foorth syncere fayth malicious purpose professeth christe bee iesus sonne god geat hym confesse thesame hymself playnly vtter harmes dooyng selfesame thing mouth man satan temptour hym fore gonne dooe laboured owne persone professeth christe subtile craftie mynde hymselfe might atteyne saluacion myght lette hyndre saluacion others neyther loue caused hym vtter voyce feare punishemente wherfore eiuill malicious vile slaue desperate mynde vnpossible bee recouered grace deserued heare thankes confession holde thy peace thou vnclene spirite departe man tyrannie thou doest possesseand sayed holde thy peace cum hym come saue men whan deiuil throwen hym myddes came hym hurt hym emperiall almightie voyce iesus commaundyng hym departe vnclene spirite whan throwen man vpo yearth vexed hym departed hym harme appered dooen vnto man beyng safe clene delyuered threwe hym euident signe peruerse wyll token sore agaynste mynde forsoke thatsame dwellyng place hurt hym proueth playnly wieked spirites hurt none whiche dooe wholly commit themselues vnto salueour goodnesse one iesus onely strength saue man malice innumerable deiuils destroye hurt thesame men whan labour deliuer mennes body noysome spirites woont take purpose vse possible kindes remedy thynges vertue strength putte awaye eiuill exaumple certayne prayer speciallye prescribed appoynted therefore made certayn woordes apte purpose burnyng frankincense sprincling holy water thinges accustomed certayn herbes hauing vertue propertie expell many kyndes ceremonyes vnlyke feacte sorcerie witchecrafte yet right seldome seen thynges expell eiuill spirite tyme dooe departe leaueth behinde token markes manyfest malice either tearyng awaye membre lymme bodye legge arme el leuyng behynde disease sickenesse vncurable whan people sawe mere worde sharpe commaundement iesus eiuill spirite sodaynly departed manne perfectly healedand feare came vpon muche leste marke signe could eiuill remayned sawe doen astouned began wondre thus talked emong themselues iesus straunge case see suche thyng doen lyke hath reade ne herde hath vnclene spirites vnder rewle obeysaunce commaundeth commaundementes suche mightie power autoritie byandby acknowleagyng hym power themselues dooe forsake man suche wyse bee goen hym perfect health returneth place sickenesse thus sight woondrefull miracle caused name fame iesus bruited spred abrode acte onely citee eapernaum also throughoute regionand fame sored abrode euen synagogue iewes whiche lackyng spirite christe made vprore stiere spirite satan trueth ghospell throughe inspiracion whiche satan nazareans attempted murdre saluaour aforesayde pand whan arysen vp come synagogue entred symons house symons mother lawe taken great feure made intercessio hym stoode ouer rebuked feure feute lefte immediately arose ministred vnto departed synagogue entred house symon name peter afterward geuen whose mother lawe holden veray sharpe feure woman kinsfolke alliaunce besought iesus vndesired expul ed drieuen deiuill man aforesayed synagogue woulde bee good desire great manye frendes heale woman feure rather forasmuche allyaunce affinitie peter disciple owne whome entierly fauoured iesus shewe declare hymselfe readye dooe good bothe priuatelye openlye aswell acquaintaunce straungiers vnto hym yea vnto age young olde sex men woman state degree ryche poore came nighe standyng harde woman threafued feureand immediatlye arose ministred vnto commaundyng departe foorthwith lordes comaundemente sickenesse wente quite awaye strength lustinesse bodye returned agayne littell littell commonly dooeth whiche cured handes phisicians sickenesse beeyng soodainelye drieuen awaye whole strength lustinesse perfect health cherefulnesse moode suche wyse restored arisyng fro bedde lyen sicke dressed supper iesus disciple serued whyle sate table pwhan sunne downe sycke taken diuerse disease broughte vnto hym layed handes euerye one healed deuils also came many cry saying thou arte christe sonne god rebuked suffred speake knewe christe readye lorde dooe good helpe men neuer muche laye excuse importunitie vnseasonablenes tyme simple mere fayth truste hym requyred helpe succour matier beyng openly blowen abrode throughout whole citie many sicke folkes theyr house whiche troubled disease diuerse sortes broughte sicke folkes doore house iesus lodged beeyng mooste entell salueour neyther layed excuse nowe people within doores oughte reason haue quiete reposyng hymselfe labour ne night therfore vnseasonable tyme suche doynges vpon euer brought vnto himand layed hys handes euery one layed hades euermore geuers health helpe kyndes disease bothe easily freely put awaye personnes one mynded exaumple teache men suche wyll free disease mindes must flee none iesus onely euermore readie freely pardone forgeue grieuous soeuer offense committed hath sincere fayth turne wholly vnto hym beeyng onely auctour true saluacion kynde syckensse incurable rooted sticke man deadly touche commaundemente maye bee healed waye set foorth paterne exaumple bishop pastoures curate succede christes place myldenesse oughte receyue synners desyrous emende theyr vyce synfulnesse yf lorde iesus muche one litle prient marke either sickenesse vice woulde neuer turne awaye face disease neuer ougly lothely see would receiue would touche handle also would heale muche dooeth beseme persones thesame benignitie iesus hath tofore pourged sickenesse mynde yet neuerthel sse meane tyme free faultes especially forasmuche take awaye sickenesse minister gifte commeth heauen haue nothyng office exortyng stieryng others aske desyre health bringyng vnto mightye phisician mouyng thesame mercie theyr intercession vouchesalue touche theyr hertes myndes handes heale onely syckenesse fledde commaundement voyce touchyng handesand deiuil also came many also deuils beeyng hable abyde godly power iesus ere commaunded wy lyngly fled bodyes myserable creature long tyme tofore possessed great piece felicitie blisse come nere vnto iesus nere towardes hym dooeth persone drawe come myslikyng hymself desyrous fayn made better whiche conceyueth assured confidence feyth synnes neuer haynous grieuous yet vnspeakeable mercie iesus freely clerely forgeuen bee bodyes diuerse kiendes sickenesse neuer whir fewer disease soule yea bothe perillous except perchaunce ye thynke fewer kyndes intemperancie mysgouernaunce kyndes feuers bee thyng ieopardie daungier bodye boyle feuer perillous soule rage renne mad lecherous lustes emong disease bodye foule lothely see man next frendes cannot abyde come nere hym exaumple bee eaten lyce agayn contagious infectiue man shal hee ieoperdye come nere vnto suche haue leprie especial pestilence albeit trueth speake fewe sickenesses disease bee one waye infectiue agayne disease either strong sore vpon bodye el suche long continuaunce ouercome passe cunnyng cure phisicians power oure phisician great sickenesse whose greatnesse aboue bee compared vnto purenesse maye bee stayned sinnes eiuils anye mortall creature greater mercie lothe abhorre mannes ouglye fylthynesse receiueth men hym one moste singulare goodnesse toucheth men hymselfe beeyng moste pureste healeth menne one moste mightyest disease bodye phisicians lesse hable dooe cure vpon sickness whiche corrupte tabernacle mynde reason exaumple fransie forgetful slepie disease called phisicians letharge albeeit dede men possessed deiuils incurable either bothe wicked spirites beeyng stronger mannes nature dooe tosse turmoyle bothe theyr soules bodyes vexe theyr pleasure neyther custome bryng suche vnto phisicians men lefte heauenly helpe god greate strength power eiuill euen beholde pieteous matier peraduenture seme miserable although dede wretched caitifes desyre reignyng bearyng rewle ouer others drawen poisonyng witchecraftes nigromancie sleaghing yea nerest theyr kynne sacrilege mo dedes mischief hainous suche persones also wrathe carryeth violently right waye spoylyng inculpable poore men murdre innocentes whiche haue nothyng deserued makyng warre burnyng settyng whole worlde rose howe lytle porcion eiuell partie aboue sayed whose bodye deuill possessed dooeth suffreth compared great fury suche one vexed great confusion prince bryngeth whole worlde sette rage spirite tyrannie violent force sicknesse mischiefe ouercommeth mannes power cure spirite christe stronger mynde man haue conceyued cannot bee chosen vncleane spirites would possesse bee neuer manye muste auoide bee goen shall bee brought passe shall sodaynly made tyraunt father cruell man moste mercifull gouernour poller people relieuer succourer oppressedwhan sunne downe yt furious warriour ensewer peace briber extorcioner liberall dooer geuer benefites glorious crakyng thraso sobre prudente prynce great experience onely leat bee brought iesus bee ledde awaye worlde euen aboute goyng downe sunne small noumbre came vnto symons house saye vnto churche congregacion christe gospell preached power christes spirite vnclene spirites came openly protestyng one come whose goodnesse mightier malice whan departed menne cryed sayed thou arte veraye sonne god yet tyme come whan lorde woulde knowen vnto menne messias veraye sonne god thoughe mynded yet woulde vnclene spirites bee troumpettes glorye eyther theyr confession simple good purpose subtile craftie ieopardie lest yf theyr witnesse shoulde haue anye weyght estimacion great matier shoulde haue credited beleued thynges wherin woulde theyr delyte felicitie beguile men theyr false lye satan veray dede forasmuche nature lying marchaunte althoughe sometyme speaketh truthe yet dooeth onely ende deceyue men thereby another time waye doubtelesse crafte haue men learned hym intermiengle godly thynges emong vngodly true thynges false puttyng deadlye poyson holsome meates maye allure mo men damnacion wherfore iesus teachyng v becommeth suche menne haue consecrated themselues vnto holy ghoste haue thyng dooe wieked spirites rebuked theyr clamouryng cry sore threatnynges added put silence felte woondrefull strength vertue procede therof suspected messias sonne god euen thesame promised pa soone daye departed went deserte place people sought came hym kept hym departe theim sayed vnto theim must preache kyngdome god city also therfore sent preached synagogue galilee iesus truely come moste speciall pourpose heale bodyes cure soules one citie onelye countreyes worlde whan shewyng many soondrye myracles holsome doctrine life well begon castyng abrode sede euangelicall philosophie veray erely euen breake daye multitude shoulde eftsons flocke thither hym people whiche came gase woondre myracles seke bodely healthe seke saluacion theyr soules leaft capernaum withdrewe hymselfe departyng wyldernesse place solitarie one woulde fayne bee awaye great preasse throng people vaynly resortyng vnto hym teachyng v lesson waye miracle bee wrought vayne oftentacion braggue selues yet wyll pleasure people theyr fansies appetite ferre onelye maye auayle growe mennes saluacion goddes glorye suspicion vaynglorye euermore tymes bee vttrely avoyded healed al men exaumple goodnesse beeyng prompt readye shewed vnto al men yt priuely withdrewe himselfe exaumple humilitee mekenesse fleeyng vayn prayses vauntyng hymselfand kept hi shoulde departe wha brode daye light resorted thither agayne dooen great noumbre sortes people allured greatnesse thynges dooen daye whan knewe iesus goen many byanby folowed hym whan found hym entreacted hym tarye leaue citie take house thentente might bee continuall dweller emongest mynde affeccion towardes iesus dede vngodly yet muche blessed whiche suffre lorde iesus departe litle house hertes whan addresseth goen doe muche prayer cal backe agayne notwithstanding presente season dispensacion state fleshe whiche iesus taken require often manye tymes chaungeyng place might occasion daye daie sprede ferther ferther abrode preachyng ghosell beeyng yet newe doctrine late cummen vp sedesower seute worlde sowe caste abrode place doctrine ghospell although al place like prosperously come vp proue growyng wherefore theim willyngly desyred hym returne againe capernaum enhabite himselfe ientilly coldely made aunswere benefite hath freely bestowed vpon take well woorth dooe mislike entreteynement harbrough ne despise iourner emong must necessitie preache kyngdome god city haue dooen truely father hath sent ende purpose preache one citie onely shoulde call bid men felowshyp brotherhood heauenlye kyngdome thesame iesus nowe himselfe taught afterward disciple also dooefor therfore sent whiche shoulde trauaile ouer ouer whole yearth teache nacions iourneyng place place disease ficlenesse vnstablenesse earnest affeccion good vnto men flitte place place poynte lightnesse man euident signe charitee suche folowe steppe apostle ought haue yea place doctrine ghospell riefe enough yet good watching shepehearde leaue walke fro round cure one carefull flocke committed charge custodie ende maye call againe shepe whiche goen astraye heale scabbie sicke deliuer daungier woulfe see curyng torne wouded coumfort cherishe good kepyng tendre weake made pastours heardemen see one two householdes mo continually watche behoufe excuse thus made capernaites therewith satisfyed iesus went one another village city tounes galile preachyng accustomed woont synagogue myracies whiche many tymes often wrought purchasyng credite vnto doctrine emong iewes harde herted without myracles coulde beleue nothyng fifth chapiter came passe people pressed vpon hym heare woorde god stoode lake genezareth sawe twoo shyppes stand lake syde fisherman gon theim washyng theyr nettes entred one shippes perteyned simon prayed hym woulde thrust oute litell lande sate taught people shyppe forasmuche fame iesus daylye bruited abrode emong alfolkes great resorte people sekyng vnto hym bee emongst theim leate theim haue free accesse vnto hym synagogue stretes tounes enoughe whatsoeuer place lorde tyme withdrewe hymselfe thither would greate multitude bothe menne woman one emong byandby come rennyng maignie desier bodely healthe occasioned doe good noumbre straungenesse miracle moue veraye manye vertue power heauenly doctrine drawe vnto desertnesse countrey lying waste saluage nothyng feare theim commyng hym peynefull climing mountaynes nothing discourage shame forceable breakyng mannes house coulde kepe theim hym case occasio kept hymselfe secrete within doores short tale make come last great pooles syde yet whan iesus addressed hym take bote coulde fynde theyr hertes leaue hym neither gathered hym flockes thei letted shouldring ne thrustyng geate forbare breake par orce place haged styll hym woulde awaye spared manier beare hym afore theim importune pressyng hym frende theophilus wyse open iyes thy mynde ende thou mayest recityng thing dooen fleashe saye theim yet perfeictelye knowe spirite veray playnely see liuely representacion churche fyrste sprong vphe stoode lake genezareth also grewe tyme passyng great noumbre iesus standyng shore euen harde poole called genezareth whiche poole shooteth foorth great waye bothe length bredth reason muche wynde ariseth poole selfe laboureth fro veraye often many rough sourges hebrues doe ofte tymes call name sea semed theyr thought mynded take bote goen vnrewly multitude flockyng hym euermore veray hole hym importune throng pressed still vpon hym faynnesse heare woorde god mouth phariseis talke preachyng great manye euen already cloyed withall wetye sauoured altogether carnallye worldelye nothyng el importune facion people didde nothyng displease moste meke pacient lorde iesus one compelled beyng narowe streyght one syde thicke presse people made importune thrustyng syde water manier euen vpon hym seeyng place commodious one preache ghospel neither people thrustyng stil fro bearyng forward one others necke coulde well fynde sute footyng stand quiete dounhill place voyce souneth lowe place commeth fewer noumbre yea moreouer conueniente man whyle teacheth gospell maye stande quiete safe pestreaunce peopleand saw two dippes stand lane syde cloustreyng throngyng together auenture withdraweth hymselfe place somewhat quiete euen god would lying thesame shore twoo fisherbores fyshermen selfes beeyng goen oute botes washyng theyr nettes haue readinesse nexte fishyng tyme iesus espyed fisher botes entred one symon peter bote prayed launche litle lande doen whan meanes somewhat remoued pestreous throngyng multitude sate hym downe quietlye oute bote doctours chayre taught people stadyng shore lorde afore called fisher office preachyng ghospelland sate downe taughte people oute shyp euen iesus nowe oute bote fishe men poole worlde wauyng vp downe soondrye troublous mocions thynges simon shippe churche beyng first gathered iewes whiche churche simon peter afterwarde instituted chiefe spyrituall ministre worde simon saye englyshe obedient iewes thei required haue woondres shewed putte affiaunce hope saluacion workes lawe philosophters side naturall reason argumentes mannes brayne holde great disputacions thyng called theyr terme sumo bonum yf ye shoulde saye englyshe highest moste perfecte good thyng could bee thereby measure esteme felicitie man whiche call heauens blisse whereas doctrine ghospel promiseth vnto al men saluacion feith feyth kinde obedience obedient persone beyng bydden beleue doeth beleue without stickyng without reasonyng whiche beeyng bydde hope dooeth hope dependyng altogether mere pleasure whose feyth hath yelded hymselfe pwhan leafte speakyng sayed vnto simon launche diepe lette slip nettes make draught symon autish ered sayed vnto maister haue laboured nyght haue taken nothing neuerthelesse thy commaundemente loose foorth nette dooen inclosed greate multitude fish theyr nette brake beckened felowes whiche shippe come helpe came filled shippes sounke agayne thou hast heard theophilus first foundacion cummyng vp churche heare nowe growyng encreace thesame whiche shall co sequently ensue euangelicall fishyng whan euangelicall sermon ended lorde iesus spake vnto simon maister bote saying rowe bote awaye ferther lande haue foorth depth shoote ye foorth nettes abrode take fishe simon accordyng terme woorde name aunswereth wyse mayster nighte long haue laboured fysshyng haue taken nothyng therfore beeing hope take fishe tyme haue washed nette made ready lay vp yet thy bidding wil shoote furth shall parte obediente thy bidding proufe lucke therof shall reste thy handes lorde iesus commaundemente obeyed bote awaye depthe poole nette caste abrode greate coumpasse within whiche euen enwrapped caughte suche greate multitude fysheneuerthelesse thy commaundemente looce foorth nette disciple nette great deale slender burden fyshe dyd breake one botes sufficiente holde draught taken ye bote wer simon felowes made sygnes wordes wer ferre meanes shoulde come theim bote helpe theim dischargyng theyr nette great burden came holpe theim founde myghty great quantitie fyshe botes wer fylled veray full lucky spede one nette insomuch reason ouer laden burden within litle daunger sinkyng thou haste symon fourme image preacher ghospell propre moste speciall office suche one caste abrode nette euangelicall preachyng oute phariseis snare philosophiers sophisticacions directlye oute rewles holy scripture bokes knitte made actes saiynges christ maye enwrappe veray many let escape oute againe world also hath nettes sathan hath fisher owne dooe flatreyng enticementes allure miserable soules men towe theim nette damnacion soe bring laste perishing euer happy blessed soules nette apostle hath wounde draweth vp diepe doungeon synnes errours vnto open aier darkenesse lyght fylthie mudde purer lyfe oute wandreyng affeccions constaunte zeale endeuoure continuall liuyng vpryghtly withoute offence drawen murdremente healthe safety wound would theyr good willes escape case doe escape peryshe euery syde encou paced knottes trueth euangelical acknowlage owne miserable state reioyce drawe ship churche nette preachyng doeth time drawe catche coumpace fyshes soondrye kyndes al party cannot chosen eiuill miengled emong good therfore faulte eiuil nette doeth breake yet doe good fish therefore slippe heritiques doe attempte laboure cutte sunder doctrine ghospel christ euery side fencing turneth deiuelishe attemptates others profityng betteryng porcion vncorrupted lade trouble shyppe theyr troubleous disturbaunce burdenous heauye affeccions world also couetyng returne mudde least shyppe drowneth whiche christe hathe bouchsalued loke vnto although mo onely one churche throughout world yet doeth figure thereof cause conteine two botes shoulde vnderstande churche congregated two people iewes gentile beginning saluacion proceaded fyrst iewes emong dyd peter fyrst men nexte christe caste nette apostolicall preaching one draught plucked vnto christ three thousand menne woman together al sortes whan played fysher catche menne tale people tyme linked together art rhetorike intricate subtilties philosophiers sophisticacions myghty effectuall throughe vertue power holye ghoste tyme caste nette abrode vpon truste strength man biddyng christ onely whose spirite led el net cast vayne onlesse christe sende prosperous lucke mannes castyng lyke iewes fyrst beginning growing vp gentile came ryght plentifull increace vnto insomuch firste caste theyr nettes force constreigned earnestly require helpe theyr felowes afterward reason gentile euery syde violentely breake brotherhood saluacion cummethe ghospell petur iames gaue theyr handes paule barnabas token theyr eguall feloweshyp concernyng affayres ghospell bothe party earnest endeuoure myght laboure fill vp bothe shippes matter well succeded wondred pwhau simon peter sawe thys fell downe iesus knee saiyng lorde goe synfull man astouned draught fish whiche taken soe also iames iohn sonnes zebedee whiche parte er simon iesus sayde vnto simon feare hearefoorth thou shalte catche men broughte shippes lande forsoke folowed hym simon therfore sawe matter goe mannes power casualty onely godly vertue iesus dyd eftsons geue lesson exaumple hymselfe ought bee doen hym preacher apostle doctryne yf laboure preaching doo time luekely come passe althoughe bote hys owne althoughe owne nette caste althoughe himselfe beste manne sette handes drawyng draughtwhan simon sawe fell downe iesus knee yet taketh vnto himselfe thanke therof
