greatnesse lucky spedyng strieke humilitye falleth downe knee iesus putteth ouer vnto whole glory al thissame acte owne parte confesseth hymselfe naught el synner persone vnworthye bet ministre instrumente diuine power maister sayeth neuer afore dooe acknowelage mine owne vnworthinesse whan considre thy hygh maiestie goe thou hence awaye vnworthy thy compaignylorde goe sinful manne albeit desire wyll hym departe oute lordes compaignye enforced petur speake woordes loued iesus singularely aboue others certayne earnest merueilyng power ferre surmountyng power worldly meane neyther simon felowes anye mynde affeccion simon hymselfe certayne vncredible wondreyng dede possessed hertes full whole somuche one theim tooke owne prayse parte doyng thereof acknowelaged euerye one laboure dede lucky spede takyng muche fishe draught onely bidden caste nette manne would bee astouned yf consider preaching fewe men beeyng poore creature byrth degree beyng also priuate persones neither learning yet office within fewe yeres perswaded manye thousandes people settyng cleane aparte affeccions kinsefolkes settyng naughte losse decaye goodes substaunce nothyng regarding threattenynges prynces despisyng al punishementes tormentyng yea finally deathe selfe coulde fynde hertes folowe playne homely doctrine christ beleuing thinges man naturall reason cannot possibly bee proued hopyng suche thynges power strength nature playnely bee despaired bisshope therfore muste duetye bee ready cherefull caste nette may earnestely apply hymselfe winne veray many vnto christ shal looce nette abrode owne glorye bee gayner thereby pleasure appetite prince worldly affeccion pleasure bydding christe commaundeth net caste abrode healthe saluacion theim fished magnifiyng goddes goodnesse none apostle manner fishyng fishyng although executed ministerie seruyce man voice diligente laboure yet whole summe prayse bee referred vnto christe onelye whose luckye settyng fyrste looceth tongue speake whose spirite dooeth put herte speaker saye whose secrete power drawethe vnto hym myndes hearer standyng case maye bee teacher euen due ryght take piece praise vnto himselfe behalf yet poynte safetye referre whole vnto hym withoute whose ayde helpe nothing man attemptethe dooeth succede proue folkes saluacion skill take away himselfe hath geuen skylle enbraied man hath frankely sente hys bounteous largesse muche rather bee contented leate thyng bee thyne owne yf whatsoeuer myght waye haue semed bee thyneand also iames iohn c thou bee mynde shalbe wyll wel contented commoditye profite redounde glory praise suffer geuen god onely case haue luste glory shal safely glorie whan meruaylyng acte iesus made styll continue astouned associate petur takyng fyshe emong coumpaignie iames iohn sonnes zebedee felowes symon fisher crafte whereasand iesus sayd vnto simon feare merueyling vertue power hys godhed durste bolde approche thing nere vnto iesus lorde gaue woordes veray greate coumfort petur whome muche accustomed set foorthe paterne anye thyng would haue bee enpriented hertes al reste thus said simon nothyng thou shouldeste bee afearde thou dooeste acknowelage thyne owne weakenesse experimente thou haste hadde power god power god bee loued bee dreded hable dooe dooethe shewe furthe oppresse weakenesse synners trede vnder foote lifte vp set vprighte nothyng el required thou bee obediente vnto byddynges weigh thy strengthe hable dooe wyll haue dooen nothyng shall come ill forwarde thou put thyne affiaunce thou doeste greately meruaile matter came luckilye passe takyng fishe lyghte matter thyng muche greatter woondre shall prosperouslye goe forwarde thefrom hen foorth thou shalt catche men whan thou shalte beegynne take men thy fishing kynd fishyng haue specially chosen bothe thy felowes enough thys tyme thys fishyng ye haue hytherto vsed henceforth thou shalt apply thyselfe fyll thys bote thyne fyshes thou mayste replenishe churche preacher ghospell lorde spake vnto petur thesame euerye one vnderstande spoken vnto therefore euen oute hande theyr botes beeyng conueighed lande thynges lefte euen behynde wente iesus voide care concernyng thinges corporall theyr whole myndes bente purpose bee fyshers men pand fortuned citie beholde man ful leprosie whan spied iesus fell flat face besought saiyng lorde thou wilt thou canste make cleane stretched furth hande touched saiyng bee thou clene immediatlye leprosie departed charged shoulde tell man goe sayeth shewe thy selfe prieste ffre thy clensing according moses commaunded witnesse vnto noble office fishyng catche menne framed enstruccyons good lesson bee trayned misticall exaumples entente therefore woulde declare vice faulte abhominable ne deadlye forgeuen anye wyll acknowelage disease feyth gospel earnestly call remedy hande heauenlye phisician iesus fortuned certayne citie certayne man right greuously infected impediment leprosiebeholde man ful leprosie c al whole bodye ouer veraye full foule lothely scourue see sorte people suche wyse abhorred emong iewes suche cleane exiled coumpaigniyng others lawe expresse wordes streightly forbidde charge none suche shoulde bee muche touched daughter infeccion woulde immediatly folowe thereby greate deale fouler muche bee abhorred leprosie mynde body iewes whereas themselfes swimmed full theyr skynnes myghte holde many great vice laye inwardlye hydden within skinne yet dyd greatly deteste abhorre ethnikes publicanes persones knowe sinner case happened time talke suche sone came home agayne theyr owne house would make washyng theyr body top toe thoughe taken veraye sore infeccion christes mynde haue disciple ferre presumteous clenesse iewes manne therfore beeyng thus piteously arayed leprosie great good turne sawe iesus acknowelaged vnclenes iudged hymselfe man vnworthie holde vp face looke lorde seeyng bee abhorred lothed men foule ploches leprye beeyng muche ashamed hymself fel postrate groueleyng face spake woordes bothe full humility also assured truste lorde hydde face poynte one acknowelaged owne eiuill prayeth bee made whole poynte one beeyng vndoubted affiaunce goodnes iesus christe beeyng bothe power dooe thynges readilye offreyng selfe vnto creatureslorde yf thou wilt thou canste make clene lorde sayeth knowe soreto bee vncurable physicke man percase man worthye suche benefite thy hande yet neuerthelesse one poynte fully perswaded thou arte hable make clene disease yf thy pleasure thou haste hearde faythfull truste haue thy power restethe thy goodnes bee iudge whether vouchesalue extende hys mercye suche poore felowe plagued extreme affliccyon paste r medy man cure coulde bee fuller confidence towardes lorde whan manne hadde already acknoweleaged power coulde doe yet neuerthelesse iudgemente whether woulde dode benefite remitte wyllynglye vnto hym knewe bee otherwhyles expediente v bee plagued malady disease bodye prosperous successe thynges temporall bee nothyng oure behou eand stretched furthe hys hande iesus beeyng delited perfeicte confidence feyth man muche bee pityed dyd onely remoue hym awaye oute syght also setteth hym feete wheras lay prostrate stretching furth hande touched leper face saiyng thou requireste goodnes bee thou dooeste openlye proteste thy selfe beleue power bee thou clene euen woorde speakyng leprye hadde long tyme bene full al ouer ouer went clene away al body discyples meane whyle learne lesson wise ought turne awaye theyr face persone beeyng intangled neuer enormeous detestable synnes partye acknoweleageyng disease earnestely desyre remedye goodnesse christe perfecte truste receyue health yf lorde onelye none pure manier leprye viciousnesse vouchsalued owne handes touche creature bee abhorred folkes howe muche lesse conuenienteis disciple lordes onely goodnesse hath made clene theyr sinne whiche neyther bee altogether clene offence oute possibilytie fall enormity shoulde thynke foule bestowe theyr diligente cure healing disease others suche nier touchyng dooeth defyle toucher scoureth clenseth partye touched partye touched furthewith made pure nothyng lesse pure toucheth hym lestewyse yf instrument true apostle handes iesus selfe dooeth vouchesalue touche nowe lawe remitteth iudgement discerne whiche l prie whiche vnto persones auenture priestes onely lorde woulde haue miracle bruited abrode rumoure vulgare people onelyeand charged shoulde tell man entente truethe matter might certaynely knowen gaue streight charge vnto partie healed byandby noyse abrode benefite whiche hadde receyued fyrste foremoste according playne ordre lawe resort vnto priest whose iudgement afore condemned lepry disseuered coumpaniyng folkes yf sayeth iesus whan hathe vewed thy bodye shall geue sentence iudgemente thou arte clene manne veray dedeleut xiii offre thy clensing c goe offre thyng moses law appoynteth offred suche haue hadde fortune bee ridde leprie shall vnder one come passe neyther priestes may fynde faulte gaines dooeth decreace vnto lawe haue bene broken contemned whiche come abolishe make perfect othersyde slaundreouslye reproue thys benefite myne eyther deniyng euer thou lepre el iudgeyng thou hast bene made whole thyng self shal euen fyrste woord fully aunswere full leprie ye whiche take vpon skilfulnesse determynyng leprie geue sentence lepre therupon disseuer conuersaunt others othersyde case bee whole haue ye receyued oblacion lawe appoynted limited one beeyng made clene leprie lorde iesus dyd consideracion muche circumstaunces commaunde thissame bee doen myghte bee manifestelye apparente vnto creature one come greater lawe hable without helpe lawe mere touchyng onlye voyce becke head alone hys owne wyll pleasure geue perfect clenesse dydde take awaye vnclenesse olkes whiche woulde offer themselfes throughe feyth bee healed hymselfe stayned infeccion creature whiche moreouer dyd freely helpe folkes whereas priestes dyd without rewarde certayne offreing somuche pronounce theyr sentence concernyng purity clenesse bodye restored anye persone priestes moses institucion neyther dydde sende leprye bodye toke awaye bodye leprye eyther breded bodye orels taken awaye dyd iudge onlye onely iesus taketh awaye kynde disease creature exactyng requiryng none sacrifice playne pure truste hym acknoweleage vertue power godhed whiche hable dooe whatsoeuer wurshyp hym goodnes possible bee expressed woordes also hys mercye whiche woulde fayne haue sinner bee saued paying owne bodye euer bee offred sacrifice synnes theym lorde iesus gaue great charge partye made clene make woordes talkyng bodye happened whereas knewe yt felowe would kepe vnspoken dyd therein ordeyne exaumple disciple hunte seke anye blastes vayneglorie theyr well doynges emong menne none god worketh v shall bee conueniente require prayse bee rewarde thinges shal still noise declare selfes reioyce behalfe neyghboure whome benefite hath happened glorie shall referre geue vnto god litle wyll shall haue take anye parte thereof vnto owne lande glory touching owne behalfes bee muche desirous might men vtterly vnknowen suche benefite god hathe fortuned neighbour beeyng instrumentes therof pattie neither hathe felte beneficiall good turne oughte refette thanke praise therof vnto man hath receiued ought rendre thankes vnto god worker sender vouchsalueth moste bounteously geue vnto men suche highe greate benefites seruauntes yea glorie doeth better successe lucke ensue enneth awaye sekyng auoyde much also mane honour dooeth come whan desired hunted veray dede none true glory renoune verai vertue selfe doeth purchase vnto man beeyng vtterly vnwillyng haue seking al meanes auoid renoune neyther flattery people doeth geue oure ambicious desire dooeth require suche partye selfe hath well deserued doeth acknowlage sincere trueth skylle flattering dooeth owne mere mocion lay lappe pbut much went abrode hym much people came together heare hym healed theyr infirmity kept hym nay wyldernesse gaue hymselfe prayer suche manier wondrefull actes fame iesus ayly renoumed bruited abrode whyle reporte vnto others thyng seen hearde agayne muche lyke whan men deliuer thynges hand one doe talkyng sprede ferther ferther abrode thesame hadde receiued whiche reported fyrste others therefore came flockyng thyther euery syde greate coumpaignies people multipliyng daylye partely piththye doctryne yt healeth disease soules partely whiche wer likely fall sickenesse theyr bodyes myght power iesus vee made whole grosse carnall people doeth rather meruaill take regarde thynges whiche bee seen iye suche thynges seene estemed myghtye great matter mannes acte pure clene skynne restored leprouse persone onely touchyng iesus hande whereas greater godlye benefyte greate oddes thesame iesus hath ministring phisicke euangelicall doctryne put clene away mennes soules feure lecherous concupistence dropsye couetise diuelyshe spirite ambicion deadlye pestilence myndeand gaue selfe prayer nowe iesus myndyng dooyng teache v good woorkes bee dooen neyther braggyng pompe worlde stayge play open sightes shewed yet many ons long together tyll menne cloyed withdrewe himselfe place wildernes beeyng solytarie resorte people gaue himselfe prayer wherein rendred thankes vnto god father benefites whiche dyd moste large aumple wise sende vnto manne sonne suche chaungeyng nowe coumpanye menne preachyng nowe solitarye contemplacion prayer foloweth fyrst yf one certayne season pause dooyng benefites auoideth clotyng werines receyuers reneweth freashe appetite desyre moe secoundarily whoso hath sequestred hymselfe men talkyng god returneth better also hertye cherefull hys office hath tyme rested lorde iesus dyd suche wise temper ordre whole lyfe myndyng shewe v paterne howe liue woulde oftentymes shewe hymselfe bee manne oftentimes agayne woulde shewe veray plaine token godhed truely nothyng dooeth better make teacher ghospell hartye quicke freashe office preachyng nothyng dooeth well sence hym arme hym agaynste corrupcion lyfe dooeth often goyng al coumpany men place solitary ydlenes gamyng sensuall pleasure whych sorte reposyng riche cobbes worlde whan sequestre themselfes resorte men moste parte ar readyng holy scripture bookes pure prayer thankes geuing contemplacion thynges heauenly finally th perfeict clensyng soule yf percase spotte haue caughte throughe liuyng coumpany ye people thynges christ behalf manier nede al minde expresse hymselfe paterne v folowe dayly conuersacion ye pastoure curate emong people doeth oftentimes brede contempt regarded otherside litle good suche one doe continually absenteth hymselfe mennes coumpanies ryght teacher gospell therefore shall shewe head abrode often people shall nede foode euangelicall doctryne often disease soule growyng sore vpon doe require helpe one cure agayne soone haue well fedde helpe hath bene done euils greate mayny lest one side familyaritye maye engendre contempte othersyde muche presence may clotyng let sequestre solitary closette ende holy study booke veraye talkyng god may returne helping neighbour euery one time greater man tymes better man afore pand happened certain day taught sate phariseis doctours law come al townes galile iewry hierusale power lord present heale beholde men brought bed man taken paulseye sought meanes bryng hym lay whan coulde finde side bring presse went vp top house let ye tiling bed middes iesus whan saw fayth sayed vnto manne thy sinnes forgeuen thee lyke sorte veraylye afore expressed dyd lorde iesus returne agayne wildernesse capernaum restored hys presence desyres people beyng nowe made sharpe eager sore longyng euen sittyng certayn priuate house teaching wheresoeuer christe teach th sittyng churche come swarmyng thither nowe basse inferiour sorte people also phariseis swellyng pryde vnder pretence cloke holinesse also doctours moses lawe beeyng muche moued wyth fame iesus hadde purposely come thither ferre place onely townes galile capernaum stoode iewry whiche laye nexte adioynaunte vnto thesame galile also veray city hierusalem whiche hierusalem dyd presumpteously take vpon selfe higheste preemynence godly perfeccionwhiche come al townes galile also wisedome iesus forasmuche fountayne helthe dyd altogether toppe tooe sende nothyng certayn effectuall godlye power healyng man thyng dooe onely cause comyng thys worlde principall parte man dyd good congruence take place bee cured firste woordes healed disease theyr soules therfore first taught dyd sittyng downe lyke one tooke vpon hym iuste cause myght full autority doctour teacher puttyng awaye disease bodye yet remaynyng nexte bee doon whiche euryng bodye thyng open iyes myghte frame perfeicte beliefe suche thynges fruite power also thoughe althyng apparente iye wrought doen soules beholde matter euen readye prepared wherupon exercise shewe hys godlye power euen presence manne possessed wyth disease paulsey l yng bedred hab e stiere caryed thyther fowe menne soore thys disease vpon hym senewes euerye part whole bodye taken withall holden pieteous creature coulde dooe nothyng lye still hys bed none otherwyse carryed aboute corpse deade carkesse albeit veraye nature kynde thys disease besydes furth selfe suche phisicians moste tymes haue homelye spede lucke wrastlyng carryed sicke man hadde greate beliefe confidence iesus put manier doubt iesus knewe kind disease vncurable soone beholde pieteous syght facion thys straunge plague would moued compassion helpe immediatly moste adoe lyke pieteous creature myght come sight iesus suche one nowe already veray nigh poynt made perfectely whole hath forsaken lurckyng corner sinnyng man miserable state dooeth offre hymselfe syght iesus acknowelageyng extreme distresse lookyng iesus moste merciable goodnesse touchyng thys diseased man th let brought hym laye hym iesus feete thicke presse people whiche common set manyand whan thei could fynde c would el make haste saluacion neuerthelesse thatsame poynt matter although stopped hyndred sicke man gettyng iesus yet dyd make great desirefulnes also truste confidence aswell partie paulseye also others carried hym famouslye knowen althoughe god nature propence ready shewe mercye vnto creature yet doeth many time make delay beneficiall goodnesse entent maye sharpen oure desyres also teache v ought leaue nothyng vnattempted vnassaied maye bee deliuered disease soule loueth behalfe see v impo tune importunitye ye woulde say compelled force vnto thesame thyng neuerthelesse veraye owne nature moste enclined dooe therefore marke bolde auenturous parte carrier sycke man played rather partye disease muche importunitie made parforce dooe gotte theyr heauye cariage house roufe syde tilyng pulled awaye let downe sicke man cordes hadde beene windoore euen liyng styll bed emong thickest people directelye feete iesus shamelesse sawcie pranke coulde bee take downe tilyng mannes house tumble suche lothelye sight suche presence behold thicke presse doore woulde geue way pieteous bodye come coulde choose force make roume whan came sliding downe house toppe dooeth moste ientill mylde phisician therewhyle casteth teeth theyr shamelesse facion theyr importunitieand whan sawe c maketh tailyng bitter chidyng preachyng interrupted sight muche lothed abhorred bearer sicke bodye lookyng downe house toppe asked nothyng hym manne selfe paulsey asked nothyng neyther whome great disease taken awaye vse toungue also yet dydde speake mercifull phisician coulde speake power therto neither nede making peticion miserable sight selfe dyd moste earneste wyse make requeste mercy thing bearer dooen dyd euidentely enoughe declare theyr truste haue lordes handes iesus therefore whan hadde throughlye perceyued seene woondrefull affiaunce hym dyd accomplishe vnto loked summe theyr hertes desire partye whiche paulsey myght bee deliuered sickenes body iesus declaring bee godly thing doo thyng bee desired sought oure behalfe bee deliuered disease soule turned hymself sicke man sayed thou man thy sinnes forgeuen thee pand scribe phariseis began thinke saiyng felow whiche speaketh blasphemye forgeue sinnes god onely whan iesus perceiued thoughtes aunswered saied vnto thinke ye hertes whether easier saie thy sinnes forgeuen thee saie arise vp walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgeue sinnes yearth sayed sicke paulsey saie vnto arise take vp thy bed goe vnto thy house immediatly arose vp tooke vp bed whereon lay departed owne house praising god amased nd gaue glory vnto god filled feare saiyng haue seen straunge thinges daye woord plainely souned certayne power perteynyng godhed dyd throughlye moue myndes scribe phariseis beyng menne neuer vnreadye vndisposed forge matter crime againste priestes whose offyce offre sacrifice sinnes dyd theyr owne selues remitte synnes onelye made intercession god meanes prayer would forgeue offence trespaced agaynst iesus withoute brente sacrifice suche priestes dydde offer without prayer bene owne propre autoritie autoritie perpetuall continuauce sayeth thy sinnes forgeuen thee comprehendyng vnder generall name sume corpse sinnes together general wheras priestes dyd procure certayne offence bee pourged meane sacrifice sinnes vniuersally esay thus muche taught onelye god myghte geue remission synnes vnto men manier speaketh mouthe sayed prophete euen veraye dooe wype awaye thy iniquity myne owne sake shall nomore beare thy sinnes remembraunce scribe phariseis thoughe espyed sawe hym playne token power godesai xliid xliiii yet beyng offended infirmytye body whan sawe partely also beyng enuye forge slaundre agaynste beleue hym secrete thoughtes thus dyd speake within theimselfes propertye pharisaicall diuisyng slaundres vnto theyr moste deuilishe wickednesse pretende cloke hygh deuocion towardes god earneste zele tendreyng glory pernicious kynde vngodlinesse dooe felowe thissame say speaketh woordes blasphemye presumyng hym thing appropriate vnto god alone power remitte sinneswhat felow speaketh blasphemy c onelye god lorde iesus declare yt behalf also equality diuine nature made aunswere manier secrete thynkinges theyr heartes wherfore haue ye suche thoughtes youre heartes whether twoo dooe ye iudge easy eyther saye man cloggued wt sinne thy sinnes forgeuen thee el saye vnto thys partye whome ye see haue euerye ioynte hys bodie vnknitte looce one paulseye aryse walke yf ye shall see perfeicte healthe bodye bee restored mere woorde vnto man beeyng hymselfe paste remedye cure beleue ye soule also lyke easinesse restored perfeict health thys ye euidentelye see youre iyes beleue ye thyng bee seene wyth iyesbut th ye may knowe c lette infirmitie thys bodye myne offende veraye actes ye see dooen acknoweleage ye power godhed take ye nowe therefore visible lesson learne sonne manne hath hym perpetuall power appropriate vnto yearth geue full remission synnes vnto creature whyche syncere feythe dooe seke aske hys helpe therewithall sayed scrybes phariseis geuyng good eare vnto hym earnestelye herkenyng sayed partye paulseye saye aryse take vp thy bedde goe home thy house euen immediatly man bene vexed paulsye soone bidden ariseth syghte presence takyng vpon hys shoulder bedde whiche lien sicke wente awaye feete home owne house perfeicte strengthe body suche wise receiued againepraising god afore lying sicke bedde carryed fower men nowe strong enough carrye hys owne bed himselfe awaye goeth perfeict whole man altogether soule body leapyng herte ioye cherefull countenaunce glorifiyng god whose goodnesse bene restored healthe whereas handes man bene hope recoueryand wer filled feare truely people beyng earnestely moued wt straunge sight seen righte greately astouned many praysed god geuen great power vnto man yet demed none ferther thyng iesus knowyng themselfes sinfull naughte theyr owne conscience throughlye taken greate feare forasmuche dyd yet vnderstande christe come veraye purpose caste awaie ne lese suche hadde offended make pure innocente sayed emong themselfes haue thys daye seen thinges woondred suche thynges neyther haue heard time haue bene doen yet haue read people meruaileth fear euen good large steppe forwardnesse towardes helth phariseis grunte murmour haue enuy hym pand wente furth sawe publicane named leuy sitting receipte custome saied vnto folowe leafte rose vp folowed leuy made hym greate feaste owne house greate coumpaignie publicanes sate meate scribe phariseis murmured againste disciple saiyng ye eate drinke publicanes sinner iesus aunswered saied vnto whole nede phisician sicke came call righteous sinner repentaunce iesus whan gon thence preached water syde teachyng v thereby seede euangelical doctryne place withoute excepcion bee sowed passyng caste iye vpon certain publicane called matthewe otherwyse also called name leuy sonne ilpheus leuy sittyng receipte custome thyng dooen blinde chaunce haue caste iye lesse haue chosen hym bee one publicane chose felowshyp brotherhood apostle purposeand sawe publicane called leuy reache seruauntes sorte men reiected profession ghospell forsake trade theyr former naughty lyfe yelde themselues wholly perfect godlinesse iesus sayed therfore vnto leuy folowe voyce iesus thoughe hadde bene one strong charmyng enchauntemente clene chaunged manier man ariseth vp thynges leafte alone behynde euen folowed lorde conuerte manne wholye geuen afore slaundreous trade gettyng gaynes enwrapped manifolde affayres suche vnneath possible get conuerte suche one soodainlye clene contrarye trade miracle muche notable restore sinewes manne hadde lye sicke paulsey veraye poynte euen nowe alreadye greate herte burnyng phariseis iesus vtterlye refusing theym tooke vnto hym publicanes whose company hauyng dooe theym iewes thought themselfes bee defyled made vnclene came thyng besides whiche caused theyr enuye grutche braste furthe matthewe beeyng nowe become disciple christes ordeyned maister great feaste home owne house thither dyd christ vouchsalue come accompanied disciple tyme bydden called also sayed feaste great noumber publicanes matthewe euen companion former tradeand leuy made great feast desirous faine haue folowers new trade cummyng christe scribe phariseis seyng coulde nowe longe kepe wicked murmoure theyr hertes yet durst presume speake lord speake disciple disciple finde matter cauillacio mayster entent turne theyr mindes myght forsake theyr saiyng disciple forasmuch besemeth holy conuersaunte kepe coumpaigny holy wherefore doe ye bothe admitte publicanes sinner open slaudre obloquie worlde haue talke also eate drynke familiarely theyr house doe abhorre haue theyr table youres al one speciall token right dere frendship iesus well vnderstandyng ende purpose diuelishe murmouring phariseis spoken made aunswere vnto disciple behalf wherefore doe ye falsely turne slau dre saieth iesus haue conuersacion publicanes sinner naie veraily besemeth persones sooner kepe coumpaignythey wholenede ye phisicia c sinner emong doeth become phisician conuersaunte emong sicke come none purpose cure soules oppressed bounde disease synne apte bee cured persones beyng openly knowen synners acknowelagyng disease therfore calling phisician others thinke themselfes whole men shewyng poincted shieth iyes worlde vnder counterfeicte pretence ryghteousnesse whereas within foorth vexed grieuous eiuels haue disease great deale vncurable whose sickenesse open bee perceyued forasmuche therefore phisician mete menne beyng thynke themselfes righteous take indignacio kepe coumpaigny seeing whole soules haue nede leache trulye suche righteous verai dede ought haue enuy grutch sinner endeuouryng emende better lyfe doe lesse worthie bee condemned reproued therefore one whole take indignacion phisician visityng sicke persone helpe hym sickenesse concerning cause foule whole himselfe ye enuieth health vnto beeyng sicke himselfe vnholden disease whan may doeth release neyghbour sickenesse thissame aunswere ientle well bee allowed lorde iesus bothe played parte aduocate disciple yet sufficiently armed dampe choke malicious capciousnes phariseis ye scribe also plainly teache said phariseis curteous demeaning hymselfe towardes sinner mercy fauouryng vnrighteousnesse thirdelye dyd couerte woordes yet sharpely rebuke theyr presumpteous takyng vpon dyd great solemne countenaunce despyse persones whereas themselfes euen veraye poynte vncurably wicked enemy god stoode owne conceiptes vpon false countrefaict title holinesse pand saied vnto dooe disciple iohn fast often praie disciple phariseis also thyne eate drinke sayed vnto ye make child wedding faste bridegrome dayes come bridegrome also shall bee taken awaie shall faste day spake also vnto theym similitude man putteth piece newe garmente olde vesture doe breaketh newe piece taken newe agreeth olde man poureth n wine olde bottels dooe newe wine burste bottels renne oute selfe bottels shall peryshe newe wyne muste bee putte newe bottels preserued man also drinketh old wyne strayght waye awaye newe saieth old better one slaunderous querell comethe others necke fyrste arose partely certain bene disciple iohn iohn marching border betwene lawe shoulde afterwarde cease liberty ghospell shortely aryse gaue certaine tradicions dyd vtterly disagree phariseis ordeinaunces whereas christe opinion many thoughte muche inferiour iohn vse disciple sufferaunce tendernesse especially thinges bodily obseruaunces doe aparteyne sorte fastes prayer two thynges moste speciallye phariseis purchase theimselfes fame holines emong people christe though hys owne persone prayed often yet dyd teache hys dysciples praying ought fewe woordes also priuely place secrete neither pricisely require fast yea certain thinges would winke whiche prescripcions lawe partely seeme bee neglected whan dyd meane nother facion frame higher stoute matter whiche dyd speciallye apparteyne euangelicall stoutnesse muche higher poynte stoutenesse botome herte forgeue displeasure wrong dooen vnto v dooe good euen veraye haue harmed v susteyn losse owne lyfe sauyng oure neyghbour forbeare eatyng litle meate tyll towardes nyght humme fewe psalmes toungue phariseis made woonderous muche hygh seruyce might outwardly seen myght bee doen hipocrisie neglectyng meane ica tyng goe suche thyngesand sayde vnto hym disciple iho faste c matter true perfeict vertue dede phariseis beyng felowes shamelesse scribe boldelye presumed chop logike euen lorde hymselfe saiyng vnto cause iohns disciple dooe often time faste great long together prayer thy disciple eate drinke lustes ne lyke sorte seen much prayer thou constauntly allowe holinesse iohn dooeste thou varie institucion ordeinaunce unto surmuised chalenge lorde touched man el aunswered ciuillye nothing impaciently saiyng dooe saye praiyng fasting naught twoo thynges dooe meane time suffer disciple doe lust themselues may facion bring forwarde hygher matter stoutenesse thynges whiche concerne bodye come somewhat nere ceremony lawe traynyng theim somewhat fauour ientilnesse matter perteine soule greate waye streighter sharper thynges ye esteme hyghest degree holinesse seruauntes shall theyr volutary willes readilye dooe yf case shall tyme require dooe ye meane time enuy disciple endes thinges shal shewe whethers institucion iohn shall efficacie vertue iohn hys moste gloriyng protested hymself frende bridegroomes bridegroome selfe veraily co uenient doe familiarly remain stil bridegrome bee conuersaunt spousal chambre reason wouldthe dayes come whan bridegrome also shall take away c thynges ful mirth iocoundnesse shoulde compelled abstinence eatyng drinking yet tendre depende altogether bridegrome hym shall haue anye long tyme emong tyme shall come whan shall depriued spouse beeyng made firme stable shall onely accorde willingly faste also death prieson shall contente goe often charitie shall earnestelye require fastyng selfe neyther good ill therfore faste onely faste dooe greate acte suche accordyng mine ordinaunce sette naught glory worlde passe nothing sensuall pleasure despise ryches esteme affeccions thynges nothing refreine wrath enuy beare true louing hertes theyr yl willers say well speake euill theim praye suche dooe persecute theim finallye sette penye theyr lyfe respecte sauyng theyr brother suche acknowlage dysciples worthie meete presence fleshly bodye dooeth season make theim bee weake whan thys bodye shal bee taken awaye wise may haue whan would whan shall haue diepely receyued spirit ghospell shal theyr priuye giftes grace within theim bee strong vnuanquishable suche persones dooe put prayse ryghteousnesse corporall obseruacions truste theyr owne weorkes founde weake perceiue thynges whiche prepayre seruauntes vnto whoso mistrustyng theyr owne doiynges sette al theyr defence sauegarde vertuous quality mynd vertuous quality shal acknowelage haue receyued man el suche men shall manier aduersitee cause quaile iohns training disciple breaking myne twoo sundrye sortes marke shoote lyke twoo hys myne cannot haue full myxture made theim wyllyng disciple muste altogether spirituall puttyng manyer truste thinges corporall whiche ryghteousnesse phariseis dooeth altogether consiste therefore enioyne disciple whit thinges haue affinity carnall obseruacion lawe leste case shoulde admitte suffre euen neuer litle woulde altogether slyde backe agayn state wil wyse haue theim moste fertheste lorde iesus entente woulde shewe howe greate diuersitye betwene iohn trayned hys disciple accordyng fyrste smatche olde lawe bene nouzeled infancye muche waie dyd breake disciple thynges higher perfeccion put furth similitude thys sorte folowyngno putteth piece newe garmente old man sayethe folyshe case mynded patche vp broken hole hys olde cote woulde bee soe mad sette pece newe clothe cut payer shiers oute newe garmente whiche thing yf shoulde doe double incommodity fyrst formost renteth newe vesture patche vp olde secondarilye newe clothe standyng old garmente agreeth wyll leate ilfauoured syght patching hydden agayne man folish wil put newe muste olde bottels bee kepte yf dooe surelye soe come passe strengthe muste boylyng weorkyng theim wil breake olde bottels soonder shal consequentely folowe double losse bothe bottels shall pertshe also wyne renne therfore dooen leat mixture made thinges agree one leat olde garmente bee botched olde clothe newe garmente leate bee pece olde clothe put leate also newe muste bee put newe bottels bee kepte soe shall come passe bottels shall saued whole wyne know heard thyng make thissame new ghostely doctrine mine acceptable vnto haue nowe long time bene enured olde vneath thyng dooeth lyke persone yf bee contrarye hath long tyme bene accustomed vnto offended first tastyng thyng hath bene vse hym therfore like whiche hath long tyme bene accustomed drynke olde wine first assaiyng delited new muste mysseth tast would haue saith olde better sayeth none cause sauing onely hathe bene vsed soe haue liued theyr dayes afore olde trade iewes carnall constitucions dooe first tasting ghostly doctrine sterte backe desyre haue grosser thinges haue bene vsed vnto wete circumcision holy dayes solemne rite sabbothes difference meates diuersitie vesture feastes hierusalem temple slayne sacrifice oblacious washynges vowes blinde costitucions phariseis thinges mo vnlike vnto premiss thei requyre haue also doe preferre thesame thynges bee greate deale better necessary thynges harte circucised peruerse desyres mynd continually keping holy day worldly vngos ly appliyng selfe breste throughly quieted troubleous vexacions assaultes euill passion spirit abhorryng infeccion al thinges stayneth defoileth puritie mynd soule enuironed besette rounde aboute feyth charitye humilitye purenesse herte euermore temperate refreinyng form euilles mynde alwayes labouryng come heauenly countrey soule euer temple place soiournyng holy goste soule tyme tyme offreeyng selfe acceptable pure sacrifice god soule beyng pure cleane al spot synne feith ghospell soule clene mortified thinges belong thys worlde dedicatyng selfe altogether vnto godly thynges mynde ready diligent obserue thinges doctryne ghospell doeth enioyne require thing requireth forsoothe feithe thyng enioyneth commaundeth charitie thissame verayly newe muste doctryne muste new wyne vessel haue vsed olde soure turned wyne moses law shall wel abide requireth new pure vessel gostlye giftes grace strong made endure substauciall sure holde p vi chapter pit happened principall sabboth day went corne fielde disciple plucked eares corne eate rubbed hades certaine phariseis sayde vnto doe ye whiche lawefull sabboth dayes iesus aunswered sayd haue ye read dauid whan himselfe hungred hym went house god take eate shewe bread gaue also whiche lawful eate priestes onely sayd vnto sonne man lorde also sabboth daie beholde ensued immediatly god woulde haue occasion whereby might playnely made open thing newe wyne whiche olde bottels high holy keping sabboth daye olde wine charitie euer ready occasion helpe neighboure newe wyne happened therfore certayne sabboth day whiche iewes call sabboth secound first secounde principal falling betwene two sabbothes semed haue double holynesse solenitie one thede sabboth aforegoyng begynnyng sabboth nexte folowe happened suche sabboth day iesus goyng hys waye passed fielde corne disciple beeing fortuned houngredhe went ye corne fielde pulled fewe eares corne also rubbed theyr handes eate grayne kinde easemente euerye bodye might woulde commonly take houngre sore vpon muste nedes eate somewhat whiche case veraily whereas charitie gospell woulde owne accorde haue geuen susteynaunce vnto beyng houngrie phariseis beeyng olde bottels require sower verdured wine olde supersticion saying doe ye geare whiche agaynst al god forbode sabboth dayeswhy dooe ye whiche leful doe sabboth day lord agayn playing aduocate disciple aunswered ye professe high knowelage lawe haue ye lestwyse read poyncte dauid like case whan hys coumpainy houngrie like ye se disciple houngrie dauid woulde haue auentured extremitie hungre haue doen disciple doe manne laitee entred temple god thing afearde care consecrate loaues whiche called pane proposition saye loaues proposicyon shewyng foorthe whiche loaues eate playne ordeynaunce leefull p stes onely none persone yet onely auenture breade himselfe alone selfesame loaues fed al coumpainy nothing moued neither reuerence temple ne streight commaundement law forbidding persone doe muche touche saide loaues sauing onely priestes yea thing might priestes selues doe long longer remayning temple execute minister sacres prieste neither thing stare sticke deliuer vnto dauid holye loaues one verayly well vnderstode suche streight obseruaunces first ordeyned destruccion men theyr preseruacion therfore ceasse lese force often certayne greatter cause vrgente necessitie doeth requirethe sonne lorde also sabboth daye whan lorde iesus large declared manye thinges concerning matier last knit vp talke sentence take ye matier certaintie sonne man lorde thinges lorde sabboth firste maker sabboth hath power abrogate sabbothe come geue health vnto al creature letted office reuerence sabboth pand fortuned sabboth also entred synagogue taught man whose right hand dryed vp scribe phariseis watched whether woulde heale sabboth daye myghte fynde howe accuse knew theyr thoughtes sayd man withered hande rise vp stande furth middes arose stode furth sayed iesus vnto aske question whether lawfull sabboth dayes doe good doe euill saue one life destroy behelde al coumpace sayd vnto man stretch furth thy hande hand restored againe whole filled madnesse commoned together emong themselues might doe iesus ensued shortely exaumple also howe greatlye olde bottels abyde newe muste libertie ghospell happened certayne sabboth day entred sinagogue custome dooe taughte thys thyng phariseis could soso away withall thing comon vsage also prescripcion law present place emong manye moe certayne miserable creature much bee pietied carriyng dried vp cleane maymed hande helpe labour wherof bene wont fynde himselfe child wise bene better haue hand loden bearing whan dead al scribe phariseis whose parte duetie bene haue take compassyon man haue spoken vnto iesus healing sayd neuer word stode watching whether woulde restore felowes hande whole agayn vnto knewe mercyfulnesse lorde euery readie helpe creature therof sought occasion surmuise false matter agaynst breaking holy sabboth day restored vnto woefull creature hys hande agayne whiche sabboth lawe forbidden doe worke laboure iesus vnknowyng mattier scribe phariseis dyd thynke caste within themselfes speaketh vnto man dead hande entente might plainly bee seene coumpaignye commaunded hym arise come foorthe middes people therewhether lawfull sabboth day good eiuil c partie ye maye firste woorde perceyue one woorthye benefite iesus dooyng obediente persone arose sighte presence stode euen still shewing syghte extreme missehap iesus turnyng hymselfe scribe phariseis discouer maliciouse imaginacions vnto people demaunding question touched hit theyr conscience throughly home saying woulde hearte learne professe knowlage lawe whether bee leefull helpe neighboure dooyng good turne sabboth daye elles leaue neyghbour destitute succour woe distresse whoe man able helpe whether lawfull saue man lyfe sabboth daye el caste awaye playnely casteth away man lyfe whan lyeth power saue doeth saue whan lorde caste iyes round man would make aunswere sayd vnto man holde furth thy hand immediatly stretched furth hande libertie whiche afore lame shrounken together case could stiere whit great vertue power iesus bidding stretche furth shoulde scribe phariseis case doe miracle euidente coulde bee denyed veray common reason allow godly thing manyer tyme helpe preseruacion men hauing long accustomed olde soureswig moses lawe coulde awaye muste euangelicall charitie wheras actes theyr duetie bene acknowlage power godhead acknowlage autour firste maker lawe turned starke staring madnesse euen hande enter consayll emong themselues commyttyng murder way might destruie iesus bring death ioyly captaynes religion thing lawfull dooe sabboth day wheras mattier conscience geue helth man extreme miserie sabboth daie fortuned day went mountaine praye continued night prayer god assoone daye called disciple chose twelue whome also called apostle simon also named peter andrewe brother iames iohn philip bartholomewe mathewe thomas iames sonne alpheus simon whiche called zelotes iudas iames sonne iudas iscarioth trayt ur lorde iesus eftesons departing city greate resorte people sequestred himselfe went vnto mountayne pray night passe ouer deuoutly praying vnto god teaching v lesson thereby case shall bee willyng beginne thyng whiche woulde fayne haue luckie prosperouse proceding beginne making earneste prayer maye please god handesomelye fauourably sende good ayde spirite vnto thinges goe enter whan brode day lighte called vnto disciple whome perpetual companyons witness thinges whiche wrought pieked certayne nouber special person whome cosideracio named apostle entended send abrode shortelye ambassadoures gospel throughout worlde theyr office nothing el commission fro name said apostle first symon afterwarde name geuen sirians tongue called cephas greke petros latine saxum englysh stone none cause verayly sound constant professio wha people wauering mamering peter voyce thapostles together pronouced sentence iesus ye sone liuing god unto peter andrew brother associate felowe iames iohn philip bartholemewe mathewe thomas iames sonne alphei simon surnamed zelotes iudas sonne iames iudas iscariothe afterward betrayed iesus whome iesus chose vnaduisedly one wist prouydence entente woulde exaumple iudas teache creature horrible mattier abuse fauourable goodnesse oure salueour towarde v yea whole noumber apostle muche one man eyther power rychesse learnyng one eyther pharisee scribe bishop pieked vnlearned rawe grene cunning euerye one ende purpose might poure newe wyne newe bottels came downe stode plaine fielde compaignye disciple great multitude people iewrie hierusalem sea coaste tyre sydon whiche came heare hym bee healed theyr disease vexed foule spirites healed people pressed touche hym went vertue healed apostle thus chosen vnto hym came downe mountayne vntil come certayn plaine able receiue great multitude people suche thynges require purytie moste perfeccion dooen mountayne emong thynges moste hyghe perfeccion deuoute prayer hath firste place next place hath special chosing themwhiche came heare hym c whome despensacion stewarding goddes word committed presente also residue disciple veraye great noumber sortes people besides come thither iewry yea hierusalem selfe also city tyrus sydon lying sea coast hounger hearing gospell preached drawen thither many folkes euen ferre party many hope receiue bodely health semblably allured euery one came iesus deliuered kindes disease impedymentes holden yea also whiche vexed vncleane spirites made whole geare doen hym lightly easily mere woorde bidding restored theyr helth others healed moment sodainly onely touching garmente ware fountayn fulnesse effectual vertue power god proceded hym none otherwise light doth sonne heate fyer brought health vnto persones salueoure come worlde perfeict healyng creature lifted vp iyes vpon disciple sayde blissed ye poore kingdome god immediatly vpon begoonne shewe furth new muste doctrine ghospellblissed bee ye poore wherunto specially chosen certayn number sum stedfast sure sorte new bottels receiue holde blissed ye sayeth iesus haue spice proude hert rather mislike selfes although worldward ye seme bee person abiect refused company yet kingdome god youres whiche greate oddes higher honour royaltie kingdomes world ye see disease drieuen away deuils flee men sinnes clene abolished hath regal estate world compared heauenly hyghnesse kyngdome hygh regalitie thrall vice bee cloggued inordinate desire haue troden vnder feete deiuill hys armie haue ouercomed worlde withal terrours also flattering enticementes belonging thesame men called taken familiaritie brotherhood god bee registred emong inheritours kyngdome heauen blissed ye hounger ye shal bee satisfyed blissed ye men pouertie penurie doe liue houngre thirste contented spare repastes doe despise richesse excessiue fare thys worlde hounger ye haue meate soule whiche woorde god thirste liuely water spirite ghospel ye shall assured sacyated filled restoratiue delicates whiche ye faine haue blissed ye wepe ye shall laugh blissed ye whiche haue owne myndes willes exempted depriued selfes sensuall voluptuousnesse worlde earnest rendreing euangelicall deuocion sette suche thinges meane temporal affliccions enduryng whyle dooe bryng men vnto ioyes life euerlastyng tyme shal come whan thynges beeing clene chaunged contrarie course sorowe shal turned ioye mournyng laughter blissed shall ye bee whan men hate thrust coumpaignie ta lon abhorte name thyng soonne mannes sake reioyce ye daie bee glad beholde towarde great heauen thus father vnto prophetes moste parte people dooe calle suche men happie fortunate vnto whome people sheweth token high fauour lykewyse auaunced honour sache throughe glorious title muche renoumed ye woorde warrantyse shall bee blissed whan men shall haue decision whan shall cast coumpaignies persones bee de ested abhorred whan shall speake manye sore woordes reproche vilanie sake whan shal earnestly endeuour labour either vtterly abolishe name memorie euer el make detestable vnto shal come faulte youres hatred soonne man whose doctrine glorye ye shall preacher dooe ye neuer therefore mislyke yourselfes rather bee ye glad whan suche thynges shall chaunce vnto reioyce ye fauour eiuill men shall dooe according desertes yet plenteouse rewarde well dooynges abydeth heauen shall lye power men abolishe name whiche bee written heauen shall lye theyr woordes reproche despite appale derken youre glorye whiche shal euermore coupled glorye naie contrariewyse shall persecute name fame muche shall make renoumed bee misliked vngodly highest prayse commendacion may ye shal first haue bene thus vsed excellent vertue hath euermore bene hated eiuil persones men present time shal selfesame thing haue forefather dooen tymes paste agaynste holy prophetes none respecte thesame prophetes accordyng god dyd holde theyr tongue speakyng trueth trueth hath eiuil disposed person bene euermore odiouse example sayd prophetes shal ye comforte selues whose name attempted vtterly abolish memory thesame high holy al creature yet neuerthelesse ye beyng assured comforte innocencie perfeict good liuing must haue mynde ne thoughte auenge owne cause shalbe assured escape without smarte ende shall doe vnto though season seeme fortunate flourishing rufflers pleasure welth thys worlde suche differred reserued tormentes whiche neuer shall haue ende woe vnto riche ye haue consolacion therfore woe unto ryche cobbes whiche ye may dooe solace delite mindes treasoures honoures delectable enticementes worlde dooe remember ne thynke erelong come passe vayne felicitie pleasaunce shall taken away thesame shall ensue woefulnesse sorowe neuer haue ende woe vnto full ye shall houngre woe vnto whiche nowe worlde hauing mynde nothing bealies plaie glutton take excesse delicate meates drinkes pampre vp bodie luste necessitie nature though ye borne beastly feedyng onely nothyng el though ye rather mayntayned lyfe purpose eate drinke eate drinke maynteyne lyfe beeyng full paunched gorge vpon gorge haue mynde relieue poore brother perishing famyne though ye borne fede none selues bounde relieue necessitie neighbour woe vnto whan corporal meates drinkes wherwith ye delicately volupteously fede selfes yea bealie gourmaudeth shalbe consumed shall ye houngrie fynde reliefe shall ye wishe ye might happie haue one lytle crummes falleth table god shall ye wishe ye mighte haue one droppe water caste vpon tongue coole mouthe whan ye shall lye burning heate fyer vnquencheable shall ye wyshe ye lyfe houngred ryghteousenesse god whan ye shal se litle poore one plenteously saciate aboundaunce al felicitie glory heauen whome world ye accoumpted miserable muche despised ye saw penurie houngre destitute al reliefe coumfort lacking foode susteynaunce necessarie bodye woe vnto nowe laugh ye shall waille wepe woe vnto doe make much good mirth laughing folkes pleased euen youre owne mindes prosperous luckinesse thinges transitorie men made drounken sweete fortune within litle shorte space thinges turned contrarie ye shall wayle wepe youre plesaunce lasted moment shalbe turned peyne torment euer endure doe vnto men prayse dyd theyr father false propheces take ye high conceyte ne pride selues whan world vpon counterfeicte likenesse happie fortunate doe eyther woordes token shewe themselues reioyce behalfes person knowing true felicitie blisfulnesse whan highly extolle pra e tho thinges abominably wickedly doe geuyng vnto deiulishe persecutyng truethe ghospell name z le towardes lawe affliccion also slaughter good men call deuour seruice doen vnto god false praise shal deliuer vengeaunce god shall make worthie double grieuous punishemente ye haue onely bene ashamed dooyng manye wieked dedes mischiefefor theyr father false prophetes also haue sought laude prayse eiuil doynges shall prayse wicked doynges forefather person lyke manier shewe muche token hygh fauoure long agone false prophetes rebelled agaynste prophetes lorde vtterly stiered vp aswel prince people sleaghing prophetes lorde seke haue vengeauce theyr persecutours yet neyther haue godlye lacked theyr condigne rewarde wieked shall lacke theyr punishmente according ouerlate shall bee suche repent theyr extreme hainous offence presente doe nothyng regarde gener better aduertisement say vnto heare loue enemy doe good vnto hate blisse curse pray wro gfully trouble vnto smiteth thee one cheke offer also hym taketh away thy gowne forbid take thy coate also geue euery man asketh thee taketh away thy gooddes aske agayne ye woulde men shoulde doe vnto doe ye also vnto likewise choose hardylye woorthy haue whiche good dooen vnto dooe rendre mischiefe vnto geue eare sayingesand taketh awaye thy goun c geue new lesson rewle muste mightie strong verdure ghospell onely requite ye eiuill turne dooen eiuil turne also loue ye enemy doe ye good doe eiuill rayling reprochefull woordes rendre ye frendely woordes agayne suche woordes may others welth benefite praye ye surmnise false accusacions agaynste youre prayer maye bee reconciled god haue theyr true crymes clerely forgeuen whiche detecte false crime afore men ye wise ferre hertes desyre doe displeasure agayne displeasure doen case bodie geue thee blow one cheke thou rather offer foorth cheke strieken thou wouldest auenge first case shoulde attempte take away thy cloke thy backe suffer rather take awaye thy cote thou come contencion wrong dooen vnto thee case hath displeasure dede displeasure contrariewise owne damage losse thing hath seene keping peace tranquilitie hath aduauntage gayne thereby damage lette earneste endeuour bee doe good vnto folkes hurte body bodie shall dooe harme ye haue god redressour auenger therof ye shall dooe manne good behalfe ye sure present time shal selfesame thing haue forefather dooen tymes paste agaynste holy prophetes none respecte prophetes accordyng god dyd holde theyr tongue speakyng trueth trueth hath eiuil disposed person bene euermore odiouse example sayd prophetes shal ye comforte yourselues whose name attempted vtterly abolish memory thesame high holy al creature yet neuerthelesse ye beyng assured coumforte innocencie perfeict good liuing must haue mynde ne thoughte auenge owne cause shalbe assured escape without smarte ende shall doe vnto though season seeme fortunate flourishing rufflers pleasure welth thys worlde suche differred reserued tormentes whiche neuer shall haue ende woe vnto riche ye haue consolacion therfore woe vnto ryche cobbes whiche ye may dooe solace delite mindes treasoures honoures delectable enticementes worlde dooe remember ne thynke erelong come passe vayne felicitie pleasaunce shall taken away thesame shall ensue woefulnesse sorowe neuer haue ende woe vnto full ye shall houngre woe vnto whiche nowe worlde hauing mynde nothing bealies plaie glutton take excesse delicate meates drinkes pampre vp bodie luste necessitie nature though ye borne beastly feedyng onely nothyng el though ye rather mayntayned lyfe purpose eate drinke eate drinke maynteyne lyfe beeyng full paunched gorge vpon gorge haue mynde relieue poore brother perishing famyne though ye borne fede none selues bounde relieue necessitie neighbour woe vnto whan corporal meates drinkes wherwith ye delicately volupteously fede selfes yea bealie gourmaudeth shalbe consumed shall ye houngrie fynde reliefe shall ye wishe ye might happie haue one lytle crummes falleth table god shall ye wishe ye mighte haue one droppe water caste vpon tongue coole mouthe whan ye shall lye burning heate fyer vnquencheable shall ye wyshe ye lyfe houngred ryghteousenesse god whan ye shal se litle poore one plenteously saciate aboundaunce al felicitie glory heauen whome world ye accoumpted miserable muche despised ye saw penurie houngre destitute al reliefe coumfort lacking foode susteynaunce necessarie bodye woe vnto nowe laugh ye shall waille wepe woe vnto doe make much good mirth laughing folkes pleased euen youre owne mindes prosperous luckinesse thinges transitorie men made drounken sweete fortune within litle shorte space thinges turned contrarie ye shall wayle wepe youre plesaunce lasted moment shalbe turned peyne torment euer endure woe vnto men prayse dyd theyr father false prophetes take ye high conceyte ne pride selues whan world vpon counterfeicte likenesse happie fortunate doe eyther woordes token shewe themselues reioyce n behalfes person knowing true felicitie blisfulnesse whan highly extolle praise tho thinges abominably wickedly doe geuyng vnto deiulishe persecutyng truethe ghospell name z le towardes lawe affliccion also slaughter good men call deuout seruice doen vnto god false praise shal deliuer vengeaunce god shall make worthie double grieuous punishemente ye haue onely bene ashamed dooyng manye wicked dedes mischiefefor theyr father false prophetes also haue sought laude prayse eiuil doynges shall prayse wicked doynges forefather person lyke manier shewe muche token hygh fauoure long agone false prophetes rebelled agaynste prophetes lorde vtterly stiered vp aswel prince people sleaghing prophetes lorde seke haue vengeauce theyr persecutours yet neyther haue godlye lacked theyr condigne rewarde wieked shall lacke theyr punishmente according ouer late shall bee suche repent theyr extreme hainous offence presente doe nothyng regarde geuer better aduertisement say vnto heare loue enemy doe good vnto hate blisse curse pray wrongfully trouble vnto smiteth thee one cheke offer also hym taketh away thy gown forbid take thy coate also geue euery man asketh thee taketh away thy gooddes aske agayne ye woulde men shoulde doe vnto doe ye also vnto likewise choose hardylye woorthy haue whiche good dooen vnto dooe rendre mischiefe vnto geue eare sayingesand taketh awaye thy goun c geue new lesson rewle muste mightie strong verdure ghospell onely requite ye eiuill turne dooen eiuil turne also loue ye enemy doe ye good doe eiuill rayling reprochefull woordes rendre ye frendely woordes agayne suche woordes may others welth benefite praye ye surmuise false accusacions agaynste youre prayer maye bee reconciled god haue theyr true crymes clerely forgeuen whiche detecte false crime afore men ye wise ferre hertes desyre doe displeasure agayne displeasure doen case bodie geue thee blow one cheke thou rather offer foorth cheke strieken thou wouldest auenge first case shoulde attempte take away thy cloke thy backe suffer rather take awaye thy cote thou come contencion wrong dooen vnto thee case hath displeasure dede displeasure contrariewise owne damage losse thing hath seene keping peace tranquilitie hath aduauntage gayne thereby damage lette earneste endeuour bee doe good vnto folkes hurte body bodie shall dooe harme ye haue god redressour auenger therof ye shall dooe manne good behalfe ye sure haue god rewarder hys handes leat care al bothe remayne bee thou prompte readye geue body shall desyre thyng theegeue euerye man asketh thee suche meanes mutuall loue one purchaced knitte together persone take awaye thee thyng thyne fraude strong hande leatte hym rather haue thou come make strife businesse better one lese money house piece lande recoueryng thynges wilfully forsake better wise leat false guile bee awaye youre lyfe euerye one woulde hys good haue dooen others towardes himselfe case shoulde require thesame leat doe towardes neyghboure woulde good haue doen himselfe leat labour doe agaynst another loue neighboure one loueth himselfe pand ye loue loue thanke haue ye sinner also loue louers yf ye dooe good theim whiche dooe good thanke haue ye synners also euen thesame ye lende whome ye hope receiue thanke haue ye sinner also lende sinner receiue like agayn loue enemy doe good lende loking nothing rewarde shal greate ye shall bee child higheste kynde vnkynde eiuil bee ye therfore mercifull father also merciful euerie bodie dere frende himselfe doeth require himselfe rewarde loue leat therfore charitee tendre loue towardes neighbour also playnely without fraude guile franke without hauing iye vnto mennes desertes ready dooe good oft nede shall bee respect rewarde growe come vnto thee agayne therby cause thy neighbour although bee one wil neuer make thee emedes yet accordingly doe parte louing thee agayne thou doest rewarde youre loue youre benefite truste goddes handes onely ye loue moe loue piece rewarde ye require goddes hadeand ye doe good whiche doe good c youre loue ye loue others fully requited alreadie whoso loueth loueth would loue thesame onlesse loued hym suche one ferre euangelycall charitie enbraceth wel ye enemy frendes suche one loueth loueth hym great high acte dooeth acte mete high dignitie gospel dooe louers world otherswyse also sinner yet neuerthelesse verai ledyng nature make muche one maketh muche theim turne face dooeth parte agayn mutuall loue towardes theim case ye doo benefite vnto haue beneficiall afore piece rewarde shal bee due suche beneficiall dooyng ghospell requireth choppyng chaungeyng benefites one aswell suche bee synners also ferre waye high perfeccion professyng ghospell dooe ledyng nature recompence benefite hath beene dooen crye vpon vnthankefulnesse thyng detestable dooe thinges therefore shamefullest thyng may dooe matter greate prayse thanke moreouer case ye lende moneye suche menne whome ye veryly truste receiue agayne al owne principall ye lent acte doe ye woorthie seming liuely herte ghospell dooe eiuil person enterchaungeably lende one otherand ye lende whome ye hope receiue c receiue theyr due sumes agayne common poyncte pleasure doyng euery iacke vseth dooe man commoditie time ende like commoditie may dooen thee agayne pleasure pure sorte doen vpon hope lyke pleasure come home agayn thy neyghbour lacke desyre thy helpe requireth money waye lone delyuer yea although bee hope money shall bee repayed thee deliuer suche mynde case repaye thou canste bee contente haue thy free gyfte lone let aswell loue also beneficialnesse bee bothe franke free beare ye good hertes euen suche person also ill willers doe ye benefites vnto suche eyther dooe benefite agayn orels requite benefite shrewed turne lende also suche mynde although shall neuer come parte therof thy handes agayne yet thou haue ioye delyte succoure thy neyghbour neyther daungyer lest ye parte shal lese rewarde muche lesser rewarde shall eyther recompensed orels hoped handes men much plenteous aboundaunte rewarde god repaye vnto youand ye shall bee like vnto highest doyng highest acknowlage chyldren right marke yf ye shall power folowe hys manier goodnesse nature beneficial lorde like great liberalitie bestoweth onely vpon good also vpon eiuill vnto euery one dooeth geue lyfe yea besydes bothe heauen yearthe hath fournished manye ornamentes manye soundry kindes richesse many commodity vse seruice eue wieked prouoking eiuil fauourable mercifulnes also bounteouse liberalitie emende stiering vp good vnto thankes geuing large beneficialnesse father thesame creature time open duetie lyke kindely child resemble shewe selues accordyng ensaumple muche ye ernestelye studie meanes dooe good vnto persones aswell good maye bee made better also eiuil youre ientle mekenesse may prouoked stiered honester wayes god priuie mennes heartes yet neuerthelesse infinyte goodnesse nature beneficiall towarde veraye manye vnwoorthye creature whome perfeictly knoweth largesse shall bee loste caste away muche requisite dooe thesame forasmuche often season thing vnknowen whether party holpen beneficiall good turne bee woorthye vnwoorthye ende maye come v vncertayne many time chaunceth whiche first apparence seme naughte good honeste agayne whiche presente naughtie men dede dooe righte shortely turne better mynde true euery creature shall fynde god suche one towardes shall haue shewed vsed himselfe towardes neighbour iudge ye shal bee iudged condemne ye shall bee condemned forgeue shalbee forgeuen geue shalbee geuen vnto good measure pressed downe shaken together tunning ouer shall men geue bosomes measure ye meate withall shall men meate agayne thys also forsoothe foloweth poyncte christian myldenesse also plainnesse vncounterfeict ye enterprete con rue better parte sayinges doynges neighboure many maye bee doubtefull minde dooen herte pure corrupcion alwayes enclined thinke best mistrust deme eiuill manifeste naughtye thynges whiche sorte slaunderous backebiting filthye talke ri auldie open robberie aduoutrie shalbe youre goodnesse remedie cure faultes muche doeth lye mennes selfes neyther hate ne take vengeaunce iudge ye therefore man shall come passe ye shall agayne bee iudged youreselues condemne ye man shal come passe ye shall agayne youre owne partes bee condemned forgeue ye case offence trespace hath bene doen agaynst god shall hys partie forgeue sinnes vnto geue shalbe geue vnto youbee ye liberall beneficiall towardes youre neyghbour good turne ye dooe shall returne agayne vauntage encrease shal poured lappes backe againe good measure measure brimfull measure turned shaken together euery lappe maye full corner thereof emptie voyde measure shall runne ouer side fulnesse althoughe recompence good turne ye haue doenfor measure c shal returne agayn handes men selfesame measure whiche ye shall haue measured liberalitie towardes neighboure thesame measure shal reward returned home agayn goddes hande ye haue bene pynching iggishe towardes neighboure sorte shall ye feele youre rewarde agayn bee putte foorth similitude vnto blinde lede blynde dooe bothe falle dieke disciple addue hys maister euerie man shall perfeicte euen maister est thou thy brother iye considerest beame thyne owne iye either canst thou saie thy brother brother let pull mo e thyne iye whan thou eest beame thine owne iye thou hypocrite caste beame thyne owne iye first shalt thou see perfeictly pull mo e thy brother iye ende lorde iesus woulde better empriente premiss heartes disciple added moreouer similitude parable blynde manne bee guyde blynde assaye mattier dooeth come passe bothe fall pitte requisyte bee pure hymselfe manyer cryme whiche take vpon hym leade righte waye innocencie shall one teache man bee dooen himselfe faste entangled errour bee clene waye harde thyng ye saye throughlye endure obstynate malice persones ye agrieued endure selfe dooe endure reason dyscyples state case bee better state hys mayster shall bee perfeicte good case enoughwhy seest thou thy brother iye c bee made felowe hys maister doest thou shew thy self heauie iudge indifferent equitie thy neighbour thine owne selfe entangled grieuous eiuils vice sinne dooe thyne iyes serue thee well see bodyes faultes whan thyne manifolde naughtinesse thou art starke blinde doest thou espye lytle mote iye thy brother doest considre whole blocke thyne owne iye face maieste thou bee hable saye thy brother brother suffer take mo e youre iye whan thou seest whole beame fast thine owne true goodnesse merciful iudge vpo others doeth sharper sorte chastice selfe contrariewise counterfeict holinesse seketh geat selfe opinion perfeccion meanes winking great transgression owne selfe dooe extreme rigoure sharpenesse make open rayllyng vpon small lyght trippes others committed onely humayne fraylteethou hypocrite cast beame thyne owne iye first c doest thou condemne thy brother meate drinke thine owneselfe thy power arte weorkyng confusion destruccyon thy brother heare thou false counterfaictour righteousenesse thou wilt truely righteouse dede first al cast great beame thine iye thou shalt thinke good thou shalte see take litle mote thy brother iye peruerse kynde iudgemente setting cart horse thou flatterest pleasest thy selfe thyne owne good quality though syngular mannes thou makeste muche tusshyng many excepcyons thyne owne eiuil propertyes thou arte fauourable stacke punyshmente mannes faultes cruell full rigour pfor good tree bringeth furth eiuill fruicte neyther eiuill tree bringeth furthe good fruicte euerie tree knowen hys fruicte thornes doe men gather figges busshes gather grape good man good reasure herte bringeth furth whiche good eiuil man eiuil treasoure hearte bringeth foorth whiche eiuill aboundaunce herte mouthe speaketh doe ye presumpteously take vnto laude prayse suche thynges may bee indifferentely common well good menne eiuill neyther habite vesture neyther meate long beeyng prayer brode border garmentes holye scripture dooe declare man good tree estemed leaues beareth fruicte fruicte raketh sape iuice roote whiche sape iuice bee bittur cannot tree bring foorthe fruicte swete relice agayne sape bee good cannot tree bryng furth fruicte sorte agreable sape fedde withall leaues rynde sensyble iye beguyle bodye sape roote seene hearte bee corrupte eiuil whatsoeuer procedeth bee sincere pure pure also whatsoeuer springeth thethens euerye tree hath fruicte cummyng whiche fruicte cannot hyde though woulde neyther figge gathered hawethorne tree bryere dooe folkes gather grape good whatsoeuer good man dooeth whatsoeuer eateth whatsoeuer habite vesture gooeth whatsoeuer doeth thynges themselfes neyther good eiuill haue rather certain shewe pretense godlynes true godlynesse verai dede eateth good man wel dooeth eateth wel dooeth bothe dooe procede good affeccion herte agayne eiuill whatsoeuer eiuill persone dooeth procedethe corrupt herte howsoeuer bee clothed whether faste whether eate whether pray whether pray ye know fruietes euangelical tree whose roote moste swete sape faythe charitie hath filled replenished one loueth folkes hateth creature willeth well euen veray enemy ferre dooyng wrong person wisheth wel whome accused wished deiuill prayeth long lyfe health whome accused falsely earnestlye myndeth preseruyng sauing euen whome himselfe killed earnestly bendeth applieth himselfe doe good menne looking rewarde god hande onely demeth eiuill persone whatsoeuer indifferente partes enterpreteth taketh better condemner man owne parte remyttyng iudgemente god onelye setteth hys mynde dooe menne good wieked suffereth entent may emende neighboure strayghing righte waye dooyng amisseand eiuill man il treasure herte bringeth c louingly warneth telleth faulte one trespasse againste forgeueth hearte beareth offence mynde thou shalte see suche fruictes know thou euangelicall ir e hath fruicte seming ghospell take also markes wherby knowe fruictes tree whose roote infected bittur sape pharisaicall pride enuie couetise one willeth wel man sauing himselfe ne loueth frendes owne sake owne glory setteth glory god displeasure wrong bee auenged yea dooe wrong hys owne offre taketh conceypte pryde himselfe euen hys naughtie dooynges well doynges men slaunderousely reproue fynde faulte withal taketh wayes owne singular commodity hurte damage neighboures woordes euermore disagreeable hys herte neither trusteth god ne loueth neighbour himselfe maketh vauntes others condemneth sayeth bee naughte flattereth himselfe doeth well thynges vpon hys brother dooyng neuer li le amisse iudge without mercye wheras produceth suche fruictes yet leaues ynde beareth counterfayte lykenesse good tree goeth walking vp habite garded hemmed brode philacteries washeth euerie resteth sabboth daye busilye fleeth talkyng publican geueth diligent attedaunce great riche widowes towardes selie poore creature fierce crueltyrane towardes riche cobbes plain flatterer fasteth ofte face world abrode home playeth glutton onely serueth bealye prayer long long agayne lawe temple god hath alwayes mouthe occasion brasteth laie hidden herte whiche layed vp treasour mennes good property eiuil also often case dooeth earnestlye pricke hym dooeth outward shewe cloked holynesse vanishe awaye cometh furth sheweth selfe hath lyen diepely hidden botome hearte wrong displeasure laied waye grieuousely reuiled without deserte haled prieson spoiled goodes case doeth good man good treasour hearte shewe furth goodnesse payeth home one displeasure sorer displeasure agayne eyther suffereth elles recompenseth displeasure dooen vnto yea euen beneficiall good turne one reuyleth aunswereth mylde quyete woordes agayn beyng haled prieson geueth thankes god losse dignitie promocions receiueth ioye clene contrarie premiss sayde pharisaicall tree occasion offered sheweth furth fruictes ferre contrarie sorte others calle ye lorde lorde dooe bidde god cannot meanes bee deceyued one thing forasmuche throughly seeth diepeste corner bottome herte within neyther thing moued respect regarde bodelye outwarde ceremony whiche dooe oftentimes deceiue menne counterfaict semblaunce holinesse geue man gloryous payncted woordes secretlye doe theyr vttermoste power bring open shame purpose serueth ye speake waye honour making euerie word solemne repeating name lorde lorde maister maister ye nothyng regarde thinges whiche commaunde enioyne vnto ye acknowleage lorde maister see ye bee obediente dooers biddinges yf ye dooe acknoweleage meaneth callyng lorde maister doeth case requireth obedyente readye seruice honoure due youre lorde maister muste bee shewed foorthe woordes dooynges dilygent keping lordes commaundementes dooe shewe feithfull seruaunt gloriouse speaking woordes honour whosoeuer cometh heareth sayinge dooeth thesame shewe whome lyke lyke man whiche builte house dygged ditye layed foundacion rocke whan water arose fludde beat vpon house could moue grounded vpon rocke heareth dooeth like man without foundacion built house vpon yearthe agaynst whiche fludde beate fell immediatly fall house great dooen thesame lorde taughte similitude good eiuill tree whose fruyctes bee esteemed roote selfe none thyng doeth still beate theyr heades similitude comparison building eyther geue ouer falle geue ouer stormes beatyng vpon truely thyng roote tree thesame thyng comparison foundacion buildyng leaues tree euen lyke therof makyng anye house yeldeth without furth pleasaunt shewe beholder whosoeuer cummeth sayeth iesus syncere hearte myndewhoso cometh ne eareth sayinges dooeth thesame c dooeth heare woordes whan case requirethe shewe furthe euident token perfecte vertue treasour hys sayde hearte shewe whome lyke lyke prouydent circumspect buylder buildeth house vaine braggue shewe onelye serue hym shorte whyle longer firmenesse stedfastenesse stande endure without perishyng agaynste bloustreous storme tempeste come therefore diggeth downe great depth layeth sounde substauncial foundacion vpon sure rocke thys dooen maketh vpper buyldyng afterwarde whan fluddes arise beate agaynst itbut heareth dooeth like c mightie tempest windes light vpon neyther swift rage flud extremely roushing vpon yet forceable vyolence wyndes blousteryng agaynste suche house bee ouerthrowen appayred standeth sure vpon strong foundacion contrarywyse cummeth suche thinges teache dede heareth suffereth preceptes good lesson sinke throughly downe euen bottom hearte like builder hath slender forcast maketh buildinges sort tempeste like anytime arise forasmuche suche one hath care ne passeth substauncial foundacion goeth vp buildinges great height braggue shew onely soone eyther renning ouer fluddes doth come blustryng storme wyndes doeth aryse downe cummeth euer hath buylded statelye royallye hath made building vayne shewe muche greatter ruyne dooeth house fall downe truelye whatsoeuer standeth foundacion ceremony pharisaicall constitucions obseruacions thinges outwardly belonging body house buildyng vndoubtedly quaile falle often shall light vpon wronges displeasure losse damage goodes open shame punyshementes worlde deathes sore storme vnluckie fortune otherwise p seuenth chapter whan ended sayinges audience people entred capernaum certaine centurion seruaunte whiche dere vnto hym laye sicke peril death whan heard iesus sent vnto elder iewes beseching woulde come heale seruaunt whan came iesus besought instautly saying worthie thou shouldest loueth nacion hath built v synagogue iesus went whan fer house centurion sente fredes hym saying vnto lord trouble thy selfe worthie thou shouldest enter vnder roufe wherefore thought selfe woorthie come vnto thee say thou worde seruaunt shalbe whole also man set vnder power haue vnder souldiers saye vnto one goe goeth come commeth seruaunt doe doeth whan iesus hearde merueiled turned sayde people folowed say vnto haue found greate feith israel sent turned backe home agayne founde seruaunt whole bene sicke lorde iesus spoken many woordes muche lyke sorte afore rehearsed whiche trayned discyples people sette trade towardes excellent high perfeccion euangelical philosophie went citie capernaum whiche citie vsed muche often bee conu rsaunte eftsons befalleth many soondrye occasyon weorke shewe miracle ende autoritie hys doctryne myghte bee confirmed ratified highe excellencie actes dedes place certain ceturion home house seruaunt whiche suche perill daungier lyfe disease paulsey euen nowe deathes doore thys matier litle vexe hearte centurion estemed bondeseruaunte hys vile state bondage fidelitie trustinesse founde pure honestie behauiour thesame exaumple also reproue inhumanitie certayne maisters whiche doe commonlye esteme vse theyr seruauntes better degree regarde dooe horse ox purpose whan centurion gotte knowleage iesus gone capernaum procured made certayn auncient head men iewes make instaunt request lord theyr owne name woulde vouchsalue go vnto house make seruaunt whole agayn came reuerence shamefastnes mistruste centurion first beeyng gentile secoundly man armes whiche bee thought vngodly thing maketh suite lord meane others himselfe whan come vnto iesus suspecting halfe deming thing like enough greate benefit would without much doe bee obteyned firste bondeman secoundlye heathen thirdely centurion saye pet captayne crue souldyers entreate hym muche carefulnesse earneste woordes saying syr haue respecte gentile man armes ne thys benefyte asked one bondeseruaunt vnder crue soondry wayes man worthie whome doe good pleasure cometh right louing frendly oure nacion hath builded v synagogue iesus woulde shewe persone vyle afore hym bee commended sette furthe hym feyth wente thesame place called vnto whan nowe come somewhat nere house partie laye sycke hys bedde centurion perceiuyng lorde approched willed hys frendes goe mete hym thus saye vnto maister cause thee take thys laboure cumming hither thy bounteous goodnesse doeth durste haue presumed desire knowe thy dygnitie well enoughe knowe myne owne selfe heathen creature centurion businesse make better man bonde seruaunt myne owne iudgemente felowe vnwoorthye vnder whose houseroofe thou shouldest put thy head thys cause durste presume come vnto thee selfe iewes thynke themselues metyng cummyng v emongest bee defiled taken men vttrely estraunged true seruing wurshyppyng god enwrapped manye soondry sinnes neuerthelesse great dolour herte mine exceding great trust thee hath caused haue presumed desire aske health seruaunt lying nowe extreme whiche health thou arte hable woorde thy mouthe geue symple basse mattier yea also light mattier thee come dooe thyne owne persone coniecture comparyson myne owne selfe man subiecte power man whose commaundementes obedyente haue souldyers also vnder whiche dooe thynges commaunde necessarie goe aboute dooyng thinges myne owne persone case bee anye homely slendre mattyer dooe saye thys felowe goe gooeth come hither cummeth saye anye seruauntes whome lusteth dooe thys beyng obedyente biddyng dooethe commaundemente suche one haue great autoritie syttyng styll thyng woulde haue neuerthelesse executed dooen men vnder gouernaunce muche though thou stiere shall bee dooen thou woorde nothyng el shalt geue commaudement commission thy disciple iesus delyted thys talke full hertie good affeccyon towardes seruaunte lowelye opinion himselfe woonderfull affyaunce towardes lorde stayghed sodaynelye stode styll shewed veraye token one beeyng greate meruaile thing hearde straunge vnto hym forasmuche knewe well enough herte centuryon woordes spoken purpose wente aboute making countenaunce merualing commende vnto iewes centurion affiaunce assured truste god also embrayde theyr vnbeliefe exaumple man bothe heathen souldyer iesus therefore makyng delaye aunswere centuryon turned multytude iewes accompainyed hym saide thys one thing affyrme vnto certaintie yet vnto daye haue founde ne knowen muche fayth al nacion israell senioures iewes come vnto lesse beleue made suche earneste desire haue lordes owne presence halfe mystrusted iesus woulde haue healed seruaunt heathen man onlesse alleged hertie fauoure towardes nacyon israelite thoughe lorde geuer benefites humain worldly affeccions dignitie woorthinesse persone muche rather feithfull truste peticioner iesus therefore affirmed vnto tyme shoulde come whan suche iewes estimacion reputed heathe sinner shoulde commendacion fayth receyued vnto
