dignitie nacion israell person reiected beeyng natural descent child abraham theyr vnbeliefe made selues vnworthy suche paterne heade stocke lynage sayde vnto centuryon laste come hymselfe goe thy wayes thyng thou hast beleued maie doen doen thy seruaunte perfitely whole returnyng homward knowelage hys seruauntes meting waye seruaunte euen selfe tyme sodainly deliuered disease lord said thy seruaunt liueth largely dooeth vertue efficacie y worde extende doth lesse fruite benefite helpe person absent ferre distaut presente within sight reache faythfull belefe affiaunce hym dyd hable theim apte woorthye receiue godly desire theyr faythes sake especially whan exaumple suche myghte eyther put gentyles hope cumfort goddes grace towardes theim orels bee monicion iewes defaulte true fayth lese fauour god wilfully obstinately reiecte cast whan offered certes present exaumple image figure gentile afterward cum felowshyp grace ghospel pure fayth without obseruacion moses lawe yet neuerthelesse commendacion lawe sorte lawe nouryce first scholemaister bringer vp men vnto christe iewes originall preachyng ghospell first procede certes fygure matter nothyng el elder iewes commend centurious cause doe speake vnto iesus iewes dooe accumpany iesus centurion house would afterward driue owne temple fortuned went citie called naim many disciple went muche people whan came nigh gate citie behold dead man carried whiche onely soonne mother wedowe muche people citie whan lord sawe co passion said vnto wepe came nigh touched coffin bare stode styll said young man say vnto arise deade sate vp began speake deliuered mother came feare gaue glory vnto god saiyng great prophete rysen vp among v god hath visited people rumour hym went foorth throughout iewrye throughout region whiche lye round forsooth lorde entent seede euangelicall doctryne might ferther ferther spred abrode oftentimes remoue departe one place befell leauing citie capernau passed citie naim whiche lieth fro mountain thabor muche distaunce two myles towardes south coaste ferre fro endor whan thyther wente disciple folowed hym whome tyme great nobre besides wet also great multitude common people sortes degree wha ye lord ferre gate citiebeholde dead caried ou beholde occasion newe miracle came dead corpse carried menes backes towardes buri ng great coumpanye people doulful matier first young man dead taken fro lyfe euen floure age secondarily onely sonne wedowe beeyng depriued coumforte housebande sette hope staye lyfe soonne wedow therfore testified woful tormenting hert weping teares also many piteous woordes lamentacion suche extreme raging dolour doth commonly putte folkes myndes speake great wailyng wedowe together vnripe deathe yong strieplyng caused reste coumpanye also wepe many kyndenes bonde neighbourhode went folowyng corpsewhan lorde sawe compassion whan ye lorde iesus beeyng mostefull mercie pitie seen sight toke compassion wedowe shewed effectuall comforter vnto none el bee hir comforter holpe bothe wordes also dede woma saith make weping whan said came vnto biere wheron dead carried put hand immediatly whiche carryed corpse stayed bothe coumpanies earnestly herkenyng aswell accoumpanyed wedowe also came lordand deade sate vp beganne speake iesus turnyng yong dead young man saie vnto thee arise worde immediatly ye yong euen one newly awakened reysed slepe sate vpright biere entent euidet token life restored hym begoonne speake speakyng dyd ferthermore also declare lustye freashenesse heartynesse spirite lept doun biere cleuyng faste vnto iesus perceiued lyfe restored vnto stil rendryng thankes lorde deliuered hym vnto mother haue home goyng feete caused dead carryed towardes bur yng fower mennes shoulder thus truely matier doen touching story without significacion ghostly doctrine wedow beyng mother represeteth churche forsooth euen thesame wedow prophete esaye doeth coforte saiyng glad thou barain bringest foorth chyldren reioyce thou ye art nothyng towardes bearyng mo child forsaken hath husbande synagogue trusteth altogether spouse moses maketh great vauntes child abraha beyng equall noumber sande lieth sea shore churche estimacion worlde semeth destitute spouse hath conueyed hymselfe vp heauen first semed barain without hope issue successio iewes also price world labouryng al memorie iesus supposed vtterly destroyed dead might vtterly take away abolished euer wedow doth daily bring forth child world childre lyght neyther dooeth bryng foorth moses taught thinges earthly vnto christ teacheth also promiseth thinges heauenly bryngeth foorth death immortalitie groneth daily bringing forth childre yet vnshapen vnperfite vntil thei haue receiued ye spirite gospel vntil christ brought perfite shape true mother singularly doth loue childre wt gret carefulnesse frameth trayneth vntill may growe full age may bee brought vp strength perfite men loue deuocion towardes god also hath infacie hath cumming forward growthe age tyme fortune chyldren dye wepeth coumforted wepeth lesse hym none hym alone loste innocencie whiche geuen euangelical fayth life sinne death see howe great affeccion mother mourne bodily corps child muche tenderly doeth churche wepe waill one baptisme fallen deadly synne pensife death one sinner ye synagogue glad fourescore nynetene ryghteous well forth dead borne foure carrier say inordinate desire worlde hauing dead corpse theyr shoulder benng destitute holy ghost lackyng felyng beyng dead aslepe ownnaughty vice carrye hym streighte graue euerlastyng despaire church ferthermore hath gate casteth dead folkes lest stinkyng dead corpse others also yet whole maye bee infected hathe gate also whiche receiue suche called life agayn lorde bringeth foorth life spirite christe doeth receiue life christ doeth call backe porter carry dead neuer stop ne stay vntill cum euen graue whoso hath made al restyng place worlde whoso hath let large ledde sinfull affeccions ceasseth damnable proceding fail cotinually wurse wurse vntill cum ye mayne depth euils deliuered lustes abominable naught doeth mother wepe yea coumpanye coutreimen wepe sorowyng deade cast wishe returne life verilye prayer mother churche teares sighes grouynges godly persones makyng mone sorowe death synner young strieplyng dead beeyng yet confirmed spirite ghospel muche worthye mercie thesame hoped trusted ye spirite christ haue prospered growen foreward vnto highest degree euangelical godlynesse hym see past life void spirite merciles porter euen carriyng toward derke pitte graue yet neuerthelesse mother al foloweth folke toune also folow charitie ca scarcely meane despaire teres fettyng sighes wofull lametacions declare thyng wish ye thyng wishe lyeth power geue neither able kepe stil whan lyfe departed yet power reise hym vp dead man power dead past possibilitie callyng life al welinough weping teres churche iesus cumeth meteth luckie blessed al tymes ye metyng sauiour body casteth iye wedowe luckye blessed time merciful lordes beholdyng body casteth iye dead bodye thought hymselfe nede mercy yet seme woorthy mercy iesus ye earnest affeccion zele churche dooeth obteyne whiche ye synner beyng desperate past grace dooeth muche wishe lord biddeth mournyng ceassed bringyng hope ioye folowe putteth hande biere porter dead corpse dooe stand stil first poynt hope one way amendyng towardes innocencie go ferther naughtines ceasseth wurse geueth yet sum token hope wil one day better yet doeth fortune onlesse iesus vouchsafe mightifull hande touche biere hande iesus setteth end vnto wicked desire appetite ye partie shal ceasse naughtines cariyng graue church dede praieth maketh great intreatyng exhorteth chydeth suche persones dooe offende would haue amende bee perfite reste viciousnesse vayn onlesse iesus secrete vertue power touch soule sinner dead iesus lyfe euery man yea euen ye dead good hope lyfe wil cum whan iesus vouchesalueth touch ye biere hertines lyfe doeth yet retourne onlesse lorde speake vnto dead voice none el dead reuiue agayn yea although haue laied graue yea haue lien fower day continuaunce entent man shoulde thynke synners bee ferre past grace whose recouerye grace charitye churche shoulde despaire lazarus carryed oute buryed laye stynkyng already graue yet wepynge wayliynge made hym whyle voice iesus callyng hym came foorthe hys sepulchre dede lazarus sumwhat dooe reysed lyfe iesus present dyd wer rore spirite wept sore troubled himselfe harder reise one lien fower day buried one whose lyfe departed euen nowe oute bodye shewe howe hardely suche personnes cum amendemente haue longe continuaunce accustomed themselfes vnto viciousnes iesus caste iye wedowe leaft weepyng shall lykewyse caste iye dead persone shall begynne lyue moste mercifull lorde therefore turned partie laye dead thou young man saye vnto thee aryse cannot choose reuiue againe woordes shall bee spoken iesus mouth yea although dead wordes speaketh al spirit life folowed al reuiued innocecy dead sinnes setteth vpright afore laie still hauyng felyng himselfe whiche moste euident token mynd corrected goodnes beginneth speake cofessyng synnes geuyng thankes mercie god restored mother aliues man againe afore carriyng graue great mournyng many people nowe muche greatter ioye brought home propertie hath true godlines loueth men muche better whiche haue ameded fro greate enormity ernest endeuour ledyng better life dooeth goodnesse god better appereand came feare suche haue neuer falle greuous crime enormitie mother reioyceth yt hathe receyued sone thei afore mourn ye corpse reioyce thei reioyce also euery one many wer preset sight taken certain feare suche opely eiuill vncurable churche casteth felowship dead corps end exaumple one many may afeard sinne yesame cumpany doe praise magnify mercye god whose power dead retourne life againa great prophete arise vp emong v notable miracle seen yesame people said great prophete sprong vp emongest v god hath taken regard people iewes yet deme ne suppose higher thynge christe sum notable prophete act also fame lord iesus growe bruite matter spred abrode throughout al iewry also throughout coastes euery side lyeth fluime iordane iohn afore baptised aswel people also iesus self disciple iohn shewed hym thinges iohn called vnto twoo disciple sent iesus saiyng art thou cum shal loke another men cu vnto sayd iohn baptist hath sent v vnto thee saying art thou cum shall awaite another thatsame houre cured many infirmity plague euill spirites vnto many wer blind gaue light aunswered said vnto goe way bring woord iohn thynges ye haue seen heard blynd see halt goe lepres clensed deafe dead rise agayn poore glad tidynges preached happy offended certain iohns disciple halfe enuiyng great successe thinges wrought doen handes iesus hauyng certain spice enuie name waxyng euery one day famous maner derkenyng glorye iohn hyghe opinion make relacion vnto iohn liyng fast bounde pryson thynges iesus spake dyd iohn therfore purpose remedie cure affeccyonate mynde disciple called two apart vnto set vnto iesus demaud questio thou sayd cum el dooe loke iohn often alreadie geuen testimonie christe also pointyng finger said behold lambe god beholde hym taketh awaye sinnes worlde nothyng contrary al reason thinke great prophete iohn beyng nere vnto death begynne doubte though body prison yet testymonye christe bound haines neither derkenes prison thing dimme iudgemente concernyng christe acknowlaged mother wombe hym dyd lese acknowelage pryson synguler good man iudged expedientgo wais brig word iohn ye haue seen might way wer make deliuerie disciple handes iesus whan iohns disciple therfore dooen message christe thesame maner fourme maister geuen commission lorde iesus first make aunswer many miracle doen presence right many sundrie malady driuen suche sicke many vncurable euils put away fro men vnclene spirites cast word sight restored vnto many blind last thus aunswered purpose geue sentence self testimonie clere oute doubte testimonye actes goe way beare word vnto iohn ye haue seene iyes ye haue heard eares blynd receiue sight werlaine made hable walke lepres made clene deafe haue hearyng restored dead returne life poore lowe dooe enbrace glad newes saluacion according prophecy esaye whiche sayeth hath sent preache ghospell vnto poore iohn preached kyngdome heauen hande weigh ye selues whether thynges whiche ye seeand happy offeded thynges worthie semyng kyngdom heaue blissed shal turne thinges doe health men occasion slaundre hymselfewarde greatnesse thinges wrought shall stiere many persones enuie agaynst shall weakenesse body bee occasion slaundre great many saying iesus secretly checke enuie iohns disciple geuing also therwithall woorde knowledge would cum passe worldly open shame crosse whiche wyse mystery kingdome heauen bee executed accomplished would turne many mennes hertes way doctrine ghospell ferther blessed shoulde bee neither woulde beare enuie ne grutche glory ne men dismaied troubled reproche open deathe would sterte backe holsome doctrine pand whan messenger iohn departed began speake vnto people concerning iohn went ye wildernesse see rede shaken wind went ye see man clothed softe raiment behold whiche gorgeously apparelled liue delicately kynges courtes went ye foorth see prophete yea say prophete written behold send aungell thy face whiche shal prepare thy way thee say vnto among woman child greatter prophete iohn baptiste whan iohns disciple gon way reporte vnto hym aunswer iesus lorde begonne largely speake ye praise iohn entent none reason demaundyng former question disciple mystrust suspecte iohn hymself thyng waueryng concernyng owne testimonie afore geuen iesus haue chaunged mynde halfe doubte ye iesus therefore remoueth waye iohn suspicion inconstauncie also maketh iohns testimony concernyng hym credece weight wise extolling iohns excellet vertues yet neuerthelesse gaue hym tytle messias whiche tytle certain person good long space labour geue vnto maner iesus spakewhat wet ye oute wildernes se rede yf ye suspecte saieth yt iohn good sen gaue testimonie nowe waueryng mynde ye greate agon leaue tounes sorte rennefull whole deserte place see man see rede trowe ye blowen fro winde neuer long abideth stedfaste goe yet went ye foorth laste see man trowe ye gaily apparelled softe sylkes yt may deliciousnes fare ambicion honour bee corrupted suspicio cannot light went clothed camel hide whiche gyrt loynes roughe thong heary leather whiche lyued grassehoppers meate plaine water drinke whiche wheras susteined life fyner diete besides also fast often gorgeous araie doneth best please deliciousnesse meates dooeth delite suche dooe seke make shift kynges courtes suche persones haue great desire thynges aboue said suspicion corrupt sentence mynde inconstancie waueryng plain flattery may perchauce light iohn hath preferred wildernes ye courtes prince hath preferred ye hearie hide camel veluets silkes garmetes clothe golde set precious stone wilde honey locustes hath preferred ye martspaines swete delicates kynges plain water swete hypocras riche iohn wise flatter prison dooeth sufficiently trye therefore cause man suspecte iohn dyd afore mannes pleasure fauour geue high worthie testimony haue chaunged mynde yet would fain know thyng called foorth wildernes trowe ye see prophet dede opely cofessed messias yet one thing affirme vnto ye ranne forth wildernes cause see prophete ye frustrate ne deceiued thyng ye loked ye haue true dede seen prophet yea prophet esaye long many day gonne dyd prophecie shoulde bee foregoer messias beholde saieth sende messenger thy face whiche shall prepare thy way thee prophetes derke mysticall sayinges foreshew certain thinges long cum iohn fynger point messias shewe whan came therefore thinke highly iohn dooe thinke rightly well thus muche affirme vnto emong al men tyme afore tymes hitherto haue borne woman hath prophet arisen greatter excellent iohn neuerthelesse lesse kingdome god greatter people publican hard iustified god baptised baptisme iho phariseis lawiers despised counsail god theselfes baptised lord sayd wherunto shal lyken men generacion thyng like lyke vnto child sittyng mercate place criyng one saiyng haue pyped vnto ye haue daunced haue mourned vnto ye haue wept iohn baptist came neyther eatyng bread drynkyng wine ye say hath deuil sonne man cum eateth drinketh ye say behold gluttonous man vnmeasurable drinker wine frende publicas sinner wisdome iustified child great great enough dooe nowe witnesse hym thyng sum assygne vnto wyll hymselfe acknowlage ne take due vnto hym one greatter vertue dooe thynges also dignitie neuertheles opinion acceptacion people inferiour kyngdom heaue strayght liuyng goyng deserte oute coumpanye dooe highly esteme familiaritie contemne dignitie iohn haue reuerece glory haue enuy doctrine hym enbrace ye doctrine slaudre depraue preached baptisme vnto repentauce affirmed kingdoe heauen approche voice hym herkened euery body wel ignoraut inferiour people also publicanes souldiers harlotes making haste baptisme iohn ministred vnto confessing theimselfes synners beyng desirous fain washed si ne glorifie righteousnesse god acknowlagyng theyr owne vnrighteousnesseand people publican heard hym iustified god forasmuche creature clene great sinne sauyng onely god enbracyng goodnes god hath made promisse freely forgeue al offence transgression former lyfe vnto persones syncere trust affiauce wil take refuge vnto cotrariwise pharises scribe lawiers reken shame acknowlage owne iniquitie haue rather willed make god lier enbrace trueth therfore thought skorne bee baptised iohn vnto cofusion castyng away despysyng mercifull counsaill god hath appoynted determined abolishe sinnes mortall people moste easy ientle waye easy thyng confesse diep water innocencie might geuen iohn baptisme preachyng iohn make preparatife innocencie end noumbre persones might brought saluacion preachyng iohn forerenner messenger case finde hertes myndes already prepared receiue nothyng premiss vnaduisedly doe wtout good grounde prouidence god disposed thynges ye health saluacion mankynde poore commoner people moste lowest sorte synners semed ferthest way fro true godlynesse farre short knowlage lawe suche men embraced beneficial mercifull goodnes god contraryewyse behoued moste vnderstand thynges wer promysed holy saiynges prophetes also seemed ye pillours al deuout holines haue vtterly refused bounteous goodnes god beyng offred vnto haue felt maner compunccion repentaunce amendment neither iohns preachyng yet mine iesus laiyng obstinate malice plain face brought similitude sorte communicacion shall say people peruerse generacion thyng shall say likewe haue piped ye haue aunced may bee lykened vnto boyes see sitting together ye open strete boy aunswering one another plaiyng vse thus saye haue plased mery songes vpon pypes yet haue ye therby nothing moued dauce haue played mourning songes yet haue ye wept thissame prouerbe beeyng taken common guise child strete lord iesus apply compare vnto obstinate iewes neyther streight liuing iohn moued feare god vegeauce yet wt ye courteous familiaritie beneficial doinges christ wer thing stirred vnto loue came iohn saieth iesus singular streightnes liuyng bothe preachyng repentaunce also geuing exaumple repentauce neither eating breade ne drinkyng wine liuing wildernesse clothed pilche camel hyde girte gyrdle lether thynges ferre wer ye repentaunce thyng doen emende youthe soonne manne come eateth drynketh ye turned surmised slaundres querels saying lacketh common reason hath deiuil hym sonne man come seking contrary waye bring saluacion wete man familiar readie mete speake persones woulde makyng shew new streightnesse lyuyng manacyng threatenyng punishement alluryng persones benefites vnto loue hym eatyng drynkyng folkes vse beyng conuersaunte emong sortes men whatsoeuer differyng men either meate el arye mane humanitie cutteous behaueour wherewith ye ought haue prouoked vnto better wayes ye turne occasion slaundreous reprochefulnesse saying behold gluttonous felowe drynker wyne frende publicanes synners yet nothyng preuayled malice men agaynst workyng purpose wysedome godwysedome iustyfyed hir chyldren righteousnesse god euen meanes glorifyed chyldren geuen euangelicall wysdome well knowen nothyng leaft vndoen sauyng creature yet euyll proude refusyng free gifte god theyr owne iust true desertes cast bee condemned theyr stede publicanes harlottes sinner heathen rightfully admitted partakyng felowshyp saluacion prophecied afore shoulde proue reason come passe came passe dede thei vaunted themselfes bee godly men righteous theyr vnbeliefe reiected put awaye free gifte euangelicall saluacion contrarywise suche promptnesse beleuyng vncorrupt affeccio haue violently brast come lord neuer secular wer neuer muche abhorred wer neuer muche defoyled synfulnes haue receyued felowshyp brotherhood kyngdome heauen one phariseis desyred hym woulde eate hym wente phariseis house sate meate beholde woman citie whiche synner soone knewe iesus sate meate phariseis house brought alablaster bore oyntemente stood feete behynde hym wepyng beganne washe feete teares dyd wype heares head kyssed feete enoynted oyntmente pharisee whiche bidden sawe spake within hymselfe saying man prophete woulde surely knowe er woman toucheth hym synner beholde folowed byanby necke hereof certayne matier wherin case selfe laye playnly iyes thesame lord taught woordes concernyng puttyng awaye suche thoughte themselues righteous receyuing synners grace fauour pharisee ferre aboue men puffed vp pryde reason knowlage lawe opinion people holynesse befell one prayed lorde take repaste home house neither iesus disdeigne thesame denied man haue presence woulde whan beyng entred phariseis house set table beholde certain womanne whiche within thesame citie knowen notorious synner soone knewe moste mercifull lorde iesusa woma citie sinner c would debarre creature commyng hym also moste promptely readilye helpe eiuils persones presente altogether mislykyng herselfe synnefulnesse yet conceyuyng great truste affiaunce mercifull goodnesse iesus ye would saye breake parforce pharisee house ardent desyre herte shaken shame thoughe knewe well enough great stately disdeygnefulnesse straunge countenaunce pharisaicall sorte vsed turne awaye face synners loke vpon whereas themselfe within foorth swimmed full theyr skyn might hold muche grieuous vice brought precious thinges moste chiefe pleasure nicitieshe brought alabla bore oyntmente yet remayning monumentes token remembraunce former lyfe whiche lyfe abhorred vpon christ heaue ly loue burned intente without making store therof pleteously poure cheryshyng hym bestowe precious fyne thynges wherwith afore tymes naughtely serued hir owne delicate pleasure made amiable vnto world thing brought fyne delicate litle bore swete oyntment sauours whiche vessell called alablastre greke terme smothenesse whiche letteth one maye vneath take vp holde handes slippyng oyntmente specially good fyne coste great summe money smale thyng olde tyme suche bondeseruauntes sensuall pleasure fleashe veray greatly delyte swete oyntmentes perfume especially coumpayny banquettynges see note holy importunitie woman beyng synner dyd onely ieoperde vnbidden geaste boldely entre house pharisee also euen decked trimmed araye came boldly coumpaynye satte bourde table parlour stoode letted come caste herselfe prostrate fore syde feete iesus stood behynd backe aswell might begonne washe foot teares wepyng marryng soule health beautie iyes long tyme afore woont waye abhominacion peynte stibie foot iesus beyng wel wasshed teares tryclyng iyes lyke droppes rayne shower wyped drie towell lynnen heares head whiche vntyll daye customablye vsed delycate sensuall pleasure fleasheand wipe heare head c enoynt swete perfume dye coloures kembe brede wrythes golde enterlaced emong woondrefull loue also woman beeyng synner yet satisfyed iesus foot washed wyped leaft kyssyng thynges instrumentes fylthye pleasure turned obedient seruice hym onely none loued thou hast plain facion synner vnsaciable importunitie ardent loue throughe stedfastnesse feith breakyng parforce kyngdome heauen syde haue thou paterne iewe presumpteous conceite hymself vnbelefe maketh hymself vnwoorthie merciful goodnes god offredwhan pharise bidde c pharisee desyred iesus dyner wha saw wheras part fauour woman suche feruet good zele pressyng great humilitie submitting iesus many token protestyng earnest repentance former life wheras haue loued mercifulnesse iesus putteth away perso moued slaunderous misiudgyng bothe thinke within man prophete suche one reputed forsooth could ignoraunt woman sort thus toucheth handes co mon harlot woman notorious vnchaste liuyng whiche thyng dyd know would suffre himselfe bee defiled touching body polluted vncleane pharisee thoughte holy men bee polluted muche talke sinner stately proude braggues counterfayted ryghteousnesse thorough whiche iewes stode highly owne conceites incurryng indignacion god thereby iesus aunswered sayed vnto symon haue sumwhat saye vnto sayed maister saie certain lender whiche two debtours one ought fyue houndreth pense fiftie whan nothyng paye forgaue bothe tell therfore whether loue hym moste symon answered said suppose forgaue moste saied vnto hym thou hast truely iudged turned woman said vnto simon seest thou woman entred thy house thou gauest water fete hath washed fete teres wiped heares head thou gauest kysse sen time cae hath ceassed kisse fete head oyle thou diddest anoynte hath anointed fete oyntment wherfore say vnto many synnes forgeuen loued muche lesse forgeuen doeth lesse loue said vnto thy synnes forgeuen thee iesus entente would muche declare hymself bee prophete made aunswere vnto secrete thought pharisee symon haue thing tell thee sayd pharisee maister saye iesus seyng pharisee geue good eare vnto hym woulde beefore coumpanye geastes nly det cte vngodly thought pharisee parte ryght gospeller also see vse ciuilitie good courtesy put forth vnto hym parable suche sorte foloweththere certayne leder twoo debtours two certain persones went endebted bothe one vsurer whiche two debtours one oughte fyue hundreth pyeces syluer coyne called denaries whiche muche estimacion rate fiue sixe pense piece old sterling money mannes whole debt amounted muche nere ye sume twelue fiftene poundes sterlynge rather aboue albeit sum wryters yea muste wryters dooe value olde denarie muche aboute twelue pense eol g debte twentye fyue poundes sterlyng debtour oughte fiftye suche syluer piece whiche muche aboute summe fyue twentye shyllynges thirtie shyllynges greatter estimacion fiftie shillinges sterlyng muche bothe found vnhable pay dueties forgaue whole summes euerye penye indebted whether two bounde hertilye loue liberall creditour symon yet vnderstandyng ende thys parable ment cum aunswered plainly without subtiltie mynd saieth partie bound earnestly loue credytour summe forgeuen said vnto symon dooest thou see womanthan iesus openyng purpose put foorth doubtfull question saied vnto symon thou hast iudged rightly thou applye thy iudgement nothyng equally ne indifferently foorthwith tourned woman spake vnto symon dooest thou see woman thou callest synner dooest thou see full wepyng heare lyig shoulder makig lauasse precious perfumed oyntemente lyberall liberall kiss geuyng feete liyng prostrate afore outwardly shewyng behaueour vsyng body paterne liuely exaumple repentant persone e manifest token certain excedyng great loue towardes ernestly hateth self muche frankely tendreth maketh came hither siner throughly made whole assone touched physicion thou despisest woman synner thyne owne selfe thou hast good opinio coceit thou art righteous man ye godly zele affeccion sinneri entred thy house c ferre oddes aboue thy righteousnesse cum thy house geast bidden repast desired cum yet hast thou muche geuen water fete whiche neuerthelesse ientle poynt courtesie euerywhere comoly vsed woma hath washed fete teres hath wyped ye heare head thou hast geuen kysse sen came whiche euery common frende dooeth customable vsage geue one woman euer sece came first dores immoderate zele affeccion hearte hath ceassed still kissing fete thou hast anointed head much comon oyle point ientlenes comonly shewed geastes whatsoeuer cum repaste mannes house woman hath precious costely oyntment perfume al ouer ouer anoynted fete say abiect vyle parte bodye doe thou weigh muche hath synned consider thou muche loueth dere loue couereth multitude sinnes muche plainly affirme vnto thee great noumbre synnes forgeuen hath muche fasted hath vsed muche praier cotemplacion hath deuout obseruer many pharisaicall costitucions hath muche loued hath whole hert put trust confidence greuously hath synnned muche dooeth myslyke selfe muche earnestly doeth loue whose free mercy hath deliuered many fold synnes hath greatnes sinnes turned gracious blissed good end part side lesse forgeuen partie doth loue greatly exaumple ye pharyseis thinke selues righteous obseruyng lawe haue great thinges nedeth god pardone therfore loue affeccion colder towardes geuer remission lord whan spoken pharisee sayed vnto woman thy synnes forgeuen theeand sayed vnto thy sinnes forgeuen thee made praiers wordes made confession wordes dyd muche euidently confesse herselfe doinges muche effectually praye teares christe moste acceptable confession sorte prayer moste soonest moued shewe mercie happie teares blissed waste losse swete oyle blessed ky winne iesus speake suche worde thy synnes forgeuen thee christ one forgeueth reserueth backe doeth freely pardone sinnes together imputyng parte former naughtie liuing vnto persone penitent botome herte pand sate meate hym began saye within themselues whiche forgeueth synnes also sayed woman thy fayth hath saued thee goe peace marke agayne pharisaicall holynesse true godlynesse doeth veraily reioyce bodyes good chaunces owne phariseis sate altogether table enuying mercifulnesse iesus vnto womanne beeyng oppressed synne begoonne secrete thoughtes murmoure agaynst hym theyr hertes saying felowe whiche taketh muche vpon hym hauyng none authoritie owne remitteth sinnes whiche power one prophetes patriarkes hitherto hath vsurped priestes neither take ferther thyng vnto praye synnes people iesus knowyng theyr secrete thoughtes would confirme woman herte sende home agayne house glad woman sorowfull sayed vnto thy feith constaunt truste hath saued thee goe thy wayes peaceand said woman thy feyth hath saued thee phariseis perswaded themselues synnes forgeuen burnt sacrifice washynges dede thynges certayne figure thynges ghostly lorde iesus playnly shewed vnto synnes throughe feith ghospell full whole forgeuen euer suche repente emende thus thinges whiche haue made rehersall hath vnder certayn shadowe sette forth certayne representyng people wete iewes gentyles whiche two people one saye iewes kynde louyng pretense wordes call bydde christe vnto cry space many hundred yeres come thou lorde tarye whan come neyther theyr owne party receyue theyr bounden duetie haue doen beare themselues bolde false perswasion holynesse whiche conceyued theyr hertes throughe outewarde obseruyng lawe yet morouer murmoure whine agaynst others wer willyng embrace saluacion whan offred attempte laboure throughe oblacion outwarde bodily thynges establyshe owne righteousnesse subiecte righteousnesse god feyth freely geuen people gentile whome christe come forasmuche besides ydolatrie reigned wer morouer altogether wedded al kinde vice ne affiaunce woorkes lawe whiche altogether ignoraunte assoone knowleage iesus ye might saie forceably breake plain simplicitie feith made woorthie haue remission grieuous offence withall possible earnest good myndes embrace kysse fre gift god whiche iewes either set naught el leste wyse coldely faintlye embrace albeit woman exaumple repentaunce sette foorth vnto creature generall whosoeuer shall begynne lothe hate synnefull dooynges turne hymselfe moses phariseis ne vnto philosophiers leat make haste iesus onely none none mercifull none enclined pardone forgeue iesus leat hym poure oute hath tofore accustomed wastefully bestowe wicked sensualitee vnto obedient seruice iesus leat hym consecrate al membres whiche fore serue filthy abhominable lustes touchyng iesus shal take awaie synnes cannot come touche iesus head leat hym touche hym fete parte iesus basse yt maye make hym whole al synnes woman perfeictely cured healed bloudy flixe whiche touched skirtes iesus garmente iesus wel contented bee imputed himselfe whatsoeuer ientilnesse pleasure hath bestowed neighbour yea ue moste lowest degree acknowelege benefite doen membres leate therefore consideracion sinner bee howe muche hath offended leat hym kepe audite accompte well doinges though would euen poynte rekonyng iesus suche sorte pharisee let veray hert thinke bee naught whole breste conceiue assured hope truste iesus leat hym begyn hate naughtie facion loue let hym begyn loue wiekedly refused cared faythe shal moste mercifull lordes handes obteigne merites coulde possibilitie hope emong al thynges moste honeste theophylus consider three fold soondrie persones firste woman beeyng synner second pharisee third iudge iudge onely none veraye true dede pure staynyng filthinesse vice synne rather veray true fountayne al puritie woman synner dooeth nothyng el wepe wasshe wype kysse enoynte haste thou markes knowe duty true loue charitie towardes thy neighbour pharisee beeyng pussed vp pride iudaicall righteousnesse slaundreously blameth accuseth gracious mercifulnesse salueour thynketh skorne synner also enuieth himselfe beeyng cloggued muche grieuous eiuill suche sorte moste parte perswasion righteousnesse spryngeth habite clothyng choyce meates putting diuersitie betwene one daye wasshynges bodye vesselles whiche serue eate drinke long beyng prayer meditacions lyke thynges whiche haue countenaunce shewe godlye deuocion afore menne whereas none thynges consisteth godlynesse ghospell suche folkes manye put theyr truste confydence thynges suche sorte aboue mencioned bothe wont folishly stande high conceite themselfes thynke vile neyghbours also bee replete enuye slaunderouslye reproue free goodnesse almightie god woman touched pharisee skornful loke would haue shake washynges would haue pourged hymselfe infeccion suche sorte doe despise miserable sinning woman partes sore sicke enuie stately pride disease burdening men false crime muche vncurable theyr owne conceytes opinion seme nothing sicke many time chaunceth menne soner amende notorious open vice suche kepe themselfes hydden vnder cloke holines aduoutrer drounkard felowe drouned riotte idolatrie souldier dooeth hym lusteth man maie sooner conuerte good mynd pharisee enuious persone one standeth owne conceyt backebiter dissembler sate meate beganne saye within themselfes whiche forgeueth sinnes also sayed woman thy faythe hath saued thee goe peace nowe suche maister feaste euen suche geastes also beyng phariseis felowe thissame say remitteth synnes iudge alone none knewe menes hertes alone men myghte haue loked alofte holynesse doeth mauerly courteously correct pride pharisee playeth attorney aduocate synner assoyleth also coumforteth confessyng sinfulnesse must therfore parte euangelical pastour flee exaumple pharisee folow tendre ientlenes iesus receiuyng synners pthe viii chapter fortuned afterward also went throughout city tounes preachyng shewyng kingdome god twelue also certain weomen whiche healed euill spirites infirmity marie whiche called magdalene went seuen deuils ioanna wife chusa herodes stewarde susanna many whiche ministred vnto substaunce great gracious goodnesse iesus towarde synners neuer base lowe degreehe wente thoroughoute city preachyng onely admitte woman alone vnto touchyng feete dyd also sumtymes permitte certayn woman goe aboute place place apostle suffered well hymself also disciple releued liberalitie seruice y twelue discyples assayes euerywhere folowyng end sede euangelicall doctrine might ye largely spred abrode euer tha chaunge place walkyng euery citie village entet said disciple cotinually goyng place place earnestly attendyng onely buisynesse preachyng ghospell nothyng el bee destitute thynges necessary besides forth certaine holy woman folowed iesus whersoeuer wet thei wer suche either deliuered vnclene spirites el healed fro disease emog marie called magdalene lord cast seuen deuils ioanna ye wyfe chusa herodes steward ladie courte becum disciplesse vnto christe one susan also others fewe bearynge mind benefite thei receiued suche meanes thei could helpe businesse gospel forward ministring necessary vnto iesus disciple propre goodes christ beyng poore man hymself chosen poore men also apostle chaungyng seates restyng place goyng forth cotinually one place often coulde euerywhere haue vytayles necessary ready vse occupiyng time mete conueniente first foundacion doctryne ghospel laied lowe degree slender substaunce also learnyng ne authoritie howbeit paul whose disciple longe tyme folowe attende vpon hym mynde laboure owne handes liue findyng folkes much thei haue enough fitte preach ye gospell bound freely departe theyr brother sum porcion yt god hath sent yet notwithstandyng thought thing reaso conscience sowed spiritual foode relieued susteined often nede aide succour thiges necessary body handes suche personnes whose behoufe toke peynes christe woulde teache lyberalytie oughte bee compulsion eche folkes owne accord voluntary admitted dede receiued certain woman cu pany traine suche accorde dyd folowe howbeit neither call send vnto neyther read euer craued required thyng body would ye effectuallye make sum ashamed shameles fashion muche take peines ghospels behoufe yet vnder pretece labouryng ghospell plain force extorcion loke require haue people willes may suffyse necessitie also enough wyll bee maynteined riot excesse truely free liberalitie good people shall neuer fail man whiche syncere mynde doeth altogether embuisye occupie preachyng ghospell moreouer iesus lyke admit person euer helpyng forwarde ghospell vse admit eyther mother brother kinsfolkes hindre effectuall procedyng ghospell whan muche people gathered together cum hym oute cyties spake similitude sower wente sowe feede sowed sum fell waye syde troden downe foules ayre deuouted vp fe stone soone sprong vp withered away lacked moystnesse felle emong thornes thornes sprang vp choked fell good ground sprang vp bare fruite hundreth folde sayed thinges cryed hath care heare let hym heare certaine daye whan goen forth house vnto lake syde reason great multitude people whiche resortyng vnto heare hym syttyng shoore banke buisely teachyng people great multitude bothe men woman city thereby came rennyng heare hym people gatheryng thycke hym co streigned go bote therehens chayre pulpite taught multitude beyng assembled sortes people spake many thynges vnto vnder misticall derke couert similitude parable partely might effectually stiere vp earneste desyre learne partely might diepely settle reste mindesthe sower went sow ede enpriented mystical derke colour speaking first therefore putte foorth similitude parable aduertise gredie myndes receyue preachyng gospell reakon sufficient haue heard onlesse bestowed whan heard vse exercise godlynesse went forth quod certayn housbandmanne sowe sede dooeth euerywhere caste sede abrode leauyng place voydesum fel ye high way syde c one coue ed muche encreace possible sedes receyued diuerse sondrye place ground beyng euery one eguall fruitfulnesse beare sedes whan cast fell high wayes syde sedes partly wer troden bruised foot suche wente waye remnaunte couered earth birdes ayre dyd eate vpand sum fel emog thornes agayn sedes fell stonie place soyle beyng receyued thynne couert earth whiche scarcely hydde stone sprong vp dede litle earthe ynoughe vnderneathe geue moystre full rypenesse anon shot foorth aboue grounde dryed vp withered awaye soone feruent heate sunne came euen first bladyng perished agayne sedes fell emong thornes sprong vp dede also thornes sprog vp quickely shoote vp commonly sprede themselues abrode thickenesse heigth also corne dooeth came passe blade come good sede smouldred stiefled vp could shoote vp high haue open ayer large yet sedes fall vnluckily fell vpon good earth whan sprong foorth brought fruite hundredfold double whan lorde thus muche sayed paragraph knewe woordes whiche spoken wer perfectely vnderstanded euery bodye yet willyng haue afterward beare wel mynde parable whiche directly concerned welth creature cryed loud voyce saying hath eares apte heare wysedome ghospel leat herken woordes whiche haue nowe spoken requyre haue hearer neyther grosse capacitie vnderstandyng wyl stande gaping yeanyng whan geue eare though halfe slepe apparteyne euery one without excepcion bee lyke vnto dead image haue eares heare haue eares enough serue vnto pharisaicall constitucions towarde doctrine true godlinesse starcke deafe pand disciple asked hym saying manier similitude sayed unto geuen knowe kyngdome god parable whan see see whan heare vnderstande parable sede worde god hose besyde waye hear commeth deiuill taketh awaye woorde hertes leste shoulde beleue saued stone whiche whan heare receyue woorde ioye haue rootes whiche beleue tyme temptacion goe awaye whiche fell emong thornes whiche whan haue hearde go forth choked care rychesse voluptuous liuyng bring foorth fruite whiche fell good ground pure good herte heare worde kepe bryng foorth fruicte pacience disciple whiche nerest iesus moste familiar hym desired hym declare derke misterye parable thus sayed vnto vnto familiar frendes household geuen know misticall secretes kyngdome god courtes temporall kinges haue certain priuities belonging matiers counsail kept priuie multitude common people suche others haue nothyng courte kyngdome ghospell also hath lyke manier secrete priuities belonging whiche many without consideracion good cause vttered euery body auentures must sette forth maye seen onely house holde belonging god almighty court vnto others must enwrapped shadowed derke parable entente suche vnwoorthie persones whan see maye see whan heare maye vnderstande parable secrete menyng sower sonne man grounde herte man seed woorde ghospell yearthly seed heauenly ne proceded man therfore called woorde god sonne man leaueth place voydethe sede word god casteth sede abrode euery partely malice satan partely defaulte man happeneth commyng vp growyng proueth well fewe seed fell waye syde betokeneth whiche light sorte negligently slugyshely heare woorde god byanby euer thing settle theyr myndes commeth deuil putting contrarie thoughtes taketh theyr mynde hearde one enuying theyr welth wicked suggestion doyng let maye atteygne saluacion sonne manne laboreth meanes possible bryng sinner saluacion doeth leaue nothyng vnattempted drawe many euer maye damnacio therefore immediately castyng foorth seed woorde euangelicall flyghyng sodaynely dooeth gather vp ere cleue sticke fast mynde tyme forceth nothyng haue heard furthermore sede receyued stonie grounde dooeth sygnifye whiche hearyng woorde receiue ioye laye vp mynde lyke freashe grene blade late sowen corne newely shotte vp aboue grounde shewe hope token godlynes themselues certain outward thinges forasmuch thing haue heard throughly impriented hath taken sure rootyng wer inmost affeccion hertes litle time obedyently rewled word god whan bloustryng storme euils dooeth arise quaille forsake good beginnyng easie thyng prosperitie kepe doctrine ghospel thou haue throughly sucked conceiued earnest affeccion zele towardes true godlynesse whatsoeuer tyme aduersitye requireth stout strength euangelicall hert face holynesse shewed tyme doeth vanishe away sede fell emong thornes dooeth sygnifie whiche haue receiued sede goddes woorde beare away frute true godlynesse thereby affeccion towardes better liuyng stifled oppressed care worldand whiche fell emong thornes c ryches sensuall pleasure preset life sede cast vpon good yearth betokenethe whiche sincere herte taking dilygent hede void vaine affeccions dooe receiue holsome worde lay vp memorie cause throughly synke downe bottome affeccions assaulte euils thei remoued earnest exercise godlynesse ons entered begonne man whan lighteth candele couereth vessell putteth vnder table setteth candelsticke whiche entre may see light nothyng secrete shall cum abrode neither thyng hid shall knowen cum light take hede therfore ye heare whosoeuer hath hym shalbe geuen whosoeuer hath hym shalbe taken euen whiche supposeth hath parable therfore iesus vouchesalue expounde disciple seuerally themselues partely learne parable lyke maner godly curiositie serche derke menig themno man whe lighteth candle couereth wt vessel c partely afterwarde whan due tyme occasion myght preache openly al creature thing whiche tyme heard secrete vnderstandyng holy doctrine cleare lyghte geueth parte lighte abrode others dooeth geue entent haue kepte hidden maye shewe lyghte abrode many man saieth doth light candell beeyng lighted dooeth couer vessell ne setteth vnder table fyrst setteth candlesticke ende suche personnes come house may se light nothing deliuered vnto priuately entrieked wrapped derke parable hereafter must opened whole worldtake hede therfore howe heare nothing derke closely hydden fro vnderstandyng vnlearned processe tyme shall brought shal bee sette forth knowlage al creature wherefore ye muste take euen verye speciall good heede ye great carefulnes imprint mindes thinges ye heare nothyng fall remembraunce peryshe greedily receyueth vnderstandyng mistical doctrine god diligently laieth vp heart treasure declareth hymselfe worthy haue mo thinges committed vnto credite forasmuche diligently kepeth whiche geuen vnto hym hath shall haue geuen hym whoso owne negligence leseth thyng suche one shall onely haue geuen vnto also euen whiche semed haue shalbe taken away rechelesly kepte euangelicall treasour wherewithall muche rycher one muche doeth couet still ferther ferther enriched came mother brother could cum preasse told hym said thy mother thy brother stand without would se aunswered said vnto mother brother whiche heare word god doe concernyng suche lyke matter lord iesus put foorth many parable vnto people euery one expou ded seuerally vnto disciple lord would declare precious thyng doctrine gospell great diligece carefulnesse ought bothe taughte receiuedthan came hym hys mother brethre happened certain day iesus teaching people mother brother came place beyng desirous faine haue spoke sum matter whatsoeuer concernynge theyr familye houshold thei could cum ye thicke preasse ye multitude wherfore word geue others mother brother stode dore desirous speake iesus declare woorde ghospell precious thyngmy mother brethre hear word god ought broken interrupted worldly affeccions care householde buisynesse affayres made aunswer geuen hym word matter mother brother whiche heare woord god dooe geuyng therby lesson carnall kynred ought regarded acknowelaged long ofte matter concernyng soule health hand chaunced certain day went ship disciple also sayd vnto let v goe ouer vnto side lake launched forth sailed fell aslepe arose storme wind lake filled water ieopardy came awoke saying mayster maister lost arose rebuked winde tempest water ceassed wered calme said vnto fayth feared wondered among selfes saiyng thinke ye comaundeth bothe wyndes water obey thyng moreouer also lordes wyll pleasure true matter dede teache vnto discyples howe al matter trouble busines meanes wherof world would time cum arise foreward procedynges gospell ought falle despaire mynde trust strength depende rest helpe help shal faile v perilles daungers leastewyse yf want faythfull trust hym wyll prayer procedyng botome hert call aide succour befell therfore certain daye iesus whan taught people daie long entred bote disciple bid make passage ouer vnto side tyme drawyng well toward nyghte sailling iesus fell slepe meane season sodainly arose piere wind troubled water reason waues cumming fast ouer ship disciple ieopardye beyng sore afrayed went vnto iesus reised slepe saiyng maister thou slepest perishe iesus arisyng vp rebuked wynde roughnesse water bid still immediatelye bothe elementes wete bothe aier water acknowlaged lorde co maundement immediatly folowed great caulmnesse stilnesse theim bothe beyng doen turned disciple chidyng sore afrayed presece seeing thei hard hym often teach nothing hurt least way thei would kepe stedfast continuall faith truste towarde thus sayed becu faithfull truste ye shoulde haue truely defaulte therof thyng reised vp troublous blousteryng upon coumpanie carryed ship whan sawe whole tempest soodainly quieted momet onely voice rebukyng seing certain manifest token sum thyng aboue coumpace man reache take feare also great woundrying hym muche saied man thissame dooeth onely commaunde charge spyrites goe men also hath rewle commaundemente ouer dead deaffe elementes sea windes obey commaundemetes often therefore shall fortune v also bee ieopardy often iesus slepeth mides let v godly desire plucke ye sleue let v continual praiers awake reise immediately shall tempeste bee tourned caulmnesse ambicion euyll winde wrathfulnesse hatred perillous wheorlewyndes naughty corrupt desire bee horrible waues sourges yea readye ouerwhelme barge minde turne vpsidedoune lord reised slepe may commaunde rewle mocions streight way shall tempeste ceasse thei sailled region gaderenites whiche ouer galilee whan went lande mette citie certain man whiche deuill long tyme ware clothes neither abode house graues whan saw iesus cyred fell doune loude voyce said haue dooe thee iesus thou sonne god highest beseche thee torment commaunded foule spirite cum man ofttymes caught bound chaynes kept fetter brake bandes carryed fiend wildernesse iesus asked saiyng thy name said legio many deuils wer entered besought would commaud theim goe diepe heard swine fedyng hille besought would suffre enter suffered went deuils man entred swine heard ranne headlog violence lake choked whan heardmen sawe chaunced fled tolde citie village came see doen came iesus found man deuils departed sittyng fete iesus clothed right mynd afraied also whiche sawe tolde meanes possessed deuils healed multytude gaderenites besought would departe taken great feare water beeyng made caulme still saylled lande gaderenites whiche right ouer galilee part neather lower arabiethere met hym certayne man deuill long tyme whan cum foorth shippe land mette certayn man great long season possessed vexed outragious cruell spirite muche neyther could kept couered clothes yet rope chaines kept home within dores went wandryng graues dead folkes oftentymes woulde flye vpon suche passed way man rennyng forth noise stranger arriuing sawe iesus withoute good turne benefite part iesus takyng pitie compassion manne commaunded wicked spirite departe partie possessed ye deuil fel downe knee iesus certain priuie power vertue godhed drawen partie vnto vncleane spirite made houge roring ye mouth miserable selie creature sayd iesus sonne high god heaue haue thee beseche thee torment mehe fell downe c comaundement ye lord wrought strongly vpon hym leaue manne long space vexed many tymes ofte would wicked spirite cease man woulde manifold pieteous sortes moste cruelly tormente vexe breakyng fetter chaines al thinges boud withall bee driuen feased deuill desert place wherfore sayed spirite yll wyllyng loth leaue olde habitacion yea moreouer full sore afeard este day cum whiche bee adiudged euerlastyng payne torment helle eternally punished euil woe world torment plague men withal repentaunce euill doynges enforced praiers feare punishemente iesus ende greatnes miracle bee better knowen folkes demaunded wicked spirite name auswered legio mening souldierly word perteinig warfare manne possessed one deuill alone immunerable multitude deuils one great sinne without great ambushmente vyces together clouster sickenesse mynde greuous none great multitude great offeces geueth place departeth commaundemente iesus deuyls beyng feare therof praied iesus case could bee auoyded thei must nedes cast thei yet least wyse myght commaunded go doune depe pitte hell whiche place know ordeined last day iudgemetthere heard swyne c ferre thesame place vpon certain hill whiche lay harde maner directly aboue thesame water greate heard swyne feedyng pasture euen point may perceyue ye said countrey heathen wholy geuen al vngodlines ye iewes lawe ne might eate swynes fleshe deuils made request sufferaunce lorde myght haue libertie flitte man said hogges great desyre iuste wicked spirites doe hurt mischiefe iesus make ye thyng bothe euident also terrible suffred haue desire immediately deiuils leaft man wet hogges streyght way al whole hearde carried hedlong furious rage fast might driue poole drowned stone dead soone swyneheardes sawe sore afrayed went thei way thence fast thei might renne tounes village beare tydynges al happened inhabitauntes countreye scarcely beleuyng tale swyneheardes tolde went foorth see prouffe token vncredible matier cumming place see hearde peryshed loste whiche litle hearde mighty great multitude man also whiche tyll tyme possessed many deiuils notable mischiefe countrey well knowen vnto euery body hym fynde quiet pacient whole mynde wearyng clothes bodie sitting fete iesus harbourer deiuils sodaynly made disciple scholar iesus whereas fore tumbled dryuen wicked spirites kyndes mischief ientyll meke spirite merciful lorde framyng earnest deuout exercise godlynesse ferthermore whiche present hadde theyr owne iyes seen possessed deiuilsand found sitting feete iesus heard legion saye great noumbre deiuils nowe sawe hym suche litle made perfectly whole reported ye residue people befallen wherupon certayne feare came vpon rather haue glorified god louingly enbraced power restored health miserable creature beyng otherwise past hope recouerie would fayne therfore haue iesus goen people dreding power knowyng goodnesse moued losse theyr cattel health man restored yet durste thei bolde banishe driue region gerasens ientilly desyre praye name whole countreye departe theyr coastes great feare taken possessed gat hym shyppe returned backe agayne man whome deuils departed besought hym might bee iesus sent hym awaye saying goe home agayne thyne owne house shewe thynges soeuer god hath doen thee went way preached throughout cite thynges soeuer iesus doen vnto hym iesus woulde caste holy thing emong dogges returned agayne shippe partie whiche deliuered deuils desyred iesus might continue coumpaignye awayte hym seeyng bound vnto hym alone none receiuing health iesus woulde suffre sayed vnto hym returne thine owne house ende thyne owne relacion sight thee folkes maye certaynely knowe thou afore thou arte benefite godand shewe thi ge soeuer god hath doen thy countreymen refuse haue come emong yet bee thou leastewyse wytnesse emong ill frendes haue themselues castyng theyr region man obeyed lordes biddinges goyng decapolis throughout euery citie declared talked coumpaynies came emongst great high benefites receyued handes iesus page duplicate page duplicate thissame yet manier entreaunce fyrst settyng foorth preachyng gospel emong folkes beyng grosse wieked veraye well resembled swyne whiche deuils flitte whan lefte man neyther open publyshyng man sayed deiuils fore possessed altogether vayne many beleue meruayl thyng certes exaumple figure lorde iesus geue lesson v grace ghospell ought profered euery bodye bee neuer wieked yet notwithstandyng thesame bee thrust theyr lappes beeyng vnwillyng receyue also refusyng agayne syde muste leafte forsaken sparke true godlynesse lefte emongst whiche one daye tyme come maye occasion appere sparcle vp pand fortuned whan iesus come agayne people receyued awayted hym beholde came man named iairus rewter sinagogue fell downe iesus fecte praying hym woulde come house one daughter onely vpon twelue yeares age laye dying iesus therfore went backe agayne shippe galilee whence come greatly spoke wondreful euery mane mouth returnyng great multitude men receiued great missyng looke returne ye gerasenes beholde eftsons occasion whiche mighte declare aswell howe readye iesus helpe euery body bothe ryche poore good bad also muche behinde beleuyng trustyng god emong iewes semed chiefe pillours religion whiche emong inferiour people accoumpted moste vile abiect one chiefe synagogue called iairus came iesus iairus daughter within litle ouer vnder age twelue yeares euen nowe dying fell downe therfore feete iesus desyryng woulde vouchesalue come home house helpe daughter whiche euen present laye dying suche like sorte phisician wont called tyme vrget nede come proue thou canst doe howe muche full feithfull truste beliefe centurion whiche sayed yt nede bodely presence iesus hable mere woorde mouthe helpe heale lusteth iesus folowed desire iairus made haste towardes house went people thronged hym woman hauyng issue bloude twelue yeares whiche spent substaunce vpon phisicians neyther could holpen came behynde hym touched hem rayment immediately hir issue bloude staunched nd iesus sayed hath touched whan euery man denyed peter hym sayed maister people thruste thee vere thee sayest thou hath touched iesus sayed bodye hath touched per eynt ertue goen whan woman sawe hid came tre blyng fell fecte tolde hym people cause touched hym howe healed immediatly sayed vnto daughter good coumforte thy feyth hath saued thee goe peace loe goyng waye thitherwarde reason throng people wexed thicke euery syde great desyre euery bodye bothe heare see iesus manier borne downe emong euen emongst thickest people hadde wroong thrust emongst certain woman sicke spare twelue yeares bloudy flixe disease lothely muche abhorred loue health hadde bestowed substaunce vpon phisicians whiche time tyme fed forth fayre promise easing paine howbeit holpe nothyng cast another disease pouertie afore good wise woma beyng destitute mannes helpe tooke refuge vnto goddes helpe conceyuyng meruaylous truste iesus might touche parte hym thyng healed notwithstandyng muche ashamed come forth hym discouer foule disease shamed willing preu e stealth geat benefite health crepte gotte hym behynde backe touched vtmoste skirt garment whiche throng people drawen waye waye immediately perceiued disease gon bloudie flixe clene stopped verayly iesus nothyng enuyed sycke woman health willyng shewe vnto rewler synagogue iewes paterne perfect feythi perceyue vertue gone sayed hath touched whan others went nexte vnto hym sayed touched hym peter disciple whiche nexte vnto iesus neuer heles saied maister thicke presse throng people doeth euery side come vpon thrust thee thoughe wer two three doest thou aske hath touched thee iesus geuyng woord speakyng common manier touching disciple mene aunswered bodie hath touched common facion touchyng one another goyng otherwyse knoweth himselfe whosoeuer touching felte certayne vertue procede forth vnto partie touched methe ei hath saued whan bodie made aunswer iesus cast iyes aboute coumpaynie thoughe soughte would priuily haue stolen benefite woman knowing doen halfe stealth vnknowen iesus came foorth great feare fallyng feete confessed people bothe cause touched hym also howe immediately healed disease whereof sore sicke whole twelue yeares space physician takyng great labour vayne moste mercifull lorde droue parforce confession shame woman detectyng declare vnto iewes muche howe great thyng assured feith maye doe iesus comfortyng woman beyng feare lookyng lesse great rebuke hir presumption sayed daughter thy feith hath deserued haue thy health geuen thee goe peace benefyte bee euer saying touched nipped pharisee scribe put hope owne workes goodnesse god pwhile yet spa e came one rewlees synogogues house whiche sayed thy daught r ade disease mayster whan iesus hearde woorde aunswered father damosell feare beleue onelye shall bee made whole nd wh n h came house suffered manne go hym saue peter iames iohn fath r mother marden euery body wepte folowed sayed wepe damosell deade slepeth laughed hym skorne knowyng ade thruste oute caught th hande cryed saying mayde aryse hir spirite came agayne sh aro est reygh waye commaunded geue hir meate father mother hir astouned warned tell man doen lorde iesus yet ended speakyng woordes whan one mayster synagogue house came rennyng sayed sir neuer trouble ne disease ye lorde fe ther lyke come vayne thy daughter already dead felow brought worde thought ne greater ne higher opinion beliefe iesus especiall good phisician coulde haue holpen beeyng sicke alyue reyse agayn beeyng dead meanes hable dooe whan iesus sawe iairus deadly astouned amased newes conforted hym saying afrayed onely haue thou feithfull beliefe gierle shalbe safe whan come maister sinagogues house iesus woulde suffre moe multitude goe doores hym peterbeleu shal made whole iames iohn also father mother gierle whan came found house full mourning dead mayden wept bewayled frendes kinsfolkes whiche dewtie office mournyng commonlye dooen great ryche folkes theyr deathes pryde honour sorowe make appoynte certayne nonce make lamentacion syng doulfull songes mourning shewe outwarde countenaunce sorow wepyng wryngyng theyr handes beatyng tearyng themselues pompe vayne shewe iesus refreigne forbid saying make none wepyng mayden deade slepeth hym derision sayingwepe c knewe certaynely dead dede iesus entreyng veraye fewe persones inner chambre dead corpse mayden laye toke hande muche like though awake lepe saying good loude voyce mayden arise folowed creature liue doeth lightlier awake slepe voyce calleth vp mayden arose agayne death lyfe soone iesus spake vnto onely soule lyfe retourned agayne tabernacle hir body whens tofore departed also arose vp walked house mery lustie euer iesus thentent shoulde bee certayne euident declaracion life perfectely restored vnto hir wylled meat geuen vnto hir whiche thyng whan father mother gierle sawand h commaud g u h r ate wer greatly astouned iesus gaue great charge shoulde make wordes creature thyng happened though veray fayne miracle shoulde bee knowen fewe partelye teache v ought hunte glory prayse well dooynges handes men partely signifie figure exaumple light faultes rebuke secretely geuen may sufficient gierle beeing deade dooeth betoken man throughe weakenesse frailtie fallen syn deathe yet freashe corpse come abrode open fight therfore multitude beeing shut without doores matier al ended fewe person made priuie vnto happie blissed whome iesus doeth vouchesalue take hande ix chapter iesus called twelue togetherthe gaue power autoritie ouer deiuils might heale disease sent preache kyngdome god heare sicke sayed vnto take nothyng iourneye neyther staffe sc ip neyther breade neither money neither haue two coates whatsoeuer house ye entre abyde thence departe whosoeuer wyll receiue whan ye goe citie shake veray dust feete testimonie agaynst departed went tounes preachyng ghospell healyng euery hitherto iesus execute administre office preachyng ghospell owne persone framyng meane space traynyng twelue apostle many soondrye wayes men receiuing holy ghoste succede tyme come office preachyng yt aie cause would wyse haue continuall witness actes preachyng entent meane season themselues also might shewe paterne saumple themselues towardes executing great office euen lord beyng yet alyue might assaye proue well coulde dooe called euery one together one placeand gaue power autoritie ouer deuils lesson token ought bee discorde ne disagreyng emong theyr preachyng thentente preachyng suche poore meane felowes vnlearned persones shoulde vttrely altogether lacke autoritie gaue vnto moreouer vertue power cast kynde deuils heale al kynde disease mete whiche shoulde preache kyngdome god haue power ouer wicked deuils enemy god also suche shoulde preacher doctrine whiche healed al disease mind lacke vertue heale manier disease bodye yea ferthermore conuenient people allured woonne profession ghospell good turnes benefites rather thynges terrour accordyng exaumple sayeth selfe haue geuen see gladly freely vse power heal yng al people disease misery see ye corrupte synceritie purenesse preachyng ghospell suspicion dooyng aduauntage lucre appoynted vnto playne wordes ought teache gaue commission suche thyng teache ceremony lawe whiche shoulde short tyme abolished teache blynde constitucions men scribe pharises vsed teache go rounde bothe sea lande make one selie proselite nouice secte gaue commau demente teache kyngdome god hande kyngdom god consist outwarde thynges bee dooen bodye spirite vertue thus muche preache vnto rude ignoraunt people present tyme begynnyng sufficient preparyng mennes hertes vnto higher doctrine carefulnesse thynges necessarie sustentacion bodye meanes lette buisinesse ghosphell sayed vnto carrye kynde page duplicate page duplicate baggage aboute waye neither staffe defende withall ne scrippe kepe meate store ne purse wherein putte money expensestake nothig iourney nether sta scrip charge necessarie twoo coates bee ye well assured ye shall lacke one thynges yf ye shall pure hertes according tenour commaundement diligently prouide labour ghospell go forwarde dayly encrease euery shal whose voluntary ientilnesse liberalitie shal geue muche beeyng men lyue hande mouthe bee content litell maye tymes sufficient neither shall ye haue cause pe sife carefulland soeuer house ye entre bee enterteined lodgeyng harbour wheresoeuer ye knowe woorthie mete kyngdome god turne ye theyr house continue soiourne leste yf ye euery whyle bee flyttyng one house another ye maye seme haue dooen sekyng deyntie fare beeyng content suche chere ye shall fynde tarie ye long house thesame persones vntill good procedyng encrease ghospell shall aduertise go forward another place shall happen bodye receiue theyr house yet acknowlage remembre woorthynesse dignitie office bee ouer earnest thrust lappes whether thyng euery creature ought moste specially craue streightwayes forsake ye citie beeyng ferre takyng kynde commoditie suche persones wilfully reiecte preachyng ye shake caste backe agayne vnto yea euen veraye duste maye happily chaunce haue stycked foot playnly testifying protesting vnto ye haue frely preached kyngdome god vnto haue made themselfes vnworthie great gifte freely profered vnto themand departed whan iesus many woordes mo enstructed armed apostle foorth went twoo twoo together goyng round euery towne village preached euerywhere kyngdome god come whersoeuer found menne possessed deuils sicke daungier impediment bodye healed name iesus firste rudimente entreaunce apostle preachyng herode zetrarche heard doen hym doubted sayed iohn arisen agayn death helias appered one olde prophetes arysen agayne herode sayed iehu haue beheaded heare suche thynges desired see hym reason thynges name iesus bruited abrode made famous reporte workynges doynges came eue eares herode tetrarche whereas knewe iesus heard sate certain man byddyng word could cast deiuils put awaye disease restore lame suche taken sinowes shrounken make clene lepres rayse vp dead life agayn great doubte wonderously troubled mynde man might sodaynly sprong vp boasted abrode iesus iohn herode litle tofore flayne iohn haue returned lyfe agayne therefore beyng made halfe god bee wexed mightye dooyng suche great miracle others said helias beeyng taken vp fiery chariot iewes loke cum agayn accordyng prophecie malachias agayne sum supposed sum olde prophetes memorie whiche prophetes high holy great reuerence among iewesiho haue beheaded howbeit herode fearing owne behalf yf iohn reuiued put death reckening thing vncredible yt man dead returned life saied iohn mine self haue caused beheaded beyng dispatched rid world thought none left liue would haue enterprised suche great matter felow heare much greater thinges euer iohn wrought hereupo earnestly sought sum occasio haue sight made better thereby satisfie curiositie knowe thynges orels case thinke good euen thatsame doen iohn afore iesus forasmuche knew herodes mynd welinough would cum seen cum purpose fede delite iyes wicked prince miracle bring simple poore folkes helth beheaded like predestinate vnto high exalted standard ye crosse apostle returned tolde al doen toke went aside solitary place high vnto citie called bethsaida whiche whan people knew folowed receiued spake vnto kingdom god healed nede healed twelue returned home vnto iesus greate cherefulnes declaring preaching gospell well prospered great miracle euen thei also doen name iesus called backe vnto sobrenesse humilitie teachyng shoulde wexe thyng haulte ne take thing highly vpo theim prosperous successe maner thiges enfourmed miracle wrought doen power god men thesame oftentimes shewed foorth men suche predestinate euerlastyng life onely godlynesse mynd doeth make man blessed whether haue ye power worke miracle accordyng tyme requireth orels haue iesus therfore purpose teache dede selfe liuely practysyng verye thyng sort ought fede multitude foode god word ghospell whiche learned went aside oute cumpany desert place thei might repose theselfes awhile ye labour iourney place great resorte people could haue maner tyme respite muche eate meate away therefore solitarye place hard citie galile called bethsaida whiche natiue cou trey peter andrewe philip thre doubtelesse departyng aside place solitary bestowed vpon fond sensual pleasure slepe vpon quietnes pray geue thakes god sorte ought pastyme relaxacion suche men folowers apostle assone spred abrode bruite ye people whither iesus conueyed hymselfe solitary innumerable multitude people gatheryng together clousters euery sideand receiued went wyldernesse iesus seeing gredy desire came solitarie place gon repose hymselfe littell mynde putte away hym went accord mete teachyng disciple therby lesson also little shorte tyme reposyng theselues ought euen anon eftsones returne restyngand spake vnto kingdoe god vnto office preaching ghospell whan iesus cum foorth sawe infinite multitude menne woman chyldren cu great iourney foote diuerse place deserte shepe wandryng hither thyther lacke shepeheard beeyng moued pitie compassion first fed soules speakyng vnto many thinges kingdome god heale whiche holden great disease malady body whan day began away came twelue said vnto send people away may goe tounes neer village lodge geat meate place wildernes said vnto geue ye eate thei said haue mo fiue loaues two fyshes except goe bye meate people fyue thousand men said cause sitte doune fyfties coumpany made sitte doune toke fiue loaues two fyshes loked vp heauen blissed brake gaue disciple set people eate satisfied take vp remained twelue basket full broken meate thinges doyng daye began drawe towardes ende apostle consyderyng multitude infinite eue ide drawe nere place bee ferre towne village vytayles put iesus litell remembraunce saiyng leat goe people season goyng next litell townes village may geat themselues meate desert place meate gotten iesus shewe whiche harte applyed doctrine gospel prouided neuer lacke meate also minding miracle whiche entended shewe euident auswered disciple nede purpose depart hen townes village rather geue ye meate selues shewyng vnto theim thesame woorde thyng also dooeth otherwhyles appertaine duetie one supplieth apostle roume relieue necessitye flocke part owne substaunce neuer small apostle tyme lacked good willwe haue mo fiue loaues two fyshes sory men thei lacked habilitie therfore thei auswer maner haue bytte meat world fiue loaues two fish prouision scarcely enough v fewe oure supper excepte percase bee thy pleasure shall gooe nexte tounes village aboute bye meate asmuche may serue great multitude therunto nede haue good summe money wheras haue right small store money among v wer almost full noumbre fyue thousand men sayed iesus cause ye sitte downe compaynies deuide themselues sitte fiftie fiftie compaynyeand fiue thousand men dooe make feaste great noumbre vse appoynte determinate noumbre persones mess euery table butler seruitours maie knowe muche appoynte prepare apostle although sawe prouision toward yet lordes commaundement thei bydde people sit compaynies afore sayed euen though meate shoulde immediately sette afore people also syde euen lyke playnesse doe bidden iesus therfore manne newe straunge facion bee feaster geastes toke fyue loaues twoo fish liftyng vp iyes streight heauen firste halowed luckie woordes multiplying brake thesame delyuered piece meale vnto disciplesand h toke fiue loaues blissed set people euery one refreashed muche woulde eate ferre wer lackyng thyng whan euery body satisfied largest twelue baskettes ful broken meate gathered handes disciple matier lyeth hidden figurate representacion secrete doctrine apostle prouision viaundrie suche belongeth iesus viaundrie lyke lyght pryce course geare poore folkes eatyng litle quantitie doctrine moses manyfolde philosophiers learnyng soondrie manier sortes matiers ful plenteous stuffe worde ghospell playne homely geare short yet suche maie suffise soules nacions refreashed case deliuered receyued ought bee men apostle profession worde committed wherewith soules made fatte thesame woorde doe sette afore people fede except firste consecrated broken christe neuer el true fruite preachyng ghospell teacher dooe presumpteouslye vsurpe hymselfe gift learnyng whiche hath thyng commytted credite ne vndiscretely misaduisedly shewe foorth thoughe owne yelde vnto christe bee made holy otherwyse vain shall teacher labour bee preacheth onlesse iesus shall firste haue blissed woorde onlesse shall haue broken onlesse shal handes deliuer distributed people piththye effectuall whatsoeuer procedeth hys holy handes fedeth refresheth maketh full bishop nothing el minister distributoures mannes liberalitie people sitteth coumpanies vpon ground nothyng stickyng doubtyng nothyng murmuryng repinyng whereby signified faithfull congregacion christes churche oughte sobre humilitie plain faithfull truste heart god without doublenesse discorde sedicious vproare ought away co sider ferthermore mysterie lorde iesus firste thynges taught healed people fedde afterward woorde god also heauenly meate soule sum porcion hereof denayed vngodly newely entered instructed faythe medicine mennes soules refeccion weake holsome doctrine worketh like effect soules sinner iesus worde touchyng disease body mistical bread whiche geuen persones already wel taught also throughly healed thesame forsouth heauenly breade lordes body geue yet baptisme receyued body churche congregacion ne vnto suche whose mynde soule holden grieuous cryme wer mortall sickenesse meate priuie hidden wysedome god paule apostle dyd shewe foorth emong perfect vttered vnto persones auenture pand fortuned alone praying disciple hym asked saying saye people aunswered sayed iohn baptyste saye helias saye one olde prophetes eu sayed vnto saye ye simon peter aunswered sayed thou art christe god warned commaunded tell man thyng saying sonne man must suffre many thynges reproued elder high priestes scribe bee slayne ryse agayn thyrde daye lorde tempered sayinges dooynges while would shewe forth toke godly power another tyme would manifestely shew veritie humayn nature opinios men concernyng hym dyd muche varie requisite emong appoynted renewe world bee one vniforme profession perfectly agreyng selfe concernyng hymwho saye people time whan prayer solitarie disciple demaunded opinion people hym sayed disciple aunswere suppose thee bee iohn baptiste reuiued agayn saye thou arte helias iewes thynke shall come agayne messias shall come others beleue one man olde prophetes called lyfe agayn sayed iesus people inconstaunt waueryng woont ye knowe nerer familiarly dooeye saye petur beeyng ardent fyerie residuesimon peter aunswered saied thou art christe god c made aunswere name al know thee messias god hath enoynted heauenly gyftes grace theyr right profession iesus dede alloweth well yet geueth great charge shoulde make woordes creature opinion sayed tyme openyng misterie open face worlde yet come sacrifice death muste firste bee executed accomplished appoynted come glorie name many kyndes despite reproche sonne man sayeth muste abyde muche woe must bee reproued thelders scribe chiefe priestes yea length bee slaine aryse agayne death lyfe third daie ye muste therfore beware leste glorye euen name present preached fynd feyth credited affliccion death bodye might let death pand sayed vnto man wyll come leat hym denye hymselfe take vp crosse dayly folow whosoeuer wyll saue lyfe shall loose whosoeuer dooeth lose life sake shall saue auauntageth man winne whole worlde lose himselfe runne damage himselfe whoso ashamed woordes shall soonne manne ashamed cometh maiestie maiestie father holye aungels tell trueth standing shall ast death till see kyngdome god petur mencionyng deathe trembled quaked veraye feare aduised christe better way whan iesus putte hym silence begoonne exorte disciple also folowyng deathe saiyng thus hathe pleased father thys waye muste come glorye whoso wyll bee disciple myne yf gladly desyre bee partaker blisfulnesse muste necessitye bee folower deathe afore enoughe goe folowyng fote hel goe muste folowe deedes el acknowelage hym disciple whosoeuer shall come office preachyng ghospell must denye hymselfe altogether muste renounce care worlde euer rychesse pleasure promocions kyns olkes affeccions yea lyfe selfe also muste euery daye take crosse hys backe hauing mynde euermore readye vnto suche thynges ye see abyde endure wyll goe maister leat hym come whosoeuer shall bee mynded bee disciple neyther anye cause ye shoulde feare bee slayne peryshe bee preserued whosoeuer shall lose lyfe sake thesame hath set lyfe perfeicte safetye contrary side whosoeuer stertyng backe shrynking away buisy charge ghospel shall haue mynde saue lyfe hys bodye thesame shal lose life soule alone none bee reckened true lyfe preseruyng lyfe parte wise man gladlye take losse thynges worlde shall auayle manne yf wynne euer worlde hath woorthye bee desired whan hath loste hys owne selfe whan mannes selfe dyeth thynges also gotten perished gone hym perisheth altogether dede whoso hath loste euerlastyng lyfe leate disciple myne thinke shame suffre thynges whiche selfe shall suffre leate hym bee ashamed professe doctryne afore worlde whosoeuer shall bee ashamed woordes men one offended slaundred worldly shame crosse suche one shall sonne man agayne bee ashamed whan laiyng downe infirmitie fleashe shal come secoud time shewyng foorth vnto whole vniuersall worlde maiestye hymselfe father hys holy aungelles doubte ye nothing thing saye shall one day come passe affirme vnto matter assured trueth bee emong standyng whiche shall departe life shal fyrst parte se maiestye kyngdome god thyng nowe lyeth hidden shall one daye tyme come made open manifeste vnto creature pand fortuned aboute eyght dayes saiynges tooke petur iohn iames wente vp mountayne praye praied facion countenaunce chaunged garmente whyte shone beholde talked hym two men whiche moses helias appered ye spake departiyng whiche ende hierusalem petur wer heauy slepe whan awoke sawe maiestie twoo men standing iesus perfourme promysse whiche nowe made dyd theight day woordes speaking choose three xii apostle e petur iames iohn according accustomed woont gotte hym vp mountaine praye prayyng face soodaynly chaunged lykenes replete maiestie glorye garmentes shone white snowe seene also thesame instaunte two men lyke maiestie talking whome one moses helias lawe figure set christ derkely shadowe prophecy directely poynted oute nowe talkyng twoo wyth iesusand spake depar yng c thing doeth signifie perfeicte agreyng olde newe testamente together talkyng hym concernyng kynde deathe whiche lorde accordyng ye tenour fourme prophecie many daye afore written set foorth theim shoulde afterwarde accomplishe hierusalem thede eftsons delectable swetenesse glorie
