shoulde bee brought tempre mencion deathe al apostle euen veray wel see iyes euen heauye slepe soone awaked playnely sawe maiestie lorde also two men standyng harde pand chaunced departed petur saied vnto iesus maister good beeyng v let v make also three tabernacle one thee one moses one helias wi saied thus spake came cloude ouer shadowed feared thei wer come cloude came voice oute cloude saing dere ne heare ye soone voice paste iesus founde alone kept close told man day thinges whiche seen whiche twoo men begun departe iesus petur fearing leste delectable sight shoulde also goe awaie saied vnto iesus maister goyng whyther oute suche place fare well hierusalem leate goe threateneth put thee death tushe v rather make three tabernacle mountayne one one moses one helias thus spake petur man inebriate made droncken swetenesse vision knowyng sayed required triumphe woonne battaile woulde haue best game rennyngthere came cloude ouer shadowed c tenne euen instaunte tyme petur speakyng woordes soodaynly arose cloude caste shadowe ouer disciple beeyng nowe hable theyr mortall bodie abide beholding greate glorye moses helias wer entreyng cloude wer vanishing awaye iyes ye disciple reason light euangelicall trueth apperyng shadowes misticall derkenesse figure shoulde geue place go voyce heauenly father sowned downe cloude saiyng moses helias prophecied sonne iewes haue hitherto highe estimacion reuerence great men thei two dede yet wer seruauntes thissame sonne dere beloued vnto hert none alone therefore herken ye hym voice thus sounyng eares iesus founde alone leste mighte haue demed testimonie voyce concerne person eue veray onelyiesus found alone sayed three disciple ryght commaunded lorde kept matter close reported priuity vision creature aliue vntill christ arisen againe dea h lyfe passion lordes pleasure haue maiestie godhed published openly spoken tyme deatheand kept close c aswell shoulde bee nothyng myght lette vnto thatsame sacrifice whereby mankynde bee restored also thyng myght bee openly talked whiche man woulde beleue yf bene reported vnder ne therin exaumple true matter dede geue lesson v case excellent good thing v ra h kepe close make vauntes braggues therof case haue special vertue good qualitye v free gyfte god thesame bee declared shewed deedes rather makyng many gaie high woordes pand chaunced nexte daye came hille muche people met hym beholde man coumpaignie cried saiyng maister beseche beholde sonne haue see spirite taketh hym soodaynely crieth knocketh beateth hym foometh againe muche peine departeth whan hath rent hym besought thy disciple cast hym coulde iesus aunswered saied feithlesse crooked nacion howe long shal bee shall suffre bryng thy soonne hither yet cumm ng f ende rent tare iesus rebuked vncleane spirite healed ye childe deliuered father amased high power god nexte daye folowyng iesus came downe hyll said thre disciple foud mighty great multitude people gathered residue disciple hadde lefte behynd hym whan addressed hym goe vp mountayne people assoone espied iesus returnyng agayn went mete hym found great lacke mysse presence happened freshe matter require haue presence one coupaignie cryed hym saiyng maister humbly beseche thee leat extreme miserie sonne mine moue haue mo alone holden extreme tyrannous deuill whiche dooeth euerye whyle soodaynlye take hym vexeth hym sundry way pitie see much greate roaryng flasshyng hym grounde wrestyng limmes though woulde teare body hym fomyng mouthe peine whyle often taketh hym scracelye departeth hym vntyll hys body rent torne praied thy disciple caste spirit best haue bene hable dooe iesus well perceiuyng thyng hadde chaunced reason father vnbeliefe prayed health soonnei besought thy disciple caste coulde consideracion disciple feithe beeyng yet hitherto weake cryed loude voyce saiyng nacion full mistrustyng herte nothyng single howe long tyme shall bee conuersaunt emong shall suffre thynges yet thys whyle bring thus muche passe make haue perfeicte feyth truste dooeth weakenesse thys bodye myne muche leate turnyng hymselfe man requyring hym afore hand haue stedfast feith saied bring thy sonne hither soone young thyng brought iesus eiuil spirite tooke quasshyng chylde groundeand amased myghtye power god immediatelye iesus restored hym hys health gaue father agayne made perfectely whole father brought thither vnpossible cured mannes helpe miserable sight eiuill muche people euery one meruaill see howe quickelye childe holpen hande vertue power god whyle woondred euery one thynges dyd saied vnto hys disciple seate saiynges ncke downe youre care wil come passe sonne men shalbee deliuered handes menne wiste woord ment hidden theim vnderstoode feared aske hym saiyng whan fame iesus weaxed euery daye famous suche actes certayne temptacion worldly glory entred hertes disciple reason hadde suche maister whose name euen also themselfes dyd manye great actes woondred iesus calleth home affeccion contemplacion lowe state abieccion worlde whiche time long come woulde offended slaundred glorie dooeyng miracle sayeth matter delectacion vnto thing much materiall depely enprint hertes sayinges myne myndes dooe gretlye abhorre thyng ought ye moste haue mynde whiche shall behoue euerye one folowe glorie leat alone see thing muste nedes come passe haue already tolde yet nowe agayne saye vnto soonne man whose glorie fame dooeth nowe delite shall ere long attached shall bee deliuered handes menne shall sundrye way suffre much affliccion shal lastely put death tale though bene twise heard mouth yet well settled myndes disciple coulde well beare mynd thing luste hearefor wyll come pa son man abhorred mencion death men setting al mindes glorie iesus hauing al intelligence vnderstanding glorie lord chiefely renoumed made famous open worldely shame hangyng crosse dede hearde speakyng death half dreme nothyng well vnderstandyng thyng ment whiche spoken yet durste demaunde anye question hym woordes might meneand feared aske hym saiyng hauyng freash theyr remembraunces petur whan somewhat ouer bolde buisye iesus hearde iesus saie vnto hym auaunt sight thou satan thou haste saueryng thynges appertein god altogether thinges appertein world pand entred thought emong whiche theim bee greatest whan iesus perceiued thought hertes tooke chylde set hym harde sayed vnto whosoeuer receiueth childe name receiueth whosoeuer receiueth receiueth hym sent least emong al shalbee greatest al iesus wente capernaum forasmuche disciple wer yet carnal seen glory weorking many miracle hearde maiestie kyngdome god promysed theimselfes dooen many woondrefull thynges aboue nature ye name iesus certayn worldly thought entred theim laste braste thus ferre going way reasoned together one whiche shoulde sute highest kyngdome heauen dreamed like order shoulde bee kyngdome heauen seen courtes worldely prince ryche folkes house whiche proude quicker bolder spirited iolier felowe iesus althoughe knewe well enoughe emong theimselfes kept disputacions yet soone come ye house demaunded theim matter hardelye disputed reasoned waie plaiyng mum hauyng woorde saie wer halfe ashamed matter iesus shewe thoughtes priuie talkes behynd backe wer hydden ne vnknowen hym toke litle innocente childe hand set hym hard syde callyng twelue together vnto hym sayed ye dispute greatnesse whiche shalbee greatteste greatteste moste inferiours playne without fraude guyle litle chylde thyng lowe euen veray suche muste ye become ye chiefe kyngdome ghospel kyngdome feith charity knoweth none ambicionwhosoeuer receiueth chylde name acquainted plaiyng lorde skill tirannye whatsoeuer persone receiueth vnto suche childe name receiueth myselfe whosoeuer receiueth receiueth hym hath sent haue plaied lorde towardes reason also shalbe ye chiefe emog haue rather vsed self willing readye seruaunte commodity persones knowe ye shalbee great man emong contemnyng glory humilitie submission feruent affeccion bee seruaunte dooe creature good shalbee least moste inferiour men pand iohn aunswered saied maister sawe one castyng deuils thy name forbad hym folowed v iesus saied vnto forbid ye hym v v hearde hym saye litle one bee receiued name iesus came iohns mynde excluded debarred certayne man fraternitie ministring ghospel therefore doubte whether lyke men bee receiued vnto felowship saluacion ghospell lyke manier men wer admitted ministracion preachyng ghospellwe sawe ne castyng deuils thy name weorkyng miracle poyncte hydden litell spice certaine secret pangue enuye god tofore geuen power vnto twelue onely caste deuils heale disease thys dignitie thoughte e bee made common others therefore iohn saied maister tyme whan beeyng sent foorth thee executed office preachyng ghospell abrode sawe certaine man casting deuils thy name though bee none noumbre v twelue dooeth soe muche folowe thee neyther man one beyng straunger brotherhood forbadde shoulde dooe iesus although would place suffre hymselfe preached wicked spirites yet teacheth men sorte soeuer bee bee forbidden hauyng ghospel although thesame veray sincere hert saith thyng doefor agist v v doe name iesus doe thesame thyng ye dooe whosoeuer aduersarie vnto v doeth euen veraie poynte make syde doeth v thyng straunge possible way euerye published abrode al fauour doeth auaile miracle yt doeth goddes sheweth power man ministre instrument therfore whatsoeuer persone sheweth miracle callyng vpon name dooethe publishe spred abrode glory debarreth al title speake thensforth whose name hath found effectual ful power pand fortuned whan tyme come shoulde bee receiued vp sette face go hierusalem sent messagiers went entred city samaritanes make ready thei would receiue face though would gooe hierusalem whan hys disciple iames iohn sawe saied lord wilt thou commaund fyer come heauen consume euen helias dyd iesus turned rebuked saiyng ye wotte manier spirite ye sonne manne come destroy mennes lyues saue theim went owne befell time beeyng nowe veraye nere hande iesus leauyng yearth receiued vp heauen lorde already entred iourney shewed eue plainly countenaunce bounde towardes hierusalem one purposely minded way agaynst occasio death come therfore sent messagers afore hym twoo three apostle prepaire harbourgh place soiourneyng within certaine citie samaritanes throughe whiche iourney laye whan came tounesmen shutte gate citie coniectured veray facions cou tenaunce apostle gooyng towardes hierusalem samaritanes consideracyon theyr woorshyppyng god mountaine owne hated abhor ed went hierusale way deuocion worship god upon iames iohn hadde sente sayed message sawe vncourtesie inhabitautes whiche woulde suffre much come within precincte towne walles beeyng euen pacience sayed lord maister thy pleasure bidde fier come downe heauen helias ons dyd whiche may consume felowes iesus woulde shewe howe great mildenes teacher ghospell ought bee bridleed wrathefulnesse sharpe rebuke saiyng take ye dede helias exaumple beyng led spirite brought wicked people tyme confusion ye doe yet vnderstand spyrite ye ought bee spirite ghospel meke shall hereafter come time redresse vengeaunce vntill daye sonne man come cast awaie mennes liues soules saue yt presente kepe v towne wil peradueture day hereafter take v therefore bee saued maie bee case repent emende leauyng towne turned waye litle towne wordes iesus toke theyr stomakes al desirefulnesse vengeaunce taught v vse fauourable bearyng towardes suche firste begynnyng woulde exclude kepe doctrine ghospel theim allegeyng enough leaue season vntil might tyme occasion bee conuerted better mynde chaunced walkyng waie certaine man saied vnto folowe whither soeuer thou goe iesus saied vnto hym fox haue hole birdes ayre haue nestes sonne man hath laie head againe fortuned wente certaine man voluntarie mynde sayed vnto iesus folowe whithersoeuer thou shalt goe iesus myndyng shewe suche broughte myndes mete suche weighty matter bee admitted fraternitie preaching ghospel better take matter vpon geue ouer taken hande sayed vnto fox haue hole theyr owne earth birdes aier haue theyr nestes tree sonne man hath anye place put hys head suche one therefore hathe anye thing worlde whereon sette hys delite whereon set ful reste quiet mete folower sonne man muste renounce thynges folowe saied vnto another folowe thesame saied lord suffre first go buirie father iesus saied vnto hym leat dead bu rie dead go thou preache kyngdom god saied lord wil folow lea e first go bid farewel home house iesus saied vnto man putteth handes plough looketh backe apte kyngdome god againe whan cast iye certaine man saied vnto hym folowe made aunswere maister geue leaue fyrste buirie father iesus geuyng bywoorde cause saluacion bee preferred poync e carnall duetye sayed vnto hym leate dead buirye theyr deade gooe thou shewe abrode kyngdome god thys exaumple dyd lorde forfende excuse suche men whiche vnder colour naturall affeccion dutieleat ye dead buirye dead dooe putte delaye care earneste appliyng eternall saluacion yet wurse orte menne whiche vnder colour fyndyng stoppes lettes affaire theyr housholde prolong drieue fro morowe morowe matter saluacion whiche oughte euen first occasio streight way gone withal came man hymno man yt putteth hys handes ye plough loketh backe beeyng commaunded folowe aunswered maister come thee doe nomore suffre goe bidde familiar frendes housholde farewell saied iesus whosoeuer hath ons put hande plough afterwarde loketh backe apte kyngdome god matter ghospell high matter hard come whiche whoso hath ons enterprised thesame must pe pertuall appliyng procede stil goe forwarde thynges perfeccion neuer turne mynde awaye vyle care transitorye thynges worlde x chapter thinges lorde appointed seuenty also sent two two euerie citie place whether would come therfore saied vnto ha uest great labourer fewe praie ye therefore lord haruest send forth labourer haruest goe way behold send forth lambes emong woulfes beare ye wallet neither scrip shooes salute waie whatsoeuer house ye entre first sate peace house sonne peace peace shall teste vpon hym yf shall turne againe house tarrye styll eatyng drinkyng suche geue labourer woorthye rewarde thinges lord chose toke noumbre disciple seuetie also tofore chosen twelue apostle sent two two hym euerye citie place whether determined come end theyr preaching teaching thei might prepare make ready myndes people cumming lord dyd euen enstructe howe preache teache ghospel taught twelue shewed opened cause encreased noumbre preacher saiyng harueste greate labourer fewe praye ye therfore lorde harueste sende forth labourer haruest ferre roumour bruite gospel spred manye sette fier wyth gredye desyre doctrine heauen wel willyng toward itthe haruest great labourer fewe wante onely call gather myndes together beeyng theimselfes bothe ready full hast towardes kyngdome heauen gooe ye therefore puttyng youre wholle truste confidence safegarde maintenaunce alone suche great men hath rewle thynges suche iuill shall murmour grutche againste doctrine againste men doe send forth naked wythoute weapon fense sende hurte grieue man ye full simplicitie void hutte studye endeuour selfes profite good euery man seke ye therefore help man hande ye may therewith arm defende selfe violence maliciousnes eiuil take care ne thought liuing thinges necessarie al readinesse go ye buisinesse ye gospel neither carrying scrip wallet yet shooes ye shal neuer want shalbee sufficient nature salute man neither welthy lest ye seme flattre seke vpon gaine indurate lest ye seme fauour theyr vngodlinesse take thought house lodgeyng shalbe whiche shall receiue take theyr doores shewe selfes pure vncorrupt mynisters ghospell house soeuer ye shall entre first wish praie peace whole houshold yt sonne peace say ientill meke man one thristeth mekest doctrine ghospell praier shall profite dooe good shall enbrace gladlye receiue well wyshyng geastes yf dooe receiue welcome yet leate repent haue prayed shall lese rewarde profered seruice ye shall ouermuche entreatyng castyng selues knee man require lodgeyng shall men without shame presse house great thyng muche bee estemed bee offred thruste handes suche gladlye receyue yet ought bee profered euerie man whosoeuer shall gladly willyngly receiue see tarie wyth hym desiryng lokyng pleasure life forsomuche shall bee necessarye susteinaunce bodyes drinke fede suche thinges ye shal therefinde emongest theim good reason yt laboureth preachyng teaching ghospell shoulde liue susteined liberalitie whose behoufe laboureth taketh peine case haue sufficient owne wherof fynde himselfe pgoe house house whatsoeuer citie ye entre receiue eate suche thinges set heale sicke therein say vnto kyngdome god come nigh vpon whatsoeuer citie ye entre thei receiue go way stretes saie euen ai dust citie cleueth v wipe notwithstanding ye sure kyngdome god come nigh vpon saie vnto shalbe easier tha daye zodeme citie thyng take ye diligent hede also lest ye straighing house house despisyng setting naught former hospitalitie lodgeing serche seke delicate lodgeyng better furnishedand heale sick leate suffice whatsoeuer cometh first hande shal chaunce come city yf enhabitauntes willingly receiue entreteine eate drinke withoute anye choyce without lothyng abhorring thyng whatsoeuer sette ende ye maye geastes acceptable better welcome also ye maye better credence preache kyngdome heauen heale sicke folkes citie restore ye weake impotente theyr strengthe delyuer ye suche possessed eiuill spirites thynges doe ye freely without reward willyngly refusing creature neither poore ne riche saie ye vnto ye see manifest token power god prepare hertes myndes earneste exercise innocente liuyngand say vnto kyngdome god come nowe draweth nere vnto kyngdome god malady disease bodye nowe taken awaye ere long shall malady soule bee driuen awaye also whiche sinnes yf ye shall chaunce come citie whiche none wyl receiue make ye kynde humble suite vnto intreteinmet come forth abrode stretes opely face whole citie saie ye vnto wyse haue freelye withoute hope rewarde handes offreed vnto glad tidynges euerlastyng life forasmuche ye haue despised regarded office wil take benefite beholde therefore euen veraie dust whiche stucke vnto feete shake cast witnesse haue profered ye forsaken moste happie tidynges ought bee layed lappes wil none yet thing tyght sure whether ye receiue receiue kingdom god verai nere vpon ye wil receiue tidynges shal come greate profite commoditee yf great hurte destruction ye contente waye onely haue reuenged selfes shall despyse vengeaunce shal light vpon due tyme thing verailye shewe vnto day last iudgement shalbe better zodomites shal fynde grace lordes handeit shalbee easier daye zodome citie whiche hathe despysed great gracious goodnesse god freely offred vnto theym menne dooe muche meruaile sharpe rigorous vengeaunce god shewed vpon zodomites yet dooeth poyncte somewhat ease theym neuer many wayes prouoked emendemente liues iewes standyng muche owne conceiptes doe vttrelye abhorte deteste veraie name remembraunce saied zodomites whome wrath god terrible exaumple presidente menne beeware dyd vtterlye destroye horrible dredefull punishement abideth thesame iewes beeyng stirred prouoked many benefites many miracle shall neglecte despise goodnesse god woe vnto corazin woe vnto bethsaida miracle doen tyre sidon haue doen thei great agoe repented sinnes sitting hea en cloth ash neuerthelesse shalbee easier tyre sydon iudgement thou capernaum exalted heaue shalt thrust hell heareth heareth despiseth despiseth despiseth despiseth hym sent woe bee thee corazain woe bee bethsaida city israell miracle whiche haue shewed shewed city gentile tyrus sidon whiche ye crie fye vpon accoumptyng theim abhominable would haue called themselfes home emendement yea sittyng heareclothe ash woulde haue dooen penaunce theyr synnes whereas ye beeyng veraye styffe necked agaynst god dooe stand highly conceiptes thinke selfes faultlesse woe bee capernaum whiche swellyng nowe pride richesse swymmyng delices sensualitieand capernaum whych exalted heauen c appearest exalted aboue moone high heauen daye shalte thou bee caste downe euen vnto diepe pitte helle albeit ye homelye lowe messagiers yet shall come vnto name shal shew vnto vnestimable gift god condemnacion suche shall despise shall bee small heareth heareth whiche speake vnto theim instrument mouthesand despiseth despiseth contraryewyse despiseth despiseth despiseth despiseth hym hathe sente dooe myne owne head thyng speake whiche haue receiued first father ye shall speake nothyng whiche ye shall first haue learned therfore doctrine doctrine father myne youre preachyng shall bee preachyng lorde iesus whan suche woordes duelye enstructed armed threscore tenne disciple sent foorth assaye proue themselfes well coulde dooe preachyng ghospell seuentye returned idye saiyng lorde euen veray deiuils subdued v thy name saied vnto sawe satan lightenyng fallyng downe heauen beholde geue power treade serpentes scorpion ouer manier power enemye nothyng shall hurte neuerthelesse reioyce spirites subdued vnto reioice name written heauen whan matter woondrefullye well prospered handes returned home great mirth ioye saying maister disease driuen awaye v vncleane spirites also subiect vnto v ye name thee iesus arme fense theyr myndes agaynst disease vainglorie vleth stealth crepe enterand said vnto sawe satan beene lighte yng fall downe heauen c yea holy also putteth foorth vnto exaumple lucifer pride sodainly cast downe great felicitie sawe quod satan fall heauen euen like lightening great dignitie heauen yet puffed vp pride sodainly cast higheste place heaue botome helle pitte much ought beware pride whiche carrye aboute mortall bodye subiecte perilles daungiers yearth great power haue geue haue geuen entent ye therby weare proude high minded ende miracle men geue attribute greater fayth belefe ghospell dooe require handes haue ons geuen ye wil abuse geue power whiche shall trede serpentes scorpion vnder foote yea bee thyng meane wherof satan enemie maie hable hurt one suche thinges shal haue power hurt yet expediente glory vaunt selfes concernyng suche thingreioyce ye spirites subdued vnto c spirites subiecte thinges shalbe dooen also wicked euil men reioyce ye thyng youre name alreadye written heauen thither shall mekenesse lowelinesse thither shall simplicitie bring whens lucifer pride haultenesse mynde fel yf ye shal still persiste continue entente purpose houre reioyced iesus holy gost saied thanke father lord heauen earth thou hast hid thinges wise prudent hast opened vnto babe euen father pleased al thinges geuen father man knoweth soonne father father sonne sonne wil shewe turned disciple saied secretely happie iyes see thinges ye see tell many prophetes kinges haue desired see thinges whiche ye see haue seen theim heare thinges whiche ye heare haue heard whan lorde saied woordes byanby beganne oyce holye ghoste geue thankes father prosperous successe ghospell teachyng v euen thesame tyme exaumple hymselfe case thyng come luckilye passe handes whan go reioyce humaine affeccion spiritual ghostely reioycing taking selfes parte ye prayse glory euermore reioycyng glory god set foorthe magnified reioycyng profite neighbour rendre thankes saieth vnto thee lord father maker heauen ye rth hygh thynges thou hast kepte secrete hidden worlde reputed wyse politique hast opened litell tendre one inferiour meane sorte ignorauntes suche iudgemente worlde haue great wytte experience thus veraily dooen father hath pleased thy eternall prouidence wysedome proude men beyng reiected cast thou mightest suche lowenesse exalt lift vp men true heigth heauely thyngeseuen father pleased thee power ne autoritee whiche father hath deliuered handes therefore feare ye worlde beeyng ryght wel assured ye haue maister hable defende eguall feloweshyp thynges betwene father truely man knoweth sonne howe great sauyng onelye father whiche begatte hym manne knoweth father howe greate onely sonne borne hym suche maie please sonne open vnto openeth sheweth hym none suche bee humble meke spirited enclined apte beleue afterward turnyng hymselfe disciple declared hymselfe veray glad thei blissefull happe denied men euen veray high dignitie saiyng blessed ye iyes whiche see thynges ye see tell thyng certaintye many prophetes kinges would faine haue seen ye poore abiect persones doe see yet thei haue seen heare thinges ye heare heard see ye acknowlage take youre good happe flee ye takyng pride presumpcion therby take ye suche pride may stand holinesse wete pride agaynste thynges whiche worlde dooeth gase vpon meruail takyng theim high thynges wheras small trifle veraye filthynesse comparison thinges geuen vnto pand beholde certayne lawier stoode vp tempted hym saiyng maister shal dooe inherite eternall lyfe saied vnto hym written lawe tradest thou aunswered sayed loue lord thy god al thy hert al thy soule al thy strength al thy mind thy neighbour thy self saied vnto thou hast aunswered righte thus thou shalte liue willing iustifie saied vnto iesus neighbour iesus aunswered saied certayne man went downe hierusalem hierico fel emong theues robbed rayment wounded departed leauing half dead chaunced came downe certaine priest way whan sawe passed likewyse leuite whan went nigh place came looked passed certain samaritane iourneyed came vnto hym whan sawe hym compassion hym went bound vp woundes poured oyle wine set hym beast brought hym common ynne made prouision hym morow whan departed tooke twoo pen gaue hoste saied vnto take cure whatsoeuer thou spendest whan come recompence thee whi h nowe three thinkest thou neighbour vnto fel emong theues saied shewed mercie hym sayed iesus vnto hym goe dooe thou lykewyse certaine day whan iesus disputing iewes put sadducee silence waye prouyng hym putte foorthe question woman hauyng married seuen soondrye housebandes whiche haue daye generall resurrectio came vnto hym one scribe well seene lawe one woulde putte foorth question diepeste profounde knowelage law sayed maister whiche chiefeste commaundemente god kepyng wherof maye atteigne euerlastyng lyfe iesus aunswered thyng thou demaundeste thesame shoulde men haue learned thee thou dooest professe knowelage lawe writen doest thou reade writen made aunswer thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy herte thy soule al thy powerwhat written lawe c thy mynde cannot bee loued enoughe nexte hym thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe iesus allowying hys aunswer saied wyse thou knoweste beste remaineth nothyng thou put vre daily practise thou doeste vnderstande whiche thyng yf thou dooe facte dede thou shalt liue knowelage geuethe lyfe kepyng dooyng lawe pharisee beeyng somewhat touched aunswere oure lorde knewe woordes lawe dydde kepe whiche chiefeste poynte lawe yet puffed vp vayne glorye woulde acknowelage hys owne faulte euen though hadde nowe alreadye large fulfylled commaundemente louyng god moued newe question neighboure saiyng neighbour thoughe man myght loue godwho neighbour yet neuerthelesse bee cruell hurtefull hys neighbour iewes dyd manier interprete name neighboure extende ferther men owne nacio supposyng lawfull theim hate alienes foreinours leate theim alone withoute dooeyng theim benefite good iesus therefore knowyng pharisee mynde aunswereth hym parable ensuwyng painctyng oute whole matter settyng iye certayne misticall exaumple representacion thyng teachyng precepte louing neighbour ought bee enclosed within narowe streighte boundes kynred countreye thesame enlarge extende selfe ferther coumpace wete vnto menne forasmuche oftentimes chaunceth whiche nighest v byrth countreye ferther v affeccion loue veraye foea certayne man fell emog theues c certayne man sayeth iesus takyng hys iourney hierusalem hierico chaunced lyghte counpaignie theues beeyng contented ne thinkyng enoughe spoyle poore soule turne hym clothes moreouer geuyng soondrye woundes lefte hym high wayes syde half dead perishe right yf man holpen hym doen themselfes wente way chaunced certain priest goyng iourney whiche laye veraye waye whereas veraye ordre profession priestehoode whiche taken hym vnto ought chieflye aboue others haue fulfylled commaundemente god yet notwithstandyng hymselfe beyng iewe sawe one iewe beeyng man hierusalem saw one hierusalem spoiled wounded liyng halfe deade yet passed whyt moued drop pietie compassion chaunced certaine leuite passe thesame way whose hande man might iustelye haue looked due obseruyng kepyng goddes commaundemente beeyng manne dedicated temple ministre goddes holye seruice therefore oughte haue beene man deuocion man euen hadde dooen thoughe sawe wounded man well enough yet passed foorth waye dyd helpe brother countreyman thesame citie happened certaine samaritane passyng thesame waye iourney goe espied man bene robbed laye halfe aliue halfe deade meruailyng matter drewe nere vnto perceiuyng extreme mysfortune man moued pietye compassion towarde iewe whereas himselfe samaritane yet iewes veraie sore abhorre hate al samaritanes onelye take pietye also hindraunce iourney nothyng passed wente vnto poured wine oyle woundes bound vp thinkyng enoughe haue played suche kinde parte tooke sette thesame beaste hymselfe rode carried ynne made prouision shoulde bee diligentely attended looked vnto iourneye required suche haste coulde longer tarye drewe foorth twoo piece siluer coyne whiche called denaries amountyng afore saied couple shillynges sterlyng thereaboute deliuered theim hoste ynne keper shoulde see wounded man well attended kepte vntil suche tyme iourney beeyng dooen shoulde returne thesame waye backe agayne saying myne hoste ye haue money purpose see man coste charge yf ye shall bestow thyng aboue summe haue deliuered ye parte shall loser mite rekon whan returne way whatsoeuer ye laye oute vpon shall paie whan lorde spoken saied vnto lawier whiche three seme vnto thee bee neigh boure vnto partye fallen handes theues aunswered lawier whiche beeyng moued pietye coumforte helpe distresse sayed iesus ferther poynte also hast thou made right aunswere true see thy lyfe bee lyke aunswerable vnto thy woordes bee thou willyng rather bee lyke samaritane pryeste leuite parable lorde iesus reproued checked pride iewes whiche thought themselfes enoughe enoughe againe loue god wer good churche daily goer temple kylled beastes sacrifice vnto hym carried commaundementes theym written skirtes garmentes god lorde euermore theyr mouth whereas god doeth nothyng passe wurshippyng delited secrete affeccion syncere pure mynde towardes neighbour felte mocion charitie men liuyng behoufe theymselfes moe yea also repynyng welfare theym whome beene partes helpe dyd good turne pleasure dyd persones owne fecte wheras euery one man ought neighbour yf case anye tyme require helpe succour priest leuite birth nacion neighboure wounded man samaritane birthe kynde enemie charitee loue became neighbour religion iewes diuideth nacion nacion ghospell knoweth suche manyer diuersyties ne difference euer glad profite doe good men withoute respecte accepcion persone lorde hymselfe came saue creature beeyng called iewes samaritane waye reproche tyme whan vilainy callyng hym woord doeth offende al vniuersal nacions worlde forasmuche fynde thyng comprised vnder name bee theyr healthe safegarde samaritanus emong syrian muche saye keper veraylye true keper shepehearde dyd suffre nothyng perishe whether sickelye bruised wandreyng aboute straighes wished menne bee partaker eternall lyfe leaste wise muche laye vniuersall progenye mankynde beeyng throughe malice satan spoiled clothing innocencye sore wounded kynde vyce cast aside destitute healpe halfe dead euen nexte doore desperacion iesus cummyng heauen vouchesalued visite see ende myghte better helpe takyng mannes nature came veray nere manne bothe seeyng beeyng seene hearyng beyng heard felyng beeyng felt hauing pietie extreme distresse tooke vp synnes beare owne bodye dyd owne propre persone suffre deserued thesame iesus hath seene curyng v neuer turned face synner neuer vyle abiecie whereas proude disdeignefull prieste passethe hym euen geuyng vp ghoste whereas leuite neglecteth hym biddyng god haue mercye vpon goyng foorth waye hadde begonne lefte shoulde susteine hindreaunce damage thynges worlde whyle helpeth hys neyghboure samaritane iesus hath hostes inneholders leaning yearth ascendyng heauen dooethe committe wounded man bee well looked vnto promysyng rewarde heauen yf aboundaunce charitie shal haue layed oute anye thyng commaunded healyng pieteous bodye inneholders bee vnderstanded apostle theyr successours whome euen daye doeth cure healpe mankynde gathereth thesame violence theues hostrye churche woundes synne healed therfore doctryne ghospell euen veray enemye also muste loued whereas accordyng profession phariseye euen samaritane bee loued iewe yf doo hym good yet iewes coulde perfeictlye saye rote finger endes thou shalte loue thy god aboue thynges thou shalte loue thy neighbour well thine owneself veraye owne person christe dyd breake commaundementes ons one parte reprochefull theyr woordes agaynste god whose woordes woulde beleue whose miracle staundreously reported bee doen power beelzebub father beeing veraye god sonne beyng veraye god parte hated neighbour benefite wroughte alwayes destruye putte hym death freely broughte healthe saluacion vnto creature suche one hathe fulfilled aswell one commaundementes aboue rehersed doeth christe loue god aboue al thinges man also hauyng moste highly doen hym himselfe true loued hys membres whome sembleablye offended whan weake conscience offended putte open shame worlde whan bee putte shame putte death whan putte death pit fortuned went entred certain toune certain woman named martha receiued house woman sistur called marie whiche also sate iesus feete hearde woord martha coumbred muche seruing stoode saied lord doest thou care sistur hath lefte serue alone bidde therefore helpe iesus aunswered saied vnto martha martha thou arte carefull troubled aboute manye thynges veraylye one nedefull marie hath chosen good parte whiche shall bee taken awaie parable whan iesus taughte howe muche bee loued bestowyng theyr wholle tyme thattendaunce euangelicall doctryne haue none care ne entente learne iesus doctryne lyfe whereof maye geue parte vnto persones also greately bee loued forsakyng leauyng seruice doen bodye dooe altogether attende suche thynges concerne soule chaunce euen bee seene whiche thys documente lesson may better enpriented minde suche plaine exaumples experience hertes grosse ignoraunt sort piththily effectually framed whan iesus hauing voyd time laisure fro businesse walkyng vp downe disciple hauyng geuen ouer care worldely matter attended onely gospel nothing elsas thei wet fortuned entred certain litle toune certain woma called martha receiued entreteined hym house woman sistur called marie eyther theym eguall loue towardes lorde theyr course liuyng twoo soondrye sortesand certaine woma called martha receiued house exercise also theyr deuocion towardes god twoo soondry sortes lyke one bodye bee soondrye v lymmes bodye iesus whyche churche bee soondrye gyftes spirite marye ye would saie makyng holy daye businesse bee doen house set herselfe downe lord iesus feete listenyng hys talke wherewith rauished forgeattyng thynges coulde plucked awaye hym contrariewyse martha beeyng carefull aboute prouydyng dyner ranne vp much vnquiete one hauyng bothe handes full buisye coulde manier pointe myght bee wantyng suche thinges belonged sweteentreteinyng lorde disciple one loue towardes lorde possessed would suffre mary bee pulled awaie fete made martha destiere vp downe house suffred stande still lorde thus dyd one thesame zele force two sisturs vnto dooynges two soondrye sortes whereas louyng making muche iesus throughly accordelorde doest care sistur hath left notwythstandyng martha forasmuche hable great paine doe al thynges alone whych apperteined prepayryng thinges ordre sawe sistur lyke holydaye woman sittyng feete iesus made querele vnkyndnesse sistur knewe wel enough could pulled away halfe blamed iesus wt suche wordes spake kept awaye puttyng helpyng hande beeyng requisite maister saith doest thou nothyng care syster suffreth doe seruice self alone commaund thou therfore helpe orels knowe wyll pluckt away thee except thou bidde great swetenesse thy talke yet meane time ye diner must bee dressed beeyng one sole woman able inough dooe al bee dooen woordes lorde delited ye zele dothe woman dooeth disallow diligence martha chydeth whan murmured syster yet sumwhat taketh mary parte saiyng martha martha dede thou art tormented carefulnesse dressyng diner art vnquiet drawen way way many thynges one thing aboue others necessary whiche ought continually doen might bee dooe thou make ende thy busynes thou hast hande howsoeuer thy prouidyng makyng ready v shall frameuerely one nedefull shall cotented marie hath chose great dele better parte hauyng forgotten thynges requisite body altogether occupied suche matter concerne ye soule therfore reason pluckt away thynges principall best sorte whiche hath specially chosen thrust oute office basser seruice doe good parte take good loue zele thy r whiche tyme prepareth repaste dysciples refreshed better filled handes take soules woordes may haue saluacion therby meate whiche dooeth moste singulerly fede memari hath chosen good parte shall take away drinke wherwith refreshed whoso embus ed prouidyng thynges perteinyng body drawen many wayes soondrie care ende suche poyntes takyng paynes shall suche tyme cum whe apperyng immortalitie necessity shal ceasse wt whiche wekenesse mannes nature present world soondrie way disquieted suche one hath great aduantage fordele hauyng caste suche maner care altogether rauished thynges heauenly gatheryng hymself together restyng vpon one thyng thesame one thyng suche nature surmounteth thynges goodnesse felicitie whiche one thyng shall taken awaye shalbe augmented tyme whan whiche vnperfite shall bee abolyshed perfite shall bee opened neither meane tyme mourmouryng made suche persones though altogether idle sitting still bodily seruices suche respecte cosideracion geue attendaunce heauenly doctrine cleuyng fast steppe long learning thing thei may afterward teache thoroughly sendyng downe bottome affeccions theyr owne heartes thing may afterward prescribe enioyne vnto others ende may thereby dooe good vnto muche greatter noumbre towardes achiuyng eternall saluacion yet shall suche person lacke due reward neyther accordyng exaumple thy dooyng nowe tyme dooe godly zele rate ye tyme relieue corporall necessitie haue cause ghospell handelyng suche fede hungrie clothe naked visite sicke gooe theim lye prison harbour straungers lacke lodgyng also shall bee partaker rewarde ghospell lyke bodye iye whiche semeth idle dooeth good seruice hande beyng buisily occupied soondry kyndes seruice euen suche altogether geue hede vnto thinges whiche nerest cocerne touche life euerlastyng although seme holidayemenne repose theymselfes corporall businesse yet dooe good others doe thyng chiefly requisite doen one must grutche forasmuche euery one accordyng gyft hath receiued god serueth mebres xi chapter fortuned praiyng certain place wha ceassed one disciple sayd vnto lord teache v pray iohn also taught disciple said vnto wha ye pray say father art heauen halowed thy name thy kingdome cum thy wyll fulfilled euen earth also heauen daily bread geue v daye forgeue v sinnes euen forgeue euery man trespasseth v lede v temptacion deliuer v euill whan lorde iesus kynde representyng matter exaumple afore goyng taught great matter buisye whoso dyd full whole geue attendaunce doctrine ghospell whiche doctrine person sincerely handle onlesse shake al desire care world remained prescribe point tenour fourme praiyng also praier ye would saye moste purest sacrifice euangelicall deuocion vnto whiche prayer iesus oftentimes depart place solitary contemplacion enured disciple also vnto thesame prayer thatsame secrete methyng whiche mynd soule man beyng ye would say carryed vp heauen ioyneth talke god care phantasticall imaginacions earthly thinges set apart dede phariseis prayed oftentimes also long together sadde droupyng countenaunces abrode folkes see iohns disciple praied also yea samaritan prayed mountaine religion heathen folkes also maner praiyng fashion muche therefore neyther sortes menne one maner praiyng one maner thynges asked god folkes prayer apostle desirous fain haue precise fourme tenoure praying appoynted vnto christe whiche oughte folowe wherupon whan iesus according accustomed wont withdrawe hymselfe disciple resorte people solytary place praye soone finished praiers one noumbre disciple saied vnto hym maister forasmuche thy disciple mete thynges thyne appointment teache v therfore fourme praiyng alsolord teach v praye like iohn whan lyued taught disciple pray iesus whereas many woordes soondrye tymes taughte discyples praiers christian neither ought bee long made ostentacion vainglory ne maner thynges well one another appoynted vnto fourme praiyng suche hereunder foloweth although common vnto persones yet doeth iustely directly appertain vnto mynisters teacher ghospell beyng ye woulde saye persones exempted world bestowe labour trauail onely behalf glory god may opened renoumed amonge good kyngdom day day may florishe strength force kyngdome satan vtterly suppressed brought vnder foote like heauen aboue whence lucifer al complyces confederacie toumbled doune headlong nowe maner rebellion agaynst wyll god among child god beyng ordeyned succede place augels wer cast heauen lucifer thynges may bee dooen heauenly father also feede chyldren breade heauenlye doctrine grace whiche may make soules iustie full fedde vnto lyfe euerlastyng case offence trespace bee thoroughe humayne frailtie committed agaynste wyll mercyfully forgeue hys chyldren lyke tendre frendely father among theymselfes forgeue one another one haue thing offeded trespaced ye duryng tyme life mortall bodye lyke maye profyte growe better maye contraryewyse fall vnto wurse especiallye tyraunte satan meanes prouokynge irryng dooe may vnder tuicion wardyng heauenly father safely defeded satan engiens eyther may fall teptacion doe fall beyng defendour whiche stronger might puissaunce may depart conquerours victory tenour woordes praiyng folowyngour father whiche art heaue c heauenly father beyng set earth thy goodnesse hath vouchesalued call name childre pray doctrine liuing thy power thy wisdom thy goodnesse may still cum knowlage men thei may haue vnderstanding glorie due vnto thy name procedeth thyng whatsoeuer goodlye honorable eyther heauen orels earth ende though beeyng basse slendre owne party yet thee maye glory tryumphe hytherto hath satan reigned worlde ouer sinne wherunto men haue bondseruauntes beyng therto allured trayned wicked lustes make thou father sinnes clene taken away thy holy spirite poured vpon creature may obedient thy wyl thou euery day bounteously geuyng vnto v heauenly foode thy grace may tyme tyme growe foorth better better vntyll maye cum full perfeccion euangelical godlynes furthermore muche men made frayle metall case beeyng wrong way ignoraunce thorough weakenesse frailtie shall thyng trespasse thee father ceasse thou bee fauourable thy chyldren accordyng thy mercifulnesse forgeue v muche forgeue one brother thorough thesame frailtie offende brother end peace may bee firmely established amongest selfesand lede v reptacion may haue peace thee knowe malice thatsame euill tiranne whence thy fatherly goodnesse hath redemed v suffre v eftsones ouercummed hym thou suffre v probacion pacience afflicted either souldiers wicked men leat v thy sure safegard haue ouerhand hym leat assaultes turne benefite ende pand said vnto shall haue frende shall goe hym midnyght say vnto frende lend thre loaues frende mine cum way haue nothing set within auswer say trouble dore shut child ate chaumber cannot ryse geue thee saye vnto though arise geue frende yet importunitie wyll rise geue hym many nedeth say vnto aske shall geuen seke ye shall fynd knocke shalbe opened vnto euery one asketh receiueth seketh find th knocketh shalbe opened better stirre seruauntes vnto instauntnesse prayinge besidesfoorth putte assured trust obteine added premiss parable suche sort foloweth ientle saith easie entreated god beyng nature beneficiall full lyberalytie towardes child coiecture ye selfes one destitute necessary haue frende wil bolde goe vnto middes night familiarly knockyng dores wyll bee bolde saie frende lend thre loaues bread certain frende myne takyng house waye hath soodaynly cum vpon vnawares euen late euenyng lodge nigh e haue nothyng home myne owne howse sette afore hym eate peraduenture frende wyll even byanby fyrst woorde geue thyng thou doest aske beyng yll willyng open dores wyll aunswer within house trouble cummyng craue thynges sorte nyghte tyme doores shut al nyght child bedde canot arise geue thou requirest partie whiche lacketh loaues goe wayes byanby excuse makyng shall continue still knockyng frendes doore one wil haue nay thing cumeth affyrme vnto although respect frendship moue yet beyng ouercomed ye importunitie partie maketh suche praiyng vnto wil arise bed geue thre loaues according tenour peticion askyng geue howe many soeuer shall haue nede importunitie praiyng bee suche force effect one mortall mannes hande behoufe man howe muche shall take place effecte god muche delited maner importunitie offended case tyme make delaye geue asked niggardeshippe cause therof yet hardenesse wyll entreated therein enkiendleth desyre maye plenteously geue aske party maye derely esteme loue thyng hath obteyned importune prayer thesame therfore frende beeyng nede would dooe frende beeyng mortall man thesame leat euerie one muche bolde towarde god beyng bounteous liberall father whome suche importunitie doeth well contente neuer vndoen made poore geuyng hym therfore aske ye hertie prayer botome herteseke ye shall fynde c case ye nede thyng shall geuen yee bee ignoraunt thyng make ye due inquisicion secrete workyng father spirite ye shall fynde thyng whiche mannes witte coulde possibly haue perceyued knockeye prayer ioynyng therunto almesdedes towardes neighbour shall bee opened vnto importunitie wherewithall god ye might saye ouerco med euen playn force wonne peticions cannot saye naye euen castell fortresse woonne force armes praying man oftentymes made vayne either perfourme asked el goddes hande whosoeuer asketh doeth receiue whosoeuer seketh doeth fynde whosoeuer knocketh opened father best knoweth thynges auaillable towardes eternall saluacion thesame thynges doeth glad frely geue bee prayed insomuche beeyng wrong opinion errour iudgement asked thynges hurtefull would rekon benefite towardes denie vnto naughtly sued stede thyng ye wyshed would geue might bee welth sonne shall aske breade father wyll geue hym stone aske fishe wyll fyshe geue hym serpent yf aske egge wyll offre scorpion yf ye beyng euill geue good giftes vnto child muche shall father heauen geue holy spirite desire hym naturall affeccion carnall parentes towardes child doeth worke cannot saye naye vnto whome haue begotten yf thesame shoulde make peticion thyng perteynyng health bodye makeye coniecture comparison owne selues case aske piece breade father suppose thesame would geue sonne stone stede piece bread case shoulde aske fishe thynke father would offre sonne serpent stede fishe case desire haue egge rekon father stede egge would geue hym scorpion hidden egshell tendre loue affeccion nature great force strength emong men beyng many wayes naughtie persones towardes theyr chyldren askyng thynges profitable frendly geuers much heauenly father father spirites nature good geue vnto heauen spirite beyng good whiche shall aboundauntely geue goodnesse yf ye shall make peticion casting deuill thesame dumme whan cast de ill dumme spake people woondred sayed casteth deuilles beelzebub chiefest deuils tempted hym required hym signe heauen knowyng thoughtes sayed vnto euery kyngdome deuided agaynst selfe desolate one house doeth fall vpon another satan also bee deuided agaynst hymselfe shall kyngdome endure ye saye cast deuils beelzebub helpe beelzebub caste deuils whose helpe doe child caste therfore shall bee iudges fy ger god caste deiuils doubte kyngdome god come vpon whan strong man armed watcheth house thynges possesseth peace whan stronger commeth vpon hym ouercommeth hym taketh hym al harnesse wherin trusted diuideth goodes agaynst h gathereth scattereth abrode satan also hath spirite owne whome enspireth seruauntes prouoker mouer naughtinesse yea worlde hath spirite belongyng whiche allureth men loue thynges transitory spirite heauenly father spirite hath manier entremedlyng therfore spirite heauenly father shall dwell spirite satan must bee expoulsed one spirite must nedes auoyd make roume maie come inhabite brestes behold chaunce might laye manifestlye iyes thyng euill spirite wrought hertes iewes beyng euermore wrastlers agaynst holy spirite god broughte vnto iesus certayne man possessed mischieuous deuill deuill one sorte onely dumme deiuill also blynde could neither loke vp vpon iesus yet speake vnto tha iesus owne accorde takyng pietie man beeyng suche affliccion commaunded deuill voyde voyded beholde wer certain iewes present standing whose soules spirite satan daungierfully possessehe casteth deiuils beelzebub vnclene spirite possessed body man slaunderously saied miracle doen deiuill allegyng iesus suche thinges power god helpe beelzebub prince deiuils others agayne seeyng many miracle yet stil remayning vnbelefe required hym notable token heauen whereby might euidently appere familiaritie god dwelleth heauen vnclene spirites whose blindyng mennes iyes doeth commonly spryng yearth speake temptyng lorde neuer whitte myndyng beleue hym although doen ye thyng requyred whether doen doen surmised matier slaundre one readie obiecte agaynst hym iesus soone sawe theyr vngodly thoughtes made aunswer wi ked surmise suche sorte foloweth dooeth slaundreous reprouyng stande together see kyngdome hable stande bee strife within selfe ciuill discorde one realme agaynst anothereuerie kyngdome deuided agaynst selfe c whiche thyng yf bee cannot chosen muste come desolacion one house fall downe vpon another vniuersall ruine thyng bee true whiche ye thynke throughe maintenaunce ayde beelzebub prince deiuils dooe cast hurtefull spirites veraily bee felowes souldiers foloweth true conclusion eiuill spirites beeyng variaunce within theymselfes dooe fyght together one theim bee chaced awaye nowe satan fighte satan shall kyngdome stande ye see deuils cast oute ye graunt euill dooe cast grounde dooe ye coniecture thynges bee dooen supportacion beelzebub rather god beelzebub woont doe health safegarde men chace souldiers possession exerciseth tirannie yet bee dooen argueth proueth kyngdome satan shall shortely bee destroyed kyngdome god bee nowe hande caste deuils mere worde cast oute freely vse thereunto charmyng woordes witchecraft ne iugleyng blyndyng mennes iyes acte ye cannot disproue haue ye mynde referre glorye good worke beelzebub god yf hatered whiche ye beare vnto dooeth perswade cast deuils ayde beelzebub young men beeyng sonnes whome ye haue seen doyng selfsame thyng whose helpe thei chase awaye deuils plain homely men men knowlage ne autoritie ca skill malicious sleightes witch nygromanciers yet caste deuils name thig thei doe doe faithfull truste god therefore shall vnbelefe condened iudges none plain simplenesse hath beleued wheras wisedom expert knowelage world striueth glory god wherupon seeyng neyther ryme ne reaso saying one euil spirite driueth euil spirite forasmuche child cast deuils helpe none whose helpe cast clere doe cast euil spirites ye vertue power god good spirite power might al whole packe wicked spirites yt neither agremet betwene spirite god god loueth ye preseruacio mankynde seke destruccion thesame nowe bee thyng manifest thynges whiche ye see doe doe power god doubte kingdome god cum vnto whiche iohn preache bee hande reason therfore ye ioyne selfes hym withdrawe reigne satan shall shortely haue ende ye cannot partaker bothe kyngdomes betwene god satan bataill possibylitye maye brought attonemet cause wil neuer condicions brought agrement satan shall either geat victorye orels stronge hande bee dryuen shall yeldyng submyttyng hymselfe continue hys reigne ne yet bee receiued vpon condicions agreement appoynted vnto hath hitherto reigned without redresse nowe cum power puissaunt mighty tirannie one finger god mightie preserue saue mankind tha ye hostes beelzebub destroy thesame thesame thyng therfore shall behalfe cum passe whiche comonly woont chauce betwene two head captayns valyaunt strong beyng fierce couragious al affiaunce trust resteth armour weapon whan man great forte puissaunce beeyng armour dooeth kepe fortresse thynges bee possession peaceable reste quite power set vpon plain force armes co quere harnes wel armed wil entre leage felowship bee halfe partener castell dryuyng quite awaye wyll entre vpon full possession wholle house hymselfe weapon wherin trusted plain force take away fro hym richesse substaunce rifle spoile distribute among souldiers doeth behoue loke aboute see whether syde ye bee whether ye wyll take parte god beyng mightier satananon bee dryuen oute ye haue peace satan ye god ye haue peace god cannot ye satan agree one others campe must ye fight tyme shapeth suffer person sitte idle whoso syde aduersarie vnto euen verye poynte dooeth hurte athe ought dutie fauour syde doth fauour whoso doeth gather scattereth abrode whan vnclene spirite gone man walketh drye place seekyng test whan findeth none sayeth wil returne vnto house whence came whan cummeth findeth swept garnished goeth taketh hym seuen spirites wurse entre dwell ende man wurse beginnyng iewes toke vpon opinion righteousenesse vpon boldenesse thereof either negligently leat slippe doctrine gospell orels vtterly refuse would none put forth derke parable wherby signifie greuous damnation lighte persones whan haue gone litel way foreward towardes righteousnes fall backe agayne olde enormity suche neuer knowing ye light euangelical trueth cotinued still derkenesse sinneful liuing ye people iewes disseuered meane lawe gentile beyng idolater fallyng euery day freashe former transgression cum length suche degree vngodlynesse whatsoeuer offence forefather doen putting prophetes death conspiryng moses thesame seuenfolde double vngraciously renewe sonne god disciple albeit parable doeth ferther also touch euery man beyng washed fro former synnes baptisme deliuered euill spirite worlde worde ghospell dooeth negligently vse gyfte god taketh care procede tyme time ferther degree perfeccion unto suche one beeyng walowed downe former liuyng baptisme ye knowlage holy doctrine shall auaile none effecte purpose yt shal sekyng haue sorer damnacion daie iudgement one whiche former sweruyng right waye hath ioyned vnthankefulnes maliciousnesse also parable tenour folowyng whe vnclene spirite gone oute man cwhan vnclene spyrite departed man beeyng putte awaye power god muche hath obstinate doe hurte goeth walkyng vp downe place barain waterlesse seeking rest whan could fynde thesame sayeth within hymself returne backe house came returning vnto founde dede sweped cleane brome altogether emptie wha espieth goeth waye taketh vnto seuen spirites vngracious tben euer suche knotte company goeth house dede made cleane leaft vnkept armed defence vertues semyng gospel ornamentes garnishyng ceremony dede make outwardlye shewe semblaunce godlines onely certain vain counterfaites thynges kepe away assaultes wicked spirites rather occasion ferther vngodlines euen doeth chaunce vnto thatsame man beyng clensed one yll spirite made subiect vnto seuen euery one wurse fortuned spake thinges certain woman cumpany lift vp voice said vnto happy wombe bare thee pappes whiche gaue thee sucke said yea happy heare word god kepe iesus speakyng great deale vnto people al sortes certain woma meruailyng wordes beig wise piththy liftyng vp voice amog al cupany said blessed wobe thatsame woman bare blessed ye pappes thy nourice thou didst sucke voice woma pronouced ye synagogue iewes beyng euermore slaunderous maligner againste christ woman beareth figure churche wherfore iesus doeth deny testimony preachig maketh perfite saiyng forsoth blessed thei whiche heare word god kepe thesame hert renne tary vntil may one day bring foorth frute euerlastyng saluacion thatsame muche blessed thyng mother haue borne body haue nourced wt milke one woman myghte bee hable beare great one geue sucke blessednesse may thyng common creature whan people gathered thicke together began say euill nacio signe shall signe geuen signe ionas prophete ionas signe niniuites shall sonne man nacion quene south shal arise iudgement men nacion condemne came vttermost partes earth heare wisdom salomon beholde greatter salomon men n tiue shall arise iudgement nation shall condemne brought repentaunce preachyng ionas behold greatter ionas whan speakyng suche woordes multitude people came still thicker thicker rennyng thyther iesus begon make aunswere vnto theim fore required haue notable sygne shewed vnto theim heauen though thynges whiche iesus hytherto dooen basse lowe matter dyd conteine poynt semyng great prophet doen common inferiour sorte thoughte vnto pharyseys partes menne learnyng higher degree ferre aboue rate common multitude mete shewe special matter woondre euen purposely specially speake vnfayned mynde menyng good faith therein tempte proue entet shewed none might finde cauillacions al rest miracle doen helpe mainteynaunce beelzebub side shewed might find su matter hym whereof falsely accuse hym lay charge iesus therefore saied euill generacion none vpryght ne plain meaning haue already seen many miracle doe thei require yet sum ferther straunge toke wherunto geue credite maye slaunderously report thyng whiche aske ye waye fraude guyle shal obteyn shal receiue signe one woorthye shall haue geuen wherat fynde surmised cauillacions shall haue geuen maye conuince malice infidelitie shalbe geuen vnto signe ionas prophet preachyng ionas niniuites repet refourme manifold vngraciousnesse whan thesame ionas shewed miracle amongst nacion miracle ne benefites bee brought soften hertes repentaunce yet one preset among greatter euer prophet ionas ionas folkes dooe highly esteme thesame beyng whale mouthe sea liued three day three nyghtes whan estemed reputed dead sodainly appered aliue lyke matter hereunto yet muche woderful aboue course nature shal soonne man beeyng dead dede shall lye three day buried herte yearth yet contrarye lokyng euill persones yearth shal yelde hym liuesma third day receiued dead wherfore last iudgement nacion despiseth others comparison theymselfes thinke theimselfes sitte euen high topcastell true seruyng god shall bee condemned manye nacions whiche thought bee toto ferre waie fro godly deuocion quene saba shal arise iudgement nacion shall condemne theym beeyng woman hauyng nothyng doctrine lawe yet came great log iourney ferthest partes worlde ierusalem purpose heare wysdome salomon yet euen nowe herein place greatter matter euer salomon yet thyng set naughte preset niniuites folkes without knowlage lawe wurshippers idolles shall stande tryall nacion iudgemente shall condemne repent amend abominacions preachyng man vnknowen vnto aliene borne miracle ne benefites shewyng cause hymselfe bee muche regarded behold nowe presente greatter matter euer ionas yet nothyng moued amendment man lighteth candell putteth priuie place neither vnder bushell candelsticke whiche cum may see light light body iye therfore whan thine iye single thy body also shalbe full light thine iye bee euill thy body also shalbe full deckenesse take de therfore lighte whiche thee bee dec enesse thy bodye therfore clere hauyng part decke shall full light euen whan candell doeth light thee brightnesse although many emong iewes whose hertes reason owne wilfull stubburne maliciousnesse light ghospel make blynde afore yet trueth ought hen foorth bee suppressed forasmuche knowlage therof bryng veraie many eternall saluacion obstinate malice vnbeleuers muste lette hindreaunce good wherfore trueth muste bee brought open lighte horrible grieuous damnacion eiuill persones saluacion good sorte body lighteth cadle faith hideth apriuie derke corner couereth whelmyng busshell ouer itwhan iye single body also shal bee full light setteth candelsticke maye geue light suche wyllyng enter house thesame house without candle thesame body without iyes euen thesame ye soule without knowlage trueth commeth mere vnfayned feith thyne iye single nothyng perished ne infected inordinate desyres world receiue light euerlastyng trueth al thy body shall haue fruicion lyght suche wyse shal stumble iutte agaynst thyng case iye thy bodye corrupted bleamished shal whole body entrieked ready take harme derke feith commeth iudgement statute ordeinaunces good liuing fountaine goodnesse whiche putrified cannot bee chosen thynges must corrupted also see therfore iye wherewith trueth seen maie pure thee clere without corrupcion leste selfe membre onely apte receiue light onely must shewe light al whole bodye encoumbred derknesse thesame thyng beyng infected heade ye roote good workes euen verai thynges whiche seme bee good good contrariwyse thynges whiche seme vnto pharisee bee eiuill shall bee euill fountaine wherhence spryng foorth bee pure clere infeccion thyng candle iye well clarifyed euen lyke thyng woorde god soule beeyng well pourged singlenesse feith naughtie affeccions whatsoeuer procedeth feith synne iye thy bodye shall syncere pure thyng made light candele euangelicall trueth shal geue parte light vnto membres shall bee derkenesse parte body reason iye shal looke foorth behofe membres thereof whatsoeuer thyng hande shall doe shall bee daungier harme derke whole body shall bee lightsome euen whole house lightsome wha brightnesse candle geueth light pand spake certayne pharisee besought hym dyne hym iesus wente fate downe meate whan pharisee sawe meruayled firste washed dyuer lorde sayed vnto hym ye pharisee make clene outsyde cuppe platter inwarde parte full rauenyng wickednesse ye fooles made whiche without make whiche within also neuerthelesse geue almes ye haue beholde thynges cleane vnto woe vnto pharisee ye tythe mynte ue manier herbes passe ouer iudgemente loue god ought ye haue doen yet leaue vndoen euen immediately herupon folowed matter whereby thesame lorde taught might ye would saye bee playinly declared phariseis forasmuche iye foule blemished setting righteousnesse ceremony longyng body wilfully leat slippe thynges whiche seen pure clere iyes vnto candle euangelicall trueth sheweth light supposed light bee derknesse stumble renne agaynst thynges moste whan thought theimselues goe gaily well vpright iudged bee grieuous enormitie none contrariwise sore offense transgression wened thei bee none theyr iyes sore bleamished supersticion lawe ignoraunce disdeineful pride enuie couetise hypocrisie naughtie vice certayne pharisee prayed iesus come dyne hym iesus made refusall one euer readie offre hymselfe vnto euery bodye entente might drawe creature vnto hym whan lorde sette table without washyng handes afore contrary guyse pharisee saied pharisee begoonne meruail hymselfe secretely mynde cause bee lorde washed satte meate euen thyng neither maketh man good ill spryngeth thyng veraye dede euermore yll pharisaicall ceremony whiche consiste thynges perteyning bodye haue propertie naturall cummyng euen theyr veraye kynde brede slaunderous backebityng euill suspicion peruerse iudgementes variaunce hatred muche bralling iesus therefore well knowyng thissame ye chiefest corrupcion euangelicall godlynesse sharpely rebuke pharisaicall supersticion saying moses olde tyme appoynt certain ordinarie constitucions customes purifyng neuerthelesse conteyne figure representacion pourgeyng clensyng soule ende serueth al euer lawe derkely set foorth shadowes tyme consideracion trueth clerely apperyng foorth mete shadowes olde lawe litle litle vanish awaie ye phariseis whiche professe perfect knowlage lawe enbrace thatsame parte lawe onely whiche least weyght towardes true godlynesse ye onely offend behalfe ye enbrace carnalitie lawe passyng spirite lawe also reason carnall ceremony added lawe constitucions owne making ye wyll wyse reputed holynesse veray comaundementes god puritie consisteth inculpablenesse innocencie herte ye euery whyle make muche washyng bodye ye washe pottes cuppes ye drynke ye washe plater dish meate serued beyng outwarde thynges nothyng al makyng true godlynesse mynde ye meane tyme innermore chieffer parte beyng still vnwashed full filthynesse detestable afore god wete rauine iniquitie ye beleue selues defoyled yf ye drinke vnwashed cuppe ye eat vnwashed dishe yet ye thynke selfe pure clene yf cuppe dishe yea al conteyned haue gotten rauine fraude fooles peruerse iudgemente made bodye make also soule purenes dooe highly please mete make whole man pure euery parte hymdid made witho c mete haue prouided firste chieffer parte al ye flattre selues though ye pure euen best sorte one syde ye dooe euerie whyle washe bodyes vessel ye eate drynke litle water syde yf herte beyng polluted manyfold guyles rauines hatred enuie desire worldly promocion pestilent vice bee purged almesdedes whiche almes though ye doe vainglorye shewe onely yet ye thinke bee sufficient vttermoste highest clensyng soule bee woe vnto pharisee vnder pretexte colour seruyng god woorke owne commoditie tithing euen vilest moste common herbes myntes rue thoughe god cared mo priestes leuites onelygeue almes behold thynges clene vnto meane tyme contrarye mynde god ye deale guilefully neyghbour relieue nedie enuie grutche haue wealth yourselues weake ye oppresse iudgement veraie dede ouerthwarte peruerse thynges whiche lawe hath appoynted season kept fleashe dede bene partes leaue vndoen tho thynges whiche god would moste chiefly doen euermore good acceptable vnto hym outh first principally haue doen suche thynges concerne owne commoditie ye dooe euen scrupulously looke vnto thynges concerne helpyng neighbour ye passe nothyng pwoe bee pharisee ye loue vppermoste seates synagogue gretynges market woe vnto scribe pharisee ye hyprocrites ye graues whiche appere men walke ouer ware aunswered one lawiers sayed vnto hym mayster thus saying thou puttest v rebuke also sayed woe vnto also ye lawiers ye lade men burden bee hable beare ye selues touche packe one finger woe vnto pharisee though ye outwardely beare shewe holynesse yet neuerthelesse withinfoorth swell ambicion sekyng haue higher seates synagogue ye reioyce heare suche honourable tytles maister maisters bidde good morowe good eauen stretes abrode nothyng el entendyng ne sekyng ye maye please iyes estemyng thyng nothyng displease iyes god filthinesse soule therfore woe vnto hypocrisie lyke vnto dead mennes toumbes whiche shyne loke smothe without foorth reason whyte worke title many soondrye picture whereas withinfoorth full stuffed vnclenesse meane tyme thyng outwardly appeareth sheweth faire iyes suche passe thyng hide within vnseen neuerthelesse men maye beguiled god loke moste priuiest corner herte whan lord great sharpenesse spake thynges cloked holynesse ye pharisee one lawiers beyng desirous bridle playn speakyng iesus sayied vnto hym whyle thou speakest ye pharisee thou doest also reproche v herte yt knoweth conscience guiltie cannot abide playne speakyng feareth leste exa ple playn speakyng agaynst others maye last light vpon hymselfewo vnto e lawiers ye lade menne burden iesus beeyng euerlastyng trueth whiche skill flattreing sayed trueth onely faultlesse vnculpable yet neuer chydeth emende misse aunswered vnto lawier wordes whiche speake touche thou acknowlegest woe shalbe vnto lawiers also beyng contente exacte euerie triflyng obseruaunce lawe handes poore ignorauntes moreouer besydes authoritie lawe adde many poyntes owne heapyng burden vpon burden ye laye vpon shoulder simple people whole fardel vnpossible borne meane whyle ye take owne pleasure vttermoste beyng ferre touchyng thynges whiche ye laie folkes shoulder ye muche kepe chiefe poyntes neither without whiche reste nothyng pwoe vnto ye buylde sepulchre prophetes father killed truely ye beare witnesse ye allowe dedes father kylled ye buylde sepulchre therfore sayed wysedome god wyll sende prophetes apostle shall sleagh persecute bloud prophetes whiche shed beginnyng worlde maye bee required generacion bloude abell vnto bloude zacharie perished betwene aultare temple uerayly say vnto shalbe required nacion woe vnto vainglorious bosting perfeccion buylde vp toumbes prophetes moste parte thesame wer slayne forefather therby cometh passe euen veray thyng wherewith ye would moste fainest cloke maliciousnesse ye moste bewraye thesame whyle ye garnyshe sepulchre prophetes ye graunt person detestable whiche kyllers suche men whose memorie high holy emong theyr ofspring forasmuche owne selues dooe towardes prophetes tyme beyng ferre superiours prophetes time pastye beare witnesse ye allow dedes youre father attempt wurse harmes auncetours committed prophetes olde time ye playnly declare beeyng blynded lucre ambicion enuie hatred ye doe wetingly allowe wicked actes forefather whiche actes theyrs ye doe onely folowe also earnestly labour passe go beyond often hath goodnesse god called backe emendment tymes haue ye wickedly shewed extreme crueltie layed trueth euen lappes whiche trueth vnto none cause odious sauing contraried naughtie lustes desyres wherfore wysedome god whiche ordreeth thynges suche prouidence cannot wordes expressed wil punishe obstinate malyce nacion hath determined leaue nothyng vnassaied whereby maye bee conuerted better wayes aswell botomelesse goodnesse god also peruersenesse possible woonne goodnesse shall bee declared creature muche greuous tormentes shall endure howe muche longer space haue suffred muche greater benefites haue prouoked occasioned repentaunce wherfore thus spake wysedome god within selfe shall doe haue dooen vnrewly nacion sent moses vnto sent many prophetes olde tyme sent iohn baptiste moses conspiracie wrought prophetes euery one either slewe orels plagued affliccion iho neither would thei heare though prophet neither escape scotfree geuing good aduertisement sonne man come hym woorke destruccion death shall hereafter sende vnto last prophet shall ghostely expound lawe vnto shall sende apostle shall haue great vertue workyng miracle shal freely doe good people shall bryng vnto al folkes saluacio excedig smal charge bought wete faith yet heare neither wil persecute tormet driue awaie yea sum wyll slea farre shal malice excede goodnes god laste wha malice shalbe ferre growen shall onely matche also excede passe abominacions age past shall vengeaunce god fall sodaynely vpon shall bee required handes bloud prophetes hath shed sen first creacio worlde wete ye bloud abell firste men slaine brother cain beyng enuious vnto bloud zacharie prieste sonne ioasgene iiiiii paralip xxiiii callyng backe people better aduised wayes stoned death sedicion people betwene temple aultare sayd zacharie euen momente whan departed life bothe testifiyng innocencie theyr wickednesse sayed lord see require euen approcheth tyme vengeaunce one nacion shall ye would say bee punished al hainous dedes forefather hath gone beyond malice euer hath reigned shall cum passe vndoubtedly wisdome god hath sayd afore shall cum passe iewes day excede rebellion peruersenesse crueltie olde tyme haue shall suche greuous sorte bee punished though alone accomplyshed dooen yll partes euer auncestours haue soondrie age wickedly played woe vnto lawiers ye haue taken away key knowlage ye entre selues came ye forbad whan thus spake vnto lawiers phariseis began buisy capciously aske many thinges laiyng wait hym sekyng catche sum thyng mouth wherby might accuse hym woe vnto lawiers woe openly professyng knowelage lawe whiche ghostly takyng handes due vnto key science cuning whiche ought haue opened way kyngdome heauenye entre selues theym came ye forbad yet neither haue ye intred thither selfes others yt wer willing haue gon ye haue kept ye peruersly expound lawe ye one might say lay battrey whiche principall chefe foundacion al lawe maner woordes iesus beyng dede halfe bitter reason plain speakyng ye trueth yet worker hearth suche thei wer spoken willing receiue medicine wer phariseis also lawiers sore offe ded knew priuely owne conscience thinges whiche wer spoken wer euen true would make countenauce people yet meane tyme lay sure awayt saiynges iesus huntyng serchyng thyng might procede foorth mouthe wherupon might grounde make foundacion sum surmised matter end might seme persecute certain priuate hatred zele religio loue towardes god propertie also hath pharisaical hypocrisie worketh ne attepteth none wicked acte whereon layeth fayre glose loue duetie towardes god xii chapter gathered together innumerable multitude people muche trode one began say vnto disciple first beware leauen phariseis whiche hypocrisy nothyng couered shal vncouered neither hid shall knowen thynges ye haue spoken derkenes shall hearde light whiche ye haue spoken eare euen secrete place shalbe preached top house say vnto frendes afrayed kyll bodye haue wyll shewe shall feare feare whiche hath kylled hath power cast hell yea say vnto feare hym fiue sparowes bought two farthinges one forgotten god also euen heares head noumbred feare therfore ye value many sparowes lorde iesus knewe malice pharyseis scribe lawiers vncurable pleasure openly notifie publishe theyr hypocrisye ende creature mighte vnawares deceiued cloked counterfaytyng many coumpanyes people euen standyng round thicke presse trode one vpon others heles began say vnto disciple beware ye leaue phariseis hypocrisie endeuour selfes earnestly suche ye would taken nothyng cloked shall fro hensfoorth hable long hidden shall tyme come whiche shall vttre make manifeste vnto worlde aswell innocencie also malice neither thing preset close vnder couerte whiche shall shortly bee vncouered ne thing secretely hidden whiche shall cum open knowlage men wherefore beware ye life void cloking counterfayte glose ye neither speake ne yet thinke thyng alone youreselfes ye would good willes haue knowe al creature whatsoeuer ye shall speake priuelye derke shal one day time cum bee reported agayne clere light whatsoeuer ye shall nowe saie folkes eares within bedchaumbers shall one day bee openly talked house toppes trueth shall offende wycked sorte beeyng peinted counterfait semblaunce godlynes leat feare euil person lede away sincere preaching ye trueth gospel vttermost extremitie mischiefe doe kylle yea bodie onelye kille thus muche doe say vnto frendes forasmuche ye maye boldely truste sure defence leatte crueltie felowes anye thyng feare though attempte euer may bee dooen may sleagh poore carkesse doen haue nothing besides dooe ferther harme vnto dyeth slayne cause fantasie take feare bee one counsayle thys case good reason lesser feare geue place greatter rather bee feare hath power becke destroye whole man altogether ye wil nedes haue shewed vnto euen god onelye hathe power whan hath kylled bodye caste soule hell leat cruelnesse wieked persones make anye thyng afrayde dooe lyghte harme nay dooe harme al neyther sufferaunce god yf ye shall vpon dreding man growe cleane kynde sinceritie preaching ghospell ye laboure eschue lyghte transytory mysaduentures ye shall fall harmes euer endure leat therefore one nayle dryue nayle leat feare god dryue feare menne feare ye leste ye shall peryshe day men must without choice one come death neyther dooeth force howe long man hath lyued howe well hath liued blissedly dooeth departe hen whosoeuer dieth name sake yet shall suche thyng chaunce beefore tyme prefixed vnto youre heauenlye father ye shoulde lyue whit longer though feare death neuer much vexe mindes yea poyncte also youre father prouyde euerye one shall dye hys due tyme although thynges seme apparence bee dooen chaunce aduentures yet shall nothyng chaunce vnto permission youre father careth thynges belongyng vnto lower pryce thyng contemned selye sparow may man bye fyue two ferthinges yet doth god leaue vncared muche anye one euen vileste vermine liuing doeth perishe without knowelage heauenlye father whome hath specially pyeked chosen veray fewe number reste sette furth glory hys name dooeth greatelye leaue vncared hath euen veraye heates youre heades numbred talethe veraye beares heade nu bred agaynste hym wickednesse striue nothing desyre shall know beste therefore youre carefulnesse concernyng youre lyfe caste ye full whole vpon hym taketh care selye sparowes leaue vncared ferre better sparowes worlde saye vnto euery one whosoeuer confesseth men shall sonne man knowlage also aungells god denieth men shall bee denied aungels god whosoeuer speketh worde againste sonne man shall forgeuen vnto blasphemeth holy goste shal bee forgeuen bring vnto synagoges vnto ruler officer take ye thought thing ye shall aunswer ye shall speake holy ghoste shall teache houre ye ought saie wherefore bee ye feare eiuilles mischiefes whiche men may bee hable dooe vnto men fall profession name menne remembryng affliccyons lastyng shorte lyeth waye euerlastyng blisse shall bee partaker ioye shall refuse bee partaker worldely reproche albeit open shame emong menwhosoeuer confesseth men c true glorye god one thing say assuraunce whosoeuer shall professe name presence menne whiche dooe shall afore worlde bee thyng odyous detestable also shall professe hym tyme maiestie sonne god shall bee opened shewed foorthe face aungels god contrariewise whoso shall acknowleage face men shall bee knowen beefore aungels god knowe infirmitie humayne bodye myne shall bee slaundre vnto manye faulte whiche eyther procedeth man beeyng deceyued wrong opinion elles cummeth weakenesse nature although greuous shall neuerthelesse bee easilye forgeuen therefore call samaritane drinker wyne frende publycanes iesus carpenter sonne shall soone bee releassed yf amende reproche whereunto weakenesse thys bodye hathe opened entreaunce occasionunto blasphemeth ye holye goste shall forgeue whoso shall speake raylling woordes agaynste holye ghoste whome god woorketh miracle suche one doothe sette prepenced malice wetingly willingly resiste agaynst glory god shall fynde pardone neyther preset world worlde come lyke wicked aungels waye leaft come agayne vnto repentaunce resisted god infirmitie weakenesse obstinate malice thesame wicked au gel shall euer emende ne haue anye hope forgeuenesse euen thesame state shall men bee sure bee folowe peruerse facion others see manne taking reste slepe sufferyng houngre yea shall see dying therefore maye bee pardoned speake thyng may truely bee sayde mortall man beyng corrupted enuie impute actes spirite beelzebub whiche knowe bee power god forasmuche one syde defraude god glory syde put ouer vnto wieked spirites cometh god due theyr doyng verayly deiulishe malice whiche thesame cause shall obteine pardone god though beeyng singularely enclyned shewe mercye skille repente himselfe goodnesse many wayes shall murmouring agaynste youre preaching persones shall persecute eyther strayghing right way mere simplicitie el maliciousenesse miengled theyr errour othersome agaynst conscience theyr owne harte shall labour destruie veritie whiche euidentlye see trie knowe shal doe none respect contrarieth theyr naughtie affeccions meanes suche persones shall eiuill spirite satan rebell good spirite god helpe garde ye wicked men shall inuade kyndes ingiens although ye bee ignorauntes worlde poore men lowe degree cause bee afearde vproare sedicion world agaynste spirite god graciouse playne without guile deceite sufficient againste aswell
