fraude violence worlde therefore ye shall bee haled theyr synagogue app ached greate crymes ye shall bee drawen come beefore magistrate rewlerstake ye ne thought ye shall aunswere prynces doe ye common sorte people doe whan broughte afore iudge theyr aunswere muche carefull aunswere maye make maye speake ridde theyr handes mattyer thus muche shall bee geuen puplique autoritie magistrate beyng called ye shall appere cause none ye shoulde bee afearde sighte ye shoulde bee carefull howe defende youre selues oracion prepared afore playne tale trueth shall continually tyme tyme bee ready freshe memory vnto suche kiende wordes speake holye ghoste shall sufficientelye minister vnto often nede shall require suche sorte life shal wordes also bee nothing pithie effectuall playne trueth without coloures pone coumpany sayde vnto hym maister speake brother deuyde enheritaunce said vnto man made iudge deuider ouer sayde vnto take hede beware couetousenesse man life standeth aboundaunce thinges possesseth put furth similitude vnto saying grounde certain riche man brought furth plentifull fruictes thought within himselfe saying shal doe haue roume bestow fruictes ayde doe destroy barnes builde greater therein wil gather al goddes growen vnto wil say soule soule thou hast much aied vp store manye yeres take thyne ease eate drinke mery god saied vnto thou foole nighte fetche away thy soule thee whose shal thinges thou hast prouided gathereth richesse riche toward god feare iudgemente maketh many goe crosse way sinceritie professing gospel doth greedy desire money corrupt great mayny ende therfore lorde might vtterly plucke affeccion also disciple hertes thyng basse vyle vnmeete suche haue entred charge heauenly affayres matier euen offered vnto whereby thing mighte bee doen great multytude people iesus yet manne daye beene bolde aske lowe basse mattyer one sayed vnto maister brother myne vsurpeth parte enherytaunce whiche shoulde serue v bothe fyndyng manye euasyons stertyng hole delayeth daye daye make particion therof leat autoritie thy woorde bee succoure ayde vnto say vnto bidde deuide enheritaunce iesus ye woulde saye taking skorne indignacion bee interrupted heauenly busynesse preaching vnto carnall fylthye ca e meane vnder one geuing lesson seruautes suche one beareth office apostle ought bee enwrapped secular filthie affayres world answered thou felow face doest thou myddes preaching interrupt agaynste thy brother diuiding youre enheritaunce hath made iudge betwene two variaunce light tryflyng mattier shortely decaye hath geuen vnto bee diuider enheritaunces hath worlde iudges enough ende lowe matiers trauerse haue suche commission partie shall growe richesse cuming temporall goodes landes succession creature may come enheritaunce lyfe immortall heauen turning disciple rest present begoon euen exaumple partye interrupted hym afore hys sermon exhorte earneste desyre geatting worldely rychesse richesse themselues eiuil put chiefe aygh man life desyre called away tho thinges whiche doe earnestly concerne euerlasting blissetake hede beware coue ousnesse veary folye beware ye sayeth iesus wise thinges belonging vnto auaryce oftentimes vnder colour necessitie making prouisyon aforehande one liuyng cometh stealing creping man vice neuer voide pensifenesse care suffered enter minde leadeth right way vnto kinde dishonestie yea vneath may possibly eschewed except euen thinges whiche doe possesse owne good right possessed v vnearnest sorte suche contempt set naught expedient doe suche people doe suche sorte put theyr trust affiaunce theyr richesse sette certain great staygh assuraunce man felicitie doe veraye sore deceiue themseluesno man life stadeth ye aboundaunce ye thinges hath aboudaunce maketh felicitie rather pensife carefulnesse yea side contempte thynges whiche onely none sought acquired necessitie nature appeaced satisfied litle woulde diepely empriente thesame hertes grosse people lorde added therto parable whiche euerye manne myghte trye examyne hys owne affeccion sayeth certayne ryche felowe whose lande broughte exceding aboundaunce fruictes profytes fruitefulnesse yeres lyke yeres better manne hauyng whyle mynde relieuyng extreme pouertie neighboures sorte though growen hadde bene brought furth behoofe himselfe moe toke care laying vp store bestowyng anye parte thereof nedye waye alines liberalitie sayd within himselfe hearte may beste doe plenteouse aboundaunce corne fruictes ouer greate barnes haue laye vp store thynges haue come yeres groweth hadde taken charitie bee counsayle whan herte thus boyled charitie woulde haue sayde vnto hym looke well aboute howe manye bee lacke thynges thou haste superfluitee acknowelage remember whome thou arte beholdyng whome thou arte bounde thanke thys fortunate luckienesse yere thine god hath speciall greate tendrenesse towardes thee geue thee stocke goodes wherof thou maiest gather great increase gayne godlye weorkes make thou exchaunge goodes trasitory goodes shall euermore kepe staygh yearthly goodes heauenlye humayne goodes dyuyne shall thy lyberalitie bee gayne vnto thee mynde take folye vnbethinking bee counsaylesoule c take thine ca e eate drinke mery instinct mocion thereof say within himselfe downe myne olde barnes make larger lay vp store whole increase thys yeres growyng reste goodes nothyng maye decaye miscarrie whan thinges fully stablyshed thing sette good safetie tha taking thoughte ne care nothing wil say myne soule soule great abound aunce thou hast thynges layed vp store thee euen enoughe serue thee greate maynye yeres take thyne ease take thy fil eating drinking make mery thou canst dreame fortunate state long endure whan sayde riche manne thus caste hys mynde came sodaynely vnto hym voyce god saying thou foolish man thy veray life vncertayn thee dooeste thou hoorde vp thynges store manye yeres come seeing thou canste take fruicion thinges whiche thou layest vp longer thou arte thys lyfe whiche lyfe man assured muche one dayes space dooeste thou promise thyselfe many many yeres veraye nyghte shall require haue thy lyfe soule awaye thynges whiche thou haste prouided whose shall bee certes shall bee none thyne thou must force leue vnto heyre thyne owne enter take possession ghostlye rychesse whiche bestowyng thy richesse almes thou myghtest haue gotten would haue gone thee whan thou haddest bene dead thou hast nowe heard exaumple state man whiche hoordeth vp richesse world owne vse ryche owne behalfe onely ryche wardes god would fayn refreshed cherished membres suche persones haue serue muche blisfull ryche suche sorte dooe growe pouertie pand spake vnto disciple therfore say vnto take thought life ye shall eate neyther bodye ye shall put lyfe meate body rayment consider rauens neither sowe ne reape neyther haue storehouse b tus god fedeth howe muche ye better fethered foules whan lorde thus muche sayde multitude al sortes degree anon turning disciple whome requisite fer alauarice also bee voyde al carefulnesse thys lyfe thentent nothing might hinder put backe theyr myndes charge teaching ghospell cause quod haue already afore thys time sayde vnto euen repetyng agayn agayn shall warne ye nothing carefull concerning lyfe body folkes perplexitie feare lest ye shoulde want meate drinke yet incommoditie youre bodye lest shoulde wante clothes youre heauenly father hathe geuen better also geue lesse valour soule life better meate although mean time without meat endureth tabernacle body body precious garmenteconsidre rauens thei ither sowe reape c dooe ye thynke father lesse bountifull riche suffer seeing hath bounteous liberalitie geue lyfe shall lacke meate wherewith life must continued seing hath geuen body doe body shall want wherwith couered prouidence god dooeth slacke thing beastes whiche brute price trowe ye bee slacke whome hath specially chosen deputed high matier consider ye raues owes neyther sowe corne ne reape neyther haue storehouse ne bar yet god dooeth prouyde also concernyng theyr foode one neglecteth none thinges whiche hath created howe muche beeyng youre father prouyde whome muche derely loueth aboue crowes rauens pwhich taking thought adde stature one cubite ye bee hable doe thing whiche leaste take ye thought remnaunte consider lily growe labour sprune yet say vnto salomon al royaltie clothed like one god cloth grasse day fielde tomorow cast fornace much cloth ye litle fayth aske ye ye shall eate ye shall drinke neither clime ye vp high al thinges heathen people world se e father knoweth ye haue nede thinges wherfore seke ye kingdome god thinges shallbee ministred vnto troubleously vexed care suche thinges poyncte onelye mistrustefulnesse towardes god also folye playne folye bee vexed carefulnesse mynde whiche shall nothing auayle manne hable hys carefulnesse make hys lyfe one day longer shoulde beewhiche c adde stature one cubite muche quantitie stature youre bodye shape therof hande god geueth suche shape himselfe beste pleaseth geueth suche stature hys euen dooethe geue lyfe long hym lyketh praye hable throughe hys carefulnesse adde one cubite heithe vnto stature bodye man hable carefull thoughte takyng make one whyte heare head blackeconsidre ye l lie howe grow c one blacke heare whyte thynges whiche mannyer weighte carefulnesse nothyng auayle purpose bee carefull concernynge lyfe nowe entente ye maye bee troubled care clothing body considre lily whiche growe fieldes without anye mannes laboure howe shoote vp theyr full heithe quantitie manne dressyng bestowyng anye laboure aboute lily dooe neyther laboure ne spynne ne weaue yet prouydence youre father dooeth insomuche suffer lacke clothyng moste ryche kyng salomon whan moste shewed princely porte hys regall estate anye suche tyme well arayed anye one whiche soeuer bee fyelde lilyes whiche shall last shorte tyme god dooe greate prouidence cloth blade euen commonly growing euery anone vade perishe away suche blade daye freashe greene fielde nexte morowe whan dryed vp caste fournace mouthe burned howe muche suffer bee vnclothed ye litle feyth thys carefulnesse youres commeth none thyng onely mystrustfulnesse towardes youre father beeyng aswell moste mightyfull also moste lyberall yea also moste prouydente feedethe clotheth gouernethe thynges whiche hathe created dooe ye also caste awaye care concernyng thynges basseste sor e wete meate drynke clothyng lette neyther penurye suche thynges kylle heartes suffysaunce sette pryde neyther ydle folkes hange ye together weather obseruyng markyng lykelyhoodes fore geassynges tempestes weaxing pale woe often planetes shall threaten penurie derth corne concerning suche thinges make great inquisicion serche afore long tyme come condicyon gentile beeyng wholly wedded vnto world doe knowe god ye knowe howe gracious bountyfull father ye haue heauen dooe ye vayne carefulnesse tormente youre owne heartes youre father knoweth well enough ye haue nede suche thynges appertayne necessitie nouryshyng coueryng bodye neyther harde suffer peryshe defaulte suche thynges forasmuche ye earnestly occupied businesseseke ye ye kyngdom god c rather leat youre chiefe pryncipall care bee sette foorth kyngdome god whereof haue specially chosen appoyncted bee publisher also mynysters especially afore al thynges seke ye ryghteousnesse therof consistyng iudaicall ceremonyes thynges whiche haue aforetaughte whole hearte mynde bee ye earnest thys thyng whiche moste greatest smaller thynges god himselfe hys owne accorde mocyon geue vnto euerye one suffer thyng wanting pfeare litle flocke father pleasure geue kingdome sell ye haue geue almes prepare bagges whiche olde euen treasure sayleth heauen cometh neither mothe corrupteth treasure hearte bee also leat nothyng make afearde litle litle flocke ye afewe ye meane lowe degree ignoraunt person ye learning worldly knowelage ye wth anye richesse anye power weapon bendes harnessed men armed agynst thys worlde beeyng full wiekednesse readye aryse agaynste kynde engyens yet cause ye shoulde bee afeardefor father pleasure geue ye kingdome hath lyked youre father reiecte men power men learnyng proude hearted vnto worldely acceptacyon persones moste abiecte geue hys kingdome whiche throughe priuie richesse soule whiche reason celestiall fortress vnpossyble bee subdued wherefore beeyng specially chosen highe dignitie kingdome celestyall contemne ye basse vile thinges marked goodes shall euermore contynue theyr perfeccyon take ye regarde thynges shall shorte space decaye come naughtesel ye haue geue almes yf yearthlye possessyons dooe hynder pulle backe thinges beeyng ferre better fel ye ye haue possession deale money made thereof relieuing nede poore richesse cannot layed vp safe custodie put banke exchaunge greatter assured encrease intereste whoso geueth almes layeth hys goodes receiue intereste goddes hande vse anye deceipte fraude riche bountiful vile thinges repaye precious earthly thinges celestial thinges transitory shortly bee taken awaye thynges eternally euer euer endure endeuour selues therefore bee grounded ryche menne suche goodes geat treasour bagges dooe neuer weaxe olde laye vp treasour vse heauen whiche shall neuer fayle whiche shall bee safe aswell theues mothes thing see commonlye chaunce place euery manne hath hys treasoure hath hearte alsowhere treasour hearte also thing man dooeth earnestlye loue forgeat lyke vnto ryche manne hath great goodes eyther layed vp home hys cofers dygged grounde thoughe bee abrode home yet hath hys hearte home full care feare leste priuye shoulde robbe leste casuall chaunce may eyther bewray perishe hys treasour agayne loue haue theyr myndes euermore earnestly fixed set thyng loue herte muste euermore heauen heauen euermore bee ye shall haue nothing earthe whiche ye dooe eyther hyghly esteme loue shall haue treasour safely layed vp heauen plet ygnes bee girt lightes burning ye selues like vnto men awayte theyr lorde returne wedding wha cometh knocketh may open vnto immediatly happie seruau te whome lorde whan cometh shall fynde wakyng veryly say vnto shall girde himselfe make sit downe meate walkyng shall minyster vnto come seconde watche yea come third watche fynde happie seruauntes vnderstande ye good man house knewe houre thefe woulde come woulde surelye watche suffer house bee broken vp ye therfore ready also sonne manne come houre whan ye thynke tyme shorte earneste endeuour ye must attende ye hoorde vp heauen great heape good weorkes daye approcheth euen hande whiche euerye one shall seede haue sowed temporall thynges reape harueste euerlastyng thys daie vncertaine ye muste continually fro time time bee prepayred readie come shall ye bee ye shall bee stopped ne staighed lettes impedimentes wordely thinges ye shall haue leat slippe occasion good agaynst cumming thys day thanleate lo gnes bee girt eat loignes time time wel girt leat light burning candels handes ye may like vnto wise feithful seruauntes vncertayne houre lorde wil returne fro wedding stande continually redinesse watching torchelight ende assone beyng come home agayne shall knocke may open doores vnto hym thys diligence seruauantes shall displeasaunte lorde maister happy may bee yf maister sodaynly cumminge shall see theym watching saye vnto certayntie maister shall geue agayne theym excedyng large rewarde pleasure seruice whiche neuerthelesse bounden dutie doe agayne hys partie shall girde hymselfe diligently watching euery one requireth haue shall seruitoure geue theym hys owne handes neyther dooeth make force parte night cometh pleasure haue thyng vncertayne whatsoeuer watche night comethand yt come seconde watche c whether secounde thirde veray dead night happy shall seruauntes bee yf lorde shal finde due readinesse therfore slackenesse vsed life muste men liue though day shoulde come euen present houre shall sodainly vnwares steale vpon worlde therfore muste men alwaies prouyde maye come vpon theim beyng vnready shall ous already come time ouerlate amende slepinesse afore paste none sluggyshe mayster house woulde suffer haue hole dygged throughe hys house nyghte knewe afore hande houre thefe woulde come suche one dooeth kepe continuall watche maye bee spoyled hys worldelye goodesbe ye therfore readye also sonne man come c howe muche youre parte watche ye maye lese blisse euerlastyng nyghte thefe comethe stealyng suche houre whan folkes house moste harde dead slepe leaste loking body vndermyne shall sonne man sodaynely come suche houre whan ye shall leaste mystruste thynke come therefore asmuche tyme vnknowen yet vndoubted come bee ye contynually readye well armed furnyshed good weorkes lyghte menne clene rydde voyde lettes encoumbraunces thinges worldely ppetur sayed vnto maister tellest thou thys similitude vnto v men lorde sayed feithfull wise stewarde whome hys lorde shall make rewler ouer householde geue duetie meat due season happie seruaunte whome lorde whan cometh shal finde dooing trueth say vnto wil make rewler ouer al hath seruaunt say herte lorde differre cumming shall beginne smyte seruauntes maydens ate drinke bee dronken lorde seruaunte wil come day whan thinketh houre whan ware e piece geue rewarde vnbeleuers petur whan hearde woordes sayde vnto lorde maister whether thy pleasure thys parable shall appertayne properlye directely v alone thy disciple el dooeth indifferentlye concerne touche people lorde suche sorte attempereth hys aunswere denyeth behalfe perteyne menne couet atteygne euerlastyng saluacyon specially signyfyeth concerne suche haue despensacion disbursing god worde committed vnto added parable wente afore ende woulde better enkiendle disciple perpetually bee incubent vpon theyr office also propouned set aswel rewarde whan duely executed theyr office also punishmente suche slacke officewho seithful stewarde whome lorde shal make rewler ouer housholde rare thing saieth emong men finde experte feithfull stewarde haue dysposicyon one goodes whan hys maister home straunge countrey see well hys householde whiche made ouerseer deputye vse hymselfe lorde tyranne ouer oute tresoures hys lorde bring furth pay vnto euery body due allowaunce much conueniet suche time requisite blessed shall seruaunt whome hys lorde sodaynly returnyng home shall finde attendaunt vpon office hauing approued tryed hys vpright trueth diligence proporcions assigned vnto wil make rewler goodes wil ouchesalue vse hym manyer halfe partener hymselfe goodes substaunce contrary parte case said seruaunt neither one honestye truste vnto yet wyse experte hys offyce taking pryde absence lorde reason office stewarde deputie commytted vnto hymbut seruaut saie hert lorde differ cumming shall saye hys owne mynde maister doothe nowe sette long daye cummyng home agayne peraduenture neuer come agayne meane tyme dooe myne owne fansie seruethe thus shall beegynne vse crueltie ouer felowe seruauntes bothe men weomen onely feedyng wheate theyr mayster aswell hys also pumbleyng beatyng vsurpyng certayne tyrannye ouer hys felowes dooe hys owne parte whyle eate drynke bankette vse drinke himselfe dronke wastfully consuming maisters goodes filthye sensuall pleasure tyottous excesse iudge ye suche stewarde shall haue hys laboure forsouth hys lorde shall returne home agayne suche daye whan looked suche houre knowen seruaunte dooynge whatsoeuer hymselfe lusteth without feare care hys lorde shall separate cutte hys housholde shal vouchsalue suffer hym bee one hys house shall rekon hym noumber vnfeithfull persones assured suffre condygne punyshemente forasmuche woulde bee myndefull hys officethe lorde seruaunte wil come euangelicall stewarde dispenser goddes woorde thyng better winne lorde maisters herte vnto hym whan lorde absent represent gracious bountie towardes neighboure thynke himselfe lorde ouer neighboure remembre felowe seruaunte pthe seruaunte knewe maisters prepared himselfe neyther according shall bee beaten many stripe knewe commit thinges worthy stripe shal beaten fewe stripe vnto whomesoeuer much geuen hym much shalbe required whome men haue committed muche aske certes perfeict knowlage man hath shall haue veritie euangelicall muche grieuous shall hys condemnacion negligente slacke folowe hath learned righte way ye gentile whome trueth hath neither meane law ne meane gospell bene shewed shall nothing sore punished iewes whome law moses instruct forwardnes godly exercise emong againe phariseis suche experte poynctes lawe shall sharpelye punished symple ignorauntes moste grieuous punyshemente others shall haue whome trueth wel knowen many miracle whome liuely exaumple hath moued zele earneste exercyse theyr duetie towarde god haue hydden nothyng whatsoeuer thyng heauenly father hath bene ye shoulde knowe meane haue opened declared vnto beware ye therefore exaumple afore goyng negligent seruaunt regardeth hys maysters commaundemente suche seruaunte hys maister hathe vsed higher degree aboue rest one whome hathe commytted disbursing bestowing hys goodes whome hathe opened priueties counsayle whome hath put truste whan went fer party home excepte shall dooe commaunded dooe shall prepayre hymselfe executyng dooyng suche mattyers knewe hys maister woulde hearte haue bee dooen shall abye manye sore strype whoso shall bee noumber seruauntes whome lorde hath opened hys hearte yf suche one shall dooe offence woorthye punishmente shall drinke fewe stripe cause despensacion goddes woorde ghospell beeyng commytted youre charge shoulde make thyng haulte takyng vpon youfor vnto whome soeuer muche geuen shalbee muche required c rather carefull discharge youre duetie well dooeth verayly take vpon hym charge honoure whoso taketh hande office ministracion churche thyng free gratuitee commytted vnto anye man committed vnto euerye man veray purpose bee broughte furth vsed common vtilitie whole housholde indifferently lyke maisters doe require streight precise accoumpte handes suche one whome haue put trust moe thinges handes one whome larger gifte ministracion knowlage autoritie hath bene geuen god shall required handes others whose credyte larger greater ministery hath bene deputed moe persones oughte haue dooen good vnto muche shall hys hande bee required learning thou hast muche better teache thou richer thou arte muche gladly relieue thou poore thy power manye moe persones leat thyne auctoritie draw bryng vnto ghospell mannes thou haste thyne owne true owner haue lyberally bestowed vpon others hath lent thee pi come sende fyer earth desyre weare already kiendled notwithstanding muste bee baptised baptisme howe payned tyll bee ended suppose ye come sende peace earth tell nay rather debate hensfoorthe shall bee fyue one house deuided three two two three father shall bee diuided sonne sonne agaynst father mother agaynst daughter daughter mother mother law againste daughter lawe daughter lawe mother lawe thirst saluation man cause therof come worlde earnest desire hearte tarying delay semeth long washe doctryne ne worldely haue brought downe heauen mere pure fyer whiche surelye eyther clense puryfye man el burne hym euen purpose come fyer maye bee kiendled yearthe thyng el dooe desyre wante beeyng kiendled ferre wyde daynelye take vniuersall worlde slaine thys fyer shall leape ne sparcle foorth onlesse thys flint stone body bee first strieken crosse baptisme yet behynde comebut must baptised baptisme c whiche father hathe precisely appoyncted vnto dieped myne bloud end shal death suffer paynes tormentes sinnes whole worlde houre neuer afore shall sparcle euangelicall charitie appere vp shewe furth selfe emong men whan shall see innocent giltlesse man haue willingly suffered vyle shamefull death malefactoures haue transgressed sparke perfeict charitie loue baptisme doe onely abhorre loue beare saluacion mankinde great agonye haue accomplished expedicion nature body abhorreth matier entier loue soule greatelye longeth thys fyer kiendled shall stiere vp great vproares worlde shall bee vehemente fyer heauenlye aswell discussyng also strieking foorthe naturall affeccions men doe ye beleue come bring suche peace earthe thys worlde loueth whome altogether quietnesse tranquilitie wha lustes appetite herte bee pleased satisfied whan eiuill persones dooe agree eiuill verayly come set suche concordes one sende debate variaunce people euery one obey ghospell ghospels sake thynges bee contemned whereupon shall come passe one house whiche naughtie peace afore shal aryse holesome variaunce fyue sortes person nature nere ioyned togetherthe father shall bee diuided onne shall cause bee dyuisyon emong themselues three agaynst two eft two agaynst three nere coupled together nature sonne father yet shall father ghospels cause fall bee distaunce sonne sonne shall ghospels sake despise father lyke mannier shall mother bee variaunce daughter charytie ghospell shall bee force daughter mynde naturall affeccyon towardes hyr parentes mother lawe also shall bee playne defyaunce warre agaynste hir owne daughter lawe loue eternall saluacyon shall mynde outweighe respecte alyaunce fleashe bandes spirite dooe muche streygne hearte bandes nature dooe phe sayde also people whan ye see cloude aryse weke straight waye ye saye shall haue shoute wh n ye see southe winde blowe yt say shall haue heate commeth passe hypocrite ye skill facyon earth skie cause ye cannot skill time yea iudge ye selfes right thou goest thine aduerserie rewler thou arte way geue diligence thou mayeste bee deliuered lest bring thee iudge iudge deliuer thee ayler ayler cast thee prieson tell thee thou departest thence tyll thou hast made good vttermost mite woordes iesus turning people sayde wherefore dooe notye prepaire hertes kingdome god whiche euen veray nighe hande doe ye perceiue fele approche many token thinges ye haue ye behalfe nothing good coiecturers seeing mattiers muche lesse weight importaunce ye haue quicke smelle caste geasse thynges come whan ye see cloude arysing westwhan ye see cloude arise west c ye streyghte waye tell afore hande shower toward thing commeth passe ye doe prophecie agayne whan ye perceiue winde blowe south ye tell aforehande greate heate folowe youre geasse dooeth nothyng beguile neuerthelesse litell forceth whether rayne rayne maketh veray great force euangelical feith ye procure atteyne euerlasting saluacyon ye hypocrite sorte youre dooynges cloked counterfaicte euen suche youre holinesse euen suche lyke youre wisedome also thynges perteynyng thys presente lyfe ye haue witte forecaste thynges belongyng immortalitie ye haue syghte ye marke parte skye yearthbut happeneth ye skill time nexte therof ye gather coniectures likelihoodes thynges ensue howe happenethe manye token haue bene shewed vnto ye doe marke espie time hande whiche shall beyng creature eyther healthe bee duely accepted eternall damnacyon case bee neglected ye knowe prophetes haue promised ye heare manye thynges whiche sayde wroughte emong ye see worlde bee chaunged newe state ye yet thinges caste ne coniecture tyme bee hande hath bene promisedwhan ye goeste thine aduersarie ye reweler onely thyng youre earnest endeuoures bee attended vnto neyther shoulde anye thing bee greate weyghte regarde respecte cause whereof ye shoulde susteyne anye losse hindreaunce good procedyng ghospell thou haue good substaunce bee leatte vnto thee selle anye bodye haue dooen thee anye offence dyspleasure forgeue rather take vttermoste thy righte lawe mattier come ferre ye bee goyng iudges euen thou goeste thitherwarde waye take thou suche wayes thou mayeste bee rydde thyne aduersarie better ende variauce betwene euen condicions fare wurse equitie would thou shouldeste dooe abyde vncertayne ende iudgementes lawe whiche iudgementes better cause dooeth alwayes preuaile geatte ouer hande otherwyse thou putteste thy selfe hasarde auenturethou shalte departe thence c leste iudge shall delyuer thee gayloure taketh charge persones condemned caste thee priesone whiche thyng chaunce tell thee mattier certaynetye thou shalte get thence vntyll thou paye demaunded euen vttermoste ferthing busy mattier trauerse lawe whoso maketh hast marke gole euangelicall perfeccion hath vacaunt tyme long letted suche coumberouse tariers firste formoste weigh well thy selfe howe muche gaynes forgeuing wrong displeasure doen vnto thee extreme folowyng suyte lawe geuing ouer leattyng goe thyng recoueryng lawe first thou arte sure gayne frendeshippe partie entreyng trauerse lawe hasarde lesing secoundlye thou winneste aduauntage great deale tyme whiche folowing suit thou muste nedes haue loste besides thou gayneste tranquilitie perfect quiete mynde quiet troubleouse suite lawe wont take away man finally thou doeste escape w tsoeuer mishappes harmes vnluckie ende trauersyng lawe may hable cause vnto thee pthe xiii chapter pthere present season certayne men shewed galilean whose bloud pilate miengled owne sacrifice iesus auswered saide vnto suppose ye galilean greater sinner galilean su fered suche punishemente tell nay excepte repente ye shal likewise perishe xviii vpon toure siloe fel slew thinke ye sinner aboue men dwelle hierusalem tell nay except ye repent ye shall lykewise perishe whyle iesus speaketh premiss many thynges moe multytude sortes people assembled partelye prouokyng luryng theyr duetie towardes god promise rewardes partlye makyng afearde terroure punyshementes woulde bee negligente behalfe vsing meanes possible howe enkiendle myndes audience vnto earneste endeuoure excercyse better lyfe came euen happe certayne persones whiche brought hym newes straunge matier horryble heare concernyng certayne men galile haynouse offender vpon whome pylate lieutenaunte iewrie caused execucyon bee dooen straunge exaumple firste euer sorte whiche whan party aforesayde founde guiltie condemned theyr offence miengled theyr bloud bloud beastes thesame galilean slewe sacrifice ordinary facion iewes offence great enormitie doencertain shewed galilean c punished horrible kynde death terrour feare others nowe vulgare people vseth commonly detest person condemned crye reioyce theyr owne behalfes haue committed suche acte one maketh suche reioysyng manye tymes eiuill higher degree vngracyousenesse myschiefe whose manyfeste openlye knowen cryme hath beene satisfied pourged open execucion deathe iesus beyng mynded terroure thys exaumple shoulde come vnto persones whereas made relacyon thereof supposed touche anye others sauyng onelye suche partye dooen thesame transgression made aunswere vnto thys wyse dooe ye beleue galilean onely moe haynous transgressoures among people galile rigourous sharpenesse iudge hath shewed thys vttermoste extremytie punyshemente vpon alone enoughe kepe youre selues dooyng lyke theyr highe offence ye muste amended sinnes whiche thing onlesse ye doeexcepte ye repente ye shall lykewise perishe though mercifull fauoure god suffer tyme purpose haue conuerted shall ye laste peryshe sembleable vengeaunce god vengeaunce tyme delayed shall put hope escape vnpunyshed excepte ye amende season shall come sodaynelye take ere ye bee aware lyke eyghteene persones late dayes sodaynely taken oppressed falling toure vpon siloe although ye escape vengeaunce menne yet vengeaunce god meanes bee auoyded exaumple fewe toucheth doe ye beleue whan falling sayde toure oppressed thosesame menne many hierusalem euen vngraciouse mischieuous mercifulnesse god differreth vpon hope repentaunce crymes persones manyfeste open mennes vnknowen euerye bodye laugheth theyr owne eiuill property emong one good neyther shall man escape naughtinesse vnpunished yea thus muche boldely assure except ye amende former naughtinesse vengeaunce god shall lyke manier lighte vpon euerye one see ye therefore ye doe abuse fauourable sufferaunce god sinne libertie checke remembring well later vengeaunce god dooethe come muche sorer lyghte whan falleth god dooeth manye soundrye wayes prouoke repentaunce speakyng fayre tyme putting feare last whan seethe obstinate malice men meanes brought amedement vttrely destruieth whole man ende partie would bee good himselfewarde may bee profitable exaumple others tolde also similitude certain man figtree planted vineyard came sought fruicte thereon found none said dresser vineyarde beholde three yere haue come soughte fruicte figtree finde none cut downe coumbreth grounde aunswered sayde vnto lorde let alone yere also till digge rounde dounge see whether beare fruicte beare shalte thou cut downe iesus woulde diepely impriente sentence hertes grosse multitude added premiss similytude apte bee applyed case aforegoyng certayne man sayeth figtree planted within vineyarde partie sette came vnto due tyme seekyng haue fruicte whiche nowe begynnyng cummyng foorthe leaues seemed lykely yelde founde thereon nothyng sauyng onelye leauesa certaine man figtre planted vineyard c callyng hym charge dressyng housbandyng vineyarde sayde beholde thirde yere nowe paste come figtree seking haue fruicte thereof yet none fynde therefore cut downe purpose dooeth occupie coumber roume grounde bothe hurtyng vyne shadowe also drawyng vnto itselfe sappe moysture wherewith profitable fruictfull tree myghte haue beene nourished baylife vineyarde sayde vnto hys maister maister thou haste suffred stande nowe three yeres leatte alone yet thys one yere vntill may trie euen vttermoste cure bee doone vpon maye bee barayne defaulte soyle shall therefore digge rounde ca te doung roote throughe suche cherishing tree bee reuiued stiered vp dooe bring foorthe fruicte thou shalte preserue tree case thou shalte afterwarde see bee desperate baraynesse shalte thou come vttermoste extremitie shalte cutte downe leastewyse may dooe harme thy vineyarde present parable lorde generall warne aduertise persones make lighte god prouoking repentauce particularely directly noted signified nacio iewes whiche hauyng manye tymes beene prouoked moued take better wayes aswell patriarkes moyses lawe also prophetes iohn baptyste lastelye manye miracle euangelicall preaching yet dyd stubbernelye persiste continue theyr obstinate malice shoulde romaynes bee vtterly cutte vp roote taught one theyr synagogue sabboth day beholde woman whiche spirite infirmitie xviii yeres bowed together coulde wise lifte vp hir head whan iesus sawe hir called hir sayed vnto hir woman thou art deliuered thy disease layed handes hir immediately made streight glorified god rewler sinagogue aunswered indignacion iesus healed sabboth daie saied vnto people sixe day whiche men ought weorke come ye may healed sabboth daie lorde aunswered said thou ipocrite doth eche one sabboth day looce e as fro stall leade water ought daughter abraham whome satan hath bound loc xviii yeres looced bonde sabboth day whan thus saied aduersaries ashamed people reioyced excellent dedes dooen hym beholde immediately exaumple barrayn figtree suchewise presente case myght laye playne iyes menne thesame thyng whiche figure parable afore goyng ye woulde say tricked drawen grosse obseruacions ceremony lawe one mighte saye leaues sinagogue outward apparence semed promise swete fruicte vnto god pleasaunt true godlinesse charitie loue towardes neyghbour hath onely broughte foorthe suche lyke thyng also hathe brought furthe bitter frui te enuie hatted backebyting blasphemie murder nowe iesus whan according hys accustomed wont teaching sabbothe dayes presen e synagogue certayn woman continually space eighteene yeres beene arayed disease incurable piteouse se body shrounken clonged together coulde lyfte hir heade vprighte ne looke vpwardethere woman whiche spirite infirmitie eighteene yeres c loe therefore mattyer occasyon shewyng foorthe good frui te figtree vtterlye baraine thys weomanne represente figure gentile suche beeyng openlye wicked full mischiefe nothing hyde rather shewe foorthe theyr extreme eiuill case altogether fixed downewarde vpon earthely thynges muche thynkyng thynges eternall heauenlye contrariewise iewe stode bolte vpryghte vineyarde lord synagogue well decked garnished woordes lawe corporall ceremonyes leaues iewe coulde nothing el dooe enuie surmuise false matiers accusacion lorde iesus firste oste mercifull iyes hys beehelde womannewhen iessawe hir called hir vnto hym c veray pointe euen already lucky token health b anby folowe contented hys owne mere mocion called hir vnto hym happie blessed euer borne whomsoeuer iesus calleth vnto hym fortunate heareth hym whan calleth woman cometh hym beyng full good hope disease long continuaunce vncurable none great vngodlinesse iniquitie euangelicall fayth clerely abolished put away euer leat v see fruite good tree iesus would fain haue could find sinagogue woman saieth thou arte ridde thy great disease sickenesse taketh disdain ne skorne touche holy body laieth hande vpon immediatly able stand bolt vpright bodye knowelagyng celestial benefite glorified god sodainly congregacion gentile chaunged forsakyng idol forsaking earnest desire gredines money forsakyng moste fylthye abomynable lustes whiche long time suche wise bound could haue desyre cum knowlage thynges heauenlye begoon geue laude praise mercifulnesse god whose fre benefite goodnesse hathe clerelye delyuered synnes vnto whiche beyng long tyme captiue thrall mooste piteous wyse liued bondseruaunt vnto satan contrary part consider euyll frute euill tree whan reweler synagogue seen matter beyng dede sayed figtree selfe barrain yet settyng selfe iyes menne sale onely reason leaues lawe takyng indignacion iesus healed woman sabboth daye turned hymselfe people congregated though would haue taught sum great matter nowe heare verye ryghte voyce pharisee thesame voice one manne esteme thou wholle doctrine secte deuout godly man fearyng leste people exaumple iesus fall vnto vngodlines prouideth take good way preseruacio sayig wt great autoritie sixe day ye weke leful worke therfore body desirous made whole let cu one working dayes violate ye sabboth day thyng standing god pleasure folishe saiyng could ye merciful lord abide made ye sabboth day purpose yt men rest ceasse fro helping neibour made sabboth end fro al euil doynges perpetual resting rest yesame outward rest iewes sabbothes figurate voice ye ruler synagogue spoke ye mindes al phariseis scribe lawiers vnder person alone iesus made aunswer saying ye hypocrytesand ought daughter abraham c passyng pith lawe lye altogether rynde barke therof make glorious paynted shewe righteousnes without forth dede ye fer fro al true godlines see ye wicked iudges ye matter reuerence sabboth let would vntye oxe asse owne stalle haue thesame water ye iudge sabboth daye violated commoditie whiche beestowed bruite beast doth seruice doe ye lay vnto charge perillous sore acte haue sabboth day healed doughter abraham rightly borne one synceritie purenesse faith doth perfitelye resemble sayed parente abraham came youre owne priuate commoditie great estimacion among ye haue scrupulositie vntye haulter vnto asse sabboth day may perishe default drinke haue ye indignacio haue sabboth daye looced deliuered woman beeyng one owne nacion satan hath space eyghtene yeres kepte fast tyed bounde workyng labouryng sabboth daye bee forbidden whether two doeth bodily labour vntieth asse ledeth hym water el mere worde touchyng haue made whole al whole woman bothe bodye soule ye suche sorte mercifull fauourable oxe asse syster brother ye suche wyse obserue law supersticion thereof ye neglecte whiche highest chyefeste poynte whole lawe woordes iesus coprised veritie clere manifest also agreable common reaso mannes owne nature made slaunderous raillers full euill ashamed small grefe vnto whan parte glorye abated face multitude thei alwaies set themselfes muche could owne glory said kingdo god like wherto shal compare like grain musterd seed man toke sowed garden grewe wered great tree foules ayre made nestes braunches said wherunto shal lyken kyngdome god like leauen whiche woman toke hid thre peckes meale till leauened iesus hereupo minding open al vain glorious bostyng phariseis whiche conteyned high portly shewe holy conuersation shortely vanishe awaie contrariwise vertue ghospel lowe beginninges grow vp high state dignitie drawe whole vniuersall worlde vnto ye meane death meane apostle beeyng poore meane men ignorauntes put foorth two sundrye parable one meanyng ye see kyngdome synagogue fighteth kyngdome god notwithstanding thesame puissauce might shall ende haue victory therfore lord one enspired newe spirite entent would make multytude people geue better eare vnto hym sayed thyng shall say ye kyngdom god like thyng shal compare make vnderstande maner thyng iswhat kingdoe god like c comparison thyng creature excedingly well knowen whan people euery one looked heare sum royall hygh symilitude taken sum comparison sunne lightenyng lyke matter iesus thought better take parable litle sede yt body estemeth setteth lyke sayth litle grayne corne mustardsede time wholeit lyke grayne mustardsede c like one least thiges possible thyng least value bee worlde thyng neyther colour ne sauour pleasaunte iye yf haue strength vertue hath withinforth without certain wyse felowe whan gotten one sayed litle sedes set naught ne cast away sowed garde thissame sede lest value regarde spronge vp grewe mightie great tree muche euen birdes made themselfes nestes braunches therof one litle litle grayne sowed brought forth many thousandes ght kyngdome god whan shall moste seme bee extincte vtterly abolyshed euer euen shall sprede furthe selfe abrode moste largest compace agayne thyng may saye kyngdome god bee like lyke vnto litle lumpe leauen wise housewyfe hide three bushel mele poured together leafte ye woulde saye buiried vntill strength leauen litle litle turned sayed mele though great quantitie lyke manier lowe humble doctrine gospel shal one day throughly possesse vniuersall nacions worlde went city tounes teachyng iourneying towardes hierusalem sayed one vnto hym lorde fewe saued sayed vnto stryue enter streight gate many saye vnto wy seke enter shall hable whan good manne house rysen vp hath shut doore ye begynne stande without knocke doore saying lorde lorde open vnto v aunswere saye vnto knowe whence yeare shall ye begynne saye haue eaten dronken thy presence thou haste taught stretes shall saye tell knowe whence yeare departe e woorke iniquitie shall wepyng g ashyng whan ye shall see abraham isaac iacob prophetes kyngdome god ye selfes thruste shall come th aste weste north south shall sytte downe kyngdome god beholde last shall firste firste whiche shalbe laste iesus thus muche spoken made haste place grayne saied mustarde seede bee dygged yearthe leauen hydden meale iourney towardes hierusalem knewe shoulde bee slayne waye went throughe euery citie strete village taught creature shoulde piece tyme loste ghospelwarde tofore taught certayne high mat er concernyng menne shoulde sell substaunce concernyng howe men liue hande mouthe manier rauens liliesthen saied one vnto lord fewe saued concernyg howe one ought continue strife contencion aduersary certaine persone cometh vnto saied mayster true fewe whiche atteigne saluacion iudge great multitude wyll enbrace thynges whiche thou teacheste yet othersyde parable grayne mustardsede lumpe leauen appereth promise contrarye wete effectuall power kyngdome god shall come many iesus willyng shewe dede fame knoweleage doctryne euangelicall yea also working miracle come vnto veray many yet man come saluacion would lay clene waye lustes desire worlde bee folower poore christe sayed dooe earnest endeuoure labour ye enter narowe gate thing maye suche persones atteygne iye slugging full slouthfulnesse menne muste putte good willes labour therto entreyng narowe leadeth wyde waye kyngdome heauen gate receyue suche burdened rychesse suche haue heape honour promocions vpon theyr backes suche full paunched excessiue delicate fare suche heauie laden couetise suche puffed vp swollen pryde suche sortes choose brode wyde roumed waye fyrst vieu delectable flatteryng ledyng streight pathe death therefore make ye greate shifte entre whyle waye thereto lyeth open shake caste packes fardel narowe entreaunce maye hable receyue playnly saye vnto youmany seke entre c shalbe one daye many whiche shall bee desirous faine enter shall suffred enter reason commyng thereto shal nowe stopped vp whan good man house shall gon shall haue shutte doore dooeth stande wyde open persones doe theyr true endeuour goe beeyng ouerlate emende ye acknowleage errour hauyng enuie suche entred ye shall begynne stande watchyng doore knocke gate saying lorde maister open doore vnto v good could heard afore whan desyred come shall agayne heare shall aunswere manier heare name maister knowe none seruauntes goe ye seke hym whome ye haue serued shall ye begynne saye maister happeneth thou wilt nowe knowe v thou borne emong v haue eaten dro ken thee coumpany stretes hast thou taught many lesson thy disciple yea moreouer thy name haue healed sicke folkes haue cast deuils wordes shall good man aunswere thynges ye reherse make vnto disciple true right sorte foloweth thesame steppe haue goen hym knowe disciple whose men whence ye cannot tel hence away shall nothyng auayle haue knowen lawe haue heard teache shall nothyng auayle cousinage kynred birth naciondeparte al ye worke iniquitie familiaritie conuersacion eatyng drynkyng shall nothyng auayle miracle shewed doen name shal nothing auayle whosoeuer enuieth hateth brother whosoeuer seketh way owne glory iniurie god glorye whosoeuer preferreth money loue neyghbour suche one whatsoeuer nacion come none myne go wayes hence therfore receyue rewarde mete handes hym whome ye haue wurshipped serued seruauntes haue cause suffred persecucions tribulacions shall enioye pleasaunt swetenesse feaste neuer shall haue ende ye haue set pleasure worldthere shal bee weping c eternall felicitie goe ye hence place shal wepyng gnashyng teeth blissefull state whan ye shall see others ye persecuted afore worlde shall encrease woefull distresse ye shall se progenitours abraham isaac iacob prophetes whome forefather eyther persecuted el slewe sitting glorious feast kyngdome god selues haue descended theyr stocke linnage shutte withoute doores neither prerogatiue bloud kynred haue thyng auayled obseruyng lawe haue nothing auayled hearyng v workyng miracle tymes past haue nothyng auailed ye haue entred blisse faith shal thing moreouer added vnto ye premissesand shal cufrom east fro west shal yet bitterly cause hertes burne beeyng putte beleued selfes alone moe receyued shall come euery nacion whole world coastes quarter world megled one al age degree without choice accepcion persones many whiche neuer kinred abraham isaac iacob knowelage lawe ne familiaritie conuersacio beyng dainly fayth made childre abraha adopcionthere last whiche shalbe first shall sytte feaste kyngdome god thus shall matter muche otherwyse ye looked turned contrary thei semed nerest saluacion shall bee reiected cast ferre saluacion iudgement reputed bee fertheste fauour fro god idolater captain garrisos publicanes souldiers harlottes shall haue chefe principall honour kyngdome god thesame day came certayne phariseis said vnto geai thee oute way depart hen herode wil kyl thee said vnto goe ye tel foxe behold cast deuils heale people day morowe third day make end neuertheles must walke day tomorow day folowyng cannot prophet perish saue ierusale ierusalem ierusalem whiche killest prophetes sto est sent vnto thee oft would haue gathered thy chyldren together byrd doeth gather young vnder wynges ye would behold habitacion leaft vnto desolate tell ye shall see vntyll tyme come ye shall say blessed commeth name lorde iesus abrode great playnnesse without sparyng body teache suche thinges haue fore rehersed beyng thinges odious hateful vnto eares iewes certaine phariseis purpose stoppe mouthe ghospell castyng hym feare came iesus sayed vnto hym take wyse way sauynge sparyng thy lyfe forsake galile herode king prouince beareth malice seeketh occasion slea thee excepte thou beware wyll handle fauour ne mercy dyd handle iohn baptiste iesus declaryng coulde bee daungyer towardes hym handes mortall man onlesse hymself wer cotented therwith declaryng dye suche time decreed heauenly father neither kynd death place tha appoynted determined sayed vnto go ye thus say vnto thatsame foxe veryly thinketh worldly subtyltie wylinesse hable doe feates againste wisdome workyng god beholde workes manne dooe may leaue time prefixed god herode hath maner power ne medling buisinesse lyke autoritie woorde cannot geue vnto man gyft dooe lyke thynges whiche dooe hath power lette man goe thorough hath begoonne till hath ended lette thynges good doe caste deuils men put away disease dooe freely shal long doe time short many people would full fain wer longer determined father shall health man continue doyng suche lyke actes daye morowe third day make finall accomplishemente full ende al kynd doinges wherfore duryng little short tyme must ceasse offyce appoynted vnto shorter space time haue worke muche earnest endeuour must doe commission deputed vnto therfore must fle herode ierusalem muste goe decreed must dyefor cannot prophete perishe saue ierusalem c ende vngodlynesse citie maye bee made open creature vaunteth selfe name behalfe deuoute wurshippyng seruyng god ierusalem thatsame auncyente sleac murderer prophetes neither conueniente prophete perishe suche death place ierusalem yet meane tyme mercifull lord goodnesse desirous faine haue people saued foresaw vtter destruccio ruine hang ouer said vncurable citie ierusalem bewaileth thesame reason often tymes settyng naught despising goodnesse god callyng better wayes woorthyly deserued haue extreme vengeaunce god light vpon ierusalem ierusalem thatsame auncyent murderer prophetes stoner suche men death sent vnto thee many time oft haue assaied gather thy child together ioyne vnto selfe none otherwise hen gathereth chicken vnder winges thei may miscarry thy stubbernes hath gon beyond goodnes though thou haddest euen vowed beheasted thy selfe vtter ruine dooest thou refuse thynges whereby thou mightest bee recouered made whole therfore sence thou makest measure ne ende thy wickednesse hangeth ouer thee mercylesse destruccion house shall bee leaft vnto deserte waste suche sorte shall scarcely remayn marke token euer suche citie thisbeholde habytacio left vnto desolate day vaunteth selfe head holinesse religion glory shall transposed shal go vnto gentile selfes shal geue sentence iudgement selfes dede ye shall put death playnly affirme vnto ye shall see ye shall saye blessed cummeth name lorde shall open protestacion whiche trueth shall enforce vtter yet notwithstandyng ye shortely returnyng naturall inclinacion forefather shall put death ye magnified afore suche high wordes xiiii chapter chaunced went house one chiefe phariseis eate bread saboth day watched behold certain man dropsie iesus aunswered spake vnto lawiers phariseis saiyng lawfull heale sabboth day held peace toke heale let goe aunswered saiyng whiche shall haue asse ore fallen pitte wil straight way pull sabboth day could aunswere thinges befell afterwarde beyng desyred dyner certayne manne one chyefe among pharyseis wente mannes house toke repaste hym sabboth daye sate thesame table also many phariseis according accustomed woont watched iesus yf shoulde speake dooe thyng whiche thei might slaunderously reproue loe euen ready occasio false accusacion againste hym presence certayne manne possessed dropsie disease moste parte vncurable physike talowe coloured swollen body ouer blessed turne pieteous creature came iesus sight vnfortunate suche sinner withdraweth hydeth fro sight would faine haue people sauedand behold certaine man hym hadde dropsy nowe iesus knowyng well enough thought phariseis lawiers myndes demaunded whether thyng standyng god pleasure geue health sabboth daye vnto man beyng otherwyse ready perishe dye whan held peace would make none aunswer iesus calleth vnto partie whiche dropsye touchyng handes healed man bidde goe way immediatly mannes coulour chaunged swelling fleshe abated due course although dede woonderfull yet solemnitie ye sabboth day beyng broken interpreted highly offende phariseis iesus shewyng religion peruerse contrary sorte would offended preseruyng mannes life sauing asse offended made aunswer secrete thoughtes said oxe asse youres fallen downe diepe pitte sabboth daye whether would partie tarie vntil sabboth day al past orels makyng tariaunce would straight waye euen thesame daye geat beaste might miscarry preseruyng oxe asse doeth weigh muche ye thinke sabboth daye bee broken herte offended haue ye sabboth day geuen health man ieoperdy haue died hand disease dropsie case bee bodily worke laboure weighed bodily labour halyng oxe asse oute great depe pit makyng man whole disease haue seen touched hym bidden hym goe way persone ye esteme ought ye tendre preseruyng one sole mane right great noumbre ox assesand could aunswer thinges woordes phariseis plaied mum hertes corrupt peruerse whan thei aunswer make plain clere trueth yet could thei mollifie theselfes allowe sawe doen iesus case theselfes hable haue doen suche lyke thyng would wt al trompettes countreye haue blowen abrode glory lord iesus would glory doynges redoud father god heauen euerywhere discouered peinted holynesse phariseis ouerlog already mocked seduced plain simple people cloked hipocrisie huted glory among men therfore enuied ye glory god true dropsie soule growing first corrupt iudgemet mind dropsie cumeth liuer corrupted perished said phariseis setting al glory thiges wherin gloriyng made swolle wt outforth puffed vp haultnes pride al entrailes withinforth wer miserably corrupted putrified put forth also similitude vnto geastes whan marked pressed highest roumes said vnto whan thou art bidden man wedding sit highest roume leste honorable man thou bidden bid thee come say thee geue man roume thou begin shame take lowest roume rather whan thou arte bidden goe sitte lowest roume whan bidde thee cummeth may say vnto thee frende sitte vp higher shalt thou haue wurship presence sitte meate thee whosoeuer exalteth himselfe shalbee brought lowe humbleth himselfe shalbee exalted lorde therefore onely touchyng healed man dropsie desyrous cure men disease also medicine holsome woordes doctryne whatsoeuer phariseis pride vainglorious bosting woulde goe walkyng vp downe philacteries would stand praiyng ye open stretes soondrie way mete much people passe thei would haue trompet blowe afore whan gaue almes whan fasted thei feate discolour face thei might loke pale thei would goe hunting haue glorious salutacions gretinges ye stretes came diner supper loked sought sit vppermoste men table great desyre moste foolishe vainglorie great swellyng pryde withinforth nothing syncere void corrupcion partie diseased dropsie easily soone healed acknowlaged infirmitie desired made whole disease ye soule canot possibly cured one acknowelage itand put forth also simylytude geastes whan marked howe pressed higheste roumes c iesus therefore mynded reproue hault myndes cumpanye pharyseis thesame head pharisey tyme hospitalitie vain bostyng hymselfe bidden diner thesame phariseis whan desired take repastes men house looked made meanes haue vppermoste seate thinking themselfes ioly felowes happened haue place preeminence table contrariwise sad without mirth cum lo te placed lower end euen much sorte day see solemne pompes moste parte graunde sen mayster doctours often acte commencemente vniuersitie come great solemnitie sinagogue feast within sinagogue haue theyr seates made high sitte loking doune vpon reste aboue likely ready soner theyr elbowe iastle toumble theyr nexte felowe downe place let man haue roumes whan muste cum bedle cumeth maketh way repeatyng euery woord honourable title mayster doctour maister doctour offended yf man arise honour passe yf one put cap presume sit sayed maister inceptour doctour come sette place fonde ceremony tyme consumed awaye therewhyle tyme learne thing al sayed maister doctours come suche purpose eyther learne teache hunt vayne glory emong people shewyng themselues theyr degree great pompe come first greater pompe goe foorth agayne one knew would saye solemne stage playes playing el corpse great ryche cobbe goyng buirying eftsones small place ordre go one thynketh hymself haue great iniurie doen vnto hym yf go left hande semeth iuniour inferiour againe sitting downe feast meruaylous striuyng placyng euery manne degree ordre nedeth many woordes disease dropsie euer doe huntyng vaynglory whereas whyle would emong people reputed vsed god almighty felowes iesus therfore couetyng minister lesson good doctrine sicke suche disease true glory sued sought thou eschewest muche thou mayest euen whan thou moste deseruest haue propouned parable foloweth suche wife ciuile curteous sorte touching conscience euerie one neuerthelesse vttered ne bewrayed none name whan thou shalt desired saieth bidden weddyng feast beware yt thou thine persone preuent take chiefe place begin table leste percase thou set come sodaynly manne higher degree better reputacion thou arteand thou shame begyn take loweste roume rather whan thou art bidden goe sy lowest roume nowe partie desyred thee feaste come byd thee aryse let better man haue thy roume glory thou soughtest haue thou shalt wynne shame shalt bee constreyned read chekes content lowest place therfore rather whan thou shalt desyred wurshypfull table choose take vnto thy selfe neythermoste place sit whan maker feaste shall come maye saye vnto thee frende go vp place honour shall thy humilitie turne thy glory wurship emong reste geastes thy humilitie shall perceyue well enough thou chosest lowest roume place thy selfe thy dignitie shall knowe maker feast euen lykewyse lyfe man greater dignitie one somuche must humble hymselfe vntyll come doeth true perpetuall glory exalte suche lowe degree worldewardefor whosoeuer exalteth c proude high casteth downe lykewyse kyngdome god inferiour people hath receyued euen vnto high degree apostolicall dignitie priestes pharisee scribe lawiers haue reiected gentile acknowleagyng theyr basenesse haue lyfted vp brotherhood eternall glory iewes woulde alone haue reygned feaste nowe eyther haue place el haue laste place pthan sayed also hym desyred hym dyner whan thou makest dyner supper call thy frendes thy brother neyther thy kynsmen thy ryche neyghbours leste also bidde thee agayne recompence bee made thee whan thou makest feast call poore feble lame blinde thou shalt happye cannot recompense thee thou shalt bee recompensed resurreccion iuste men parable forsouth aforegoyng concerned proude pharisee lord added therto another parable whiche directely concerned principall head man phariseis whiche maker dyner ryche cobbes whyle would seme men good hospitalitie call dyner supper maye refreshe suche persones maye bidden good feaste agayne hence maye seke glory themselues ward dede suche makyng feastes hospitalitie ambicion auarice el together one called liberalitie ready wyll doeth benefite man without respect without hope thanke recompense returne hymselfe agayne therby tenour parable folowyng thou disposed well bestowe feast repaste thy makyngwhan thou makest dyner supper call thy fre de c yf thou tyme haue mynde gyue dyner supper call thou thy frendes whiche haue nede thy liberalitie suche haue doen thee great good turne afore leste thou maiest seme either make recompense benefite receyued el seke haue benefite whome thou doest call el call shame thou mayest seme vnthankfull neyther call thou thy brother saye menne thyne owne bloud kinred el thy neighbour whiche dwell thee leste thy benefite maye seme thyng dooen onely respect kynred good herte zele dooe good dede ne call thou thy riche welthie neighbour leste thanke feast thou hast made maye perishe vttrely loste truly wyll perishe loste dede bidde thee agayne diner either good thyne el fyner deintier geuen thee thy benefite beeyng recompensed payed shall ough thee thanke case thou mynded well bestowe diner supperbut whan thou makest feast call poore wherby may come backe agayne thee veraye large rewarde men god call thou poore weake feble blynde lame refreshyng doe thou refreshe god thou wilt peraduenture saye suche one shal labour cost lost haue nothing recompense agayn alwaies nede another whan one paste euen veray poynte shalte thou bee blissedbut thou shalt recompensed resurreccion haue nothyng geue thee agayne haue incomparable riche patrone suffre bee imputed doen hymselfe whatsoeuer shall bestowed wyll transitory thynges repaie euerlastyng dooe thou ouer hastely aske recompense one perfecte true dealyng thou lendest vndoubtedly make recompense life albeit also recompense yet leastewyse resurreccion iust truely parable lorde dyd concerne onely refreashing poore foode meate drincke also relieuyng manier necessitie neyghbour whether bee taught bee tolde faulte bee coumforted whatsoeuer ientyll poynte charitie bee ferthered towardes health bodye soule al thynges bee reputed dooen god man whan one sate meate also heard thinges said vnto happye eateth bread kingdom god said vnto certain man ordeined great supper bidde many sent seruaunt supper tyme say wer bidden cum thynges ready began make excuse first sayd vnto haue bought ferme must nedes goe see praye thee haue excused said haue bought fiue yoke ox goe proue pray thee haue excused said haue married wife therfore cannot come seruaunt returned brought maister woord therof goodman house displeased said vnto seruaunt goe quickely stretes quarter citie bring hither poore feble halt blinde seruaunt said lord doen thou hast commaunded yet roume lord said seruaunt goe vnto high wayes hedge compel cum house maye bee filled say vnto none men whiche wer bidden shall taste supper whan iesus spoken premiss well concerning wedding feast also concerning resurreccion iuste one geastes table wer half dreame touched desire celestiall feast whiche iesus made mecion said blessed man whiche shal haue happe eate bread kingdome god whiche spake ye would say geuing half watche woord fewe bee whose lotte felicitie cum though euery bodye withoute excepcion receiued feast iewes onely head iewes iesus meane parable whiche propouned vnto taughte dede iewes called first place ende might complayne fynde faulte naught set muche beeyng wedded affayres worlde refused cum whan called menne sette goodes whiche afterward perishe lyfe euerlastyng nacions indifferently called ende noumbre christes church congregacion myght made complete parable folowyng certayne oute ryche manne appoynted make sumptuous greate suppera certaylie man ordeined great supper c supper bidden righte greate coumpanye whan tyme supper euen verye poynte houre sente seruaunte geue knowelage vnto bidden geastes supper tyme nowe verye nere warde therefore cum spede bydden theyin long afore prophetes eftsones geueth theim woorde thereof iohn soonne manne cum wayes sayeth nowe thynges readinesse case whereas myghte pleasure haue full fruicion supper long tyme looked beginne euerye one make theyr excuse together one one coulour fyrst theym beeyng manne whollye bente encreacyng substaunce settyng gaining worldly possession euerlasting blisse made aunswere seruaunte beeyng earneste hym haue hym cum awaye haue boughte piece lande fielde muste remedilesse goe thyther see haue boughte praye thee lette thy maister hold excused went second sicke lyke dysease aunswered haue bought fiue yoke ox muste therfore nedes goe proue whether haue made good mercate biynge theman saied haue bought fiue yoke ox c praye thee cause thy maister haue excused would herte come might wente vnto thyrde also made excuse saiyng haue maryed wyfe thou knowest buisie matter many care bringeth tayle therfore though wer neuer wel willing yet maye nowe come thus whan euery one made excuse one one coloure ende myghte bee wurse pynched herte roote time commyng whan shoulde haue perfite intelligence well howe great thyng despysed also maner personnes hadde succeded vnto felowship blisseful state refused said vnto seruaunte bidder geastes goe thy way quickly stretes laues citie whatsoeuer personnes thou shalt mete impotent blynde lame bryng feaste called others first way theyr honestie preferrement thei haue cause fynde faultego quickly stretes c though lothe feaste yet shall therfore bee lost shal haue ful pleasure therof though set ye honour offred shall make whiche thinke themselfes great state shall haue enuy despite hertes see themselfes ferre wurse blynde impotente lame others mooste abiectes creature seruaunte came againe thinges accomplished whiche good manne house geuen hym commaundement saied vnto maister haue brought coulde geat auenture whatsoeuer euen middes stretes wayes yet shall piece thy feaste bee vacaunte shal lacke geastes thou hast purueied dressed excedyng plentifull feast place receiue innumerable coumpany geastes upon lorde beyng desirous feaste prepared shoulde serue commoditie many sayeth vnto seruaunte go thy way againe go thou euen without precinct citie way hedge gather folkes together whece soeuer thou geat themgo vnto highe wayes hedge compell cum beggar straungiers neuer vnacquainted yf bee lothe come compell euen importunitie come vnto house may last furnished euen full affirme vnto one menne muche honour shewed firste called nowe haue dysdayned lothed feaste one shal taste bitte supper mine one day peraduenture repent whan shall see delicates goodly furniture seruice feastfor saye vnto c shall haue enuy suche persones theyr skornefull lothing hath made roume sitte stedes shall vaine desire enter forasmuch whan might haue doen made excuse would cum wente greate coumpanye hym turned sayd vnto theym manne come hate father mother wife child brethre systers yea owne lyfe also cannot disciple whosoeuer dooeth beare crosse come cannot disciple whiche disposed buylde toure sytteth downe coumpteth coste whether haue suffycient perfourme leste hath layed foundacion hable perfourme beholde begyn mocke hym saying man began buylde hable make ende kyng goyng make battayl agaynst kyng sitteth first calleth mynd whether hable tenne thousand mete hym cometh agaynst hym twentie thousande el yet great waye sendeth ambassadoures desyreth peace likewyse whosoeuer bee forsaketh hath cannot disciple iesus hearde al wordes feaste pharisee went furth still waye towarde hierusalem folowed hym coumpanie mightie great multitude people folowed hym theyr feete great maynie whiche hable folowe hym exaumple lyfe went towardes crosse whereunto must readie whosoeuer willyng disciple turnyng hymselfe therfore folowed hym sayed euery one foloweth feete body disciple veraye dede let none ioyne hymselfe disciple excepte readye suffre lyke dooe nowe make haste vnto must vttrely renounce worldly affeccion whosoeuer disposed bee perpetuall disciple myne yf persone come vnto suche purpose dooeth yet hate father mother wyfe child brother sister yea moreouer veray lyfe cannot bee disciple myne lothe vnwilling beare owne crosse folow cannot disciple manier way el yf one come beyng entangled worldly affeccions rychesse promocions sensuall pleasure parentes kynsfolkes alyaunce clogged desyre lyue styll worlde feare death whansoeuer occasion layed afore wyll readie sterte backe purpose profession hath taken vpon hym therfore thou enter matier prepare thou mynde nothyng nyce ne coye ne delicate endure vttermoste thynges hardnesse aduersitie otherwise pardonable haue entred matier afterward fal thyng thou hast begoonne leastwise case muche prouidence circumspeccion perfourmed made goodwhiche disposed build toure men commonly shewe perfourme affayres muche lighter among litle forecast circumspeccion beyng purposed mynde buylde toure wyll euen fyrste chop vnaduisedly without consyderacion set vpon doyng hath head dooeth onely thynke mynde wyll haue toure cast foundacion wyll good laysure vacaunt tyme sitte downe cast penywoorthes mynde charge bee requisite finishyng suche toure yf shall fynde substaunce litle yt cannot hable beare necessarie charge thereof holdeth handes letteth alone leste foundacion layed afterward leaue consideracion habilitie perfourme folkes whiche passyng waye see worke begoonne leafte middes ere finished woulde begynne mocke hym saying felowe hath begoonne make buildynges whiche hath hable bryng perfeccion therefore yf shame bee thyng page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate great weight among menne none dareth bolde begynne building aske counsayle substaunce habilitie aforehande howe muche expedient weigh strength herte ye professe ye wyll folowers whome yf ye shall begynne steppe backe agayne shoulde bee foule shame vnto aungels god matier nice delicatenesse folowe neither enough sette face braggue matier high woordes onles stregth sufficient hable thesame kyng hath litle remembraunce consideracion himselfe case entende furnishe voiage warfare agaynste kyng wyll ere make stieryng towardes warre sitte downe leasurely firste weigh ponder diligently minde puissaunce royalme whether bee expedient goe power ten thousande menne mete enemy cumming agaynst twentye thousande menne case perfectly knowe power ouerweake bicker wyll bryng armie thyng nere sende ambassadours treacte vpo article peace truely better bee suffered trye hasarde battayle power strengthes vnegually matched honestie suche oneso likewise whoso uer forsakethe c battayle ioyned make treactie atonement receiuing great plague bee glad take peace yea thesame vpon condicions dishonour yf menne skyll suche affaire make theyr accoumpte hable doe beginne howe muche mete dooe buisinesse whiche none greater requiryng stoute courage whosoeuer therfore bee foloweth hath veray affeccio herte renounced al thinges hath possession may disciple myne must bee ientilmanly disciple ryght makyng orels none nothyng abiecte vile suche one beeyng ouercummed desire lustes fleashe hath stepped backe gon waye profession euangelicall perfeccion taken hande psalte good yf salte hath loste saltenesse shal seasoned therewith neyther good lande yet dounghill men caste doores hath eares heare let hym heare disciple myne ought bee lyke vnto salte salte yf haue quicke strength good effecte preseruyng seasonyng meates ceasse longer bee salte natiue strength vanished away sorte salte selfe haue nede salte make sauery meanes brought suche passeit neyth r good lande yet dounghill wyll good serue vse occupacion neyther serue poudre season thyng ne yet seasoned made sauoury salte thynges although corrupted yet serue occupacion exauple wine hath loste verdure turned vyneager salte thing made dede great effecte albeit moe effectes one e seasonyng meates yf bee weaxed vnsauerye mete bodyes vse insomuche good caste dounghill neither whiche suche thynges caste whiche moste full corrupcion yf mingled ranke dounge would cause baraynesse ferre seruyng vse also hurteth whatsoeuer toucheth woordes lorde iesus geue halfe rebuke vnaduised rashenesse woulde nedes appere bee disciple christehe hath eares heare let hym heare whan ryght well knewe euen specially p eked chosen veray fewe whole numbre would afterwarde shrynke awaye fall hym terrible sighte crosse ende sayinges might dieply enpriented hertes better vnderstanded afterwardes sayed moreouer let suche one heare sayinges hath eares apt receyue suche thynges eares euery body abyde suche manier talke xv chapter resorted vnto hym publicanes synners heare hym pharisee scribe murmoured saying receiueth synners eateth put furth parable vnto saying man emong hauing hundred shepe h lose one dooeth leaue foure score nynetene wyldernesse goeth whiche lost vntyll fynde whan hath found layeth shoulder ioye soone commeth home calleth together louers neyghbours saying vnto reioyce haue founde shepe lost saye vnto lykewyse ioye shall bee heauen ouer one synner repenteth oure foure score ninetene iust persones whiche nede repentaunce whan whole multitude people drewe nere vnto christe came thicke aboute euery side neyther putte one despised sette naughte certayne publicanes certayne notable synners boldened feared approche nere vnto whiche kynde people pharisee much abhorre accoumpte abhominable woulde haue appere theimselues holy menne dede whereas moste vndoubted token holynesse contemne ne disdeyne synner manier meanes labour ame maye amende reioyce whan doeth amende therfore whereas pharisee withinfurth full disdeyne enuye hatred couetife pryde yet theyr owne sight iudgement semed righteouse whan sawe iesus willyngly suffre publicanes approche presence ofte would publicanes onelye others also whiche lyued slaundre obloquie theyr transgressios notoriouslye knowen worlde exaumple bawdes harlottes suche others murmured agaynst mercifull dealyng sayed manne whiche dooeth professe certayne newe vncouthe trade holynesse yet dooeth nothyng eschewe coumpanye naughtie persones receyueth euen knowen synners talke hym dooeth muche flee ne abhorre haue come bee hym coumpanye euen eateth also theim nothyng remembryng howe good men defoiled coumpany conuersacion eiuill emong themwhat man among hauyng hundred ep iesus entente woulde vttrely wede hys disciple hertes merciles disdeyne putte foorthe three parable soondrie tenours yet cumming one poynt conclusion effect theyr exhortacion wete possible mercifulnes towardes sinner refourmyng hys naughtye lyfe suche one onely bee cast reiected whan returneth agayne better grace also manier wayes bee exhorted amende firste parable renneth thus greatly god tendreth sinner sayeth iesus turneth awaye face thesame synner turnyng agayne grace amending euery man maye coniecture owne herte affeccion man whiche hath hundred shepe owne dede euery man derely loueth thyng owne would haue parte therof perishe miscarrye would chaunce one hundred shoulde breake straygh flocke would losse thatsame one bee greatly moued nyntie nyne residue leafte wielde field would carefully go rennyng loste would quiet vntill founde hym yf chaunce fynde agayne litle selye shepe whiche fore loste forsooth man muche reioycyng wyll laye shoulder putte hym among residue flocke gladder man one shepe receyued agayne whiche feared loste safetie rest flocke whiche hadde taken feare miscarying great gladnesse cannot staigh ne refreyne selfe must breake presence others soone commeth home euen one gotten notable great gaines calleth frendes neighboures together saying vnto declare shewe selues glad behalfe reioyce ye lyke true frendes ioye among frendes becummeth thynges bee common haue founde shepe whiche loste bee affeccion good shepeherde towarde flocke affeccion doe ye thynke god towardes mankynde created nourisheth hath glorye owne name predestinate euerlastyng blysse trowe ye despise sinner satan hath seduced led contrary waye flocke el al mercifull tendre louyng ouer thynges whiche hymselfe hath made rather doe maye bee doen recouer wynne suche one owne handes possession agayne great ioye receyue synner agayne repenteth tooke great griefe thoughte lostei sa e vnto lykewyse ioye shall bee heauen ye woorde right well assured sayed shepeherde receyuyng thesame one litle se e shepe maketh muche reioycyng frendes neyghbours euen shall greater ioye aungels heauen one synner repenting amendyng naughtie lyfe nynetie nyne iust menne haue ede repentaunce image parable dede moste directly properly signifie represent lorde iesus onely shepeherde goodnesse incomparable whan mankynde fallen trespaced dyd reconcile thesame agayne father paying owne body whyche deserued carrying owne bodye transgression albeit found neuer nacion muche burdened endaungered sinne yet iewes compared heathen nacions semed haue lykelyhood shewe righteousnesse wurshipped one god alone obserued kept lawe geuen god wer emog iewes dyd streighter sorte cleue outwarde preceptes lawe thought themselues theyr owne opinion nede repetaunce righteousnesse brought lesse ioye vnto tendre louyng shepeheard heathen nacions turnyng great manifest synnes idolatry adultries fro straunge vnnatural misusages body emong iewes paule sette foorth mercie god chaunged persecutour became apostle secretely miengled christe ye lawes supersticious customes iewishe profession whiche thyng tyme doen small noumbre parable dooeth generally concerne apostle successours bishop ought beare affeccions christ theyr guyde captayne towardes flocke leastwyse hyrelynges true shepeheardes oftentimes cometh vre suche bee reclaymed throughly conuerted manyfest synnes great enormitie vnto true godlinesse dooe ensuyng godly conuersacion outrenne passe whiche neuer fell lyke haynous enormity suche persones euangelical shepeheard despise disdeyne rather seke alwayes possible vntill shal eftsos haue brought home agayne restored shepecotes churche repentaunt synner endeuouryng walke newe life take hym great gladnesse common reioycyng feythfull congregacion leat pharisee murmour clatter agaynst whiche trustyng deceiptfull false righteousnesse doe perceyue vnderstande muche acceptable mercie vnto lorde kynde sacrifice dooen vnto hym suche righteous veray dede suche vnfeigned frendes fauourers good shepeheard shewe themselues gladder receiuyng recoueryng one lost shepe many suche doe put trust confidence theyr owne colde naked righteousnesse doe ferther charge burden hym old faultes misdooynges whiche god mercie hath freely remitted forgotten muche reioycyng shewe forth gladnesse whiche conceyue returnyng synner vnto newe life could haue returned except shepeheard laying hym shoulder brought hym home againe therefore whole compainye saynctes rendreth thankes reioyceth goodnesse god enuying thesame benefite vnto another whiche benefite euery one haue experience proufe themselues estemyng reputyng common whatsoeuer hath chaunced euerie particular membre whether wer good eiuill good reason reioycyng gladnesse ye churche bee comon al seeing yt griefe sorowe common firste parable whereby lorde checketh reproueth proude arrogant righteousnesse pharisee whiche nothyng onely hate synners eschewe theyr coumpainie whereas duetie true holinesse procure studie health emendemente creature suche guiltie faultie toward god call home agayne ientilnesse better wayes possible affeccion loue charitie tendrely receyue suche repente emende liues christe neuer knewe sinne vse mercifulnesse toward sinner muche doeth beseme man beyng owne self subiect vice synne shewe vse thesame mercie towardes neyghbour peither woman hauyng tenne grotes lose one doeth light candle swepe house seke diligently till fynde whan hath found calleth ou r neighbour together saying reioyce haue found grote whiche loste lykewyse saye vnto shall ioye presence aungels god ouer one synner repenteth eyther woma hauing rene grotes yf lose onethe secound parable renneth thus woman saith christe emong whiche yf tenne grotes lese one would neglecte losse one grote nyne safe enough sure custodie truely light candle turne tosse vp rush serche euery corner house wil remoue al thing place shorte tale make neuer make ende sekyng vntyll suche time hath found grote lost chaunce fynde muche reioycyng made woman one grote receyued agayn tempre staygh selfe euen emong frendes gossops must declare tell sayed gossops beeyng called together saye vnto wyse reioyce ye shewe selues glad cause haue found grote whiche lost maketh boste nyne whiche lost glorieth one grote mo whiche hath founde gotte agyne thinketh herselfe richer woman one grote nine woman affeccionately set toward money muche grieued losse parte therof greatly reioyceth fyndyng thesame agayn neuer litle porcion muche god bee mynde parte shoulde bee loste men redemyng sauyng hath willyngly geuen hymselfe hanged crosse fourmed made manne paterne owne lyknesse sayed certayne man two sonnes younger sayed vnto father father geue porcion gooddes belongeth deuided vnto substaunce long whan younger sonne gathered together toke iourney ferre coutrey wasted goodd iottous liuyng whan spent
