arose great derth lande began lacke wante came citezen countreye sent hym erme kepe swyne would fayne haue fylled bealye coddes swyne dyd eate man gaue vnto hym added ferthermore third parable whiche albeeit generally apperteineth synners arysyng theyr synnes trespaces yet rate tyme whiche spoken dooeth directly touche gentile called receyued grace ghospell iewes semed themselues alreadie iust enuying felicitie thesame gentile discourse processe parable foloweth certaine man sayeth christe twoo soonnes whiche younger folowyng instinct leding youth folye went vnto father faied vnto father geue childes part goodesgeue porcion goodes c wil myne owne fashio assay profite gaines leuie therof father tedre ouer lettyng folow bridle course deuided substaunce betwene two sonnes either porcion deliuered free libertie withall put suche vse would yet without hope thei would thriue good therwith elder planted ferre father house younger within fewe day sold al substaunce whan turned ready money strayed father went ferre countrey dooe beeyng young man beeyng owne libertye mayster hymselfe liuing ferre father straunge countrey vtterly diuorceth disseuereth hymself god ientell father maketh straungier pilgrime world disseueryng sundering place affeccion herte euill talk dooeth corrupt marre good maners iewes receiued lawe instruccion guydyng whereof knowe bee folowed bee eschewed gentile also giftes quicknesse witte knowlage vnderstanding thinges created made goddes handy woorke whiche mighte haue knowen maker dede knowlage yea wrote setforth bokes absolute perfite manier fourme howe line wel hauing mind thei ought referre attribute ame rychesse vnto god autour whiche tenderly geue suche ende purpose folishely abuse thesame wurship honour beneficiall father wurshippyng prouoke ferther lyberalitie geue ferre strayed gone wanderyng awaye god thei wurship wood stone dogges oxe ape serpetes oynions lekes yf thynges goddes ferre gon fro god fell suche filthines verye perceiuing reason nature hath euermore remoued kepte bruite saluage beastes unhappy libertie whiche father presence dooeth gouerne stay chaunce length befell ye young man set owne free libertie father tuicion spete wastefully consumed among straungiers substaunce owne nothing owne father spent riottously dyce harlottes feastyng banquettyng plaineriotte isand wasted goodes c whatsoeuer spent inordinate lustes ye body without necessitie verily saied inordinate lustes desire corrupt marre euen right precious giftes nature wha wasted substaunce folowyng behalfes owne sensuall mynde pleasure arose great famine said countrey youg kept straugier pylgrime worlde hath nothyng may fully satisfie soule man onely whiche chiefest moste best thing whiche thyng el father house well young man beyng straungier among suche knewe beyng naked without clothyng beeing daungyer death great houngre wheras grieuous vnto hym obey commaundemente moste ientle father force constreyned bee bonde seruaunte foreyne vncurteous citezen straunge touneand cam citezen thatsame countrey whan men refuse receiue swete yoke lorde compelled beare moste hard heauye yoke satan wilt thou heare miserable kynde bondage serue desire world citezen maister sent hym mainour ye coutrey kepe fede hogges fro great dignitie great reprochefulnesse miserable young man brought throughe hys owne folye ryche inherytour excedyng ryche house nowe made boude man swyne heard yet notwithstanding dyd thatsame cruell maister muche geue hym meate eate needeth many woordes greate famine houngre trueth grace god whiche trueth onely none hable fede satisfy ye soul man desyred fill bealye cared wherewithal yf huskes coddes wherwith hogges wer fedde yet man whiche would geue thesame muche wurse case swine whome rather bonde seruaunte rewler maister ouer verye gyftes nature wer defaced clene forsaken young man freedome owne poore yet lost gon yet stomake appetite soule beeyng extremely corrupt eagre haue sum meate appeace hougre euery vayne voyd pleasure ye worlde dooeth short space pacifie neither satisf yng ye soule makyng fatte huskes coddes swyne feede yl spirites delited suche sworne serua e doe rather tolle traine baites fill yet haue alwaies plentie aboundaunce readye hand neyther ease haue yet marred disrealised muche galle griefes sorowes came said many hyred seruauntes father haue breade enough perishe houngre arise goe father saye vnto father haue sinned heauen thee woorthy called thy sonne make one thy hired seruauntes well come poynte extreme calamitye dystresse happy distresse whiche constrayneth man amende ill liuyngthan came self c first degree steppe toward saluacion call remembraunce whence man fallen acknowelage howe ferre hath swerued growen kynde father owne drawyng vnto gon away leaft father father euery present tymes past young man past right mynd distraughte deceytefull snare worlde fleeyng suche thynges onely bee desyred desiring thinges whiche bee eschewed auoyded matter good state whan synner mysdooer thorough secrete inspiracion moste ientle fatherand said cumeth herte agayn young man therefore beeyng length cum well himselfe agayne spake himselfe maner degree condicion state come wretched creature mine owne countrey exile banishement rich welthy house countrey famine libertie seruitude moste louyng father moste cruell mayster dignitie beeyng soonne father howse vileste condicion bondage may bee feloweshyp brother seruauntes lyuyng among swyne many hyred seruauntes father househow many hyred seruauntes father haue bread enough c whiche bountie father haue plentiful stoore breade much eate beyng soonne suche good householder dye hungre many iewes hirelingers whiche sorte obserue comaudemetes law godly affeccion eyther seruile feare orels reward thynges temporal yet matter sowhat lyue couenaunt seruaunt ryche bounteous housholder disseuered put asundre fortunate happy house one shall hired seruaunt made soonne haue thaffeccion soonne ought haue godly kinde enuie prouoketh young manne hope forgeuenessei wil aryse goe father c himselfe bewayled estate extreme myserye wherein laye altogether walowyng begoonne somewhat lift set hymselfe vpright take herte vnto saiyng arise go vnto father yet ala sayeth darest thou bold hast thou thyng whereby make thine excuse pourgacion vnto hym thou foudeste hym euermore moste tendre louyng father leat thee haue thyne owne thou diddest eagrely require thy childes part goodes gaue thee without saiyng nay vnto thee thyne owne mocion dooyng thou leaftest thy father beeyng thee bothe louyng fauourable thou hast shamefully wasted thy father substaunceand wyll say hym father haue sinned c geuen thee suche purpose thou canst impute thy calamitie none persone vnto thyne owne selfe stand defense dede litle helpe preuail hope forasmuch know father bee right father dede saie owne nature man mercyfull easye entreated maye bee part old loue charitie remaineth still hert though haue vtterly cast al ye whole nature duetie true soonne wil goe make fault trespace lyght denye plain simple confession matter shall weigh mynde true dede mislykyng selfe naughtinesse best excuse pourgacion yt may made studie verily shall hate selfe muche easily shal stirre vp kendle loue toward last extreme desperacio rather committe self vnto myne father none hable restore trespacer hath suche foulle fall yea also world bee willyng suche good dede wil willing tary till shall knowe fault till shalbe aduertised enfourmed wretched state woefull distresse men selfe peraduenture instigacion rather incense prouoke hym punishe wickednesse pardon readiest way appeace matter make al thinges quiete shalbe self first breake shewe plain case vnto euen stadethand woorthye bee called thy soonne leat take suche way ordre therin shall please father soonne whatsoeuer haue faulted haue faulted alone therfore say vnto hym father haue faulted greatly thaungels god thee neither iudge selfe woorthy hence foorth called name thy sone shal thinke enough thou takyng pitye copassion shalt leat like place fauour thee euery one thy common hired seruauntes leat bee hanger one corner thy househould bee fitter wordes framed stirre vp enkiendle moste singuler good father mercy compassion towardes howe muche plainlyer confesseth fault whiche faulte coulde neyther hidde yet bee excused dooeth mislike hymself dooeth huble submitte declareth hiself haue hope ne trust remainyng leafte vnto hym onely father grace mercie muche shal drawe father mynde dooe euen would haue doe tenour fourme speakyng vnto father art rhethorike put young mannes mynde owne conscience beeyng grieued displeased selfe yet vtterly conceyuyng extreme yll opinio say despairyng father goodnesse arose came father whan yet great way father saw compassion ranne fell necke kissed soonne said vnto father haue sinned heauen thy sight worthy called thy sonne father said seruauntes bryng forth best garment put put ring hand shooes feete bryng hither fatte calfe kyll leat v eate mery sonne dead aliue lost founde began merye hope therefore truste conceyued young man ariseth arise saied first step degree towardes saluacion backe goeth therefore home al way cum weping sighyng way wheras fore departed father perte fierce rashe wilful could thus hast thou plain paterne exau ple declared vnto thee man returnyng extreme naughtinesse nowe beholde paterne gracious mercifulnesse god young man yet full come father house whan father espyed cummyng ferre dede naturall fatherly loue hath alway iyes open see ferreand hadde compassion dyd tenderly loue twoo dyd first espy ye sawe soonne cummyng woondreous ougly pieteous behold wilfully departed fierce young man one woulde take dooenand ranne fell necke kissed hym sawe ragged houngerstaruen fylthye lamentyng sighyng weping syghte beeyng pieteous begonne byanby moue father herte wheras iuste cause haue angryefather haue sinned heauen c sight turned angre pietie copassion reneth forth mete young man thesame cummyng towardes hym lookyng bee praied sonne beyng ouercumed natural loue caught sonne necke kissed albeit thinges ye sufficient token mynde ready self forgeue yet youg angrie himselfe sayed father haue doen amisse greatly bothe aungels god thee yet haue bolde auenture come thy sight wheras vnwoorthie called thy sonne forasmuche bandes naturall loue duetie behalfe haue broken man instincte mocion nature beyng thus affected toward sonne vnderstande thou goodnesse god muche gracious mercifull towardes man hath synner truely vnfeignedly repente mislike himselfe father possibly bee towardes sonne though neuer rendrelye loue thesame sonne yet spoken conceyued recorded mynde reason wepyng sobbing breake tale teares declared spake wordes could haue doen doeth father therewhylebut father sayd seruauntes c trowe ye dooeth speake thoundreyng woordes crueltie doeth threaten beate hym dooeth threaten cast hym neuer take hym sonne doeth cast hym teeth bounteous goodnesse shewed vnto hym dooeth laye hym goyng awaye dooeth burden hym gluttonie abhominable poyntes lyuyng remembreth none geare doeth greatly reioyce hath got sonne agayne sonne thought hymselfe vnwoorthie title name sonne yet father restoreth hym old state degree agayn sonne doeth vttrely condemne hymselfe father doeth absolue quitte hym sonne cast himselfe downe bee seruaunteand putte tyng hande c father setteth hym perfectly agayn olde state dignitie father turnyng hymselfe seruauntes sayed bryng ye foorth quickely former robe apparell woont weare put hym sette also ryng fynger put payre shooes fete doen fette ye also pasture thatsame beste fattest calfe kyll let v prepare feast let v reioyce sonne deadand leat v eate merie come lyfe perished vtterly lost found agayne great matier true penitent herte maye dooe god punishement ministred vnto hym onely penitente coutri e herte suffised moste louyng father whiche yll demeanour made himselfe vnwoorthy come father sight presence thesame father espie cast mercifull iye vpon cummyng wardes hym great waye hath deserued euer thrust father house whiche beyng vnthankefull persone tofore wilfully vnhonestly forsake returnyng cuming home agayne father persone came forth doores mette hym hath none whole house mercifull hymselfe hym cast hymself bondeseruice abhominable maisters wete filthie pleasure bodye hym father vouchesafe embrace armes hym deserued scourged many sore stripe geuen kysse token perfeicte loue attonement happie synner lord vouchesalueth embrace kysse confessed offence refused name sonne conscience knewe himselfe faultie brought foorth restored vnto hym token old dignitie loste apparell mete suche mannes sonne weare brought vnto hym principall best robe vesture former innocecie whiche lost lost worthinesse dignitie soonne house owne wilfull seruitude yet ryng deliuered agayn lacke nothyng might serue deckyng trymmyng hym vttremoste hath shooes put feete young man hymselfe durst hope haue suche thyng muche lesse hopeth looketh muche sooner dooeth obteyne geat thentente none house lesse esteme hym set hym lyght homely pranke youth father soone ye calfe killed moueth prouoketh al whole householde reioyce altogether allegeth good cause vnto glad howsoeuer hath behaued hymselfe sayeth sonne hath dead called life agayne synne death soule renneth towarde death leaueth forsaketh autour life leaueth forsaketh autour lyfe whosoeuer loue thinges worlde worldly pleasure ferre wyde god almighty schoolyng suche one reuiued agayne dooeth repente refourme synnefull lyfe lost without hope euer bee recouered agayne concernyng hymselfe howebeit found gotten agayn departe awaye fro father house perishe thesame house health neither waye returne excepte father selfe putte sonnes mynde beeyng brought extremity father putteth remembraunce hymselfe sonnes mynde owne beneficiall goodnesse towardes sonne sonne dooeth neglecte whan putte vnto imputed hym thyng meritorious veraye confessyng fault receyued accoumpted satisfaccion loste owne folye founde agayne father loue repented emended euen botome herte forasmuche vttrely myslyke hymselfe father mercifulnesse onely restore hym old dignitie made also feaste might commende settefoorth sonne hertie loue belongyng vnto hym pthe elder brother fielde whan came drewe nighe house heard minstrelsie dauncyng called one seruauntes asked thynges ment sayed vnto hym thy brother come thy father hath kylled fatte calfe hath receyued hym safe sounde angrye woulde goe came father entreated hym aunswered sayed father loe many yeares haue dooen thee seruice neither brake tyme thy commaundement yet gauest thou neuer kidde make mery frendes soone thy sonne come hath deuouted al thy gooddes harlottes thou hast pleasure killed fatte calfe sayed vnto hym sonne thou arte euer haue thyne mere make merie bee glad thy brother dead aliue agayn lost found suche manier one father beeyng expressed similitude parable shewed hymselfe towarde sonne euen suche one ought curate bishop shewe themselues towardes penitent synner proude phariseis fauouryng theyr owne faultes dooe nothyng shewe moste cruell tyrannie vpon mennes faultes ferre wyde fro exaumple beholde whyle al wholle house father saye wholle congregacion deuout godly persones altogether merie full reioycyngthe elder sonne field onely brother beeyng well resembled pharisee doeth enuie grutche whyle thynges doyng elder sonne home busily occupied fielde moyses lawe labouryng till sweate agayne carrying burden co maundementes moste peinefullye wadyng strougleyng beare heauye woorkes lawe whereas younger brother dydde meane tyme receyue take moste ientyll yoke father whan saied elder sonne drewe nere vnto father house heard straunge noyse songe daunced ioye stickyng wholy vnsauourye lettre lawe knowe kowe great ioye spirite ghospell hath whyle iewes neglecteth premiss dooyng nothyng digge beare burden fielde lawe meane tyme people gentile great ioye receyued taken house father nothyng el desireth saluacion folower olde lawe meruaylyng muche straungenesse newe matier woondreyng bee cause suche vnwoont mirth would vouchesalue entre might bee partaker common gladnesse emong rest whiche thyng father dyd earnestelie wishe gentile receyued israelite bee excluded shutte euen yet styll stande without doores fumyng freating churche reioyceth gentile receiued saluacion ghospell elder sonne therfore called one father seruauntes demaunded hym newe ioye gladnesse thissame wasand called one seruautes asked thynges ment made au swer brother come whome whan father gotten agayne veraye glad kylled thatsame principall best calfe log fatted safe sound thought vttrely loste euer beholde iudaicall herte stomake wheras ought haue reioyced receyuing brother ought haue praysed mercifulnesse father yet rather enuie brother take indignacion agaynst father caried still therfore without doores murmouryng full chafyng whan moste louyng father perceyued hym desyred ioye bee common house went vnto hym begon courteously praye casting enuie grutche stomake woulde come make one feast emong reste woulde bee partaker father ioye yet would elder sonne thyng bough relente father courteous entreatyng proudely quereled reasoned mattier father vnnaturally accuseth brother beholde sayeth many yeres bondeseruaunte within houseloe many yeres haue doe thee seruice c neuer brake transgressed commaundement yet godly obedience hath neuer regarded ye neuer gaue muche young kidde wherwith might make merie emong frendes thissame sonne hath wasted spent substaunce whoores harlottes come home ye haue killed hym thatsame principall best fattest calfe doest thou theophilus thinke thy selfe see elder sonne entre fumyng chafyng thus murmouring father whan thou readest phariseis backebityng christe eate publicanes synners whan thou readest iewes repinyng agaynste grekes thesame grekes admitted ministerie office apostle whan thou readest thesame iewes scoldyng raylyng without ende gentyles leauyng theyr ydolatry without burden law fayth bee admitted grace ghospell shoulde bee baptysed confyrmed holy ghoste whan thou readest hauing enuie absteynyng feast congregacion churche gentile vnspeakeable ioye spirite dooeth eate thatsame speciall goodly calfe father commaunded slayne redepcion whole worlde yet man also beyng murmourer gracious goodnesse moste good father goeth aboute appeace sonne saieth thou shalt fare neuer whit wurse though vse ientilnesse mercie towardes thy brother thou art continually myne thyne continuall felicitie neuer interrupted broken hath muche pleasure delectacion lyke disease sickenesse afore goyng doeth commende health vnto vsit mete shoulde make mery c make seme sweter vnto v bee restored agayne euen misfortune haue afore sonne maketh mirth gotten agayne thou oughtest reioyce thy brother behalfe awaye mirth feaste thissame thy brother dead returned lyfe againe loste founde againe therefore dooe thou thynke returned home thee thesame man thynke hym vnthrifte bee newe borne honeste well disposed manne thou must remembre hath bee glad nowe become suche one wishe desire haue three parable lorde dyd exhorte disciple mercie ientilnesse receiuing synners glorie god neuer shewed better sette foorth whan whiche veray notoriously eiuil sodaynly grace god made newe manne ydolatre made seruaunt iesus christe rauiner extorcioner made defendour helper poore vnchaste liuer made chaste ambicious persone brought humilitie reuenger chaunged bearer long sufferer furthermore younger sonne found father mynde muche redier forgeue hym gentile whiche knowe god faulted agaynst hym ignoraunce stubberne indurate pretensed malice ignoraunce lacke thynkyng castyng afore wil come alwayes moste parte ioyned coupled youth therfore muche willingly dooe forgeue youth beare age whan doeth offende iewe whiche hymselfe semeth iust standeth muche owne conceypte fulfillyng lawe dooeth trespace grieuously enuying brother synned sweruyng strayghyng right waye xvi chapter pand sayed also vnto disciple also certayne ryche man steward thesame accused vnto hym wasted gooddes called hym sayed vnto hym heare thee geue accoumptes thy stewardshyp thou maiest bee longer stewarde stewarde sayed within hymselfe shall dooe maister taketh awaye stewardshyp cannot digge begge ashamed wote dooe whan put stewardeshyp thei maie receiue theyr house wha called maysters debtours together saied vnto first muche owest thou vnto maister sayed hu dreth tunnes oyle sayed vnto hym take thy bylle sytte quickely wryte fiftie sayed another muche owest thou sayed hundreth quarter wheate sayed vnto hym take thy bylle wryte foure score lorde commended vniust steward doen wysely child worlde nacion wyser child light saye vnto make frendes vnrighteous mammon whan ye shal haue nede maye receyue euerlastyng habitacions thissame hath hitherto sayed moste specially moste directely touche pharisee takyng muche indignacion lorde iesus one remebred owne highe dignitie dyd receyue publicanes knowen synners familiar couersacion lyuing coumpaynye anon returning disciple aduised exhorted theim larger fauourablenesse onely murmour agaynst goodnesse god also meanes wayes possible folowe thesame goodnesse god theyr owne behalfes earnestly applying theimselues dooe theyr neyghbour good euery occasion relieuyng thesame succoure thynges necessarie body easyng theyr hertes wordes coumfort exhortyng goodnesse teachyng ought dooe admonishyng theim whan dyd amisse forgeuyng theim whan trespaced agaynst theim would teache v ientle goodnesse thus dooyng shall perishe v warde contrariwyse layed vp store v agaynst lyfe come whatsoeuer thyng bestowed neyghbour propouned forth sentence parable suche sorte foloweth certayn great ryche man committed bestowyng housebandyng goodes thynges vnto steward steward complayned lorde beeyng prodigall reason wasted consumed gooddes awaye lord therefore callyng steward sayed vnto hym doe heare bruite fame thee come make thyne audyte accoumpt thy stewardship mynded ne wyllyng thou shalt longer haue ordreyng disposicion gooddes myne stewarde soone vnderstoode lyke within litell shorte tyme come passe put office stewarde ye litell short time subtilly craftily prouyde hymselfe men haue rychesse men haue learnyng others haue experience worlde one man hath one qualitie another man another thyng euery persone hath wherby maye hable neyghbour good substaunce riche lorde maister whiche substaunce office vountifully bestowe neighbour mortall man hymselfe lorde suche quality giftes hath stewarde dispensour onely office dispensyng soone taken awaye life worlde shorte lyfe longer power ne libertie good plain waster manne lordes substaunce whosoeuer bestoweth owne affeccion hath doeth parte therof relieue neyghbour stewarde therefore beyng sure within litle tyme remoued stewardeship consulteth owne minde aduiseth himselfe sayingwhat shall dooe mayster taketh fro stewardship c shall best seeyng lorde mayster taketh awaye power office longer haue dispensyng gooddes wheron lyue haue gathered nothyng together myne owne behoufe whyle might haue doen nothyng lefte nowe either digge fielde hire wage daye daie el go euery begging digge delue lack strength begge ashamed happe haue euen sodaynly deuised brayne make ioly prouision selfe procure geat selfe frendes maisters gooddes sayed frendes bearyng wel mynde beneficiall goodnesse towardes wil receiue theyr house whan put myne office stewardship hereupon calleth together maisters debtours one one saeyth vnto fyrst muche arte thou behinde mayster endebted vnto partie aunswered hundred bates oyle bate wryters accoumptetake thy bill c write fiftie kynde measure emong hebrewes conteynyng seuen gallon liquour theraboute stewarde haue take thyne obligacion sitting quickly wryte thou fiftie stede hundred mayster ryche enoughe wyll haue thee saue one moytie clere thyne owne auauntage good helpe doen sayed secounde howe much oughest thou aunswered hundred quarter wheate quod stewarde take bille thy hande wryte foure score twentie quarter whan abated mayster neuer perceyue thee beyng poore man twentie quarter saued good seruice stede thesame sorte plaied debtours also case fraude espyed knowen foresayd ryche man steward neuer escaped vnpunished yet lord iesus exaumple beneficial liberalitie praised vnto disciple ye deuise said stewarde though guylefull yet wyse politike exhorted al folowyng hym geuing sharpe checke sluggishnesse men seruyng world prouident forecastyng also diliget industrious prouydyng theyr bodily susteynaunce liuyng suche persones hauyng clerely renounced worlde ensue thynges eternall making prouision themselues towardes euerlasting life heauen foule shame v theyr kynde wyse full good prouision buisinesse beyng onely lighte trifiyng matiers thynges shall anon come nothyng whan slacke dooyng good turnes pleasure neighbour purchace geat sure stayes lyfe immortal seeyng reason vncertain terme present life euery v ought loke lesse cum must heare spoken v maister wordes said stewarde heard spoken vnto thou maiest time forwarde exercise occupy thy roume steward tyme muche bothe euerye man vncertaine whan shall comemake frendes vnrighteous mamon also otherwyse man better thyng veraye short continuance must make hast al worldly goodes bestowed poore way almes maye prepare geat selues prouisio serue bring v life euerlasting meanes shall come passe also shalbe made partaker good deedes men haue doen muche haue temporall goodes holpen whoso dooeth part substaunce help aide maynteyn man beeyng buisily occupied cause affaire ghospell bee settefoorth thesame shall kyngdome heauen relieued made partaker well doynges euangelist say writer preacher ghospell therfore saied lordethat ye shal haue nede mai receiue euerlastynge habitacios take ye good wayes selfes season time exaumple sayd worldely wyse politike steward procure vnto selfes good frendes euil thyng thend suche tyme whan ye shall commaundemente lord compel ed depart tabernacle mortal body thei may receiue tabernacle euerlasting happy permutacion whan transitory thinges make chauge thinges eternal vile ferther fro vertue rychesse worlde vneath tyme gotten without guile falsehode wayes meanes either saue el encrease none thesame gotten possession much buisinesse encoumbraunce yet neither daungier miscarriyng whyle ne waye thyng long contynuaunce folowe theyr maister whan departeth hen yet notwithstandyng thesame man may bye euerlastyng whiche may hym good stede seruice life cum shall cum passe thing whiche case hoorded vp hidde maketh manne vnrighteous thrall many care thesame bee layed bestowed dooyng charitie shalbee instrument euagelicall righteousnesse bothe minister ghospell relieued necessary reward cummeth geuer large encrease entresse faithful whiche leaste faithful also muche vnrighteous leaste vnrighteous also muche ye haue faithful vnrighteous mammon wil beleue true ye haue faithful man buisines shall geue whiche seruaunt serue two maisters either shall hate one loue orels shal leane one despise ye cannot serue god mammon whoso steward hath disposyng beestowyng mortall mannes gooddes suche meanes none el founde faithful trustie verye pynchyng sort bestow put truste withall contrariewyse god ryche towardes creature would fain haue moste bountifully laied hath purposely delyuered handes eueriwhere distributed taketh vntrustie seruaunte whosoeuer kepeth owne propre goodes lordes mynde made common al people often necessitie neighbour doeth require therfore whoso disposing thing least value possible behaueth hymself otherwise moste liberal master would haue himhe faitheful whiche leaste faithful also much shal seme person vnworthy whose honestie maister committe dispensacion higher thinges euer haue lordes corporall rychesse whatsoeuer worlde produceth bounteous goodnesse god doctrine gospel ghostly giftes goodes almightie god suche purpose geuen vnto v selfes mo haue fruicio thesame bestow lyke good stewardes vtilitie profite neighbour thus muche oddes betwene two sortes goodes treasours suche thinges pertein coufortyng cherishyng bodie without v v neyther propre owne continuall vnto v goodes world rather moreouer thei haue outward likenesse felicitie ye worlde wheras dede sore lette hinderaunce happye blissefull state man bee thyng neither named bee named goodes whereas dede thynges whiche bryng man state extreme miserie wretchednesse rychesse therefore mynd soule true richesse dede rich maye bee called owne though bounde god leaue possessour life come lestwise man vse present life ought dooe lyke comon weale auaunced head office gouernoure maiouraltie suche others excepte haue firste roume counstable suche inferiour offyces shewed ensaumple perfy e honestie vprightenesse priuate familie distrybutynge precious thinges comitted one hath euidetly shewed faithful fore matter lesse weight doeth lord teach v dispensacion bestowing rychesse euangelicall whiche onelye none el true rychesse dede propre owne bee put credite truste suche oneand vnrighteous least c hath nothyng faithfully distributed money beyng thyng moste vileste euen beyng ma none owne whoso cannot sette worldly rychesse naughte syncerely distribute richesse soule lord stil beating suche thynges myndes disciple saied whoso faithful thing leaste value great likelihode thesame faythful great matter vniust litle thyng wyll bee vniust great matter also man whose herte care thyng nothyng worth worlde may bee hable moue dooe amysse wyll muche sooner greatter occasion bee drawen dooe amysse wicked mammon saye false rich goodes gotten falsehood commonly true dede ye shal shewe yourselfes faithfull lorde hath deliuered thesame disbursed distributed abrode manne wyll commytte vnto bestowyng true rychesse mynde thyng mannes whiche canne perpetually continue man ye haue nothyng trustie putte handes suche thyng might perpetually tyme come bee owne lighter offence trespace dooeth whiche vnfeythfully handleth rychesse world whiche vnfeythfully dispeseth treasoures gospell kyngdome god requireth haue whole mynde requireth haue free loue worldely thyngesno seruaut serue two maysters c neyther man attempte goe make medley worlde ghospell together whiche ghospell kyngdome heauen man bee seruaunte common indifferente vnto twoo maisters scarcely twoo men dooe well agree within themselues one seruaunt hable due attendaunce satisfye bothe one sette naught muste force compelled sticke one alone howe muche lesse ye hable serue god mammon bothe beeyng maysters ferre discordyng together muche one poynct wherin agree seruaunt vnto mammon man euer setteth great piece heauen rychesse cause laboureth al earnest applying mynde geat veray great aboundaunce thesame vpholde maynteine encreace whan gotten suche one leapeth ioy whan substaunce multiplieth sore vexed herte taken awaye hym misfortune seruaunte god either shakyng hym gooddes world el possessyng though possessed dooeth earnest applying hymself go prouision thynges whiche make euerlastyng saluacion thynges heard phariseis also whiche couetous mocked hym sayed vnto ye whiche iustifie selues men god knoweth hertes whiche highly estemed emong men abhominable sighte god woordes talke afore goyng though wer specially purposely spoken suche beleued themselues possible enough bee christes disciple though wer charged loden carefulnesse richesse phariseis also heare whose hertes beyng olde bo tels could hold ne receyue newe muste doctrine euangelicall wer couetous gredie onely money also glorie wer haulte mynded fierce men would auenged euery matier therfore skorned doctryne iesus moued charitable liberalitie caryng auenged passyng glorie ne theyr lyfe neyther certes worlde also hath euermore shall haue phariseis trustyng theyr owne force haue derision doctrine humilitie fauour pardonyng offence tractablenesse liberalitie mouth enured accustomed ye soure turned wyne worldly wysedome policie abhorreth fro heauely muste maie also please god vouchesalue one daye dampe tauntyng mockes suche persones lykewyse present sharpely reproue phariseis beeyng scorner whan sayed ye swell pryde vayn countrefaictes goodnesse settyng foorth peynted sheathe face men esteme man ryches gaye apparellye iustifie selues afore men obseruacion ceremony thynges ye purchase vnto selues also laude prayse holynesse veray dede ye neither ryche holy happie blissefull state yet great men god onely seeth beholdeth hertes estemeth veray goodes soule suche man none ryche rych godbut god knoweth hertes iust iust sight god man great beeyng litle owne estimacion great iudgement god moste commonly chaunceth suche thyng men semeth high matier bee high veneracion god reputed thyng abominable pthe lawe prophetes reygned vntyll iohn sence tyme kyngdome god preached euerie man riueth goe easier heauen yearth perishe one title lawe fayle whosoeuer forsaketh wife maryeth committeth aduoutrie whiche marieth diuorced houseband committeth aduoutrie also ye dooe yet still hold rynde lawe fast teeth ye glorye shadowes thynges wheras kernell within bee opened lighte euangelicall trueth arisyng maye euery syde dryue awaye shadowes ye must disacouainte estraunge selues ye oure old wyne moses lawe drynke newe muste souder doctryne figure lawe time holy sayinges prophetes promise looked figure ceasse nowe trueth hath appered foorth neither propheticall promisyng longer looked nowe thyng whiche promised veray facte perfourmed geuen shadowes ye must goe foreward growe veritie feith promyses ye must grow vp loue thyng beyng sent geuen dede iohn ye would saye marchyng bordre particion diuidyng seueryng lawe figure prophetes promise ghospell ghospell doeth veray facte dede geue aswell lawe figure signified appoyncted also prophetes beyng enspired god promised shoulde come iohn preached kyngdome god already come veray thyng forsouthe lawe shadowes marked veray thyng prophetes solemnely spoke afore ye see thyng self agreable iohns preachyng euer sence tyme kyngdome god continually preached vnto al people many dooe glad hertes gredely take blissefull heauenly newes drynke newe muste take doctrine god contemne yearthly thinges growe ryche goodes treasoures heauenlyand euerye striueth cast money awaye woorke miracle haue armour ne weapo cast deuils men wealth rychesse power glorie renoume worldely estimacion humilitie tractablenesse pacient suffreaunce charitable geuyng goodes mynde veraye true dede bothe ryche men power also full glory sight god ye high pathwaye vnto felicitie shutte vp man ye pharisee vouchesalue entre others preuent take vp roumes gentile entre nacions worlde entre cannot bee kept nowe doore sette open breake plain force violence thei receiued ye see publicanes souldiers sinner harlotes thei come rennyng thither sortes people despisyng euer oweners contemnyng volupteous pleasure worlde trustyng promisses ghospell dooe herte applye theimselfes true gooddes mynde whereas ye stande without doores whose partes firste others enter yea also bring others whiche would enter whome haue rehersed dooe feruentenesse feith promptenesse mynde breake whether wyll suche kinde violence dooeth kingdome heauen loue neither cause affeccionate louers law make suche great criyng lawe nowe abrogate prophetes nowe abolished nay thissame abolishyng lawe accoplishing perfeictyng therof mother dooe vse make weping wailling soonne loste whan boye weaxed growen vp bee man veray great poynte folye one enbrace armes counterfaicte porterature man whan may enbrace verai mannes selfe portured lesse poyncte foly speake ye maker promisse whan one maie sure yf haue presentely handes veray thyngselfe promised thyng must compared image case thei doe agree one acknowlage thou thing hath beene set shadowes enbrace thou perfourmed geuen facte proufe ye thinges dooe agree promisses prophetes discharge theim true men theyr promisse enbrace thou truely perfourmed brought effect ferthermore thou se thine iyes right many thinges haue come passe whiche marked oute shadowes lawe law spiritual ghostly whosoeue forsakethe hys wyfe maryeth committeth aduoutrye great maignie cause end proufe matter aunswerable olde auncient foresaiynges prophetes beleue thou thynges also shall semblable assuraunce bee perfourmed time come whatsoeuer lawe prophetes haue saied shall hereafter come passe lawe carnal grosse thesame geue place thynges perfeccion thesame spirituall thatsame onely abrogate fordoen also brought iust full perfeccion lawe permitteth ye wedded houseband vpon geuyng wyfe testimoniall diuorcemente maie putte wyfe awaye hym bring newe wyfe home stede lawe ghospell whosoeuer refusyng true wedded wyfe maryeth dooeth committe aduoutrie maryeth woman diuorced committeth aduoutrie neither men hath wyfe neither weomen owne housebande aswell comon reason nature also euangelicall sinceritye dooeth earnest wyse require perpetual amitie without anye breache vnion possible dissolued plucked sondre matrimonie also al fredship neither occasion grounde finde cauillacions doctrine gospel repugnaut thinges prescribed moses moses consideracion hardenes hert durst precisely require thyng rather wished conceiued anye hope sore mynde leat haue diuorcemente willes lest denied hatred wiues woulde haue braste furious cruel dedes mischief towardes therfore whiche requireth perfeccion dooeth make vp lawe abrogate ye laweasier heauen yearth perish c father contrary hauing great whyle afore somewhat tendrest ouer sonne leat haue bridle tender age require hym whan come ful age require assure saie told ye skie yearth yet nothing shal longer endure two shal yet sooner passe one litle io e title lawe shal perishe al perfourmed whatsoeuer hath beene foresaied prophecied veraye true come bee abolisher lawe pthere certaine riche man whiche clothed purple fine white fa ed deliciously euerie day certain begger named lazarus laie gate full sore desiring refreashed rummes whiche fell fro riche mannes bourd man gaue vnto dogges came also licked sore fortuned begger died carried aungels abraham bosome riche man also died buried beeing hell tormentes lifte vp iyes sawe abraham ferre lazarus bosome cried said father abraham haue mercie sende lazarus maie dippe ieppe finger water coole tongue tormented flame abraha saied sone remembre thy life time receiuedst thy pleasure contrarie wise lazarus receiued peine conforted thou art punished beyond al betwen v great space sette would goe hence cannot neither come then v saied praie thee therefore father send father house haue fiue brother war e leste thei come also place torment abraham saied vnto haue moses prophetes leat heare said nay father abraham one come vnto dead repent saide vnto heare moses prophetes neither beleue though one arose death againe nowe lorde iesus vnder parable wilye stewarde lytell afore propouned exhorted menne exercise charitable liberalitie towardes nedye ende thesame party might life receiue v euerlasting habitacions time thei cotrarie chaug course thinges shalbee pleteously endewed good thynges riche heauen afore world shal lye peines bee tormented extremity woe distresse plain picture setteth exaumple thyng entet cleue sticke faster menes mindes saieth great riche man semed lacke manier thyng highest degree fortunate happie state worlde manne great name muche spoken emong men name al ne acquaintaunce god man wente apparelled purple veluettes lesse nicely gorgeously would lacke nothing delectacion body would day day haue delicate fare banquettinges would serued portely sorte princely man al one bonde seruaunt aswell ambicion also gluttonous excesse volupteousnes also tyme certain begger much vnlyke vnto man say felow low birth felow destitute acquaintance emong men famous noble afore god name eue state case inand certain begger nam lazarus c called lazarus man destitute al worldly staigh maintenaunce rested onely helpe god alone lazarus neither house apparell ne meate yet prospe ous health bodye al full sore botch bodie euen suche manier read scripture yt iob lazarus liyng saied riche mannes gate loking reliefe haue bee sent crummes scrappes fel riche mannes table wherwith swage gredinesse stomake nowe fretting gnawyng ye might saye euen barkyng hungre lazaro man beeyng ful botch blame might bee suffred come leste syghte hym beyng deadly beholde myght haue bene iyesore cou paignie myghte turne merye al whole feaste sadnesse whereas behalfes neate fienely appoyncted thou heareste nowe pompous pride welthinesse emong excessiue fare wastefull prodigalitie otherwyse yet much pinchyng niggardship toward neighbour veray poynct dye hou gre might muche crummes scrappes geuen hym whan made earneste peticion wheras dogges wer fed eue panchefull greate lumpes whole loaues good bread yea dogges euen veray teeth laye inhumanitie vncurtesie ryche manthe dogges came li ked sore swymmyng aboue care deliciousnesse dogges came licked sore lazarus would haue iudged ryche man haue perfecte exaumple paterne welthie happy state poore lazate man paterne vtter miserie felicitie owyse measured thinges fortune geueth men lyfe matter nowe speake altogether sodainly turned clene arsie versy death hanging ouer head euery creature lyke vnto riche folkes end al sensual pleasure vnto whiche liue care woe ende sorowes fortuned begger dyed nothing passed ne regarded among men duryng life tyme soone deade aungelles caryed lappe abraham god vouchsalued shew thus much honour riche manne would vouchesalue leate within hys house euen veray self time dyed thesame ryche man death alone beeyng egually indifferente vnto al folkes teacheth riche sore lesson men aswel others lazare man muche honestee burial laied graue riche man caryed hys burial great solemnitie myght corpse whan bothe departed oute worlde riche man hel liyng greuous tormentes lesse hardely hadled well lacke thynges delectable also aboundaunce kyndes euyls duryng life time cherished hymselfe nicely deintilye laste liftyng vp iyes sawe abraham great waye also espied lazarus knewe hym olde suffred afore lye abiect gate sawe abraham lappe takyng ful fruicion moste perfecte quiete consolacion swete tendre enbracyng thesame moste holy father abraha acknowlaged hym hys sonne whome ryche man would vouchesalue acknowelage man sight mannes blisse heauen hym encrease tormentes case riche man beyng vain become faire mouthed crauer begger cried pieteous noise good father abrahaand cried father abraham haue mercie vpo haue thou pietie compassion vpon send lazarus diepe euen tippe finger water maye euen much ous coole toungue one litel droppe sore tormented burnyng fyer abraham aunswered soonne coolyng refreashyng whiche thou doeste ouerlate make peticion thou shouldeste refreashyng thy poore neighbour haue purchased thy selfe whan thou liuyng time thou thinkyng thy selfe wel present thinges world thou haddest tha wouldeste vouchsalue much crummes thy table relieue lazarus beeyng ready dye houngrie knowe thou nowe course thynges bee rightefully chaunged muste thou know thou bee disposed cal thy remembraunce thy lyfe time thou hast receiued thy gooddes lazarus contrarywise passed ouer al e uils missehappes life time altogether turned vpsyde many tolde affliccios paciently suffred refreashed thou al delicious sensualitye wherewith thou hast naughtily taken thyne pleasure art worthyly tormented thou turnedst thy face lazare beeyng ful sore biddedst away hym thy syght whereas thyne owne parte thou thy swete sauoures perfume mine armes smooth clere skynned top toe thou wouldeste vouchsalue leate hym come within thy house content haue hym sytte lappe thou diddest neither meate ne drinke refreash hym beeyng extreme penury nowe refreashed eternall rest whiche knoweth vexacion houngre ne thirste face dooest thou hande aske refreashemet cooling thy mouth seyng veraye long sen could obteine refreashyng case thou haddest cladde whan naked thou haddest fedde hym whan houngrie thou haddest geuen drynke thirst whan laye without thy gate thou haddest gathered hym thy house thou haddest doen cure hym beeyng full sore would nowe obtein coumforte thee releace thy tormentes would receiue partie brotherhoode coumpaignie thou wreatched miser nowe thy fine silkes thy purple bee thy perfume thy feastinges baquettynges thy pipyng dauncyng bee many thy pleasure mixt ambicion vain glory whyle thou wer aliue kynde wyne could please thee beeyng cloyed theimbetwene v great space sette great deliciousnesse thy mouth neither wouldeste thou whyle muche geue lyttell water lazarus beyng thirstie nowe thou canst obteine soe muche poore droppe water refreashe scaldyng heate thy toge stede thy galaunte manours whiche thou haddeste thou haste nowe derke doungeon hell thy delicate pastime euerlasting peine thy testynges songes continuall wepyng owlyng much ye past remedye extreme distresse huige great gapyng hole dooeth kepe v soondre sorte would gooe hen thither ye helpe thei cannot would assay come vp then hither cannot nowe iudgemente god cannot chaunged vnto al sortes due place limited theim remayne life season tyme refreashe ye neighbour dooing good turnes pleasure one man relieued one agayn ouer late wyl desire cannot possibly bee doen thy delicate pleasaunt pastime thou wouldeste nedes bee alone suche thou wer thy selfe lazarus lazarus thou wouldest suffre come ons thy coumpaignie nowe art thou serued thesame sauce thy labour wha abraham spoken riche man beeyng put hope himselfe obteine reliefe desirous leastwise prouide good way certain brother whiche yet aliue lest ledyng liues facion come place felyng peine woe suche coumpaignie ioyned vnto hym increace vnto hym whereas myserie extremitie enough al ready dooeth nowe vain become humble suiter whiche tofore vsed putte hym lazare man thesame made muche crouchyng knelyng vnto succour great derke doungeon saieth bee let yt helpe ministred dooen selfe yet thus much praie thee thou wilt send lazarus father house haue fiue brother aliue may geue warnyng aduertisemente vnto theim leste case folowe steppesthan sayed raye thee send father house c shall come hither bee felowes partaker wofull sorowes peines rather leat theim relieue necessitie poore suche gooddes haue leate vse rychesse sensualitie fleash godly deuocion mynde ne leate theim sette fansye loue suche thinges season swere delectable worldly life thynges maye purchase rest euer endure thus saied riche man extrem tormentes whiche nowe hadde experience made bothe humble suppliaunte also teacher though nowe ouer late death praiers wil serue ne yet maie man haue lycence geue warnynge counsaill nothyng haue deade dooe liuyng abraham therefore made aunswere nothyng requisite lazarus bee anye suche cause called awaye fro quiete reste thy brother bee disposed bee honeste men wel haue moses prophetes leat herken theyr bookes speake vnto al creature riche man beyng hard suiter peticioner would satisfied yet neuerthelesse ouerlate saied abraham father abraham moses heare prophetes neither yf one dead might come theym bring theim sure perfecte woordebut yf one come deade wil repente c howe sore grieuous tormentes tho persones doe suffre whiche dooe passe liues myne exaumple whiche ryche folkes moste parte doe amend frame theimselfes better rewle gouernaunce hereunto abraham said yea thou speakeste colourable laiyng excuse suche persones disposed neuer leaue ne forsake doe naughtily viciously loue autoritie moses prophetes greater theym autoritie lazarus poore begger shoulde bee yf geue eare ne regarde truely one arise death life would heare neither would fynde stoppes cauillacions walkyng ghoste bee eiuill spirite wordes dyd lord iesus couertely geue nippe vnbeliefe iewishe nacion thei verai true dede beleue moses prophetes doe euen yet still present crie agaynst christ also beeyng restored aliue oute sepulchre nowe sitting righte hande father whereas veraye dede woulde beleue hath bee doen yf truely beleued moses prophetes tellyng shewyng long afore bee parable dyd christe coumforte hys disciple shoulde afterwarde loue kyngdome heauen endure abyde many affliccions worlde selfesame parable dooeth feare phariseis scribe experte lawyer priestes headman ryche folkes proude sorte fierce perillous men liue behoufe commoditie themselfes mo ende myght leastwyse feare punishemente would none otherwyse refourme vngodly lyfe otherwyse shoulde come passe daye bee mocked whiche worlde mocker skorners christe whan called better way xvii chapter saied vnto disciple cannot bee offence come neuerthelesse woe vnto thei come better milstone hanged necke cast sea offende one litell one take hede selfes thy brother trespace thee rebuke repent forgeue though sinne thee seue time daye seuen tymes daie turne saiyng repenteth thou shalte forgeue decreed heauenlye father expedient ye saluacion mankynde yt proud phariseis bee offeded weakenesse ye humain bodye nature whiche lorde taken phariseis shoulde punishe hym affliccion yea also putte hym deathe beeyng fourme pouerty low degree brought fourme mekenes humilitie yt thei also mind shew neuer whit mercy fauour disciple neither folowed steppe maister vnbeliefe eiuil disposed vngracious sort doeth wrappe godly affliccions ye pacient suffreing good haue occasion greater danacion ye eiuil yet neuertheles god vseth malice suche ferre otherwyse thei meane ye benefite ye whole world iesus therfore sayeth vnto disciple emong iudas afterwarde bee causer fyrste beginner offence say slaundre grutche conscience occasioner betray iesus vnto death man worldly estimacion selie lowe degree albeit wickednesse saied iudas made ye redepcion world sooner come danable ende holsome ensaumple creature cannot bee auoided ne chosen saieth iesus yt offence must shall happen yet yt none excuse whose default offence consciece shal ariseit canot offence come great deie expedient one cast headlog sea great lidger milstone tied necke occasion suche slaundre offence one litle tendre one worldeward haue god auenger cause thinketh hymselfe bee hurted thesame litell one whan hurted lesse sauenture man endure punishement world bee neuer sharp offending conscieces litle one god loueth wilfully seke procure euerlasting tormentes helle beware ye therefore lieth auoide yt slaundres conscience shal arise partes beware none suche arise faulte occasion best way meane howe auoide offence conscience maye bee imputed onelye ye shall geue anye occasion slaundre offence conscience body fault also yf anye suche thyng bee ministred vnto others ye eyther wype cle e awaye mildenesse elles suffre good exaumple pacience wyse dooe like ye shall haue vexacion vproares arise handes wicked sorte onely also beeing ye mortal menne made frail metalle shall euen emong youre selfes manye time arise offence trespaces whiche ye muste remedye brotherlye charitable admonicionif thy brother trespace thee rebuke hym whose proprety condicion neyther bewraye disclose offendour may anye reformacion yet haue pardone readye hym case repente bee willing emende therefore shall chaunce happen thy brother haue commytted trespasse agaynst thee doe ynke fault though thou knewest leste ye leattyng escape vnspoken maye bee occasion boldenes eftsons lyke playe thou faithfull phisician saye shewe thou disease lighte chydyng secrete ende maye bee refourmed beeyng ashamed hath doone wil sooner heare frendely man shall tell hym hys faulte troubleous brablyng accuser whome must repute take open enemie suche nature manne moste parte better sette himselfe staigh quiette good aduise counsaile yelde ouer troden wrong cannot appere bee great poyncte ientilnesse whan one secrtely telleth bodye faulte openlie detecteth manne requireth haue hym punished semethe bee suche minde cure brother sore rather notifie publishe dishonestee open confusion case thy brother beeyng tolde faulte shall emende acknowelage offence leat forgeuenesse bee ready whiche maye familiarly louinglye receiue againand repente forgeue hym soone refourmed ferre bee thou fro ons thinkyng howe redresse auengemente thou saue party honestee also muche thy power lyeth partye humain frailtie shal eftsones falle relapse thesame suche lyke offence yea although trespace seuen tymes daie doe seuen tymes daye repente agayne earnestelye appliyng himselfe pacifye thee shall saye haue doone amysse sorye forgeue forgeue thou faulte botome thy herte ientilnesse forgeuyng releasyng one others offence trespaces shal muche better sorte mainteine peace concorde emong mutual requiting one shrewde turne displeasure pand apostle sayed vnto lorde increace faith lord saied ye faith like grain mustard sede ye shoulde saie vnto sicamine tree plucke thy selfe vp rootes plant thy selfe sea shoulde obeie apostle well perceyued saiynges iesus faithe fountaine euangelicall vertues whiche fayth lord diligentely require thyng necessarye yf bee hable worke miracle whiche faith dyd many time allow comend yea euen many alienes wer borne iewry faithe could obteine manier thyng euer throughe whiche fayth euen theyr owne selfes also putte awaye soondry disease men hadde cast deiuils knewe remembred well yt onely defaulte wante faithe theim hadde hapened coulde deliuer certaine persone afore beeyng possessed dumme deiuill albeit one shall fitte man necessarie preceptes ghospell neither onlesse haue conceiued vndoubted faith truste hys herte whan despise sensuall pleasure worlde whan poure oute gooddes bestowe theim poore whan wyll releasse clerelye forgeue displeasure wrong dooen vnto hym brother whan dooe suche persones good haue dooen hym contrarye whan mekely pacientelye take enpriesonmente scourgeyng roddes peines death fully throughly perswaded hathe vnestimable large rewarde prepared hym heauen thys thyng saye apostle well vnderstoodelorde encrease faith saye vnto lorde maister forasmuche haue goodnesse thee praye thee thou wilte encreace faythe v lorde hereupon one well knewe apostle bee yet grosse vnperfeicte make requeste haue fayth encreace chiefly purpose myghte haue power shewe myracles dooethe dede allowe ratifye strength power fayth yf bee syncere pure body ought bee opened vnto theim thesame oughte bee coupled humilitie sobrenesse moste perfeicte degree oughte bee shewed foorth vainglorious bostyng suche time alwaies either preseruacion neighbour orels glorye god dooeth poynte extremitie necessarily require hereupon sayeth similitude comparison ye haue fayth graine corne mustarsede whiche litell quantye lowe grounde ne putteth foorth vertue bityng toungue excepte bruised thing broken betwene teethif ye faith lyke grain mustardesede ye shall saye sycamine tree whiche reason rootes taken great wyde coumpace within ye grounde semeth vnpossible strength power plucked vp place bee thou plucked vp roote bee thou remoued sea stande fast rooted thou standest nowe shal obey bidding tertes graine mustardsede ye lorde signifyed himselfe wheras shewed vsed hymselfe moste lowest meanesse al creature yet dyd hyde within hym secrete power nature godhed tha neuer afore vttred selfe whan grayne bodye bruised crosse deathe burried within grounde effectuall strengthe grayne wrought disciple whereof oughte haue vsurped porcion theyr owneselfes principall autours ne heade dooers thynges wroughte onelye minister seruauntes assured punished lingred slacked goe executyng geuen theim charge commission dooe bounde putte ouer lande prayse vnto god thing shoulde meane theim bee iolyly royally wel doen pwho seruaunte ploughing feding cattalle wil say vnto whan cometh fielde goe quickely sitte meate saieth rather vnto dresse wherewith maie sup girde vp thy self serue til haue eaten drounken afterward eate thou drinke thou dooeth thanke seruaunte thinges wer commaunded vnto trowe likewise ye whan ye haue dooen thinges whiche commaunded saye vnprofitable seruauntes haue dooen whiche duetie dooe good lesson afore goyng lorde dyd addyng thereunto parable engraue hertes disciple whiche sayed maister muche seruauntes ease commoditie dwelle withall case haue seruaunt tiller hys grounde hearde kepe hys cattall wyll saye hym soone come home hys weorke fielde geat thee yonder goe sitte downe meate well rather thus speakewhiche hadde seruaunte ploughing c come make readye somewhat haue supper girde thy clothes thee come awaite vpon vntill shall haue taken repaste meate drinke shalte thou take thee meate drinke afterwarde yet notwithstandyng saied seruaunte dyd vprightly faythfully duetye fielde dooeth maister vse geue hym thankes hath dooen geuen hym commaundemente bee dooen thynke would haue punished hym well truelye case dooen sodooeth thanke seruaunte thinges c veraily none respecte consideracion seruauntes euen duetye oughe theyr seruyce theyr mayster theimselfes due true owener thanke praise euer dooen maister taketh hymselfe accoumpted dooer ye thynges whatsoeuer dooeth meane theim without hym vtterly dooe manier good thyng lyke manier euen ye take vnto youre selfes glorie youre well dooynges onely ye faithfull labour duetie whan ye shall haue dooen thynges whiche enioyned commaunded yet saye ye unprofitable seruauntes duetye dooe haue dooenwe vnprofitable seruauntes humilitie shal conserue kepe iewel feyth perfecte al rest thynges leaue ye vnto lord leat none take owne handes due vnto hym honour ne preuent iudgement lorde best knoweth hys owne tyme wil defraude man reward ye meane whyle remembre youre selfes bee none seruauntes oughyng woorke labour bounden dutie chaunced wente hierusalem passed samaria galile entred certaine toune merte tenne men lepres stood fette putte forth voice sayed iesu maister haue mercye v whan sawe theim saied vnto theim goe shewe selfes vnto priestes came passe thei went thei wer clensed one wha saw clensed turned backe againe loude voice praised god fell downe face fete gaue thankes thesame samaritane y aunswered saied tenne clensed nine found returned geue god praise saue straungier saied vnto arise goe thy waie thy faithe hath made whole befell lorde goyng towardes hierusalem made waye lye throughe countreyes samaria galilee oftentimes fansy wha myght haue anye occasion take samaria galile waye yt myght enbraide inhabitauntes hierusalem hardenesse beleuyng whereas abhorred samaritanes wurse heathen reputed ye galilean half paganes miscro autes entreing litle village met tene men beyng lepres euerye one ye maie wel thinke yt lepres signified hereticall persones beeyng within foorth altogether defourmed corrupted eiuil affeccions skinne withoutfoorth spotted speckled reseblaunce vnderstand heretical persones vnpure doctrine altogether entremedleth false thynges true infectiue kynde people sore bee abhorred therefore streightly kepte coumpaigniyng emong men yet kinde sore iesus dooeth heale diseased come sight disease vttred vnto hym perfecte affiaunce reste party lepres agnised knowlaged disease therefore thei approche nere persone iesusgoe shewe selfes vnto priestes c standyng ferre lifte vp theyr voice high crie aloud vnto lorde iesus maister haue thou mercie pietie vpon v iesus hearde crye whiche good witnesse affiaunce hym turned iyes towarde theim blissed suche criyng maketh lorde earneste geue eare blissed castyng iye whiche moueth hym shewe mercie none aunswere made iesus vnto theim sauyng shoulde goe theyr waiesand one theim c turned backe shewe theimselfes priestes priestes rested autoritie discerne lepre clene manne dooe biddeth departe theyr way replenished faythe assured truste god health euen goyng made clene hadde euerye one eguall fayth affyaunce hadde euerye one eguall thankefulnesse herte benefite receyued samarytane onelye mo theym whan perceyued felte hymselfe plainly veray dede deliuered disease made counsail beneficial goodnesse god towardes returned immediately vnto iesus gloryfiyng god loude voyce fallyng downe prostrate face layed hymself fete iesus wurshippyng hym geuyng hym thankes iesus knowing well enough benefite health hadde come vnto al tenne myndyng checke vnthankefulnesse much could theyr mynde priuye stealth enioye great benefite saied tenne lepres made whole nine become lorde knoweth none vnthankefull people sheweth suche one bee vnworthye benefite receyued doe geue thankes hym hath dooen theim good god cannot abyde haue benefites kepte secrete hugger mugger whan samaritane kept ilence man onely thankefull also full humilitie sobrenesse one come thyther dooe owne duetye accuse anye others iesus turnyng coumpaignie whiche stood round aboutthere founde returned saied tenne hath one beene founde would returne backe glorify god one straungier beeyng foremer borne countreye become others thus dooe thei iewes haunte theimselfes bee true seruers wurshippers god yet veray thyng selfe samaritane passeth deuoute holinesse wha lorde thus muche sayedthy faythe hathe made whole spake samaritane liyng prostrate ground arise vp saied goe thy wayes assured thys benefite shall continue thee euer whiche benefite thy faithfull affiaunce hath purchased obteined vnto thee pwhan demaunded phariseis whan kingdome god come aunswered saied kingdome god shall come wyth waiting neither shal thei saie loe loe beholde kingdome god within nowe iesus hadde kyngdome god oftentimes hys mouth phariseis dyd yet vnderstande kingdome euangelicall bee ghostelye kyngdome dreamed kyngdome wh rein nacion iewes haue dominion ouer nacions came vnto hymthe kyngdome god shall co waytyng demaunded wha kyngdome god come iesus time whan anye mencion made laste daye vsed euen custome aunswer doubtefully saied kyngdome god come manier worldlye kyngdome sorte either tyme therof place maie bee watched espied kyngdome body soules neither dooeth stande visible mayntenaunce inuisible therefore shal bee saied vnto loe loe nedeth awaite place seyng kyngdome god within dooe ye looke without foorth thyng whiche ye haue within carried aboute whereuer ye goe yf ye bee disposed youre selfes dooe ye looke thyng thoughe yet hereafter come whiche already present wheresoeuer mynde hert beeing maister ouer rich sensual pleasure dignitie promocions world yea finally contemner death whersoeuer mind strong stout feith burnyng charitie enspired holye ghoste thatsame place ye kingdom god nowe ye embrace thing present lest whan day shal sodainly come whiche shal make perfect shall shewe kyngdome fynde vnreadye pand saied vnto disciple day come whan ye shall desire see one daie soonne man ye shall see thei shal saie see see goe theim folowe theim lightening appereth one parte vnder heauen shineth vnto parte vnder heauen shall sonne man bee day first muste suffre manye thinges refused nacion disciple neyther dyd well vnderstande partes also dreamed yearthlye kyngdome israell shoulde bee greatly enlarged iesus turnyng vnto tempre woordes myght make alwaies ready last day iudgement yet take awaye carefull searchyng tyme whan shoulde bee myght rather arme tempeste crosse euen already veray nere approchyng tyme saieth vndoubtedly shall come whan ye shall desire haue fruicion syght sonne manne euen muche one dayes space whereas presente manye one dooe set naughte hym yet ye shall haue wishe n desyre yet shall want persones flatreyng earnest fainesse men shall attempte make somewhat dooe shewe hym thoughe wer presentand shall saye se saiyng loe loe geue ye credit suche manier prophetes shal say amongest v go ye shal say loe yonder ferre hen gooe ye thyther folowe theym leate beliefe credit suche thynges ye see haue told spoken afore holy prophetes present fulfilled onely one thyng goddes pleasure bee made open world therefore pleased hym tyme thereof shoulde bee knowen aforehand moste expediente health saluacion men mynde bee readinesse againste tymes houres therefore lyke lightenyng soodainlye flashyng foorthe dooeth shewe fierie brightenesse one syde aier ferre syde ye haue perceiueraunce suche thing come shall cummyng soonne man bee certes small glorye yet vnloked suche daye hymself mo knoweth wyse haue thesame vnknowen maiestie shal shewe foorth shall haue throughly fulfylled dispensacion lowenesse humilitee waye brightenesse kyngdome godbut fyrste must suffre manye thynges must first bee shewed doore kyngdome heauen muste first opened men maie entre otherwise veray smal benefite commoditie kyngdome god come suche persones partes haue prepared themselfes thesame ere maiest e shall shewe selfe whiche ye dooe affeccionately desire due tyme soonne man must suffre manye thynges muste bee condemned nacion ende fyer fyrst mounteth ye smoke afterward shooteth vp flame maye glorie god clerely shewe forth self open shame reproche worlde happened day noe shall bee also day sonne man thei eate drinke thei maried wiues wer maried euen vnto e daie noe went vnto arke floud came de uied al likewise also chaunced day lot thei eate thei dranke thei bought thei solde planted thei builded euen thesame daie lot went zodome rained ier brimstone heauen destruied al euen thus shal bee daie whan sonne man shal appere daie house toppe stuffe house leat come downe take lea e field turne backe thinges lea behinde remembre lotte wyfe saied day may take man tardie remedie prouision easie euery one prepaire hymself readinesse though thesame day wer euen nowe euerie momente cumming handeand happened dayes noe men beyng wedded vnto worlde promysse waraunt themselfes longer daye ere come yea suche day neuer come beyng carelesse reason suche hopegene viii v mat xxiiii idlely geue themselfes lustes appetite therefore thesame chaunce shal come day soonne man whiche happened dayes noe toke wyues gaue daughter mariage though floudde differred time would haue come al euil misaueture came soodainlye vpon theim tooke tardy onely noe fewe mo saued meane arke residue perished euery one eue muche like lighte also bee one time lot delay made goddes vengeauncelikewise also chau ced dayes lot gene xix thei conceiued opinion vnpunyshed whatsoeuer synne committed therupo beeyng voide al care eate dranke bought sold thei plated set tree thei made buildinges stroke vengeaunce god lighted soodainly vpon theim also whan wer al voide care thought nothing vpon selfe daye whan lot forsooke citie sodome departed waie then rained fier brimstone heauen sodainly destruied al euen veray thing see shal bee worlde whan sonne man shal soodainly shewe forth maiestee whansoeuer daye shal growe come fast vpon worlde leat al care worldly thynges shaken leat euery man present perill looke sauing himse fe escape may therfore whosoeuer thatsame day shall find ye house toppeat daye house toppe c al gooddes leaft beneath house leate go take away gooddes hath leat onely thynke vpo sauyng semblably ye saied daye shal chaunce sodainly finde man abrode field leat flee home escape ye peril shal come ouer fast vpo leat haue time laisure euery bodye shall bee found euen leate renning away faste saue life call ye remembraunce chauced vnto lotte wiferemembre lotte wife turne loke backe perished immediatly yll dooeth swift stroke saied eiuil suffre delay tariaunce suche one euer bee shalbe safe perill shalbee lighter burdened flee pwhosoeuer wil goe aboute saue life shall lose whosoeuer shal lose hys life shal saue tell night shalbee twoo one bedde one shall bee receiued shalbee forsaken two shal bee grinding together one shall bee receiued forsaken two fielde one shalbe receiued forsaken aunswered saied lord saied vnto whersoeuer bodie shall thither also eagle bee gathered together houre day goe seke prouide suche thynges wherewith commonly vse sette sure staigh life come exaumple apparel money dwellyng place suche thynges shalbe none casting awaie lesing life suche one castyng away hym al pestreaunce heauy carriage shal regard helpes staighes present life shall leat goe one shalbe sure winne life day shalbe laisure n space thynke lyfe ye body whan lyfe soule shall turne wh le beeyng hassarde ieoperdyin ye nyght shal two one bedde c neyther gooddes ne place ne thys kynde liuyng shall peril saue man mynd ready departe waie hen twoo persones beyng nere together possible sodainely shal one bee taken life shalbe leaft behind damnacio thus much tell abide vpon night sonne man shal come shall bee two persones liyng one bedde two shall diuersitte rewarde soodainly parte sondre one shalbe taken vp euerlasting blisse shalbee leafte behynd endlesse damnacion shallbee twoo persones gryndyng one mille whiche one shall bee taken leafte behynd twoo persones shalbe housebandrie labouring fieldes one theim shalbee taken vp shalbe leaft whan ye disciple heard al half dreme vnderstandyng mente saie vnto iesus maister still dreame fleashe seke knowe place kyngdome iesus myndyng vnder derke couert signify vnto yt holy people wheresoeuer shall bee found shall bee disseuered lord aunswered wheresoeuer shalbee caryan thyther eagle also drawe gather together forceth place ye ye whiche feder soules doe fede theim myne owne selfe foode endlesse felicitie xviii chapter pand putte foorth parable vnto signifiyng men oughte alwaie praie wery saiyng ther certaine cite iudge whiche feared god neither regarded man ther certain wedowe thesame citee came vnto saiyng auenge myne aduersarie would afterward saied within hymself though feare god care yet wedowe importune vpon wil auenge hir leste come last raill lord saied heare vnrighteous iudge saieth shal god au nge elect whiche day night vnto hym yea though differre theim tell auenge theim quickely neuerthelesse whan soonne man cometh shal fynde fe ih year h forasmuche last ende worlde beeyng hande shall aryse grieuous persecucios godlye somuche maie possibly bee wrought euen veray elect chosen persones shalbe seduced albeit veray dede infaciable peruersnes eiuil doeth neuer time succeasse cruell full tirany good lord iesus teacheth disciple seruauntes al aduersitees thei shal none place aske helpe succourthat ought alwaie praie c handes god neither goyng auengemente meane whyle defendyng one displeasure receiued dooyng god dooe first houre deliuer theim affliccion yet must thei therfore surceasse praiyng wyll vndoubtedly heare prayer seruauntes oportunitee tyme shal bee delaiyng therof shall turne benefite godly yea muche grieuously shal vngodly bee oppressed perswaded theimselfes whatsoeuer dyd therin shoulde dooe man say blacke theyr iye lesson lord iesus parable ensueth enprinte hertes disciple seruauntes saieth certayne citee certain iudge gouernour beyng bothe wieked man also void al shame honestee one neither stood feare god ne reuerence towardes mortal man wickednesse made hym case feared god great power brought hym poyncte woulde shewe reuerence manne citie certaine wedowe beyng sore oppressed aduersarie went vnto sayd high iudge whose handes rested highest powerthere certaine citie iudge whiche feared god c praied helpe ayd violent oppressyon aduersarye syr sayeth matter veray good true yet ouertroden throughe rychesse frendshyp myne aduersarie hathe courte poore wedowe alone woman destitute fredes praye see redresse cause ryght ye violence mine aduersary oftentimes thus spoken wedowe yet neuerthelesse longe tyme woulde bee acknowen matter woulde helpe wedowe whereas suche greate power geuen certaine men euen purpose onely thei helper succourer orphanes wardes beeyng nonage wedowes poore folkes againste riche men mainteners brableyng matter last whan woulde make none ende criyng vpon hym iudge begoonne thus thinke within although neither stand feare god ne beare reuerence man aliue yet wedowe importune vpon vnsaciablenesse bee aunswered wyll help rid oppression aduersarie good mynde beare leste wil el length come againe beeing many time shaken raillyng sette greate blurre myne honestee good name occupiyng roume chiefe iustice iudge citee haue yet neuerthelesse wilfullye stiffely leate wedowe bee without helpe redresse whan wrongfullye ouertroden whan iesus thus tolde parableand shal god auenge elect sayed doe ye heare iudge saieth vngodly man il disposed beeyng ouercomed importunitie praiyng entreatyng holpe wedowe god moste iuste mercifull towardes hys elected beeyng called vpon nightly also daily praiers criynges wyll weaxe deaffer deaffer deliuer seruauntes violence oppresse wyll slowe pacient mynde suffre theim bee oppressed affliccions neuer see anye auengemente ne redresse therof nay saie vnto bee bold wil suffre bee eyther wyll conuerte theyr hertes sort wyll chaunged shall ceasse dooe affliccion el wil take awaie theim habylitie power dooe harme el suche bee hys elected wyl altogether quickely deliuer eiuil remoue place rest euerlastyng wy whan laste daye iudgemente shall bee ons come nowe shal neither satan weorking tooles yll men bee power thyng doe whome god hath specially chosen asyde partaker hys kyngdome whan wickdenesse eiuill sorte shall bee weaxen highneuerthelesse whan sonne cometh growe higher shal sonne manne sodainly come verai dede sooner shal come eiuill menne thynketh tyme whan sonne manne shall come shall trowe ye ynd feith vpon yearth aswell multitude also peruersenesse eiuill persones shall bee greate feith shal remaine perfeict whole fewe yet withstanding whomesoeuer thatsame constaunt feyth trust god shal found thesame persones shall deliuered god beyng auenger cause pand tolde parable vnto certaine whiche trusted theimselfes perfeict despised twoo men went vp temple praie one pharisee publicane pharisee stoode praied thus hymself god thanke thee men extorcioners vniust aduouterers publicane fait twife weeke geue sithe al possesse publicane standing ferre would lift vp iyes heauen smote vpon brest saying god thou mercifull sinner tel man departed home house iustified euerye one exalteth hymselfe shall brought lowe humbleth hymselfe shal bee exalted parable afore goyng putte suche people feare beeyng openly wieked daily scourge vnto godlye pharisaicall sorte ryghteous men puttyng trust owne weorkes presumpteously taking vnto themselfes lande title righteousnesse weorkes wheras creature iust afore god dyd onely stande owne conceiptes like fooles also comparison theim selfes despised others sinner whereas humilitie others acceptable god woorkes anye suche lorde iesus aswell persones suche pharisaicall righteousnesse also coumforte synners botome theyr hertes mislikyng themselfes putte foorth suche parable ensueth befel twoo certaine persones went vp temple praie whiche persones one pharisee publicane pharisee stadyng nigh propiciatorie mercie seatetwoo men went vp temple praie ye saie englishe high aulter like one woorthye talke wyth god eue veray elbowe praied sorte within himselfe thanke god lyke vnto menne whiche liue robbyng stealyng whiche encrease substaunce fraude guyle whiche pollute marryed mennes beddes wyth aduoutrye finallye whyche bearyng office infamye slaundre dooe piele people god prince pleasure whiche sorte thys publicane one dooe geue selfe excessiue eating drinking parte people dooe fast twyse sabboth saie twyse euery weke farre defrauding bodye geue cotinually tenth part al goodes almes poore manier praiyn swellyng proude pharisee althoughe recited thynges th wer true gaue thankes god yet euen verai pointe displease iyes god liked hymselfe well plaiyng flaterer towarde hymself full despitefull woordes againste neighbour publicane contrariewise alltogether mislikyng hymself hys conscience yelde hym gyltie many sinnes stode farre holy thynges muche ashamed repentaunt hymselfe durst much lyft vp iyes heauen knocked brest saiyng god thou mercifull vnto synner pharis geue thankes one yt thought hymselfe want nothyng vnto perfite godlynesse neither dooeth confesse offence wheras eue praiyng grieuouslye synne makyng vauntes owne doynges despising one penitent proud presumptuous prayser hymselfe rashe accuser neighbour publicane parte maketh rehersall ne mencyon well dooynges onely acknowelagyng eiuils knocketh brest knewe state stode lamentably calleth lordes merciei saie vnto man departed iustifyed tha wyll ye knowe ende contrarye maners praiyng said publicane cum synner temple wente waye home righteous sighte god pharisee thoughte hymself man moste perfite iustice whosoeuer magnifyeth hymselfe owne mynde shalbe cast downe syghte god whoso casteth hymselfe doune owne herte shalbe exalted high sight god brought vnto also young child touche discyples rebuked iesus whan called vnto said suffer child cum vnto forbid suche kingdom god uerilye saye vnto whosoeuer receiueth kingdom god child shall enter therein beholde occasion whereby lorde commende vnto v humilitie softenes coupled simplicitie plainnesse mother brought young babe vnto iesus entente touche blisse thinkyng shoulde come passe thesame chyldren meanes safetie fro suche chaunces disease age commonly woont bee daungier dyscyples whan saw thyng rebuked woman thei suche tryftyng matter trouble lorde hauyng otherwyse thoughte handes ful enough bussinesse already iesus although knewe al thissame bee dooen said disciple certayn good diligence declaring readinesse dooe duetie towardes hym yet expresse vnto v exaumple simplicitie humilitie innocencie al vnder one geue lesso vnto pastours ought despise body neuer meane weakebut iesus saied suffer child cum vnto called disciple together vnto saied suffre ye child cum vnto thei may brought vnto vnto suche belongeth kyngdom god leat exaumple shewed foorth vnto creature may vnderstande degree perfeccion ought grow litle one knowe fashion clokyng ne counterfaityng acquaynted pryde ne haultnesse ooke knowe way strike agayn whan steiken skill geue reuiling wordes againwhosoeuer receiueth c thei know auarice meaneth skill ambicio mere innocecy mere simplicitie without fraude guile woorde saye vnto truste vnto kyngdome god receyueth none suche bee reforged chaunged accordyng paterne therfore onlesse man cum doctrine gospell lyke simplicitie child shal enter kingdome god certain rewler asked saiyng good maister ought obtein eternall life iesus said vnto callest thou good none good saue god onely thou knowest comaundem e thou shalt comitte aduoutry thou shalt kill thou shalt steale thou shalt bea e false witnesse honour thy father thy mother said haue kept fro youth vp whan iesus heard said vnto yet lackest thou one thyng sell al thou hast distribute vnto poore thou shalte haue treasure heauen cum folowe whan heard sorye ryche whan iesus sawe sorye said difficultie shal haue money entre kingdom god easier camel go nedles iye riche enter kingdome god heard said bee saued said thynges whiche vnpossible men possible god good mayster oughte doethan agayne came vnto iesus one great state heademen one shoulde bee euen verye facte plain declaracion ment iesus saied concernyng state chyldren thus sayed great man good maister maye dooe atteyne euerlastyng lyfe iesus willyng notifie surname good serueth none god onely propre nature good aunswered hym thus dooest thou cal goodwhy callest thou good c none good sauyng god lorde dooeth acknowlage surname good due vnto hym touchyng god sayed ryche man attributed woorde good vnto iesus beeyng man yea woulde peraduenture haue taken occasion cum place therfore right sorte call iesus good yet beleue bee god cause lord time refuse honour title wel vnderst de demaunder question vtterly voyde swellyng pryde one thought abounde many good woorkes iesus would shewe foorth mannes sore saiedthou knowest co maundeme ntes thou knowest preceptes moses lawe wete thou shalt kyll thou shalt committe aduoutrye thou shalt doe thefte thou shalt beare false witnesse honour thy father thy mother woordes sayed one myndyng beare way prayse commendacion perfite righteousnesse al poyntes euery one haue duely kept euen beginnyng youth saiyng ferre saiyng pharisee aboue specified great dele short symplicitie young chyldren la afore declared one faulte therfore opened hereby priuie faulte hidden besides also whiche made vnapte kyngdome god iesus therefore woulde discouer ye fault said thou lackest one pointe yet thou wylt enter kingdome gospellsel al thou hast goe thy way sell euer thou hast thy possession distributyng abrode almes poore laye vp treasure thy selfe heauen dooen beeyng free rydde lette vncoumbraunce come folowe sayed demaunder whan heard wordes striken great sorow exceding rychehe sorye veraie ryche yet reduced broughte paterne young child forasmuche loue rychesse possessed herte iesus seing hym
