depart heauy man suche sort sue come ye blisse kyngdome heauen neuerthelesse coulde contemne rychesse world turned disciple one beyng great meruail saiedit easier camell goe thorough nedles iye c hardely shall whiche heauy laden burden rychesse enter kyngdome god narowe gate easier thing camell perce iye nedle riche man entre kingdoe god disciple beeyng woordes sore troubled myndes saied ryche entre thyther sauedthe thynges whiche vnpossible c one shall fynd fewe person either haue ryches couet haue recomforted dismaiyng disciple saiyng thing whiche men vnpossible possible enough god mannes power despyse rychesse suche commodity folowe taile richesse strength stoutenesse hert dooeth god geue vnto suche simple vnfeyned beleuyng dooe shewe themselfes apte receyue gyftes god longer taken worldely ryche whosoeuer hath laied away hym loue money suche wyse possesseth money wil herte leaue thesame often respecte health saluacion euerlastyng shall require peter said loe haue forsaken folowed thee said vnto uerilye say vnto man hath forsaken house either father mother either brother wife child kingdome god sake whiche shall receiue much worlde world cum life euerlastyng woordes apostle conceyue good hope parte left altogether whatsoeuer thei owner tofore therfore behalf al speaketh peter saiyng loe haue left al haue folowed thee haue perfourmed eue yesame point also thou diddest earnestly require ryche man although small porcion peter andrewe left albeeit would haue forsaken lorde conneth thanke readinesse doen nede repente dooen sheweth great gain haue lost worldely rychesse kyngdome god lieu place transitory vyle thynges contened bothe worlde mynd soule enryched goodes heauenly also worlde come endlesse felicitie repaied furthermore hereupon thus sayd lorde auouche vnto matter doubted onely shall turne great gaines ende haue left sake litle slender possession ye also whatsoeuer person shall respect kingdom god forsake either house father mother brother wife child shall bothe preset life receiue much mo thynges also better lefte moreouer world cum shall receiue life euerlastyng iesus toke vnto twelue said vnto behold goe vp ierusalem al shalbe fulfilled written prophetes sonne man shalbe deliuered vnto gentile shalbe mocked despitefully entreated spetted whan haue scourged put death third day shal arise vnderstode none thinges saiyng hid soo perceyued thynges whiche spoken sayinges somewhat lifted vp chered hertes disciple agayn tooke twelue apostle behoueable ignoraunt thyng wrought doen redepcion makind beginneth euen suwhat openly plainly beate matter heades concerning ye death ierusalem wittingly willingly dye accordig foresayinges prophetes knew wel thei sore dismaied discuforted death maister consideracio th often beate tale heades ende laste may engrauen hertes litle litle myght bee enured abide matter yet eares abhorred heare mecioned spoken verily none vnbelefe theym certain earnest loue strogly working towardes maister seuerally therfore cumpany begoonne open vnto tyme hys death approch behold saieth goyng vp towardes ierusalem shal thinges accomplished haue writte prophetes concernyng sonne man must deliuered handes gentile shall scorned scourged spetted shall haue scourged shall haue mynistred vnto hym kyndes reproche vilanie wordes thei shal fine put hym death shal aryse agayne third day death lyfe talke nothyng swete ne pleasaunt could wise sink apostle stomakes commoly harde belefe matter would good willes haue bee true coulde wyse perceiue mysterie crosse wherhence redepcio saluacion newe found conueighaunce god cum forth issue vnto worlde luste ne fansy beleue man loued entierly dye suche violent kynde death neyther coulde possibly beleue likely suche one put deathe handes wicked hable wonderfull actes many tymes escaped oute handes suche attempted assail fasten vpon finally doubted myghte afterwarde easier thyng hym bryng passe dye al tha reuiue death said would yea thought better dye death bee restored life althoughe coulde doubte maisters trueth hys wordes yet maner flatter owne affeccions enterpreted wordes iesus lay priuily hidden figurate mistical maner speakyng suche lord special property muche often vse bryng begilyng meanes colourable speakig people also apostle selues exauple wha willed beware fro ye leaue ye phariseis wha auswered kind meate whiche hougred wha taught lesso camel might soner passe nedles iye riche man entre kingdome heauen whan signifiyng doctrine must receiued conueyed throughly bowel soule saied man shoulde haue lyfe tyme come onlesse thesame shoulde first eate fleshe drynke bloude finally wha promysed hymselfe would within three dayes space reedifie temple destroyed iewes suche suspicion coniectures apostle flattre affeccion dede hearde woordes iesus hearde halfe slepe pith effectuall meanyng wordes vttrely vnderstande doen state tyme required lordes permission sufferaunce thend partely might litle better better bee enured thyng whiche shoulde afterwarde bee incomparably bitter vnto partely shoulde tyme scattre themselues abrode fleyng mayster whose communicacion yet many matiers schooled could yet throughlye see ne perceyue priuities goddes workyng conueighaunce iyes theyr mynde manier sterke blinde muche foggie derkenesse came passe come nigh vnto hierico certayne blynde man sate wayes syde beggyng whan hearde people passe asked mente sayed vnto hym iesus nazareth passed cryed saying iesu thou sonne dauid haue mercie went rebuked hym holde peace cryed muche thou sonne dauid haue mercie iesus stoode styll commaunded hym brought vnto hym whan come nere asked hym saying wilt thou doe vnto thee sayed lorde maye receyue sight iesus sayed vnto hym receyue thy sighte thy faythe hath saued thee immediately receyued syght folowed hym praysyng god people whan sawe gaue prayse vnto god yet muche wer others dymme sight lesse familiaritie lorde fountayne health knowyng iesus know haue perfect sight feith bright light earthly desire lustes world darknesse beholde casuall chaunce maie laye playn iyes maye see iesus one blind man set foorth exaumple blindnesse soule maye bee taken awaye many sate one waye man depriued sighte bodily iyes lorde many folowyng trayne iesus sawe great deale wurse theyr soules whan euen verai twelue apostle theyr iyes yet styll ouergon derke slyme ignoraunce coulde vnderstande lordes manifest sayinges befell iesus beeyng waye towardes hierusalem nowe farre hierico sate certayne blynde manne highe wayes syde beggyng blynde creature whan aswell noyse hearyng folkes speake also trampleyng feete perceyued veraye well great multitude people passed demaunded matter dede suche kynde people muche curious inquisitiue suche thynges lacke theyr iyes aunswere made vnto iesus nazareth passyng thatsame waye partie immediately hauyng conceyued herte feythful trust reason suche thynges hearde iesushe cryeth saying iesus thou sone dauid haue mercie vpo cryed aloude saying thou iesus sonne dauid haue pitie compassion vpon unto importunitie added also swete woordes flatterye euen metely well accordyng facion guyse beggers companye went afore iesus rebuked bidde holde peace suspectyng would haue craued almes common rate also fearyng leste beyng slouenly felowe vnsightly geare common begger high wayes syde haue somewhat noyfull troublesome vnto lorde blynde manne people clattered agaynst hym muche earnestly dyd crye repeatyng styll thesame wordes whiche spoken afore thou iesus sonne dauid haue mercie vpon could see iesus muche streygne voyce man beyng ignoraunt ferre iesus called vnto iesus made though heard hym though cried loude voyce twyse thryse afore purpose make faithfull truste partie euident cumpanye laste stayghed waye commaunded blynde man broughte vnto hym purpose occasion iyes whole cumpanye diligente beholdyng myracle whan come iesus lord asked question thy wyll dooe vnto theewhat wilt thou doe vnto thee ignoraunte thyng blynde man wished haue woulde haue confession euill vttered wordes thende myracle might bee euident wont feigne blyndnesse themselues maye thereby receyue larger almes yea peradueture company blynde mannes case would haue bolde hope ferther thyng almes rewarde money lorde also though estimacion worlde poore yet vse geue vnto poore porcion suche thynges geuen hym frendes sustentacion blynde man great affiaunce faith sayed lorde make thou maye haue sight agayne wordes craue thyng whiche mere man could bee assured vnto hym castyng doubtes iesus foorth bothe could one moste mightiest also woulde one moste mercifull iesus therfore makyng lyke quicke aunswere quicke ready fayth restored hym iyes worde agayn saying receiue thou thy sight agayn thy faith hath saued thee seen christ faith ere sawe hym iyes bodythe fayth hath saued thee fayth verily thyng whiche obteyneth without excepcion moste merciful lorde fayth whiche thickest derkenesse synne yet calleth ferre iesus maye shewe mercie conscience priuie knowelage naughty synnefull actes paste doeth iangle agaynst whan cryeth feruentnesse fayth doeth muche eagrely streygne voyce suche maner beggers doeth lord iesus loue none consideracion doeth many tymes make delaye asked sauing pa tie whiche begger maye worthie haue benefite moste diepe derkenesse suche people lye wurship stockes stone stede god whome theyr moneye whome bealye god bondeseruauntes ambicion leacherie suche set world vproare furious rageyng warres suche persones cannot yet come approche nere vnto iesus cannot see yet lestewise noyse suche doe throughoute whole worlde preache glorie iesus leat aske matier whan shall knowe iesus passyng leat suffre presente occasion slippe away leat pieteous criyng wery eares case priuie conscience naughty eiuil dedes afore past counsail kepe silence leat clamoure faythfull beleuyng herte muche instauntly knocke dores eares iesus deafe ne harde hearyng body asketh faithful trust hi power hable geue asked ce y passeth wil go ferre paste one strayne voyce happy ye begger euer born whose voice iesus stayeth way meruaill stayed voice one speakyng vnto sence vouchsalued cu ferre iourney vnto shepe lost happy blind man brought vnto iesus nere health neither ca log blind whoso hath approched ye fountain al light thatsame lord beyng fountain glory doeth put away begger man sinner disdaineth neighbour thou art cum presece afore iesus thou art gon away fro thy selfe nede long praiyng speake woord thou wouldest haue speake perfite faith affiauce coceiued thine merites great power lesse goodnes immediatly shal thy sight cum saluacio together assone iesus said loke thou vp sight beggar became folower iesus traine open declarer god goodnesse yea moreouer people also whan thei seen notable miracle gaue laude praise vnto god xix chapter entered went hiericho behold named zacheus whiche rewler among publicanes riche also sought meanes see iesus could presse litle stature ranne clymed vp wild figgetter see cum way whe iesus came place loked vp saw said vnto zachee cum doune day must abide thy house came doune hastily receiued ioyfully whan sawe grutched saiyng gon tarry man sinner zacheus stode forth said vnto lord behold lord half goodes geue poore haue doen man wrong restore fower folde iesus sayed vnto day health happened vnto house also becum chylde abraham sonne man cum seke saue whiche lost blynde man whome lord restored vse light doeth figure vnaptly signyfie people gentile iewes ye lawe gaue sum piece lyghte vnto gentile laye moste diepe derknesse ignoraunce muche among thesame greate manye whiche verily beleued god others beleued goddes innumerable thesame full mischief abominacion men selfe againe sum thought god tooke care gouernaunce worldly thinges yea sum also reputed vsed sone moone ox dogges ape yea lekes oynios god among gentile knewe laweful ne determinate bandes matrimony fulfilled lust body going together one another maner bruit beastes sum also accounted naturall thyng haue killed theyr parentes wha aged others among thyng lawful vsuall eate man fleashe sum highe poynte deuocion seruyng god kyll mooste derely beloued child sacrifice deuil ca lamentable blyndnesse yet blynd man beeyng poore destitute vertues perceiued iesus whan passed nacion iewes put away whan came streyned voyce fayth criyng aloude thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon costrained iesus stay goyng deserued asked would haue doen hym confessed blindnesse shewed desire hert lord may haue syght receiued plainely fewe woordes craued wurshipper monstreous thynges made wurshipper iesus bondseruaunt deuils maner vice made disciple folower iesus common beggar crauer miserable almes made publisher power god many tyme twise exauples kinde laied lappes iewes end either thei amed fro vnbelefe orels make open manifest time cumthere man named zacheus worthilye cast would made whol figure certes shewed enterauce citie hiericho euident exau ple sheweth self anon within citie selfe lord beig entred hiericho goyng along middes citie encoupaced euerye side exceadyng thicke presse multitude sortes certain man zacheus hauyng name thing propertie wete man feruent earnest loue desyre righteousnesse whereas dede head man among publican yea riche withall whereas neither kynde trade liuyng ne papering fortune well agree suche hert holde great desire see iesus entent might know hym ight also bruite fame spred abrode thinges worthye maruailed beleued also loued heard cause muche accordyng exaumple inward desire simeo patriarkes holy desirefulnes couet satisfie iyes blissefull happye sighte hym one would haue attempted greatter thynges sauyng softenesse humilitie let therof euen pointe worthier haue fruicion presece cumpany iesus desire haue sight iesus long tyme holde herode saw last bid away despite vain doth see iesus seen iesus iesus seen zacheus zacheus euer sette iye hym herode would fain haue seen might haue delyted curyous iyes beyng kyng shewyng sum myracle afore hym zacheus beyng desirous see bee woulde knowe man wete thatsame onelye soonne god authour worker saluacion vnto creature beeleuyng trustyng hym greate matter see iesus flesh suche lyke iyes phariseis sawe withall euery day yet hym derision iyes disciple earnestly reported blissed deserued seemath xiii luke x many prince earth denied simo sone ionas mouth iesus pronounced blessed sawe iesus whan gaue testimony thou arte christemath xvi luke ix iohn vi sone ye liuing god iewes sawe sayed ioseph carpentars sonne vnto godly desire zacheus shamefastnesse lette breake iesus perforce cumpany great multitude people sta dyng thicke round iesus euery sidemarke vi math xiii luke iiii let short stature bodye also third lette verye lowe man stature lowe menne spiritually suche incumbente dooe rest filthy vile transitory thynges lowe basse whatsoeuer world hath compared maiestie gospel person cannot iesus seen except conueigh theymselfes high place iesus beeyng aboue great heigth bee seen lowe iesus beeyng middes among lowe vulgar presse people seen suche haue troden higheste toppe al worldly thynges vnder feete therfore ende might bee seen litle lowe persones euery side throughout nacions world hymself afterward climed vp wood crosse standing aloft great heigth zacheus beyng litle lowe onely stature bodyeand ran beefore clymed wilde figtree also humblenesse hert entent would stand aloft see iesus beyng alowe grounde ranne afore toke vp high place ye way iesus passe high stading good pulpit got ready hym wylde figtree whiche called sycomore bringeth forth figges owne right kynde figtrees reason therof also called figge egypt yet leafe resembleth mulbery tree great presse iewes enuironed iesus round euery side law gon afore prophetes also gon afore present age one side close round yea yet day nacio iewes dooe come behind learne thynges iesus dyd thynges taught yet see thatsame thei ought hope saluacion zacheus renning afore preueteth felicitie bearing verily figure ye gentile cause therof forsoth iewe remaineth yet still alowe grounde cleueth carnalitie lawe iesus seen onely suche fro lowe basse lettre lawe auauce vp theselfes ye loftier sence spirite doune high standyng one may well see iesus otherwise case man remain still beneath amongest ye throng say thou haue smatche ne sauouring excellent good thyng aboue comon sorte thou shalt oftentimes heare yesame deceitfull saying loe christ loe yonder phariseis crie loe y sadducee cry behold ebeonites crye behold poynteth sum one pharisaical sorte clad blacke frocke cope saieth loke way christ sheweth towardes pharisaicall sorte goyng whyte wede sayeth beholde christ felowe shewyng many sondry colour shape vesture crieth christe sheweth one eateth nothig fishe saieth christ sheweth gelded sort forbidden mary saieth christe iewishe vnbeleuyng nacio art thou mynded willing se christ climme vp tree high take vnto thee iyes zacheus fain see robe y coueteth see know face face iesus couered ye holy scripture drawe aside vaile lift vp thine vnderstandyng tho thinges whiche within thou shalt see iesus thou shalt see whence true healthe redepcio issueth forth vnto v pharisee goeth iettyng bolt vpryghte beyng high conceipte hymself takyng vnto himselfe owne due right praise righteousnes takyng vnto hymself knowlage lawe thinketh hymselfe great man nedeth bee euen largest nigh enough vnto christ euen harde elbow wil vouchesafe thinketh skorne vse sure helpe tree zacheus beyng lowe owne iyes climmed vp tree seeth wisheth seemath xxi marke xi yea peradueture figtree like vnto figtree whiche lord accursed freashe grenesse leaues made one hungrie beleue fynd fruite vpon dede none yet nowe tyme figure law holy saiynges prophetes bring foorth fruite euangelical godlines thatsame figtree lord commaunded cutte vp roote onlesse wha doug wer laied rote therof would leaue still barain nigh barain dedeluke xiii zacheus climmed vp stand vpon stemme iudaical figtree brought foorth grosse vnsauery vnrype people zacheus climed vp tree saye assoone people gentile graffed begonne bring foorth fruite lord iesus loueth iewes many hundred yeres loked last came vnto walked fro dayly coumpany yet knowen among theym people gentile heard fame report iesus beyng enkiendled loue know thesame iesus iewes hanged vpon tree ranne iewes feruentnes faith acknowelagyng vnrighteousnes lowe wer contemned lettre ye lawe contened ceremony figure iewes eue yet day embrace true substauce thynges selfes thorough euangelicall faith see iesus passing apostle acknowlage hym therby deserue haue iesus cum geaste owne offre soiourne house forasmuche vnbelefe iewes expulsed banished hym away fro dooeth litle zacheus sitte still tree ready iyes lokyng iesus yet cummyng good preatie way yet throughly taughte marke mighte knowe iesus sauyng onely perfite hope trust thyng whiche earnestly wished desired whan people came sycomore tree zacheus peraduenture matier laughter good sporte great many forasmuche beeyng welthie ryche man office customer stoode alofte tree bee gazer vpon one man mo coueted knowe man sauyng onely iesuswhan iesus came place loked vp iesus beyng delited notable fainnesse man whiche fainnesse shewed veray facte countenaunce earnest lookyng iyes albeit iesus espyed hym afore yet shewe vnto iewes exsaumple prompt beleuyng cast vp iyes high sawe zacheus looke lesse tymes notable benefite saluacion often iesus doeth vouchesafe looke vpon anye persone iyes haue medicinable kinde charming sought onely see hym vayne doeth suche partie see iesus iesus doeth agayne vouchesalue behold iyes auaunce thyself vp lowe vile thynges iesus loke vp vnto thee loking iesus vpon man hath porcion good lykelyhood come matier token greater blysse heare iesus voyce zacheus nomore ne none beholde iesus lorde owne mere mocion sayed vnto hymzacheus come callyng hym euen name manne knowen vnto hym zacheus come thou quickely daye muste soiourne thy house haue heard lorde hath oftentymes goen dyners menes house wha hath desyred haue tyme heard euer dyd owne mynde come make hymselfe geaste man whan bydden yea men moste parte taken poynte homely curtesie lorde beholden affeccion herte man within sette muche hauyng sighte hym passed would haue assayed somewhat ferther hadde owne priuie knowelage vnwoorthinesse lette therof thus dyd thinke owne minde blissed haue happe cleue vnto suche one whose happe beholde face daylye presence hym whose chaunce heare voyce standyng harde hym iewes none others haue muche good happe publicane euen largest suche one haue hadde syghte hym passed come woorde oute mouthe bydde iesus house suche herte excedyng courteous bidder geaste lord iesus loueth well bidden suche sorte suche one vpon acknowelageyng owne weakenesse conscience dareth bee bolde craue thyng wisheth herte would fayn haue suche one doeth obteyne another biddeth iesus house though would bynde iesus vnto hym dooyng hym suche pleasure peter neuer came nerer vnto christ whan sayed goe awaye maysterluke v luke vii math viii felowe synner man also piththie earnest bidder iesus sayed vnto hym maister manne worthie thou shouldeste entre vnder roufe house iesus alreadie sayed party house whiche certayn centurion whan young felowe made whole though iesus bodye came iesus wheresoeuer health recouerie iesus thirsted redempcion mankinde therefore biddeth zacheus come quickely nowe time redempcion whiche passe awaye iewes shoulde bee transposed putte ouer congregacion gentile muste iesus soiourne abyde vntil consummacion veray last ende closing vp tymes come might suffred abyde emong iewes high stand watchyng iesus feith came downe office duetie godly deuocionand cam doune hastely enough vieu iesus gaze vpo hym often nedeth place soiournyng therof hath iesus nede ofte ye neighbour hath nede doeth zacheus hereupon woorde doeth geue aunswere earnest affeccion herte doeth often vse take awaye mannes speakyng doeth bidden without making tariaunce cometh quickely co uenient tarrie whansoeuer iesus calleth v iewes called make theyr excuse zacheus beyng veray foreward full reioycyng entreteyned iesus house raiserable synagogue whiche loste geaste iesus happie house churche hir good promptnesse prouoke iesus authour geuer heauenly blisse come vnto well thus nowe thou seest original begynnyg churche beeyng gathered together gentile nowe consider well saumple paterne iewishe enuie people whan sawe iesus muche enclined towardes fauour publicane owne voluntarie mocion bid hymselfe geaste house made murmouryng gon soiourne felowe synnerhe goen tarrye wt man sinner righteousnesse foule stayned odious god whiche coulde rather mynde disdeigne bee healed could rather mynde grutche neighbour leat thesame haue parte felowe synner though wer principal sinne al haue enuie neyghbour though suche one maye bee honest man grutcheth brother bee state grace stadeth thou without doores congregacio thou enuious iewe open entre also thou wilt case thou refuse yet hath iesus determined abide zacheus house gentile litle proude suche geaste neuer looked muche better welcome hath happened onelye without theyr deseruyng also contrary expectacion euen murmouryng made nowe presente agaynste iesus great murmouryng made afterwarde agaynst peter cornelius centurion whan sayed vnto hymactes x wherfore haste thou gon vnto men vncircumcised doen zacheus contemnyng murmouryng people iudaicall standeth iesus maketh suit also bee taken noumbre disciple shewyng thereby ferre growen proceded forwardebehold lord halfe gooddes geue poore sayeth vnto iesus behold lorde geue away halfe gooddes emong poore case haue defrauded man ferthyng promise geue hym fower tymes muche agayn hearest thou thou pharisee zacheus maketh rehearsall oblacions sleaghyng beastes sacrifice choyse meates fastyngesluke xviii holydayes solemnysyng sabbothes washynges maketh vauntes ne braggues vesture secte religion bryngeth hym workes charitie poyntes synner better iust person publicane passeth suche glorye owne holynesse sayde pharisee beeyng setter foorth owne manyfold good dedes gaue teth parte gooddes poore man gaue one halfe gaue pollyng gaynes peny hath gotten falsehood restored thesame thencreace fower tymes double muche moreouer gooddes iustely truely come byluke xi mat xxiii gaue one moite charitie vnto nedie course thinges meruailously turned withinforth pharisee thesame replete rauine guyle zacheus haue vpright true dealyng man liberall whereas man onely ryche also publicane yea head manne trade wherby muche abhorred emong iewes lorde passeth mennes title style beholdeth mynde manne estemeth hym dedes yea suche dedes saye dooe procede foorth feith charitieluke xviii neither zacheus speake premiss hymselfe waye makyng vaunt boste sorte foresayde pharisee beyng trumpe owne righteousnesse scorner publicane zacheus doeth sette righteousnesse another party righteousnesse man bothe synner publicane openeth playne woordes without dissimulacion earnest mynde desire exercise righteousnesse yea euen sight iesus whome desyrous bee enstructed whether well ferther bee dooen geattyng euerlastyng lyfe expediente woordes zacheus shoulde bee hearde enuious iewes bee allowed christ hearyng thesame iewes possible hym piththily effectuallye laye vnto iewes theyr pollyng facions theyr auaryce theyr catchyng mennes gooddes geue nothyng theyr owne vnto neyghboure beyng nede also vnder colour godlynesse defrauded parentes succour due vnto theyr childrens handes iesus therfore turnyng murmouryng iewes sayed playnly affirme vnto health come house present daye forasmuche thesame also perteyneth abraham beeyng father vnto whome glorying fyrst founder generacion whatsoeuer persone doeth feith sinceritie lyfe godly deuocion resemble abraham thesame sone abraham free partaker blissing old tyme promised vnto abraham stocke man beeyng bloud stocke abrahamthis daye health happened vnto house lette vnto hym sorte trade lyfe hauyng heretofore passed ouer sinfulnesse whatsoeuer persone conuertyng emending former lyfe doeth enbrace doctryne gospell whosoeuer folowyng steppe abraham doeth ensue true righteousnesse thesame chylde true heyre vnto abraham suche wyll soonne manne thynke disdeigne came worlde veray purpose seke goen straygh saue lost suche synners acceptable vnto god swell false persuasion righteousnesse heard thynges added therto parable nigh hierusalem thought kyngdome god shortelye appeare sayed therfore certayne noble man went ferre countrey receyue hym kyngdom come agayne called tenne seruauntes deliuered tenne pounde saying vnto occupye ye tyll come citezens hated hym sente message hym saying haue man reygne ouer v came passe whan receyued kyngdome returned commaunded seruauntes called vnto hym whome geuen money e muche euery manne dooen came ye first saying lord thy pounde hath gayned tenne pounde sayed vnto hym well thou good seruaunte thou hast feithfull veraye lytle thyng haue thou autoritie ouer tenne city another came saying lord thy pound hath made fyue pound thesame sayed thou rewler also ouer fiue cyties another came saying lorde beholde thy pounde haue kept napkyn feared thee thou arte streight man thou takest vp thou laydest reapest thou diddest sowe sayeth vnto hym thyne owne mouthe wyll iudge thee thou eiuell seruaunte knowest thou streight man taking vp layed downe reapyng dyd sowe wherfore gauest thou money banke cummyng might haue requyred myne owne vauntage sayed vnto stoode take hym pounde geue hym hath tenne pounde sayed vnto hym lorde hath tenne pounde saye vnto vnto euery one whiche hath shalbe geuen shall haue aboundaunce hym hath shalbe taken awaye euen whiche hath moreouer myne enemy would shoulde reigne ouer bryng hither sleagh talke iesus declare hensfoorth none ought glory obseruyng lawe whatsoeuer good qualitie gyfte grace happened vnto man bounteous liberalitie god bee wholy employed suche ende yt maye drawe veray many men grace saluacion thereby suche kinde gaynes god moste speciallye delited sent owne sonne purpose freely forgeuyng theyr synnes might ioyne nacions world vnto dede emong disciple thought soone come ierusalem whiche begoonne nowe drawe somewhat nere vnto kyngdome heauen wold immediately appere whiche many tymes made mencion wherin imaginacion ranne vpon kingdome lyke worldely reygne whereas christ ment reigne spirite euangelicall meane wherof tyrannie synnes oppressed troden vnder foote kyngdome certes consisteth puissaunce armed souldiers weapon force handes feith truste god beneficiall goodnesse towardes neighbour mercifulnesse towardes offendours sincere liberall dispensyng worde god maiestie kyngdome whiche shall honourablye rewarde godly immortall glorye shall adiudge wiekedde vnto endlesse tormentes declared streightwayes bee shewed foorth shoulde bee made open manifest due tyme beeyng v vnknowen ferther shoulde meane season meanes wayes employe earnest diligence good gyfte qualitie euerye bodye hath first remembre bee lordes moneye whome debtours al haue money whiche haue receyued oughte vprightly feythfully bee destributed abrode gaynes profite thesame lorde hath nede manier thyng charitie loue towardes mankynde thirsteth redemyng saluacion creature thynketh himselfe encreaced great auauntage gayne yf one man emende another viciousnesse bee conuerted vice earnest exercise godly deuocion whereby maye haue rewarde party aswel one helpeth doyng benefite also hath holpen nothyng maye behalfe take possession eyther prayse el thanke seruauntes euery one v bounden dutie owe beste labour seruice stocke money euery whyt yea owene v ourselfes must labour euery man best power encrease lordes substaunce touchyng reward leat v leaue arbitrement lorde conuenient tyme moste largely rewarde prompte wil faithful endeuouring discourse parable ensuing certain man nobilitie great powera certaine noble man went far coutrey toke voyage ferre countrey recouer possessio realme hades tirany vsurped preueted possessio afore doe returne home great man entred iourney called together certain seruauntes numbre tenne deliuered tene poundes vnto sort equal diuisio stocke money indifferently among al therwithal gaue commission money saieth deliuer vnto cosume wastfully kepe idle hads may ecreace ye trade occupiyng ende beyng returned home againe may fynde substaunce well encreased home thinges thus sette ordre home went forth voyage inhabitauntes citie whiche rewler gouernour ofwe haue thys manne reigne oue v hated hym wherupon soone gon foorth iourneye begoone treacte chaunge attemptyng suche matter wer recoueryng kyngdome expulsed already possession upon sent ambassadours vnto hym beeyng nowe good waye onwarde iourney make relacion vnto hym subiectes suche mynde henceforth woulde longer haue hym kyng therfore make labour returne home theim whence taken present voiage befell wha recouered possession kyngdome whiche taken saied voiage returned home agayne owne realme commauded seruauntes bee called fore deliuered stocke tenne poundes audite accouptes duely made myght knowe muche euerye gotten clere gaynes first came foorth beyng demaunded accoumpt saied lord thy pounde enprowed summe tenne poundes whose industry fidelitie lord muche praisynglord th pound hath gayued ten pounde aunswered well saied good seruaunte forasmuche whan substaunce suche might haue lien narow roume thou hast litle summe money declared thy selfe faythfull trustie louyng toward thy maister nowe substaunce enlarged reason conscience thou bee partaker welthyer state take thou vnto thee rule tenne city seruaunt cumeth seconde beyng required accoumpte sayed lorde thy pounde thou deliueredst stocke occupy hath encreased fiue poudes thy behoufe mannes industrie also though inferiour yet lord well commende accordyng rate thine industrye sayeth bee thou also rewler ouer fiue city wha resydue also vpon accoumpte rekenyng made geuen vp bene rewarded dignitie euery one according rate lesse last came seruaunt euen one alone moste slouthfull luske euer wurste honestie bee put truste credite whan mayster required streight accoumpte made aunswere lord behold bryng againe pounde whiche ye put truste withall haue kepte euer sence tyme hitherto safely layed vp cloute ye haue agayn safe sound haue well auoided wastfull spender haue muche touched handes thought better doe come hasarde perill leste mine occupiyng ill framed haue buisines afrayed one ignoraunt rigorous cruell ye couetous lucre muche ye onely geue nothing owne also wil take away thence ye layed nothing gather haruest fro suche place ye neuer sowed grain lorde onely offended slouthfulnesse seruaut also laied owne faulte condicions maysterof thyne mouth iudge thou euyll seruaut c beyng throughly pacience sayed thou slouthfull seruaunt vntrustie felowe yea moreouer false accuser thy maister thou hast geuen sentence thine owne head thou knowest thou sayest rygorous cruel man couetous lucre takyng vp money fro thence layed downe none reaping sowed nothyng yet thatsame pointe ought haue quickened actiuitie best yr yng thee haue deliuered foorth money kepers banke would doubtelesse haue comen would haue streightly required together encrease entresse suche purpose put thy handes encrease thee wordes ye lord whan vnprofitable seruaunte helde peace woord speake lord said others stode take ye way pound hym geue vnto hym hath tenne poundes seruauntes meruailyng therat sayed lorde nedeth geue hym ryche welthy enough hath tenne pounde saied lord forceth hath haue thoughte good dooeth stande reason equitie rekenyng whose hath faithful industrie encreased maisters substauceunto euery one whiche hathe shalbe ge bounteous goodnesse muste vnto suche one geue ferther surplusage ende maie styll haue aboundaunce contrariewise whoso hath reason slouthfulnesse gotten hymselfe gaynes suche one nede shal liberalitie litle helpe euen hath shalbe taken away stocke mine gaines encrease therof due partes perfourme due labour bountifully geue vnto bothe stocke also encrease thesame thus farre lord iesus derke mystical fourme speakyng teache disciple ye buisy trade preachyng ghospell euery man oughte shewe hymselfe faythfull industrious euen vttermoste theyr rewarde looke secounde coming lorde time shal nowe appere mightie high kingdome church shalbe recouered handes deliuered vp father first iesus knowen iewry onely seemed litle king duke one citie whan deiuyll reygned without redresse throughout vnyuersall nacyons worlde royalme mannes none hys iesus couetyng recouer hys owne possessyon agayne throughe preachyng ghospell satan tyrannye entred vpon leafte lande iewes tooke voyage heauen till firste diligentlye enstructed hys dyscyples trade occupying affayres ghospell whiche hys discyples put truste dyspensacyon woorde god conteyned ghospell certayne stocke playe occupier withall wherof great gaynes might growe vnto lorde beyng righte couetous suche mannier encrease put truste draw vnto kingdome gospel whomesoeuer might publicanes harlottes souldiers grekes romaynes scithians frenchemen gothians sarmatians others thys shoulde doe vntill lordes returne come againe ende worlde distribute vnto euery one euerlastyng rewardes theyr dedes come agayne onlesse shall firste haue subdued worlde domynyon empire ghospell nacyons whole worlde ioyne together one churche congregacion whyle earnestely goeth thys meane hys disciple iewes emong whome alone moe god hitherto seemed reigne reason theyr knowlage lawe autoritie beeing right trade religyon beeing subiectes whome emong whome borne whereas oughte specially aboue others haue loued mannier meanes sticke hym recoueryng hys kingdome dyd onely doe hym helpe also lette agayns e hym cry beefore chyefe iustice iudge haue kyng ceasar selfe thyng dydde agayne afterwarde playnelye denouncyng vnto apostle commaundyng make mencion tyme furthewarde name iesus moyses willyng haue theyr kyng christe woulde none hated contraryed theyr naughtie lustes appetite see euen yet still day sorte nacyon iewes haue withdrawen themselues kyngdome gospell howe stiffe stubberne hatefulnes haue conspired agaynst hym vnto whome geuen father power heauen earth haue thys manne say reygne ouer v wise serue christe bonde slaues vnto tirannes thys worlde bonde seruauntes satan moste mercilesse tiranne se euery place throughout whole worlde christian reioyce freedome spiryte dooe yet styll holde faste theyr teeth vnsauerye lettre whome bounde lyke vnto men assigned appoynted glebe turfe sayde iewes vayne cry agaynste hym kyngdome churche recouered established geatting establishyng wherof many shall haue doen theyr feythfull trauayle shall bee crouned glory honour kyngdome heauen accordyng quantitee rate fruicte whiche haue broughte lordes vineyarde nowe iewes beeyng obstinatelye vnbeleuyng rewarde shall haue euen thyng also dyd lorde declare residue thesame parable latter ende punished vntrustie seruaun e sayde moreouer yea subiectes myne nacion countreymen hearte enemy whiche sedicious ambassade sente vnto praied shoulde come bee theyr kynge ne reygne ouer bryng ye hyther may bee put deathe euen syghte bee punyshed theyr rebellyon thys punyshmente deathe euerlastyng whiche bydethe suche obey ghospell glad tydynges sonne god tyme shall worthylye fynde hym vnpossible bee appeaced forasmuche nowe obstinately contemned hym beeyng mylde full mercie pand whan thus spoken proceded furth taking iourney goe vp hierusalem fortuned whan come nigh bethphage bethanie besyde mounte whiche called oliuete sent two diciples saying goe ye towne whiche ouer agaynste whiche soone ye come ye shall finde ass colte tyed wheron yet neuer man sate looce bring hither yf man aske doe ye looce hym thus shall ye saye vnto lorde hath nede thereof sent went waye founde euen sayed vnto loocing col e owner therof sayde vnto looce ye colte sayde lorde hath nede brought hym iesus cast theyr rayment colte set iesus theron went spred theyr clothes way whan nowe come nigh going downe mounte oliuete whole multitude disciple began reioyce prayse god loude voice al miracle sene saying blissed king cometh name lorde peace heauen glory highest lorde whan spoken premiss went foorth towardes hierusalem shoulde afterwarde accomplyshe thatsame excellent sacrifice redempcyon mankynde oute beakon place crosse like couetous ambicious kyng plucke al thinges vnto hymselfe although haue euery bene many tymes paste manye hereafter shall bee whiche crye theyr veray dedes haue thys man bee kyng ouer v yet nacion ferre distaut waye iewes whence shall plucke veray great noumber vnto hym wherfore doth eftsones beate heades facte afore represented zacheus whiche thyng dydde anon longer parable expresse large lorde dooeth meane procure thyng whiche procured many tymes afore also whiche might bee clere euidente vnto creature whatsoeuer shoulde afterwarde suffer hys owne accorde willingly wetingly suffer otherwise power dooe whatsoeuer doe forasmuch determined meane moste extreme worldely shame fall might bee recouer possession highest glorye possible emong men disciple beeing yet fullye apte ne hable receiue vnderstandyng thys mystery didde looke matier whatsoeuer greate royaltie thyng high enterprise estymacion worlde lordes handes pleased hym afore hys death litle season flatter rather mocke theyr affeccions also mocke glorye thys worlde shewyng howe vayne howe slippie truste seeyng greate token ioyfull receyuyng hym manye cryinges shoutes made hys honour muche earneste fauour people deathe crosse dyd immediatelye folowe necke therof whan iesus therfore come mounte whiche called oliuete nere vnto twoo lytle townes situate syde mounte whence hierusalem nowe afore within sighte sente two hys disciple erand goe wayes sayeth litle towne ye see yonder foreryght agaynste entreyng whereof ye shall see young colte asse standyng tyed without doores vnbroken yet manne ryde whome hathe neuer man sitten vntie hym bryng hym anye bodye shall bee agaynst demaunde wherefore doe ye vntie colte ye shall thus aunswere hym lorde hath nede hym dyscyples departed founde colte tyed addresse looce hym whyle certayn persones presente asked ye woulde saye beyng dooyng doe ye looce colte tofore bene commaunded made aunswere lord hath nede name lord heard suffered colte beled awaye broughte hym vnto iesus whan sawe lorde mynded mounte vpon hym lyke whereof neuer tofore tyme vsed dooe dyscyples beecause shoulde vpon bare rydge colte sitte muche vneasilyand wente spred theyr clothes waye cast robe abrode vpon beastes backe iesus sitting coltes backe goyng onward spred abrode garmentes euen veray way partly doe honour partly lest colte vnbroken also vnshod hurt hoofes stublyng stone whan nowe come foote hyll goyng directly towardes citie hierusalem certayn woonderfull affeccion sodaynly toke hertes people whome come traine iesus come foorthe hierusalem mete hym euerye body coulde dooe best strawed way lorde went braunches tree euery broken great ioye also loude voyces begoon laude god al benfites miracle sene heard wrought iesus souned euery side voice people reioycing cummyng bene god cummyng triumphblessed bee king yt cometh name lorde men cry honour hym osanna hygheste blessed bee cummeth name lorde peace heauen glorye highest voyce multytude al sortes especially young folkes bene certayne inspiracion god enuie grutchyng phariseis contemned dyd open face worlde geue testimonie vnto lorde iesus pand phariseis coumpanye sayed vnto maister rebuke thy disciple sayed vnto tell holde theyr peace shall stone crye multytude certayne phariseis whome thyssame cry christe welcummynge hym dyd muche agrieue outwardelye shewe thoughe woulde haue worlde knowe thyng iesus whatsoeuer aboue rate man emonge phariseis warned iesus himselfe owne mouth autoritie restreigne vngodlye shoutes multytude procedynge certayne vnmeasurable fauour people towardes theyr maister therefore vnpleasaunte euen lorde selfe vse acknowlage suche hyghe prayses maister saye phariseis rebuke thy dyscyple iesus neuer went styll deuout profession playne meanyng people byword cheeked blindenes phariseis ashamed attribute vnto beelzebub prince deuylles suche thynges iesus hyghlye well dyd wroughte made aunswere agayne face shoulde suppresse woorthily syng glorye vnto god deuout voyces nowe synging thesame many long day sen spoken prophetesif holde theyr peace shall stone cry thus muche saye vnto certayntie god muche willeth thys hys laude vndeclared case men woulde altogether holde theyr peace veraye stone woulde crye oute truely harder stone whiche many benefytes manye miracle prouoked yet bee moued theyr heartes speake aduauncemente goddes glorye suche pompe triumphaunt lyke suche trayne hym dyd lorde iesus goe vnto hierusalem suche litle tast thys worldes glory lyked hym take woulde take crosse vpon hym professing godhed parforce wring nacion anon bee moste cruelly dooen death thende iewes mighte bee condemned owne sentence crucifyed theyr messias salueour nowe thys story gestes hidden comprised small poynte mistery asse dame standing colte also standyng whiche ass fole dame already bene woonte bee ryden beyng long continuaunce enured weare yoke lawe sygnifying doubtlesse nacion iewes colte beeyng fole thys asse redempcion toke fyrste beginning iewes colte saye betokenyng people gentile yet vnbroken neyther anye tyme charged yoke lawe yet throughe euangelicall obedyence carrying iesus sitter backe beastes tyed one syde sinagogue lyued bondage vnder carnalitie lawe atteygnynge freedome spiryte gentile syde entangled decree philosophiers subiecte wurshippyng idolles deiuilles season owner indifferente aswell one yea suche maisters fewe people aswell iewes also gentile great mayny bounde couetise leachery ambicion enuie manye filthie also mercilesse maysters twoo apostle dooe lordes commaundement vntye wete peter teacher circumcision say iewes paule teacher gentile whan euangelicall fayth baptisme forgeue one transgression former life nowe looced may hensfurth worthy haue iesus sitter thys power gaue vnto hys dysciples onely emong iewes also emong gentile whatsoeuer looced yearthe shoulde bee loo ed heauen meruayl former owner lette vntying seeyng whiche doe vntie doe vntye commaundemente newer maister whose creature resiste thys newe maister hath nede suche manier beastes backe suche one dooeth reioyce sitte dooe simplye obey without anye fraude drawing backe suche good hearte mynde dooe take vpon swete yoke euangelicall doctryne suche bee skittishe ne prauncynge agaynste sytter suche quiete ientle softe pace dooe beare glorifye lorde iesus theyr bodyes vntyll come euen full holy citie temple lorde meane citie common murderer prophetes heauenlye citie whiche knoweth rebellion doeth meane worldely prynces loue fyerce stieryng courser foled euen purposely warres well broken taughte thereafter lorde iesus loueth suche manier ass mekelye stilly carry theyr meke maister caste hym whan sitteth thys facyon carying doe haulte prince world laughe philosophiers theyr disdaynfull lookes dooe laugh phariseis swellyng pryde dooe laughe thynke themselues fortunate carry deiuill theyr backes rougheste sytter possyble moste vnfauourable lyue bondage many moste mercilesse maisters whereas serue thys one maister christe heauen nothynge happie blissed case litle simple one looced bondage haue receiued iesus vpon theyr backe worldely estimacion ignorauntes symple sorte suche skyll fraude falsehoode appeare bee assishe kinde haue lorde theyr directour leat straygh way onelye vouchesalueth sytte theyr backes also haue hys habytacion theyr heartes whiche gouerneth hys owne spirite beastes bare vntil apostle doe couer al ouer robe theyr doctrine exaumples holy conuersacion preparing iesus geatte vp vpon whiche iesus dyd fleashe neuer ceassethe dooe spirytuall sence way rough way dooe disciple make sure enough goe vpon spreadyng theyr garmentes abrode vpon shewyng way godly conuersacion easye case man goyng exaumples holy submit hymselfe vnder lorde iesus goe vpon braunches palmes vpon greene leaues tree memorye mattirs virgin confessoures continuallye bearyng floures keping theyr freashe grenesse great noumber good exaumples doeth euery syde offer themselues vnto entred way godly deuocion great store exauples doe bokes iewes minister eue getiles also shew token gladnesse thys coltes behalfe oeuer bee acknowleage christe theyr lorde owner neyther doe want phariseis thys day ne neuer shall want fayle whome glorye chrste shall cause herte burning enuie lieffer haue cryed vnto themselues osanna highest lauded cometh ye name ye lorde wheras come lordes name theyr owne iewes euen thys daye kepyng sylence glory christ whiche haue enuye stone vnceassauntly crye nowe become child abraham doe people hierusalem crye awaye hym awaye hym dooe hym crosse irishe men scottes englyshe men frenche menne sarmacians germaines crie landed cometh name lorde people whyle sette theyr heartes aduauncyng theyr owne glory doe labour derken glory christe whiche respect theyr owne priuate commodytye dooe suppresse depraue corrupte sinceritie holy scripture whyle desyre haue theyr owne greatnesse set men talke glorye christe leaft vnspoken suche veraylye playe partes phariseis whiche attempted stoppe mouthes chyldren hebrues whiche chyldren god enspyred sing foorthe glorye hys name hys sonne whome geuen salueour vnto worlde yea thys poyncte also hathe holesome significacion firste stiepe cumming downe mount oliuete afterwarde euen smoothe waye ouer playne anon agayne goyng vp vnto mounte sion vpon thys mounte sion temple lorde builded except former mount oyle wherby light feyth might nourished maynteyned coulde bee cummyng downe affyaunce lawe iewes swel pride trustyng philosophie gentile thinke themselues ioly felowes firste steppe degree growing forwarde goodnesse feyth muste approche house cheke bethphage muche say sirians tounge thys cheke puffethe vp haultenesse mynde looke ready come foorth confession offence committed agaynste god neyther muste bee ferre bethanie whiche called house obedyence creature obediente vnto ghospell yet herehence cometh begynning health downehyll waye lieth ouer playne euery syde strawen braunches good exaumples vntyll eftsones come rysyng vp hyll towardes mounte sion whiche called tooryng hylle peake hygh beacon place watchyng toure whence see ferre thys verayly hygh toppe vertue whiche hygh peake beakon place altho thynges great waye beneath looked downe vpon contemned whiche thys worlde maketh greate moustre shewe hyghe thynges aboue moone mynde beeyng nowe drawyng well towardes heauen beholdeth suche thynges euerlasting doe surmount coumpasse al man reason pand whan come nere behelde citie wept saying thou haddeste knowen thinges whiche belonge vnto thy peace euen thy day thou wouldest take hede nowe hidde thyne iyes dayes shall come thee thy enemy also shall cast antie thee compace thee rounde kepe thee euery side make thee euen grounde thy child thee shall leaue thee one stone vpon thou knowest tyme thy visitacion whan lorde iesus nowe come ferre onward hierusalem somewhat nere full fighte afore viewing beholdyng cytye portely gorgeous buildinges flourishing menne richesse opinion holinesse deuocion towardes god proude state world presente day voyde thought care reason knewe thextreme distresse myserie come vpon earnestly moued compassion wept woordes sodaynly brastyng without suche talke afore goyng one sighing sobbing sorow muche lamented destruccyon citie spake thys effecte ensuyng thou also dyddest nowe well dooe knowe thys day thyne whiche offred vnto thee peace remission thy great synnes past thou wouldeste earnestlye sette thy minde embrace offered forsooth thys thy day whiche thou art occasioned emendemente whiche goodnesse god prouokethe thee repentaunce dooeth prouoke thee hygheste vttermoste degree bounteous goodnesse high degree goodnesse dooen mercifulnesse god often tymes despysed thee vouchsalueth certayne newe mannier visite thee ende thou mayeste lestewise thys meane weaxe mylde reformable come day thyne romaine goddes vengeaunce whiche thou wilt plagued thy greate transgressyonsbut nowe hidden fro thine iyes c whiche thou hast mynde heape vpon lamente bee sory paste nowe thou neyther knoweste thyne owne daye ne forescest day come whiche shall bee thyne bothe one hydden thyne iyes whiche thee almoste vttrely blynded drounkennesse thy flouryshynge welthye state thou art present thou neyther hast remembraunce eiuils past whiche thou hast dooen ne foreseest thynges come hang ouer thy head acknowlagest prest goodnesse god towardes thee whiche goodnesse god thou doest yet styll obstinately sette naught thou citie vnpossible bee recured common murderer suche bryng vnto thee woorde thy saluacion redempcyon shall come straungyers lande agaynste thee whiche shall brynge vtter destruccion ruine vpon thee thy lot refuse put thy messias stede chose ceasar vnto thy king thou shalt therefore fynde fele thy kynges cummyng vnto thee ferre furnyture prouision thy king doeth nowe come vnto thee bringer health paceable quiete king thou wilt nowe receyue hym cummeth geue health safegardethy enemy shal cast banke thee coumpare roud c ere longe shalte thou force bee compelled receiue shall come geue vtter confusion prince rome whome thou haddest preferred beefore thyne owne kyng shall come enemy stede kynges bendes men well armed appoyncted warre firste shall enuiron thee rounde trench shall bee way open escape shall euery side encoumpace thee men artillery shal streight siege oppresse thee fynally thyssame thy gaye buyldynge temple alland shall leaue one stone slading c shall cast downe lowe grounde satisfied withal thissame shal vniuersal slaughter destruie thy childre whome thou art proud doest sembleably set pride pompe thy gorgeous royaltie thyssame glory thyne shall suche sorte wipe away roote foundacion shall leaue muche one stone standynge faste mortised ende shall sygne thee remayne ne yet hope reedyfying thee agayne tyme come thynges dede shall bee miserable beeholde shall chaunce thyne owne desert often time occasioned long many yeres gon sundry prophetes also iohn thy messiasbecause ye knowest ye tyme thy visitacion thou doest obstinately despyse mercie god thou shalt therefore f le tyme vengeaunce whiche wouldest knowe tyme thy visitacion euen thou aswell others thou haddest woulde mightest haue embraced thy redempcion offered nowe leastwise thou shalt thy confusion bee holesome exaumple vnto others maye lyke manier despise goodnesse god whan prouoke take better wayes pand went temple beganne cast solde therin bought saying vnto written house house prayer ye haue made denne theues iesus spoken premiss came hierusalem entred templeand cast solde therin yt bought esay lvi droue therhence bying selling saying god sayeth scryptures house hath bene dedicated trade bying sellyng praying ye haue turned denne theues spoyling straungiers come wicked lying awayte procuring owne lucre losse damage others thys fact lorde iesus declared great destruccion persones dooe bryng churche vnder pretence coulour godly deuocyon applye theyr myndes altogether filthye lucre vnder tytle deuout wurshipping god doe attende theyr owne profit feding theyr flocke taking away al swete vnpure doctrine sleaghing soules whome theyr dueties pure doctrine bring vnto lyfe pand taught dayly temple priestes scribe chiefe people went destroy hym coulde fynde doe people stacke whan hearde thys dooen lorde one beyng nowe fully possessed hys owne kingdome taughte daye daye temple vncurable malyce phariseis openly despysed whiche hyghest dignitie emong priestes also scribe ringleders people netled therewithall stiered wrathe soughte occasyon caste away salueour lacked maliciouse myndes appered hope bringyng effecte hearde shoutynges people honour iesus saw temple also whole vniuersall multitude people depende altogether hys sayinges greate aswell effectuall pith also grace goddes woorde theyr colde feble doctrine concerning washynges concernyng corbone theyr treasoury churche concernynge true tythynge myntes rue stoode agaynste men stomakes euen lyke soure wyne people tasted newe must euangelicall hertinesse thys behalfe afearde lest theyr autoritie shoulde abate feared decaying theyr gaynes feared leste theyr kyngdome shoulde haue fall thing whiche tyme befell according litterall discourse storie doeth often tymes happen morall sence also whansoeuer often sitte top castel high chayre religion persones notorious profession teaching doctrine holy scripture doe fall conspiracie secular prynces iesus suche tyme great destruccyon hangeth ouer people thys thing cummeth passe often autoritie priestes doctoures open professours diuinitie dooeth flatter kynges monarch world often doctours say amen wilful affeccions appetite sayde worldely prynces autoritie wheras theyr partes bene wholsome franke monicyons tell prynces theyr faultes restreygne brydle power whan monarch agayne theyr party dooe theyr treasoures possessyons vnderproppe others make themselues buckelers peruerse desire bisshops diuynes wete theyr couetise theyr ambicion theyr tirannie albeit neyther dooeth commonly loue others yet wicked collusyon diligentlye ayde mayntayne eyther others forwarde suppressyng destruiyng trueth goddes woorde truely pernicyons conspiryng suche causeth mischiefe castyng away men worlde conspiracie bisshopes scrybes phariseys headman people dayes emong iewes p xx chapter pand fortuned one day aught people temple preached gospell high priestes scribe came together elder spake vnto saying tell v autoritie dooest thou thinges eyther gaue thee autoritie iesus aunswered sayd vnto also wil aske one thing aunswere baptisme iohn heauen men thought within themselues saying saye heauen say beleue ye say men people stone v persuaded iohn prophete aunswered could tell whens iesus sayed vnto neyther tell autoritie dooe thynges occasyon therfore sought although theyr faynesse putte christe death vngodly yet might afore men seme dooe earnest zele fauour righteousenesse befell therefore vpon certayne daye iesus eaching people temple styll dylygently repeating vnto newes gladsome bee wished euerlastyng saluacyon sayde hygh pryestes together scribe phariseis chiefe men lattee confederacie assemble together clustre ende might leastwise theyr autoritie bridle iesus teachyng holy doctryne ould condene wondrefull actes naught whiche great noumber wrought presence sigh e people hable confounde doctrine forasmuch altogether consonaunt agreable law god upon thys ground therfore doe deuyse theyr slaundreous querell agaynste hym thys autoritie bee teacher people taken vpon hym hymselfe oughte haue receiued handes wherein theyr drift none either take ouer vnto themselues glory whiche due vnto god elles thereupon frame surmuised querelle mouyng sedicion charge christe withall called people together kepte hym without publique autoritie prynces goe therfore altogether temple iesus saying thy bee also shoulde beleue thee tell v autorytie thou dooest thyssame thou dooeste thou doest baptisetell v autoritie dooest thou nges thou doest preache thou healest folkes sabboth dayes thou reacheste temple thou gatherest disciple thee thou calleste people theyr home businesse kepeste thee thou arte manne v vnknowen publique autoritie power haste thou none therefore hath geuen thee thys autoritie iesus veraye well perceyuyng thys questyon haue proceded wi ked thoughte wete purpose laye surmuised matier vnto hym learne went teache damped theyr malice question agayne bodye shoulde dryue one nayle bourde iohn baptiste veraye great estimacion come thicke vnto hym whan baptised sayde iohn also gathered disciple vnto hym also preached great multitude people soundrye place wildernessethe baptisme iohn fro heauen men ime iordane kingdom god approche boldly frankely declared damnable vice persones indifferently prouoked repentaunce yet iohn neyther anye autorytie geuen hym priestes phariseis chyefe men laytie come furth wildernesse manne newly come vp late enspired sente god accordyng prophecye esaie question headman beyng put foorth bayre take hym trippe ment none conclusyo ne purpose thys case christe aunswered thatsame autoritie bene geuen hym god would haue accused hym blasphemie beeyng manne tooke vpon hym familiare talke conuersacyon god bishoppes phariseis scribe suche autoritie geuen hym remayned conclusyon theyr argumente power whiche tooke vpon hym sediciouse comen instinete satan veraye stiffe thys poyn te power autoritie god due succession come vnto none others nothyng deuoutly godly executed whiche executed dooen autoritie yet beyng b ynded hatred remembraunce highly regarded iohn tofore thynges sembleable without autoritie men yea muche woulde anye wyse holde argumente iohn messyas sauing iohn wrought miracle yet thys behalfe working miracle ought much lesse haue iangled murmoured christe thys poynte neyther came theyr mynde god long continuaunce afore tymes hadde geuen thys kynde power whan spake hys prophetes autoritie prophetes receyued alowed thing foreshewed prophetes woulde receiue lorde therefore beeyng mynded defeacte malicious policie loutishe false packyng shaped aunswere thys mannyer make aunswere vnto demaunde partie also demaunde certayne questyon whiche ye hable quickly despetche woorde soone ye shall haue despetched make aunswere vnto question ye nowe demaunde tel thys baptysme iohn minystred vnto people whether heauen elles menne whose auctoritie dyd baptise whether receyuyng heauen power god el receyuyng handes peruerse conseyence iewes smelle felyng thys forked questyon whiche sophisters call horned question whether partyes bodye shall make direct aunswereif saye heaue c shall renne sharpe poyncte horne saye shall incurre inconuenyence bee taken hys aunswere mynded aunswere veraye trueth mattier woordes trueth playne ready tale bee spoken smelle themselues layed policie trayne wherewith layed bayte hym herupon goe wyly counsayll together emong themselues none busye piece woorke framyng countrefaycte matyer commonly one fraude halethan hys ayle one guyle draweth hym therefore laye theyr heades together thus conferryng emong themselues aunswere shall make thys doubtfull questyon shall say iohns autoritye came immediately heauen strayght way hitte v forehead saywhy beleue ye hym dyd ye geue credyte hym whan testyfyed playnely confessed hymselfe inferyour vnwoorthye beare shoe openly confessed hymselfe earthly manne speake earthelye thynges beeyng basse slender persone speake basse matiers beeyng issued heauen aboue creature howe doe ye receiue autoritie thyng procedyng god doe openly face worlde fynde slaundreous cauillacyons myne autoritie whiche gaue playne testimonie syde shall auouche iohn dyd nothyng autorytie godbut saie men c humayne spirite onely vnyuersall people vpon v stone thyng rooted heartes full whole iohn propheteand auswered c wroughte inspiracyon god whateuer wrought care aunswere trueth aunswere yt might best serue purpose doe false doctoures auswer thyng scripture teacheth takyng suche sence therout interpretacion maketh affeccions case shoulde haue aunswered trueth theyr autoritie emong people stode great hasard aunswered false feared theyr lyues stode great feare men wheras cast feare god wherupon aunswered could tel none hole thys alone left open escape oute atneither tel autoritie doe thinges whan gotten suche euasion doe vnder one se blably deliuer lorde aunswering question saied vnto ye fynde euasions sterting hole wil aunswer ye knowe well enoughe neyther tell autoritye doe thynges whiche ye see albeit ye ignoraunte thing neyther whiche ye nowe demaunde pthan began put foorthe people parable certain man planted vineyard let foorth husbandman went himselfe straunge countrey greate season whan tyme come sente seruaunte houseband men shoulde geue hym fruicte vineyard beate sent away emptie agane sent yet seruaunte beate entreacted shamfully sent away emptie gayne sent third also hym wounded caste hym sayed lorde vineyard shal dooe sende dere sonne peraduenture stande awe hym whan see hym whan housebandmen sawe thought within themselues saying heyre come leat v kill enheritaunce maye bee cast vineyarde killed shall lorde vineyard therefore doe vnto shall come destroye housebandemen shall leat vineyarde priestes phariseis scribe headman laitie beyng thus confuted lorde brought parable whiche might laye playnely theyr iyes theyr vncurable malice woorthie damnacio hauing bene many wayes prouoked god amendement tyll growen euermore wurse wurse rennyng contempte lawe striekyng prophetes puttyng deathe entendyng lesse afterwardes put deathe sonne god also beeyng extreme remedie al eiuilsmath xxi mathe ii certayne man planted vineyarde c yea put afterward agayne affliccio apostle martirs tenour paraple thys certayne man iesus planted vineyard singularly loue withall mighte possibly bee doen might length haue fruict hedged diligently rounde builded towre within watching kepyng dygged gutter receyue wyne pressed sette ferthermore wyne presse whan thus well furnished thynges apperteynyng putte foorthe handes housebandemen shoulde dooe requisite housebandry vnto gather fruicte therof tyme conueniente thys doen taketh voyage ferre countrey continued greate long season absent home verayly vineyarde lorde sabaoth whiche lorde transposed remoued egipt set lande beheaste hedged aboute precincte lawe protected watching keping owne selfe proper persone beautified goodly temple added moreouer priestes iudges capitaynes teacher omitted nothing ordreing dressing therof might appertayne thys vineyarde beeyng thus furnyshed poynte deuyse wha bene long season loked yt bring furth good grape yet neuerthelesse defaulte housebandemen bryng furth wylde grape lorde dede present yet semed vnto bee absente ferre hys conuersacyon heauen therfore whan time due seasonable people israel last bring furth fruicte according bountiful goodnesse god towardes maister vineyarde sent seruaunt hys say one prophet vnto housebandmen prince priestes scribe wer bearer swaigh stroke shoulde rendre yelde vnto hym parte suche fruicte growen vp vineyardeand beat sent away empti housebandemenne tilled vsed vineyard behoufe themselfes lord firste pumbled seruaunte aboute eares beate thrust shoulder sent home agayne emptie whome prophetes hath crueltie bene shewed great lordes ientlenesse pacience although acte greate despy e prouoked indignacyon yet shewe none extremitie ne rigour towardes housebandmenne sente seruaunte assaye whether coulde call home agayne dooe theyr duetie beecomed handled secounde messagyer ientlenesse ne fauoure hadde vsed afore whan hadde sore coyled hym reuyled hym muche despyteous language sent hym also emptie home hys lorde emptie say fruicte whiche looked loden backe burden wrong ill handleing whither shoulde goe lorde sayed redresse left shall acquite pacience lorde though thys extreme sorte eftsones encensed wrath yet thys steppe furthe doe vengeaunce neither sent yet thyrde seruaunte housebandemen sore wounde send home againe hys maister emptie goodnesse lorde prouoked repentaunce encece theyr malice yea wurse afore though al ye despite wherwith grieuously handled seruauntes sente good cause touche maister sente thoughe oughte nowe good right haue bene punished often occasioned goodnesse euermore growe forward haynous dedes mischiefe euery one act wurse yet lorde exceding great mercifulnes make yet ferther delay stroke vengeaunce therfore one desyrous trye vttermoste remedie possible shewe execute rigour vpon housbandmen thus caste hymselfe hys mynde may dooe bryng wieked housbandemen myne better minde agayne whose defaute fruicte vineyarde doeth long continuaunce perishe vnto haue sent many seruauntes one whit better emended thing whiche onely yet behynde dooei send dere sonne c sende onely sonne whome loue tendrely whiche sette seruauntes naughte yet peraduenture whan shall see sonne though loue yet certes beare reuerence vnto wurshippe selfe hym naughtie persones woonte leastwise shame brydled dede mischiefe whiche woulde el doe deuise therfore hasarding owne sonne seke sauing recouery housbandemen lyked moste mercifull lorde lorde righte desyrous saue men slowe striekethis heyre come leat v kil hym sonne obedient hys father wente housbandmen whan sawe sonne onely reuerence hym also wieked stomakes turned themselues full whole deuises purpose moste extreme madnesse saying emong themselues hitherto haue shaken seruauntes haue come v thissame sonne heyre entendeth one daye auenge despyte dooen v vnto hys father leatte v kylle hym shall recouer enheritaunce vineyarde owne behoufes stoutelye settyng lorde naughte thys deiuelyshe deuyse well lyked emonge confederate altogether cast sonne vineyarde slewe hym whan lorde iesus thys processe playnely shewed pryestes scribe chiefe rewlers theyr veray owne conscience euen presente houre theyr endeuour tempted thesame withyn lytle whyle afterwarde commytted facte dede leadyng iesus foorthe crucifying hym withoute citie turnyng hymselfe vnto asked thys questyon matier goyng thus shall lorde vineyarde dooe vnto suche housebandemenne whan eftesones vse theyr euasions auoyde makyng aunswere lorde sayed moreouer lorde hymselfe come sende shamefull ende housebandemenne coulde bee woonne ientle fauour persones vtterly destruied death sette foorth vineyarde housebandemen saying dyd lord sygnyfie religion iewes euen roote bee abolished fruicte ghospell bee transposed remoued vnto gentile ministery apostle whan heard saied god forbidde beheld said writte stone builder refused become head corner whosoeuer dooeth stumble vpon stone shalbe broken whomesoeuer falleth grinde poudre hygh priestes scribe houre went lay handes feared people perceiued spoken similitude phariseis men coulde wyse away hearing aunswered god forbydde shall bee well perceyued thys parable bene tolde agaynste coulde veray well away deiulishe purpose deuyse kyll iesus yet doe vtterlye deteste abhorre iuste vengeaunce god due suche wyeked purpose iesus purposelye shewe veraye thyng denyed bene foresayed prophetes would fortune cast earnest iye vpon ye woulde say speaking vnto consciencethe stone builder refused c sayed ye geue credite parable ye reade psalmes stone whiche builder cast aside woulde none become head stone corner whosoeuer shall light stone stumble shall crushed agayn whome stone shall fall hym shall grynde poudre christe sygnifyethe hymselfe celestiall stone sent god whome iewes refused building vp theyr synagogue without christe god made hym corner stone whiche knitteth together closethe vp bothe walles one coupleth twoo soondrye people one churche congregacion throughe euangelicall fayth without ceremony lawe thys stone moste sure buckeler defence agaynste assaultes worlde satan vnto suche beleuyng hym doe cleue fast vnto hym dooe rest staygh hym sounde vnresistable vnto suche rebell agaynste hym none great power thys worlde al crusshed stumble thys stone certes stumble dooeth hym whosoeuer resisteth hym casteth hym nowe syde drieuen ponder shall persone bee whome stone shall lyghte hys fallyng certes suche doeth lyghte whome haue bene great long time suffred stroke god laste falleth sodaynlye vpon ere bee aware thinke one stone lyfe reste thereon damnacion suche enemyes vnto parable lordes declaring sette heartes headman priestes scribe suche eagre rage mynded euen presentelye haue layed handes hym drede people dyd tyme streygne wieked vilannie emong whome sawe iesus veray great pryce knowing themselues naughte theyr owne conscience smelled parable whiche tolde touche hitte righte anye thyng yet parable bene tolde suche intente might vnderstanding therof called backe agayne theyr moste deiulishe purpose whiche entended nowe made crabbed fierce vnto dooing mischiefe selfesame thyng ought haue bene clene discouraged drieuen theyr malice pand watched sent furth spyes fayne themselues righteous men take hys woordes delyuer hym vnto power autoritie deputie asked saying maister knowe thou sayest teachest right neither considerest thou outward apperaunce man teachest way god truely lawful v geue tribute vnto ceasar perceiued craftinesse sayde vnto tempte ye shewe penye whose image superscripcion hath aunswered saide ceasars sayde vnto geue vnto ceasar thynges whiche belong vnto ceasar god thynges perteine vnto god coulde reproue saying beefore people meruayled aunswere helde theyr peace therfore beeing nowe departed reason standing dreade people dooing hainous acte open face worlde whiche eiuill heartes already dooen determined goe bringing effect priuie traines vndermyning beyng euen somuche vngracious ioyne fraude vnto malice lyke mischieuous creature sleagheth prieuely poyson one killeth sweorde heare thou theophilus wile traynes wicked priestes whose desire thys cause haue iesus euer destruied saye haue trueth euangelicall vtterly oppressed veritie gospell taken awaye theim farming vineyarde propre owning possession wherof promised vnto themselues bothe perpetual foreuer also come title succession enheritaunce hide angre shewing manier countenaunce therofthey sent foorth spy whiche shoulde feigne selues righteous men c watche occasion possible put deathe colourably sende forth certain counterfeict person shoulde feigne theimselfes iust righteous afore god nothing worlde pestilent deadly counterfeict righteousnesse ende shoulde hys woordes hunt one poinct wherof might detected emperour rome deputy lieutenaunt pilate present season hygh rewier iewry ceasars behalfe thys dyd thentent purpose grutche querele thys facte myghte bee layed ouer themselues others though beene putte death sentence iudgemente ceasars officer theyr party men vnculpable mighte appere haue kept theyr handes effusion bloude goe worldelye subtiltie hyde muche doe notoriously bewray theyr incomparable malice sayde disguisyng maskyng esquiers therefore bysshops dooe set vpon iesus assayle hym suche kinde wordes ensuemaister knowe thou sayest teacheste right c maister haue throughlye seene thy perfecte vpryghtenesse thou tellest thy mynde playnely without feare dissimulacyon teachest euery thyng righte sorte neyther thee suche respecte accepcion persones thou wilte tell lye fauoure man bee neuer muche power autoritie thou hast euermore onelye god none elles beefore thyne iyes acceptable hym standing hys pleasure dooest thou playnely without feare teache teil thou vnto v therefore thy veray opinyon mynde mattier whiche muche controuersie variaunce emong smalle noumber v whether thyng standyng goddes pleasure contentacionis lawefull v geue tribute vnto ceasar geue tribute vnto ceasar iesus perfeict vnderstanding smoothe swete hony woordes mening fraude deceipte towardes hym knowyng veraye well ende thys snareful bayted question ment whiche case aunswered according theyr veray hope woulde standing goddes contentacyon people beeyng consecrated vnto god shoulde bee subieccyon shoulde paye tribute vngodlye prynce ydolatre whiche opinyon pharises allowed though durste openlye speake woulde eftesones haue procured addressed counterfeicte persones whiche shoulde haue detected highe treason beefore pilate beeyng emperours lieutenaunte dyd euangelycall policye suche wyse defeate theyr maliciouse deceiptefulnesse dyd bothe take awaye occasyon whiche soughte doe harme also put remembraunce duetie doe whiche thyng vndoubtedly man shoulde leaue vndoen without assured peril ieopardye life christ come purpose teache howe much payed vnto emperoures emperoures deputy due spirituall substaunce bee payed vnto god lorde thynges come ye tempt sayeth shewe piece syluer coyne knoweth image ceasar forasmuche nothyng earthe whan piece coyne shewed hym hys hande demaunded whose phisyonomye wasgeue vnto ceasar thinges whiche belong vnto ceasar whose tytle poysee written thys thing true christian dooeth knowe knewe men wedded worlde sayed ceasars phisionomye pryente iesus byanby render paye ye vnto ceasar yf anye thyng belongeth righte force nothyng prynces thys worlde dooe require theyr exaccions thys yet greater poyncte charge requisite purpose ye tendre vnto god ye oughe vnto hym know ye therfore image hym stricken coined youre hertes acknowelage ye title poisee soule due hym euery whit oughte bee bondage persone hym created bothe bodye ye soule bearing doeth image god wherefore paied tribute deiuill subtyll awaiters haue taken trippe meruayle warie circumspect answer euangelical simplicitie hath politique cast yet notwithstandyng woulde acknowelage heauenlye wysedome god sorowed nothing could reproue talke pthen came certaine sadducee deny resurreccion asked saiyng maister moses wrote vnto u mannes brother dye hauing wife dye without child brother take wyfe reise vp sede vnto brother therfore seuen brother first toke wife dyed without child seconde tooke died childelesse thirde tooke likewise residue seuen leaft child behind died last woman died also nowe resurreccion whose wife theim shall seuen wife iesus aunswered saied vnto childre worlde marye wiues maried whiche shalbe coumpted worthye world resurreccion dead doe marie wiues neither maried yet cannot dye anye eguall vnto aungels sonnes god somuch thei child resurreccion dead shal rise moses also shewed besides bushe whan calleth lorde god abraham god isaac god iacob god dead liuing al liue vnto certain phariseis aunswered saied maister thou haste well saied durste aske question whan saied party departed hym came vnto secte sadducee vnder false title righteousnesse made much high solemnitie theimselfes like manier phariseis name excellencie outward apparence sighte menne wherein thought theimselfes ferre surmounte passe sectes secte sadducee hathe one propre ie theimselfesthe sadducee denye yt resurreccion dooe beleue arisyng bodyes bee lyfe neither parte man remayne death ne anye aungels sadducee propoune lorde suche question foloweth maister manier law hath geue v moses case anye man hath maried wyfe shalbee deceassed without chyldren brother partye deceassed shall marye wedowe leaft hym succedyng place brother shal reise succession issue vnto brother thesame woman bodye fortuned seuen brethre whome fyrst maried wife died without issue nexte eldest brother tooke leaft wyfe dyed hymselfe lykewyse hauing chyldren nexte hym succeded thirde brother wedlocke accordyng course age partie also dyed withoute chyldren short tale make semblable manier woma maried vnto euerye one vntill seuenth al yet made neuer one theim father ne brought hym forth chyld processe tyme dyed woman general resurreccion seuen brother shall recouer possession woman wyfe ons maryed euerye one theim bee common theym al ne mo housebandes one toye hauing neither time reason sadducee supposed opinion phariseis myght bee wyped clene awaye whiche phariseis dyd stiefflye holde argumente soules doe remayne bodyes dead yea ferthermore bodyes dead shall one daye returne lyfe againe mennes apposyng hym conteined foolishenesse malice iesus vouchesalued enstructe saiyng ye wrog opinion ye imagyne like state thynges bee lyfe come ye see presente world child world worlde neuer without successiue alteracion diyng euery day othersome daily cummyng worlde dooe remedilesse seke procure wiues sonnes doe sette theyr daughter mariage housebades mankynde cannot possible meanes bee continued progeneracion issue therefore matrimonie emong thyng blissefulnesse necessitie persones whose lotte suche blisse shall falle maye reputed woorthie resurreccion iust worthye thatsame worlde whiche knoweth mortalitie suche neyther shall procure wyues theyr soonnes shall geue theyr daughter housebandes mariage nede shall bee mariage carnall copulacion whan bodye shall nowe dye haue nowe alreadye succeassed longer bee carnall bee subiecte incommodityes worlde haue nowe receiued bodye shall neuer dye shall nowe hencefoorth none otherwyse liue aungels dooe liue emong whome mariage ne vse wedlocke necessitie dying worlde mortall parentes borne mortall dooe vse matrimonye make prouision meanes continuing succession mankynde others beeyng nowe vertue spyrite newe borne againe made sonnes god liuyng euer withoute ende shall fele misse matrimonie shall knowe death beeyng nowe resurreccion restored vnto lyfe immortall thissame doubtefull question hadde bene propouned sadducee purposely mocke arisyng deade beleued soules dooe remayne aliue death bodye iesus vouchesalued enstructe ignoraunt hertes concernyng case autoritye holy scripture whiche holy scripture dede dyd disalowe yet dydde reade thesame hauyng theyr myndes marke doe ueraily saieth thyng possible enough ye dead may arise agayn soules dooe dye together bodyes euen moses hymselfe dooeth teache bee true whose autoritie forasmuche ye dooe matter acknowlage ye ought case reiecte moses hath written god spake vnto hym manier oute bushe whiche seen redde flamyng fyer burne without anye consumyng wastyng god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob c abraham isaac iacob tyme alreadye buiried graue according opinion euery one dyeth dyeth altogether dyeth neuer recouered agayn doeth god call hymselfe god theim none suche seing god ye veray true liuing god rather truely speake veray lyfe selfe thyng vnconueniente call hym self god suche meane deathe vtterly perished gonne euer gonfor god dead liuing forasmuch chieffer parte theim remaineth aliue soule beeing parte whereby life v liuyng creature besydes man death vttre perishing euer theim aswell bodye falleth altogether downe soone destitute lyfe also soule theim naught el certayne harmonye proporcionate agreyng together qualites humour bodye whiche soone thatsame temperature dissolued vanisheth awaye immediately thyng nothyng man deathe nothyng el pluckyng soule soondre bodye better parte twoo v remayneth styll vncorrupted bodye season vttrely perished neyther ye woulde say putrified thesame body restored agayn power god resurreccion ought seme meruaill vnto forasmuche ye daily see dry graine sede caste awaye earth putrified newe liue tree spryng vp whiche laie hydden litle smale deade sel e grayne buiried grounde therefore dead ward dead dede forasmuche ye hable reuiue agayne euerie one yea euen deade also dooe lyue godwarde whose hande whansoeuer wyll
