shall bee restore soules haue beene plucked awaye euerie one theyr owne body agayn whan sadducee saiynges helde theyr peace hauyng worde speake certayne scrybes allowed talke iesus concernyng case pharyseis scribe consente opinion agaynste secte sadducee notwithstandyng lyke opinion phariseis scrybes behalfe righter opinion sadducee hertes replete mischiefe vngraciousnesse suche place dooeth lesse parte malice remayn resteth grosse ignorauce defaulte learnyngand ye durste aske hi questio thus iesus vayne beene tempted proued soondrye sectes iewes afore tyme aunswered phariseis question concerning greateste precepte law one al suche spede woulde attempted man durst auenture buisie beginne demaundyng question pand saied vnto theim howe saie christe dauids soonne dauyd himselfe saieth booke psalmes lorde saied vnto lord sitte thou right hande till make thine enemy thy foote stoole dauid therefore calleth hym lorde howe sonne iesus therefore mocion whan thei wer gathered together p upe bid theim aunswere would question would demaunde beeyng question full baites take theim trippes questio concerned soule health demauded whose sonne scripture dyd pronounce messias beyng ignoraunt prophecie bene foresaied messias tyme cummyng bee borne linage dauid made answere without stoppes staighes dauids sonne iesus said dauid enspired holy ghostepsal cx speaketh messias manier psalmes lord said vnto lord sitte thou righte hande vntil make thyne enemy thy foote stoole howe agreeth dauid shoulde calle lorde whome acknowelageth taketh sonne sonne inferiour father reason wer soonne waye honour reuerence call father lorde contrarie wise question coulde one theim soile presente iesus thoughte sufficiente ye would saye misticall iedell haue geuen theim litle intimacion inclyng nature godhed whiche nature godhed superiour vnto patria kes forasmuch egual vnto god father albeit euen humain nature also excelled creature reputed memorie dauid bee holy precious hym whome dauid acknowelaged bothe soonne also lorde hym caste ignoraunce lawe iudgemente beyng blinded peruerse corrupte affeccions audience al people saied vnto disciple beware scribe whiche wil goe long clothing loue gretinges markettes highest seates sinagogues chiefe roumes feastes whiche deuoure wedowes house feigning l ng praiers thesame shall receiue great damnacion forasmuche therfore malice generacion past al hope grace curable salues could remained simple vnlettred multitude people haue good warning geuen might bee trained deceiued coulouring crafty conueighaunce others whereas voyde al religion true deuocion yet dyd countrefeicte highest godlinesse possible hauyng iye none marke theyr glory lucre onely cause murmouryng pratyng manier wayes possible agaynst glory god agaynst health neighboures none deadlye enemy true godlinessehe said vnto disciple suche countrefaictyng holy conuersacio purchase vnto theimselfes autoritie bearing theimselfes bolde thesame withdrawe simple people true godlinesse kynde masker fore taken twoo disease especiall ambicion altogether enclineth tyranny couetise insaciable suche men dyd iesus plainly peince vnto disciple people beyng within audiece ende said phariseis scribe myght bee shunned forasmuche would refourmed myght haue longer tyme deceiue seyng would wyse emend suche poyn backebite take awaie mennes good name fame make good sure waie safegarde preseruyng simple innocet people listen thou swete theophilus wt coulours lorde pe neteth theim yt thou mayeste eschewe theim whan bee knowen vnto thee beware ye scribe saith suche ye dooe nowe often tymes see assayle guyle subtiltie professe perfeict knowlage lawe dooe obstinatelye resiste mynde law haue god theyr mouth thei open aduersaries glorie god proteste woordes earneste trauaillers people behoufe profite whereas coutrefaict al thinges euer doe respecte theyr owne comodities th make great fleeyng outwardly coumpaignie sinner yea case thei light coumpaignie suche anye casuall chaunce purge theimselfes much washynges theimselfes owne party dooe withinfoorth altogether swymme vyces much detestable e desire vainglory high solemnitie looke countenaunce enuy moste specially auirice whiche doe lesse plain wurshyppyng idolles vnderstad perceiue people must chiefly moued suche thinges maye bee seen bodily iyes doe suche kyndes iugleyngesand loue gretinges marketies hunt seke geat autoritie emong simple soules doe ye would saye sette themselfes sale newefound disguised vesture hauyng great pride felicitie ie tyng vp downe thei maye seen autentical robe auncyentenesse reachyng hard grounde countenaunces framed grauitie often much present ye high stretes place great resorte people entent maie haue much crouchyng doukyng made vnto theym maye bee hailled greted name wurshypfull maysters sinagoges also place much coumpaignie sitting together thei looke seke haue highest seates feastes whan shall sitte downe meate haue great appetite beginne table woulde seme great iolye felowes eye men whereas face god accursed detestable yet might seme bee nomore vainglorious foolyshewhiche deuour wedowes house feining long praiers made ferther sekyng suyng swifte blastes bruit fame ye people vanishing smoke haillinges gretynges nay nothyng full catchyng pollyng thei thei occupie trade vsurye lending money encresse gaines thei collectours ne receiuers tribute wherby polle piele comon people haue caste sleightes vngracious craftye trade suche simpler sorte people whiche maye easily beguyled doe hunt take praie seke catche wedowes suche welthye ryche destitute aide housebandes might defend sexe womankynde apte deceyued fraude godly acte apparence bee helper suche destitute suche simple wedowes therfore doe easily flocke lou e countrefaictyng holines ueraye muche grauitie doe pretende countenaunce bee honoured euerye bodye theyr veray habyte dooeth euerye syde crie bee men holy conuersacion thei vse besydes bee long whyle together prayer yea shall bee doen open stretes euerye bodye maye beare recorde thesame thing dooen iohn also olde auncient prophetes dooen secrete none might behold god felowes dooe praye hunte meruayl tha selie wedowes bee deceiued manye way coulourable delyng whan haue ons crepte geate theyr heades within saied wedowes doores deuoure house piele polle sely weomen partes defende saue ought haue g ue almes behouf poore doe wholly conuerte owne lucre manier men scribe day phariseis without ende bothe woord dede made resistece agaynste ghospell albeit bee euen present daie euer wyl scribe whyle sette al mynde studie vpon owne profites dooe onely bothe speake woorke agaynst commodity people also resiste glorie iesus dooe vnder false pretence religion theyr wedes title long prayer huntyng geat opinion holinesse syght common people whiche common people dooeth yet well vnderstande thynges true religion dooeth consiste nowe shall disciple christe dooe agaynst suche scribe phariseis forasmuche ye true disciple christ manier skyl harmyng bodie indewed simplenesse veray doues forsooth shall case vse also subtiltie serpent beeyng duely tolde ill doinges emend coumpaignie muste shunned seeyng vncurable simple bee warned beware secte liyng awaite theim saide scribe phariseis theyr due punishemente abideth theym whan shall come seate iudgemente thatsame iudge iudgeth suche thynges seen iyes bodye priuye affeccions hertes houre shal suche adiudged grieuous tormentesthe shal receiue greater damnacion whiche ye open sight worlde vnfeignedly full hainous enormity beyng persones much lesse culpable shewe disease openlye hide xxi chapter behelde sawe riche menne caste offreinges treasourie sawe also certain poore wedowe whiche cast thither twoo mytes saied trueth saie vnto poore wedowe hath putte thei al thei haue surperfluitie added vnto offreinges god penurie hath cast substaunce entente lord iesus would diepelye enpriente foresaied matter hertes people whiche men estemed ye sight god thynges visible sinceritie ye herte also mighte checke couetise scribe ye phariseis preestes broughte people earneste beliefe especial selie fond weomen wedowes welthie riche el higheste poynete holinesse coulde dyd contribute verai great porcion best substaunce corbone churche treasurie iewels offreynges pouertie meane whyle ouerpassed yea many tymes child parentes sitting emple cast vp iyes vnto thatsame place whiche called eazophilacium say iewelhouse extrye treasourie whiche iewels temple kepte priestes would wise haue moneye reputed holye lawe specially commaunded parentes honoured theyr doctryne father ought rather bee least vnholpen ye corbon bee encreased wheras money yet neuerthelesse default abusion priestes alreadye great parte turned mainteinaunce sensuall excessiue liuyng thesame priestes onely whan manie ryche welthie persones cast many thynges treasourie muche countenaunce sygnes allowing casting suche money made vnto theim priestes phariseishe sawe al certain poore wedow caste thither twoo mite goddes creature dooyng came thither certain selie poore wedowe cast twoo mytes littell brasse pen money muche came ferthyng yearthly creature would make signe commendyng gaue littel yet iesus pleasure godly deuocion woman bee knowen people saied wedowe semeth iudgemente men haue putte veraye smal porcio treasourie thesame woman ye iudgemente god hath cast riche persones whiche haue veraye largelye dooenthis poore wedowe hath put liberall superfluitie whiche haue home poore wedowe vpon earneste zele deuocion dooyng duetye vnto god hath geuen penurie whereas full great nede haue kepte still substaunce whiche home hath nowe cast treasourie sighte god therefore hathe iye quantitie thing herte geuer gaue bouteous offreyng others whiche gaue greate dele quantitie thus iesus euerye occasion withdrewe disciple puttyng affiaunce truste thynges maie bee seene wherunto iewes dyd attribute ouer muche vnto ye earnest exercise euangelicall deuocion godlinesse consisteth syncere affeccion herte pand vnto spake temple garnished goodly stone iewels saied day come whiche thinges ye se shal leaft one stone vpon shal throwen downe asked saiyng maister whan shal thinges signe wil whan thinges come passe saied take ede ye ee deceyued manye shall come name saie christe tyme draweth nere folowe ye therfore whan ye heare warres sedicions afraied thinges must first come passe ende foloweth byandby saied vnto nacion shall arise nacion kingdome kingdome great yearth quake shalbe al place hungre pestilece feareful thinges great signes shall bee heauen iewes especiall glorie temple hierusalem whiche excedyng curiously builded also enriched many high precious iewels visited great religion onely al iewes also alien men straunge nacios nowe tyme come religion thesame materiall temple sacrifice oblacions thesame belongyng ceasse temple mannes herte beeyng consecrated holy ghost prepared god acceptable sacrifice daily offred vnto hym bruite beastes godly praiers thakes geuyng pure herte yea euen euery poore body portelye gorgeous temple god saied sumpteous teple ierusalem whiche many yeres edifiyng chastitie humilitie charitye per c e loue towardes al men ornamentes great dele precious ye syght god marble pillours garnishing yuerye tymbrewoorke cedret e golde siluer precious stone whereof priestes phariseis made muche greate pryde shewe whan certaine persones made poynctyng shewyng iesus towardes woondrefull buildyng temple whiche edified moste pure stone coulde bee thesame stone bothe poolished keruen greate woorkmanship masonrie ferther many iewels gaie richely beseen aunswered prepaire ye vnto god ghostlye temple whyche neither oldnesse maie eate vp wt rottyng neither tepeste maie ouerthrowe fier maie burne vpthere shall leaft one stone vpo ne power man maie destru e caste downe time shall shortely come whan thynges whiche ye dooe make muche meruailyng gazyng thynges woorthie mete god shal bee throwen downe euen foundacion yea much shal muche one stone left standyng vpon shall bee destruied disciple hearyng coiecturyng euen veray wordes kyngdome heauen ferre whiche kingdoe supposed imagined come greate chaunge turning vpsyde world beeyng gredye men knowe tyme whan thinges come dooe saie vnto lorde maister al thissame thou speakest castyng downe temple vttre destruyng cytye hierusalem daie whan shall cumme passe signe maie bee hable knowe saied tyme alreadye come iesus whose wyll haue disciple euermore readinesse assaultes eiuyll mysauentures dyd doubtfull entrieked communicacion sette theyr myndes suspence perplexitie makyng medley many soondrye matter together concernyng affliccions afterwarde abide preachyng ghospel concernyng beatyng miserable plague citie hierusalem concernyng ende worlde houre tyme whereof pleasure haue vnknowen creature entent continually euermore readinesse disciple mindes ranne altogether vpon kyngdome lorde willyng haue theim knowe thyng nerelye touche knowe matter veray speakyng mencionyng whereof hertes vttrely abhorred thei wer yet weake fraill menne better fansie heare woordes pleasaunt eare worldelye coumforte solace heare thynges concernyng coumforte soule health foresaied blessed reigne one daye surely come due tyme wil come care charge thereof moste expediente put handes god leat hym alone withall partes meane tyme behaue selues maye seme vnworthye kyngdome cummyng glorye thesame reigne meane soondrye affliccionsse ye deceiued affliccions behoueth hertes well armed iesus therefore saied oute doubtes come displeigh maiestie reigne euangelicall see ye ye bee seduced enbracing christe stede prefixed tyme whiche wyll comefor many shall come name saie yt christe come many whiche wyll vsurpe name vnto boldely auouche themselfes saie christ tyme hande ye thyng moued wordes case shall call whether goe ye theim ueraily ye shall heare al worlde garboile sedicios warres manye persones shall plaie prophetes shall allege ende world approche ye thyng feared suche rumour though last daie euen byanby hande dede suche thynges shal fortune ende worlde cometh euen streight waie necke thereof shall bee nothyng el certain preaubles said extreme distresse shall bee eiuil sorte vttre castyng awaie good shalbee examinacion triall purif yng whan bodye towardes poyncte diyng signes token therof strog disease hauing come vp growen thesame bodyes vnnaturall disteperature humour shall terrible comocios hurleyburley foreshew ye end ye world hurleyburley man self doeth procure vnto hymselfe reason infected wt inordinate lustes affeccions man peruersenes shal ye veray nature thynges shaken al due ordre course detestyng wer malice man strongly ensourgeyng redresse auegemente vngra usnessenacion shal arise agaist nacion kingdom kingdome greate vproares garboile shal bee arisinges nacion nacion royalme royalme whereas nothyng distresseful warre yet doeth man purchace wilfully procure pernicious confusion vnto hymselfe abicion folye couetise hatred throughe lyke corrupt affeccions yea verai nature selfe shal ouer besides ye premiss cause many sore yearthquakes many soondrye place sorte though ye world tooke high skorne disdeigne wer forced beare men beeing suche vngodly wicked creature shal morouer cum great pestileces infeccion shal waste awaie cosume mightie great noubre people sort though aire armed weaponed doe vengeaunce vpo ciuil sort whereas purpose first ordeined sette mane vse holsome breath bothe geue nourish life vnto al creature ferthermore throughe penurie fruites ye yearth shall come famine case yf yearth say would geue foode vnto child wicked agaysnt godand greate signes shall fro heauen eue dumme elementes also doe bounden seruice duetie sea also shalbee throughly moued strauge vnwont rage tumbleyng tossing wheras thesame aforetymes accustomed serue vse man yea besides ye premiss veray skye heauen shal shewe woondreful signes testifiyng wrathe god sunne shalbee turned derkenesse moone blasyng sterres shal straunge likenesse shewe theimselfes vnnaturall woonders shall appere beeyng vncouth worthie bee meruayled lyke mannes bodye doeth streight waie passe world wha strieken wt extreme great sickenesses yet neuertheles thesame lyke disease euer cummyng vnto taking agayn declare tyme death ferre right whan world wt manier eiuils aforesaied ratleed shaken together yesame euils shal geue great significacion tokening world drouping apa towardes last date faste growyng towardes decaye ruine al thinges shall laie handes persecute deliueryng vp sinagogues priesos shall bring vnto kinges rewlers name sake shal chaunce testimoniall bee sute poyncte therefore hertes studie ye shal answer wil geue mouth wisedome al aduersaries shal hable speake resiste ere thissame woefull distresse shall thus cease vpon world shal excedyng great peruersenesse men come afore shal prouoke goodnesse god wrathe whan ye shall preache name throughe whiche maye saued shal laie handes vpon shal persecute al kynde dooyng yll mischiefe vnto shal hale pul vnto counsaile house assemblie though ye wer culpable malefactours thei shal ferthermore cast prieson thei shal taine condemne bench kinges rewlers anye youre transgression great high well dooyng wete professing name whiche name myne shal laboure meanes way abolishe myghte thesame freely atteigne euerlastyng saluacion shal chaunce vnto conscience maie approued also malice maie well perceiued bee iustly condemnedfor testimoniall boldly trustyng sure defence innocencie cause ye shoulde feare iudgemente seates ne yet ye carefully deuise recorde wt selfes ye beeyng ye men knowlage shall pleade cause ye consistorie court estate prince neither cause bryng anye rhetorycian patron man lawe bee attourney myne owne selfe inuincible patrone aduocate stande spirite shal ministre vnto bothe toungue wisedome suche aduersaries shal power resiste ne gaynsaye neuer cruell eloquent well spoken worldely wisedome moreouer ye shalbe betraied father mother brother kinsfolke frendes shall thei put death hated shal ye men name ake shal one hea e head perishe possesse soules thissame shal ye suffre handes men vnknowen straungers also handes theim whiche knitte ioyned vnto nerenesse bloude streight bandes frendeshippe father shal persecute sonne brother shall wrappe brother affliccion cousyn shall appeache accuse cousyn one frende shal bring lawe yea shall bee whome shall hatred pursue vnto death shal slea eagre greuous hatred shall whole world conceiue agaynst profession name therfore whatsoeuer thyng shal entreprise doe agaynst thesame take dooen despite wherefore nothing thynke deuise auengeyng wronges shall haue displeasure dooen shal slaine shalbee dede bothe prouide wel enough also take vengeaunce theyr malice thoughe stormes persecucion handes men shall neuer somuche fede satisfie cruelnesse cause feare case standyng youre protectour defendourand shal one heare heade perishe dooe one heare heade shall perishe much lesse leue brier destitute succoure neyther haue ye iye worldelye assuraunce defence armyes weapon engiens onely sufferaunce shall ye defende liues myscarrye slayn profession name ye shall peryshe daye geue vnto violence men much wyl yea suche one shal veraye true dede haue saued soule whoso shal constauntely take deathe cause whan ye see ierusalem besieged hoste ye sure desolacion thesame nigh leat iewrie fligh mountaines leat whiche middes departe leat countreies entre therin day vengeaunce thinges whiche writen maie bee fulfilled riche welthye citie whiche iewes thys present take high pride whiche thynke theymselfes bee kynges felowes shall bee euen foundacion destruied gentile therfore whan ye shal see hierusalem bee round besette siege vnderstande ye playne destruccion thereof bee hande doen euerye bodye saue theymselues spedie fleyng awa e euerie bodye moste comonly vseth warres flatre himselfe hope victorie beware ye hope beguyle none whoso shall tyme bee march iewrye leate hym priuely steale awaye conueigh hym self mountaines desert place waie ne path lyeth suche folkes shall bee enhabited veray herte iewrye leate theim remoue dwellyng place whomesoeuer theim extreme distresse shall soodaynlye take anye forein countreyes regyons leate suche recule iewrye leate esteme thynges clene forsaken doe euerye man saue owne life thynges shall come passe casual commocions mortal menfor day vengeauce vengeaunce god hauing long time prouoked obstinate malice man shal instrumente forein nacions scourge plague nacion many long day continual rebeller agaynste god shall come passe prophetes haue manye hundred yeres sen prophecied especiallye danielldaui xix auoyded chosen bee muste come passe whatsoeuer thyng ye scripture hath foreshewed shal fortune scripture neuer failleth beeyng thing wrytten enstincte spirite god yet shall woefull extremitie therefore chaunce prophetes haue prophecied shall bee hath therefore beene prophecied god foresawe obstinate wickednesse man whiche would afterwarde prouoke vengeaunce god light vpon surely shal bee lesse huge storme euils long obstinate iousnesse nacion hath gon afore whiche nacion hauyng many way prouoked emendemente hath neuerthelesse continuallye proceded forewarde wurse wurse pbut woe vnto bee child geue suche day shalbe great trouble lande wrathe ouer al people thei shal fall edge sweorde shalbe led awaie captiue al nacions ierusalem shalbe troden downe gentile vntill time gentile bee fulfilled nowe tempeste shall enwrap al sortes people together aswel offendours innocentes somewhat lesse vnhappie shall bee whome said storme mysauentures groweth faste vpon worlde shall fynde prest readye appoyncted flee woe vnto woman chylde geuers sucke thesame beeyng charged burde neither good willes would though thei would shalbee hable lay downe shall lyght enough renne awaye neyther shall hope escapyng harmelesse sauyng onely fleeyngfor shalbe great trouble ye lande shall bee affliccion plague common rate sharpe vengeaunce god shall sodaynly take region people beeyng space many hundred yeres continually rebellious city shall bee turned vpsyde theimselfes shall bee either slain orels taken captiue disperpled scatered abrode course thynges turned contrarie waie shalbee bonde seruauntes slaues vnto ye nacions gentile hitherto people abhominacion haue detestedand hierusalem shall bee troden gentile shall bee bounde oughe thankes thesame gentyles thissame veraye poyncte remaynes leafte vnslaine wieked nacion said iewes yea citie hierusasalem also beeyng aswell welthinesse richesse also opinion true perfeict religion gaily beseen together temple sure building wherof flattre theimselfes promyse shall perpetually endure vnto neuer decaye shall bee troden vnder fete gentile vntil tymes shalbee completed duryng whiche god suffre nacion iewes bee oppressed afflicted gentile beeyng vncircumciseduntill time getiles fulfilled vntill said iewes beeyng chastised long aduersyties mai last emende ioyne together gentile felowshippe brotherhood professyng ghospell thesame thyng shall come passe laste daie worlde shall come pand shalbe signes sunne moone e re earth people shalbe wittes ende despaire sea water shal roare mennes hertes shall faile theim feare looking thinges whiche shall come earth power heauen shall moue shall see sonne man come cloude power great glorie whan thinges beginne come passe looke vp lift vp heades redemcion draweth high approchyng thesame laste daye manye signes shall wondrefully declare come drefull daie shal said daie especially suche persones despise tyme beyng quiete benefites prouokyng theim myne owne offre better mynde therefore shall veraye elementes worlde ye would say tremble quake agaynst comyng ye sayed daye thatsame bright shynyng sunne beyng fountaine lyght hauyng accustomed make thynges looke wt merie countenaunce shall sodayne derkenesse couer face moone neither shal haue entrechaungeable course geuing light vnto slertes beeyng ridde bloude shall descende skye vpon earth also sore perplexitie myndes earnest desperacio thynges shall soodaynly come vpon al nacions reason sea shall boile swell styll sourges thereof make doulrull roaryng noyse aferre monstreous token suche others manye whiche shall euerye syde shewe foorthe theymselfes oute partyes world shal declare terrible stroke god grow fast therefore shall people worlde consume pine awaye shalbee people world feare continual expectacion thinges shall anon come vpon whole vniuersall world whole nature thynges shalbe shaken together al ordre earth sea shalbee clene altred also saied sounde massie body worlde aboue shalbee altogether moued whereas thesame haue euermore vntyll tyme beene vntouched free alteracion elementes haue vsed geue theyr influenceand thou shal see sonne man come cloude wt power bee woorkers vpon thynges lye vnder theim fele anye power interiour elementes entrechaungeably working shewing effectes vpon suche persones haue nowe worlde despised bidden away sone man pacient milde beneficial shal houre see thesame cummyng high cloude great power high glory whan ye shal see ye premiss come passe lift vp iyes lift vp heades vnto thatsame citie heauely ierusalem tha shall kyngdome god bee nigh hande whiche shall nowe bee none affliccion euils perpetual quietnesse endlesse felicitie thynges aforesayed shalbe vndoubted token ye last day hand shewed similitude beholde figtree tree whan thei shooteforth buddes ye se know selfes summer nigh hade likewise ye also whan ye see thinges come passe sure kingdom god nigh ueraily sate vnto generacion shall passe till bee fulfilled heauen earth shall passe woordes shall passe lord added similitude therto take ye exaumple tree whiche doe assured token geue men knowelage afore hande fruicte folowe ye see figtree others shootefoorth buddes leaues veraye owne reason ye vnderstande summer almoste come ye begynne hope haue fruict right euen ye time ye shal see foresaied signes profres towardes ye chaunge ye world coceiue ye vndoubted hope ye kingdome god nowe shewed forth euill shall longer haue power doe care good wieked sorte shal suffre endelesse tormentes godly shal haue fruicion ioyes eternall ye haue alreadie seen come passe al yt euer hath hitherto bene foreshewed vnto prophetes beleue ye wythoute doubtes yt thinges also haue foresaied vnto shal semblably ensue come effecte woorde auouche vnto warauntise yt tyme man worlde shal passe awaie ye thinges euery one shal fortune nothing stable likely endure skye yearth yet shall skye yearthe sooner vanishe awaie woordes passe without taking due effecte ptake dede selfes leste tyme heartes ouercummed surfa ting drounkennes care life daie come vpon vnwares snare shal come al dwelle face whole yearth watche ye therefore continually praie ye maie escape thinges shal come ye maie stande soonne man beeyng therfore adcertained dredfull tyme wyll come prepaire selfes agaynst cummyng thesame come vpon soodaynly ye lye sluggyng shall ye easily dooe yf ye shall beware youre hertes bee ouercharged excesse meates drounkennesse pensife care present lyfe rather liue yefor snare shall come though said daye would come within houre bee men louyng anye thyng worlde beeyng youre wholle hertes myndes bent vnto thynges heauenly shall come passe saied daye shall vnawares take ere bee looked vnto others dooe lyue though time speake shoulde neuer come daye shall come snare trappe sette priuye stealth bodye liyng wait take shal catche al creature many haue hertes iyes lift vp heauen dwelle vpo face ye yearth haue permanent abiding haste waye towardes thesame eternall dwellyng placewatche ye therefore continually praye suche persones certes whyle occupied matter shall fele theimselfes taken shall foresee snare entet lyke case may chaunce vnto flee ye sluggyshenesse lye ye styll slepyng sensuall pleasure care worlde kepe selfe stil wakyng watchyng earneste exercise heauenly thynges praiyng continually god vouchesalue take noumbre theim maye escape great peril ye maye stande vpright iudge bee avoided wete soonne man lyke doeth nowe great fauour prouoke people repentaunce shall tyme greate seuerytye iudge quicke dead leate man thynke hym sure enough owne aide creature shall bee hable abide iudgemente onlesse bee fensed aforehande fauour god thesame fauour shall bee none sauyng suche dooe meane tyme al possible zele exercise goe aboute shewe theimselfes woorthye haue shall tyme ouer late suche persones pietious mone lamentacion call mercie dooe nowe worlde abuse pacient forbearing daie time taught temple night wente abode mount called oliuete people came mornyng temple heare whan time death approched iesus exaumple geue v lesson suche tymes principally ought apply godly study exercise whan laste daye lyfe draweth nyghe saied last day iesus foreshewed many thinges shalbee vnto worlde thesame thyng daye owne deathe vnto euerye bodye particularly lorde therefore daye season ministre eachyng dooe good vnto know put death soone night came went then mount oliuete en ent might quietly geue himselfe prayer wherein made vncessaunt intercession redemcio world geuing verai smal porcion tyme slepe soone day br ke people woulde customably resorte vnto hym temple heare hym teachyng xxii chapter pthe feast swete breade drewe nigh called easter high priestes scribe sought myght kill feared people entred satan iudas whose surname iscarioth noubre twelue went way comoned high priestes officer might betraye theim glad promised geue money consented sought oportunitie betraie vnto theim people awaie people depended lordes mouth saiynges much incensed priestes scribe phariseis beyng confederate headman lay fee putte iesus death nowe dyd also tyme drawe nere whyche bene tofore decreed expedyente hoste killed sacrifice redempcion mankynde vnto conueighaunce determinacion specially chosen oute deputed daye moste highe solemnitie others emong iewes whiche call feaste swete br ade long dayes thesame feaste lasted iewes thyng agaynste god forbod eate anye leauened breade thesame daye also called phase whiche syrian toungue muche saye passage passyng ouer named lambe one yere olde whose bloude highest partes postes anoyncted aungell lorde shoulde passe ouer whan destruyer marke doores suche daye nothyng paye mynde priestes scribe would muche li ffer haue death closely handled halfe stollen without high buisinesse open doeand priestes scribe lyke myght bee common manier doyng execucion vpon common malefactours iesus pleasure haue death openly knowen worlde bee solemnelye dooen euerye behalfe agree figure olde testamente holye saiynges prophetes yt holy lambe knowyng anye spotte synne whose fleashe true israelite dayly refreashed throughout wholle worlde vniuersall whose moste holy bloude beeyng throughly clensed haue beene conueighed damnacion haue beene deliuered tyranny synne goyng daylye ferther ferther awaye egipt dooe make haste towardes thatsame heauenlye lande moste plenteouslye flowyng kynde blisse absteinyng meane tyme leauened breade liuyng simplicitie sinceritie spirite euangelicall suche day speciallye chosen god true sacrifice nothyng pleased phariseis suffred death arbitrement pleasure iewes pleasure father hymselfe suche tyme woulde suche place woulde suche manier woulde hymselfe nothyng matter eyther doen vnaduisedly el casualtie malice phariseis almost euery daie weorkyng death vnto lord power tyme agaynste hym although lacked peruerse yet anye power geuen theim god accomplishe thyng whiche purposed yet neuerthelesse doe suche sorte conferre miengle theyr counsailles together though habie owne supportacion power bryng theyr wyll effectefor thei feared people malice phariseis priestes beeyng incensed manye wayes ticled itched laye handes iesus bring death feare people lette thereunto whome sawe broughte loue fauour towardes hym shewyng many myracles benefites depende altogether mouthe behalfe great peril leste yf attempted laye handes presence multitudethan entred satan iudas sedicion sodaynly arisyng taken force violence handes al theyr labour proue matter vain asmuche iesus whan escaped fyngers woulde tyme come see prouide well enough hymselfe dyd whyle remembre many time afore safe sound without harme escaped handes furious rageing multitude daye also beeyng nothing fitte purpose dooyng suche thyng moste theyr contentacion aswell high solemnitie feaste selfe also greate resorte people thesame feaste yet fitte occasion beeyng meane offreed whan hoped nothing lesse thesame occasion metyng euen iuste theyr wieked wil despeched scruple festiuall daye satan tempted iesus tofore veray owne selfe persecutyng thesame iesus yet stil minister instrumentes hadde possessed herte iudas iscarioth one twelue specially chosen rest iesus tofore named apostle iudas onelye couetise money whyche daylye came throughe handes perswaded hym furye mocion wente heade priestes rewlers priestes also aswell rewlers men armes aboute theim anye suche purpose geuen theim treactyng commonyng theim aboute betraying iesus theyr handes knewe theim bu sie counsaile emong theimselfes aboute suche matter seruaunte meie man betraye iesus suche one title profession moste familiar hym affeccion herte enemie iudas ill opinion lorde euer receiued displeasure hande wherefore shoulde haue cause beare hym malice il wiland wer glad pestilent corrupcion auarice hym faste stomake priestes thei wer glad men suche plaier come play first pageaunt plaie counsaile iudas lyked theim agreemente made price sue tie required euen veray slendre case aunswerable prophecie promised money promysed theym seruice best yt coulde meane time sought occasio whereby delyuer iesus vnto theym whan shoulde bee solitarye place sequestred cumpany whiche thyng desired entent sedicion might arise fauourers hym iudas well acquainted place lorde vsed solitary came day swetebreade whan necessitie passeouer must offered sent peter iohn saying goe prepare v passeouer may eate said vnto wilt thou prepare said vnto beholde whan ye entre citie shal man mete bearyng pitcher water folow thesame house entreth ye shal say vnto good man house maister saieth vnto geaste chaumber shall eate passeouer disciple shall shew great parlour paued make ready went found said vnto made ready passeouer nowe daye swete breade come hyghest holy daye iewes whiche accordyng prescripcion lawe labe bee slaynethan came daye swetebread whiche iewes call phase passing ouer haue already sayd true phase lord y lambe pure bee slayne sacrifice redempcion worlde accordyng eternall determinacion father therfore iesus would ye diepely inprint hertes dysciples memorie deathe woulde make playne open vnto suffered thinges bothe knowyng afore also willinglye mynde last supper euer make would mystical token make among representacion thyng ye next day folowyng execute accomplishe vpon crosse ignoraut greatly would afterward dismayed death therfore preueteth tyme whyle mindes wer yet past taking good counsayll aduertisemente dooyng matter commytted two chiefly beloued apostle peter iohn goe ye twaine sayeth prepare v paschal lambe may eate altogether thou hearest wordes beginnyng churche end synagoguewhere wilt thou prepare forbecause iesus though lord creatour thynges yet hadde house propre owne certaintie point vpon saied two disciple demaunded wyl pleasure haue ye paschal supper made ready great strau gers forsooth vnacquainted disciple wt citie thei scarcely perfite knowlage house therin euen verye suche ought true disciple christe bee worlde iesus entent would shewe part thynges wer foorthwith folowe hym vnknowen saied vnto beholde soone ye shall bee entred citie shall man come towardes cariyng pitcher full water folowe thesame felowe euen house shall enter shal ye say good house master hath willed v say vnto thee behalfe parler wherin may eate paschall lambe disciplesthe mayster saieth thee c partie shal byanby know title maister euen one day acknowlage thee calling lorde time ye vntyed ass colte partie shall without delaye shewe great wyde parlour bourde already couered thynges prepared repast taken make ye pascall lambe ready nowe consider point frede theophilus hoste none acquaintaunce findeth christe parloure suppe bearer water yt leder vnto house christ kepeth solemnitie pasche meane baptisme doctrine god woord entering churche liuely water god word doeth clense water also sacrament doeth clense good house hath name expressed churche christe euerywhere springyng first vp derke lowe beginnynges spreadyng self ferther ferther abrode fro day day whole vniuersal worldand went c beginnyng health saluacion faith discyples beleue lord obediently rewled departe citie fynde carriyng pitcher water folowe thesame goeth leadeth way declared good house suche message comaunded sheweth theim great large dinyng parlour wyde large must nedes able receiue nacios worlde iewes synagogue place narow roume ferre fro earthly thinges must people sequestred disposed eate meate celestiall place disciple prepare supper verily executyng office pastours whan houre cum sate doune twelue apostle said vnto haue inwardly desired eate passeouer suffre say vnto henceforth wil eate vntill bee fulfilled kingdome god toke cuppe gaue thankes said take deuide among say vnto drinke fruite vyne vntill kingdom god come toke bread whan geuen thankes brake gaue vnto saiyng body geuen remebraunce likewise also whan supped toke cuppe saiyng cuppe newe testament bloud shed yet behold hand betraieth table truely soonne man goeth appoynted woe vnto man betrayed began enquire among themselfes whiche shoulde dooe whan nowe supper tyme iesus came thyther sate downe eate twelue specially chosen disciple residue yet able receiue depe hidde mistery whiche pleasure meane apostle made common vnto already entred misticall rule profession ghospell sone meate drynke sette theim table lord entent might depely enprient mindes apostle would suffre death crosse necessitie warde onely loue redemyng mankynde sayed vnto theym great earnest desire haue desired eat pascal labe deathhenceforth wyll eate c time wherof reioyce come thirst redepcion man woorde assure tyme forthward wyll eate pasche according litterall ordeinaunce prescripcion lawe pasche perfeccion shal spirite bee accomplished kyngdome god lambe whiche euery yere solenely killed iewes coprised figure death true thyng self come place shadow shall ceasse ye shal hensforth solemnise vnto ghostly effectuall passeouer eatyng whereof shall make immortalland teke cuppe gaue thankes euery one tasted lambes fleashe iesus tooke cuppe hande gaue thankes vnto father geuing firste assaye cuppe holdyng foorth vnto sayed vnto disciple take ye deuide ye emongst take ye true woorde mouth wyll hensforth drynke fruite vynetree necessitie fleashe kyngdome god shall immediately bee present euery one thynges whiche lawe hath outward carnall shall spiritually shewed ministred thus ferre ende figure lawe immediatly hereupon lorde iesus entendyng misticall figure token consecrate seruauntes newe testament tooke breade thankes geuing father brake owne handes deliuered vnto disciple saying body whiche betrayed vnto death death shall doen oncethis remembraunce onely one sacrifice death sufficient synnes age tymes aswell paste come ye shall oftentymes renewe vnto yourselues memory tendre loue towardes dooyng lyke emong selues ye nowe see doen shal high holy signe bande league made betwene soone supper doen tooke cuppe also reachyng foorth sayed newe testament consecrated bloud calfe goat mine owne bloude whiche poured foorth redemyng sauing ye haue nowe highest token pledge myne entier loue towardes dede ought bee like loue towardes agayne yet one table emongest betraye handes whiche seke vnto death neither doen casualtie prefixed determinacion godwoe vnto betrayed foreshewed prophetes sonne man suche processe redeme mankynde indede good necessarie poynt seruice doeth herein towardes vniuersal redempcio man yet doeth wicked minde thesame thyng shall conclusion turne damnacion whiche shal bee instrumente saluacion others determinacion god dooeth drawe hym deiuelishe acte ledde thereunto owne inordinate couetiseand thei began enquier emog themselfes c saying iesus sore dismayed theyr hertes caste great passion begon aske serche emong themselues shoulde whome iesus spoken one knew hymself culpable conscience besydes iudas iscarioth onely yet durste one truste owne selfe matter notwithstandyng iesus bewrayed betrayer oftentymes pricked conscience thentent shoulde emende knewe well enough iudas would neuerthelesse continue stil madnesse teachyng v therewhyle vse moste fauoure possible towardes synners forasmuche cannot sure whether thesame party maye one daye come themselues agayne striefe emong whiche shoulde seme greatest sayed vnto kynges nacions reigne ouer haue autoritie vpon called gratious lordes ye shall greattest emong shalbee younger chiefe shallbe dooeth ministre whether greater sitteth meat serueth sitteth meate emong ministreth ye whiche haue abidden temptacions appoynt vnto kyngdome father hath appoynted vnto ye maye eate drynke table kyngdome sitte seates iudgeyng twelue trybes israell nowe lorde iesus supper tyme made mencion kyngdome god eftesones befell contencion emong disciple beyng yet weake hauyng yet still behalfe smatche fleashe lordes death haue prima ie supremitie kyngdome godthe kinges nacions reigne ouer c holdyng forth breade cup vnto semed make eguall one another saying deuide ye emong iesus although sondrie tymes afore also called backe suche affeccion yet beyng veray nere towardes death repeateth thesame bea eth theyr heades saying doe ye imagine suche lyke thing kyngdom heauen ye see worldly kingdomes ferre sorte reygnyng standeth benefites force armes kept defended spirituall fence violence dilated enlarged circuite perswasion wordes forceable compulsion prynces worlde doe exercise lordelye power ouer suche people haue gouernement rewle doe vse perswasion woordes make loue honest wayes feare euill doynges terrour punishemente subiectes require haue honour reuerence doen vnto though bee worthie thereof yea nerer drawe poynte tyrannie muche obedience subieccion dooe require haue theyr common whyle honoured thesame people title style estate royaltee haue name style geuen called prynces father theyr countrey sauers defendours consul theyr power kepe theyr inferiours vnder subieccion sorte forsothe reygnyng heathen nacions emong frame breake kyngdome ghospellbut ye shal bee shall bee ferre trade greater euerie one shalbe emong muche lesse shall take vnto hym violent power glorie shall haue iye oppresse ouertrede inferiours good giftes quality whiche hath receyued god dooe inferiours good therby relieue neyther shall take laude prayse vnto hymselfe refer thesame entierly vnto god yet speake though shal ordre kyndome whiche chosen preeminence beyng guide vnto others towardes godlynesse shall greatly serue commodity personesbut greattest emog c maie seme minister seruaunt rather head shal make sekyng ne suite fauour good herte mynde beyng moste quicke readie doe good vnto persones shall deserue iustely haue autoritie perfeccion lyuyng shall mainteine proude disdeynefull looke stately porte countenaunce let greue truely perfourme shewe thesame humilitee emong yourselues whiche haue throughly shewed vnto whereas due right might haue taken vnto state lordely power dominion considre pondre ye myndes whether twoo semeth greatter man serueth table orels sitteth ye table serued doth sitteth seme greatter whosoeuer sitteth dounefor whether gretter c dede greatter man rather enterteineth others makyng feaste euen respect greater dignitie dooeth good many yet suche one courtesy good maners sake whan others hath called feaste dooe sitte table goeth house fro place place careful diligent see persone lacke thing feaste carefulnesse hym alone prouideth satisfiyng well beeyng coumpanye haue vsed self lyke suche one among haue suche sort conuersaunt among though wer seruat mynystryng myne owne takyng care selfe alone muche ought ye bee ferre al tirannye ambicion condicion state eguall one whiche ministre vnto others thynges whiche haue one maister egually indifferent vnto allbut among c ye haue receiued ye high holy caucion token pledge euagelical concorde entier loue haue embraced thesame loue ye shoulde embrace one another among selfes reigneth ambicion cannot concorde bee sure staye meane tyme honoure must bee willyngly deserued vsurped taken thyng duetie right prince worlde although dooe offyce rightlye yet thei require homage fealtie subiectes therfore shal haue reward god ye puttyng away al care touchyng rewarde leat myndes onely vpon office dutie shalbe mine office prouide touchyng dignitie ye shalbe true folowers humilitie ye shall also partaker glorie ye shalbe felowes takyng suche part affliccions doye haue abiden intemptacions shall ye also haue suche part immortalitie heauen haue hitherto haue ye persisted continued mine affliccyons affliccions hath pleased heauely father haue mine obediece throughly tried approued neither lownesse degree pouertie trauailles life obloquie men phariseis laiyng await threatenyng men power hath disseuered fro coumpaniyng liuyng wheras others haue fallen away fro wheras others haue bold spirit professe theselfes disciple mine yf ye shall still persist thesame mynde ye haue hitherto shall irke meane tyme folowe humilitie end ye may better profit persones againe parte shall bryng passe ye shall day bee partaker glorye kyngdome hath pleased father shalbee waie kyngdome heauen thesame haue heretofore opened vnto doe thorough deaththat ye maye eate drynke mytable meane lowenesse father shall exalte glorye kyngdome temporall affliccions ioyes euerlasting like kyngdome prepared father meane whyle accordyng doe behaue vse selfe minister lorde euen exalted dignitie kyngdome prepare feloweshyppe kingdome folowe steppe suche wyse ye whiche haue sought honour worldeand e con seates c haue behaued selfes minister seruauntes vnto others diligently dispensing doctrine ghospell shall sitte table kyngdome minister honourable chyldren god ye nowe sake reputed amog ye iewes persones moste abiect ye shal houre sitte head men dignitie vpon twelue throne iudgyng twelue tribe israell day shall vasenesse suche people appere present seme sitte high benche world shall highnes seme daye outcaste world thus muche lord iesus speake vnder figure qualifiyng teperyng wordes rawnesse disciple whiche rawnesse suffered cause remaine long season partly would v effectually plucke suche worldly affeccios disciple wer time subiect vnto partly learne great pacience fauour suffre weakenes frailtie folkes vntil may growe thinges perfeccion lord said simon simon beholde satan hath desired lift wheat haue praied thee thy faith fail whan thou art conuerted strength thy brother said vnto lord ready goe thee prison death saied tell thee peter cocke shall crowe daye till thou hast thrise denied thou knowest remaining hym arme mindes disciple tempeste euen approchyng roote theyr hertes puttyng trust confidence themselfes sodain stormes affliccions dooeth persones ouer geue ouerthrow suche haue confidence boldenesse strength suche persones vtterlye mistrustyng theyr owne assurednesse say worldly aide mainteinaunce man wholly depend goddes defece helpe suche none others hable stand sure vproares tumultuous business preset worlde tourned tale vnto peter entent might exaumple peter trayne correcte knewe peter quicke prest spirite others bee one put muche confidence hymself tendre good affeccion certes yet humain worldly yet receyued thatsame holy spirite godbehold satan hath desired bounteous geuer al vertue therefore saied simon simon beholde satan hath earnestlye desyred haue might winow sifte wheate purpose blow soondre might would haue doen dede case ye leaft frailtie haue hartyly prayed father thee peter although thy faith wil somwhat waueryng yet maye fail clene away first exaumple hereof hath pleased hym shewe vpon thee whiche trustest verye muche thy selfeand whan thou art co uerted c end beeyng come thyselfe thy falle thou maiest exaumple thy self confirme thy brethre wha thei shal frailtie bee fallen end may euery one vnderstande man may possibly strength bee hable matche againste malyce satan onlesse bee stayed aide mainteinaunce peter whan heard wordes trustyng yet still owne strengthe aunswereth lorde fallyng way thee conuersion doest thou tell ofi ready goe thee prison c naie thou shalt perceiue fynde constant man faith vnpossible ouercomed like haue hitherto tyme forsaken thee forsake thee tyme hereafter neither insomuche ready put self extreme dauger life thee whether go priso yea death either saiyng peter procedyng truely good plain menyng hert yet eue throughly knowe vnto hiselfi tell thee peter c lord immediatly repressed auswer saiest thou peter art thou wilt go prison death naye tell thee another contrary tale aforehad cum passe yt thou wylt thrise reneague wilt sweare thou knowest eue preset night cocke crowe twise great shal storme affliccio vpo thee said vnto th whan set without wallet scrippe shoe lacked ye thing thei said thou said vnto hath wallet let take vp likewise scrippe hath sweord let hym sell coate bye one saye vnto yet thesame whiche written must perfourmed euen among wicked reputed thinges whiche written haue ende sayd lord behold two sweordes said vnto enough plucked hertes puttyng affiaunce trust themselfes eftsons beateth heades thynge oftentimes fore taught whiche defend theimselfes worldely defence violence euil persos minister heauenly doctrine gospel ought fre vile care lifewhan set without wallet c ne ought armour weapon bee appoynted assaultes wicked sorte sweorde spirite whiche woord god time sent proufe assaie preache among iewes howe kyngedome god approchedlacked ye thyng sent vnfurnished prouision ye muche purse aboute putte money muche poore scrippe kepe meate tyme houngre yet shooes sauyng fete yet ye want thyng thei aunswered wanted nothyngbut hath wallet lette hym take vp c iesus entente would vtterly plucke vp ye roote stomakes desire auenging beguileth whyle deckenesse woordes suffreth purpose ren e wrong opinion would surely effectually plucke myndes al affeccion auengyng quarels knew enkiendled earneste defendyng reskewyng hym wha see armed soldyers great stiere ru felyng inuade fall vpo maister earnestly loued though neuerthelesse yet affeccionate sorte humain loue worldely whiche humaine affeccion loue euidently chastised would haue thought bee lawfull defende selfes weapon violence wicked person putte away force force nowe seeyng peter shent beecause drewe sweorde againste deuelishe hainous coumpany maisters cause beyng man innocent cause may bee hensfoorth christian bodye put away wrong wrong thus sayed lorde first preachyng ghospell ye went light vnfurnished prouision liuyng yet thorough supportacion sure defense ye wanted nothyng enough whan sore storme nere towardes fro hesforth ye must prepare hertes hardier matter ye extreme sore ye storme persecucio shalbe muche lighter mete ye fro al yearthely lettes encoumbraunces nowe great battayl towardes ye shall haue nede sweord wherfore man percase hath pouche scrippe let hym take vp maye bye hym sweorde case haue thynges whiche dede may bee cast away whiche ye haue lacked without incommoditie vnto leat hym sell coate bye hym sweord nedeful bodye come batail lyght carryage armed thyng sweorde matier sure come extreme thei onely lay violet ha de also must nedes perfourmed yt esai long agon prophecied become meesay iiii euen amog wycked reputed euen emong wicked reputed sore grieuous matter killed much sorer thing suffer shamefull execucion peines death men speake eiuil yea thesame suffer emog heinous malefactours yet chaunce also soonne man sure haue tyme euen whatsoeuer hath foresaid prophetes concernig must acco plished apostle whereas thei vnderstode misterie saiynges deemed lorde said put remembraunce haue sweorde readinesse putte theym violence beyng towardlorde beeholde two sweordes aunswered plainly without mening fraud maister behold bee two sweordes already supposyng dede wise thei shoulde nede sweordes fearyng leste two sweordes woulde bee enough fight shewed good hert affeccion fight lordes sake knewe hable enough power supply defence strength wanted thyng like afore yt time multiplied fiue loaues two fish make suffice manye thousandes people grosse affeccio iesus preset leaue disciple entent haue said weakenes might instruccio v vnto perfite pacience suffering tribulacion therefore aunswered enough take thyng spoke though first fray might bee borne twoo sweordes thei ready whereas christes menyng ghostely fight worlde deiuill whiche fighte victory cumeth herte beyng lightened discharged al earthly desire armed sweord heauenly doctrine said victory consisteth vndefeasable scripture olde newe testamente man maye vnderstande twoo sweordes thesame sweordes deliuered foorth one spirite came went wont mout oliuere disciple folowed hym wha came place said vnto pray leste ye fall temptacion gatte fro stone cast kneled doune praied saiyng father thou wilt remoue cuppe neuerthelesse wyll thine fulfilled appered aungel vnto heauen coumfortyng hym agony prayed longer sweate lyke droppes bloud tricklyng downe ground men armes whan shall entre fight woont bickering enemy approchyng nere refreashe body plucke vp hertes lorde beyng mynded shew vnto seruauntes thyng might moste principally strengthe suche ioynyng battail whan toward wet foorth ierusalem accordyng accustomed vsage wente mounte oliuete disciple accoumpanying hym whan cu priuie place woont praie said vnto entet purpose ye may bee hable manfully stande tempest hangeth ouer watche ye pray ye leste yf thesame come soodaynely vpon ye lye sluggyng idle may take trappe ere ye aware maye ouercome lorde whan thus muche spoken withdrew hymself cumpany mountenauce maner stone cast pray solitarily creature like afterward sole perso suffre death creature lyke death profite idle persones must prayer neither auaillable vnto suche haue diligente earnest mynde pray themselfes toofather yf thou wilte c geue v lesson herte bee submitted often addresse speake talke god praied father knee bowed downe grounde saying father bee thy willneuerthelesse thyne fulfilled remoue thissame cuppe away fele humain nature haue taken abhorre death behalfe leat redempcion man ouercome leat bee doen whiche thy wil beeyng vnmutable hath determined thing whiche weakenesse body doeth geue aduise mocion vnto lorde knewe wyll father party couered drike cuppe death redempcion worlde laied vpon hymself affeccion body studied prescribe vnto seruauntes fourme trade praiyngand appered vnto hym angel heauen co forting maner praiyng fitte martir litle time martyrdome thy wyll dooen myne whether thy wyll haue liue dye feareful tremblyng nature christe toke vpon would take away entet would teache v suche tymes haue prest helpe readye lordes hand whan wholly comitted selfes wil god whether lyfe death appered vnto aungel doune heauen strengthenyng cast great agonie pangues behoufe behoufe cumforted strengthened ye augell toke certain extreme agonie trouble mynde suche moste parte woont chaunce vnto menne whan haue death euen iyes behold myndes passion comonly woont grieuous death self neither y disdayne take tormente mynde also cause refused cause hang crosse teaching v meane time succour ought take refugeand hys sweat lyke drop bloud often thatsame quaking feare shall take infirmitie cease vpon liyng doune prostrate vpon ye groud praied yet earnestly forsoth hereof depedeth whole hope victory verify entet stedfaste time suffering paine torment great trouble mind toke christ droppes bloude tricled doune earth body ouer whan arose vp praier cum disciple found slepyng heauinesse saied vnto sleape ye ryse praye leste ye fall temptacion assoone arose praiyng stode vpright retourned vnto disciple found slepyng sorowe heauynesse thatsame surfaict made heauye weakenesse nature grieuous dolour mynde caused slepe whoso suche bataill goe awaie conquerour muste fighte agaynste weakenesse lustie stregth spirite iesus therfore chideth disciple eftsons calleth vp pray saiyng dooe ye great daungier ieopardy geue selfes slepe arise ye praye leste tempest growing fast towardes doe oppresse ouerwhelme euen ye lye sluggyng houre euen nere hande yet spake behold came cumpany called iudas one twelue went pressed nigh vnto iesus kysse iesus said vnto iudas betraiest thou sonne man kisse whan whiche sawe would folowe said vnto lorde shall smite sweorde one smote seruaunt high priest stroke right eare iesus aunswered said suffre ye thus ferre forth whan touched eare healed hym lorde iesus yet ended wordes euen nowe alreadye appered sight rable vngracious souldiers priestes phariseis beeyng vngracious purposely sente attache iesus honest iudas euen little folower christe companion hym table nowe become guyde deuelishe bande souldiers came afore good preatye waie betwene geuen token doe thyng comoly vsed warres whosoeuer geue kisse well wete iesus whan cum sumwhat nere vnto iesus eue ready kysse wont lord accordyng accustomed mildnesse refused ye traiters kisse neither yet eftsons pricked conscience thetent moued leastwise great pacience fauour lord might haue ameded iudas saieth arte thou betraier sone man kisseiudas beetraiest thou sonne man kysse iudas word well vnderstode herte hidden fro god knewe innocencye lorde many tymes suche myldenesse lorde neuer lyke heard prouoked chaunge wicked entente purpose euen verye flinte stone myghte haue suppled therewith satan altogether possessed whole hert disease corrupcion couetise truely deuelishnesse iudas cause da nacion hymselfe alone mo suche personnes dooe nowe tymes seblable guile betray veritie euagelical vnto ye prince world causers greuous cofusion worthy greater punishement vnhappye iudas ouerlate takyng repentaunce hys facte execute vpon himselfe immediately vpon kisse geuen company harnessed menne came rennyng vnto iesus laye handes vpon hym suche none purpose mynde wyl knowe iesus myght take hym happye folkes labour knowe euangelcail woorde god purpose folowers iesus disciple seyng suche violence attepted entended towardes maister loue ministred suche boldnesse herte vnto theim saied lorde lorde wilte thou strieke sweordelord shal smyteth sword freashe remembraunce lorde tofore saied vnto byinge sweord seene perpetuall myldenesse neuer faillynge doubted whether woulde suffre theim occupie sweordes peter loued lorde feruentely others aboue reste made voluntarie promise hardie stoute actes neuer taried lordes answere stroke sweorde one chief priestes seruauntes whiche firste enterprised laye hande iesus one expressed resembled crueltie maister mildnesse lorde moderatyng strokeand stroke right eare peter cutte felowes right eare happie persones euer wer horne whose eare hath hitherto herkened wicked priestes carnal lawe cutte beyng restored set agayn christe doeth herken suche thynges materiall euerlastyng saluacion eare cutte wounde subiect obloquie ill speakyng people daungerous life bodie yet neuerthelesse wounde vncurable gristle earepiece beyng cut twoo cannot close ne growe together iesus whome wound vncurable chidden peter contrarie euangelicall myldenesse remembryng styll olde lawesuffre ye thus ferre foorth c begonne fight sweorde restored vnto malchus eare sette againe appered signe woud euer souldiers seruauntes least offence whose mere folye serued turne priestes phariseis scribe malice peter rather haue bestowed fierce angre vpon pleased god euangelicall victorie shoulde consiste pacient suffreyng saied iesus high priestes rewlers temple elder whiche come hym ye bee come vnto thief sweordes staues whan dayly temple stretched forth handes euen veraie houre power derkenesse tooke hym led hym brought high priestes house iesus declare willyngly suffred thynges turnyng hymselfe cumpaignye whome priestes scribe sente sayed vnto chaunce befallen ye armed weaponed sweordes clubbes haue issued foorth citie night thus come rennyng hither fourme open warre vanquyshe common robber defendyng himselfe sworde makyng resistence whereas haue dayly temple readie come euerie bodye wouldebut euen youre verai houre power derknesse naked man without weapon creature layed handes vpon truely ye euen thesame wille ye nowe haue wylle lette vnto whome creature hable resiste tyme determined suffre yet come tyme night tyme power darkenesse permitted god lord iesus immediately wha thus sayed without makyng strongleyng resistence willyngly offreed hymselfe bound cordes coumpainye soon fast brought house cayphas time chiefe head priestes saie moste naughtiest porcion whole people iewes inner courte caiphas palaice gathered theselues together conuocacion priestes scribe phariseis heade rewlers people also hadde gathered thesame place multitude whiche either feare affeccion deceiued wrong opinion wer instrumentes foresayd company malice peter folowed ferre whan kiendled fyer myddes palaice set together peter also satedowne emong whan one wench beheld hym sate fyer looked vpon hym sayed felowe also hym denyed hym saying woman knowe hym litle sawe hym sayed thou arte also petur sayed man space houre another affirmed saying uerailye felowe hym also galile petur saied man wote thou sayest immediatly yet spake cocke crewe lorde turned backe loked vpon peter peter remembred woorde lorde sayed vnto hym cocke crowe thou shalt denye thryse peter wente wept bitterly meane tyme disciple beyng strieken feare renne awaye one one place another another place peter nothyng prosperously played man maisters behalfe makyng fraye malchus yet neuerthelesse vttrely putte awaye hope matier recouer doe well enough folowed iesus good waye behynde also toke good herte hym aduentured derke entre hall bishop palaicepeter also sate downe emog make one emong presse seruauntes man vnknowe body beyng fyer made cole myddes palaice courte night time colde emogst seruauntes sittyng fyer warme peter also sate emongst moe warmed himselfe cole whome whan certayne wenche house espied sitting suche facion face euen full light fyer beholdyng hym somewhat steadily knewe sight olde would declare maisters sorte cryed hearyng al coumpaynye yea felowe taken thyng doen casuall chaunce pleased dispensacion god tho thentente confidence whiche peter hymselfe might better caulmed damped wheras tofore made suche royall promise vnto lord would shrynke goe hym euen veray death worde peluishe woman reneague maister petur feared saying woman aunswered desperately herte hele clene goenand denied saiyng woma knowe thou woma haue none acquaintaunce meanes peter first plounge escape within whyle cometh lyke dau gier agayn one seruauntes eftsons begonne knowe hym metelye perfectly sayed vnto yea thou arte one nombre whose maister capitain haue taken peter beyng eftsons reason woordes one halfe worlde feare sayed thou man none swore knewe iesus thus escaped forswearyng hymselfe yet whyle come mynde lorde tolde hym promyse hymselfe hadde made lorde iesus examinacion afore th wicked counsaill strieke buffettes contrarie manier ordre iudgementes courtes iustice peter beholdyng good waye lookyng styll ende matier lyke haue muche space houre certayne felowe seruauntes beeyng cousin hym whose eare peter strieken beholdyng peter well knewe saied promise felowe also iesus herbare whan sayed sayed morouer thing true saye euen veray owne toungue doeth declare one galile borne peter beyng altogether cast extreme feareand peter sayed man wote thou saiest c begonne sweare naie mattier bidde diuell take muche vnderstad iesus herbare felowes galilee seruaunt spake ferre vttrely forgotten hymselfe afterwarde one chiefe congregacion meane season whyle peter reneagueth sweareth naie curseth himselfe geueth hymselfe bodye soule deuill cocke crewe seconde time whiche token lorde geuen hym yet thereby neither come himselfe agayne neither lyke haue made ende straying righte waye lorde middes wicked coumpaynye thereand lord turned backe loked vpon peter turned iyes vpon peter earnestly beheld hym peter beyng touched lokyng maister vpon hym remembred wordes whiche lorde litle sayed vnto hym cocke crowe twise night thou shalt thrise reneague deny beyng sodaynlye touched earnest sorowe conueyed hymsefe foorth doores wepte bitterly thing peter thesame would disciple also haue doen lyke necessitie come vre person peter pleased iesus teache others man truste himselfe ne man miengle associate hymselfe compayny euyll persones nighte loue weaxed stone cold hym warmyng hymselfe fyer wicked folkes sittyng coumpayny emongest deiuilishe sorte house cayphas bishop whereas hymselfe afterwarde bishop muche vnlyke cayphas bishop cayphas house vngracious dedes mischiefe doen conspiracie made death iesus priestes phariseis scribe elder people thence sent foorth harnessed men agaynste bounde scourged hath face couered skorned accused doeth peter committe periurie doeth accurse hymselfe great grieuous crime vnlesse frailtie excused peter offended prepensed malice iudas doen heauinesse herte wherwith astouned hadde come thither purpose reneague iesus onely might behold thende iudgemente whereas yet sufficientlye confirmed die christ tyme yet come therfore many soeuer haue fallen grieuous crime leat praye lorde iesus wyll vouchesafe turne iyes vpon shall strayghtwayes acknowlage themselfes state ease fallen let withdrawe themselues vngracious coumpayny leat washe awaye theyr fault teres testifying herte conuerted chaunged men toke iesus mocked hym smote hym whan blyndefolded hym stroke hym face asked hym saying arede smote thee many thynges despitefully sayde agaynst hym meane season thatsame nighte passed ouer spente mockes scornes iesus felowes apprehended iesus scorned hym geuyng hym bothe reprochefull wordes stroke therto heard saye people reuerence prophete blyndefolde iyes buffeted hym face saying arede tell spirite prophecie man hath geuen blowes many wordes mockage reproche dyd wicked company continue rayling iesus fountaine glory none v ought take greuously reuiled rayled worde ghospell suffer affliccion euill turnes handes suche persones serue myndes vnreligious byshops doe thynges fulfyll appetite cloked phariseis doe thynges satisfie fansie folyshe prynces soone daye elder people hye priestes scribe came together led hym theyr counsayll saying arte thou christe tell v sayed vnto yf tell ye wyll beleue yf aske ye wyll aunswere let goe hereafter shall sonne manne sytte ryght hande power god sayed arte thou sonne god sayed ye saye sayed nede witnes oure selues haue hearde owne mouth assone fayre daylyght come chiefe priestes scribe head ruler people pretending sit kepe courte due fourme iudgemente assemble together great noumbre summoned iesus personally appeare theyr courte demaunded many question hym hunting one poynte wordes whiche might openly laye charge crime wherewith charge hym euen sekyng whan alreadye set iudgemente death beeyng determinately appoynted vpon looke deuise title coloure cause death maye layed vnto hymarte thou christ tell v whereupon thus speake vnto hym thou thatsame christe whome accordyng godly sayinges prophetes looke tell v playnly iesus knowyng moue suche question purpose learne trueth hunt matier false accusacion agaynst hym thus made answere vnto shall tell ye wyll geue credite vnto case shoulde question testimony scripturesif tell ye wyl beleue maner promised messias whether thesame token doe iustely agree person ye wyll aunswere accordyng conscience men haue anye earnest desyre learne true yet teache neyther wyll ye vpon suche cause consideracion acquite discharge shall declare myne innocencie vnto ye doe youre opposyng examining meane eyther vpo knowlage trueth discharge innocent condene beyng found guiltie lawfull iudgementes commonly vfed bee doen entent thyng ye haue determined doe ye maye seme doe tytle colour iustice therfore wyll tell thyng whiche though ye knowe yet ye wyll knowe thing tell whiche ye shall one daye fynde true sonne man present moment reason weakenesse humayne naturehereafter shall sonne sit c humilitie agnised knowlaged beyng proud hault mynded men shall tyme come aboue earth hye syttyng right hande god maiestie wordes iesus speake thentent forasmuche mynde wyll putte iesus death fourme humilitie whome mighte haue saued enbrace hym haue knowledge daye see hym iudge punisher theyr vngodlynesse salueour promised many hudred yeres loked would acknowlage suche worde semed vnto meete sufficient occasion laye false accusacion agaynste case woulde openly take vpon hym sonne god whereupon saye arte thou thatsame sonne godarte thou sone god whome foretellynges prophetes doe make mencion question doeth iesus suche wise tempre aunswere neither woulde deny hymself geue vnto occasion matter falsely laye charge yet touchyng hymselfe shewe spyce poynte arrogancie lorde minde eche actes dedes declare diuine nature godhead himye saye woordes professe take vpon therfore wyse shaped aunswere ye saye hu ble lowly sorte geuing knowlage thing whiche demaunded manier fourme question thyng doubtful might fewe wordes vsed alteryng manier pronunciacion spoken playne affirmacion iudgeing thissame cause sufficient enough wherefore accuse hym blasphemy crime none emong iewes worthie death sayed doe yet styl require witneswhat node ferther wytnes oure owne selues haue hearde manifeste blasphemie mouth upo verdite whole coumpainy quickely agree men afore decreed title whatsoeuer put iesus death xxiii chapter whole multitude arose led hym vnto pylate began accuse hym saying founde felowe peruertyng people forbidding paye tribute ceasar saying christe kyng pilate opposed hym saying arte thou kyng iewes aunswered hym sayed thou sayest sayed pilate high priestes people fynde faulte man fierce saying moueth people teachyng throughoute iewry begonne galile euen place whan found cause theimselues appered fit enough put hym death remayned might remoue also enuie displeasure death themselues laye others wherupon thought best shift ouer themselues pilate lieutenauntes handes bee arayned entent might seme putte death iewes gentile wherefore counsayle multitude also drawe partakyng theyr wicked dede aryse vp altogether bring iesus pilate lorde president lieutenaunte iewry though iewe hymself yet head officer vnder emperour first iewes doe deliuer gentile alienate themselues theyr messias beyng sent god gentile receiue wurship whan commended betaken lorde already condemned foreiudgement counsaile iewes pretense coloure neuer slendre suffise rageyng madnesse thirsted death innocent benche pagane heathe iudge equitie ministryng iustice courte iewes necessarye haue forged witness whiche shoulde laye many great crymes chargewe founde felowe peruertyng people c alone creature clere crime beginnyng theyr accusacion sorte founde tooke felowe manier subuertyng nacion forbade yt tribute bee payed emperour talke hath auouched himselfe messias king two crime thought gaily well deuised thesame crime excedyng greatly moue mynde lorde deputie aswel one comprised spice high treaso cesar naughtily moste shamelesse craftie forger lye assaulte veritie euangelicall bee deuised shamelesse suche lye iesus afore tyme whan piece coyne shewed vnto hym made aunswere manier geue pay ye vnto cesar thinges belong vnto cesar god thinges belong vnto god made kyng whereas afore willyngly offreed hym iewes owne mocion woulde none fled ranne away auoydeit beyng messias also veray factes dedes afore tyme declared hymselfe bee thesame wherfore affirmed auouched hymselfe messias yet ought haue laid matier charge cryme except first openly proued suche thinges prophetes foresayed concernyng messias agree ne serue spoken hym hope put foile ouerthrowe greate noumbre suche multitude beeyng conspyred together agaynste hym iesus accused altogether destitute fredeles finally iudge supposed man godlines pilate although wurshipper idolles yet beeyng man muche equitie conscience priestes iewes wynked fyrste artycle accusacion whiche concerned tribute ought payed vnto ceasar made though herd partely smelled well apperceyued forged matter partely beecause newe thyng poynte bee reasoned disputed amonge iewes muche whole secte phariseis thought people peculiarly specially chosen dedicated vnto god ought pay tribute heathen nacions artycle concernyng bee kyngand pilate opposed saying art thou ye king ye iewes questioned iesus sawe spyece ne lykelyhode worldly reignyng beeyng kyng one sole persone apparell countenaunce behaueour body shewed token humilitie symplenesse wherfore president whan hearde accuser tooke aparte asked hym whether kyng iewes iesus aunswered thou sayest lord euermore moderate aunsweres bothe myghte approue innocencie yet laboure escape condemnacion iudgemente forasmuche determined dye kyng iewes poynte congruente hym saye naye vnto kynde reigne kyngdome went recouer hymselfe father diuine nature godhead kyng al thynges whiche diuine nature pilate suspected ne thought suche thynge hym touchyng reygne kyngdome euangelicall sayd pilate vnderstandyng forasmuche man ignoraunte lawe prophetes sauyng hearde looked iewes one messias kyng whatsoeuer coulde tell whiche rumour beeyng man nothyng supersticious passed muche vpon therefore althoughe vnderstoode aunswere iesus yet beeyng ignoraunte iewes malyce gatheryng sobrenesse humilitie iesus euen veraye countenaunce came forth byshops iewes multitude gathered clouster togetherthan saied pilate c fynde fault haue sayed examined partie suche faultes haue laied charge fynde none offence hym men knowyng theyr owne conscieces doen thei wer able euident profes conuince get ouerhande hym set throte made ope outcry hym linking together crime vpon crime lie vpo lie thicke could nay ferther say sedicious felowe thoroughly moueth perswadeth people iewrye ouer doctrine beginnyng galilee waye euen tyll come verye citye forsooth speciall cryme faulte alledged laied euangelical veritie maketh comocions sedicios people whan deuelish sort men insourgeth reyseth garboyle agaynst veritie whiche deadly hate cannot abyde suche tumultuous garboyle right bee imputed true preacher ghospell vncurable malice persones haue desire haue holsom trueth vttrely oppressed ouerwhelmed laye aparte disease malicious hertes none otherwise dooeth doctrine ghospel trouble people medicine physycke dooeth grutche stiere body excepte bee fyrste stieryng roumbleyng body muste nedes wholly peryshe altogether whan pi ate heard mencion galilee asked whether man galilee sone knew belonged vnto herodes iurisdiccion sent herode also hierusalem tyme whan herode sawe iesus excedyng glad desyerous see hym long season hearde many thynges hym trusted haue seene summe myracles dooen hym questioned hym many woordes aunswered hym nothyng hygh priestes scribe stoode foorth accused hym streyghtly herode wyth hys men warre despysed hym whan mocked hym arayed hym white clothyng sente hym agayne pylate thesame daye pylate herode made frendes together varyaunce accusacion forasmuche moued pylate litle nothynge sawe wholle mattier dooen conspyracie chiefe rewlers certayne others people consenters helper forewarde malyce thesame head men saye sayed veraye desyrous earneste remoue priesoner also accuser examinacion trial iudge end case might bee hable delyuer iesus yet leastwise himselfe hys parte might ridde despeched cause quickely tooke occasion thys one lytell woorde galilee whiche countrey herode tetrarche prynce therfore demaunded whether iesus one galilee aunswered galilean emongst common people belieued bee nazaritehe sent hym herode c brought vp hys childehoode afterwarde led moste parte hys yeres therfore soone pylate perceyued sitte iudgement vpon priesoner belonge vnto herode shiefted hym ouer herode tyme chaunced hierusalemwhan herode sawe iesus excedyng glad howbeit al whole matter wrought doe dispensacion wisedome ordeinaunce god thend lorde iesus might bryng wyth hym testimonie hys innocencie bench courtes iustice malice byshops scribe chiefe headman might bee better manifested vnto worlde herode whan sawe iesus brought vnto hym glad syght man long tyme wyth chylde haue syghte iesus whome hearde many thynges verayly trusted woulde nowe come passethan questioned hym iesus woulde hys face shewe myracle suche heard veray many wroughte place hym wherfore questioned iesus many thynges one desierous geat many thynges iesus ende hymselfe myghte bee made better man therby satisfie hys owne curious fansye knowe thynges none thynges enquyred iesus suche woulde haue asked magian saye cunnyng man syght priuities phylosophy mysticall conclusion nature iesus come serue fasie lust wicked prince procure health vnto al creature made none aunswer allbut aunswered nothyng teachyng v meane season sometyme woorde god bee vttered whan euident persones vnworthy vnmete heare bishop whyle scrybes folow matter earnestly call vpon dooe eagrely lay charge afore herode fore fearing y tha arrained mighte meanes escape yet herode although wer wicked king yet nothing al moued accusacions one well apperceiued euer dooen entended arisen proceded enuie thinking sufficient despise hym despised clothed iesus way mockage white garmente guise maner goyng kynges emperoures sent backe pilateand herode warre despised hi c reproche lord taken herodes handes beyng prince grosse witte brayne armed garde beeyng lyke men like maister accordyng prouerbe among men suche sort felowe goe daunce rope orels one hath feate playe iuggelyng cast shall sooner haue praise thanke syncere preacher ghospell suche persones haue mynde ne wyll eyther haue pleasure delectacion shewed theym orels learne suche thinges maie serue maintenaunce tyranny yet withsta ding meane time herodes ciuilitie dyd condemne wickednes byshops scribe quitte iesus also seeyng condemned hym death beyng accused afore making aunswer offeces wer layed charge meane time thing highly contentacio herode pilate shewed hym muche honour sende iesus vnto haue sight whereupon time forewardes amitie fredship grewe betwene herode pilate wheras variaunce betwene wicked vngodly frendship made iniurie trueth euangelicall pand pilate called together high priestes rewlers people said vnto ye haue brought man vnto one peruerteth people behold examine hym find fault man thinges wherof ye accuse yet herode sent vnto loe nothyng worthy death doen vnto therfore chasten let looce necessitie must haue let one looce vnto feast al people cried saiyng away deliuer v barrabas certain insurreccion made citie murdre cast priso pilate spake willyng leat iesus looce cried saiyng crucifie crucifie said vnto third time eiuill hath dooen fynde cause death therfore chasten let goe cried loude voyces requiryng might crucified voice high priestes preuailed pilate gaue sentence required let looce vnto hym insurreccion murdre cast prison desired deliuered iesus dooe would whan pilate sawe prisoner sent backe herode purpose come suche effecte assayed bring begoon iudge become spokesman iesus callyng together bishop scribe chiefe men common came theyr tayles spake sorte ye haue youre owne myndes brought man one withdraweth people obedience emperour lawes youre presence haue dooen boulte truethe examinyng askyng dyuerse question hym neyther dooe fynde hym culpable crime ye accuse selfsame thing hath come passe herode whiche iudge better mattiers forasmuche man skilled lawes consideracion wherof also put ouer mater iudged tried courte founde guiltie would haue let escape hath founde hym anye offence woorthie deathe beeyng contented light punishment hath geuen man mocke one veraylye ui ing daungier death wherefore best also folowe equitie herode wil chastice manne lesser punishment death lette goe lorde presidente trusting furious rage iewes would asswage whan seene iesus put many reproches scourged whan pylate coulde doe good thys way neyther sawe madnesse iewes sette fyer therby deuised also caste howe deliuer iesus custome euery yere emongest iewes lorde president theyr
