highe solemnitie feastfull daye whiche hande leat goe pardon releasse vnto iewes one offendours would aske therfore president preuenting askyng putte choise whether twoo would haue pardoned realeassed vnto theimawaye hym deliuer v barrabas c iesus el barabas barabas greate robber notable felowe reason mischeuous dedes stiered vp sedicion citie slain one tounseme offence beene caste prieson lieutenaunte right well knewe felow al whole citie hated trusted would haue come passe would sooner haue suffred iesus bee lette goe doen muche good manye people manne distourber publike peace tranquillitie bishop theyr adherentes suche rage desired haue barabas releassed vnto theim iesus hanged vpon crosse kynd deathe like moste grieuous long peine accoumpted also moste shamefull tyme ferfurthe dyd iewes leaue kynd cruelnesse vnministred iesus pleased wisedom god iesus fountayne autour glory great contempte sedicious murdreer bee preferred dispaire yf tyme name doctrine christe despised suche loue worlde whan pylate perceyued yt coulde doe good way neither moued yet againe prouyng yf coulde meanes mytigate theyr stomakes deliuer iesus beeyng innocentbut cryed saying crucifie hi crucifie hym beyng eftsones stiered wrath sing furious song crucifie hym crucifie hym yet pilate geue place clamour cry neyther attempted thirde tyme pacifye saying iudge haue title agaynste innocentes neyther putte manne death whome fynde cryme death worthie hath man committed offended dyei fynde haue streightly examined cause fynde punyshed death bee small offence wil thus muche doe mindes sake punishe geue sharpe rebuke let goe frowardly still made striuyng agaynste equitie iudge prouffesand cryed loud voice c myghte bee crucified furious mad outcry requiring y might crucified barrabas leat goe whan president assayed possible wayes meanes perceiued cryed styll called water washe handes testifiyng innocecy iesus condemnyng frowarde maliciousnesse iewes gaue sentence death iesus owne mynde wilfull arbitrement iewes would nedes haue iesus put death beeyng autour life health releassed vnto barrabas sedicious murderer preferred iesus iesus deliuered vnto doe suche execucion vpon hym themselfes would led away caught one simon cyrene cummyng field hym layed crosse might beare iesus folowed great cumpany people woman whiche bewailed lamented iesus turned backe vnto said ye daughter ierusalem wepe wepe selues child behold dayes cum whiche shall say happye barraine wombes neuer bare pappes neuer gaue sucke shall begin say mountain fall v hilles couer v yf doe grene tree shalbe dooen drye vsed kynd opprobriousnes villany satisfie hatered clothed owne garmentes entente better knowen people broughte hym forth towardes place execucion bearing crosse himselfe maner goyng thitherward met chaunce one simon man cyrene cumyng ferme vpon whether would would layed lordes crosse entent iesus might goe beare crosse entent spare iesus shewe fauour might spedie dispeche accomplishe thyng went aboute meane tyme goddes prouidece figure procured churche bee afterwardes gathered gentile willingly enbrace crosse iesus folowed steppe fete folowed iesus also great multitude people menne woman priestes scribe reioysedye daughter ierusale wepe wepe yourselfes partes make much wailing lamentacion death innocet nothing el beyng poore folkes men peace could doe wycked conspiracie great iesus would haue death thyng lamentacion glory neyther would haue bewayled wurshypped whiche tooke vpon willingly redepcion whole worlde willed refraine vncomely lamentyng although proceded came godly affeccion ye daughter ierusalem saieth bewaile bewail owne cause childrens death innocent lameted confusion lamented theyr hainous wicked actes shall punished pieteous plague affliccions afterward also adiudged peines euerlasting miserable distresse extremitie doeth hang ouer region men shall call wemen happie whiche neuer bare childre wombes happie neuer brought furth fruite pappes happie neuer gaue sucke ye natural kindenesse mother grieued childres trouble owne reioyce though doen noble great act wha time goddes vengeauce shall come shal great feare mischifes hand come theyr mindes shal say mountaines ouerwhelme v hilles couer v grene tree shall doen dry withered tree derke sentence lord testifie imcomparable innocencie alone corrupt rottonesse vice inordinate desire altogether flourishing continually budding al kind vertues theyr malice shewe suche exauple cruelnesse altogether faultlesse punishemet ought haue wholly corrupted naughty affeccios could meanes brought honestie wer two euill dooers led hym slaine come place called caluarie crucified ciuill doer one right hande left saied iesus father forgeue theim wote dooe parted raymente caste lotte people stode behelde rewlers mocked theim sayinge saued men leate saue himselfe veray christe chosen god pompe prince king goe furth towardes triumphe also led execucion two offendours whiche condemned thesame matter thyng also matter procured iewes entente might bryng slaundre infamy emong comme people matched suche companionsand twoo ill dooers led wt hym slaine also pieked therunto place reason continuall execucion offendours place slau dreous name mortal bloud spilling named thing selfe golgotha white skulles bone folkes put death place tha iesus crucified ye middes betwixt two theues though diepe partaker theyr offence forasmuch partaker theyr punishmet whatsoeuer thyng malice iewes could deuise shame reproche lord iesus al turne owne glory health beyng innocent doeth owne submitte hymselfe saue men vnto worldly shame humbleth hymselfe somuch glory doeth deserue afore god afore man also thus please wisedom god thende might notable exaumple plucke downe pryde desire haue laude commendacion men yea euill dedes nowe iesus beeyng heighth lifted vp watch tower beako place would call thynges home vnto himselfe willing shewe moste perfecte exaumple pacience incomparable whereas beeyng innocente one many wayes doen good many harmes peines many kindes open worldly shame many mockes skornes ministred vnto also hanging crosse thyng doeth make euen veray mourdreers bee pietied gaue suche bittur woordes reuilyng grieuous manne abyde suffre death yet ferre auengeyng hymselfe ferre railyng agayne prayed father thesame person whose handes vngoodly shamefully handled father sayeth forgeue knowe doe thissame verayly holy prayer bishop aultare crosse offreyng vp euer sacrifice paschall lambe redempcion health whole worlde neither prayer without condigne effecte many thesame person whiche ignoraunce doer nailyng lorde crosse whan afterwarde knew trueth meane apostle preachyng professed name hym crucified howbeit malice phariseis also altogether without ignoraunce suche grosse ignoraunce dooeth deliuer ne discharge offence might haue lacked ignoraunce errour inordinate affeccions desire whiche led bondseruautes letted euen emong lyke mynde zele persecute lord paul dyd persecute churche god yf thou consyder moste ientill theophilus moste perfite innocencie iesus moste great goodnesse thesame iesus towardes creature moste high vertues minde beyond compariso excelled al others agayne contrary parte thou sette thyne iyes beholde hatred railyng reproches guile traines accusacions kynde death wiekednesse iewes put vnto shouldest heare hym vpon veray crosse middes reuilyng woordes praying father take vengeaunce forgeue weorkers doer hainous dede shall suche one seme vnto thee veray shamelesse persone whiche professing hymselfe disciple christe goe aboute bee auenged synner seeyng synner hymselfe yea although haue great iniurie displeasure occasioned prouoked therunto ferre suche persones vnnaturally swerue exaumple christe lyght woord reproche drawe theyr sweordes ready thrust theyr neighbour herte howe ferre also exaumple christe suche person digestyng tauntyng woorde thing stubbernely proudely spoken shake whole city whole kyngdomes pestilente blouddie warres enforce whole nacions wilful effusion spilling one others bloud let v moue iyes exaumple let v beholde folowe king christe subdueyng vpon crosse power tyranne satan vanquishing puissaunce worlde triumphing power many auaunce themselfes agaynste trueth ghospell whiche trueth behoueth otherwyse gette victory ne otherwise triumphe vnder standarde owne prince christ let v beholde bishop christe effectuall sacrifice pourgeyng puttyng awaye sinnes worlde nacions time past come suffreing punishment owne body menne thyng whiche freely offreeth vnto v sincere fayth receiue accepte menne acknowlagyng vnrighteousenesse enbracing vnspeakeable goodnesse towardes v whither doest thou turne thy face awaye thou vnhappie miserable sinner lord crieth father forgeue thou fallen despayre thy selfe doest thou either addresse hang thy selfe iudas el art thou heaper sinnes vpon sinnes cause thou shouldest hencefurth feare power satan christe hath gotten victory hym thy behoufe hath gotten victory high vpon tree crosse maye bee sene nacions louingly biddeth u come vnto hym three angle armes crosse doe ferre cal louingly aswell vnto asia europe also afrike biddeth come partaking euerlasting helth iesus ferthermore hanged naked vpon crosse would haue thyng worldes forasmuche executyng heauenly sacrifice teachyng v veray right exaumple true matier dede howe pure affeccions howe clere desire worldly thynges euangelicall bishop ought haue meane tyme souldiers crucified hym though haue rysen agayne castyng lotte parte deuide lordes clothes emongst themseluesand parted raymente c manier rewarde theyr wicked seruice iesus pleasure beyng spoyle taken hym remayne souldiers v beyng professours name would poynte carnalitie remayne thentent loue spirite euen present daye also clothes v lyke dooeth dayelye hang vpon crosse v behoufe thynges thesame must according spirite wise therfore priestes scribe phariseis chiefe people together souldiers whiche doen execucion crucifying iesus dooe skorne hym hanging crosse one beyng brought confusion man destitute hope castyng hym teeth wheras reporte goen holpen many one miracle hable saue hath saued others say leat salueour himselfehe saued men lette hym saue hymselfe c leaste wise case thatsame christe hath bosted hymselfe case thatsame derely beloued chosen sonne god whome hath talke auouched suche woordes chiefe rewlers caste hearing people wont wondre myracles christe thentent might turne myndes sayed people awaye hym yea ferthermore theyr woordes drowne vtterly wype away hym autoritie euery whit prouing wer couincing matier self case stoode neyther messias neyther sonne god openly taken vpon himselfe excepte would come downe crosse healthe safegarde worlde consiste cummyng downe continuyng throughly enduryng ende thesame enduryng ende weight force iesus opprobrious reuilyng wordes chiefe headman pthe souldiers also mocked hym came offred hym vineagre sayed yf thou kyng iewes saue thy selfe superscripcion written ouer hym letter greke latine hebrue kynge iewes one ciuill dooers whiche hanged rayled hym saying thou bee christe saue thy selfe v answered rebuked saying fearest thou god seeyng thou art damnacion righteouslye punished receyue accordynge dedes thys man hath dooen nothynge amysse sayede vnto iesus lorde remembre whan thou comest thy kyndome iesus sayed vnto hym uerayly saye vnto thee daye shalt thou bee paradyse souldiers grosse kynde men partly ignoraunt iewishe religion partly despisers skorned iesus reported chalenged kyng ouer iewes moued therto doubtelesse exaumple chiefe iewes nacion thesame souldiers reachyng vp vineagre vnto hym waye mockage sayed thou kyng iewes shewe thy power quickely deliuer thy selfe daungier iesus premiss shewed moste perfecte exaumple myldnesse paciece holding peace al opprobrious wordes also superscripcion poisee written top crosse directly ouer head greke latine hebrewe letter mighte better reade nacionsand sup scripcion writt ouer hym kyng iewes also veraily thought belieued haue doen mocke yet enough neyther one malefactours hanged hard iesus side rayled hym crosse hanged saying thou thatsame christe salueour worlde nowe saue thy selfe v also hangyng likewyse crosse consyderyng meruaylous great mekenesse iesus blamed rebuked felow whiche suffred peynes hangyng hymselfe dyd co mitted one offence saying thou thou haue thee reuerence towardes men ne shame world leastwyse thou oughtest feare god speakyng suche opprobrious woordes vpon one muste dyebut auswered rebuked hym saying c especially seeyng thyselfe doest suffre thesame punishement euen thatsame one thyng alone ought haue staighed bridled thee raylyng although eguall offender v nowe great diuersitie betwene case suffre punishement offence dyeth innocente double inhumanitie rayle vpon one must dye also vpon innocent testimonie crosse geue vnto iesus innocencie might euery syde testified thesame immediately turnyng hymselfe iesus sayed lord remembre whan thou comest thy kyngdome meruailous fayth thefe whan sawe iesus hangyng crosse poynte dying himselfe also assured dye thesame placeand iesus saied daye shalt thou bee wt paradise yet asked health iesus kyng nowe iesus dumme deafe reuilyng woordes deafe dumme manne askyng helpe assured fayth trust hym make thee sure sayeth christe present daye shalt thou paradise boubtlesse promising hym haue rest refreashyng immediately soone punishement suffreyng ouer past howe happie thyng euermore ioyned christe al place time saueth yf euangelicall fayth bee present pand sixth houre darkenesse ouer yearth vntyll ninth houre soonne darkened vaile temple rente euen middes whan iesus cried loude voice sayed father thy handes commende spirite whan thus sayed gaue vp ghoste whan centurion sawe happened glorified god saying uerayly righteous man people came together sighte sawe thynges whiche happened smote theyr brestes returned acquayntaunce woman folowed galile stood ferre beholdyng thynges nowe well nigh sixte houre daye saye euen muche aboute noonetyde doe iewes rekon houre noonetyde whiche tyme daye sunne woonte bee moste hotte shyne moste brightest came soodaynly great derkenesse ouer thatsame countrey aboute hierusalem continued till nynth houre saye till three clocke afternoone sunne detesting abhorryng suche great iniquitie men hyde face suche time put death light worlde yearth also dyd quake stone brake soondre euery parte nature trembled horrible dede crueltie ferthermore vaile temple whiche parted inner holy place whiche called sanctum sanctorum parte temple rented quite soondre twoe partes manne stieryng shewyng openly shadowes ceremony iewes nowe ceasse sacrifice accomplished whiche alone sufficient pourge clense sinnes tymes past come iesus whan loude crye sayed father commende spirite thy handes yelded vppe ghoste myght bee euidente men dyd fainte others wonte doe strength theyr body litle litle consuming awaye byanby strong stretche crye woordes distinctely pronounced willingly ye woulde sayewhan centurion sawe c glorified god c owne accorde gaue vp ghoste thyng dyd centurion well apperceiue marke purposely stode hard crosse man take downe alyue tree man also iesus testimonie innocencie glorified god shewed great power sayed uerayly man righteous openly condemning vnrighteousnesse iewes whosoeuer pronounceth hym innocent condemned maketh hym offendour hath condemned thesame coumpanie common guise come see execucion dede great many moe would el haue come partely fauour partely hatred iesus drawen thither whan seen thynges whiche fortuned returned home knockyng theyr brestes partely sorowe man innocente doer suche good dedes vngodly intreated partely feare stroke vengeaunce god whiche knowing themselfes culpable theyr owne conscience straunge token seen mistrust deme hang ouer thesame manne whome lyfe tyme seen lowe poore degree none lyke contemned thesame doe see euen dying houre manne great power insomuche elementes worlde shaken disordred ut theyr course eftsones theophilus marke thou one po tymes grace founde gentile iewes tooke vnto laude deuocion towardes god holy conuersacion aboue others centurion glorifieth god iewes doe feare strokeand acquaintaunce ye weomen folowed hym fro galile c made afearde thynges woondre whereas many benefites could possibly wonne ferthermore iesus kynred familiare life time stode ferre beholding doen durst feare come nerer emongst also wemen desire good minister thynges necessarie disciple folowed galile witness beholder thynges doen thesame beyng nowe destitute hope dyd nothyng el mourne make lamentacion hym beholde man named ioseph counsaylour good man iust thesame consented counsayle dede aramathia citie iewes whiche also waited kingdome god went vnto pilate begged body iesus tooke downe wrapped linnen cloth laied sepulchre hewen stone wherein neuer manne laied beeyng therfore many euident token assuredly well seen knowen lorde vndoubtedly dead leste man myght fynde poynte cauillacion eyther veray naturall manne dede orels veraily dead behold cometh man owne free offre lordes buriall myght executed accomplished buriall iesus pleasure clenly honourable life milde lowe without bearing part death thyng muche effecte buriall magnificent resurreccion glorious euen veray houre euen god would cometh willingly owne free offre certain named ioseph borne aramathia citie iewry good man iust one noumbre loked kingdom god although one chiefe men nacion noble senatour rewler yet neuer consented cousayle dedes priestes scribe head people although feare power hated iesus durst openly professe acknowlage good zele herte towardes iesus yet geuen vnto boldenesse holy ghost thynges despised might haue power openly professe name iesus disciple therfore drieuen away feare ioseph together wt nicodemus dareth take hande office burying lorde whether fauour menne towardes good doeth death thesame encreace orels saied ioseph iudged ye enuy iewes iesus saciate death wherfore cometh vnto pilate man well knowe reaso nobilitie asked ye body iesus pilate would geue perfect knowlage centurio throughly dead ioseph toke body taken downe crosse enbaumed ouer swete odoriferous sauours wounde vp fyne shete hauing meane time hope resurreccion whiche iesus briefly fewe woordes geuen knowlage litle afore vnto disciple suche wyse doen thesame page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate disciple better remembred beleued opinion iesus good man putte death without cause thoughte honour remembraunce magnificente buiriall wherupon laied corpse toumbe stoode garden platte therby hewe whole piece rocketstone eue grew whiche neuer body buryed thinges wheras present semed bee dooen mere chaunce yet altogether dooen prouidence ordeynaunce god iewes might quarel make cauillacions toumbe hauing hole made body taken way chaunged day preparyng sabboth sabboth drewe wome folowed whiche cum galilee beheld sepulchre body layed returned prepared swete odour oyntmentes rested sabboth day accordyng commaundement whan thinges doyng day preparacion saye eane high sabboth called parasceue vpon day prepared al thinges necessary solemne kepyng sabboth daye shoulde bee morowe entent might bee compelled doyng bodily labour breake reste sabboth daye woman whiche farre loked vpo iesus crosse folowed buirial would ignoraunt body iesus layed place maner orderyng layed ende might knowe whan come thynges beeyng diligently vieued marked thei returne home prepared spice odour oyntementes wherewith myght afterward dresse bodye lorde although nowe already soso myght anoynted ouer myrthe nicodemus godly deuocion woman minded put precious thyng lordes corpse lorde therefore suffered allabastre precious oyntemente bee powred vpon hym beecause woulde nottary woman swete oyntementes tyme whose deuoute diligence neuerthelesse auayled confirme belefe resurreccion whan seke hym dead bee anoynted spyced haue due knowelage alyue nowe sunne sette thesame day vntill eauenyng nexte day folowyng rested accordyng prescripcion lawe standyng goddes precepte shoulde doe bodily labour sabboth daie sunne sette finished begoonne preparyng oyntementes spice selfsame tyme also lorde kepte sabboth restyng graue sayd day preparacion executed accomplished woorke redempcion vnderstande mankynde restored thesame manne created finished makyng worlde sixte daye seuenth day rested worke thesame lorde finished redempcion world sixt daie parasceue day rested graue rested working touchyng humain body vntill eight day dyd shyne eight daye iewes knowe christian doe wurshippe eight daye daye mortalitie reste werinesse weorke idlenesse shall course enterchaungeably one succede shalbe euerlastynge gladnesse neyther shall daye folowe night night daye agayne course continuall euerlastyng light shall shine iyes godly xxiiii chapter vpon firste daye sabbothes veray erely mornyng came vnto sepulchre brought swete odour prepared woman found stone rolled awaye sepulchre went f und body lorde iesus happened amased therat behold two men stoode shynyng garmetes afrayed boughed dow theyr face yearth sayed vnto seke ye liuing emong dead arisen remembre howe spake vnto whan yet galile saying sonne man muste deliuered haundes synnefull men crucified thyrde daye aryse agayne selie weomen rested doyng weorke thynge geuen solemnitie sabbothe assoone lawfull returne agayne workynge diligence weomen bestowed tyme watchyng sunnesette aboute deuoute piece woorke yet woorke neded daye first nexte folowyng sabbothe saye eight daye whan sabbothe daye fully ended euen veray erely firste breake daye make haste vnto graue carrying spieces swete sauours whiche hadde purposely prepaired certes bestowe laste poynte honour euer shoulde shewe vnto hym beeyng dead tendrely loued whyle aliue wheras yet neuerthelesseand found stone rolled away sepulchre truste hope euer shoulde aryse agayne life mouth sepulchre stopped shut fast vp mightie big stone suche one might vneath remoued awaye good many men also seale set theron thyng prouided doen phariseis scribe leste felowe mighte priuely haue stolen awaye dead body sprede abrode vntrue rumoure arisen life agayne coulde nowhere found kepers moreouer set lorde lieutenauntes men weomen whyle carefully looke round stone might rolled asyde see soodainlye remoued awayeand thei went way come sepulchre lying wyde open tooke hertes entre deuocion loue towardes god geuen boldenesse euen weomen whan entred fynde bodie lorde iesus whan matier soore dismayed manier killed theyr veraye hertes whan stone remoued conceyued veraye good hope yet syde againe wer great meruayle possible graue bee emptie whiche hadde euen byanby afore seen shutte seal vp soodaynly stande harde twoe aungels fourme lykenesse twoe young menne gladsome frendely countenauncetwoe men stode shynyng garmentes c theyr garmentes glitteryng maner clere brightnesse lightning thissame veray lightnesse sight aungels open semblaunt triumph arysing agayne lyfe whan weomen beeyng throughly afrayed straunge syght cast countenaunce iyes downe vpon grounde durst loke streight vpon maiestie visio thing aboue reache man nature sayed aungels mylde amiable speakyng vnto doe ease recoumforte hertes beeyng astouned soodayne feare ye weomen saye aungels doe ye seke hym graues dead liuesman dede layed whan dead nowe forasmuche reuiued agayne graue dead doe reste arysen agayne death life walketh liuesman emong lyuing owne woordes foreshewed dye foreshewed tyme also kynde death thesame also foreshewed would third day returne lyfe againe ye belieue hym bee dead ye sawe belieue ye also arysen againe liferemembre howe spake vnto c pointe deceyue whiche parte tolde trueth hath sorowe trouble mynde made forget thynges tolde aforehande lette come remembraunce againe howe thynges whiche haue nowe dooen leafte one poynte vnspoken vntolde aforehande whan yet galile tolde afore decreed wysedome ordeynaunce father redempcion mankynde sonne man deliuered handes synners bee accused beaten setfurth receyue al kyndes mocking skorning finally beyng hoighced vp vpon crosse put death yet thesame man thirde daye returne lyfe agayne call ye tyme well vnto knowlage taken downe crosse well towardes euentyde preparacion daye layed thissame graue daye rekoned firste daye death whole sabboth day rested sepulchre nowe dayspring third day third day himselfe arising together thesame hath willed gladsome prosperous whole worlde woordes spoken aungels vanished awaye theyr sight pand remembred woordes returned sepulchre tolde thynges vnto eleuen remnaunt mary magdalene ioanna mary iacobi tolde thynges vnto apostle theyr woordes semed vnto feigned thinges neyther beleued arose petur ran vnto sepulchre loked sawe linen clothes layed themselfes departed woondreyng himselfe whiche happened wemen aungels bringyng remembraunce doe call memorie lorde iesus woordes whiche tolde aforehand vnto disciple aswell death also resurreccion whervpon leauyng monumente make hast eleuen apostle disciple feare iewes lay secrete place gathered together euen themselues forgotte maner thinges iesus tolde wer manier despayre doe weomen bryng newes seen heard aungels first weoman eue beeyng deceyued serpent allured housebande adam doe amysse deuoute weomen beeyng taught aungels doe moue exhort men promptenesse beleuing therfore weomen kynde shoulde euermore without ende continue slaunder oblique death issued menand woords semed vnto feigned thing moste gladsome tidinges lyfe restored agayne doethe therehence procede whence occasion death hath first issued weomen whiche brought fyrst newes premiss vnto apostle marie magdalene systur lazarus ioanna wyfe chusa herodes agent factour mary mother iames younger whiche also called systur mary lordes mother many weomen whiche coumpany woont goe iesus euer wente vncredible mat er brought newes weomen beyng estemed bee vessel sumwhat fraile founde suche regarde bee credyted emong apostle lorde suche consideracion suffred bee slacker beleue assured trueth hys resurreccion myghte moe euidente proufes token bee confy med therfore sayed weomen reported soodayne seeyng aungels stone momente remoued mouth sepulchre semed apostle disciple bee poynte dotage suche reigneth weomenthan arose peter thys sexe woman kynde hauyng conceipte imaginacion somewhat infected corrupte weakenesse reason good iudgemente doe many time belieue themselfes see thei see heare yt heare although belieue mattier trueth weomen reported yet dyd theyr earnest affirmyng standynge therin thus muche auayle peter arysyng place sate ran furth monument puttyng hys head lokyng afore hym fyndeth body piece linnen whiche body iesus wound vp seeth liyng aside place themselfes yet neyther dyd belieue lorde arisen agayne death lyfe diepe forgetfulnesse taken hym thynges iesus sayed awaye went sepulchre meruaylyng himselfe befallenand departed w dreyng himselfe c doubtyng whether body taken awaye bodye monument castyng many soondry thynges minde entent purpose thatsame poynte dooen body taken awaye sawe linen piece leafte behynde thynges laysurely taken body whiche could without buisinesse haue plucked sawe thesame linen piece cast aboute auenture one one handesomely layed vp theyr place ordre kerchefe wherwith head face iesus couered beyng layed selfe aparte rest pand beholde twoo went thatsame daye toune called emaus whiche hierusalem aboute three score furlonges talked together thinges happened chaunced commoned together reasoned iesus himselfe drewe nere wente theyr iyes holden shoulde knowe hym sayed vnto manier communica ion ye haue one another ye walke sad one whose name cleophas aunswered sayed vnto arte thou onely straungier hierusalem hast knowen thynges whiche haue chaunced dayes sayed vnto thynges sayed vnto hym iesus nazareth whiche prophete mightie dede woorde god al people howe high priestes rewlers deliuered condemned death haue crucified trusted whiche haue redemed israel touchyng thynges daye euen thirde daye doen yea certaine weomen also companie made v astouned whiche came erely vnto sepulchre founde bodye came saying seen vision aungels whiche sayed aliue certayne whiche v went sepulchre founde euen weomen sayed hym sawe befell euen veray daye twoo disciple vnto newes tofore reported sepulchre y found voyde without body ittwo went daye toue called emaus although credence geue theyr wordes sayed two disciple leauyng citie hierusalem wente vnto towne called emaus emaus distaunte hierusalem mountenaunce thre score furlonges whiche eight goe myle hierusalem emaus seuen myles one halfe myle rekonyng theyr goyng waye talked together many sondrie matiers men commonly vse doe namely whan sorowe pensifenesse theyr hertes men greatly dismaied caste heauinesse lordes death euen nowe manier veraye poynte desperacion cast awaye hope theyr talkyng altogether iesus thynges whiche seen whiche heard latter dayes aforegoyngwhile thei commoned together c hadde borne great loue towardes hym one notable man full beneficiall goodnesse albeit gaye royall hope restoryng kyngdom israel theyr mindes almoste cleane forgotten yet delite mutuall talking one renewe memorie hym euen dead theyr myndes beyng altogether vnquiete troubled certayn kynde slumbre ye would saye creped vpon slepe beare loue towardes hym could forget last diuising tellyng betwene themselues many thynges iesus talkyng many matiers fro one behold euen personallye presente talked iesus tofore promised would bee myddes betwene wheresoeuer fynde two persones talking together hym tyme euen corporall presence body also shew thing whiche spirite neuer ceasseth doebut theyr iyes holden ioyned himselfe coumpanye waifaryng manne offred hymselfe kepe company waye likenesse vnknowen body verai whiche death pleased iesus haue theyr iye sight impediment could knowe though sawe hym corporally happie coumpanye blyssed goddes hande often twoo person haue none talke ne make none serchyng iesus happie euer borne whome iesus vouchesalueth ioyne hymselfe mate coumpanion lorde iesus hath good fansie bee presente suche talke hym doeth satan reioyce bee present emong vse suche communicacions together emong may corrupt honest behaueour exaumple leacherie falsehood auengeyng pryde gaynes lu slaudre neighbour two men dyd burne loue iesuswhat maner communicacios yt ye haue one c reason humaine frailtie doubted promisses lorde litle season deceyuyng theyr iyesyght sercheth opnion thing vnknowen would remedie vnbeliefe better cofirming feith therfore sayeth talke thissame ye two haue betwene waye ye goe countenaunce moode shewyng whyle sorowe heauinesse herte euen thyng also doeth commonly asswage sorowe yf may fortune haue body whose lap may poure thyng grieueth v yea one propertie ferthermore hath man affeccion yf thyng ons veray high contentacion delite thynketh thesame vnknowen euery body hath speciall care regarde therof muche rate affeccion doeth one ye disciple aunswerart thou onely straunger hierusalem c whose name cleophas sayeth thyng veray well knowen many enhabite liue hierusale seeing thou comest citie aswel possible thou alone wer sum newcome straunger shouldest ignoraunt thynges haue doen nowe last dayes man alyue knoweth iesus one couetyng learne veray dede come teache aunswered thynges ye speake playnly mening good feith vp declare large vnto iesus summe whole matter straunger one ignoraunte doen frankely makyng open confession howe fer wer hauyng yet opinion iesus wurthy wurthinesse howe clene cast awaye hope maner arisyng death life talking say telling story one iesus nazareth excellent man prophete mightie woorde dede onely afore god veray dere beloued also emog people vniuersall miracle doctrine benefites purchaced gotten high autoritie high priestes rewlers people pursued death lieutenaunt conclusion nailled crosse nowe conceyued certayne maruaylous hope hymbut trusted whiche haue redemed israel haue redemed people israel men beyng vtterly beliefe messias long agon promised prophetes death bothe vndoubtedly true also full open worldely shame hath taken away hope v ye smal hope put heades would come passe would thre dayes haue returned agayne life wheras condemned crucified buried veray present daye thirde daye sence thinges fortuned doen yet doe see whitte assured hope sauyng certayn weme fraternitie disciple haue reportyng certayn straunge newes suche neuer heard made v yea astouned afore yea certayne wemen also cou pa ny made v ouned cfor wemen went furth sunrisyng sepulchre say playnly founde body affirme moreouer certayne aungels appered vnto sayed aliue wha man gaue credite theyr reporte certayne coumpany went also graue proue whether fond wemens tale trueth concerning graue selfe found matter goe euen wemen made relacion found ope emptie piece linnen also thynges corpse cast found within graue layed vp together one corner hymselfe found hym sayed vnto fooles slowe herte beleue prophetes haue spoken ought christe haue suffred thynges entre glorie began moses prophetes enterpreted vnto scripture wrytten drewe nigh vnto toune whiche wente vnto made though would haue gon ferther constrayned sayinge abyde v draweth towardes nyght daye farre passed wente tary whan two disciple tale tellyng simply declared howe greatly wauered theyr myndes howe lytle hope lordes promisses iesus dede doeth yet suffre hymselfe bee knowen like one iesus disciple better enfourmed enstructed matter chydeth dulnesse capacitie rebuketh vnbeliefe ye hard witted felowes sayeth vnapte bee taught vnderstanding scriptureso fooles slowe herte beleue prophetes haue spoken hard herte slowe beleue many holy sayinges prophetes haue wrytten christ doe thynges nowe appere straunge vnto bee wrought doen already seeyng prophecy prophetes dyd many hundred yeres past tell aforehande afterwarde bee doen doe ye conferre compare theyr foretellynges thinges haue nowe wrought executed doe scripture haue inspiracio god written teache howe pleased prouidece god christ suffre thynges whiche hath suffred sorte vncouthe conueighauce restore lyfe meane death meane crosse recouer kyngdom open shame worlde enter gloryought christe haue suffred thinges c world hath glory neither true glory dede yet perpetual endure euer suche person acquire get thesame get vaine petigrewes tytles rychesse bounteous geuyng stately porte ruffleyng worlde yea many tymes get men whether extorte power christ shall ferre vnlyke way meanes recouer winne vnto emong men owne glory creacion worlde shewe vnto mortall men pathway ought stoutely breake passage vnto true glory shall neuer dye bega moseswhere moses hath matter taught many lesson prophetes haue foretold many thinges ye yet stil grosse minde vnderstanding ye looke messias captaihn wiche shall vsurpe vnto himselfe kingdom world entre possessio therof charyottes horse elephauntes wilde ass armed hostes men gunnes crossebowes ingiens fyer sweorde bloud doe ye yet fele scripture spirituall power messias consiste garrison fortress meanes whiche prince worlde doe either get theyr handes orels enlarge temporall kyngdomes contrariwyse consiste vertue power celestiall doe ye rather serche try scripture haue already foreshewed many thynges christe conferre thesame thynges christe foreshewed hymselfe vnto disciple haue come effect accordyng foreshewed meanes shall come passe neither thyng matter haue late fallen shall seme vncouthe straunge thinges promised afterwarde come shall matter ye conceyue mystrust lorde lytle fitte chidyng made earnest geue better hede eare matter declared vnto scripture openly foreshewed thing come passe christe nowe late fortuned shewyng many prophecy figure effectes thinges facte cumyng passe iustely accorde time gether must nedes bee one syde token certaine exceding great dulnesse espie marke syde notable mystrustefulnesse belieue processe begonne moses prophetesand ente preted al scripture whiche writte hym gatheryng euery booke holy scripture one poynte might enforce credite thinges fore already happened also purchace credite aforehand thinges afterward come place scripture sorte conferre one matter appered clere euident happy euer borne thought worthy heare heauenly teacher liuely voice expouning thesame thinges large afore caused writte prophetes hauyng instinct owne holy spirite sufficient recite make relacion certaine noumbre place gathered blissed talkyng christe sayed two disciple whiche place would god iewes would leastewyse euen last geue eare vnto would leaue looking messias would earnest zele affeccion embrace man iesus geuen worlde onely salueour redemer whereby myght saued myght made free yf empire cesar yet leastewyse blissefull thyng tyrannie deuill myght theyr captaine christe atteyne kyngdome worlde whiche fraile transitorie heauen whiche knoweth none ende moses saied iewes doe maner lesse wurship certain god coducted brought people israel egypte deliuered vnto deserte lawe obseruing kepyng wherof atteyne deliueraunce safegard come lande flowing wt honey mylke thissame moses thing certain shadowe christe come sonne god seruaunt veray true dede deliuer people seeyng afterward bondage vnder king babilon vtterly without synne neuer entred owne persone lande vnto whiche guide captayne people case entred great matter seeyng yt idolatres enhabiting selfe lande euen present daye thynges beeyng vnderstanded fleshe doe conteyne great matter christe thatsame true right moses owne propre power doth deliuer hebrewes onely also vniuersall nacions worlde many doe put theyr affiauce suche doeth deliuer vengeaunce stroke god deliuereth tyranny deuill deliuereth derkenesse errours deliuereth abhominable bondage synnes whan hath first clensed owne bloud bryngeth forth fredome spirite beyng perpetuall guyde coumpanion also vntill bryng past daugiers presente lyfe vnto thatsame heauenly lande aboue plenteously flowyng rennyng ouer kindes blisse felicitie true moses made lawe ghostely euangelicall whiche lawe teache corporall righteousnesse ceremony sacrifice beastes geue true perfeite righteousnesse feith charitie suche one spring vp moses himselfe foresayed thus speaketh deuteronomiedeut xviiic lorde thy god shall reise vp vnto thee prophete thyne owne nacion thine owne brother hath doen shalt thou heare forthwith euen thesame deuteronomie lord confirmeth promisse moses saying deut xviii di shall reise vp vnto prophete myddes brethre lyke vnto thee shall put woordes mouth shall speake vnto wordes shall comaunde enioyne speak ye haue prophecie moses compare thing prophecie sprang vp none moses hath meanes eagually matched authoritie sauing iesus christ hath suche wise resembled moses euery waye ferre passed moses maker newe testament thesame testamente euer endure testamente hath consecrated bloud calfe owne bloud ye maker newe lawe lawe bryng present helth moses ministre seruaunt god christ sonne came downe heauen taught thynges whiche sawe aboue father one hauing within himselfe perpetuall vncessaunte power doe whatsoeuer wyll moses vpon mountayne talked god cloude christ hath proceded come foorth brightenesse father moses taught deliuered shadowes thynges christ taught gaue trueth moses sort make intercession sinnes people hymselfe hath nede mediatour owne offence christ beyng clere synne pourged clensed sinnes al age time aswell past come moses fasted fowertie day christ dyd thesame one might leastewyse token knowe seconde moses moses brought lawe firste downe mountayne christe mountayne taught perfeccionyng lawemat v luke vi whan pronounced straunge beatitude neuer afore heard taught often tymes also temple whiche sette mounte sion whiche thing doen according prophecie esai sayeth lawe shall come sion woorde lorde hierusalem tyme lawe moses made geuenesai ii thynges wer wholly replete terrours snibbe hamper hardenesse herte reigned people christe came milde amiable rather terrible conuincing reason prouokyng benefites alluryng mekenesse offreyng himselfe menne readie euery manne geue health ouercummyng paciente suffreaunce suche maner one holy sayinges prophetes afore promised ye haue read esai hath wrytten haue geuen hym spiriteesai xlii may shewe foorth iudgemente equitie emong gentile shall cryer lifte vppe hys voice voice shall heard stretes brused rede shal breake smokyng flaxe shall quenche faithfully truly shal geue iudgement pensife carefull may restore righteousnesse vnto earth gentile also shall kepe lawes againe esai certain place maketh messias speakyng maner spirite lord god vpon lord hath enoynted hath sent preache good tydynges vnto pooreesai lxi myght bynde vp wounded hertes might preache deliueraunce vnto captiue open prieson bounde myght declare acceptable yere lorde daye vengeaunce god myght coumforte heauinesse myght geue strength herte vnto mourne sion myght geue say beautie stede ash ioyfull oynctement syghyng pleasaunt raymente heauy mynde ye haue heard maner one prophecie promised shoulde nowe rekon myndes whether came euen suche one promised sexe age state high lowe remoue putte beneficiall goodnesse child wemen publicanes synners harlottes kinde disease cry fie vpon turne face lepres men possessed deiuils persones possessed bloudie flixes folkes diseased palsie coulde bee meke ientyll saying whiche ye haue heard spoken owne mouthmath xi come vnto ye laboure loden shall refreshe yoke swete burden light learne ye meke lowe herte ye shall fynde reaste vnto soules mother hath euer loued suffred cherished hir childre disciple besydes lawe moses neyther geuen people al age christes lawe like geue vnto al nacios age ne time chauged vntill thende world cosidre ye behalfe also howe poyntes doe iustely agree one firste formoste howe clerely plainly hieremy prophecie vnto afore circumcision body shall ceasse together sleaghyng beastes sacrifice solemnisyng sabbothes obseruacion dayes difference meates fastes vowes residue ceremony whiche season purpose geuen might vnto iewes figure thynges spirituallhiere iiii plough lande sayth sowe emong thornes ye circumcised lorde take ye awaie foreskynne hertes ye iuda enhabitautes hierusalemhier xxxi f certain place thesame prophete sayeth beholde dayes shall come sayeth lord shall make newe league couenaunte house israel house iuda tenour couenaunte whiche couenaunted father forthwith added manifest difference betwene thatsame lawe beeyng rough vnpossible man beare whiche without good cause written stone whiche stone hardnesse represente hardnesse iewes hertes betwene lawe euangelicall meane wherof innocencie freely offred faythhier xxxi f shall couenaut sayeth whiche make house israel dayes sayeth lorde shall plante lawe inward partes theyr hertes wryte thesame forthwith teacheth shadowes also lawe shall cease soone lyght trueth shewed forth thensforth shall man teache neighbour brother saying knowe thou lorde people shall know leaste moste sayth ye lorde shall haue mercy theyr iniquitie shall neuer remembre theyr sinnes doe ye remembre christe spake thinges agreable herunto wha yet liuyng manifestly denounce geue warnyng endemath xi b luke ivi ihon iiiic lawe whan sayed lawe prophetes reigned vntill iohn iewes wurshipped god prayed vnto citie hierusalem sayed iesus samaritane woman houre shall come nowe already present whan ye shall neither mountaine yet hierusalem wurship father spirite shall wurship hym math xii math ii luke vi adid secretely without making woordes beginne abrogate lawe whan healed sabbothes phariseis vain roaring hym whan spake defence maintenaunce disciple slaundreous querelyng saied phariseis tyme hys disciple plucked eares wheate corne field ye sabboth daymath ix c marke ii e luke v f whan plaied aduocate thesame disciple sebleable querele pieked thesame phariseis dyd kepe theyr solene fastemat viii marke luke vc mat ix marke ii luke e great dele time healed lepre without ceremony thing lawe forbiddeth touched one handes codemned lepry priestes time without remedy lawe forgeue sinnes vnto possessed paulsey woman sinner rushed phariseis house vnbidden diner many moe besides ye law commauded burnt offreynges sacrificed synnesmat xxvi mar iiiii luke ii f iohn xii offence committed pourged clesed certain sacrifice oblacions appoynted name christe beeyng newe reforger old law stede burnt offreing substitute charitie saith many synnes forgeuen hir hath loued muche substituted feith stede sacrifice tyme also whan sayed sonne haue thou sure feith trustmath xix mar x thy synnes forgeuen thee yea yet manifestly also certain seaso shew vnto diuersitie lawesluke xvi math v f math v g new olde forbidding diuorce ye lawe moses permission graunted also whan forbidde swearing former lawe moses forbidden also whan comaunded loue enemy wheras olde lawe permitte hate enemie also aueged trespace altogether abrogate take awaie al autoritie priestes scribe phariseis yet still hold grosse letter lawe fast teethmath xv v let alone saied blind guydes blind prophetes foreshewed thing also thynges carnall tyme cummyng geue place thynges spirituall doe ye remembre daniell prophete doeth wryte preuaricacion sayeth may vttermostedaniel ix f synne may haue ende iniquitie may wyped cleane awaye euerlasting righteousnesse may brought vision prophecie may fulfilled holy holyes may enoyn ted whan ye heare prophecy consummate brought theyr perfeite effect verayly ye doe nowe vnderstande suche thynges alreadie past doen ought longer looked still come whe ye heare eternall righteousnesse ye vnderstande righteousnesse lawe whiche endure whyle nowe abolished whan ye heare messias enoynted holy holyes alone maketh thynges holy forsoth ye vnderstand corporall enoyntyng must ceasse priesthood lawe together oblacions sacrifice thesame abrogated iesus neuer enoynted thatsame holy oyntement lawe veray scrupulously teache make threatenyng death vnto persones whosoeuer coutrefeited practised lyke confeccio applied thesame nto secular v enoynting body maketh nothyng effecte purpose priestes signe spirituall enoynting wherwith christe enoynted accordyng recited erewhyle prophecie spirite god vpon meesai lxi lorde hath enoynted wherunto psalmiste dauid accordeth speaking messias therfore god thy god hath enoyncted thee oyle gladnesse aboue thy compierspsal xliiii b math iii marke b luke iii iohn iv prophete promised ye sawe perfourmed wha iesus baptised fluime iordane holy ghoste came visible lykenesse lighted toppe head voice father heard enoynted sone oyle gladnesse aboue prophetes patriarkes yea aboue mortall creature whiche eyther tyme past haue nowe present herafter shalbe heauenly spirituall enoyntyng hath sette ende priestehood moses institutyngdaniel ix f whiche thyng daniel doeth forthwith clerely bryng sayinge middes weke hostes sacrifice shall faill neyther thyng god ment speakyng esai one whose stomake arose stode corporall sacrifice beastes care multitude killyng sacrifice sayeth lorde full burnt sacrifice wether greace fatte beastes bloud calfes lambes goates none nowe ferthermore danielluke xix f manifestly foreshewe destruccion throwyng downe citie hierusalem gether temple therof dyd christe prophecie thesame vnto disciple wepyng iyes lamenting bewailyng wofull case extremitie thesame citie people grieued god already beeyng spirituall made wery enhabite temple made built vp handes man nothyng delited offreynges beastes slain sacrifice founde misse lacke citie whiche thatsame name hierusalem myght truely light missed wanted temple mete hym dwell builded himselfe consecrated hallowed owne spirite sacrifice oblacions nacion circumcised herte name israel might truly agree nowe nothing perpetual cotinuaunce may seen bodily iyes thynges seen euerlasting therfore mete semely god eternitie selfe neuer haue end yet shadowes thinges visible geue time grosse vntrained people ende might one daye processe tyme fyrste introduccions growe procede forwarde thynges minde iesus whose stomake stode muche aswel citie also temple nacion sacrifice olde lawe doeth prophetes declare euidently enough maner thynges wished thensforth haue stede others nowe rehersed haue ye read esai wrote heauenly hierusalem esai gthou shalt sayth hensforth called citie righteous man feithfull citie sion shall redemed iudgemente shall bryng hir home righteousnesse ye heare new buildyng citie whiche churche congregacion built vp liuyng stone corner stone wherof foundacion wherof veray christe himselfe stone prophecie ye mistical psalme signifie sayethpsal cxviic mat xxi mar xii luke xxc stone whiche builder refused cast asyde thesame made head stone corner ye haue heard christ himselfe obiecting testimonie scripture vnto phariseis attempted best could cast aside stone god chose yea thissame stone prophete also maketh mencionesai xxviii petr ii b shall lay foundacion sion stone approued tryed corner stone stone price founded foundacion tune christes woordes whe liued agree wt woordes thys prophecie tyme propouned parable house builded vpo sounde rocke stone house violent blaste rage wyndes water could hable plucke placemath vii luke vi g math xvi wherin veraily signified himselfe foudacion churche gate hell hable preuaill one day freely promise vnto disciple peter salomo builded teple hierusale according appoyntement ordeinaunce moses lyke beeyng peacefull kyng beare image figure messias restored perpetuall peace atonemente euer betwene god man sayed temple built vp mannes labour conteined figure temple wherof christe himselfe builder chiefe workeman lord many yeres agon spake prophete nathan vnto dauidii kynges vii b ye reade secound boke kinges thou shalt shalt builde house dwell shall reise thy sede whiche shall come forth thy wombe shall builde vp house name shall establish throne euen euer euer verayly woordes whiche spoken sayed prophete doe agree spoken salomon euen poynte though nothyng el doeth plainly proue conuince salomon throne euen nowe present daie sit straunge borne alien whole people iewes shall shortely dispersed scattred abrode nacions worlde saied house salomon built hierusalem buisie thyng slaughter beastes fumigacions washynges veray troubleous perfume house whiche christe hath builded made acceptable faith inuisible house knoweth ende prophete thesame place afore alleged speaketh maner faithfull shall thy house thy kyngdome euen euer face thy throne seate shalbe firmely established euer promisses vainest worlde moste full lyesii king viic yf taken according lettre renneth concerne salomon dauid eyther dauid deadly foiled kyngdome aduoutrie coupled murdre salomon carnall loue weomen plucked awaye god drawen euen vnto idolatrie consider ye nowe sorte woordes nathan doe agree woordes esai thou shalt saieth esai called ye citie ryghteous manesai g faithfull citie euer hath none besides christe alone myght called purely righteous free corrupcion infeccion synne also suche one men iustified made righteous doeth christe require seruauntes fayth thesame consideracion call churche canot skill workes lawe faithfull citie wholly altogether staighyng trusting alone whan ye heare citie shalbe redemed iudgement ye see confidence trusting ceremony lawe bee taken awaie god iudgeth man workes fayth meate drinke garment solitarie quiete liuing godlynesse mynde iudgement suche persones shal beleue christe shall death thesame christe suffred peines tormentes creature redemed theyr synnes shalbe iustified righteousnesse yf folowe goe steppe head captaine ye heare nowe knowe spirituall citie teple canot shewed ne pointed vnto men fyngers neither kyng workemanselfe poynted vnto according lesson folowing himselfe taught wha heare liuing whan shall sayemat xxiiii b beholde christe beholde yonder beleue ye iewes glory mounte sion whiche beareth temple shalbe ghostly sion bearing vp myndes soules beleuemar xiii b luke xvii c fro couetous desire thynges earthly ye study thynges celestiall whiche prophete esai prophecied vnto saying shalbe last dayes hill preparedesai ii house lorde ye top mountaines shall lifted vp aboue hilles nacions shall flowe vnto shall many people goe shall saye come ye let v clyme vp mountaine lorde house god iacob shall teache v wayes shall walke pathes forth sion shall lawe come woorde lorde forth hierusalem dauid also doeth ofttymes make mencion spirituall mountepsal cxxiiii trust lorde mounte sion shall moued euer whiche dwelleth hierusalem materiall temple whiche iewes nowe proude howe shall shortely cast downe euen christe also prophecied house saieth shalbe leaft deserte waste vnto selfesame thyng euen come passeluke xix xxi god tyme threatened vnto salomon ye reade third booke kyngesiii kyng ix b temple whiche haue poynted marked name shall cast fro sight israel shalbe prouerbe common talkyng stocke people house shall exaumple euery body passeth shall astouned woondres shall hisse shall saye wherfore hath lorde thus doen thissame lande thissame house shal aunswer haue forsake lorde god thatsame house prouoker god doth prophetes often tymes chyde bralle whiche ferre forth fell fro god sonne hoighced vp nayled crosse yea moreouer stede people carnall stifnecked prophete doeth promise people peaceable obedient euen vnto death maner folowyng doeth esai speake shall forge theyr swordes plugh share speares sithes sicles one nacion shall lift vp sworde nacionesai ii neither shall ferther forth exercised fightyng battayle ye house iacob come ye lette v walke light god woordes consonaunt agreable woordes christe whiche promised would stone rei e vp child vnto abraham whan called himselfe lyght worlde whoso folowed walke derknesse whan cast saying prophete esaiihon viii people honoureth lippes herte ferre meesai xxix newe people promiseth vnto hymselfe prophete oseas people makyng vauntes braggues theyr workes acknowlageyng mercy god shall place shall saied vnto ye none people shalbe saied vnto child liuing god shall haue mercy ye people whiche destitute mercy signifying people gentile wheras hath hitherto serued idolles shal shortly receiue doctrine ye ghospell iewes hath refused forsaken psalmiste dauid also hath prophecied toforepsal xvii people knewe hath serued hearing ye eare hath obeied ye woordes christe agree prophecieiohn xc wha saied haue shepe folde euen also must nedes bryng home forsouth priesthood kyngdome restored made newe dooeth make thinges newe newe priest holy writte prophetes promised aforehande misticall psalme renneth manier forme folowyng lorde hath sworne shall forthynke hym thou art prieste euermore ordre melchisedec melchisedec beeyng bothe priest kyngpsal cix priest highest god instituted lawe kyng salem saye kyng peace signified christe neither hath begynning ne neuer shal haue endyng thissame christ bloud calfes goates owne bloude entreth high holy place make intercessio synnes whole worlde sacrifice executed altare crosse offreyng moste pure sacrifice vnto god father suche prieste certes god long agon promised vnto helias whan readie dyei kyng ii g shall sayeth reise vp vnto selfe feithfull prieste shall doe myne owne herte myne owne mynde shall builde vp vnto feithfull house shall walke myne enoynted people al dayes euer veraily euen verai thing whiche christ himselfe hath promised vnto youmat xxvii iohn xxiiii euen vntyll consummacion worlde nowe stede bloudie slaughter beastes whiche priestes moses lawe vsepsal xlix kynde sacrifice shall succede prophete hath leaft vnspoken psalmiste inspiracion sayeth thus sacrifice thou vnto god sacrifice laude paie thy vowes vnto highest call daye tribulacion deliuer thee thou shalt glorifie agayne thesame placepsal xlix whoso offreeth thankes prayse honoureth hym ordreeth conuersacion right wyll shewe saluacion god another placepsal iii sacrifice ye sacrifice righteousnesse truste ye lorde ye haue nowe hearde threfold manier sacrifice wete sacrifice prayer vowes whereof christe hath thus taughte whatsoeuer ye shall aske father name wyll geue vnto youiohn xiiii b sacrifice laude prayse whiche euidente enoughe solemnely executed accomplished many tymes rendring thankes vnto father sacrifice righteousnesse whiche geueth perfourmeth strength power lyfe innocente seruiceable attendaunce charitie towardes nedie righteousnesse dyd propre persone shewe vnto perfecte exaumple spendyng soule lyfe shepe beeyng founde onely alone emong men whome fraude ne guyle taught thing also ye prophetes wordes saying thus goe ye learne woordes prophete dooe meane mercye wyll haueosee vi sacrifice spirituall temple vnder moste highest prieste christe shall nowe bee geuen distribucion rawe meate fleashe calfes goates shepe precious bodye bloud iesus christe whiche hath offred thende maye al tymes bee spirituallye taken enoynted renewyng vnto themselues certaine manier death head king thankefull commemoracion forsouth hoste whiche shall shortely offred world ouer priestes god hath enoynted whiche sacrifice malachias spoke afore spirite propheciemalach c haue wyll saieth lorde ho e gyfte wyll none take hande arisyng sunne vnto goyng downe name greate nacions euery place sacrificed offreed vnto clene oblacion whiche foretolde hely prieste also come passe whosoeuer come newe temple saye leat goe beseche thee one syde priesthode maie eate morsell thesame sacrifice whiche christe estur supper gaue vnto disciplesmat xxvi c marke xiiii c luke xxii b corinth xi c puttyng foorth breade vnto whiche sayed body geuyng cuppe whiche sayed bee cuppe bloude whiche bloud consecrated vnto newe testamente saye bande league frendeshyp neuer dye ne decaye thynges yf ye twoo haue sene owne party yet leastewyse ye mighte haue hearde twelue speciall apostle meane hath wylled hath wrought dooen come knowlage creature lyke christe cummyng heauen hath turned carnall thynges ghostly citie temple priesthode sacrifice woulde also kyngdome bee newe thesame cause muche vse call kyngdome heauen ye looke suche manier thyng ye see many kyngdome worlde although lorde yea euen came downe yearth yet ghostlye kyngdome whiche would recouer vnto father became obedient thesame vnto death crosse meanes hath ouercomed vanquished aduersarie waie hath deliuered people made free meanes hath recouered enlarged establisshed kyngdome vnto father dede prophete promised messias title kyng captaine assigneth double cummyng hym former whiche selues haue seen humble peaceable came heale strieke waye vengeaunce shall come ende worlde maiestie garded encoumpaced round many thousandes aungels iudge quicke deade tyme hath come lowe mylde many haue taken slaundre conscience insomuche euen twelue also whome coumpanie specially chosen moste feithfull trustie vnto hym beeyng strieken drede haue fled euerie man waye feare yea one hath reneagued hym saying neuer knewe hym ye woulde diligentlye compare writing prophetes thynges whiche ye haue seen wrought doen cause ye bee offended slaundredzacha ix b cause ye acknowlage hym came suche one promised come consider ye zacharie sayeth beholde thy kyng shall come vnto righteous salueour beeyng hymselfe fourme poore man mountyng vpon asse vpon colte foale asse came came make battaile destruie battayles worlde whiche made kepte vnder satan banner prophete bryngeth byanby shall scattre soondrie way abrode carte ephraim horse hierusalem bowe battayle shall destruied shall speake peace nacions power shall bee sea sea ye sawe entre citie hierusalem pompe partly mocke kyngdomes worlde partly would putte good remembraunce prophecieesai ix b marke ye well poynte whether esai promise hym sorte euery violent takyng booty forceable ruffleyng garment embrewed bloud shall burnyng meate fyer lytle one borne v sonne geuen v princely power set vpon shoulder name shall called meruaylous counsaillour god strength father world come prince peace empier shalbe multiplied shalbe ende peace shall sitte vpon seate dauid vpon kingdome may conserue thesame make strong iudgemet righteousnesse whan ye heare kyngdome princely power set vpon shoulder doe ye manifestly heare kyngdom crosse crosse christ beare vanquishe power aier whan ye heare ye prince peace forsoth ye vnderstande kyng alluryng benefites co pelling violence ne feare whan ye heare ye father worlde come ye see one much vnlyke prince worlde neither doeth describe hym man sorte speaketh hym certaine placeesai xi shal strike rodde mouth spirite lippes shall sleagh wicked righteousnesse shalbe ye girdle loignes feith belt reines woulfe shal dwell lambe leoparde shall lie downe hard wt goate reste foloweth much dessonaunt contrarious armour battayles worldely princespsaml ii nowe herken ye himselfe saieth himselfe misticall psalme dauid constituted king vpo sion holy hill preachyng precepte woordes manifestely expresse kyngdome woorde euangelicall certes ye sweorde wherof psalme maketh mencion bee thou girt thy sweorde vpon thy thighpsal xliiii thou moste mightiest thy beatutie fairnesse entede thou prosperously procede reigne thou thy veritie mekenesse righteousnesse hath heard king hath beautie body prosperously gon foreward el haue gotten himselfe kingdome mekenesse grace woorde god ye haue seen iesus allure draw vnto great multitude people trueth ye phariseis many time vaine attept wrastle striue maner sweorde whiche tyme whan die aduertised apostle gette whiche afore also spoken allegeing come ye yearth send peace sweorde suche lyke one also arrowes mighty beyng sharpmath x goreth inordinate lustes desire men killeth couetous reiseth beneficiall bounteous man sleagheth idolatre reiseth vp professour eua gelicall godlinesse killeth fierce man man vengeaunce reiseth vp meke merciful ouerthroweth proude man setteth vp humble ye vnderstand kyngdome sorte nature see ye maner minister enlarger dominion iurisdiccio chose nons poore felowes lowe degree learnyng ne knowlage euen bare mother witte toungue ne treasour ne weapon victayles ne strength maintenaunce worlde furnished armed capcious malice phariseis power prince pryde philosophiers say ye great schole captaines shall outwarre subdue vniuersall kyngdomes worlde none coplete harnesse helmes saluacion right vnderstanding holy scripture buckler feith vertue wherof god beyng protectour shalbe perfeite safegard al assaultes wicked people iacke haberion made righteousnesse al vertues euagelicall belt chastitie shooes ghospels making herte pure yearthly affeccions moste specially aboue al thinges sweorde spirite woorde god thought good vnto god meane sonnes weakenesse would shewe power preaching accoupted worldly folishenes would declare wisedom worldly shame crosse would renoume glory thinges consisteth kingdome euagelicall meane whyle vntill maiestie christ shall ende world shewe forth selfe low degree laied away blissefull state godly sort shal also shewe selfe stained defoiled affliccions yet outward bassenesse conteineth ghostly strength spirite effectuall apt cast downe al buildinges lift vp themselfes stand glory god haue ye euer seen thing ientill pacient christ haue ye seen thing lowe basse worldly acceptacion thing poorer meke felowlike people ferther remoued lykenesse kyngdome yet thyng coulde regall kinglike worde cast wicked spirites woorde speaking caulme wyndes sourges ye sea touching heale folkes infecte lepry mere bidding put away al kindes disease many time escaped harmelesse thickest iewes working death vnto suffred himselfe taken voice armed soldier fell flat ground dyed crosse thing could power death made elementes worlde shake whiche caused sunne lese light full derkenesse cutte stone soondre opened graues reysed dead bodyes thesame could nothing lowe basse worldeward natiuitie yet euen natiuitie also streight way first houre appere token moe one high maiestie would acknowe borne tendre young virgin operacio god holy spirite laied downe oxe mau ger aungels syng glory god highest lieth cry infaunte cradle place herode kyng trembleth feare magians wurship knee thynges yet knowen veray many shall time come preached throughout vniuersall worlde suche lyke sure fen shall appoynte furnishe apostle also ye shal reade scripture marke well shall conferre thynges ye haue seen heard ye cannot doubt thesame christ promised priest king salueour worlde none looked rekon pray consider mindes whole age ye haue partely owne iyes seen partely ye might haue knowen kynsfolkes familiar ye shall fynde one poynte hath bothe signified marked figure also foretolde prophetes promised stocke dauid tribe iuda toune bethlee touching place borne se ye whether micheas derkely propheciemichea v el plainly thou bethleem effrata litle one thou art thousandes iuda shall one come whiche shall vnto rewler israel cummyng foorth without beginning day eternitie come passe scribe phariseis vnderstode doenmath ii whan herode demaunded question made aunswere messias borne citie bethleem euidente iesus borne citie occasion surueigh taxe cesar caused madeluke ii cause matter selfe herodes crueltie made knowen worlde ye knowe comonly reputed bethleemite nazarea man galile brought vp nazareth vntyll tyme full mannes state lyued good noumbre yeres fosterfather iosephmat xxvii luke xxiii ihou xix mother mary muche poisee crosse intitulacion iesus nazarean neither poynte vnspoken prophetes neither nowe note hym call hym name holy holy holyes singularly consecrated lorde lawe whiche indifferently apperteined first borne sexe accordyng wherunto iesus also brought paretes vnto temple cosecrated vnto lord also aboue mortal creature certain speciall prerogatiue whiche man nazarean iacob see beeyng man maner altogether blynd iyes body veray sharp quicke sight iyes feith tyme blissed ioseph bare figure christe shall sayeth head iosephge xlix toppe croune nazarean separate brother whatsoeuer thyng lawe moses doeth fleshe appoynte enioyne consecratyng nazareans thesame spirituall vnderstanding fulfilled christe god dauid thus speaketh psalmes fruite thy wombe set vpon thy seatepsal cxxxi b esai xi againe elswhere prophete esai dauids tyme shall rod issue forth roote iesse floure shall ascede roote lordes spirite shall rest vpo well knowen ye mary tribe iuda house dauid neither thyng hidden vnknowen phariseis wha iesus himselfe suffered death asked whose sonne messias beemat xxii mat xii luke xx g esai vii made aunswere without study tarying sonne dauid prophete foresayed borne virgin thus esai prophecie cause shall lord himselfe geue vnto signe behold virgin shal conceiue shal bryng forth sonne name shall bee called emanuell daniel foretolde selfesame thyng couertelydaniel ii whan expouned mente stone cut hill without hades brake al piece powdre thatsame prodigious image made golde siluer brasse iron clay within short grew great mountaine largenesse fylled possessed kingdomes world christe without mannes helpe borne virgin mary shal grynde crushe powdre kyngdomes worlde shall hys doctrine possesse worlde uerayly ezechiell beyng enspired dyd perceyue thesame fore time described este gate temple ye maiestie lord entred gate speaketh maner gate shall still shutte shall opened shall man passe lorde god israel hath come therat el shall shutte still prince hymselfe shal come c whan ye heare temple lord ye knowe well enough met therby wombe mary consecrated holy ghoste whan ye heare este gate doe ye knowe menyng bee enclosure tabernacle virginly chastitie neither mortall man entreing vnto ne sonne god either entreyng cummyng forthe hathe violated defoiled certes thissame este gate whiche proceded issued light lighten worlde vniuersall misterie although yet published abrode emong iewes yet vnknowen vnto haue familiar conuersacion lyuing mary mother iesus ioseph hir spouse saied ioseph taken vsed moste true vndoubted witnesse priuy misterie due tyme shall famously spred spoken throughout worlde vniuersall howe virgin without lyke exaumple afore goyng sence worlde first begon breathing holy ghost vpon hir brought forth babe whiche partaker diuine nature godhead humain nature man appere seme thing vncredible god borne creature mortall considre ye prophete baruch prophecie sonne god taking pietie compassion mankynde dyd euen veray purpose sende yearth vnto straighing wandreers blynded shewe waye health saluacion batuch iiithissame god sayeth shall none estemed besydes hym hath found way discipline hath aught vnto iacob babe israel beloued hath ben seen yearth hath liued emong men daniel doeth also shewe tyme birthdani ix accoumptyng seuens seuenfoldes wekes yeres man thyng curiously serche trye long many daye patriarke iacob beeyng nowe ere tyme departing worlde endewed spirite prophecie shewe thynges come prophecied manier gene xlixthe scepter shall taken awaye iuda guide fro thighe hym vntill come whiche must sent shall expectacion heathen al regio iewes subieccio emperours rome iewrye herode kyng beeyng aliene outlandishe man borne thyng euidently conuince proue messias nowe come body serched prophecy added math ii shall bee expectacion heathen albeit poynet shall tyme come bee clere manifest yet euen veraye time natiuitie appere immediately vpon deliueraunce virgin come renning thither guiding leding sterre thre magians sage philosophiers presentes wurshyp newe kyng dooe homage vnto euen thissame veraye poynte voyce prophetes leafte vnspoken neither thus sayeth esai esai xii haue knowelage refuse eiuill choose good shall take spoiles samaria damascus king assyrian whyle beeyng yet young babe infaunte draweth three magians vnto hym ledyng guidyng sterre idolater maketh wurshippers kyng kynges take spoiles samaria whiche countrey eiuill name worshippyng seruing idolles damascus olde tyme reputed parte arabia diuidyng particion countreyes syria assigned parte syrophenicia dede easte party haue muche aboundaunce swete odouriferous sauours spieces wherof magians rychesse brought foorth frankinsence myrthe golde wherof prophecie failed make mencion neither thus speaketh esai esai lx al saba shall come bringyng golde frankynsence shewing forth laude vnto lorde prophecie also psalme maketh mencion thesame sayeth psa lxxi math ii c shall geuen vnto hym golde arabie agayn another place kynges arabian saba shall bring presentes region party chiefe rewle gouernaunce commonly handes magians saye saiges wyse knowlage forsoth name kyng assyrian signifyed wieked kyng herode spryngyng vp messias whan told hym fore quiete mynde defeated purpose magians therupon folowed murdreyng infauntes within limites boundes beethleem whiche thyng prophecy leaue vnspoken neither thus hieremie syng voyce heauinessehiere xxxi wepyng lamentacion heard high euen rachell mournyng hir child would comforted wer awaie expresse lamentyng mother bewailing boucherly murdrement young suckyng babe place halfe derkely mistically expresse name rachel whose sepulchre ferre bethleem secretly conueied egipte warnyng aungell broughte home agayne thence warnyng thesame aungel prophecie oseas shewed afore mat ii b oiee xi mat iii b marke b luke iii iohn c egipte haue called sonne begonne take hande office preachyng appoynted vnto hym father foregoer iohn opely testifie come immediatly furthwithal whan came dede shewed people iewes finger esai clerely prophecied afore bee esai xl voyce cryer wildernesse prepaire ye waye lorde make ye pathes god streight wildernesse wysse ye sawe iohn preachyng wyldernesse ye hearde hym acknowelaging prophecie forespoken hymselfe prophecie least baptisme vnspoken neither begonne preachyng hierusalem galilee esai prophecie clerely enough therof afore saying land zabulon lande neptalimesai ix sea waie goeth ouer iordane lande galilee people sate derkenesse haue seen great light dwell lande shadowe death vpon hath light shyned well knowen capernaum iesus first dwelt whan entred office preachyng standeth marchesse zabulon neptalim ttie sytuate shore syde sea neither straungenesse clokyng made kynde doctryne whiche oftentymes vsed emong peoplepsal lxxvii enwrappyng mynde sentence misticall derkenesse parable thus renneth discourse psalme azaph parable shal ope mouth shall speake proposicions beginnyng ferthermore people shoulde bee whiche crye agaynst doctrine withstande thesame men sinistrely interpretyng slaundreyng aswell sayinges dooingesesai vi esai prophecied saying ye shall heare dede ye shal vnderstade ye shal playnly see perceyue harden thou herte people stop eares shut theyr iyes see iyes heare earesesai liii vnderstande theyr hertes conuert bee healed suche people doeth fynde faulte withall place also lorde hath geuen credence vnto thyng whiche haue hearde ferthermore touchyng miracle whiche ye haue seen shewyng holy sayinges prophetes plainly tolde therof afore doeth esai thus speakeesai liii hath taken infirmity hath borne peines kynde sore euill hath drieuen awaye persones woefull case miserable thesame esai place also speaketh yea openly plainly selfe thyng manier saie vnto fearefull bee good chere feare beholde god commeth take vengeaunceesai xxxv ye shall see rewarde god geueth god commeth owne selfe deliuer shal iyes blynde lightened eares deaf bee opened shal lame man leape herte dumme mannes toungue shall geue thankes haue ye owne iyes seen iesus dooe premiss yea greater thynges also ye heard whan acknowelaged thissame prophecie thyng written spoken hymselfe tyme certain disciple iohn beeyng sente vnto iesus demaunded hym whether messias looked el looked aunswered sayed goe youre wayes beare woorde agayne iohn thynges whiche ye haue hearde seen blynd see haulte goeluke vii lepres clensed deaf heare dead arise agayne poore glad tydinges preached chiefe rewlers synagogue woulde bee benefites yet stil wurse wurse incensed esai goodly sorte peinte vnder parable vyneyarde beyng excedyng many poyntes diligente cure good housebandyng occasioned bryng forth good fruite dyd aunswere expectacion tiller esai v bi looked saieth haue brought forth grape hath brought forth wylde grape looked haue doen iudgemente beholde wickednesse haue doen righteousnesse beholde cry miserymat xxi mar xii luke xx b doeth parable iustely agree thesame sentence prophecie whiche ye haue heard iesus hymselfe concerning vineyard enclosed fensed toure furnished wyne presse gutter whiche vineyard neuerthelesse defaulte housebandmen yelded condigne fruite lord owner thesame thyng also noted thatsame figtree whiche would begynne fruitfullmat xxi b luke xiii b neyther whan much doungyng cherishyng doen neyther thyng el mente parable sede cast vpon ill grounde founde thesame selfe fault el also prophetes mat xiii b mar iiii luke viii esai lxv haue daye long euermore holden handes vnfaithful people goe rightway owne imaginacions people euer defying face menne power enuy vertue slaudreously surmuised miracle wrought supportacion beelzebubmat xxvi mar xiiii luke xxii iohn xviii zachar ix weakenesse body meannesse degree affliccions whiche suffred matter offence slaundre conscience weake though euyll men whan taken iewes euen twelue specially chosen apostle fled ranne euery man waye see ye whether prophete zachary leaft euen poynte vnspoken psal lxxxvi shal strieke shepeheard saieth shepe ye flock shalbe scattred abrode wherunto accordeth song eightie seuenth psalme mat xxvi mar xiiii c luke xxii f ioh xviii c thou hast put awaye myne acquaintaunce ferre made bee abhorred dyd petur detestacion forsweare mayster apostle ready doe thesame lyke perill bloustreously come vpon would come passe christ foresaied petur came passe dede betrayed iudas one noumbre twelue cosider ye whether propheticall psalme foretell ye also psal cxiiii mine enemy sayth spoke ill would verayly haue paciently borne yf hated spoken great thinges vpon would peraduenture haue hidden selfe fro thou myne owne minde guyde familiar ye haue learned ye christe whan iudas comyng purpose betray lord vnto souldiers meane deceiptfull kisse thus speake vnto himmath xxvi luke xxii e frende purpose art thou come betraiest thou sonne man wt kisse manifestly lay vnto veray teeth ye saying ye prophete calleth guyde iudas semed maner one made rewler ouer apostle charge doyng affaire abrode comitted vnto psalme speaketh yet clerly psal xl peace haue trusted eate loanes hath magnified supplanting ouer see pray howe wordes christe whiche spake disciple betraier last supper doe iustely agree prophecie psalme xxxvii eateth breade saith christ shal lift v foote sole psalme sayth frendes next neighbour haue approched nere haue stande mepsal liiii psal xxxvii yea psalme yet woordes suppled aboue honey dartes woorde softer honey say haill maister spoken kisse geuing darte infected deadly poison say thatsame hold ye fast thus might ye haue heard apostle case ye haue yet heard ye may yet learne time come iudas demauded couenaunt bishop chiefe rewlers sume thirtie pen denaries siluer deadly sume money forthwithall piece ground bought buriall poore folkes poyntes prophete forespeake prophecie concerning pryce sold thus one ye prophetes say toke thirtie plate pryce valuedzachar xi bought child israel gaue potter field thinges thus executed iudas ouerlate repenting facte honge himselfe diminishing therby noubre twelue chosen making roume bee supplied ye ordre apostlespsal cviii neither vnspoke ye prophetes thus sayth ye processe misticall psame let abyding made lye waste let dwelleth shepeherdship let body take deuilishe conuocacio ye putting iesus death solemnely kept house caiphas beeyng highest bishop scribe phariseis rewlers people comons sworne thesame marke ye whether thesame poynte also hath wrytten declared ye prophecie psalme sayth doe heathe furiously rage togetherpsalme ii doe ye people imagine vaine thinges kynges earth stand vp rewlers take coucell together lorde enoincted ye heare namyng heathen ye knowe iesus crucified pilate seruauntes crue ye heare ye woorde people ye knowe multitude ortes iewes cryed crucifie crucifie ye heare name kinges ye know ye pilate ye rewler gouernour iewry ceasars behalfe whose sentece iesus codened ye heare woorde ye rewlers ye earth ye vnderstade ye headman people iewry vnderstading lawe spirituall sought earthly thinges wise pulled fro thesame put ye king heaue death yea esai also doth fore threate thesame woe vnto ye soules sayeth haue thought exceding naughty thought theselues saying let v tie vp ye tighteous man purpose brought iudgement man accused arraignedesai iiii c yea thing also esai tell afore lord stadeth iudged stadeth iudge people ye lord shall come iudgement wt elder people rewlers thesame iesus iudged house caiphas chief priestesluke xxii scribe phariseis chief rewlers ye people eftsons co dened ye cry clamour ye people ye benche ye lieutenaut wha cried away away naile crosse lord iudged iudged themselfes ye detestable iniquitie maner way meanes bewraied pilate gaue pronounced sentence iudgement vpon sayed free innocent bloud thissame righteous man choose themselues gaue sentence iudgement agaynst themselues whan cryed bloud vpon vsmat xx ii vpon chyldren hieremie also muche lameteth deiulishe weorkyng agaynst christe lord saieth thou hast seen iniquitie agaynst iii f iudge thou iudgement thou hast seen furious rageyng theyr thoughtes agaynst thou haste hearde reprochefulnesse lorde theyr thoughtes agaynst theyr lippes arisyng agaynst studying agaynst daye theyr sitting downe theyr arisyng agayn haue seen doeth wordes clerely playne picture set foorth priestes head men people consultyng together might put iesus death huntyng false testimony whereby might oppresse hym beyng innocent laying blasphemie vnto charge condemnyng hym iudgement matier hym sitting vpon hym iudges arising whan iudged would accuse lieutenaunte mischieuous sitting downe mischieuous arising vp kynde death auenture mighte satisfie hatred speciallye chosen suche kynde death bothe moste shamefull also moste hardest hieremie witnesseth bearyng persone christhierem xi lord haue learned thee vnderstande thou hast shewed theyr imaginacions meke lambe carryed awaye slayne knowyng thei deuised suche counsayles agaynste saying destruie meate woode drieue lande liuing name shall neuer thought vpon deuise purpose phariseis name iesus accused condened hanged betwene two notorious malefactours shoulde either bee vttrely euer abolished el bee reputed emong name execrable
