detestable nowe ferthe call ye vnto remembraunce christ tolde al matier death betrayed deliuered handes getiles refused menne cast skorned scourged crucified ye knowe owne iye pointe hereof vnaduisedly doen blynde chaunse casualtie iewes presence anna caiphas meane false witnessema xiiii g mat xxvi c luk xxii g laie vnto hym cryme blasphemie none crime hainous matier marked figured ioseph brother conspiryng together enuie accuse veraye naughtie cryme iudges iesus aunswered either nothyng el veray fewe wordes wha sparke ne spotte cryme determined dye redempcion worlde thynke ye hardely thyng dooen blynd chauncegen xxxvii esai tell afore offred vp would opened mouth shepe shall led put death shall kepe silence lambe one shereth shall open mouth see iustely prophecie psalme agreeth esai lyke deaf manpsal lviii heard one dumme whiche dooeth open mouth became eue man heareth whose mouth reproufes thee lorde haue put truste nowe full tyme come shoulde willingly offre himselfe open shame world one shoulde shewe vnto felowes perfeicte exaumple pacient suffreaunce bounde strieken beaten bothe blowes buffettes scourged spetten face wede purple doen backe waye mockyng skorning crouned croune thornes beeyng contemned herode waye puttyng hym worldly shame sent backe agayne pilate white vestureluke xxiii myserable lykenesse pieteous behold brought foorth people barrabas preferred hym bee pardoned escape nowe forasmuche willyngly suffred thynges redempcion worlde accordyng foresayinges prophetes oughte haue bred desperacion rather haue geuen hope doeth hieremie lamente bewaile thynges sayeth verai breath mouth euen enoyncted lorde himselfe taken theyr nettetren iiii saye vnder shadowe shalbe preserued emong heathen heare ye againe thesame prophete lamentyng shall holde cheke sayeth hieremie vnto hym strieketh hym shall filled wordes reuilying assemblie conuocacion iewes striken blowe bishop seruaunte pilate men striken blowes buffettes rede yet made resistence nowe heare prophecie psalme upon backe sayeth synners haue ploughedpsal cxxvii haue made long furrowes theyr iniquitie song holy esaie muche accordyng thesame lorde god sayeth hath opened eareesai l therfore saye naie withdrawe selfe offre backe vnto smyters chekes nipper turne face men rebuking spetting vpon whan ye reade prophecie thesame prophete place ye thynke selues see verai christe hymselfe scourged spetted crouned thornes couered garmente broughte foorthe presence people iewes waye mockage skorne writeth manier folowyng hath neither beautie ne fauour whan shal looke vpon shalbe fairenesse shall haue lust vnto hym despised abhorred menesai liii suche man full sorowe hath good experience infirmity haue rekoned hym vile hyd face yea despised therfore regarded hym howbeit hath taken infirmitie hath borne peynes yet iudge hym though plagued cast god punished wheras notwithstandyng wounded offence smytten wickednes chastisement peace layed vpon hym striepes healedpsalm xxi therfore thus speaketh misticall psalme wourme man verai skorne men outcast people neither hath misticall scripture kept silence croune thorne vnto first man adam sayd cursed yearth thy worke whan thou shalt tille thorne brier shal cause budde thee thesame earth former adagene iii thesame thing iewyshe people vnto second adam thatsame earth beeyng many sondrie way tilled prouoked occasioned many benefites bryng foorth good fruicte brought foorth thornes vnto tiller christe spouse churche holye congregacion ye heard iohn also testifie sonne synagogue murdreer hir owne fleshe bloud therfore misticall weddyng song father calleth forth al cruell sight spouse crouned thornesballetes ii goe ye forth ye daughter sion behold king salomon croune wherwith mother crouned hym daye gladnesse herte forsoth thatsame earnest effectuall louer whiche washed spouse owne bloud knitte hir vnto hym bande knot vnpossible vndoen thatsame daye espousall whiche great desire desired hym beyng earnestly loue delay tariaunce semed long whan lieutenaunte leaft nothyng vndoen myght doe quitte iesus let hym goe chiefe men iewes together people cryed murdreyng rageyng voice aloudeluke xxii awaye hym awaye hym crucifie hym crucifie hymhierem xii see howe hieremie leaft thing vnmencioned speakyng persone christe haue forsaken myne owne dwellyng place haue leaft myne heritage lyfe also loue well haue geuen handes myne enemy myne heritage become lion wood cryed vpon whatsoeuer thyng doen vnto hym waye open shameluke xxii shall turne glory herode set backe pilate clad vesture white people gentile shall time cumming embrace priest crue soldier vpon backe robe purple gaue hym moreouer rede stede sceptre set head croune made thornes god people shal acknowlage shall theyr knee wurshippe theyr kyng euen suche facion ouercumming trioumphing herode pilate play daly together castyng iesus boule balle fro betwene meane tyme made frendes wheras tofore discorde variaunce mutuall hatered euen theyr veray lesse ratifie iesus reconciler pacifier thynges heauen whiche yearth wherof iob prophecied maner lorde reconcileth heartes prince yearth nowe eftsons renewe ye thatsame sight vnto selfes castyng mynde thatsame sight saye nowe last day ye sawe iyes wete iesus goyng place execucion bearyng crosse vpon owne shoulder geuen tokeninges yt whan many tymes saye emong disciple people whoso doeth take vp crosse folowe memath x mar viii worthy forsoth thissame sceptre king iewes saye men confessyng thyng whiche esai long many daye agonne sawe vpon shouldersesai ixv gen xxiiv whan sayed kyngdome vpon shoulder figure therof isaac represente many hundred yeres past whan bore faggot wood vpo shoulder hymselfe slaine burnt sacrifice isaac safe vnto v ramme slaine say materiall body iesus whiche could dye yet dye within veray litle time arise life againmath xx mar xii luke xxv slaine without precinete citie thing christe himselfe signified tofore parable housbandemen fermers cast sonne vyneyarde slewe hym long afore dyd moses signifie thesame thyng ye reade booke entitled leuiticus comaunded calf stain sacrifice ye sinnes people carryed forth without precincte ye tentesleuit vii burnt takyng allegorie saye meanyng wordes iesus burned vp without precinct hierusalem beyng enkiendled vnestimable fyer charitie loue towardes mankindenume xxi offreed himselfe vp altogether wha ye sawe iesus hanging great heighth vpon tree crosse dyd thatsame misticall serpente come mynde moses old time hang vpon stake whiche safegarde vnto stoungen serpentes yf earnestly steadily cast iyes vpon thesame iye man feith whosoeuer shall earnestely cast iye vpon iesus crucified shall immediatly safe yea veray thyng also moses foreshewe iewes beholding christ haging crosse death gaue life vnto creature yet neuerthelesse would beleue himdeut xxviii maner speaketh deuteronomie thy life shal hang thine iyes thou shalt feare daye night shalt haue trust thy lyfe ye sawe hym hangyng betwene twoe theues doe ye acknowlage prophecieesai liiiv math xxv luke xxii amos viii saied wicked reputed ye sawe derkenesse night sodainly ouercast middes ye day time sixt houre vntill nynth christ himselfe saied affirmed himselfe light worlde gaue knowlage yt night drewe nere tyme doen death worlde dyd amos clerely prophecie matter shalbe day saieth lord sunne shall goe downe noontide make yearth ouercast derkenesse daye light neyther zacharie hold peace concernyng matter whan sayed shall daie shalbe light colde froste shalbe one daie whiche knowen lorde daie night due time euentyde shall light day knowen lorde day iewes knewe markes therofzach xiiiiv daye aboute houre noontyde arose derkenesse night nynth houre light came colde froste hertes disciple whan fled euery manne waye despaired noumbre petur ferthermore abiured lord saye swore knewe hym naught doe hym naught would medle hym throughly taken colde taketh warmth heate cole wicked iewes coferre ye thynges doen whyle christe hangyng crosse whan thirsted raught vp vnto hym wyne mixed myrrhe vyneagre withall euen like whan bee hoighced vpon crosse offered hym wyne mixed myrrhe prophecie psalme tell plainly herof aforepsal lxviii sayeth gaue gaule meate thirst gaue drinke vineagre ye heard phariseis rewlers lyke conquerours speakyng proudely agaynste haged crosseluke xxiii emong reuiling woordes laying also sayed sonne god putteth wholle trust confidence lorde let nowe deliuer yf haue hym see ye nowe lustely prophecie psalme onely foreshewe veray thyng also speake euen verai woordes wicked personespsal xxii sayeth wourme manne veray skorne men outcast people see laugh skorne shoote lippes shake theyr head saying trusted god would deliuer leat deliuer wil haue ye sawe lambeluke xxiii whiche esai prophecied openyng lippes holdyng peace al opprobrious woordes yea moreouer praying hertely causers worker death whan cried father forgeue knowe doe nowe loke ye whether psalme fore tell thing toopsal cviii spake agaynst guilefull roungues coumpaced round wordes hatred assailed without cause stede haue loued railled againste praye ye sawe hym fastened crosse nailles hang naked bodye stretched euerie waye vttermoste heare ye nowe clere plain prophecie thesame perced handes feete tolde bonespsal xxi ye sawe souldiers partyng emongst garmentes iesus whan crucified poyncte also foloweth prophecie thesame psalme manier parted garmentes emong cast lotte vpon vesture garmentes parted emongst coate whole piece selfe seames might bee vnriept drewe lotte whan euen poynte yelde vp ghost ye heard hym saye strong voyce father commende spirite thy handespsal xxxv declaryng prophecie psalme spoken afore death ye sawe twoo theues legges broken sodre iesus legges broken woulde signe also declare hymselfe bee true paschall lambe whose bloude hath made free hath deliuered euerlasting death al persones belieue whome commaundemente geuen booke entitled exodus ye shall breake bone hym ye might also haue marked poynte ouercame strengthe worlde satan contrarie simplicitee maistered craftinesse mekenesse ouercame fiercenesse humilitee hadde ouerhande pompe glorie courteous behaueour subdued pryde lyke manier weakenesse body conquered power satan thyng weake feble man dying yet great strength weakenesse ye sawe ye beheld sawe sunne ouercaste derkenesse yearth cast quakyng stone brast one piece fro anotherpsalm cv graues open vail temple cutte soondre thynges veraily declared special great strength wherwith throughly subdued deiuill world preastly readily shewed foorth houre death thyng also mysticall psalme foreshewedabacuc iii sayed tell ye nacions god hath reigned tree thyng prophete abacuc leaue vnspoken brightnesse sayeth shal ye lyght horne handes strength hidden death shall go face deiuill shall go feete ye heare horne peakes crosse feblenesse wherof beguyled prynce worlde lord iesus priuely hidden heauenly vertue strength thende might oppresse deiuill led death triumphe made satan openly knowen made hym open shewe verai self dyeiohn vii c foretold thing sayed whan shalbe exalted vp yearth wyll drawe thynges vnto selfedeu xxxiii selfsame thyng moses signifie beyng nere tyme death although derker woordes misticall sense whan blissed tribe euerie one selfe come ioseph bare figure christe saied firste borne oxe beautie hym horne horne beaste rhinoceros shal fanne nacions euen vnto endes earth hath ben thought good wisdom god christ subdue vniuersal world horne angle crosse neyther prophetes leaue buiriall vnspoken neyther hieremie representyng persone christe wryteth manier lyfe fell downe lake put stone vpon ye knowe buiried sepulchre stoneluke xxiii mat xxii mark xv iohn xix g mouth monumete shutte mightie great stone body take awaie corpse preparyng daye well towardes euentide laied graue rest sabboth saye whan weorke mannes redempcion nowe finished completed consider ye whether prophecie foreshewe euen thissame thing also sight iniquitie saieth prophecie righteous taken awaie place shall bee peace moreouer vntill tyme death suffred hymselfe touched wieked death would handled ne touched body frendes neither tyme forthward shewe selfe seen frendes matier aunciente prophecie iacob patriarke geuen darke significacion tokenyng whan dye prophecied manier iuda naye shoulde rather saye christe thou layest long lyon shall reise hym vp ferthermore lyke dyegene xlix bee buiried shoulde come passe rotte sepulchre tarying veray shorte tyme arise lyfe agayn thyng openly foreshewed prophetes doeth holy ghoste speake manier fifteenth psalme thou shalt leaue soule hell shalt suffre thy holy one see corrupcion spieces swete baulmes doe geue gifte dead carkesse shall neuer putrifie forasmuche continuaunce tyme doeth forweare verai spice selfe whiche tyme consumeth euen monumentes though marble stone gifte doeth resurreccion geue whiche geueth immortalitie whole figure matier ionas prophete many yeares sence plainly presente tempest imputed vnto himionas v entent lest al ye companie perishe headlong toumbled sea thende losse one tempeste might alayed wheras otherwise threatened death vnto al company christe dyed sauyng creature ende alone might pourge awaye sinnes people ionas swallowed vp whale bealye thesame whale rendred againe thyrde daye otherwyse folkes loked christe layed graue wherhence promised woulde come forth thyrde daye vnto iewes requiring signe heauen promised signe ionas prophetemat xii c mark viii luke xi iohn vi hymselfe would exaumple thesame ionas come forth thyrde daye caues yearth howe many tymes repeate thing drieue disciple myndes dye returne agayn life thyrde daie thing oseas prophete told long afore sayed twoo dayes shall reuiue vso see vi thyrde daye shall reise v agayn lyfe forasmuche therfore ye haue hitherto seen thynges agree together figure law foresayinges prophetes foretellinges christ finally ende thynges haue tyme tyme folowed come passe howe happeneth ye nowe men beyng halfe sloumbre dreame vnbelieuers doe rather thynges alreadie pa e coniecture thynges afterwarde ensue tolde afore betraied shoulde deliuered gentile bound scourged skorned crucified one iote thynges hath come passe premiss ye haue seen dooe belieue euen verai man told also afore thyrd daye would arise life would space certain dayes shewe hymself vnto worlde vnto disciple wherefore ye credite weomen reporte selues haue adcertayned aungels arisen lyfe agayn doth frailtie feblenesse body deceassed greatly offende ye nowe fall vtter dispaire though al thatsame noble promise wer vtterly extinct dead concernyng kyngdome concerning power heauen yearth deliuered vnto sonne concernyng ascending vp heauen returnyng hence vnto father concernyng sittyng right hande father extendyng spreding gospel throughout nacions world concernyng glorious cummyng little ende world concernyng immortalitie holy concerning euerlastyng paine tormentes wicked na wete ye well death whiche opened waye entreaunce maiestie thynges euen ye haue seen hym dying buried shall ye see hym returned lyfe agayne shall ye see ascending vp heauen ye shall receyue spirite god ye shal see celestial power god shewe foorth self men lowe degree learnyng ne knowlage worldly ye shall see light ghospell meane thesame persones litell tyme sprede ouer world adiaunt beames iesus hath b n set naught spetted derision ye iesus shall world wurship equall god father eguall partener kyngdome finally mankynde without excepcion shall see maiestie father encoumpaced coumpanies aungels iudgeing quicke ye dead hath pleased cummyng thatsame daye shoulde bee vncertayne creature meane season wille seruauntes shoulde care nothyng kyngdome ghospell premiss haue foreshewed prophetes haue marked appoynted fygures moses lawe haue great porcion alreadie perfourmed neyther ought manne doubte thynges shall theyr due tymes bee presently shewed wordes lorde iesus mouthe onely striekyng eares saied twoo disciple also percyng throughly sinking theyr hertes possesse neither felte trauayle waie tooke markes face spake yet remembred thynke themselues theyr myndes thissame hath holy scripture doctrine lyfe iesus prompte finger endes whiche doeth suche wise hold v stil moueth verai bottome herte roote talke suche efficacie pith man neuer see emog disciple yet doeth nothyng escape knoweth dyd nomore cast fansie loue vnto halfe dreame hadde great delite learne iesus iesus self neuer better lucke successe learned whan himselfe vouchesalueth teache hymselfe vnto v theyr iourney beyng lyke comunicacion wel ouerpassed drawe nere litle towne called emaus iesus would enkiendle desirefulnesse febled made coutenaunce though woulde make tariaunce emaus made though yet somewhat ferther waie goe others men fallen despatre forsaken hierusalem returnyng home theyr owne countrey borne wheras suche persones haue truelye belieued christe haue world parmanent citie doe continual iourneyng make haste vnto thatsame citie celestiall sayed two disciple could bee plucked awaye suche ioly talkyng companion waye praye hym beseche hym goddes sake make al possible instaunte requeste vnto yea conclusion bothe desyryng wolde haue nay also takyng holdyng fast cloke vesture went wheras refused dooe compel without choyce remedie take lodgeyng night callyng hym name maister knewe hym bee iesus meruaylous talke coniectured hym bee common waifaryng man sayed vnto hym maister thou haste hytherto shewed thyselfe swete frendly coumpanion waye shew thy self also like geaste vnto v wouldest thou committe thyself goyng ferther iourney euentyde draweth faste sunne draweth well towardes setting west veray good cause dooe hate nighte many loue iesus yet ought suche people feare nighte worlde haue iesus theyr coumpanion iesus loueth prayed doe thyng whiche dooeth glad partely entent maye geue giftes persones ientilly deseruyng worthie partely teache v lesson benefite good turne bee put lappe nill bee dooen neighbour beeyng necessitee person suche sorte offre good turne neighbour thoughe feare leste partie offreed would refuse geue suche countenaunce seme geue agaynst stomakes iesus hereupon entreed toune vouchesalued vse courteous entreteinmente pand came passe sate meate tooke breade blissed brake gaue iyes opened knewe hym vanished sight sayed betwene themselues hertes burne within v talked v waye opened v scripture arose vp thesame houre returned agayn hierusalem found eleuen gathered together saying lorde risen dede hath appered symon thei told thynges doen waye thei knew breakyng breade sayed twoo disciple beyng glad men great noble geaste wha ministred vnto manier thynges whiche wont bee ministred geastes welcome one house also layed table made readie supper apperteined men slendre hauour thei sette theron hym suche poore parte fare competent meane without excesse aboue al thinges countenaunces set theron good frendely aunswerable moste sincere hertes iesus sette table themas sate meate h tooke breade blissed c tooke bread blissed brake raught forth thei knewe guyse thyng peculiarly vsed christ man el would meate geue thankes vnto father tha afterward would breake owne handes distribute emong disciple twoo disciple ben sodaynly awakened slepe begonne bothe thynke theyr myndes vpon iesusand theyr iyes opened c immediatly impediment hitherto therof beyng taken away thei knew marke veray iesus dede certain sodain kynde beyng amazed entred theyr hertes iesus vanished awaie sight time death forthward litle sparing facion shewe hymselfe presence either infirmitie mortall men hable abyde maiestie bodye beyng returned life el might litell litell enure themselues lacke sight body verai shortely bee awaye ende loue spirite ferthermore haue perfect markes know iesus house whiche churche holy congregacion haue sure markes whan himselfe reacheth forth vnto breade worde euangelicall openeth iyes wherwith iesus sure markes token knowen waye broken geuen thatsame bread misticall sorte whan opened scripture vnto thyng dooen spirite afterwarde renewe corporall bodyly token whan iesus body goen better see suche tyme whan bodye present theyr iyes holden beleued whan absent see iyes theyr faith departure iesus awaie themand sayed betwene selues dyd hertes burn within v ceasse talke iesus betwene themselues saying happened late ere knew iesus certayn kynde slepe possessed myndes blessyng bread breakyng geuyng vnto v firste thyng shake awaye thesame slepe men half slepe mighte veray talkyng v euen aswel haue coniectured himselfe iesus long processe meruailously tell v many thinges iesus whan talkyng familiarly v waie expoune vnto v scripture mysticall derke speakinges figure prophecy fele certain woondrefull feruentnesse herte suche talke scribe phariseis doeth engedre like hertes hearer euen lyke sorte lorde iesus woordes woont bee vnto suche folkes heare simplicitie woordes sermon would pricke conscience would moue myndes affeccions would rauishe would burne would enflame woulde leaue certaine sparcles stynges priccles behind hertes audience whan bothe one confessed plainly hadde bothe lyke sorte strieken hertes thing doubte veray iesus self returned life streight waie lefte emaus although daie nowe growe fast awaie greate spede gotte backe hierusalem thentent mighte make disciple also partaker great ioye mutual conferring one another feith cumpanie might confirmed lord hath great desire haue benefites free gift suche wyse spred ferther ferther abrode emong men mutuall doyng good one another aswell charitie maie growe emong also good desertes maie encrease whiche god maie rewarde slowe wha leaft hierusalem iesus beyng one kept talke beguyled felyng werinesse waie plucked theyr mindes desyre beyng theyr hosterie gredinesse aswell bearyng tydynges backe agayn happened also knowyng againe syde befalle others made light though wynges fete whan returned backe hierusalem whan come thitherand found ye eleuen gathered together founde eleuen apostle iudas ben abated noumbre twelue eleuen many disciple mo present tarying vntill twoo reported theyr tale leapyng theyr owne mocion ioye made relacion thesame vncertain hope whiche woman fyrst creature made vnto lordes arisyng death lyfe present knowlage come arisen veray true dede sayed appeared vnto symon peter woordes peter principall estimacion emong apostle credite disciple wordes woman afore pleased lorde iesus cu forte peter first confirme presence knewe besydes euill vnbelief whiche rest also aswell hym bee greued priuie knowlage conscience forswearyng maister twoo disciple aforesaied beyng glad men newes doe sembleably theyr parte also make relacionand thei tolde thinges ben doen waie howe whan thei waye goyng towardes emaus came certaine man beyng none acquaintaunce ioyned hymselfe together coumpanie lykenesse wayfaryng man takyng occasion tolde recited manye thynges iesus repeatyng bookes moyses prophetes whatsoeuer thyng foreshewed concernyng iesus also recityng fortuned afterward happen knowlage hym token till last peculiar speciall custome euermore tofore vsed blisse breake geue bread vnto pa thus spake iesus hymselfe stood middest sayeth vnto peace bee vnto feare ye abashed afrayed supposed seen spirite sayed vnto ye troubled thoughtes arise hertes beholde handes fete euen selfe handle see spirite hath fleashe bone ye see haue whan thus spoken shewed handes feete whyle yet beleued ioye woondred sayed vnto haue ye meat offred piece broiled fishe honey combe tooke eate whyle suche holy talkes bothe party counforte glad themselues beleuing yet still doubting lorde iesus sodainly entred whan doores shutte seen commyng thither sodaynly standyng euen middes emong suche lyke sorte angel soodainly appere visible whan selues soodainly vanishyng awaie whan lyketh good spirites wha appere accustomed frendly amiable speakyng vnto men take feare entent weakenesse mannes nature maye bee thyng dismayed troubled righte lorde shewed himselfe visible bothe sodainly commyng also euentide ed verai darke speaketh vnto wt amiable salutacion saying peace vnto feare ye speaking although ought good cause putte awaye feareand said vnto peace vnto c yet neuerthelesse great weakenesse disciple hauyng theyr herte theyr verai mouth feare dyd belieue iesus supposed themselues see spirite seen hym long afore dead buiryed sawe hym entred doore appered sodainly wherfore coulde wyse synke hertes iesus bodye sawe spirite common people reporte suche manier fable howe yt gostes dead folkes doe oftentimes appere suche wyll represent mortall mennes iyes certain lykenesse verai naturall bodyes yet haue materiall veraye body dede emong thomas vnto disciple reportyng seen lorde sayed playnly would neuer belieue except puttyng finger syde hadde serched prientes hole nailles speare iesus therfore shewe vndoubtable trueth vnto bothe aliue also bare aboute hym veray reall body dede bodye thesame whiche caryed tofore sayed vnto dooe ye yet feare sight ghoste seeyng ye playnly beholde iyes knowe fauour olde seeyng yt ye heare voyce beyng acquainted familiar vnto yet neuerthelesse dooe thoughtes vnbelief mystrustyng aryse yet still hertesa spirite hath fleashe bone ye see haue euen suche like woont come commonly menes myndes satisfie ye euery one sens vieu beholde hades feete haue manifest prientes nailes touche handle ye syde hathe gashe speare fele ye bodye come nerer iyes leaue ye suspectyng spirite ghoste hath neither fleashe bone ye see haue entred hither doores beeyng shutte whan wyll seen whan inuisible blyndyng mennes iyes sleyght gifte body beyng made immortall euen suche lyke shal body also resurreccion whan lorde suche woordes taken awaye feare put comforte shewed foorth vnto handes feete viewed opened side might handle manifest dientes woundes lordes pleasure reserue thesame entente euidet token might emong disciple perfectly auouche trueth humain bodye also maye tyme come laste daie iudgement enbraide iewes vnbelief accordyng prophecie sayeth shall see haue perced made hole nowe wheras wer yet still plainly belieue bee thesame bodye seen dead case certain inebriacion ye would saye drounkenship gladnesse holde theyr myndes neither perfectly beleue theyr owne iyes theyr eares theyr handes oft tymes afeard belieue thyng whiche doe rather liues wishe truehe saied vnto th haue ye meate men fearing leste caste selues fooles paradise false ioye wherof bee anon depriued iesus vouchesaluyng token euidence bee phisician vnbelief spiece lyke mistrustfulnesse remaine v saied haue ye thyng maie eaten none vndoubted token prouf man aliue yf thesame take meate therfore iesus willed meate geuen damisellmath ix marke vc luke viii iohn xi wha called life sembleably also vnto lazarus shall fele huger reised agayn immortalitie woulde preset tyme requyred confirme make euidente vnto disciple veritie humain body wer present tyme place good nu ber disciple yet veraye small prouision viandrye therfore bryng foorth whiche morsell fishe bruiled honey combe iesus sight al eate parte thinges whiche set hym sayed vnto woordes whiche spake vnto whyle yet must nedes fulfilled whiche written lawe moses prophetes psalmes opened theyr wittes might vnderstande scryptures sayed vnto thus written thus behoued christe suffer aryse agayn death thyrde day repentaunce remissyon sinnes shoulde bee preached hys name emong nacions muste beginne hierusalem ye witness thynges beholde sende promisse father vpon tarye ye citie hierusalem vntyll ye bee endowed power high whan nowe made theyr sens perfectely belieue sighte ghoste verai liuyng man euen thesame tofore seen bothe liuing also dying taketh recourse vnto holy scripture wherunto ought credite bee geuen although s man neuer muche crye ye ought sayeth meruaill thynges whiche ye see haue doen scripture cannot lye forasmuche hath wrytten inspiracion holy ghoste whatsoeuer thyng hath hitherto doen thesame foreshewed prefigurate afore bokes moses prophetes psalmes euen veray figure moses lawe signifie man holy prophetes promised many thynges whose first springyng vp whose progression goyng foreward whose cosummacion misticall psalmes doe describe lesse trueth shall rest thynges also bee perfourmed haue thesame scripture foreshewed concernyng returnyng heauen concernyng spirite god sent bodye myne shalbe taken awaye shall make stedfast concernyng ghospell bee spredde throughout whole vniuersall worlde concernyng laste ende worlde thynges whiche many tymes labour beate heades whan hauyng yet mortall bodye subiect vnto death lyued conuersaunt emong beeyng also mortall tyme premiss setled hertes ye longer doubte whan ye see sayinges agree misticall scripture cummyng passe sequele thynges agree bothe hitherto tyme hath required haue tendrelye borne weakenesse fleashe haue grosse proufes laied trueth matiers hensforthe growe ye forewarde spiritual vnderstandyng scripture shal ye fro henceforth see shall ye heare misticall bokes vnderstanded excepte god open mynde reason iesus opened vnto iyes theyr herte thei might reade belieue vnderstad written scripturethan opened wittes thei mighte vnderstade scripture c man doeth vnderstande scripture dooeth beleue ordre sayed iesus hath semed good vnto father restore mankynde thyng whiche decreed hath ben set forthe inspiracion bookes holy scripture selfe thyng hath foreshewed doen neither possible otherwyse come passe determinacions god immutable holy scripture litle skille lye selfe spirite god whole instincte haue wrytten death open shame crosse waie lye vnto glory necessarie shoulde arise lyfe thyrd daye ende ye might know selfes haue lorde aduocate beyng liuesman one hensfoorth shall dye nomore thesame aduocate beeyng admitted heauen shall thence send vnto spirite godand repetaunce remissio synnes shoulde bee preached name muste ye name iesus christe preache repentaunce lyfe past remission synnes without kepyng moses lawe thesame remission synnes shall bee geuen people euangelicall feith onely haue suffred peines behalfe creature leat beleue shall atteigne state innocencie thynges muste preached onely iewes also nacyons worlde yet prouyded alwayes ye begynne firste hierusalem iewrye borne haue wroughte miracle hierusalem haue taught suffered death emog people shall ye fynde hertes meanes wayes nowe already prepaired vnto feithand behold wil send promise father vpon unto people shal ye renewe memorie thynges whiche ye haue seen heard doctrine whiche firste receiued father taught vnto ye shall poure world gainsaye withstand testimonie lyke vnceassauntly crye haue heretofore saied father sende vnto spirite whiche long agone promysed prophetes woulde sendeiohel ii g psal iiii whan spake mouth iohell shall bee shall hereafter poure spirite vpon fleashe soonnes daughter shall prophecie whiche spirite holy dauid also wishe wha saiedbut tarrye ye citie hierusalem vntill c sende thou furth thy spirite shal created thou shalt renewe face yearth thatsame spirite shall make strong inuincible terrours bee shewed world thesame spirite shall morouer geue eloquence whiche creature shall bee hable gaynesaye shall also geue power worke miracle sorte testimonie concernyng shall bee thyng condigne pith efficacie ye meane tyme vntil bee ye perfecte quiete rest yourselues beeyng congregated together one coumpainie remayne ye citie hierusalem begynnyng concorde vnitie churche shall spryng vp exhorte ye one another holy communicacions deuoutly praying geuyng thankes vnto god vntill thatsame spirite come aboue shall enstructe arme power strength celestial pand led bethanie lift vp handes blissed came passe blissed departed caryed vp heauen wurshypped returned hierusalem great ioye continuallye temple praysyng laudyng god lift vp handes blissed herupon iesus soondry euidente prouffes confirmed veritie resurreccion led disciple bethanie beeyng euen readie departe hence heauen lift vp hades blissed representyng euen veraye poynte also thexaple patriarkes moses thesame instaunte wisheth well vnto disciple lifted vp yearth sighte al carryed vp heauen disciple fallyng prostrate grounde wurshipped lord lookyng theyr iyes long might muche thei looke hym hertes bodye taken awaye iyes premiss thus executed dooen returned hierusalem accordyng lorde enioyned returne thei great ioye nowe feith shaken theim sorow heauinesse assured hope promise geue cherefulnesse meane season thei wer muche ofte templeand wer cotinuallye temple praysing laudyng god men euen tha alreadie offreing euangelicall sacrifice praysing magnifying bounteous goodnesse god towardes mankynde rendryng thankes vnto hym decreed freely geue suche high benefites vnto mortall men sonne finis moste vertuous ladie moste gracious quene katherine late wife moste noble kyng henry eight moste famous memorie deceassed nicolas udall highnesse moste humble seruaut wisheth health prosperitee christ cosider gracious quene katerine greate noumbre noble weomen time countreye englande onelye geuen studie humaine science straunge tongue also throughlye experte holy scripture hable compare wyth beste wryters aswell endictynge pennynge godlye fruitfull treatise enstruccion edifiynge whole realmes knowleage god also translating good bokes latine greke englishe vse commoditie suche rude ignoraunte sayd tounges cannot thynke esteme famous learned antiquitee ferre behynde tymes cannot iustelye bee made comparison betwene cornelia noble matrone rome throughe longe conuersacion continuance learned housebande processe tyme wel learned eloquent hirself chiefe principall instructrice brynger vp hir two sonnes caius gracchus tyberius gracchus learning made thesame lengthe fyne yet daye remayne registred noumbre absolute perfecte oratours olde tyme reade one amesia rome woman well spoken fine toungue beynge time indicted arrained grieuous offece wittily piththily wich suche grace made answer hirself whole benche courte presente iudged ye mere respecte eloquence witte present perill ieoperdie shewed worthy theyr whole cosentes sentence quit discharged law crime hortensia daughter quintus hortensius brought vp continually fro hir cradle tendre infancye house companye suche noble oratour came lengthe nere perfect eloquece father hable publique hearing make oracions thesame piththye sorte noble weomen rome time sore taxed departe golde iewels toward certayne necessarie charge comon weale hortensia came co missioner speake behalfe matrones exquisite talke obteined mitigacion almoste wholle taxe whiche sessours afore agreed vpon appointed vnto weomen contribute exaumples eloquence weomen lyke verye fewe noumbre thynges suche highe excellencie meruailed great matier woondre emong many thousades three fower founde hable speake iudge open audience strauge case reputed one two weome haue ben foud wittie learned latine toungue beeynge owne natiue language euerie carter handicraftes man spake though al thinge finely learned men oratours dyd high matier praise commendacion weomen either wine daughter excellent fine latine men could continuaunce greate manye yeares speake latine well yet weomen specialy chronicled history notable yea syngulare exaumples worthy perpetuall fame memorye wytte learnyng eloquence heathen hiereme epistle writeth speciall high praise commendacions eustochium mother paula daughter blesilla daughter daughter whiche euerye one passyng well sene onely holy scryptures also latyne greke hebrewe whiche toungues learned exactely veray shorte tyme excelled like testymony geueth marcella veray noble woman rome whome reporteth time well profyted knowleage holy scripture departure rome yf doubtefull question poynte difficultee concernyng scripture folkes woulde resorte hir iudge hable also sufficient decise matier controuersie ambiguitee happened emonge knowleage extended ferther priuate edifyinge theyr owne selues fewe others thesame suche place latine mother toungue natiue language nowe gracious blisse full time knoweleage hath pleased almighty god reuele shewe abrode lighte holy ghospell noumbre noble weomen especially realme englande yea howe many yeares tender virginitie onely aswell sene familiarlye traded latine greke tongue owne mother language also bothe kyndes prophane litterature liberall artes exactly studyed exercised holy scripture theologie ripe able aptely cunnyngly muche grace eyther endicte translate vulgare toungue publique instruccio edifying vnlearned multitude neyther nowe straunge thing heare ientle weomen stede moste vaine communicacion aboute moone shynyng water vse graue substanciall talke greke latine housebandes godly matiers newes englande see young damysels noble house courtes prince stede cardes instrumentes idle trifleing haue continually theyr handes eyther psalmes omelies deuoute meditacions el paules epistle booke holy scripture matiers familiarlye reade reason therof greke latine frenche italian englishe nowe common thing see young virgin nouzeled trained studie letter yt willingly set vayne pastime naught learninges sake nowe newes see quenes lady moste highe estate progenie stede courtly daliaunce enbrace vertuous exercise readyng wrytyng moste earneste studie erely late applye themselues acquiring knowlage aswell liberall artes discipline also moste specially god moste holy worde wherunto christen folkes estate degree euer ought vttermoste possible power moste principally moste earnestly themselues geue dedicate great cause publique reioycyng lorde maye yt time christes harneste euerie good bodye moste busily applyinge worke vocacio towardes inning lordes corne instructyng youth teachyng scholes preachyng simple flockes godly inducing family wrytyng good godly treatise edifying suche willing reade translating good bokes straunge tougues vulgare language helpe vnlearned noble weomen bloude estate royall lesse diligent trauaillours best aboue named office mete sexe ne take manier skorne disdeigne ye labour drawing haruest home bee ioyned kefelowes inferiour person moste lowe degre condicion howe happie art thou england whose behoufe edifying christe quenes princess spare ne ceasse earnest endeuour sedulitee spende tyme wittes substaunce also bodyes behalfe lyke highnesse moste noble quene katerine aswel composyng setting foorth many goodly psalmes diuerse contemplatiue meditacions also causyng paraphrase moste famous clerke moste godly writer erasmus roterodom bee translated oure vulgare language englande neuer bee able render thankes sufficiente may neuer bee able desertes require enough praise magnifye moste noble moste vertuous moste wittye mooste studious ladye mary grace daughter late moste puissaunte moste victorious kyng henry eyght moste famous memorie moste derely beloued systur king soueraigne lorde maye neuer bee able saye enough prayse magnifie hir grace takyng suche great studie peine trauaill translatyng paraphrase said erasmus vpon gospel iohn hyghnesse speciall contemplacion noumbre right well learned men woulde bothe haue made courtesie also would haue brought wurse frame doyng greatly maie glory suche pierlesse floure virginitee grace middes courtly delices emiddes enticementes worldly vanity hathe owne choice eleccion vertuously fruictefully passed tendre youth publique comforte gladfull reioycing whiche byrth brought englande doeth nowe also conferre vnto thesame vnestimable benefite f rtheryng bothe v posteritee knowleage goddes worde clere vnderstandyng christes gospell royal exercise dede virginly educacion vnestimable precious fruite maydenly study noble successe princely spending tyme especially woma zele prouokyng god glory worthy immortalitee fame renoume coulde manifeste argumente myndyng publique benefite countrey coulde bee euident profe desyre dooe good father moste dere beloued subiectes could plaine declaracio constaunt purpose promote goddes worde free grace gospell effectually prosecute weorke translatyng whiche begoonne whan ouer peynfull studie labour wryting cast weake body grieuous long syckenesse yet intent diligent englishe people shoulde bee defrauded benefite entended ment vnto committed weorke maister frauncisce malet doctour facultee diuinitee celeritee expedicion fini hed made complete case kynges maiesties moste royall commaundemente moste godly iniunccions expressed declared published sayed paraphrase shoulde within certaine monethes bee sette foorthe curate people realme englande hadde preuented grace might eftsones haue put fyle poolishing thereof nowe alreadie veraye absolut perfeict woulde emong rude homely dooinges suche none otherwise haue glyttered clothe golde enpowdred emog patch canuesse perles diamoundes emong peoblestones meane tyme learned man maye sedulitee suche noble princesse bee spurre prouocacion employe talente learnyng knowlage publique vse commoditee countrey maye moste notable exaumple vertuous lady occasion shake sluggishenesse yeld vnto common weale englande condigne fruicte studie learning idle loiterer maye moost excellent acte kynges daughter kynges sistur bee shame reproche negligence persones neuer ignoraunt vnlearned maie moost earnest zele princesse suche highe estate bee effectuall prouocacion encouragyng haue good mynde wyll reade heare enbrace deuout catholyke paraphrase plainly sensibly translated graciously offred ye would saie put folkes handes made familiar vnto besechyng therfore almighty god maie harte good englishe people take lesse place ne weorke effect godly knowleage innocent liuing highnesse procuryng traslacions said ladie mary grace partie also haue ment shall sembleablye continuall peticioner diuine maiestee longe yeres preserue bothe estate procuring many good translacions edifying simple people christes discipline many lyke actes publique vtilitee v al wherby ye maye bothe atteygne worlde condigne fame renoume perpetuall memorie emong men lyfe croune immortal glorye blisse heauen eternally raigne christ holy aungelles amen moste renoumed prince ferdinando archeduke austriege brother charles fift emperour romaynes erasmus roterodam wysheth health laste yere moste gracious prince ferdinando tooke hande write paraphrase vpon gospell saincte mathewe vrgente request moste reuerende lorde mathewe cardinall hedune myne owne mynde partly greate excellencie woorke certayne reuerente feare withdrewe minde medlinge therwithall partlye also forasmuche besides many sundry difficulty whiche mighte abashe weakenesse whiche acknowleage owne habilitie medlyng treatise farre aboue power thought vtterlye dispatched allsuche kinde wrytyng yet notwithstandyng compelled cannot tell sorte declare ghospell sainte iohn partely successe former bolde enterprise partly auctoritie certayne noble personage whose desire satisfie might thought vnkynde wicked also yf disobey commaudementes yet vnknowen vnto muche full godly maiestie present gospell whiche moste parte doeth trauaile declaracion suche secrete misteries vnto nature god doeth appertaine wonderfull copulacion sayed nature vnto incarnacion canne imaginacio comprise god father beyng without beginning doeth continually beget god sonne begetter doeth wholy powre yet thereby nothyng diminished also sayed sonne suche wyse borne yet thereby nothyng secluded againe bothe holy ghoste doeth procede continueth perfit copulacion one nature emogst without confusion distincte proprietie person witte atteyne knowe coniunccion omnipotente vnspeakeable nature incarnacion couple mannes nature vnto hys selfesame whiche euermore bene god lyuyng god begotten also man borne virgin marie declaracion suche matter whiche oftentymes bare transposing one woorde haynous offence lybertie paraphrase haue aboue perceyue muste go prosecute purpose ouerplaces incumbred many sundry difficulty hedged diched parted diuided fluddes gulfes ouer whiche possible passe reason thicket standynge moates none gospel hath eyther mo harde question solued either vehement studie hath bestowed old excellent autours finallye whose exposicion interpreter varry discent whiche verilye doe thinke mete imputed dulnesse lacke learnyng either obscuritie stile elles diffusenes thinges conteyned therin besides peculiar difficulty sayed matter wordes euangelist doeth attribute vnto christ intricate enigmaticall question whiche man shoulde expresse wyse paraphrase suche thinges willnot agree answer yt perceiue purpose christ speake many thynges spoken christ suche sorte knewe well neither coulde neither woulde perceyued vntill conclusion thyng dyd declare sayinge furthermore asmuche office paraphrase expresse thing brefely spoke fewe wordes couched copy plety wordes could obserue ye due measure time wher read lorde kepe maundy vpon night time disciple saied time haue washed feete yet thesame mau dy long comunicatio disciple maye thoughte wonder time speake manye wordes namelye seynge woordes euangelistes declare manye thynges also wer bothe saied doene hym thesame nighte wherfore dewe measure tyme could obserued whiche declare large sayed thynges copy plenty wordes finallye euangelist hath certaine peculiar kynde stile doth knit stile thoughe wer ring ringe ioyned linked togither sumtime contrary mebres sumtime like sumtime one selfe thynge sudry tymes repeted paraphrase able expresse suche pleasaunte elegance stile meane suche place principio erat verbum verbum erat apud deum deus erat verbum beginning worde worde god god worde iii place worde worde god god pleasautly repeted byan repetyng agayne beginning concludeth sentence hoc erat principio apud deum thesame beginninge god omnia per ipsum facta sunt sine ipso factum est nihil al thynges wer made thesame without thesame nothing made yt made quod factum est ipso vita erat vita erat fux hominum sux tenebris sucet tenebre cam non comprehenderint life life ye light men lighte shineth derkenes derkenes coprehend doeth appeare euery membre sentence doeth alwaye repete former ende former beginneth latter suche lyke thyng may perceiued greke eccho wot represent touchynge thinges sumthyng haue spoken argumentes euagelistes gospel epistle peculiar grace elegancie speche perceiued well could haue place paraphrase therfore although perceiue many like difficulty yet toke vpon busye piece worke seyng many noble men theyr exhortacion encourage thereto auctoritie enforce specially good successe former dewtie obedience rather presumpcion dyd bolden thesame onely good successe forasmuche gentyll reader trauayle paine doeth thanke also forasmuche charles al emperours yt eight hundreth yeres hath reigned world moste puissance beholde large dominion also moste vertuous consider besides imperiall quality feruet affeccion zeale towardes religion godlynes hath paynes vnto dedicate countenaunce wordes also letter full honorably louingly wryten certified thankfully accepted grace wher upo thought conuenient seing mathew emperour charles dedicate preseted iohn vnto ferdinando second charles dedicate plainly good hope doeth greatly comfort minde promising shal come passe like former labour charles good fauour wel procede good successe shal present endeuour gracious fauour ferdinando procede haue lucky successe two name tyme moste fortunate couple brother day moste lucky neyther doubted thinke yt fauour god wil prosperously set forth godly purpose suche godly disposed prince man maye thynke haue good opinion beeyng yet tender age excellente fruite vertue doeth satisfy ye great expectacion whiche might call blading tendre age put v comfort chyldage appered certayne straunge meruelous towardenes suche prudencie moderacion mekenes integritie deuocion godlines euery hope grace woulde wonderfull excellent prince euery condicion perfite absolute touchyng publike hope al whole world hath coceyued like hitherto haue frustrated haue brought passe nowe come age discrecion doeth appere onely contente fullfill sayde hope expectacion also desire men vttermoste litle treatise christian prince suche many dayes goe ye young man caused studious person lyke asmuche ye dyd vouchesafe reade present worke dedicate vnto grace name shall likewise cause lyked seing youg time floure many fold consideracions vnto worlde moste derely beloued neyther shall ye eyther aduaunce glorye renoume eyther procure benefit commoditie neyther noble estate neyther suche sober moderate nature doeth couet looke prayse commendacion man neyther minde fantasie doeth seke thyng el fauour christe whose furtheraunce paine taken men generall paine bestowed plentifully might haue comoditie therby suche thieir owne nature commendable haue especial profite singuler commoditie ouercum malice thought worthie fauour commendacion men present purpose maye grace muche helpe declare present worke compiled payne studie haue bene reiected grace maiestie feared truste leste grace wysdome geue credence vnto whiche peraduenture saye shal vnderstande paraphrase vpon ghospell dedicate vnto prince ferdinando laye prince younge manne gospell wil make cauillacion saye yt geue frogges wine greke prouerbe speaketh though wer thought suche presente prince wt mete giftes yt bryng vnto bokes written barbarous togue conteyning matter huntyng kepyng dogges horse ingines warre yea mafortune dising carding uerily contrary opinio deame euangelical heauenlye philosophie thought hyghest lowest myddle estate wonderfull profitable yet none necessarie supreme heades power worlde weight charge burden susteyne daungerous storme apperteineth vnto caulme assuage manyfold occasion haue whereby good wyttes well inclined nature well instructed educacion maye marred corrupted muche semyng shoulde instructed armed diligently reste moste godly infallible preceptes holy doctrine suche cannot offende withoute great dammage whole world peculiar office prelate nourishe ye people plentifull abundant foode euangelicall doctrine cause called pastours herdes scripture graunte bee true yet poete homer comendable christian auctors comme ded vnworthily calleth kyng herd ouer people howe muche mete yt name title agre euery christia prince prince doeth preache teache gospell doeth obserue practise fulfill yet doeth sort teache whosoeuer doeth kepe obserue fulfil knowe shall know excepte diligente frequent readyng peruse except great studie profoundly print memorie behoueth stedfastlye beleue yt celestial king gouernour world vnto nothing vnknowen whose iyes man deceiue whose power man resiste shal iudge euery man accordyng merites supreme power whiche reason power dreade man list easilye deceyue whome list whiche trespasse thyng bee cited appere mortall man consistory commended also oftymes misdedes whose mindes ought depely grauen present lyfe wherof kynges theselues haue assuraunce asmuche houre whiche man enioye long come another lyfe neuer shall haue ende whiche indifferentlye without respecte estate dignitie sauing strayter iudgement shallbe straiter accopt shal make yt world hath surmounted roume office auctoritie euery man shall sentence moste righteous iust iudge whose iudgemet man shall escape reape ye croppe hath sowen preset life neither shall escape either good dedes shall receyue croune eternal glory blisse el offence committed euerlastyng fier whose myndes say necessarie thyng depely infixed al kynd prosperitie flatterye man doeth prouoke set affiaunce thinges present forget hereafter come whose memorie requisite depely printed christ hath plainlye threatenned v wordes wo ye riche high power world hath comfort world whiche haue plentie store suche thinges wherby man minde corrupt degenerate whose eares coueniet diligently beate euery man ought warely bestowe talent lorde hath committed vnto waye vsurie lordes auauntage wil cal euerye man make accoumpte thereof whiche reason power committed vnto god may pleasure either profit disprofit world ought assuredly beleue men neuer puissant high auctoritie themselues nothyng thynges good comme dable come god al thinges ought desired maye christian peticion lawefully desired vnto whole glory prayse prosperously affaire ought attributed ascribed world doeth commede magnifie reason haue suche thinges christ taught despised certaine vaine fantastical apparent shadowes thinges yt seeme comendable ye base sorte doeth maner regard wurship goddes ought thorowly perswaded yt sternnes hated god iniurie ought reuenged iniury yt nothing commendable peace nothing acceptable god meaknes clemencie suche whome muche busynes dayly doeth prouoke vnquietnes warre reuengyng displeasure whose minde oughte depely printed yt neyther desire life neither feare death lawfull swarue honesty yt present life man oughte loke rewarded merites desertes seyng nexte world man shall defrauded dewe rewarde mindes prince manye prouocacios much troublesome busines many occasion doeth oft many tymes entise allure dishonestie uerely minde vpon general felicitie miserie whole world doeth depend ought weightie profoud persuasios philosophy armed whereby maye vprightly nothing shrinking perseuer againste policy engine worlde suche doctrine whiche doeth peyse minde tossed waues surge fortune worldly busines otherwyse balans dothe staye shippes tyme tempest neither conueniently neither certayne veritie neyther yet efficacie power collected woorke ghospel god ye profane prince asmuch thei must commonly trauaile worldly affaire maintenaunce publique tra quillite reste cannot alwayes obserue suche thynges perceiue iudge conuenient kepte obserued yet least euangelical doctrine profoundly rooted shal able forasmuche liethe shall alwaye endeuoure themselfes approche nigh vnto ye performaunce christes preceptes litle nothing swarue theyr marke thing desire may appeare gouernours worlde gracious prince ferdinando greatly hope se whome haue knowen childeage hitherto haue maruelously geue readinge gospell wont whyle priest seruice spende tyme either supersticious kind praiers eyther vnfruitfuliagling moste parte nobilite doth ope testamet reuerently se epistle gospel day doeth instructe exhorte neyther doubt example childage haue muche encreased encrease age neyther mystrust tyme come euery place many folowe exaumple like infeccion vice taken example men estate doeth spedely crepe vnto many euen example vertue haue beginning renoumed person wil soone well lyked men estimacion worde god old time may euidently appere rite ceremony yet vsed churche lefte vnto v old antiquitie boke adorned truly gold iuery precious stone reserued laied vp deuoutly emogst ye iewels broughte foorth ne caried without greate reuerence gospeller desirethe licence hym doeth execute maye rede pronounce ther caused holy perfume censing frankincense stacten droppyng mirrha mirrha selfe powder herbe galbanum forehead brest hath signe crosse made vpon glorye geuen lorde downe ground euery man ariseth standeth bolte vpright heades bar eares attentife iyes full reuerence name iesus oft mencioned knee bowed downe ground great reuerence holdeth boke brest carieth euery man doeth kisse laste reuerently layd vp emongest ye reliques thyng doeth ceremony meane put v remembraunce yt nothing ought christian men regarded derely beloued reuerently handled celestiall doctrine whiche christ hath preached vnto persones whiche manye hundreth yeres ago consent whole world hath allowed whiche worlde prince therof maketh v preuaile like wurthely vain misordred deuocion iewes reproued whiche iewes doe greate reuerence vnto booke lawe olde testamente laying pure cleane clothes vnder knelyng downe wurshipping touchyng cleane vndefiled handes thinges lawe doeth chiefly teache wickedly contemne despyse perceyued v vndeuoute keping fulfylling ghospel supersticious scrupulous obseruers rite ceremonyes doeth auayle haue booke adourned iuorye siluer golde sylke lyuing bee polluted infected vice ghospell doeth straytely forbid soule bee decked vertue accordyng ghospell booke auayle v borne hert doctrine herte mynde seruice doeth perfume odour caused censyng doctrine bee contemned lyuyng haue dayly pestilent sauer better bowe downe necke booke lustes obstinately stiffe neckes repine preceptes doeth profit auayle v rise vp stand bare headed al whole life suche declare openly despise doctrine ghospell howe dare ye bolde kisse boke ghospell whiche beeyng subiect lecherye auaryce ambicion sensualitie yre defile dishonest admonicions ghospell howe dare kysse booke teacheth nothyng peace mekenesse charitie whiche despysyng christes doctrine wholy consumed enuie replenished hatred boyleth anger inflamed desyre reuenged furious madde neyghbour whiche also mynde maye bee satisfied forceth wood battayle set world eares together howe dare impudente embrace wurshippe holye booke whiche kinde liuing conuersacion vtterly geuen married vnto worlde whiche mortall enemy doctrine gospell doeth detestate abhorre cleane handes verye reuerentlye vse touche holy boke gospell filthy myndes doe despise preceptes gospel doe rather lay hert doe kisse mind pure affeccion boewe neckes certain hath hanging necke cariethe part iohns gospell remedie againste disease suche heuy misfortune doe rather beare aboute v doctrine gospell mynde whiche maye remedy al disease synne vice doe discommend ceremony doe raile vpon deuocion simple people plainly tha th se saied thinges profit v put practyse thynge whiche visible signes putteth v remembraunce true christien men saye yf vnfainedly professe doctrine gospell let v inwardlye myndes practise suche thynges signes outwardly represented vnto v haue heard saye fashion place prince shall al ghospell tyme stande holdyng naked sweard hand rest laying handes vpon hyltes howe shall defende ghospell swearde whose mynde doethe hate gospell whiche wholy affeccionate vnto vanity worlde whose opinion nothyng lesse regarded excellente precious perle ghospell whome nothynge hated whiche christe taughte onely coueted pouleth people oppresseth poore warre defaceth good badde occasion many folde calamity whose vaine glorye muche mannes bloudde shedde dooeth saye drawe swearde defende christes gospell withall let first made one gospell lette cutte awaye vicious naughtie appetite mynde swearde gospell yf lyste lette hym drawe swearde ennemies ghospell thynges haue spoken moste renoumed prynce waye aduertisement without reproche person open matter onelye reprehende person boldelye vnto grace wryte thus kynde suspicion al suche faulte enormitee suspected bee none byshoppes except congruence ought liue gospell prince oftentymes simplicitie vnder assemblaunce deuocion deceyued perswasion suche whiche thoughte perfite professours religion ofttymes esteme poynt great perfeccion daily saie ouer praiers call mattens see masse euery daye whiche thinges lay prince young man also graunt certaine token signe well disposed mind yet many thinges yt straitly appertayn christe prince office foresee storme warre arise publike libertie diminished ne violated poore comminaltie bee compelled famishe naughty officer made permitted opinion shall acceptable seruice god yf saye praieres vi yeres together yet commende said thinges whiche principall bee coupled ioyned therto prince suppose lacketh porcion godly perfeccion putting confidence obseruacion thinges settyng part suche thinges whiche peculiarly appertain vnto kynges office dutie plainly confusion religio subuersion common welth geue suche councel neither geue profitable holsome councell prince neither yet subiectes good dede heare seruice thei pure yt cum pure life vnto sacrifice doen remembraunce true highest prince redeme seruauntes bestowed life fury vain glory negligence many thousande men bee eyther vexed vtterlye perishe thinke nedefull shewe part prince neuer leisure neither lesse carefull thei diuine seruice great thyng prince saye praiers houre prescribed therfore whiche cannot haue sufficiente tyme leisure order disposeth affayres common wealth prince shall pray inough full saye daily recite hearte notable prayer wyse kyng salomon lorde geue wisdome knowledge behaue selfe vnto thy people praier muche lyke vnto thesame whiche wyse man remember reciteth boke wisdome geue wisdome whiche euer thy seate maie labour wt may knowe acceptable thy sighte knowethe vnderstandethe thinges shall leade sobrely workes preserue power shall workes acceptable shall gouerne thy people righteously worthy sitte father seate haue knowledge thy vnderstandynge meanynge except thou geue wisdome sende thy holy ghost aboue way vpon earth maye refourmed men may learne thinges pleasaunt vnto wisdome wise young desireth haue may man chiefly fynde holy scripture list vnfainedly godly curiositie seke haue otherwise howe cu passe christen men behauiour maners partely bee decayed conuersacion wurse gentile ethnickes partly degenerated certaine iudaical supersticion reason doctrine ghospell hath regarde notwithstandyng saye trueth tymes hath euer sum whome gospell hath beene hadde due honoure reuerence yet neuerthelesse fower hundred yeres past liuely heate feruencie therof hath greatlye abated part wherfore ought vttermoste power endeuour selfe euery man parte reuiue thissame sparkle heauenly fire whiche eternall veritie iesus christe lorde hath sent earth wishyng nothyng el maye feruentlye kyndled great circuite spreade selfe abrode set fyer tyme man condicions corrupted great dissencions opinion wherby houre thinges confounded order whither shall rather flee haue redresse hilarie doeth well admonishe v vnto pure fountaine well spring holy scripture wherof moste pure vnderfiled part ye gospel neyther oughte gospel mislyked supreme power cause thoughe dyd sum saye cause suche sedicious disobedient whose parte duetie bee obedient vnto prince nay rather profiteth prince pointe insomuche doeth teache execute true office prince tirauntes causeth people gladlye obey euery good prince quietly tollerate beare bad finally gospell blamed man vse best thing whiche nature moste excellent best called gospel peace reconcilyng god v vnitie secondlye couplyng mutuall loue amitie betwene eche v together man stumble stone let blame hymselfe gospell power man hath policy cospiracy coniuracion together able anquishe oppresse veritie gospel whiche moste mightily setteth furth self greuously persecuted touchyng matter feare haue heretofore spoken inough muche paraphrase may fruite bee red haue spoken worde two euangelistes entent purpose wyll make ende lyfe doctrine lord iesus christ thapostles preachyng euangelistes wrytinges spred large ouer world euangelist iohn whome christ notably loued toke hande write present gospell muche thentent compile historie gospel make rehersall certaine thinges omitted euangelistes semed vnworthy knowen especiall cause wrote gospel men suppose set forth confirme godhead christ heresye whiche euen day euill weedes emongest good corne begun spring namely heresye cerinthians ebeonites whiche besyde erroniouse doctrine preached christ nothing el man nether wise borne ye virgin marie necessarie worlde shoulde knowe beleue christe bothe god twoo former article doeth principally helpe inflame loue man toward better knowe thing better wil loue secodarily doth cause v haue feruet courage folowe step attept folow couterfait yt thing doen aungell vision apperaunce dede furthermore like hard obserue ye thinges comaundeth eue thinges excedyng excellet promiseth therfore requisite also godhed vnknowen thentent yt might haue cofydence yt vndoubtedly would helpe seruautes sort loue neither defraude promise yt able wt becke list euagelistes yt wrote iohn made maner mencion diuinitee christe thynke bee wysedome paul vsed speake emogst ye perfit emogst rest professing know nothing el iesus christe crucified mafortune ye time suffer inexplycable misterie put wryting al men knowledge lest derisio ye wicked could neither beleue neither vnderstand matter also olde aucient auctours oft make mecion heauely thinges doe vse speake seldome reuerently therof beeyng copious suche thynges doe profite appertaine godly lyuing apostle iohn constrayned therfore vndiscrete boldenes heretikes plainly euidently affirme nature christe like bolde presumpcion arians catholyke father inforced precisely discusse certaine thinges touching thesame matter wher would rather haue medled diffinicion suche matter whiche doeth greatly passe capacitie mannes wittes cannot determined without great daunger perill matter without consideracion reserued iohn wel beloued christ well worthy whome well wysedome dyd loue aboue reste feruetly beleued thesame plentifully reuele open certain secretes misteries vnto hym maye cal wel beloued dearlyng therfore derely beloued christ let v profoundly groundely vnderstand part may louers christ well one thing put reader acknowleage present paraphrase folowe mynde moste allowed olde autours euery place neyther euery thing themselues often discent emong themselues yet alway sincerely faithfully declare bring forth thinketh true sence meaning muche dyd perceiue olde auctours contendyng opinion heretikes haue wrested place something violently purpose yet mynde manne geue credence paraphrase would geue commentarye wrytten one vpon notwithstandyng paraphrase kynde commentarie allegory whiche perceiue olde auctours haue scrupulously supersticiously diligente haue medled withal seldome neyther copiously thought conuenient farewell redoubted prince endeuour fauour sette foorth glory gospell almightie christ part graciously assist desyres yeuen basile yere lord mdxxiii v daye ianuarye psaint iohns lyfe wrytten saynt ierome iohn apostle iesus loued tight well beyng sonne zebedeus iames apostle brother lordes deathe herode beheaded wrote ghospel last ye rest desired thereto byshops asia agaynst cerinthus diuers heretickes principally agaynste opinion ebeonites whiche euen arose ebeonites auouche christe marie reason wherof enforced shew euen diuine natiuitie saye besydes cause wrytyng whan red volume matthewe marke luke well allowed texte story affirmed sayd trueth made stor one yeres actes whiche imprisonmente iohn christe suffered wherfore omitting yeres actes whiche sufficiently entreated three shewed thynges doen iohn imprisoned whiche thyng may euidently appeare suche shall diligently reade volume fower gospel whiche thing also doeth take awaye disagreyng semeth betwene iohn rest wrote besides premiss one epistle beginneth thus beginnyng haue heard haue sene iyes c two begin elder welbeloued lady chyldren c elder best beloued caius loue trueth c affirmed haue written iohn priest whose seuerall toumbe daye sene ephesus many suppose two memorial iohn euangelist whiche matter entreate shall order come lyfe papias scholler fowertenth yere tyme domicianus nero styred vp seconde persecucion ihon banished isle pathmos wrote ye reuelacion entitled apocalipsis iustine martir hireneus doe make commentary vpon domician stayne actes reuoked senate ouer muche crueltie returned ephesus tyme prince nerua continuyng vntill tyme emperour traiane instituted gouerned church asia continued tyll impotente age dyed three score eight yere passion lorde iesu buried lytle besyde thesame citie paraphrase erasmus vpon gospell sainct iohn p first chapiter nature god doeth passe beyond measure weaknesse man wit although thinges right good quicke sight yet diuine nature neither perceiued sens dede ne conceyued mynde imagyned expressed woordes although thinges create certain apparauce godly power wisdome goodnesse shewed commeth passe similitude brought foorthe thinges whiche dooe sumwhat perceyue sens witte maye bringe v summe small shadowelyke knowlage incomprehensible thinges may behold theim wer dreame cloude yet withstanding similitude maye bee taken thinges create whether ye behold aungels woorkemanship heauens el inferiour body whiche although bee familiare sens neuerthelesse cannot fully perceiue theim similitude say canne bee broughte foorth forsaied thinges whiche maye poynctes agree reason nature thinges whiche attaine knowelage comparison brought place therfore behoueth manne apply study minde may rather loue goodnesse god meruail comprehende highnesse whiche neither cherubin seraphin dooeth fully attayne although god cannot bee meruaylous workes yet rather beloued v goodnesse meruayled excellecy full knowlage diuine nature reserued worlde come theym whiche haue purged iyes herte godlynesse innocent lyfe man knoweth father dede sonne suche sonne manifeste vnto therfore serche knowlage goddes nature man reason presumptuous boldenesse speake thinges cannot bee expressed wordes madnesse geue iudgemente therof wickednesse haue grace meane beholde parte therof truely comprehended pure faith helpe man wisedome meane tyme enough attayne eternall saluacion beleue thinges god whiche openly sette furth himselfe holy scripture men chosen purpose whiche inspired spirite suche thinges hymselfe afterwarde conuersaunt yerth opened disciple last hath vouchsaued declare manifestly holy gost disciple chosen entent beleue thinges simply truly christen wisedome reuerence thinges pure hert true religion thynges goe forewarde vnto meditacion heauenly lyfe godlynesse continue perseuer thinges victorye haue victorie thinges whole summe felicitie man serche godly cause man reason ferther thinges certaine perilous wicked boldnes although semed enoughy yt bothe trulye preached set furthe writinge euangelistes whiche declaring order natiuitie iesu christe concerning manhed life deathe affirme haue true nature man ferthermore declaringe sermones rehersinge miracle resurreccion death declare godly nature time required speaking nothynge diuine natiuitie whiche borne vnspeakable waye father without beginninge refreyninge also call manifestly name god thintente neyther trueth hidden godly disposed easy taughte neither occasion geuen weake vntaught iewes go backe fro doctrine ghospell whiche vttrely perswaded themselfes tradicion elder also moyses holy bookes name god could bee rightfullye attributed onelye god father alwaies wurshipped besides also leste gentile whiche wurshippe innumerable goddes yea goddes made men haue taken occasion continue peruerse errour perceiued ghospell name god beene made common many thinge are iewes hable receiue mistery thinkinge name bee approiprate one firste could meanes haue borne minde gentile beynge broughte vp opinion many goddes coulde firste bee perfeictly taughte thre deuided proprietie persones whiche thre euerye one god yet thre one god occasion one godly nature whiche common thre equally yet thus hath pleased god thintente faith ghospell shoulde bee stablished woulde haue declared mankinde litle litle shoulde beste serue time man capacitie nacion iewes wurshyppe god father deuoutly many hundrethe yeres ignoraunte bothe sonne holy goste sonne god himselfe whan herein yerthe averay man witnes hungre thirste slepe sorowe wepe displeased compassion longe suffred reputed none manne yea euen owne disciple also resurreccion would haue theim ignoraunt thinges muche holy goste open thynges thinges onelye whiche helped forwarde perswasion beliefe euangelical doctrine saluacion mankinde considering nature godly thinges comprehensible yea highest wittes men angel profession gospel pertainethe indifferently men heauenlye father hath opened vnto v muche godly thinges sonne hath willed sufficiente obtaininge saluacion therefore comethe certaine perilous presumpcion affirme thyng godly nature whiche either christ himselfe holy goste haue opened vnto v pin beginning woorde woorde god god woorde day wheate god woorde hath growen hertes good folkes also cockle wieked hath ouergrowen whose cursed presumpcion hath braste far hath ben afraide take iesu christe manhed bringing stede man vain vision similitude man contrariwise woulde take godhed falsely saying beginning whan borne virgin mary blinded yerthly affeccions coulde attain mystery god counsaill howe god toke vpon hym bee man one person shoulde bee meane nothing withdrawen immutable nature god yet perfectnesse manhed shoulde still remain shall therfore set forth sum thinges plainly ghospell much spirit christ hath vouchsaued open vnto asmuche thoughte sufficiente obtein saluacion thorow faith ghospell began say forasmuche nothing emonges thinges euer god made wherof may make comparison whiche throughly agree truth godhed must though improprely vse termes thinges vnderstading acquainted thintent may geue knowlage thinges whiche passeth men vnderstanding vtteraunce therfore holy scripture calleth god excellent minde whiche mind greatter better thinges imagined euen calleth onely sonne woord minde although sonne bee father yet lyke father man may see one say father sonne sonne father resemblaunce father sonne whiche man generacion many way vnperfit moste perfit god father sonne nothinge dooeth fully euidently expresse secrecye minde true declarynge woorde loking glasse minde whiche cannot sene bodely iyes couete haue man knowe minde thinge broughte passe meanes certainly quickely speache whiche beinge fetched inward priui y minde conueiethe certaine secrete efficacie minde speaker minde hearer eares hearer neither thynge amonges men effectuall stire vp euerye mocion mindes vttre speaking haue auctoritie maye shortly appoynte woorde haue done therfore called sonne equal al thinges father distinct differeth onely proprietie person called word god whiche proper nature way comprehended woulde knowen v neither pleasure knowen cause thintente mighte attain euerlastinge felicitie knowlage birthe teporal time ne yet woorde like man woorde corporall thing god nothing passeth time conteined place neither thynge subiect beginninge proceding age mutabilitie alwaye one whole altogether himselfe sonne continually begotten euen one himselfe eternall eternall almightie almightie good yt best conclusion god god neither later time inferior hys father euerlastinge worde euerlasting mind father speaketh himselfe al way secret thought yea world made knowen body himselfe sonne euermore shall begette sonne himselfe like wise euermore bringe foorthe almighty woorde nede thinge create whose felicitie nothinge added naturall goodnesse hath made whole ingine world set therin euangelicall mindes mankinde meane betwene aungels beastes thinthent might gather thinges wunderfully create also himselfe power loue goodnes makir thereof greate mighty king whatsoeuer commaunded doen shoulde doen euen veraye almightye father hath made thinges sonne woorde firste way shewed furth woord woulde knowen though spoken vnto v himselfe beinge knowe wonderfulnes f moste fayre workemanship might wind himselfe inward mocions therefore erre go far fro trueth whiche thinke worde god time procedeth emonges v mind goethe speache also whiche take worde god whiche god father hath made thinges bee numbred emonges thinges create errour rude grosse whiche suppose sonne woord god haue begun neuer whan borne bodily virgin mary thinge soeuer create hath beginning time sonne god twise borne father time rather time god verily god borne virgin mary time appointed thereto eternally euerlastynge fatherthe woord god c man mankynde hath pleased god sorte bringe furthe agayne v hys woorde saye sonne thintente mighte knowen plaine waye familiarly person therfore wicked maketh argumente iesus christ nothinge el manne contendethe haue beene create emonges creaturesan accidet thing may without corrupcion ye wherin exaumple one may take awaye whightnes wal yet substaunce doeth stil remayne father get bothe sonne woorde yet one soundry way time touchinge manhed alwaye without time touchinge godhed beefore vniuersall creacion thinges yearthly heauenly eternall woorde alredy euerlastinge father woorde procede father yet remained still father suche inseperable nature father proprietie person father yet cleue father accidente doeth substaunce god god god god god god reason one diuine nature common twaine bothe one nothing made difference betwene theim sauing onely proprietie person father sonne speaker worde spoken like onely beegotten sonne onely father onely woorde said father therof onely speaker pthe beginning god al thinges without made nothing made albeit woorde god almighty almightie yet differing proprietie person vnlikenes nature god ye father brought furth time tymes alwayes procedyng fatherly mind neuertheles neuer departed thesame neyther create father father made thynges create visible inuisibleall thinges c worde beyng lykewyse eternall himselfe woord gouerneth thinges hath restored thinges vsyng instrument minister sonne selfe nature vertue thinten manier thynges come father excellent auctour maker thesame sonne whome eternally begotten shall get without ende like himselfe thinges pin lyfe life light men light shineth darkenes darkenesse comprehended woorde god might power make thinges generall visible inuisible pleasure becke also worde life strength thinges create thesame euery thyng haue naturall strength force might whiche geuen saue themselfes kynde continuall generacion nothing idle without vse emonges great multitude thinges euery herbe tree hath strengthe put euery beast hath certain wit kynde prouidence hath framed al thinges whiche hath create certain power naturally graffed theim euery thing worke propertie continuaunce kinde hath lefte moste fa e workemanship worlde without light folkes fountain lyfe also fountain lyght reason father powreth hym fulnes diuine nature euerlasting natiuitie restoreth lyfe yea euen dead light putteth awaye darkenes men mindes neuer darkethe lyghte shineth darkenes c therefore woorde god whiche christ iesus men myndes selfe thing yearthly sunne bodily iyes whose mindes fallen thorowe sinne depe darkenes death labored helpe vnspeakable charitie tyme men dyd lyue ignoraunce abyding darkenes synnes wurshippyng dumme ydoles stede true god synfully drowned blind desyres theyr mindes lacked iyes hert wherwith eternall trueth perceyued god sprinkled men mindes litle sparke quicke perceyuing wit bodily affeccions darkenes synnes blinded darkenes worlde great neyther man wisedome philosophie neyther religion moses lawe yet lyght prophetes coulde put clerly awaye last came eternall moste bright sunne whose inuincible light darkenes geueth place came restore lyfe men iewes nacions worlde putting away darkenes synnes geue syght people thorowe lyght faith might acknowlege god father onely bee wurshipped loued onely sonne iesus christe bodily sunne doth geue lyght men hath soondrye course spirituall lyghte naturall power dooeth shyne yea euen moste thicke darkenesse worlde offeryng selfe menne thentente maye haue lyfe see waye eternall saluacion whiche open euery body faith ghospell although world blinded filthines synne cloude synfull desyres woulde beholde lyght yet could bee blemished darkenes worlde greate soeuer onely pure impurenes synne neyther thyng light manier way pure vncorrupted darkenes worlde doeth cotinually striue lyght wiche worlde hateth bewrayer workes darkenes doth eyther quenche darken beames many lyuely eternal lyghte coulde nothyng preuayle iewes haue striuen lyght philosopher great men world whiche hath dedicate themselfes wholly transitory thinges light hath victory shineth still middes darkenes worlde ener shall shine making men partaker therof apply themselfes bee apt receyue man doe whiche wittingly willingly repell lyght whan offred vnto theim whiche whan bee allured called lyght purpose shut theyr iyes wyll see truely sonne god dyd leaue nothyng vndoen wherby man lacke lyght pi sent god man whose name iohn came witnes beare witnes lyght men hym might beleue lyght sent beare witnes lyght dyd preace hymselfe sodainly men sight lest shoulde haue blinded reason incredulytie lacke beliefe woulde haue beleued thing muche bee meruayled atthe came witnes excepte lytell lytel prepared men mindes many wayes belyefe therefore satisfyed haue declared men wunderull creation worlde almighty power wisedom excedyng great goodnes excellent charitie towardes mankind neyther yet contented sygnifie cumming hand many prophecy prophetes many shadowes figure olde lawe conclusion sente man excellent prophetes wose name iohn although deserued chiefe prayse holynes emonge men borne vntil time called aungel dignitie
