office greater prophetes office yet none man largely endued many giftes god came goddes liberalitie owne nature geuen hym firste yet chosen sente god purpose accordyng prophecie prophecied hym myght beare witnes godly lyght whiche couered manhed conuersaunt worlde say whiche god declared voice father shoulde nede mannes witnes thintent might manier meanes cause hymselfe bee credit people woulde iohn shoulde bee goer lyghte day sterre appearing sheweth rysyng sunne woorlde also preachyng shoulde prepare mennes mindes receyue lyght whiche shoulde immediatly come synne l wherby heauenly lyght admitted receyued iohn dyd allure call people penaunce proclaming openly kyngdome heauen hande firste degree step lyghte men shoulde hate owne darkenes iohn great auctoritie emonge iewes excellente holines liuinge many toke christe himselfe whereby christ would rather bee comended iewes witnes time required thintente litle litle men commonly vse might crepe mindes people otherwise meaner person alwaye wount bee commended witnes greater esay promised christes cu ming shoulde certaine excellente lighte arise springe vp theym whiche liue darkenes shadowe deathe cause christe notable miracle many suspected iohn haue light whiche promised prophetehe light iohn onelye publisher true lighte light selfe therefore christe oportunitie time serued ye woulde saye abuse errour iewes auctoritie iohn prepare mindes men faithe gospell truely iohn certaine light saye burninge candle geuinge lighte feruently burninge godlines geuing light holynes life neuertheles lighte whiche bring life whole worlde woord god whereof wee doe speake presente true light euer proceding god father fountaine light whence soeuer lightsome heauen earth boroweth lighte sparke witte knowlage trueth light faith soeuer either emong men angel cummeth fountaine pthat lyght true light lighteth euery man cummeth world worlde blind without sunne thinges darke without light worlde also full darkenes euery syde sinne abhominable errours reigne euery place tyme darkenes often tymes shine foorth men excellent holynes lyfe lytell sterre moste darkest nightes gaue lyght thorow cloud howbeit dyd iewes borderer iewry true light geueth lyght onely one nacion men come darkenes worlde iewes went challenge lyght seuerally themselues thought promised theim onely asmuche touchyng fleshe dyd spring theim emonge theim light came geue lyght hertes nacionswhiche lighteth euery man whole world thorow faith gospel neither scithian iewe spaniard gothian englisheman kynges bondman excluded lyght lyght came geue light al men asmuche lay continue darkenes faute lyght hym frowardely loueth darkenes abhorreth lyght lyght shineth al none might pretend excuse willingly wittingly perisheth thorow owne faute man shoulde get knocke noone day woulde lyfte vp iyes phe world world made hym world hym woord god alwaies worlde say whiche without measure bee contayned circuite place world deuise workeman woorke ruler thing ruleth also tyme lyght dyd shine worlde sumwhat opening godly power wisedom goodnes therof thinges wunderfully creat meanes sorte speake mankinde many putting felicitie visible thinges worlde whome cause good righte lorde iesus accustome cal name worlde taughte eternall thinges beinge blinded earthly affeccions acknowleage maker darkenes mindes greate worlde knewe maker thereof wurship serpentes ox goates lekes oynions yea whiche vile stockes stone dispising whome receiued themselfes phe came emong owne owne receiued accustomed darkenes abhorre light blinded sinne enbrace deathe stede life yea whan shewe himselfe familiarly worlde conuersaunt liuing manhed emonges men knowen whiche dedicate themselfes wholy worlde neither meruail though gentile beeynge woorshippers ydols measuring thinges commodity life also ignorant prophetes lawe acknowleage while liued shape man meruayled came specially owne people whome messias ben promised many prophecy prophetes bene shadowed many figure ben loked many hundreth yeares saw miracle heard teaching yet wer far receiuing fierce mindes wente destruccion whiche came specially saue procured innocentes death frely brought life enemy sawe see heard heare hauing intelligence vnderstand whiche thorow froward study lawe rise law promised therfore malice came passe yt light whiche brought eternall lyfe beleuers therof occasion greater blyndnes frowardnes could hinder health theym beleued rather blindnes iewes made open way gentile lyght ghospel vnto time taken people god onely boaste theimselues wurshipping true god religion lawe kynred father promise god testament turned theimselues sonne god came theim therefore iewes righteously caste rebel ghospell grace ghospell remoued thence gentile course thinges altered whiche swelled pride thorowe false colour religion shoulde openly declare wickednes reiecting sonne wurshipped god parte thei vtterly contrary true religion dyd wurship beastes stockes goddes shoulde enbrace holynes ghospell faith howebeit vpon occasion gentyles admitted bee saued ghospell neyther iewes nacions shoulde excluded hauing entry therunto woulde put away stubbernes shewe theymselues obedience faith principall onely gate eternall saluacion many receyued hym theim gaue power sonnes god euen beleued name albeit many iewes gentile whiche loued worlde god withdrewe themselfes lighte yet cumming thereof vayne firste manifeste infelicitie whiche thorowe owne faulte depriue themselues greate goodnes frely offered vnto neyther coulde man doubte iuste iudge mente god shoulde reserued eternall deathe furthermore caused contrary parte shoulde euidently appeare howe notable liberalitie god simple redy faith would receiue woord gospel cause bothe sonne god god humble himselfe lowe estate thintente yt thorowe faith might exalte v highnes therfore toke vpon rebukefull misery mortalitie make v partaker godly glory therefore also woulde borne corporal man virgin thintente borne spiritual god purpose came downe earth carry v vp heauen stately scribe pharisee proud kinges power worlde stoute hau philosopher reiected woulde beleue high dignitie admitted men lowe degre litle estimacion without renoume vnlearned person bondemen barbarous men sinner worlde hath estimacion nothing required pure faithe neither cunninge noblenes bloode yet professyon moses lawe receyue worde nacion condicion euer behalfe gaue theim dignitie beinge graffed christ thorow faith baptisme hauing professed name made euen child god mighte bee made adopcion thinge whiche christe nature bee higher honour whiche child deuill inheritours hell shoulde thorowe faithe onely made child god brother iesu christe coinheritours kingdome heauen touching flesh borne child wrath firste father adam worde god released sinfull kinred touching spirite happily borne god iesu christ wer borne blood fleshe yet man god finally god takethe child suche bee borne child abraham man sede actuall luste generacion borne god faith first father adam begotten v vnfortunate miserable sorte begate v deathe hell moreouer whiche borne touchinge carnal birthe bee borne one estate borne kingdome bondage christe iesus auctor newe generacion doth regenerate al men without difference like dignitie bondage sinne misery mortalitie put awaye thorow faith grace may made child lyuyng god woorde became fleshe dwell emong neyther meruail though man transformed sorte felowship godly nature seyng woord god submit selfe cause take fleshe say mortall body virgine ioyning together himselfe two thynges moste vnlyke god manne thing frayle vile man fleash thing mighty excellente god neuer meruaill thinges knit gither god neither mistrust men may made child god seynge loued v sake himselfe would made sonne man doubtles toke vpon fantasticall body coulde loue vain vision disceitful illusion truely toke vpon body manne say full perfect nature man abhorring muche parte wherby subiect death dooe litel diffre kinde brute beastes bacame man small time redy put awaye thinge whiche taken proue assuredly toke manhed deceitfully vnder colour long conuersaunt earth hungrie thirstie diuers way punished suffred death seen iyes hearde eares touched handes thintent dignitie alwaye remaine mankinde godhed hauing manhed glorified sittinge righte hande father allmighty dooeth stil dwell v sawe glory glory onely begotten sonne father full grace trueth neuertheles lacked godly maiestie manhed walked earth whiche liued familiarlye witnes god man haue seen hungry athirst slepinge wepinge vexed dyinge haue hearde speake voice man haue touched handes profes tokenes haue founde man yea also haue seen godly glory dede mete onely sonne god like whereof neuer shewed angel prophetes patriarch suche god father woulde haue onely sonne honoured glory haue seen workinge miracle vttringe heauenly doctrine vision vpon mounte thabor transfigured iyes also voice father cumming downe heauen professed dearly beloued sonne saied father notably set furth baptisme voice holy goste vnder figure similitude doo e againe sonne death desired hym glorify hym glorye whiche worlde made voyce came downe heauen knowledged bee sonne saying bothe haue glorifye conclusion haue seen hym resurreccion already beeyng risen death lyfe shewe furthe v body whiche mighte touche handle yet subiecte euill also oure iyes carried vp heauen glory appeare shine vnto v onely thinges also death aproue godly power strengthe vaile temple deuided earth quaked stone braste soundre graues monumentes open dead body rise againe sunne losinge lighte broughte sodaine darkenes worlde while immediatly vehementcrie yelded vp goste sayeth forsoke life wyllyngly lacke strengthe thys wonderfull death glorify father thefe whiche hange also centurion acknowledge bee sonne god albeit conuersaunt earth went busines saluacion leauer shewe v exaumple sobrenes mekenes obedience boast owne greatnes yet communicacion dedes yea behauiour countenaunce declare hym bee full godly giftes full eternall suche trueth cannot bee confounded although god doeth geue holy men also large giftes grace trueth yet powre onely sonne whole fountaine heauenly giftes thintent hym alone might muche shoulde suffice men thorowly see suche one euen vntill ascencion piohn beareth witnes hym crieth saying spake whiche though came went let v procede declare first knowen vnto worldby brethre vnderstande disciple wheras vntil time muche owne brother beleued hym man woulde knowen lytle lytle lest straunge thing shoulde haue beleued emonges men risen sodainly truly many thinges went whiche might maner way haue prepared men mindes faithfull beliefe auctoritie prophetes shadowes lawe agreable song angel natiuitie godly deuocion shephardes guiding starre deuout behauiour three wise men vnquietnes kyng herode ierusalem birth new kyng prophecy simeon anna also certain thinges beyond reche course man nature wherat mother ioseph meruailed theim selfe thinges meane yet neuertheles tyme come wherin deereed eternally openly take hande busynes preaching kingdome heauen pleased hym sayd commended set furth witnes iohn also tyme neded man witnes expedient eyther allure iewes beleue euery one iohn hye estimacion el rebuke vnbeliefe wicked woulde beleue hym bearing witnes christ thinges attribute much toke messias promysed prophecy prophetes deliuer people israell therfore iohn preaching ye kyngdom god bee hand alredy gathered together many disciple dyd dayly baptise many great auctoritie emong al men dede men ill opinion iesu said iohn doth openly beate heades multitude eftsons reherseth thing whiche diuers time witnessed accordyng esaies prophecy whiche dyd tell hand shoulde wildernes say loud voice make redy way lorde nowe priuely vnto owne disciple people indifferenly euery day resorted accustomably baptisme doctrine yea came purposely heare certaintie opinion notable man iesu say spake plain cleare voice saying heretofore haue often spoken vnto whome thorow errour prefer tolde shoulde one folowe age time preaching shoulde also rekened inferiour opinion multitude hath nowe ouertaken whereas semed bee hath begun meruaile seing euen also excell giftes although iudgemente men semed inferiour vnto pand fulnes haue eceiued euen grace grace law giuen moses grace trueth came iesus christe fountain truth grace ye haue great admyracion bee nothing el litle brooke furth cumming streames litle haue euery man according porcion drawen furth fulnes fountain fro whence whatsoeuer apperteineth euerlasting saluacion springeth vnto men vertue patriarkes prophetes moses dyd come fountain nothing el goer hym cumming publisher also auctour grace ghospell whiche geueth true euerlastyng saluacion men thorow faithe bounde thanke hym voyce prophetes haue enstructed godlinesse prescript appointmente lawe haue forbidden dooe eiuill haue receiued shadowe true religion nowe doeth euen offre men plenteous grace thorowe faythe ghospell pardoneth freely synnes geueth euerlasting life theim deserued death moses whose auctoritie emong thing halowed consecrate manier waye bee compared hymthe lawe geuen moses moses onely pronouncer setter furth lawe auctor brought lawe vneffectuall sharpe hard whiche figure shadowes might bee preparacion light ghospell come thesaied moses lawe rather make synnes bee knowen take awayebut grace trueth came iesus christ yea say trueth shoulde rather make way health geue health allure v promise nowe steade straytnesse lawe grace geuen iesu christe whiche thorowe faith ghospell frely wholy forgeueth men synnes hath geuen lawe trueth steade shadowes wherof hymselfe onely decla also auctor vnto god father hath geuen power man hath seen god time onely begotten sonne whiche bosome father hath declared truely secretes god father bee hidde counsailes diuine mynde whiche hath pleased hym god shoulde become manne sorte make menne godlike mixe moste highe thinges lowest exalt lowest vnto hiest dyd neuer fully open thinges forefather although dyd sometyme shewfurth certain lytel sparkes lyght angel dreames vision mortall man neuer great euer see god dede couertly shadowe although dyd vtter parte moses patriarkes prophetes litell porcion secretes yet none onely begotten sonne dyd receyue fulnes grace trueth made man come v neuertheles godly nature doeth alway remaine bosome god father touchyng thinges pertayne obtayning euerlastyng saluacion hath declared vnto v familiarly plainly without wrappyng coueryng thyng whiche dyd signify partely vnder cloud slepe pand recorde iohn iewes sente priestes leuites hierusalem aske art thou confessed denied saied plainly christe iohn often time priuely commended christe maner witnes openly declare maner man dutie pure honeste seruaunte whiche neither woulde wrongfully take vpon honour maister whe iewes woulde haue geuen neither yet woulde depriue saied maister thereof althoughe knewe well inough shoulde onely meanes leese estimacion auctoritie alredy emong iewes also shoulde cause enuy muche rather haue geuen auctoritie iohn whose birthe also famous notable emonge iewes dignitie father beinge head prieste highly estemed theim straungenes diet wearinge camell skinnes beinge wildernes baptisme greate numbre disciple caused ye people haue admiracion whereas christe basenes kinred reason trade liuing apparell nothinge differing comon vse people time litel set therefore seing poore christ himselfe contente proud pharisee yea began sum enuy iohn commended christe preaching said pharisee sent ierusalem priestes leuites men great auctoritie enquire iohn multitude waswhen iewes sent priestes iudgemente people somuche vary said christ shoulde deliuer whole nacion iewes seruitude supposed helye according malachies prophecie thought come ye goer messias come touching christe fewe regarded hym parentes himselfe liued barely poorely yet neuertheles began enuy hym crafte pharisee goe aboute thyng thintent might frame christ euill desire whiche thing thought shoulde brought passe alowed theyr auctoritie profe taught thinges repugnaunte theyr affeccions vice woulde haue disalowed taken away auctoritie emong people whose doctrine perceyued shoulde hinder theyr commodity folishe policie worldely wisedom christe whose doctrine heauenly woulde haue part theyr humain auctoritie mixe euangeliall doctrine iewes also trust come passe iohn although wer christ yet would accept honorable name willingly offred bondman addict geuen glory know wel inough moste holye men soone deceiued pestilence vainglorye ignoraunt muche nacion woulde haue reioyced iohn woulde haue taken vpon name messias already good part iewes willingly attribute taken vpon emonge people occassion wherby might exclude christe hated poore estatewho arte thou taken vpon woulde furthwith haue falsely accused therefore aske iohn people auctoritie ye priestes phariseis saying art thou alredy begunne greued auctoritie sumwhat enuy good renoume beinge well assured asked question hatred christ byanby open vnto owne opinion concerning christ repell false suspicion touchinge himselfe whiche mighte haue hindred glory christ among people boldly contemning glory vnrightful title confesse messias many thought ben neither deny himselfe bee thinge dede beinge redy declare glory name due whiche two aunswers one saye confessing endau gered lose owne estimacion whiche declared redy confesse christe put ieopardy hated pharisee manne perfeicte without corrupcion passing nothing either bothe daungers openly confesse messias whiche promised prophecy prophetes voyce moses denying messias alredi comei saith shewed surname due excelled neuerthelesse lesse regarded opinion maliciouse diligent serche pharisee came none effecte stablishe faythe gospell pand asked arte thou helias saieth arte thou prophet aunswered therfore wer disapointed first question procede demaunde futher sayinge thou cheefest many attribute vnto seing thou doest vsurpe new dignitie wythout auctoritie scribe pharisee causeste people wonderfully fauour without ye decay common auctoritie priestes pharisee leaste thou muste one nie vnto mesias much vnder reade prophet malachie messias cummeth elia thesbite shal cum shall repaire thinges art thou therfore eliasart thou elia iohn denied elia elia sum respecte goer christe spirite ely elia thesbite whiche rapte sodainly caried vp aier fiery chariot prophet iudged reserued purpose maye goer second cumminge iesu christe iewes read prophecy vnderstood neither thei wurthy learne mistery much enquired hatefull minde knewe moses promised certaine prophete shoulde come iewes kinred commaunded thei geue eare vnto knewe right well prophete shoulde messias himselfe moreouer brui ed abrode one aunciente prophetes rysen agayne suspected iohn bee thesame therefore asked whether prophete promised moses leaste prophetes whiche beeynge rysen deathe lyfe shoulde take vpon auctoritiehe answered frankely playnly confesse suche thynge many toke pthen sayed vnto art thou may geue aunswere sente v saie e thou thy selfe sayed voyce cryer wildernes make streight way lorde sayed prophete esaias matier question hym seeing men coniectures touching iohn full pointe moued hym er nestly tell openly hymselfe shoulde longer make delay excuse prouoked auctoritie priestes thintent euen feare power confesse perceyue say thou takest vpon thee pharisee priesteswhat arte thou scribe ferther diuine coniecture therof yet must bring aunswer haue sent v hither fall people bee deceiued diuers soundrie opinion thee tell thou thyselfe thou art vndoubtedly thou arte knowen thyselfe wel ynough therfore doest thou professe thy selfe bee iohn spake theim learned lawe lest shoulde seme take vpon man presumpcion thing whiche dede taught prophecie esay whiche righte well knowen pharisee howe none goer christei voice rier wildernes c lorde hymselfe already come ought receyue cleane hertes also blinded enuie ambicio pride shoulde crucifie sayeth neyther messias elia prophetes reised vp agayne lyfe neyther yet haue taken vpon office myne owne autoritie forasmuche many yeres heretofore appointed busynes office auctoritie god euen esay write voice criar desert make right way lorde see deserte heare voice crier nowe lacketh cast away worldely desire prepare mindes againste cumming maye come sauiour moses set furth vnto wer shadowe prophetes long agone prophe shoulde come doe shew vnto nowe already cumming whiche sent pharisee shall vnderstande sent iohn pharisee secte pharisee day excell bothe knowlege lawe opinion holines also auctoritie fare doctrine gospel forsomuche beleue immortalitie soules life cum ambicion couetousenes enuy corrupted mindes howbeit time malice yet farre inflamed woulde openly shewe themselfes aduersaries christ within perceiued doctrine bee contrary ren ume aduantage autoritie vtterly caste extreme rage went crucify messias promised people prophecy knowlege muche bosted themselfe hurtful pestilent thing yea knowlege euen holy scripture excepte man minde free voide yearthly desire prudence god far wiser man inuencions clerely turne malice wicked men welth good enuious craftie enquiring pharisee hath stablished beliefe asked saied vnto baptiseste thou yf thou christ helyas neyther prophet iohn aunswered theim saying baptise water standeth one among ye know therefore nowe stired prouoked onely enuiyng christe alway contempte also iohn heretofore reuerence goe aboute charge hym fynde faulte sayinge cause thou takeste vpon thee power baptise people thou neither christe prophecy declare shal put away sinnes people elia goer messias notable prophete moses promise neither yet prophetes whie dooeste thou enterprise putte awaye sinnes thyne owne auctoritie whiche thou neither hast god decree priestes whose auctoritie thou darkeneste thy newe customes slaundreous demaunde iohn aunswere mekelye yet suche sorte frely knowlage owne lowe estate openly declare dignitie christe baptisme saieth euen suche like preaching isi baptise water c preaching perfit onely prepareth mindes wisedom gospel baptisme whiche consisteth onely water doth washe way filthynesse mindes certaine resemblaunce true baptisme frameth ignoraunte prepared repentaunce former life maye bee hable receyue baptisme whiche messias thorow spirite shall washe away vniuersall vnclennes vice theim shall credite heauenly doctrine farre hence alredy present great noumbre people one multitude conuersaunte euen middest therfore either despised knowen worldes estimacion poore small regarde vaunting himselfe pompe thinges whiche honour worlde doe exteeme manne hath pleased yet put furth power greatnesse veraye dede maner persone take hym bee phe whiche though came whose shoot latchet wurthie vnlose people iudgement seme bee sumwhat notable comparison highnes nothing veray whome tolde men toke mine inferiour come dignitie preuent excel whose wurthines vnwurthy compared know selfe vnwurthy serue bondman lowest kind seruice yea leuse buckle shoe pthese thinges wer doen bethabara beyonde iordan iohn baptise iohn pronounce full honorable witnes christe phariseis priestes leuites presence great noumbre people famous place saye bethabara farre ierusalem beyond iordane place conueniente baptiser preacher penaunce reason plentie water nigh also deserte whiche place great preace people diuerse coastes iurie resort dayly baptised iohn bothe preache baptise pthe next day iohn seeth iesus cumming vnto saieth behold lambe god whiche taketh away sinnes worlde hitherto beare witnesse iesus neyther name hym poynte hym hys fynger stoode emong multitude would styre vp enuie phariseis hym also would set fier mindes simple folkes haue desyre know sayd iohn notable highly commended preaching muche tyme many people make diligent serche knoweiohn seeth iesus cu ming shoulde great man whose dignitie euen iohn beeing men iudgement taken excellet persone much geue place iesus therfore came thither agayn day folowing kepe hymselfe close emong multitude went iohn seuerally alone partely good manier sake salute cosin partely knowledge baptiser specially geue occasion testifye playnely liuely christ emong people lest yet knowen seme goe iohn purpose saye baptised taughte el confesse sinnes baptised iohn geue v exaumple humilitie body shoulde suspecte nede baptisme spot hym whiche water iordane could washe away separating himselfe multitude wente iohn aparte iohn warned holy ghoste shoulde doe beholding iesus cumming towardes hym turned himselfe people poynted iesus fynger knewe sight shoulde accustome themselues lyke hym loue better rather folow hym iohn himselfe yea rather couet baptised hym iohn purenesse iesus mynde ful holy ghost shine iyes countenaunce shew selfe furth goyng behauiours hys bodye contrarye parte furyouse mynde ouerwhelmed vice dooeth expresse selfe countenaunce bodye beholde sayth iohn many see baptise wheras dede water iordane purifye himbehold lambe god taketh awaye sine worlde rather halowe alone none free al kinde spotte sinne verely pure lambe whome god accordyng esaies prophecie chosen appoynted bee sacrifice moste acceptable hym purge sinnes whole worlde whiche defiled maner vice whome lambe moses lawe signifye whose vnharmeful bloud defended child israel reuenging sweord angel lambe saye fer subiect kynde sinne alone hable take away sinnes whole worlde well beloued god onely may turne wrath mercie also gentle desirous man saluacion redy suffer paynes sinnes men take vpon hym euils woulde bestowe vpon v good thynges whome sayd cummeth man went knew shoulde declared israell therfore come baptising water yea thys whome haue tolde diuers tymes thoughe wer sumwhat derkely one come going dignitie power ouerreche although semed come byrth hys manhed tyme hys preaching also auctoritiei knew yet godly gyftes far much myselfe certainly knowe fyrst howe great great whome ye haue suche reuerence maner way compared vnto lorde auctour health none seruaunte goer neyther baptisme preaching thing introduccio heauenly doctrine vertue whiche shall bryng vnto neyther yet sent purpose commaundemente god preache repentaunce former sinnes shewe kyngdome heauen hande washe water thintent shewed father sure token might coming better conceiued mindes already prepared principle conuersacyon life simple pure beyng poyncte notable emong men ioyned hymselfe multitude one common sorte people came baptised though bene subiect sinne pand iohn bare recorde saying sawe spirite descende heauen lyke vnto dooue abode vpon knew therfore coulde knowe surely disposicion hys body man coniecture onely sonne god moste pure lambe whiche faythe shoulde put awaye sinnes worlde taught notable sygne heauen thys whome appoynted bee goer sygne iohn openly declare multitude christe sayeth willynge shewe worlde exaumple humilitiei sawe spirite descende heauen c ioynyng hymselfe company sinner came baptised father heauen honour hym heauenly token selfe sawe holy ghost cummyng downe vpon head likenesse dooue remayning time certaynly knowe hym whose goer reason corporall estate hyde hys celestial excellencie sent baptise water sayed vnto upon thou shalt see spirite descende stil baptiseth holy goste sawe bare recorde sonne god yet tyme come whiche father heauen woulde haue openly knowe people therfore knew inspiracion sayde father messias alreadye come take awaye errour mistakyng hys persone leste mannes coniecture haue doubt therin whose commaundement toke vpon office baptise water taught sure token shewing wherof might assuredly knowe shoulde baptise effectuall baptisme holy gost wherwith replenished freely geue trusted hym remyssyon theyr synnes iesus came baptised father heauen aduertise hande saying thys token thou shalt surely know sonne emonges many thou shalt wash water vpo whomsoeuer thou shalt see holy ghost lykenesse dooue descending remaynyng wel assured thesame hath power baptise holy gost man washeth wt water onely heauenly power taketh away sinnesupon thou shalte see spirit descend c geueth righteousnesse saw token according father promyse hym whan baptised thys cause gaue grace see also preaching know autour saluacio wherfore like heretofore haue witnessed doe also openly testifie sonne god whence fro heauenly fountayn ye must require thynges whiche perteyne righteousnes eternall felicitie suffer longer suspecte greater thinges deseruei saw bare record sonne god yet ignoraunte hym whome knowe saluacion manier witness iohn often commend iesus beyng yet vnknowen multitude gaue ouer owne auctoritie better entent time furth people leaue hym cleaue gouernaunce iesu goddes prouydence meane tyme procuring thentent might v holsome exaumple true preacher ghospell truely iohn neyther encisemente great renoume beeing willingly offered vnto hym much corrupt would take vpon hym mannes praise yet afrayed enuie priestes phariseis whose ambicyous enuie enuious ambicyon woulde suffer bodye bee exalted themselfe therefore dyd ceasse speake glory chryst neyther regarde owne commoditie expedient people hereby teachyng preacher ghospel ought haue constaunt sure stayed mynde yea euen auenturyng hys lyfe onely agaynste excesse couetousnes also al ambicion iesus christ came one common sorte people baptised also behaued himselfe amongest iohns disciple bene one wheras lorde taught v must come true glorye great humilitie modestie mynde none mete mayster vnlesse haue played parte good scoller neyther anye ought take rashely hande office preachyng excepte hath bene manier wayes well tryed approued manier appointed therunto god next day iohn stode agayn two disciple beheld iesus walked sayeth beholde lambe god two disciple heard speake folowed iesus thentent iohns excellent purenes honestie might clerely appere thought inough turne thaffeccions ye people christ laboureth also despatch himselfe owne peculier disciple whome put christ day thinges haue already rehearsed vnto doen presence people iohn stoode agayne twoo hys discyples hym iesus walked vp downe farre thence whiche thyng indede doen signifie misterye thereby iohn fygure moses lawe christe auctour profession ghospell therefore law whiche come vttermost poynt stayed though coulde goe shoulde ceasse byanby giue place christ hys comming commit disciple hym neuerthelesse meane constauntly bearing witnesse christ deliuering sinagogue true spouse churche christe walketh vp downe declare alway growe greater greaterhe behelde iesus walked c euery gathereth disciple heare hys heauenly doctrine therefore while iohn stoode behelde iesus walked knowyng righte well sayde iesus dyd desyre long saluacyon mankynde also couet geat disciple mete hys heauenly doctryne iohn turning twooe disciple whiche stoode hym beeyng theyr maister would put iesu better maister hymselfe poynted finger walking sayde beholde yonder lambe god whome haue often testyfyed alone doeth take away sinnes wholle worldebehold lambe god c haue prepared whosoeuer desyreth true effectuall baptisme whosoeuer loueth true innocecie whosoeuer coueteth true perfit health must nedes commit rule ordre true obseruers moses lawe lawe selfe doeth witnesse profit goe forwarde thereby perfeccion ghospell say fayth fayth wheras phariseis peruerse ouerthwart loue lawe persecute law comended iohns disciple made maister aunswere geuing credite worde left sayd iohn goer ghospell folowed iesus auctour euangelicall healthand ye two disciple heard sayde neuer woorde folowed hym beeyng set fyer loue hys hye doctrine hope wherof conceyued testimonie iohn dare bolde moue anye communicacion whome bene acquaynted iesus turned saw folow sayeth vnto seke said vnto rabbi say one enterprete maister dwelle thou sayeth vnto come see came saw dwelte abode daye tenth houre therefore iesus perceiuing purpose folow declare ready woulde mete ioyne whiche pure mindes doe thirste couet doctrine ghospel say tarying theyr calling vpon hym hys owne good doeth encourage alure bashefulnes turning himselfe towarde beholde folowed yt ignoraunt folowed minde folowed would shewe theyr woorth ye mete affeccio gospel speaketh asketh woulde haue intent theyr desyre beeing knowen might also kindle styre vp myndes otherwhat seke ye furth declared themselues bee verye desyrous learne eue yt name called sayingrabbi dwellest thou rabbi worde siryans tongue much say maister wheris abyding vndoubtedly called maister confesse themselues disciple whereas enquire dwelling place doe declare haue learne certayn secret thinges familiarely peradueture would speake openly euery body lorde iesus taking pleasure theyr deuoute feruentnesse learne maketh excuse reason nynesse night commaundeth come againe day folowing neyther yet signifyeth house case woulde theyr conuenyente leysure visite hym ientlye courteously requireth come talke lodgeingcum se saying come ye se perceiued delay shoulde haue bene paynful theyr earneste desyre reioycing aunswerthei came abode daye beyng euen suche woulde haue wished came thither onely see litle house iesus hys abidyng also taried day enflamed holy communicacion onelye reioyced theyr owne behalfe mocioned procured also come company felicitie came iesus house almost teth houre day say nye vpon goyng downe sunne tyme place vnfit vnconueniente learne thynges whiche pertayne euerlasting welthe presence preacher ghospell oughte alwaye bee redinesse suche one oughte taketh vpon hym teache christen philosophie wisedome whiche onely philosophie skill pryde statelynesse one two heard iohn speake folowed andrew simon peter brother found brother simon first sayeth vnto haue found messias interpretacion anoynted brought iesus iesus beheld sayd thou art simon sonne ionas thou shalte bee called cephas interpretacion stone concerning two whiche folowed iesus counsayl iohn one andrew simon peter elder brother whiche peter although younger yet excellet feruencie faith iesus afterwarde promise keyes kyngdome heauen committed shepe fedde hym thryse professed hys loue towardes iesu godly loue ghospell hath thys difference man himselfe inclined vnto haue gotten notable treasure hydeth enuieth manye thynke dooe possesse thyng common aswell themselues thys godly loue reioyceth commoditie therof shoulde common many andrew much comforted great felicitie asmuche report iohn much familiar communicacion iesu hymselfe found true iesus yt heauenly lambe onely take away sinnes world sonne god onely redemer mankynde also christe whiche promised prophetes looked manye hundred yeres beefore sayde andrew say soone found simon peter brother whose presence desyred greatlye thys purpose peter whome knewe dyd looke christe greate feruenciewe haue foud messias c myghte made partaker felicitie assured knowledge whiche andrewe hymselfe christe haue founde sayeth messias whome prophetes promysed shoulde bee redemer worlde messias sirians tounge muche say christe vnderstande anoynted anoynting perteineth kynges priestes christe onelye anoynted god hym onely power geuen heauen yearth onely ye priest eternally melchisedechs ordre hath reconciled god mankynde sacrifice hys bodye symon beeing glad pleasaunte welcome message satisfyed onely haue heardest ioyfully preaseth hymselfe also see iesuand brought hi iesus andrew already proued gentlenes graciousnesse iesu furthwith broughte simon hym iesus behelde peter onely vewe face wherin neuerthelesse shine purenes hert rather loked vpon minde endued doouelyke simplicitie thereby apte receyue grace ghospelland iesus behelde c sayde iesus takyng pleasure hys pure affeccion dooeth tell name peter father declaryng nothyng hydden hym therewithall prayseth godly simplicitie peter minde gathering argument thereof propertie hys father name darke sence chaungeing peter owne name telleth time come shall hym stablenesse inuyncible faythe ionas asmuch saye dooue grace simon interpretacion signifieth obedient obedience moses law furtheraunce fayth gospell therefore iesus loked vpon hymthou art simon sonne ioanna c doeth lyke hys present simplicitie also doeth sum open woulde saye darkely stedfastnesse come saying thou arte simon sonne ioanna right aptly agreyng thyne owne name thy father hereafter fayth shall haue gathered strength may able stand stable vnshaken al temptacions deiuillthou shalt called cephas c thou shalte called cephas whiche greke muche saye peter latine saxum englishe stone firste instruccion principle christes church also first beginning schole ghospell day folowing iesus would goe galile found philip saieth vnto folow philip bethsaida citie andrew peter philip founde nathanael saieth vnto haue found moses law prophetes write iesus sonne ioseph nazareth nathanael said vnto good thing come nazareth philip sayeth come see day pleased iesus goe galile whche least set al prouinces iewrie man great renoume fame tyme come thence yet neuerthelesse esay dyd prophecie light ghospell first appeare haue hys begynning ye place also diuine counsayl thought good woulde beginne churche meane persones vntaught vnlearned borne come countrey barayne regarde peter andrew whiche without calling folowed christe men galile one brother perswade drawe iesu fortunate pronosticacion churche nowe newly beginning whiche consisteth brotherly charitie mutual concorde therfore iesus goe way galile hauing alreadie two disciple galile wayte vpon hym myghte come sum better accompanied taketh hym two also countrey lyke nobilitie iesus founde one called philip borne bethsaida citie galile whiche nye vnto lake genazareth countrey andrew simonhe founde philip whome name peter added furthermore one countrey betokeneth concorde agreement ghospell diuersities maner people ioyned brought together one churche wer one citie philip semed haue met christe chaunce thyng dede doen altogether prouidence god whiche eternallye decreed appoynted whome woulde haue ye first ruler beginner churche therefore iesus sayed philip met folow taried nothyng allfolowe c byan folowed iesus whome alredy knowen many thinges witnesse iohn also common rumour people woord speaker great effect mind hearer ready hys owne good chaunced verely andrew allured drawen hys brother simon philip nowe reioysing seruice iesuphilip found nathanell found nathanell whome knew wondrefully desyrous messias cummyng whiche cause woont diligentlye marke obserue prophecy lawe prophetes whence messias shoulde come philip say would make nathanaell partaker ioye wherin reioyce withall hertwe haue found c iesus ye sonne ioseph c sayeth vnto hym haue found true messias whome moses hath written prophet rise kinred israel whome prophecy prophetes hath vttered declared many thynges thys iesus sonne ioseph nazareth al time euery man toke iesus iosephs sonne better knowen name name marie hys mother moreouer called emong comon sorte nazarean borne bethleem halowed hys birth infancie conuersaunt brought vp childe parentes nathanael hearde truely lyketh wel ioyfull tydinges offeded yt doubt wherwith secretly troubled propheciecan good thinge come nazareth whiche euery man knew doeth promise christ shoulde come furth bethleem therfore desyring taught certainly sayeth vnto philip good thing come nazareth whiche towne prophecy prophetes hath made mencion philip himselfe yet vntaught hauing ferther knowledge hys plaine simple faithphilip saieth come see could discusse hard matier aduiseth allureth nathanaell goe iesu fountayn selfe doubtyng woulde beleue soone seene heard doubt sayeth credite come selfe see iesus sawe nathanael cumming sayeth beholde right israelite whome guile nathanael saieth vnto whence knowest thou iesus aunswered said vnto philip called thou wast vnder figge tree saw nathanael aunswered saide vnto rabbi thou art euen sonne god thou art king israel iesus yet fame renoume working miracle sumwhat open godlye power knowlage secrete thingesbeholde right israelite c whe behelde nathanael cumyng toward hym turned dysciples philip gaue hym warning hym named hym shewed nathanaell saying behold verye israelite dede whome guile wordes iesus prayse true meaning beliefe nathanael also pure desyre haue knowlage whereas vntruely doe boast themselues israelite wont busy curious desyre haue lay matter mennes charge nathanaell perceiuing iesus shewed wordesnathanael sayeth vnto c knewe well inough communicacion betwene philip concerning iesus hymselfe meruaylyng came knowledge yet toke iesus none sayth vnto knowest thou iesus yet declaring euidently knew thoughtes men neuer secret sayth philip called thou wast vnder figtree already sene comunicacio betwene two witnes could make relacion thereof place expressed figtree noted spoken ye way mistery thing priuie counsel firste fault saye hys vnbeliefe whiche faute must nedes leaue knowe christ manifest argumentes iesus knewe matter theyr whole communicacyon wherof neuerthelesse maketh great rehersal lest seme vp braide hym lacke fayth sham fast asked question good symple mynde assone nathanaell hearde thinges perswaded secretes hearte open god onely thing heard man could nowe beeyng nothyng offended doubte concernyng name place christes birthrabbi thou art euen sonne god c gaue verdit hym saying maister thou arte sonne god father hath determined deliuer people thou art king israel whiche long goe promised prophecy prophetes iesus aunswered said vnto say de vnto thee saw thee vnder figtree thou beleuest thou shalt see greater thinges sayeth vnto uerely verely say vnto herafter shall ye see heauen open aungels god ascending descending ouer sonne man iesus gladly enbracing mannes ready chereful fayth euangelicall profession doeth stablishe also opynyon nathanaell euidently declaring godly nature sayth thou hast hereby conceiued beliefe messias king israel promised tolde thee howe sawe thee euen thou waste philip vnder figtree therefore thou hast good opinion tyme come thou shalt see apparaunte sygnes whereby thyne opinion may encreasethou shalt se greater thinges c foorthe withall iesus turned hym disciple whome yet neuer one iudge hym according hys dignitie sayde vnto take thys suretie hereafter shall see heauens open aungels god ascendyng descendyng ouer sonne manne thys derke saying lorde iesus styrre vp fayth disciple although simple vncorrupted yet fully enstructeduerely verely c ye shall se heauens open besyde far perfect knowledge excellencie christ styrre vp faith say lookyng greater miracle therby haue higher knowledge althoughe disciple fantasie dreame thing christ passing mannes nature whereat marueiled neuerthelesse dyd yet vtterly beleue fulnesse godhead hym nathanaell dyd confesse selfesame thinges whiche peter dyd confesse hys meaning lyke peter therefore lyke aunswere peter whiche upon stone buylde churche thee wyl geue keyes kingdoe heauen dede called sonnes god holy scripture great holines besides christ also many time se thinges shoulde folowe inspiracyon holy ghoste therefore bee marueiled christe knewe without relacion doen secretly betwene two disciple furthermore called hym kyng israell intending thereby honour iesus hye gloryous tytle declareth euen yet dreamed worldelye kyngdome haue kingdome thys worlde base earthly thing thyng far honour bee kyng whole worlde also aungels thing mente christe sayde aungels minister diligent doe seruice ascende descende ouer sonne man although disciple yet vnderstande tyme saying iesu neuerthelesse dyd hyde layed vp theyr myndes seede whiche shoulde bryng foorthe fruicte due tyme afterwarde knew aungels dyd often knowledge hym bee kyng thynges theyr obedient seruice whan gabriel brought tidinges concepcion song hys natiuitie glory god aboue diuerse tymes appearing ioseph procure safegarde childe hym seruice tempted deuyll dyd coumfort hym conflict tyme swe water bloud while often appeare tyme hys resurreccion agayne also men sight taken vp heauen aungels wer present suerties promise returne dede shalbe doen specially whe shal come cloudes maiestie father whole hoste company aunge iudge bothe quicke dead deliuer kingdome god father p ii chapter third day mariage cana citie galile mother iesus iesus called disciple vnto mariage wine fayled mother iesus saith vnto haue wine iesus sayth vnto woman haue doe thee myne houre yet come iesus taryed long galile thorowe working miracle bega declare ye iohns witnes vntrue dede iesus better knowen galile countreys iewriethe mother iesus c yet notable opinio ye time also euen brother kinsfolkes right iudgement therfore third day came galile solemne mariage made cana toune ye countrey iesus mother bidde wedding alyauce occasio iesus hiselfe also bidde fower disciple wt hi gathered together litle ye feast hottest bridgrome lacke wyne lyke abashed made nygardely feast besides feared leste hys geastes carefulnesse lacke wyne shoulde make feaste lesse cherefullthey haue wine marie mother iesu certain womanly carefulnes desyring haue disco moditie remedied seing already manye token also witness iohn ignorant power sonne bold cal vpo saying sonne haue wine dare speake declared motherly auctoritie dooeth prescribe appoynte thyng would haue doen sheweth reuerence towarde sonne iesus intendyng nowe take hande heauenly busines ghospell whereof would haue hys father onely auctour suffereth man auctoritie mixte therewithiesus saith c dyd myracles purpose please affeccions hys kynsfolkes cause spiritual doctrine better beleued corporal sygnes token amonges vnfaythfull people countrey therfore aunswereth mother sumwhat roughly loue entierely suche one consyderynge loued mankynde muche thentent yt would kepe auctoritie working miracle fre worldly affeccions cause whole glory therof ascribed power god thing expediente man saluacion whiche iesus dyd greatly thyrst couetwoman haue doe thee therfore vtterly denying hys mother declaring litle doe ye busines went aunswereth woman haue doe haue time appoynted father sorte weorke saluacion mankind time yet come hitherto haue shewed self obedient thy wil hen forth must doe thinges according father man prescript appoyntmente thinges thou hast bene mother herafter wil take thee woman often occupied father businesse whensoeuer glorie shal serued shal nede thy calling vpon wil doe mine good wil yt ye thing selfe shal require haue time appoynted father yt time also whe childe tolde mother yt interrupt hym disputing ye teple like thing againe warned whe bad one cal furth while preaching emog ye people mother sayeth vnto minister whatsoeuer sayeth vnto doe standing si e waterpottes stone ye maner purifying ye iewes conteyning two thre firkius piece iesus sayth vnto fill waterpottes water filled vp brimme sayeth vnto drawe nowe beare vnto gouernour feast bare marie mother iesu beyng neither offended sonnes aunswere although sumwat roughe meane tyme mystrustyng either goodnes hys power maketh aunswere agayn calleth seruauntes house secretly theyr eares sayeth thus vnto doe yewhatsoeuer saie h vnto yo whatsoeuer shall bid doe undoubtedly godly pitifull carefulnes mother procure lest ye seruauntes lacke belefe vnready seruice let wherby whiche lacked feast amended time ye thing dooen holding peace leaueth secretly hir sonnes wil appointment thinges wer doen chaunce iesus deferred miracle ye nonest lacke wine better perceiued euery body shoulde well sene bee geuen necessitie vayne boasting glorye lord wrought hys miracle semed doe thaffeccion worldly praisefil waterpottes water succour relieue men eiuilles griefes temperatly due ordre could faithfully trueth therfore while geastes taried carefull lacke wine iesus perceyuynge tyme bee come knowen commaundeth seruauntes fyll water sixe pottes stone stode purpose according ye custome iewes would clense washing might haue plentie water ready forasmuche countrey drye fewe place well watered fountaynes running riuers thys truely cause miracle also rather beleued ye vse waterpottes solemne thyng emong iewes sayd pottes neuer receyued licour water moreouer greatnesse ye vessel setfoorth belefe miracle conteined two three firkens piece could easily bee remoued theyr place seruautes obey filled waterpottes water commauded euen brimme whe doen would haue witness miracleand thei filled vp ye brime commaunded drawe waterpottes offer whiche drawen hym chiefe ruler ordreyng feast iesus partely ruler sober hath charge committed hym see thinges wel furnished euer wont abstayn wyne while folkes doe drinke partely well skilled tast hauing fyne iudgement therein myght trewely geue verdite wyne rest ye geastes whose taste myght seme bee dulled drynking muche wyne pwhen ruler feaste tasted water turned wyne knew whence minister drew water knew calleth brydegrome sayeth vnto hym euery man beginning doeth set furthe good wine men drunke whiche wurse thou hast kept good wyne vntill beginning miracle iesus cana galile shewed glorie disciple beleued hym soone ruler feast tasted wine turned water knew drewe suspecting fame seruauntes cotrary custome deferred bring wine vntil latter end feast calleth bridgrome hym desyring know occasion ye fault chaunsed others sayeth make solemne feast beginning thereof bryng table beste sortes wine afterward whe geastes already drunke haue mouthes tast powre drinke vntemperatly bring serue wurst sort thou cotrariwise hast reserued vnto end ye feast wine better pleasaunt yt serued yet casio ye miracle ye thing yt doe spred abrod litle litle emonges afterward examining seruauntes thing knowen water onely turned wyne also good wine forthe waterpottes mistrust onely dedicate ordeyned water seruauntes put water water filled vp brimme drawen powred vessel offered gouernour ye feast sobre bridgrome knoweth well inough wine prouyded prepared wente waterpots found ful ye selfesame good wynethe beginning miracle iesus c dede lorde iesus began working setting foorth miracle cana towne galile intending litle litle shew furth token godly power worlde first thing doen matier weightie also priuatly yea almost please mother kinsfolkes withal whiche lesse admiracion familiar kinne miracle much noted manye afterwarde grewe bee hadde greatter credite moe yet meane ye fayth disciple yt present stablished concerning iesu hauing promised greater thinges perfourmed whiche promised besides miracle wherby framed beginning ye rest afterward vain firste woulde honour mariage presence knowing beforehand tyme come would condemne vnpure filthye thing whereas honourable mariage vndefiled bed thyng acceptable god moreouer iesus dyd shadowe vnto v certayn figure thing whiche chiefely went aboute tyme come yt steade vnsauery waterishe lettre moses lawe drinke pleasaunt wyne spirite gospel reaso christ turned welth thing without strength vnprofitable law vnsauery ye iewes without christ also hurtfull deadly haue beleued ghospel doe stil drinke water moses law haue beleued christe doe happely waxe warme growe liuely toward loue heauenly lyfe moyst swete licour heauenly doctrine doen christ ioyned vnto churche hys spouse also mother iesu present representing forme sinagogue whose autoritie diminished yet telleth lacke wyne selfe doeth remedy neuertheles behoufe mother vnto doth reioyce coumforte mindes swete wine spirite name place also agree mistery ye thing cana galile betokeneth possessio ready passage fro one place ye original beginning new people gathered together remoue letter lawe spirite ghospell world heauen pafter went downe capernaum mother brother disciple continued many dayes iesus thys miracle begonne declare mightie power emonges kinsfolkes towne smal renoume went downe capernaum citie selfesame galile gentile ryottouse swelling pryde reason plentie richesse therin beyng also nye vnto lake genazareth coastes zabulon neptalim according wisedome ghospel thing highely estemed world abiect litle set afore god iesus mother brother disciple went thither taryed fewe dayes neyther miracle doen place benefit semed doen meane time mother kinsfolkes pleasure would longer cary asmuch would take hand greater thynges worldly affeccion loue chalenge vnto parte thinges whiche doen glorye heauenly father iewes easter euen hande iesus went vp hierusalem found sitting teple solde ox shepe doues changer money made scourge small coardes droue al teple shepe ox powred chaung er mo ey ouerthrewe table sayd vnto solde dooues haue thinges hence make father house house marchaundies disciple remembred written zele thine house hath euen eaten therfore iesus leauyng kynsfolkes behynde capernaum seeketh time place mete declare openly hys power auctoritie receiued heauenly father men euen high solemne feast iewes hand called easter hebrewe tounge much say passing ouer kepe day holy feast euery yere remembraunce olde story elder safelye passed ouer oute egipte wente lande whiche god promised thing whiche honour figure doen dede christ yt say brought passe men hauing forsaken darkenes errours cloude sinne remoued brought fayth gospel innocencie light immortalitie forasmuch therfore time ierusalem great number people al partes sirya asseble againste feastful day iesus wente thither nowe going vp towardes hys father businesies went vp ierusalem c wheras went capernau obey please kinsfolk withal furthwith goeth temple place wont ofte gone religiouse minde serue god therin verelye christ maister true religion entered temple ordeyned deuout religion wurshipping god founde thapparaunce teple rather market place founde verye many yt holy place exercise themselues filthieand found sold ox yea sinful gaine turned robbery ordeined geue occasio godly religion thintet straungiers might haue somewhat offer solde hye pryce shepe ox dooues suche lyke thinges whiche according custome ye iewes woonte offered geuen priestes meane ye seller bargained priestes leuites sayd priestes leuites sel agayne lesse pryce selfesame beastes priestes receyued offered whiche thing seller myghte sell beastes agayn straungiers double gaine brought passe powling straungers filthie gayne whiche rose double selling one thing twyse shoulde deuyded betwene merchauntes minister temple haue quicke readye marchaundise ther presente according custome comon market chaungers money banker chaunge greater coynes money smaller coyne golde siluer el exchaunge strange coyne coyne place thereby also shamefull gayne litle dyfferyng vsurie iesus declaryng hys acte great pestilence corrupt desyre lucre church howe far al ought thys disease professe themselues ruler religyon gospell made wer scourge smal cordes though would driue dogges goddes temple great indignacion auctoritie droue temple displacyng throwyng downe bothe merchauntes ware onely put men also shepe ox shoulde remayne behynde suche filthie baggage yea besydes scattered abrode chaungers money vpon ground ouerthrew also boardes teaching thinges ought vtterly troden vnder foote wurshippers true religio moreouer bene moued indignacion therat sayd sould dooues haue thinges hence make father house house marchaundise hys disciple sawe iesus beyng time quiete meke earnestly chased vnsemely vse defyle godly religion temple theyr fowle sinnefull gayne disciple say remembred prophecie whiche three score eyght psalme zele thy house hath euen eaten aunswered iewes sayd vnto token shewest thou vnto v seeing thou doest thinges iesus aunswered sayed vnto destroy teple three day reare vp iewes hearde namyng father house certayne peculier singular way declare himselfe sonne god saw hym also hyely take vpon hym openlye apparaunce angrye whiche semed bothe priestes profite also religiouse seruice god crie vpon hym saye god thy father thou wilt reuenge contempte iniurie thy father doe soe miracle yt may perceyue thou doest thinges auctoritie thy father thou doest thinges thyne owne auctoritie presumpcion thou dost goddes autoritie token west thou may beleue thee iesus knowing yt would slaunder case wrought miracle shew himselfe therby seeyng neuer yet miracle onely succoure lacked helpe theyr nede thintente yt thyng whiche proufe hys godly power also benefit helpe vnto necessitie man promised toke vnder parable toke opely declared would haue beleued much beleue whe doe dede toke cocerning death resurreccio also signified ionas toke iesus promised doen many miracle also time required shew su toke yt cu fro heaue promiseth although darkely yt selfesame token yet ignorau teple wherin time occasioned say teple iewes dyd boast theselues beyond measuredestroy temple three dayes c breake temple sayth three dayes wil set vp agayn parable much apostle vnderstand legth whe knowe sene resurreccio perceiued meaning saying theffect thing selfe iesus ment temple hys owne body whiche malice pul downe putting death godly power raise vp within thre day iewes thought thys saying onely fonde without reason also vngodly wi ked vngodly thyng commaund temple great religion bee broken set vp agayne within three dayes laboriouse building semed saying contrarye reason sayde iewes xlvi yeres temple building wilt thou reare vp three dayes spake temple hys bodye assone therefore risen deathe agayn disciple remembred thus sayd beleued scripture woordes whiche iesus sayde vnderstode thing answered accordingly saying men labored sore ye space xlvi yeres babilonias brought iewry captiuitie repayre temple wilt thou set vp thre day lord iesus made aunswer obieccion knowing haue doen good case made playne darke saying whe much owne disciple yea instructed many miracle manifolde preachinges could abide heare hys death spoken beleue mistery resurreccion yet saying cleue remayne still certayne seede myndes hearer brought furth sundry fruites soondry persones iewes kepyng still theyr remembraunce lay thys saying hys charge wicked priestes cryine worthye deathe disciple muche time could vnderstande yet bearing theyr mindes dyd meruayl meane vntyl tyme hys resurreccion holy ghost taught christ name templebut spake temple bodye ment bodye muche holy temple whiche iewes dydde honour religiously muche fulnesse godheade dyd dwell therin yet emongeste sacrilege defile violate temple stone nothing afrayed synfully throw downe holy temple hys moste holy precious bodye howbeit iesus verye salomon builded temple owne selfe virgin marie restore agayne within three dayes pulled downe according prophecy prophetes therfore disciple conferring scryptures iesus saying thys tymeand beleued scripture c dyd perceyue thys hys resurreccion greatest token wherby declared iewes godhed albeit haue red men haue risen againe death life yet man raise vp himselfe life onely lord iesus onely power himselfe leaue life reuiue agayn would principle beginninges iesus sti vp al iewes mindes loke greater thinges hym theyr hye feast nowe hande ierusale ester feast day many beleued name whe saw miracle iesus commit himselfe vnto knew al men neded testify knew yt taried ierusalem certayn dayes feaste ester miracle doctrine sowen sedes faythe ghospel many moued rather miracle whiche woordes credite saying beleued bee sonne god whome preached himselfe iewes much moued reason sight miracle iesus shewyng v forme fashion teacher gospel whose wisedome apperteyneth euen firste commit myndes ignoraunte persones misteries hye doctrine whose getlenesse behoueth beare suffer yet weake vnperfit vntill may attayne hier thinges iesus say knewe theyr fayth yet wauering vnperfite theyr myndes hable receyue mysteryes wisedome gospel dyd auenture himselfe emong common sort lest people affeccions sodainly altered commocion like rise many sore vexed auctoritie iesus specially whiche dyd suppose hys doctryne glory shoulde hinder theyr lucre auctoritie enuie phariseis scribe yet brast foorth open slaundering hym neuerthelesse kepte enuie malice close theyr heartes deceitfullye sekyng occasion hurte hym therfore time iesus coulde dooe litle good emong lest geue euil persones occasyon greater euyll withdrewe himselfe forasmuch knew secret thoughtes neither neded bee tolde thyng manne ignoraunte nothing knewe euen hymselfe verye secrecie euery man neyther yet meane whyle dyd iesus make prouisyon saue himselfe willyngly came veraye purpose suffer deathe saluacion world toke away theyr malice occasyon wherby shoulde el haue sinned p iii chapter pthere man phariseis named nicodemus ruler iewes thesame came iesus night said vnto rabbi know thou art teacher come god man coulde doe suche miracle thou doest except god amongest many whiche conceiued good opinion iesu seing miracle certain man called nicodemus ye phariseis secte one noumber whiche taken emong iewes chiefe ruler thys nicodemus knowing right wel many ordre secte enuie iesu lay waite doe hym displeasure went vnto iesu night tyme declaring dede yet weake wauering hys loue toward iesu whome although heretofore great admiracionthe came y nighte c neuertheles woulde hys sake sustayne anye losse hys renoume glory emong men yet loue would brought hated enuied cumpany came rather feare vngodlines surely worldly shamefastnes frowardnesse trueth maner shamefastnes hath great power folkes myndes whiche litle regarde bothe theyr goodes lyfe cannot ouercome kinde affeccion specially graffed hertes naturally disposed gentlenes chiefest emong ruler iewes ashamed bee taken poore iesus disciple placed ye hiest seate synagogue feared put place iesus moste milde gentle teacher doeth breake broused reede quenche smokyng flaxe repel refuse saied nicodemus came salute hym though fearfull came due tyme doeth curteously receiue hym doubtlesse weake spirited manne yet without malyce cause worthy promoted lytle lytle higher thinges byanby nicodemus declaring much profited seyng iesus doe miracle maketh suite gette good preface maister saieth doe already euidently perceiue thy doctrine suche phari eis thyng selfe dooeth shewe thine autoritie preaching geuen man god manne coulde doe miracle thou doest except god present hym helpe hym nicodemus dyd set forth opinion concernyng iesus hye great estimacion howbeit farre vnder dignitie nicodemus supposed none summe prophete god dyd fauour present miracle though wrought owne power iesus answered sayed vnto verily verily saye vnto except manne bee borne fro aboue cannot see kyngdome god nicodemus sayeth vnto hym howe man borne olde entre mother wombe borne againe iesus doeth neither reproue nicodemus vnperfite opinion cocerning neither doeth forthwith boast owne greatnes gentle fredly behauiour litle litle bringeth apte easy bee taught vnto knowledge secrete misteries euagelicall doctrine iewes yet druke ye water moses lawe whiche knowen nothyng el baptisme iohn neither yet tasted wyne euangelicall doctrine baptysed spirite fyer iewes say vnderstode thynges carnally cause rude vnfit philosophie gospel whiche spiritual therfore lorde cast teeth ignoraunce halting minde side partely apply himselfe worlde partely god yet spake thing afterwarde required disciple come knowledge saying whosoeuer shalbe ashamed afore men also ashamed hym father lorde say lay none forsaied thynges charge darke sayinges causeth nicodemus vtter ignorauce entent litle litle may instruct bring carnal affeccion spirituall vnderstanding nicodemus sayth take suertieiesus answered c except man borne new chauged new man canot see kingdome god new doctrine thou desirest learne forasmuche nicodemus thought saying purpose aunswereth dede ignorauntly grossely neuerthelesse simply plainly saying possible man beyng already many yeres borne canne waye brought passe entre mother wombe come thence borne newe iesus answereth verily verily saye vnto except man borne water spirite cannot entre kyngdome god whiche borne flesh flesh whiche borne spirite spirite iesus beyng offended euen grosse aunswere vouchesaueth getelly enterprete declare borne new aboue nicodemus sayth thing haue saied true hath desire hable receiue euangelical doctrine must borne againexcept borne water spirite maner byrthe speake sorte carnall spirituall doeth consist multiplying bodyes generacion turnyng sowles new forme neither byrth made child ye child god therfore wel assured toulde eue excepte man borne water holy gostthat whiche borne fleshe c carnall become spirituall cannot entre kingdom god altogether spiritual lyke borne lyke borne flesh none thyng flesh borne spirite spirite verily much difference betwene flesh spirite betwene ye body god much generacio wherof speake excellent bringeth forth one body borne ye flesh doe sauer none thing flesh beleue thing yt fele perceiue wt sens thinges seen moste excellent greatest strength flesh weake impotente meruayle thou sayed ye must borne aboue wynde bloweth li teth thou hearest sounde therof canst tell whence cummeth whyther goeth euery one borne spirite wherfore seying two sundry wayes borne cause thou shouldest meruaile veray manmeruaile thou sayd thee ye must borne aboue borne naturally flesh wherby might child man borne spirite inuisible thereby maye childe god spirite also might made apte kyngdom heauen whiche spirituall carnal thou doest yet vnderstand take vnto similitude suche thynges sumwhat agreable spirituall thyngesthe winde bloweth c yet may perceiued bodily sens god de moste sincere pure spirite far bodily sens ayre wherby coserued life wherof fele great strength profit called spirite wynde bycause coparison body right subtile fyne kinde spirite wynde stayed mannes wil pleasure owne violence caryed whyther soeuer list spreading selfe ouer thynges putting corporall thynges meruailous force strength sumtyme bryngeth lyfe sumtime death otherwhyle calme still otherwhile boysteous violent sumtyme bloweth east sumtime ye west sumtime one part world sumtime another shewing himselfe theffect therof thou hearest soud whe thou seest body thyng whiche thou canst catche lay hand vpon thou perceyuest present yet doest thou see cummeth place conueyeth selfe goeth theeso euery one borne spirite spiritual birth lyke sorte spirite god doth rauishe transforme myndes men secrete inspiracios therfore felt vneffable strength efficacie yet thyng whiche doen perceyued iyes whiche thus borne led worldly carnal spirite spirite god whiche geueth life thinges gouerneth thesame nicodemus answered sayed vnto thinges iesus answered sayed vnto hym art thou maister israel knowest thinges nicodemus yet rude grosse repugne iesus perceyuing meanyng woordes desirouse also haue thynges heard plainly declared sayeth iesus meanes thinges brought passe man bodily substaunce turned spirite newe byrthehowe thynges god bee borne godlyke nowe iesus declare thinges pertaine heauenly doctrine perceiued man reason rather co prehended fayth shewyng lykewyse philosophiers world proude naturall wytte vnapte taught thinges yea phariseis also whiche stoutly professed litterall sence laweart thou maister israel c dede knewe spiritual meanyng therof declare therfore doctrine thesame wisedom father heauen would hyde worldly persones open touchyng world simple witted taken fooles iesus say maketh answer nicodemus saying thou art taken maister israel professest thy selfe teacher people art thou ignoraunt thinges thou oughtest chiefly knowe farre common sorte people spirituall doctrine thou great teacher people doest vnderstad thinges meane shal profit thee beleue thing thou canst vnderstad faith shall cause feele perceiue thinges although thou seest thy witte cannot serue thee come full knowledge nature violence worldly ayre thou felest thy sences howe shalt thou attaine knowledge thinges farre hier al bodily sens truly much godly doe farre passe surmounte capacitie mennes myndes except theyr myndes inspired holy ghoste uerily verily speake doe knowe testifie haue seen ye receyue witnes haue toulde yearthly thinges ye beleue shall ye beleue yf tell heauenly thynges thou mayest surely safely beleue whiche doe onely inspiracion feele thynges heauenly haue heard sorte prophetes whose numbre thou takest one speake thinges wherof haue full proufe sure knowledgewe speake doe knowe c yea beare witnes earthe ye thing haue seen heauen ye yet borne spirite doe beleue spirituall thinges ye beleue man heareth witnes thinges hath seen wt bodely iyes yet ye doe credit heauenly himselfe hath seen heauenly thinges spirituall iyes heauenly thinges certaintie earthly thinges assuredly perceyued hym hath heauenly iyes uerily lord iesus spake thynges couertly darkely signifying naturally god although caryed mortall body shewe also witnes nicodemus attribute hym hye thing say sent god farre vnder iesus dignitie sorte meanyng whiche spake nicodemus yet iudged higher thing iesu sent god reade prophetes haue suche wyse iohn also sent god sonne god higher sorte sent god alwaie god father sent yea eue father touching godhead reason wherof neuer departed father thinges hertofore iesus spoken cocerning borne new water spirite might appere grosse rude highnes misterie say god nature man vnited together one person thesame person lyue earth mortall man immortall god still remaynyng father heauen therfore say iesus spake saying reaso carnal fleshly minde doe beleue speakyng yet earthly thinges ye beleue shal tel thinges altogether heauenly neuertheles selfe haue seen knowen assuredly ye knowe thynges ye see bodily iyes man ascendeth vp heauen came downe heauen euen sonne manne whiche heauen moses lifted vp serpente wildernes euen must sunne manne lifte vp whosoeuer beleueth hym peryshe haue eternall lyfe emong eyther menne angel euer able ascende vp heauen beholde celestiall thynges presently looke vpon diuine nature dedeno manne ascedeth vp heauen al ascendeth vp heauen sonne man came downe heauen earth doeth yet still remaine heauen beyng neuer seperate perfite beholding godhead albeit meane semeth earth base litle regarded thus thought mete ye determinacio god declare glory ye world worldly reproche lowe estate thintent yt way men haue forsake false glory make haste true eternall glory manne aske necessitie compelled sonne god come downe heauen lyue earth poore abiecte perso truly none thing cause therof moste hye excellent loue god father toward mankynd whose saluacio hath geuen begotten sonne suffer death yea suche death moste shameful worldes estimacio bestow geue one saluacio al menas moses lyfted vp ye serpent nicodemus sayth let thyng seme thee suddayne straunge thyng moses figure signifie come time people perishe thorow vehement inuasion serpentes hang vp brasen serpent vpon stake whosoeuer loked therupon safe deadly biting serpetes therfore brasen serpent hauing dede likenes venemous beaste yet beyng voyde venome also helpe others whiche poysoned hanged vp desert men might see safetie muste sonne man exalted th ntent thorowe faith shall lifte vp theyr iyes vnto hym maye deliuered fro deadly poyson synne onely people israel generally manne euer pure herte putteth full truste hym perishe subiect sinne bringeth euerlastyng death thorow death one innocent shoulde obtayne eternall lyfe trulye lorde iesus maner darke sayinges opened nicodemus misterie manhed redemyng worlde crosse albeit yet able receyue vnderstande thynges meane declaryng therewithall howe great difference betwene whiche reade lawe carnall sence consideryng nothyng plaine story therof whiche inspiracion holye ghoste heretofore haue spoken perceyue mistical sence l eth hid couered ouer texte neuertheles lorde iesus wer sowe seedes fayth nicodemus minde hereafter might perceiue thyng haue doen casualtie chaunce appoyntment god good seede beyng receyued apte grounde might bryng furth due tyme fruite faith nicodemus hert whiche heare thynges also theyr myndes vnto thynges declared reporte god loued worlde gaue onely begotten sonne whosoeuer beleueth hym perishe haue euerlastyng life god sent sonne worlde condemne worlde worlde thorow might saued beleueth hym condemned beleueth condemned alreadye hath beleued name onely begotten sonne god would haue beleued charitie god haue greate towardes worlde beyng rebell hymhe gaue one ye begotten sonne giltie many great faultes onely reuenge vngraciouse actes committed therin also sent downe onely sonne heauen earth deliuered hym suffre death yea euen moste shamefull death crosse thintente man soeuer would beleue wer iewe grecian neuer barbarouse perishe obtaine eternall lyfe thorowe fayth ghospel albeit tyme come father iudge vniuersall worlde sonne last cummyng yet tyme whiche appoynted mercie god hath sente sonne condemne worlde wicked dedes therof death geue free saluacion worlde thorow faithhe beleueth condemned leste body perishyng wilfully haue wherby excuse owne malice geuen al folkes easie entrie saluacion satisfaccion faultes committed required neither yet obseruacion law circumcision beleueth hym shall condemnedbecause hath beleued forasmuche hath embraced thing whiche eternal saluacion geuen folkes thei neuer muche burdened synnes thesame person hath professed ghospell dooe abstayne euil dedes former life laboure go forward perfect godlines according doctrine whose name hath professed whosoeuer contemnyng great charitie god towardes hym putting himselfe saluacion freely offred hym doeth beleue ghospell hath nede iudged body forasmuche doeth openly condene himselfe reiectyng thyng wherby mighte attaine eternall lyfe maketh hymselfe giltye eternall payne god hath offred saluacion folkes onely begotte sonne yt thorow faithe thyntent maie knowlege wurshyp hym auctour saluacion put hope oure felicitie hym whosoeuer refuseth thus despiseth goodnes god beyng readie dishonoreth sonne father woulde haue honored also estemeth nothyng death suffred v person saye doeth declare himselfe euen dede woorthy euerlastyng punishement perceyueth hym perishe good right thorow owne faute whiche willingly wittyngly doeth embrace thing perisheth resisteth thyng wherby might haue recouered health condemnacion light come worlde men loued darkenes lighte dedes euill euery man euill dooeth hateth light neither cummeth light lest dedes reproued dooeth trueth cumeth light dedes maye knowe wrought god errour synnes darkenes myndes synnes doe ingender euerlastyng death sonne god lighte worlde lighte truethmen loued darkenes lyght beleue euerlastyng health therefore thorowe bountifull goodnes god light came worlde whiche blynded thorowe lacke knowledge trueth innumerable vice thintent trueth beyng knowen conuerted saued yet men loued theyr owne darkenes lyght sente heauen sicke man perishe whiche hideth disease phisician would holpen dooeth geue iudgemente hymselfe perisheth thorowe owne faute menne altogether geuen worlde refuse light offred workes euill whiche committeth shamefull acte dooeth loue darke nighte theyr woorkes euill shunneth light sunne leste deedes knowen thei whiche know themselues giltie hate light euangelical trueth whiche foule naughtie doinges bewrayed thei might amended cannot holpen loueth disease sinner must slyke may please god whose workes good loueth light sunne maye commended well doyng hath good coscience least whiche desyreth healed doeth dissemble coloure synnesfor euerye man euill doth hateth light also kynde trueth knowlege euill thee couet good thyng thou lackest saye doeth willyngly offre hymselfe light gospell workes maye made manyfest dedes good maye praysed bycause procede spirite worlde god whiche euill maye corrected amended whiche doe presumpteously attribute themselues perfit righteousnes obseruacion lawe inwardly myndes swimme vice also sette felicitie defense worldly wisedome commodity worlde eyther lyue great darkenes case belieue herte el liue greatter darkenes yf blinded naughtie affeccions doe stifly vphold mainteine thyng perceyue euill obstinately refuse thyng see helthfull lorde iesus dyd lay vp store certain seedes suche like misteries nicodemus harte verily nicodemus afterwarde defende aunswer iesu false surmise phariseis meane autoritie saying howe manne ought condened vpo due prose actes also dyd honour buriall seruice dead thinges came iesus disciple lande iewry taried baptised iohn also baptised enon besides salim muche water came baptised ihon yet cast pryson arose question betwene iohns disciple iewes purifying came vnto iohn sayed vnto rabbi beyonde iordan thou barest witnes beholde thesame baptiseth men come hym iesus laied foundacions glory ghospel galilehe taried baptised iohn also baptised c ierusalem thintent might knowen abrode went lande iewry countrey proper name iudas autor tribe iesus lineally descended taried lytle whyle disciple beginnyng euangelicall preaching thesame principle wherwith iohn begun dyd allure penaunce baptise tyme also iohn dyd stil baptise herode yet put priso baptise iordan wounte doe place lesse notable whiche called enonthere muche water c farre salim whiche signifieth syrian tongue guishyng streames water reason wherof pletie water baptise people withal many come place baptised iohn sum went iesus baptised disciple occasio certain iohns disciple enuy iesu forasmuch concerning himselfe lately baptised iohn behaued himselfe though disciple also comeded set furth people witnes would sodainly make himselfe equall yea moreouer preferre himselfe hym disciple take vpon thyngand arose question c hitherto none iohn doen first al laboured withdraw people fro baptisme iesus disciple went perswade iohns baptisme effecte washyng awaye synnesand came vnto iohn baptisme iesu coulde perswade people beleue wente iohn makyng complaynt thinking would miscontented therwith sum meanes stay griefe grudge worldly affeccio iohns disciple ye set furth christes glory caused iohn testifie manifestly christ doe coplaine matter wt woordes maister say lately wt youall men come baptise besydes iordan baptised himselfe yea euen ye comend witnes emonges multitude vnknowe al folkes taketh vpon doe say baptise opely menne runne heapes thyng must nedes come passe hym thyne autoritie shall darkened iohns disciple spake thynges certaine carnall affeccion desiryng haue maisters glory renoume dayly increased cause dyd enuy christe whose autoritie semed hynder iohns estimacion iohn aunswered sayed man receyue nothyng excepte geuen hym heauen ye selues witness howe sayed christe sente hym hath bryde bridegrome frende bridegrome standeth heareth hym reioyseth greatly bridegromes voyce ioy therfore fulfilled must encrease must decrease iohn heard thinges goe remedie euill desyre disciple dyd onely shewe himselfe take greuously dayly increase iesus glory darken also greatly reioyce therat shewed fully accomplyshed office charged withall christes tyme come performe thinges far excellent therefore answereth wise ye glory carnall worldly affeccion doe ye desyre make selfe greater man haue nothyng except geuen hym abouea man receyue nothig excepte c thinges doen mannes helpe strength autoritie god office hath assigned according habilitie thesame haue perfourmed faythfully haue doen office goer haue allured prouoked men penaunce warnyng kyngdome heauen hande baptisme water haue prepared many baptisme spirite fierye selues witness c christ sent hym haue shewed ye ought folowe hence forth ye must aske perfecte health ye regard myne autoritie doe ye geue credite woordes selfes beare recorde haue diuerse time openly confessed selfe christe many toke neyther yt sente purpose going make redy waye came seruaunt lord thynges begin knowen worlde fame renoume doeth derken myne reioyce witnes true wish desire seruice myght growe ende effectehe yt hathe bryde brydegrome bryde right whiche bridegrome dede yet whiche bridegrome onely frende doeth enuy bridegromes felicitie taketh spouse reioyseth behalfe loueth herte holdyng peace standeth also great ioy mynde heareth voice bridegrome while talketh spouse haue wished nothing knowen great man trueth taken greater man dede doe greatly reioyce perceiue matter haue good successe right must encrease hitherto hath reputed much lesse dede mere decrease haue alwaye taken greater thus expedient man saluacion myne estimacion darkened glory dayly growe greater disciple leaue goe comparison whose power myne weake none effecte baptisme farre vnderneth fire might water cummeth hye aboue yearth yearthly speaketh yearth cummeth heauen aboue al hath seen heard testifieth receiueth testimonie hath receiued testimonie hath set scale god true god hath sent speaketh woordes god mete yearthly
