thinges geue place heauenly worldely godly vnperfite thynges perfite cummeth earth earthly speaketh thinges earthly base thing man speake thynges pertayning manwhat hath seen heard testifieth whiche come heaue excelleth al men neuer great haue receyued small knowledge heauenly thinges able testifie doeth beare witnes moste faithfully emong men thyng whiche hath seen heard heauen father men haue admiracion muche inferiour man almoste receiueth witnes doe require seruaunt beare recorde hym refuse witnes beareth father dede yf bodie doe trust doeth mistrust man yf doe beleue hym whiche sonne father hath witnessed owne voice person maketh god lier iewes doe wurship father contemne dishonor sonne sent howbeit euery reproche iniury doen sonne redoudeth father therfore whosoeuer receiueth witnes sonne geuing credit sonne doeth certainly affirme god true whiche speaketh sonne sonne sent father speaketh woordes woordes god god hath spoken bothe prophetes also hath made euery man partaker spirite accordyng haue able receyue god hath geuen spirite onely sonne certaine measure hath powred vpo whole fulnes spirite father hath nothyng sonne hath thesame father loueth sonne hath geuen thynges hande beleueth sonne hath euerlastyng lyfe beleueth sonne shall see lyfe wrath god abideth hym whatsoeuer incredulitie men would take sonne father imputeth taken himselfe father loueth sone intierlythe father loueth sonne c hath put hande whole summe thynges depriuing himselfe owne power maketh vertue power hath common thing soeuer god hath willed geue bestowe vpon mankynde pleasure geue sonne verily offreth men small meane thyng offreth euerlastyng lyfe hym whiche fountayne eternall lyfe howbeit person maketh hymselfe vnapte receyue excellent gyfte whiche refuseth take surely refuseth whiche doeth beleue sonne geue perfourme whiche promiseth moreouer doeth charge father vntrueth sayeth promise sonne vaine vntrue thinges therfore rewarde belefe great punishment vnbelefe fierce terrible trueth whosoeuer putteth hope trust sonne hath already sonne whoso hath sonnehe beleueth sonne shall see lyfe hath eternall lyfe contrariwyse trusteth sonne forasmuch hath closed vp owne iyes cannot behold light shall see lyfe lyght lyfe men continewyng sinnes remaineth bounde gyltie vengeaunce wrath god say euerlastyng death iiii chapter soone lorde knewe howe phariseis heard iesus made baptysed moe disciple iohn though iesus himselfe baptised disciple leaft iewry departed againe galile iohn woordes corrected vnmesurable loue affecion disciple toward hymselfe euill wicked opinion concernyng iesus secretely prouokyng leaue folowe iesus men ought aske al thynges therfore iesus fro nothyng hid dyd perceiue like thing haue chaunced wonte happen emongest men saye enuy foloweth prayse renoume also already phariseis took euyll parte allure drawe hym many disciple people recourse baptisme iohns although dede iesus himselfe disciple baptise euen declaring yt preache gospel excellent office baptise phariseis muche greued displeased disciple dyd take muche vpon scantly would haue suffred iohn haue doen dyd attribute muche iesus saye partly would prouoke sharpen stiere vp theyr enuy case haue longer taried therby seme haue contemned partly tyme would shewe tyme come iewes refused repelled grace ghospell brought geuen gentile leaueth iewry hauyng begunne already principle euangelicall doctrine prepareth hymselfe returne galile whence came must nedes goe samaria came citie samaria called sichar besydes possession iacob gaue sonne ioseph iacobs well iesus beyng wery iourney sate downe well sixte houre came woman samaria drawe water iesus sayeth vnto hir geue drinke disciple go awaye vnto towne bye meate sayeth woman samaria vnto hym howe thou beyng iewe askest drinke samaritane iewes medle wt samaritanes iesus aunswered sayed vnto thou knewest gifte god sayeth geue drink thou wouldest haue asked would haue water life meane waye goe samaria whiche countrey gentile old time enhabite expulsed ye israelite thence brought thither straungers assebled diuerse place dwel therefor must nedes go thorowe samaria samaritanes last taught god many trouble affliccions partely enbrace religion iewes began wurship one god although contrary sorte also referred petigrew vnto iacob abraham sonnes sonne sayed iacob dwelled time past emoges caldeis samaritanes receiue moses bokes prophetes allowe people toke name mount samorthan came citie c therfore iewes dyd beare cruell common hatred agaynst remembryng howe wonne theyr countrey violence put inhabitauntes therof theyr dwellyng place also forbecause theyr contrary rite customes parte thinges receyued moses lawe yt yet remayne many toke old supersticio therfore whe iesus cum citie samaria called sichar lacked meate disciple dyd muche attende vpon theyr maister made prouision vitels iesus himselfe went myddes citie would geue iuste occasion iewes laie charge hauyng forsaken israelite dyd goe heathen wicked getiles afterwarde great despite called hym samaritane man possessed deuill suffered disciple go citie bye meate himselfe taryed alone partly looke abide returne disciple partely would absente occasion shoulde serue miracle knewe afore happen porcion ground whiche iacob geuen ioseph sone possesse place holy famous emoges samaritanes memoriall olde storie leui simeon hadde reuenged place vilanye rauishyng dina great slaughter destruccion inhabitauntes also wel notable emong people euen iacob digged sayde samaritanes glory theyr first progenitour auctour linage iesus beyng weary long iourney whiche goen fore horse backe wagon euen geuing v exaumple maner man preacher gospel ought sat hym downe place serued nigh vnto welland sixt houre refreshed hymselfe ayre therof sixe clocke iewes computacion sonne alreadye drawyng towarde nonetyde dooeth heate double paynfulnes iesus labour token iesus didde declare hymselfe man dede subiecte euen selfe passion wherunto bodyes men subiect meane whyle came certain woman samaria thither drawe water thesame well nighe vnto whiche iesus sit iesus furthwith woulde mynister matter communicacion would go bring saluacion vpon occasion thing whiche herselfe saieth manier woma geue drinke chaunced well yt apostle meane wer absent iesus would speake certayne secrete thynges spoken presece others might haue thought point lightnes whiche thyng certes lorde iesus shewed gaue teacher gospel example sobre behaueour gentleneshis disciple goen awaie vnto toun bye meate doeth litle disdayn talke sinful woman one naughtely vnchastely misused body diuerse also meanes alone prouided bashefulnes vnchast woman woman perceiuing iesus togue apparell also iewe knowyng right welt muche iewes wont abhore cumpanye samaritanes insomuche thought themselues also defiled eyther mete speake hauyng great meruayle owne good called asked drynke aunswereth wyse commeth passe thou beyng iewe maye well coniecture thy speache garment doest contrarie custome iewes aske drinke samaritane consyderyng ye iewes wont abhorre haue thyng samaritanes accomptyng thyng detestable haue familiaritie conuersacion v iesus muche thirste kynde water albeit concernyng manhed thirst dede couete health soules litle litle doeth allure poore woman knowledge grace ghospell aunsweryng sorte darke saying entent might kindle desire learne thou diddest knowe saieth excellent gifte whiche god doeth offre vnto case thou knewest hym also whiche presente asketh water drinke thee thou wouldest rather aske drinke hym coulde geue vnto thee ferre better water saye water lyfe woman saieth vnto sir thou hast nothyng drawe wel diepe whence hast thou water lyfe arte thou greater father iacob gaue v well himselfe dranke therof child cattell iesus aunswered saied vnto whosoeuer drynketh water shall thirste againe whosoeuer drinketh water shall geue hym shall neuer athirste water shall geue hym shall hym well water springing vp euerlastyng lyfe woman sayeth vnto hym sir geue water thirste neither come hither drawe forasmuche spoken spirite whiche beleuers ghospell receiue meruaill thoughe poore selie woman samaria vnderstand seing nicodemus beyng iewe maister could perceiue thing whiche iesus spoken sumwhat plainly concernyng borne agayne aboue yea yet aunswere grossely woman sayed man olde enter mother wombe borne newe woman conceiued certayn great high thyng saying iesus thou knewest gifte god thou knewest coulde geue thee water life miscontet semed litle regarde iacobs well whiche great reuerence neither yet mocke bolde sayinges straunger vnknowen also iewe desyryng learne whiche set furth thyng straunge notable token honour calleth lord saieth alreadie conceiued small opinion meane exaumple woman samaria thus deuised brought passe ordynaunce god counsel rebuke declare thereby peruerse frowardnes iewes whiche ferre shewyng themselues easie taught lord iesus thei wiekedly despise benefites finde fault holsome doctrine wheras poore woman hauing desyre taught curteously gently aunswere al thynges insomuche tarying styll heate hauyng forgotten thyng whiche came gaue hede wordes vnknowen straunger whome yet heard notable reporte sir saieth thou doest promise vnto water farre excellet thisthe woma saieth vnto hym c thou hast vessell wherewith drawe thesame well diepe therfore shouldest thou come liuely water thou doest promise art thou greater father iacob whome ye iewes also haue reuerence gaue well vnto v notable gift muche set water wont drinke therof al familie also cattel iesus perceyuing woman apt taught suspect hym southsayer enchaunter notable great man thought worthy compared iacob man highly estemed iesus say doeth disdeyne allure litle litle haue higher greatter estimacion shewyng water wherof speake spirituall whiche refreshe beastes soules whoso drynketh sayeth water whiche patriarche iacob gaue vnto dooeth onely shorte time slake bodily thirst whiche within returne agayne thintente thou maiest vnderstande howe muche gyfte god wherof haue spoken excellent gift iacob muche water promise better water floweth furth oute veines yearth man drinke water shall geue desyre shall thirste eternally neyther shall thirste euer put hym ieoperdye yet shall nede tyme tyme anye el aske water hath drunken water shall remayne hym hath druncke shall bryng furth thesame fountaine perpetually springing vp euen vnto life euerlastyng iesus spake thynges darke similitude knowyng woman yet hable receyue ministrie faith whiche holy ghost geuen beyng receyued neuer failleth doeth styll goe forwarde whilest bryngeth man vp eternall life simplicitie woman great whereas iewes wont ouerthwartly wrongfully interprete suche maner parable vnderstanding saied yet beleuing louyng hym sayed lord praye geue parte water compelled beyng often sundrie time thirst go vnto wel drawe therof albeit aunswere grosse yet neuertheles declare mynde enclined readie beleue piesus saieth vnto goe call thy husbande come hither woman aunswered sayed vnto hym haue husbande iesus sayed vnto thou hast well saied haue husbande thou hast fiue husbandes thou hast thy husbad sayedst thou truely therfore alreadie conceyued small opinion iesus doeth inuite moue greater token proues godhead thynke yet highly hym iesus though woulde open secrete matier vnles husbande wer present commaundeth call husbande bryngyng hym returne agayn hym woman heard thinkyng spake man reason womanly shamefastnes desiryng dissemble hide vicious liuyng deniall matrimonie kepe secret aduoutrie saieth sir haue husbande iesus declaryng godhed gentely reprouyng woman lyfe saieth vnto thou sayest thou hast husbande thou hast tolde trueth although thou hast fyue husbandes satisfy thy filthy luste yet neuer one lawfull yea euen thou hast thy lawfull husbande therefore poynte thou hast spoken nothyng trueth woman sayeth vnto hym sir perceyue thou arte prophete father wurshipped mountaine ye saye hierusalem p ace menne oughte wurshippe iesus sayeth vnto woman beleue houre commeth ye shall neither mountayne yet hierusalem wurshippe father ye wurshippe ye wotte knowe wurshippe saluacion cummeth iewes houre cummeth nowe true wurshippers shall wurshyppe father spirite trueth suche father also requireth wurship hym god spirite wurship must wurship hym spirite trueth woman perceyued rebukeful synnes life committed home hidden iesu beyng straungier also iewe could know reporte menne thing whiche disclose shrynketh awaye hym one confounded shame neither anger moued answer agayn spitefully muche inflamed haue hym great admiracion wheras iesus spoken suche thyng vnto phariseis would haue cried saied enchaunter possessed deuillsir perceyue thou art prophete aunswere made godly sinner samaritane sir saieth perceiue thou arte prophete feith woman come poynte firste calleth iewe meruaileth earnestly obserue iewes religion contrarie custome iewes aske drynke samaritane anon calleth lorde nowe attributeth vnto name prophete euen knew secretes otherour father wurshipped mou tayne last desyryng learne certayne higher thynges prophete ceassed speake lowe meane matter propoundeth question thyng thynkyng impossible assoyled concernyng waie maner wurship god poynt iewes samaritanes muche disagree albeit bothe kyndes people wurship one god yet iewes opinion god wurshipped place onely ierusalem temple though god el heare desire praye cotrariwyse samaritanes like supersticion another sorte denyed god wurshipped place mounte garizim place appoynted moses patriarkes blesse people kepte commaundementes god forasmuche nacions beyng wel pleased owne seuerall rite customes one contemne religion woman desyred learne iesus prophete ignoraunt suche thynges whiche two nacions holyest waye seruyng god one would folow waye whiche knowe best ye saye ierusalem place men oughte wurshiptherfore sayeth elder wer wont wurship god mount thinke lawfull wurship hym place iewes contrariewyse accoumpt abhominable sacrifice high place groues lawfull wurship god hierusalem temple wherof glorie though god shut vp house builded man hand question woma apperteine learnyng true godlynes iesus openeth declareth howe true spirituall wurshippyng god sette foorth doctrine ghospel supersticious religion goddes deuils gentile vtterly extinguished yea also maner samaritanes wurshyppyng god abolyshed whiche suche iudgement god ought haue toke hym certain special deuell mixe wurshippyng hym wurshippyng deuils mingling confounding together wicked supersticion ge tile wurshyppyng god man put fyer water folowing saied gentile exaumple sacrifice hye groues mountaines furthermore shewed iewes religion time required hitherto grosse carnal rather represent certain shadowes true godlines godlines selfe encreace vnto perfeccion god afterward fully knowen sonne holy gost wurshipped onely iurie whole worlde yea holy temple temple hierusale say pure myndes god dedicate vnto himselfe spirite nowe pacified sauoure burt offreynges beastes holy prayer godly desire chaste affeccions iesus would open misterie godlines gospel speaketh first feith without none mete hearer euangelicall doctryne neyther fitte wurshipper christes religion faith doeth purifie hertes maketh apt put trust secretes heauenly wysedome woman sayth beleue thou take prophete dede time come vnpure wurshippyng samaritanes shalbe abolyshed also carnall religion iewes shall turned better neither shal ye herafter wurship father mountayne god mountayne also whole worlde ne yet ierusalemye wurship ye w know wurshippe c wheresoeuer shalbe congregacion good godly people shall hereafter ierusalem meane whyle iewes doe excell behalfe wurship god know lawe doe confesse lord thinges people doe defile wurshipping honoured wurshipping god wurship cannot tell supposing god body god iewes owne yea ye take hym suche one would suffer hymselfe matched deuyls wheras godly honoure due hym alone lawe hath taught iewes thynges god commaundement temple builded ierusalem wurship one god therin fygure spirituall temple priestes ordayned also rytes ceremony sacrifice certain shadowes betokening holynes gospell therfore iewes doe excell herin haue better iudgement god haue also doe pollute defile ye wurshipping prophane wurshippinges god moreouer doe excell doe wurshippe hym place appointed god himselfe rytes ceremony teaching howbeit ye meane religion although perfit yet step furtherauce toward perfit honouryng god therfore eternall health came firste iewes prophetes haue promised messias come whiche meanes lawe haue fygures shadowes religion gospell tyme come false religion gentile must geue place carnall wurshipping must geue glace spirituall wurshipping god also shadowes lawe light gospel tell tyme hande yea alreadie presente true wurshippers shall wurshippe father temple beastes bodily thynges spirite shadowes trueth god seyng spirite delyted purenes body walles temple neyther yet haue beastes offered sacrifice loueth spiritual wurshippers may wurshipped according spirite trueth hath hitherto enough attributed shadowes figure moses lawe hereafter whersoeuer shalbe mynde pure synne faith ghospel shalbe worthy teple god whersoeuer shalbe heauenly desiers pure praiers holy thoughtes shalbe sacrifice wherwith god pleased woman sayeth vnto hym wote messias shall come called christe come wyll tell v thynges iesus sayeth vnto speake vnto immediately came disciple meruayled talked woman yet n manne sayed meanest thou talkest thou woman left waterpot went waye vnto citie sayeth vnto men come see man whiche tolde thynges euer dyd christe wente citie came vnto hym simple pacient belefe woman samaria dyd muche profite forsaid communicacion iesu nowe supposeth hym first called iewe lorde prophete messias himselfe samaritanes also promyse moses dyd loke excellent prophete aryse come iewes therfore aunswered sorte knowe messias shall come iewes doe loke fori knowe messias shall come whiche called christe already rumoure emong iewes therfore shall come shall declare vnto v thynges whiche thou haste spoken concernyng newe maner wurshippyng god neither shall suffre v ignoraunte thyng iesus perceyuyng belefe woman apte taught suche feruente desyre knowe trueth founde like among countrey men iewes vouchesalueth therfore ope declare vnto thou lokest sayeth messias comeiesus sayeth vnto speake vnto thou assured come euen nowe thou seest hym doe talke dede soone thynges spoken disciple returnyng toune came thyther came hym perceyued talked woman samaria dyd meruaile great gentlenes yet manne durst aske hym thyng required woman cause talked woman beyng amased saying lorde iesus aunswer nothing leauing waterpotte well nowe thirsting water clearely gon forgotten tasted water christe promised maketh haste towardes citie synful samaritane sodenly became messenger apostle doeth declare thing openly folkes thintent knowledge many cofirme feith come saieth see manne meruailed one knoweth secretes although straunger one neuer sawe yet hath tolde secretes haue doen possible thesame messias trust woordes proue thyng selues ye shall fynde lyar meane disciple prayed saying maister eate sayed vnto haue meate eate knowe therfore sayed disciple emongest themselues hath man broughte oughte eate iesus sayeth vnto meate wyll hym hath sent finishe worke saye ye yet fower monethes cummeth haruest beholde saye vnto lifte vp iyes looke region white alredy vnto ha uest reapeth receyueth rewarde gathereth fruite vnto life eternall bothe soweth reapeth might reioyce together herein saying true one soweth another reapeth sende reape wheron bestowed labour men laboured yeare entred theyr labour while woman bruite abrode rumour emonges citizen sychar meane tyme iesus disciple supposyng hym bee payned houngre moued hym take suche meates brought iesus euery takyng occasion drawe men vp care bodilye thinges desire spirituall thynges lyke allured drawen woman knowlage fayth ghospell speakyng water occasion meates prouoketh disciple yet ignoraunt diligent preachyng ghospel yea peraduenture time muche thyrste water well although yet desyre thirst man saluacion neuertheles affeccion woman whiche came drawe water gaue occasion godly comunicacion lyke maner although hungrie mani haue meate eate ye know c muche hungrie saue mankynde cause descended heauen therfore sayed vnto disciple whiche moued hym take bodilye refeccion haue meate eate sayeth suche meate delite whiche bryng disciple meruailyng saying mente yet bolde aske maister reuerence bare vnto hym leste shoulde bee thyng offended therewith talked thus emong themselues meaneth hath body while absent brought meate iesus would nowe imprint theyr myndes thynge whiche spoken darkelyiesus saith vnto meate hym hathe sent sayeth nowe openly passe litle sayeth vpo bodely meate kynde meate specially care saye accomplishe thyng whiche cause heauenly father hath sent hither houngre thirst go thyng hath comaunded time prouoketh promptenes men mindes faith ghospell also require diligence preacher whiche doe muche care welth commoditie ye body know haruest hande fower monethes seede tyme pastsay ye yet iiii monethes end cummeth haruest muche ought regarde tyme spirituall harueste corne beginneth grow yealowe dooeth require fyckle diligence reaper yf wyll lyfte vp iyes behold corne groweth men mindes yea euen emonges samaritanes heathen make haste doctrine ghospell ye shall perceyue region countreyes euery syde wer reapyng rype haruest ghospell require labour dilygence yf hope yearthly fruite dooeth soone prouoke reaper labour howe muche ought forwarde gather harueste father whiche bothe shall obteyne reaper ryghte large rewarde heauen shall gather god wheate barnes soules men euerlastyng lyfe shall come passe bothe sowier reaper shall reioyce together thyng happeneth whiche woont spoken common prouerbe one soweth another reapeth payne laboure aboute tilling sowingand herein saying true one soweth reapeth haruest reapyng grounde muste plowed cloddes muste broken harowe fielde must dunged sede muste bee sowen couered earth attended kept cokle also muste weeded whe corne ripe great reapyng therof fruite beyng ripe ready doeth mitigate tediousnesse laboure spirituall haruest happeneth muche otherwyse bodily haruest accordyng common prouerbe often fruite commoditie haruest cumeth another hym soweth reaper dede reioyceth sowier grieuosly vexed spirituall haruest otherwyse sowier reaper reioyseth neyther lacketh theyr fruite commoditie haue sent reape corne sowyng wherof ye bestowed labour prophetes haue tilled groud trauaile haue theyr doctrine prepared ghospell world beyng time vntractable ye nowe succede entre vpon labour goe thyng prepared hade reason world nowe applyeth selfe receyue willyngly heauenly doctrine men goeth prease kyngdome heauen manner violence pmany samaritanes citie beleued hym saying woman whiche testifyed tolde euer dyd whe samaritanes come vnto hym besought hym woulde tary abode two dayes many menne beleued owne woordes sayed vnto woman beleue thy saying haue heard selues knowe euen christe sauiour worlde while lorde sayinges doeth exhorte disciple towardes bu sine ghospell thing selfe doeth declare true spoken corne waxing white rype towardes haruest citie many samaritanes dyd beleue messias come whereas woman testified nothyng el iesu opened declared vnto secrete shamefull deedes life time yet neyther heard speake seen doe miracle readye yea euen beliefe semed farre promisses prophetes therfore multitude samaritanes came renning citie see foresayed woman earnestly commended sette furthe vnto neither doeth presence diminishe opinion hym neither offended homely course apparell ne yet slendre trayne simple vnlearned disciple whereas iewes seen many miracle hearde many sermon receyued many commodity benefites hande eyther falselye accuse hym openly rebuke hym el chased awaye castyng stone hym conclusion samaritanes vpon woman reporte witnesse goe foorth mete manne whiche theyr owne nacion whome yet neuer heard speake neuer seen notable thyng doenand abode ii dayes yet require desire bee contented take lodging theyr citie moste gentle iesus knew enuie iewes knewe hatered bare samaritanes yet tyme come ghospell taken beeyng reiected theyr inuincible lacke beliefe shoulde preached gentile therfore tempered matter neyther gaue apparaunt profe occasion owne countrey men iewes complaine despised samaritanes preferred consideryng prophecie promised messias come neither yet would vtterly disapointe godly beliefe samaritanes went samaria euen necessitie theyr request tary two dayes good maner gentlenes wherewith manne right coulde fynde faulte nowe heard iesus many moe dyd beleue theyr beliefe stablished vpon reporte one woman conceyued notable opinion iesu nowe beare full witnesse iesu suche testimonie ryght semyng true iewe saying woman thou haste reported lesse thing requireth nowe doe beleue hym messias perswasio thy woordes selfes doe assuredly knowe woonderful communicacion true messias loked iewes shall bryng saluacion whole worlde cherefull full witnesse samaritanes declare theyr owne beliefe therewithall reproued wicked vnbelefe iewes two dayes departed thence wente awaye galile iesus hymselfe testified prophete hath none honour owne countrey assone come galile galilean receyued hym seen thynges ierusalem daye feast went also vnto feast daye therfore iesus would geue occasion iewes greater hatred enuy wrought miracle emong samaritanes neyther tourned waye theyr desire yet dyd lodge emong lenger two dayes forthwith maketh ende purposed iourney goeth forth waye galile moreouer albeit owne countrey lay waye iourney yet would turne despise reaso contempte lacke belefe owne countreymenne knowen also kindered concerning mahood hope gospell bring forth fruite preaching haue doubled faulte theyr vnbelefe meanes theyr faulte lesse beleuing iesus doctrine whe lord asked questio goe owne nacion shewe power aunswer vsed auncient prouerbe whiche common people vseth saye prophete nowhere contemned hys owne countrey emong owne kinsfolkes affeccios men familiaritie bringeth contempt exteme many thinges none cause come fro farre straunge countreys furthermore forasmuche galile reason iohns testimonie miracle iesus hymselfe doen late ryght honest brute fame spred galile receiued came thither specially ierusalem seen hym dryue byers seller temple thynges doen great authoritie presence people tyme also galile assembled ierusalem kepe holy feastfull day thynges verily doe condemne incredulitie phariseis betoken grace ghospell shall remoue gentile samaritanes doe beleue reporte one symple woman doe maner force hym beyng straunger lodge confesse hym bee messias redemer worlde yet vouchsaued worke myracle emong people galile beyng grosse nacio vnlearned lawe neuer prophete emong seen miracle began beleue ierusalem priestes phariseis scribe seemed kepe moste perfectly religion iewes also excellently learned lawe obstinately fynde faulte iesus doinges sayinges therfore iust religious euery man thought himselfe muche farther godlines ghospell agayne semed mannes iudgement knowledge prophetes lawe whiche dyd promyse christe contrariouse iewes religion muche nerer vnto christe lawe promysed come apte receyue doctryne ghospell iesus came agayne cana galile turned water wyne certayne ruler whose sonne sicke capernaum thesame heard iesus come iewry galile went vnto besought hym would come downe heale sonne euen poynte death sayed iesus vnto excepte ye see signes woonders ye beleue ruler sayeth vnto sir come downe euer sonne die iesus sayed vnto goe thy waye thy sonne liueth man beleued woorde iesus spoken vnto went waye nowe goyng downe seruauntes met hym tolde saying thy sonne liueth required houre began amende sayed vnto hym yesterdaye seuenth houre feuer lefte hym father knewe thesame houre iesus sayed vnto thy sonne liueth beleued al housholde agayne seconde miracle iesus dyd come iewry galile therfore iesus beyng entred galile wente againe cana toune saied galile long turned water wyne miracle first knowen afterward commonly bruted abrode caused people haue good opinion iesu yet suche wurthy dignitie fewe dyd beleue messias many toke prophete therfore iesus went againe cana get prayse miracle doen time reape corne sede sowen secretly thing thirsted coueted say faith men wurthy ghospell againe occasion rose lay ye iewes charge vnbelefe time galile certaine ruler emperours deputie prophane temporall cause neither iewe samaritane heathen manne clene contrary iewes religion sonne loued entierly whiche lay sore sicke great daunger life citie capernaum heard iesus left iewry come galile leauing sonne home departed citie capernaum came iesus requiring earnestly go capernau heale sonne vehemencie disease sicke man could caried iesus eue poynte death forsayed ruler departed hym nowe iesus declaring ye faith ruler yet vnperfit dyd rather beleue sone could healed vnles iesus himselfe gon thither though called vpon physician el though iesus could restore euen dead vnto life iesus rather rebuking incredulitie certain iewes would beleue seen miracle sayeth vnto ruler doe alowe belefe sayeth whiche doe credit woorde alone without confirmacion miracle ye beleue vnles see token miracle ruler myndful sonnes perill ieopardy made answer saying lorde iesus thought comunicacion wasting time wheras disease required present remediethe ruler sayeth vnto hym therfore requireth importunately make haste come capernaum sonne dead though shoulde come vayne case dyd come geuen vp ghost whereas easie iesu call againe lyfe past kepe thesame body ready go therofiesus sayeth vnto hym goe thy waye thy sonne lyueth therfore iesus without rebuking ruler fayth sheweth dede selfe doe much ruler trusted could doe nede sayth cause go capernaum go thy waie thy sonne thou diddest leaue poynte death aliue helth ruler faith somewhat stayed sayingthen enquired houre wha began amende trusting iesus woorde maketh haste homewarde goyng thyther seruauntes mette hym bryng father good tidinges childe saye whiche litle poynte death sodeinly recouered trouble iesus whose helpe nede supposed childe recouered health hap men ignoraut doen betwene ruler iesus poynt verily ruler lacke full trust mixte hope caused miracle better beleued ruler desirouse knowe trueth certaynly whether sonne restored helth againe chaunce power iesu enquired seruautes houre sonne began amend yesterday say seuenth houre one clocke none feuer sodeinly lefte hym byanby sonne whole father knewe euen houre iesus sayed vnto hymso father knewe c go home thy sonne lyueth well assured sonne reuiued chaunce power iesus though miracle wrought vpon heathen manand beleued al hou holde yet muche fruite came therof ruler himselfe beleued christ messias also perswasio exaumple whole housholde beleued thesame must nedes haue muche people considering ryche manne high autoritie wheras iesus wrought many miracle amongst owne countreyme kinsfolkes muche doe wyn fewe gospellthis seconde miracle second miracle iesus wrought come iewry galile entent myght confirme agayne former miracle whiche wrought cana doyng greater example prophane heathen manne might prouoke owne countreymen vnto fayth euen occasion pronosticate signifie bothe iewes repelled theyr incredulitie gentile faith receyued grace ghospell pthe v chapter pafter feast daye iewes iesus went vp ierusalem ierusalem slaughter house poole called hebrue toungue bethsaida hauing fyue porch lay great multitude sicke folke blynd halt withered waiting mouyng water angell wente downe certain season poole stired water whosoeuer first stirring water stepped made whole whatsoeuer disease iesus wyse begunne matter among samaritanes people galile goeth ierusalem euen feast penthechost intendyng reason great resorte people declare setforth autoritie many reproue ye phariseis infidelitie whiche swelled pryde false perswasion holines knowledge nowe samaritanes heathen muche excelland ierusale slaughter house apoole c ierusalm verily poole certayne depe lake water whiche grekes calleth probatica takyng name cattell priestes wonte washe sacrifice offered lyke reason called hebrue bethsaida would say slaughter house house cattel lake hath fiue porch ouer porch lay great numbre men sicke diuerse bodily disease besydes great multitude folkes blynde halted lame abiding lokyng mouyng water angell lorde went downe certaine time poole therwithall water moued angell stiered water stepped first poole made whole sicke whatsoeuer bodily mayme euen tyme figure baptisme wherby filthines disease soules neuer deadly washed away often office baptiser god operacion aboue concurrant element water doubte occasion muche people time place either gathered together beholde see doen el whiche dyd attende vpon sicke folkes lay fyue porch certayne man whiche diseased xxxviii yere iesus sawe hym lye knewe nowe long time diseased sayeth vnto hym wylt thou made whole sicke man aunswered syr haue man water troubled put poole meane time aboute come steppeth downe iesus sayeth vnto ryse take vp thy bedde walke immediately man made whole toke vp bed walked miracle myght notable iesus chose among sicke folke one whiche furthest fro hope recouery whose disease dangerouse almoste incurable also holden hym long tyme finally saied manne moste lacked helpe succour men poore able prouide man might due tyme caryed downe water one multitude cured whose chauce first goe downe water man great misery must nedes setforth greatnes miracle thesame man faith helped muche example palsie vexed xxx yeres together teache v disease soule deadly long cotinuauncewhan iesus sawe lye c baptisme faith iesu may easily take awaye therfore moste mercifull iesus beholden sicke palsey euery body pitied lying withall membres looce shakyng reason disease also perceyued sickenes muche dispayred holden already miserable creature thirtie yeres togetherhe sayed vnto hym wylte thou bee made whole iesus saye beeyng moued mercy sayed vnto hym wilt thou made whole wyllyng declare hereby stander fayth sufferaunce man also make besydes perceyue violence disease declaryng therby howe man cured vyces soule vnles hate owne sickenes haue desyre made whole doubted desired health whiche many yeres lyen besydes poole constante hope health ofte disapointedsir haue man c ceased hope dispaired therfore sicke man palsey made aunswer iesus question yet conceyuing good hope vpon cherefull demaunde sheweth lacketh mistrusteth greatnesse long continuaunce disease healed case brought ye poole howbeit sayth lacketh man helpe beare hym myght due season cary hym poole assone water stirred perceiued ye poole stirred euery man made haste himselfe entre first obteine alone benefite helth sayed sicke man slowe reason disease lackyng one beare hym dyd vayne crepe forth towarde lake asmuche gon hym truely sicke mannes meaning saying lowely shamefastly desire iesus beyng man strength piteouse semed woordes would time cary downe poole whiche thing durst requyre hym opely yet disclosed necessitie shewed hindred helth sicke man knew iesus iesus well pleased man pacient sufferauce whiche moste parte suche miserable creature wont doe say cry wishe himselfe dead cursse daye borne neyther offended iesus askyng whether would made whole therfore saye make clamour iesus derision lord likewyse moued constant hope recouer helth conclusion willing shewe healed mouyng foresayd poole cured power easy ready thing hym euen becke take awaye disease body soule saied vnto sicke man ryse take vp thy couche goe thy waye woorde soner spoken man healed healed clerely deliuered fro disease el haue fainte feble like wont cured phisike man saye throughly healed without stay man helpe rose vp vpon fete caried awaye bed vpon shoulder beyng strong inough beare owne bed walke forth bare home mennes sight remembraunce long continued disease thesame daye sabboth iewes therfore sayed vnto made whole sabboth daye lawfull carry thy bed aunswered made whole saied vnto take vp thy bed walke asked man whiche saied vnto take vp thy bed walke healed wist iesus gotten himselfe awaye prease people place thesame daye sabboth cand sabboth daye whan sicke man palsey dyd thinges wherat phariseis toke occasion finde faulte phariseis supersticiously mainteine suche thinges lawe carnall geuen time contened thinges chiefe still continue amonges counted wicked dede doe busines sabboth daye deceyue neyghbour vpon sabboth daye toke trifle would haue seme vngodly thing poore sicke cary away bed vpon sabboth daye grudge enuy helth thought faulte knew man sicke palsey well inough lyen sicke many yeres well perceiue nowe strong toke apparance disease great miracle ought haue glorified god haue reioysed behalfe cured vnles wicked god enuiouse toward neighbour therfore like peruerters true religion fall hand chide caried awaye couche sabboth daye say ought kept rest quiet lawfull cary awaye thy couche dissemblyng benefite receyued deliuer hymselfe enuy faulte autoritie iesu shewyng coulde doe great thyng woorde semed greater either man sabboth daye poore man say maketh answer ye spitefull iewes made whole woorde commaunded cary awaye couche walke heard wheras ought reason miracle haue beleued enuy curedtha asked hym man c also wet deuise matter cured ye man saye whiche badde thee cary awaye thy couche walke would haue burdened faulte breaking ye sabboth day doen many tymes nowe healed knewe iesus name onely sight howbeit tyme coulde shewe hym vnto iesus spoken sicke man palsey immediately withdrewe hymselfe multitude partely lest presence shoulde prouoke iewes enuy partly beeyng absente miracle better knowen reporte hym whiche felte benefite health afterwarde iesus found temple sayde vnto hym behold thou arte made whole sinne lest wurse thyng happen vnto thee man departed tolde iewes iesus whiche made hym whole therfore iewes dyd persecute iesus sought meanes slea hym doen thinges sabboth daye miracle made manifest euidently proued iesus willyng autour therof also knowen met man vpon whome bestowed benefite health sayed vnto hym beholde thou hast obteyned healththe man departed tolde iewes iesus art deliuered bodelye sickenes whiche came reason thy soule sicke haue cured thee bothe disease take thou good hede hereafter thou fall agayne thyne olde former synnes therby cause thy selfe haue wourse disease therfore man made whole knewe whiche commaunded carrye awaye couche whiche nowe also hauyng testified authour health monish warne hym beware leste shoulde fall agayne sorer wurse disease committing renewyng synne also perceyuyng name iesus sayed manne went maliciouse slaunderous iewes tolde howe iesus might thanke health thinkyng profitable manye haue hym knowen menne whiche woorde could helpe desperate disease nowe againe iewes peruerse damnable frowardnes sheweth selfe wheras samaritanes honourably receyued iesus reporte one woman whereas people galilee beeyng euill spoken commonlye among iewes theyr basenes ignoraunce lawe geuen credite christ great ruler also beyng gentile heathen man familie householde one onely miracle confessed iesus sauioure worlde yet citizen ierusalem beyng proude well noblenesse theyr citie also wholy religion theyr temple lykewise auauntyng themselues bee menne exactely learned lawe picked quarels iesusbecause doeth thynges sabboth daye suche purposed malice albeit benefite healthe euident coulde denayed holy coulde found faulte thyng holy freely geue healthe body manne miserablye afflicted yet dooe laye christes charge faulte without regard sabboth daye hath commaunded hym carye awaye couche saye man made sabboth daye rather sabboth daye ordeyned manne though ceremony moses lawe oughte euerye geue place holye preceptes dueties great blyndnes disdayne iesus hadde healed piteouse creature vpon sabboth daye whiche thoughte themselues moste precyse kepers obseruers lawe afrayed helpe vp theyr asse beyng fallen ditche vpon sabboth daye falsly say helpyng manne god offended without whose helpe man coulde cured helpyng vp asse thought religion sabboth day bro n ouerthwart disordered religion iewes imbracyng outwarde apparaunce religion therby subuertyng perfeccion true religion styffely obseruing shadowes lawe obstinate mindes persecutyng hym cause lawe wrytten onely slaunder iesus also persecuted doen holy good dede vpon sabboth daye iesus aunswered father worketh hytherto worke therfore iewes sought kyll hym onely broken sabboth sayed also god father made hymselfe equall god iesus shewe maister sabboth day bonde verye auctor subiecte therewithall declareth thyng wherof iewes slaundred hym beyng sonne father heauen one worke whatsoeuer father auctoritie dyd also redounde father dishonour iesus saye went represse put awaie iewes false reporte woordes heauenly father saieth whose religiouse wurshippers ye would seme bee also made sabboth daye made whole worlde sixe day rested seuenth daye wroughte saye bynde hymself rest quiet maye worke whatsoeuer wyll ofte pleaseth althoughe sabboth daye dooeth yet stil endure neuerthelesse ceasseth worke wherby gouerneth thynges whiche hath made wherby also causeth tyme tyme procreacion one thyng succede another finally wherby restoreth thynges decayed therfore lyke doeth cease dayly good men thinges hath create notwithstanding religion obseruaunce sabboth day wherin scripture saieth ceassed creacion thynges sonne hauyng power exaumple hym worke suche thinges perteineth man saluacion letted religious obseruacion sabboth day maye perfourme thynges whiche father hath commaunded yf ye blame breaking sabboth daye thesame meanes ye condemne also father geueth exaumple autoritie thynges yf ye thynke hym faultlesse glorifie hym restoryng health desperate creature wherfore ye laye charge fault breaking sabboth daie rather acknowledge vertue power whiche greater keping sabboth daie haue restored lyfe miserable man craftely go procure death doyng good dedetherefore iewes soughte kill hym moste sacred wordes iesus spake dyd litle asswage fury iewes thereby sharpened vehemently styred hym sekyng occasion putte death nowe dyd breake sabboth daie also dyd sayed wrongfullye take god owne father makyng himselfe equall god woorkes auctoritie whatsoeuer would pthan answered iesus sayed vnto uerely verely say vnto sonne canne nothyng hymselfe seeth father doe soeuer doeth doeth sonne also father loueth sonne sheweth hym thynges hymselfe doeth shewe hym greater workes bycause shoulde meruayle lykewyse father rayseth vp dead quickeneth euen sonne quickeneth wil neyther iudgeth father man hath comitted iudgemente vnto sonne men honour sonne euen honour father honoureth sonne thesame honoureth father whiche hath sent hym lord iesus perceiued malice procedeth openeth manifestely vnto power receiued god father therby make afearde procede theyr wicked crueltie doeth tempre communicacio otherwhiles talketh certaine hye thinges signifie vnto couertly diuine nature whiche one betwene god father hym otherwhiles againe communicacion bringeth lower thinges testifie mahed therby affinitie betwene would stirre loue leaste maiestie godly power let wicked rashenesse yet doeth chalenge hymselfe lyke power father neuertheles attributeth preeminence autoritie spake wyse ye meruayle haue taken vpon equall power father workyng doe assuredly promyse sonne whiche doeth wholy depede father doe nothyng hymselfe forasmuche hymselfe doeth whiche seeth father doethe sonne doe nothyng himselfe c haue one one power autoritie resteth father whence procedeth sonne whatsoeuer sone may doe therfore whatsoeuer ye father doeth thesame likewise worketh sonne equalitie power communicate eternall natiuitie among men oftentymes child vnlike maners theyr parentes neyther father wyll sonnes one yet theyr power like case thing farre otherwysefor father loueth sone c father loueth sonne intierly hath begotten hym moste like hymselfe pouryng hym egall power workyng sheweth vnto sonne howe doe thynges whiche doeth himselfe exaumple cummeth hym workyng common hath create world also gouerneth world yea euen vpon sabboth dayes hath made man also preserueth man vpon sabboth dayes therfore whosoeuer doeth slaundre workes sonne doeth iniurie father thynges whiche ye see doe sabboth daye doe father autoritie appoyntment yf ye thinke thyng merueyled aboue man power restore helth woorde man sicke palsey father whose commaundement sonne doeth thynges whiche doeth wyll declare hath shewed sonne greater workes ye may maruaile thyng farre greater power raise dead life restore helth sicke yet father hath geuen power also sonne hath geuen owne euer father becke rayseth dead calleth agayne lyfe sonne also selfe power may call agayne lyfe lust whatsoeuer father doeth doeth sonne whatsoeuer sonne doeth doeth father father sonne haue one wyll lyke haue one power moste hye chiefe autoritie god iudge world king lord thynges yet hath made sonne partaker hym whole powerneyther iudgeth father man vnto hath geue al power iudge whatsoeuer heaue yearth vnder earth like father hath create thynges sonne gouerneth al thinges sonne hath restored al thinges sonne iudgeth nothing sonne entent eyther may glorifie honour father knowen sonne workethhe honoureth sonne c sonne partie declareth maiestie father whence hath whatsoeuer worketh eyther beyng knowen men may honour sonne doe father mete egall power also felowes honour thinke ye haue father mercifull vnto ye alienate fallen sonne whosoeuer honoreth father working sonne honoreth also sonne working power father whosoeuer doeth honour sonne moste intierly beloued moste lyke father person doeth dishonour father sent sonne thintent might hym honoured euery thyng common betwene honour dishonour mistrusteth sonne mistrusteth also father sent hym worlde whose wyll appoyntmente doeth thynges doeth also father speaketh vnto worlde lyke faithfull shall haue great reward vnfaythfull shall haue small punishmente uerily verily saye vnto heareth woorde beleueth sente hath euerlasting life shall come damnacion scaped death vnto life tell certayne whoso heareth woorde beleueth hym whiche sent speaketh persone hath already euerlasting life whosoeuer iustified sinnes lyueth god thorowe righteousnes hath god also life eternall neyther shall nede feare damnacion eternall death whiche redie receyue vnfaithfull yea rather doeth alreadie possesse vnfaithfull true beleuer beyng clensed olde sinne faith passeth thorowe fro death lyfe greater thyng rayse soule dead sinne death life restore dead body life father hath geuen power sonne doe thynges uerily verily saye vnto houre shall come nowe dead shall heare voyce sonne god heare shall lyue father hath lyfe hymselfe lykewyse hath geuen sonne haue lyfe hymselfe hath geuen hym power also iudge sonne manne maruayle houre shall come whiche graues shall heare voyce shal come forth haue doen good vnto resurreccion lyfe haue doen euil vnto resurreccion damnacion ye well assured tyme hande yea alreadie presente euen dead also shall heare voice sonne god whoso heareth shal liue raysed slepe shall come forth graues shall declare vnto beeyng astonished therwith liue dede like maner also ye dead soules doe liue againe heare voice sonne god doeth heare whiche heareth without fayth tyme come dead bodyes shall ryse agayne voyce sonne godthe time shall come nowe c hauyng shewed likelyhoode resurreccion come raysing fewe death lyfe greater matter hade rayse vp soules death lyfe worde call nothyng preciouse lyfe nothyng godlike geue lyfe restore thesame cause man mistrust power sonnefor father hath life hymselfe c yf beleue power father man doubteth god fountaine life whence l uing thinges eyther heauen earth haue theyr lyfe father hath life himselfe geue restore list hath also geuen sonne haue himselfe ye foutaine lyfe besides hath geuen power iudge quicke dead sentence sayed sonnemaruail c whiche cannot exchewed haue eyed doctryne shall go hence eternall lyfe contrarye woulde obey shall appoynted iudged eternall punishment meruayle great power geuen man consideryng thesame sonne god selfe thyng nowe committed hym whiche alwaye common betwene hym father endeuour selues meane tyme thorowe fayth ye maye wurthy haue lyfe tyme shal come whiche dead buryed shall heare almightie voyce sonne god furthwith bodyes shall liue agayne shall haue dead buried come theyr graues rewarded sundry sorte eyther accordyng theyr beliefe vnbeliefe whiche haue doen good workes lyfe shall lyue agayne enherite immortall lyfe syde whiche haue doen euill shall lyue agayne suffre paine eternall death lyke fayth well fountayne goodnes infidelitie spryng euill myne owne selfe nothyng heare iudge iudgemente iuste se ne owne wyll father whiche hath sente beare witnes self witnes true another beareth witnes sure witnes whiche beareth true neither cause man slaundre iudgement sonne though indifferent father iudgement cannot bee indifferent sonnes iudgement whiche one father like maner indifferent sonne iudgeth none otherwise father hath appoynted prescribed vnto whoso feareth father iudgementi mine owne selfe nothyng ought also feare sonnes iudgemet nothing selfe heare father iudge therfore iudgement iust haue whiche father wyse corrupt wherof maye procede corrupte iudgemente among men small credite geuen whiche beareth witnes himselfe counted arrogant proude whiche owne reporte attributeth great thynges hymselfe alone myne owne witnes let witnes taken emong vayne vntrueyf bea e wytnesse selfe one hath borne witnes saye iohn ye dooe attribute muche thynges nowe vnstedfast men ye dooe credite wheras knowe witnes true forasmuche hath vttered hymselfe inspiracion father ye cannot deny iohns recorde witnes muche set amonges selues haue sent graue men vnto trustie men might knowe moste true auctor whether messias take vpon hym false prayse whiche ye would haue attributed vnto hym confessed trueth openly testifying manne taken sayed messias whiche shoulde take awaye sinnes worlde geue lyfe thesame ye sent vnto iohn bare witnes vnto trueth receiue recorde man neuerthelesse thing saye ye maye safe burning shining light ye would season haue reioyced light haue greater witnes witnes iohn workes whiche father hath geuen finishe thesame workes beare witnes father hath sent father hath sent hath borne witnes ye haue heard voyce tyme seen shape woorde haue ye abydyng hath sent hym ye beleue least witnes ye muche exteeme ye dyd beleue hym messias ought haue regarded among specially seyng procured behalfebut receyue recorde man c brought light owne selues concernyng selfe haue nede bee commended mannes witnes reporte vnto ihons witnes care nothyng worldly glory would made among thintent whiche muche regarde iohns auctoritie shoulde credite hath borne witnes whereby ye maye exchewe condemnacion infidelitiehe burnyng shynyng light thorowe faith obteyne saluacion iohn doubtles greate man yet light whiche promised world onlye burnyng candell tynded fyre geuyng light light yet whereas ye ought tellyng declaracion haue made hast ye true light doeth alwaie illuminate euery man cummeth world ye leauer shorte tyme boast glory lighte embrace true light geueth euerlastyng glory neuer darkened dyeth iohn gaue light sonne one immediatelye geue place thesame derkened thorowe shining true light woulde haue taken hym messias denyed hymselfe woorthy vnleuse latchet messias shooes doe litle regarde witnes bare mebut haue greater witnes witnesse iohn seing thynges ye haue good opinion hym depende vpon iohns witnes yet woulde wishe ye woulde geue credite vnto ye perishe thorowe infidelitie though ye beleue witnes yet haue certaine testimonye selfe saye father testimonie witnes greater iohn whose witnes cannot reproued recorde sure dedes man doeth yf ye perceyue workes worthy god whiche ye haue seen doo workes whiche father hath geuen finishe c beare sufficient witnesse doe nothyng selfe hym whiche saluacion hath sente worlde wherfore ye haue cause whereby excuse infidelitie diminishe credence sayeth alonely myne owne witnesse declare great thynges selfe ye haue iohns witnes whiche among muche regarded taken weightie howbeit dede rather nedeth witnesse le e seme haue borne false witnes ye haue testimonie workes nowe ye nede beleue mannes sayinges ye looke vpon dedes themselfe dooe satisfie vnbeliefe yet haue ye hearde iordane voice father aboue bearing witnes yet father forasmuche spirite neither hathe voice whiche maye perceyued mannes eares fourme shape maye bee seen bodely iyes moses neyther heare see hym veraye fourme owne mere nature suppose onely sonne hath seen hym heard sorte yet neuertheles hath made himselfe knowen sensesye haue hearde voyce anye tyme seen shape kynde voyce thorowe manner fourme spake prophetes prophetes hath spoken hath spoken iohn iohn vnto hath spoken owne nature speaketh vnto ye make excuse iohn beare playne manifest witnesse ye beleue hym ye thinke god dede speake seen moses prophetes wherfore ye credite thynges hath spoken psearche scripture ye thinke ye haue eternall lyfe whiche testifie yet ye come ye mighte haue lyfe receyue prayse men knowe ye haue loue god come father name ye receyue come owne name ye receiue howe ye beleue whiche receiue honour one another seke honour cummeth god thinke accuse father one accuseth euen moses whome ye truste ye beleued moses ye would haue beleued wrote yf ye beleue wrytynges howe shall ye beleue woordes uerely ye beleue scripture come god albeit diligentely occupie selues searchyng put ope felicitie lyfe yet euen ye would beleue iohn thynges ye gaue great credite bare witnes beleue scripture whiche chiefe poynte promyse life father doeth beare witness promiseth wil send sonne men shall saued ye haue heard iohn beleued hym also voice father geuen credite vnto neither witnesse lawe prophetes sticketh myndes although ye haue theyr bookes euer handes woordes alwaye mouthes yet doe ye reiecte hym whome sc iptures dooe promyse doe beleue hym whome father hath sent accordyng promyses prophetes wheras none entrie life hathe approued manye testimony yet ye wyll forsake thing come wherby ye maie obtain life withoute difficultie gate entrie saluacion haue beleued sonne father sent cause seke worldlye glory amonges testimonie iohn prophetes sory youre destruccion whiche incredulitie dooe maner enuye owne saluacion besides leaue maner excuse make selfe beleue haue brought foorth thus manye witness whiche thynges veray great auctoritie among onelye matter concernyng whose cause thynges wer written spoke ye doe alowe ye pretende wurship loue god ye haue prophetes reuerence spake yet despise promised god doeth declare himselfe workes playne argument ye wurship god counterfaicte holynes ye loue god dede lawe commaundeth loue power soule stregth inasmuche ye contemne regarde sonne therfore infidelitie wante witness lacke true loue towardes god loue worldly glory loue money loue pleasure get thynges misuse selues false pretence religion ye persecute sonne god teacheth thynges whiche contrary wicked desyres albeit reachyng agreeth fatherye haue loue god thynges declare ye loue god herte whiche loueth doeth also beleue obeye whoso loueth father cannot hate moste entierly beloued sonne lyke maner loueth sender cannot mislyke contemne messanger specially consideryng couet neither glory kyngdome richesse among onely glory father also couet thentent maye saued see workes wurthy god yet doe ascribe worldlye prayse selfe father worketh therfore although ye would eme religiously wurship father yet ye receyue come name doe none thyng whiche hath prescribed vnto looke howe peruersely discredite cummyng father name freely offer lyfe saluacion euen fondely shall ye beleue whosoeuer cummeth owne name presumpteously takyng vpon hym glory god therewith attendeth owne busines god bringyng suche thyng vnto maye leade eternal death ye loue god ye murmure crie agaynst seketh glory ye loue euerlastyng lyfe ye reiecte autour lyfe ye accompte hym wicked whiche chalengeth glory god hymselfe wherefore ye receyue hym whiche doeth presume fal take vpon glorye god sayed ye must nedes confesse holynes towardes god fayned ye wurship god woordes outwarde abseruaunces ceremony ye hate hym dede ye haue alwaye mouth temple lord temple lord temple lorde h rte set vpon rychesse ye talke muche lawe prophetes herte ye couet desire worldly prayse bee euer speakyng woordes lawe loue thy lorde god al thy herte thy neighbour thyselfe hert remaineth enuy hatred manslaughter deserue prayse god true prayse dede true godlynes geue ascribe glory god therfore howe ye beleue settyng fueth none thyng god glory despisyng true glory procedeth god goe seke false glorye prayse amongst men one flatteryng another enuying god shoulde haue owne due prayse glorye sekyng also vnder false pretence thought holy men regardyng sincere pure conscience whiche god beholdeth while ye trauaile get vile lucre worlde ye lose eternall life therfore meruail though god angrie ye resiste stubbernely thynke desire reuenge contempte ye haue accuse father nede bee youre accuser moses hymselfe shall accuse whose autoritie amongeste take right holy ye put veray great trust takyng whatsoeuer wrote thyng spoken god owne mouth ye pretended feigned reuerence towardes iohn whose witnesse concernyng ye doe belieue ye doe shew selfes regarde saiynges prophetes feynedly ye doe nowe persecute hym whome haue promised finally ye vntruely wurship god whose workes ye doe acknowlage whose sonne ye doe hate ye doe honour moses feined sort whose autoritie ye sette litle yt thyng wherein ye ought moste regarde yet euen veraye hath written youre elder beeyng agreued terrible voyce god perillous fyer made intercession thencefoorth might heare voyce god proue dreadfull fyer god dyd graunte requeste promysed moses would rayse excellente prophete lyke vnto hymselfe whiche shoulde cumme brother whose gentle pleasant voyce fearyng men threatenyng alluryng theim saluacion shoulde behoue heare god threaten punishement would obey thys prophetes woordes saiyng truely reuenged hym whiche wyll heare woordes shall speake name agayn comaundeth destroied whiche wyll heare prophete cummyng owne name speakyng suche thinges god hath commaunded hym therefore none shal accuse god moses frend whose writinges ye contemne hath promysed shoulde bee quiete gentle speake thynges accordyng goddes one beeyng presente yet ye refuse also commaundeth persone killed whiche shall cum name speake spirite one dooe embrace make much hatred ye beare one agreable wicked desire therefore onely stubberne agaynst also agaynst moses hymselfe whose promyses credite truely yf ye beleued moses ye would credite also hath promysed whose saiyng hath commaunded bee beleued therfore meruaile though ye beleue woordes ye doe openly contemne one meane simple person ye geue credite moses writynges whose autoritie ye woulde seme haue great estimacion ye haue notable opinion sayinges lorde iesus beyng light trueth reproue disclose feyned religion iewes thyng muche contrarye godlinesse ghospell may bee entent would make euidently knowen menne theyr owne faulte defecte didde perishe whiche would moued many recordes testimony hym allured benefites gentle woordes feared threatenynges neither prouoked fayth desire eternall life yet turne theyr infidelitie feare hell iesus hadde spoken thinges amonge samaritanes gentile specially causing woordes better beleued myracles would haue conuerted penaunce scrib priestes hierusalem make aunswere thynges could reproue yet neuertheles doe stil remaine theyr murderouse thoughtes procure deathe whiche offreth benefites eternall life p vi chapter pafter thinges iesus wente waie ouer sea galile whiche sea tiberias great multitude folowed sawe myracles diseased iesus wente vp mountaine sate disciple easter feaste iewes nye nowe therfore geue place tyme furie withdrawe hymselfe amongest swelled pride opinion thei hadde false feyned religion theyr vnexperte knoweledge lawe iesus presented hymselfe plaine meanyng men goyng cana galile whiche lyeth beyonde great lake tiberias takyng name citie tyberias whiche citie tiberius emperoure buylded vpon ryuers syde great noumbre folke folowed hym goyng thither partely beeyng moued doe great minde hadde myracles hadde seen healpe men theyr disease rare straunge power partelye whiche sicke vncurable disease mighte bee holpen hym partely desired heare doctrine sawe feruencie disordred confused multitude bee great forgettyng prouision vitels wente farre deserte make disciple mete myracle whome moste specially would haue thing woorke knowen imprinted hertes yet rude ignoraunte iesus saye gote himselfe secretlye vp mountaine disciple hym teachyng euen thesame dede albeit whiche professeth hymselfe shepeheard people doe accumpany hymself often meane lowe sorte profite yet behoueth suche one eleuate lifte vp mynde high thinges oft throughe holye studie prayes mynde bee stirred prouoked contemplacion heauenlye thynges people abideth benethe vpon plaine grounde onelye iesus disciple wente vp hym behoue bishop bee withoute vile care temporall thynges menne haue mounted higher co temne thynges whiche ignoraunte people setteth muche therfore iesus beyng sumwhat separate people setteth hym hyll accumpanied disciple might loke vpon people bishop ought goe backe christe although comon people sticke muche lower thynges dede aboue hyll conuenient men sitte saye studye celestiall thynges muste menne take reste lower inferiour matter whiche thynges bee handled gone aboute charitie tyme requireth men muste rather walke therin sitte downe reste mynde ought delited contemplacion hye thinges fall careles common flocke solitarinesse bishop ought thys ende liuelye better enstructed myght repayre againe looke people profite neyther doeth beseme whiche christes stede leaue coumpany bankettyng wantonnesse bodye dicyng huntyng suche lyke inordinate pleasure quietnes renewe mynde whiche muche buisied weried lowe meane buisinesse make thesame pure desyres instant praier holy studye deuoute communicacion mete offyce ministerie ghospell moreouer whylest thynges dooen galile easter hande feast iewes kepte verai religiously wherfore sought haue bene noted theyr religion conuenient hym tyme haue hierusalem shewe sum likelihood tyme cum theyr house bee leaft desolate iewes wer becum rebel god incredulitie also holy ghospell openly setfurth al theyr carnal wurshippyng god ceasse finally feaste easter moste specially celebrate whereas worldly affeccions renounced put away mynde shoulde brought vnto loue celestiall thynges vpon consideracions saye iesus rather bee among people galile deserte solitarily hierusalem temple iesus lift vp iey saw great cumpany cum vnto saieth vnto philip whence shal bye breade maie eate saied proue knew would philip aunswered two hundred penyworth bread sufficiente euery manne maie take litle nowe iesus opened iyes looked vpon people perceiuyng noumbre bee exceadyng greate prepared myndes disciple towardes true credence myracle fyrst woulde haue lacke meate well marked considered theim also multitude whiche stoode beneath sight innumerable besydes thys verye fewe loaues whiche themselfes handes shoulde take vnto iesus hym distribute thesame among people finallye howe shoulde bee leafte manye baskettes full broken meate whiche thesame disciple gather together fragmentes feaste woulde iesus haue theim consider ignoraunte thyng neyther afterwarde forget thesame knewe yet disciple wer smal vnderstandyng forgetfullwhece shal bread maye eate therefore proue mynde philip little little make hym beleue better myracle iesus sayeth vnto hym shall bye breade great noumbre people maye haue sumwhat eate lorde iesus asked thinges ignorant store breade vitels hadde partelye sayed euen nowe cause apostle aduisedlye considre myracle partelye also yt men myght knowe howe without care bodilye sustenauce disciple whiche folowed christe howe well contented common homely meate philip yet lookyng myracle althoughe hadde seene christe turne water wyne mariage wayed well lytle money hadde succoure theymselfes withall great multitude men aunswered syr speake bying breade assure case bestowe twoo hundred penny bread yet wyll enough meane satisfie menne reason long abstinence veray muche hungred wil relieue euerye one eatyng litle maye escape thereby peryll famishyng pone disciple andrew simon peter brother saieth vnto lad whiche hath iue ba ly loaues twoo fish hat among many iesus saied make people sitte downe muche grasse place men sate downe noumbre fiue thousand iesus toke bread wha geuen thankes gaue disciple disciple gaue set downe likewise fish muche would philyp spoken thus andrewe brother symon peter beyng sumwhat wyser lifted vp hys mynde hope myracle howbeit yet full confidence seene water turned wyne therefore dyd altogether mistruste loaues also myght bee multiplied neuertheles thought none otherwyse moderate porcion fewer loaues lesse bread mo loaues breade shoulde encrease whereas iesus trueth nede anye matter make breade createth euen nothyng wyll andrewe therefore sayed certayne boye hathe fyue barlye loaues two fish litle great multitude beyng alreadye hungrie iesus sawe perceyued lacke meate pondered multitude wasies saieth make people sitte downe entendyng stiere vp theyr myndes looke myracle commaund apostle see people placed set downe vpon grasse whereof place great plentye disciple dooe nowe aunswere againe saye nedeth haue sette downe lacke meate sette whiche haue store suffice selfes simply without dooe obeyed iesus commaundemente caused people sitte downe ordre wer feaste people also lyke simple playne men trusted wel obedientely apostle badde although sawe prouision meate sate downe almost fiue thousand iesus therfore toke fiue barly loauesand iesus toke bread customable maner hadde geuen thankes father brake theim toke disciple distribute vnto people framyng fashionyng theim thys corporall similitude enure theimselues playe well shepeherdes beeyng minister ghospel feede norishe soules christes flocke spirituall foode bread came heauen geue eternal lyfe desirously eate thereof breade verily byshops bestowe ministre vnto people el christes handes without rendryng thankes father heauen whome must knowlage selfes haue receyued whatsoeuer apperteineth saluacion mankynde vnto auctour lorde iesus referred notable thynges whiche dydde worlde monishyng v therewith way case haue ex ellente vertue v shoulde chalenge prayse thereof clerelye putte ourselues glorye thesame geue vnto god procedeth al thynges right deserue prayse furthermore iesus dyd euen nowe thesame thing two f shes doen fyue loaues deliueryng vnto disciple wyl pleasure meat encrease betwene handes dealer muche quantitie knewe would suffice theim yea also great deale make myracle better beleued eaten enough saieth vnto disciple gather vp broken meate whiche remaineth nothing loste gathered together filled twelue baskettes broken meate fiue barlye loaues whiche broken meate remained vnto eaten men seen myracle iesus saied trueth thesame prophete cumme worlde finally great cumpany well filled meate iesus settyng foorth certaintie dede profe leste anye manne shoulde fynde faulte impute thyng bee delusion countrefayte thyng sayed thus disciple gather vp broken meate whiche lefte reaste nothyng bee loste founde muche broken meate euerye one eaten fylle fylled twelue baskettes bountifull goodnes iesus augmented scarcitie small store vitayles wete fyue loaues two fish greate plentye teache v way shoulde niggardlye charitie vnto poore myracle muche teacheth howe behoueth hym whiche hath taken vpon hym charge feede flocke christe largely bestowe oute ryche treasourye holy scripture whatsoeuer apperteineth enstructe counsayle coumforte encourage theym nedeth suche foode moreouer whiche eaten enough full ignoraunt howe fyrst founde fyue barleye loaues two fish hadde alreadye seene manye baskettes full broken meate remayne begonne highlye reporte iesus saying truelye thatsame prophete whiche hath long tyme looked cumme worlde euen nature common people dooe sooner feele benefite bely mind seen greater myracles yet neuer g ue hym hye prayse plentye meate could cause speake thus iesus therefore perceiued would cum take vp make departed mountaine alone euen cum disciple wente downe vnto sea gat vp ship came ouer sea vnto capernaum darke iesus cum presente yet ignoraunte grosse lookyng messias shoulde cum get hymselfe worldelye kyngdome dyd consulte among theimselfes take iesus make hym kyng well assuryng theimselfes thereof case myghte haue suche kyng haue plentye thynges vittayles inough rich libertye worldly commodity aboundantly iesus whiche couet maner kyngdome came teache v contemne rich pleasure worldely glorye knowyng right well entended wente aboute dydde nowe agayne secretelye conuey hymselfe hyll whence came downe people theym called hym kyngdome withdrewe hymselfe priuelye alone manne coulde perceiue goyng awaye owne free meteth theym pulleth hym crosse therein geuyng playne exaumple shoulde hereafter deputy neuer preache ghospell purelye loueth worldelye kyngdome pompe whiche thynges spirituall shepeherdes ought litle seeke behoueth refuse thynges though freelye geuen kyngdome worlde agreeth kyngdome heauen v rilye darkenesse light accordeth disciple long looked theyr maister hyll euenyng nowe hande leste darke nyght cum vpon beeyng deserte wente doune lake rowe ouer vnto citie capernaum iesus litle place repose hymselfe well hopyng eyther summe shyppe mete wer sailyng ouer lake leaste shoulde fynde hym citie darke already prepared theyr passage ouer neyther dyd iesus meane cumme disciple beyng long much looked knowing wel enough howe much agreued absence iesus mynde absence make disciple desyrous hym therewyth also teache great daungier great darkenes worldely trouble hangeth ouer v often disseuered iesus meane whyle matter prepared greater miracle pand sea arose great wind blew rowen xxv xxx furlonges sawe iesus walkyng sea drawyng nighe vnto shippe wer afraied saieth vnto afrayed would haue receiued shippe immediately shippe lande whither went lake great called sea nyght made terrible make moe way daungerous one hadde windes outragious agaynste theim lake exceadyng rough withall yet neuerthelesse disciple desirous theyr mayster dydde aduenture rowe vpon water nowe therefore farre lande hadde rowed vpon fyue twenty thyrtie furlonges almoste despaire theyr liues oure lorde iesus cumme nighe vnto theym vnlooked notwithstandyng darkenesse se hym goyng foote vpon sea thoughe troden vpon harde grounde declare hymselfe thereby lorde onely yearth elementes also trueth charitie ghospell hath iyes see uen darke neyther anye nyght iesus presente anye deadly tempeste whereas nygh maketh thinges clere caulme nowe lord cum nighe vnto shyppe disciple sodaynly aferde could well see perfectly di cerne darke nowe suspect thyng vision nyght ghoste suche lyke vulgar people beleue many bee seen theym sayle nyght neuerthelesse put theym feare speakyng vnto theym owne propre voyce whiche knewe well accustomed therewith iesus sayd vnto bee afraied signyfiyng thereby haue assistence lorde iesus oughte bee afrayed worldly trouble bee neuer great necse truelye whiche simplicitie plainnes heart constatly faythfullye depende vpon hym hath hym presente euen worldes ende disciple boldened voyce theyr maister desirous take hym shyppe euen verily sumwhat afrayed whose truste hope yet bothe weake vnconstant thintent lord iesus myght declare disciple whole thing yt doen wrought diuine power storme swaged ceassed casualtye shippe incontinentelye tossed hyther thyther ferre shore sodainly ariue lande whereunto entended goe disciple whose faythe framed confirmed wayes could possible proues token dydde diligentelye imprinte theyr myndes myracle base folowing people whiche stoode side sea sawe ship saue one wherin disciple wer entred iesus went disciple ship disciple wer gon awaie alone howebeit came ship tiberias vnto place eat bread lord geuen thankes people sawe iesus neyther disciple also tooke shipping came capernaum seeking iesus dede people altogether ignoraunt straunge thing myracle nexte daie thynges dooen multitude whiche remayned styll syde water sawe none shyppe saue one wherein disciple went ouer sawe shootyng shore well assured iesus wente disciple shippe went awaye alone people saye meruailed place hadde secretelye withdrawen hymself muche withstandyng multitude fed day dyd muche desire long hym yet mornyng dydde appeare yet supposyng woulde long absente disciple whiche alreadye gon ouer euen folkes also determynyng rowe ouer water proue yf could fynd hym side presente tyme certayne shyppes cum capernaum tyberias c tie also standyng sea syde igh vnto place fedde eaten fil v barly loaues wherewith beyng satisfied gaue thankes god whiche sente people suche prophete therefore shyps readinesse carrye ouer people iesus muche soughte coulde bee founde people tooke shippyng eke iesus restyng place also knewe apostle sailed ouer thyther found side sea thei said vnto rabbi camest thou hither iesus answered saide uerelye verely saie vnto ye seke ye sawe myracles ye eat loaues wer filled labour meate perysheth whiche endureth vnto euerlasting life whiche meate sonne man shall geue vnto hath god father sealed founde iesus sawe passed ouer lake knowyng righte well shippe conueigh ouer muche meruailyng meanes coulde passe ouer water asked saiyng maister cameste thou hyther desiring gather time howe hadde passed ouer supposed euen thing also bee doen myracle lyke day past fedde vey great multitude feruencie whiche daye whereby daye went force kingdome euen agaynste well cooled leste iesus seme auaunte owne power maketh aunswere thynges intente shoulde mo e crediblye enfourmed myracle disciple also euidente thereof iesus dyd sore rebuke earnestely reproue affeccion multitude onely vnconstaunte also rude grosse farre vnmete doctryne ghospell albeit hadde seene greatter myracles whiche dyd proue diuyne power yet neuerthelesse one plenteous diner dyd stirre desire eternal saluacion sette bodily susteinaunce wherewith thyng time releued whiche within whyle shall perishe dydde hungre meate without whiche soule euerlastingly perishe finally didde correcte grosse iudgemente whereby thought woorke miracle intente deserue therewith rashe people hand worldly kyngdome whereas christe veraye deede accordyng tyme required didde shewe sum prou e diuine power certaine miracle none cause surelye throughe sensyble bodilye thinges myghte cause credit bee geuen vnto doctrine whiche promysed thynges cannot bee perceiued bodilye sens waie also bring vp yet rude weake certaine degree capacitie hye thynges like trustie maister would wishe coulde scholer shoulde foorthwith take vnderstande whole science yet time fourmeth fashioneth rude vnframed wytte wyth certayne pryncyples vntyll haue broughte hym vp perfecte knowlege facultie shal neede none introduccions though teacher dooe teache veraye letter fyrste rule without werines yet doth beare tediousnesse weare awaye hope profityng scholer labouryng wayes get soone course principle therefore iesus declare also godhead knewe theyr thoughtes sawe people hadde nowe agayne recourse vnto hym desire suche myracles whiche shoulde rather fyll bellye instructe mynde tooke occasion meate hadde geuen teache theym foode ought haue moste desired effecte saiyng uerely thing true saieth whiche wyll tell ye calle maister ye bee muche desirous doctryne whiche spirituall ye seeke worldelye pleasure small commodity whiche estemed thynges whiche dooe farre excelle presente ye dooe seeke great affeccion yet wisse muche see myracles whiche ought dede allure mynde celestiall thynges yesterdayes dooeth prouoke ye bee enamoured goddely power ye coumpte great matter manne fede bodye without charge small matter feede bodie otherwyse muste needes decaye bee destroied neyther shal bee desirous doctrine ghospell lacke meate therfore turne youre care gette foode whiche taken dooeth perishe disgestion dooeth prolong lyfe bodye shorte tyme common materiall susteinaunce dooeth yet within hungre cummeth againe gette suche foode saye tarrieth styll man noryshing soule spirituall foodelabour ye meate perisheth geueth eternall lyfe thereunto sonne man wil geue excellent bread perceiue doe long hungre certainly god willyng geue eternall lyfe mankynde dydde speciallye appoynt sonne manne geuyng vnto hym power myracles bringing greate estimacion shoulde geue spirituall foode desyre eternall life also purpose gaue vnto thesame power auctoritie myracles brought hym great estimacion iesus came worlde get vnto himselfe worldelye honour make menne blessed worldly commodity came rather aboute buisinesse lift vp men vyle filthy care care studye heauenly thynges pthen said vnto shal might worke worke god iesus answered said vnto worke god ye beleue hath sent said therfore vnto signe shewest thou maie see beleue thee doest thou worke father eat manna deserte written gaue bread heauen eate rude ignoraunt people minding altogether belly vnderstoode thynges considered theim aunswered iesus wise muche thou councelleste v woorke certaine meate shoulde still remayne v bring euerlastyng life shall doe therefore maie woorke thynges mete god maie deserue eternall lyfe whiche cause saye sent worlde iesus beeyng nothyng offended grosse aunswere procedeth li le litle call fondnesse perfite thynges ye aske saieth woorke whereby ye maie deserue haue god whiche spirite pleased spirituall thyngesthis worke god ye beleue ye shall vnderstande sacrifisyng beastes keepyng sabboth daye outwarde washynges choyse meates relygion garmentes thynges whiche dooeth consiste corporall ceremony woorke whiche god requireth beleue sonne whome hath sent whome speaketh vnto leste shoulde seme graunt euerlasting life vnthankeful persones rather vnworthy suche benefite people whiche chalenged wondrefull religion throughe obseruyng moses lawe made nowe aunswere vnto thynges onely grosly also vnkyndelye wickedlye saye take vpon speciall auctoritie aboue elder whose auctoritie haue hitherto folowedwhat signe shewest shewe sum profe lesson thine auctoritie geuen ther god vpon syght therof maye beleue thy woordes thy deedes reason without sum woonderous signe beleue whiche wordes takest arrogantly vpon auctoritie neyther woulde rashelye haue geuen credence vnto forefather throughe token whiche came heauen dydde certifye v theyr goddelye authoritie auncetours dydde eate manna wildernesse vnder moses theyr guyde truethe breade god heauenly foode whiche dydde putrifie writen psalme gaue celestiall breade eate therefore reason woondrefull thyng people beyng moued obeyed moses case thou canste doe lyke el summe greatter thyng wyll also beleue yet dyd grosse vnkynde wicked aunswer people make gentlenes iesus weary alluryng knowledge spirituall thynges fyrste require sum straunge token thoughe neuer seene anye myracle neyther contente euerye kynde myracle men woulde gooe hym thynges prescribe hym kynde myracle would haue hym doe conclude amongest many wonderful doinges red doen vnto old auncient iewes picke chiefly apperteineth fedyng muche care theyr bellie pthen iesus said vnto verely verely saye vnto moses gaue bread heauen father geueth true bread heauen breade god whiche cummeth heauen geueth life vnto world therfore iesus wer dissembleyng ignoraunce people thus little litle bringeth theim perceiuyng spirituall thinges saiyng moses auctoritie bee therefore weightie regarded among gaue manna heauen ye honour heauenlye foode came doun heauen god moste thanked herein whome manna dyd flow glorie praise al myracles due neyther moses could thyng nothyng el god ministre neyther bread heauely breade deede although dauid wrote psalmes cal bread heaue came heaue rained doune ayer lyke byrdes liuyng ayer called byrdes heauen truely manna onely figure heauenlye bread euen god gaue corporall breade carnall people moses serued world father heauenly sonne geueth vnto spiritual people bread whiche
