vndoubtedly came heauen doeth onely fill saciate bodyes time geueth immortalitie soule receiue materiall breade gaue lyfe onely bodye tyme great benefite euer yet profit people one nacion alone bread speake neyther corporall neyther dyd distyll ayer procede euen god hymselfe suche efficacie geueth lyfe bodyes soules one sorte people alone ye whole world touchyng autour thereof case ye passe muche therupon well stede moses whome ye muche glorye ye haue god auctour gyfte seruaunte god ye haue goddes owne sonne yf ye regarde gift great diuersitie betwene betwene bodye soule betwene life shal shortly ease euerlastyng lyfe heauen pthen said thei vnto lord euermore geue v bread iesus said vnto breade life cumeth shal hungre beleueth shall neuer thyrst said vnto ye also haue sene yet ye beleued whan iewes heard thynges yet wer lifte vp loue celestiall thynges styll dreamyng vpon matte touchyng belly sayde vnto iesus syr geue v alwaye breade loued sacietie meate better healthe soughte rather plentifull geuer meate drynke sauiour therefore take dreame corporall foode iesus expresseth plainelye vnto theym speake bread chewed teeth whiche beeyng conueied throughe throte stomake swageth bodilye hungre season heauenly bread whiche woord god therefore saith bread geuer eternall life hungrely lusteth breade cumme suffre haue passage bowelles soule fayth shall feele grief hungre shall cum hym bee fullye satisfiedi bread life shall tarrye stil abide hym hath receyued vnto eternall lyfe woorde hath fountaine spirituall water whereof soule drynketh fayth bodye therfore beleueth shall onely without hungre also without thirst eternally bread receiued gapyng mouthe beliefe soule therfore haue spoken thynges vnto let knowe thoroughe owne faulte ye shall perishe case ye dooe persiste continue infidelitie father denieth breade man men hath fyrste offered notwithstandyng ye care bread shal vtterly cum naught ye haue sene greatter thynges yf feede manna promyse vnto thinges greatter felicitie al ye beleue pall father geueth shall cum cummeth cast away came doune heauen hath sent father whiche hath sent hath geuen shall loose nothing raise vp againe last day wil sent euery one seeth sonne beleueth haue euerlasting life wil rayse vp last day albeit ye vnbeliefe loeth breade yet father hath sent worlde without cause shall bee sum folke breade shall bryng euerlastyng lyfe althoughe whole nacion iewes shall reiecte god sonne therefore euen wicked towardes god contemne said sonne whome father hathe sent saue whole worlde father god onely iewes also al gentyles haue nothyng dede myselfe yet whatsoeuer father hath geuen kynde people euer bee thesame shall cum fayth although hath nothyng dooe wyth moses law whosoeuer wyll cumme hym reiecte yea woulde god folke woulde cum vnto father muche lyeth hym men shoulde bee saued fayth muche wyll myne one ende therfore descended heauen doe wyll disagreyng father dooe father wyl whiche sente whose wyll myne cannot dissente truely father wyll sente thisfor cum downe heaue thyng euer hath faith geuen vnto deale thereof dooe pe ishe beeyng preseruer thesame leste worlde shoulde violently drawe vnto death thyng whiche father hath ordeined liue furthermore although bodye dye course man nature yet eth soule whiche better parte man remain still aliue thintente also whole man shoulde like throughe father wyl eth thys thyng toothis wil set last day shal restore dead body also lyfe father wyll sente euen soonne geue ternall lyfe vnto men moses lawe faythe ghospell father dooeth nothyng sonne therfore dooeth acknowlage soonne dooeth acknowlage father whoso resisteth sonne also resisteth father father inuisible yet seen sonne therfore whoso seeth sonne acknoweledgeth hym beleueth woordes saide soonne suffre hym perishe althoughe bee deade bodye wyll rayse hym agayne laste daye accordyng father wylle maye liue wholly bodie soule presence soonne whome gaue credite vnto father hath geuen power vnto soonne maye restore euen dead vnto life iewes murmured hym said bread life came downe heauen said iesus sonne iosephe whose father mother news saieth came hea iesus aunswered saied vnto murmure among youre selfes man cumme excepte father whiche sente drawe hym wil rayse hym vp laste daie iesus spoken thinges people whiche hytherto thorough hope meate coulde metely wel away communicacion seyng sawe hope bodilye sustenaunce taken awaye fell quarellyng hym maligne also whome beeing sufficed eatyng woulde haue made king doe contemne vyle persone laie arrogancie charge openlye yet murmuring emong theimselues chieflye saiyng whiche others oughte embrace e liuelye breade whiche descended heauen moste coueted gaped bodilye foode saiyng thoughte theimselues deluded mocked dede thyng farre excellent offred loked certes infirmitie man ed offended theim whiche onely loo vpon bodily iyes myght bothe dooynges sayinges haue seene power god hym yf iyes faythe man saye ioseph carpenter sonne whose father mother knowe well enough sight poore folkes meane estate furthermore shame say came doun heauen late time borne earth emongest v man men bee meaneth tellyng v father whyles wer talkyng secretly one thynges iesus declaring forthwith me thoughtes wer hid fro knowlage make plain also confirme spoke saiyng cause ye shoulde murmure among selfes thynges haue spoken vnto infidelitie cause woordes sticke myndes ye se se heare heare whyles ye present yet ye absent trueth whosoeuer cumeth shal obteine eternall life fayth muste men cum faithe cummeth auentures hadde inspiracion god father like draweth vnto men myndes sonne breathyng fayth secretly men soules draweth sonne suche wyse operacion ioyntly together men cum father doth geue great gift willing desirouse haue truely whoso doeth redy godly diligence deserue bee drawen father shall obteine euerlastyng life tolde shall call lyfe euen dead ye day shall cum wherin felicitie godly destruccion wicked shalbe finished fully concluded beleueth receiueth excellent greate thyng ought thanke father without beleue yet al meane season doe beleue excuse theyr faute saying drawen father muche lieth hym coueteth drawe men drawen faute himselfe wythdraweth hymselfe el would drawe hym pit written prophetes shalbe al taught god euery man therefore hath heard hath learned father cummeth vnto man hath seen father saue whiche god hath seen father uerilye verilye saie vnto putteth truste hath euerlasting life thynges thys worlde learned mannes endeuour studye celestiall philosophye vnderstande vnles secrete inspiracion father make mannes hatte apte bee taught undoubtedlye thys whiche prophetes long ago dyd saye shoulde thus propheciyng hadand shall bee al taughte god shall al taught god lustes world maketh many one vntowardes taughte whiche worldelye desyres whyles euen droune men earthlye thynges suffre theym lifte vp theyr myndes heauenlye thynges gyfte goddes endeuour man heareth wordes bodily eares vayne excepte heare secrete voyce father whiche must inspire mynde insensyble grace faythe therefore whosoeuer fashyon theymselfes bee apte receiue inspiracion father dooeth thus drawe theym onely drawen cummeth finally god spirite neyther hearde seen bee spirituall haue seene haue hearde hym saluacion many shall see heare sonne theyr peryl daunger notwithstandyng ye glorye god seene heard moses prophetes neuer mortall manne sawe hard god nature substaunce thing geuen sonne god alone whiche onely came god euermore came worlde therfore put clearely myndes vyle care corporall lyfe labouryng al ye earnest desyre thynges spiritually good ye may attaine life euerlastyng would ye forget bread wherewith bodie satisfyed ye desirous heauenly bread whiche geueth eternall lyfe bread receiued fayth fayth obteyned god father ye well assured thereof whosoeuer hath affiaunce thesame hathe already eternall lyfe muche hath fountaine immortalitie pi bread life father eate manna wildernes dead breade whiche cummeth heauen man maie eate therof die liuing bread whiche came downe heauen manne eate breade shall liue euer breade geue fleshe whiche geue life world bread whiche geueth bodily transitorye life lyfe soule eternall lyfe althoughe ye haue presente yet neuerthelesse ye desyre manna woondrefull thyng albeit manna whiche youre auncestours didde eate feede vpon certaine tyme wildernesse didde cum heauen suppose yet dyd theim ferther pleasure wheaten barlye breade woulde haue dooen putte awaye whyle hunger bodye whiche shortelye woulde returne agayne require meate coulde geue immortalitie though forefather neuer happye yet dyd manye dye dyd feede manna breade whiche speake descended heauen veraye deedei liuing bread hath receiued god celestiall strengthe make hym eateth liue bodye soule euerlastynglye neuer bee subiecte vnto deathe ye neede therefore aske importunately manna heauen ye haue heauenly breade presente ready prepared whiche geueth eternall lyfe case ye wyll receiue fayth selfe bread grauter immortall lyfe alone came heauen whome beeyng offended infirmitie bodye take thynke nothyng el sonne ioseph marye truely woorde god father whiche whoso beleueth shall haue immortall lyfe man wyll conueye digeste heauenlye bread inwarde partes soule shal bee quickened growe eternall lyfe yf beyng carnall yet vnderstande spirituall thynges wyll shew plain grosser matter thyng apperteinyng vnto fleshe euen thys fleshe whiche see loke vpon whiche shall bestowe geue vnto deathe redeme lyfe whole worlde liuyng breade beleue eate lyue thys sayyng lord iesus sumwhat obscure sorte open vnto misterie godhed whereby alwaye god father death also whiche deliuer sauethe worlde tyrannye deathe finallye insinuate herein vnto priuitie hys mysticall bodye whereof membre fayth annexed therevnto styll cleaue sticke fast vnto branche dooeth cleaue vnto vyne shall haue life hym iesus knewe well enough tyme iewes dyd vnderstande saiynges yet assured tyme cum cum passe howe sedes ye would say norishmentes misteryes beeyng shutte closed vp within myndes good men growe vp bryng forth plenteouse fruite iewes therfore stroue among theimselfes saiyng howe felow geue v flesh eat y said vnto v raily veraily saie vnto except ye eat fleshe sonne man drinke bloud ye haue life whosoeuer eateth flesh drinketh bloude hath eternall life raise vp last daie fleshe meate dede bloude drinke dede eateth fleshe drinketh bloude dwelleth hym therfore whe thynges semed incouenient folish spokeoke durst talke homely familiarly ye lord arose great discorde opinion amog diuerse diuersly interpretyng thyng yt spoken euen nicodemus vnderstode iesus spake newe heauenlye birth woman samaria knewe iesus ment darke speakyng water flowe euerlastyng life rude grosse people coteded could brought passe geue hys flesh eaten suche sorte suffyse al men perpetual lyfe dyd bid inuited eate heauenly bread sayd moreouer flesh bread shall say eate flesh liuyng mane iesus beeyng ignoraunte matter contended dyd declare vnto way meanes flesh might eaten steade breade confirmeth ye thyng nedeful necessarie thyng iudged vayne thing plaine absurditie could doen take veray suertye saieth excepte ye receiue whole saye vnlesse ye eate flesh sonne man steade breade place wyne drinke bloud ye shall haue life contrarye syde whosoeuer eateth flesh drinketh bloud hath eating drinking therof eternal life neyther shall soule alone liue blessed happy reason meat drinke also resurreccion bodye whole man bothe bodye soule shall haue fruicion euerlastyng lyfeexcepte ye eat ye flesh sonne manne like man naturall meate beeyng conueyed downe stomake bee digested conueyed thence throughout membres bodye turnethe substaunce bodye meate man eateth al one lyke maner othersyde hath eaten shal spirituallye transformed turned furthermore forsomuche chefe auctour resurreccion wyl suffre membres bee disseueted pulled awaye whosoeuer surelye ioyned thys meate drinke shall rayse hym vp agayne last day whole man hauyng bothe bodye soule beleued whole man also maye liue euerlastynglye bodelye meate woorketh effecte neyther yet manna wherein ye reioyce eatyng bodye drinkyng bloude bringeth thyng passe therefore flesh truelye meate whyche geueth immortalitie bloude truely drynke doeth procure eternal life ye body ye whole man bodye soule lyfe bodye whiche nourished dayly sustenaunce lest shoulde perishe tyme common membres body reason indiuisible felowshippe partes bodye hathe togetherwardes muche though membres bodye diuerse sundrye yet one bodye one soule geueth lyfe euerye parte bodye eateth fleshe drynketh bloude suche sorte coupled ioyned neither seperate hym hym spirite wyll geue lyfe hym membre bodye braunche vyne suche participacion cannot bee dissolued pa liuing father hath sente true father euen eateth shal liue meanes bread came downe heauen father eate manna dead eateth breade shall liue euer thinges sayed sinagogue taught capernaum many therefore disciple heard sayd hard saiyng abide hearing father sent principall fountaine al life whosoeuer ioyned hym made partaker life therefore father geueth life also power geue life vnto euen likewyse eateth annexed reason misticall eatyng drinkyng made one doe geue lyfe endure shorte tyme eternall life thyng soeuer earthly nature thesame dooeth continue time small efficacie manna whiche stylled downe heauen beyng vnder moses tuicion conductyng foode pertainyng bodye coulde geue eternall lyfe elder whereas men eat therof neuertheles dyed neyther one great numbre remain vndead yea part died also soule prouoked god manye way wrath certes bread vndoubtedly came downe heauen hath celestiall vertue geueth eternall lyfe eater thereof lorde iesus instruct ignorant grosse multitude wordesthis bread whiche came heauen c desirous stirre vp loue vysible corporal thynges loue desire heauenly eternall thynges spake woordes sinagogue amogest great assembly people exercising office teacher howebeit grosse people farre capacitye heauenlye mystiries great sorte disciple also beyng offeded herewith wer fall theyr maister murmuryng amongest themselfes whisperyng saiyng harde cruell saiyng saye concernyng eatyng lyuyng mannes fleshe drinkyng bloude whose eares abyde heare doctryne iesus knew disciple murmured said vnto doeth offend ye shal se sonne asced vp thither spirit quickeneth flesh rosueth nothing wordes speake vnto spirit life sum beleue iesus knew fro beginning thei wer beleued betraie said therefore said vnto man cum vnto excepte wer geue vnto father iesus vnderstandyng murmured secretly among themselfes labored remedie thing offeded geuing knowledge beforehand vnto shoulde see greater thinges iyes heard hym tyme speake hymselfe shewed wordes whiche spoken touchyng eatyng fleshe drinke blood incoueniet thing abhorred right pleasaunt graciouse fruitfull saying case taken vnderstande course grosse intelligence spirituall sence nowe therfore turned towardes disciple behoued haue consydered haue wyser base sorte people reason acquaintance familiaritie whiche iesus also myracles seen hym worke iesus say loking vpon disciple rebuked theyr dulnes wyse saying doeth offend eares heare saye breade came heauen geue lyfe worlde whether greater difficultie grosse vnderstandyng mannes wit haue descended heauen ascend vp heauen yf hereafter ye see sonne man ye nowe see haue natural body man ascende heauen came downe thence mortal bodye doen graunted reason sens ye shoulde bee alwaye carnall vnderstand thinges fleshly ye shoulde leaue fleshe go forwarde spirite spirit descended heauen incarnate fleshe beeyng made spirituall shalbe carryed awaye vp heauen leste ye waye loue fleshe carnall yet beeing first instructed flesh ye ought profit go forward toward heauenly thinges flesh alone himselfe profiteth nothing spirite geueth life bodily substance men spirit lacke euen woord carnally vnderstandwhat yf ye shall see sone man c shall geue life vnles ye take heauenly thing vnderstad spiritually fleshe blood meane doctrine tearme whiche doctrine yf ye true faith receiue desyrously effectuously conueigh bowel minde retaine quicken make mindes liuely cause al one ye shal spirite liue euerlastingly like membres one bodye lyueth one common spirite long adhere cleaue fast together shall leaue vnto fleshe blood hid secret mystery mistical token copulacion felowship selfe thing although ye receiue yet profit vnles ye receyue spiritually therfore repugne refuse saying though still carnal ye rightly vnderstande take ought taken rather labour true vnderstanding therof woordes haue spoken vnto carnall interpretate spirite lyfe whye uerely beeing spiritually vnderstand conferre geue lyfe soule receiueth woordes rightly truely eateth fleshe drinketh blood coupled gayneth thereby euerlasting lyfe willingly refuseth continueth death thorough synnes former lyfe doubleth owne damnacion eternall death reason infidelitie refuse bread offered beleue woordes knowe thinges spoken al vaine sum folkes right wel assured sum among dooeth credite woordes therefore reiectyng life offered cause owne vtter destruccion cause lorde iesus spake thynges ignorant nothyng yet knewe well ynough euer spake woordes whiche disciple woulde geue faith vnto hym moreouer coulde tell also euen amongest twelue apostle surnamed honour sake whome hee dyd also choose specially bee aboute hymselfe sure frendes knewe say one theim whiche woulde betraye hym iewes shoulde put hym death therefore note whiche though dyd heare one woorde saying reste though also one twelue eate thesame bread drinke cup felowes shoulde eate drinke yet shoulde obtaine lyfe thereby tooke receiued heauenlye bread spirituallye carnally iesus added sayde cause tolde litle man coulde cum vnto excepte geuen heauen father haue heard voyce nothing haue seen felte body nothyng except father heauen haue geuen withall iyes fayth whiche loked vpon beholder health vnles shall geue therwith heauenly eares mynde whiche heard fruitefully hearer commoditie tyme many disciple went backe forsooke hym walked hym sayed iesus twelue wyll ye also go awaye symon peter answered hym lorde shall goe thou hast woordes eternall lyfe beleue sure thou arte christe soonne lyuing god iesus answered haue chosen twelue one deuill spake iudas iscarioth sonne simon betraye hym beeyng one twelue wordes iesus beyng full doctrine saluacion dyd descende doune theyr myndes whose mindes occupied earthly desyres couetousnesse also vnderstood heauely thinges besides grosse carnall religion vsed moses lawe therefore iesus communicacion among parte onely common people also owne disciple fell awaye theyr maister thereby made wurse whereby myght haue muche better case taken thinges well receiued hym accordynglye muche forsooke hym withdrewe themselfes cumpany eating drinking hym men facte woulde condemne doctrine iesus shewe euen maner way preacher ghospel behaue themselfes doeth neyther make humble vile suite haue tarie styll hym leste shoulde seme dooe thing wounte dooe shew himselfe stande nede cumpany neyther doeth speake reproche theyr goyng awaye leste therein myght haue thought haue sought owne prayse glory theyr saluacion yet doeth vtterly put away hym myght perchaunce afterwarde haue better aduised declare owne faute offended without occasion geuen went awaye yt saying shoulde altogether lacke fruite although sum made themselfes infidelitie vnworthie heauenly gifte iesus saye vpon skylles tourning towardes twelue apostle admitted taken vnto hym speciall witness bruters abrode thinges wroughte get theim open confession theyr belefe neyther retaineth flatterye thoughe gonne owne buisinesse rather theyrs neither much feare theym threatening chiding leste shoulde seeme folowe iesus rather compelled owne consent perswaded man compelled vnto fayth ghospell iesus leauer men openly forsake haue disciple colourably aud fayuedly therfore while departing iesus saieth twelue ye also goe away ye maye tarye styl ye lust vnlesse ye thinke commoditie departe uerely doe desyre might euery man lucke haue heauenly gyft neither geuen theim refuse itwill ye also go away c dooe deserue manne attaine cum excepte desirouse yet gift father man doeth couet earnestly desyre nowe doeth simon peter man alway plaine ardent faith towardes iesus representyng person whole churche name also maketh aunswer cherefully great courage saying lorde god forbyd forsake considering muche desyrous eternal saluacionthou hast woordes eternal life c also knowe right wel bare vnpleasaunt colde vnprofitable thinges phariseis teache seing also haue hearde iohn testifying whither el man go thee thou alone speakest woordes bring euerlasting lyfe thou receyuest euery one cum shalt driue v thou hast admitted thy seruice neyther desyre chaunge lorde maister shoulde change wourse new maister soeuer shall choose trusting vpon thy woordes beleue thee also wee knowe dedes thou doest haue certainlye foude tried therby thou arte verie christe anointed sonne godwe sure thou arte christ c onlye men ought hope eternall health saluacion iesus neither shew himselfe muche wounder stoute saying peter wherby peter hielye reporte christe lest seme take pleasure men praisyng vtterly refuse lest shoulde haue denied truth exhortyng men perseuer faithfull confession peter made name sumwhat disclose one fewe shoulde bee suche one shoulde go hym disciple doen also couenaunt aduersaries betraye euen deathe pleasure sygnifye thing couertly would bewray iudas lest man shoulde thinke iudas beyng suche rebuke prouoked worthely reuenge hymselfe vpon maister iesus minde also cause euery man saying beware leste theyr owne faulte fal wicked dede sayeth cause ye meruaill already sum disciple gone awaye haue chosen moste excellent amongst yet one small numbre specially chosen diuell shal accuse betraie whose bodie hath eathen whose bloud hath dronke carnally spiritually hath hearde also preache seen doe miracle therfore shrinke thing haue begonne haue doen ye haue seen go awaye perseuer waxe alwaye better better vntill ye maye wurthelye cum suche spiritually eate foode heauenly doctrine beyng thereby conuerted ye shall obtaine euerlasting lyfe vij chapter pafter thinges iesus went galile would goe iewry iewes sought kill hym iewes feast tabernacle hande brother therfore sayed vnto hym get hence goe iewry thy disciple also maye se thy workes thou doest man doeth thing secret hymselfe seketh knowen openly thou suche thinges shewe thy selfe worlde brother beleued lorde iesus went muche couersaut galile forsomuch reason wordes whiche implie certayne heauenly thynges thynges greater importaunce man reason coulde reache also miracle wrought gat self muche enuie amogst disciple contepte knowen vnto beyng house among verely basenes house parentes came made hatred bitter vengeable againste hym could lyue iewry suretie lyfe ye iewes good sought wayes kyll yet iesus went iewrie fear death power slyde awaye middest theyr wilie traines ofte list shewing himselfe man layed disciple image portrature thinges shoulde folow chaunce maliciouse infidelitie iewes copelled go gentile iewes feastful hye solemne day emong grekes called scenopegia englishe feast tabernacle hande feast name scenopegiam call remembraunce olde patriarch wayes whiche led theyr lyfe pauilions tentes many time remouyng place place euen tyme declaring figure maner lyfe ought professe doctrine gospel great mayn companye folkes came holy tyme hye feast syriahis brother therfore sayed vnto hym countreis whiche border therupon thicke threfold vnto hierusalem solemnitie temple holynes religion wherof reuerence euen among heathen people iesus kynsfolkes ignorant subiect yet worldly desyres affeccions hauing affiaunce title theyr kinred boldly mete exhorte hym ben desyrous fame glory yet toke hym timorouse lesse audacitie behoued hym cause moue thought himselfe well inough ayded durst trust therto would lurke hide himselfe amongst alien galile woulde woorke perfourme hierusalem full syght euen middest people resorted thither thinges whiche hiely spoken hymselfe great day solemne feast saye hande leaue galile therfore whereas thou hast long tyme kept thy selfe close go iurie florishing part whole kingdom bring thyselfe hierusalem chiefe citiethere man doeth thyng secrete c head place iewish nacion thou maiest get many disciple looke vpon thy doynges man would extemed doeth thinges priuely corner wherby maye get name amongst men thou cum heauen dede canst great thinges thou sayest thou canst thou mayst knowen world let meruail carnal presumptuouse vngodly saying lorde iesus kinsfolkes trueth time nye kinsman therfore called brother knit straight familiaritiefor brethre beleued hym beleue sum afterward numbre apostle constantely setfurth christes glory theyr preachinges pthen iesus sayd vnto tyme yet cum tyme alwaye readie worlde cannot hate hateth testifie woorkes therof euill go ye vp vnto feast go vp yet vnto feast tyme yet full cum whan sayd woordes vnto avode styll galile soone brother cum went also vp vnto feast openly priuely sought hym iewes feaste sayd muche murmuring hym among people sum sayed good sayed nay deceiueth people howbeit man spake openly fear iewes iesus therfore according singular modestie gentilnes blame boldnesse familiar frendes easely greate softnesse signifying carnal kinred hath inrresse concerning saluacion mankinde suche businesse heauenly moderate thauctoritie father heauen declared also neyther feared death ready willingly suffer saluacion mankind desired glorie world hatred wherof prouoke towardes himselfe speaking trueth thiges cotrary men worldly affeccionsmy time yet cum c consideracion hereof iesus sayed tyme yet cum whan shall exhorte shall nede aduertisementes dependeth father heauens determinacion man deuise whan behoueth knowen world came father pleasure arbitremente haue tyme tyme whiche beyng led worldly affeccions seketh glorye world woulde haue according iudgement worlde glory alway readythe worlde cannot hate ye may safely go whither ye list world loueth men coformable therunto seke glorye worldes hande affeccion loue ye hunte seke father glory go saluacion man vnlike far kynde f attery get glory prayse world rather bring hatred world vpo dissentinge lustes carnall pleasure therof testifying openly yt woorkes euel withstanding world selfe putteth forged godlynesse false felicitie workes carnall worldly iewes haue theyr feastfull dayes whiche late time god abhorreth offre vnthankfull sacrifice odiouse god seying meane tyme haue handes bloudie self day would thought pure holye go death innocentes one true feastfull daye must celebrate spiritually wherewith father pleased delited day yet cu shal cu shal willingly go mete yet stil carnal worldly wise get vp solene feast intend go greate feast handei go vp feast c time yet fullye accomplished woordes lorde iesus sent awaye hym natural kynsmen alwaye wont set asyde regarde affeccion towardes theim often vusynes gospel gone hand withall whiche matter woulde shoulde wholly ascribed father wil arbitremet would suffre polluted wt worldly thing thus restraine stint autoritie mother mariage euil apaied maner thought scorne disdayned called mother kynsfolkes talking gospel made abode nye frendes capernau left set hande preache furthermore hanging vpon crosse called mother woman though knowen mother ye businesse yea also beyng child xii yeres old semed disdayne theyr autoritie shoulde called father affaire therfore supposyng feare iewes iesus woulde cum hye solemne feast wet thither alone going vp hierusalem iesus taried still galile tempering al doinges moderacion duelye bestowing somtime proued verye man lest shoulde haue semed man sum time shewed great likelihood godlye power lest men beleue man brother departed gon towardes feast go matter plain muche refrain going ye solemne meting feare iewes eschewe coumpany kinsman yet carnall would haue associate wt hym gospel cause haue anye medlyng therwith came hierusalem auaunt stelth priuely man would say cause earnestlye loke cumyng time cum abrode declare himselfe brode worlde fruite knewe phariseis mindes great conuenticles secrete counsel fynde sum occasion vpon holy daye attache apprehende therfore trueth cum hierusalem yet went abrode common resorte assemblie people wont doe iewes marked layed spyal whether went keping holy day forasmuche desyred se enquired one euen nowe alredy many sundry tale went amonge people absent men one opinion lyke affected towardes iesus suretie manye homely sort people whiche present miracle workyng heard preache also experience gentlenes cumpany said iesus good man one mete euil entreated cruelly hadled cotrarye side priestes phariseis prayse renoume iesus vexed great denyed good man lyke sedicious felowe allure people hym turne hauing priestes scribe phariseis reuerece uerely sayinges secrete whisperinges sperpled abrode concernyng iesus whereas man durst ye meane opely make good reporte hym howbeit many whiche good opinion hymhowbeit spake penly hym c feared head men iewes whome knewe iesus muche hated semed woordes dedes diminishe theyr auctoritie moreouer touchynge kepinge hym selfe waye mekenes modestie lest thought wittingly willingly haue prouoked malice phariseis soughte nothinge el matter occasion put deathe go abrode doen theyr cause knewe shoulde bee furthered saluacion doctrinefor feare iewes whereas ignoraunt yt phariseis scribe would growe heady fierce saye doe saluacion worlde lorde beynge moste desirous man saluacion coueted yf mighte possible doctrine worke saluacion al men yet muche geuen frowardnes certaine doctrine gospel withdrawen kept good simple people whan half feast done iesus went vp temple taught iewes meruailed saying knoweth scripture seing neuer learned iesus aunswered saied doctrine mine sente man wil obedient shall knowe doctrine whether god whether speake self speaketh himselfe seketh owne prayse seketh prayse sent true vnrighteousnes hym therfore highe solemne feast halfe doen iesus went openly syght men temple taught people pharisaicall ordinaunces ceremony lawe whiche anon cease philosophy wisdom ghospell iewes could picke quarell doctrine yet deuise studie brynge credence diminishe autoritie amoge people meruailinge learned vnlettred dede neuer brought vp pharisaicall doctrine reading profession whereof swelled pride cu sayinges whiche alledged brought holy scripturehow knoweth scripture great wisdom muche purpose maner appeaching one deuill teache hym cu knowledge learning whiche learned man sum magical arte deiuilishe witchecraft iewes therfore consyderacio hereof sayed doeth felowe carpeter carpenter sonne read vnderstad science neuer learned uerely iesus shewe v exauple sobrietie gentle behauiour courteously muche lenitie put awaye confuted sinfull wicked suspicion declaring plainlye yt doctrine came neyther man deuill euen god also wurship whose glorye honor ought duetie fauour yf thei woulde taken true godly men told plainly neyther chalenge himselfe doctrine woondred honour prayse enuie altogether came father heauen whose businesse told furthermore forasmuche taken vpon perfite knowledge lawe god gaue vnto disdainfullie lothe vnlearned ideotes indifferentlye doen case true knowledge scripture shoulde embrace acknowledge doctrine whiche proceded thesame law came vnlesse would make men knowe enuie hatred desyre owne glory loue gain lucre suche lyke inordinate carnall desyres whiche procedeth leude minde blinded iudgement god sayeth contrary himselfe would teache sonne contrary thing gaue lawe therfore iesus knowyng secretes made answer secrete murmuring saying doctrine ye woder whome shoulde haue muche haue learned letter man mine dede bring newe learning differeth god minde lawe whiche geuen god father doctrine hath sent worlde worlde seduced sundry manifolde doctrine men blinded wicked affeccions naughty desyres might knowe father knowen folowe folowyng obtein eternall lyfe trueth beleue sonnes sayinges teacheth speaketh vnto shoulde get thereby euerlasting health cause many lesse minde desyre thing enuie hatred ambition aduauntage euill desyres carnall lustes man would setting asyde malice true meaning plain simple herteif man obedient vnto obey father wil rather lewde vngraciouse affeccions soone recognyse doctrine man newe straunge inuencion deuill becum fro god speake thinges saye mannes reason witte father minde whose ambassadour men studiouse owne glorye goddes preferre newe doctrine owne inuencio doctrine godhe speaketh himselfe seketh owne praise made ye worlde themselues rather taken author man doctrine whole glorye wherof shoulde altogether continually redound themselfes bee publike preacher god doctrine leauer teache thinges might get themselfes prayse aduauntage bring glory honour god saluacion neyghbour seketh owne prayse sent speaketh thinges purely vncorruptely neyther doctrine daunger errour fauty lustes ambicion auarice enuie hatred moses geue lawe yet none kepeth lawe go ye kill people aunswered saied thou haste deuil goeth aboute kill iesus aunswered sayed vnto haue one woorke ye meruail moses therfore gaue vnto circumcision moses father yet ye sabboth day circumcise men man sabboth day receyue circumcision without breakyng lawe moses disdain ye haue made man euery whit wholle sabboth day iudge vttre apperaunce iudge righteous iudgement teache thing god taught lawe man vnderstand meaning lawe nothyng el lawe prescribeth vnto auctoritie moses halowed thing reuerence despise take lawe whiche receiued god hande ye take vpon right vnderstanding keping lawe whereas none doeth truely obserue law wil god gaue lawe yea rather vnder coulour pretence lawe ye go thinges whiche doeth moste deteste punishe ye laye blasphemie vnto charge doe seke glory god man prayse ye obiect breakyng sabboth daye haue saued man sabboth day holy religion sabboth doeth stay deuisyng labouring destroye innocent innocent suche one hath deserued good handes magnifie moses ye preferre honour reuerence god ye feyned religion wurshippe doeth law curse sheadeth innocentes bloud neither doeth permitte power autoritie putting death vpon malefactours vpon neyther except lawfully conuicted condened ye contrary lawe trauaill death sent god preache wil pleasure according intent law seke glorye mine owne effectuously seke kingdome rich frely offre saluacion men hurte good men saying iesus vexe trouble phariseis mindes two cause first perceiued well craftie inuencions though secretly doen hid knowledgethe people aunswered said thou hast deuill supposed mighte soone without difficultie haue made awaye yf thing went could haue kepte secrete secondarily woordes pinched mindes appeale sinnefull transgression lawe presence people would haue thought moste true obseruers law laying snare innocet bloud feared knowledge god feared haue dedes knowen people therfore face thyng dissimulacio let fare thought multitude knowe wickednes fell open rebuke checkes maner wicked person taken maner mischeuouse dede canot excused thou hast say deuill seyng thou makest father heauen god himselfewho goeth kil thee auctour thy doctrine auaunt thy selfe thereby god true thou deuils instigacion art vntrue goeth deuise thy death lorde iesus brawle checking answere furiouse blasphemie lest haue made woode putting furie already cruel fur ouse geuing v ensaumple mildenesse full gentelly telleth cause dede whiche quarelled hym themselfes dede breaker lawe thinges yet accuse iesus transgressour lawe healed man sycke palsey sabboth day saieth iesus one certain dede ye sabboth daye neyther euil sinfull yet vnhonest wherwith gaue health man miserably diseased selues could allowe commend case doen sabboth day rather breake sabboth whiche goeth thing sabboth sinful wicked daye soeuer bee doen religion sabboth great ought giue place thinges whiche weight nd greatter importaunce good godly euery daye whensoeuer doen moses himselfe ye highly esteme attribute much vnto haue geuen exaumple hath doen like wise haue doe also lawe teache worke maye doen sabboth day without breakyng lawe sabboth eyther ye muste nedes absolue cleare el n case ye condemne ye must also codemne moses lawe selfe whatsoeuer gaue vnto lawe moses gaue circumcision vnto circumcision began euen whan moses lawe began geuen god patriarch lawe writen cause circumcision greatter matter religion sabboth daye went lawe wer head lawe moses whiche commaunded circumcision commaunded sabboth daye circumcise man sabboth daye ye thinke ye violate sabboth day therin dignitie circucision wherunto ye thinke ye religion sabboth ought right geue place like deacon priestes doe also temple thinges whiche pertaining goddes seruice yet doyng take theymselfes breaker sabboth daye somuche esteme thyng doe holynesse omitted sabboth daye ye sabboth day circumcise manconsideryng therefore ye doe circucise man sabbothe daye leste throughe beynge circumcised one neyther doe wene sabboth day worke wurse kept meruaill like disdainfull men make suche clamour worke sabboth daye vnkept broken haue healed one parte alone haue preserued saued whole manne altogether sabboth daye although circumcision lawe sorte beginning chiefe parte lawe yet perpetuall men acceptable dearly beloued god circumcisio time shalbe god shall mislyke refuse ouerthwarte circu cision fleshe beyng without inward circumcision herte geue health body soule man ly wretched neighbour greater acte holy dede circumcise man alwaye good law tyme law law owne selfe good doe ye cause vnlyke yea much better matter touchyng behalfe wurship haue moses reuerence accuse giltye greater crime doe dispute whiche v twayne greatter take moses still excellent man let euen suppose mean abiect person yet ye loke well consider matter rightly either ye ought codemne v bothe assoyle v bothe ye lawe trueth teacheth v geuyng iudgement ye loke vpon matter persone standeth accursed fauouring riche oppresseth poore therfore iudge qualitie personeiudge vtter apperance c lette iudgemet iuste rightful according matter ye truelye obserue moses lawe thinges many suche spoken lord iesus gentelly able haue pacified neuer cruell minde sayinges also trewe could proued false confuted man neuer shamelesse phariseis truth ceassed speakyng neuerthelesse persist continue theyr malice without mitigacion minde durst presence multitude suche wise laye himselfe faulte breakyng sabboth burdened muche greater crime pthen sayed sum hierusalem go kil lo speaketh boldely saye nothing doe rewlers knowe dede christe howbeit knowe man whence christe cummeth man knoweth whence cryed iesus temple taught saying ye bothe knowe whence ye knowe cum selfe sent true ye knowe knowe saye knowe hym shall lyar lyke vnto knowe hym hym hath sent phariseis pride great would thus farre priuileged innocent accused rather geue ouer true cause theyr auctoritie shoulde thing quayle amongest people rather god prayse glorye shoulde nothyng spoken vpon parte honour shoulde decaye yet euen kynde men founde many among people whiche rather serue lewde ambicion obey god certain hierusalem sayed scribe phariseis drift put death men thought hyde himselfe durste cum hye feastfull day feare lo speketh openly temple vttereth mind vnto frankely frely euen theyr face yet geue hym aunswer meaneth sylence head ruler brought belefe messias confesse thing silence whiche impugne denie howbeit lyke true chefe rewlers thus thinke euen knowe whence man came father mother knowen well inough playne folkes meane sorte knowe countrey man knowe also brother kinsfolkes whan messias cummeth shall cum man shall knowe whence cummeththen cried iesus temple c iesus perceyuing theyr blindnesse great prophecie geuen knowledge beforehande messias shoulde cum bethleem iesus borne signes prophecy agree hym purpose yet beyng blynded malice denye knowe hym cause el knowe therfore euen purpose make lye saying christ shoulde cum man know whence cummeth forge would compelled recognyse iesus say fro whose knowleage secretes men hidde rebuke also foolish ignorance multitude whiche corrupt seing head men set affected whiche multitude wilfully ignorant thing whiche might haue knowen theyr lewde minde letted theyr iudgemente doeth shrill loude voice thintente might heard onely nye hande people whiche within temple place moste conuenient haue god glorye preached setfurth beginne teache openly sent man could ignorant eyther suche one wilfully would without knowleage el malice would confesse thing knewe thus iesus doeth admonishe v therwith giue place oftentimes malice men lest beying kindled shoulde wurse cruelly prouoke sorer iudgemet god thus also assayes could doen amendment might iustely geue ouer leaue desperate persones theyr owne folly disease yt glorie god hid conceled ne yet neyghbours health saluacion neglected theyr obstinate wickednesse therfore sayeth iesus ye thinke messias whome prophecy prophetes ye looke bycause ye knowe whence came euen thing might teache dede haue cum sorte borne selfe place wherof prophetes hath tolde hand messias cum ye haue heard iohns record ye se miracle ye heare beare witnes trueth studying none thing god glory saluacio therfore ye muste nedes knowe except ye leauer wylfully ignorant thing ye knowe ye say ye messias cum man knowe whence cummeth prophetes pointe assigne stocke countrey thinges knowen vnto might induce vnderstanding prophecie howbeit thing force better knowe whence cameand cum myselfe sent true stocke borne case ye woulde consider pure sincere iyes ye could trueth ignoraut therin neyther worlde nowe cum worlde ye slaunderously reporte cum sente ye worlde intent might conuert saued sent ye knowe cause sent ye also shoulde learne knowe meand ye knowe muche may man knowen albeit ye meane yet knowe except ye applye selfes godlines deserue would geue knowlage knowe yt doeth obey sufficient knowe god woordes ye denye dedes ye haue true knowelage father ye must learne sonne onely haue truely knowen proceded came worlde sent worlde teache knowe throughe belefe ye might saued came mine owne head dooe sekyng owne praise rather goddes honour teaching owne commentes fantasy doctrine god sent true haue whatsoeuer speake therfore sayinges also true pthen sought take man layed handes houre yet cum many people beleued sayd whan christe cummeth moe miracle man hath doen senior ruler stirred sore heated woordes weaxed wood chafed heartes toke vnto suche authoritie people openly rebuked theim peruerse wickednes muche holde handes angre turned woodnesse passed nothing good aduisement deliberacion wherwith purposed make awaie secretly though readye mischieuous deede yet time laide handes vpon christ willing haue time yet cum whiche father appointed worke therin death saluacion worlde willingly dyed coulde taken lay stay mennes mindes neuer fierce mannes power could preuaile vnlesse pleased exceding charitie towardes man crucified saluacion world priestes scribe phariseis headman people holy profession knowlage lawe behoued first haue acknowlaged christ perseuering wycked purpose euen corrupte mindes many comminaltie vnlearned lawe whiche lesse auctoritie learning good mindes deuocion beleue lorde iesus woordes miracle yet trueth fully persuaded iesus messias howbeit brought poinct semed apte persuaded man say christ phariseis thinke yet muche meruailed hath great power workyng miracle yf messias himselfe shoulde cum shoulde greater thinges whiche man doeth pthe phariseis hearde people murmured suche thinges concerning hym phariseis hie priestes sente minister take hym saied iesus vnto yet litle goe vnto sente ye shall fynde whither goe thither ye cum phariseis senior whose part haue allured inticed vnlearned multitude vnto christe perceiued many people inclined towardes hym fel suche furious headines yt determined euery way without stoppe ought dye whiche thought would obscure honour suche pestilence ambicion couloured pretence religion doctrine meane tyme feare daungier neither shame pitie stayed theim manifest enormitie therfore hyre priuely common catche polles take iesus sight people taken hym bring euill doer iesus knewe priuie conspiracie conspired could taken excepte liste himselfe sumwhat openeth vnto darke sayinges time come would voluntarily offre himselfe death wheras sought death vain maner also gaue warning glad wel vse while hym tyme vain shoulde desire absent persecute beyng present specially coulde cum place whiche shoulde conuey himselfe went euen death whereunto yet might folowe returned heauen thither mortall bodye able pursue himye shall seke shall finde c well iesus spake vnto manier yet litle goe vnto sent ye shall seke fynde shal goe ye cannot cum lorde iesus spake thinges vnto couertly wont dooe many mo thinges vnderstande put vre finished darkenes speaking maketh man diligent seke matier whe thinges exibite dooen wordes surely beleued finally thing grue point well knowen men whatsoeuer lorde suffered suffered aduisedly vpon deliberacion casualtie suffered willingly necessitie though wordes spoken men generall yet specially pricke phariseis seruauntes whiche sent take iesus perceiued coulde nothyng except willyng while toucheth secretly inwarde conscience declareth knoweth thyng soeuer moste secretely hid mennes heartes therwithall winneth hertes vnto gentilnes whose wicked enterprise disclose vnto people pthen sayd iewes among themselues whither got shall fynde goe amonge gentile whiche scattered abrode teache gentile maner saying sayd ye shall seke shall fynde thither ye cum therfore multitude vnderstande saying reasoned among themseluesthan sayd iewes among themselues whither wil goe c meaneth sayeth goe thither ye cum priuely steale awaye goe sum farre countrey among heathen people suffre himselfe forsake holy lande holy people go dwell among wicked prophane people whither thinketh neuer folowe wander hither thither like vagabounde among gentile dwellyng farre awaye cannot found v last day great day feast iesus stode cryed saying man thirst let cum vnto drinke beleueth sayeth scripture belly shall flowe riuers water lyfe spake spirite beleue receiue holy ghoste yet iesus yet glorified last day feast cum whiche moste solemnely kept moste great resorte people great religion day past euery glad repayre home againe iesus stode vp temple though also would leaue coutrey iurye doth halow moste solemne day great feast notable sermo therwith purueyed vitailes euangelicall faith ghospell theim iourney onely speake openly also cryed firme stayed voyce therby declaryng matier mete heard folke phariseis babished simple people fained colde religion tangled theyr conscience mannes ordinaunces surely multitude nothing el almost admiracion iesus sayd miracle somuche drounke spirite gospell toke lesse spirituall profite handes therfore iesus called allured menne openly barren colde doctrine phariseisif man thirst let cumme vnto drinke vnto himselfe promisyng spirite whiche receiued grace themselues shall attaine true euangelicall doctrine shall also theyr preachyng issue foorth vpo great aboundaunce efficacie wysedome sayth fountaine helthfull wysedome whoso thirsteth let aske nothing moses phariseis scribe priestes let cum drinke well whosoeuer beleueth wordes thesame drinketh therfore whosoeuer beleueth desyrously drinketh vp wordes scripture biddeth bearing witnesse shal weaxe dry throwe infidelitie ye draught dronke spirite god shall bring foorth heart well shall runne euermore plentifully suche wyse heart shall flowe onely small litle streames also great pleteous fluddes wherwith drynesse gentile shalbe watered therof shall spring muche fruite ghospell parable far speakyng iesus meane fertile pleteous spirite whiche afterwarde receiue woulde beleue whiche spirite apostle receiued foorthwith begon great confidence preache diuers toungues whole worlde ye philosophie gospel distil soules beleued christ thesame spirite receyued heauen albeit many time sum smattering sumwhat entered knowlage faith verye effectuall plentifull spirite yet cum iesus death resurreccion glorified ascended vp heauen sitte father right hande whence sende spirite apostle misterie crosse perfourmed whiche thing could doen accomplished except glorious maiestie kept secret dissembled season also could made able receyue diuine spirite vnlesse first framed fashioned therunto many miracle sayinges doinges therfore lorde iesus doeth call byd folke well water lyfe yet compelleth man againste wyll excludeth man cum athirst many people therfore heard saying sayed trueth prophte sayd christ sum sayd shall christe cum galile sayeth scripture christe shall cum sede dauid toune bethleem dauid discencion amog people sum woulde haue taken hym man layed handes hym lorde iesus spoken many mo lyke thynges though fullye vnderstande yet dyd woorke sundrie myndes affeccions multitude people sum vpon sight many miracle great auctoritie wordes sayed truly prophete thought hyghly sayed yea messias prophetes haue promised prophecy contrary syde corrupted pharisaicall leuen went reproue confute men opinion woordes prophetes whiche tolde shoulde ryse tribe iuda towne bethleem christe thought moste part men borne nazareth nursed broughte vp parentes whiche dwelte also beganne preaching galile moste part abode people ierusale iewes tribe iurie toke people galile men nigh neighbour vnto heathen myxte together halfe countreymen neyther excelled knowledge lawe euer prophete whome might worthily reioyce knewe verily messias promysed tribe iuda men galile shoulde cum seede dauid princely palace ierusalem thus therfore dyd chalenge vnto honour christ cum themselfes malice corrupted nowe cumming persecute say therfore lyke true man messias ponder straitly examine prophecy christe shall cum shall cum v oute galile doth prophecy manifestly saye messias shall come sede dauid certainly trybe iuda also expresseth tounes name shoulde bee borne say bethleem whiche citie dauid geuen iudas parte tribe therefore forasmuche prophecie dooeth plainlye shewe shoulde cum kynges stocke moste holye tribe iuda princely toune howe stande accorde man shoulde messias whose parentes poore estimacion cummeth v vile toune name whiche standeth galile countrey renowme sorte people disputed iesus diuers iudgementes dissencion among theim sake yet iesus accumpany himselfe theim disputacion dispute suche simple purenesse mynde dyd deserue bee taught yet tyme declare hymselfe howe great excellent man yf vprightly truely desyred knowe themselues might haue learned iesus kinsfolkes borne nazareth part theim supposed bethleem came dauids familie fewe knewe thinges iesus dyd bryng hym shewe vnto thinges agreable lustes wyllyng serue theyr owne affeccions receiue acknowledge hym minde plain simple pure might haue learned thing wherabout contended case woulde haue asked iesus hymselfe question many people blynded enuy hatered conspired among theymselfes take lorde iesus laye handes hym malice man power strength hym hath thinges power pthan came minister high priestes phariseis sayed vnto haue ye brought minister answered neuer man spake man doth answered phariseis ye also deceiued doeth ruler phaririseis beleue hym common people whiche knowe lawe accursed therefore sergeauntes phariseis sent seruantes mad fury attache iesus returned againe mindes cleane chaunged vnto hye priestes phariseis whiche fierce cruell myndes taryed lokyng theyr seruautes haue brought apprehended person vnto intete last might haue satisfyed accomplisshed hatered vpon hym meane tyme prouision god whiche farre passeth worldly mennes crafte subtiltie procured succoure whatsoeuer malicious phariseis wente procure thesame lighted vpon theyr heades made well settyng foorth christes glory vnlearned multitude rude ignoraunt people galilee samaritanes cananites heathen people beyng moued iesus sayinges doinges beleued hym onely scribe phariseis senior priestes whose gouernaunce open confessio discussion whole law religion wer neuer deale moued cum better aduisement conuerted made euery way wurse woode cum point hiered men catche polles curryshe kynde people readye hiered vnhappinesse money bothe honestly reporte iesus also reproue theyr vncurable blyndnesse seruauntes seen miracle wroughte onelye hearde hym speake fewe wordes yet hauing myndes cleane altered without regarde commaundementes phariseis retourned agayne vnto brought iesus sent asked quarelled wer commaunded menne laye excuse feare multitude feined excuse frankly frely confessed truth went purposely haue taken iesus haue brought hym affectuouse gracious wordes charmed newely hearted agayne vtterlye repined theyr harte thyng whiche purposed neuer saye hearde manne speake man doeth laye violent handes vpon suche lyke men recorde coulde haue auouched synagoge haue burdened pressed openly disclosed phariseis obstinate malice could vttermoste theyr power subuert doctrine iesus endeuoure wente backewarde while went way could vtterly destroy christ doctrine stablishe set forth yet still dissemble wood furie harte speakyng seruauntes courteously quietly according fury thoughtes howe chaunsed saye theydoeth ye ruler phariseis beleue hym ye belong v therfore taken raskall noumbre also deceiued ye perceyue go deceiue men faire promise sell false ware good true ye thynke suche notable men doth excell learning auctoritie would approue sayinges ye see ruler magistrate vnto auctoritie religion belongeth phariseis hath moste exacte knowledge law perswaded wordes doeth exaumple fewe atifes sorte drudge moue sorte people ignoraunt knoweth lawe therfore accursed well euen god thus disposed thinges certifie teache v nothyng doeth obstinately resist true religion malice whiche cloked false pretence religion man deadly enemy ye doctrine gospel wresteth holy scripture owne lewde affeccions neyther desperately wicked whiche pretence holynes perswasion learnyng publike auctoritie armed trueth gospell dede whatsoeuer worlde deuiseth engyns agaynst heauenly trueth successe therof glorie lord iesus christ marke well wise reader scarcitie theyr harte fauoureth christen trueth among ringleader religion head learned men nicodemus sayeth vnto came iesus night one doeth lawe iudge man heare hym knowe hath doen answered sayed vnto art thou galile searche looke galile ariseth prophete euery man went vnto owne house great counsail phariseis scribe seniours priestes man saue onely nicodemus would stand defence innocente lorde suche wicked enterprise nicodemus one headman secte phariseis grosse truth lesse learned lesse corrupt minde thesame feare iewes came iesus night tolde better instructed priuate secrete communicacio one metyng profited muche toke iesus good man though fully vnderstande mistery spirituall meanynge woorde man sawe felowes bloud suckyng myndes tende vtter destruccion iesus whome fauoured neuerthelesse feared malice armed auctoritie tooke iesus part wa ely spake thynges whiche might haue spoke malefactour conuicted sayeth professe law whith doeth condemne euill doer except first heard matter duely discussed whiche layed charge accused lette manne haue leste benefite lawe whiche common folke lawe selfe geueth euen misdoers matter open theyr mouthe speake indifferent manerly defence whiche nicodemus vsed speakyng christ onely call themselfes home turne better mynde yet pacified appeased without regarding mannes dignitie auctoritie fall hande rebuke reproche say thus vnto hym art thou also nowe become man galile common people vnlearned holden excused maye forgeuen great shame thee art head man doctor lawe disciple scholler galile mansearche loke galile riseth prophete whiche verye deceiuer people man ioyneth himselfe suche moste vile abiectes menne cursed god thou professest knowledge lawe art open reader discusser searche well scripture throughlye examine thou fynde throughout scripture either prophete hath euer cum euer shall cum galile beleue felowe prophete answere phariseis onelye wicked also folishe nicodemus affirmed prophete sayde whosoeuer ought common rather publike law saye lawe indifferently perteyneth men euery state condemned except cause knowen malice hatred heart occupieth power mynde iudgement thynges wer commoned fro one counsell brake vp dismist euery went home wyll beriue christ life beyng delayed proroged chaunged iesus tyme yet viii chapter iesus wente mount oliuete early mornynge came agayne temple people came vnto hym sate downe taught drewe nere night iesus wet vnto mount oliuete bethanie pleasaunte lodgeyng lorde consideryng quiete place ierusalem herein taught v secrete place vacacio coueniet preacher ghospell trueth hath lesse place riche welthy city howebeit sometyme euangelicall wyse preacher shall resorte thither get rich honoure good though endaungier liues thereby therfore next daye folowynge iesus returned againe ierusalem early mornynge stadyng daye sate downe taught temple bolde countenaunce openly shewyng hymselfe nothyng afearde phariseis wicked conspiracy people came great assembly vnto partly brought haue admiracion throughe miracle wordes doen spoken tyme partly intrappe hym get matter harme scribe phariseis brought vnto hym woman taken aduoutrye whan set middes saye vnto hym maister woman taken aduoutrie euen deede doyng moses lawe commaunded v suche shoulde stoned sayest thou sayde tempte hym mighte accuse hym marked hym certayn merueilous clemencye gentle pacience towardes poore miserable comon people thereat toke occasio accuse wheras thei ought rather haue loued hym moses law ordeined sore statute aduoutrie saye case woman taken vnlawfully vsyng selfe manne stoned people handes meane men pardoning themselfes extreme woman though thei innocent god auoide eternal paine punished lawe though otherwyse committed greater faultes lawe onely punisheth open faultes doth punishe pride hautenes mind hatred god doth abhorre thniges ye ye law punisheth therfore scribe phariseis wete men ye knowe well inough seuere kepers iustice zeale loue ye lawe fiercely set malefactours open synners themselues inwardly hertes soused washed muche enormious sinnes brought woman taken aduoutrie vnto iesus time sitting temple set woman opely middes ye people thintente christ would haue geuen sentence condemnacion herand scribe phariseis brought vnto hym woman taken aduoutrie many multitude shoulde haue borne lesse fauoure whose fauoure gotten chiefly reason lenitie gentlenes pardon clearely dismisse thoughte woulde haue doen might finde faulte wherof accuse hym whiche afrayd forgeue aduouterer cotrary moses ordinaunce lawe hope bring passe beset roare steede woman christ himselfe ouerthrowen eue pressed downe stone verely phariseis themselues beyng wicked synners accuse synfull woman iesus iudge wyse woman saye euen taken aduoutrie euen deede moses made v law suche shoulde stoned therfore bryng vnto people stoned excepte thou disagree therunto thynkest thou iesus sto ped dount fynger wrote grounde continued askyng lifte himselfe vp sayed vnto let amonge without synne caste firste stone againe stouped downe wrote ground assone heard went one one beginning eldest iesus left alone woman standyng middest iesus lifte vp sawe man woman saied vnto woma act thine accusars hath man condemned sayd man lorde iesus sayed neyther condemne goe synne uerely iesus knewe secretes heartes ignoraunt manier thyng neuer priuie elude disapoynte malice godly wysedome deliuered aduoutresse oute stonecasters handes yet clerely absoyle fautlesse leste seme abrogate moses lawe whiche necessarily geuen cause men refraine euil dedes say iesus came breake abrogate lawe fulfil againe syde condemne came worlde haue sinner loste saue trueth iesus doeth euery moderate woordes touchyng ordinaunces whiche worlde obserueth necessarily euen preserue publike peace common quietnes neither muche alloweth improueth vpo occasion therof geueth monicion generally vngraciousnes eschewed onely dedes whiche worldly prynces lawes punishe truely goddes iudgement crymes horrible yet lawe doeth punish notwithstanding cannot escape punishment goddes hande taketh hand reuenge doer therfore iesus doeth neither refuse iudgement comitted vnto forasmuche iudge ouer doth appoint comit woman giltie vnto men wer readinesse cast stone neither doeth cleare woman matter dede deserued punished silece succoureth pulled hurried pain preserue vnto penaunce mighte due repentaunce bee better aduised conuerte healthe saluacion gaue aunswere worde mouthe spake dede knewe selye giltie woman bee sinner also knewe accuser whiche woulde haue thought righteous sinfull take away moses lawe shewed mercifulnes christes newe law whereof thauctor informed drewe faultie woma cruel pain loke well vpon theselues according god lawe examine owne conscience duely euery one shewe suche one towardes neighbour offended would haue god iudge hym thyng lorde iesus instruccion bowed downe hymselfe signify man al statelinesse pride layd doune wherwith man flattered hault minde despised neighbour descende doune loke wel vpon bowed doune iesus wrote vpon grounde euen geue v warnyng god shall iudge euerye man lawe gospel lawe written table made vntrue righteousnes proude arrogant law written vpon grounde maketh euery man conscience knowlage owne infirmitie meke mercifull vnto neighbour while iewes preaced still vpon himlet hi among without sinne cast ye firste stone knowe iudgemente although already dede pronounced stoode vp tolde playnly minde wyst meant sayd among without synne let cast first stone saying clearely assoyle offender pearced conscience euery one knowynge himselfe giltie feared leste iesus sawe wer knowen euen moste hid seret thynges haue published vngracious actes thus pricked conscience stouped doune againe wrote vpon grounde wer dede paintyng theyr iyes would haue noted arrogancie whiche toke vpon holy dede synfull lawe extremely punished brought foorth stoned commo handes manye kylled husband frailtie fleshe geuen vse body man committed aduoutrie beyng full enuy hatered complainyng couetousnes ambicion deceite laye wayte kyl lorde ye whole lawe alone free al thynges clerely pure synne therefore vpon lordes answere euery one knowing giltie afrayed lest shoulde bewraied faultes disclosed went temple one another senior phariseis scribe priestes head men goyng rest folowing whiche among sorte wer taken pillers mainteiners religion iustice euen sowsed mormities inwardly moste great synners folkes goen neuer one cleare without fault iesus remained alone onely without fault nowe synful woma found neuer hadde doen synne mercifull iudge wheras haue theim cruel murderer themselues giltie grieuous sinnes therfore woman seing crueltie stoode alone wofull synner iesus alone woman ready perishe sauiour sinfull creature fountaine perfeccion holynes quaked feare euen conscience clemencie iesus whiche shewed selfe euen countenaunce put good coumfort meane whyle lord man occupied thyng wrote vpon grounde iewes well appeared wente waye men afraied lordes threathynges condemned owne conscience lengthe iesus stoode vppe sawe goen woman alone fearefull speake curteously vnto sayinge woman wher thine accuser hath man condemned answered si said vnto woman thyne accuser iesus sayed neither came saue men bee vnmercifull condemne haue condemned rigour lawe doeth punishe feare men fauourablenesse gospell seketh deathe synner rather amendemente lyfe therfore go thy waye sinne hereafter example lorde iesus taught taketh vpon shepeherdes ouer people teacher gospell howe greate sufferaunce gentelnesse ought vse towardes themgo synne whiche fall synne frailtie considering synne al shewed hymself merciful towardes open sinner great ought bishop gentilnes towardes offeders themselues haue many time nede goddes mercy whose faultes angry case synful certes life without spotte leaste waye truely maye frailtie man fall kynde synne pthen spake iesus agayne vnto saying light worlde foloweth doth walke darkene se shall haue light life phariseis therfore sayed vnto hym thou earest recorde thy selfe thy recorde true iesus answered sayed vnto though beare recorde self yet recorde true knowe whence cam whither go ye tell whence come whither go ye iudge fleshe iudge man iudge iudgement true alone go father sent also written lawe testimonie two men true one beareth wytnesse selfe father sent beareth witnesse sayed vnto thy father iesus aunswered ye neyther knowe yet father yf ye knowen ye shoulde haue knowen father also wordes spake iesus treasury taught temple man layed handes hym houre yet come therfore nowe whiche complayned woman sente awaie euery man brought knowledge owne synne synner dismyst iesus vpon occasion goeth hande agayne make ende sermon whiche begun sinne darkenes bee true plaine meaninge studie thoughte maner folke go light deliuered darkenes lyke synfull woman wente vnto iesus denye confessed thynge committed wente waye iustifyed contrary wyse heade men phariseis woulde thoughte righteous dede wer vngraciouse wicked dedde lyghte leste theyr dysease shoulde knowen made whole therfore iesus doeth exhorte folke yt whosoeuer wrapped synne come hym come penitente shoulde rather folowe hym phariseis blynde guydes blynde leste man throughe knowledge sinnes shoulde bolde come vnto hymi light world c taught v aduoutresse litle howe reiected man desirethe healed sayethe whole palestine alone sunne firmamente worlde muche saye light worlde sunne taken awaye maketh thinges darke withall beareth lighte bodyes light pure soules geueth life likynge bodyes lighte presently soules walketh lighte sunne stumblethe darke whoso folowethe beleueth doctrine shall abide longer darkenes errour sinne beinge purged fro sinne illumined doctrine gospell shall haue true light geueth lyfe soule belongeth dead hid darkenesthou bearest recorde thy selfe propertie aliue walke couersant light haue knowledge life soule contrary synne bee ignoraunt eternall death phariseis enuye coulde broke magnificence whiche christe preached hymselfe specially forasmuche thoughte themselues touched couertly whatsoeuer redound vnto iesus commendacion praise thesame derogacion furthwith therfore cried againste hym presence multitude fearyng leste common people would forsake folow christ bryng hym credence would make lyar charged hym therwith thou saye bearest recorde speakest stoutly thy selfe man owne recorde beleued true man parte proude man fashion set forth owne prayse wherfore thyne owne testemonye true vengeable checke whiche yet dede coulde muche hurte glory mighte hynder saluacion great nombre people iesus made sharpe aunswere saying trueth amonges men witnesse hym whiche bothe maye deceyue deceiued small importaunce weyeth litle alone witnesse selfe bring iohns recorde witnesse whiche prophetes bare yea though mannes recorde stande nede alone shoulde beare witnesse selfe yet could case ye knewe plainly whence came reproue mine owne recorde expedient mennes witnesse drawen question doubted nothing el verye men according man iudgement make relacion themselues may deceiued also lye list thinges hath way place speake nothing mine owne head thyng say cummeth sent haue none pretese therein set furth glory cannot lye onely recorde holy vncorrupt mennes witness whosoeuer hath pro eded fro himbut ye tell whence speaketh thinges according minde within returne vnto thesame person whence came hath nede man witnesse owne propre actes redines declare blinded enuye purpose knowe thing ye might knowe ye iudge peruerslye thestimacion ye haue thinges mortall men indifferetly page duplicate page duplicate comon ye perceiue fro whence came whither shall go seen except mennes myndes wicked affeccions set aside iudge spirite ready belefe myndes learne thynges whiche speake coferryng together sayinges prophetes see heauenly thyng worldly thyng iudge fleshei iudge man yf iudge iudgemente true ye corrupted worldly affeccion condemning wickedly owne vtter destruccio thing ye ought imbrace eternall saluacion iudgement therfore corrupte false cumeth god worldly humaine lustes meane tyme iudge man tyme iudgement yet saluacion yet geue iudgement iudgement true doeth swarue dissent god iudgement shoulde geue sentence alone father sent ioyntelye together pronounce semblably one thyng forasmuche bothe throughlye one worldly matter iudgement many weyeth greater auctoritie one mannes mynde alone yet goddes iudgement alone passeth iudgement mankynde ye despise sentence man iudgement trulye ye cannot contemne iudgement god though himselfe alone geue iudgement yf ye despise iudgement god neither ye reiecte refuse iudgement whiche consentyng thynges except common contempte ye v bothe wrong bothe sendeth sent hym speake nothyng whiche hath commaunded semblably euen amongst menne recorde many substauncial fewe lawe recorde vnlesse two least allowed admitted iudge yet dede regarded man beare recorde another beare witnesse howbeit cannot auoided among men wrong iudgementes vntrue recordes yea although thousand men agre vpo one thyng beyng men either errour knewe truth el corrupte affeccions pronounce geue sentence accordyng true iudgement reason le de affeccions heart notwithstandyng euen one alone sayth thing hymselfe case pronounce thyng r porteth himselfe owne heade god commaundement iudgemente recorde must nedes true god neither deceiued corrupt beare witnesse selfe autoritie father doeth also himselfe beare witnesse neither pronounce thing co cernyng myne owne person hath testified sent worlde witnesse trueth onely hath knowe ye put away recorde ye must nedes therin also reiecte ye infringe repel iudgement ye must force necessitie contrarie twaine two haue one witnesse iudgemet one twaine alone yet iudgement replied ye aske father testifie forsoth bare recorde law whose voy e ye know ye would wt pureheartes vnderstand yt writte also testifie iordane recorde seen artes dedes whiche doeth conclusion whe tyme shall shall glorifie euident clere witness thinges wer spoke iewes heard father ofte named sent whose auctoritie laied defece meruailed woulde speake highly ioseph carpenter whose sone commoly thought case ment desirous get father fro come go thei thy father thou speakest suche wonderful thynges iesus somewhat opening yet knowen vnto touchyng diuine nature godhead whe supposed man nought el yet al haue beleued man vnlesse theyr iudgment corrupted carnal affeccions yea wordes also implie neither father could truly knowen sonne sone fully knowen except father wer knowen sonne knowen bodilye iyes fayth ye father shewed man s maye brought deuout myndes spiritually well iesus say maketh answere wyse ye neyther know yet father long ye know ye knowe father geue credence vnto ye shall know father ye saye ye know ye know countrey dwelling place paretes brother whe wordes vnderstode lorde iesus sore prouoke phariseis myndes teaching openly temple yea preace people place temple called treasury offringes thinges geuen temple brought thither kept whiche thinges wholly wer turned priestes phariseis pleasure gaine excessiuely though thinges geuen ye woulde saye consecrate god albeit say christe thus haue said yet man layde handes hym lacked vngracious wyll god suffre time yet come whe christe appoynted himselfe suffre neither would suffre vntyll fully taught doctrine whiche father committed ministracion saluacion man pthen sayde iesus agayne vnto go waye ye shall seke shall dye synnes whither go thither ye cum sayed iewes wyll kyll hymselfe sayeth whither go thither ye come sayed vnto beneth aboue ye world worlde therfore saye vnto ye shal dye synnes ye beleue ye shall dye synnes therfore while wer whisht kept silence yet cumpassyng minde full vngracious murderous thoughtes iesus went forth talke priuely pricking cosciences leaste wa might forthinke knew nothing hid vnto thyng whiche neuer geuen hym verye man mannes wickednesse sayeth let thyng father commaundement thyng finished go hym sent ye shall seke vayne myne absence ye shall desyre beyng present enuy displeasure vnto ye shall knowe ende conclusion matter ye shall wyshe presence haue whiche doe nowe persecute preacher setter foorthe eternall trueth shall dye synne yf ye persiste continue infidelitie doeth perishe owne faulte obstinately putteth awaye healthe freely offered vnto hym prouoketh sekethe owne deathe whoso doeth despyse fountayne lyfe go thither whereas youre wickednes compelleth willynglye go thither ye cannot folow parable lord iesus meane manye thynges first owne good went death furthermore yt death resurreccion lyfted vp heauen whither man worldly wisedom could brought saying ye iewes wer made afeard vnderstode ment durste al aske meanyng whispered talked therof secretely among theselues saying matter man doethe sundrye tymes threaten v goyng awaye thither whither cannot folowe hym wyll violently kyll hymselfe withdrawe v iesus whiche knew thoughtes dyd temper moderate aunswere vnto grosse muttrynge sinfull murmuryng thyng whiche spake shoulde bee vnderstande death resurreccion ascencion supposyng iesus nothing el man could coniecture none thyng shoulde go death delyuered grefe persecutours meanyng hymselfe touchynge godhede came heauen anon ouercome deathe returne agayne thither whence came ye sayethe beynge worlde worldly wise speake carnall iudgement worldif ye beleue ye shall dye sinnes worlde speake hyer thynges vnderstande neyther shall ye euer vnderstande excepte ye leaue infidelitie shew selues ready taught therefore tolde erwhile tell againe vnlesse ye put away malice ye shall dye sinnes onely waye escape darkenes synnes receiue lyght onely waye lyfe knowe whiche onely deliuereth deathe faythe gospell case ye obstinatelyrefuse beleue father willeth men obtaine life saluacion ye shall thorow faulte dye synnes sayed vnto hym thou iesus sayeth vnto euen v thyng speake vnto haue many thynges saye iudge ye sent true speake worlde thinges whiche haue heard hym howbeit vnderstoode spake father sayed iesus vnto ye haue lift vp dye sonne man shall ye know doe nothyng selfe father hath taughte euen speake thynges sent father hath left alone alwayes thynges please hym neither yet saying lord iesus settell downe mindes phariseis muche inordinate loue world blynded theyr myndes therefore thoughe neither seen hearde anye thing wherby might know maliciously saie vnto iesus art thou iesus knowing hand thei would picke quarell whatsoeuer answere make asked ye question frowarde mynde therewith also iudgeyng fitte heare themselues wer maketh aunswere wise sayinge ye desyre knowe wel beleue surely ye shall beleue excepte ye put awaye grosse worldely affeccions el doe tell shall tell harme ye wyll onely neuer deale better therby forasmuche ye manye wayes euyll ye shall muche made wurse nowe speake vnto shall make damnacion greater thyrst couet saluacion men theyr vtter destruccion el coulde speake manye thynges manye cause condemne thought good father sente world cause euyll bee wurse thintent whiche euill forthinke amende themselues saued father sent sayth trueth yf ye beleue hym ye shall saued ye shall beleue hym yf ye beleue truethe ye shall without daunger safelye beleue speake nothynge vnto haue heard father came worlde hath commaunded speake true thynges trueth suche thynges saluacion damnacion yf man perishe shall perishe thorow owne faulte doeth enuye owne health offered blyndnes iewes grosse althoughe ofte made mencion father sent shoulde go haue recorde heare thynges whiche speake yet vnderstood spake father heauen coulde beleue nothynge hym aboue manne sayinges seedes closed vp memorye hearersthei vnderstoode yt spake father thintente shoulde bring furth frute thinges shoulde fully accomplished whiche prophetes written iesu expediente yet shoulde thought man vntill fully finished ye saluacion worlde hye sacrifice whiche bee offered vpon alter crosse pleased father death god shoulde bee glorified lorde iesus meane time meaning goeth furth communicacion insinuating couertly shoulde afterwarde willinglye crucified sayeth thus ye shall lyfte vp hye sonne man euen ye shall vnderstande ye shall thinke vtterly made awaye conclusion ye shall well knowe power ye shall right well perceiue thing wrought men thinges father power whose pleasure iudgemente thing soeuer practise herein earth saluacion man neither speake thing according minde albeit sente worlde hym yet forsaken hym hath lefte alway present doeth assiste worketh speaketh vnto betwene v two moste hye consente glorified againe hym auctor messenger office embassadour faythfully alwaye thinges whiche hath commaunded determined moses dauid ye haue great reuerence spake manye thinges according god yet thesame many tymes offend hym doynges neuer dissent whiche father pleasure spake wordes manye beleued hym sayed iesus iewes whiche beleued ye continue worde ye disciple ye shall knowe trueth trueth shal make free aunswered hym abraham seed neuer bounde man sayeste thou ye shall made free iesus aunswered uerely verely saye vnto whosoeuer committeth sinne seruaunt sinne seruaunt deth house euer sonne abideth euer sonne therfore shall make free ye free dede know ye abraham sede ye seke meanes l worde hath place speake whiche haue seen father ye whiche ye haue seen father season none fully vnderstade sayinges yet many among people whiche thought vngodly diuerse conceyuyng good hope thynges whiche iesus promysed beleued hymif ye cotinue woorde c yet perfitly still ignoraunte wer able vnderstande doctrine gospell dede certayne way prepared fayth already although wer yet far forwarde brought afterwarde lorde iesus therfore doeth exhorte perseuer thynge wherin metely wel entred vntill might atteyne perfyte knowledge faith good men doeth eue beleue thynges whiche vnderstadeth notand tru th shall make free malice phariseis waxed alwaye wurse wurse sayeth vnto take exaumple wilfully perishe good beginnyng deale beleue sayinges men infidelitie withdrawe ye firmely abide yeare entred vnto professe heauenly trueth pharisaicall doctrine take owne proper disciple whiche hitherto haue embraced shadowes moses lawe truthes shall processe tyme knowe trueth knowen trueth shall make free iewes perceiuing christe mente libertie whiche gospell teacheth whiche libertie doth chaunge worldly aduauncement deliuer bodye intereste maister hath ouer setteth mynde libertie sinne leude worldlye desyres tirannye deuil feare death bondage pharisaicall ordinaunces yoke carnall obseruyng lawe iewes saye vnderstandynge makethe aunswere disdaynefully wer proude nobilitie theyr carnal aunceters say successio come abraham patriarche naturally free men borne onely free noble gentleman also neither euer serue man bode men libertie therfore doest thou promise v though bonde seruauntes nedefull manumission aunswere declared iewes grosse whiche put affiaunce glory carnall thynges neglectynge spirituall thinges whiche commende v god tooke purenes consiste wasshyng bodye cuppes vessel though theyr soule polluted sinfull vice despised comparison themselues bodely circumcised whe vncircumcised mynde thought themselues holy caried lawe written brode scrolles rounde aboute theyr heade holye god whiche haue lawe wrytten theyr myndes expresse scrolles theyr dedes nowe wer proude herte fleshe came abraham though great matter borne holyones god noble famouse whiche whosoeuer borne expresse condicions holy men maners therefore iesus reproued two cause thei ignoraunt trueth also serued bondemenne dissembled fyrste stomaked lesse weyghty matter ignoraunce trueth fault mynde seruaunte euyll thynge mynde lacke worldlye fortune nowe therefore oure lorde iesus teacheth plainlye seruitude ment sayeth disdayne prom e liberty owne co ceyte ye free saye naturall ee child abraham kynde seruitude muche vyle myserablewhosoeuer committeth sinne c noblenes aunceters neuer greate clay ie fredome make man free ye haue man lorde whose bondage ye bee made f e hereof wellassure whosoeuer sinneth maketh seruaunt synne looseth fredome verily naturall borne frema subiect dishonestie giltie sinnefull vilanye fredome whereof ye maye worthely reioyce god
