whosoeuer addicte sinne hath deuill lorde moued drawen plea arbitremente although maye dayme k nne bryng pe igrue moste holy aunceters man holynes taketh awaye bondage succede bloude euery man taken estemed owne dedes seruaunt make felowe seruaunt also sinfull partaker fredome maketh men free tteth libertie whiche onely voyde sinne albeit seruaunte tyme certain thinges house yet seruaunt heyre hath perpetuitie enterest euer put house pleaseth maister sonne heyre lorde house hath continuall right house hymselfe onely free dede without seruitude may also make folke free ye therfore desire freedome cause ye loke haue moses patriarkes priestes whose ministracion neyther vttrely voide sinne autoritie abolishe put awaye sinnes ne yet knowe trueth exactely fullbut sonne make free c one cleaue fast sonne geuen whole perpetual power house thesame whatsoeuer stocke borne maye well hope haue true fredome therfore abraham dyd begette v free moses priestes sacrifice make v free sonne shall make free errour sinne ye shall truely fully free stande muche owne conceyte ye sonnes abraham know ye borne abraham touching flesh honour smal vsual comon al iewes ye wil algates thought abraham posteritie child moste holy father nothing degenerate dedes declare sonnes ye propertie true naturall childe resemble expresse fashion maners parentes abraham muche beleue god promised god populouse succession great nuber come sonne isaac doubted one commaundement god lea sonne isaac speake yt whiche haue see cbut ye see farre ye maners father whiche endeuour kill euen cause el blinded desyres flesh worlde vnderstande communicacion wordes whiche spirituall abraham doubtyng promyses thing nature beleue aungel whome god spake vnto ye se god speaketh promising greater thynges time paste abraham ye onelye geue credence also maliciously seke deuise death therefore arrogantly chalenge abraham father euery god ye sonne hym whose acre condicions folowethe child seeth theyr parentes home growe lyke affeccion maners proue wordes dedes sonne sente speake haue sene heard father lykewyse thynges whiche haue seen father pthey aunswered sayde vnto hym abraham father iesus sayeth vnto ye abraham child ye would dedes abraham ye go kill man hath tolde trueth haue hearde god abraham ye dedes father sayed vnto hym borne fornicacion haue one father euen god iesus saied vnto god wer father trulye ye woulde loue proceded forth came god neyther came selfe sent doe ye knowe speache euen ye cannot abide hearyng woorde ye father uill lustes father wyl ye serue murtherer begynning abode trueth trueth speaketh lye speaketh owne lyar father thing tell trueth therefore ye beleue forsomuche iewes toke saying lorde iesus euill parte frame aunswere suche sorte go aboute therein picke iesus wordes thing spoken abrahas rebuke thing dede woulde haue prouoked people haue stoned christe openly testified dedes euill added thinges whiche sene theyr father neyther knowledge father abraham toke saying iesus abraham patriarche reproued hymselfe suche one child came iesus spake nothing sore abraham reasoned cotrary saying prouing therfore child abraham moste farre wayesyf ye abraham child c moste vnlike ye sayeth taken true child abraham father beleue goddes worde trueth notable affiaunce god deserued commedacio righteousnes called righteouse although ye haue neuer doen boastyng abraham father neuertheles studie drifte kill albeit none man yet innocent one harme man therefore woulde lea tell trueth whiche fayne myne owne heade trueth whiche haue hearde god insomuche whosoeuer distrusteth thesame must nedes distruste god abraham acknowledge sonnes whiche goe wicked matter muche disagreable maners euery one man sonne whose dedes foloweth dedes withall farre vnlike abraham muste nedes haue father whosoeuer whose naturall disposicion resemble shewe selfe lyke condicions iewes beeyng trueth prouoked sayinges nowe geassing ende processe iesus wordes tended noted father aunswere el apointest thou father takest awaye father abraham base gotten maye reioyce common iewes onely succession abraham also sonnes god whiche calleth israell first begotten childe israelite thou take away father abraham vsif god wee father thou geue v another father god common father nacion thou art iniuriouse dispiteful v whole nacion iewes wheras wicked shameles aunswere coulde shameful boaste themselfes child god knewe themselues giltye great faultes also laied wayt bring ye sonne god death iesus replied sharpely answer saied god father witte ye true naturall israelite ye woulde sure loue brother begotten common father one doeth expressely folowe father behaueour maners euen becummeth true naturall childe neyther shewe foorth thyng god father none men busynes father proceaded came world neither speake thing selfe apoint selfe embassage sente ye clayme comon father yf ye saye trueth ye acknowledge speache father sonne true sonne also father came world neither speaketh thyng father appoyntment ye euill beare wordes whe god speaketh vnto ye beleue god true beneficiall health geuer frendely godly enemy wicked ye see nothing sayinges doinges vnlyke vnto thinges acknowledge manner verye nature youre father ye couet heare father name whome witte dedes ye reseble ye neyther beegotten abraham god euen deuill ye naturall child whose witte disposicion ye breathe shewe likelyhoode whose ye obey ye haue bothe hated trueth go aboute kyll innocent exaumple deuill father hath chiefe auctor bothe lye murder lying entised vnto deathe firste parentes mankinde none thing prouoked throughe enuie folkes felicitie thesame sinfull disease doth pricke forwarde slea one innocent beneficiall person deuill enuyed man blessed creacion ye enuie man restored vnto felicitie whence fell fell truethe hys pryde fall suche hope amendemente persistyng euill heapeth sinne vpon sinne striuing againste god veritie presente doyng thesame thyng beginnyng worlde firste practised drewe first auctors mankynde vnto death whoso therfore hateth trueth loueth lye declareth sufficiently father whosoeuer pronounceth lye speaketh hym foutaine lye whatsoeuer auctor speaketh lye speaketh hymself onely lyar father prince lye contrary syde god fountayne truethe whosoeuer speaketh trueth god glory speaketh hymselfe god begotten rather god auctour trueth deuill father lye wherfore consideryng dooe speake vnto heauenly trueth doe beeyng chyldren abraham beleue god ye child god acknowledge loue goddes trueth pwhiche rebuketh sinne saye trueth ye beleue god heareth goddes woordes ye therfore heare ye god aunswered iewes sayed vnto hym saye well thou art samaritane hast deuill iesus aunswered haue deuyll honoure father ye haue dishonored seke mine owne prayse one seketh iudgeth ye fynde lye wordes faulte procedyng geue credite wordes ye burden one faulte maner men ye ye selfes priuie whatsoeuer right true thesame god neither ye proue thyng varieth right trueth beleuyng ye distruste god specially consideryng ye boaste selues child god ye extolle aduaunce selues truely ye would acknowledge woorde god case ye vntruelye ye declare selues haue lying father god heereth god wordeswhosoeuer begotten god thesame doeth lyke true naturall chylde geue eare father woordes thing well proueth begotten god father ye cannot abyde heare truethe cummethe iewes beeyng made woordes wood fall geuyng cursed woordes theyr aunswere wherunto malice men beyng reason concluded woont haue refuge saieth saye right thee thou wilte taken iewe boastest god thy father thou art samaritane haste deuill whiche selfe thyng thou doest declare dede approuest iudgemente thee aunswer made moste gentle iesus vnto peuishe mad reproche touching reproche namyng hym samaritane althoughe commonly taken greate rebuke slaunder yet naught el fumishe checke spoken furye made aunswere therunto though called hym mushrome oynion yet bearing hym hande deuill aunswereth suche sorte gaue euill language againe whiche mighte worthely haue doen countermauded backe againe theyr lewde saying themselfes auoydethe courteouslye hymselfe teachynge v waye ofte haue concernyng goddes glory ofte truethe ghospell defended agaynst wicked earnest quicke sharpe often oure selfes rebuked shew selfes entle meke suche wise make au swere thynges repell auoyde thinges onely v cannot concele without hinderaunce gospell haue people vnderstande christ euery thyng procedynges deiuils auctoritie god father beyng aucthour made muche furtheraunce ghospell haue sayeth christ familiaritie deiuill doe therfore boaste selfe god beeyng father thintent woulde lye obtayne myne owne prayse father myght glorifyed emongst men albeit ye doe glorie ye haue thesame god father yet doe ye despite seke nothyng el glory ye woulde thought true wurshippers curiously seke myne owne prayse mennes handesi seke myne owne prayse c neyther doth contumeliouse wordes hurt rather worketh destruccion one couetous glorified amonges men wisheth agayne haue glorye hym eyther haue nede glorye haue expediente exchaunge death ye maye attayn saluacion trueth lyke doe muche couet myne owne glory howbeit dede glory glory father reuenger myne owne rebuke iniury yet thinke ye shall without punishmente ye haue slaundered seketh prayse glory reuenge iniury contempte except ye amende uerely verely say vnto man epe saying shall neuer see death saied iewes vnto nowe knowe thou hast deiuil abraham dead prophetes thou sayst man kepe saying shall neuer aste death arte thou greater father abraham whiche dead prophetes dead est thou thy selfe glory name ye doe profiteth nothyng sorte neyther abraham originall begynnyng stocke moses priestes pharisee ne god father shal good ye well assured hereof man obey wordes haue sayed ofte shall neuer see death onely belefe way entrie immortalitie althoughe iewes ought caulme gentle aunswere haue ben appeased great rewarde haue ben allured vnto fayth yet accordyng theyr rudenesse dooe interpretate thyng whiche spiritually spoken life soule spoken bodily lyfe whiche told instruccion sediciously marre frowardly turne reproche patriarkes studyng euerye waie procure hatred agaynst lord iesus among multitude aunswere verely thys manier haue also thy saying certayn knowlege thou art possessed deiuill wood frantike promisest thing kepe thy worde whiche manier thing patriarkes menne moste highe prayse neuer vnto whome god himselfe spake god spake vnto abraham also prophetes obedient goddes worde neuerthelesse deade thou promiseste perpetuall lyfe obserue thinges whiche thou teachestwhat makest thou thy selfe countenaunce howe dareste thou bee bolde promise thyng whiche thou haste thy selfe doeste thou promise immortalitie beyng mortall thy selfe arte thou greater oure father abraham whiche deade yea moreouer prophetes also dead durste promise suche thyng man highly doest thou presume thy selfe whome makest thou thy selfe thou preferreste thy selfe prophetes abraham promising thing god thou makest thy selfe god piesus aunswered honour selfe honour nothyng father honoureth ye saye god yet ye haue knowen know hym yf saye knowe hym shall bee lyar lyke vnto knowe hym kepe saying father abraham glad see daye sawe reioysed sayed iewes vnto hym thou arte yet fiftie yere olde haste thou seene abraham iesus sayed vnto uerely verely saye vnto ere abraham borne toke vp stone caste iesus hid himselfe wente temple lorde iesus moderate aunswere vnto fonde peuyshe reproches wherewith iewes taunted hym yet able receyue great mistery dyd trueth somewhat insinuacion open greater prophetes abraham hymselfe one might perfourme god power thyng promyse yet would appeare arrogant amonges ignoraunte tempered sayinges leste shoulde kyndle wrathe moued already sayeth attribute nothyng vntruely selfe yf shoulde manner men seeke prayse mannes hande prayse false vayne case curiouse seeke prayse glory nedefull hunte amongest men father true glory cummeth glorifyeth honoured hymit father honoureth c rebukefull woordes menne doe dishonoure thesame yf ye wyll algates knowe hym father whome ye boaste god father whose chyldre ye dede forsothe ye would recognyse embassadour yf ye true wurshippers hym ye would fauour glory bryng hym contempte whome sente worlde saluacion ye wurshippe hym false religion ye vntruely clayme vnto knowledge hym spiritual fauour knowe nothyng el carnall thynges sonne dede doe verely knowe hym thyng doe arrogancye vntruely chalenge saye whiche true yf shoulde saye knowe hym lyar lyke vnto professe knowledge god ye knowe sent hym hym came worlde therefore knowe hym thyng soeuer hath commaunded doe whosoeuer contemneth worde contemneth god whose name exercise commission embassage faithfully whosoeuer despyseth god worde neither knoweth god taketh god furthermore whereas ye neuer ceasse braggyng youre father abraham ye moste farre vnlike ye procure hatred vnto take selfe abraham better verely neyther vainly boaste mine owne greatnes diminishe dignitie saye vnto abraham whome doe rather wonder folowe great man soeuer yet glad thought happy myght lucke see daye sawe thyng whiche desired great man greatly ioyed haue daye chaunce hym yet contemne iesus dyd herein straunge saying signifie whan abraham made hymselfe ready offre sacrifice sonne isaac sawe spirite prophecie lord iesus geuen father vnto death crosse saluacion worlde yet death vtterly peryshe within three dayes reuiue againe immortall lyfe iewes yet vnderstandyng misterie doe nowe againe according theyr carnall iudgement fall hand checking supposyng iesus nother thyng man beyng borne mary thou art yet say fiftie yeres olde haste thou seen abraham died many hundred yeres agoe finally lorde iesus man prouoked theyr opprobrious woordes deale openeth vttereth lytle sparke godhed whiche knoweth tyme number yeres alwaye one course tyme lyke god father without limites tyme alwaie thus speaketh vnto moses signifyinge eternalitie nature cannot chaunge lyke maner sone vsing woordes father sayeth doe assuredly confirme vnto though yet ye wil beleue euer abraham bornethan toke vp stone caste hym woordes playne blasphemous beyng mortall man semed take vpon hym eternalitie thyng god couenient coulde withholde theyr handes toke vp stone wente hande ouerthrowe presse hym stone iesus professyng hymselfe god declare hymselfe man also gaue place fury feared theyr forcible violence whiche power kepe teache v waye time requireth trueth ghospell preached valiantly boldely executed duetie fury euill men causelesse vayne prouoked exasperate lorde iesus knewe coulde haue beate heades say grosse ignoraunte multitude disciple brought belefe therof case openly preached himselfe god man thesame mortall touching manhed also immortall touching deitie perteyning fleshe man borne virgin time touchyng diuine power haue alwaye time god god surely secrete misterie rather time conueniente perswaded worlde miracle death resurreccion ascendyng heauen inspiracion holy ghoste due tyme brought vttered open playne woordes would belue therfore iesus withdrewe hymselfe geuyng place theyr fury wente secretly forth temple acte declaryng beforehande afterwarde light ghospell beyng repelled wicked voluntary blynde iewes put ouer gentile house left desolate thought themselfes true seruauntes god obseruers true religio iesus author true godlines wente place ix chapter iesus passed sawe manne whiche blynde byrth disciple asked saying master sinne manne father mother borne blynde iesus sayed neyther hath manne sinned yet father mother workes god shewed therfore lorde iesus geue place fury yet sawe incurable falleth hande miracle declare godly power whiche coulde dryue theyr headdes perswasion woordes loe fel forthwith matter waye vnlike thynges doen temple trueth much doe blynde suche blynde soule body whiche moste vnhappy kynde blyndnesse muche also wurse although blynde yet thought themselues quicke sighted miserable also vnworthy cured somuch miser blynde man iesus sawe passed whiche man lacked onely bodily sighthe sawe man blind borne blinde maladie aboue phisicions cure yet coulde christe heale man inwarde sight sawe iyes soule iesus therfore sawe man compassion much pitying misery disciple called remembraunce christe sayd man healed palsey go hereafter sinne leste wurse thing come vpon supposing euery blemishe body come faulte soule axed christe blinde man sayed whose sinne chaunced man borne blinde none coulde sinne borne whosoeuer borne sickenes impediment body thought punished man faulte thyng yet seme equitie disciple therfore sayed maister whece came great euill felowe borne blinde whether came owne sinne parentes iesus aunswered neyther man owne sinne deserue borne blinde coulde sinne yet parentes lawe teacheth god punysheth chyldren faultes theyr parentes excepte child folowe sinnes theyr parentes blyndnesse chaunced man vpon casualtie man sinne course man life many thinges chauce many folke man misery lacke sight prohibit suffered chaunce vnto hym hym mightie power goodnesse god blinde iewes obstinately cryeth vpon declared vncurable disease famous commendable shall healing thesame must worke worke hym sent whyle daye night cummeth manne worke long worlde light worlde assoone thus spoken spatte grounde made clay spettell rubbed clay iyes blynde layed vnto hym goe washe poole siloe interpretacion asmuche saye sent wente waye therfore washed came agayne seeyng cause sent worlde eue procure glory god suche dedes cause vnfaythfull beleue woordes true thintent also whiche beleue cured blindnes must doe commaundement diligently daye yf menne haue worke hande wonte doe day night perdy vnhansome worke therfore meane tyme whyle prensent day geueth v leaue worke may cease night shall come men vaine would worke cannot long worlde light worlde men make spede finishe worke goe commoditie life night muche behoueth euery man labour haue may go thorowe busines eternall saluacion fauour wherof whatsoeuer meane season doe worlde doe thing sake saluacion thing doe folke iyes faith see acknowlege god sonne sent worlde shall within departe hence shall haue nowe worke desyre lyght vainei lyght worlde lord iesus saying couertly notise vnto present al infid litie set aparte quickely go beleue sonne god coulde long see bodily moreouer insinnate therwithall otherwyse coulde brought beliefe hearing speake seeyng worke miracle none effecte desire haue made away despised beyng present whose light beyng obiecte mennes sight shut iyes furthermore signified likewise al suche obstinate minde persist wilful blindnesse minde time menne vnrecouerable without hope amended lefte theyr owne folly vnto eternall destruccion euen aduersaunte miserye immynent ready inuade whiche calamitie wyll rather cause perishe heale ouer dyd ensigne tyme come terrible iudgemente season wicked shall couet labour aboute businesse theyr saluacion shall bee lefull night suffre muche neglected day myght haue wrought yet euery one whyle state bodely lyfe also christes ascencion heauen hath dayes lyght apostle holy scripture whiche geueth habilitie doe thyng appertayneth saluacion bodye dead daye awaye hym cannot worke thing rewarde foredoen dedes hoped vpon loked diffuse sayinges lord iesus quicken pricke forwarde feare thyng come men slowe beleue nowe disciple looked miracle iesus spatte grounde spattle duste mixed together made clay anoynted blinde man iyes clay euen therby resemblyng father rather owne worke wherein made firste manne hard clay molified licoure restore whiche loste pertayneth thesame author fyrst made thesame thynges nought purifie make whole agayne thyng corrupted power strength begette thyng borne well meane tyme noueltie plaster made theyr myndes attentiue quietely geue hede well considre miracle wrought also proued stedfast fayth blynde man whiche murmured nothyng hym anoynted hym simply obeyeth hym doeth hymselfe liste doubtyng nothyng benefyte waye euer geuen blynde dyd furthwith receyue sight soone anoynted clay commaunded goe poole siloe washe awaye clay wherewith iyes embrued thentente blynde mannes faithfull affiaunce greater fame made refusall doe commaunded noueltie straunge sight also delay whiche length iourney bryng furthmoe recordes miracle blynde manne farre temple beggyng waye syde well syloe wherof ryseth poole foote mounte syon whiche water esay speaketh complayneth water contemned water geueth manne helthe beareth figure holy scripture scripture god whe without blusteryng worldely eloquence issue furth caulmely smoothely yet bubble priuy hid caues godly wisedome haue heauenly violence remo e blyndenesse mannes mynde howe long soeuer hath continued open iyes wherwith god seen haue seen felicitie syloe syrian tongue sygnifieth sent one euen specially sente father whiche geueth lyght mennes myndes fountayne represente christe hymselfe euen presente tyme also beyng secrete power enclosed holy scripture openeth iyes blynde yf acknowledge theyr blyndenesse must made blynde receyue light christe wyse worlde farre hope heauely wisedome thinketh himselfe well sighted vouchesaueth haue iyes closed vp clay iesus cause hope lyght ghospell nowe whan blynde felowe notable knowen manne beggyng knowen also bee borne blynde wente thither commaunded doubte great croude people folowed hym wente without laughyng see iyes blurred clay twise blynde goyng water whiche name miracle euer doen therin come water washeth awaye clay iyes returneth home open iyes cleare sight pso neyghbours seen hym howe begger sayed sate begged sayed agayne sayed lyke hym hymselfe sayed euen therfore saied vnto hym howe thine iyes opened aunswered sayed manne called iesus made clay anoynted myne iyes sayed vnto goe poole loe washe nd whan went washed receiued sight sayed vnto hym sayed cannot tell brought pharisee hym litle blynd sabboth daye iesus made claye opened iyes neighboures therfore whiche knowen hym neither coulde well knowen many considering common beggar knewe face iyes sawe altered sayed whome sawe sitting temple begged waye syde sayde contrarie like hym whyle disagreed among themselues blynde himselfe sayed yes verely beggar borne blynde whome ye haue often seen thus sayed voyce also beyng knowen cause miracle better beleued say sawe blinde see see open iyes chaunced thyne iyes shut open man saieth called iesus made claye therwith anoynted mine iyes doen sayed goe thy waye poole siloe washe thine iyes wet waye washed see sekyng occasion pycke quarell lorde iesus put rebuke tempering claye anoynting iyes therwith sumwhat laboured holy daye enquire dede beggar aunswered knew knowen iesus sight onely name bryng whiche blynde man brought sight vnto pharisee shewyng thyng playnely shoulde detecte iesus hadde broken sabboth daye sabboth daye whan iesus opened blynde mannes iyes pthen agayne phariseis also asked howe receyued sight sayed vnto put claye vpon iyes washed see therfore sayed phariseis man god kepeth sabboth daye sayde man sinner suche myracles strife amongst speake blynde man agayne sayest thou hath opened thine iyes sayed prophete pharisee enquire manne againe howe came beyng blinde haue sight casting peril shewed playnly matter sayed annointed mine iyes claye tempered spattle vpon commaundement washed siloe doen receyued sight certayne pharisee hearde sayed iesus god though speake god father tooke god auctour woulde doyng suche miracle violate sabboth whiche god commaunded kepte detestable thyng breake holy sabboth daye god medleth suche one maliciously faithlesse could denye manifest dede reproue beneficiall dede borowe make shift haue quarell holines daye agayne curable sayth man beloued god detestable hym breakyng sabboth howe coulde woorke miracle matter selfe sheweth thynges dooen ayde god nowe firste miracle hath wrought sorte alteracion sondrye opinion among touchyng iesus therfore phariseis whiche assayes toke occasion reproue hym spake yet againe blynde thinkest thou saye hym opened thyne iyes thyng hunted case spoken euill iesus whiche thyng blynde man knewe theyr mynde might haue matter laye againste whiche merely good opinion iesus reported well hym woulde haue fierce againste blynde man selfe haue caste hym synagogue beggar trueth simplie withoute dreade spake thought iesus take hym sayeth prophete meanyng thatsame greate notable man heard great fame also experience power strengthe hymselfe iewes beleue man howe blinde receyued sighte vntyll called father mother hym receyued syghte asked saying sonne whome ye saye borne blinde howe dooeth see father mother aunswered sayed knowe sonne borne blynde meanes nowe seeth cannot tell hath opened iyes cannot tell olde ynough aske hym leat hym aunswer himselfe suche wordes spake father mother feared iewes iewes conspired already man dyd confesse christ shoulde excommunicate synagogue therfore sayed father mother olde ynoughe aske hym many iewes therfore whiche coulde brought beliefe thesame whiche late sate beggyng doore temple beyng borne blynde forsomuche euidentlye appeare nowe cleare sight open iyes therfore father mother called whiche coulde knowe sonne euen speciall marke nowe malicious curiositie pharisee set forwarde beliefe also commendacion thyng doenis sonne c therfore saye paretes sonne whome ye woont saye borne blind howe chaunced nowe seeth dede suche bee timorous haue small substaunce home answere warely thing saye whiche certainly know testify knowe sonne borne blind sight geuen neither knowe came himselfe shall testifie thyng assuredly old ynough aske rather v lette speake himselfe knoweth parentes sayinges ignoraunt befalle vpon childe leauer alone shoulde come daunger endaunger themselues iewes already conspired man durste professe iesus messias shoulde bee exco municate caste synagogue whiche taken matter among iewes great reproche wherof cumeth euen among professers gospel sharpest kynde punishment man swarue fro professio fal haynous cryme remoued felowship intente whiche cannot bee refourmed wholesome informacion beyng eschewed shoulde better aduised veray shame amend exaumple gentle fiercenesse whiche fitte bee exhibite vpon onely theyr enormity make themselues detestable pestilente iewes nowe turne establishement theyr tyranny lyke dyd also abuse good ordinaunces theyr owne gayne pompe darte whiche ought haue hurled euill sorte haue healed therby rather haue destroyed turne thesame weapon agaynst whiche professe christe blinde ma parentes fearyng thyng layeth vpon theyr sonnes backe enuie shoulde rise testifying trueth saye sufficiente age ye maye aske agayne call man blinde sayed vnto hym geue god prayse knowe man sinner aunswered whether bee synner cannot tell one thyng sure blinde nowe see sayed hym agayne thee howe opened thyne iyes aunswered tolde ere ye heare wherfore woulde ye heare agayne wyll ye also disciple blynde called agayne bee owne witnes aduocate bee also publisher christes renoume christes vse reuerse turne malice pharisee vnto god glorye though dede euidente partelye recorde paretes partely ye acte selfe could cloked denied yet turne awaye prayse dede christe whome hated saye thou haste sight thou waste blinde ascribe iesus vnto thou arte nothyng beholdengeue god prayse prayse god benefite know felow iesus sinner hath acquaintaunce god pharisee endeuour deuide sundre whiche coulde seperate wete glory father glorye sonne spake colourably hyde theyr owne iniquitie pretence hye godlynesse thoughe toke great care leste goddes honoure shoulde decaye dede sought theyr owne prayse thynges regarded prayse god blynde manne answeryng vnto sayinges bothe boldely aduisedly sayeth whether bee sinner let men iudge parte geue sentence therin one thyng trulye testifie founde dede blynde nowe see nowe sufficient occasion geuen pharisee eyther rebuke iesus bee cruell agaynste man whiche spoken warelye good aduisement turned backe agayne theyr former interrogatory driuing driftes euery syde beriue christ praise saye meanes open thine iyes hoping new maner framing tale thei might picke somewhat wherby perswade prayse due christe agaynst impudet shamelesse malice phariseis beggar beyng wel boldned maketh answere tolde erewhile playnelye thyng doen dede ye haue heard purpose repete thesame agayne ye enquire pure simple minde well haue already opened matter recorde haue satisfied whiche demaunded yf ye dooe aske indifferentelye dooen eftesones tell thesame dooe ye therfore diligently enquire maner dede matter throughly knowen ye also wil become disciple god worketh great thinges lyke vpon experience power many moe disciple rated sayed thou disciple moses disciple sure god spake vnto moses elowe knowe whence man aunswered sayed vnto merueylous thyng ye wot whence yet hath opened mine iyes sure god heareth sinner yf anye man wurshipper god obedient vnto wil heareth sence world began heard man opened iyes one borne blynd man god could haue doen nothing aunswered sayed vnto hym thou arte altogether borne sinne doest thou teache v cast phariseis beeyng sore prouoked beggar great affyaunce made aunswere rated wishing thyng manne extreme euill whereby themselues might bee made blessed abhominacion putting backe thyng whiche oughte haue moste hartely desyred sauyng blynde soule beggar beyng nowe euangeliste bodye pharisee saye saye vnto hym thou vngracious wretche bee thou naughtye felowes disciple disciple moses whome iesus bee comparedwe moses disciple doe deteste abhorre suche maister bee certayn god spake moses whatsoeuer teacheth v hath goddes hande teache geue eare iesus seing knowe whence came leat teache proue vnto v authoritie perchaunce beleue beggar courage boldenes dyd tyme theyr reasonyng growe increase thoughe perceiued subtill meanes went destroye iesus yet stoutely setting syde peril pleade iesus cause gathering well prouyng miracle wroughte geuyng sighte cleare ynough whence iesus came meruayle sayeth ye saye ye knowe whence iesus cannot denayed hym myne iyes open whiche shut withoute sighte borne certes thing without controuersie neither dooe ye thynke contrary god heareth desyres sinner man wurshippe deuoutly obeyeth whome religiouslye serueth hym dooeth god heare god iesus haue taken blyndnes albeit chiefe prayse geuen god yet neuertheles must nedes reuerente wurshipper god one god loueth whose desyre prayer god gaue vnto notable benefite common meane miracle whiche ye see wrought many wonderous thynges tolde god log agoe elder suche holy sinner except iesus come god except power god present coulde himselfe nothing man stregth wiche yet see doen phariseis beeyng made extreme woode courage boldnes beggar hope bee hadde poore felowe would either bee corrupted feare astonished cease preachng christ fal extremitie say vttermost could vpbrayed olde blindnesse cast teeth beggerlynesse though god hadde punished therwithall sinnes though borne wicked vngracious commeth worlde poore blind otherwise bleamished bodye thou saye arte altogether borne sinne teachest thou v knowe howe defende religion vpholde profession lawe darest thou presence great men teache diuinitie whiche go asked almes neyther suffer speake longer beyng ashamed put silence haue mouthes stopped poore ignoraunt person thrust sinagogue leude master leude disciple iesus hearde excommunicated founde hym saied vnto doest thou beleue sonne god aunswered sayed lord might beleue hym iesus sayed vnto hym thou hast seen hym talketh sayed lorde beleue wurshypped hym whome pharisaicall fiercenes thrusteth sinagogue doeth christe receiue churche bee disseuered communion wicked coupled christe bee disallowed stablishyng owne righteousnesse speake agaynste righteousnesse god bee approued alowed rebuked seking owne prayse goe darken prayse iesus moste hye prayse detestable detested derely beloued god therefore relacion made vnto iesus boldely man muche set foorth prayse behaued himselfe towardes phariseis already bruted abrode people caste reiect therefore soone iesus met make man fayth knowen al men sayeth vnto howe sayest thou felowe beleuest thou sonne god already confessed pharisee whiche greate thyng came playnely god iesus ignoraunte thereof gatte mannes open confession thereof mennes sake procuryng thereby good exaumple though blynde yet knewe iesus sighte yet hauyng great affeccion knowe mannes face whome iesus named sonne god sayeth lorde knowe hym maye beleue manne beleued iesus yea ere sawe hym voyce faythlesse man one vehemently desyred see auctour great benefite iesus therefore humble woordes signifying hymselfe personne spake sayeth vnto hym thou haste already seen hym whome thou desyreste see talketh thee whome behoueth thee beleue man vpon woordes without staying confesseth great promptnes mynde doeth beleue euen saying fell downe iesus knee wurshipped hym dede declared thought iesus pand iesus sayed vnto hym come vnto iudgemente worlde whiche see might see whiche see might made blynde phariseis hym heard wordes sayed vnto hym blynd also iesus sayed vnto ye blind ye shoulde haue synne nowe ye saye see therfore sinne remayneth iesus thentent example manne might prouoke men mindes wer present sayeth light worlde therfore came worlde course thynges mighte turned vpsyde doune muche say symilitude sleight vntrue holinesse forged knoweledge beyng disclosed whiche heretofore sawe might se whiche see might made blynde sayingi come iniudgemet c iesus noted naughty peruerse iudgement pharisee though thought onely knew religion law righteousnes yet wer foule ouerseen mean sorte people reason worldelye couetousnes darkened iudgemente mynde sely poore blinde felowe simple vnlearned likewyse bodily sight frely geuen inwardly see muche soule knowlage trueth excelled euen pharisee neither bytyng wordes scape phariseis whiche folowed iesus good minde rather seke euery syde occasion reproue hym styng saying caused marke beguiled therwith beyng nothyng altered malepert presumpcion thintent might either force lorde testifie honorably haue matter accuse vnto pharisee ordre saye vnto hym blynde also iesus doeth aunswere vnto question whiche wily capcious also presumptuouse declareth whiche thoughte themselues men great fight blinde body soule bee vncurably blyndeif ye blynde ye haue sinne thought themselues quicke sighted uerely sayeth iesus yf ye blynde woulde knowledge howe ignoraut soule ye simplicitie pardoned nowe forasmuche ye blinde dede yet ye would praysed among people learned men ye starke blinde ye cannot healed blinde manne hath obteyned sight knowledged deformitie body euen ye voluntary blynde menne blynded lustes fleshe cannot cured continue sinne infidelitie whereas vnlearned whiche firste ignoraunt trueth vpon syght miracle hearyng preache darkenes taken awaye enbraceth light trueth presumptuously taketh vpon hym knowe lawe speaketh againste principall poynte conclusion lawe blynde altogether waye men haue liued heretofore vnder shadowes waye lieth open lightwarde fayth ghospell therefore common vulgare people souer receiue sight muche thynke themselues well sighted whit ouerseen rather rude ignorauce malice whan themselues twise blinde yet professe themselues teacher people guiders blynd suche say sta ke blynde moste daungerously without recouery neyther theselues come light yet false opinion pretence learnyng holinesse seduce bryng errour pthe x chapter uerely verely say vnto entreth doore shepefolde climeth vp waye thesame thiefe murderer entreth doore shepeherde shepe hym porter openeth shepe heare voyce calleth owne shepe name leadeth whan hath f forth owne shepe goeth shepe folowe knowe voyce straunger folowe flee hym knowe voyce stra ngers albeit yet disdain enuy lord iesus allure people vnto hym withdrewe obedience phariseis priestes whiche sayed persones coulde longer defende autoritie honest meanes doe ende oure mayntaine tiranny disceites frayinges wyles traynes thretninges wicked conspiracy attendyng people commoditie fitte haue doen cosidering professed themselfes teacher guydes shepeherdes people people discommoditie sought owne commoditie iesus therfore tyme many diuerse similitude enuited men vnto hym somewhyle callyng hymselfe heauenly breade wherof dyd eate lyue ternally tyme namyng hymselfe liuely water wherof drinke conceiue hymselfe spryng water would gushe runne euerlasting lyfe tyme light worlde lighteneth mennes mindes time sonne ambassadour god father beleue obtaine eternall saluation place doeth thesame thyng parable entendyng thyng depely settle al mennes myndes hiefe head poynte mannes whole saluacion witte manne directour shepeherde people vnles hymselfe firste shepe christe true shepeherde shepe placed right hande last daye surely christes shepe membre chrste membre christe doeth preferre worlde owne honour christes glory phariseis would shepeherdes without christe therfore robber theues shepeherdes though chalenged due themselfes name hye looke solemne grauitie shepeherde iesus therfore noting sayeth one thyng assure whosoeuer entereth shepefold doore entereth force waye eyther climyng ouer enclosure diggyng walles thesame shepeherd murtherer thefe catche somewhat fraude stealth murtherer kill violence whoso entereth doore deuiseth guile shepe shepeherde hauing minde entre doore shall open doore whiche onely hath right let though shepe fearde vnknowen voyce thefe murtherer yet doe acknowledge heare mannes voyce true shepeherdes voyce albeit shepe seely simple beast dependeth ayde yet shepe doe knowe voyce shepeherde perceyue relefe quake feare voyce wulfes put feare death therfore shepeherde goyng shepefolde doore maketh shepe afearde well inough knowen behalfe knoweth shepe also name euery one beyng called doe obey voyce called theyr foode meate fle shamble killed called frendely knowen voyce thruste violence shepeherde conducteth beyng redy towardes call pasture brought folde wherin enclosed come abrode common fieldes leste runne astray true knowen shepeherde goeth flocke ye flocke foloweth goeth husht dumme eftsones entiseth folowe hym calleth shepe backe againe case wandered strayed asyde knowe theyr shepeherdes voice therat come ordre doe folowe shepeherde flocke loeth flie vnknowen knowe nother shepeherdes voice owne prouerbe spake iesus vnto vnderstode thynges whiche spake vnto sayed iesus vnto againe uerely verely saye vnto doore shepe euen many came theues murtherers shepe dyd heare doore yf man entre shall safe shall goe finde pasture parable lorde iesus sore reproue phariseis scribe priestes headman people whiche indignacion disdained many whiche leauer cleaue vnto iesus toke themselfes guide people moreouer swyne goates gaue eare men voyces truely shepe without fraude simple doeth harme knowlage voyce lorde iesus true shepeherde father beyng porter opened doore might lede obedient shepe pasture euerlastyng lyfe much phariseis vnderstand parable ment iesus vouchesafe make playne thynges whiche spoken darkely two skilles tho e make attetiue matter whiche vttered parable myght take roote deper theyr hertes heard sayeth vnto doe affirme vnto moste true thyng doore wherof haue spoken doore shepe yt saued must goe doore behoueth goe entre office shepeherd exercise funccion ynough aduentures regarding waye haue entred forceably within limites enclosure shepefolde ye churche sufficiet haue attained name dignitie shepeherde forcing howe howe many soeuer hath euil meanes haue rashely runne shepefolde god people minde feede spoyle haue entred ye doore shepeherdes theues murderer forasmuch gredy lucre crueltie rigorous tirauntes yet swine goates loue worlde haue geuen eare manier voyces shepe limited predestinate pasture eternall life desirous foode gospell haue hearde voyce knowen gospeller voyce true shepeherdes voyce soundeth nothyng shepeheardlyke lyke voyce robber rauenous woulfe tell dore healthfull entryng churche kingdo heauen whether thou wilt shepeherde shepe entre shall attain eternall health shalbe without daunger theues murderer shepehearde shall go shepefolde safe take fruicion blessed quietnes contemplacion shall go pasture practise put vre office charitie shal lacke pasture place shall matter good vpon intente maye bothe profit hymselfe good dedes repayre home agayne shepefolde fatter better likyng thus ye haue one token wherby ye maye discerne shepe goate true shepeherde false beleueth yet maketh shepeheard people ought men beware voice shal tha disclose manier one woordes haue taste goddes glorye sauoure people health owne praise gaine worldly subtiltie tiranny let shepe take hede themselues beware thefe murtherer shepehearde daungerous fameth himselfe shepeheard case voyce sufficient profe take hede theyr dedes thefe cummeth steale kyll destroye come mighte haue lyfe might haue aboundauntly good shepeherde good shepeherde geueth life shepe hired seruaunt whiche shepeherd neither shepe owne seeth woulfe comming leaueth shepe flieth woulfe catcheth scattereth shepe hired seruaunte flyeth hyred seruaunte careth shepe good shepeheard know shepe knowen myne thefe cummeth none purpose steale get himselfe vile filthy gaine harmes man flocke murderer cu meth worry destroye practise tirany vpon flocke vnto whiche haue dooen good parte duetie thre wayes therefore shalbe lefull decerne true shepeheard thefe prayecatcher entre doore saye yf dooe acknowlage whome onely hope eternall healthe speake thynges whiche agreeth doctrine god thyrdely intente directed waye thynges appartayne goddes glory saluacion people none faultes found rather father heauen haue opened doore speake thinges whiche accordeth meanyng lawe whiche agreable father heauen yf doe hunte lucre mine praysei good shepehearde obeying father pleasure thirst nothyng el al folkes health vnderstande ye true shepehearde acknowlage ye founder voyce desyre study auaunt themselues shepeheardes goe aboute verely euen get themselues commoditie discommodities fare best whan flocke fareth wurst haue entred doore came none thing diseased shepe bee healed dead liue quicke shoulde fatted kynde vertues taken good shepehearde liueth dede reuenewes yearely profites come shepe whiche purloyneth nothyng nothyng deuoureth euangelicall shepehearde ferre passeth vpright dealyng doeth onely spoyle thefe doeth onelye teare piece praie catcher doeth also bestoweth owne life defend shepe farre would gayne sake hurt flocke put trust withal lose hath taken hand kepe therfore sort braggue vpon theyr beyng shepherdes woulfes shepeherdes ye demaunde exaumple profe good shepherde good shepherde whiche onely selfe seke commoditie flockes harme also dooe frely geue myne goodes yea lyfe resiste theim come againste flocke endammage greue dooe shepe one frende doe another cannot shepherde vnlesse pure singular profite priuate commoditie except also set euen owne life naught whan time flocke standeth ieopardy ther many thinges make incursion health flocke therfore true shephearde herte careth flocke none skill lou th flocke redy commaundemente gaue flocke kepte safe nye shorne spoyled slayn worried defendeth health shepe euen losse owne lyfe contrary hierelinge hath taken ouersight flocke owne aduauntage yet although doe rightlye gouerne rule flocke while al thinges caulme quiet yet hange ieopardye life thereupon see woulfe prease vpon furyously betrayeth shepe leaueth flocke woulfe scattered abrode pece meale worried saueth owne lyfe runnyng awaie cause nothing el hired seruaut shepeherd true charitie hath respecte rewarde whereas consideracion reward hath place either charitie vnperfite charitie duetie doen doen good wyll true shepehearde would dooe thyng moste requireth naturall shepehearde tha ye flocke deceitfully betrayed while hired shepeherde runneth awaye hath considered matter worldly iudgement counteth better man flocke perishe himselfe come perill life yet maner men deale better whiche playe woulfes themselues flocke vnder false title shepeheardes whiche tyme prosperitie doeth right faythfully take hede theyr flocke yet great daunger leaue traiterously flocke woulf disperpled abrode torne piece fantasieth thus case thei go wracke haue losse therby wage safe though lose deale therof rather lose cope fight woulfe another mannes cattell shal another flocke foud whiche shall bee hyred haue ouersight thoughe maister flocke loose neyther doeth death flocke greue hyred man mynd happeneth owner hath losse thing entierely loueth flocke cummeth destruccion whiche mighte haue bene saued therfore meruayl though euangelike shepe knew voyce like shepeherdes shepe faute lewde shepherdes blame disdained whome father draweth folow forsakyng hyred shepherdes theues murderer feele perceiue maner wayes good shepeherde euen spend lyfe therfore know shepe comitted father al whose goodes mine syde shepe drawen inspiracion father acknowlageth shepeherd loueth foloweth hym knowing right well hope saluacion father knoweth euen know also father geue lyfe shepe shepe haue folde also must bring shal heare voice shal one folde one shepeherd therfore doeth father loue put life might take againe man taketh put away self haue power put haue power take againe commaundement haue receiued father father knoweth owne naturall sonne obeying wil thynges agayne know father desyreth menne shoulde saued commaundemet bestowe life safetie shepe whiche hathe geuen haue saued thyng wyll dooe worlde shepherd shall haue power harme yet prince world deuil kepe shepe whol soud geue selfe death meannes abate woulfes violence deliuer obedient shepe chawes doeth fully content father wil charitie saue shepe alone whiche beyng people israell hath geuen saued first cure reacheth bee also nacions shepe scattered daungier snare woulfes theues murderer neyther rest vntil bring also common shepefold although heare voice moses prophetes yet shal knowe geue eare voyce meane suche ordayned saluacion countrey dooeth exclude saluacion whosoeuer heareth voyce sonne god true shepeherd shalbe saued hitherto flocke god hath bene scattered multitude false shepeherdes doeth promise saluacion euery one hath voyce one calleth waye waye meane whyle flocke destitute scattered dyuers wayes perisheth soone shall heare wyll knowe voyce true shepeherde shall come together partes worlde shall made one folde moe shepeherdes one without folde cannot saued dooethe acknowlage thys shepeherd shal goe perdicion lest happen fault throughly play good shepeherde lose lyfe clerely decay fatheri geue life shepe c thoughe thyng create doe peryshe hath nede nothing mere charitie towardes mankynde sente hys sonne saue menne coulde thesame mynde father therfore doeth derely loue hys owne sonne hired manne myne owne good bestowe lyfe health father flocke muche vnlyke would hurt flocke withal seke myne owne comoditie amongest men great loue one ieopardie towardes daungier imminente doeth priuely steale awaye doe free good geue selfe deathe lyeth wayte haue lyfe well theyr malice could preuaile agaynste excepte determyned myne owne free dye saluacio mine folke truth mind murther yet could kyl vnlesse would selfe therfore shal take life willyngly yelde vp redeme shepe wt death euerlasting lyfe doe beleue shall willingly geue selfe vnto death except take agayn willingly left lyfe euen myn power herein consisteth prayse true shepeherde hys free offereth death flockes helth lieth owne power eschew death list man power could take lyfe wili put life fro yt might take againe geue willingly flockes saluacyon dye would dead reuiue though may wickedly kill himselfe yet cannot reuiue hys bodye agayne lyfe gone haue power doe sende foorth lyfe bodye call agayn selfe sayd body case seme thyng incredible vnto manne shoulde willingly redeme mannes lyfe owne death say thought father sente worlde waye weorke feate mannes saluacion willingly gladly doe obey commaundement whose wil mine one hath geuen power perfourme discencion therfore agayne among iewes sayinges many sayd hath deuil madde heare ye sayd wordes hath deuil deuil ope iyes blind ierusale feast dedicacion winter iesus walked temple euen salomon porche came iewes rounde sayde vnto long doest thou make v doubt thou christ tell v playnly iesus tolde long tale thinges straunge vnhearde far aboue common capacitie men fel newe iar opinion among people sayde whiche already many tymes sayed whensoeuer disclosed theyr secrete conspiracy spake thyng aboue power manne hath deuyll saye madde wordes whiche speaketh lacke common sence pleasure heare felowe againe folke el sayde suche man wordes deuils daunger woordes smelleth power god specially muche deedes agreable wordes wordes suche dedes speaketh thinges farre passing man wit doth thinges far excede man power mad man possessed deuil open blinde men iyes ye propertie deuils put one iyes seeth geue fyght borne blind cummeth power god forasmuche euident thyng doen hym hys talke cannot procede noysome deuil whose dedes appereth playne come beneficiall god lorde iesus maketh aunswere thys altercacyon teachyng v way wieked alway striuen wordes dedes rather bee declared dooe woordes sumtimes place bee geuen furie eiuil sorte moderate temperaunce ghospell tyme bee forgotten thys feastful daye ministred newe matter sette hande dispute hym agayne solemne feaste whiche call dedicacyon temple temple reedefyed repayred exile made hierusalem persian neyther iesus absent feasteful daye newe maker law new temple say churche chefe deuyser maister woorkes winter full mere tyme theyr myndes whiche throughe loue colde lawe dyd burne loue ghospell therfore iesus nowe inner parte temple walked porche ioyneth temple called salomon temple intent place shoulde declare peacemaker presente whiche shoulde reconcyle thynges heauen earth walked truely aucthor lawe ghospel moses lawe nowe poynte cease iewes therefore leste escape theyr handes came rounde whyle walkyng sore moued many sayinges dooynges neyther dyd well agree among themseluesyf thou bee christ tel v playnly maliciously fynding faulte al thing gathering hys dedes wordes certain thing honored aboue mannes power set vpon hym woordes howe long wilt thou kepe v doubtful mynde therewith sette people rore thou bee verye messias whome looke tell v openly without colour iesus aunswered tolde ye beleue workes doe father name beare witnes ye beleue ye shepe sayd vnto shepe heare voyce know folow geue vnto eternal life shal neuer perishe neyther shal man plucke hande father whiche gaue greatter man able take father hande father one although iesus ignoraunt dyd demaunde peruerse mynde thing whiche oftentymes hearde myght also haue perceiued doinges yet maketh gentle aunswere desyrous enstruct angre nedeth sayth often speake selfe tell namely forasmuch doe openly testifie trueth ye call recorde therof arrogancie haue already tolde ye woulde beleue yea though ye dooe credite woordes yet ye cannot ignoraunt thyng whiche ye desyre knowe surer profe dedes ye see doynges selues doe witnesse doe father deuilles doe misreporte actes worthie bee imputed god beleue sente god ye dooe neyther beleue dedes woordes whereof cause owne corrupte suspiciouse mynde meane well playnelye bee polluted naughtynesse thys worlde beeleue woordes lyke good shepe knowe voyce good shepeherd semblably knowlage shepe though worlde poore sely thinges ye therfore doe knowledge voyce ye number shepe whose simplicitie lightely taughte youre myndes swollen ambicion leuened malice enuie corrupted infected couetousnes sundrie affeccions worlde defyled whiche vice ye would purge minde verely euen also heare voice neither doe without benefit first al ye therby auoide death hangeth ouer rebel agaynst sonne god moreouer ye shall obteyne therby euerlasting life trueth shepe simple vnlerned soeuer iudgement worlde long doe knowleage shepeherde folow gyde dooe liberalitie get euerlasting life taken worlde men great felicitie goe euerlastyng death symple shepe harmelesse weake lacking worldely succour world riseth engiens force aduersarye shall haue greate power shall hable take handes world hath auctoritie phariseis dignitie priestes hath armed kynges hye magistrate iudges place iudgement prisones cheines roddes ax broddes pricke exile deathes whatsoeuer wont bring feare yea euen stedfast myndes syde hath rich pleasure dignity honour soeuer wont corrupt vncorrupt myndes world vseth engine plucke shepe handes beeyng theyr protector gouernour man shall hable take awaye thyng soeuer worlde shal goe shall commodiouse shepe turne father glorye fyght agayne weapon poyson counter geue rebuke rebuke without suche defence shall yet new way haue victorye father c greater al cthat defence alone whiche father hath geuen defende shepe withall greater force wepons wherewithall world shal ryse agaynst myne neyther father forsake shepe thyng lyeth doe lyeth also father doe power world force thing handes whiche dooe thynges nodde neyther thyng pull handes hath taken kepe exact companionship power betwene father full consent throughly one one power one nill iewes agayn toke vp stone stone withal iesus aunswered many good woorkes haue shewed father doe ye stone iewes aunswered saying thy good weorkes sake stou thee thy blasphemie thou man makest thy selfe god iewes sore moued sayinges content often namyng hys father whose defence promised great thynges tooke vp stone stone iesus yet set vpo time yet come whiche determined dye saluacyon mankynde assayeth assuage mitigate theyr furie gentle woordes people accustomed take vp stone theyr handes sayth openly punishe euil doer common malefactours haue doen nought el bestowed benefites father liberalitie haue better enstruct erred haue comforted affliccion haue fedde ye hungrie haue restored one handed haue made cleane leprouse haue healed sicke haue driuen away deuils menne haue set fo e diseased palsey nowes shrounken haue put awaye feuers disease malady haue called dead lyfe agayn whole power auctoritie father hath geue hath bene bestowed succour hath bene frely employed comoditie al thinges yt one thing ye thinke worthy stoning good liberall stoned doen naughtie folke harmful iewes brought conclusion poynte eyther muste bring furthe faulte agaynste hym clies aknowlage theyr owne folye leste shoulde haue pretext hyde theyr furie withall say wont stone man good weorkes sake count thee woorthy bee stoned horrible crime moste greate euen blasphemye thys thyng folowe auctoritie lawe commaundeth ouerthrowen stone suffer longer thou man makest thy selfe god hauyng eftsones god thy father thy mouthe though al child god though thou newe peculiar waye god sonne thou thy father may parteners thynges take certayn godhead vpon thee forasmuche one god manne euer therefore taketh vpon felow god power iniurious god maiestie rebel iesus aunswered written law sayd ye god ye cal god vnto whome worde god spoken scripture cannot broken co cerning whome father hath sanctified sent vnto worlde doe ye say blaspheme sayd sonne god workes father beleue doe ye beleue beleue workes ye may knowe end beleue father lorde iesus dooeth suche moderacion make aunswere vnto thys faulte layed charge clearelye auoyded sinne blasphemie also terrible woordes engreue theyr frowardnes yet great sobrietie defend due whiche ought denye woulde haue vnknowen v sayth lay blasphemie charge name god father greatter thing writte lawe euen psalmes haue sayd ye al god sonnes hie god himselfe geue prayse dignitie name vnto whome woorde god spoken onely calling child god god yet maiestie one god harmed thing vntrue whiche declared holye scripture howe ye stretche faulte blasphemie doe say sonne god whome father hath sanctified sent vnto world sonne al obteine holynesse comunicacion betwene god man make men god chyldren god thing borne say god sonne whiche woorde god selfe god came worlde hath coumpany thinges presumpteouse thyng take vpon woordes thyng verely beseemeth many aucthoritie scripture conuenient iudge selfe dedes name ought haue dedes dooe proue aboue man haue proofe godly power beleue sonne god god agree throughly al poyntes ye see god father shew furth power though algates ye geue faithe wordes yet least beleue dedes ye see iyes take arrogant doe perfourme dedes take vpon woordes ye would consider thinges pure simple mindes come passe ye would geue fayth wordes doubte father father bothe one sociate adherent together naturally vnseparably while woorketh whatsoeuer doe swarue alter exaumple commaundemente muche whiche beleueth hym beleueth whosoeuer speaketh agaynst hym speaketh agaynst agayn went take escaped theyr handes went away agayn beyond iordane place iohn baptised abode many resorted vnto sayde iohn miracle thinges iohn spake man true many beleued iewes hearde sayinges therwith angred wherwith dede ought haue bene refourmed goe lay handes hym accomplishe thyng whiche already often attempted vayne iesus escaped oute theyr handes declaryng thereby wel willyng suffer time come therfore iesus taught sufficientlye geueth place tyme theyr vncurable fury wet ouer beyond iordane place iohn begun first baptise haue sayd afterward chaunged place baptised water sichem iesus abode deserte one lothed extremely hated sinnefull wickednes city many came also thither vnto place yt ioyned nye therevnto whose myndes fame bruted iesus sermon miracle yt heard sene inflame truth place brought furthwith mynde compare iesus alreadye shewed tryall profe himselfe wt iohn whome knowen wha remembred iohn bene highe auctoritie yet dooen nothing el preached baptisme penaunce without dooyng anye miracle gotten himselfe greate estimacyon among multitude thought christ side iesus shewing furth many miracle declared power greater man strengthe yt often put scribe phariseis silece prudent piththie aunswers finally iohn himselfe often testifyed highly iesus confessing openly himselfe worthie leuse latchet shoe iewes say consideryng thinges thys saying among themselues iohn say wroughte miracle credite iewes much therfore ought faith geuen man woderful seldome sene miracle gathereth winneth faith wordes albeit iohns recorde man heretofore litle beleued yet matter selfe declareth recorde true much saide iesus hath accomplished mo thinges iohn promised man behalfe therfore partely iohns relacions sake whose reporte slender auctoritie among iewes partly wordes ful godly wisedome partly dedes sake beare witnes diuyne power many beleued iesus verye messias while yet phariseis scribe priestes styl continue persiste theyr frowarde malyce p xi chapter certayn man sicke named lazarus bethania towne mary sister martha marie anointed iesus oyntment wiped fete heate whose brother lazarus sicke therfore sister sent vnto saying lord beholde whome thou louest sicke whan iesus hearde sayde infiemitie vnto deathe prayse god sonne god mighte bee praysed reason furthwith occasion offered whereby christes glory father shoulde highly renowmed withal malice phariseis prouoked murther made abode iordane chauced certain called lazarus lay sicke towne bethania sicke ma twoe sister marie marthaes countrey furthermore mary ye notable profe loue towardes iesus precious oyntmente anointed head sitting feast heare wiped fete washed teares wherof came great amitie betwene lorde iesus familie therfore whe lazarus greuous sickenesse perill sister trusting vpon acquayntaunce iesus sendeth shewe frendes dysease doubtyng would merueylouse getlenes towardes folke helpe frende daunger behold say whome thou louest sicke thought inough signifie thing loued manne therefore made intercession whome iesus made answere sickenes vnto death god hath suffered fall vpon hym occasion god sonne shoulde glorifyed putting awaye sickenesse theyr godly power iesus loued martha sister lazarus hearde therfore sicke abode two dayes still place sayde disciple let v go iewrie disciple sayd vnto maister iewes lately sought stone thee wilt thou goe thither agayn iesus aunswered twelue houres day man walke day stumbleth seeth light worlde man walke night stumbleth light iesus verely loued martha mary theyr brother lazarus yet suffered fall sickenes also dye lest shoulde thinke vnsemely thing tyme good folke right holy menne bee punyshed misery world god dissembling either bicause expedient suffer el helpeth set furth glory god god doeth man harme procure hys owne glory man sake wont turne eiuels chaunseth v lawe man state condicion casualtie saluacyon hys owne glory knewe right well frendes sickenes yea tolde yet fit disciple mindes prepared made redy great miracle come therfore report made iesus frendes disease furthwith goe thence taried still two dayes place verayly neglecting daunger hys frendes looking large matter worke miracle wherwithal himselfe sone dye might lift vp mindes disciple weake feble yet hope resurreccion disciple kepyng silence feare late escaping handes iewes thought safe deserte iesus sayd vnto let v go iewrie whe disciple heard iewry named remembryng howe vengeable cruell phariseis hatred cowardes often taken vp stone cast ofte endeuored themselues apprehende hym disciple saye stoode dreade onely theyr maisters harme also theyr owne yet receiued holy ghost bare certayne worldely affeccion towardes iesus themselues lykewise feblenes lothyng death therefore dissuading goyng agayne iewrie say sir haue forgotten agoe iewes would haue stoned vnlesse ye secretely withdrawen youre selfe goe thither agayne puttyng selfe open daunger iesus coumforte theyr fearefulnesse parable signifying nothing dredde cleane christ light worlde night hath vayn feares daye knoweth suche terrours hathe daye sayeth christe twelue houres night shall come tyme meane tyme whosoeuer walketh daye stumbleth sunne maketh see eschewe stumblyng sunne beeynge taken awaye whosoeuer walketh night stumbleth lacketh light light worlde right mete guided folow conductyng goe lighte afrayde tyme long geue light vnto ieopardie night shall come whe beeing disseuered shall bee troubled pthis sayd sayd vnto frende lazarus sleapeth got wake slepe sayd disciple lord slepe shal doe well inough howbeit iesus spake hys death thought spoken naturall slepe sayd iesus vnto playnly lazarus dead glad sake ye may beleue neuertheles let v goe vnto iesus saying mitigate apostle feare sheweth cause goyng furth iourney saying frende lazarus sleapeth therfore go hence wake disciple troubled feare supposed iesus dyd speake deathe common slepe aunswer sir slepe cause goe thither slepe sicke folke woont bee token recouery health disciple wer loth go iewry therfore vttermost theyr power doe auoyde cause going thither iesus litle litle prepare myndes earnestly consyder beholde miracle come therfore leauer say fyrst aslepe dead entente might vsage holye scripture shewe hope resurreccion rather aslepe dead whiche reste lyue agayne neyther easy v awake hym sleapeth lorde call dead lyfe therefore discyples vnderstandyng thyng spake sleape waking sleape let know hidde thyng vnknowen himlazarus dead glad sake c sayth vnto playnly lazarus dead added thing stoute spoken concerning raysing vp agayn woulde rather signifyed expressed hys mynde rather dooe thyng promyse euery makyng readye v exaumple modestye temperaunce aunswered tolde hym frende sicke sickenes deadly chaunced entente goddes glorye hys sonnes also shoulde bee set furthe lyke thyng sheweth disciple saying glad frede sicke dyed youre cause reioyce youre truste whiche perceyue bee weake yet may bee strengthed confirmed euident miracle sicke man mended recouered healthe present might haue bene thought casualtie case hys sister requestes raysed hym bene newly dead phariseis whiche fynde faulte thynges mighte haue layed bene lacking sens swouning death sumtimes happeneth disease body lying long time swoune come lyfe agayn asmuche death dede shal plenteouse matter beliefe therfore let v go going thither pleased disciple feare iewes feare slacke sore theyr mindes yet coulde improue godly weightie cause iourney albeit iesus ignoraunt thing troubled myndes disciple though also swaged theyr dreade reason sayed shoulde goe bethania hierusalem yet neuerthelesse nyenesse place feared made also theyr timorouse myndes afrayd sayed thomas called didimus vnto disciple let v also may die hym went iesus foud lien graue tower day already bethanie yt vnto hierusalem fiftene furlonges many iewes came martha marie coumfortt ouer theyr brother disciple carefull pensyfe yet durste refuse maisters commaundement thomas whome grekes cal didimus latine named geminus twinne timorouse rest sayeth vnto felowes let v also goe certaynly thus dye muche determinate mynde bring bothe himselfe manyfeste peril lyfe wheras may deuise bothe shall safetie iesus went furth hys disciple bethania founde lazarus lyen hys graue fower dayes alreadye uerily bethania fiftene furlonges hierusalem thereof came discyples feare thereupon also arose occasion caused miracle haue moe witness lokers vpon nighnes place caused many come thither hierusalem euen fauoure beare marie martha neyghbourlye duetie coumforte deathe theyr brother whiche kinde office duetie wont doen riche folke euen honour sake martha assone hearde iesus cumming went met marie sate stil house sayde martha vnto iesus lorde thou hadste bene brother dyed neuerthelesse know whatsoeuer thou askest god god geue iesus sayth vnto thy brother shall rise agayne martha sayeth vnto knowe shall rise agayne resurreccion last day martha diligently bestirred wente thinges diligence one tolde iesus come nyghe hande spede went mete hym marie kept still house martha therefore within sight iesus vpon ryght good hope conceiued brother called life doleful voice sayd vnto lord thou hadst bene brother bene dead thou couldeste soone haue healed woorde although dede thing yet euen present vtterly without hope know thyng soeuer thou askest god deny nothing although thou wouldest aske life hym dead buried sayinges spoken martha minde neither vtterly despayre yet fully beleue therfore confirme beliefe iesus sayed vnto good coumforte thy brother shal ryse agayne neither promise satisfye marthaes minde siely piteouse hope brother rysing agayne coulde feare matter afrayd verilye lyke aunswered messenger saying sickenes deathlyke doubtefull aunswere beguiled nowe lykewise mistery wordes disapoynt deceiue hope knowe sayeth brother shal ryse agayne shall bee laste daye shall ryse agayne iewes namely phariseis secte beleued bee generall resurreccyon iesus sayeth vnto resurreccion lyfe beleueth yea though dead yet shal liue whosoeuer liueth beleueth shall neuer dye beleuest thou sayde vnto ye lorde beleue thou arte christ sonne god whiche come worlde iesus therefore woman affiaunce opinion hym litle litle greater thynges might declare himselfe onely could obteyn prayer god lyfe dead thing redde ofte bee dooen holy men fountayne selfe authour lyfe already geuen bee geuen thynges death feared putteth theyr confidence hope forasmuche thoughe deathe chaunce nothyng hurte hym cleaueth fast fountayne lyfe iesus saye vpon consideracions aunswereth martha thys wise thou beleueste martha prayer may obtayne father lyfe thy brother whiche deade thou beleueste thy brother shall bee restored lyfe agayne shall last day yea thou must beleue also shal ryse last daye shall haue lyfe man hath lyfe gifte neyther restored lyfe agayne onely touchyng death body muche feared concernyng death soule also whiche feared soule liueth liueth reuiuing soule reuiueth fountayne resurreccion lyfe cleueth fayth although bee dead bodye yet shall lyue take thys saying onely spoken thy brother generally man woman soeuer hath faythful affiauce shall dye euerlastingly although body lyuelesse lye rest tyme martha beleuest thou thyng saye martha beeyng thys tyme altogether myndeful haue brother reuiued againe geueth apre aunswere iesus saying yet confesse generally hiely iudged saying lorde doe beleue beleue thou arte messias sonne liuing god beeing promised prophetes many hundreth yeres looked art come worlde assone sayd went waye called marie sister secretly saying maister come calleth assone heard arose quickly came vnto iesus yet come towne place martha met iewes house comforted sawe marie rose vp hastely woure folowed saying goeth vnto graue wepe martha vpon wordes commaunded returne home agayne call sister marie lamentable mourning already aswaged doth nowe leaue iesus goeth al chearefull full good hope home sister calleth secretly throng suche sette rounde prieuely telleth eare ioyfull thyng saying master come calleth assone marie knew iesus come saw sister chearefull good coumfort selfe also conceiued good hope although iesus semed haue come alredy late whome therfore dyd often call messenger thoughte inoughe knewe frendes perill committyng thynges hys arbinement marie supposing cuming nought without delaye rose vp goe mete entre house expedient better bestowing miracle yt shewed fitte many phariseis shoulde present although came duetie priuate frendeship sake se marie yet dyd hate iesus surely woulde haue folowed marie case knowe howe went mete iesus therefore iewes marie house coumfort hir saw great hast arose vp wente furth house folowed hir suspectyng vpon soden pangue brunte heuynesse woulde haue gooen graue wepe hir belly full saciate sorowful harte teares marie come iesus sawe cummeth nye vnto feete sayth vnto lord thou hadst bene brother bene dead iesus therfore sawe wepe iewes also weping came groned spirit troubled himselfe sayd haue ye laied sayd vnto lorde come see iesus wept sayed iewes behold loued hym sayde coulde whiche opened iyes blinde haue made also man shoulde haue dyed marie went furth founde iesus yet vnentred within walles towne abode place martha late met tarried marie whome commaunded called hym chosyng place fitte weorke miracle graue far place maner make dead men sepulchre nye hye wayes marie come thither assone euer sawe iesus dede woefull fell downe feete spake weping thing hir syster sayde lord sayth thou haddest bene due time brother bene dead bene without miserable weping waylyng iesus seeing marie altogether heuinesse iewes lykewise folowed wepyng withall dyd reason stande disputacion dyd sister martha whome talked aparte people remoued asyde neyther dooeth promyse thyng nowe place tyme performe dede whiche promysed martha iesus say firste al groned spirite troubled euen shew truth manhoode ready anon bryng furth sygne hys diuine power godhead fayned affeccions lothsome mynde himselfe troubled good skill tooke vnto hym mocyons mynde whiche came infirmitie nature consente reason neyther al one cause wept iesus troubled bewayled death body certayn worldely naturall affeccyon iesus rather mislyked lothed mennes sinnes whereby many soules shoulde peryshe dysquyeted throughe inuincible dyffydence iewes wepte theyr frendes bodelye death selues touchyng soule subiecte eternall deathe yet dyd wepe themselues iesus desyred men reuiue deathe indignacion hys doctryne miracle deathe loste many one therefore horriblenes spirite trouble mynde countenaunce iyes whole habite bodye genen manifest profe hys manhoode teachyng also waye behoueth yelde bee subdued suche affeccions called away thynges vertue turmoyle mind beeyng refrayned stayed iesus sayde haue ye layed hym ignoraunt therof remoue suspicion disceyt myracle kinsfolkes aunswereth lorde come see aunswere proued graue far nowe sight graue sorow ben renuediesus wept iesus wept groning trouble went token sorow force entred hys mynde teares bloud minde already wounded ouercome teares came mind ouercome bestowed vpon lazarus dead v beleue man also learne death soule bee pitied lamented whiche yet men doe suche sorte abhorte bewaile iewes supposing iesus suche moode nought elles death hys frende whome acquaynted behold say enterely loued lazarus dead wepeth sort yet nothing kinne would haue layed charge rebuke teares wherwith testifyed meane common loue towardes lazarus sayng dyd thys felowe late geue sight blinde beggar wt acquaintaunce made great frende die case wil doe dooeth nowe signifye teares loue cummeth season could doe thing easie doe feat difficultie dooen phisicion manye tymes saueth sicke man lyfe neuer gaue sight yt borne blind piesus therfore againe groned himselfe came graue caue stone layed iesus sayed take ye away stone martha sister dead said vnto lord time inketh hath bene dead fower day iesus sayth vnto saied vnto thee thou didst beleue thou shouldest se glory god toke away stone place bene dead layed iesus nowe nye graue declare playnly horrible state manne hath alreadye lyen long synne howe great repentaunce howe many teares nedeful throughe god mercy may penitentely returne lyfe innocencie dyd grone agayne fared euill hymselfe exemplyfying hymselfe verely thyng whiche ought exhibite v eftsones repente v euilles returne wherin haue long tyme nusseled selues nowe come graue verely caue whose mouthe closed stone layed vpon made much beliefe miracle exclude suspicyon inchauntment delusion beliefe therof certayne sure thyng dooen handes hys frendes iesus owne handes hys disciple frendes suspect fraude illusion iesus turned sayed take awaye stone playne meanyng martha sister dead man also set furth made certentie miracle forgetting iesus promised wepyng heuinesse sawe iesus come agayne olde mynde affeccyon conceiued almost certayn diffidence uerely feared lest stone beeyng taken awaye styncke deade bodye shoulde offende theyr nose stode considering general resurreccion rayse men body already many hundreth yeres turned duste coulde rayse dead bodye euen newlye putrifyed tell thus thynking sayd lord tyme stinketh hath bene dead fower dayes iesus therefore litle rebuke styrre vp vnconstaunt wauering woman fayth saying hast thou forgotten tolde thee euen thou diddest beleue shoulde come passe thy brother death god glorifyed al therefore depending staying expectacion vpon hope newe woonderfull miracle stone lorde iesus commaundement remoued pand iesus lift vp iyes sayed father thanke thee thou hast heard howbeit know thou dearest alwayes people stand sayde may beleue thou hast sent thus spoken cryed loude voyce lazarus come furth dead came furth bounde hande foote graue clothes face bound napkin iesus sayd vnto leuse let goe furthwith theyr myndes iyes pawsing men doubte lord iesus lifting vp iyes teache v therby yt whatsoeuer great thing dooe ought referre god authour thereof withall declare vnto stander himselfe goddes power doe thing euer doe saide father thanke thou hast heard desyre vncouth time thing knowe forasmuche thy myne one thou dooeste alwaye heare aske thing neither wil thing yt thou willest thys prayer make people stande thencent whe haue sene miracle may beleue doe al thinges earth thy also sent worlde set furthe glory thy name amongest men spoken thus hys father calleth dead man name saying lazarus come furth could euen becke alone haue made hym buryed reuy e come graue great sterne voyce token great power wherwith sinfull soule far syghte god beeyng buried darkenesse sinne rotten filthinesse enorme crymes maye ryse agayne come furth light trueth without delay dead buryed came byan voyce called vpon theyr iyes came foorth hys body sounde whole trueth came ye clothes vpon hym buried al might know thesame man whome buried apparell thre dayes corse wont doen withall feete tyed lystes handes bounde sepulchre bandes hys face also bound napkin nowe thys wunder dead corse dyd quiuer styrre litle litle shewe likelihod life returning parte happeneth whome rede raysed life good holy men thys man bene dead fower day space came sodaynly lyfe agayn commaundement woorde make miracle seme greater tied harde fast bounden sodeinly cumeth furth abrod ye depe secret place caue lest thyng shoulde wante full perfecte beliefe miracle iesus sayde mannes frendes use let hym goe hys mouyng lustie quicke pace maye declare manne doth onely liue hath also health iesus could haue made bandes haue lewsed theyr owne accorde sith theyr seruice throughly al thinges al wayes proues excluded suspicion forgeyng thynge confirmed certayntie miracle twoe sister aduertised iesus beyng absent theyr brother sickenesse men absence iesus man dyed buried kept till stonke withall mourned solemne recourse muche people sister themselues tolde iesus hys death shewed graue muche people waityng vpon hym stone taken away men handes menes handes lewsed came foorth graue nothyng left vnfaithfull coulde lay excuse neither iesus wrought notable miracle speake stoute word checke reproue people accustomed maner slaundre fynd faulte miracle requireth thanke lazarus systers many iewes came marye seen thynges iesus beleued hym sum went way phariseis tolde theim iesus doen gathered hie priestes phariseis counsell saied doe man dooeth many miracle let escape thus al men beleue hym romaynes shall come take away bothe ou e towne people therefore many came frendly duetie martha marie lazarus sister seene notable miracle beleued yt iesus messias stacke doctrine power wherof sawe theyr face bee greate effectuall truely returnyng home hierusalem shewed phariseis thinges iesus dooen litle bethania therfore thys great acte beyng exceadyng wonderous hearde ye bishop phariseis euident declaracion god power ought haue wurshipped iesus haue bene ioyous god behalfe styrred prickes enuie cannot beare longer cause thyng seme lawefully dooen call wieked counsayl wherein consult emong themselues way meanes maye resiste suche great daungiers albeit respect priuate wealth sickenes soule set woodnes iesus beneficiall towardes al men yet wil thys matier apperteyn vnto health preseruacion people aduyce say dooen manne dooeth many wonderful thynges excedeth daily miracle suffer goe hath begun come passe lyke many people doeth thinke hiely hym within awhyle al wil take messias whiche thyng yf hap brute therof cum romaine wit nacion iewes hath forsaken emperour fallen new king theyr owne whiche romaynes well knowe late certayn kynge hath loked iewes whiche shoulde set nacion libertie romaine make cruell warre agaynst v al prophane gentile shall kepe force thys holy place mannes slaughter make hauocke destroy whole flocke iewes one named caiphas hie priest yere said vnto ye perceiue nothing consider expedient v one man die people people perishe spake himselfe highe priest yere prophecied iesus dye people people gather together one ye childre god scattered abrod whereas aduice vnder pretence publike health tended destruccion iesus christ thautour health yet thoughte vnto cayphas slender deuice weake counsell bishop yeare dignitie thoughe within whyle shoulde fayle altogether ceassed continuall roume beyng benefice sette sale fined euery yere prynces therfore professed selfe chiefe prelate religion wieked blameth cowardship deliberate counsell debate matter whether iesus put death nay whereas thought thynges set aparte dooen incontinently spede sayeth sitte deliberatyng whether thys felow doeth suche thynges put execucyon seme wey matter ye consider howe profitable expedyent euery man thys one dye people rather saued al people perishe saying came byshops owne mynde vngracious full murder reason office priestehode whiche bare spirite prophecie dyd bryng foorthe godly prophecie mouth wi ked man sayd prophecie geue foreknowledge come passe iesus death redeme saue iewes onelye bryng thys effecte suche iewes dydde beleue shoulde saued alone also among gentile whiche lyued diuers countreys dispersed wholle worlde thys ende apoynted shoulde made child god fayth ghospell might counite together man de manne ethiope greke scithian britan ioyne together felowship common vniuersall churche day furth toke counsel together put death iesus therfore walked openly among iewes went way thence countrey nighe wildernesse citie whiche called ephraim continued disciple therfore phariseis stablished voyce wieked bishop doe theyr hertes certaynly determine thyng often attepted occasion serued rid iesus way meanes possible though therby well prouided preseruacion common weale agayne leste theyr vngracious act shoulde lesse sinfull coulour impietie supposing found matter stiere prouoke al people likewise openly lawe put iesus death hurtefull man whole nacyon iewes neyther neded thought fault new cause lay hys charge iesus
