therfore nothyng hid although rumoure people aduertise phariseis priestes pretenced malyce shewyng himselfe man al ye iury came abrode leste increase fury conueied himselfe farre bondes citie ierusalem killer prophetes went citie ephraim wherunto deserte nye signifying dede wicked iewes forgoe synagogue newe people sticke vnfrutefull workes moses lawe fayth gospell gathered together churche made whiche people also significacion hebrue woorde betokeneth grow small beginnyng exceadyng great thing ephraim hebrues signifieth encreasing iesus therfore tarryed fewe disciple whiche though wofully afearde themselfes also yet durst forsake lorde iewes e ster nye hande many went countrey vp ierusalem easter purifie themselfes sought iesus spake among themselfes stode temple thinke ye seyng cummeth feast day hye priestes phariseis geuen commaundement man knewe shewe myght take hym time come sothly apoynted father christ offered vp sacrifice saluacion mankinde religiouse day iewes hande call phase e passing ouer english easter name calling reme braunce dede long ye tyme bloud lambe striken postes saue hebrues sworde aungell kylled egypcians house passed ouer postes marked lambes bloud therfore feast verie nie many went diuerse coastes palestine ierusalem purified ceremony law solemnise ye holy feast let v know nothing vnreligiouse iewish religion consisteth visible thinges sith also ye take great hede much vaine deuocio leste ouerslip thing prescribed moses added phariseis loth doe thing moste sacred daye whiche al thinges wieked wete shead ye bloud innocent therfore whe great throng people together many knewe iesus whose maner present suche feastes wondered yt present standing temple talked one cause contrary customable maner iesus absent fro solemne high feast solemnitie would yet altogether absent himselfe thentente myght come loked deferred cumming vntill time thought best furthermore bishop phariseis suspecting sumwhere hide himselfe feare traueyled gaue commaundemet yea autoritie also knew secrete shew might apprehe ded approued holy customes bishop phariseis guide maisters religion prepared themselfes feastful day meane vnwares procured saluacion worlde pthe xii chapter iesus sixe dayes easter came bethanie lazarus dead raysed death made supper martha serued lazarus one sate table hym iesus therfore knowyng concluded vpon death tyme also nigh determined willingly offred sacrifice vnspotted lambe saluacio worlde would longer kepe hymselfe secrete one offreyng hymselfe sacrifice seuenth daye feast easter whiche daye iewes wount solemne supper aste hand pascall lambe retourned againe bethania call remembraunce lately doen miracle also impriente hope resurreccion myndes disciple knewe death excedyngly troubled mynde dwelt lazarus fewe dayes raysed death lyfe place notable beeyng nigh ierusalem therfore supper made readie iesus martha serued supper lazarus one numbre sate supper make certain vision gost whiche lately seen goe graue home house forasmuche nowe liued death many dayes also commoned eaten toke mary pounde oyntmente called nardus perfite precious anoynted iesus feete wiped feete hir heare house filled odour oyntment mary siguler loue loued lorde iesus ardently come feast wel many cause late benefite shewed vpon brother shedde vpon iesus head sitting table great quantitie precious oyntmente whiche made beste kynde nardus mountenaunce pounde insomuche whole house filled sauour oyntmente yet woman suche loue hath heard herewith content annointed fete oyntmente washed teares wiped heer thought iesus delite suche delicacy whose moderate sobrietie knew great feruecie loue caused doe minde gaue without stay herselfe truely knew cosidered yet honor gaue aduertisemet hand iesus death buriall figure churche whiche embrace godly honor lord synagogue despised sayed one disciple euen iudas iscarioth symons sonne afterward betraied oyntmente solde thre hundred penny geuen poore sayed cared poore thefe bagge bare whiche geuen disciple thought much bestowing oyntmente thing wastfully spente specially iudas iscarioth moued withall wurst al purse committed thintent wurst man disposer laier naughtiest thyng wonte maner hath handelyng money common many steale priuily somewhat therof himselfe single pure minde depending maistership autoritie iesus ouer euen making prouision himselfe wherwith might liue departed iesus felowship therfore repining mary sayed purpose loose precious thing neither lord maister delighted suche nyce thinges neither sumptuousnes seming feast case woman determined bestowe precious thing geuen might haue solde price therof geuen poore ye wote well godly seming maister v albeit dede apostle also speake thynges simplicitie mente none euill therin yet iudas farre vnlike mynde though woordes like vnto care poore men cause kept purse thing whiche frendes sente free good dyd full vniustly kepe therof priuily stole somewhat euen shewyng profe hymselfe howe vnfit ministracion god woorde whose mynde inordinate desire money doth possesse sayed iesus let alone daye burying hath kept poore alwayes shall ye haue haue ye alwaye muche people iewes therfore knowledge came iesus sake onely might see lazarus also raised death hye priestes helde councell myght put lazarus death also sake many iewes went awaye beleued christe iesus apease disciple murmuryng yet openly disclose malice iudas suche wise toke mary part signified howe owne voluntarie wil dye lord iesus coueted haue folke induced beleue compulsion man owne good aduisement suffre death saluacio man euen would would grudge ye sayeth woman obsequiousnesse benefite towardes coste lost honor doen bestowed time buriyng honor woman doth preuenting thing shall lacke wherwith anoynte iudge well beyng aliue haue alwaie refused suche plesante thinges yet death burial cumly honorable doe haue enuy honor bestowed shall shortely departe hence ye shall haue alway ready hand great plenty common sorte poore men whose nede ye maye succour ye shall haue many ierusalem came much bethania reason nynesse bycause lazarus notable tyche man therby knowen many yet knowen fame late doen miracle vnknowen abrode iesus bethania verie many came thither citie thicke threfolde partely see iesus whose fame renowne myracle notable dyd muche encrease partly also came see lazarus hearde raysed death lyfe curiositie naturally geuen man caused thus doe moreouer enuy despite iesus blinded myndes priestes phariseis suffice malice put iesus death fel deuice also howe make lazarus away coulde lay colour likelyhood fault cast theyr synagogue ye blinde man boldly defende iesus glory among nowe enuy growen suche malice mynde kyll lazarus great estimacion power neuer woorde dede prouoked offended coulde imagine thing kill would nothing el many iewes moued manifest myracle fall awaye phariseis conspiracie beleued iesus nexte daye muche people come feast heard iesus come ierusalem toke branch palme tree went forth mete cried hosanna blissed name lorde cummeth kyng israel iesus got yong asse sat theron written feare daughter sion beholde thy kyng cummeth sittyng ass coite daye folowyng great route men assembled ierusale feastfull day knowledge would leaue bethania come ierusalem doe honor came mete branch cut palme tree wherwith strawed waie goe tree theyr garlandes made gate victorie tree perteyning triumphes alwaie grene long hye hard climed vpon pleasante swete frute certayne peculiar power nature riseth vp againste weight burden layed vpon saying whiche written psalmes osanna prayse honor loked v cummeth name lorde cried vp aloude like people wonte publishe witnes common ioy iesus also euer tyme bearyng full lowe sayle contemner worldely glory contente come ierusale newe solemne portely shewe gotten vnto asse rode vpo wheras wount walke iourneyes foote partly teache howe vaine honor worlde partly ratifie whiche esay prophecied written feare daughter sion beholde thy kyng cummeth thee meke gentle sitting vpon colte asse suche pompe certainly becummeth well kyng spirituall ierusalem whiche churche pthese thinges vnderstode disciple first whan iesus glorified remembred suche thynges written hym suche thynges doen vnto people called lazarus graue raysed death bare recorde therfore mette people also hearde doen suche miracle apostle verily season vnderstode thinges supposyng doen casualtie iesus death resurreccion sending downe holy gost glorified coferring thing doen wt wordes ye prophetes wel perceiued wordes whiche people cried loude also thing thus cummyng written hym whiche loked suche kyng worldly kinges christes pleasure haue men expectacion decided declaring kyngdome ghospell doeth consist stande aide defense worlde mekenes heauenly doctryne great notable affeccion people came men stirryng prouocacion late presente litle bethania lord raysed lazarus graue made relacion thyng whiche sawe theyr iyes therof came suche preace people came foorth mete iesus learned sawe wonderous miracle suche one neuer hearde since beginnyng worlde wrought hym accordyng thyng broughte open apparaunce certain godly power suche honour geuen vnto neuer geuen prophete pharisee therfore sayed among themselues perceyue ye howe preuayle nothyng beholde al whole world goeth certayne grekes amonges came wurship feast thesame came therfore philip whiche bethsaida citie galile desired saying sir woulde faine see iesus philip came tolde andrewe agayne andrewe philip tolde iesus thing droue myndes priestes phariseis almost desperacion neyther repent theyr wicked enterprise spitefull mutteryng emong sayed ye perceiue crafty policy deuices go nothyng forwarde oure purpose ye resist doeth autoritie florishe earnestly doeth people fauour hym fewe disciple beholde nowe whole world falleth v hym somuche nowe sumwhat daungerous v openly arest vngraciouse phariseis communicacion thintent thei might thereby stirre prouoke eche one another set sodainly come vpon lord iesus succour greater guile wherfore thei atchieue accomplishe mischieuous acte graund consent phariseis scribe priestes auncient rewlers people also dede theyr mynde vnconstant beyng inflamed thesame fury wicked mynde yea pilate viceroyes auctoritie neyther yet withoute deceytfull craft brought withall iudas traytour people notwithstanding tyme fauour iesus gentile also whiche religion sake came ierusalem praye muche desired see iesus reuerence temple great farre countreies many went thither deuocion serue god religion sake uerily tyme certayne likelyhood thyng shewed wit gentile idolater haue recourse come christes churche wherof temple ierusalem bare figure louingly embrace iesus due religion whome phariseis reiected folke therfore beyng desirous see iesus heard wonderful thinges yet bashefull shamefastnesse letted approche vnto hym dede coueted passed lightly se throng also salute heare hym speake nere hande persones saye come philip reason nighnesse countrey borne bethsaida citie galilee gentile knowen cummyng hym would make waye iesus gaue knowledge desirous se iesus philip brake matter andrewe copanions one citie andrewe greater auctoritie lorde fyrst called therfore wente iesus declared vnto certayne folke iewes gentile whiche measure desyred se woulde vouchesafe admitte iesus aunswered saying houre come sonne manne must glorified uerely verely saye vnto excepte wheate corne fall grounde dye bideth alone dye bryngeth furth muche fruite loueth lyfe shall destroye hateth lyfe world shall kepe vnto lyfe eternall iesus certified disciple heathen also longed see leudly contemned phariseis priestes vpon occasion began open death disciple great fruite bring onely iewes al world like maner miracle raysing vp lazarus alone drawe prouoke onely many iewes also gentile loue shoulde death resurreccion moue drawe countreyes whole worlde iesus gaue aunswer disciple shewed godly minde affeccion heathen sayed ye dyd heare iewes saie loude voice blessed cummeth name lorde ye see gentile drawe lyke desyre tyme nygh whan phariseis beleueth sonne man shall bee vtterlye extincte shall bee glorified nacions worlde newe kinde glory newe waye must gotten beyng aliue haue drawen ewe deadexcepte wheat corne fa l ground dye fame shalbe spred abrode drawe mo bodily presence hath doen ye loth heare death yet take moste sure vnlesse wheat corne caste grounde beyng buryed dooe rotte dye shall bring furth fruite alone abideth safe dead lye buried grounde sprouteth vp againe muche gayne fruite yealdyng one corne hundreth nowe corne standing ioyfully vpon grounde garnisheth fieldes abrode many place plenteous encrease enricheth countreye thing commodious many coueted saluacion many redemed death fewe bestowe life perishemente auautage loose lyfe kepe soule doeth perishe whiche departeth bodye bodye dooeth altogether go destruccion tyme come shal liue blessedlye immortall therfore whosoeuer loueth life worlde whyle euill kepeth loseth contrary whosoeuer hateth life worlde furtheraunce ghospel casteth peril betaketh death doeth loose lyfe whiche bestoweth kepeth mortall shorte wretched lyfe shal receyue time resurreccion eternal blessed lyfe lyke maner kepeth wheat corne looseth euen el selfe would perishe soweth burieth ground conclusion well saueth within whyle receiue thesame agayne auantage whiche thought loste man minister vnto let folowe shall also minister minister vnto father honour nowe soule troubled shall saye father deliuer houre therfore came vnto houre father glorifie thy name therfore cause death trouble whiche death shalbe folowed thintent whiche shalbe folowers death may partaker glory immortalitie autour ghospels businesse doe bestowe life willingly saluacion world father glory shall minister businesse reporting publishing abrode whole world preaching thinges haue wrought taught thesame thing byshoppes phariseis doe great craft deuise shal wicked execute vpon whiche vngraciouse persones loueth worlde god while ful folishly kepe life loose euerlasting life cast themselfes headling euerlasting death one professe himselfe disciple minister behoueth thesame folowe theyr maister lord mete seruaunte pulled away lord neither prosperouse thinges aduersant haue partaker companios affl cious aduersitie di euer felowshyp felicitie wheresoeuer become shall also seruaunt though worlde reiecte neuer muche yet shall father enhaunce glory case manne behaue hymselfe faithfull seruaunt hym recompence transitorie harmes ignominie wherwith liueth rebuke among men father shal bewtifie honour eternall felicitie true glory father shall acknowledge minister also sonne shall vouchesafe like reward vpon hath knowen suffre suche like thinges sayed sonne suffre affliccion hath trueth anguishe paine reason infirmitie man body saluacion many well considered felicitie euerlasting life well poudered whiche redemed recouered short torment ought conuince quiuering feare man nature time come ye feale nature irketh repineth dreadfull tormentes deathes wherewith ye menaced threatned doe vtterly sterte awaye men discomfeited clearly ouercome let valiantues mynde alwaye depending father heauens ayde vanquish feblenes cowardnesse man nature euen nowe also fele myne owne soule troubled selfe daye death nye see sore greuouse tempest imminent hang ouer shall saye whither shall turne shall yelde infirmitie body abhorreth death shal flee succour worlde shall loue mine owne life neglect life whole worlde accommodate applye selfe father naturall infirmitie beyng sore incumbred horriblenesse death shall say vnto father may kepe safe instant perill death charitie whiche muche desireth man saluacion furthwith putteth saying yet rather sayeth case fit expedient let coueted death come spirite whiche doeth disagree thyne haue willyngly wittingly offered selfe death nowe bryng thou passe death resurreccion maye cause thy name notable famouse al countreys worlde thou art knowen people honoring thee may attayne eternall saluacion came voyce heauen saying haue glorified glorifie againe people therfore stode heard sayed thundred sayed aungell spake hym iesus aunswered sayed voice came sake nowe iudgemente worlde nowe shall prince worlde cast lifte vp earth drawe men vnto sayed signifying death dye lord iesus thus prayed iyes lift vp heauen voice father came heauen saying haue glorified name excellently set forth alredy name many miracle waxed great muche knowen among menne sonne moste chiefly raysing lazarus death lyfe soone would augment glory name ye nacions worlde crosse resurreccion ascendyng vp heauen sending downe holy ghost preaching apostle moreouer route people whiche stode farre heard voice came downe heauen toke lytle hede neyther euident vnto voice appartayne cumpany people say agreed opinion thyng interpretate voice thought heard thuder voice came cloudes againe interpretate thyng fauourably saying angell speake vnto hym iesus make take hede also put awaye suspicion prayse sayeth voice neither noise thundres voice angell voice father hath heard prayer came knowe selfe father minde come ye maye vnderstand father doe agre whatsoeuer doe authour doe saluacion sake haue hearde father hath promised touching death nowe shortly must satan wrestled withal good prince rather tiranne world sinne hath hitherto kept al death loue world nowe cause whole world drawen iudgemente falshood beyng reproued trueth shall come light while prince world authour death thinketh himselfe conquerour shall death put tiranny men shalbe pardoned theyr sinnes faythe gospell sinne take away tirantes force strength qualled valiant mighty weapon saue sinne onely shall thinke himselfe haue victory shal sodainly expelled kingdom shalbe thought vtterly made away lifted vp fro earth wil drawe thinges euery side vnto right chalengyng thyng vnto hitherto hath kept possession tyrany furthermore christe sayed shalbe lift vp earth saying doubtfull yet right fitte expresse ye thing would signifie kinde death dye hanged vp vpon crosse hang vp hye men may see farre gaue withall priuey warning old story sheweth brasen serpent beyng figure christe set vp vpon hie pole geue behelde though farre presente helpe mortall woundes serpentes people answered hym haue heard lawe christe bideth euer howe sayest thou sonne man must lift vp sone man iesus sayd vnto yet litle light walke ye haue light leste darknes come walketh also darke wo eth whither goeth ye haue light beleue light ye may child lyght yet assembly people coniecte forespeakyng death spoken tormente crosse therupon stode argument messias published himselfe dye whereas scripture geueth messias power kyngdome eternall thus writeth daniel power euerlasting power shal taken away kingdome shal remaine euer micheas prophete speaketh thus outgoing hath beginning euerlasting also esai sayeth shalbe ende peace yea moreouer prophecie psalmes doeth promise hym perpetuall priesthood saying thou art priest euer order melchisedeck say therfore knowe lawe messias shall come shall abyde continue euer meaneth therfore thou sayest shall come passe sonne man shall lift vp earth lift vp earth dye yf thou wilt haue sonne man often thou speakest taken thee thy selfe eyther shalt thou dye el sonne man messias prophecie saye trueth well sayinges spoken malice iesus made aunswere uerely myght haue aunswered man also god trueth die concerning natural man body yet one rise againe yet death let perpetuitie kingdome worldly spirituall kyngdome neyther vnderstande misteries yet oportunitie declare openly doeth onely councell setting aparte blyndenesses harte would cease theyr cry trueth come light specially seyng within whyle taken awaye light ghospell euer throughly abolished heare owne mouthe doctrine see hym worke myracles whiche myght geue sight see theyr foly repente yet lytle sayeth lyght wherfore ye haue lyght walke ye amende sith good cause leste lyght sodainly taken awaye darke night come ye desyre vayne thing taken nowe offered vnto ye doe contemne whoso foloweth blinde affeccions owne minde walketh darkenesse knoweth whither goeth while beleueth doeth wel godly falleth death lyght worlde whoso beleueth shall erre swarue trueth child darkenesse flyeth light therfore haue light beleue light ye maye seen child light beleueth seeth whoso beleueth thesame hauyng syght blinde thynges spake iesus departed hid hymselfe though doen many miracle yet beleued saying prophete esaias might fulfilled whiche spake lorde shall beleue saying arme lorde declared iesus spake time leste prouoke fury knewe prone vnto mischiefe went thence hidde himselfe would absence silence assuage cruell woodnes withall admonishing v way according exaumple often haue doe wilful persones hope doe good ought geue place time leste doe good al also make wurse lamented myndes iewes lorde iesus many cleare woonderfull miracle wrought iyes ought haue brought moste surely haue beleued sayinges yet dyd stande stifly vnbeliefe doubte euen blinded enuy hatred ambicion auarice vngraciouse concupiscence mynde euen esai long ago dyd prophecie suche saying lord hath beleued woordes arme lord opened uerily therfore see power god iesus doynges beyng blynded malice beleue therfore coulde beleue esaias sayeth agayne hath blynded iyes hath hardened theyr harte see theyr iyes leste shoulde vnderstande harte shoulde de conuerted shoulde heale suche thinges sayed esaias sawe glorye spake hym yea beleue would caste awaye theyr naughtie desire also esai speake hath sayth esai blinded iyes hardened harte see iyes vnderstand harte conuerted shoud heale seeyng see vnderstanding vnderstand contrarye owne saluacion made could whose hand alone saluacio hoped thiges tolde esai long ago beeyng spiritually inspired sawe iyes prophecie glory sonne god whiche tyme come haue beyng man prophecied sawe thing prophecied haue seen doen neuerthelesse among chiefe ruler also many beleued phariseis would knowen leste excommunicate loued prayse men prayse god yet al men vnbelefe exclude saluacio beleue many gaue faith iesus ye vulgar people noble also neuerthelesse men wurship durst confesse faith openly feare phariseis whiche made decre yt whosoeuer confesse himselfe disciple iesus excomunicate thrust ye synagogue ouer whiche haue preeminece worlde ignominie irketh much yet theyr faith stable perfite notwithstanding time good beginning euagelicall minde thinke well iesus though feare shamefastnesse letted shewe furth enuy stopped couetousnes letted othersome ambicion hinder whole harte cleaue christ whose sake thynges contemned holye ghoste whiche corroborateth man towardes ghospell yet geuen many beleued fearfully yet settyng man glorie goddes hiely placed synagogue honorable among men reiecte wicked men synagogue christes sake honour prayse god feare infirmitie men nature weake soone obteineth forgeuenesse howbeit whiche blynded eiuill desyres wicked conscience spake agaynst christe turned awaye people layed snare hym ouer craftely sought death nedefull saye perishe would bee saued iesus cried sayed beleueth beleueth hym sent seeth seeth hym sent come light world whosoeuer beleueth shoulde abide darkenesse another tyme agayne iesus goyng abrode sight iewes fury ought haue well appeased moue beleue leaue excuse al theyr owne wilful malice would perishe declaryng great profite come beleued great destruccion persiste theyr vnbeliefe iesus saye cryed sayd professe ye beleue god forasmuche come god saye thyng vnlesse beyng auctour whosoeuer beleueth beleueth yt nothing self sent worlde worlde full darkenesse errour sinnes therfore dyd descend world father fountayne al light beame sune errours beyng remoued synnes taken awaye lighte worlde truely faythe iyes blynde opened maye see lighte fall darkenesse doctrine miracle thyng soeuer haue doen shall hath respecte whiche beleueth putteth whole affiaunce doeth abyde darkenesse beyng lightned knowledge trueth pourged al sinnes old lyfe maye leadyng light godlinesse ghospel procede euerlastyng lyfe man heare wordes beleue iudge hym came iudge worlde saue world refuseth receyueth wordes hath one iudgeth worde haue spoken thesame shal iudge last daye man heare wordes obey hearing doeth profite vnbelefe shal haue sory ende shall iudge came condemne worlde sinnefull enormity therof saue beyng purged fayth neyther yet shall yt man escape terrible iudgemente whiche hath hearde woordes casteth awaye contemneth uerily present omitte nothyng wherby may drawe al folke eternal saluacio man shal loste faulte whosoeuer shall contemne saluacion offred hym selfe sayed woorde whiche speake shall condemne hym shall laste daye rebuke perishe owne wilfull malice parte haue inuited menne promising rewardes haue feared threatnyng punishementes haue allured benefites haue prouoked miracle repell bodye saluacion set open ready waye euery man woman life excuse therfore laste daye shall pretende beyng many wayes prouoked belefe doeth continue still blindnesse haue spoken selfe father whiche sent gaue commau demente saye shoulde speake knowe commaundemente lyfe euerlastyng whatsoeuer speake therfore euen father bad speake ye wurshippers god ye thinke selues case ye haue lawe reuerence ye cannot contemne woordes speake myne owne heade woont whiche dooe feine liste theyr owne prayse aduauntage teache thynges repugnaunte law perfourme dede thynges whiche lawe shadow figure prophecied come futhermore father ye auctour lawe came hither hath prescribed shall saye therfore consideryng obeye commaundementes thynges ye honour hym ye cotemne ambassadour truely thing whiche hath geuen commaundement hath onely commaunded loue towardes throughe beleuyng thinges whiche shewe vnto maye obtayne euerlastyng lyfe lyke father thirsteth saluacion seketh man damnacion verely desyre haue saued wyll suffre none perishe muche lyeth verily wherfore well assured whatsoeuer hath willed saye doeth perteyne saluacion therefore doe leaue naught vnspoken hath assigned saye vnto touchyng good god father towardes myne also throughly agreeth father wil minde see defaulte behalfe wilfully sekyng owne damnacion ye maie attaine eternal saluacion xiii chapter feast easter iesus knewe houre come departe worlde vnto father loued whiche worlde vnto ende loued lorde iesus didde kynde woordes exhorte ye wicked people prouide theyr owne saluacio leaue vngracious purpose consideryng leafte nothyng vnassayed whereby might recouered brought better minde emendmente nowe doe enstructe disciple speciallye chosen whome shortely leaue behinde whome knewe would muche discoumfited deathe theyr maister storme imminente nye hand throughly pull theyr myndes pestilence whiche corrupteth sinceritie ghospell saye enuie hatred pride ambicion graffe affeccions contrary declaryng therein token perfite charitie whose example steppe folow louing eche mutually shewing also mannier suche mekenesse humilitie hath hearde wherby one shoulde preuente sembleably mutuall benefites therfore daye easter whiche hebrues sayed call phase saye passeouer forasmuche oure lorde iesus nothyng hid knewe tyme nowe bee hande hymselfe aunsweryng name feastefull daye shoulde passe worlde go agayn father whece came seyng alwaies loued apostle specially chose hymselfe familiares frendes whiche shoulde yet depart worlde shoulde haue great long battayle world didde declare continuall loue charitie towardes neyther storme death beeyng nowe hande put awaye zele affeccion whiche bare towardes veray departyng speciallye shewe token certayne rare loue fayntly loued thinges whiche shoulde printe theyr myndes goyng mighte diepely remayne memorie pand supper ended deuill put harte iudas iscarioth simon sonne betraye hym iesus knowyng father geuen al thynges handes come god went god rose supper layed aside vpper garmentes taken towell girded hymselfe powred water basin began washe disciple feete wype towell wherwith girded therefore laste misticall supper prepared whiche holy memoriall body bloude beeing geuen leafte vnto v waye couenaunte continuall remembraunce himselfe purposed make league frendeshyp neuer meanes dye betwene v although knewe wel ynough iudas iscarioth suggestion deuill already went betraie might taken iewes whiche mynde iudas pestilence couetousnesse possessed coulde called backe vngraciouse wicked dede greate gentilnesse mildnesse maister towardes seyng iesus knewe also father woulde suffer none thynges perishe whiche deliuered kepe well assured himselfe shortelye go father whence came yet would vtterlye pull oute disciple mindes ambiciouse desire riseth supper meat already set vpon table laying asyde vpper garmentes whereby might euery condicion shewe similitude seruaunte tooke towell girded furthwith himselfe powred water basen takyng vpon hym moste vile abiect office worldes estimacion began washe disciple feete hebrues dede accustomably bestow manier seruice vpon geastes fredes yet thyng christe onely exaumple perfit humblenesse also figure misticall meanyng saye howe whiche prepare themselues office preaching ghospell would partaker ye table lord ought moste pure al earthly affeccions notwithstanding none attein puritie vnlesse lord iesus goodnesse wipe awaye filthinesse infirmitie onely without spot also beyng veray man suche sorte conuersaunt among men trained forth whole course life without spot carnalitie came simon peter peter sayed vnto lord doest thou washe feete iesus aunswered sayed vnto hym thou wotest thou shalt knowe hereafter peter sayeth vnto hym thou shalt neuer washe feete iesus aunswered hym yf washe thou hast parte therefore lorde thinges heauen earth knowyng thynges hauyng al thynges geuen hym father apparell beyng girded sorte seruaunt naked carrying basin came symon peter kneled hym washe feete peter horribly afearde rare straunge exaumple humilitie side knowledgyng owne infirmitie syde consideryng ye maiestie lorde whiche somewhat perceyued myracles meruelouse doctryne although yet fully knowen hym god yet seene hym ryse agayne neyther ascende heauen sitte ryghte hande father wurshipped whole worlde godly honour thyng beyng knowen afterlord doest thou washe feete commend exaumple notable humilitie peter therefore refusing washed maister vpon selfsame consideracio iohn baptiste lothe take vpon baptise christe sayed lord thyng whiche thou goest aboute wilte thou washe feete knowe thou arte furthwith peter refusall iesus aunswered suffer thyng whiche trifle doen vain thou doest yet vnderstad thyng meaneth hereafter thou shalt thou shalt wel perceyue thyng whiche haue nedefull thee peter stayed manier aunswer vnderstoode made deniall saying neuer suffer great man thou arte washe suche one feete lorde put awaye earnest refusal although came loue dryue one naile another threatninges forced peter cosentif washe thou hast part seing otherwise easie taught yet saying peter doest thou stryue washe thee thou canste partaker eyther thou shalte washed thou shalt remoued felowshyp boorde league muste pure cleane admit company iesus spake washyng fete bodye concernyng folowyng notable humilitie purenesse mynde whiche oughte bee excellent persones professe doctrine gospell take vpon cure christes flock psymon peter sayeth vnto hym lord feete onely also handes heade iesus sayeth vnto hym washed nedeth saue washe feete cleane euery whitte ye cleane knewe shoulde betraye hym therefore sayed ye cleane although peter loued lorde feruently vnderstode iesus sayinges meante yet greuouse louer heare mencion made diuorcement departure soone heard separate coumpanie hym entierly loued sodaynly became vehemet admitting washe feete refusing sayed lord rather would put thee doe suffre washe feete seeyng pleaseth doe also handes head lord aunswered washed hath nede washed rest body beyng cleane remayneth nothing washed feete eftsones treadyng grounde gathereth filthinesse truely lorde iesus signifie parable sufficient preacher gospell haue comon puritie baptisme profession christes fayth geueth al folkes except feete say affeccions minde often purged impuritie worlde whiche neuerthelesse man pure vnlesse study washe awaye many tymes mercy christe infeccion hath taken cumpanie men therfore sayeth washe againe reste body onely feete ye clea e euery one excepcion lord iesus touche conscience iudas iscarioth knewe well inough betray iewes gentlenesse iesus great although knewe yet would bewray reiecte hauyng feete washed neyther would put backe holy supper yet communion body bloud doeth touche conscience knewe himselfe welynough might repent emende himselfe perceiue vnknowen lorde determined betray therfore cause iesus sayd verily ye cleane washed feete receyued clothes set downe saied vnto againe wote ye haue doen ye call maister lorde ye saye well lorde maister haue washed feete ye also ought wash one others feete haue geue exaumple doe haue doen uerily verily saye vnto seruaunt greater maister neyther messenger greater sent yf ye vnderstand thinges happy ye ye doe speake al knowe haue chose scripture may fulfilled cateth bread hath lifte vp hole nowe tell come come passe ye might beleue iesus finished kinde seruice towardes twelue apostle put againe garmentes sate downe sup meane doeth againe put myndes exaumple lowelines shewed leste forget thing necessary sayth doe ye vnderstad met haue washed feete ye call maister lorde good cause ye doe doubtlesse thesame ye call seyng haue washed feete dede maister lorde brother seruauntes together shall muche lesse grudge eche one serue continually farre aboue haue therfore geue examplefor haue geue example lothe doe lyke among felowes whiche haue doen disciple seruauntes one brother ashamed take vpon pryde tyraunt ouer brother likewise seruaunt ouer companion seyng maye worthyly take vpon preeminence dignitie haue humbled selfe washe fete neyther cause manne say thyng doe vyle abiecte seruile greater man behoueth humble himselfe pestilence ambicion doeth crepe euen emong euangelicall vertues ye shall doe myracles name ye shal prophecie ought ye chiefly remember thing whiche haue doen day vnto ye may defend autoritie gospel high lookes pryde violence meanes shall attayned thing verily cannot denied certainly knowe naturall reason say howe seruaunte greater maister messenger sent doe man businesse greater sendeth ye knowe maister hereafter ye shall knowe better ye messenger authour message therfore shame puft vp pryde fierce cruel flocke committed vnto also among selfes considering ye haue found meke curteous lord maister nowe ye vnderstande ye doe hereafter ye shalbe blessed doctrine often repeate vnto leste waye forgotten shall obtayne blessing dede haue chosen honourable roumth office apostle shall aunswere worthynesse office blessed shall shall vse apostle office myne example among shall lytle folowe myne example towarde brother companion hathe heretofore felowe like shall lift vp head whiche great lord suche maister long agon prophecied psalmenow tel come thing thus sayed shal eate bread shall lyfte vp hele doe nowe shewe come passe thyng shall ye shall see doen whiche scripture hath spoken ye maye beleue hath prophecied nothing doen chaunce aduenture matter moderate according god determinacion like followeth mine example happy shal vnhappy whosoeuer rather folowe trayters myne shall haue time come many folowers naughtinesse shall set money glory myne name pretendyng honour apostle name shall traiterously misuse office apostle shall deface thapostles office uerily verily saye vnto receyueth whomsoeuer sende receyueth receyueth receyueth sent greater dignitie office muche greuouser faulte abuse honour profession thorowe playing traytour tell assuredly whosoeuer receiueth send receiueth whosoeuer receiueth receiueth hym sente father messenger nothyng accordyng wil messenger apostle yf faythfullye put execucion thyng yt haue commaunded shall bee receiued godlye folkes thoughe spake lyke father speaketh teache none thyng whiche hath limyted pwhan iesus thus saied troubled spirite testified saied uerely verely saie vnto one shall betraye disciple loked one doubtyng spake one iesus disciple whiche leaned euen whome iesus loued beckened symon peter therefore aske spake leaued iesus brest saied vnto lorde iesus aunswered geue soppe wette breade gaue iudas iscarioth simon sonne soppe satan entred iesus comfortyng apostle myndes spoken wordes furth woulde make theim afrayed folowe traytours exaumple entente woulde vehementelye prouoke traytoure amende troubled spirite one greuouslye vexed destruccion hym whiche thorowe owne malice wente aboute procure himselfe euerlasting death dooeth againe witnesse euen othe thyng whiche spake beefore shall verilye come passe forsoothe tell yet saieth one whiche beeyng fewe doeth sit downe one table shall betraye saiyng often repeted awake disciple myndesone shall betray whiche el bene ful heuye pensite foresaid departure maister euerye man conscience sauyng iudas coumforte hymselfe onelye one noted bee betrayer addicion trouble theim neyther didde doubte thyng shoulde tyme come passe whiche lorde saied bee yet man could suspecte detestable deede forasmuche thought theyr minde sauyng euerye man mistrusted fragilitie mannes nature onely iudas knowyng hymselfe giltye neyther shrinketh thereat ashamed yet dreadfull bee presente holye repaste besides meane whyle coulde abyde syghte maister whome knewe whole purpose minde bee manifestely knowen pestilent thyng couetousnesse liked hym abuse gentlenes maister beeyng alreadye well knowen vnto therfore reste disciple beyng heuy careful dydde beholde one see coulde perceiue token countenaunce whome iesus spoken whiche withoute doubte woulde furthwith haue fierce agaynst determined wicked deede truelye simon peter mynde set fyer loued lorde man hitherto ye parte boldenes reason loue towardes maister euill successe hadde heard lorde saye go backe sathan thou sauoreste thynges appertaine god euen nowe hearde hym saye thou shalt haue parte therfore peter dyd greatly desyre deliuered doubtefull care knowe assuredlye went great mischiefe one would haue suffred hym haue si te emong feaste yet durste hymselfe buisie aske iesus traytour aduertised beckened certayne disciple demaunde iesus manne spake whiche disciple lorde loued intierly vsed familyarly thatsame tyme leaned vpon lordes breste reason whiche kynde dealing familiar handeling hym manne dyd mourne halfe deade lordes death hande lord dyd coumforte recreate therfore disciple leanyng vpon iesus breste saied secretly vnto hym lorde shall dare enterprise suche mischeuous dede iesus aunswered hym saiyng whome shall geue dipte soppe hadde dipped breade brothe gaue soppe iudas iscarioth simon sonne vnhappye traitour neyther ashamed therewithall wente amende hymselfe shamelesse countenaunce settyng noughte lordes knoweledge despisyng greate gentylnesse tooke token frendshyppe lordes hande whome woulde anone betraye litle money receiued litle morsell deuill dyd fully possesse minde wicked man made hym vncurable pthan said iesus vnto thou doest quickely wist man table entent spake vnto thought iudas hadde bag iesus saied vnto bye thinges haue nede feaste shoulde geue thing poore assone receiued soppe went immediatly nyght iesus sawe purposed malice iudas woulde neyther bee chaunged shame feare almoste bewrayed allready haue bene daunger yf iesus hadde disclosed hym therefore sent hym awaye feaste suffred hym dooe vngraciouse dede whiche already committed full wyll purpose mynde thyng thou goest saieth doe quickly iudas knowyng himselfe giltye dyd onelye vnderstande saiyng none reste sate table perceiued wherefore iesus spoken goodnesse nothyng mistrustfull none coulde suspecte whome iesus shewed manye token loue whome semed manner preferre ye reste kepyng moneye also sate righte nere vnto hym feaste whome euen nowe lorde gaue dypped soppe man saye dyd mistruste durste enterprise haynous deede betraye hym death whereas iesus saide thyng thou dooeste dooe quickelye knewe iudas kepte purse dyd take itthat shoulde geue ye poore lord admonished hym bye thinges nedeful solemnisacion feastful day distribute somewhat poore iesus often wounte commaunde hym doe instructyng prouokyng v liberall poore folke iudas hadde receiued soppe made thoughe hadde vnderstande lordes saiyng went furthewith parlour supped beecame hym longer presente coumpany holy folkes whiche geuen hymselfe deuill shewed hymselfe iesus often vncurable nyght tyme betokenyng mynde blynded darkenesse couetise whiche shoulde withdrawe hymselfe lyght make suche haste doe worke prynce darkenes muche vndue season tyme u de moue hym delaye purposed wicked dede lacked euyll iesus hadde geuen hym power intente also myght bee euidently perceiued man coulde preuaile thyng agaynste excepte woulde geue licence vngracious wyll accomplishe dede thyng whiche determined mynde ptherefore gone iesus saied nowe sonne man glorified nd god glorified god bee glorified god shall also glorifie himselfe shall streightwaye glorifie litle chyldren yet litle ye shall seke saied vnto iewes whither go thither ye cumme also saie nowe newe commaundemente geue vnto ye loue together haue loued euen ye loue one shall men knowe ye disciple yf ye haue loue one therfore departed whiche made hymselfe vnwoorthye bee coumpanye iesus beganne speake manye thynges disciple whiche partely coumforte stablishe partly arme storme hande vtterlye prientyng theyr myndes thynges whiche fyrste beyng ignoraunt afterwarde dulled rowe steape coulde fully perceiue yet shoulde afterward vnderstande fyrste shewed death hand although iudgemente worlde shoulde seme full reproche yet set furth father glorye owne nowe sayeth thyng specially hande whiche ye haue hearde praye nowe tyme come soonne manne whiche hath semed hytherto poore abiecte shoulde newe sorte become notable among men father glorye shoulde likewise set foorth sought owne glory thorowe infirmitie sette forth father glorye lyke manier father true fountayne true glory shall glorifye soonne men aungels archaungels yet anye creature hymselfe declaryng worlde howe father sonnes glorye one entente menne maye knowe euerye syde theyr mutuall woorkes canne wynne thyng men knowyng glory bothe myght obteine true glorye tyme come verily shall throughly glorifie sonne laste cumming company heauen meane whyle also shall furthwith gloryfie hym owne death whiche shall bee force al man power anone resurreccion ascencion wherfore child let death discoumforte whiche although seme come want strength yet shall bee power lyfe though shall seme shamefull vyle yet shall sette foorth bothe glory father yea though shall seme vtter bolishyng yet shall bryng saluacion bothe whole worlde lette thynges comforte heauinesse myndes expedient mortall bodye myne bee withdrawen syght nowe yme euen hand bee dooen meane whyle vse coumpanye one shall gooe shortelye printe well hertes thynges commaunde el haue tolde iewes ye shall seke vayne gone hence within goe away suche place whither tyme ye cannot folowe therefore nowe take departure paciently fasten well myndes doctrine remembraunce mea new commaudement geue vnto ye loue together thyng shall make happye rather syghte mortall bodye bee many preceptes moses lawe nowe departure commaunde one newe precepte lyke haue loued one loue haue vsed tyranny againste haue coueted praise luc e haue got en worldelye commoditie haue loued youre welthe yea freelye haue loued euen vnto death willingly bestowe life like manner loue one men disciple knowen na e appaul obseruing certaine ordinaunces menne ye haue learned none thinges onely signe menne shall knowe ye bee verie disciple dede ye haue suche mutuall loue among youre selues haue effectuously shewed rare thing among menne yet fruite whereby good tree knowen psimon peter saied vnto lorde whither goest thou iesus aunswered whither go thou canste folowe nowe thou shalte folowe afterwardes peter saied vnto lorde cannot folowe nowe operde life thy sake iesus aunswered wilte thou ieoperde thy life sake uerely verely saye vnto thee cocke shall crowe till thou haue denied thrise peter whiche set fier loue maister althoughe tooke death grieuously yet hadde said vnto go satan durste moue moleste concerning matter thing troubled peter minde loued well coulde haue leaue folowe shoulde departe frendes great comfort manne loue one vnfainedlye folowe chaunces wheresoeuer shall become therefore peter asketh lorde whether goest thou maie folowe iesus aunswereth thou maiest presencely folow thither gooe hereafter thou shalte peter vnderstanding yet purpose iesus spake woordes wheras mente owne deathe whiche yet apte beare well lorde saieth maie folowe thee perilles woulde refuse thee whiche readie die thee loue beeing v earnest dede neuerthelesse yet worldly throughlye knowen himselfe caused hym thus speake beyonde power iesus therefore thentent would frame successoure litle litle vtterly pull disciple mindes confidence mannes power like hadde somewhat remoued put backe thesame suche time peter didde boldelye aduise die againe rebuked saied peter rashelye caste himselfe water furthwith beganne doubte yea agooe also controlled muche woulde haue obeyed hym suche time wente aboute washe feete euen nowe taught truste owne strength credite hys owne affeccions distrustyng hymself depende vpon helpe christe saieste thou peter sayeth iesus howe stoute thynges thy selfe doest thou promise v doe wilte thou bestowe thy nay veray experience shall teache thee howe true saiyng whiche speake euen nowe coulde bee beleued thee saye whither goe thou canste folowe profe therof hande thou well assured nyght cocke shall crowe saye firste cocke crowyng thou shalte haue denied thrise muche lesse shalte thou bee hable saue lyfe thynebefore cocke crow c woordes lorde restrayne peter stoute saying although came great loue therewithall warned perylles shoulde truste theyr owne strengthe whensoeuer broughte passe suche thyng knoweledge come power gyfte god thynges peter helde peace one yet free carefulnesse concernyng betraying whiche iesus made men pthe xiiii chapter pand saied vnto disciple let herte troubled ye beleue god beleue also father house many mansion wer would haue tolde goe prepare place yf go prepare place wyll come againe receiue euen vnto selfe may ye bee also whither goe ye knowe way ye knowe saying whiche sygnifyed certayne straunge ou ragious tempeste imminente hanged ouer theim whiche storme shoulde also driue peter moste mannely greate erroure shoulde thrise thesame nyghte denye lorde saye disciple wer therewith stricken euen hertes peter exaumple euerye one stood dreade himselfe iesus beeyng maister moste gentlenes dyd moste fayre pleasaunt wordes comforte troubled sorowfull disciple saiyng thynges shall doubtles whiche haue tolde beforehande yet cause ye therewith hertelesse dismayed cruell thynges shall bee dooen againste lyke shall dooen againste ignoraunte howe greate infinnitie man nature notwithstanding put youre whole affyaunce god ye shall neede feare anye violence wicked men god almighty alone maye doe fearcelye stryuen againste v verilye euen moyses lawe truste hym case ye truely truste hym also behoueth trust shal haue victory yf distrustyng owne proper ayde defense ye wyll fyxe youre affiaunce hope vpon deathe selfe shall able dysceyuer v lyke ye shall tyme bee partaker affliccions shall bee croune glorye wyll fyrste shewe waye exaumple howe fyghte gette victorye shall boldnes bee geuen vnto felowshyppe glorye onely trust vnto nowe father house many dwellynges readye haue victorye neyther rewardes prepared alone neyther shall peter alone folowe mein father house bee anye mansion c cleaueth vnto charitie fayth ghospell shall bee recompensed seuerallye haue euerye one rewarde prepared hym vnlesse knewe certaynly dwellyng place alreadye prepared receiue shall whyle bee taken oute hurly burly worlde felicitie euerlastyng lyfe woulde nowe beforehande haue admonished dooe therefore goe father thentente maye prepare place also whome wyll suffre dissociate nowe knowe certayne father kyngdome euery manne hath mancion readinesse hym haue neede bee carefull beyng recompensed onelye lyeth vpon hande fyght manfully though dyd go farre awaye prepare place yet cause ye shoulde meane thynke selfe succourlesse shall come agayne vnto receyue wholye vnto neuer departe wheresoeuer shall also bee matter distruste cummyng thyther nowe goe dede ye knowe whither go waye thyther darke parable lorde dyd geue littell knowledge shoulde go father none otherwyse death crosse thyng gone worthye desired well liked way thought worthy misliked beloued disciple coulde knowe hearyng lorde often speakyng thereof pen fenes obliuiousnesse made theym ignoraunte thyng knewe pthomas saieth vnto lord knowe whether thou goest howe possible v know waie iesus saieth vnto waie trueth life man cummeth vnto father ye knowen ye hadde knowen father also nowe ye know haue seen therfore thomas desirouse knowe certainely whyther lorde woulde goe sayeth lorde knowe whether thou goest knowe waye thither rather thou sayeste knowe dede ignoraunte blunte althoughe vehemente saiyng thomas dyd maner force oure lorde tell playnly whyther woulde goe thence whiche thyng dydde space euen long knowe trueth iesus enstructyng framyng fashyoning litle litle doeth dede teache thyng wishe knowe doeth yet couertly thentente thing might depely fixed mindes whiche shoulde haue muche doe long tyme learne saye hadde lefte mortalitie shoulde retourne agayne father whence came incarnate withall teacheth waye vnto father open vnto manne sonne whiche onelye shoulde open waye heauen whiche onely shoulde instructe mennes fayth heauenly knowledge shoulde bee onelye fountayne immortalitie whome whosoeuer dydde firmely sticke thesame shoulde bee without feare death thomas sayeth howe happeneth thou deniest knowe waye vnlesse thou yet percase knoweste alli waye trueth life verely way trueth life sayed euen nowe yt doe goe agayne father onely open tolke way vnto hym come dedes fit semyng god ye haue proufe good life also man without cummeth father ye haue learned trueth yf feare death meane tyme trouble youre myndes knowe well ye bee sure immortalitye forasmuche lyfeno manne cummeth father c dooe ye onelye folowe thyther goe beefore beeleue kepe minde whiche haue taughte hope assuredly thyng promise ye aske whither goe goe father yf ye desyre knowe waye whereby ye maye come thither say man cummeth father wherefore knowe bothe aswell whyther dooe goe waye iourneye lyeth excepte paraduenture ye bee vtterlye ignoraunte verely yf ye hadde knowen ye hadde also knowen father yea say trueth ye haue already waye knowen father whome ye thynke bee vnknowen vnto ye haue onelye knowen hym determinacion lawe ye haue also seen hym doubtlesse lord iesus dyd obscure saiyng sumdeale aduertise disciple hys father trueth inuisible onely inuisible bodilye iyes also mynde owne propre nature coulde see perceiue yet notwithstanding beene seene sorte sonne whyle see hym soonne rewlyng wyndes sea forcyng deuils obeye putting awaie woorde sickenesses disease neuer incurable woorde raysing deade life vnlearned apostle didde yet vnderstande hye misteries yet euen though dede vnderstand lorde spake vnto euen leap skip greate affeccion see father imaginyng father mighte bee seene suche sorte sawe sonne simplicitie yet albeit neyther sawe sonne throughly whiche beholde hym bodily iyes alone pphilip saieth vnto lord shewe v father suffiseth v iesus saieth vnto haue long time yet hast thou knowen philip hath sene hath seen father howe saieste thou shewe v father beleuest thou father father wordes speake vnto speake selfe father dwelleth dooeth workes beleue father father el beleue workes sake philip therfore beyng desirous learne reste speaketh thus lorde thou tellest v father seene v woulde god thou wouldest graunte myghte bee lawfull v see looke vpon thy father oure desyres satisfyed woulde wishe desire ought el deede haue hearde muche speakyng lacke onely sight hym lorde doth controull correct philip request rude foolishe saiyng philip haue long tyme wyth yet thou knowest syght face thou knowest ryght vnderstandyng power vertue trueth maketh knowe mighty trueth true power seen bodilye iyes minde soule seeth therefore verye image father thynges lyke vnto hymhe yt hath seen hath seen ye father deedes woordes thou oughtest already haue knowen verelye haue knowen haue seen howe dareste thou bee bolde countenaunce sayeste thou shewe v father though hath seene hath seene father meane father none betwene v two vnlikenes thyng vncommon touchyng higher diuyne nature case thou canste vnderstande saye naturall reason seeth also tel beleueth thou hast heard speake thou hast seen myracles therein surely thou haste seen heard father doest thou yet beleue inseparable copulacion nature wil power father father thing soeuer speake speake mynde thyng soeuer dooe dooe mynde therefore alwaye hym reason suche coniunccion nature wyll cannot vnioyned disseuered alwaye speakyng declaryng miracle power neyther doe speake thing selfe whiche thing speaketh neither dooe thing selfe whiche ioyntelye doeth worke howe therefore doest thou separate inseparable seueral sight desireste see seuerally beleueste thou one knowen vnknowen doth reste also yet beleue yt al thynges cummeth father spoken doen separacion betwixt v two behoued haue credited oft teachyng thing ye mistrusted woordes yet truely diuine woorkes deedes surmounting mannes power oughte haue caused beleue thing soeuer procedeth fro father yf father himselfe speake vnto would speake none thing doe would worke would worke none thing worke haue one minde one one power nature puerely verely saie vnto beleueth w orke doe thesame shall also greater workes shall goe vnto father whatsoeuer ye aske name dooe father maie bee glorified sonne ye shall aske thing name wil dooe ye loue kepe commaundementes wil pray father shal geue coumforter maye hide euer euen spirite trueth world cannot receiue world seeth neyther knoweth knowe dwelleth shalbe therefore beleue retaine haue surely fixte youre hertes whiche thyng yf doe dede withdrawyng syghte bodye shalbee harme vnto ye shall better see beeyng absente iyes faythe thesame thing whiche ye nowe see father dooe whiche doe faste cleaue vnto manner wayes shall dooe cleaue fayth charitie yea shall also euidently extende foorth mightie power godheade shall remoue awaye manhead yea moreouer whoso euer dooeth ioyne himselfe true christen fayth like naturally alwaie ioyned neuer disseuered company father thesame persone shall also dooe greater thynges doe often glorye god requireth miracle father worketh nowe shall worke expediente saluation manne doe goe againe father ye shall succede course enter roume concernyng ministracion ghospell thyng shal onelye bee doen thing soeuer elles ye shall aske father namewhatsoeuer ye aske name whiche shal appertayne vnto prayse glorye father name myne shall doe ende also maie bee glorified emong men father hath beene hitherto glorified soonne let departure therefore trouble whiche shall tourne greate commoditie prefermente moste shall bee youre ayde al affayres purpose whiche make true health shall take awaye sielye body onely aske thing couete father shall heare desire beeing continuall presente aduocate vnto bring passe soeuer ye shall aske shall bee obteined denieth nothing whiche dooe manner thing redoundeth glorye denye nothyng long ye doe whiche shall set forth honoure name forsooth spirite shall put myndes ought aske thus greued going hence proufe christen charitie men dismaied frende remoueth whome shall soone forget ye loue truely dooe loue father declare charitie towardes dede ye shall soothly certainelye declare ye dooe kepe commaundementes shall come passe father loueth denieth nothyng like wise shall also loue obeying preceptes whiche veray commaundementes father thus nedefull saluacion worlde doe absente selfe yet going awaie wyll leaue desolate altogether without coumforte rather ye abide firmelie loue kepe commaundementes shall obteine father praier returne againe vnto denieth nothing shall sende coumforter whiche sente shall goe awaie nowe concerning manner corporall presence pulled awaie shall continue euer shall spirite father whiche shall make carnall folke spirituall shall tourne worldelye affeccion whiche ye nowe beare towardes heauenlye loue shall also secrete inspiracions putte treweth thinges whiche ye nowe vnderstande dreame throughe cloude speciall pledge shall bee peculiar propre vnto haue exhibite selfe generallye common eiuill good leste anye mighte make excuse inuited saluacion worlde whiche coueteth muche gapeth goodes bee worlde deceitfull cannot receiue spirite beecause heauenlye true hath grosse iyes whiche deliteth loueth grosse earthlye thynges seethe hym knoweth hym withoute noyse beyng whisshed still tasteth hymselfe secrete sens mynde fynde anye conueniente place reste truelye case delusion deceytfull thynges worlde beeyng despysed ye wyll folowe thynges good deede liue well saie shall knowe hym onely come vnto come one may bee seen shal also abyde continually shall suche sorte conuersaunte emong aduocate client shall inhabyte hymselfe secrete inner partes soules shall toyne hymselfe giued spirite maye become one spirite folkes shalbe bred planted hertes shall accumpany assist thynges meane tyme shall bee long ere coumforter shalbe steade vicegerante shall come vnto wherfore cause hertes discoumforted afeard good child haue perfeitly begotten sumwhat framed heauenly doctryne god woorde nourishe beeyng yet vnperfite fully taught vntill ye growe vnto strength ghospell pi leaue coumfortlesse come yet litle world seeth ye see liue ye shall liue daye shall ye knowe father hathe commaundementes kepeth thesame loueth loueth shalbe loued father loue shewe mine selfe although goe hence tyme shal longer liue manne men yet wyl leaue meanetyme fatherlesse without confortable succoure hande cumine agayne returne father wyll shewe selfe iyes bee seene bodye dede mortal entente maye aduaunce bryng loue fleshe spirite great matter yf geue bodye alwaye looke thereupon euen wicked dooe also beholde theyr damnacion within whyle therfore shalbe worldes syghte death graue shall take awaye fro syght worldly folkes neuerthelesse wyll see presente selfe vnto aliue kynde deathe shall alienate v sundre kepe youre syghte shall liue agayne yea bee deade shall onelye liue withall bryng lyfe euerlastyng notwithstandyng tyme myne absence beeyng alyue shall fynde aliue spende life shall health safegarde shall vnderstande fully nothyng pull father father bothe agayne ioyned mutuall charitie together death disioyne v let onely care youre owne faulte ye bee vncoupled let lewse obseruyng commaundementes shal try true charytie loueth herte neglecteth preceptes lorde sufficiente haue accepted commaundementes vnlesse manne retayne mynde inoughe remembre theym excepte bee kept doth accomplishe kepe truelye loueth bee tormented mynde departure proufe veraye trewe loue truely loue father kepe commaundementes kepe theym vnto death crosse cause commaundementes sufferyng iniurye pacientelye beatyng crosse quietely shoulde muche putte feare seuere grieuous commaundementes charitie shall sweten make easie shall lacke coumforte hande surely whoso loueth shalbe bothe loued father also wyll loue hym neuer leaue succourlesse see hym againe openlye shewe selfe vnto hym bee looked vpon make certain doe vtterly perishe suffryng deathe crosse nowe geue selfe bee seen folke manne shall see excepte abyde constantly frendeshyppe trueth lorde iesus spake thynges sumwhat darkelye onely signifiyng beeyng reuiued agayne would often death come among frendes bee seen would also holy ghoste spirite secretely place wynde himselfe theyr myndes finally woulde come glorye father open sight folke piudas saieth vnto iudas iscarioth lorde done thou shewe thy selfe vnto v vnto worlde iesus aunswered said manne loue kepe saiynges father loue come vnto hym dwell loueth kepeth sayinges worde ye heare mine father whiche sent thinges haue spoken vnto beyng yet present comforter whithe holy ghost whome father send name shall teache al thinges bring thinges remembraunce whatsoeuer haue sayed vnto peace leaue peace giue vnto worlde geueth geue vnto let hettes greued neyther feare ye haue hearde sayd vnto goe come againe vnto ye ha ye woulde verely reioyce sayd goe vnto father father greater iudas verely called iscarioth absente sermon iudas whose surname lebbeus fully vnderstande lordes saiyng beyng throughe sorowe feare sore troubled dyd suppose lorde shoulde suche wyse appeare frendes terrible spirites phantastical sightes shewe themselfes many tymes darkenesse nyght certain vision appeare dreames rather feare men mennes coumforte iudas therfore saith lorde hath chaunced thou maieste seen folke thou shalte appeare worlde onely v howe canste thou one may seen v yf thou one cannot see iesus knewe disciple yet able vnderstande misterie howe bodye whiche hadde deade buiried nowe made spirituall hable dooe lyste shoulde ryse agayne iesus saye knowyng dyd playnely answere thyng asked turned saiyng thyng whiche necessarye bee imprinted theyr heartes whereby shoulde nowe bee prepared spirituallye haue presence muche presence whiche shoulde bee exibited vnto theim resurreccion coulde long endure theim therefore iesus sayed presente selfe worlde loueth neyther dothe kepe commaundementes one loue truely wyll testifie loue sorowe kepyng commaundementes hym wyll loue semblablye whome shall loue hym wyll father loue shall neuer bee pulled awaye hym wyll onelye see hym agayne hath commaundementes remembraunce withall father wyll spirite whiche common v come vnto hym come forthwith departe againe dwell neuer go away doen spirite perpetuall effectuall bodilye ioynyng together muste nedes haue ende euen ye shoulde sette naught transitorye thynges inure selfes loue eternall thinges ye yet cannot come v come inuisible effectually dwell temple hertes three deede ioyned conuerte together whiche loueth one muste loue hath one v lacketh none v behalfe let charitie presente couenaunte kepte whiche made late shal couple v together neyther life deathe vncouple v membres maie bee disseuered heade maie disseuered bee many whiche boaste themselfes loue god father seme obserue commaundementes lawe none dooeth truelye loue god yf hat contemne soonne verelye contemneth soonne whosoeuer kepeth commaundemente whosoeuer neglecteth preceptes neglecteth withall preceptes god good sooth thyng haue taught peculiar doctrine father rather father myne whome cummeth whatsoeuer doe teache doyng nothyng autoritie whome sente worlde teache matter whiche dooe teache nowe thynges haue spoken according youre capacitie yet mortall manne beeyng conuersaunte among mortall menne soone hereafter wyll repayre see againe certayne dayes space beeyng immortall wyll kepe cumpany menne mortall entente maye coumforte teache geue counsell neyther vnawares ye shal fully vnderstande thinges whiche nowe speake shall speake anone deathe ye yet styll carnall rude notwithstandyng spoken vayne shall take away body comforter shall come yf ye aske hym god name comforter saye bodily ye seme holy spirite doeth sanctify spirites mindes whome father shall sende roume yf require hym name ye shall neede corporall presence whiche season geuen consideracion men grossenes entente myght degree orderlye go forwarde perfeite thynges spirite asmuche myne father shall putte remembraunce thynges whiche nowe speake vnto bee yet ignoraunte small capacitie besides obliuious also shall make vnderstande thynges whiche ye hadde vnderstande neyther suffre forget anye thyng lacke knoweledge anye thing perteineth saluacion menne obliuious shall make good remembraunce slowe witted easie bee taughte sleapishe slu gardes vigilante watchefull sorowfull men cherefull yearthly fol heauenly onelye perseuer charitie hauing remembraunce commaundementes cause ye meane feare troublesumnesse worlde whiche ye shall see ryse agaynste tyme come againste also let suffise departure shall leaue peace vnto geue peace worldelye storme destroye vndoe hym hath peacepeace leaue v worlde also hath kynde peace whiche bestoweth vpon whome loueth peace trusted peace whiche doe geue doeth make frendeshyppe betwene god hurte hym whiche hath god protectour gouernour peace whiche leaue vnto ioynyng together among selfes mutuall concord shall make felowship strong inuincible agaynst worlde satan prince world dooe meaneth goyng hence whiche shall bee veray commodious vnto doth muche feare let hertes therefore bee troubled strieken feare ye haue heard saye alreadye ye shoulde credite eftsones tell trueth goe hence tyme wyll anone returne againe vnto meane tyme bryng effecte shall fynde returne safe health blusterous storme cruell persecucion shall one tyme executed vpon onelye soone come againe father wyll bee presente agayne throughe spirite comforter hym father shall also bee shall neuer bee separate vntyll fully placed v kyngdome heauen ye sorowfull goe waye ye rightly loue forsooth ye woulde reioyce owne sake mine wyll playe runagate gooe euerye returne agayne father obteyne excellent giftes hand father greatter cum eth thyng soeuer doe departe ye stande dread harme towardes sorowefull cause semyng ye ioyfull behalfe remoued taken waye euils world goe father coumpany yf ye sory selfes departure shall bring muche profite nowe haue shewed come come passe ye might beleue hereafter talke many woordes prince worlde ummeth hath nothing world may know loue father nd father gaue commaundemente euen doe se leate v goe hence knowe speake neyther greatlye take hede vnderstande thesame therefore repete often inculcate bryng thesame dede shal effectuously verifie ye thing haue spoken ye may therewith beleue rest true haue tolde aforehande shoulde folowethe prince worlde cummeth hath nothing beyng mortall man shall speake many thynges mortall time hande shalbe taken away body uerye satan prynce worlde presente minysters ready set vpon full myght force vtterlye caste awaye extinguishe hande ieopardie hath right autoritie ouer moste eu teth haue ouerhande victorye shall bee vanquished ouerthrowen hath ryghte vpon theim whiche bee synne worlde bondage synne maye playe tyraunte ouer make worlde theyr god dede neyther forced dye faulte dye suffre throughe deathe redeme bee ioyned faythe membres bodye tyrannye sinne deathe father hath commaunded thus doe whiche commaundemente dooe accordyng minde wherefore haue nowe already sitte long inough doe father commaundemente willingly tyme goe mete death whiche hande arise therefore goe hence lorde iesus seeyng disciple many wayes dismayedarise let v go hence partely sorowe sawe theyr lordes death nye loued somewhat worldly yet moste vehementelye partelye feare harmes whiche thoughte hang ouer hym beeyng abrode also seeyng heauye slepe whiche nyght prouoked also sorowe mynde augmented theyr sittyng made theym sluggishe mynde commaundeth theym ryse least dulnesse beeyng auoided myghte bee made pregnaunte quicke witted thynges whiche shoulde saye vnto therewithall monished farre darkely nowe tyme eleuate theyr myndes yearthly affeccions heauenly thynges bodily thynges spirituall thynges mortall thynges immortall thynges transitorye eternall thynges woulde ha also imprinted theyr myndes knewe willyng suffre thyng soeuer shoulde suffre father also willyng thesame whose wyll neuer varye apostle farr mannes weakenesse coulde beare witness seer passion therefore sermon maketh oftentymes mencion departure litle litle thereby inure sufferaunce mixyng withal many coumfortes mitigate bitter payne sorowe saiyng dede muste departe within shoulde come agayne go father thence sende coumforter whiche finishe begoonne also father ioyntly together come dwell sayed furthermore persecucion shoulde vtterlye deuour consume thence place place open syght hearde prynce world euen presente stoode generall feare themself therfore brought place wheras wer safetie thyntente myght bolde hertes geue eare thynges conclusion telleth aforehande length shoulde folowe hym thyther whether nowe goeth well nowe hath recourse agayne saiyng whiche algates muste sitte inwardely byde theyr heartes whiche saiyng counsaileth perseuer charitye obseruyng commaundementes leste throughe theyr owne faulte shoulde disseuer theymselfes felowshippe father sonne holy ghoste whiche iudas already forceably dissociate himselfe aduiseth theym sticke theyr couenaunte obeying saiynges theyr lorde thuttermoste theyr power folowe doynges trueth coulde n vnlesse dyd perseuer spirituall felowshippe soonne yet meane tyme truste theimselfes thyng presume vpon theyr owne propre strength shoulde neuer bee able dooe oughte anye tyme benefite free gyfte godde whome floweth issueth oute folke thyng soeuer setteth forwarde true health maketh saluacion myght better vnderstande retaine memory declareth matter similitude taken brought plaine knowen thing vyne braunches thereof p xv chapter true vine father husbande man euery braunche beareth fruite take awaye euery braunche beareth fruite wyll pourge maie bring foorth fruite thintent saieth ye maie vtterly vnderstand cleane voyde perill ye yf ye wyll continue stil felowship great daunger yf ye fallyng couenaunte haue made bee disseuered remembre true vyne ye bee braunches father housbandman roote stocke vyne ye membres braunches sprong stocke father hath planted saye hath begotten stocke came foorth hym ye stocke thanke whole benefite redoundeth father fountaine therof whiche doth geue vnto spirite whatsoeuer geueth sappe stocke whiche geueth vnto braunches lyfe strength bring forth fruite spirite common bothe father lyke spirite knitteth father doth also ioyne therefore braunche soeuer cleaueth liuyng spirite bringeth forth fruite woorthy stocke thesame shall father purge cuttyng awaye superfluous desyres thereof maye bring forth plenteous kindly fruite whoso cleaueth ye profession faith bringgeth foorth fruite euangelicall charitie father shall cutte vyne cumberous vnprofitable membre braunche hath fruite onely leaues serueth purpose vyne nowe ye cleane woordes whiche haue spoken vnto byde braunche cannot beare fruite selfe excepte bide vine ye excepte ye bide vine ye braunches abydeth bringeth forth muche fruite without ye nothing man bide cast foorthe braunche withered men gather caste fier burne ye byde wordes abide aske ye shalbe doen herin father glorified ye beare muche fruite becum disciple already ye braunches somewhat purged made cleane beleuyng woorde yet ye muste hereafter bee purged ye maye bring forth plentye fruit tyme inough bee grafted stocke whence fayth ye maye receyue life laboure dilygently abyde lyke manner dwelle long depende vpon braunche pulled fro vine cannot selfe bring foorth fruite taketh sap stocke ye bryng forth fruite good worke excepte ye cleaue faythe charitie whence muste come whatsoeuer furthereth trewe eternall saluacion wherefore neyther moses prophetes vyne onelye vyne whiche muste cleaue wyll bryng foorth fruite saluacion ye braunches vyne wherein ye frely graffed freely pourged ye maye fall thence owne faute wherefore ye muste earnestely take hede ye maye bee alwaies ioyned whosoeuer continueth stil ioyned hauyng likewyse ioyned hym liuyng spirite persone throughe father inspiracion bringeth forth fruite plenteously gayning himselfe eternall saluacion causing god whose sake al thinges bee dooen bee glorified amonges men glorie glorie whome hathe pleased liberally geue al geueth menne atteinyng eternall saluacion therfore remembre well without ye doe nothyng good anye braunche dooe owne faulte pull hymselfe backe againe onely bringeth foorth fruite like vnprofitable braunche cut shreadyng hooke withereth afterwarde beeyng gathered vp twigges bee shred caste fyer burne thesame braunche destitute moysture spirite dyeth spirituallye althoughe liue bodilye beeyng life seperate withoute recouerie vyne caste euerlastyng fyer burne euer great tormenteyf ye byde c aske ye yl shall bee geuen somuche woulde abyde styll vyne bryng forth fruite eternall felicitie ye shall abyde yf woorde abyde ye kepe mynde thinges whiche ye beleue execute dede whiche ye remembre ye wyll ye neede feare worldelye stormes thoughe bee still presente bodye yet father heare yf ye rightly aske thinges ye would haue ye shal obtayne asking like selfes ye able bryng foorth fruite euen ye ought presumptuously attribute selfes prayse good dedes haue sought mine owne glorye father whome haue power shall ye referre thanke commendacion good deedes father menne shall perceiue bryng foorth muche euangelical fruite father glorified among theim prayse soeuer shall gette thesame shall redounde father glorye whome ye shall cause praysed among menne shewyng selfes ryght disciple sonne neede worldely praise expedient saluacion mankynde thyng thriste couete cummeth charitie ambicion father thus desireth bee glorified amonges men pa father hath loued euen haue also loued continue ye loue ye kepe commaundementes ye shall byde loue euen haue kept father commaundementes haue byden loue thinges haue spoken vnto ioye might remaine vnto ioye might bee full haue loued whiche braunches euen father hath loued stocke carefull kepe great benefite freelye geuen leste ye lease negligence ye shall lease lyke alwaies procuring father glorye haue continewed euen death loue towardes hym ye perseuer loue towardes wherin ye shall perseuer obseruing phariseis phylosophers preceptes keping commaundementes neither flattery feare world may separate doeth constantly death kepe father commaudementes neuer disseuered fro loue hym deedes declaring selfe requite loue lyke loue wherfore shall father glory haue naturall sonne worthy hym lesse shall honour may haue disciple obseruers woordes folowers doinges albeit thinges sumwhat painful tedious yet therfore vse long comunicacion therin thintent haue labored ioye worlde herein reioyce obeying father comaundemet beloued seke comfort worlde reioyce kynde ioye whensoeuer ye folowing steppe shall afflicted let ioy remayne euer increasyng greater better vntill cum perfitly perpetuall felicitie immortall life one charitably loue shalbe great cumforte euen myddest trouble ye wurste pthis commaundemet ye loue together haue loued greater loue hath man man bestowe life frendes ye frendes yf ye whatsoeuer commaund hence furth call seruauntes seruaunt knoweth hys lorde doth haue called frendes thynges haue heard father haue opened diuerse preceptes phariseis moses hath also manye one precept owne whiche includeth thinges teache shall make pleasaunt aduersities whiche shall happen say ye beare loue one haue borne towardes doe testifie loue woordes onelycotinue loue c also deedes loue commune sorte excellent greatest man lyuing haue bee greater token loue amonge men man bestowe lyfe frendes sake euery man setteth lyfe aboue thinges many perchaunce myght bee found coulde bee content bestowe money labour man sake person rare bee found whiche bestowe lyfe frendes sake doe whiche bestowe lyfe mine enemy becum frendes meane call frendes waye honour haue good right call seruauntes neuertheles take seruauntes frendes yf ye wyll cherefully gladly perfourme thinges commaunde dooe willingly obey father commaundement vnder moses lawe rightfully called seruauntes depend vpon diuerse rule prescribed vnto rather feare loue doe thing apointed haue called bondage law vnto libertie gospell hence foorth call seruauntes frendes whome mutuall loue necessitie doeth ioyne vnto seruaunte perceiueth lordes intent onely dooeth bydden lokyng greate rewarde yf dooe well assured bee punished yf dooe besydes euerye sundrie doyng must sundry commaundement goe cum agayne doe eschewe maister telleth owne counsell seruauntes whiche therfore euil trusted rather feare loue hym cause wherfore haue called frendes haue opened vnto purpose minde thintent nede hereafter mennes preceptes contrary myne whatsoeuer father hath willed shewe therof haue made partaker trust ye frendes thinges whiche haue taught doubte haue taught none saue haue hearde father preceptes preceptes kepyng wherof shall count frendes stede seruauntes pye haue chosen haue chosen ordeined goe bryngt foorth fruite fruite shall remayne whatsoeuer ye aske father name may geue ye maye better vnderstand great honor gentlenes towardes consider ye haue neyther prouoked seruice frendship duetie ought loue yet haue willyngly cum frendshippe getlenes sake requite lyke loue ye wer bondage lawe farre fauour god myne owne voluntarye wil chose among al reste without desert purpose haue chosen ye increase goodnes beeyng grafted thorow mutuall loue whiche ye coulde haue towardes except first loued braunche alwaye norished moysture vine spredeth self many braunches must lykewise plentifully bring forth fruite ghospell throughout whole world good self loose fruite therby common vyne bringeth foorth fruite suche soone decayeth wherfore braunches thereof fruitefull tyme growe vine soone fadeth contrarywise ye cleaue immortal stocke shall bryng forth fruite neuer shall perishe continue unde eternall saluacion ye haue cause meane say great payne trauayle worlde teache gentile suffer dispites wicked people wage ayde rewarde apoint v passe vpon worldely defense let stand stede rewardes helpes whatsoeuer ye shall rightly aske father name shall geue thinge easy aske able geue furthermore thyng geue sake commaunde ye loue together yf world hate ye knowe hated hated ye worlde worlde woulde loue hou beit ye world haue chosen worlde therfore world hateth remember word sayed vnto seruaunt greater lord haue persecuted also persecute haue kept saying kepe also besides commaundementes tedious pleasaunt one loue bee weake mutuall loue maye make strong thyng greuous mutuall charitie make delectable neither let trouble while bee frendes one charitablie doe agree ye shall discorde strife worlde rather selfe thyng ought coufort myndes muche thys token ye shall well perceiue selfes bee disciple frendes saye contrary worlde whiche sette vpon malice whereas apointed heauen disdayne suffer world haue suffered worlde hateth also deserte reproue disclose euill dedes therof teachyng thynges whiche agree theyr worldly affeccions worlde knoweth menne secte doeth loue exalte lyke louethe lyke euyll itche coueteth handsume scratcher therfore vnhappy worlde flattereth fauoreth declareth bee farre fauour god whiche onely thyng make man happie dede whan worlde hateth remember myne exaumple reioyce owne behalfe ye haue feloweshyp worlde cleaue faste vnto shall ye perceiue hatred worlde beareth howe ye myne case ye world ye loued wordly thinges taught according worldly desyres worlde woulde knowe loue hys owne ye folowe wayes fleshe spirite couete worldly goodes heauenly therefore worlde hateth ye deserue ye vnlyke thesame whiche euill wicked tymes paste ye thoughte perfitte righteousnes consiste grosse ceremonyes moses lawe setting mindes transytorie thinges loue heauenly thinges worlde well lyke called secte euangelicall heauenly doctrine graffed braunches stocke worlde beganne hate onely ye bee myne yet trueth cause elles shall ye bee blessed ye mine meruayle nothing though innocence shall defende hatred worlde remember howe haue tolde seruauntes state better lordes neither coulde innocencie greater defende malice worlde neyther afearde despise doctrine yet benefites would waxe gentle call themselfes backe theyr cruell purpose thing whiche durst enterprise lorde maister muche boldely se ing haue de sed many snare bring euen reprocheful death haue often spitefully railed vpon wil also persecute disciple nay rather obey woordes wil also obey vnto lyke haue well borne doctrine wil ye shal teache selfe thinges teache thinges doe vnto name sake haue knowen sent cum spoke vnto haue synne nowe haue nothing clocke theyr sinne withall hateth hateth father doen among workes none man haue sinne haue bothe seen heard onely also father happeneth saying might fulfilled
