written theyr lawe hated without cause whatsoeuer despite shall doe thinke doen thynges shall agaynste shall doe hatred beare curse shal curse thei reiecte shal reiecte beate shall beate whatsoeuer displeasure doen membres thesame redoundeth head would doe lyke present cannot shewe crueltie wil shewe iniurie dooen toucheth lyke maner whatsoeuer committed name tourneth father dishonour also rightlye knowe thynke doe woulde neuer shamfully haue handled sonne arrogantlye pretende loue towardes god yet bee wickedly minded againste sonne aske saluacion god goe aboute destroye sonne boaste themselues kepers god commaundementes doe reiecte preceptes whiche sonne geueth auctoritie father glorie knowledge lawe doe receiue knowledge hym lawe setteth forth wurship sender persecute hym whome hath sente therefore knowe god whome boaste themselfes knowe yet thys ignoraunce shall excuse daye punishemente ignoraunte dede woulde learne therfore woulde learne loued theyr owne glorye glorye god set owne aduauntage winne saluacion gospell wherefore thynge whiche father hath ordeyned theyr saluacion haue owne stubber esse heaped vp theyr eternall damnacion verily come sente purpose mighte saue men sonne god greatest persone could sent come selfe declared vnto suche thinges might haue brought better minde also doen thinges whiche inough haue forced euen stouye hertes faythe belefe surely theyr destruccion shoulde haue easie giltlesse infidelitie addicion wherof shall make burden theyr eternall damnacion heauyer nowe sith haue leafte nothing vndoen wherby might saued againe obstinate malice haue resisted whiche frely offereth saluacion alledge excuse theyr incredulitie one hate straunger maie bee thought sumwhat woorthie pardon hateth neuer sawe haue bothe seene hearde haue seene doe good folkes haue hearde speake thinges woorthy god neuerthelesse hate thinges whiche ought loue whoso hateth must nedes hate father whose auctoritie speake speake whose power haue onelye spoken wordes also dedes yet blinded neither beleue woordes dedes selfe thing shall make damnacion greuouse haue stubbernely abused goodnesse god alwaye ready thembut nowe haue nothing cloke theyr sinne withall doen suche miracle among neuer prophetes afore whether man consider noumber greatnesse make afeard astonished therewith helpe afflicted doen al say haue giltie moste greuouse sinne nowe haue heard seene muche haue hated haue spoken doen also father whiche hath spoken set furth power neuer sawe moses yet hym doe exteme hylye beleue prophetes neuer hearde turne cleane awaye haue presentely seene theyr iyes haue hearde speake whose benefites haue manye wayes profe herewith satisfyed take lyfe meane pretende reuerente loue god father whereas whoso truely loueth father cannot hate sonne howbeit thinges happen chaunce thing men doe psalmes whiche haue reade long agon prophecie cum passe saye stede thankes shoulde recompence good turnes euill thus spake mouthe prophete let reioyce triumphe ouer whiche vniustely myne enemy hate without cause man prouoked hate maye bee suffered one hate straunger maye sumwhat pardoned forgiue hateth one bothe knoweth hath found beneficiall comforter cum sende vnto father euen spirite trueth whiche procedeth father shall testifie ye shall beare witnesse also ye haue begynning neuerthelesse incredulitie persones shall make fruite vneffectuall whiche cleane shall haue accomplished al father hath geuen commaundement comforter come proceding father wil sende according promisse whiche holy goste beyng inspirer teacher trueth shall declare euer haue sayd doen wherby bothe goodnesse obstinate blindnesse shall euidetly appeare shall shewe hath nothing doen hath prophecied owne bookes whiche reade yet vnderstande ye also whiche weake made strong inspiracion spirite shall testifie menne muche ye haue seene ordre haue doen hearde haue sayed lyke haue tolde thinges certaine euen whiche haue seene heard father neyther shall holye goste put thing trueth youre mindes muche procedeth father shall ye beare witnesse thinges doubtefull suche throughly tryed sens sum whiche beleue yet muste saluacion loste bycause whiche wilfully perishe theyr owne faulte xvj chapter pthese thinges haue sayd vnto ye shoulde offended shall excommunicate yea tyme shall cum whosoeuer kylleth thinke doeth god seruice suche thinges doe vnto haue knowen father yet thinges haue tolde tyme cum ye may remember tolde shal seming euerye daunger withdrawe folke fro open cofessio gospel trueth world trueth shal spurne deuices shall neuer bee able put vtter silece conuince trueth staieth selfe vpo god auctour thereof ye see thynges woorlde goeth doe publyshyng father trueth nedeful yt ye prepare mides paciently suffer lyke doe therfore tel yt thin ge shall cum lest ye suppose professio ghospell bee plesaut delicate ye sor r dismaied thinges chau ceth vnwares otherwise loke eiuils man foreseeth whiche stifly bendeth mynde ere cu place lesse grieueth deceiue neither displeasure whiche muste nedes suffered ye gospel sake neyther touchyng ye rewardes ta ieth ye valiantly doe theyr duetie office beginne preache ghospell shall thing fyrste happen thoughte vnderstand highe poyntes religion kepe perfeccion teache professe knowledge law shall caste synagogue wicked coursed people thing amog moste reproch herewith afterwarde contented cum imprisonment stroke length thyng growe ende yt whosoeuer kylleth shall thynke therein offre thakefull sacrifice god shall colour wickednesse pretense godlinesse shall accuse condemne giltie impietie teacher true godlinesse shall cum passe onely ye muste suffer harde greuouse thinges ye shall bee punished vngodly person malefactours care ye worlde iudgeth let exaumple comforte remembring ye suffre thinges father sake myne iniurie haue wrong shal parte bothe ayde youre conflicte rewarde hauing victorie resiste also punishe obstinacie thinke ye nothing vengeaunce shall thus handle ye theues transgressours waye el woorthie suche eiuill intreating doe yet perfectly knowe neyther father ignoraunce wherwith crueltie mingled shall cause father take compassion vpo would ye muche desyre punishmente haue saued doctrine zeale religio shal sette prouoke many rather errour iudgement eiuill wil folke shall repent themselfes amend father knowen worlde assone men shall youre preachyng vnderstande doctrine knowe power holy goste knowe ye bee sory departure hence sorow added vpon sorow thought mete forewarne hereof discommodities falleth vpon ye maye paciently lesse hertebreake beare calling remembrauce tolde yt thinges shoulde folowe myne exaumple ye suffer wicked suche ignoraunte trueth euen father sake myne ye suffised stayed conscience trueth passe menne iudge rather folow doctrine iudge selfe blessed name sake menne doe persecute speake eiuil elie shall put synagogue selfe thing shall proue name registred heauen thinges sayd vnto beginning present go waie sente none asketh whither goe haue sayed suche thinges vnto hertes full sorow neuerthelesse tell trueth expediet goe awaye yf goe awaye comforter cum vnto departe sende hym vnto cum wil rebuke world sinne rightuousnesse iudgement sinne beleue rightuousnesse go father ye shall see iudgement prince world iudged alreadye knewe thynges shoulde happen neuerthelesse firste tooke spake nothing deceiue thereby time serued dede thinges fyt al time bodily presence hath season nourished strengthned weakenesse forasmuche tyme departure hande nedeful yt ye openly admonished ye shall suffer entent ye maye litle litle enure selfes content lacke comforte corporall presence ye haue sequestred worldly affeccion take vnto fyrme manlyke boldenesse herte childishe end lyke vnto babe hang mother lap afraied chaunce tyme pulled away parentes syght would pamper disceyue vaine hope yet tyme discourage ye haue serued according infirmitie tyme required haue comforterit expedient goe awaye aduocate defender must departe hece though cause chiefly strengthen greater thinges body bee withdrawen sight yet talke therof dooeth put suche feare none doeth aske much thinke whither goe dede ye ought rather reioice mind troubled departure seing goe father came shall hereafter vtterly absent sorte present ignoraunt would haue pleasaunt affeccions ye rather haue continuall alcion conuersacion among leauer speake thinges profite doth delyte would leauer haue vpo knowelage trueth heauinesse time procede sure constancie yt shoulde fitte storme cum cause open vnto shall chaunce hereafter uerily thus must leue taken away ye shall suffer many thinges ye may apte beare paciently expedient ight vnlesse takyng sight fleshe ye ware spirituall comforter spirite shall make strong vanquished shal cum vnto haue prepared shall perfourme finish haue begonne finally spirite shall alwaye continue yea presently gone nowe kynde presence purpose cumming dwell still worlde cause abase selfe state infir tiefor goe away coforter wil cum vnto enhaunce heauen hath semed good father wysedome processe tyme shoulde serue aduaunce litle litle certaine degree thinges perfeccion reason ye behalfes accommodate mindes good willes father order disposicio thinges ye shall haue al thing gifte parte endeuoure selfe mete receiue benefite ye alway cotinue thus affect ye heauely comforter wil cum yet vnable receiue giftes goe waye regarding corporall presence frame mindes hier giftes whiche spirite shall geue shall father sende hym vnto neuer forsake leue succourlesse whether lyue dye shall frutelesse spirite cummeth shall worke nowe doe power ne becau e appointe euery busynes tyme thing expedient ne saluacion haue reproued worlde thing shall doe fully plainly shall sore charge world excepte thinke amende selfe geuyng faithe ghospell shall without excuse dede lyke infirmitie fleshe offendeth worlde euen doeth seme minister matter sayed world maie pretende excuse infidelitie haue seen outward man hungrie thurst haue seen poore contempt within shall se sore afflicted taken mine enemy al beate curryed conclusion die thinges finished flesh hath shall se body dead liue againe ascend vp heauen shall se holye ghoste sent make dainly vnfearefull preacher name shall also perceiue wonderfull power vertue strength shewed calling vpon name deuils go dainly men halte lame restored lymmes sycke healed dead lyue againe moreouer euery thing cu passe whiche prophetes prophecied shoulde folowe say manner excuse shal left wicked mi reantes worlde shall adiudged condened thre pointes excused firste synne rightuousnesse thirdly iudgemet shal rebuke worlde greatest suche synne doeth include sinnes synne inexcusable whye seing perceiued prophecy god owne prophetes take effect many thousandes professe name beleued receiued holy goste speake straunge language much noted miracle forsake supersticion moses lawe imbrace holy gospel deteste theyr forefather idolatrie yet wurshippe father heauen true godlynesse life nothing regarding worldly commodity haue mindes wholye sette vpon heauenlye thinges worlde saye perceiuing excuse shall make lacke belefe shal lacke father behalfe hath sent myne whiche sent haue men saued yf holy ghoste shall omit nothing whome shall sende neyther ye whome heauenly spirite shall vse instrumentes resteth al may vnderstand howe perishe synne vnbelefe whan shall see prophane gentile haue sinnes olde former lyfe washed away themselues endued innocecie thorowe baptisme profession name shal manifeste wittingly willingly abyde still filthines adde sinne vpon synne worlde also shall bee reproued falsely vsurped righteousnesand righteousnesse c nowe sum waie pretende kepyng lawe sumwhat glory obseruing ordinaunces progenitor pretende religion whiche forefather gaue feastes sabboth dayes prayer woorkes mercie wayes honouring god suche lyke whiche hath pretence righteousnesse shall see wonderfull power spirite bee geuen haue professed name shall bee chaunce whiche idolatres haue without kepyng lawe shall say thereby whiche challenge themselfes righteousnes kepyng lawe vaine glorye menne false righteousnes whiche haue refused hym whome onely true righteousnesse cummeth bee true shall open worlde whan spirite shall declare bee dead fastened crosse bur ed dyd returne agayne father came ly hym inuisyble withdrawen men syght greater thinges inspired spirite dyd ng ly yng worlde thus shall cum passe thinges vnrighteousnes shall rebuked haue put hope righteousnesse iustice god made notable whiche faithfully hath perfourmed thing many yeares agoe promised mankynde apostle prophetes within thing shalbe put v e take effect shall long conuersaunt among visible bodie shall dye goe father yet ye shall perceyue one liueth hath power shall accomplishe haue promised moreouer worlde also shal rebuked reproue iudgement seing men euery penaunce co erte synne innocencie lyfe leaue grosse ceremony moses lawe ruine godlynesse ghospellof iud emet prince world iudg already nacions whole worlde forsake theyr wurshipping diuels image falle true wurshipping god father sonne holy ghost shall manifestly appere prince worlde hath heretofore synne practised already owne weapon vanquished put waye iudged one hath procured death innocencie libertie gospell immortalitie recouered employed geuen shall well appere haue triumphe whiche semed thing shame reproche haue victory whiche imputed counted ouerthrowe vtter destruccion whan deuils shall eche cast temple shall crye signe crosse shall leaue bodyes whiche long tyme possessed naming shall openly proue theyr prince iudged condemned shall bee apparante clere matter also woorthely iudged condemned whiche leuer folow hym alreadye vanquished iudged eternall deathe conquerour folke verye auctour innocencie life god shall carrye vp auaunce felowship kyngdome pi haue yet many thinges saye vnto ye cannot beare awaye nowe howbeit cum whiche spirite trueth leade al trueth wil speake hym selfe whatsoeuer shall heare shall speake wil shewe thinges cum shall glorifie shall receyue myne shall shewe vnto thinges father hathe myne therefore sayed vnto shall take myne shewe vnto coulde tell many mo thinges tyme serueth weakenesse wyll yet beare since haue yet altogether goen thorow mine ambassade therfore reserue cummyng holy ghoste beyng come shall fynde apte receyue full knowledge euen busynesse deathe resurreccion ascencion shall dispatched fynished spirite speake shall lying worldely spirite spirite saye spirite trueth shall teache trueth whiche ye nowe able receiue ful also shall speake vnto shall secrete inspiracions shall mouing ayer touche bodely eares priuey secrete vertue shall moue inwarde myndes neyther shall speake thynges vncertaintye lyke maner haue spoken nothyng whiche haue heard father shall inspire nothyng hertes hearde father shall onely open vnto trueth thynges paste also shall foreshewe thynges cumme ere happen often nede shall require alone almighty hathe withall knowleage thinges shall make glory name knowen men lyke deathe resurreccion shall make father glory notable famouse thing soeuer doe redoundeth father praise glory whome haue haue receiued haue cum shall growe honour praise whatsoeuer shall woorke shall mocion nothing contrary thinges whiche receiuing father haue taught thinges common betwene v thinges procede father whosoeuer mine thing father mine whiche common spirite therefore sayde spirite shall speake father hathe spoken beleueth beleueth father beleueth spirite beleueth v pafter ye shall see againe ye shall see go father sayed sum disciple betwene themselues sayeth vnto v ye shal see againe ye shall see go father sayed therefore sayeth whyle cannot tell sayeth iesus perceiuing woulde aske hym sayed vnto ye enquire betwene selues sayed ye shall see againe ye shall see uerily verily saye vnto ye shall wepe lament contrariwyse worlde shall reioyce ye shall sorowe sorowe shall turned ioy corroborate stablished many thinges ye bold take good hearte vnto againste storme hangeth ouer aduersitie saue selues prosperitie whiche shall folowe within whyle ye shall lacke syght ye shall without longe time within shorte space shall presented syght agayne ye may litle litle brought vre wante sight body moste commodiouse returne father thentente cease seen maye endue greater giftes withstanding great sorowe possesse disciple mindes time neyther vnderstood coulde kepe memorie thinges often repeted reiterate whereas lord iesus declare wordes obscurely yt death buryall absent disciple sight yet none otherwyse within thre dayes would appeare vnto againe euen self bodye immortall fewe dayes space confirmed stayed mindes disciple conuaye hymselfe heaue thentent hauing bodely sight withdrawen letted spirituall mighte deserue heauenly spirite looke lordes bodely presence saue onely laste daye shall shewe hymselfe whole worlde iudge quicke dead saye notwithstanding yet disciple perceiue thing spoken sayde mutteryng among themselues meaneth saying litle ye shall see shalbe litle time ye shal se go father shall se hym hath himselfe awaye go father meaneth litle wherein shall restraine v seing hym againe litle shall permit v see darke saying vnderstande speaketh iesus perceiuing mindes aske ment sayingwhat sayeth vnto v preuented demaunde question declare custome knewe moste secret thoughtes againe saith sayde litle whyle sight shalbe taken fro againe litle shalbe restored newly vnto expedient shoulde alwaye tarry among suche sorte profit yt depart hence go father doeth trouble thing haue sayd moste true tyme nyghe hauing familiar cumpanie disceuered broken ye shall wayling sorowe weping manner consumed werye lyues men destitute succoure contrarie worlde shal ioye praunce triumphe conquerour within litle tyme course thinges shall chaunged worldes ioye shall turned sorowe sorow ioye gladnesse cause death shall greue make pensife shall make iewes gladde resurreccion shall make ioyouse contrarie shall vexe trouble iewes wherfore beare well boldly shorte sorowe thorowe hope ioye shall folowe soone pa woman trauayleth hath sorowe houre come assone deliuered childe remembreth anguishe ioye man borne worlde ye therfore haue sorow see againe hertes shall reioyes ioye shall man take daye shal ye aske question lyke manner woman greate childe suffereth sore gre ous paynes tyme trauayle yet beareth oute painefull throwes stout good herte knoweth shall long endure soone foloweth vpo byrth childe ioyous pleasure sone hath brought foorthe childe laboured trauayle pleasure beyng mother newe childe great forgetteth dolourouse payne whiche sustained trauailes yea saye sothe ioyeth muche hath boughte long comforte shorte dolour thesame wyse shall also litle time draweth fast sore vexed minde yea ye nowe already great sorowe yet within fewe dayes hereafter conquerour death shal present selfe alyne againe vnto hertes shal replenished great ioye whome ye bewayle mourne dead ye shall se aliue made immortall neuer dye sorowfull mourning shall shorte ioyeful mirth shall perpetuall death ouerpasseth immortalitie remayneth euer puerily verily saye vnto whatsoeuer ye shal aske father name wyll geue hitherto haue ye asked nothyng name aske ye shall receyue ioye maye bee full thinges haue spoken vnto prouerbes tyme wyll cum shall speake vnto prouerbes shall shewe plainly father daye shall ye aske name saye vnto wyll speake vnto father father hymselfe loueth ye haue loued haue beleued came ou god went father came worlde agayne leaue worlde go father nowe many thinges whiche herte lepeth desyre question shall mindes also iyes bee fully content satisfied ye shall wene mo question bee demaunded great excelling ioye shall shake vtterly put awaye griefe minde neyther shall wyshe require thing el considering ye shall se perceiue giuen loked durst bolde desyre assure taken vp heauen ye shall wante nothing bee easie aske father whatsoeuer verely ye shall aske namewhatsoeuer ye shall aske father name shall geue shall geuen nede ayde father alone maye thinges deny frendes aske name nothing hitherto bodely presence hath letted aske thing name worthie yet ye wholy depende heauenly ayde led worldly affeccion ye depende vpon bodie hereafter lyfting vp hertes heauen make peticion ye knowe present aduocate ye shall obtaine whatsoeuer ye aske ioye shall heuines come vnto reason ye shall se againe maye full perpetuall shall chaunge sorowe ioye hauing hauing infirmitie body trusting heauenly succour alwaye ready hauing alwaye spirite present coumforter counceler ye maye enioye continuall gladnes conscience thankyng praysyng god bothe prosperitie also aduersitie nowe waye haue sumwhat obscurely prouerbially spoken vnto yet fully vnderstanding doe saye behoued geue place beare infirmitie also maye learne co descend agree imbecillitie weakenesse time shall come whan hauing mortall body remoued hence shall comon stablished stronger also sorowe set syde attent father manifestly without closynge vp matter parable reason yt minde vnsteadie weake carefull thing plainly openly spoken parable length shal euen spirite declare open vnto certaintie father wyll becummeth ignoraunt father wyll verely shall speake vnto whishtlie without wordes shall speake assured manifeste thinges bee ye aske yea also holy ghoste shall incense aske howe aske name whiche case ye surely though great matter thing difficultie yet shall father sake deny askyng doe nowe speake ye shall obtaine requeste mediacion suche sorte men doe sumtime kinges hande yt obtaine requeste desyre suite sum one fauour kyng whiche peticion kyng woulde el haue graunted content geue sake whiche commende set forward suters supplicacion father althoughe loueth bee asked sonne whome hath beene graunte thynges menne yet notwithstandynge wyll otherwise consente desyres onlye loue beareth towardes sonne whiche hath also towardes loueth sonne loueth whomsoeuer sonne loueth father loueth also therefore loueth workes sake ye loue semblablie beleue cum hym loue father euen loue sone beleue father euen beleue sonne trueth dooeth beleue whiche denyeth sonne haue cum father haue sayed doen thyng euen father auctoritie already father came worlde euen cary vp takyng vnto mortall body yt ye se cause came worlde euen cary vp heauen thynges beyng n whiche father gaue commaundemente doe euen sake leaue world touchyng bodily presence returne vnto father truely whatsoeuer shalbe doen shall bee doen bryng saluacion phi disciple sayed vnto hym lo nowe alkeste thou plainly speakeste prouerbe nowe sure thou knowest thynges nedest shal man aske question therfore beleue thou camest god iesus aunswered nowe ye beleue beholde houre draweth nye already cum ye shalbe scattered euery owne shall leaue alone yet alone father wordes haue spoken vnto ye mighte haue peace worlde shall ye haue tribulacion good haue ouercum world disciple beynge boldened sayinges begunne sumwhat stande owne conceite though theyr owne strength beene able abide heare lordes death hande answere wyse loke saye euen present doest thou fullfill selfe thynge whiche thou promised afterwarde doe nowe withoute darkenes parable thou speakeste plainly thou wilte neyther nedeth aske question thou knoweste thynges thy good wordes hast deliuered hertes sorowe nede communicacion nothinge doubte hope thy ioye come wee shall boldly paciently suffre thynge imminent cumming towardes v therfore finallye verily beleue thou art cum god thou seest throughly botome secrecie hertes lord iesus whose maner euery sharply controll restraine whatsoeuer humayne worldely arrogancie ambicion selfe affiance perceiued arise discyples heartes yt mighte plainely learne distruste owne strength vertue whereby myghte dooe nothyng wholly depende vpon hande god father lorde iesus saye dyd thus abate acoole arrogancie whiche suche thoughe yet vnderstoode sayed thoughe true belefe yet meete stormes wer cummyng vpon tooke hande thing asked god prayer aunswereth sorte dooe heare thynge whyche promyse geue hereafter whan ye shal made strongenow ye beleue c staied doctrine inspiracion holy ghost ye proudely take hande due time ye might least sumwhat helpe assistence ma owne power vertue rather tyme full nyghe ye shall declare howe strengthelesse yeare selfes ye shall onely bee vnable go instante tempeste leauing alone handes sergeauntes catchpolles whiche shall violently draw deathe crosse ye shall run awaye eche one ere waye feare amased ye shall one beare cupany another succoure comforte whyles euery one shall feare leste others telling mighte bewrayed come daunger albeit dede nede aide helpe shall trueth forsaken frendes yet shall desolate father shall neuer leaue therefore speake thynges vnto distrusting owne strength ye maye reste staye selfe worlde shall make greate commocio fiercely rise againste doeth agaynst bee bolde shrynke remebryng haue conquered worlde ye shall take exaumple shall trust holpen ye shall also haue victorie beyng youre owne nature weake yet tyme occasion shall require ye shal throughe spirite stronge vnuanquished xvii chapter pthere wordes spake iesus lift vp iyes heauen sayen father houre cum glorifie thy sonne thy sonne also may glorifie thou ha geue power ouer geue eternall lyfe many thou hast geuen life eternall might know thee true god iesus christ thou hast sente iesus kynde talke partelye comforted disciple partely taughte geuen also instruccion againste daungerouse storme imminence cumming vpon theim muche woorde mouthe aduertised howe man power strengthe trusted menne muste put truste heauenly ayde succour nowe therfore woulde teache practise worldely affliccions whiche percase myghte sodeinly falle vpon shoulde looke none succour vnto father heauen vpon whome oughte wholly depende bee desyrouse bee strong inough able beare persecucion therfore lyfting vp iyes heauen thentente might euen semblance behauiour body teache whither minde shoulde bee directed wherupon fixed spake wise father sayed nowe tyme cum whiche haue alway longed glorifie thy sonne amog men death resurreccion thy sonne behalfe maye glorifie amongest men one knowen expediente saluacion mankynd worlde knowe sonne thee father sonne cause hath pleased thee geue vnto sonne power ouer mankynde vniuersally none ende haste thou geuen power folke shoulde saued deliuered death attein euerlasting lyfe hath liked thing soeuer thou grauntest geuest men thou geuest grautest whose death thou geuest eternall lyfe furthermore originall fountain eternal life one setting forth eche others honour name men fayth know v saye thee whiche art onely true god iewes al people whole world procedeth whatsoeuer good knowe also thou hast sent worlde saluacion mankynde iesus christ thou geuest whatsoeuer pleaseth thy goodnes geue men thou doest rendre thankes v thee chiefe autor al thinges thy wil pleasure willingly gladly finishe vp busines appointed cannot cum saluacion whiche honoureth father case despise sonne yet hath sonne reuerence contene neglecte father asmuche praise glorye one praise glory haue glorified thee earth haue finished worke whiche thou gauest glorifie thou father thine owne selfe glorie ere world haue declared thy name vnto men thou gauest worlde thine thou gauest haue kept thy worde nowe haue knowen thinges whatsoeuer thou hast geuen haue geuen vnto wordes whiche thou gauest haue receiued haue knowen surelye came oute haue beleued thou diddeste sende haue hitherto renoumed thy name miracle doctrine worlde haue goen doen thy commaundement forwarde readie prosecute accomplishe remaineth doen haue sought myne owne glory thine yea haue abased caste downe selfe extreme contempte thentente might blase honorably set furth thy name amog men thy glory alwaye whole substanciall sounde selfe without decaye thou haste nede ma prayse standeth hande thou knowen vnto theym father bring thou passe parte worlde may semblably knowe perceiue fully wholy receyued glorie whiche efore worlde made reason frayle mortalitie brittlenes bodie men impute base exteme courselye hiely exteme thy glory selfe hath neyther beginning endyng neither encrease decrease infirmitie bodie haue put vpon doeth impouerishe lessen glorie whiche haue alwaye beyng euermore borne thou haste made worlde haue folke shoulde knowe shoulde haue admiracion shoulde loue thy power wisdo goodnesse nowe agayne time thy goodnesse muste restore whiche hath fourmed made shall verelye restored worlde knowe howe great thy loue towardes mankinde whiche saue thou haste geuen thy sonne vnto death howe great thy power hath conqu red deuill vanquished tyrannie great thy wisdome hath suche wonderfull deuice conuerted worlde vnto thee alienate thee thing begun foundacion worke layed haue made thy name knowen vnto thy godly inspiracion exempte priuileged worlde thou haste geuen committed vnto could haue beene taken separate world could haue grafted vnles thy liberall fre goodnesse inspired minde thyne thou createdst thine thou haste appointed businesse geuen taught infourmed neither hath thy bounteousnes laboure diligence bestowed vpon vaine haue b leued doctrine wherin haue taught thee onely geuen dence vnto haue hitherto stande stedfastly faythe obeying wordes well knowen persuaded vnto iewes would beleue whatsoeuer haue taught whatsoeuer haue doen hath proceded auctor hath doen thy power vertue haue taught none thing haue learned also haue al whatsoeuer ther whatsoeuer thine also mine therfore worde whiche phariseis haue contemned haue receiued cum beleuing thesame haue certainly knowen proceded sent worlde haue thus muche profited perswaded howe messyas whiche haue many hundreth yeares looked whome thou haste sente worlde saluacion faithfully beleue nowe leaue theim touching companiship body behalfe agayne commende thy goodnesse kepte preserued decaye alwaye profit waxe better thei knowe ought thanke theyr saluacion knowe bee succoured whome leane doe depende vpon thee praye praye worlde whiche thou hast geuen thyne myne thyne thine myne glorifyed nowe worlde worlde come thee holye father kepe thorowe thyne owne name whiche thou hast geuen also maye one whyles worlde kepte thy name thou gauest haue kepte none loste loste chylde scripture might fulfylled therefore praye whome beyng withdrawen worlde thou wouldest shoulde thine prayer thy goodnes would stablyshe make thyng perpetually theyr owne thou haste begun nowe praye worlde blynded euyl desyres doeth stubbernly oppugne reclayme agaynste doctrine hauyng enuie theyr owne saluacion freely offred praye thou hast committed tuicion thei worlde thine agaynst malyce deuill cannot sauetie thy continuall ayde therefore father commende thee maye please thee let alwaye thyne lyke perpetually thyne euer therfore myne bee thyne betwene v thynges common whatsoeuer myne thesame also thyne whatsoeuer thine thesame also myne like thou arte honoured glorifyed doctryne among menne glorifyed beliefe whiche sticke vnto constauntly phariseis scribe stade obstinately deniall therof shall sorte succede offyce come roume take way world shall make bothe thy name myne famouse memorye throughout worlde haue played preacher parte dooen funccion office therein wherein shall succede come lyke offyce nowe worlde whiche furth leaue goe yet abyde styll worlde steade disperse abrode throughout nacions worlde whiche haue learned leauyng behynde come whole thee holy father kepe preserue preachyng thy name whome thou gauest teache kepe maye preache teache thynges thou haste wylled preache whiche thynges haue taughte obeying thy wyll thynges neuer went thy commaundementes thynges haue agreed consented thy wyll bothe doctrine also theyr lyfe neuer dissent fro myne shall name truely glorifyed yf agreyng within ourselues bothe one glorifie eche euen neuer dissentyng v doe make name famouse worlde thorowe whatsoeuer haue taught doen shall perceyued haue come v shall therfore redound referred prayse glorie name long lyued theyr company familiarly man men diligente kepe thyne men thou haste put truste withall eue bodely seruice doynges also haue reteyned continued hitherto league v manye thou gauest haue faythfullye kepte safe neuer one couente felowship hath perished except one whiche though lyued companye yet none myne borne damnacion whiche hymselfe owne faulte willinglye called occasioned fall vpon hym omitted nothyng haue reuoked haue brought better mynde thyng truely dyd happe casualtie holy scripture dyd long tyme shewe come passe familiar companion householde shoulde betraye death owne lorde maister notwithstandyng throughe thy godlye deuise diuine prouidence come effecte purpose also mannes death damnacion shall profitable good publique healthe saluacion whole worlde synce hym procured thyng without whiche saluacion coulde sithe also example gotten thereby whiche ought counsayle admonishe euery man abyde constantly perceyuer thyng hath begunne taken hande leste owne folie turne owne vtter destruccion cause owne damnacion thyng whiche mere bountie free goodnes god geuen hym obteyne thereby eternall health saluacion nowe come thee wordes speake world might haue ioye full haue geuen thy worde world hath hated worlde euen also worlde desyre thou shouldeste take worlde thou kepe euill worlde also worlde sanctifie thorow thy trueth thy worde trueth thou dyddest sende worlde euen haue also sent worlde theyr sake sanctifie selfe also might sanctified thorowe trueth nowe lyke matter dooen thy eternall wisedome iudgement euen accordyng thou wouldest haue haue finished thynges thou commaundedst leaue worlde come thee shall go hence meane speake thynges vnto thee thyng doubtfull thy wyll maye prayer comforte stablishe disciple entent maye vnderstand thou wilt care prouide shall wante presence sight body maye also put awaye sorowfull pensiuenesse knowe howe shall lyue agayne theyr ioye soone renued agayne haue sene risen death life conclusion haue seene taken vp heauen haue receiued heauely spirite holy ghost one shalbe steade thee maye conceyue receyue temporall vnperfite ioye whiche maye ryse sight body brought agayne haue perpetuall perfite ioye whiche oure spirite shall alwaye infuse dwelling theyr harte entent nowe shoulde depende nothyng el good affiaunce v vprightnes conscience worlde shall stire vp sore stormes grieuous persecucion agaynste doctrine agreeth affeccions carnall desyres worlde men trueth desyrouse gape earthlye transitory thinges teache heauenly thinges doctrine haue taught fewe haue well liked enbraced thesame worlde setting nought loue doctrine worlde hateth forsakers worlde runnagates v worlde hath none grounde thus doe stick vnto v renounce worlde worlde hath baites enticementes seme pleasaunt time hath also dreadfull thinges threatninges wherwith doth discourage weaken euen right stronge bold herte herewith mayntaineth defendeth faccion fighteth religion therfore equitie would lesse becummeth bounteousnesse whiche hath forsaken worlde come v haue co mit credite themselfes wholy v altogether depend vpon v care prouide thentent worlde may knowe safetie betaketh themselfes succoure mayntenauce leaneth ayde helpe worlde simple playne true hart beare towardes v trust haue v deserueth heauely fauour hatred worlde beareth towardes sake prouoketh beneuolence good towardes worlde doth therfore hate theues murderer rauishers deceyuers false bying sellyng cleare pure enormity worlde ambicion couetousnes malice pharisaicall fraude idolatrie vnclenesse sinnes wherwith worlde euery infect furthermore worlde hateth bicause haue obeyed thy doeth also hate doe mislyke contemne doctrine phariseis set nought folishe wisedome worlde simple true meaning fayth obey lawes tradicions worlde doeth onely hate also name lothe haue spoke yea cause hateth whosoeuer wyll neglecte man doctryne folowe plaine pure doctrine gospel euen doeth muche disagre lustes desire whiche withal affeccion pleasure doe enbrace thinges worlde nowe haue diligently doen duetie officei de e thou shouldest take c separate felowship worlde mete would yet haue cumpanions time yet also taken cleane worlde vntill likewise haue diligence executed office commit vnto pray lining worlde polluted vice worlde fall away v turne backewarde faccions vnstable opinion worlde beyng many wayes assauted cannot shunne exchue without thy helpe stycke brauches membres thus matter stadeth diuers agreable worlde stycke euen also vnlike worlde misliked cleane stycke haue kept safe pure filthy pollucios worlde kepe thou cleane impolluted contagious infeccions worlde shall take effecte yf thy ayde helpe perseuer trueth wisedome worlde hath muche falsehood mixte withall moses lawe wrapped shadowes thinges thy woorde whiche haue taught pure trueth hath disceite cleare easie without smoke shadowes trueth haue taught purely sincerely nedeth nowe many interpretacions translacions many pharisaical ordinauces many laboured philosophical sophemes subtyll sentence doctrine playne easie vnderstand folke fayth shall sufficient doctrine euerlastyng felicitie lyke beyng thy apostle messenger sente thee worlde haue doen thy busines faithfully haue corrupted contagiousnes worlde rather haue drawe worlde purenesse euen doe send worlde steade teache purely sincerely whiche haue heard studying owne gaine prayse folowyng thy intent testimonie many maye drawen v separate worlde whiche altogether sinfull may pourged synne perseuer pure preachyng trueth gospel doe offer selfe sacrifice thee cannot purely preache doctrine worlde subiect worldly affeccions neuerthelesse pray alone also whiche shall beleue thorowe theyr preachyng may one thou father art thee also may one v wor de may beleue thou haste sent glory whiche thou gauest haue geuen may one also one thou may made perfecte one worlde may knowe thou haste sente haste loued thou hast loued father whiche thou haste geuen may see glory thou haste geuen thou louedst makyng worlde doe onely pray whiche fewe numbre shal doctrine preached renounce worlde put whole affiaunce shal come passe sticking thy woordes pulled away thee like sticking preceptes shal pulled away brauches shal liue v membres shalbe quickened made liuely spirite euen shall sticke men woordes beyng receyued handes shall teache worlde beyng graffed maye ioyned thee whole body maye cleane ioyntly together thou beyng roote stocke spirite beyng distribute thorowe al membres braunches shall brought fayth beyng dispersed thorowe whole worlde farre neare nothing thee coulde nothing without thing receyued thee haue poured spirite whiche common allthe glorye thou gauest haue geuen thou extendest foorth thy power strength inseparably cleane vnto euen bothe maye extende foorth power cleaning vnto v disseuered thintent ye worlde prouoked me vniforme doctrine miracle honest chaste maners maye beleue come thee whatsoeuer haue doen may redound glory thy name worlde also may vnderstande perceyue spirite bee persones shewyng foorth bryngyng light force power miracle diuers proufes haue chalenged selfe prayse glorie whiche miracle haue wroughte haue gotten amongest men haue translate surrendred put ouer thee father whome haue confessed auctor thereof glorie whiche shall prepare theyr great acre tyme come shall altogether shall nothyng theyr owne name shall referre thynges commendacion glory name therfore world shall perceyue suche concorde betwene betwene thee wil worke spirite thou hast set abroche thy trueth wyll come passe also membres one bodye cleaning one heade quickened one spirite maye mutuall concorde sticke together among themselues party maye consummate perfite concorde heauen yearth iscencion opinion doeth take awaye beliefe doctrine agreyng one another shall teache thesame haue taughte yf lyfe agre doctrine doubtles world shall perceyue worldlye humayne doctrine come whome thou sendeste worlde shall also vnderstande beloued thee obeying thy beloued thee one declineth swarueth thy mynde purpose father desyre beyng disseuered world thou haste geuen shall folowers myne affliccions crosse maye partaker glorie like haue bene beholder base meane state witness payne tormentes maye likewyse see beholde glorye whiche thou shalte giue haue passed thorowe euils haue finished whole passion also maye learne affliccions go eternall ioye reproche ignominte go immortall glorye newe glory whiche thou shal geue newe charitie wherwith thou louest therfore thou shewest token argumentes among menne thy loue towardes intente whiche wyll myne shoulde lyke waye meane cumpasse seke thy loue lyke dedes laboure promoted vnto glorye heauen whome thou hast vouchesafed loue shalt alowe wurthy thy glorye haue loued creacion worlde righteouse father worlde also hath knowen haue knowen haue knowen thou haste sent haue declared vnto thy name wil declare loue wherwith thou haste loued maye righteouse father nothyng hath ouerslipt omitted whereby thou shouldest haue brought knowen folke worlde beyng parte blynded sinne faultes therof would know thee would beleue while taught thee vnto worlde beyng pure worlde haue knowen thee haue taughte thee beyng knowen vnto neyther hath preachyng altogether vaine whome thou specially diddest chose purpose haue knowen thee knewe came thee although phariseis open clamoure sayeth came beelzebub prince deiuils thy goodnes sent haue saued folke could waye haue brought passe thy righteousnesse suffre desire faythful frustrate voyde infidelitie vnfaythfull learned potentate chiefe heades religion haue contemned thy doctrine rude ignoraunt meke vnlearned persones haue receyued knowleage thy name shall cause knowen vnto thou mayest great charitable loue wherwith thou enbracest lykewise enbrace beeyng fully taught spirite maye theyr behalfe agayne bothe loue v one mutuall gentlenes nourishe cherishe defende eche one shall strong agaynst troublesome hurly burlies worlde shall persist vnuanquished xviii chapter iesus spoken wordes went foorth disciple ouer brooke cedron gardeyne entred disciple iudas also betrayed hym knewe place iesus oft tymes resorted thither disciple iudas receyued bande men minister hye priestes phariseis came thither lanternes fyre brandes weapon iesus knowyng thynges shoulde come vpon hym went foorth sayed vnto seke ye aunswered hym iesus nazareth iesus sayeth vnto iudas also whiche betrayed hym stoode assone sayed vnto wente backewarde fell grounde kynde talke lorde iesus confirme stablishe bolden hertes doen comme ded flocke father departed thence owne voluntary wyll go mete shoulde apprehende hym therein declaryng playnly disciple woulde willynglye gladly suffer whatsoeuer payne shoulde put vnto hym midnight except well knowen place could haue taken therfore departed place whereas thus spoken disciple goen ouer brooke whiche hebrewes call cedron many cedre tree growe disciple wayting hym wente gardeyne ignoraunt iudas woulde come thither bande harueysed men attache hym iudas betrayed hym knewe full well lorde iesus wonte often gette hymselfe secretely thither late night disciple praye tooke night tyme cause leste company iesus shoulde make resistence let take hym iudas disciple become traytoure cumpanion hym redemer made capitaine theuishe souldiers came gardeyne lorde beyng disciple prayed bad men whiche taken vnto hym appoyntmente bishoppes phariseis whome couenaunted betraye iesus bryng hym theyr handes verily brought fierbrandes lanternes meanes whereof might discerned knowen night came withoute sweardes staues agaynste force violence christes disciple yf percase would haue profered defende lorde howbeit iesus knowyng thynges wroughte dooen agaynst teache playnly hymselfe wittingly willingly suffer al suffered tarying theyr cumming went forward mete cumming towardes owne mynde vnforced asked sought leste lacke knowledge myght haue layed handes vpon disciple answered hym iesus nazareth sayed boldely vnto ye seke also iudas iscarioth present bande whiche iudas litle betrayed iesus kysse vnder false pretended frendeship ere lord spoken woordes yet iesus neither meane time bewray betrayed spake rough rebukefull woordes souldiers hyred attache would styll euen tyll fully ended shewe disciple exaumple gentlenesse modeste mekenesse soone iesus sayed vnto bande men beyng soore afrayed went backwardes fell grounde able sustayne abyde violence lordes voice asked agayne seke ye sayed iesus nazareth iesus answered haue tolde ye seke therfore let goe way saying might fulfilled spake whiche thou gauest haue lost one come themselfes againe made ready set vpon iesus secound time lord asked againe seke nowe answered saying sought iesus nazareth made lyke bolde answer doen sayed toulde euen nowe thesame manne ye looke ye seke lycence medle suffer ye therfore go theyr waye geue interest present cause iesus thus declare manifest toke could haue apprehended except permitted himselfe taken one woorde put backe cast downe grounde desperate armed multitude souldiers iudas selfe shameles traitour moreouer lyke gaue leaue take himselfe syde restrayned hauyng power ouer disciple tolde beforehande fiercenesse storme presente time light vpon owne head alone rest although somewhat ouerthrowen deiect yet safe without hurte vntill see agayne herein declaring hymselfe play parte good shepeherde redemeth health flocke losse owne life symon peter hauing swerde drewe smote hye priestes seruaunt cut right eare seruauntes name malchus therfore iesus sayeth vnto peter put vp thy swerde thy sheathe shall drinke cup father hath geuen cumpany captayne minister iewes tooke iesus bounde hym led hym away aunas firste father lawe cayphas whiche hye priest thesame yere cayphas whiche gaue councell iewes expedient one man dye people nowe symon peter whiche bore notable ardente loue towardes lord made great braggue himselfe lesse would content dye saue lordes lyfe seing armed band men lay hand vpon iesus forgat lorde sayed vnto hym beyng sodayne rage drewe swerde tarying bee commaunded lorde doe stroke byshops seruaunt whose name malchus stroke light would haue onely stroke felowes right eare euen accordyng lorde staye hande entent geue small wounde howbeit iesus forthwith owne gentlenesse heale man againe dede ye lorde suffered ruler churche fall godly zeale truely errour might afterward surely effectuously put awaye desire doe vengeaunce shake altogether priuate reuenging vse weapon since rebuked whiche yet hauing contrary commaundement deuocion godly affeccion goe aboute defende moste vertuouse godly lorde wicked iesus verily put awaye diuine power force men warre peter yet withall chideth peter disciple seeth hym hotely set fyght matter sayth peter doest thou hast thou forgotten thou hast heard late while thou diddest exhorte dye witte howe thou wast called satan commaunded folowe behynde purpose thy swerde drawen thou wouldest hynder death whiche goe suffer willingly apoynted doe father becummeth folowe repell crosse therfore put thy swerde thy sheath matter ghospel defended thou wilt succede vicar thou must fight swerd god woorde whiche cutteth away sinnes saueth men shal drinke cuppe death whiche father hath geuen drinke shall come passe one according prayed father excepte like doe obey father euen death lykewyse obey commaundementes disciple beyng saying restrayned stayed fightyng menne warre capitayne minister also whome byshops phariseis sent augment numbre layed wicked ha de vpon iesus led hym fast bounde malefactour first byshop anna caiphas father law caiphas verily hye byshop yere therfore thei led iesus anna house caiphas spoken while perplexed doubt doen iesus beyng office sake bare inspired wyth spirite prophecie cousailed case iesus finally suffre death expedient folke helth saluacion people recouered redemed death one man iesus therfore led vnto caiphas father inlawe first fede iyes sight wished longed also might examined man house could finde lykelyhode faulte although suche bloudsuckyng hertes could haue contente haue murthered owne paretes yet feare people lieutenant pilate studied pretend colour iustice god prudence turned wicked subtil crafte man glory sonne whylest thus taken thus led anna caiphas caiphas pilate pilate herode backe againe herode pilate while examined many many matter accused made witness confessours innocencie yea enemy verily certaine testimonie innocencie trueth forceth enemy litle equitie shewe mete byshop bought betraying innocent money arested toke naked man without armour bande armed men hyred purpose bounde hym made resistence onely shewed great lykelyhood howe great power case would haue vsed willingly gaue himselfe vnto led iudge enemy men auaunting themselfes theyr praye finally sought faulte layed againste hym equitie euen prophane lawes man arested except first man moste hated naughtines burdened faulte simon peter folowed iesus disciple knowen vnto hye prieste went iesus palace hye prieste peter stoode doore without wente disciple whiche knowen vnto hye prieste spake damsell kept doore brought peter thou sayed damsell kept doore vnto peter art thou also one man disciple sayed seruauntes minister stode whiche made fyre cole colde warmed themselues peter also stode among warmed hym nowe iesus brought thither cayphas symon peter notwithstandyng forbid fightyng neuerthelesse hauing yet confidence owne strength folowed iesus certaine disciple euen thesame lytle leaned iesus breast supper tyme disciple knowen byshop bolde trust knowledge go palace iesus peter knowenpeter stode doore without durst folowe palace taryed doore without meane tyme muche swaruyng bolde saying venter lyfe yet manlinesse remayned came loue durst styll folowe vnto doore seeyng reste felowes scatter themselues abrode eche one sere waye durst go feare dyd pronosticate soone deny lorde howbeit disciple perceyuyng peter folowed spake damsell kepte doore take stode doore without mayde let behelde peter thought knowe hym bothe seen iesus cumpany specially commaunded brought knewe bee iesus disciple therfore sayed vnto peter art thou also mannes disciple whiche nowe taken brought hyther voice woman small reputacion whiche yet pretended kynde crueltie thyng feared seeyng compared peter appeache violently handle knewe hym iesus disciple named iesus vnto calling suche sorte manne though rather pitied disdayned peter say sodainly forgetting al thinges whiche iesus ofte repeted vnto forgetting also owne stoute promisse denyed iesus disciple euen firste profession desirouse mortise themselfes prince house verily deny christe saye trueth whan peter thus gotten wente stode among byshoppes officer seruauntes standyng fyre syde warme themselfes colde late tyme nyght peter warmed hym trustyng myght kepe hymselfe secrete meane tyme see become iesus conclusio issue matter drawe yet peter putte awaye hope hys lorde escape death although striken feare thinke lorde euen newly told would peter selfe al bolde promiser would forsweare lorde maister hye priest asked iesus disciple doctrine iesus aunswered hym spake openly worlde euer taught synagogue temple iewes resorte secrete haue sayed nothyng askest thou aske heard haue sayed vnto behold tell sayed thus spoken one minister whiche floode smote iesus face saying aunswerest thou hye priest iesus answered haue euill spoken beare witnes euill haue well spoken smytest thou nowe bishop cayphas shewe semblaunce rightfull iudgement yet entent gather somewhat iesus sudry answeres myght charge hym withall manne faultye therfore questioned iesus disciple maner men whence purpose gathered suche cumpanye together yea also secretly taught howbeit iesus knowyng dyd demaunde question ryght iudgelyke mynde knowe trueth deceytfully hunte thyng hym woorthy blame gette occasion withall howe harme disciple would yet safegarde iesus say knowyng made answere byshoppes wylie traiterouse interrogacions banyssheth testimony hymselfe sendeth common reporte also recorde enemy profe moste certaintie innocent sayth vnto byshop askest thou haue taught disciple secretly hugger mugger doctryne hathe sediciouse secrete haue spoken openly brode worlde whiche haue taught haue alwaye taught synagogue haue taught temple vpon holy dayes place tyme moste notable famouse whither iewes euery syde partes syria resorte haue spoken nothyng priuitie corner whiche thing durst teache openlyi euer taught synagogue full ofte hath people phariseis heard doest thou nowe aske suche maner doctrine taught stelth priuely rather aske haue heard teache openly theyr recorde shall certaintye hath familiar acquaintaunce yea hate let euen mine enemy reporte haue taught many knowe shalbe easie fynde witness doctrine whan iesus spoke thynges teachyng thereby trueth answered boldely dede without tauntes rebuke one bishoppes minister chaunce stoode nexte man vnlyke lord maister willing defende bishop dignitie agaynst franke liberal speache iesus suche lyke sorte peter would haue defended maisters lyfe force souldiers tarrying commaundement lorde gaue iesus blow vpon cheke suche checkeful rebuke fit suche byshop suche felow seruaunt saying aunswerest thou byshop lorde iesus might bothe haue destroyed wicked byshop also haue letted blowgeuer would shewe exaumple howe ferre course peruerse iudgementes world lorde iesus whiche behaued himselfe moost mekely agaynst iniuries beyng sharpe vnder pretence religion barke worke againste true religion tooke blowe without replying woordes whiche yet endured crosse made wordes therat bishoppes sate auctoritie iesus beyng bounde examined loe face iudgement trueth temporall iudge beyng heathen accused shall heard saye hymselfe bishop blow geuen makyng one aunswere blowe geuen hym afterwarde iudge quicke dead dede iesus aunswered dede frankely yet mildly coldely saying speake iudge aunswere hym beyng required case gentile also matter hadled good reason stroke haue sayed thyng amisse tell howe haue spoken nothing euill doest thou beyng iudges officer tyme iudgemet iudge holdyng peace beate without consultyng thyng saye anna sent hym bound vnto caiphas hie priest symon peter stoode warmed hymselfe sayed vnto hym art thou also one disciple denyed sayed one seruauntes hye priestes cosin whose peter smote sayed vnto hym see garden hym peter therfore denied againe immediately cocke crewe led iesus caiphas hall iudgemente mornyng themselues wente iudgement hal leste shoulde defiled mighte eate passeouer uerily anna although vpon malice reioysed iesus vnder warde hold neuertheles could trye nothyng whereby might colour proued giltye sendeth hym euen bound bishop caiphas sonne lawe meane time whilest thynges handlyng peter vewyng thynges farre whiche begun tell stoode throng minister warmyng hym fyre syde among certayn token somewhat knew peter sayed vnto hym arte thou one mannes disciple whome byshop thus handleth peter seeyng cruell syght whiche made hym also sore afrayed agayne denyed iesus disciple nowe perceyued byshops interogatyues howe deuyse attache iesus disciple also peter thought deniall bee safe daunger lyke shifted hymselfe kepte doore make know better could nothing owne propre stregth beyng disseuered felowshyp lorde stoode among throng minister certayn kinsman litle garden first auentured laye handes vpon iesus eare striken peter felow iudgement god brought instrument vnder pretence auenge cosen malchus harme dede correcte rashe confidence peter hymselfe sayed felow beyng content peter one denial fighting though doen darke made wel knowe sayeth vnto peter sayeth doest thou denye thy selfe one disciple euen right nowe see mine iyes garden iesus peter beyng saying vtterly blancke sore astonished wished himselfe accursed yf euer knewe iesus anon cocke crewe neyther peter token whiche oure lorde tolde hym come hymselfe agayne neyther woulde haue well aduised except lorde recouered hym brought himselfe agayne effectuall lokyng vpon peter also inwarde inspiracion prouoked teares penaunce hym many wayes speciall minister vnder christ holy churche taught al thinges mistrust owne strength depende lordes onely ayde succour therefore iesus nighte long till mornyng early examinacion caiphas faulte coulde founde hym wherefore oughte called bee arrained vpon lyfe death haue bishop caiphas house leade hym pilate lorde presidente thentente might charge hym discharge themselues hatred sheading innocent bloude euen bounde stoode iesus led hyred souldiers presidentes iudgemente hall howbeit iewes themselues went house iudgement leste shoulde polluted asmuche paschall lambe muste eaten eatyng wherof woulde go pure cleane naughtie peruerse religion ye sure consideryng thoughte themselues contaminate suspended harmelesse house president ge tile iewe themselues many craftes went deuised man death doen nothing amisse yea many way doen well deserued muche good theyr handes pylate went vnto sayed accusacion bryng ye aunswered sayed vnto hym euill doer woulde haue deliuered hym vnto thee sayed pilate vnto take ye hym iudge hym owne lawe iewes therfore sayed vnto hym lawfull v purie man death wordes iesus might fulfilled whiche spake signifying death dye therfore pilate sawe vncouth newe maner iudgement man captiuitie bounde ere examined hearde iudge see band harnessed men commeth forth abrode hymself polluted suche men communicacion thought theselues pure vnpolluted verily came appease assuage yf possible furye iewes quite innocente ye sende sayeth manne vnto putte death maner rome put man execucion except hym proued giltie faulte worthy death crime therfore ye laye mannes charge iewes aunswered autoritie byshops phariseis inough discharge man malefactour coulde profession haue committed hym handes pilate suspectyng trueth haue priuate grudge towardes hym supersticion superf uous religion vayne deuocion lawe sayeth vnto matter apperteyneth counte office exaumple case sabboth day broken swynes fleshe eaten percase rashe liberall woordes hath spoken moses prohetes temple god loe nowe suche scape haue whiche owne lawe commaunded punished though yet suche thing prohibite lawe rome selfes take vnto iudge hym lawe sette emperours name rule play iudge hath committed faulte emperours lawes worthy death bryng conuicte lawe lawfully cast shall cause put execucion intermedle perplexe selfe doubtfull matter lawe uerily though iewes would forced howe haue made away yet pretende reliousnesse feare leste iudge forthwith haue punished would haue kylled harmelesse vncondemned person thesame tyme sought effectually newe kynde punishement one among iewes moste spytefull opprobrious say lawefull v put man death shamelesse people spake woordes whiche slayne many prophetes flatteryng themselfes cleane fro murder notwithstandyng many wayes persecute innocente death el thus hangman handes fasteneth man crosse sole murderer herte murderer murderer theyr tongue theyr money hyred one trayterously betray hym hyred sorte warryers hyred false witness forged false haynouse crymes prouoke prycke forwarde iudge threatning make hym fearde yet impute themselues pure fre murder also worthy eate pascall lambe cause el dyd stay refrayne themselues goyng iudgement hall well thinges truely doen make appeare euidente nothyng wurse haynouse false peruerse religion thyng also brought effecte iesus sayed come passe signifying parable death shoulde dye whan spake woordes suche tyme shall lyfte vp hye grounde shall drawe thynges vnto force woordes would take certaintie selfe death determinately limited vnto also choice seuerall kynde death pilate entred iudgement hall againe called iesus sayed vnto art thou king iewes iesus answered sayest thou thy selfe tell thee pilate answered iew thine owne nacion hye priestes hath deliuered thee vnto hast thou doen iesus answered kingdome worlde kyngdome worlde would minister surely fight deliuered vnto iewes nowe kyngdome hence wherfore pilate vnderstanding woordes iewes spoken matter knowe amonges thinges obiecte iesus concerning kingdome goe desirously yet appeared likelyhood iesus shoulde cause manne thynke hym fauty therein pilate saye went againe iudgement halle lefte people standyng without called iesus secretly asyde quietly without ruffle might boult gather hym countenaunce appeared lesse vertuouse wise matter saied vnto art thou king iewes reported looke one thyng pilate diligently searche matter touched weale publique faul e call himselfe kyng semed concerue emperours maiestie common peace tranquillitie truly pilate made searche enquirie take true get matter accused wherwith might reproue ye iewes falsehood howbeit though iesus knew wel inough iewes haue falsely appeached hym desirous kyngdome emperours losse despite highnesse yet entent myght open disclose malice iewes commende reasonablenesse equitie muche better pilate byshops phariseis though gentyle set naught iewes religion skill saye iesus made hym aunswere saying whether thinkest thou thine owne coiecture desyrouse kingdome haue iewes accused herof thee pilate declare owne innocecie malice iewes sayeth doe coiecture mine owne head neyther doe see thee thyng agreable thereunto iewes tale king come thinkest thou iewe thy quarelling cou trey folkes byshops committed thee handes seking meanes haue thee put death fashion rome putte vncondemned person death therfore thou haste trasgressed ye trayterous desire kingdom faute beside haste thou made pilate asked thynges simply meaning good fayth entending deliuer innocente iesus vouchesafe aunswere hym rydle prouerbially teaching maner kingdom wherof prophetes spoken farre excellent kingdom kingdom worlde whiche consisteth man lawes ayde haue power vpo body howbeit signified kingdom heauely kingdom could couet ye kingdom worlde contemne harme auaunce better kinde kingdom sayth christ suche kingdom ye emperours kingdom terrestriallmy kyngdome worlde c mine celestial ye cause affeccionate nothing harme emperours maiestie kingdom world world handle doth vnreuenged euen ye sure haue kynges hath garde harnessed men haue squiers body suche onely attende vpon myne owne persone haue plentie well appoynted men lacke ayde succoure would fight iewes power doe thyng goe vnrequired presente haue fewe disciple haue bee vnapte warre weake poore selfe beyng vnarmed wartyer euen one seketh helpe kyngdome worlde ppilate therfore sayed vnto hym arte thou kyng iesus aunswered thou sayest king cause borne cause came world beare witnes vnto trueth trueth heare voyce pilate sayde vnto hym thyng trueth sayed wente oute agayne vnto iewes sayeth vnto fynde hym cause ye haue custome delyuer one looce aster wyll ye looce vnto king iewes cryed agayne saying hym barrabas barrabas murtherer forasmuche pylate beyng laye man gentile fully vnderstande mistye darke saying albeit heard iesus dyd vtterly ren unce denye name kyng dyd put difference kingdomes pilate therfore sayed vnto hym true thou arte somewhere kyng whatsoeuer kynde kyngdome thou perteynyng v iesus beyng earnestly asked iudge whether waye kyng naye confesseth trueth great temperaunce modestye muche sobrietie good aduisemente aunsweryng thus thou sayest kyng whosoeuer asketh question lyke numbre wordes pronunciacion onely chaunged affirmeth thyng iesus sayed parte denye trueth namely consyderyng cause borne came worlde deceyue lye shoulde beare witnes vnto trueth hath simple meke mynde blynded lustes desire worlde acknowlegeth lyketh well heareth voyce pilate hauyng intelligence whiche spokenfor cause borne c supposed thyng matter hym know yet christe made pilate apte aunswere therewith either sette iewes quiet dispatche thence asked iesus trueth wherof spake come worlde beare witnes therof pilate saye wente oute agayne vnto iewes tarrying aunswere thing questioned nedeth many woordes sayeth pilate haue examined man fynde faulte hym worthy death president chiefe iustice vnder emperour shoulde sentence condemne innocente case noysome ye thynke fautye fynde yet standeth equitie good indifferencie ye wyl spare forbeare hym innocent leastwaye honor holy feast religion sake pardon hym life offender dede custome amonges feast phase whiche moste highly solemnised kept moste holye feastes request pardon set libertie one offender therfore ye shall haue free eleccion chose one twayne eyther barrabas arrant notable robber disturber publique peace iesus man iudgement fautlesse whome folke sayeth kyng iewes beste surely man yea though haue doen amysse fele enioye graciouse fauour priuiledge youre solemne feast wyll ye therfore forgeue persone sake trueth president looke great outragiousnes iewes woulde preferre felowe openly knowe full mischiefe valiaunt ranke thefe iesus man moste meke innocent iewes whole consen great lowde voyce cryed haue iesus geuen v barrabas xix chapter pylate toke iesus therfore scourged hym souldiers wound croune thornes put head purple garment came vnto sayed hayle kyng iewes smote hym face pilate wente furth agayne sayde vnto behold bryng hym furthe ye maye knowe fynde faulte hym came iesus furth wearing croune thorne roo e purple sayeth vnto beholde man pilate emperours lieutenaunt also occasion sente iesus herode leauyng nothyng vndoen eyther shifte ridde handes hym accused el dimisse sette hym looce innocent lorde president saye thus assayed wayes sawe coulde good furiouse folkes iewes commaunded iesus scourged maner rome whiche feat dyd assuage theyr furie saue innocentes lyfe doen souldiers inner courte whome iewes hyred numbre serue theyr tyrannye dyd theyr owne inue cion adde muche cruel fearcenesse vncouth solemne piece passion bene scourged beaten mocke hym withall putte vpon purple garment wounde croune thorne put head geuyng hym reede hande stede scepter byanby castyng hym tethe kyngdome shoulde desyrous god wotte see homely base contempte persone came kneled vnto saying hayle king iewes spitted vpon face buffeted hymhayle king iewes beyng lorde thynges behauing hymselfe moste pacientely moste coldly al theyr kynde mockage teache v len tye pacience aduersitie v saye haue hautye verye fierce myndes though yet dede thinges nought sothe pilate suffered iesus thus delt withall would man affliccion haue appeased malice iewes people hathe raged agaynste sturred theyr fury ceaseth sodainly namely scornyng added calamitie make hym suffereth lamentable hated therfore pilate presidente wente furthe vnto agayne proue yf coulde mitigate fiercenes meane multitude sayeth lo bryng manne vnto ye maye looke fyll vpon hym perceyue howe hath bene handled pleasure withstandyng finde faulte therwith iesus pilate comaundement cummeth furth appareled bounde scourged beate bespitted crowned crowne thorne wearyng purple garment pilate presented hym saying beholde man hye priestes minister sawe hym cryed saying crucifie hym crucifie hym pilate sayeth vnto take ye hym crucifie hym fynde cause hym iewes answered hym haue lawe lawe ought dye made hymselfe sonne god pilate heard saying afeard went agayne iudgemente hall sayeth vnto iesus whence art thou iesus gaue answere sight therefore whiche ynough haue tamed crueltie neuer great wild rude barbarouse people myndes yet iewes onely mollified therewith set fyre finish thing farre proceded bishop afeard leste horribly cruelly tormented haue let looce affeccion mynde people already sette roare turned side grudge extreme great crueltie might light vpon owne heades bishop therfore seruautes great stier shone cryed woodly crucifie crucifie hym pilate perceyuing hope pitie gotten handes fayre intreatie goeth aboute restrayne bridle fury feare sayth minister lawe iustice reueger folkes malice lawfull processe punishe trangressours lawe autorisate butcherly murderer bloudshedder innocecie hath doen serue satisfie hatred fierce noysome persone yf shall algates crucified wyll haue courte iudgemente distayned polluted bloud innocente upon owne perill haue ye man awaye yf semeth good doe ye crucifie wounte crucifie wicked doer man finde crime deserueth crosse likelihode trayterouse dede whiche layed charge concerning kingdome ynough accuse man fault except proued matter certaintie obiected sure euidence specially cause concerneth life death whole matter lawful processe hadled ruffeled sediciously iewes heard pilate iudge frendely diligently withall take iesus parte defende vtterly thinking mete waye iesus escape falsely surmised cryme whiche might seme iudge learned theyr lawe greuouse faulte saying although doen none offence emperours lawes yet haue lawe geuen v god emperour also hath left vnto v force lawe hath well deserued dye hath made himselfe sonne god takyng vpon godhead commit blasphemie god pilate heard hauyng ready aunswere make led iesus againe iudgement hall went himselfe talked againe iesus beyng desyrouse learne hym thyng wherewith charged hym howe might bee refelled auoyded therfore first pilate asketh hym whence entent knowen progenie came might haue confuted whereas sayed desirouse taken sonne god though dede among gentile written poetes fable commonly beleued taken halfe goddes folkes borne god manne verily iesus knowyng pilate assaye wayes finally saue lyfe ignoraunte yet pilate shoulde afterwarde meanes bene proued geue place obstinate furye iewes iesus saye woulde make aunswere vnto president leste thought haue made meane howe get oute theyr handes would seme compelled death hitherto made aunswere would haue recorde innocecie pleasure dye willingly gladly pthen sayed pylate vnto hym speakest thou vnto knowest thou haue power crucifie thee haue power looce thee iesus aunswered thou couldeste haue power agaynst except geuen aboue therfore delyuered vnto thee hath synne fro thence furthe sought pilate meanes looce hym iewes cryed saying thou let hym go thou arte ceasars frende whosoeuer maketh hymselfe kyng agaynst ceasar pilate heard saying broughte iesus furth satte geue sentence place called pauemet hebrue togue babatha preparyng daye easter sixt houre sayth vnto iewes behold kyng cryed awaye awaye hym crucifye pilate sayeth vnto shall crucifye kyng hye priestes aunswered haue kyng ceasar delyuered hym vnto bee crucifyed pylate meruaylyng man silence standyng hasarde lyfe consideryng iudge muche frende dyd prouoke hym aunswere saied doest thou arte ieoperdye lyfe make aunswere knowest thou haue power auctoritie ouer thee whyther thou shalt lyue dye presidente chiefe iustice region dependeth vpon pleasure whether thou shalte crucified quitte let looce unto woordes iesus made suche aunswere presidente loked whiche presidente desyred instructed defence iesus cause intendyng bee steade iudge aduocate defendauntes syde waye shoulde somewhat haue appeared iesus hadde bene willyng haue dyed aunswered suche lyke thyng aunswere onelye concernyng power whiche pylate dyd arrogantelye attribute hymselfe signyfying neyther pylates power sette hym libertie seyng power whiche shoulde condescende furie iewes pilate hymselfe shoulde able doe oughte agaynst hym excepte woulde owne voluntary wyll suffer trueth thou hast sayeth iesus power accordyng mannes lawes thou couldest haue power vnlesse hadde permitted thee whose power passeth mannes power dede thou fauourest innocencie yet naughtines ouercummeth thee leadeth thee righte trade wherfore people iewes auctours passion deathe theyr violence constrayneth iudge condemne innocent persone sinne greuously pilate heard thereby perceyued bothe modestie clearenes accused also malice iewes yea owne indifferencie vnknowen pilate fauoured sawe manne nothing moued disquieted peryll death stode pilate cosidered wrought al maner way leaste meanes might cleare sette iesus libertie iewes perceyuyng thesame presidente made light cryme whiche fyrste layed hym concernyng moses lawe ceased doe coulde dimisse iesus fall hand againe first fault whiche neglecte declare daungerous iudge hymselfe saye therfore though doe appertayne vnto hath offended god certaynly wheras hath offended emperoure thou haste doe withall whosoeuer maketh clayme kingdome without emperours commaundement offendeth cryme lease maiestiewhoso maketh hymselfe kyng ceasar committeth hye treason felowe maketh himselfe king thou therfore doe let loo e acquite thou fauourest enemy art emperours frendes pilate heard bishop phariseis conspired together iesus mayne multitude withal cry wordes aloude although ignoraunt went false matter yet sawe well malice whiche priestes phariseis bare towarde iesus could appeas sawe also headman common people wunderfully consentyng sayed grudge malice one agremet brute take away one man life furthermore pilate perceiued also iesus dede nothyng fawtie al symple poore innocent man made shifte himselfe lykewise thought meane tyme howe vnder emperours many daungerouse hasarde enuy without iust cause thought himselfe alreadye sufficiently traueiled whole conspiracie agreed vpon betwene noble menne common defence one poore mannes innocencie pilate tell vpon skilles determined hymselfe condescende satisfie theyr malice suche sorte condemning iesus thought withal get pardon deliueraunce begynnyng speake firste owne innocecie deriued grudge wicked facte vnto iewes layed vpon theyr heades nowe iesus therfore brought forth giltie condemnyng hym kynde lawfull iudgement vsed pilate sate downe place lawful iudgemet hye geue sentence sate high place seen folke height called hebrewes gabatha grekes verily call lithostrotos pauedit preparyng daye easter aboute si te houre behoueth iesus condemnacion solemne publike leste innocencie hidde man condemned quitte cleared iesus deliuered vp crosse iudge gaue sentence vpon iewes nowe tyme drewe nye according maner solemne feaste innocente bloude offered sacrifice saluacion worlde sabboth euen nowe called good fryday whiche falleth easter feast aboute sixt houre therfore iewes called vrgently vpo matter vnwittingly doyng therby seruice thyng god appoynted haue sacrifice made conueniente tyme due season pilate nowe reason iudiciall garment playnly seen perceyued people shewed vnto iudgemet place accused person thentente euen sight hym facion myght appeare howe vnconueniently cryme cruel autoritie desirouse priuate commoditie layed beyng vexed troubled shewed great quietnes minde great mildnes pilate saye shewed person sayed beholde kyng iewes whiche thirsted nothing el innocent bloud cryed away hym away hym crucifie hym infamous reprochefull death pleased well iewes trusting would come passe ye shame reproche crosse would make name iesus odious detestable manne come whiche professe name beyng suche wyse made awaye pilate deriding obstinate madnesse sayeth shall doe great vilanie vnto kyng nayle hym vnto crosse dishonor shal redound shame slaunder people whiche haue brought theyr king crosse voyce pilate although dyd iesus good yet disclosed malice iewes forced confesse openly knowledge seruitude hated iewes desyred looked many hundred yeares messias kyng promised prophetes emperours kyngdome wherwith sore pressed ouerlayed spitefully hated yet standing enuy hatred waxed wylde euen woode renounce openly face worlde theyr messias acknowlege emperour theyr soueraygne lorde haue saye kyng emperour luste reuege great vnconstrayned adiudged themselues perpetuall bondage might therby vtterly extinguish iesus autor libertie pilate therfore seyng went aboute disapoynted committed iesus vnto crucified theyr ordre libertie tooke iesus led hym awaye bare crosse wente furth place whiche called place dead mennes sculles hebrue golgotha crucified two hym euery syde one iesus myddes pilate wrote tytle put crosse wrytyng iesus nazareth kyng iewes tytle read many iewes place iesus crucified ny citie written hebrue greke latyne sayed hye priestes iewes vnto pilate wryte kyng iewes sayed kyng iewes pilate aunswered haue wrytten haue wrytten iewes tooke deliuerye iesus beyng brought place iudgement led place execucion without citie place might also aunswer figure sacrifice wherwith testamet consecrate offered without host iesus wet thither hauyng yet garmentes thentent might shame fauoured hym goeth full mekely bearynge crosse hymselfe iewes prouided leste shoulde lacke despyte reproche furthermore vyle diffamed place also chosen appoynted wherein maner put wyked malefactours execucion place perdye detestable violated dead bodyes whose bone laye scatered abrode euen place shewed selfe purpose dedicate thyng common name geuen hebrue toung called golgatha greke toung cranii topos latyn toung caluarie socus englyshe place dead men sculles leste shoulde putte shame ynoughe iewes procured also two whiche openly knowen wycked theues shoulde crucified iesus together thentete felowshippe poffenders might lykewyse thought taken offender lyke one commune punyshemente seme haue one commune faulte thentente might vtterly appere companyon theyrs iewes dyd ordre place cross iesus honge myddes hauyng thefe hangyng eyther hand hym howebeit fountayne purenes coulde polluted fylthynes manne yea fountaine glorie magnified renoumed men reproche crosse afore odyouse thyng reproche made hym triumphant signe wherunto worlde boweth downe heade aungels wurshyppe deuyls feare iesus condemned founde one whome thefe made citizen paradyse muche vnlykelyhoode felowship punishement shoulde defile hym verely leste shoulde wante kynde apparaunce iuste condigne punishmente euery one manner title stile geuen vnto hym describe declare person fault pilate geuen title according deseruing commaunded crosse iesus lorde shoulde bee fastened ti le superscripcion iesus nazareth king iewes euen cause truelythe wrytyng iesus nazareth c selfe inscripcion mighte cause bothe malyce iewes innocencie hym crucified recorded howbeit title conuenient respect iewes accusacion yet according whiche himselfe confessed presydent title moste seming hym truely iudeus doeth signifie hebrues confessing doubtles dede kyng setter libertie whiche professeth name vnto whome geueth felowship kyngdome heauen bryng bishoppes phariseis hatred thereby pilate prouided title bee write thre sundry language hebrue greke latine whereof first owne countrey speache two tounges reason great occupying grekes romaine brought among iewes also knewe greke latine toung therfore prouided president man neither resiaunt thesame countreyman straunger resorter thyther shoulde ignoraunt title title thus wrytten odiouse vnto phariseis reason place muche haunted greate resorte confluence golgatha mounte caluery nyghe vnto citie layefull theyr syght casualtie passed waye many iewes therefore read saye superscripcion sum knewe well name iesus nazareth howe litle desyred worldly kyngdome many tru knowledge whiche seen hym hyde hymselfe shoulde haue drawen force kyngdome kyng whiche promysed prophetes whome iewes call messias truthe loked among iewes althoughe pilate ouersene herein yet vnawares gaue hym tytle dyd moste demonstrate notise folke hong vpon crosse trueth selfe kynge kynges honge crucifyed whiche deathe dyd vanquishe tirannye deuyll thou oughtest call rather token banner victorie crosse thoughe thynge semed full shame rebuke byshops scribe phariseis yet intitleing superscripcion greue theyr myndes honorablye set woulde haue great desyre wycked abolysh name onely glory whole world ought geuen therefore treate common president chaungeing title written king iewes dyd vsurpe vniustly take vpon hym name presydent notwithstandyng euen vnawares dyd pronosticate folow profession healthfull name whiche iewes falsely denyed departe thence redy beleuyng gentile saye true iewes dede yet saye notwithstanding also heretofore condescende folowe theyr malyce presydente woulde alter chaunge title sayeth haue wrytten haue wrytten verie deed commoditie profit folke christe shoulde put death agayne also mennes weale name fame renoume thorowe whole worlde profession whereof saluacion shoulde bee brought folke souldiers crucified iesus toke hys garmentes made ower partes euery souldier parte also coate coate without seame wrought vpon throughout sayed therfore among themselues let v diuide cast lotte shall haue scrypture myght fulfylled saying parted rayment among coate dyd calle lotte souldiers dyd suche thynges dede stoode crosse iesus mother mother sister mary wife cleophas mary magdalene iesus therfore sawe mother disciple standyng whome loued sayeth vnto mother woman beholde thy sonne sayed disciple beholde thy mother houre
