disciple toke owne nowe therefore lorde iesus nayled maner naked vnto crosse foresayed superscripcion aboue heade souldiers crucified hym accordyng vsage parted among iesus garmentes thyng came amendes reward theyr paynes taking forasmuche fower noumbre deuided resydue garmentes saue coate cause made soundrye piece sowed together euery manne hys parte porcionately coate iacket garmet verely whiche inner nere bodye sewed garment wouen thouer hem lower beyng leusyd rypte woulde haue good nothinge nought wourth therefore ye souldiers thought good shoulde bee kept whole vncut sum one shoulde haue whole iacket whose lotte chaunce withstandynge souldiers dyd thinges prophane mynde worldlye purpose yet vnawares fulfylled doyng prophecy prophetes hereby also might haue bene knowen bee whome holy ghoste spoken psalmes thus haue deuyded myne apparel amonge caste lotte vpon garmentes thinges perdye souldiers while yet lord honge vpon crosse alyue stoode ye crosse iesus mary mother associate syster marye daughter cleophas marie magdalene therefore iesus lokynge ye crosse vpon mother castynge iye withall vpon disciple loued familiarly reste thentente clothes beyng distributed lefte worldly substaunce behynde woulde leaue vpo earthe worldly mannes affeccion iesus saye turned towardes mother sayed woman beholde thy sonne poyntynge nod head wincke iye disciple turning furthwith disciple sayeth beholde thy mother verily tyme sayd disciple bore sone mynde affectio toward mother iesus toke whole charge care thinges iesus knowyng thinges perfourmed scripture myght fulfilled sayeth thirst stoode vessell ful vinegre therfore filled sponge vinegre wounde wt isope putte mouthe assone iesus receyued vynegre sayd finished bowed heade gaue vp ghoste thinges doen iesus knew nothing wanted perteyning lawfull sacrifice yet bryng therunto accomplyshe prophetes saying sayeth gaue gall eate thirstye gaue vinegre drinke cried crosse athirst trueth suche dye kynde death wonte sore greued vehement thirst reason woundes ye body bloude exhaust cleane drawe euen much proue declare man oute doubte punyshed great payne tha vessel full vinegre stoode wont reached vp geuen athirste make sooner dye souldiers therfore fylled sponge vinegre woude ysope helde mouthe sone iesus tasted ye vinegre saied finished signifying sacrifice rightely doen accomplyshed accordynge father wyll byanby bowed heade gaue vp ghoste iewes therfore bicause preparing sabbothe body remayne crosse sabboth day sabboth day hye day besought late legges might broke might bee taken downe came souldiers brake legges first ye crucified whan came iesus sawe dead already brake legges one ye souldiers speare thrust ye syde furthwith came bloud water sawe bare recorde recorde true knoweth sayeth true yt ye myght beleue also thinges doen scripture fulfilled ye shall breake bone agayne another scripture sayeth shall looke hym whome pearced sporte wonder withall heare againe case peruerse religion iewes farre course mysordred iewes vpon myscheuous malice wicked meanes brought violence vnto crosse innocent one bene beneficiall vnto beyng nothing abashed relygion feastfull daye cruel vngraciouse dede supersticiouse made muche taking body fro crosse came vnto pilate besought ye commaundement legges crucified might broken thentent might sooner deade corps taken downe waye lesse beyng sene shoulde violate breake feastfull daye daye solemne greate daye whiche great apareylyng fournature holy adournmetes dyuine seruice called grekes parasceue saye preparacion holy solemne sabbothe daye nye hande vpon whyche daye worke detestable thing season men beeynge ye wote well precise relygion finished accomplyshed horryble acte thoughe thinge well doen bente myndes celebrate sacrifice offered moyses lawe solemnely purely knowyng true easter lambe already offered vp sacrifice suche poyson pestiferouse thing holynesse consisteth outwarde bodily thinges hath holynes godlynes herte mynde ioyned annexed vnto nowe therfore pilate grauntyng request souldiers brake bothe theues legges whome found yet aliue come iesus saw alreadye deade therefore thought vayne superfluous thynge breake legges lefte whole vnbroken ende purpose legges brokenone souldiers thrust ye syde furth came wat r bloude whiche hung vpon crosse shoulde sooner gyue vp ghoste among souldiers stoode certaine man whiche certeintie lorde iesus death opened syde speare immediatly wounde gushed forth bloude water great misterye declaryng death shoulde washe cleanse v synne also geue v euerlastinge lyfe saluacion baptisme standeth water water baptised ye lyfe manne bloude againste course nature water runne bodye wounded howbeit sawe thing iyes testified beareth witnes hereof knowe recorde bee true leste shoulde stande doubte whether ye maye beleue thing whiche el mighte seme incredible assure iesus himselfe knewe witnes tell trueth althoughe thinges semed doen chaunce casualtie saye stede breakyng legges others chaunce haue side thruste thorowe yet doen foresight prouidence god diuine councell disposed pointe also theffecte conclusion thing myght aunswere agre prophecy prophetes among rite customes wherwith moses teacheth exodus paske passouer ought obserued celebrate prescribed eue thing specially name wete lambe sacrifised slaine bone broken euen thereby notyng declaryng iesus true phase passeouer figure whereof mosaicall lambe beare resembled thesame bloud true lambe iesus saueth beleue hym death spirituall eatyng lambe conueyeth v beeyng made free seruitude egypte saye sinfull lustes worlde tyranny sinne heauenly region againe holy ghoste speaketh thus zacharye shall see hym pearsed shall come thesame body wherwith hong crosse though alreadye gloryouse body yet shall shewe printe wounde folke shall shewe vnfaythfull theyr rebuke fountayne open vayne would beleue flowyng streames wherof might haue cured ioseph aramathia disciple iesus secretely feare iewes besought pilate might take downe body iesus pilate gaue hym licence came therfore tooke downe body iesus came also nicodemus begynning came iesus night brought myrthe aloe mengled together aboute hundred pounde weyght tooke body iesus wounde lynnen clothes odour maner iewes bury place crucified gardeyne gardeyne newe sepulchre wherin neuer man layed layed iesus therfore preparyng sabboth iewes sepulchre nye hande nowe death beyng already certayne himselfe founde dead experience many behoued furthermore buryall many wayes confyrme belefe resurreccion christe would perdie whole life base lowe porte would buriall honorable great maiestie intendyng therby teache v carefull sepulchre thentent thinges accomplyshed whiche concerned abasyng hymselfe whole ministery thereof might make waye honour prayse resurreccion dede honour whiche geuen manne alyue without either suspicion daunger honour whiche voluntarily geue dead sure wytnes prowes goodnes vertue nowe therfore ioseph beyng manne honour great power substaunce aramathian borne sayed ioseph disciple iesus openly knowen feare iewes made lawe whosoeuer openly confesse himselfe iesus disciple thesame person caste synagoge ioseph saye came vnto pilate well knowen desyreth licence hym take downe iesus body crosse pilate tried whether dead content withal therfore ioseph went way crosse toke downe dead corp meane season one helpe furthe thinges doynges pertayne funeral euen nicodemus also cummeth thither man among phariseis notable estimacion dignitie also secrete disciple iesus tyme come iesus night myght beste auoyde displeasure grudge phariseis rehersed menne knowyng death commonly maketh ende hatred trustyng vpon presidentes fauour enterprysed h ely honoure dead while liued durst talke openly nicodemus trueth brought oyntment myrrhe aloe ming ed together aboute hundred pounde weyght muche sufficient sweten bodye honorably preserue corrupcion therfore ioyntely together one common seruice anointed iesus body take downe euery parte pleasaunte swete sauerye spice well imbrued corp odour thei woud linnen clothes oyntmet runne body maner iewes sorte bury leste body corrupte putrefie verily honour lord iesus wurthy one throughly good againe thus honoured thentent man thynke dyed cryme faulte yet hyer opinion hym innocent good man loued god whose name memory ought haue honour doen vnto saye remembred one enuied vertue euen death thyng vsually hapneth maner moste beste menne moreouer preparacion great doe euen finished leste man myght supect body chaunged agayne lord buried garden nye place crosse garden new sepulchre lately made harde thicke stone wherin neuer man layed albeit thinges supposed doen casualtie yet made much fayth resurreccion sepulchre could seme digged vp vndermynyng becau e cutte whole sounde vnholowe rocke stone none could thought haue risen whiche la ed yet ioseph nicodeme respecte resurreccio dede hope rise againe moued thus doe iewishe deuocion religion sake feastfull day dede iewes easter day euen therfore sabboth prouoked setforwarde dede sabboth day lawful worke wherfore leste body vnburied buriall slender small honour doen ryd thyng hande layed hym sepulchre nexte vnto also furthermore euen diligence iewes serued belefe resurreccion iewes obteined pilate kepers sepulchre procured watched attended vpon leste body secretly steale waye dead corp contente therewith close vp mouthe sepulchre great stone seale hadde doen euery side malice iewes succeded came glory christ whose name went vtterly destroy abolish xx chapter first daye sabbothes came marye magdalene early yet somewhat darke vnto sepulchre sawe stone taken awaye graue ranne came symon peter disciple whome iesus loued sayed vnto haue taken awaye lorde graue cannot tell wher haue layed hym peter therfore went foorth disciple came nto sepulchre ranne bothe together disciple dyd runne peter came firste sepulchre stouped downe sawe linnen clothes lying yet wene verely residue disciple beeyng stryken partly feare partely dispayre neglected burying rought dead corp certayne weomen disciple cared asmuche ioseph nicodemus religion feastefull ye stayed labouryng aboute preparacio swete odour howbeit soone phase sabboth daye past oyntmentes beyng made ready nyghte mary magdalene came earlye yet somewhat darke vn sepulchre morowe sabboth daye sawe stone wherewith entrie sepulchre closed vp remoued thence sepulchre open woman supposed nothyng el deade corp hadde taken awaye night intent might haue semely accordyngly buried body layed time purpose might soone adourned set foorth due full solemnitie burying dede hope resurreccion fell awaye disciple muche astonied certaintie death therfore marie ere loked grauethey haue take awaye lord c retyered backe agayne ran simon peter euen disciple whome iesus loued sayeth lord taken awaye sepulchre know whither haue caryed toke waye beyng styrred voyce went foorth surely small hope yet hadde great affeccion desyre towardes theyr maister muche loued therfore ranne together graue disciple beloued iesus outranne peter came first sepulchre founde doore open wente stouped downe looked graue whether emptie sawe well dead corp linnen clothes lefte imbrued swete odoriferous ointementes wherwith body bene wrapped also napkyn iesus head bene bound linnen clothes lying together wrapt vp layed aside selfe easy perceyue body taken awaye theues whiche woulde haue rather purloyned whole corp laye wrapped wounde vp swete smellyng spice linnen clothes fine kercher though bene valure therof least would haue doen thei haue lacked laisure haue separate oyntmentes swete spice bodye seeyng cleaued fast therunto byrdelime woulde haue doen also haue sufficient tyme folde vp couche euery thyng hande somely seuerally place suche dede firste comforte hope geuen resurreccion came simon peter folowyng hym went sepulchre sawe linnen clothes lye napkyn head lying linnen clothes wrapped together place self wente also disciple whiche came first sepulchre sawe beleued yet knewe scripture shoulde pse agayne death anon cummeth peter also certified thing iohn slower running bolder diligent trying trueth thyng beyng content lokyng graue also went disciple loker wel whiche yet durst hymselfe alone go howebeit dede companion beyng hym tooke parte feare awaye nowe folowed peter sepulchre nowe sawe certaynly hande thing true whiche one seen shadowe glymmering sight therof corse dead corp place dede sawe clothes wherin body wrapped suche sorte pulled laied aside appeared doen theues hast sleyghtly shuffled vp quietly layserly howbeit yet beleue risen agayn lyfe onely beleued true marie tolde verelye corp taken awaye sepulchre although heard iesus saye would rise againe yet saying sticke inwardly theyr mindes though hope therof theyr hertes yet whiche already place theyr myndes feare tumulte crosse passion draue theyr myndes fully vnderstand yet saying prophet prophecied certaynly iesus suffer death rise againe thirde daye death lyfe disciple went away agayne vnto theyr owne home marie stode without sepulchre wepyng wepte bowed hirselfe sepulchre seeth two angel clothed white sitting one heade feete layed body iesus saye vnto woman wepest thou sayeth vnto haue taken awaye lorde wo e haue layed hym therefore two disciple departed thence wente backe place whence came marie certain excedyng loue wonderfull desire lorde coulde drawen sepulchre sekyng hym deade whome loued beyng aliue desirouse shew gentilnes seruice vpon dead bodye forsomuche could haue fruicion liuely body stoode without nye vnto doore graue nought el wepe loke coulde haue hope lykelyhoode finde bodye nowe weping dede durst go graue turned head aside loked graue sawe two angel goodly looke good semblaunce pleasaunt white apparell sittyng seuerall place one head feete place dead corp laied dede pleasaut chereful peaceable sight somedeale asswage extreme feare night carefulnesse angel also comforte sorowfull pensifenesse theyr owne accorde gentlenes speake vnto wepyng woman saye woman thou wepest beyng rauyshed one drounke certayne vehemencie loue sayeth haue taken awaye lorde know haue laied hym calleth lorde also loueth hym dead hauing yet hope resurreccion onely herewithall grieued coulde haue sighte bodye whan thus sayed turned herselfe backe sawe iesus standyng knew iesus iesus sayeth vnto woman wepest thou whome sekest thou supposyng gardiner sayeth vnto hym sir thou haue borne hym hence tell thou hast layed hym wyl fetche hym iesus sayeth vnto mary turned herselfe sayed vnto hym rabboni whiche saye maister iesus sayeth vnto touche yet ascended father go vnto brother saie vnto ascende vnto father father god god while speaketh thus coniectured semblaunce angel man stode behinde backe tarying angel aunswer cast iye aside incontinently sawe iesus standyng angel wurshipped yet marie knewe iesus appere forme poore simple man lest sodainly seen owne fo shape haue muche astonished woman therfore bolden withall calleth speaketh gently vnto thesame faier wordes angel saying woman wepest thou whome sekest thou loking hither thither suspecting gardiner workeman keper ground wherein sepulchre garden womanly simplicitie sayed vnto hym sir thou hast taken away tel thou hast hid maie go fetche thece supposed frend feare iewes procured body secretly caryed awaye leste shoulde come iewes handes otherwyse handled woulde shoulde iesus therfore beyng delited great desyre woman doeth knowen familier voyce speake vnto calleth marie knowen voyce woman sodainly turnyng herselfe euen presente bowed downe herselfe agayne towardes angel muche sodayne mocions mynde stiered loke waye waye woman saie knewe iesus rauished sodayne ioye disciple speaketh master calleth hym rabboni whiche worde syrian tonge signifieth master withal falleth flatte downe grounde would haue kissed feete hauyng yet remembraunce theyr olde familiaritie iesus knowyng yet thought great excellente thyng hym although loued sincerely ardently prohibite touche bodye marie sawe well aliue agayne thought yt reuiued none cause liue familiarlye frendes beyng man aliue dead ignoraunt caryed hym immortall body handled muche greater reuerence whiche bodye lorde neuer exhibite present wicked suffered handled euerye man thentent might litle litle altogether withdrawe loue bodye touche sayeth thesame bodye whiche hong vpon crosse nowe beautified adourned glory immortalitie truely thine affeccion yet somedeale carnall haue yet ascended vp father whiche thyng doen shall sende vnto spirite comforter shall make perfite wurthy haue spirituall felowship meane time content thy selfe thou hast seen heard speake specially go thou brother whiche throughe death comforteles foorth make partaker thee ioye comforte whiche thou haste receyued sight vpon wordes shewe ende rysen death lyfe euen haue taried certayne dayes among maye leaue worlde ascende vp father also father thesame god mine common bothe let therfore put away earthly affeccions rectifie mindes applying thesame spiritual heauenly thinges mary magdalene came tolde disciple seue lorde spoken suche thynges vnto thesa e daye night whiche firste daye abbothes dores sh th disciple assembled together feare iewes came iesus stoode middes sayeth vnto peace bee vnto wh n sayed sheweth vnto handes syde disciple glad sawe lorde mary bad returnyng againe disciple shewed seen lorde tolde thynges whiche commaunded made relacion name doen take right great comforte nowe called brother prepare also theyr myndes loue desyre eternall heauenly thynges muche preset vse body endure long certayne apparicions lord iesus litle litle lift vp theyr myndes quicknesse spirite hope resurreccion already past selfe daye morowe sabboth daye whiche next folowed sabboth easter nighte disciple secretelye gathered together whiche feare iewes durste assemble together daye tyme iesus went doores shut standyng middes sight take awaye al feare saluted amiably full gentlye saying voyce well knowen vnto peace lest shoulde suspect ghost another bodye sheweth vnto printe nayles handes scarre wounde whiche souldier hadde made side speare salutacion sight fayth disciple confirmed sorowe take awaye theyr myndes muche recreate made ioyouse iesus promised thus shoulde within shorte tyme woulde see agayne hadde seen hym theyr sorowe put awaye would make hertes gladde merye therewithal tolde also folow world haue sorow heuinesse hym shoulde haue peace quietnesse sayed iesus agayne peace vnto father sent euen sende also sayed woordes brethed sayeth vnto whosoeuers sinnes ye remit remitted vnto whosoeuers synnes ye retayne retayned thomas one twelue called didimus iesus came disciple therfore sayed vnto hym haue seen lord sayed vnto excepte see handes printe uayles thruste hande syde wyll beleue therfore confirme apostle theyr ioye coumforte agayne saluteth good lucke peace saying peace tyme withal hiely auctoriseth commaundeth preache thinges whiche seen sayeth father sent sende haue truely faithfully glorifyed father name agreyng amog selues shal lyke trueth faithfulnesse preache father name mine prepare mindes fuccion office asmuche nowe haue doen diligently thyng commission go agayne father thence shall sende vnto plentie power holy ghost meane shall also make partaker holy ghost accordyng capacitie euen thus speakyng brethed gaue spirite auctoritie forgeue men theyr sinnes woulde ioyned hym profession ghospel baptisme woulde forthinke former life eftsones amended haue erred whosoeuers synnes ye remit sayeth remitted vnto whosoeuers ye retayne shall abide subiecte theyr synnes thinges doen residue disciple assembled together thomas onely except absent whiche name thomas signifieth greke tongue didimus latin geminus englyshe doubtefull one twelue lorde specially peculiarly choose office preachyng gospell therfore come disciple could scant stande ioye shewed openly vnto seen lorde thomas supposyng deceyued illuded vision spirite denyed beleue vnles might see hym owne iyes beleue owne iyes sufficient witnesse except might see withall printe nailes euen freshe handes yea putting owne handes iesus side perceyue felyng wounde speare made trulye incredulitie apostle dispensacion god shall dispose didde muche good confirmacion stablishement fayth pand eyght dayes agayne disciple within thomas came iesus doores shut stoode middes sayed peace vnto sayed thomas bryng thy fynger hither see handes reache hither thy hande thrust syde faythlesse beleuyng thomas aunswered sayed lorde god iesus sayeth vnto hym thomas thou haste sene thou haste beleued blessed haue sene yet haue beleued many thinges truly iesus pre ce disciple written boke written ye might beleue iesus christe sonne god beleuyng ye might haue life thorowe name therfore eyght dayes apostle met together agayne stealthe tyme reste thomas coumpanye whiche hitherto woulde beleue christe rysen lorde came gate beyng hard faste shut standyng middes saluted vsuall well knowen maner facion saying peace turnyng hym thomas whose vnbelefe knewe ignoraunt nothyng whiche lacke beliefe iesus knewe came phariseis infidelitie malice man infirmitie vouched safe heale sayeth thus hym thomas sayeth forasmuche dooeth suffise haue hearde many rysen lyfe agayne whiche hath seen hearde except thy sens mighte feale perceyue thesame bring hither thy finger feele woundes nayles see truelye carye true markes therof put thy hande syde handle wounde whiche speare made hereafter vnfaythful harde belefe mattiers thou haste nowe seen thing proued certainly true whiche persemed thee incredible see thou geue fayth promise howe incredible soeuer seme common sence iudgement men thomas seen felte knowyng bothe face accustomed voyce lorde conceyued full fayth spake aloude lorde god harde belefe body clearlye confesse iesus god man handlyng body late hong dead vpon crosse witnessed whiche rysen lyfe agayne man dede knowleage hidde secrete thynges proued well godhead trueth iesus well accepte embrace thomas confession yet withall reproue hardnesse belefe saying thomas thou hast seen hearde handled thou beleuest blessed shall whiche though see yet beleue verely lorde iesus declared vnto disciple diuine power godheade many token whiche written booke thynges reported declared euangelistes thynges also reported tolde worde mouthe euen teller therof bothe sawe hearde thynges themselues set write thynges whiche woulde haue bene worke greatnes coulde haue measured cared yet thoughte necessarye write thinges thereby ye mought come beliefe iesus sonne god whiche thyng yf ye dede ye shall haue full blisse beatitude whiche lorde iesus promised see beleue lyke suffered death liueth immortal shall ye also profession name true faythe obtayne eternall lyfe xxi chapter pafterwarde iesus shewe himselfe againe sea tiberias wyse shewed hymselfe together symon peter thomas whiche called didimus nathanael cana galile sonnes zebedei two disciple verely confirme faythe disciple iesus oft time appeared vnto talked sometyme also eate meate theyr company le te suspicion shoulde setle theyr myndes delusion ghoste whiche sene neyther therwhiles continuallye present company wont death familiarly handled among yet seen menne hadde sayed would appere world neyther euen list nowe immortalitie shewed certaine semblaunce full maiestie reuerence thentent faith beyng full stayed establyshed might withdrawe altogether sight body spirituallye amongst therefore appered shewed himselfe againe disciple ye depe lake called tyberias presented himselfe vnto wyse disciple yt tyme kept theselues secrete hierusalem sauetie phariseis daunger repayred againe galile good sorte together euen fewer tha simon peter thomas called didimus also nathanael cana citie galile iesus turned water wine besides ye two sonnes zebedei iohn iames ye greater two disciple psymon peter saieth vnto wyll go fishyng saye vnto also wyl go went theyr waye entred shippe immediatlye night caught nothing mornyng nowe come iesus stoode shore neuerthelesse disciple knewe iesus iesus sayeth vnto child haue ye meate aunswered saieth vnto cast net right hande ye shal fynde nowe lacked theyr lordes helpe woonte fedde mere fre bounteousnes frendes peter wente hande againe olde facultie get lyuinge owne handes lest burdenouse man fed others lyberalitie idlenesse might preache thoughte right whiche serued ghospell lyue ghospell therfore twie lyght shoulde haue goen abrode vpon theyr peryll daye peter saieth go fishyng reste saied vnto also wyll go fishing goyng foorth doores togetherwarde entred shippe fished night vayne ga e neuer one fishe intente waye shoulde made miracle therwith misterie signified labour euangelist vayne vnles christe prosper mannes endeuour waxed daye iesus stoode shore dysciples knewe partely distaunce betwene partely scant daye also partely lorde woulde furthwith knowen therfore iesus spake vnto shore saying child haue ye meate forasmuche knewe lorde voyce supposed manne whiche came sea bye fyshe made aunswere none could selle taken nothing iesus declare litle lytle sayed vnto caste nette righte syde shyppe ye shall fynde ye coulde hytherto caste nette anon hable drawe multitude fish sayed disciple iesus loued vnto peter lord whe simon peter heard yt lord girded coate vnto naked sprang sea disciple came shyppe wer farre lande two hundred cubites drew nette fish dyd bad werynesse vaine laboure great desire take fyshe conceiued hope byanby great multitude fyshes taken net laden withall coulde v neth drawen vp boate wete ye well euen resemblaunce multitude men whiche afterwarde preachynge apostle brought ioyned churche whole world language countrey soeuer noueltie thing disciple whome iesus loued moued attentyfe marke thing knewe iesus incontinently aduertysed peter altogether busye aboute drawynge vp nette lorde whiche standyng shore commaunded looce caste oute nette peter beyng alway one man lyke himselfe forget nette fishe toke shyrte naked coulde abyde sprang sea came first lord disciple came shyp farre shore two hundred cubites altogetherward drewe nette full laden fyshe assone come lande sawe hotte coales fishe layde theron breade iesus saieth vnto bryng fyshe whiche ye haue caught symon peter went vp drewe nette landeful great fyshes hundred thre fiftie many yet nette broken wer come lande sawe vpon bancke hotte coales fishe layed theron breade withall therfore iesus commaunded also bryng fyshes whiche caught peter returned againe shippe drewe nette land full great fish noumbre hundred thre fyftie also made seme greater myracle great multitude great fish yet nette broken sundre weight therof thynge dyd represent humble churche worlde weake narrowe yet suche thing shall embrace nacions worlde lorde iesus beyng head chefe gouernour therof iesus saieth vnto come dyne none disciple durste aske hym art thou knewe lord iesus came tooke breade gaue fyshe lykewyse third tyme iesus appered disciple yt raysed againe fro death whe dyned iesus saieth vnto symon peter symon ioanna louest thou sayed vnto hym yea lord thou knowest loue thee sayeth vnto hym feede lambes furthermore shewe certeintie verye manne ghoste therfore approuyng veritie body beyng sene me iyes heard eares handled handes would also eate meate therfore inuited disciple dyner ready disciple sate downe whusht spake wordes maiestie immortall bodye toke accustomed boldnes dede knewe hym lorde nowe appeared high gloriouse sorte one great noblenesse excellencie therfore none durste aske hym arte thou yet thynge selfe knewe hym lorde although shewe semblaunce bodye chaugediesus came toke breade c iesus therfore came feast maner brake bread owne handes gaue fishe likewise exau ple dede teaching whome specially chosen bee shepeherdes churche fede euangelicall flocke holy doctrine yet suche hymselfe taught thirde time iesus appeared certayne space betwene disciple theyr company continually dyner doen lorde iesus maner declaryng worde mouthe thyng whiche facte signified committed shepe peter feede first thrise required loue entent mighte powre mindes disciple man fitte shepeherde euangelicall flocke excepte whiche beareth suche loue towardes put truste withall kepe christe shewed himselfe haue towardes bestowed lyfe specially spake peter vtterly put awaye remembraunce denying christ notise haue hiest chiefe place ministerie gospel passe excellency charitie towardes flocke lorde therfore hym iesus knewe feruente minde reste would expresse apostle successours proufe true perfite shepeherde dede peter wount tymes also mouthe apostle hym lorde woulde haue knowen hearde also would openly confesse expressed voice man publique confession whole churche dyd late tyme deserue promise keyes kyngdome heauen thesame wyse also woulde mannes voyce open confession made moste hye charitable loue towardes hym entente one man reste shoulde knowe maner men ought curate lordes flocke simon ioanna sayeth iesus louest thou lorde dyd aske thinges ignoraunte muche loued peter woulde haue inwardelye fastened hertes disciple moste hye charitie towardes iesus nedefull shoulde take cure lordes flocke whiche lorde himselfe suffered death vpon crosse peter nowe come circumspeccion wount made aunswere concernyng howe muche loued lord knewe fully mennes mindes owne parte conscience maketh aunswere whereof bolde make lorde hymselfe witnesse howe muche loueth thee sayeth knowe lorde loue thee thou askest knowest doe loue thee thou knowest secretes mennes myndes art ignoraunte loue thee sayeth iesus thou louest thou openly sayest fede lambes whiche loue moste dearely haue spente lyfe shewe thy selfe suche towardes haue shewed self towardes shall proufe perfite loue towardes sayeth hym agayne seconde tymer symon ioanna louest thou sayeth vnto hym yea lorde thou knowest loue thee sayeth vnto hym feede shepe sayeth vnto hym thyrde tyme symon ioanna loueste thou sayed vnto hym lorde thou knowest thyng thou knowest loue thee iesus sayeth vnto feede shepe lorde iesus asketh hym agayne euen like many wordes simon ioanna louest thou peter aunswereth euen lyke noumbre wordes lorde loue thee thy selfe knowest loue thee sayeth iesus agayne thou louest mein dede feede shepe whyche deare lorde asked peter thyrde tyme symon ioanna louest thou lordes askyng often repeted caste peter scruple sorowe although knewe owne conscience loued lord exceadyngly yet thryse denyed lorde stoutely promysed contrary caused hym also distruste hymselfe peter fall deniall lorde turned hym good furthered saluacion whiche falle taughte hym humble briete caused hym learne newe lesson put muche truste affiaunce hymselfe suche pestilence euangelicall godlynesse none canne perniciouse deadely therfore aunswereth sincerely trueth timerouslye lowlye withall trusted hymselfe putteth affiaunce hym onely truste affiaunce oughte geuen saying lord askest thou often seing thou knowest al thing thy self knowest loue thee sayed iesus therfore feede shepe vpon declare howe muche thou settest thou shalte take exaumple good shepeherde haue spente lyfe shepe thou lykewyse shalte playe faythfull shepeherde shepe euen losse lyfe heade shepe myne haue redemed bloud returning againe father comit betake thy fedyng thou therfore shalt playe shepeherde lorde thou shalt fede saue kyll pull theyr skyn vtter vndoyng yf thrise deare welbeloued shal dearely beloued loue exceding well lord iesus would haue thinges wyth greate diligence powred myndes disciple knewe would rise men loue iesus theyr commodity sake take cure christen people rather inuade violence take cure vpon hande maner person woulde stede shepeherdes playe tyrauntes robbe altogether moreouer lorde didde vouchesafe declare also thre tymes repeted confession loue meane health safetie lordes flocke contemneth ryches careth worldlye honoure neglecteth owne affeccions sheweth greate lykelyhoode trueth hath pure sincere loue sauyng flocke letteth auenture lyfe manne ye wote well hath doyng geuen sure lesson perfite loue charitie verely verely saye vnto thee thou wast young thou gyrdedst thy selfe walkedst whyther thou wouldest thou arte olde thou shalt stretche forth thy handes shall gyrde thee leade thee whether thou wouldest spake signifying death glorifie god lorde nowe willyng somewhat open peter tyme come thyng sayed peter well assure thee therof thou shalt whe tyme perfourme accomplishe thyng whiche thou nowe sayest cofessest truely delicate profession thou wast young bodily strength able suffre laboriouse greuouse thynges thou waste dayntely occupied liued ease thou vngirdedst gyrdedst thy selfe thyne owne wyll pleasure walkedst libertie whither thou wouldest thou arte olde bodily strengthe weaker thou shalt hardely entreated thou beyng hearte strong thou shalt stretche furthe thy handes another shall gyrde thee leade thee whither thou wouldest riddle parable iesus signified kynde death peter shoulde glorifie god beyng aged led crosse whiche though suffred gladlye excellente loue bare towardes lorde yet weakenesse mannes nature lothed pand spoken sayeth vnto hym folowe peter turned aboute sawe disciple iesus loued folowyng whiche also lea ed breast supper sayed lorde whiche betrayeth thee peter therfore sawe hym sayeth iesus lorde shall ere iesus sayeth vnto hym wyl haue ye tyll come thee folowe thou went saying abrode among brother disciple dye yet iesus sayed vnto hym shal dye yf wyll tary tyll come thee iesus sayed thus begunne walke sayed peter folowe agayne prouokyng inuityng hym folowyng charitie deathfolow peter turned loked aboute hym seeth euen disciple whome iesus loued leaned lordes breast laste supper whilest asked betraye hym forasmuche peter entierly loue disciple knewe alwaye better beloued lord rest sawe thesame vnbidden folow nexte vnto peter peter asked lorde become knewe already owne death desyreth knowe whether shoulde haue man companion dye hym thoughte gloriouse thing vnto hym great token lordes loue towardes hym might dye exaumple iesus iesus correct vnnecessarie care peter hadde mannes death sayed haue hym tary tyll come thee myne mine aduise wyll ordeyne determyne hym shalbe beste care prepare thou whiche apperteyneth thy selfe saye thou folowe vpon occasion saying arose bruite among disciple iesus welbeloued disciple shoulde dye violent death liue styll vntyll lord shall come agayne iudge quicke deade thought sone albeit lorde saye shall page duplicate page duplicate dye make dull abate repulse peter curiositie ouermuche diligence denied perteyne vnto hym though hys wyll pleasure man shoulde styll lyue vnto laste cummyng thesame disciple whiche testifieth thynges wrote thesame thynges knowe hys testimony true also many thynges whiche iesus whiche yf thei shoulde written euery one suppose worlde coulde conteine bookes shoulde written dede thatsame disciple witnesseth thynges thus bee dooen wrote thesame entente maye truely farre abrode bee scattered dispersed knowledge folke haue knowen testimonie true wrote mennes hearynges whiche hymselfe presente hath made mencion thinges whiche iesus sayed manne shoulde goe tell euery thyng selfe vnmeasurable sorte bokes shoulde bee made therof muche written suffiseth obteyning saluacion therfore rest beleuyng stickyng steppe wayes iesus labour diligently get rewarde immortall lyfe thus endeth paraphrase vpon ghospell iohn moste uertuous ladie quene kateryne late wyfe kyng henry eyght moste famous memorye deceassed nycolas udall grace humble oratour seruaunt wysheth perpetuall felicitee ioye iesus christ lorde much nothyng doeth lyke spede better effecte eyther open worlde engraue mennes heartes knowelage goddes commaundementes rule true christian doctrine deuout godly tractises expoundyng declaryng holy scrypture howe happie blyssed howe greatly bounde thanke god tymes dayly cum foorth many fruictfull godly weorkes owne toung ghostely coumfort edifiyng deuout chrystian reader true fayeth relygyon tymes past studyous wryters bookes wer enforced much highe suite seruice procure fauoure good wyll prynces estate whome dedicate weorkes thei wrote thentent vnder name protection noble personage sayd weorkes might better habled reader better accepted people nowe dooe kynges quenes prynces pier especyally englande owne mere mocions good zele propense fauour benefycyall ayde coumforte lyberalitee helpe forewarde good endeuour sedulytee studious wryters myndyng godly monumentes edifie feithfull congregacion also dylygent peynefull bothe put theyr owne handes endictyng pennyng many holsome traictises purpose yea ferther exaumple prouocacion set hande wrytyng translatyng fructefull exercise learned holsome enstruccion englyshe reader effectuall edifiyng simple ignoraunt multitude bee content solle helthe gyue eare mynde thereto emong sorte publique benefactours excellent highnesse quene kateryne deserueth lesse next soueraygne lorde kynges maiestee whoe euen nowe already fyrst entreaunce moste noble reigne within yeres tendre minoritee doth aduice consent moste prudent moste dere vncle edwarde duke somersette aswell moste royall persone tyme mynorytee gouernoure also hys maiestees realmes dominyons subiectes protector together assent consent moste honourable moste trusty moste feythfull counsaillours moste forewardly moste earnestly possible diligence labour daye nyght well moste holso lawes also elyes moste pure doctryne true preacher refourme abuse sowe abrode woorde god plante true relygyon partes realmes domynons youre hyghnesse saye next vnto twoe deserueth lesse estemed called chiefe patronesse onely dyuers moste godly psalmes meditacions owne penning settyng foorthe also procuryng thys present weorke erasmus paraphrase translated vse vnlearned multytude whiche go ferther vnderstandyng readyng englyshe paraphrase erasmus conteined maner whole librarie deuout catholyke expositours vpon whole new testamente new testament conteyned plenteous richesse precious treasoures christes ghospell glad newes goddes fauour mercy towardes mankynd fauour mercy god whosoeuer doth feithfully syncerely enbrace cannot fauour ferther setting foorth scripture vulgare language al folkes maye knowe also godly traictises whereby generall benefyte god towardes mankynde maye clerelye certainly perceiued effecte forasmuche desiderius erasmus roterodam doeth especially directe aswell paraphrase vpon newe testament also right christian wrytinges much indifferencie possible cannot iudge whoso prompte hasty condemners erasmus eagre aduersaries vnto doctrine vnder name colour erasmus rather vtter stomake hatred againste goddes woord grace ghospell erasmus parte moste diligently moste simply laboureth bryng lyght doctryne wyll vneguall iudges saye scarcely sincere shall insynceritee doctrine appere wrytynges wyll say comon co sent chrystian world doeth fynde iudge erasmus doubte theyr weorkes shalbe good people approued desyred enbraced folowed erasmus wyl headie persones say doth somewhere erre maye forasmuch man estemeth hymself woulde weorkes none wyse reade accepted wrytynges mortall men case place saie worde much litel putte wurse word apte terme place stoumble swarue whiche poincte humayne frayltee best doctours wrote sence apostle tyme hathe escaped erasmus standeth owne wylfull opynion beeyng found tryed faulte woulde haue readye retracte euer godly catholike wryter hath ben yet one lytle tryppe poore iudgement emong many notable good workes enterpretacion scrypture helpe symple rather bee borne withall many good thinges either reiected kept away hungry christian reader colde charitee beare nothing eagre malice trifle matier nothing woulde haue ignoraunt multitude lacke much good edifying may taken erasmus aswel hys ryght deuoute catholyke woorkes also moste specyally paraphrase laboureth enlarge processe tenour texte sense therof may bothe euedentlye gathered may well hange together erasmus therfore lyke hathe paraphrasticall discourse playnly sette foorth ghospelles fower euangelistes afore dooeth expoune seconde parte luke ghospel entitled ye actes apostle whiche woorke athanasius leste wy e athanasius dede wrote litle traictise entitled bokes bothe olde newe testament c testifieth luke wrote peturs mouthe petur endicted vnto luke wryte paule endicted ye luke whan wrote ghospell whereof erasmus preface paraphrase vpo luke ghospel recordeth gathered thought sayde actes wer wryten rome whersoeuer wryten certes worke lesse expediente necessarie wrytten ne paraphrase vpon thyng lesse requisite bee translated englysh reste newe testament firste plain historical narracion piece veray ghospel declareth aswell ascencion christe yearthe vp heauen also hys sendyng oune holy ghoste heauenly father together spryngyng vp prymatiue churche fourme ordre preachyng apostle first begonne secondely erasmus hymselfe testifieth last parte whole paraphrase vpon testament reason thereof iudge moste absolute piece worke best dooen reste reason long exercise afore kynde writing thyrdely piece new testament lesse profytable publishyng furtheraunce ghospel luke dyd deuise entende ne poore younglynges christes dyscipline thyng lesse auaillable may learne beginninges christes churche whome manier persones feythe christe fyrste sprong vp howe proceded grewe howe persecuted persecucyon wexed stronger stronger paulme tree weight burde layed vpon ariseth shootheth vpryght ghospel persecucion inflycted vnto rigour wrong reproche cheynes aduersytee mynistred vnto grewe ye prospered better wente forewarde floryshed actes reade meanes dryftes humayne polycy enemyes christes bloude ghospell wrastled suppresse glorye crosse howe wysedo world thought euacuate fruicte christes deathe passion dyd humylytee preachyng crosse worke harte simple contemne onely pleasure flattery worlde also persecucion tyranny therof dayly encreased euery place ghospell preached thousandes vpo thousandes augmente ye feithfull congregation actes therefore lesse necessary translated rest paraphrase actes haue occasio adding digesting sorting texte paraphrase throughly perused conferryng latine haue dooen good wyll diligence make englysh aunswerable latyne booke lestwyse sense occasion also mathewe iohn haue manier dooen nothing sauing placed texte diuided paraphrase knew translatours thereof whose erquysite dooynges myght without cryme great arrogancie presumpcion busy entremedle moste humbly therfore beseching highnesse moste gracious ladie good parte take good zele diligence case thyng shall suffyciently answere mynde desyre impute rather lacke facultee knowlage default good wil shal without ferther circustaunce woordes commend leue whole worke diligent readyng folowyng deuout englyshe congregacyon wyth moste hertye prayer beseche almyghty god long yeres preserue cotynewe prosperous estate highnesse thende good help meanes deuout people willing foreward learne liue christianlye maye receiue many lyke godly weorkes fruictful traictises theyr continuall ghostly profite coumfort edifying lorde iesus christe whome father holy ghoste al laude honour glory heauen yearth euer euer amen actes apostle chapter former treatise deare theophilus haue spoken iesus began teache vntyll daye taken vp holy ghost geuen commaundementes vnto apostle chosen whome also shewed aliue passion many token appering vnto fourty dayes speakyng vnto kyngdome god gathered together commaunded departe hierusalem wayte ye promise father wherof saieth ye haue heard iohn truly baptised wt water ye shalbe baptised holy ghost fewe day nowe haue accomplished thone halfe promyse deare frede theophilus forasmuche coprised former treatise ye life iesus christ groundly rehersyng history yt write therof yt e euen fro time iohn baptist foremessagier lorde conceaued ye rehearsal certaine prophecy also disclosed affirmig expressed wordes promise yt messias sone come done sum thinges haue rehearsed large wryters lefte vntouched christes conception hys byrthe circumcision purificacyon marye somwhat also touched godly towardnes wherof shewed proufe toke xii yeres olde thinges thought cause worthy recited ye many token myght bee euident whome prophecy notablye spoken euen tender youthe iesus lacked wytnesse good menne whiche inspired holy gost thoughe doubted ye iesus whole trade lyfe excellent example perfecte holynesse yet thynges omitted whiche doone meane space passed ouer vntyll tyme iohn preachyng baptisyng began shew hymselfe foremessagier christ forasmuche oure lorde iesus began tyme forwarde chieflye occupied aboute healthe mannes soule accordyngly conteyned figure darke sayinges moyses lawe foreshewinges prophetes whiche busye endeuour resteth two poyntes dedes muche saye workynge myracles sufferyng paine crosse resurrection wher lefte none al thynges vndoen either shadowes lawe wer signifyed spoken prophetes wordes meane whereof taught newe kynde philosophie ioyfull might bothe learne take example liue godly lyfe thynges haue treated ordre euen vnto daye receiued heauen whence came arisen death lyfe commaunded xii apostle disciple numbre threscore x whoe specially chosen thende whan thei receiued holy ghost euen breathyng face endued afterward sente heauen aboundauntlye shoulde go throughe worlde preache ghospell iewes onely vnto maner nacions world fyrst expedient purposed bryng menne belefe wonderful actes shoulde throughly confyrmed fayth themselues chyefe poynt among rest menne shoulde fully perswaded iesus veraye dede deade verayly arose death lyfe thyrd daye phantasticall body veray beeing immortall whiche tyme carryed yearthe subiecte deathe whiche layed voyde lyfeto whome also shewed hym selfe alyue hys passon graue cause thought sufficient onely shewe hym selfe disciple arisen deathe lyfe often tymes appered lyke ghostes wonte appere sundrywyse declaryng euident token taken vnto liuely bodye agayne fowerty dayes taryed yearth cause purposely yet tyme would seene owne disciple onely pleasure sene hearde felte also familiarely eate dranke moste euident token maye lyuely body meane space often commoned kyngdome god puttyng mynd thynges whiche done taught deathe myght finally perceyue euery thyng cumme passe whiche sayed shoulde cumme warning farder thence forthe shoulde eyther doe awayte thoughe already geuen authorytee preache ghospelland commaunded shoulde departe ierusalem c yet forbade shoulde hastely set vpon exercyse weightie matier shoulde departe hierusalem assembled together applying themselues eache fasting geuing laudes god praying awayt cummig holy ghoste whome death promysed hys father sende bee comfortour sayed promysed myne owne mouthe doubte ye father see vnfeignedly perfourmed haue promysed name myne bee bothe one thentrepryse ye shall take hande heuen yearthely mannes inuencyon ye shall teache carnall thynges phariseis haue doen hitherto ghostely thynges greate trouble shal ye haue preachyng ghospell wherefore necessarye ye bee stregthed power heaue ye may hable susteyne chargefull entrepryse shall brought passe mannes policie helpe holy ghoste iohn truly baptised waterfor thynges haue hitherto done rule instruccions princyples young begynners respecte setting forward ye gospell iohn baptyzed water holy ghoste gaue passeth mannes power geue hym nothing el preached ye man repent kyngdome heauen hand nowe muste ye haue stronger mayntenaunce sette forthe lyuelye doctryne ghospell beare assaultes worlde whiche shall stryue agaynste bryng sufficient voyde synne ye haue nede newe spirite settyng forth newe kinde lerning plenteous spirite yt shal aboudantly assist heuenly spirite spirit lyke fier ye shal christened within fewe day baptisme yt iohn could geue prophecied geue thus sayde bearyng wytnesse shall christen sayed holy ghoste fyer tymes past also god endewed hys prophetes holy men spirite haue brethed holy spirite euen veray spirite nowe shall plenteously powred ouerall whole worlde shall renewe thynges agaynst cummyng make selues ready fastyng prayer specially full truste confydence ye maye fytte instrumentes hym spreade abrode heauenly power whan therefore cum together asked saying lorde wilte thou time testore agayne kyngdome israell sayed vnto knowe tymes season father hath put power ye shall receyue power holy ghost cum vpon ye shalbe witness vnto onely hierusale also iewrye samaria euen vnto worldes ende iesus spoken wordes vnto disciple beyng assembled one placewhan therefore cu together asked hi sayinge lorde c woulde haue variaunce lefte emong theim hys departyng euen houre yet put oute theyr heades theyr phantasticall dreame kyngdome israell aduaunced enlarged hym enquyred lorde euen readye streight wayes departe whether soone sente downe holy ghost woulde restore people israell theyr worldelye kyngdome agayne whether woulde immediatlye appere face woorlde maiestie yet conceyued manner thyng thys ghostely kyngdome shoulde bee peter woulde haue hym establyshe kyngdome whan hille reste also thapostles tyme mencion made rysyng deathe lyfe enquired hys kyngdome nowe eftsones vpon communicacion whiche hearde sending holy ghoste came remembraunce temporall kyngdome trusted shoulde cum passe iewes shoulde bee rewlers ouer world veray dede sure cum israell shoulde reigne fleashly israell truelye deserued name saye dede strong god iacob deserued well haue name whan wrastled thaungell longe worldly manne trusted owne desertes hable satisfye iustice god world sinne reproued subdued vnto punishment manne began mystruste owne workes sticke vnto promyses gospell dyd man woulde saye ouercum iustice god force obtayned mercye kingdome beeyng decayed euerye place speciallye emong iewes christe restored hys gospell disciple vnderstandyng thys phansied selfes sum good chaunce woulde cum whiche shoulde delyuer persecucion wycked loked ende worlde whiche tyme lorde woulde haue theim knowe expediente knowe therfore whan curyouslye demaunded put silence answer enquire thynges whyche expediente knowe onely beleue stedfastly dooe ye commaunded ye shalbe minister matier leaue procedynges herin ende heauenly fatherand sayed vnto c therfore parte knowe yeare moneth houre kingdome israel shal cum thinges ye folysh calkers curiously seke much father pleasure yt knowe haue tolde time haue vttered vnto father reteineth hymselfe knowleage therof ende ye diligent duty kingdome god shal cum finally wheras good bad shalbee rewarded accordyng desertes againste whose cummyng must ye bee alwayes ready albeit spirituall kyngdome shall meane season also appeare setting forthe whereof god shall vse helpe rewardyng therfore let alone wherfore settyng aparte desyre knowe matter whiche ye oughte know make redy youre selues hand whiche thyng ye habilitie sufficient holy ghoste accordyng promyse shalbe powred heauen augment strength mynde bryng youre remembraunce agayne whatsoeuer haue heretofore taughte farther put myndes whatsoeuer thing el shal behoue know shal ye taught instructio strengthed wyth hys ayde beare wytnesse fyrste hierusalem accordyng saying prophete syon shall lawe procede word lord hierusalem sone throughout iewry nexte throughout samaria nygh adioyning iewry fynally al cuntreys world euer dwelling man came indifferently men sake died euery man eche man hath gracious fauour gospel profered hitherto law hath reigned onely among iewes father wyl haue gospel reigne farre abrode worlde open wyde spoken wordes behelde taken vp hyght cloude receyued vp sight thei loked stedfastly vp toward heauen behold two men went stode white apparell whiche also sayed ye men gal le stande ye gasyng vp heauen iesus take vp heauen shall cum euen ye haue sene go heauen last wordes lorde iesus spake disciple beyng gathered together one place bethany wordes whe blessed syght al caryed vp hygh long vntil bryght cloude toke bodie cleane syght tha full tyme theym truste longer vnto bodely presence might spiritual myght behold iesus none otherwise iyes theyr fayth cause iesus taken vp hyghand looked stedfastiye vp towarde heauen beholde c disciple stode iyes stedfastly fyxed towarde heauen hard thing pul loued excedyngly though beyng yet weake loked also whether miracle shewed aboue therfore sodenly two messagers frome heauen appered mannes likenesse white garmentes verye fourme caused feare bryghtnesse theyr garmentes conuenient messenger hym hastened glory two frendly wordes asswage disciple sorow conceyued departure lord called backe againe theyr gasing vp profited nothyng vnto theyr vocacion saying ye men galile stande ye loking vp towardes heauen iesus whiche nowe taken heauen returned whence came ye haue often heard hym came father woulde leauyng worlde returne father againe taken vp ayre helyas receyued father palayce shall sitte hys right hande partener kingdom heaue sawe going heauen visible body yet immortall likewise tyme cum shal returne would while knowledge bee theyr sauiour shal feele hym bee iudge shal cum againe poorely high shal shewe himselfe iyes al men greate glory fewe sawe goyng vp euery manne shall see seconde comming albeit ye must loke immediatly returne himselfe shewed gospel god fyrste preached throughout world nowe therfore endeuour youreselues rather ye bidden tarye continue hierusalem ende ye haue receyued holye ghoste ye maye luckely take hande heauenly businesse returned vnto hierusalem mount called oliuete whiche hierusalem sabboth dayes iourney wer cum went vp parlour abode peter iames iohn andrewe phylip thomas berthelmew mathew iames sonne alpheus symon zelotes iudas brother iames euery one continued one accorde prayer supplicacion woman mary mother iesu brother numbre name together hundred twentye disciple obeyed wordes departyng mount called olyuete whiche lorde death delyted veraye often resorted vnto vpon whiche last also stoode ready returne vnto heauen repayred hierusalem hyl hierusalem farre lawful iourney sabboth daye saye almoste two myles hill went suffer shamefull death crosse fro thence lykewyse went glorye within sight hill hierusalem situate sittyng thereupon prophecied weping teres distruccion thesame citie cytie whiche murtherer prophetes lorde willed first lyght gospell sprede partely foresaid prophetes partely haue pretexte ne cloke lefte excuse whiche otherwise theyr owne infidelitie woulde vtterly haue perished chapostles desirous looke vpward heauen whither lorde went theim profite neyghbour must often come doune thinges bee rather necessary pleasaunt came hierusalem went vp certaine parlourthey went vp parlour discyples abode emong reste moste famylyar christe saye simon peter iohn iames andrewe philippe thomas bartholomewe mathewe iames soonne alpheus simon zelotes whiche hebrewe called cananeus iudas sirname called thadeus lebbeus brother iames yonger certayne woman besydes tarryed parloure whiche deuoute loue folowed lorde hys waie rydyng hierusalem serued goodes among also marye mother iesus certayne hys kyns olkes whome hebrues called brother marke litle beginning churche young borne delyted cytie hierusalem whiche signifieth hebrues sight peace suche take worlde theyr cuntrey dwell hierusalem neither attayne quietnesse heuenly lyfe neyther haue myndes troubled worldlye desyres dwell hierusalem holy ghoste cutteth hertes also delited parloure whiche high place house shoppes worke house wonte occupye lower partes house maketh himselfe readye bee dwellyng place holy goste must vtterly voide vile care holye congregacion whiche oure lorde iesus chose among others parlour first house wherin godly churche dwelled nowe marke done spent tyme brablyng idle tale continued together one mynde holye prayer christes church agrement concorde theyr prayer god accepteth whiche loue brotherly neyther woorthye heard ye prayeth instantly holy congregation prayeth al one thyng one prayeth rich wisheth deathe enemye long lyfe another promocion thinge praier mete christes congregacion reste also disciple resorted parlour thapostles wer whosoeuer wil accoumpted iesus disciple must flocke companye churche nowe people gathered together aboute numbre hundred twenty fewe loued christe harte dayes peter stode vp myddes disciple sayed ye men brother thys scripture muste nedes haue fulfylled yt holy ghoste thorough mouth dauid spake iudas guide toke iesus noumbred v obtayned felowship ministracion hath nowe possessed plat grounde rewarde iniquitie hanged burste sonder bowelles gushed knowen vnto inhabytours ierusalem insomuche thesame fielde called mother tounge archeldama saye bloud fielde began peter ful well besemed faythfull shepeherd earnestly wished thincrease christes flocke sumwhat careful thapostles whome master iesus chosen twelue noumber wer diminished reason ye death iudas iscarioth twelue remayned eleue marke theophilus maner churche vsed consultacyon great multitude disciple beeyng presente peter representing person bishop stode vp middes disciple wer sittyng thintent sum decree eache mannes consent myght stablished seme conueniet make vp thapostolike ordre againe beginning holy scripture thence must sermo bee taken yt worthy spoken man church neither thing determined made one assent theyr prayer wordes brother ye ought attempt new matter mannes polycie persuasion spoken long sythens holy goste mouth dauid touching putting man supplye roume iudas muste nedes bee fulfylled dauids prophecye psalmes howe shoulde come passe iudas swaruynge lorde make roume nother succede lorde iesus among chosen specially twelue whome woulde haue beare witnes taughte ye see presente except iudas iscarioth also lorde chosen numbre twelue woulde shoulde partaker apostle office rather chose caste lordes company oures bee guide vnto sinfull souldiers whiche tooke iesus folowe hys capitayne iesus bee felowe thapostles wicked purpose came euill ende couetousenes blynded hym solde betrayed lorde whiche giltlesse thirtie plate siluer afterwardes repenting faulteand whan hanged burst sunder c broughte againe thungodly money cast priestes feete whome hyred hauing minde mischeuous dede mercye iesus wroughte hys owne deathe hanged himselfe hong hys bealye brake bowelles fell vnlucky money whiche cast priestes feete counsell contributed byinge fielde wherein straungers mighte buryed thought vnmete laye vp price innocentes bloude treasurye house detestable scrupulositie priestes phariseis caused bothe iudas wicked acte owne vngodlynesse better knowen dwellynge ierusalem insomuche fielde called among iewes acheldama whiche asmuche saye field bloude nowe see fulfylled iudas whiche holy ghost lxviii psalme prophecyed cum vnto iewes mortall enuye pursued christe woulde repent entyced manye benefites whiche shalbe accomplished also whan time cummeth prophecie let theyr dwelling place solytarye manne remayne dwell unhappy iudas hath lost roume tyme cum also temple shall bee destroyed priestehod scribe phariseis authoritie citye hierusalem shall perishe cruell iewes shall thruste place shall true iewes enter whiche beeyng circumcysed mynde bodye shall knowledge messias crucified also shewed many foreprophecies selues haue hearde lorde iesus prophecied wepyng teares thynges shoulde betide citie ierusalem written boke psalmes habitacion voyde man dwelling therin shoprycke let another take wherfore haue co panyed v tyme lord iesus al conuersacion among v beginnyng baptisme iohn vnto daye taken vp fro v must one ordayned witnes v resurreccion wherfore nowe remayneth partes seeand man dwellyng therin c manne bee chosen iudas towme meaned prophecie hundred eight psalme let take bisshopryke oure office nothing el takyng cure lordes flocke prouide foode doctrine ghospell lefte place yet ought flocke bee defeated theyr shepeherdes noumbre bee diminished whiche lorde first ordeyne geuing speciall name shoulde bee called apostle pleasure haue alwayes witness woordes dedes whome purpose continually householde companye wherefore one must chose iudas towne hath conuersaunte v lorde iesus beyng busied health man soule willed v companye hym styll goe hym whither euer went saie fro baptisme iohn straightwayes came vnto daye went vp heauen thintent maye sufficiet witnesse v thinges lord taught wrought especially resurreccion appeared often vnto disciple onely whome specially chosen thei appointed two ioseph called barsabas whose sirname iustus matthias wha prayed said thou lord knowest hertes al shew whether two thou hast chose may take roume ministracion apostleship fro whence iudas transgression fell might go owne place gaue forth lo te lot fell matthias rounted eleuen apostle multitude approuing saiynges appoynted two chosen numbre lxx disciple ioseph otherwise named barsabas whiche also vpright liuyng called iust matthias yt two whiche wer lyke godlines cumpanie liked better twain take vpon thoffice apostleand whan praied sayed c mystrusting owne iudgementes prayed god one voyce saying men iudge thynges see heare may deceiued fayle iudgemente thou lord onely lokest heart wherby man dede either good bad vouchesafe thou shewe v thy seruauntes sum token whether two person thou hast chosen make vp ye numbre xii apostle cum ye exercisyng office whence iudas fell go place wherunto vnknowe seest al thinges shoulde go neyther long forsoke thy companye whiche dyddest might done call hym repentaunce neyther thou deceyued iudgement thou diddest admitte hym shoulde sone shrinke thy heauenly wysdome sawe expedient v treason thy sonne sacrificed v take example traitoure dauger wer v negligently recheles execute thoffice whiche take hande prayer caste lotte accordyng custome hebruesand gaue foorth theyr lotte ionas lot caste sea ionathas perceyued haue tasted hony lykewise priestes execute holy misteryes lotte holy ghost yet cum downe thapostles smelled styll certain iewish maners albeit daunger drawing lotte whiche soeuer chosen good man mete office yet whole mater commited lotte two moste approued persones firste chosen voyces doubte whether two myght take lot decided doubtefulnesse whiche coulde bee rashely done forasmuche ruled prayer lot whiche nothing el opening wyll god chose matthias whereas ioseph besides commendacion appered name also kin vnto iesus yet matthias preferred shoulde lesson v chosing bishop whose credite dispensacion gospel must committed must vtterly forbeare leaue vnto mannes affection bee equalles must prefer home carnall propertie doeth set foorthe leste whiche doone fauour bee ill presidente sum lyeth also name certayne priuy misterye hydden matthias whiche hebrue betokeneth gift god preferred iust whiche name phariseis chalege good woorkes yet none vnmete preache ghospell recogniseth free gift god fayth gospell preacheth worthy succede place thapostles neyther dyd iuste disdayne felow preferred neyther dyd matthias stande anye thing owne conceyte ioyned eleuen apostle make vp holy noumbre verye speciall good man succede ye roume naughtiest felowe euer ii chapter whan fyftie dayes come ende one accorde together one place sodaynly came sounde heaue ye cumming great wynde fylled house sate appered vnto cloue tounges lyke fyer sate vpon eche filled holy ghost began speake tounges euen spirite gaue vtteraunce whan nyne fowertie dayes christes resurreccion wyse ouerpassedwhan fiftie day wer cum ende daie longe loked penthecoste saye fyftyeth come whiche iewes also kepte holye myrthe great solempnitie aswel remembraunce yere iubile whiche came aboute euerye fiftieth yere course agayne also lawe deliuered writing vpon mounte sinay fiftieth daye kyllyng paschall lambe throughe whose bloude departed safely egipte upon high mountayne olde lawe geuen beeyng engrauen table stone newe lawe holye ghoste intituled faythfull beleuyng hertes high parlour disclosed thone eke highnesse place one syde like fyer nought el v considre hyghe mountayne whiche people beyng veray carnall worldlye therefore vnapte conceyue spirituall thinges forbidden yea muche touche vpon mounte house whereby maye marke concorde vnitee bee churche mount called sinay place conuenient setting forth suche lawe shoulde great nombre sondry preceptes conteyned kepe vnder stubburne rebellyous people precepte commaundemente hyll called sinai mounte named syon whiche worde hebrewes betokeneth high hill toppe wherof al thinges yearth beneath despised whence heauenly thynges seene far faith though thei nigh hand moute el seene terrible fier smoke flame lightening thundring mounte spirite greate vehemencie cherefull man nothing dredful fier burne bodye lighte soule richely endowe plaine tounged man heauenly eloquence people beyng square among themselues murmured theyr captayne quiete one secrete chaubre making praier one assente heauely gifte whiche wayted daye chosen lyke place also matter heauenly comfort wherunto woont often repayre nine dayes space wha fyftyeth daye come came altogether ful consent selfe parlour ready receyue heauenly spirite minde occupyed vile filthy cogitacions conuenient place holye ghoste ye parloure company godly occupyed behoued hym bee mynde troublous discord hatred contencion mansion place holy ghost whan come altogether one place high continued one fayth prayer expectacion beholde sodaynely came gift god high aboue sodaynly heauen came sounde great puffe winde carryed replenished ye whole parlour satte quiet without trouble northerne winde whiche blustereth coolde cloudes ye sowtherne winde bringeth warmthe hym oute marryshe fenny place pestylent lyuyng bodyes blast heauen procedyng thence whither christ hymselfe wente breathyng lyfe euerlastyng soule man geuing stregthe withall weake cherefull courage vnto litleonesand appared vnto cloue touges c sounde afrayde manne stiered vp mindes looke holy spirite promysed one token cummyng serued eare another eye twoo principall sens man tongue sawe lyke fyer dealyng themselues euerychone disciple parte one parte another restyng whyle vpon euerye mannes heade intent shoulde playnly vnderstande howe gift shall endure euer one spirite enspired myndes one fyre kyndled eche mannes herte toung incontinent vpon visible token folowed efficacie heauenly gifte many preset like bene transfourmed sodaynly heauenly person replenished holy ghosteand wet filled holy gost c began speake diuerse laguages thei neuer learned mannes communication spirite heauen enprinted hertes membre manne pestilent euel touge none profitable tha ye good nedefull suche shoulde sowe sundry wise doctrine heauen among people language haue toungues endowed heauenly knowelage ouer flamyng burning charitie mete gospel tha chiefest toke christes faith euangelicall whiche token lorde promised saying shall speake new tounges thei accuse men vniustly slaunder neyghboure forsweare themselues speake rybauldrye toung thei haue inflamed fyer celestial fyre helle infernall al contende disputacion vile thinges world haue yet receiued toung celestial apostle time reasoned loaues bread thei left behynd reasoned temporal kingdom israel aduaunced sit ye vpper hand haue al soueraygntie toung man vnmete publyshe gospel thynke whatsoeuer speake al spiritual celestiall burning al like fier put away toung laye asyde spirite woord spoken spirit celestial vttereth voyce celestial burning toungue loue like fier rauisheth hertes hearer inflameth mindes proude pharisee toungue styffe philosopher neuer well learned rethorician toungue neuer well spoken manne moueth therby vnto trewe gladnesse gifte cummeth onely heauen disciple wer nought el instrumentes whereby holy ghoste vttered hys mynde gifte cannot one gyue neyther delae hymselfe god dealeth eche man shal thinke good hath geuen hath cause dispise rewarded hath cause endeuoure himselfe readily profit many therwith spirite thing great vehemencie fyer veray liuely thing operacion neuer rest apostle nowe slepe soundely death lorde hide themselues soone resurrection nowe cum abrode preache openly men healthe euerlasting frely geuen faith iesus litle crucyfyed wer dwelling ierusalem iewes deuout men euery nacion vnder heauen whan noysed multitude came together astonned ye euery man hearde speake owne language wondred maruailed saying among selues beholde al speake galile heare eueri toung wherin wer borne parthia medes elamite inhabitours mesopotamia iewry capadocia poutus asia phrigia pamphilia egipte party libia whiche besides syren straugers rome iewes proselyte grekes arabian haue heard speake owne tounges great workes god thei wer al amased wondred saying one meneth others mocked saying men full newe wyne trueth say citie ierusalem tyme stage people assemble behold playes fitte firste begynnyng enterlude partely famous renoume citye partely honour paschall feast whiche pastewhan thys noysed multitude came together finally deuocion people solemne feast penthecoste manye one wer abiding ierusalem onelye came party siria cuntreyes also whither soeuer violent rage warres dryeue chaunce el brought amog whome many wer deuoute well disposed people whan strange matter comenly knowen ouer citie confuse multitude page duplicate page duplicate people came together beyng great perplexitie demauded newes meane thei wer gathered many cuntreys wer soundry language yet euery man vnderstood speaking euen though thei spoken al one tounge alone euerichon seuerally cuntrey language yea ye hebrew tonge without diuersite accordingly cuntreyes diuided whether came diuerse nacions whiche bordre one vpon el sum chaunce woman samaria knewe iesus iewe propertie toung peter pronounciacion declared hym one galilee ye greke toung likewise parted fyue sondry kindes nacions also differeth lesse language many iewes vnderstoode none cuntrey language wher themselues borne sortes therfore people greatly wondre therat reasoned suche thing might cum passe neuer lyke hearde reade thus thei said beholde straunge thing al speakethey wordred maruailed men galile howe cummeth aboute beeyng many men diuerse language ofte heare speake vnderstand hym perfectly eche v hearde owne cuntrey language borne sen multitude v gathered diuerse sondrye region v parthian medes elamite suche also doeth inhabite abrode coastes iewry besydes capadocia pontus cuntrey whiche peculiarly called asia phrigia pamphilia egipte party libia whiche reache ciren yea sum whose dwellyng rome iewes borne proselites say suche hath owne desyre professed iewishe religion moreouer crete arabian gathered many nacions sondry language dooe heare playnely vnderstade speakyng nothing comen vsage el thinges worldly man perteynyng high matter weygh importaunce yea thinges conuenient mete god maner reasoned many feared god wer abated courage strangenesse thing said meaneth wondre found fault thing whiche reason could attayne vnto phariseis wont searched diligently desired learne whiche perceyued parte suche wer hedling nothing vpright iudgement say scorne drunke new wine person man may call phariseis disciple reported iesus ye deuil within saye alwayes ye trueth great dronkenes muche vnlike furythey amased wo dred c chaunceth peraduenture fury shall speake diuerse wordes sondyry language neuer learned fury wil vndertake al shal vnderstad yu doest speake truly wordes spake mocke albeit man maye sometime tell truth although spake skoffyng wise suerty full wer ye new wine ye lorde would haue wyse put olde bottels olde wine moyses lawe lost strength vertue christe firste insured mariage churche colde vnsauery sence lawe turned christe newe wyne whatsoeuer carnall vnsauerye faynte vertue spiritual whatsoeuer lyuely strengthfull sauery uery largely dyd drynke celesticall cup whereof dauid wryter psalmes speaketh howe excellent cup whiche maketh drounke yf lawfull compare thynges together whiche throughout kynde moste vnlyke thys vulgare common drounkennesse doth engendre ower thynges chiefely vttereth secretes herte causeth man forget aduersitie past maketh minde reioyce continuall hope prosperitie come enboldeth man set nought yea owne life last maketh men whiche rude barbarous tongue bee well spoken men nowe marke sayinges whither newe swete wyne whiche proceded goddes owne spirite engendre suche lyke thyng thapostles hyd feare durst speake learned secretely woulde acknowen doe nowe publishe accordyng lordes prophecie preache vpon house toppes olde iewish fashion haue clene forgotten lyke infantes newly borne nowe remembre life past neither haue thei mynde troublous affliccions feare whereof forsaken theyr maister althoughe bare without worldlye helpe succoure yet feared neyther gouernoures ne prynces presidentes ne kynges neyther counselles imprisonmentes soondry tormentes manier kynde deathe enduryng lustie alwaye beyng courage cherefull throughe promyses christes ghospell fynally whiche poore fyshers men vnlerned forthwith practised theyr celestiall eloquence rebukyng proude phariseis confutyng subtill craftie philosopher puttyng theloquent oratours vttre scilence nothyng perill difficultie speake greate coumpanye whyche lyke monstreous beaste soundrye headdes moste tymes monstreous whan multitude collected soondry language soondry nacions peter stepped forth eleuen lyft vp voice sayd vnto theim ye men iewry dwel ierusalem knowen vnto eares heare ye wordes men ye suppose drouncken seeyng thirde houre day whiche spoken prophet iohel shalbe laste dayes sayeth god spirite wyll power vpon leshe sonnes doughters shall prophecie young menne shall see vision olde menne shal dreame dreames seruauntes hande maydens wyll power spirite dayes shall prophecie wyl shew wonder heauen aboue token yearth beneath bloud fye vapour smoke sonne shalbe turned darkenes mooue bloud great notable day lorde come shal come passe whosoeuer shall call name lord shalbe saued marke symon peter sodaynly fysher made orator multitude stirred vp clamorous rumour dyd lyke shall dooe hereafter vnto worldes ende parte good shepeherd step abrode valiauntlye amongest intent shoulde force appeare make theym styll murmured agaynst god glory el rendre one check myght constauntly rather fyercelybut peter stepped forth put away testimony holy scripture false craftye accusacion stoutely defende glorye christe peter rysenne vp parlour see noumbre thapostles fulfylled nowe eftesoones stoode vp multitude people soondry nacions mengled together partely enstruct theim sayde meaneth partely stoppe theyr monthes sayed men drounke wyth newe wyne albeit necessitie requisite bishop preache people alwayes standyng forasmuche christe hymselfe sittyng taughte people yet taketh hand apostle offyce ought stande vpright mynde consydre ye meane peter dignitie fyrste man readye occasion required set foorth ghospell put vp hys materiall sweorde wherewithall christe hymselfe pleased pulled spirituall sweord suche one ought bee chiefe byshop among people peter stode vp alone eleuen apostle standyng besydes hym leste shoulde seme vsurpe hymselfe violente gouernaunce one vttered tale one thother lyke alone openly confessed name reste iesus christ sonne liuyng god wherupon dyd shepeherd pore creature vnlearned boldely vaunt hymselfe loke vpon great assembly people excellent oratoures shall come afore assembly people presence prynces pronounce exact oracion whiche haue canned fyngers endes doe chaunge oftentymes colour cannot vtter wordes mynde lytle abashed vndoubtedly heauenly drounkennesse thys sobrefulnesse swete wyne stode presence greate multitude tooke vnto hym eleuen apostle garison men hys defence felowes wyth hym one company set hys iyes stedfastly vpon peoplewith eleuen one vnknowen whome knewe lyft vp hys voice hyghe takyng none aduysemente hymselfe woulde saye spake practisyng euen selfe thyng whiche lorde taught spake owne lucre aduautage good shepeherde defended hys flocke neyther handled hys matter sharpe wordes man inuencion vsed defence onelye holy scripture nowe multitude desyrous knowe peter woulde say let v lykewyse oure partes geue hede forasmuche hys wordes wer spoken men beginning whan wyth mouyng hys hande asswaged murmur noyse company began preface shoulde without retorical colour flattery make attent ye brother sayeth iewry ought knowe lawe eke prophetes mooste specially whiche dwell noble citie ierusalem fountayne religionwith youre eares beare ye wordes knowleage lawe somewhat peraduenture wondre nothyng man iustely fynd faute withall wherefore ye bee presente geue good eare whyle wordes learne thyng standeth touchyng profittes dooe men galile ye see stand suppose drounken wyth newe wyne seeyng yet three clockefor men ye suppose c man woonte drounke mornyng sonne rysyng nowe ye see men fulfylled whyche thyng come god long afore thys tyme promyse hys prophet iohel herken vnto prophecy trus e ye promised therein doe ye fynde faute thing ye haue seldome sene lyke rather enbrace mercifulnes whiche god dooeth profte vnto iohel inspired holy gost foreseing god giuen moyses others prophetes soondry time owne blessed spirite saluacion would last sent owne onely begotten sonne powre plenteously spirite vpon one ii lyke ye haue seene many age past fewe prophetes vpon nacions worlde whosoeuer woulde sincere fayth receyue chereful gladsome message whiche commaundement doe nowe bring vnto hath left heauenly prophecy wryting manier shall come passe saieth lorde latter dayes world powre spirite boutifully vpon men sodaynely shall sonnes prophecy daughter yong men shall see vision olde men shall dreame dreames vpon seruauntes vpon hande maydes powre spirite dayes shall prophecye shewe woonders heauen aboue token yearth beneth bloud fyer vapour smoke sunne shalbe turned darkenes mone bloud great notable day lorde come whosoeuer shall cal vpon name lorde shall bee saued thinges hath prophet iohell tolde prophecye many liues goe nowe ye see prophecied touchyng plentifull shedyng spirite effect declared iyes doubted god faithfully perfourme thaforesayde iohell hath prophecied plage shall chaunce cause ye shoulde dispayre prophet teacheth sure way saluacion seeyng sheweth perill daungier thereof call ye vpon name lorde ye shall saued pye men israel heare woordes iesus nazareth manne approued god emong miracle wounders signes god ye middes ye selues knowe hym haue ye taken handes vnrighteous persones deliuered determinate counsell foreknoweledge god haue crucyfyed slaine god hath raised vp l ced sorowes death vnpossible yt holden dauid speaketh afore hande saw god alwayes righte hande bee moued therfore herte reioyce tongue glad moreouer also fleshe shall reste hope thou wilt leaue soule hell neyther wilte ye suffre thine holy see corrupcion thou haste shewed wayes lyfe thou shalte make ful ioy thy countenaunce touching maner howe ye muste call vpon name lord lysten ye chyldren israell nowe vnto reste tale geue good hede many knewe iesus nazareth whyche persone beeyng long goe promised sayinges prophetes god hath nowe sette abrode beholde hath commended hym sondry great myracles wonder whiche hath doen wroughte hym beefore iyes verayly god speake thing vnknowen fame miracle alonely blased wide abrode thorough iewry come vnto city also bordering nyghe vpon himselfe wente wayfaryng place place ouer region healyng euery sicke hys woorde restoryng lame impotent strength agayne geuing syghte blynde clensyng leprye casting deiuils great sorte hathe seen thynges reherse none miracle doen god purposed wyll god thus saue worlde ye taken man chaunce aduenture one delyuered determinate wyll counsell god hys foreknowledge saluacyon hys people israell ye crucyfyed hym handes vnrighteous souldiers slewe hym souldiers nought el doyng haynous fact sauynge onely minister slayeth manne procureth hys death matter playne denyed manne whome ye haue slayne god woulde haue deliuered hym bee slayne veray selfe god accordyng soothe saying hys prophetes hathe called vp thyrd day lyfe agaynewhome god hath reysed vp loosed sorowes death whiche truely shall beleue ghospell shoulde hope thyng bee doen hereafter themselues whyche power god dooen hym obeyinge hys father suffered spitefull reproche crosse pacientlye puttyng hys whole affiaunce trust saluation man ayde defence mercyfulnes god therfore delyuered deadly sorowes paynes infernall whiche truely myghte reason man haue tasted felt cleane without synne coulde kepte wyse bondage death hell hath perpetuall authoritie power vpon theym subiecte vnto synne wherefore lyke death might swallow hym able holde hym beyng deuowred caste hym vp thereto constreyned
