thyrd day euen dyd whale reuomet prophete ionas wyll god innocent suffre iniuries thintent woulde delyuer v hym synne deathes tyranny yf accordyng iesus example nazareth put whole trust affyauce god haue tolde nowe brother israell ye oughte thynke incredible sen dauid beeyng enspyred wyth celestyall spirite propheciefor dauyd speaketh afore hande saw god wayes beefore tolde longe heretofore shoulde euen thus come passe fiftenth psalme speaketh iesus nazareth whome preache manier aforehande haue set lorde alwayes ryght hande shoulde bee moued therfore dyd herte reioyce tongue glad moreouer also fleshe shall reste hope beecause thou shalte leaue soule hell neyther shalte thou suffer thy holye see corruption thou haste shewed wayes lyfe thou shalte make full ioye wyth thy countenaunce ye see howe euidently hath kynge prophete dauid described lyuely picture sette beefore youre iyes whiche ye knowe well ynough dooen paste iesus nazareth made god alone hys fortresse defence trustyng hys onely helpe suffered wyllingly gladlye peynes whyche dooe knowe hath suffered sufferyng bodyly peynes reioyced inwardely hys toung ioy neuer ceased speake neuer kept silence wyll god contented bee buried although nothing mistrusted father woulde call vp lyfe agayne third day woulde suffer hym put whole trust god beeyng poynt giltie purrefye graue whosoeuer trusteth saued owne woorkes putteth trust worldely succoure shalbe founde far vnmete suffre paynful dolour death paciently neither shal hable whan entangled looce hymselfe deathes snare continually fixeth inwarde iye soule godward whiche al people mercyful knoweth alredy wayes lyfe although god semeth turne away countenaunce time yet shall againe long disclose hym beames mercy requite tormentes whiche endureth time ioyes eternall death yelde euerlastyng lyfe yearthely reproche glory heauen wherefore also taught example way lyfe euerlastyng pye men brother let frely speake vnto patriarke dauid bothe dead buried sepulchre remayneth v vnto day therefore seyng prophete knew god sworne othe yt christe cocerning fleshe come ye fruite loynes sit fear knowing spake resurreccion christ soule left hell neyther fleshe shoulde see corrupcion iesus hath god araysed vp whereof witness peraduenture shall suppose prophecy doth perteine dauid himselfe iesus ignoraunt howe highlye ye esteme dauid patriarke without cause ye suche opinion blessed derely beloued god frankelye speake trueth welbeloued brother muste set muche dauid patriarke ascribe owne due vnto messiasfor dead buried c thing trewly selfe declareth prophecy agreeth neyther dauid ne patriarke prophete dauid eche one knowe full well dead buryed neuer came afterwarde lyfe agayne seeyng sepulchre v vnto thys present day conteynyng noughte yt el dead drye bone wythout lyfe theym wherefore dauid knewe hymselfe shoulde bee buryed touching bodye shoulde rotte graue disclosed prophecye hymselfe enspyred spyryte prophecye knewe ryghte well shoulde come passe whiche god assured hym vpon othe saytherfore seyng prophete christ touching humanitie shoulde borne progeny spirituall vnderstanding shoulde sit vpon throne reigne euer prophecied one knew perfectly happen thinges ye se perfourmed iesus nazareth doubtlesse borne touching humanitie dauids kinred family ferthermore sin euidently knowen iesus lyfe tyme dyd affect worldly kingdome neuer sate vpon dauids regal seate spitefully dealed alhe knowig spake resurreccio christ appereth plainly kingdome promised prophetes say hath none end could sit vpon dauids seate slayne neuer arisen lyfe againe therfore arisen deathe lyfe agayne sytteth nowe vpon dauids seate saye vpon seate hys eternall father lorde thinges heauen eke yearth vndoubtedly dauid beyng inspyred spiryte prophecie spoke hath spoken come passe although iesus soule went downe hell yet withholden rather deliuered soules whiche libertye restreigned yea although body layde graue voyde lyfe yet rotte putrifye god hys promise lye hath called soule hell againe hath restored owne former bodywherof witness thing beare witnes ye see standing whiche haue traded liues familiarly whiche haue heard oftimes say shoulde bee crucifyed accordyng ye prophetes sayinges afterwarde aryse thirde day lyfe agayne person sawe dooyng hearde nowe bee witness resurreccion whome hath oftetymes appered alonely one seen v heard felt also handes knewe voyce knew face knew felt printed dentes woundes finally eate togither copany v thintent might wel assured se body v lay sepulchre pse nowe right hande god exalted hath receyued father promise holy goste hath shed forth gifte ye see heare dauid ascended heauen sayeth lord saied vnto lord syt thou ryght hande vntill make thy fooes thy foote stole therfore let house israel know suerty god hath made iesus ye haue crucified lorde christe wherfore selfe person whome man ouerthrew brought extreme vilany reproche god hath aduaunced heigth eternall glory whiche glory shall set open manifestly men ende world doeth meane season put forth power godhead secrete operacion holy gost whiche while liued vpon earth promised send v father hath beyng returned agayne heauen powred thence spirite vpon v bounteously accordyng iohels prophecie aboue mencioned cummeth straunge miracle ye see heare v speake language whiche beyng gathered together sondrye nacions semblably vnderstand like prophecy resurreccion vnderstand dauid haue declared euen thing prophecied ascending vp heauenfor dauid asce ded heauen sitting right hande god father euerlasting kingdome perteyne dauid like pharisee theymselues reasoning maister confessed dauid neuer ascended vp heauen retourned lyfe agayne yet misticall psalme thus sayeth beyng enspired spirite prophecye lorde sayd lorde sit right hande vntill make thyne enemy thy footestole wherefore matier playne prophecye spoken god fathergod hathe made iesus wh ye haue crucifyed lord christ hath exalted heauen iesus ye sonne dauid touching humanitie concerninge spirite lorde dauid would sit copartener kingdome therfore let al whole people israell wel assured selfe iesus nazareth whome ye crucifyed god hath aduaunced kingdome heauen hath made lorde ouer messyas say annoyncted whome ye loke messias whiche promised prophetes nowe many hundred yeres agoe pwhen heard pricked hertes saied vnto peter vnto apostle ye men brother shall doe peter sayed vnto repent synnes baptised euery one name iesus christe remission synnes ye shall receyue gifte holy gho promyse made child farre euen many lorde god shall call many woordes bare witnesse exhorted saying saue selues vntoward generacion gladly receyued preaching baptized daye added vnto three thousande soules tale peter made hearer thereof sore afrayed wer prime owne doynges howe cryed vpon pilate crucifye hym crucifye hym crucifye hym perceyued reason prophecie howe made righte hande hys father copartener hys kingdom vntyll enemy broughte vnder fotestoole put deathe beyng vnto beneficiall nowe sence cum vnto reigne afrayed leste woulde take vengeaunce vpon beginning mannes saluacion knowleage faulte feare payne deserued therfore beyng pricked conscience sayde peter reste apostle must welbeloued brother wel whan man feling hymselfe giltie conscience dispaireth ensearcheth remedye nowe doeth peter case represented sobre meke shepeherde exerciseth tyranny amongest reprocheful checkes heapeth together theyr faultes putteth abacke delay willeth kyll beastes sacrifice declareth sorowfull hertes remedy euen hande putting difference bitwixt crucifyed iesus whiche consented wicked acte none cleane without sinne therfore sayeth doe ye repent lyfe past let euerychone baptysed water name iesus christe benefites sake whiche hath freely doen v ye shall haue forgeuenes synnes shall receaue ye purely clensed gifte holy ghost whiche ye see shed vsfor ye promyse made childre let none pondre weigh owne merites geuen frely geuen vpon onely condicion ye beleue iohels prophecy doeth specially pertaine child come whome calleth sonnes doughters whome calleth seruauntes handemaydes beleue god made promis ye shall frely receaue forthwith promised neyther doeth iohels promise prophecy pertayne alone whiche people israell heathen also whiche far al kinred israelite far knoweleage god euer lord god shall merciful goodnes vouchesafe call bee partaker v gifte thynge hath prophecy well declared sayeth whosoeuer shall call vpon name lorde shalbe saued albeit eche man sayeth lorde lorde doeth cal vpon lord putteth whole hope truste saluacyon mercyfulnes lorde prophetes also hath spoken thyng worde gospel shoulde time cumming spreade throughout world besides maister iesus gaue v speciall commaundementand many woordes bare witnesse c shoulde firste declare mercifull message peace loue shoulde afterward call gentile calling cummeth man deseruinges fre bounteousenes god wordes others manye mo peter bare witnes christe bryngyng foorthe prophetes sayinges testify conferring thynges whiche alredy come passe beside teachinges exhorted might better pricke forewarde whiche wauering mindes go sayeth brother embrace ye excellent bounteousnes god towardes youand ex orted em saying saue selues vntoward generacion ready mete ye know complaintes prophetes hath made ouerthwartenes stubbernes also iewyshe nacion whiche hath declared themselues tymes rebellyous theyr lorde god whiche sent theim mynisters theyr saluacion howe often time dyd resist moses howe many prophetes haue slayne ofte haue prouoked god angre theyr mischeuous dedes wherefore iustly named house maketh lorde angry vyne turned bitternes whiche yeldeth keper stede swete grape wylde vynes iohn baptiste lamented thesame thyng callyng progenie serpentes maister iesus complayned fewe time selfe thing beyng offended many inuincible frowardenesse seyng dyd see hearyng dyd heare vnderstanding vnderstande holesome doctryne man soule despysed suche benefites wrought man hys miracle imputed spirite belzebub wherfore called frowarde nacion harde ill wylled beleue bewayling state tolde shoulde destroyed beaten killed stoned crucifyed sent god draw selfes backe brother get ye away vengeaunce god whiche hangeth ouer heades caste cankred frowardenes iewish nacion stande stifely defence theyr owne iustice wickedly rebell againste iustice god ye haue faith sincere obedyence already prouided eternall saluacion shall ye finally accoumpted true israelite shall ye child abraham shal ye right sorte iewes dede ye knowelage iesus recognise youre king ridde handes carnall generacion whiche woulde rather perishe theyr incredulitie saued ye contented borne new transfourmed spiritual nacio celestial whiche trust iesus waye saluacion sorte verely fisher eloquence whyche piked retorical preceptes rewlers receiued heaue therfore muche power efficacie operacion su orde entreth euen diuiding soule spirite whose edge hath punched stricke ye iewes hertes first cast throw net wherein fisher man soule drew vp great plenteous multitude seede gospel ought bee caste euery abrode whiche christe hath taught falleth downe men hertes yet found forthwith good grounde brought forth fruite wer baptised numbre disciple whiche time increased ioynedthen gladly receyued preaching c almost three thousand moe luckie first fruites ghospel brought forth reuenewes new testament agreeth point also figure tholde moyses commaunded feast firste fruites kept holy fiftieth day easter consecrated lord fiftieth day ye first fruites eares corne men soules preaching gospell fayth water washed away sinnes nowe heauenly spirite gredely receiued nowe marke doeth spirite god truely ydle sithen lyke vnto fyer freely made cleane soule innocentes haue frely receyued holy gost gift grace resteth parte take hede lose vnaduisedly whiche god hath mercifull goodnes frely geuen v suche first beginninges euangelycall religion suche man woulde say childehood oure first regeneracion christe haue taught hitherto milke infauntes must procede whole fast meate preacher suche feede woorde god oughte haue kindes meate euer redy hande thus lorde commaunded go ye foorth sayeth teache people baptizing teaching kepe haue commaunded teache muste christened rudimentes firste beginninges gospell whiche rudimentes principle excepte manne wyll beleue hys baptisme vayne bee alredy baptized thus must ye teache liue teachynges procedyng alwayes perfeccion pand continued apostle doctrine feloweship breaking bread prayer feare came ouer euery soule many woonders sygnes shewed apostle ierusalem beleued kept selues together thinges common sold possession goodes parted al men euery man nede continued dayly one accorde temple brake bread house house eare meate together gladnesse singlenes herte praysing god fauour al people lorde added congregacion dayly suche shoulde saued kept themselues company disciple folowed continually apostle teachinges thereby came moste profite lykewyse continued still receiuing token couenaunte shall neuer bee broken called communion token couenaunt lord taught committed v trust doen maner bread broken dealed euery man pece thereof practising remembraunce lordes passionin breaking bread c gaue thankes god bountifull goodnes clensed sinne innocent bloud owne sonne alone chosen deathes sake suffered parte vndeserued enherite life euerlasting offered vp also prayer clenes herte whose peticion kingdome iesus mighte bee made spreade euery daye abrode otherand prayer glory might throughout worlde bee knowen wyll euery might bee folowed suche professed fayth gospell might holy woorde grace celestiall profit euery day procede better better might liue concorde one eche one peace brother forgeuing iniuries faute doen man frayltie one god whiche mercifull bee mercyfull theyr neyghboure beeyng dayly strengthned goodnes god myght stedfastly abyde assautes satan vntill myght long bickering sayde sathanand feare came ouer euery soule laste receiue eternall rewarde sacrifice christen men vsed wonderfull miracle tongue peter exhortacion liuely made sodaine mutacion many men great puritie clennesse lyfe menne wrought suche effect theyr myndes whiche giltie priuie theyr owne offence sore afrayed eiuell come towarde sawe playnely thing broughte mannes conspyracy celestiall power thapostles alonely speake mennes language wrought also hierusalem many wonderfull miracle thinuocacion iesus name healyng disease putting deiuils flyght reising dead lyfe tremblyng feare encroched grew stil vpon theim beginning people towardes theyr amendement celestiall spirite wrought theyr hertes whome secretly inspired aboue thinges mutuall good wyll concorde truely cognisaunce iesus woulde haue disciple knowen many beleued gospell assembled vnto place ordinately together theyr consolacion exhorting one mutuall communycacions many numbre men al sortes admitted without accepcion person young olde menne woman free bonde poore ryche loue christe beeyng planted theyr hertes dyd greate conformitie myndes mutuall concorde knyt ioyne together beyng otherwise ferre odde eche thinges common emogest whiche thing seldome sene yea emong brother came one belly thintent eche might better departe somewhat otherand solde possessios goodes suche manoures theyr owne possession solde money prise thereof made common dole euery mannes nede required neyther wanted whiche noughte theyr owne sufficient whiche muche possession made theyr dole theyr owne proper goodes thinges common perfite charytie chalengeth goodes owne emong whiche bee one mynde man accoumpted lorde owne goodes eche man content litel thereit wyll bee harde find lacke thinges necessary distribucion common made euery man accordinge necessitie sensualitie apostle prescribed none thynges doe charitie among without compulsion lawe moyses durst require euery day also temple muche vnitie minde stedfast prayer rendryng thankes god exhortinge theimselues together entising peace conscience whiche ye gospel requireth euer hable coumpace moreouer whan thus spent whole daye suche godly excercises brake euery house theyr breadeand brake bread house house c eate meate together ioy herte cannot thinke eche one perfecte clenlynes herte gaue prayse god whose goodnes gotten muche loue fauour fauour good estimacion people woulde loue suche person hurt man ready euery man good also appered manyfestly muche godly power great sobrenesse mekenes withall mayest thou well marke theophilus howe churche beginning reason ioy men hertes vnitie luckie token well prosper muste nedes bee conformitee myndes vnitie spirite whiche pacifier troubleous hertes cannot ioy gladnes cleane conscience without dystruste promise whiche made gospell bishopes pharisee scribe chiefe auncientes head men among people wer euery alwayes redy slea iesus luckye beegynnynges young churche mencion made theim noe persone enforced come feloweship violente authoritie kept theym together league suche thither came abode still theyr owne ientle courage lorde allured theim appoincted bee saued euery day whyle smale musterdseede litell litell springyng whiche shoulde afterwarde spreade braunches abrode al worlde iii chapter ppeter iohn went vp together temple ninth houre prayer certayn man halie mother wombe brought whome thei layd dayly gate temple called beautifull aske almes yt entred temple whan sawe peter iohn woulde ye temple desired receiue almes peter fastened iyes iohn sayed looke v gaue hede vnto trustyng receyue thing sayd peter siluer golde haue none haue geue thee name iesus christ nazareth rise walke toke right hande lifted vp immediatly feete ancle bone receiued strengthe sprang stode walked entred temple walking leapinge praysing god peter iohn wente vp together company temple ninth houre daye beyng farre ouerpaste whiche houre wheras bee woonte playe drounkardes el slepe accustomed themselues dayly deuout prayer fasting vntill euentide two went forth pier thapostles without trapped horse barted mule without princely garde heare pompe vsed sate temple gate begger well knowen emong people whiche euer lame firste houre birthe weake body withall borne long porter many one chaunced fared better misery euery day layed foorth theyr owne aduauntage temple gate whiche vulgare people called beautifull moste haunted thintent shoulde aske place moste frequented mennes almes whiche went temple beggery without shyf e knoweth whiche enter temple eyther disposed geue better wyll almes el woulde appeare people disposedwhan sawe peter iohn c whan perceiued peter iohn companie whiche folowed declared bee estimacion theymselues countenaunce seemed bee liberall woulde temple asked theim almes gaue holy goste priuie warning thapostles time conuenient woorke myracle peter iohn also stedfastely behelde creple sayed looke v begger beyng sight coumfortable voyce theym quycker spirite better cheare iyed well hopynge shortly thing receiue money craued money loked good disposicion lymmes durst aske thought able geue yet herte gaue goodnesse shoulde happen wist peter set forth hymselfe stoutely woordes whiche full well semyng christes highe vicare speake sayd syluer golde whiche thou lookeste haue none ready hande myne owne bounteousenesse god whiche thou dooeste rather lacke geue thee name iesus christe nazareth ryse vp walkein ye name iesus christe nazareth arise walke tooke creple righte hande reysed hym vp immediately without delay feete ancle bone made strong suche sorte might aryse without peyne difficultie yea leape stande walke whyther euer woulde one ryghte gladde herte suche benefite vnlooked went thapostles together temple walkyng cherefully leapyng ioy reioysyng geuyng laude prayse god whome knewe hys benyfite healthe proceded hyde benefites god condicion vnthankefull persone ascribe manne poynt muche vngodlynesse people sawe walke prayse god knewe sate begged beautifull gate temple woondered wer sore astonied happened vnto halte healed helde peter iohn people ran amased vnto ye porche called salomon people temple whiche numbre many behelde manne wont bee caried porter walking foote cherefully rendring praise god eche man knew bee selfe person wount sit beautiful gate begging behelde sodainly chaunged hearde geuing god thankes wherupon greately dismayed sodaynly striken litle wondre sawe peter iohn whiche knowen many chiefe emong apostle lame kept himselfe partie blased abrode howe chaunced come health meanes whole assembly people made streight towardes porche whiche called salomon porch iesus trew salomon woont bee woonte ofte tymes dispute phariseis straungenesse thing abated courage whan peter sawe aunswered vnto people ye men israell meruaile ye loke ye v though power strength made man goe god abraham isaac iacob god father hath glorified sonne iesus ye deliuered denied presence pilate whe iudged loosed ye denied holy iust desired murderer bee geuen killed lorde life god hath raysed death witness name thorow fayth name hath made sound ye see know faith hath geuen health presence whan peter saw faste gathering together people knewe righte well cause therof beganne manner vttre agayne minde sayed ye men israel doe ye muche meruayle matter though wer seldome thing long vse see miracle lyke ye seen heretofore time paste greater thinges merueyle doe ye beholde v though owne power deseruing brought passe lame criple manne well knowen emong doeth walke man practise whiche done neyther new thyng whiche ye doe see heretofore hath spoken thing god long goe promysed prophetes reuerently ye doe worship god abraham god isaac god iacob ye auaunt selfes ye haue theym chiefe father firste beginner auncestry sonne god chiefe father auncestry hath wurshipped beyng sente saluacion poore simple loke vpon thintente shoulde make famil e person lyke one ye haue brought extreme vilanny reproche notwithstanding selfe god hath infinite might power aduaunced sonne high renoume glory one whome man malice hath ouerthrowen god hath fact lyke hath also many wayes wroughte miracle numbre iyes taught doctrine heauen ye neuer deale better al benefites deliuered last many reprochfull iniuries handes wicked thintent shoulde slaine yea pilate panim man without knowleage lawe kinred forefather woulde haue gyuen sentence king blessed person innocet deliueraunce yee ought reason knowlage ye prophecy recognise hym haue styfely denyed hym openly presidentes hyghe hall iudgemente saying haue kinge ceasar suche cruell rage ye rancour againste hym hatred lieffer ye haue barrabas notable thefe sedicious person pardoned request whiche despatched liues haue iesus saued broughte hym lyfe menne murtherers lyfe ye obtained pardon authoure euerlasting lyfe ye procured deathe neuerthelesse god hys father authoure maker lyfe hathe raysed hym whome ye haue slayne dead lyfe againe liberally hath rewarded hym lyfe neuer shall haue ende thing beare witnes vnto himselfe reuiued eftsones playnely appeared v beholde v heare handle behelde also goyng vp heauen came firste pore simple aray contented take vpon hym sake father aduaunced glory putteth foorth power strength vsof yt witness nought el witness thinges whiche haue seen hearde trust affyaunce whiche haue name man see walke borne ye well knowe bothe halte lame almightye god hath restored hys perfit limmes agayne prayse herein worthy haue neyther oure merytes cause thereof neyther restored god father sayd would haue sonnes name magnifyed men whiche name pleasure people shoulde put full trust hope health vniuersall assured trust confidence man hath euer weake first houre birth perfectly ye see limmes restored euident argumentes alonely proue liue ye suppose dead declare also mennes hope saluacion put alone brother wot ignoraunce ye also rewlers god shewed mouthes prophetes howe ye christe suffre hath wise fulfilled repent therfore conuerte sinnes may doen away whan time refreshyng cummeth whiche shall haue presence lorde god shal sende preached vnto euen iesus christe whiche muste receyue heauen vntyll tyme thinges whiche god hath spoken mouthe hys prophetes sence world began bee restored agayne cause none al brother ye shoulde despaire hath thus come passe according god sufferaunce offence herein trespase partely excused man ignoraunce feble weake body lette impedimente knowe diuine power whiche diuine godly power rewlers selfes knewe perfeictly whiche thing knowen readily neuer would haue minde crucify prince glory expedient man saluacion god determined beginning shewed mouth prophetes messias whome woulde sende fynallye redeme shoulde suffer death god lyer whome promised send person hath sent would haue slayn euen woulde haue slayne sacrifice woulde haue offered vp satisfy sinnes worlde sacrifice offered without blame suche ye shall haue forgyuenesse ye repente ye haue dooen amisse shall come passe offence whiche committed weale men shall turne singular wealthe also pardon easy come redy hand ashamed euill doinges sorowful alonely fact al see turne new life openly confesse iesus whome ye haue denied king rewler ouer whome ye haue death condemned person giltie doe ye acknowledge fountain giuer innocency ye haue violently put death beleue ye author immortall lyfe time pardon synne haste meane penaunce shall fynde mercifulnes whan shall come eftesones iudge quicke dead high aboue cloudeswhan tyme refreshing cometh whome father sent simple poore sake ye may able constauntly abide presence whiche shall terrible intollerable whiche hath penitent suche meane space doe beleue iesus name whome prophetes hath many yeres go publyshed also accordyng theyr prophecy beare witnes submit themselfes hym fayth puttyng theyr sinne away penaunce shall finde righteous iudge hath promised menne fayth repentaunce sinne euerlasting health refreshing thinges come hitherto well passe whiche prophetes hath heretofore tolde bee dooen perfourmed bee doubted god wyll perfourme rest also hath promised faythfully iesus christ shal come agayne shall come agayne gospell chereful tidinges god must preached ouer worlde cumming meane liueth glory sitteth reigneth high heauens aboue vntil prescript time wherof prophetes iohel hath spoken malachie whan thinges shall come restitucion agayne made vp poynte perfectly finished whiche god hath spoken mouth holy prophetes many hath since beginning world one persone haue al prophecied moses truely sayed vnto father prophet shal lorde god rayse vp euen brother lyke vnto shal ye heare thinges whatsoeuer shall say vnto time shall come euery soule wil heare ye prophete shalbe destroies emong people prophetes also samuel thence foorth many haue spoken haue likewise tolde dayes moses autoritie auncient vnder proteccyon vnder chiefe guide capitain ye left egipt ye traueled wildernesse ye receiued lawe yet promyse made iesus nazareth whome ye haue flayne speakyng manier father hys booke deuteronomii prophete shall lorde god reyse vp vnto euen emong brother lyke vnto hym shall ye heare shall saye vnto shall come passe soule soeuer shall heare prophete shall destroyed emong people dooe ye acknowelage prophecye moses recognise ye true moses knowledge ye iesus christe borne dauids linage trybe iuda citie bethelem according prophetes sayinges guide capitaine god calleth bondage libertie whiche alway shall endure capitayn hath disclosed new law supernal euangelicall persone offereth remission synnes lyfe euerlastyng moses woulde men shoulde heare hym eche man heareth beleueth person soeuer shal beleue shal saued refuseth beleue shalbe banished feloweship name israelite shall peryshe recouery without faith iesus chryste hope saluacion geue faythe moses muste ye hartely loue iesus whome hath highly commended prophecy neyther hath moses alone thus prophecied iesus prophetes also samuel time vntill iohn baptist hath prophecied describing natiuitie doctrine miracle punyshmentes infamie death crosse hys buryinge resurreccion goyng vp heauen sending forth holy goste vpon beleueth whiche thinges euery one euidentlye come passe spreading ghospell ouer worlde abrode gloryous cumming lorde agayne ende worlde ye child prophetes couenaunt whiche god made vnto oure father saying abraham euen thy sede shall kinreds yerth blessed first whan god reised vp sonne iesus vnto sent blesse euery one turne wickednesse ye dede prophetes child wherof ye auaunte selfes without cause haue ye distruste promyses yf ye child patriarch whiche wer chiefe father auncestry vnderstande ye perceiue pertayneth couenaunt promyse god made abraham saying thorow thy sede shall nacions worlde blessed blessing perfourmed isaac dead life come againe iesus nazareth isaac figure represented offrynge hymselfe vp sacrifice willyngly like christe obeying father offred sacrifyce crosse seede abraham wherby shall onely israelite nacions also worlde beleue gospell delyuered curse whiche due sinne obteyne therwithal blessing haue receyued holy ghoste may bee called child liuing god wherfore promise god made vnto abraham perteyneth vndoubtedly nacions worlde yet withstanding pleasure haue thus honourably preferred promise shoulde firste bee profered woulde according moses prophecie rayse one vp nacion sende meane prophet owne onely sonne iesus shoulde disclose blessyng whiche god promised abraham blessing euery person obeying woorde ghospell maye vtterly forsake vice naughty liuyng frankely confesse iesus bee author mannes saluacion iiii chapter pa spake vnto people priestes ruler temple sa duceis came vpon takyng greuously taught people preached iesus resurreccion fro death laied handes put holde vntyll next daye nowe euentide howbeit many hearde woordes beleued noumbre men fyue thousande whyle peter heauenly oratour iohn felow office wyth hym occupyed suche oracions exhortyng people embrace gospell without coloure flattery towarde manne enducyng knowledge trueth wytnesse prophetes sometymes makyng theym afrayed wyth dreadfulnes great iudgement come eftesones appeasyng pleasauntly intreatyng meanes easy waye come pardon euen ready hande certayntye promyse saluation sodaynly came vpon theim pryestes rewlers temple accompanyed also sadduces caused breake myddes theyr holsome communication pryestes ruler felt themselues poynte agreued men laitie vnlearned beare rule temple teach people none el ought speake doctours lawe phariseis scribe also offended honourably spake iesus gyltie person put deathe whose name abolyshe theyr earnest desyre study thynges set sadduces fyre agaynst apostle stycked openly publyshe iesus rysen death lyfe promise al men thorowe ryse agayne sadduces beleue nother aungell soule lyue separate body wherfore coulde wyse abyde rehersall resurrection doeth nowe wycked busshoppes eftsones make assault ghospel thyng iesus tolde disciple shoulde come passeand preached iesus resurrection fro death lyke mannes malice wrastled stroue agaynst christe set forth glorye renoume euen dyd rebell agaynste preacher ghospell vehemently brast strength therof vertue nowe reason apostle laye fast handes vpon furth awaye hale theym pryson tyme myght furth cummyng nexte morowe euentyde hande cruell mischeuouse priestes ready wyll euen furthwith haue slayne iesus disciple feare parte people stayghed theyr handes imagined meane time coulourable pretence cursed acte myghte appeare bryng theyr pretensed purpose lawfully malyce coulde naught preuyale agaynste christe vntyll tyme come himselfe contented dye lyke maner conspiracie nought able doe againste christes disciple day came father heauen prescribed eche theim christes power hys apostle yet sermon whiche twoo apostle made thoughe interrupted priestes wythout condigne frute many hearde apostle preache therby perswaded beleue nette encreased lytle grayne mustarde sede stretched bredth leuen ghospell scattered abrode vertue sondry partes faythfull tyme amounted noumbre fyue thousande men note ghospell thyng accepted commonly fauoured meane people seldome doeth noble worlde well agree note also successe ghospell chiefe capitaines moste excellent led prison neither stryued agayne guydes trouble made people therat whiche taught noughte el obey christe put theyr trust hym pand chaunced morowe ruler elder scribe anna chiefe prieste cayphas iohn alexander many kinred high priestes gathered together ierusalem whan sette asked power name haue ye done morowe wicked counsell assembled together one consent myndes put iesus death trueth oppresse priestes temple ruler elder auncientes people wyth scribe hierusalem assembled one place together besydes came anna thyther hygh byshop cayphas one confederacie reason aliaunce moreouer iohn alexandre chiefe tyme emong priestes fynally many priestes kinred emong whome higher eche manne tyme authoritie mischieuous well doeth appeare theyr busy paynfull diligence common smalle matter whyche carefully labored stente matter meane bee afrayed fewe person men vnknowen reputacion vnlearned yea disciple condemned personeand whan set asked power name haue ye doen whiche crucified foorthe brought bothe peter iohn giltie person presented simple persone vnlearned would abashed syght greate assemblie autoritie honourable fyrst sat downe stoute stately bishoppes priestes heade men theyr religyon next rewlers temple afterwarde elder among people eche thyng doen solemne authoritie euen consydered apostle themselues cruel vnryghteous iudgementes vsed towarde theyr maister iesus yet stode countenaunce cleare vndismayed lorde vndoubtedly theyr mayster iesus tolde thynges shoulde betyde armed myndes stowtely stande agaynst suche casuall aduersitie agayne marke wel example iudgemente iesus himselfe condemned upon demaunde question christ taken lykewyse enquired concernyng creple healed authoritie whose name doe ye thys thys question myghte haue asked temple brought pryson thys thyng myght haue learned people dyd peter declared cause facte euidently liefer pyke quarell theym trueth afterwarde passed nothyng vpon sought occasion worke displeasure token theyr ordre priesthood within shorte whyle haue ende seyng faultie vicious nought el defende authoritie counselles conspiracie prysons soondrye kyndes death pthan peter full holy gost sayed vnto theym ye rewlers people elder israell yf day bee examined good dede haue doen sicke man meanes made whole knowen vnto al al ye people israell name iesus christ nazareth ye crucified god raysed agayne death euen doeth man stande presente woole stone whiche cast asyde buylders whiche become chiefe corner neyther saluation amonge men vnder heauen geuen none name wherin must saued nowe doeth peter case thryse othe denyed mayster threatninges litle poore wenche seruaut doeth tremble feare one lacketh ryght wyttes dismayed cannot speake none al vndoubtedly framed sorte peter lyued phantasie sticked ake promise himselfe veray largely shortely renneth awaye falsely forswereth himselfe promyses whiche vnaduisedly made cleane forgotten thys place constantly one replenished holy ghost reasoned cause without deliberation fully ende temperyng tale woondrefull wysedome suche sorte neyther free talke man reprochefull neyther softe ientle speache appered feare bee hym flattery endeuour wel decked eloquence perswade iesus authour mannes saluation peter woordes spake ye prince ruler people elder gyue eare vnto trewly muche maruell wherfore commaunded pry seyng knowe none haynouse cryme commytted prynces wont impryson men theyr wycked doynges yf haue cryme heare bryng v neyther mischeuous dede laye charge ye wyll examyne v good turne whiche man hath gotten beyng whole sounde weake shronke together wyll stycke declare cause manner therof belongeth office gently make accoumpte declaration christes fayth desyrouse learne wherfore ye well assured ye chiefe head menne ye also common israell doctryne teache pertayneth al mennes saluacion whether prynces nobilitie el comminaltie man whome ye see stande v lymmes whole sounde wonte vnknowen caryed porter nowe hath obtayned benefite health neyther magikes art man power neyther yet deseruynges inuocation ye lord iesus christ nazareth ye dayes agoe vpon sentence gyuen ponce pilate nayled fast vpon crosse god hath raysed hym death freely geuen rule ouer life euerlastyng therefore strength vertue name worketh effectually thesame thyng healyng men sauyng theym hymself wunte yearth woorke doubt prophete dauid heretofore spake psalme stone man reiecte god shoulde see highly exalted iesus nazareth stone whiche ye buyldyng synagogue refused whiche buyldyng ye threwe hym awaye outcaste god hath made heade corner stone holde streight together diuine strength power whole churche whiche sette vp buylded iewes gentile person sake father heauen profereth men saluacion hope manne saued thorowe iesus knowe well moyses patriarch prophetes holye auncient authoritie thoughte good father heauen sonne alone woorke mennes saluacion whereof would called iesus name haue already vnder heauen tyme come shall haue whereby must saued haue ye cause meruayle creple hable muche obtaine thinuocatio name seyng hath worthely merited deserued health euerlastyng persones calleth vpon whan sawe boldenes peter iohn vnderstoode vnlerned lay men marueyled knewe beene iesu beholdyng also man whiche healed standyng coulde saye agaynste comman ded goe asyde counsell counselled among themselues saying shall n manifest sygne doen openly knowen dwell ierusalem cannot deny noysed farther abrode among people let v threaten charge speake hence forth man name whan peter spoken woordes many counsell beholdyng peter iohn free courage stedfastnes mynde whiche appered countenaunce perceyuyng also comens men vnlearned wundered greatly wherupon beare themselues bolde howe came suche eloquence perfyte vnderstandyng prophetes conclusion came remembraunce theym howe kepte company iesus whome theymselues knew certaynly slayne enuy great perplexitie reason beyng base sorte men vnlearned bolde spirited free ong liberall neither deadly paynes whyche theyr mayster suffred neither honour authoritie famous assembly troubled thyng mynde behelde man hymselfe present well knowen people beyng borne notably lame myght walke cherefully sodaynly myracle wrought secrete place temple doore magikes arte inuocacion iesus name supposed deade facte euident could well deny occasion none finde faulte worthy fauorable reporte many make wretched lame creature whole wythout rewarde none aunswere therfore make ye apostle nought aunswere whiche alreadye done coulde disproue allowe would wherfore vpon commaundement geuen apostle healed person also shoulde departe theyr assembly fell consultacion layed theyr heades together saying shal doe men although rude rascall notable miracle set forth better knowen withall dwell ierusalem shalbe ha le disafirme deny facte shall gaine v nought el therby shame dishonestie yf condemne punyshe shall seme voyde mercye cleane wythout iustice shall styrre vp people agaynst v none counsell v take quiet waye muste folowe prouide euill howe soeuer hath sprong creape abrode neyther bee published among people suche maner sore poyntes infeccio whan sprong cominaltie wonte yf man vexe anger waxe stronger violent rage go abrode yf made lyght semeth therfore good waye v holde handes let v make afrayed sharpe cruell threatnyngeslet v threaten charge c make henceforth mencion iesus name manne lyue whether iewe nacion theyr cousell folyshe myght spoken pleased whole assembly euery man one assent agreed therto perceiued apostle valiaunt courage would alter chaunge myndes thei perceyued lykewyse miracle vnknowen people learne iesus name small efficacie man health present remedy howe could shame commaud hope haue name kepte vnder specially seyng myght thorowe selfesame name attayne vnto eternall saluacion suche verely counsel prynces byshoppes priestes chiefe comminaltie ofte gather theyr assemblyes together policie mannes witte sometyme amonges whiche canne playnely see doeth well agree good reason yet perceyue folowyng thesame losse ensue renowme decaye ryches suche lyke incommoditie pand called com aunded wyse speake ne teache name iesu peter iohn answered sayed vnto whether right sight god herken vnto god iudge ye cannot speake whiche haue sene heard threatned let goe found nothyng howe punyshe people men praysed god whiche doen man aboue fowertie yeare olde miracle healyng shewed whan eche well allowed decree called apostle declared name whole counsell shoulde teache man lyue iesus doctrine ne make wyse mencion hys name eyther stelth vnwares ne yet hearyng multitude neyther openly ne priuely home el abrode folyshe wysdome worlde could kepe graue whan deade nowe goe bury suppresse name whiche wunte alwayes death better knowen peter iohn counsel decree rehearsed solempne authoritie made aunswere thereunto constauntly without woorde spoken man rebuke iudge ye selues knowe lawe whether well god shoulde obedient god commaundemente god hath heretofore sayed mouth prophetes euen thus come passe christe sonne god thus commaunded v lykewyse heauenly spirite promysed v sende downe father infourmeth v secretly putteth myndes mennes saluacion publyshe name lorde iesus christe bearyng wytnesse also haue sene heard yf ye mynde vpright iudgement ye also submit selues wyll god whatsoeuer ye decree v truly may otherwise speake sawe oure iyes heard eares god ought bee aboue men obeyed would haue preached abrode men whan counsell hearde aunswere wysely made franckly wente nought el make sore afrayed wyth threatnynges ala counsell without hope recouery haue argument perswade reason cause shoulde rebuke neyther testimony haue scripture wherwithall teache whole authoritie threatninges wicked conscience alwayes fearful desyre punishe innocentes malicious ready beyng prynces yet afraied theyr symple poore subiectes publike office dreade pryuate persones many numbre feare fewe yea men defensed vnarmed men learnyng men vnlearned thapostles neither retinewe garde defence bandes noble estate assured lordes yearthly power hable geueso threatned let go c make lame name iesus christe aryse walke man good thapostles power myghtie touchyng hurte voyde strength apostle tyme dimissed counsell beyng charged sore threatenynges yet chiefe counsellers cast theyr cakred malice differred mynde get afterward occasion could fynde waye punishe people whome feared hauing regarde themselfe god men highly praised touchyng miracle whiche done healyng lame criple eche manne noted bycause persone whome miracle wrought aboue fowertie yeres age borne thus many yeres set foorth begger open sight worlde infirmitie man coulde accuse finde fault doinges though impediment counterfeite el lyght small deformitie worthy consideracion assone let go came theyr fellowes shewed hie priestes elder sayed whan heard lift voice god one accorde sayed lorde thou art god whiche hast made heauen earth sea al holy ghost mouth thy seruaunt dauid father hast sayed dyd heathe cage people imagine vaine thinges kinges earth stode vp ruler came together lorde anointed peter iohn beyng dispatched counsell retourned company beyng theyr high parlour altogether carefull mynde ende come consultacion whiche hande rehearsed ordre whole matter prince layed theyr charge aunswer made thereunto inward true loue eche one bare replenyshed theyr heartes vpon tydynges tolde excedyng ioye disciple glad chiefe pieres thapostles dimyssedand whan heard lift vp voyces god one accord thapostles parte reioysed bount ousnes lorde whome disciple attained vnto suche ioye god maner sorte tempereth thynges seruauntes sorowe mingleth ioy ende may hable paciently suffer endure aduersitie thother syde may gladsome thynges rendre hertie thankes heauinesse pray vnto lorde whole company heard apostle tale spake aloude one assente vnto lorde whose goodnes ghospell begon haue right good successe sayed lord god omnipotent madest thorowe thy woorde heauen earth sea whasoeuer contayned whose moste blessed wyll power man able withstande whose eternall decree man conspiracie hable empayre nowe see brought passe thy blessed spirite hath spoken mouth thy faythfull seruaunt dauid patryarche saying heathen rage people imagine vayne thynges kynges earth stande vp prynces hath gathered themselues together agaynst lorde agaynste christe recognise trueth prophecie sawe come beyng enspired thy holy spirite see doen dede doyng thesame trueth agaynste thy holy chylde iesus thou hast enoynted bothe herode also poncius pilate gentile people israel gathered themselfes together whatsoeuer thy hande thy counsell determined done nowe lorde behold threatenynges graunt vnto thy seruautes confidence may speake thy woorde thou stretche fourth thy hand healyng signes wonder doen name thy holy child iesus assone made theyr praier place moued assebled together fylled holy ghost spake woorde god boldely citie whiche professeth holines herode ponce pilate yearthly prynces heathe people israell gathered themselues together agaynst maister capitayne holynesse thy holy chylde iesus thou haste enoyncted heauenly oynctment forecastyng theyr wicked counsell bryng thynges passe whiche thou thy power inuincible eternall decree haddest determined bee doen saluacion man whosoeuer conspireth againste thy sonne iesus sent downe conspireth agaynst beholde great assembly chiefe ruler cum eftsones together conspire agaynst holy blessed name thy sonne iesus lyke thou dyddest reyse iesus death beyng slayne aduaunced hym heauens partener thy kingdome dysapoyntyng theyr purpose euen see nowe vnto theyr threatening wyse preuayle strength courage thy seruauntes may moste stedfaste boldnes vttre ghospell whiche mannes woorde thy woorde saye brought downe thee earth thy sonne sake lyke thy miracle makyng whole lame creple allured many professe name iesus feared prynces whiche bent conspiracie agaynst glory euen vouchesafe ayde nowe tyme come wyth thy almyghtye power meanes healyng workyng wondrefull miracle thorow holy name thy sonne iesusand assone made theyr prayer place moued c glorye thy ghospell maye clearer shyne abrode rebell agaynst thy sonne doe rage vayne whan thus made theyr prayer one accorde place together stode trembled thing betokeneth prayer graciousl heard lorde desire ratified nothing effectuall prayer churche one whole consent uerely ought small strength power hable shake earthe whiche selfe mouable voyde token lyuely strength holy ghost forthwith renewed augmentedand fylled holy ghoste spake wordes god boldly somuch would suche threatnynges prynces made concele hyde ghospell preached name theyr maister iesus stedfastely frankely yea theym also numbre suche nature ghospell touching encrease lyke safron thynges many moe come forthe although yll handeled plenteously euen aryseth vp ghospell agaynst assaultes worlde sooner wrastelyng therwith ouercommeth thesame faithfull professed name iesus amounted within fewe dayes woondrefull great numbre multitude beleued one herte one soule neyther sayed ought thinges whiche possessed owne th thynges common great power gaue apostle witnes resurreccion lorde iesu great grace neyther among lacked many possessours landes house sold brought pryce thynges solde layed downe apostle feete distribucion made vnto euery man accordyng nede io whiche also called apostle barnabas saye sonne consolacion leuite coutrey cypre lande solde laied pryce downe apostle feete yet thou mayest vnderstande howe theyr consent myndes came mannes policie among many together one companye ambicion enuy brawlyng stryuyng suche conformitie mynde peaceable quietnes herte nne would haue thought one harte one minde eche man poynte himselfe longer folow owne mynde sortes men diuerse vnneath man maye finde two brother germane agree betwixt themselues company iesus ruler owne blessed spirite thence proceded great consent many person together one vnlike either kinred age worldely substaunce insomuche onely thynges commen amongest whiche eche man wonte departe one withoute losse geuer whiche maner thynges bee learnyng counsell admonicion consolacion exhortacion temporall possession also whiche comunicate without dammage losse possessour therfore scarcely may man fynde content poynte liberall suche thinges amongest common man would somuche chalenge thyng possessed owne wherfore gaue owne goodes looked thankes handes receyued thesame thought geuen hys owne propre good nede hymselfe robber iust person yf withholde thyng brother necessitie requyred apostle chiefe pieres thys newe citie beeyng dispurueyed worldely goodes ryche gyftes holy ghost augmented theyr company euery day bearyng wytnes lord iesus christes resurreccion wt wonderfull great stedfastnesse mynde myghty power workyng miracle resurreccion pryncipally perswaded witnes miracle many one death present fewe pryuy buriall lyued thys newe comminaltie vnder ryght valyaunte capitaynes hauyng aboundaunce thinges lacked goodes supplied borne mutuall loue concorde although many one poore yet none amongest lacked many possessioners eyther landes house made sale brought ye pryce therof laied apostle feete reuerently father regarded myght distribute goodes common theyr owne pleasure fynally lesse vpryghtnes amongest dealed pryce mennes possession whiche brought trueth vpryght dealyng seldome founde among stewardes housholde layer money distribucion made among accordyng euery mannes necessitie without choyse person companyand distribucion made vnto euery man accordyng nede one ioseph whome apostle syrname called barnabas whiche woorde sirians toung betokeneth sonne comforte bloud auncestry leuyte borne cipres ioseph bycause dyd excell among great giftes quality mynde reason wherof called barnabas ioyfull comforte multitude accesse example many folowe lyberali ie whiche semely ghospel wheras lande cypre solde brought pryce therof layed apostle feete though vyle thyng woorthy despised yet apostle suche holynes would take nothyng therof selues aboue v chapter pa certayne man named nanias saphira wyfe solde possession kepte awaye parte pryce wyfe also counsell brought certayne part layed downe apostle feete peter said ananias howe sathan hath fylled thyne herte thou shouldest lye vnto holy ghost kepe awaie part pryce landes pertayned vnto solde thyne owne power hast thou conceiued thing thine herte thou hast lyed vnto vnto god whan ananias heard wordes fell downe geue vp ghost great feare came hearde thynges young men arose vp put aparte carryed buryed hym lyke barnabas playne trueth without colourable deceite moued many folowe lyberalitie exaple put al people feare matter spiritual charge one deceyue holy ghost loueth playnes hearte hateth al deceite dissimulacion like maner iudas among twelue apostle example man shoulde put affiaunce hymselfe eche manne carefull diligence continewe doyng dutie certyne man named ananias cthere companie certayne man called ananias one farre vnlyke vnto owne name throughly consented gracious fauour god ananias wyfe called saphira vnlyke vnto housbande whan ananias ambicious honour desirous perfite holynesse sawe dyuerse person hyghly commended menne free sincere lyberalitie solde lande laied vp parte money wyfe pryuy therunto allowing two partes wherein money deuided one shoulde purchase prayse people estimation also fame holynesse woulde kepe himselfe yf nede happen distructing doubtlesse holy ghoste caring prouiding himselfe whole company brother rekenyng thus himselfe yf dye hunger sufficiently prouided suche forecasting besemyng man put whole affiance christe promysed shoulde wante nothyng seketh kyngdome god rightwysenes therof neyther imaginacion mete hym whiche shoulde bee one wyth one mynde whan brought apostle feete parte moneyananias howe satha hath fylled thyne herte thou shouldest lie vnto ye holy ghost c liuelode solde peter vnderstandyng inspiracion holy ghoste whiche aboundauntly mannes vngodly dissimulacion sayed ananias thou hast dedicate thy selfe holy ghost seen power many token euidently declared hast thou suffered deuill nowe eftesones put thy mynde take stelth awaye parte money whiche thou receyuedst thy lyuelode though thou couldest face downe holy ghost lye nowyse deceyued bryng companie suche presidente moste daungerouse constrayned thee sell thy liuelode thy cause peraduenture might haue dissemble nowe sence thou diddest thyne owne free wyll whiche thou haste done purpose auayled deface thyng hypocryse whiche haue bene example liberalitie mightest thou haue kept thy lande thyne owne hand yf thou wouldest moreouer thou haddest solde couldest thou haue reserued money wholy vnto thy selfe theyr trueth playne dealyng well commended whiche theyr owne free bringeth forth haue enforce man thus doe yf willyng thesame upon occasion hast thou stablyshed thy minde thus disseble matter man thou hast made lye vnto almightie god yf thou thinkest god may deceyued thyne opinion false vngodly yf thou beleue pryuie thynges eyther thou despisest righteousnesse el thou thynkest fauoureth falsehoodwhan ananias hearde woordes fell downe gaue vp ghoste c ananias perceyuing thapostles knewe hys falsehood sodaynly fell downe one stricken herte sharpe rebuke yelded vp ghoste one example suffered death many myght therby preserued facte bruted abrode made many sore afrayed none durste enterpryse suche lyke offence holy ghost young men remoued thence dead corse whan carryed foorth buryed deserued buryed yet ought thence remoued lest dead body infecte pure holy companie peraduenture wyll meruayle peter sharpnes towardes ananias late entily entreated crucified christe receyue pardon offence ascribyng doen ignoraunce proferyng penytent person health soule euerlastyng rebuked person sharpely witholdyng small porcion money contrarye lyberall promyse hope come pardone iesus lorde geuen commaundement men called meane baptisme saluacion pardonyng theyr offence woulde teache example violent death fewe person howe muche offence greuous fall synne baptysme lyght receyued ghospell nowe vnaduisednes ignorauce wilful dissimulacion peter knewe moste pestilent plague plaine simplicitie ghospell could haue spring dissimulacio auarice therfore euen begynnyng churche notable example openly set forth admonishe people ye none escape whosoeuer folowed steppe ananias vengeauce god although offence world forthwith punished losse money rekened vpon mystrust god mocking holy spirite peter hymselfe punished person soules health sharply rebuked bycause neyther brast wepyng expressed woorde repentaunce god toke vengeaunce hym thus goddes wonderfull mercy towardes manne one stricken many might saued example iustice set forth towardes hym dyed mercy besydes largely powred many one toke heede example eschewe synne fortuned aboute space thre houres wife came ignoraunt doen peter sayd vnto tell sold ye lande muche sayed yea muche peter sayed vnto haue ye agreed together tempte spirite lorde behold fete whiche haue buried thy housband doore shall carry thee fel downe strayghtway feete yelded vp ghost young men came found dead caryed buried housbande great feare came congregacion many heard space thre howres beholde wyfe ananias knowing chaunced housband folkes knowe later almoste euill done home theyr owne house came beyng priuy housbandes craftie deceyte wyll ready also parte gette vayne prayse vnto whose vngodly imaginacions peter aunswered saying tell woman solde ye lande muche muche lyke housbande aunswered without shamethan peter sayed vnto haue ye agreed together tempte spirite lorde c yea verayly somuche haue solde peter sayed hast thou thy housbande together agreed tempte wyth lye v spirite lorde ye see workyng v forasmuche liked thee felowe wyth thy housbande wicked dissimulacion thou shalt lyke wyse partener punishment beholde stande doore whiche buried thy housbande selfe person shall carry immediatly woordes spoken fell downe yelded vp ghoste went young menne vpon thesame founde woman deade carryed foorthe buried housbande sharpe example yet profitble manne ofter put vre thapostles yet peter ientileste creature lyuyng inflycte thys punishement inspired holy ghost expressed woordes peter knewe secrete inspiracion holy ghost already doen doen god thynges knowen wyll see punished vnder couloured falsehood doe mocke apostolyke person though suche may deceyued men hath tymes gyfte holy ghost peter tyme nowe marke howe happily euell occasion succeded wondrefull great feare sprang whole churche faythfull meanes deathe whiche twoe person ryght woorthyly suffered yea also beleued stricken feare example pby handes apostle many signes wonder shewed emong people altogether one accorde salomon porche others durst man ioyne himselfe neuerthelesse people magnified number beleued lorde men weomen grewe insomuche brought sicke streates layed beddes couch ye least way shadowe peter came might shadow myght deliuered theyr infirmity came also multitude city round vnto ierusalem bringing sick folkes whiche vexed vncleane spirites healed euery one moreouer many great myracles wrought emong people apostle wherby myght playnly appere men notable effecte came passe dyuine power aboue al strength man many sticked ghospell abode one accorde together porcheand others durst ioyne himselfe called salomon porche desyrouse hyd corner tyme requyred candle beeyng set vpon candlesticke shoulde gyue lyght entred house others yet baptysme booked themselues souldiers fyght vnder baner christes capitayne none durst company perceyued sorte people dedicate god holy therfore certayne reuerent feare withdrewe themselues theyr company lyke temporall sorte men wonte drawe backe frome halowed thynges whiche euer dedicate temple people hated honourable reuerence excellent vertue giftes god whiche clerely shone notwithstandyng example ananias saphira made many one sore afrayed none durst frame themselues counterfeyte fashion vnto coumpanieneuertheles people magnifyed theym yet thys multitude faythfull encreased euery daye numbre men woman insomuche commonly would bryng forthe sicke folkes stretes suche able go foote reason great sickenes set abrode vpon couch beddes agaynst peter cumyng shadowe passed myght leastwyse ouershadowe ueraily promyse perfourmed whiche iesus lorde made speakyng thus hys disciple greater thynges shall doe iesus healed persones touching hemme garment man healed touching hys shadowe fame theyr myracles spred euery daye ferther abrode insomuche great multitude people came city bordering nigh aboute vnto hierusalem bryngyng sundry wise diseased troubled vncleane spirites whiche made whole euerychone suche wondrefull successe thynges mete v obserue howe sobre demure apostle time claymed renoume glory theyr doynges referred prayse gyuen name theyr maister iesus pthen chiefe prieste rose vp whiche secte saduceis full indignation layed handes apostle put common pryson aungell lord nygh opened pryson doores brought forth sayed go stande speake temple people al woordes lyfe whan hearde entred temple early mornyng taught chiefe priest came hym called counsell together elder child israell sene menne pryson fet name iesus christe began maner knowen wonderfully well men swete odour ghospel spreade selfe euery daye farther abrode byshop anna prelate false religion could abyde encrease trewe religion besydes namely saduceis secte toke part forbycause apostle beare witnesse pryncypally maister iesus christes resurrection whiche thing caused phariseis defended resurrection agaynste saduceis quiet towardes apostels afore decreed busynesse shoulde layed slepe dissemblyng therat time maliciouse enuy go te vpper hande theyr decree counsayle furyousnesse shooke feare head priest whose mynde satha troubled enuy beyng assisted saduceis set hande apostels warde laying priuate prison though shoulde bee examyned vpon suspicion common pryson though taken manifest acte myschiefe pryson chos n oute veray strongand laied handes apostle put pryson leste myght meane escape el taken awaye commocion poeple holy woorde ghospell neyther bounden ne kepte prison mannes wytte policie iesus defendour owne elected sen e aungell opened nyght pryson doores brought forth sayed ye nothyng vnquieted mynde wyth maliciouse priestes rather holde holder ye haue begonne go waye temple steppe vp preache people soeuer gaue commaundement preache nation world time whan would suffre publishe christe nowe cumme tyme spake saying nothynge hyd shall bee openly shewed whispered eare preache ye vpon house toppes apostle beyng encouraged angel exhortacio came temple early mornyng according accustomed manier taught people whiche many numbre high bishop beyng ignoraunt doen nyght angell ioyned himselfe confederacie wyth saduceis certayne supporter wilfull mynde came counsell house thither called whole counsell prestes officer temple ruler whole ordre elder among people israell sorer incensed agaynst theyr disobedience determined ordeyne crueller punishemente theym consider meane whyle good reader malicious impudencie priestes iuste matier lay apostle charge yet brought aboute great assembly euer lusted theyr sentence whyche cursed vngodly shoulde appeare decreed consent whole counsell good ryghteous head men sette downe eche one place stately manier sergeauntes sent bryng forth thattached person theyr session whan minister came founde pryson returned tolde saying pryson truely founde shut diligence kepers stading without doores whan opened founde man within whan chiefe preist rewlers temple hie priestes heard doubted wherunto would growe sergeauntes came vnto pryson founde kepers watchyng pryson doore doore set open whan come none apostle coulde fynde prynt token way escaped went minister backe agayne vnto counsell tolde sene founde sayde pryson euery side surely shutte kepers standyng fast doore whan doore open let man founde muche troubled theyr myndes tidynges specially temple rewlers head pryestes menne beyng theyr wittes ende dowted sore ende ensue busines came one shewed beholde men ye put pryson stande temple teache people wente ruler temple minister brought without violence thei feared people lest haue ben staned whan brought set counsell chiefe priestes asked saying streightly comaund ye teache name beholde ye haue fylled ierusalem youre doctryne intende brynge mannes bloud vpon v meane time suche doubt while trembling feare consultacion came one ye troubled myndes heauy tydynges saying beholde men ye emprysoned yesterday nowe stand temple teachyng smalle noumber people templerewlers bycause perteyned peculiarlye theyr office see nothynge shoulde wise doen temple ought toke theyr waye according priestes commaundement vnto temple company seruing men theyr garde agaynste assaultes violence people founde lyke reportedand brought without violence standyng temple preachyng iesus great sorte people albeit laide handes lyke doen sawe present great numbre peoplefor feared people c afrayed themselues lest yf commocion haue rysen among people stoned neyther companye suche sorte would make busines neither thapostles person desyred ayde temporall powre themselues stedfaste sobre theyr doinges without fearsenes behelde thofficers led day pryson yet al neyther feared themselues neyther fled away brake preaching ghospel vntyll offycer temple entreated gently goe vnto counsell apostle obeyed lest shoulde wise seme despise publike authoritie theyr maister taught shoulde whan called refuse goe yt boldly speake nothyng afrayed came two fyshers counsell house presented company hygh great officer small trayne folowing began anna high prieste highe authoritie lesse statelines mynde hys oracion maner streightly commaund last assembly authority ye hygh power ye nomore teache people make mencion priuely appartly straungier iewebeholde ye haue fylled hierusalem youre doctrine name iesus whiche wyll shalbe abolyshed nowe wyll ye see howe contemptuously agaynst authoritie whole counsell ye haue alonely kepte sylence herein vehemently haue ye also preached insomuche ye haue fylled heirusalem wyth doctryne rumoures youre doynges meane whyle publyshed abrode yea city border v well ye goe maliciously bryng v hatred death man openly ye preache slewe thing cannot deny ye publyshe also selfesame persone good holy well god approued name ye worke miracle whiche dishonour condemne v multitude crueltie haue procured suche man death hgyhe byshoppes oracion whyche contayned honest matter defende selfe made afrayed woordes hyghe authoritie trueth dede whiche ought man health publisshed men kepte silence wicked mennes glory ppeter apostle aunswered sayed ought obey god men god father raysed vp iesus whome ye slewe hanged tree hath god lyfte vp ryght hand ruler salueour geue repentauce israell forgeuenes synnes recordes thynges whiche saye also holy ghost god hath geuen obey hym whan hearde claue sundre sought meanes slay nowe let v parte heare fisher archebysshop christes ghospell howe boldly soberly also maketh aunswere apostle high bountifull bushop sayeth ye rewlers great authoritie also elder wurshipfull men sit counsell together despyse youre authoritie preferre authoritie god mannes authoritie promysed aunswere made whan ye forbode v speake woorde iesus name suppose one assembly thinketh mete shoulde mannes prohibicion take lyghte regarde goddes commaundementes whyles feare youre wrathe renne goddes dyspleasure commaundementes stoode wyll god woulde hertes satisfy hym nowe sence youre prohibicions doe vtterly square wyth hys commaundementes cannot satisfye one ke lieffer obey god manne desyre bryng hatred preachyng iesus name procure saluation euery manne expedient rather submitte authoritie god bryng v hither refusyng vtterly saye ought el doe contrary goddes wil god father reised vp iesus whome ye slew haue hanged treethe waye open eche manne come remyssion synnes yf mende lyfe louyngly doe embrace trueth ghospel euen thus shall ye fynde haue shewed heretofore god oure father whome ye doe wurshyppe hath reysed vp death sonne iesus whome ye faste naylyng hym crosse haue ayne veryly decreed diuine counsell heretofore spoken prophetes one shoulde dye saue worlde selfe persone euen lyke feble bodye manne hath put death almyghtie god hath called lyfe agayne hys infinite power hath exalted suche renowne glorye bee guide menne chiefest worker mannes saluacion pryncipally child israell maye redily come thorowe hym remission synne whiche bee contente forsake theyr euell lyuyng professe holy name thynges rehearse beare recorde kepte house wyth hym familiar companie died death reuiued oftentymes heard hym sawe hym handled hym vntill ascended vp v beholdyng hym heauen ye esteme wytnes small importaunce holy ghoste beareth wytnes whome powreth vpon receyue ghospell ye see v ready heare straunge language see woondrefull thynges wrought excedyng common reason nought owne doynges iesus holy spirite putteth forth power vertue abrode minister oracion peter well besemyng apostle make ought eyther dreade punishment feare el hope saluacion euen hande allure theym chafed theyr myndes made incensed insomuch theyr hertes would haue braste anger laying theyr heades together howe myght slea priestes parte long tyme customably vsed murther cutte lyke buchers shepe goates temple wherby gotten themselues nought el slayght kyl men also easely communication worde heard diuyne scripture nothing godly spoken man erudicion reason onely commaund wil pleasure eyther obey thesame el shalte thou suffre death pthen stode vp one councell pharisey named gamaliel doctoure lawe reputacion among al people commaunded apostle goe aside litle space sayed vnto ye men israell take hede selues ye entende touching menne day rose vp one da boasting himselfe whome resorted noumbre men aboute fower hundred slayne al whiche beleued hym wer scattered abrode brought nought man one iudas galile dayes tribute drewe awaye muche people hym also perished al euen many harkened scattered abrode say vnto refraine selues men let alone yf counsell worke men wil cum nought yf god ye cannot destroye lest ye haplye founde stryue god councell sat one gamaliell pharisey whose fete paule apostle learned lawe man high estimacion whole people israel excellente knowleage lawe singuler wysdome gamaliel whan sawe bent vnthriftie councell stood vp desyred apostle might departe councel doen sayed sittyng ye brother israel procede headlyng councell neyther determine thinge vnaduisedly whiche afterwarde may turne remediles vnto shame take good hede ordinaunce ye make iudgemente ye geue persones take counsayle thinges past shalbe expediente determyne tyme cum wyll reherse auncient example old tymefor dayes rose vp one theudas shall reherse done sence al ye may well remembre late dayes one theudas enchauter false deceauer boastyng hymselfe people promysing prodigiouse thinges drue factiouse opinion great number men nigh vnto poinct fower hundred hys busie enterpryse proceaded maliciouse stomake vnthriftye ende hymselfe suffered paynes death many taken parte sum slaine sum taken prysoners whan wer thus scattered abrode secte brought nought hym iudas galile countreyman person ye consulte vpon tyme whole worlde taxed commaundement augustus cesar iudas muche taught thynges pleasaunt people bryng dedycate god ought pay tribute emperours whiche woorshyppers false goddes drew faccion greate parte comens afterwarde ye capitaine faccion slaine many toke parte scattered abrode wherfore myne aduise wisely shall ye yf ye forbeare persones let theim goe seyng man hytherto hurte yf haue enterprysed goe bryng passe procede man witte shall selfe cum nought yf god worker woonderfull matter vngodly poynte mynde destruccion thing god principall doer el resiste god besydes lacke foresight goe aboute ye cannot bring passe shalbe able withstand wil god hym agreed called apostle bet commaunded thei speake name iesus let go thei departed counsell reioysing counted worthie suff e rebuke name dayly temple euery house ceased teache preache iesus christ councell estemed whole assemblye sentence death would haue pronounced differred vntill tyme tyme agreed gamalyels councell would vtterly holde handes thapostles wer al twelue called together beaten charged agayne vpon strayte commaundemente speake daye forwardes muche one woorde name iesus contented vpon punishement dimitte thinkyng though made lyght thundryng woordes threatninges yet would thei better aduised said beyng punyshed warning esteminge thapostles whiche wer loke vpon abiect person base cominaltie like condicion rude barbarouse people amended stroke liuely spirite preacher woorde god wont suche iniurious afficcionsand departed ye cou sell reioysyng couted worthy suffer rebuke name gather strength together thapostles wer well assured woordes ye iesus spake wer trewe called iudges shoulde scourged synagoges congregacions euil dede professing holsum name departed councell lufty courage ioyous takyng reprocheful beatinges whiche wer thought intollerable prayse glory muche god would recognyse apostle worthy honour might owne sonnes sake spitefully entreated remembraunce iesus saied reioyce ye glad great reward heauen litle punishment menacing auayled prince holde abacke fro preachyng iesus name thapostles toke therof courage preache continuallye thei heard maister iesus openly temple euery mannes house priuily bryng eche man gladsum tydynges messias whome shoulde saued vi chapiter day whan numbre disciple grewe arose grudge among ye grekes hebrues widowes wer dispised daily ministracion twelue called multitude disciple together saied meete leue worde god serue table wherfore brother loke ye among seuen men honest reporte full holy gost wisdome may commit busines wil geue selues continually prayer minystracion woord saying pleased whole multitude chose sieue man ful fayth holy ghost philip prochorus nichanor timon permenas nicholas conuerte antioch seuen thei set apostle whan praied layed handes time whan disciple named afterwarde called christian encreased daylye moe numbre grekes amongest whiche none iewes althoughe borne iewrye profession yet iewes borne amonge gentyles begane murmure grudge againste hebrewes cause theyr grudgeyng sprange affeccion loue towardes cuntrey folkes whereas apostle carried certayne woman whiche seruice grekes agreued widowes suche estimacion myghte serue thapostles disciple dayly handreachinge suche ministery seruice estemed thinge muche preferment first ambicion christes churche yet though discorde amongest litle smallit meete shoulde leaue woorde god serue table forebecause thou shouldest vnderstande sore good shepherde ought displeased therwith twelue apostle continente whan called together great company disciple thintent authoritie determined al consetes said maner see grudgeing soeuer matter meaneth spronge amongest v touching seruice haue woman hande ordre therfore must taken appoynted higher office wise often interrupted light matter charge lorde hath inioyned v especial comaundement teache gospel therfore thing well allowed lay asyde office preaching gospel charged al serue table like bodie sundry membres euery membre doth office duetie euen suche great multitude trouble cofusion cannot auoided except diuers office distributed amongest diuers person suche sorte together referred profite whole bodyewherefore brother loke ye among seuen honest reporte c neyther seeth iye selfe alone membres neyther handes laboure onely selues ye whole bodye wherfore brother loke youre noumbre seuen men honest reporte replenished giftes holy ghoste endowed synguler wisdome maye committe hauyng good wyll withall necessarie busines wherin haue hitherto occupyed without hindraunce oure exercyse gospell whan set quietnesse diligence shall apply selues thynges long v oure owne partes prayer preaching gospell shall take charge fedyng bodyes wyll apply oure studyes feede soules whole cumpany wer wel pleased oracionand chose steue man ful faith holy ghost c seuen chosen consent congregacion steuen man good credite one largely receiued ye holy gost philip prochorus nichanor timon patmenas nicholas antioch proselite profession seuen whan chosen wer set thapostles thentent done thei allowe authoritie thapostles whan made prayer god accustomed layed handes vpon according approued custome holy minister assigned beginnyng vpon example whiche taken oure maister iesus wonte laye hande vpon blessed demaunde ye quetion nede suche tites appoyntyng minister take charge table let vnderstand handling monye dede temporall exercise moste comune among men yet suche would require sum speciall credit yt shalbe charged therwithall vpright conscience witnesse herof iudas whome vncleane herte beyng corrupted wyth auarice styred hym betray maister furthermore seuen person prescribed also thoughte suche busines necessarie done mete put authoritie rather obey felowes apostle furtherers moreouer disciple feastes wer among ye vulgare people ofte toke meate toke deuoutly euerye broken morsell breade represented bodye lorde euerye draught wyne put remembraunce oure lordes bloude fynally lordes bodye selfe bloude ministred people deacon tyme leysure besydes theyr temporall ministerie preached also themselues gospell person wer next apostle pand worde god encreased noumbre disciple multiplyed ierusalem greatly great company priestes wer obedyent faith suche maner meanes came passe doctrine christes gospell sparsed euery daye abrode disciple multiplyed ierusalem right good successe affayres greate parte onely comens receaued gospell manye priestes also whiche conspired againste christe apostle whan repented themselues theyr euil liuyng layed doune theyr pryde submitted vnto swete yoke gospel steuen ful faith power great woders miracle emong people arose certain synagoges whiche called synagoge lybertines sirenites alexandria cilicia asia disputing sieuen coulde siste wysdome spirit whiche spake steuens holines among deacon glistened pryncipally handeled hymselfe office appoynted moste fauoure whole multitude faythfull excel ente sobernes behauioure towardes rebellyous ghospell expressed valiaunte courage neuer ouercum insomuche wrought many greate miracle amonge people name iesus yea one endeuoured hymselfe expresse vertuous steppe thapostles forasmuche exceliente vertue procureth selfe enuie lyke dothe sterne wynde draw hym white cloudes certayne rose vp againste steuen diuers felowshyppes whiche one called libertine another cyrenites sum alexandria sorte suche came cilicia asia countreyes whiche ioynyng vnto siria aboue al iewes dispersed sortes though one conspiracie arose together steuen dysputyng yet coulde although manye numbre stand reasoning one yong man wisdome liuely force courage ye holy ghost ful spake sent men whiche sayed haue heard speake blasphemous woordes moises god moued people elder scribe came vpon caught brought councel brought forth false witnesse whiche sayed man ceaseth speake blasphemous woordes againste holy place law heard saie iesus nazareth shal destroy place shal chaunge ordinaunces whiche moyses gaue v sate coucel loked stedfastly saw face ben ye face angell marke maner fashion wicked whan caste al trueth vnable make theyr partie good disputacion thei fell practise foregeyng lye beyng put wurse wisdome holye ghoste gaue themselues wholy practyse diuilyshe deceytes brought certaine men false witnes saied thei heard steuen spo ke blasphemous wordes moyses god none offence among iewes deserued deathe blasphemy detested people consider good reader lyke inuencions againste seruaunte wer practised againste maister brought false accuser bycause would seen theyr owne person reuenge inwarde grief mindes whiche thei conceiued blancke wer put vnto beyng menne themselues insufficient cope steuen disputacion hainouse crime ought false ymaginacion cloked theyr cankred malice pretensed loue religion wer people elder also scribe meanes false tale teller whiche preuelye sent sore moued steuen insomuche wt one assent together toke hym violently awayeand moued people elder scribe haled hym councell came furth wer ye hyred recordes playe partes saye man haue neuer done breaking blasphemouse woordes againste place bothe holy v honorable agaynste moyses lawe delyuered v god hearde hym saye iesus nazareth woulde destroye place chaunge ordinaunces moyses gaue v steuens reporte vpon relacion ye apostlesfor hearde hym saye iesus nazareth shal destroye place howe iesus prophecied temple citie lykewyse theyr enemyes ouerthrowen euen foundacion people infidelitie rehersall steuen craftely wrested false launderouse accusacion man myght well affirme bee thesame persones ye accused iesus reportyng thus woordes hearde hym saiynge wyll destroye temple sette vp thre dayes steuen sharpe cruel accusacion nothing moued mynde cleare conscience insomuch botome herte appeared countenaunce innocent minde knoweth euel self neuer feare stedfastnes cou tenaunce put accuser soone rebuke theyr shameles falshood sate counsayle beholdynge hym markyng well howe boldelye toke offence layed charge hym lytle discouraged matter dismayde face seemed vtter countenaunce sum thynge aboue mannes excellencie certayne chearfulnes withall maiestie besemyng aungell haue vii chapter pthan sayed chief priest euen saied ye brother father herken god glory appeared vnto father abraham wha mesopotamia dwelt harran saied vnto get thy countrey thy kin ed cum lande shal shewe came lande chalde dwelt charran fro thence wha father dead brought lande ye nowe dwel gaue none inheritauce ye bredeth foote promysed would geue hym possesse feede hym yet childe demauded high prieste accused person thintent might frame sentece iudgement towardes forme lawe condemning christe questio whether ought answer thiges whether would acknowledge ye offence brought againste steuen beyng inspyred holye ghoste beganne wise make answere playnte profoundly rehersall made euen beginning honorable audience presente eyther brother trade cuntrey religion either el reason auncientnes authoritie father geue eare defece innocencie ye haue done mine accuser paciently haue neyther vsed speake contumeliously god neither moyses temple endeuoure hath disagreynge
