moyses aduaunce goddes glory spirituall temple buyldyng like god commaunded wherin god spirite best pleased blasphemy man set furth thing vttermost power whiche moyses shadowed figure whiche prophetes inspired wt goddes holy spirite hath spoken whiche sonne god ye sent downe earth purpose hath begonne put owne credite withall finyshe holy ghoste perfourmeth people saluacio beleue gospel striue obstinately god beyng well knowen bounteous towarde al men naught el hate god none thing blaspheme god whiche obstinate maner nacion hath late day begonne haue begonne longe agoe neuer ceasse continewe nowe ought take maruel thinke selues otherwise indifferently dealed withal yf cum passe iesus nazareth prophecied cum saie temple muche bragge boast citie ye raigne priesthood law ye abuse dishonest aduauntage vayne glorie taken awaye renowne glorie translate cotent wurship god syncerely trewe faythe gospel kepe lawe spiritually frame themselues lyuely temple holy holy ghost although god prouoked elder many sondry way poynte yet rebellyous obstinate people alwayes despysed hym begyn among al chiefe auncient father patriarche nacion whose obedience would god folowed bost themselues child god father whome glorie due whome worship deuoutlyget countrey thy appeared longe tyme paste vnto abraham principal father whyle mesopotamia dwelt charran sayd vnto hym get thy countrey thy kinred cum vnto lande wyl shewe obeyng goddes commaundementes went caldeies land began dwellyng charran purposing take iorney farther sum place dwell whan saw tyme god eftsones brought thence ouer lande ye dwell nowe father thares death whose age differred chaunge dwelling place ouer brought gest wise straunger geuing none inheritauce hereand promised would ge hym possesse somuch possessed ye breadth foote e epte purchased god promysed set posterytie possession land death whan abraham day sonne though semed thyng vnbeleuable promised yet abraham beleued god performed promesse herein foude trew lyke thinges hath heretofore spoken alwaies founde trewe woorde pgod verily spake wise seede geourne straunge land kepe bondage entreate euill iiiic yeares ye people shall serue iudge said god shal cum forth serue place gaue hym couenaunte circumcision begate isaac circumcised eighte daye isaac begate iacob iacob begat twelue patriarch patriarch hauyng indignacion solde ioseph egypte god hym deliuered hym aduersities gaue hym fauoure wisdom sight pharao kyng egypt made gouernour ouer egypt ouer householde thus sayd vnto thy seede shalbe straunge lande people whome thy posteritie shall lyue withall lyke straungers shal make bond men cruelly handle space fower hundred yeares thyrty last shall delyuer sayth lorde bondage people shal serue wyl iudge auenged shall serue place mannes subieccion god myght sum meaneand gaue ye couenaunt circucision bynde people sticke vnto hym gaue vnto abraham circumcision seale hys promise abraham trusting goddes promyse begat isaac hauing remembraunce couenaunte made god circumcised childe eight day birth isaac parte circumcised iacob iacob twelue sonnes patriarch chief father auncestry amongeste twelue sum litle remembred goddes promyse beyng moued enuye deuysed suche lyke thyng agaynst brother ioseph posteritie hath deuysed agaynst iesus nazareth cast hym cestern furthwith solde marchaunt men brought egypte lyke almyghtie god raysed vp iesus beyng slayne extolled hym high cast doune deliuered ioseph tyme oute trouble broughte meanes good condicions foreiudgement thinges cum fauour wt pharao king egypt insomuch pharao put authoritie ouer egypt ouer house came dearth ouer al lande egypt canaan great affliccion father found sustenaunce yt iacob heard corne egipt sent father first ye seconde tyme ioseph knowe brethre iosephes kinred made knowe vnto pharao sent ioseph message caused father brought al kynne lxxv soules iacob descended egypt died bothe father carried ouer sichem sayed sepulchre abraham bought money sonnes emor sonne sichem came dearth ouer lande egipte chanaan great trouble withal father could finde sustinaunce iacob whan knowledge plenty corne egypte sent father thyther fetche corne thence seconde tyme sent thyther ioseph knowen brother rumor herof came also pharaos eare hebrewe borne father eleuen brother liue ioseph sent iacob father whole kinred egypte shoulde lacke noumbre thre score fyftene came iacob doune egipt dwell dyed bothe twelue sonnes father wer laied sepulchre whiche abraham bought hundreth siluer cicles child hemor sonne sichem none hytherto ought possession lande promysed abraham posteritie whan tyme promise drewe nye god sworne abraham people multiplyed grewe egypt tyll kyng arose knewe ioseph dealt subtily kynred euil entreated father made caste younge child remayne aliue time moses borne acceptable vnto god nouryshed vp father house three monethes wha cast pharaos daughter toke nourished vp hir owne sonne moyses learned maner wysdome egipcians myghtie dedes woordes time drawing nyghe whan god would haue performed whiche promysed abraham hebrewes encreased multyplyed egypte vntyl pharao dyed kinge succeded hym ioseph muche fauoure pharao king fearyng lest hebrewes shoulde muche increase kepte vnder kynred craftely dealte euil father commaundyng mydwiues proclamacion cast men child none shoulde remayne lyue tyme moyses borne agaynst whome men falslye reported shoulde haue spoken blasphemous wordes moises fauour god suffered perish prouidence priuely nourished thre monethes space father house yet feare ye kynges commaundement cast twiggen basket hamper playstred ouer lyme ryuer nilus chaused pharaos daughter toke vp beyng muche delited propernes childe nouryshed hym vp home owne sonne moyses taken egypcian instructed childhood al maner cunning wisdome thegypcians myghty woordes dedes whan full fourty yere olde came herte visite hys brother child israel whan sawe one suffre wrong defended auenged quarell harme done hym smote egyptian supposed brother woulde haue vnderstande god hand deliuer vnderstoode whan fully cum fourty yeres age thought good visite brother childre israel expressed alwayes tendre loue towardes owne nacion beginnyng whan seene conuersaunt amongest one israelite suffre wrog egyptian auenged hebrewes quarell slewe egyptian declarynge euen towardenes good capitayne supposed hebrewes knowen allready time howe god determined saue people hym deliuer bondage pharao moyses presented hymselfe figure iesus nazareth whome god verily hath chosen redeme people bondage synne lyke israelite perceiued iesus euen dyd vnderstande moyses next day shewed hymselfe vnto stroue woulde haue set one againe saiyng syrs ye brother hurte ye one another dyd neighboure wrong thrust hym awaye saiyng wilt ye kyl thou diddest ye egipcian yesterday made ruler iudge ouer v fled moyses saiyng straunger lande madian begate two sonnes daye waye agayne visite brother found two israelite stryuing togyther partyng sundre would haue set one agayne saying ye syrs sithen ye brother one nacion hurte ye one dyd neyghboure wrong thrust backe woulde haue sette one saying medleste matterwho made ruler iudge ouer v made iudge ruler ouer v wylt thou slaie al thou slewest egypcian yesterday al moyses inspiracion holy ghoste yet founde shortly amongest owne brother sum rebelled agaynst hym whan moyses heard perceyuynge face vnknowen abrode fearyng owne parte ye egiptians fled land madian begat two sonnes pand whan fowerty yeares expired appeared hym wilde ne mount sinai aungel ye lord flame fyre bushe whan moyses saw woondred sight drewe neare behold voyce lord came vnto god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob moyses trembled durst beholde sayd lord thy shooes thy feete place thou standest holy ground haue perfectly seen affliccions people egipt hearde gronyng cum doun deliuer cum wyll sende egypt fourty yeares aungell lorde appeared vnto moyses wyldernes vpon mount synay bushe seemed fyre moyses beyng one dismayde sight assayed go nere therunto see thynge lorde whose voyce sounded bushe forbade sayd god father god abraham god isaac god iacob moyses whan heard name trembled therat feare durst loke neare sayed lorde put thy shooes thy feete place yu standest holy ground moyses obeyed lorde forth wente talke haue wel marked people egipte hath troubled haue hearde groning therfore compassion towardes cum downe delyuer cumme cause wyll sende egypte beholde see howe playnely iesus nazareth signified moyses people israell reiected moyses knewe saiyng made ruler iudge ouer v lyke woordes spake oure brother vnto iesus authoritie dooest thou thynges gaue authoritie al knewe god ye pitie people sent capitaine purchaser libertie gyuer lyfe euerlasting moyses forsoke saiyng made ruler iudge thesame dyd god send ruler deliuerer handes angell whiche appeared hym bushe brought shewyng wonder sygnes egipt read sea wildernes fourty yeares yt moyses sayed childre israell prophete shall lorde god rayse vp vnto brother lyke vnto hym shall ye heare moyses brother despysed god aduaunced honoure made capitaine gouernour deliuerer people ayde assistence thangell presente whiche appered oute burnynge bushe whose helpe broughte hys people oute egipte workynge manye woonders meruailes lande egipt soone rede sea besydes wildernes space fourty yeares moyses one nacion people alone truly iesus nazareth vnto al folowe guyding nowe lest thinke moyses aduersaries whiche publishe set openly furth iesus nazareth moyses himselfe hath commended iesus nazareth promysyng many lyues agoe cum ye see nowe cum sayde prophete shal god raise vp one brother lyke hym ye shal geue eare vnto congregacio wildernes aungell spake hym mount sina father man receiued woorde life geue vnto v father would obey cast hertes turned backe againe egipt saiyng vnto aaron make v goddes go v moyses brought v lande egipt wo made cal e dayes offered sacryfice vnto ye image reioysed ouer woorkes theyr owne handes saye thesame moyses lyke talked alone thangell nygh vnto bushe comoned afterwarde wyldrenes vpon mount syna presence great numbre people semblably talked auncestoursthis man receiued worde life geue vnto v c whome disclosed hearde lorde receyued hym lawe ende shoulde make v redelyuerye whiche lawe shoulde gyue kepers therof lyfe euerlastynge moyses greate authorytye yet woulde father obey repelled hym menne cleane forgotten myserable wretched bondage deliuered desyred againe egypt thintent might whan caste capitaine authoure weale redemer despysed lawe lyfe repayre vnto naughtye maners suche wurshipped false goddes therfore whyle moyses co municacion thangell sayde vnto aaron make v sum goddes whiche maye goo v moyses brought v egypt knowe hath become hymand made calfe dayes offered sacrifice forthwith accordyng example egyptian whiche wurship god apis ymage oxe made thei themselues calfe wrought pure golde offered vp sacrifice vnto god without lyfe dispised liuing god whose tendre goodnes escaped bondage reioysing wicked deede though wel done daunsed kepte feastes bankettes refusyng trewe god made al thinges bragginge dumme goddes made themselues owne handes god turned hymselfe gaue vp worship hoste skye writen booke prophetes ye house israel gaue ye sacrifice meate offeringes space fowerty yeares wildernes ye toke vnto tabernacle moloch sterre god kempham figure whiche ye made woorship wil translate beyonde babilon god beyng displeased thinges turned hymselfe lyke maner awaye suffered take owne pleasure somuche thei worshypped laste one god onely accordynge vnto heathen example whole copanye celestiall bodyes sunne moone sterres mar mercury uenus saturne vngodly poetes take goddesand ye toke vnto ye tabernacle moloch bodyes fourmed god serue vse profit man saye denyed verye thing god indignacion speaking mouthe amos prophete haue ye house israel offered vnto sacrifice xl yeares wildernes least waye ye haue embraced steade goddes trewe temple moloch tabernacle whiche ydoll amonge amonytes rempham celestiall figure god whiche lucyfer uenus sarasins worship dumme ymages haue ye made yourselues worship despised lyuynge trew god alone hath made thinges forasmuche ye delyted brynge ouer babilon ye maye serue eftsones idolater suppose suffycyently declared haue nought sayde spoken blasphemously derogacion god whome sincerely worship neyther againste moyses whose prophecie hertely embrace rather haue blasphemed hath folowynge wicked steppe elder despised longe tyme passed god selfe speaking prophete moyses yet present tyme despise god moyses speakyng iesus person nazareth touching law haue wise foud blasphemouse lawe hath appoynted v receyue prophetes euerychone hath promysed haue louingly receyued rather accompted blasphemouse agaynst law folowe stil steppe wicked father set nought moyses lawe nowe refuse lawe gospell lawe iesus published men whiche lawe doth abrogate moyses lawe perfourme father tabernacle witnes wildernes appoynted speaking vnto moises make according fashion seen whiche tabernacle also father came brought iosue ye possession gentile god draue face father vnto ye time dauid whiche founde fauoure god woulde faine haue founde tabernacle god iacob salomon buylt hym house nowe temple whiche reported blaspheme harken haue saye fewe woordes well assured temple buylded goddes commaundemente intent myght figure temple holye gyue place better euen lyke tabernacle witnesse wherein arke testimonie witnes whiche father caried aboute wt wildernes gaue place teple god speakynge mouthe prophete moyses appoynted fasshion tabernacle accordynge whiche examplar buylded tabernacle olde father made muche iosue beyng thei capitayne brought lande heathe people god draue awaye face father vntill kyng dauids dayes beyng dede holy man fauoure god desyred hym myght make tabernacle seemely god iacob salomon muche dayes lyued peasibly yt first builded magnificall temple wherof ye auaute boaste saiyng temple lorde temple lorde temple lorde temple nought el figure trewe spirituall temple congregacion faythfull whiche buildynge kyng iesus nazareth salomon figured howbeit hyghest dwelleth temple made handes saieth prophete heauen seate earth foote stoole house wil ye build sayeth lord ye place rest hath hand made al thinges sence god thing togyther spirituall dwelleth house made mannes hande neyther enclosed within walles suche greatnes cannot mesured contayneth thynges euen hymselfe beareth witnes speaking esay prophete heauen seate earth foote stole house wyl ye buylde sayeth lorde place repose hath hande made tha god made thinges rest himselfe made al take rest resteth house made man seynge heauen seate earthe foote stoole delite reste quiet hertes alwayes readye commaundement holy gost wherefore whose conscience polluted vicioule lyuyng defileth goddes temple putteth busynes whiche alreadye commaundement holy spirite polluteth temple lorde lyke offendeth moyses preferreth iesus neyther breaketh moyses lawe placeth behinde gospell euen doethe violate temple preferreth therto spirituall temple wherein god delyted reason shadowes geue veritie place putteth herselfe forth lyght meete thyng whiche selfe carnal geue place spirituall vndowbtedlye immutable god cause sent downe owne nne alone vpon earth sente also holy ghoste thintent lyght trueth ghospell myght cum abrode manner people ye stiffenecked vncircumcised hertes eares ye haue alwies resisted holy ghost father ye whiche prophetes haue father persecuted haue slayn whiche shewed cumming iust whome ye haue nowe betrayed murthered ye also haue receyued lawe ministracion aungelles haue kept ye persisting obstinately defence whiche selfe carnall rebelle ye wonte againste goddes holy spirite called long ago stubburne people yet thynke ye selues israelite childre abraham ye haue piece skynne couereth pryute membre circumcised wheras youre heartes well eares left vncircumcised shalbe hencefurth trewe child abraham hearte clensed wicked desyres kepe theyr eares obedient goddes commaundementes pourged grosnes touchinge carnall vnderstandyng maye perceyue spirituall meanyng lawe lyke youre father reason theyr grosse vnderstanding dull hearynge resisted alwayes holy ghoste euen ye also vnlike condicions youre auncestours neuer leaue euyll speakyng doyng againste holy ghoste late appeared iesus nazareth whome ye crucifyed nowe hys apostle howe often hath youre father rebelled againste moyses may call father whome ye folowe condicions whiche prophetes hath youre father persecuted prophecied iust cum whome alone shoulde iustified haue ye onely punished murthered also ye hated tolde cumming whan cum perfourmed tolde youwhich prophetes haue father persecuted ye onely refused embrace hym vpon false impechement ye put pilate handes brought meane hys sentence vnto shamefull mischeuouse death yf ye youre selues perfourmaunce acte owne handes ye vpon pretexte defende lawe whereas neyther elder obserued lawe whiche delyuered aungels neither late dayes put death whome lawe hath promysed appoynted besydes persecute hym whome ye haue slain enuying youre selues gyfte eternal saluacion whiche prefored procuring owne vtter destruccion whiche ye without cause laye charge iesus nazareth pwhan hearde thinges theyr heartes claue sunde gnasshed teeth beyng ul holy ghoste looked vp stedfastlye iyes heauen saw glorye god iesus standynge right hande god sayed beholde e heauens open sonne man standyng right hand god gaue shoute loude voice stopped eares ran vpon hym stoned witness layed downe theyr clothes young man feete whose name saule thei stoned steuen calling saying lord iesu receiue spirite kneled downe cried lorde laye sinne charge whan thus spoken fell slep oracion tale truly tolde frankely spoken sore chafed al mindes wer councell togyther insomuch theyr heartes euen readye breake soundre gnasshed theyr teeth agaynste hym steuen one vndoubtedly replenished holy ghost nothing minde troubled redines suffre death cast vp iyes accordynge iesus christes example heauenward whence helpe succoure christen man loked desyred forthwith valiant champion strengthed againste conflict whiche cummyng heauen opened glorie sawe god iesus whome professed standyng ryght hande father vision kepte close secrete multitude althoughe wer wickedly bente wer expedient mannes malice suppresse goddes glory beholde saieth see heauens open ye sonne man sta ding right hand goddes maiestie wer profitable thinge cosider maner forme iudgement faultes wer laied made answer al beyng young man alleaged himselfe testimony law prophetes wer vanquished accion piththy reason nothing spoken god godlye nothing moses honorably lawe nothyng accordyng meaning therof temple nothynge contumelyously yet harte anger breakyng sundre thei grinded teethe togither lyke woode men frantyke loth see owne glorie dimynished glorye published praysed whose glorye alone god woulde haue openly declared men witness laied downe clothes younge man feete whose name sauleif hadde praysed moyses abraham woulde haue forborne hym iesus alyue stande ryght hande god lyke dauid prophecied coulde abide al stryken turned fury madnes thei stopped eares againste holsome doctrine communicacion ran al vpon steuen violently outragious cry though ben tha conuict condemned blasphemie cast hym oute citie expressyng one poynte alone moyses lawe stoned hym witness though gotten vpperhande hym whose dewtye moyses lawe cast first stone thintente myght redier cruel murther layed downe garmetes young man feete called saule ignoraunce loue towarde hys countrey law fauoured ye wicked parte soone vpo began stone steuen neither contended againelorde laye sinne charge neither spake woordes reproche made whome seen inuocacion sayde lorde iesu take soule therby mayst thou know iesus disciple lyke maner sayed vpon crosse father commend spirite thy handes whyle stone flygh euery syde kneling vpon grounde cried aloude highe voyce inwarde great affeccion mynde sayed lorde laye vnto charge know playnly doth seruaunt expresse mayster laste woorde deathe whiche departed lyfe sounde slepe lorde whome whosoeuer dyeth doth dye dede falleth slepe shall agayne hath taken pleasaunt test awake lyfe euerlasting besemeth many trewe christian dye suche mynde steuen ryghte well agreyng name deserued first crowne martyrdome offered vp lorde first fruytes sacrifice seamely gospell viii chapter saule consented vnto death tyme great persecucio congregacion whiche ierusalem wer scattered abrode throwout region iewry samaria deuout person dressed steuen made greate lamentacion ouer hym saul made hauocke congregacion entred euery house drewe men woman thrust theim prison therfore scattered abrode went euerye preachyng woorde god emong multitude whiche perswaded iesus sonne god meane suche ignoraunce offence lesse thoughe excused murther forasmuche beyng blinded owne inordinate desyres leauer auenge learne trueth yet none lesse holden excused byshoppes scribe phariseis sum agayne whiche ignoraunce malice beleued pleasant sacrifice god dispatche worlde whiche went aboute subuert lawe god left man albeit charitie gospell excuseth yea thinges whiche cannot man excused amongest plaine ignoraunce amysse maliciouse mynde saule accompted one borne isle tarsus young man fauoryng moyses lawe excedyngly whiche afterwarde became rauenynge woulfe meke lambe cruel persecutor christes gospell egre defender lybertye therof stone verely cast none tyme steuenand time great persecucion cogregacion whiche ierusale assentyng condemned stoned hym purpose kepte garmentes myghte accounted one amongest rest stoned yet malyciouse iewes quieted mindes murther one person wonderful great persecution begune sone ryse ye church christ whiche hierusalem somuche scatered sondry coastes iudea samaria sauyng twelue apostle whiche constante mynde stedfast neyther coulde maliciouse iewes ought agaynst coulde agaynst vpon iesus lordes sufferaunce lorde permytted tyme persecucion flye citie citie theyr fliyng proceded muche anye feare disciple came wil ordinaunce god teachinges seedes cast many place abrode plentifull haruest myght soner cum forth christes religion twelue apostle moo like faithfull shepherdes shranke awaye great storme abode styll hierusale sum well dysposed persones perceiued steuen vnworthely oppressed subornate witnesse caused dead body buried suche godly loue affeccio ioseph moued nycodemus prouide dyligently lorde iesus funeralles steuens death celebrate iewishe facion maner weapynge wailynge good men christen people taketh death suche dye christes glory great ioye comforteas saul made hauocke congregacyon c victorie goddes enemyes yf teares shedde sake dead eyther suche manquellers purchaseth selues helle either el christes flocke beyng destitute necessary shepherd day saul whiche declared stoning steue sum tryal zeale began great displeasure yt conceyued christias lyke hungry woulfe teareth peces scattereth abrode flocke shepe eue wast goddes congregacion pursuynge fledde searching oute lay hid walkynge euery house wher thought christes professio furiously russhed haling men lykewyse woman prison cruell trueth say priestes scribe none al put wome trouble busines yong man good zeale noughty iudgemet therfore kepte lord cruelle rageyng minde within limites polluted wt murther while persecucion doinge hierusale suche disparsed though feare draue far one place another yet ceassed blase abrode iesus nazareth theyr walking al aboute iudea sowed thei went seade ye gospell selfe purpose ye lorde suffered scattered pthan came philip citie samaria preached christe vnto people gaue hede vnto thinges philip spake one accorde hearing seyng miracle whiche vncleane spirites criyng loude voice came many wer possessed many taken palsyes many halted wer healed great ioye citie emong whome also philip one seuen deacon ordre nexte vnto steuen philip far driuen hierusale went citie samaria self citie called sebast thither likewyse cum certaine fame iesus name nazareth whome philip preached dyuers thinges spoken crucyfied rysen thyrde day lyfe agayne furthermore whan couersaut space four dayes disciple ascended heauen howe thence sente downe disciple holy ghost woulde thenceforth beleue name haue prouided euen hande saluacio vulgar people among samarites al moste alwaies profit hearyng gospell gaue good hede one accorde philippes wordes tale promysed men saluacion wel worthy fauoured miracle afew number wrought philip affirmed woordes trew deuilles many whiche wer possessed vncleane spirites euen hys inuocacion iesus name went forthe loude crye declaryng went forth willyngly wer enforced vertue healthful name yea meruaile many wer taken palsye diuers lame recouered health cause whole citye eache degre state wonderfully glad farther went hierusalem nearer accesse vnto heathen encrease came gospell sowen beholde howe much profited iewes cruelty philip deaco became apostle fewe hierosolomytes whiche refused theyr teachinges whole city gladly receyued doctrine gospell churche feleth greatter damage handes whiche beynge themselues corrupted taketh part churche doeth openly persecuteth example declared v shoulde take better hede therby suche wolfe wrapped shepe skynnes certaine man called symon whiche tyme thesame citie vsed witchecrafte bewitched people samaria saying man yt coulde great thinges regarded f om least ye greatest saying man power god whiche called great set muche long yme bewitched sorcery sone gaue credece philippes preaching kingdome god name iesu christ baptised wome simon himselfe beleued also wha baptised cotinued philip wondred beholdyng miracle signes wer shewed man amonge samarites called symon deceyuer people practiser delusion inchauntemetes philip came thither practised citie magikes arte counterfeyt miracle monstreouse thinges nature made samarites fonde hym folyshe besydes owne selues supersticiouse much enclined deuilysh enchauntemetes meanes falsehode deceyte auaunted selfe simple plaine people whiche lyghtly perswaded supersticion bostynge excellent prophete vnto al samarites fro highest lowest gaue good hede nothing done iesus name therfore people astonyed suche monstruouse sightesbut sone gaue credit philippes c whiche eyther fayned crafte iuglyng eyther el broughte passe helpe deuylles sayd felowe goddes owne right hande whiche called mighty many day bene long made sorcery dote vpon therfore whan gotte hymselfe name great estimacion many one beleued taught perceiued philip able worke miracle dede spedely coulde dooe also surely thinuocacion iesus name samarites quite fallen fro philippes beliefe brought gladsom mess ge ye kingdo god iesus christes name bragging himselfe simon dyd settyng forth christes glory wt miracle right famously promysyng eternall saluacion baptisme receyued woulde professe name sawe many one well men woman receiue baptisme last symon also himselfe receiued christes faith whan baptisedthey baptised bothe men woman c begon philippes parte ambicio desyre worldly prayse vaine glory loue bare iesus perfytlye sene artes magicall sawe nothyng done philip thorough suche maner falsehede deceyte wherefore whan behelde sum miracle set furth whiche small weight valoure al welnyghe enchaunters worke make dragon flyghe strawe crepe deuils caste man worde men taken palsey deliuered therof word maruayled much therat man greatly astonied feate subtilitie power might suche thinges brought passe pwhan apostle whiche ierusalem heard saye samary receiued worde god sent vnto peter iohn wha wer cum praied thei might receiue holy gost yet cum none e baptised onely name christ iesu tha ayed hades receyued holy goost whan thapostles whiche ierusalem hearde tidinges samarites sorte carnall people thesame clene voy idolatrie louingly receyued philippes preaching worde god wer right glad sent peter iohn chiefe thapostles ratifye set well finished whiche philip begon two sent ratifye begon whan learned cu ming thyther howe philip christened many one gaue thankes god philip made peticion apostle theyr behalfe whiche christened might receiue holy ghost suche clensed baptisme sinnes might receyue gifte god also largely lyke doen whiche altogether highe parlour first receyued ye holy ghost yet holy ghost cum vpon sauyng wer onely christened iesus lordes name authoritie baptise deacon geuen laye hande vpon baptised wherby geuen holye ghost reserued vnto thapostles alone successours thapostles sone desyred layde theyr handes vpon forthwith visible token receyued holy ghost endowed spirites liuely strength like vnto fyre enriched tounges heauenly eloquence whan symon sawe thorough laying apostle handes holy ghost geuen offered money saying geue also power yt whome soeuer put handes may receiue holy ghost peter sayde vnto thy money perishe hast thought yt gift god may obteined money thou haste neither parte felowship busines thy herte right sight god repent therfore thy wickednes pray god yt thought thine herte may forgeue perceiue yt ye art ful bitter galle wrapped iniquitie whan symon um wicked enchaunter better christen man enchaunter perceyued thapostles laying handes vpon wer baptised gaue heauenly gyfte bicause would wante nothing might aunce himselfe owne commodity profered money saying geue power also authoritie whomsoeuer lay handes vpon maye receyue ye holy ghost deuilish inchaunter thought money might sortes men bring euery thing passe beyng learne looketh gaynes must sum expense mynde bye sell gaynes eftsones springe litle myschefe churche ananias saphira punished dissimulacion example repelled forthwith sharply whiche yf ben receyued shoulde haue vtterly subuerted synceritie christes religion peter therefore declaryng bysshoppes ought symons disciple folowers made aunswere maner better thy money thou goest aboute corrupte deuyll thou together whiche art becum thine owne sekyng ye wretched vnthryfte lyuing muche thou thinkest gyft god like bountiful goodnes geueth v freelythe herte right sight god woulde shoulde freely departe maye bought money thou canste partener benefyte haue thing v oure office preaching geuing holy ghost whiche playne sincere minde godward haue taken hand though thy bodye dipped water yet art thou vncleane herein god yf thou continue styl thy noughtye deceitfull mynderepet therfore thy wickednes c nothyng shall thy baptisme auayle wherfore sorye thy noughty purpose aske god forgeuenes thou maye wyse cum forgeuenes outragious crime whiche thoughe already acte perfourmed yet haddest thou purposed mynde leauing vndone longe yll example daungerous brought therby amonge faythful christes congregacio god putteth suche commission dispece giftes gentle spirite whiche pure sincere herte see plainly thou art cleane conscience infected poisonful couetice ambicion tyed meanes therof bondes sin releasement wherof pray thou must vnto god weaping teares great vengeaunce wrath whiche thou hast haynous acte prouoked may light vpon pthan aunswered symon sayde praye ye lorde none thinges whiche ye haue spoken fall whan thei testified preached worde god returned toward ierusalem preached ghospel many city samaritanes symon beyng afrayed goddes punishment euyll doyng penitentpraye ye lorde yt none thi ge c saide peter dooe ye rather pray lord none suche mischiefe ye haue rehearsed betyde thou seest theophilus twoo simon compared together thone declared ought flye fro thother v folow peter iohn well approued authoritie made vp perfyte philippes preaching samaria taught many thynges whiche themselues learned mayster iesus came backe againe vnto ierusalem way preached ghospell many vilages small townes samarites alwayes hade maister commaunded dooe pthe angell lorde spake vnto philip saying aryse go toward south vnto waye goeth doune ierusalem vnto citie gaza whiche desert arose went beholde man ethiopia chamberlaine great authoritie landace quene ye ethiopian rule asoure came ierusalem worship repayre home syttyng chariot read esai prophete philip muche desirous ghospell might cum forwarde mette praye good men seldome withoute occasion good angell lorde priuely warned hym sayde aryse take thy iorney sowthward kepe high waye leadeth ierusalem vnto gaza meane olde gaza man nowe dwelleth nigh vnto sea philip ready thangelles commaundement set forthe hys way man might perceyue chearefull courage mete byshop haue ofte nede shall require allure gospell like setter furth enterludes appointeth time player come goe euen doeth angell moderate settyng two person meting ye tyme god would haue certaine gelded man chamberlayne toke iourney person halfe maymed lacked stone reason wherof perfecte man body right wyse man stomacke ethiopian borne blacke skynnedand behold man ethiopia one shoulde sone clothed garment labes flece immaculate white snowe chaunge naturall complexion fonte baptisme head officer candace quene ethiope made high treasurer speake sorte people delicatly brought vp reason theyr excesse superfluitie well worthy subiection woman rich norisher superfluitie man deuout mynde taken iourney towardes ierusalem temple great renowme diuers nacions yea oute far countreyes came brought sundry gyftes consideracion whereof priestes muche dysdaine hatred sayd temple distroyed chamberlayne meaned well godly fowle deceyued seke iewes temple religion whence euen ready depart vnto heathen repayre homewarde sitting chariot mispent tyme fable elles slepe loue religion readyng esaye prophete declaring v ought seke christe temple hydden bokes holy scripture pthen spirite sayde vnto philip go neare ioyne thy selfe yonder charet philip came hym heard hym read prophe esaye sayde vnderstandest thou thou readest sayde excepte guyde desired philip would come vp sytte enour scripture read led shepe slayne like lambe dumme shearer opened mouth humblenes estemed shal declare generacion lyfe taken ye yearth chaberlaine aunswered said praye speaketh ye prophet himselfe man whan philip waye mette angell warned hym againe priuely sayde go approche thou neare vnto charet whan philip made good spede thyther heard chamberlaine readyng esay prophete streyght therupon perceyuyng good zele endeauour vnto religion sayde vnderstandest thou thou readest answered howe vnderstand man geuen wholy vnto temporall busines excepte one expounde secret sence meaning prophete desired philip ye would step chariote sit hym might commodiously talke togyther went philip sat chamberlayne marke well doth philip resemble trewe preacher gospell howe plainly chamberlayne suche heathen people described couet knowe christe must nedes wonderfull great encrease godlynes one hasteth muche desyre teache hartely biddeth hym compaynie desirous learne nothing done chauce god set al rule ordre chaberlaine happened parte vnawares vpon place prophete whiche described iesus christ place esay led shepe slayne lambe helde peace person clyppe hym opened lyppes humblenes estemed shall declare generation lyfe taken away earth texte esaye whan philip repeated hym chamberlayne enflamed ardet affeccion knowe whome prophete spake sayd praye speaketh prophete wordes himselfe sum see apte chamberlaine learne heard esaye himselfe cut piece commaundement kyng manasses wodden sawe ignoraunt prophecy laye sumtymes suche sorte doubtefull seamed spoken person historical sence oftentymes myght priuey misticall sence pertayne another easye teache person whiche suche wyse demaundeth pphilip opened mouth began scripture preached vnto iesus went waye came vnto certain water chaberlaine said see water doth let baptised philip said vnto yf ye beleue thyne e thou mayest aunswered sayd beleue iesus christe sonne god commaunded charet stand styll thei went downe bothe water philip also chamberlaine baptised sone come ou water ye spirit ye lorde caught away philip chamberlayne saw wente way reioisyng philip found azorus walked thorow oute coutrey preaching al city tyll came lesa ea philip one ready ryght good wil teache opened lyppes begynnyng place prophete expounded hym briefly principall poyntes gospell saye person prophete spake sonne god throughe whome god decreed prophetes promysed frely saue woulde put theyr truste woulde cause haue hym borne againe man virgin mary one natiuitie eke worde expressed whether eternall generacio father whiche euer withoute circumscripcion tyme virgin holy ghostes handyworke without mane help takyng vpo hym mannes nature departed neuer godhed prophete esay seing spirite muche astoyned therat sayde shall able declare lengthe generacion furthermore trewe paschall lambe whose deathes sake father appoynted delyuer onely israelytes al nacions also bondage synne death euerlastyng therfore delyuered hym handes priestes scribe phariseis head men amog people brought afterward vnto pilate beyng iudge liutenaunt prouince thentent mighte crucified muche wyll dye oure sake aunswer made releasement bene shepe suffred pacietly al mockes al punishementes hid puissaunce diuine power submitted himselfe man sake lowest degree humilitie iewes supposyng verely none thing seemed condemned hym putte hym death vndoubtedly prophete speaketh humblenes iudgement exalted innocent death condemned whiche shall cum agayne hyghe surmountyng shall iudge quicke dead god father hath called sonne backe lyfe againe thirde daye tyme resurreccion space fowertie dayes conuersaunt yearth bothe seen often felte disciple corporally finally syght lyfte vp heauen tenth daye ascencion sent downe heauen holy ghoste suche wyse enspired apostle hertes toungues also myghte without feare publyshe vnto people world iesus nazareth chiefe authour foun ayne lyfe health euerlastyng helpe moses lawe faythe baptisme poyntes rehearsed none moses law hath figure sygnifiedand went waye prophetes haue spoken yea iesus hymselfe hath taught promised chamberlayne while philip declaryng hym poyntes gospel many mo ware chaunce litle spring water fast waye sayde vnto philip prolong great weyghtye matter see water hande thou hast nowe enformed ready shall let maye forthwith christened aunswered philip let yf thou stedfastly beleue kepe wt thy herte thinges whiche haue taught promyse alone made baptisme aunswered chamberlaine right gladly beleue iesus christ prophetes hath promysed beleue sonne god whose sake al men haue profered health euerlastyng philip caused chariot furthwith stand styll noble carriage richely garnished semely hym head officer barbarous quene downe alowe muste come shall founde mete baptysme strip himselfe naked garmentes bothe wente water philip christened chamberlayne poore man riche simple abiect puyssaut mightie man himselfe right perfect lymmes vnperfect lacked parte bres iewe ethiopian litle regarde mannes personage disagreaunce faith iesus christe consent mynde together one accordeand assone w cum oute water baptisme neyther cha berlayne ethiopian newe creature philip soone come water aungel lord toke away saw chamberlaine neyther desyred haue teaching inspired holy ghost baptisme one righte glad hert learned christes fayth made ende iourney might home likewyse publishe name christe among countrey men ethiop fynally aungell set philip downe nexte citie called azotus whence came takyng thence iourney euery place village towne lye waye preached gospell vntyll came vnto cesarea citie palestine dwellynge ix chapter pand saule yet breathyng threatninges slaughter disciple lord went vnto hie prieste desyred letter cary damasco ye synagoges found waye whether thei wer menne woman might bring bound hierusale whe iourneyed fortuned come nygh damasco sodely shyned rounde light heauen fel earth hearde voyce saying hym saul saul persecutest thou sayde arte thou lord lorde sayed iesus thou persecutest harde kycke prycke tremblyng astoyned said lorde wylt thou haue lord said vnto arise go citie shalbe tolde thou must doe whyle thynges saule procedynges againste christian expressed muche crueltie onely within walles hierusalem el perceiued disciple whiche scattered abrode spred also worde gospell purposyng himselfe onely threaten enpryson kyll murther sundry wyse went vnto hygh byshop thentent maintenaunce authoritee myght sooner consume desyred haue letter commission onely city nygh already exercised crueltie vnto damasco citie phenicea far hierusalem dyrected vnto synagoges ye iewes dwellyng ende might thorowe ayde commaundement high byshop bryng fast bounde hierusalem whomesoeuer taken faultie heresye yther menne woman suche lyke thinges saule moued doe plaine dessemblyng mynde supposyng himselfe accordyng vnto lordes saying deuoure seruice herein pleasaunt god therfore god suffered handes polluted innocentes bloude called hym abacke myddes rage whan almoste iourneyes ende far citie damasco sodaine light heauen shone sodainlye fallen feare vpon ground hearde voice saying vnto hym saule saule doest thou persecute tha saule one stricken wt great maruayle hygh aboue myghty complayned wrog done frede doubt whether aungell el god himselfe aunswered fearfully art thou lorde sayed thesame iesus nazareth whome thou supposeste deade whereas dooe liue reigne heauen thou persecucio disciple name doest persecute also vnawares thereof thy labour vaine shall harde paynfull beate thy heeles againste prycke thy striuyng manne againste god whose wil manne hable resiste wherfore thine offece herein double nothing shalt thou preuaile therby yet doe thy selfe shrewde turne saule hearing trembled feare one amased saide lorde wylte thou haue doe answere erroure appeared haue cumme plaine ignoraunce malice instructe suche erpsons sufficient expedient high fierce stomake plucked downe suche one mynded nought el threaten kylle made afrayed thentent myght easlye taught sayed lorde aryse go citie shalt thou learne lorde stryketh man suche sorte maye health casteth downe maye set vp maketh blynde maye lighten saule beyng cruellrage throwen downe headlyng became meke ready obeye byd stande vp pthe iourneyed stoode amased hearyng voyce seyng saul arose yearth opened iyes sawe man led hym ye ha brought damasco three day without sight neither eate drinke certaine disciple damasco named ananias said ye lord visio ananias sayd beholde lorde lord saide vnto aryse go strete whiche called streyght seke ye house iudas one called saule tarsus beholde praieth hath sene vision man named ananias cumming puttyng handes hym might receiue syght whyle thinges thus doyng men went saule iourney stode amased hearing certainly one talke saule seing man saule vpon good comforte toke hereof arose vp first step vertue set vp foote beholde againe myracle although iyes open could see came company lead hande citie damasco yet forthwith admitted gyfte holy ghoste shoulde noted v came example howe mete laye hande forthwith vpon eache person firste see newlye instructed diligently tryed prepared fastyng praier wherefore lyke apostle abode hierusalem ten dayes space expectacion holy ghoste taryed saule damasco three dayes seing none yearthlye thyng corporal iyes thinwarde iyes soule ye meane space clearly illustrate al whyle receyuyng foode mynde fed meane time heauenly doctrineand certayne discyple tyme damasco disciple called whiche receiued gospel named ananias lorde piked oute ananias whose handes pleasure bounteously replenishe paule wt giftes holy spirit therfor hym spake vnto beyng sleape dreame sayd ananias part anon perceiuing god called made answer lo lorde sayth disclosyng true christian herte ready commaundementes sayde lorde ryse vp go thy waye streat whiche commonly call streyght aske iudas house one saule borne tarsus lo prayer suyng haue grace liberall comforte v tyme saul lykewise prayer thoughte ye one ananias entred ye house hym layde handes upon thintent myght receyue againe iyesight euen lorde prepared mutuall vision eache one pthan ananias answered lorde haue heard many man howe muche euil hath done thy sainctes ierusale hath authoritie high priestes bynde cal thy name lorde sayde vnto go thy waye chosen vessell vnto beare name gentile kinges childre israel wyl shewe howe great thinges muste suffre name sake ananias sore afrayed name saule cruelty muche spoken among christian made aunswere haue heard lord many one howe sore man hath vexed thy blessed saintes hierusalem yet contented nowe hither come also beeyng put authoritie streyght commission hygh byshoppes laye al fast fetter call vpon thy name herunto lorde agayne made aunswere knowe right well howe ye shepe muche afrayed rauenous wolfe cause thou shouldest feare wolfe haue chaunged right gentle shepe wherefore see thou go vnto hym boldly hym haue chosen myne owne selfe notable instrument carye name heathen kynges yearth chyldren israel hath done hytherto done malyce zele lawe countrey forasmuche plaine ignoraunce iudgemet failed sum tryall hath shewed towardnesse earnest defendour gospell lyke haue tyme cum hitherto hath scryuen professours name beyng armed therunto bulles high byshoppes threatnynges fetter hereafter manfully shall fight stoutly beyng armed spirite gyrte sworde euangelicall worde againste hate name glory renoume wherof far greater affliccion shall willyngly suffre nowe late prepared againste pand ananias went waye entred house put handes sayde brother saule lorde appeared vnto waye thou cammest hath sent thou myghtest receyue thy sighte fylled holy ghost immediatly fell iyes ben scale receiued sight arose baptised receyued meat comforted ananias well encouraged wordes departed thence entred iudas house founde saule praying layde hande vpon hym sayde brother saule lorde iesus christe appered vnto waye thou waste cumming hither hath sent thintent thou shouldeste receiue thi sight againe replenished holy gost ananias vneth spoken wordes fell iyes paule place certaine scale fishe recouered sight immediatly stode vp baptised whan receiued sum foode well strengthned maner excellent capitayne christes gospell shoulde soone obscure glory renowne apostle receyued hand ananias poore hu ble disciple holy ghost receiued baptisme nothing done ordre done iesus christes comaundement paule hadde hys teacher gyuen apostle authoritie woulde neuerthelesse reserue vnto hymselfe higheste authoritie whole matter saule certayne dayes disciple wer dama streight waye preached christ synagoges howe sonne god al hearde w amased sayed spoyled called name hierusalem came hyther entent might bring bounde vnto highe priestes saul encreased strength cotouded iewes whiche dwelling damasco affirmyng christe saule beyng sodainly chaunged abode certaine dayes companye disciple whiche damasco without delaye begonne furthwith e en contrary byshoppes commaundement sette vpon office appoynted vnto christe went iewes synagoges published openly frankly affirming iesus nazareth sonne god whose sake alone men shoulde haue profered accordyng prophetes foresayinges health euerlasting iewes knew saules cruel fiercenesse agaynst christian rumoure bruted abrode reioysyng gotten suche valiaunt defendour moses lawe whan hearde earnestlye preache iesus name nazareth maruayled chaunced vnto manne sodainlye quyte altered sayde amongest themselues saule late euer could assaulte theim called vpo name hierusale whiche name blaseth nowe abrode famously publisheth nowe late came hyther purposely take suche person yf myght fynde bryng faste bounde highe bysshoppes punished theyr wyll commaundement howe cummeth passe hathe sodaynly caste iewyshe condicions forsaken moyses hathe become professoure crucified paule whome name veray dede better agreed became troublesome person teacher sobernesse quiet libertee litle afrayed suche manier sayinges iewyshe beyng euery daye better strengthened spirituall coumforte confounded muche troubled iewes dwellynge damasco affirmyng constauntly prouing testimony holy scripture iesus nazareth whome ignoraunce persecuted dyd nowe preache trewe messias promysed worlde none borne hereafter whose handes iewes ought looke euerlastyng health pand good whyle iewes tooke councel together kyll laying wayte knowen saule watched ga e daye nyght kil hym disciple toke night put thorowe walle let downe basket whe saule cumme ierusalem assayed couple himselfe disciple afrayed beleued disciple barnabas tooke brought hym apostle declared seene lorde waye spoken vnto done boldely damasco name iesu conuersacion ierusalem speakyng boldely name lorde iesu whan paule taken suche enterpryse vpon many dayes damasco litle disciple ioy comforte without greate rumble murmour beleue iewes lengthe layed heades councell togither thintent might lying wayte slaye hym nacion murthereth men paule reasoned taught vanquished iewes testimonyes owne lawe owne weapon nothyng el conspiracy stockes prison stripe sondry kyndes deathe lorde promisse assured welbeloued seruauntes shoulde lose heare one heades excepte father suffered tyme come excellente warryoure dye gospelles cause many battels behynde fyght christes people many daungerouse perylles come sustayne fyght battell many city countreys wer lefte subdue goddes holy worde call vnto christes yoke wherfore paulethey watched gate day nyght kyll hym goddes wil warnyng ye iewes laye wayte insomuche kept gate day night watche away escape would kil bring acte passe procured ayde lieftenaunt citie debytie king aretas thintent yf theyr priuey watche wel proceded theyr purpose would neuertheles openly force slay disciple conceyuing myndes lesse person cared himselfe worthy saued woulde suffer valiant warryer christes worde peryshe wherfore hydde night let hym downe corde towne walles basket euen oftentymes yea bolde valiaunt capitaines runne awaye thintent maye accordyng prouerbe able fyght againe woondre see ye course thinges turned vpside nowe lurketh corner starteth away litle many sore thretnynges persecuted prouide saue paules lyfe whome inuented crafty meanes slay wha come hierusalem would haue accopanyed disciple whome olde saule well knowen paule tha vnknowen al afraied shepe woulfe trustyng woordes disciple callynge well remembraunce crueltie wonte expresse persecutyng christes flocke suspected priuie wyles cloked vnder name disciple barnabas leuyte whome spake knewe done concernynge paule brought thapostles whome declared whole matter lorde appeared vnto goyng damasco spake sodenly mynde chaunged frackly frely preached gospel iesus name lord thapostles reioysed thereat theyr honeste rehersall commended whole companye time busylye occupyed hierusalem kepyng companye thapostles disciple boldely professyng preachyng name lorde whiche plaine ignoraunce persecuted pand spake disputed againste grekes went slay whiche whan brother knewe brought cesarea sent forth tarsus congregacions reste throughout al iewry galile samaria edified walked feare lorde multiplied coumforte holy ghoste onely people hierusalem nothyng afrayed reprochefull name apostata swarued byshoppes trade religion preached lykewyse iesus name gentyles whiche great renowne citie dwelled hierusalem iewes whiche borne among grecian reasonynge verye testimony lawe prouyng iesus sauiour worlde wyse coulde abyde suche libertie speache therefore resorted suche wonte ayde againste whome able disputacions vanquyshe searchinge waye slaye paule suche bee disputacions iewyshe condicions euen priuie wyles also inuented betrappe withal whan leaste thought vpon suche daungier brother knewe lest thinge shoulde betyde hym otherwyse well conueyed hym waye vnto cesarea philippi whiche cytie phenicea sente hym eftsones thence vnto tarsus cilicia borne meanes paules wanderyng leadyng place place gospell well prospered meane tyme persecution well ouerblowen congregacion disciple whiche disparsed thoroughout partes iurye galile samarye whiche cuntreys principally taught lorde place commauded gospell shoulde preached lyued reasonable quietnes takynge comforte eache one thorowe mutuall vnitie concorde smalle regard mannes threatninges dayly increase besydes theyr nuber well edifyed christes faythe lyuyng feare lorde replenished tyme aduersitie spirituall consolacion holy ghost vndoubtedly lorde promysed worlde ye shalbee well assured trouble aduersitie shal ye haue quietnes mynde ghostelye comforte pand chaunced peter walked thorow al quarter came also saintes dwelt lydda found certaine man named eneas kept bed eyght yeares sicke palsey peter said vnto eneas lorde iesu christe make whole arise make thy bed arose immedyatly al dwelt lydda assaron sawe turned lorde befell peter whyles vigilant shepehearde stoute courage wente abrode trauelyng many countreyes nowe visyte nowe came also vnto holy sainctes dwelte lydda lydda citie sea syde palestine foude one called eneas layne bedred eyght yeares taken palsey peter tha remembryng lordes commaundement house soeuer came heale sicke syttyng bodely disease raigne spirituall phisycions present sayde hym eneas iesus christ make whole aryse make thy bed immediatlye vpon wordes spoken rose vp whole made bed himselfe token perfyte health whan sawe hym sodenly made whole vertue power iesus name layne bedred many yeares many dwelt lidda sarona towne sea coaste nyghe vnto lidda couerted lorde professed name iesus christe one whiche restored corporall health many one moued health soule pthere ioppa certaine woman named tabitha whiche interpretacio called dorcas ful good workes almes dedes chauced day sicke died whe washed layd chamber forasmuche lydda nygh vnto ioppa disciple heard peter sent vnto desyryng would greiued come vnto agayne ioppa disciple called tabitha whiche grekes signifyeth dorcas ye latynes caprea whiche name gyue cleare sight iye woman bene vertuously occupied maner godlynesse chiefly workes mercy wherwith releaued poore befell thesame time peter busye office lidda dyed thesame disease bene sicke whan done washyng dead corp accordynge theyr accustomed maner layde highe chamber annointed muche ioppa far lidda disciple vnderstandyng peter thei sente two men message desiring would vouchsafe come vnto ppeter arose came come brought chamber wyddowes stoode rounde weaping shewyng coates garmetes dorcas made peter put al forth kneled downe prayed turned body said tabitha arise opened iyes whan sawe peter sate vp gaue lifted vp whan called ye saintes widdowes shewed aliue knowe thorow al ioppa many beleued lorde fortuned taryed many dayes ioppa one symon tauner peter declaryng himselfe example good shepehearde came vndelayedly cumming within house brought hym vp chamber intent shoulde moued sight dead corp take sum pitie compassion death stode peter wydowes among ministeries whiche prayse worthye chiefely commended seruing holye necessity mourned wepyng teares whiche let fall pitie towarde poore whome wunt refreshe many good turnes ake departed weapyng sufficient openyng hym theyr myndes desyred haue called rehearsall good dedes brought forth syght coates garmentes whiche dorcas already made clothe holye withall indeuour doyng good death interrupted peter hauing remembraunce iesus example raysed vp chiefe priestes doughter synagoge multitude mourned first put oute doores commaunded go furth widowes onely mourned weping let prayer moreouer woman whiche owne nature weake spirited shoulde troubled rysyng vp deade bodye would haue none present alone prayed knelyng knee holy ghost miracle wroughte time like force vertue prayer quickened like fayth alsoand turned hym body said tabitha aryse without whiche miracle al wrought whan peter made prayer conceyued spirituall strength holye ghoste turned hym bodywarde sayde tabitha rise vp shee wordes spoken awaked though shee ben slepe loked vpon peter behelde well sate agayne peter putting forth hande ayde withall set vp beyng tha liue lastly maner must lifte vp vnto godlines whiche owne selues weake first muste god prayed vnto would take mercy vpon done muste taughte rebuked theyr lyfe mispent exhorted amende finally muste haue ayde dorcas lyfte vp good example perfeccion lyfe whan peter called holy brother widowes whome bidden go forthe chambre againe whiche likewise selues occupyed praier lokyng mercifulnes lorde shewed woman lyue beholde miracle soone bruyted abrode ouer citie ioppa caused manye one beleue christe chefe commoditie cummeth miracle shoulde otherwyse muche auayle call one two amongest manye thousandes come tymes worlde departe thesame vnto lyfe againe whiche muste neuertheles soon dye occasion peter tarye manye dayes ioppa shoulde fissheth mennes soules abide contentacion manye cummeth vnto nette meane whyle abode peter chiefe apostle reason greate myracles whiche hadde wrought famous mighty one simon house tanner occupacion x chapter pthere certaine man esatea called cornelius capitaine souldiers italy deuoute man one feared god al houshold whiche gaue muche almes people praied god alway sawe vision cu detely ninth houre daie augel god cumming vnto hym saying vnto cornelius loked hym afrayde sayde lorde sayd vnto thy praiers thy almes cum vp remembraunce god send men ioppa call one simon whose sirname peter lodgeth one simo tanner whose house sea side shal tell thou oughtest ye aungel spake vnto departed called two housholde seruauntes deuout souldier awayted tolde matter sent ioppa hytherto none ye apostle bene conuersaunt among heathen occasion chamberlaine whiche came ethiop induced christes religion yet sum gentile better dwelt nere vnto ye apostle cesarea ye floryshing citie palestine whiche fore called stratos castle certaine manne named cornelius captaine ouer band wer italie though trade auncestry heathen reason office man armes yet one desyred christen man good lyuer feared god like whole houshold commenly seene residue housholde frame themselues condicions like vnto maister house two poyintes chiefly declared hymselfe meete take vpon hym christes religion liberally refreshing neady poore continuall prayer lorde knowledged true god learneda deuou e one feared god reason conuersaunt among iewes knew fauour chiefly obtayned beyng beneficiall poore co tinuall prayer remayned alwaye certaine whiche already abundauntly ynoughe shoulde haue geuen hym man beyng prayer muche supper tyme nynth houre daye euidetly see vision angel god cummyng towardes hym callyng hym name cornelius though ben familiarly acquaynted hym cornelius beholding angel beyng sore afrayed reaso maiestie rare personage sayde lorde art thou angell aunswered thy prayer spente vayne neyther yet thy almes dedes wherwith hitherto thou hast earnestly called vpon god mercifull thou hast bestowed refreshe ye poore ye lord vouchesafeth coute bestowed vpon himselfe wil reward thee behalfe able require wherfore thou hast emploied thy benefite wil forget thou haste done thy parte accordyng wyll agayne thother parte wyll accomplishe thy requeste whiche thou haste continually prayer desyred lorde hath heard thy praiers thyne eares stopped poore nowe therfore must thou doo without delaye hence forwarde lorde maye shewe vnto bountifull goodnes sende sum thy seruauntes citie ioppa enquire certaine man named simon desyre hym cum speake thee man iyes world great estimacio sight god highe fauour reason godlynes otherwise called peter hosteth certaine mannes house ioppa whose name simon tanner occupacio dewelleth sea syde peter shalt thou learne thou must obtaine saluacion whan aungell sayde vanished awaye cornelius sent couple housholde seruauntes one souldier retaynyng hym whose honeste conuersacion trustynes hadde great profe onely cornelius owne housholde resembled godly liuinge sum souldiers also folowed vertuous trade capitaine whan shewed matter effecte touching vision sent ioppa thinges done euening pon morowe wet iourney drewe nye vnto cytie peter went vp vpo ye top house praie ye sixt hour whe wexed hugry would haue eaten made readye fell aunce sawe heauen opened certaine vesselle came downe vnto bene great shete knyt fower comet let downe earth wherein al maker fower footed beastes earthe vermin wormes fowles ayer nexte daye cornelius messenger went iournaye dayes meane embacie peter chiefe pastoure christes churche disdayne whan almoste ioppa peter thesame time accustomed gon vp hyghe chamber praye almoste syxte houre say noone hungred prayer mynded eate summe meate long abstinence whyles meate dressyng accordyng peter commaundement rauyshed spirite god chaunceth specially vse prayer fasting god discloseth mysteryes fulle belyes slouthfull person vision sawe heauen open thence great vesse l let downe yearth ben great sheete knotted fastened coardes euery ye fower corner olde tyme meate serued table great brode lynen clothes vessell kyndes fower foted beastes virmin crepe ground lyue earthe byrdes lyue ayre well vncleane cleane together indifferently meate iewes dyd abhorte yet thesame iesus longed whan sayd disciple profering meat haue meat eate yt ye knowe pand came voyce aryse peter kill eate peter sayed lorde haue neuer eaten thing commen vncleane voyce spake vnto hym againe seconde tyme god hath clensed call thou commen done thryse vessell receyued vp againe heauen whyle peter also mused himselfe vision seene meaned beholde sent cornelius made inquitaunce symons house stoode ye doore called one asked whether symon syrnamed peter lodged peter muche maruayling vision ment voyce spake sayed vnto aryse peter kyll eate althoughe lorde warned dysciples shoulde make gentile also partaker ghospell yet thintent boldely dooe thesame againe admonished vision peter iewe yet abhorting meate lawe forbyd sayed oh lorde god forbid shoulde eate suche meates vnto day haue dewly kepte trade forefather hytherto neuer eate meate suspeded vncleane thesame voyce spoken made aunswere whiche god hath made cleane thou whiche art man call vncleane vision thryse appered ende certainly beleue strayght wayes vessell taken vp heauen peter beyng cumme againe remembraunce whyles musing himselfe greate perplexitie vision shoulde meane whether dreame eyther el significacion goddes wyll beholde menne cornelius sente stoode symons dore tanner callyng forth one seruauntes enquired whether one named peter hosted whyle peter thought vision spirite sayde vnto beholde men seke aryse therfore get downe go doubte haue sent peter went downe men whiche sent vnto hym cornelius sayde beholde ye seke cause wherfore ye come thei said cornelius capitaine iust man one feareth god good report among ye people iewes warned holye aungell sende thee house heare wordes called lodged woorde broughte peter woulde speake hym whyles satte imaginyng hys mynd vision meane spirite god sayed hym god speaketh sondry wyse electe beholde three menne stande doore enquyre therefore aryse get downe goe theym nothyng doubtyng sent shalte thou vnderstande meanyng thys vision thou somuche musest peter wente downe came menne sayde loo verye symon peter whome seke thoccasyon cummyng hyther peter boasted visyonbeholde whoe ye seke cause wherfore ye cumme required heathen confessyon benefyte grace cummeth ghospell ought thruste whiche set nought lyke maner ought denyed desyrouse aunswered cornelius whiche office capitayne bande menne yet manne good conuersacion feareth god well credited lykewyse estemed reported wel owne housholde also throughout iewry warned apperaunce holy augell spake hym sende thee home house myght receyue thy handes knowleage ought doe obtayne saluationthan called lodged peter perceyuing vision agree nowe vnderstandyng voyce sygnified whiche thryse sayed god hath clensed accompte thou vncleane bad comme nere house euentyde lodged fyrst begynnyng conuersacion betwene iewes gentyles whiche gentyles theyr owne accorde preased partaker ghospell apostle dyd wisely hastye settyng forth matter myght euydent men dyd rashely commaundement god receyue gentyles benefyte ghospell cornelius sent peter commaundement aungell peter came downe mette commaundement visyon one parte marke earnest desyre gentile graciouse benefyte ghospel parte cherefulnesse readynes desirouse saue al sortes men pand morowe peter went away certayne brother ioppa accompanied hym thyrde daye entred cesarea cornelius awayted called together kynsmen speciall frendes chaun ed peter cum cornelius met fell downe feete worshypped peter toke hym vp saying stande vp selfe also man nexte daye peter went cesarea beyng accompanied certayne christen men cytie ioppa beare wytnes thinges doen mynde gaue theym sum good lucke towarde wyst meane time cornelius beyng desyrous saluacyon wayted retourne messenger bryng peter called togethere well nygh kynsfolkes chiefe frendes partely moe myght wytnesses facte partely also moe myghte partaker greate benefyte whan peter entred house captayne cornelius much reioysyng therat reuerence towarde went forth mete fallyng downe peter feete worshypped hym perceyuyng hym sum excellencie semely manne haue thus ought christ worshipped minister yet glory dewe vnto god attrybuted manne peter geuing example howe muche preacher christes woorde ought abhorre ambicio desire honoure howe smalle prayse ought chalenge thynges whiche done thorowe vertue christes name suffred thys captayne lye prostrate vpon grounde embracyng hym armes dyd lyft vp saying aryse man thou art geue vnto god homage minister pand talked hym came founde many cum gether sayde vnto ye knowe howe vnlawful thyng man iew copany cum vnto alien god hath shewed cal man commen vncleane therfore came vnto without delay assone sent aske therefore entent haue ye sent commonyng thys wyse familiarly wyth entred house together whan cum inner house peter found greate numbre assembled togetherit vnlawful thig man iew company cum vnto alien conceyued couetous pastour good hope shoulde haue great vauntage whan peter set doune began heauenly oratour speake thys wyse partly came wyth hym shoulde haue occasyon offended partly myghte stablyshe captaines houshold theyr confydence whiche conceyued know permytted lawes iewe eyther household eyther otherwyse company alien men sundry kynde religion cyrcumcised yet iewe afrayed doo yet despising eyther trade custome countrey folowyng herein commaundement god signified vnto vision oughte esteme manne countrey soeuer vncleane hate worthy muche god taketh man vncleane onely maketh holy euery thyng therefore stickyng commaundement godfor entet haue ye sent came hither wythout delay soone sent wherfore part shewe matter sende peter speaketh maye wynne perceyuyng thys cause assembled together myght al one tyme heare ghospell preached marke howe featly peter playeth pastours part doeth comunicate high misteries ghospell vnto perceyued desirious learne pthan cornelius sayd day nowe iiii day thys houre sat fasting ninth houre prayed house beholde man st de bright clothynge sayde cornelius thy prayer hearde thyne aliues dedes remembraunce syght god sende men therefore go ioppa cal symon whose syrname peter lodged house one symon tanner sea syde whiche assone cume shall speake vnto sent immediatly thou hast well done thou art cume nowe therefore present god heare thynges commaunded vnto god cornelius rehearsed howe matter stode saying fower dayes paste house fastyng earnestly prayer ninth houre daye sodaynly beholde certayne man whose countenaunce full maiestie stoode visible glystening garment sayed vnto cornelius thy prayer hearde thy liberall bountifull almes thou hast bestowed poore forgotten syght god wherfore sende ioppa desire symon otherwyse called peter come thee hosted house symon tanner nere sea sente incontinent messaungers myne owne folkes vnto thee whiche thyng holde haue enterprysed vnlesse aungell wylled moste hertely thanke youre goodnes vouchesafed come hyther nowe therefore present one mynde without hurte meanyng towardes man take god wytnesse desirous heare god hathe geuen commaundement shewe v thaungell put confidece promysed doubte wyll dooe forasmuche also commanudemente god ouchesaued come common v peter opened mouthe sayd trueth perceyue respect person god al people feareth worketh righteousnes accepted peter perceyuing vnfayned meanyng opened mouthe began speake thys wyse doe ryght well perceiue syght god one person preferred another countreys feareth god liueth lyke good man vprightly god worlde set hym ye know preachyng god sent vnto child israel preaching peace iesus christ lord ouer al thynges preaching published throughout al iewry began galile baptysme iohn preached god anoynted iesus nazareth holy gost power iesus went good healing oppressed deuill god asmuche vnderstande free oure lawe yet neuertheles ye woorship one god whiche true god dayly ye offer thorowe prayer sacrifice seeke hys fauoure succouring nedye thonely thyng lawe prophetes doe teache although god hath nowe last perfourmed thing whiche long sence promysed mouthes prophetes woulde sende messias saye christe shewyng ye israelite wyll nowe meane prophete hys onely begotten sonne iesus christ proferyng thorow fayth obedyence hym whome sent remission synne eftsones wil reconciled theym yet notwithstandyng bycause none god well gentile also israelite wyll fauour shewed men whosoeuer beleueth gospell assured rumour thyng beeyng sparsed thorowout iewrye hearde among alsohowe god anoyncted iesus nazareth holy ghost howe iesus walked ouer partes iewry exhortyng men repentaunce bearyng wytnes kyngdome god euen hand chiefely hys beginning preache aboute galilee ben christened iohn whiche foremessanger openlye bare witnesse hym ye iesus nazareth lambe god take away synnes worlde god anoynted hys messias holy ghoste whome seene lykenesse doue cummyng heauen restyng heade onely shoulde christen faythfull water hymselfe christened wyth heauenly power oure lorde iesus also expressed deades walkyng thorowout partes iewry helpyng men onely teachyng heauenly philosophye gospell whereby soule healed also curyng sycke castyng oute deuyls healyng leper reysyng dead shorte helpyng men whome deuyll tyranny kept vnder hys yoke onely free synne hable power vanquishe tyranny deuyll whiche raygneth ouer theym leadeth theyr lyfe synne god expressed hys might sonne whiche satan power hable withstande thynges beyng comonly spoken thorowout iewry assured likewise haue heard doe beleue witness thynges whiche dyd lande iewes ierusalem whome ewe hanged tree hym god reysed thyrd day aud shewed openly people vnto v witness chosen god intente whiche eate drynke wyth hym arose deathe commaunded v preache vnto people testifye ordeyned god iudge quicke dead geue al prophetes witnes thorow name whosoeuer beleueth shall receiue remission sinnes maye surely beleue thys conuersaunte wyth hym house place long beyng manne lyued among men doe beare wytnes suche thinges coastes iewry hierusalem also whome highe priestes scribe pharisee consentes bothe nobilitie commens put death fastenyng hym crosse rendryng hym euyll thankes hys manyfolde benefites employed theym ym god raysed vp thyrde day shewed hym c god whose permission thinges doen health man restored lyfe third day death endowed life euerlasting make certainly beleued personally appeare alyue hearde sene felt also handes people bene death certayne chosen witness god purposely v say vnto appered arisen death conuersaut earth fowertie dayes eate drinke wyth hym wyth v lykewyse lest doubte myndes whether body dede raysed went heauen commaunded v whome chosen office openly preache euery man beare witnes one god aduaunced hyghe estate power thend worlde shalbe iudge bothe quicke dead meane space sure easy remedy profered euery man prophetes long synce one consente prophecied hymto hym g e prophet ues c teache onely whose name remyssyon synne shalbe geuen iewes onely nacions also thorow worlde merite woorkes wherein iewes put confidence fayth wherby beleue ghospell meane ghospell beleue christe whyle peter yet spake woordes holy ghost fell whiche hearde preachyng circumcision whiche beleued astonied many came peter gentyles also shedde gyft holy ghost hearde speake tongue magnified god aunswered peter man forbyd water yt baptised haue receiued ye holy ghost well commaunded bee baptysed name lorde prayed tarie fewe dayes peter yet made ende tale beholde holy ghoste visibly descendyng heauen came hearde beleued apostle wordes whiche thing made iewes conuerted ghospell come peter company ioppa beare wytnes thynges done astonied thereat merueiling gracious gyfte holy ghoste also powred furth vpon gentile whiche circumcised supposed promise prophetes pertayne israelite onelyfor heard speake tonges magnified god whereas dede prophetes sayed spirite god shoulde bee shed whatsoeuer woulde call name god chaunce folowed expressed meaning thys token whyche sene began presence men hearde speake diuers language praysyng muche bountifull goodnes god euident token declared israelite alreadye presente circumcised thenceforth shoulde stycke call theym whiche circumcised partaker faythe christe lykewyse done cornelius frendes put oute doubt theyr fayth nothyng inferiour iewes yea thoughe kepte iewes lawes accordyng ye pleasure god ordre chaunged first whiche newly instructed fayth wonte b christened afterwardes laying handes theym receyued holye gost without laying theyr handes fyrste holy ghoste geuen apostle shoulde nothyng stycke ministre whyche lesse estimacion seeing god hys owne accorde gyuen whiche excellencie peter thoughe woulde doe nothyng wythout consent iewes thoughe already purposed sayed came wyth hym man wyl saye nay men maye chrystened albeit bee circumcysed whiche haue receyued holy ghost aswell whan man sayed contrary commaunded christened name iesus christe matter beyng happely finished peter makyng hymselfe ready returne ioppa entreated tarry wyth fewe dayes asmuche desirous haue perfecte knowledge gospell peter beyng thus intreated content abyde knewe iewes would scarsely brooke shoulde housholde conuersaunt circumcised pthe xi chapter apostle brother iewry hearde heathen also receiued word god whan peter come vp ierusalem circumcisio coutended saying thou wentest vnto men vncircumcised diddest care rumour fact came ouer apostle eares whiche remayned hierusalem eares brother also whiche abrode iewry gentyles also receyued woorde god harde thyng kepe matter close partely captaine reason office great estimation partly agayn many christened together either el iewes present dede dooing chaumberlaine spake whan christened rode waye alone withoute wytnes one stollen benefitte ghospell iewes partely also doen one noble cyties palestine peter knowing certainly would noysed abrode woulde iewes reproue hys doyng toke diligent hede euery waye myght deserue rebuke forasmuche also god put thys mynd shewed vision three time shoulde nothyng stycke dooe parte reuelacyon holye ghoste perceyued messangiers come frome cornelyus whome foorthwith dyd receyue house leste beyng iewe myghte haue semed haue desyrous compaynye wyth heathen spake theym doore wytnesses asked theim theyr cummyng thys question asked rather iewes sake presente hys owne besydes thys perceyued vysions dyd agree bothe one parte went thyther yet withoute compainy iewes whiche knowen bee menne good credence shoulde beare witnes doen without whose consent woulde nothyng thentent meanes afterwarde yf anye man woulde grudge doynges wytnesses myght become proctours hys cause agayne whan come cornelius house dyd foorthwith enter man desyrous talke hym sente woorde come cornelius myghte meete hym bryng hym yet neuerthelesse well assured shoulde bee welcum captayne fell prostrate peter feete wurshypped hym whiche iewes present greate token meruayle ready minde agayne hearing asked wyll hym sent hym thentent iewes whiche came hym hearyng tale cornelius owne mouthe myghte better beleue fynally holy ghoste came downe hys owne accorde eyther made theyr prayer eyther theyr handes layde either receiued baptisme neither yet vpon christen commoned cyrcumcised present expressed vnto mete deny baptisme whome god endowed wyth hys holy ghoste great wysedome peter beyng pastor agreable ghospell well knewe nature iewes howe muche stode theyr owne conceyte circumcised howe deadly abhorred circumcised occasyon imagined shyftes auoyde offence manne desyrous make gentyles partaker ghospell yet suche sorteand whan peter cum vp hierusalem circumcisio contended againste hym occasion thereof lese iewes yf myght nowe peter chaunce returned hierusalem reason rumour knowen howe cornelius christened whiche circumcised receyued gospell disputed saying wherefore dyddest thou enter house vncircumcised contrary tradicion forefather content diddest also sitte table eate meates whiche forbydden moyses lawe pbut peter rehearsed matter begynnyng saying citie ioppa praying traunce sawe vision certen vessel descende great shere let downe heauen fower corner came yt whan fastened myne tyes considered sawe fower foted beastes ye yearth vermine wormes foules ayre matter becommed peter holde peace tolde matter euen frome begynnyng howe chauced wise certes du st breake lawe whiche haue deliuered v forefather poincte folowed whiche aboue lawe citie ioppa fastyng prayer manne suspecte vayne dreame whan commaunded hungre enforced meate dressed meane time rauyshed traunce sawe vision great vessell muche fourme greate linen sheete knitte fast fower corner let downe heaue came werupon whan sette myne iye hungry loked maner meate sawe dyuerse kyndes fowerfoted beastes besydes noxious beastes sondrye kyndes also beastes crepe yearthe fowles ayre whome lawe expressed commaundement woulde v abstayne fro hearde voyce saying vnto aryse peter sley eate sayed lord nothing commen vncleane hath tyme entred mouthe voyce answered againe saying heauen count thou thinges come god hath clensed done thre time wer taken vp againe heauen beholde immediatly thre men ready cum vnto house sent fro cesarca vnto spirite sayed vnto go wtout doubtyng moreouer vi brother accoumpanyed entred ye man house shewed v seen angell house stoode sayed hym sende menne ioppa call symon whose sirname peter shall tell thee woordes wherby thou thyne house shalbe saued while lookyng hearde also voyce whiche exhorted shoulde sticke eate thereof sayed vnto aryse peter kyll eate whome made answere god forbyd daye hath vnclene meate entred mouthe aunswered voyce eftsones maner call thou whiche art man meates vncleane whiche god hath purified vysion dyd three tymes appere afterwardes meates whiche thought worthy abhorred taken vp heauen cum selfe whyles reuolued mynde vision whiche often apered shoulde meane spirite god forthwith gaue knowlege three men ye doore hosted sent cesarea would speake spirite commaunded shoulde sticke goe obeyed visyon holy ghostes sendyng tooke iorney cesarea alone tooke syxe brother beare wytnesse thynges whiche dyd commaundement god brefely er entred mannes house sente v presence v shewed howe fewe dayes whyles fastyng hys prayer home hys house seene aungell standyng hym glistenyng garment brode daye saying vnto hym cornelius sende thy seruauntes ioppa let theym desyre symon otherwyse named peter thy behalfe take paynes come speake shall tell thynges whereby thou thy housholde maye saued perceyuyng vision agreed partes perceyuyng farder howe earnest theyr desyre dissimulacion beganne teache thynges lorde iesus willed v preache began preache holy gost fell v begynnyng came remembraunce howe lorde sayed iohn baptised water ye shall baptised holy ghost muche god gaue like gyftes dyd vnto v beleued lord iesus christ haue withstand god whan heard helde theyr peace glorified god saying hath god also gentyles graunted repentaunce vnto lyfe fully fynished communication beholde holy ghost cummyng heauen entred theym lyke maner fyrste tyme v began speake dyuerse language euen spake thys euident token faythe approued god euen thyng selfe shewed hard vision vnderstande seene dyd meane fowerfooted creping beastes fowles whiche circumcised abhorre goddes wyll haue theym purifyed thorowe faythe yea wyll take anye thyng vncleane whiche thorowe faythe ghospell made holy farther remembred wordes lorde spake vnto v whan ready ascende heauen iohn baptised water shalbe baptised holy ghoste diepe body water water gyueth saluacion vnlesse faythe obtaine fierye baptisme whan matter selfe effect euident enoughe receyued baptisme whiche iesus lorde promysed fauoure thorowe faythe employed whiche wer circumcised
