whiche receyued deserued kepyng lawe thorowe fayth wherby beleued lorde iesus christwhat would haue wythstande god coulde agaynste wil god staye shoulde baptised water whiche already baptised spirite god seyng water nothyng elles token grace shalbe geuen v heauen grace gyuen without oure ministerie deny baptysed water bene nothynge elles improue whyche god done whan hearde hys wordes helde theyr peace praysed god saying verye thyng effect euidently declared god hath gyuen repentaunce israelytes onely gentyles also therby maye obteyne lyfe euerlastynge firste frutes gospell churche heathen peter procurement hym none durste doo philip onely also without monicion aungell also scattered abrode affliccion arose steue walked throughout vnto phenice cypre antioche preachyng word manne vnto iewes onely sum theim menne cypre cyrene whiche whan wer cum antioche spake vnto grekes preached lorde iesus hande lorde great number beleued turned vnto lorde reason sore persecucion steuens death dispersed wente vyllage village citye citie vntyll came phenice sum yle cypre whiche lyeth ryghte ouer agaynste pheniceand haue lorde wyth c sum also scattered antioche whiche deuideth phenyce cilicia preachyng euery man doctrine ghospell receyued apostle yet durst communicate anye man iewes hated menne besydes certayne godly feare whiche forasmuche thoughte lawfull gyue dogges holye whiche lorde forbydden theym aboute thesame tyme arose vp certayne menne couerted fayth borne parte cypre parte cyrene entryng citie antioche durste boldly speake christe grecian preached oure lorde iesus vnto theym prospered matter succedyng well wyll god shoulde gaue strength courage setter furthe name among also great numbre gaue credence ghospell conuerted lorde tydynges thynges came vnto ear congregacion whiche hierusalem sent furth barnabas shoulde go vnto antioche cum seene grace god glad exhorted al purpose herte would continually cleaue vnto lorde good man full holye ghost fayth muche people added vnto lord departed barnabas tarsus seke saule founde hym brought hym vnto antioche knowleage matter noysyng abrode one another came eares churche whyche hierusalem purpose ye leuite barnabas man whiche borne cypre one suche perfeccion semely apostle sent thyther apostle see dooen yf perceiued agreable god shoulde allowe authoritie thapostles great heede tooke receyuyng heathen partetakers ghospell although thapostles muche desyred shoulde partelye leste shoulde afterwardes called backe broken iewes thyng vnaduisedly rashely doone partely left gentyles shoulde verye muche mistruste theymselues dooen thoughe lawe moyses must haue helpe theyr stayeand exhorted al wyth purpose herte c barnabas cum antioche perceiued grecian obtayned lyke fauoure god thorowe fayth wythout obseruacion lawe iewes muche reioyced numbre faythfull encreased exhorted shoulde stande stedfaste theyr purpose stycke god good man replenished holye ghostethey would continually cleue vnto lord c therefore came passe meanes hys preaching manye moe dyd ioyne wyth numbre professed lorde antioche adioyning cilicia nerenesse place moued hym seke paule whiche meete thys office anye forasmuche chosen chryste glorifie hys name among gentile prynces yerth disciple brought hym cesarea citie phenice tyme fledde frome ierusalem thence went tarsus founde brought antioche hoped wynne moe hys meanes whyche apostle specially chosen office great cytie muche frequented bothe grecian also iewes pand chaunced whole yeare theyr conuersacion wit congregacion taught muche people insomuche disciple antioche ye first called christen continued together antioche whole yere wyth congregacion faythfull gathered together greate numbre aswell grecian iewes whiche afterwardes muche increased accesse smalle multitude people gathered together preachyng paule barnabas insomuche whiche called disciple name christe odious antioche firste called principall authour religion al christian professed christes doctrine pin dayes came prophetes citie ierusalem vnto antioche stode vp one named agabus signified spirite great dearth throughout worlde came passe emperoure claudius dayes disciple euery man accordyng habilitie purposed sende succour vnto brother whiche dwelt iewry thyng also dyd sente elder handes barnabas saule aboute season certayne prophetes came frome hierusalem antioche among whome one whose name agabus standyng vp congregacion inspired spirite god certified theym shoulde come greate famyne ouer whole woorlde whiche came passe claudius cesars tyme succeded caligula iewes whiche conuerted fayth dwelled hierusalem moste parte poore men partly giuen commen manye theym reason professed iesus christes name spoiled goodes priestes prouided whyche abundantlye ynoughe specially amongest gentyles receiued ghospell shoulde euerye man gyue porcion money gathered shoulde sente ye christen menne dwelled iewrye sustentacion maunne compelled gyue thyng euery man geue coulde fynde herte good wyll depart withall accordyng valew goodes euen ordeyned doen ye money sent hierusalem paule barnabe elder distribute thought beste nede therof pthe xii chapter tyme herode kyng stretched furth handes bere certayne congregacion killed iames brother iohn sworde saw pleased iewes proceded farther tooke peter also dayes swete breade whan caughte put hym pryson also delyuered hym ower quaternyons souldyers kepte entendyng easter bryng forth people peter kepte pryson prayer made without ceasyng congregacion vnto god whyle paule barnabas occupied aboute thys embassade kyng herode whiche tyme beheaded iohn sente christ agayne pilate apparelled wyth white garmente mockage beeyng sorye thys sorte menne daylye encreased name iesus kyng iewes well knowen manye countreyes thoughte appertayne hys duetye thys secte growynge dayly encreasyngand ye time herod kyng stretched furthe hys handes c shoulde bee cleane vanquyshed sathanas euen woorkyng eftesones theym hys tooles thyng whiche went yet obteyning nothyng el thereby name iesus gloryously set foorth therefore herode practysyng hys regall absolute power sente certayne hys garde weapon lay hande congregacyon professed iesus nazareth lorde thynges whyche choppyng iohns head learned behead good men freely spake trueth lykewise lay handes vpon iames thapostle brother iohn dayes estemed greatest autoritie amonges thother apostle commaunded hym headed whyche stedfastly contynued professyng name iesus whan perceyued cruell acte dyd well please iewes heaped myschiefe vpon myschiefe commaunded peter shoulde bee taken whiche chiefe among reste thapostles thinkyng woulde come passe shepehearde beyng ryd oute waye flocke myghte easily bee dispersed scattered vpon whiche consyderacyon iewes beefore slayne lorde iesus staying handes apostle would immediatly without delay haue put peter deaththan day swetebread onely easter day whiche greate honoure among iewes hande time iewes ben also afrayde slea iesus suche iewes deuocion kepyng theyr holy dayes afrayde sacryfice innocent mannes bloude people requeste afrayed breake theyr holy daye thoughe nothyng gyltie murder whiche hath harte prefixed commyt murder commaunded peter beyng thus taken shoulde caste pryson feare lest shoulde waye escape lyke paule sette sixteene harneste men kepe lying bandes thintet man myghte force take awaye purposed holy dayes bryng sacrifice people euen thirsted innocente bloud lyke people lyke kyng meane season neyther refused peter goe pryson hauynge knowledge god suche thynges shoulde happen neyther made disciple commocion agaynste vngodly cruelnes thys tyraunt hauyng well remembraunce howe lorde commaunded shoulde wyshe nothyng well yea pursued herode satisfyed wyth imprysonyng peter ne double chaynes wyth fower souldiers armour whiche tymes case thoughte enoughe haue safe kepyng one man purpose verely cruell entente great diligence myghte muche auayle settyng foorth encreasyng glory sauiour christ thys wyse peter whome souldiers tooke diligent hede kept holy day pryson meane congregacion disciple takyng lytle thought shepeherde neuer teassed day ne nighte pray god peter myght escape pand whan herode woulde haue brought vnto people night slept peter betweene two souldiers bounde wyth twoo chaynes keeper doore kepte prison beholde angell lorde present lyght shyned inhabytacyon smore peter side styered vp sayinge aryse vp quickely hys cheynes fell hys handes aungell sayd vnto hym gyrde thy selfe bynde thy sandales dyd sayeth vnto caste thy garment folowe came folowed wyste trueth whiche doen ungel thought sene vision whan past first ye seconde watche came vnto yron gate leadeth vnto citie opened owne accord went passed thorowe strete forthwith aungell departed hym whan herode purposed bryng hym forth people holy dayes ended god would nyghre shoulde haue bene brought foorthand behold angell lorde present c peter slepe betwene two souldiers bounde wyth two chaynes rest souldiers watched pryson doore beholde thangell god sodainly stode peter wonderfull lyght withall made al house bryght notwithstandyng darke pryson darke nyght also smyting peter syde reysed hym saying arise speadily forthwyth assone wordes spoken chaines fell hys handes sayed angell gyrde thy selfe put thy shooes see thou leaue parte thy apparell heare whan peter thys doen sayed angell agayne cast thy cloke folowe wise peter folowing aungell hys guide began goe foorth pryson yet perceiuing dede done aungell supposyng sawe vision seene passed first seconde warde came yron gate leadeth citie owne accorde opened vnto though many locke boltes vpon itand went passed c whan cleane foorth passed vntyll gone throughe one strete citie foorthwith aungell vanishyng away left peter soodaynly comen whan peter come himselfe sayed knowe suretie lorde hath sent angell hath delyuered hande herode waytyng people iewes consydered thyng came house mary mother one iohn whose sirname marke many gathered together prayer peter knocked entry doore damosell came foorth harken named hoda wha knew peter voyce opened entry gladnes tanne tolde peter stoode entry said vnto thou art mad affirmed euen sayd hys ungell peter contin ed knocking opened doore saw hym asto ied whan beckened vnto hand myght holde peace tolde meanes lorde brought hym prison sayed goe shewe thynges vnto iames brer r departed went place peter lookyng hym perfectly knowyng part citie cummyng hymselfe sayde nowe perceyue dreame done lorde pytiynge hys hath sente hys aungell hath delyuered handes herode whiche decreed put deathe hath disappoynted bothe cruell kyng also earnest expectacion multitudeand consydered thing came house mary c consultynge deuising hymselfe whither myghte mooste safely goe thynkyng woulde make hys dysciples felowes partaker thys hys ioyfull chaucne wente house mary mother iohn iohn brother iames otherwise called marke whose house many assembled praying wyth one assente delyuery theyr pastoure whan peter knocked wicket gate whyche towardes streate syde lytle mayden came foorthe softely harken matter name rhoda whome peter perceyuyng come doore wylled spedely open doore whan heard peter voice beeyng halfe amased sooddayn ioye open doore runnyng backe agayne house broughte theym woorde peter doore beeyng well assured howe safe herode caused peter bee kepte aunswered mayden surely thou arte peuyshe whan shee contynued styffely affirmyng true shee sayed theym sayd peter ghoste angell speaketh lyke opinion euery man hath angell hys keper guydebut peter contynued knockyng c whiche often tymes woulde take mannes lykenes vpon hym peter styll knocked opened doore whan sawe peter come woondred hym peter hearyng greate noyse reioyced come agayne beckened theym hande shoulde holde theyr peace harken wythoute noyse woulde saye leste manne shoulde perceyue matter chaunced straunge vnaccustomed noyse made whan sylence made shewed theym matter chaunced ordre howe lorde broughte hym pryson guydyng aungell looke sayde peter iames brother lorde certified hereof bysshope hierusalem reste brethrenand departed wente place maye bee partaker v thys ioye thys wyse good god dooeth myxte sadnesse myrthe myrthe wyth sadnesse shoulde vttrely despayre peter spoken woordes forthwith departed thence went place wheras myghte safely bee hydde feare leste herode whose contynual endeuoure crueltie experyence shoulde agayne espie assone daye lytell dooe emong souldiers becum peter whan herode sought founde examined kepers commaunded bee away descended iewry cesarea abode herode dyspleased tyre sydon came one accorde made intercession vnto one blastus kinges chaumbers sayne desired peace countrey nourished kynges prouysion sone daye souldiers whose custody committed seeyng chaynes remayne whole prysoner escaped doores beeyng shutte sore amased maruaylyng become peter herode whan sente peter thyntente myght bryng foorth beefore people condemne hym death founde hym pryson examynacyon hadde kepers commaunded warde myghte laysure put theym execucion god euer mercyfully tenderyng loue hym restrayned herodes rage aswell prouydyng safetye apostle also souldiers sytting safegarde peter shoulde occasion innocentes shoulde suffer paynes death meane space befel herode occasion take hys iourney cesarea citie palestine offended thinhabitours tyre sydon dyd euen purpose mynde wage battayll agaynste theym hearyng repaired wyth one accorde vnto hym fyrste desiryng fauoure one blastus whyche chyefe kynges priuie chaumbre obteyning sued peace forasmuche thought expedient haue frendshyppe hym beyng kynge dwelte nere theym ryches welthynes tyre sydon stoode moste marchaundysynge therefore theyr commoditie vauntage bee league wyth countreys adioyned nere vnto could wage battell without theyr great hynderaunce hauyng free passage occupier cary bryng marchaundises pand vpon day appoynted herode arayed royall apparell set hym seate made acion vnto toe people gaue shout saying voice god immediately angel lord smo e hym gaue god honour eaten wormes gaue vp ye gost woord god grew multiplied barnabas paule returned hierusalem fulfilled office toke iohn whose sirname marke matter p acibly ended whan vpon certayne solemne feaste high daye vowe kepte holy health emperour occasion whereof chiefe ruler whole countrey assembled thither seconde daye playes kepte continued many dayes herode speakyng vnto people hyghe place pulpet people hauyng hym gorgeous garmente richely coningly wouen enbrodered bothe syluer also gold brightenes sunne beames shyning la bosome kinges garment reason refleccio glistered vpon euery man iyes man might abyde bryghtenes thereof euen lyghteningthe voyce god c multitude flattery made shout thereat praysyng hym sayd voyce god man though perceyued thing surmount man excellency flattery people doeth often cause kynges become tyrautes whan praised goddes scarsely worthy name man prince parte flatter people exhibiting vnto theym shewes gase vpon vncleanly play oftentymes puttynge good menne death obteyned people fauour death iames yet herode hys parte refused abhorred vngodly flattery wretched person one within short space dye reioysed called god vengeaunce god immediatly lighted hym streight way presence multitude came downe aungell god smote hym lokyng backe sawe beynge man taken hym honoure cannot communicate parted creature due vnto god alone beyng taken sodayne disease whiche fylthy dolorouse anye myght died veraie payne anguishe therof within fewe dayes body beyng eaten vp vermyne wyse whan heand eaten wyth wourmes gaue vp ghoste c persecuted flocke god rydde oute waye doctrine gospell encreased spred abrode barnabas saule whan busynesse done hande consent brother delyuered money ye apostle sene distributed helpyng relyuing ye pore ordeyned shoulde returned hierusalem antioche bryngyng wyth companion whose name iohn otherwyse called syrname marke pthe xiii chapter wer congregacion antioche certain prophetes teacher barnabas symeon called niger lucius cyrene manahen herode tetrarches noursefelowe saule mynystred lorde fasted holy ghost sayed seperate barnabas saule worke wherunto haue called fasted prayed layed theyr hades leat goe sent forth holy gost departed vnto seleuria thence sayled ciprus salamine shewed worde god sinagoges iewes iohn minister churche antioche dyd floryshe dyuers gifte prophecye gyfte teachyng emong whome barnabas simeon whiche sirnamed niger besydes also lucius cyrenian borne manahen whiche ben brought vp eue child herode tetrache noursefelowe playfiere whose coumpaignie lefte dyd folow christ saule emong moste excellente one passed qualyties required apostle wheras studyed profyt churche bestowyng gyftes eche mannes welth set forth glorye chrys e faythfully whyche sacrifyce acceptable god none fastyng meane space prayer puritie lyfe myghte profytes churche besydes executing doinge al duetyes holy ghoste beeyng moued prayer certifyed theym prophetes woulde haue doen sayinge disseuer barnabas saule two chief reste purpose maye take hande effyceand fasted prayed ted hades leat go whiche haue specially chosen theym saye maye instructours gentile maye sowe farre abrode gospell theyr meanes commaundemente holye ghost barnabas saule separated set apart reste myght appere euery man wer chosen yth one consente fastyng prayer made peticion god would turne offyce toke ye profite congregation highest authoritie emog layed hades theim dimissed ready take theyr iourney whythersoeuer holy goste would leade appoynte theym firste mocion holy ghost barnabas saule went seleucia whyche great promontory peake weste parte antioche thence sayled vnto cypre soone arryued salaminand iohn minister whyche noble citie yle ye first ye cum vnto ye easte syde preached fable inuented man witte worde god corner iewes synagoges whome greate noumber reason nere vnto syria partaker thys mynysterie iohn otherwyse called marke whome brought wyth hierusalem suche honor euery geuen iewes accordynge commaundement christe wylled ghospell first offered leste sorte people whiche otherwyse euer full complayntes waywarde shoulde saye wer despised nought set wha gone yle vnto paphos found certayne forcerer false prophet iew whose name bari su wt ye ruler ye coutrey one sergius paulus prudent ruler called vnto barnabas saul desired heare word god elymas sorcerer name interpretacio withstode sought turne away ruler fayth saul also called paul ful holy gost set iyes sayed thou ful al sutteltie deceitfulnes thou chylde deuyll thou enemy righteousnes wilt yt cease peruerte strayght wayes lord beholde hande lord vpon thou shalt blynd see ye sunne season immediatly fel hym myste darkenes wente aboute sekyng leade hand ruler whan sawe happened beleued wondred doctirne lorde beyng thus occupied walked aboute whole ylande vntyll came paphos whiche citye dedicate honoure uenus cytie standeth fardest west parte cipres founde certayne enchaunter whose name bariesus manne woulde say sonne iesu iewe borne one professed iewes religion vnder pretense therof falsely bearyng men hande spirite prophecie reteynyng sergius paulus whiche proconsull saye lieutenaunt lorde deputie yland wyse man good experience suche felowes wonte commonly get suche greate mennes fauour may mischiefe among men haue broughte theym errour proconsul hearyng gospell sowed throughout cypre dyd onely withstande also sent barnabas paule beyng verye desirouse learne heauenly doctryne gariesus beynge enemye oure sauiour iesus endeuoured hymselfe resyste increase ghospel striued trueth whiche cumming lyghte dede woorker falsehood elimas whiche worde sitians language betokeneth inchaunter false prophet also withstode apostle true prophetes perceiuing procunsul desyrous heare gospell wel assured time come woulde place deceitfull craftes amonge learned sure stedfast trueth wente alienate proconsulles minde shoulde beleue apostle marke buckling together mannes crafteso thou full suttelrie deceitfulnes thou childe deiuel c liuely force gospell saule whiche also named paule coulde lenger forbeare felowe perceyued ful deiuils spirite striued myscheuous craftes pure trueth takynge hym hertie courage inspiracion holy ghost stedfastly loked enchaunter sayde vnto hym thou wicked full deceite wylynes expresseste thy father deiuyll whiche first wile lye drew man deathe enemy al iustice truth shewynge thy selfe sonne deuyll firste tooke man innocencie thou openly striuest truth shall spring againe thou art contented thou hytherto hast deceyued simple men thy deceitefull craftes nowe also wyll god isand nowe beholde hande lord vpon thou shalt bee blinde c trueth gospell whiche deceit shall shyne throughout worlde thou stubbernely continuyng thy eiuyll ent doest cease striue againste wyll god rather hauynge iye thine owne vayne glorye fylthye lucre health saluacion aswell thine owne soule great sorte mennes also thou mayest perceiue craftes whiche thou workest deiuils power nothinge preuayle againste trueth gospell beholde thou shalt nowe fele hable whose wyll thou doest withstand thou braggest thou arte prophete one knoweth hygh misteries wheras dede thou art inwardely thy soule blynde haste thou deceyued men iudge thinges see god knoweth blyndnesse thy herte shall streight wayes take awaye vse thy bodely iyes euery man shall perceyue thou art blynde dede one vnworthy see lighte whiche men see forasmuche thou wagest open warre lyght gospel beginneth aryse worlde waye shall god take vengeaunce vntyll thou repent paule scarcely spoken wordes sodainly enchauntoure stricken great blyndnesse insomuch one amased wandred vp downe sekynge man leade hande thinges doen proconsul beyng wytnes lookyng theron merueylyng muche great efficacy heauenly doctrine vertue wherof phantasticall woorkynge suche enchauntours trode soone vnder foote conuerted faythe professed name christe stede false prophet bariesus high fauoure dysciples iesus pwhan paule departed fro paphos thei came perga pamphilia iohn departed returned ierusale wandred thorow cuntreys came perga antioche pisidia wet synagoge iewes sabboth day sate lecture law prophetes rewlers synagoge sent vnto saying ye men brethre yf ye haue sermon exhorte people say thinges doen citie paphos whence paule sayling company lesse asia landed perga whiche citie pamphilia iohn whiche sirname called marke wente returned hierusalem whence came beare barnabas paule companye lesse spedynes whan gone ouer pamphilia came antioche whiche citie pisidia entring synagogue iewes dyd customably resorte sate downe men dyd heare lesson lawe prophetes whiche rehersed man arose vp chiefe ruler synagoges perceyuing garmentes apparell strau gers iewes face outwarde behaueour shewed vertuous men sente woorde vnto theyr vnder officer forasmuche iewes yf woulde teache geue exhortacion people shoulde lawfull soe doe pthan paule stoode vp beckened hande sayed menne israel ye feare god geue audience god people chose father exalted people whe dwelt straungiers lande egipt high arme brought thence time fowertie yeares suffred man er wildernesse heauenly oratour paule beyng ready shewe minde arose signifying multitude mouing hande holde peace began speake vnto wyse ye men israel according trade youre forefather stande feare god harke vnto while shall shewe vnto wyll god expounde misterye meaning lesson whiche euery sabboth daye customablye reade synagogue god defendour israelite chose forefather sayethe god people choose oure father c sorte people serue insomuche whan serued egipte beyng kept great seruytude bondage pharao endeuouringe himselfe meanes encrease remayned lyue shoulde oppressed excesse paynfull labour wonderfully sette vp throughe myracles tyranne oppressed delyuered theyr bondage meane craftye deceite el man pollicie strength high mighty power yt men might certainly know people fauoured god whan tendre loue towarde delyuered egypte gently bare theyr condycions wyldernes space almost fowerty yeares thoughe often made sedicions commocions grutched moyses yet dyd extremely punyshe ende myghte perfourme promyse whiche made vnto patriarkes pand destroyed seuen nacions lande chanaan deuided land lot afterward gaue vnto iudges space fower hundred yeares fyfty vnto time samuell prophet afterwarde desired king god gaue vnto saule sonne ci man tribe beniamin space fowerty yeares wha put downe set vp dauid theyr king whome reported saying haue found dauid sonne iesse man myne owne herte whiche shall fulfill wyll fowertye yeres completed expired brought land promysed whan theyr sake cleane vanquyshed seuen nacions within lande chanaan land parted lotte amongest within terme cccc yeres whiche euidente token howe ernestly loued oure countrey whan obteyned peace gaue iudges vnder whose gouernaunce myghte quietly lyue vntyll tyme samuell prophete whiche last iudgesand afterwarde desired king god gaue vnto saule sonne ci tyme rule desyred god would gyue kyng samuel disswadyng whan contynued styll mynde desyre made saul king ouer sonne ci tribe beniamin whome lorde reiected partely pryde partely dysobeying commaundement thus continued vnder domynion good iudge samuel vnder vngodly saule fowerty yeares yet fauour mercyfull god forsoke v people whome chosen stede euyll kynge whome contrarye wyll god desyred faysed vp vnto theim kyng dauyd whose ryghteousnes god hym selfe bare witnes saying haue founde dauid sonne iesse man mynde whiche shall obey wyll thinges euen god tyme angry great punishement geueth vnto people foolish vngodly king euen whan pleased reconciled vnto v geueth euyll kyng whome layeth way good man one fulfil commaundemente mannes sede hath god according promised brought foorth israel saluiour one iesus iohn firste preached cumming baptisme repentaunce israel iohn fulfilled course sayde whome ye thinke behold cumeth one whose shoe feete worthy leuse unto hadde god made promyse one ly nage become kyng israel shoulde raygne euer nowe length fulfilled whiche oftentimes long ago prophetes promysed stocke dauid according promyse hath exhibited vnto v iesus salvioure israelite name ryghte well agreeyng theffecte ensuinge therof saluioure promysed pophetes signifyed shadowes lawe fygures shewed hymselfe worlde prophecied spoken also shewed already cum mouthe iohn ptiste also sent according prophecye esaye messenger shewe cummyng exhortinge people bee baptysed repente lyfe whiche ledde openly onouncinge kyngdome god euen hande whan ion whome god purposely sent foremessenger saluiour cummynge make ready myndes men agaynste came alalmoste made ende cou se thoughte many go iuing christe openly reiected title hym referred dewe vnto saying thynke ye christe nothing el messenger yet whome ye though dede truely suppose wyl within shorte space cum concerning shall cum far passeth power dignitie far vnworthy yea vnbuckle hys shooes whiche amonge men acoumted homely office base seruice leaste putacion doeth farre surmounte moste excellent wherfore preache vnto newe thing saluiour come hath many hundred yeres sence promised oure forefather whiche hath long time ben looked owne selues whome iohn whiche among iewes great estimacion knowledged bee saluioure pronounced openly hym iewes ye men brother chyldren generacion abraham whosoeuer among feareth god worde saluacion sent inhabitours ierusalem ruler knewe yet voyces prophetes whiche read euery sabboth daye haue fulfilled condemning whan thei founde cause death yet desired pilate kil whan fulfilled written toke downe tree put hym sepulchre god reysed hym againe death third daye sene many dayes whiche came vp hym galile ierusalem whiche witness vnto people wherfore brother ye haue lawe price greatly regarde prophetes come abraham linage whome god promysed issue meane wherof nacions blessed yf bee child abraham dede yf ye earnestly stande feare god folowe poynt godlynesse father abraham receyue wholesome doctrine bring vnto embrace hym beyng already come beyng lyuely exhibited geuen dede whome patriarkes highly reioyce haue promysed vnto themfor inhabitours hierusalem c shoulde come helth soule thorow iesus indifferently brought men vnto especially profered whose saluacion prophecy disclosed whose stocke christe borne let vulgare example inhabite nowe hierusalem moue thing rewlers whiche condemning iesus death whome woulde knowleage messias vnderstande prophetes whiche yet bee read euery sabboth daye hath vnawares fulfilled prophecyed determyned wyll god prophetes one conset signifie declare one free al sinne sacrifysed lambe without spotte sinnes men priestes pharisee scribe pier conseite also common assayed meanes coulde finde iust c use shoulde put death yet obteyned importun clamour pilate woulde put death whan ha vnaduisedly fulfilled thynges wer spoken hy mouth prophetes toke downe crosse ayed hym graue man malyce slayne permission godbut god ceysed hym againe fro deathe ye thirde daye c reysed death power lykew se god thirde daye according prophecied lese shoulde thinke bee vayne tale tel seene arde felt owne person knowen dysciples folowed hym whan went galile hierusalem suffre space rose death lyfe fowertie dayes almoste aliu vnt day testifying faythfully people thinges sawe eye heard eares felt hand pand declare vnto promise whiche made father god hath fulfylled vnto child euen vnto v ed vp iesus euen written first psalme thou art sonne haue begotte concerni reysed vp death returne corrupcio wise holy promise dauid made wyll geue faithfully fore saith also place thou shalt suffre thine holy see corrupcio dauid af er tyme fulfilled ye god fell sleape laid vnto father sawe corrupcion whome god reysed againe saw corrupcio lykewyse beyng commaunded sauiour execute office apostle doe witnesse god hath fulfylled promyse posteritie raysing iesus death lyfe whiche thing long ago promysed abraham dauid forefather auncest mouthes prophetes sonne god borne virgin mary concerning humayne nature bodye whome father himselfe speaketh first misticall psalme saying thou art sonne haue begotten daye hath reysed death lyfe shall neuer subiecte mortalitie death affirmeth prophete esaye saying wil perforume vnto faithfully promyse made vnto dauid kept promise raysed iesus lyfe euerlasting promyse vnto dauid haue sworne dauid holy wil deceiue hym seed shall continue euer throne royall seate shall continue sunne sight full moone without ende faithfull witnesse heauen ye see none lynage dauid obtayneth kindom prophecie signified christ sitteth righthand father enioyeth kyngdom neuer shall haue ende selfe matter speaketh also xv psalme wyse thou shalt suffre thy holy see corrupcion whiche prophecie referred kyng dauid owne personne whome certaynly knowe liued reigned long pleased god diedfor dauid hys time fulfilled god fell sleape c buried sembleably auncestry see corrupcion nothing el die graue whiche yet vnto daye remaining among v bone lye dothe euidently proue hath sene corrupcion wherfore prophecy cannot referred vnto hym thother whome preache vnto god raysed death lyfe body began putrifie made immortall pbe knowen vnto therefore ye men brother man preached vnto remission sinnes beleue iustified thinges whiche ye coulde iustified law moyses beware therefore lest fal whiche spoken prophetes beholde ye despisers wondre perish ye dooe woorke dayes whiche ye shal beleue though man declare therfore knowen vnto brother thorow thaforesayde iesus ye haue profered vnto remission sinnes freedom offense coulde hitherto cleane ridde keping lawe lawe vnperfect take carnally neither coulde put awaye sinnes punished sum nether helped nacions iesus eche man without respecte persone el offence hath righteousnesse iustificacion innocencie profered vnto beleue promyses ghospel beware therfore lest may spoken god threteneth vnfaithful resiste preaching ghospell saying mouthe prophet abacuc looke ye dispisers maruayle ye beyng amased euen dye angre woorke dayes woorke ye shall beleue thoughe man tell euer yet beleue virgin shoulde beare childe woulde haue thought countreyes obtaine life euerlasting death one man woulde haue beleued man beyng slaine buried coulde within three dayes aryse agayne death lyfe euerlasting wondrefull woorke god accordynge promyse heretofore made hath wrought nowe time become ye despisers bee occasion selues perish stubberne wylfull vnbeliefe beleue ye embrace ye health soule whiche frely profered vnto pwhen iewes gon congregacion gentile besought would preache worde next sabboth congregacion broken vp many iewes vertuous proselites folowed paule barnabas spake exhorted continue grace god paule concluded hearer began departe desyred paule barnabas woulde speake matter sabboth day next folowing audience synagoge whan cumpany dimissed many partly iewes borne partely straungers whiche yet lyued accordynge trade iewes lykewyse desirous know kinde religion folowed paule barnabas coueting playnly familiarely taught apostle talked aparte exhortinge continue fauoure grace whiche begun embrace free gifte hand god begun procede continuall increase meane time rumoure matter publisshed far abrode one telling another hard men commonly nexte sabboth daye came almost whole citie together heare worde god iewes sawe people full indignacion spake thinges whiche spoken paul speaking rayling paul barnabas wared bolde saied mete woorde god shoulde fiest haue preached seeyng ye put thynke selues vnworthy euerlastyng lyfe loe turne gentile hath lord commaunded v haue made lighte gentile thou saluacion vnto ende worlde next sabboth daye onely iewes suche straungiers obserued iewes lawes also whole citie came synagoge heare ghospell preached iewes parte perswaded themselues fauoure beleuing gospell promised suche onely carnally dyscended came abraham stocke whan sawe great multitude iewes suche kept lawe whiche proselites gentile also gathered together indifferently said iewes grudgeyng minde dysdayned meruelou speaking suche thinges ben spoken paule absteyning vnsitting oprobrius rayling wordes whan paule barnabas perceyued malicious stubbernes remembring lord commauded apostle place chaunced mete suche woulde reiecte ghospell whan profered shoulde leaue citie place shakyng dust theyr feete also stubberne person againe sayde freely haue doen duty according commaundement iesus lorde gospel first preached vnto suche reputacion christ seeyng refuse great fauour hath ben freely without suyte profered vnto thinke selues vnworthy eternal life beholde wyll turne preaching gentile yet wyll dooe vpon head iesus oure lorde commaunded hys disciple preached gospel throughout iewry afterwardes preache nacions vnto ende worlde long since prophecied prophet esay iesus saue iewes onely nacions also worlde booke prophecy father speaketh vnto sonne wyse haue set lighte vnto nacions saue whole worlde pwhan gentile hearde thei glad glorified worde lorde beleued euen many ordeyned vnto eternall lyfe woorde lorde published throughout regyon iewes moued deuout honest woman chiefe menne citie reysed persecucion paul barnabas expelled coastes shoke dust feete againste came vnto iconium disciple filled ioye wt holy ghost whan gentile hearde muche reioyced iewes shoulde perishe rendred god thankes turned iewes incredulitie vnto saluacion iewes spake blasphemously againste healthfull doctrine gentile beyng sodenly conuerted receiue promptly readily glorified worde lorde whiche worde many gentile beleued yet many god mercye ordeyned haue euerlasting lyfe whereunto manne attayneth vnlesse called chosen god wise worde god sowen abrod thorowout countrey iewes enuying gentile stirred vp certayne deuout woman suche commonly sooneste deceiued vnder fayned pretence holynesse estimacion honorableand woorde ye lorde published throughout ye regio thentent might bee doen autoritic furthermore moued diuerse head men citie caused paule barnabas bee persecuted banished coastes marke good theophilus crafte iewes styrre vp myndes men againste sincerely preached iesus malyce first moueth doe counterfet holynesse soone thinwarde sorowe malicious myndes breaketh woordes reproche vpon sad woman suche deuoute meanes wherby call common vnto sedicion aunciente matrones stirre vp rewlers wise apostle drieuen paule barnabas shaking dust feete tooke theyr iourney iconium citie licaonia disciple also reioycing ghospell good successe replenished gladnesse holy ghoste xiiii chapter pand fortuned iconium went bothe together synagoge iewes spake great multitude bothe iewes also grekes beleued vnbeleuing iewes styrted vp vnquyered myndes gentile brother long tyme abode quit themselues boldly helpe lorde whiche gaue testimony vnto worde grace graunted signes woonders bee dooen handes multitude citie deuided parte helde iewes parte apostle han come iconium went together custome synagoge iewes preached also ghospell iesus christe lyke done antioche insomuch great numbre aswell iewes grecian conuerted faith againe likewyse ye iewishe malice occasion sedicion ye iewes woulde obey ghospell beyng contente perishe themselues except might drawe many damnacion stirred vp corrupted myndes gentile againste yt beleue gospel increased waxed stronger aswell aduersitie prosperitie wherefore paule barnabas continued long space fyghte iconium valiantly settyng foorth matter helpe god whiche bare witnesse whiche greater testymony man thys hys free gift exhibited al men ghospell power gaue preacher ghospel weake person reputacion woorke signes wonder thentent mighte bee knowen therby bee handye woorke god meane iewes citie iconium diuided two partes whiche th ne fauoured vnfaythfull iewes thap stles whan assaulte made bothe gentile also iewes rewlers violence stone ware fled vnto listra derba city licaonia vnto regyon lieth rounde aboute preached gospel multitude moued doctrine paul barnabas taried stil listra last whan gentile adioyning themselues iewes gouernoures citie went laye violent handes thapostles might punish stone hauing knowlege matter f ed listra citie licaonia whiche parte pamphilia thence derba meane space walked ouer coastes countrey neare sowing euery place seede ghospell flyght apostle dyd muche procure owne health spreade abrode ghospel pand sate certaine man listra weake feete beyng creple mother wombe neuer walked heard paul preache beholding perceiuing faith whole said loude voice stand vpright thy feete stert vp walked whan people saw paule doen lift vp voyces saying speche licaonia goddes come v likenes menne called barnabas iupiter paul mercurius ye preacher iupiters prieste whiche dwelt citie brought en garlandes vnto porche would haue doen sacrifice people time listra certaine manne whose legges feble impotent continually satte still nothing hable walke lame euen mother wombe neyther could go dayes life man among multitude hearde paule speakyng christe paule looking vpon man perceyued countenaunce howe earnest desirous heare hym trusted name iesus whiche hearde preached shoulde obtayne health limmes said vnto loude voyce stande vp thy feete worde lame man leaped vp wel hable go whan multitude saw wo e man knew lame creature one woorde restored vnto health spake loude voyces owne countrey language licaonia said doubtlesse god haue taken likenes menand called barnabas iupiter paule mercurius c haue descended heauen vnto v people licaonia muche perswade themselues went commonly certaine talkes iupiter mercurius god tooke lykenesse men receiued gestes licaon whome appereth called licaonians wherefore called barnabas name iupiter shewed hys countenaunce great grauitie auncientnes paule called mercurie spokesman gentile opinion mercurius messengier goddes president eloquence iupiters prieste dwelled subburbes citie listra brought ox garlandes ye gate house apostle lodged thintente woulde haue dooen sacrifice vnto supposed iupiter delighted sacrifising ox aswell priestes also beastes killed sacrifice wont weare garlandes great number estate indifferently one folowed hym whiche whan apostle barnabas paul heard rente clothes ran emong people cry saying syrs dooe ye mortal men like vnto preache vnto ye tourne vanity vnto liuing god whiche made heauen earth sea al thinges therin whiche time past suffered nacions walke owne way neuerthelesse left himselfe without witnesse shewed benefites heaue geuing v cayne fruitful season filling hertes foode gladnes whan paule barnabas enquired matter ment learned taken goddes priest hastened sacrifice vnto woulde longer abyde greate blasphemye god haue honoure due god onely applyed manne cuttyng garmentes iewes manner sorowe haste came foorth multitude cryinge sayde syrs meane ye doe thus goddes mortal men ye bee ready apte fall lyke mischaunces dooe onely desire thus bee honoured rather came hyther purpose oure counsell ye maye turne true lyuyng god made heauen yearth sea thinges whatsoeuer conteyned therein leauing false goddes whome ye haue hytherto heathen sacrifice woorshipped whiche dede nothing el eyther men nowe dead el ymages voyde lyfe finally euil spirites one god maker gouernour al thinges wyll knowen worshipped nacions worlde men maye obtaine lyfe euerlasting time paste winking mennes factes permitted nacions lyue euery one owne trade ende euidente man coulde saued owne meanes men might bee saued would beleue god ghospel taught sonne although moste parte menne erroure hath lefte true god wurshipping ymages diuerse thinges stede god thinges created stede creatoure yet dyd reuenge hymselfe iustly might haue done ceased prouoke know loue continuall benefites geuyng v raine fruitfull season cfor made worlde vse man doeth make fruitful plentifull grounde sending downe rayne heauen causeth yerely increase fruites suffice aboundantly vse mannes life refreshyng v plentyfully soondry kyndes meates stirryng hertes myrthe pleasaunte wynes ye haue receyued benefites iupiter cere bacchus whome ye haue hytherto wurshipped god whome preache vnto although apostle plainely shewed trueth hearing multitude yet coulde scarcely stay handes doyng sacrifice vnto pthither came certaine iewes antioche iconium whiche whan obtained people consent stoned paule drew citie supposing dead howbeit ye disciple stode rounde arose vp came citie next day departed barnabas derba meane space thinges done listres certayne persones beyng iewes borne repined ghospell came thyther antioche pisidia iconium whiche iewes turned many people minde opinion say caused lay violent handes vpon apostle whyche thing also attempted afore iconium stoned paule drew citie thinking ben dead thus man fortune sodaynly chaunged litel taken god haue sacrifice done vnto paule stoned cast ye citie angry reason eloquence entised manye folowe christe disciple compassed cast left dead woulde haue buried corp paule cumming himselfe againe arose priuely entred ye citie next daye fled derba barnabas whither first purposed haue gone whan preached cytie taught many returned againe lystra iconium antioche strengthned disciple soules exhorted continue faith affirming must thorow muche tribulacion entre kingdome god whan preached gospell citie taught many thinges man woulde say cast seede ghospell abrode returned listres iconium antioche making myndes disciple stedfast fayth many conuerted christ geuing exhortacion continue fayth woulde scare withdrawen truste whiche put lorde iesus moued heard saye paule stoned listres forasmuche christ tolde disciple way muche trouble shoulde entre kyngdom heauen paule toke thought lest weake faith shoulde alienated christ seyng sore vexed wicked iewes himselfe passed muche geuing example bisshoppes ought folowe thrifty husbande men whiche thinke sufficient plant sow except also diligence beginneth growe may come full typing pand whan ordeined elder eleccion euery congregacion prayed fasted commended lorde beleued forasmuche requisite setting forwardes ghospell apostle shoulde trauail many countreyes set priestes auncientes chosen voyces comens euery citie ouersee supply towmes apostle absence whan vsed generally prayer fastinge commytted god might profite whome professed pand whan gon pisidia came pamphilia whan thei preached worde god perga went downe citie attalia thece departed shippe antioche fro whence committed vnto grace god worke whiche fulfilled thinges doen antiochia whiche citie pisidia whan walked ouer cuntrey likewise went throughe pamphilia sowing gospell euery place sowed alredy strengthening already beleued vntyll returned perga whan also set matter ordre came attalia whiche citie pamphilia sumwhat neare sea thence againe toke shypping antioche syrya whence firste came whan office preaching genttiles committed vnto elder laying handes vpon prayer fasting commytted grace god throughe helpe might happely come passe taken hande pwhen cum gathered congregacion together rehearsed al god done opened doore faith vnto ye gentile abode long time disciple wherfore whan retourned thither men accoumptable theyr dooynges called together congregacion faythfull opened vnto suche thinges pleased god worke shewing fauoure god futthered endeuour geuen occasion call gentile faith whiche myght obtaine saluacion without obseruing keping heauy burdenous commaundementes lawe xv chapter pthe certayn men whiche came downe taught brother excepte ye circumcised maner moses law ye cannot saued whan arisen dissencio disputing litell vnto paul barnabas determined paule barnabas certayne shoulde goe vp ierusalem vnto apostle elder question paule barnabas continued long space antioche dysciples noble cytie great multitude faythfull gathered together sundry sortes men whiche dayly encreased apostle glad tarry longer greatter increase faythfull men inhabitours hierusalem parte syria whiche properly named iewry dyd sticke moses lawe forsomuche lesse conuersaunte gentile dwellyng nerer temple woulde permyt gentile partaker ghospell vnlesse woulde kepe lawe whiche dyd yet perceyue shoulde bee abrogate concerninge shadowes figure ceremony true lyghte come sorte circumsicion vacacion forbearyng worke sabboth day choyce meates holy dayes dyuersities dyfferences betwene one sorte men garmentes vowes fastinges eschewing eating suche beastes dyed selues whiche thinges grosse people commaunded kepe season yt might accustome themselues obey god commaundemente vntyll true lyght dyd appeare throughe ghospell shadowes shoulde geue place wherfore suche vnderstoode lawe bee spirituall affirmed whiche commaunded appoynted god lefte father obserued duely kept auncestry many hundred yeares ought continue euer opinion proceded malice rather supersticious fauour lawe whiche whyles endeuoured kepe stil cleane ouerthrewe paule first time beyng prouoked lyke zele persecuted christen men whan rumour brute thinges wer doen antioche whence paule barnabas common consente toke iourney towardes cypre thence pamphilia openly without respect person preached ghospell iewes proselites also gentile willed obscrue kepe parte lawe bene spred far hierusalem certaine came iewry antioche teaching new doctrine disagreeyng paule barnabas taught sayde gentile turned faith except ye bee circumcised accordyng rule appoynted moses lawe ye bee saued beginnyng dyssencion betwene stucke litteral sence lawe folowed pure spyrytuall lybertye ghospell whiche stryfe dyssencion wyll still euermore continue among christen menne also none ende god suffer stryfe aryse vp suche disciple christe myghte better perceiue howe pernicious thing relygion wholy founded vpon ceremonyes whan paule barnabas lyke valiaut defendoures libertie gospel ernestly resisted doctrine whiche outwardly semed godly dede ful myschiefe arose great variaunce whyles apostle strongly defended puritie doctrine ghospell whiche spirituall testimony prophetes againste supersticiously defended lawe side beyng affeccionate law receyued theyr forefather went bryng gentile vnder yoke perceiuyng meane season slaund reproche christe whose grace thought lacked assistence lawe lawful made law abrogate abolyshe howbeit doeth abrogate law perfourmeth itthey determyned paule barnabas c sedicion hurtful ghospell crueltie herode prince stroue true relygion vnder false cloked pretence godlynes wherfore lest myscheuous dyscorde shoulde increase thought expedient congregacion disciple paule barnabas certaine sorte shoulde take iourney hierusalem peter apostle nnd priestes whiche rule churche hierusalem question controuersie arisen mighte bee decysed theyr cunning knowledge hitherto chiefe autoritie remayned doctrine ghospell first sprong vp autoritie remayned emong firste sent abrode iesus christe preache brought way congregacion passed ouer phenice samaria declaring conuersacion gentile brought great ioy vnto brother paule barnabas toke iourney great multitude disciple honorably broughte waye passed phenice samaria shewed euery place howe gentile conuerted faythe sure apostle preached well feared openly theyr owne accorde rehearse neyther wente hierusalem learne apostle whether dooen well tyme troublous commocion disquieting weaker sorte mighte layed downe appeaced autoritie elder many conuerted faythe partes onely reyse sedicion iewes doen reioyced also wondrefully pand whan come vnto ierusalem receiued congregacio apostle elder declared al thinges god doen whan paule barnabas companion come hierusalem ientely receiued congregacion whiche lykewise apostle seniours vnto whome beyng assembled together shewed thinges god wroughte emog gentile pthen arose vp certain secte pharisee beleue saying nedefull circumcyse commaunde kepe lawe moses apostle elder came together reason matter wheras parte multitude approued doynges arose certaine phariseis secte conuerted faythe whiche opinionthen arose vp certayne secte pharisee thoughte man coulde obtayne saluacion grace fauour ghospell vnlesse kept lawe therefore earnestlye resoned gentile ought made partaker ghospell vnlesse woulde take vpon yoke moses lawe whiche thing gentyles excedyngly abhorred pharis woulde seen earnest folowers lawe others therefore doctours lawe affirmed gentyles receyued faythe ought bee circumcised streyght commaundement ought bee geuen vnto shoulde kepe moses lawe vnderstanding ye none brake law sticked muche letter meaning law matter eftsones dissencion moued see howe perillous thynge easye set men together eares supersticion apostle elder assembled together thentent mighte consulte deuyse best bee doen matier beyng muche desyrous maysters auauncement wynne moe vnto feared le e many gentyles myndes woulde alienated turned awaye christe coulde abyde lawe againe thoughte expedient geue iuste cause iewes forsake ghospell thoughe dysagreeyng holye lawe forasmuche earnestlye rooted lawe whyche receiued theyr forefather tyme great reuerence mighte sodainly plucked muche sputing peter arose vp saide vnto ye menne brother ye know good ago god choose emog v ye gentile mouth heare ye word gospel beleue god knoweth hertes bare witnesse gaue vnto holy ghost euen vnto v put difference betwene v seyng faith purified hertes therfore tempte ye god put disciple neckes yoke neither father able beare beleue grace ye lorde iesu christ shalbe saued multitude pleased gaue audience barnabas paule whiche tolde sygnes wunders god shewed emong gentile wherfore bothe party beyng earnest disputacion reasonyng bothe party allegyng testimony scripture groundyng theyr argumentes vpon thesame peter arose vp spake vnto wise brother wherefore call ye matter controuersy disputacion though doubtfull sayth mannes arbitrement allowe dysailowe thing god hath already allowed selues knowe fewe yeares since chaunced haue practyse suche lyke thing iewry ye finde fault withal emong gentile nowe whan ye likewyse grutched cornelius householde christened shewed vnto whole matier howe toke iourney cesarea myne owne heade commaundemente god preache ghospel gentile also throughe faythe hym might obteyne saluacion hearde preache gospell vncircumcised free without bondage moses law yet neuerthelesse god estemeth man apparel outwarde furniture inwarde affeccion herte whiche alone doeth knowe gaue v manyfest token approued theyr faythe forasmuche while harkened vnto v powred holy ghoste yea plentifully spake diuerse language well also christened put dyfference concernynge gracious fauour cummeth gospell betwene whiche circumcised v iewes hertes clensed fayth playnely declaring v thys fauour doeth consist power lawe geue vnto men fayth whiche maketh man acceptable syght god god geueth holy spirite vncleane nothing el eue playne beliefe whan holy ghost came downe vpon wherefore nowe seeyng god hath expressed mynde gentile shoulde bee receyued ghospell shoulde bee partaker therof throughe onely faith without burden lawe dooe ye prouoke tempte god while contrary ye go lay vpon disciple neckes heauy yoke lawe whiche neuer hitherto vsed vnto whiche neyther forefathersbut beleue c yet oure selues wer borne vnder lawe coulde euer bee hable beare whyche v euer kepte lawe oughte bee kepte wherfore remayneth hope v attayne vnto saluacion kepynge lawe truste bee saued grace oure lorde iesus christe beeyng behalfe nothynge better gentile vnto whome willed thys gyft bee frely communicate parted freely gaue vnto v also woordes peter contencious disputacion betwene pharisee opinion contrarye ceassed afterwarde multitude quietly harde barnabas paule shewing howe sondrye myracles woonders whiche theyr handes bene wroughte amonge gentile god witnessed gentyles shoulde bee made partaker ghospell without kepeynge heauy burden lawe accordyng declared mynde beefore peter whan preachyng christe cornelius house sendyng downe holy goste vpon pand helde theyr peace iames answered saiyng men brother herken vnto simeon tolde god beginning visit ye gentile receiue people name dooe agree wordes prophetes written wil returne buylde vp agayne tabernacle dauid whiche fallen downe whiche fallen decaye wil build wil set vp residue men myght seke lorde also gentile vpon whome name uained saith lord doeth al thinges knowe vnto god al workes fro beginning world wherfore sentece trouble among gentile turned god write vnto abstayn themselues filthynes ymages fornicacion strangled bloude moses olde tyme hathe euerye citie preache synagoges whan read euery sabboth day whan ended communicacion iames whiche otherwyse called iames iust iames good commonlye named brother lorde apostle comitted chiefe autoritie arose approued sayinges wise brother asmuche ye haue quietly heard spake vnto pray heare also while shew conceite thinke best bee doen matter symon peter declared euen thinge whiche knowe true first pleased god whiche great pitie vpon mankyndesimon told god c seeyng distresse extremitie peryll daunger lost gentyles gyuen worshyppinge idol chose hym people euen also semed bee none people people shoulde well accepted call name wel thinge whiche god begon peter hath enlarged paule barnabas heard doen long sence prophecied shewed afore prophetes shoulde come passe amonge reste sayde prophetes amos speaketh person god wyse wyll returne repayre tabernacle dauid fallen decaye wyll buylde vp againe ruines falles set eftsons vp men whiche lyue shall seke lorde gentile haue taken name sayeth lorde doe accomplyshe thinges whatsoeuer promyse god maketh wyll vndoubtedly perfourme creacion worlde appoynted would doe time tyme whatsoeuer hath ordeyned muste nedes bee wondrefully wel doen nowe therefore seeing perceyue come passe whiche promysed thinke expedyent resist wyll god speake ought againste heathen become wurshyppers true god neyther yet charge obseruing lawe forasmuche faith gospel sufficient saluacion men let onely haue monicion sake whiche weake faythe yet bee perswaded idoll pryse dyfference beetwene fleashe sacrificed idolles fleashe solde market suche person likewise thinke whordome none offence forasmuche commonlye vsed permitted without punyshment appoynted man lawe absteyne fylthinesse idolles say neyther sacrifice eate whiche sacrificed also abstayne whordome againe certaine iewes somewhat supersticious yet perswaded thinges pure clene vnto bee pure clene theyr selues let abstayne strangled beastes bloude thinges pertaine whit healthe soule charitie prouoketh v doe tyme beare certayne brother whiche weake vntyll suche tyme maye attayne perfeccion meane time let euery manne beare one nouryshe concorde betwene doynge eche louing brother neyther nede iewes feare lest moyses shoulde bee abrogate decay hath certaine hath many yeres speake hym synagoges customably read euery sabboth day pthan pleased apostle elder whole congregecion sende chosen men theyr owne cumpany antioche paule barnabas sent iudas whose syrname barsabas silas whiche chiefe men among brother gaue letter handes maner whan iames sayde euery man allowed saiynges thapostles seniours whole congregacion thought expediente certayne shoulde chosen oute noumbre goe wyth paule barnabas antioche chose couple wer knowen men good credite thone iudas whiche hys godlye behauioure otherwyse called syrname iuste silas accoumpted bee moste vpright liuyng among thother brother gaue certayne message doe deliuered epistle carye tenour whereof pthe apostle elder brother sende gretynges vnto brother gentile antioche siria cilicia asmuche haue heard certaine whiche departed fro v haue troubled wordes encumbred mindes saiyng ye must circumcised kepe law gaue comaundement therfore thought good whe wer cum together one accorde send chosen men vnto welbeloued barnabas paul beyng men haue ieoperded theyr liues name lord iesus christ haue sent therefore iudas silas shal also tel thynges mouth semed good ye holy gost v charge necessarie thinges say ye absteyne thynges offered ymages fro bloud strangled fornication yf ye kepe selues ye shall well fare ye well apostle elder brother also whiche iewes becum christen men sende gretyng vnto gentile whiche conuerted christe nowe abydyng antioche siria cilicia forasmuche vnderstande certayne iewes came hence though bene sent v haue troubled wheras theyr cummyng ye quiet continued vuitie together lyuyng trade ghospell forasmuche sayde persones cummynge haue peruerted myndes theyr newe doctrine wylled circumcised kepe lawe gaue thyng commission haue thought good expedient assemblye whole conuocacion certaine amongest v purposely chosen shoulde sent vnto paule barnabas whome without good cause dooe fauour greatly tendre forasmuche haue auentured theyr lyues settyng furthe name lorde iesus christe wherfore haue sent iudas silas men know bee godlye faythfull whose reporte ye maye certaynlye haue knowledge thynges wryte whole summe wherof foloweth hath pleased holy ghoste mocion v one consent burden wyth thinges thoughte nessarye obserued saye fyrste ye absteyne frome sacrificed idolles leste yf ye eate ye myght seme fauoure supersticion whiche ye haue renounced forsaken secondly ye eate beastes bloude beast strangled vnlawfull meates forbydden lawe fynally ye absteyne whoredome whiche gentile supposed lawfull ye absteyne thynges ye shall well thus fare ye well whan therfore departed came antioche gathered multitude together delyuered epistle whan red reioysed consolacion iudas silas beyng prophetes exhorted brother wt much preachynge strengthened taried space lette go peace brethre vnto apostle notwithstandyng pleased sylas abyde iudas departed alone hierusalem paule barnabas continued antioche teaching preaching worde lorde manye done dismissed letter message whan came antioche delyuered letter congregacion whan audience al rehearsed whole multitude reioysed great comforte apostle elder common hierusalem vouchesafed theyr authoritie staye theym opinion whiche already conceyued theyr myndes iudas sylas hauyng gyfte expoundyng scripture satisfyed euerye man thynges namelye expressed letter accordyng commission apostle large exhorted brother made stedfaste theyr mynde wyllyng contynue begonne whan taryed good sorte dayes dimissed brother peace permitted returne vnto theym hadde sente theym forasmuche sylas thought best tarrye iudas returned alone hierusalem meane space paule also barnabas remayned antioche teaching indifferentlye bothe iewes also gentile preaching saluacion vnto euery manne obteyned yf woulde beleue gospell saye worde god pbut certayne space paule sayde vnto barnabas let v go agayne visite brother euery citie haue shewed worde ye lord see barnabas gaue cousel take iohn whose sirname marke paule would take vnto theyr cupany departed fro pamphilia went wt worke contencion sharpe betwene departed asonder one another barnabas toke marke sailed vnto cipres paule chose silas departed beyng comitted brother vnto grace god went syria cilicia stablyshyng congregacions came derba listra comaunding kepe preceptes apostle elder good space paule became carefull disciple hadde lefte cypre pamphilia sayde vnto cumpanion barnabas let v go visitte brother abrode city wheras haue preached woorde god see barnabas allowed hys sayingesbut paule woulde take vnto theyr companye c hys mynde haue iohn whiche otherwyse called marke go brought whan toke theyr iourney thytherwardes whiche matter paule dissented disagreed hym thynkyng hym mete receyued parte businesse seeyng tyme hys owne accorde forsaken finished businesse whiche taken hande sayled backe pamphilia antioche earneste disputing reasonyng matter none woulde gyue place one departed cumpany anye greuous displeasure arysen betwene greate apostle contended bryng passe thought expedient setting furth gospell haue example lefte v streyght wayes esteme euyll whatsoeuer disagreeth opinion matter dyuerse opinion mennes myndes agree furtheryng ghospell god also prouyded dissencion apostle whan two chiefe capitaynes wer disseuered ghospell sprede large yf continued together one companye done barnabas taking marke sailed cypre whiche hys natiue countreyeand barnabas toke marke sailed cipres paule takyng hym sylas whiche god woulde remayned antioche euen bene none purpose paule shoulde destitute sad man beare cumpanye manne good estimacion beyng dimissed brother committed grace god toke iourney whither euer token hope ye gospel haue increase went ouer syria cilicia wheras hymselfe borne echewhere stablyshinge cumpanyes suche disciple gotten encreasyng also number purpose comaunded kepe thinges apostle elder decreed hierusalem concerning eschewinge cupany wurshyppers idolles eschewyng whoredome strangled beastes bloud none otherwyse bound kepe moses lawe whan thinges done cilicia returned againe derba listres xvi chapter beholde certaine disciple named timotheus woman sonne iewesse beleued father greke reported well ye brother lystra iconium hym woulde paule goo forth wt tooke circumcised iewes whiche wer quarter knewe father greke beholde certaine disciple whose name agreed dedes called timothie man woulde saye estimacion god borne parentes sondry sectes mother beyng nowe widowe iewe borne late bene conuerted faythe peruerse beliefe iewes vnto true faith christe father gentile timothie hys vertuous disposicionof whome reported wel brother listra iconium lyuing muche spoken among brother listres also iconium paule desiring nothyng meanes dayly enlarge boundes gospell searched euery corner suche might serue turne euen ambicious kinges accustomed whiche beyng wholy gyuen enlarge theyr dominion care nothynge get mete capitaynes ruler whome may commit affaire sufficient captayne guyed matter ghospell haue meane quality yet vpright behauioure muste haue commendacion good men leste euil name going thoughe false may hurte furthering gospel wherfore paule desyrous haue timothie beare cumpany iournies good estemed also good men bee good vertuous whan obteined hym ioyne hym circumcised thought myght therby obteyne saluacion whiche onely fayth coulde doe le te iewes shoulde make commocion whome small noumber partes vouchesafed rather suffer timothie lese lytle piece skinne yf styll keptefor knewe yt father greke bene better yet worse lacke occasion thereof turne awaye iewes myndes gospell whose stubbrenesse knewe well enough gentile free burden lawe decree apostle made ierusalem paule beeyng present circumcision profession made obserue lawe token therof iewes yet openlye delyuered yoke lawe whiche ought litle lytle abolisshed wherfore seeyng euident al token timotheus mother iewe borne father paynym occasion whereof hytherto circumcised paule tyghte well perceyued iewes woulde make sedicion yf myght haue neuer lytle cause speciallie yf timothie whiche halfe iewe borne onely made pertaker gospell without circumcision also called office preacher wherfore paule dayes beare muche theym hauyng euer respecte gospell kepe men quietnes whiche professed christ authour true peace went city deliuered decree kepe wer ordeyned apostle elder hierusalem wer congregacions stablished fayth encreased numbre dayly thus whatsoeuer city wer wente commaunded heathen wer becum christen kepe thynges bene decreed apostle elder hierusalem whyche purpose iudas sylas sente antioche leste iewes fynde faulte therwith god furthered paule hys businesse ye congregacions disciple wer establyshed fayth gospel dayly also augmeted many person beyng day day conuerted fayth whan gon throughout phrigia countreye galacia wer forbydden holy ghost preache word asia came mysia soughte go bi hi ia spirit suffred whan goen mysia came downe etoada whan trauayled ouer phrygia galacia greate profite wynnyng many fayth although thei grosse rude people muche desyrous take iourneye towardes parte whiche properly called asia holy ghoste woulde suffer theym preache gospell secrete priuie wyl god obeied forasmuche sittyng manne withstand god chaungeyng entent turned mysia fast borderyng vpon cou treye properly called asia thence attempted take iourney towardes bithinia turnyng theym northwarde noble prouince romaynes therfore hoped haue great auau tage spirite iesus whiche theyr guide would permit go thither cause vncertayne wherefore returnyng backe towarde weste whan goen ouer mysia came troas citie phrigia ioynyng nere vnto sea otherwyse called antigonia pand vision appered paule nighte stoode man macedonia prayed hym saying cum macedonia help v sene vision immediatly prepared go macedonia beyng certifyed ye lord called v preache gospel vnto whe loosed forth troada came strayght course samothracia next day naples thece philippos ye chief citie partes macedonia free citie wer citie abydyng certayne dayes ye sabboth dayes went ye citie besides riuer men wer wont pray sate downe spake vnto woman resorted thyther paule visio slepe shewed whither goe vision stoode hym certayne man appareled lyke man macedonia entreated hym sayde cum macedonia helpe v appered aungell defendout countreye soone paule sene vision whiche hadde twyse bene forbydden ye holy gost preache ghospell cumpanions glad also wrote thys iourneye prouyded al thinges take iourney macedonia beyng assured god called v thyther preache gospell vnto theym whiche doubted god woulde prospet wel thys wyse leauyng troas aylyng chersonesus ariued samothrace yland whiche situate directly chracia thence nexte daye came naples whiche citie sea syde march thracia macedonia thence citie philippos whiche free citie first ye come vnto whan ye go naples citie abode certayne dayes lookynge good tyme occasion begynne matter wherfore came sabboth daie walked foorth citie certayne place wythout ye gate nere riuer greate multitude people together customably resorte assemble make praiers syttyng talke vnto certayne wemen wer come thyther preachyng vnto iesus nazareth pand certayne woman named lydia seller purple citie thyatira whiche worshipped god gaue v audyence whose herte lorde opened atte ded vnto thynges whiche paule spake baptised houshould besought v saying ye thynke beleue lorde cum house abyde constrayned v emonge theym one whiche veraye deuout whose name lidia seller purple one borne citie thyatira whiche citie lidia emong hearkened vnto paules preachynge christe god opened herte diligently heare thynges paule taughte christened housholde desyred paule companion saying ye haue thought one vnworthye receyued meane baptisme instruction partaker ghospel pray much also cum house honour youre presence take ethnicke erewhiles take nowe renewed fayth gospell throughe ministery woordes entreated apostle tary gestes house good space example preacher refuse ientylnesse profered vnto theym newlye conuerted christe yf readely instauntly profered leste seme knowledge theyrs syde ought preace vntyll desyred lest seeme craue rewardes preaching ghospell hathe receyued spirituall ghostely benefyte ought ernestly cause haue doen hym receyue handes againe corporall benefytes yf shall haue nede therof pand fortuned went prayer certaine damsell possessed spirite prophecied met v brought master maystres muche auauntage propheciyng folowed paule v cryed saying men seruauntes moste high god whiche shewe vnto v waye saluacion dyd many dayes paule contented turned aboute sayde spirite commaunde ye name iesus christ thou cumme came houre chaunced wer goyng praye custome certayne damsell met v whiche spirit deuyll pithon whiche propheciyng tellyng thinges hand gotte greate auauntage master maystresse ouertakyng folowyng paule v cryed saying ne seruauntes high god whiche cum teache way saluacion contynued thus dooyng many day paule beeynge dyscontented leste shoulde seme knowlege prayse whiche wenche beeyng possessed dyuell attributed vnto hym turned sayed spirite commaunde name iesus christ thou depart spirite lefte immediately whan mayster maystres sawe hope gaynes gone attacked paule silas dreue market place vnto rewlers brought officer saying men trouble citie saying iewes preache ordinaunces whiche lawfull v receiue neyther obserue seeyng romaynes people ranne againste theym offyce rent clothes commaunded theym beaten roddes beaten theim sore caste pryson commaundynge iayler prison kepe theim diligently whiche whan receiued suche commaundement thrust inner pryson made theyr feete fast stockes damsel maister maystres seyng theyr bautage goen toke paul silas brought violently market place chiefe citie officer accused theym saying men whiche cum hyther sum straunge cuntrey trouble whole cytie forasmuche beeyng iewes borne teache v newe relygion teache v newe ordinaunces whiche lawfull v receyue seeyng lyue accordyng lawes romaynes whiche wyll permitte ne suffer v neyther receyue straunge goddes practyse newe kyndes wurshyppyng goddes upon complayntes people emog veray name iewe great hatred clustryng cage together made assaulte vpon apostle officer satysfye people furye cut sondre theyr garmentes wrathe commaunded beaten roddes beeyng satysfyed punishement wha laied many sore stripe theim caste pryson commaundyng iaylour kepe dyligently iaylour whan streyghtly charged hym better safegarde layed theim beneathe lower pryson yet contented sette faste stockes lucke theyr fyrst entryng preache macedonie marke euermore either lucre ambicion el supersticion letteth furtheraunce ghospell whan worlde moste cruelly rageth persecucion christes member especially appereth comforte heauen mydnyght paule silas prayed lauded god prysoners hearde sadenly great ert quake foundation pryson shake immediately al dores opened euery mannes bandes wer loosed keper pryson waked slepe sawe pryson dores open drewe swearde woulde haue kylled hymselfe supposing prysoners bene fledde paule cried wt loude voyce saying thy selfe harme mydnyght paule sylas passyng theyr whyppyng yet cast pryson praied song hymnes laude prayse god thankyng hym vouchesaued theym beeyng hys seruauntes suche honour lette theym suffer iniuries hys name whiche prysoners hearde theym meryly syngynge prayse godal dore opened euery man bandes losed hys sonne iesus christe meruayled suche aduersitie coulde merye sodaynely came greate yearthequake insomuche whole pryson shaken euen foundacyon doores pryson open prysoners gyues lyke bondes loosed keper greate noyse tumblyng made awaked whan starte foorth founde pryson doores wyde open thynkyng vpon verely imagynyng prysoners gone hauyng remembraunce charge officer pulled hys swearde aboute kyll hymselfe wyllyng rather slaye hymselfe fyrste suffer manye paynefull tormentes afterwarde hangmannes hande whiche execucioner towne suffer death paule whiche laye beneth darke seyng hym suche dede cryed wyth loude voyce although man astonied yet made hym hearken vnto hym sayde beware holde thy handes hurt thy selfe thou shalte haue damage v one v fled hence pthan called lyght sprang came trembling vnto paule fel downe feete paul sylas brought sayd syrs must doe saued sayd beleue lorde iesus thou shalt saued thy housholde preached vnto hym woorde lorde house toke houre nyght washed woundes baptised al householde streyghtway whan brought hys house set meate ioyed hys householde beleued god whan keper heard wordes came himselfe againe commau ded lyght broughte seyng thynge done crafte man sum diuine power consyderyng also wyth hymselfe howe paule sene darke cause therof went downe lower pryson fel paules sylas feete regarding charge yt geuen officer brought forth pryson commodiouse place sayed maysters must saued hys mynde exchaunge helth helth hys entent saue theyr lyues lykewyse mynded heare theym howe shoulde obteyne lyfe soule aunswered beleue lord iesus thou shalt saued thy householde streyghtewayes called theym together apostle preached vnto theym doctrine ghospell thou mayest see tyme ne place vnmete preache heare ghospel darke stynkyng prison churche apostle ceased syngyng hymnes thoughe mydnyght preachyng gospel pryson vauntage gotten christe pryson chayre preache gospell furthwith keper beyng newly enstructed fayth hastened recompense sumwhat rewarde enstructour anone asyde wasshed cleane theyr woundes iaylour thought hys duetie hymselfe afterwarde whole householde woundes theyr soules wasshed cleane awaye doen led house dwelled daye tyme gaue meate refreshe theyr body baptisme nexte communion table keper pryson reioysed muche bene chaunce haue custodye suche prisoner wherby house receiued faith thynges done night pand whan daye officer sente minister saying let men go keper prison tolde saying paule officer haue sent worde looce therfore gete hence go peace saied paule vnto haue beaten v openly vncondemned romaine haue caste v pryson would sende v away pryuely nay verily let cum themselfes set v minister tolde wordes vnto officer feared whe heard romaynes came besought brought desyred departe citie whan daye officer diligently hauinge matter communicacion weyed well sente minister keper commaundyng hym let paule sylas departe owne lybertye keper hearyng thys tidinges beyng glad well owne parte apostle sake brought woorde paule officer lycenced go lybertie wherfore sayth keper seyng hath well chaunced go ye goddes blessyng paule earneste mynde make innocencie better knowen fynde occasion also saue many made answer vnto messenger wisenay verily let come themselues see v forasmuche boaste themselues cytezens rome theyr lawes forbidden punishe man hearde pleade cause lawfully conuicted notwithstandynge haue openly beaten v beeyng romaynes pleaded matter lawfully conuicted though thys lytle caste v also sore beaten pryson nowe owne sauegarde maye seme haue done nothyng theyr office woulde beare maie thoughte gilty woulde haue v priuily couey selues hence yt intent men myght suppose brake pryson fled awaye wyll let cum themselues delyuer v hence ryght cast v minister told officer paule sayed hearyng citizen rome came themselues paul silas desired pardone doen agaynst custome romayne lawes beeyng compelled commocion people bryngyng honourablye kepers house desyred leste people shoulde make busynesse departe theyr citie named philippos went pryson entred house lydia whan sene brother comforted departed apostle contente accomplyshe request whan pryson went house lydia first hosted lydia whole householde receyued doctryne ghospell whan seen rest ye brethre comforted rehearsyng vnto chaunced nyghte while prison exhorting continue begon doen lefte philippos citie went another waye pthe xvii chapter pa made theyr iourney amphipolis appollonia came thessalonica synagoge ye iewes paule manier wente vnto three sabboth day declared scripture vnto opening alleagyng yt christ must nedes haue suffered aryse vp agayne death thys iesus chryst fayed preache vnto theym beleued came copanyed paule sylas deuoute grekes great multitude chiefe woman fewe passyng amphipolis apollonia city macedonie came thessalonica whiche chiefe head citie macedonie noble cytye synagoge iewes therfore hoped haue great encrease wherefore paule customably vsed entred multytude sinagoge thre sabboth dayes reasoned allegyng parte prophecy scripture expoundyng harde meanynges figure cityng testimony lawe conferryng sayinges together actes past shewed howe wyll god christ wyse suffre worlde aryse agayne fro death lyfe forasmuche prophecy spoken afore messias commyng thynges shadowed vnder figure agree iesus nazareth affyrmeth teachinges iewes looke none messias preached vnto christ whan paule reasoned matter sinagoge certayne iewes beleued ioyned themselues paule silas besides great number gentyles feared god conuerted faythe mong dyuers wurshipfull woman chiefe citie pbut iewes whiche beleued indignacion toke vnto euill men whiche vagaboundes gathered companie set citie roare made saute vnto house iason sought bryng people whan founde drue iason certayne brethre vnto heades cytie criyng trouble worlde come yther also whome iason hath receiued priuily dooe contrary decree cesar affyrmynge another kyng one iesus troubled people officer citie whe heard thynges whan sufficiently aunswered iason others let go parte certayne iewes beeyng ouermuche wedded moyses lawe whiche paule sometyme earnestly fauoured beyng zele moued ioynyng themselues certayne numbre naughty vagaboundes made theyr parte suche fellowes haue authours commocion nede gatheryng great companye besydes reysed vp cytye sediciously commyng house iason woulde haue brought paule sylas furth people forasmuche entryng house founde sought brought iason hymselfe hym certayne discyples gouernours cytye criyng alowde tyme serued christe sayed felowes alreadye haue troubled worlde nowe cumme hither lykewyse trouble v iason knowyng suche felowes receyued house goe suche matter lodge go doe agaynste cesars actes forasmuche saye kyng besydes cesar preache one iesus good whyles since doen nayled vpon crosse cesars deputie affyrmed hymselfe kyng iewes marke howe abuse name authoritie cesar agaynste ghospell whan people rewlers cytye hearde woordes muche moued therwyth euen pylate lyke manier moued agaynst christ cried vnhappy iewes haue none kynge besydes cesar agayneand whan sufficyently answered iason c thou let hym goe thou arte cesars frende yet agayne whosoeuer maketh hymselfe kyng withstandeth cesar parte true iewes thus doe crye haue none kyng onely iesus nazareth agayne whosoeuer conformeth himselfe folowe cesar christes frende onely kynge ouer worlde iason brother alleaged lawfull excuse officer let goe pand brother immediatly sent away paule sylas nyght vnto berea whan cum thyther entred sinagoge iewes noblest byrthe emong thessalonica whiche receyued word al diligence mynde serached scripture dayly whither thinges euen many beleued also worshypfull woman grekes men fewe iewes thessalonica knowledge word god preached paule berea came moued people whan brother perceyued throughe displeasure malyce paul silas lyke daungier spede conuaied pryuely nyght season berea whiche citie macedonia far pella wheras alexander greate borne thys wyse euangelicall captaynes flye neuerthelesse fyght styll soone came berea entred synagoge nothyng afrayed many sedicions iewes raysed agaynste gentyll others thessalonica receyued doctrine ghospell veray readely euery daye searchyng scripture diligentlywhan iewes thessalonia knoweledge woorde god preached paule berea myght see howe thynges learned thapostles instruction agreed prophecy figure lawe many citizen berea conuerted faythe iewes onely also dyuerse wourshipfull woman grekes borne greate noumber men besydes whan iewes thessalonica whiche made
