commocyon heard ghospel preached berea paule whome dryuen tooke iourneye thither doen eftsones stirred vp multytude also apostle immediatly brother sent awaie paule gooe sea syde sylas timotheus abode styl guided paule brought hym vnto athens receiued commaundement vnto silas timotheus cumme spede came theyr waye time brother perceyued daungier yf apostle taryed immediatly sent forthe paule whome thoughte moste daunger goo take sea whiche far berea silas timothie remayned berea brother brought paule thither taking shypping broughte hym farre athens left paul returned berea hauing message fro silas timothie yt folow sone might conueniently whyles paule wayted athens spirite moued whan sawe citie geuen worshipping image dysputed synagoge wt iewes ye deuout persones market dayly yt came vnto hym chauce certaine philosopher epicure ye stoickes disputed paule though wer left alone without companion yet seeyng noble citie full learned men wholy vtterly geuen worshipping idol waxed hote spirite muche coulde abyde cummyng felowes entred sinagoge ther disputed iewes deuout person besydes also reasoned market place came vnto whether iewes el grekes among whome philosopher epicure secte stoickes betwene great diuersitie opinion thei epicure sect mesuring felicitie pleasure thinke either god nothing regarde lyfe man stoickes besides straung opinion dooe sette esteme felicitie man stedfast quality soule whiche felicitie call vertue honestie men disputed paule bene philosopher begynner newe secte saide wyll babler saye others sayde seemeth tydynges bringer newe deuyls preached vnto iesus resurreccion tooke hym brought hym strete mar saying may knowe new doctrine wherof thou speakest thou bryngest straunge tydynges eares woulde knowe therfore thinges meane athenian straungiers whiche gaue selfes nothing el eyther tel heare newe thing paule taught euangelycal philosophie whiche farre dysagreed philosopher opinyons sayde mockage pratelyng felowe sayeth reprochefull worde spermologus grekes meaned iangler foolyshe talker vayne wordes pratler heauenly wisedome semed vnto theym foolyshenessehe semeth tydinges bringer newe deuilles others sayde semeth bryng newe kynde god preached vnto iesus true sauiour sonne god dead tyme cum shoulde aryse agayne athens accordyng bene instructed plato called god child god whome supposed haue bodyes whiche shoulde continue euer wherefore inasmuche while market place diuerse opinion paule thought beste leade aside strete whiche called mar strete strete place athens muche resorte people reason sit matter lyfe death nyght season place meete kynde disputacion whiche profered saluacion theym beleued therein death vnfaythfull sayde maye manne learne newe kynde doctrine thou speakest kyndes philosophye treated amongeste v yet thou shewest v newes neuer hearde yet therefore desyrous heare large ende thinges maye growe thou speakeste meane asmuche citie namely emong city grece moste exercised kyndes learnyng gyuen eloquence occasion wherof many resorted thyther partes worlde studentes bothe citizen athens straungiers wer continuing nothyng el either harken newes el tell newes theyr pleasure desyred knowlege matiers better experte god desirouse mannes healthe fyshers hunter doe inuent meanes get praye taketh euery man occasyon thynges moste delyted ppaul stode middes mar streate said ye men athens perceiue thynges ye supersticious passed behelde maner ye wurshyp goddes founde alter wherin written vnto vnknowen god ye ignorauntly wurshyp hym shewe vnto god made world seeyng lorde heauen yearth dwelleth temple made handes neyther wurshypped men handes though neded thyng seeyng hymselfe geueth lyfe breath al men euery hath made one bloud nation men dwel al face yearth hath appoynted howe longe time also endes theyr inhabitacion shoulde seke god myght fele fynde though farre euery one v lyue moue haue certaine poetes sayd also hys generacion forasmuche generation god ought thinke godhed lyke vnto golde siluer stone grauen crafte ymaginacion man wherefore paule knewe howe behaue himselfe emonge sortes men frame eloquence mennes capacity nowe beeyng myddes mar strete stage playe parte alone hauing aboute hym great multitude spake vnto thys wyse ye men athens although citie flourysheth learnyng knowlege yet perceyue ye concerning trade relygion veraye supersticious true religion dede chief parte phylosophye walked desirous knowe customes ordre citie markyng thiges yt ye haue honoure wurshyp emog thynges espied certayne alter whiche title graued made mencion vnknowen god wherefore deceiued say bryng newe straunge goddeswhome ignorautly wurship shewe vnto rather preach vnto yea euen veray vnknowen god whome ye wurshyp appeared title aulter ye knowe maye heareafter reuerently worshyp hym whan ye know hym ye haue hytherto vnknowen worshypped wyth supersticion whiche god forasmuche infinite mynde moste pure present euery yet sorte contayned one certeyne place ought beleued dwell temple mannes handyworke ymages made crafte mangod yt made worl e c neither dewly wurshipped sacrifice beastes thoughe eyther lacked el delited thyng doen mannes handes cummeth hys owne brayne infinite hymselfe able doe thynges shall please beyng also moste blessed naturally neyther hurted anye malice manne yet holpen seruyce manne doe yet somuche pryncipally best moste bountifull beneficial created made thys worlde maruaylously mannes cause ordeyned vse thynges conteyned thesame wherfore althoughe founder lorde gouernoure well heauen yearthe thynges theym contayned yet thynges taketh hymselfe fruicion reason hys eternall felicitie blysse hath nede externall outward goodnes augmentacion hys perfectnesse thys worlde hath lefte v worke muse maruayle mortall menne lyuyng therin myght perceyue wonderfull woorke power wysedome goodnesse maker hauyng therby knowlege hym shoulde loue hym greate reuerence wurshyp hym whose benefite haue fruicion many commodity yf aboue frame worlde hathe nede none thynges hathe made howe muche lesse maye bee thought delyted temple image el sauoure burned offerynges asmuche substaunce without body ought wurshipped puritie ye mynd neither loketh slaughter ox shepe endoweth thynges lyfe gyueth breathe theyr lyfe breathseeyng himselfe geueth lyfe breath al men euery c made kyndes beastes liue al continuyng multyplying euery one owne kynde tyme tyme generation mankynde made one man haue rewle ouer beastes dwell partes worlde hathe lymitted appoincted euery man determinate space lyue whiche manne himselfe prolong hath lykewyse appoyncted euery nation certayne partes yearthe inhabite deceyued suppose world whiche god himselfe made rewled hym eche thing aduentures without consideracyon vnaduisedly brought forth purpose dede nothyng doen worlde great small cummeth prouidence created worlde wytte man cannot conceyue hym naturally dede reason grossenes body endowed menne reason one thinge maye vnderstande saye thinges cannot seene seene generall thynges particuler eternall laste tyme suche thynges mynde reason spirite onely maye ymagined open sens body set middes thinges stage serche creatore maker thinges meane creature whiche maye eyther seene felte otherwyse perceyued suche commodity dooe ensue manne therof like blind menne feling sumtyme fynde whiche see consyderyng howe wonderfully thinges made myght cumme summe knowledge god whome haue true knowlege highest felycitie manne haue yet shall nede seeke god foreyne thinges may fynde hym selues yf euery manne wyll looke hymselfe marke hymselfe myghty wysdome goodnesse maker god hath shewed vnto v certaine toke godhed heauenly balles circle aboue yearthe beneth sea lyuing creature yearthe yet hath wrought none theym wonderfully manne yf man grosse wyt capacitie cannot attayne knowlege mouyng starres skye aboue ebbyng flowyng sea water shoulde fyrste spryng howe ryuers shoulde styl euermore continue runnyng briefly priuie secrete cause lyke thingesfor lyue moue c nede loke far maye see god euery man hym dooe lyue moue haue beeyng none dettours vnto bee thyng created worlde nothyng benefyte none others haue lyfefor also generacion whiche muste sone forgoe leaue yf leaue v ought thanke none member partes lyuely body dothe eche dutie iyes see legges goe handes worke euident god euery one v woorketh v worke man woulde toole hymselfe hath made man expresseth god onely woorke expresseth woorkeman chylde doeth resemble father mother certaine lykenesse symylytude fauour complexyon doeth holy scripture teache v god made adam whiche firste manne whome men came body moyste cley wherein shoulde lyke vnto beastes owne mouthe breathed yearthen image parte heauenly breathe whereby might nere resemble god father nature bee sumwhat lyke shoulde easyly attaine vnto knowledge hym whiche propertie gaue none creature yearthe lyuyng thinke ye thynge vnlyke thynge trueth youre owne countrey menne poetes haue affirmed alleged scripture emonge aratus sayeth woorke called phenomenon halfe verse thys wyse cumme hys lynage matter thoughe speake iupiter called iupiter chiefe highest god thought hym withall father lyuyng thynges especially menne wherefore seeyng lynage god symylytude mynde whiche hathe geuen v haue euyl opinion oure father yf accounted menne parte v whiche cannot see whiche reason wyl thynke hym lyke image golde syluer woode stone grauen wytte manne greater inconuenience agaynste reason manne thoughe somewhat kynne god hys heauenly father yet nothyng lesse god shoulde hable make image hys handes haue power vertue god reason woulde thynge whiche wurshypped god shoulde excellent geueth wurshyppe vnto nowe howe diuerse wayes doeth man passe image whiche doeth wurshyppe god first al thys shape body man hathe receyued god besydes furthermore dooeth breath lyueth moueth worketh finally agilitie quicknesse minde beareth hym certayne resemblauce god father image suche mattier wherefore yf bee goddes greate dishonour yf wurshyp mortall manne god howe muche doeth disagre true honoure god wurshyppe image made tymber plased ye artificer make tymber yf bene disposed myght haue made benche fourme sit whiche thinge onelye nothyng lyke god hath body also besydes outward shape body hath nothyng lyke manne one iote parte whereby manne lyke vnto god pand tyme ignoraunce god regarded nowe byddeth men euery repent hath appoynted day iudge worlde rightwisenes man appoynted hath offered faith men raysed hym death whiche reprochefull iniury though haynous god yet greate fauoure loue beareth man hath reuenged himselfe hytherto hath wynked man ignoraunce vntyll tyme cumme determyned open hymselfe men caste cleane awaye darke blynde errours menne haue long bene conuersaunt whiche tyme present wherin monisheth leaue old errours turne hys wyl yt repent shal haue forgiuenesse whiche wil stubberne shal time cu haue hath appoynted dayebecause hath appointed daye whiche wyll iudge worlde c whan iudge whole worlde iuste streight iudgement man shal escape therfore sendeth messangers warne men lest man myght pretende ygnoraunce thinges excuse profereth remyssion synne wil repent lest say god merciful purpose chose iesus nazareth excellent person sente worlde cause al men meanes might conuerted wurshyp true god hathe geuen power iudge vnfaythfull wyll resyste thys doctrine whome promysed mouthes prophetes many yeres past shoulde cum bee bothe saluiour also iudge loke promised hath hitherto perfourmed certainly borne taught eue troubled vexacio slayne conclusion arose frome deathe lyfe prophecied shoulde doubte surelye perfourme thinges remayne behynde pwhan heard resurreccion death sum mocked sayd wil heare agayne matter paul departed fro among howbeit certaine men cleued vnto beleued among ye dionisius senatour woman named damaris whyles paul spake woordes certayne stoode gyuyng good eare thynges spoken whan hearde mencion made arysyng death life mocked vnlyke thing thyng beleued philosopher holden suche opinion though summe whiche sayed soules remayned lyue death body sum also whych sayed soules entred one bodye others rashe iudgement sayed wyl heare agayne tyme matter maner paule dimissed coumpany yet sum ther wer among wer perswaded ioyned themselues paule emong dionisius senatour afterward bishop athens instituted paule certayne woman whose name damatis besydes dyuerse others xviii chapter paule departed athens came corinthe found certaine iewe named aquila borne pontus lately cu fro italy wt wife priscilla ye emperoure claudius commaunded al ye iewes depart fro rome drewe vnto craft abode wrought theyr craft make tentes preached synagoge euery saboth daye settynge forth meane whyle name lorde iesus exhorted iewes gentyles whan paule gotten thus muche gaynes litle slender thoughe encreasyng auauncyng ghospel christe athens cytye corrupte manner wente thence corinthe whiche chiefest marte towne grece welthiest reason ryot incontinencie pryde vicious chaunce met man whose name aquila obserued iewes religion borne pontus whiche pontus part lesse asia bendyng towardes north person god would cum thyther late afore italye wt wife priscilla forbecause emperour claudius comauded al iewes yt rome wer great number auoyde citie wer crafte paule lodged one house togyther would alone labouryng dyd wyth hys handes leste shoulde burthen manne theyr crafte sowe together skynnes make tentes wythall lyke peter ashamed returne hys crafte fyshyng often nede compelled greate apostle paule whiche valiauntlye sustayned borne manye stormes christes sake nothynge ashamed take hande agayne sowyng skynnes whiche gospell tyme layed asyde yet thys meane whyle ceased preache gospel disputing sinagoge euery sabboth day iewes also gentile sylas timotheus come macedonia paule constrayned spirit testifie iewes iesus christ sayd contrary blasphemed spoke ayment sayd vnto blode vpon youre owne heades fro henceforth wyl go blamelesse vnto gentile departed thence entred certayne man house named iustus wurshipper god whose house ioyned hard synagoge howbeit one cryspus chiefe ruler sinagoge beleued n lorde householde mauye corinthian gaue audyence beleued baptised meane season sylas timothee whome paule willed folowe athens came frome macedonie dooen paule muche sorie dooen veary lytle good constrayned spirite neuerthelesse preache yet dylygentlye iesus nazareth iewes af yrmyng messias whome prophetes hadde promysed throughe hym onelye none man shoulde obtayne saluacion whan clamoured agaynste hym yea much afrayde blasphemouslye slaunderously speake agaynste iesus paule hauyng remembraunce gospell case woulde hym doe shooke lappe shoulde saye cast teeth freely brought vnto message saluacion whiche ought haue ioyfully receyued sayed vnto rather perishe saued stande ye owne harme asmuche ye occasion owne death seeyng haue doen duetye fault cannot layed wherefore wyll hereafter go gentile accordynge lorde commaunded v wyse withdrawyng himselfe cumpany iewes entred house certayn man named titus iustus syrname man well dysposed dwelte harde synagoge crispus whiche chiefe sinagoge reason dwelled nere beleued lorde hys whole householde diuerse others corinthian heard paule beleued christened pthan spake lord paule night vision afrayed speake holde thy peace man shall inuade thee shall hurte thee haue muche people citie contynued e yeare syxe monethes taught worde god whan paul neyther profited muche moste gredie desyre dilygente sekyng reason iewes didde stiffely barke agaynste hym hys mynde purposed leaue corinthus lorde stayed hys wauerynge mynde apperyng hym hys sleepe vision saying let stubbernesse iewes feare thee neyther kepe thou close doctrine ghospell theyr cause thou muste regarde inuincible malice fewe health many wherfore continue boldly preachyng gospell put thy truste shall reskewe defende agaynste theym neuer manye n man shall set handes thee vexe trouble thee wyll thy defendoure wherfore departe hence citie thoughe bee vicious greate numbre people whiche haue already appointed lyfe euerlastyng whan paul hearde leauyng forsaking purpose determynacion whiche mannes deuise obeyng counsell god continued corinthe yeare halfe constantely frankly preaching ghospell pwhan gallio rewler cuntrey achaia iewes made insurreccion one accorde paul brought iudgement seat saying fellow couselleth men wurshyp god contrary law whan paul aboute open mouth gallio sayd vnto iewes yf matter wrong euyll dede ye iewes reason would shuld heare questio wordes name law loke ye selues wil iudge matter draue seat grekes toke sosthenes chiefe rewler synagoge smote hym iudges seat gallio cared none thynges whereas one gallio beyng proconsull saye lorde deputie dyd dayes rule realme achaia vnder ceasar emperoure within whiche countreye sayed citie corinthe situate iewes whiche made conspiracie agaynst paule comocion among people drewe hym place iudgement lorde deputie sate accusyng hym saying man contrarye moyses lawe counseleth men wurshyp god newe sorte bryngeth newe trade religion whiche complaynte whan paul openyng mouthe make answere vnto gallio perceyuyng accusacion enditement brought declared howe controuersye betwene theym concerned iewishe religion dyd fynd meane ridde handes examinacion thereof preuentyng paule redinesse speake defence declaracion hymselfe sayed vnto iewes maysters occupie roume officer minister iustice cause authoritie emperour see ciuile iustice kepte nothing doen agaynst common ciuile lawes rome wherfore yf wrong doen man anye haynous dede mischiefe commytted ought punyshed lawes ye myght iustly compell yea duety heare serchyng suche matiers appertayneth vnto suche matier speciall priuate contencion growe emong seluesthan grekes toke sosthenes chiefe ruler synagoge name sectes comunicacion iewes religion countrey lawes emong certayne pryuate persones selfe neither appertayneth myne office discusse whiche ignoraunte lawe beste make ende youre selues medle suche matiers woordes caused auoyde place sate iudgemet grekes seeyng thys smote sosthenes whyche chief sinagoge household take paules part forsakyng iewes moued sosthenes paul supposed paule could haue doen nothyng corinthe vnlesse bene maynteyned sosthenes yet proconsul would meddle seyng businesse dissembleth sawe forasmuche romaynes hated iewes yet put difference betwene iewe christen man proconsull whiche romayne passe regarde one iewe dyd vnto another beeyng perfecte sorte people wonte euery busy full trouble contencion paule taried yet good toke leaue brother sayled thence siria priscilla aquila accoupanying shore heade cenchrea vowe came ephesus left entred sinagoge reasoned wt iewes whe desyred tarye loget time consented fare well saying must nedes feast cumeth hierusale wil returne agayne vnto yf god wil departed fro ephesus whan come vnto cesarea asseded vp saluted congregacio departed vnto antioche whe taried departed wente ouer al countrey galacia phrigia order strengthenyng disciple paul hauyng mynde warnyng god gyuen hym thoughe perceyued rage iewes daylye encrease yet contynued good sorte dayes laste perceyuyng gospel wel forward thought best depart season geue place furious rageyng iewes takyng leaue brother appoynted sayle siria hauyng aquila hym wyfe priscilla forasmuche paul perceyued iewes moued man borne vnder iewes lawe semed sette store tradicions lawe toke shyppyng cenchrea whiche hauen corinthe shore heade makyng solemne vowe accordyng custome among iewes craftily colour feigne regarde vnto charitie offended desyre wynne theym gospell therfore frame himselfe al mennes appetite nere could thentent myght wynne christ emong iewes ordred himselfe iewe whan emonge circumcised also behaued himselfe man vncircumcised thus bare space wedded supersticion could easely bee plucked vntyll suche tyme trueth gospell myght clerely spryng abrode make vowe shere thy head vpon thesame thinge whiche selfe euyll put confidence suche iewyshe ceremony damnable like manier circumcision hurteth man beleueth christe neyther yet vncircumcised whiche matier tyme parte charitie geue place vntyl man see oportunitie suche wyse whan shall haue oportunitie speake thesame matiers themselues nought must geue place mannes weakenesse paul neuer bare gentile matier comitting aduoutrye wurshyppyng idolles famyliar conuersacion together neglecting choyse meates cityng allegeyng poetes sometyme bare firste arryued ephesus whiche citie vpon sea syde lesse asia whiche properly without addicion wonte called asia lefte aquila priscilla desirous tarye dwell ephesus himselfe entring sinagoge iewes dwelte disputed theym whan desired continue great excused hymselfe toke leaue puttyng hope woulde shortely see theim agayne coumforted wise remedy muste nedes kepe feaste nowe hande hierusalem wyll returne agayne vnto goddes grace whan spoken wordes departed ephesus sayled towardes hierusalem whan hadde arryued cesarea cytie countrey palestine wente vp hierusalem saluted congregacion thence toke iourney antioche syria taried wente forewarde iourney begon goyng ouer countrey galacia phrigia confirmyng disciple fayth euery place wheresoeuer mette assembly thus carefull paule hys flocke wonne christe pand certayne iewe named appollos borne alexandria came ephesus eloquent man myghtie scripture enformed way lorde spake reuerently spirite taught diligently thinges lorde knewe baptisme iohn thesame began speake boldly sinagoge whan priscilla aquila heard toke vnto expouded vnto way god perfectly whe disposed go achaia brethre wrot e hortyng disciple receyue hym whiche cum helped muche beleued grace ouercame iewes mightilye openly shewing vp scripture iesus christ meane space one apollo alexandrian borne one kepte iewes religion man well learned good knowlege holy scripture came ephesus paul left priscilla aquila apollo halfe christen man learned rudimentes first rewles ghospeland knewe baptisme iohn christen men wyth feruente desire dyd communicate thesame others learned suche thynges knewe iesus sayed apollo christened christes baptisme wherby grace pletifully geuen taught diligentlye yet knewe sayed baptisme christe knewe onely baptysme iohn wherby penaunce taught preached apollo beyng yet fully enstructed thinges christ taught thought sufficiente whome whan priscilla aquila hearde boldely speake iesus yet suche sorte well perceyued hym bee fully instructed principle gospell seeyng hym endued many good quality appered woulde bee excellent preacher setter foorth christes name toke hym home seuerallye taught perfectly misteries ghospell according doctrine paul taught refused teacher whiche thoughe diligent yet perfecte syde disdayned monished manne euer gaue exaumple doyng suche oughte gently holpen forwardes whome hope doyng well remayneth agayne exaumple muste gladly learne man suche thynges knowlege wherof cannot let passe without perill damnacion apollo christened name iesus receyued holy ghoste afterwardes desyrous go achaia corinthe ende myght preache ghospell brother seeyng hym wyllyng hys accorde dyd set forwardes prouoked hym wrote letter commendacion disciple achaia shoulde receyue hymfor ouer came iewes myghtelye cumming thyther muche good vnto bene conuerted fayth valiauntly dyd sette foorth ghospell holy ghoste holpe set forwardes eloquence ioyned knowlege holy scripture whiche weapon beeyng armed stoutly put iewes sylence continually contended young sowen corne ghospell bladyng vp shewyng openly also playnelye euydente testimony scripture iesus messias iewes many hundred yeares looked thinges prophetes spake messias dyd agree xix chapter fortuned whyle appollo corinthe paul passed vpper coastes came ephesus founde certayne disciple saide vnto haue ye receyued holy ghost sence ye beleued sayed vnto haue hearde whether ther holy gost sayd vnto wherwith wer ye baptised sayed iohns baptisme sayed paul iohn verely baptised baptisme repentaunce saying vnto people yt shoulde beleue hym come yt christ iesus whe heard wer baptysed name lorde iesu whan paule layed handes vpon holy gost came spake tounges prophecied ye men twelue euen priscilla aquila hadde amended apollo suche poyntes lacked beeyng necessarye christen manne haue paule fyndynge others lyke takyng dyd while apollo corinthe whiche chiefe citie achaia chaunced paule goen ouer countreyes asia lesse whyche declyne mooste northe easte returned ephesus founde certayne disciple perfecte christian whiche one flocke emong brother wherfore paule intent myght perfectly instructe theym asked whether receyued holy ghoste synce tyme conuerted faythewe haue hearde whether holy goste forasmuche theyr erroure malyce plaine ignoraunce frakely aunswered freely dede sayed neyther haue euer hearde yet hytherto whether anye holy ghoste gyuen beleue saied paule forasmuche ye taken christen men whose baptisme ye baptised made aunswere baptisme iohn thought sufficient v sayed paule haue ye doen amisse tymes past ghospell came mannes knowleage abrode ye receiued iohns baptisme sufficient eternal saluacion lyke ye doctrine iohn perfect onely testifie iesus true gyuer saluacion shoulde come makyng readye theyr myndes beleue hym whan came dyd iohns baptisme wholy iustifie onely exhorted menne repentaunce theyr life mispet shoulde prepare theyr hertes phisicion woulde strayghte afterwardes come whiche baptisme throughe faith woulde take awaye maner synnes spirite enryche myndes faythfull heauenly gyftes grace tradicion apostle receyued iesus lorde beleued ghospell shoulde christened name father sonne holy ghoste erred onely simplicitie lacke knowleage onelye deserued thus instructed beyng warned hereof obeyed theyr counsellours immediatly christened name iesus lorde doen whan paule layed handes holy ghoste came thing selfe ensued dyd manifestly expresse visible token meaned speake diuerse language prophecied also hidden secrete thynges come numbre person men amounted euen dosen ther pand went synagoge behaued boldly space three monethes disputing geuyng exhortacions kyngdom god whe diuerse wexed hard harted beleued spake euell waye multitude departed fro separated disciple disputed daily ye schoole one called tyrannus whan paule doen man woulde saye renewed authoritie forasmuche beyng preacher gentile geuen holy ghost laying hande ouer faythfull euen apostle doen entryng sinagoge ye iewes dwelled openly freely spake men preachyng hope saluacion obteyned iesus onely whiche thing dyd fewe dayes space whole three monethes disputyng kyngdome god whiche heauenly spiritual agaynst tooth nayle stifly vpheld carnall kyngdome lawe whan certayne sinagoge gaue credence thynges spoken paule stubbernely resisted insomuche openly multitude blasphemously spake agaynst doctrine ghospell paule perceyuyng feared lest beleued myght bee corrupted malice left synagoge iewes dyd lykewyse separate disciple theym yet ceassed meane season preache ghospel dayly disputed schoole one tyrannus hauynge euen mynd image pure churche corrupted leauen synagoge whiche churche shoulde receyue none woulde learne woulde reiecte suche prater blasphemous person continued space two yeres dwelt asia hearde worde lord iesu iewes grekes god wroughte speciall myracles ye handes paul fro body brought vnto ye sycke napkyns partlettes disease departed euyll spirites went thus dyd continue space two yeres suche successe onely ephesian also diuers others iewes gentile resorted thyther parte asia lesse whiche properlye named asia ephesus gaue eare vnto ghospell myracles cause beleue preachyng god wrought many also great woonders handes paule insomuche put awaye disease woordes touchyng onely also napkin partlettes whiche touched paules bodye caried sicke faynt coulde come paule touchyng therof aswell disease also euill spirites put away great confidence paul iesus preached pthan certayne vagabound iewes exorcistes toke vpon call ouer euil spirites name ye lord iesus saying adiure iesu paule preacheth wer seuen sonnes one sceua iewe chiefe ye priestes whiche euyll spirite answered sayd iesus knowe paule know ye man euyll spirite ranne ouercame theym preuayled agaynst fled house naked also wounded knowen iewes grekes also dwelte ephesus feare came name lord iesus magnified many beleued came confessed shewed workes many whiche vsed curious craftes brought theyr bokes burned al men accoupted price found fiftie thousand siluerlinges mightily growed worde god preuayled whiche thing whan certayne iewes perceyued whiche sorte men go lucre cast euil spirites certaine ceremony solemne prescribed woordes coniuracion crakyng receyued thys cunnyng salomon affirmed authour therof also attempted cast euyll spirites inuocacion name lorde iesus bycause entended set foorth glory name woulde endeuour themselues men good supposed thereby get aduauntage greater name wherfore chaungeyng certayne wordes wherewith hadde woonte coniure sayde euill spirites coniure name iesus paule preacheth ye departe especially dyd seuen sonnes one whose name sceua whiche iewe one chief priestes whan attempted wyse proue thys kynde coniurationiesus kn e paule knowe ye certayne manne possessed euyll spirite euill spirite aunswered coniurers knowe iesus vertue whose name ye go feare knowe also paule seruaunt professour christe abuse name iesus paule lucre wheras ye disciple neither iesus ne yet paule assone spoken wordes man possessed wyth euyll spirite anne vpon exorcistes coniurers gotte ouer hade insomuche muche doe escape theyr lyues scarce got away last naked wounded oute house thing bruted abrode knowen throughe oute citie ephesus emong iewes gentile occupied sore afrayed euerye man muche praysed name lorde iesus whyche healthfull suche beleued well woulde bee applyed ye lucre glorye man mischaunce fewe dyd profytte many many one afrayed ensample sonnes sceua specially suche begon beleue gospell whan saw punishmente ready hande suchemany vsed curious craftes broughte bokes burned men called vpon name iesus vncleane heartes repayred paule confessing vtteryng offence penaunce might escape punishment god citie ephesus geuen supersticious craftes owne prouerbe doeth withnesse ephesian learning prouerbe sygnified sorcery wordes coniuracion whiche ephesian learned vsed might prosper haue good happe al thinges yt went might preuayle others thing attempted wherefore many citie whiche beeyng seduced eyther vsed iudaical coniurations el geuen credite vnto besides dyuerse vsed magical curiouse craftes brought bokes common market place burned sight al persones wherof great noumber value whan rated castyng accoumpte amounted summe fiftie thousande piece syluer coyne euerye piece beeyng value aboute grote sterlyng losse moneye greate aduauntage ye furtheryng ghospell meanes hereof worde god muche increace waxed strong whiche woorde saluacion fully without glosyng clokyng dyd embrace suche vprightly walke therin terrible thynges ended paule purposed spirite whan passed ouer macedonia achaia goe hierusale saying haue bene must also see rome sent macedonia two ministred vnto eue timotheus erastus hymselfe remayned asia season whan paul thus happely spedde space two yeares continuyng ephesus monyshed holy ghost departe thence purposed himselfe walke ouer macedonia achaia take iourneye hierusalem saying muste see rome also wyll fyrste go hierusalem whan fully decreed thus himselfe sent hym couple awayted hym saye tymothee erastus vnto macedonie gather mennes almesse succouryng nedy hierusalem myghte make readye theyr myndes agaynst paule came paule hymselfe stayed season asia pthe tyme arose lytle doe aboute way certayne man named demetrius syluersmith made siluer shrynes diana lytle beneficial vnto ye craftesmen called together wt workeme like occupacion sayd syrs ye know crafte haue aduauntage moreouer ye see heare alone ephesus almost throughout asia paule hath perswaded turned away muche people saying goddes made handes yt crafte cumeth parel set naught also temple great goddesse diana despised magnificence bee destroyed asia worlde wurshyppeth aboute thys tyme greuous commocion stirred vp agaynst gospell among ephesian iewes accustomed suche stycked ouermuche tradicion receyued theyr forefather concernyng supersticious wurshippyng goddes ephesian afore sayed wonderfullye gyuen curious learning diana gentile supposed great power enchauntementes therefore sayed three face headdes hecate cause greatly worshipped ephesus marke nowe lucre gaynes firste occasion commocion supersticious people furtherers ephesus dayes certayne man named demetrius siluersmyth occupacion demetrius maker siluer shrynes tabernacle diana moone colour somewhat resembleth siluer procured good craftes men ye occupacion small gaynes wherefore demetrius called together al suche aduauntage makyng ymages diana craftes men occupacion knewe would fauour cause crafte made sedicious oracion wyse maisters time v loke oure profyte oure endeuour nede make rehearsal well knowen vnto crafte gaynefull throughout asia reason diana worshipped religio yf shoulde fayle nedes muste folowe auauntage shalbe smalle ye bothe heare see matter playne open thys felowe paule hath preached ii yeres nowe goddes whiche made handes man goddes neyther ymage haue anye power goddes either grauen tymbre made anye metall mouldes preaching hath perswaded manye ephesus onelye also thorowe asia hathe turned huge noumbre people worshipping goddes nowe forasmuche crafte lyuyng thereby fynde also oure howsholdes shall el come yf preaching continue gaynes liuing wyll decay shall fall pouertie wherefore shoulde nowe let matter slippe myght well accoumpted slacke lokyng owne profites yf man present passeth light daungier leesyng profite gaynes decaye crafte whereby haue great lucre aduauntage yet common religion ought moue menne forasmuch suffer paule continue thinges without punishemente see feared leste temple greate goddesse diana whiche nowe great fame renoume whereunto men zeale deuocion haue dayly great recourse whiche enriched great offerynges shal processe bee reputacion mad wurshyp teple yf perswaded patrone teple god meane come passe yt goddesse full maiestie beyng day many cause iustely great honour shall lytle litle rooted men mindes hertes whereas nowe worshypped citye onely asia also thorow whole world therefore yf ye suppose wise mannes part see profite case ye thinke bee godlye thyng defende goddes countreye dishonoure nowe shewe youre selues men outright helpe withstande mischief hande pwhan herde thinges full wrath cried saying great diana ephesian al citie roare rushed co mon halle one assent caught caius aristarchus men macedonia paules copaignions whan paule would haue entred ye people disciple suffred certayne ye chiefe asia fredes set vnto desiryng would prease comon halle sum therfore cried one thing another cogregacion quiete parte knewe wherfore come together oracion myndes multitude stirred vp euery one began crie greate lowdnesse diana great goddesse ephesus sedicious clamoure whole citie ephesus stirred vp people ranne hastely multitude beeyng cleane al order mette together made strayght waye comon place citie play syghtes wonte shewed suche place commonly people beyng rage fury moste mayster beginneth frayes sedicions thither haled theym force violence couple men beeyng macedonian borne wete caius aristarchus whiche two companion paules whan paule vnderstandyng bene doen minde come forth multitude partly helpe felowes partely perswade pacifie people disciple woulde suffer hym thynkyng bee vnaduised parte delyuer hymselfe multitude beeyng suche rage seeyng coulde thereby nothyng ghospel besydes disciple others also pieres chief rewlers asia whiche although hitherto professed name christ yet inasmuche wished nothing good paule sente worde vnto hym required name woulde put himselfe daungier multitude muche moued agaynst vp greate roare meane space amog people many sodry murmouringes neuer one lyke another suche case commonlye chaunceth one cryed one thing doen another another thyng multitude gathered together diuerse nacions emong themselues sundrye myndes insomuche yea moste parte wiste matter come thither cumpany drewe forth alexander iewes thrustyng forwardes alexander beckened hande would haue geuen people answer whe knewe iewe arose shoute almost space two houres men cry great diana ephesian wherfore veray tyme required man make oracyon vnto whyche fauour people sodayne commocion myght meanes asswaged pacified one alexander compelled stande foorthe thickest prease people reason iewes dyd thruste hym forwarde cease thys sedicious commocion oracion man durste bee bolde treate make anye woordes matter multitude rage diuerse sondrye myndes forasmuche whatsoeuer shoulde bee spoken coulde bee chosen one parte would offe ded wherefore beyng thruste forwardes beckened wyth hys hande desyred geue eare vnto hym aboute haue made aunswere whan multitude vnderstode alexander iewe people wurshippe one god abhorreth goddes gentyles tumulte eftsones renewed forsomuche supposed would saye somewhat dishonour goddesse diana wherefore cryed one voice diana great goddesse ephesus thus continued cry space almoste two houres wha towne clarke ceased people sayed ye men ephesus man knoweth citie ye ephesian wurshypper greate goddesse diana image whiche came heaue seyng man sayeth agaynst ye ought cotente nothyng rashely ye haue brought hyther men neyther robber church yet despisers goddesse wherfore demetrius craftes men haue matter agaynst man lawe open rewlers let accuse one another yf ye go thig shalbe determined lawful cogregacio ieopardy accused day vproure forasmuch cause wherby may geue rekenyng cocourse people thus spoken let congregacion departe last whan scribe citie entreated multitude kepe silence alexander spake vnto wise ye men ephesus purpose ye make clamour buisinesse man lyuyng ignoraunt knoweth howe citie ephesus doeth wurship greate diana ymage fell heauen forasmuche man sayeth contrary thinges ye affirme ye nede make businesse ye must go peaceably worke nothing rashely ye haue brought hither two men whiche haue neyther committed sacrilege robbyng churche holy place ne yet blasphemie agaynst goddesse wer tha people might iustely flocke together reuenge quarell demetrius siluersmithe adherentes occupacion occasion al buisinesse haue matter lay mannes charge thei nede thus runne ope place whiche made purpose say enterludes pageauntes wrastlyng suche syghtes yet thus sediciously make vnlawfull assemblie greate clamoure woonder lawes citie session kept officer sent emperour name proconsul lorde deputy may discusse suche cause maye ende controuersies matter vitiaunce maye punyshe malefactours let pleade theyr matter occasion assembly forasmuche apperteyneth common medle priuate matter yet yf matter publike pertayned common al nedefull discusse sediciously yf ye require thyng bee doen maye brought passe lawfull assemblye called together haue authoritie due fourme accordyngly feared lest complayned vnto thofficers comocion thought went make insurreccion seeyng allege probable cause wherfore assemblye people gathered together common place enterludes sightes game whan thus sayde multitude departed xx chapter pafter rage ceased paule called disciple vnto tooke hys leaue departed go macedonia wha gone ouer partes geuen long exhortacion came grece abode thre monethes whan iewes layd wayte sayle siria purposed returne macedonia accoupanied asia sosipater berrea thessalonia atistareus secundus ga u derba timotheus asia tichieus trophimus going taried v troas sayled away philippos dayes swete breade came vnto troas fyne dayes abode seuen dayes commocion cleane ceassed paule called disciple together exhorted stedfastly continue matter taken hande concernyng fayth christ enbraced bad farewell departed towarde macedonia hadde walked ouer party macedonia geuen exhortacion large congregacions wheresoeuer chaunced meete wyth wylling continue puritie ghospell profite therin came part properly called grece whiche grece achaia situated continued space three monethes aboute departe thence sayle syria perceyued iewes layed awayt hurt iourney water therfore thoughte better take shyppyng hauen returne macedonia agayne thence sayle syria firste ariued whan came macedonia iourneye sosipater berrea sonne vnto pyrthus besydes aristarchus secundus beeyng thessalonian besydes also caius derba timothie v besides tichicus trophimus bothe beeyng asia men whyles paule taryed macedonia goen make ready thinges necessari entre sea without daungier taried oure commyng troas passed macedonia came philippos thence day swete breade whiche folowe easter immediatly departed wythin fyue dayes came vnto troas taried seuen dayes pand vpon one sabboth dayes whan disciple came together breake bread paul preached vnto ready depart morow cotinued ye preaching vnto mydnight wer many lightes chaber wer gathered together sate windore certayne young man named eutichus beyng fallen depe slepe paule preaching ouercome slepe fel thyrd lofte taken vp deade paule wente downe fell hym embraced hym said make nothing life whan come vp agayne broken bread eaten talked long eue tyll morning last departed brought young man alyue lytle coumforted chaunced wondrefull notable thing vpo one sabboth dayes whan disciple assembled theyr custome breake breade paule playing eache parte good pastour refreshed myndes preachyng scripture forasmuch purposed nexte daye departe thence continued preachyng vnto theym vntyll ferre foorth nightes leste nyght myghte haue bene occasion breake delectable pleasaunt sermon many candelles sollare wheras assembled among multitude certayne younge manne whose name eutichus sate one wyndores young man reason paul continued talkyng long wexed slepie last sore came slepe vpon hym fell flatlyng downe grounde three floores hyghe men ranne founde deade brought house whan paul perceyued came downe ensample prophete hely bended body lay vpon thoughe dyd enbracyng cherishe kepe warm deade bodye whan done turned hymselfe disciple muche troubled sodeyne chaunce sayde ye nothyng troubled chaunce yet lyfe hym bodye cleane deade whan thus comforted theym wente agayne vp sollare brake breade eate thereof whan agayne long commoned began lyght breake daye appeared toke leaue length departed paynefull thyng moste louyng father departe dere chyldren remayned young manne broughte hym aliue whose sollare agayne whych thyng dyd litle refreshe myndes presente sittyng worde bryngeth health men shoulde haue bene occasion young mannes death pand went afore shyppe leused vnto asson receyue paul appoynted would himselfe go foote cum together asso toke came mitilenes sayled thence came ye nexte day ouer agaynst chios nexte day arryued samos taried trogillion nexte daye came mileton paul determined sayle ouer ephesus woulde spende tyme asia hasted wer possyble kepe ierusale day penthecost fro mileton sent messegers ephesus called elder congregacion whan taken shippyng troas sayled asson whyche citie nere sea syde within countrey troas paul determined shoulde go thyther water would folowe lande either safer dooe el myghte salute moe waye mette togyther asson receyued paule shyppe came together mitilene whiche citie sea syde yle lesbus thence departed nexte daye came agaynste chios ylande lykewyse agayne daye folowyng arryued ylande samos thence sayled trogillion citie sea banke asia directly agaynst samos taryed nyghte nexte daye came mileton whiche citie caria althoughe oure saylyng coastes asia shoulde fyrste come ephesus trogillion mileton yet paule purposed himselfe passe ephesus lest shoulde spende awaye time tarying asia yf haue chaunced coulde safely watche beyng layd sayle siria hastened kepe witsontide ierusalem yf possibly myght yet leste shoulde seme eyther regarde el hate ephesian sent mileton wil thauncient curate co gregacion ephesus left charged thesame congregacion come vnto pwhich wha come sayd vnto ye know fro first day came asia maner haue ben wt al season seruing ye lord wt humblenes mynde many feares temptacions whiche haue happened vnto lyinges awayte iewes would kepe backe nothyng profitable vnto shew reache openly throughout euery house witnessing iewes also grekes repentaunce yt towarde god fayth towardes lorde iesus whome come spake thys wise brother shall nede reherse vnto vpright behauiour preaching ghospel vnknowen vnto selues whiche haue sene howe haue behaued selfe among whyle euen first daye came asia vntill houre sought myne owne glorye lucre haue obeyed comaundement lorde iesus christ preaching gospel haue al thinges bene coformable vnto wil inasmuche folowed steppe made lowe humbled hymselfe deliuered himselfe afflicted tormented dye might clense establyshe churche euen lykewyse hath bene conuersacion setting foorth gospell humilitie lowlynesse yea also shame whiche haue suffred enemyes gospel often teares whiche haue shed beyng careful congregacion muche affliccion trouble haue bene deceytes iewes cannot abide benefite gospel comunicated partened vnto gentile yet none al mischaunces haue troubled minde greatly haue tyme feare affliccion let passe thyng apperteined health neither yet haue spared though daungier lyfe open vnto thyng myght profitable instructe openly synagoges also priuely within menes house occasion hath serued preachyng vnto iewes myndes haue done say circumcisio obseruing sabboth dayes washynges repentaunce lyfe ye leade god requireth men maye saue men full confidence lorde iesus christe whose gospell whosoeuer beleueth shall saued whether iewe greke whether circumcised el vncircumcised therefore thesame fauour grace whiche indifferently profered vnto men haue indifferently preached vnto men hauyng respect person state degre manne beeyng feared discouraged malice iewes settyng foorth magnifying lawe doe withstande gospell yet dryuen fiercenes gentile whiche stiffelye vpholde maynteyne supersticion whiche haue receyued theyr forefather thatsame affliccion persecucion whiche dyd moue rather sawe co gregacion daungier leste man beyng offended mine aduersitie might alienated turned awaye ghospell passed ye shame put sorowes woe whyche suffred endured case tyme eschewe perill daungier dyd rather pleasure satisfye appetite hauyng respecte profit cared passed thyng losse myne owne lyfe pand beholde go bound spirit vnto hierusale knowyng thynges shall come holy gost witnesseth euerye citie saying bondes trouble abyde none thynges moue neyther life deare vnto selfe yt might fulfyl course ioye ministracio word whiche haue receiued lorde iesu testifye ghospell grace god glad haue done yea nowe thoughe bee free bodye bandes yet beyng spirite mynde holde take iourney towardes hierusalem verye certeyne wyll become onely holy ghost euerye citie partely mouthes prophetes partely myne owne mynde doeth sygnifie vnto shall come passe shalbe bothe fettered tormented whiche thing though bothe beleue knowe certaynelye shall chaunce vnto yet none al thinges make afrayed execute dutie apostle whiche called vnto though shoulde assured abyde paynes death labour lyfe muche regarde whiche cannot perishe beyng vnder tuicion christe esteme maysters commaundemente lyfe may ende course preachyng ghospel cherefully haue hitherto ioyfully abyden nothing deliteth ghospell maye furthered affliccions haue delite nothyng el styll runne forwardes race gospell wherein lorde hath set vntyll come marke beyng well assured shall accordyngly rewarded handes whyche mayster game whan shall see tyme owne pleasure without deceite auaunced selfe vnto office lorde iesus set roume preach aswell iewes also gentile mooste gladsome tydynges whiche hath pleased god frely saue euery man beleuyng ghospell wherfore willyngly herte wyll nowe fulfyl vocacion regardyng whether lyue dye behold sure henceforth ye thorow haue goen preaching kyngdoe god shal se face wherefore take recorde daye pure fro bloud men haue spared labour haue shewed al counsel god take hede therfore vnto selues flocke among holy gost hath made ouersears rule congregacion god whiche hath purchased bloud long conueniently myght present holpe towardes saluacion teachyng admonishyng exhortyng comfortynge rebukyng sawe occasion ofte recourse see nowe certayne inspiration holye ghoste ye shall neuer see worlde agayne neither ye ephesian yet others inhabitours lesse asia vnto haue already preached kyngdome god haue done duetie diligence vprightly wherfore seyng muste departe without hope returne proteste yf man peryshe eyther hys owne el others defaulte gylty theyr death haue shewed euery man true way euerlastyng lyfe haue opened vnto wyll god howe mynded saue mankynde muste continue stedfast belefe towarde oure lorde iesus suche wise man saye excuse himselfe knewe selfe haue gyuen ensaumple doyng also sufferyng al myght haue continue puritie gospell mannes death imputed nowe ariseth free wyll muste hence departe frome yet feare anye persecucion conuey selfe awaye wittingly willyngly goe vndoubted daungier lyfe beeyng wylled spirite christ wherfore ye cannot come presence muste ye supplye wyth youre owne dylygence see owne hertes fayle el foote slyde backe thynges ye haue well entred ye elder vnto haue comytted cure flocke watche partely behalfes lest ye seduced false apostle partely flockes sake whyche ye haue taken hande feede haue vprightly executed myne office assygned deputed oure lorde take ye lyke care thought semblable good wyll vprightnes behauiour flocke holy ghost hath made bisshoppes saye ouerseers take diligent hede christes shepe lacke holsome foode playe partes woulues faithfull shepeherdes towarde goddes owne congregacion whiche ye muste neglygently looke vpon forasmuche god set muche store purchased bloud sheddyng onely begotten sonne ye must therfore beware wyse ware whiche god hath derely boughte maye perishe miscary negligence pfor sure departyng shal greuous woulues enter among sparing ye flocke moreouer selues shall arise speaking peruerse thynges drawe disciple therfore awake remebre space iii yeares ceased warne euery one night day teares warne thynges aforehande earnestly nothyng tight certaynly assured shall still haue paules wyth departyng fierce rauenyng woulues shall prease among foldes destitute shepeherde whyche shall spare flocke shall assaye meanes disperse scatter congregacion bee feared leste suche weake beeyng euen ouerthrowen aduersitie forsake ghospell yet another daunger muche greater haue already spoken shall come onely foreyn place whiche feare threatnyng decytfull perswasions fayned cloked holinesse shall endeuour themselues corrupte pure lyuing withdrawe youre lybertye ye haue ghospell iesus christe also euen amonge selues shall certayne men aryse whiche betraying concorde vnitie myndes ye nowe shall speake wicked pernicious thinges suche thinges shall much swerue syneere veritie ghospell suche speaker shall meane entende labour ye christes flocke may safely preserued vnto haue dysciples owne name folowe tayles entente maye seme small fooles thoughe afeard lesse shoulde seme preacher nothing excellente altogether vnlearned vnlesse teache new straunge poinetes doctryne owne brayne denylishe newe inuencion whan men shall adde vnto gospell whiche selfe sufficient pastour shepherd dede rather christ dysciples himselfe haue disciple doeth good pastoure receyue meate wherewith fede men get themselues renoume owne pryuate worldly lucre make christes disciple theyr owne dysciples wyll thought founder doctrine ghospell whereof dede stewardes minister wherfore greater daungier hande muche dilygently watche ye hauyng styll mynde howe whan asia space thre yeres ceassed daye nyght admonishe warne euery one teares pand nowe brother commende god wo grace whiche able buylde farther geue inheritaunce among sanctified haue desired man siluer golde bestut yea selues ow yt handes haue ministred vnto necessity haue shewed thinges howe labouring ye ought receyue weake remembre worde lord iesu howe sayed blessed geue rece ue thus brother must parforce departe commite god wyll forsake flocke preachinge woordes ghospell wherin whatsoeuer parsones doe syncerely vprightlye vse themselues doe rather sette forth franke bountie goodnesse god whiche freely geueth men iustice lawe wyll fauour god helpe forewarde thesame parte accordynge duty haue cast foundacion god worketh thinges may buylde whiche begonne maye according wyl finished lyke hath hitherto chaunced vnto professyng ghospell bee sonnes god adopcion ye continuyng godly purpose maye atteyne ye heritage whiche promysed vnto suche sanctified grace god whether iewes el gentyles ye haue seen howe carefull haue trauayle haue taken ye haue seen perilles haue susteyned sake sekyng rewarde neyther honour neither aduauntage gaynes somuche haue receyued muche necessary handes whiche apostle abrode doe lawfully also good conscience myghte haue receyued neuer desired golde syluer apparell manne vnknowen vnto handes myne haue sufficientlye ministred thynges eyther felowes neded myghte haue taken thinges knowyng labourer worthy wage hiere thought better loke rewarde god endeuoured selfe meanes geue ryghte pexfite ensample ye haue succession receyued charge flocke may perceyue dutye good shepeherde whereas refuseth laboure profyte flocke yet absteyne receyuyng reward man weake leste man lothe maye beare wurse wyll ghospell compelled fynde curate el lest manne passe lesse woordes pastours maye thinke daungier forasmuche receyued benefite hande nature men suche sorte tell set lesse whome haue thing beneficiall although rightand remembre woordes lord iesu whiche bestowe rychesse treasure ghospell holpen againe youre temp rall goodes whiche vyle respecte comparison betwene yet knowyng many weake persones bee emong woulde gyue man occasion ymagine euyll v endeuoure selues folowe myne ensample nere ye maye hauyng styll minde lorde iesus sayde better gyue receyue whan thus spoken kneled downe prayed wepte sore fell paules necke kyssed hym sorowyng moste woordes whiche spake shoulde see face conueyed vnto ship whan paule thus sayed kneled downe custome lykewyse dyd thesame made prayer euery man wepte excedyngly insomuche toke hym necke kyssed takyng gredely fruicion hym streyghtwayes shoulde bee plucked awaye euery man sorye mynde departure moste specially one woorde paule spoken whan saied shoulde see face neuer worlde whan doen brought longe shyppe theyr duetye loked whyles sayled farre coulde see xxi chapter whan chaunced launched furth departed came streyght course vnto chou day folowynge vnto rhodes thence vnto patara whan gotten shyp would sayle vnto phenyces wente aborde set furthe whan cyprus began appere vnto v lefte left hande sayled vnto siria came tyre shyp vnladed burden sette vp sayle wer goen syght yt stoode banke lokinge v sayled streight furth arryued ye ylande called chou nexte day rhodes thence furth tyll touched patara whiche citie licia nere sea syde founde shyppe yt redye sayle towarde phenice toke shyppyng sayled therein whan ylande cypre appeared vnto v leauyng lefte hande sayled towarde syria arriued tyre whiche citie situate sea banke phenice sydon lykewyse desired rather sayle streyght foorth palestyne tyre marte toune master shyppe woulde nedes set marchaundyse lande pand founde brother taryed e seuen dayes told paule spirite go vp hierusalem dayes wer ended departed brought v waye wyues child til come citie kneled downe shore prayed whan taken leaue one tooke shyp returned home againe whan founde dysciples also taried seuen dayes emong whiche beynge enspired spirite prophecye counselled paule wyse go hierusalem yet seuen dayes expired departed tyre disciple child wyues accompanying bringyng v citie sea banke kneled downe made prayer one consent taken leaue one tooke shyppyng returned home againe pwhen full ended course fro tyre went downe vnto ptolomaida saluted brother abode one day next day paules cumpany departed came vnto cesarea entred house philip euangeliste whiche one seuen abode fower doughters virgin whiche dyd prophecie tyre sayled ptolomaida whiche citie sea nere hyll named carmelus saluted brother remayned one daye nexte daye paule wente furth iourney came cesarea citye palestine entred house philip whiche firste preached ghospell chaumberlayne samaritanes one seuen deacon apostle instituted ordeyned hierusalem abode man fower daughter vnmaried whiche aboundantly spirite prophecye accordyng prophecye iohel tarried good many dayes came certaine prophete iewry named agabus whan come vnto v tooke paules girdle bounde feete handes sayed thus sayeth holy ghoste shall iewes hierusalem bynde man oweth girdle shall delyuer handes gentile whan continued soiourning house certaine day came prophete iewry whose name agabus takinge lodgeing emong v bayting tooke paules gyrdle whiche knotted owne legges accordynge custome olde prophetes whiche wount expresse visible token thing prophecied thorough inspiracion holy ghoste sayed thus sayeth holy ghoste oweth gyrdle shall bounde iewes hierusalem shall delyuer ye handes gentile heard place besought would go vp hierusalem paul answered sayed ye weping vering myne herte ready bound onely also dye ierusalem name lorde iesu could turne mynde cealed saying wyll lorde bee fulfilled beeyng muche feared woordes dysciples also dwelled many wepyng teres desyred shoulde committe ne put himselfe handes iewes hierusalem godly affeccion zele lothe haue excellente pastour peryshe paule whiche certaine aunswere holy ghost mynde knewe fyrste goe hierusalem shoulde see rome sayed vnto wherefore ye make herte sory vayne teares daungier prophetes warne doeth nothyng moue youre douloure sorowe maketh sory pensyfe fully mynded thyng whiche holy ghost wylleth namely ghospell nothinge feare bondes whiche haue well enured god forbyd feare enpriso ment leaue furthering ghospell seeing ready yea yf dye hierusalem lord iesus sake let paule lye chaynes gospell maye haue free lybertie passe let paul lese lyfe glory iesus name maye lyuely spryng flouryshe emong men desirous lyfe none ende maye profite ghospell otherwyse woulde recken great aduauntage gotten shortly ryd lyfe christes sake wherefore ye mourne thing selfe desyrous yf shall please god cease ye therefore make mynde pensyfe wepyng waylyng cannot chose sad seynge frendes sad woordes wha nothinge aunswere sawe fully bent go hierusalem suffred hym departe saying wyll lorde fulfylled ought woordes true christian though haue ye woordes styll mouthes yet must continually thinke hertes aduersitie well prosperitie styll muste saye wyll lorde fulfylled dayes toke vp burthen went vp hierusalem went v also certayne disciple cesarea brought one muason cyprus olde disciple whome lodge whan come hierusalem brother receyued v gladly morowe paul wet v vnto iames elder came together whan saluted tolde order thinges god wrought among gentile ministracion whan taryed fewe dayes cesarea made readye oure selues take iourney towarde hierusalem disciple folowed paule went cumpany v citie cesarea bringing certaine man named muason ciprian borne whome hoste hierusalem knowen bee good godly man longe tyme beleued ghospell persisted continued sincerite faythe whan come hierusalem brother gladly ioyfully receyued v paule nexte day takinge v went iames house iuste whiche called brother lorde instituted apostle byshop hierusalem thyther assembled elder whome soone paule euerychone saluted rehearsed ordre god wrought emong gentile ministerye emonge whome nowe good sorte yeares preached ghospell heard gloryfied lorde sayed vnto thou seest brother many thousande iewes whiche beleue earnest folowers ouer lawe infourmed thou teachest al iewes whiche among gentile forsake moises saiest ought circumcise child neyther lyue customes therfore multitude must nedes come together shall heare thou art come therfore saye haue fower men whiche haue nowe take purifie thy selfe coste maye shaue heades shall knowe thinges whiche haue heard concernynge thing thou walkest kepest lawe whan heard matter glorifyed lorde also powred grace vpon gentyles forasmuche paule accused many iewes one abhorred moyses law settyng furth benefyte came ghospell yelded lesse obseruacio lawe ought entent remedy myght founde inconuenience also sayed vnto hym brother paule sayed thou seest howe many thousande iewes e beleue ghospell muche affeccionate lawe moses rumour come eares whiche knowe bee false thou teacheste iewes among gentyles forsake renounce moyses law neyther circumcise theyr child ne kepe trade theyr forefather concerning choyse meates kepyng sabbothe dayes washyng suche thinges iewes whiche conuersaunte gentyles great deuocion obserue folowe men beyng restrayned acte made forefather indifferently contented gentile burdened lawe iewes borne shoulde led awaye obseruacion lawe gentile kynde lyfe wyse abyde wherfore must take good hede sedicion made matter remayneth tha doen first cannot chosen multitude must called together wyll soone knowen thou art come wherfore entente thou mayest bee suspicion folowe counsell among v fower men whiche accordynge custome iewes haue taken vowe ioyne fulfyll together solemne ceremony desyre purified made holy theyr vowe yf thing besydes bestowed sacrifice offeringes bestowe lyke coste vntyll suche tyme haue shauen heades doyng euery man shall knowe suertie thinges false rumoured abrode shall also perceyue thou suche forte besydes doest preache gracious benefite ghospell without reprofe kepe ceremony lawe whiche god deliuered tradicions elder wha see thee reported disproue meanes shall iewes cease speake euyll whiche manye numbre must nedes inestimacion neglected pbut concernyng gentile whiche beleue haue wrytten concluded obserue suche thing saue onely kepe selues bloud thinges offered ydolles strangled fornicacion gentyles conuerted fayth haue writ late vnto agreed vpon decreed apostle whole cumpanye dysciples shall compelled kepe moses lawe sauyng onely absteyne fleshe sacrificed vnto ydolles bloude strangled beastes aduoutry pthen nexte daye paule toke men purified himselfe entred temple declaryng obserued dayes purificacion vntil offeryng shoulde offered euery one whan seuen dayes wer almost ended iewes whiche wer asia sawe temple moued people layed handes cry men israel helpe teacheth men euery people law place hath also brought brekes temple hath polluted holy place seen citie one etophimus ephesian supposed paul brought temple citie moued people swarmed together toke paul drue temple forthwith doores wer shut paul dyd councell iames brother takyng vnto hym fower persones whiche solemnely made vowe wente temple professynge dayes purifying wer finyshed omitted ne let passe ceremonye vntyll sacrifyce offred vp euery one required seuen dayes space accomplyshement therof whiche beyng almoste expired certayne iewes beleued whiche seen hym asia raysed commocion agaynste whan sawe paule temple stirred vp people laied handes paul cry ye israel helpe haue reporte hearde hath wandered ouer countreyes hath taught place newe doctrine againste people whiche god chose seuerally hymselfe lawe also whiche receyued god againste temple whiche great honour whole worlde yet wycked person contented hathe moreouer brought temple bothe grekes others circumcised hath prophaned polluted suspeded holy place duryng tyme paule citie dayly seen cumpanye one trophimus whiche ephesian borne thereby coniecturedand al citie moued c paule brought temple troublesome noyse citie reysed multitude flocked together toke paule drewe hym temple man worthy bee delyuered handes furious rageyng people hym woulde forthwith doores temple shut faste vp myght haue place whither myght safely escape sought oportunitie saye tyme waye conueniente kyll whiche thing lawefull theyr religion doe temple thoughe vngodly wicked thing place el sley innocente went kyll hym tydinges came high captayne souldiers al ierusalem moued whiche immediatly toke souldiers vnder captaines ran downe vnto whan saw vpper captayne souldiers lefte smytyng paul captayne came nere toke hym commaunded bound two chaynes demaunded doen sum cryed one thing sum another among people coulde knowe certayntie rage commaunded caried castell came vnto stayre fortuned borne souldiers violece people multitude people folowed cry away meane space tidynges came capitaine marcial romayne armye citie ierusalem reysed vp captayne forthwith taking ioyning vnto hym souldiers theyr vnder captaynes hastened whan iewes sawe captayne marciall hastening toward harnessed men surceassed lefte smytyng paule whan captayne come nere commaunded lay handes pauleand whan coulde knowe certaintie c bynde hym two chaynes supposyng bee haynous malefactoure forasmuche multytude ordred hym roughly sore doen capitayne enquyred iewes committed whan coulde haue certayne knowlege reason troublous noyse made eche syde roryng cry loude voyce one one thing another another thing commaunded paule shoulde bee brought castell bounde myght knowe trueth within place defence safe custody people beyng set aparte whan paul came stayghers castell caryed souldiers feare leste ye multitude shoulde violently take hym awaye feared leste woulde hurte coulde conueyghed castell multitude people folowed euen staighers castell cry high could awaye dyspatche awaye whan paule began caried castell sayed vnto high captaine maye speake vnto whiche sayed canste thou speake greke art thou egypcian whiche dayes madest vprore leddest wyldernes fower thousand men murderer paule sayed manne iewe tarsus citie cilicia citizen vyle citie beseche ye suffer speake vnto people whan geuen lycence paule stoode steppe beckened hande vnto people whan made greate sylence spake vnto hebrewe toung saying came entry holde paule beeyng desyrous satisfye mynde iewes made businesse sayed captaine marciall maye please geue leaue speake vnto marciall aunswered canst thou skill greke toung paul spoken woordes greke art thou saied marciall egipcian hast made commocion lykewyse leaddest fower thousande murderer hence deserte paule aunswered whome take iewe borne natyue countrey tar u noble citie cilicia praye geue lycence speake mynde people wha permitted paule standyng steppe beckened wyth hande certified people token woulde speake vnto streyghtwayes sylence made began speake wyse hebrewe tounge xxii chapter pmen brother father heare ye myne aunswer make nowe vnto heard spake hebrewe tongue kepte sylence saieth verayly manne whiche iewe borne tarsus citie cilicia neuertheles yet brought vp citie feete bamaliel infourmed diligently lawe father feruently mynded godwarde ye daye persecuted waye vnto death byndyng deliueryng pryson men woman chiefe prieste doeth beare wytnes esstate elder also receyued letter vnto brother wente damasco bryng whiche bound vnto ierusalem punished ye menne whiche present partely lynage brethre partely auncient yeares dignitie father gyue eare while purge selfe thinges wherof falsely accused vnto wha paul spoke wordes manier preamble ye multitude heatinge speake hebrewe made ye silence whither yt euery man vnderstoode language el ye al men beare fauour owne countrey speache paul procede goe furth tale wyse entent ye maye perceyue haue committed nothing blasphemously eyther againste iudaicall people againste moyses lawe el temple iewe borne father mother iewes borne tarsus citie cilicia brought vp citie feete man ye knewe well inough whose name gamaliel euen chyldehoode diligently instructed lawe countrey earnestly bent honouring true god suche sorte ye presente tyme insomuche affeccion bare lawe dyd persecute doctrine ghospell whiche nowe professe pursuyng suche professed thesame pryson bandes onely also death entendyng nothyng el persecucion sore threatnynges sondry kyndes death againste professours ghospell byndyng castyng pryson bothe man woman stycked sayed doctrine tell nothinge otherwyse trueth beare wytnesse whiche high priest auncientes receyued letter tooke iourney towardes damasco myght bryng prysoners thence hierusalem whiche pro essed christes name entente myght punyshed accordyng dyscrecion priestes elder pand fortuned made iourney come nygh vnto damasco none sodaynly shone heauen great lyght rounde tell vnto yerth heard voyce saying vnto saule saule persecutest thou aunswered art thou lord saied vnto iesus nazareth whome thou persecutest sawe veryly lyght afrayed heard voyce hym spake sayed shall lord lord sayed vnto aryse go damasco shall tolde thinges whiche appoynted doe sawe nothyng bryghtnesse lyght led hande came damasco one ananias perfecte manne pertaynyng lawe hauing good reporte iewes whiche dwelt came vnto stoode sayed vnto brother saule receyue thy sighte houre receyued syght sawe sayed god father hath ordeyned thou shouldest know wil shouldest voyce mouth thou shalt witnesse vnto men thinges whiche thou hast seen heard nowe tariest thou aryse baptised washe awaye thy synnes callyng name lorde mynde dyd beare none cause affeccion lawe relygion whiche receyued forefather whiche thing occasion ye nowe presente muche nowe wyll tell occasion chaunged mynde whiche whan ye shall perceyue perchaunce ye also wyll turne myndes chaunced whan went thyther almoste damasco aboute high noone sodaynlye great lyght compassed heauen wherewyth stricken fell downe grounde hearde voyce speake vnto heauen saying saule saule doest thou persecute unto whome whan made aunswer art thou lorde voice saied againe iesus nazareth thou pursuest companion sawe light sore afrayed voyce spake vnto hearde sayed lorde thy wyll shoulde doe lorde made aunswer againe wyse aryse go damasco shall eche thynge thou must doe tolde thee myne iyes daseled brightnes lyght coulde see nothyng felowes led hande vntyll came damasco mette good man one vpryght walkyng lawe also godly named ananias whome iewes dwelt damasco reported well ananias standyng sayed thus brother saule receyue thy syght againe forthwith receyued syght sawe sayed god father hath chosen ordeyned ende thou shouldest knowe wyll thou shouldest see onely iuste whiche iustifyeth thynge thou shouldest heare voyce mouthe iesus lyghte daseled thyne iyes voyce thou dyddest forbecause thou shalte bee wytnes vnto menne thinges whiche thou hast seene hearde seeing wyll god wherefore doest thou stay aryse christened washe awaye thy synnes callyng vnto name thou hast persecuted pand fortuned come agayne hierusalem prayed temple traunce saw saying vnto make haste get quickely hierusalem wil receyue thy witnes thou arest sayed lord knowe prysoned bet euery synagoge beleued thee bloud thy witnes steuen washed also stode cosented vnto death kept tayment slewe hym sayed vnto departe wyll sende thee farre hence vnto gentyles thynges doen damasco within shorte space returned vnto ierusalem beeyng newe man praying temple rauished besydes selfe iesus sawe whiche sayed vnto make haste get spedely hierusalem wyl receyue thy testimony aunswered wyse lorde haue good hope shall doe good amonge people forasmuche themselues knowe fauoure dyd beare vnto law cruelly handled thy disciple halyng pryson many coulde take whyppyng congregacions gaue credence vnto thy gospell yet satisfyed doyng whan bloude steuen shed whiche death bare faithfull witnes great boldnes constancie also whan stoned hym consented death innocent man insomuche tha kepte garmentes whiche brought hym place execucion fyrst began cast stone seyng euery man may well vnderstande howe muche affeccionate towardes lawe may ryghte well perceyue chaunged myne intent without great cause many shall founde wyll muche gladly folowe myne ensample shall see zeale towardes olde religion loue whereof cruelly persecuted thyne whan sayed lorde aunswered goe say byd nowe tyme come spreadynge gospell worlde abrode begun ende haue chosen maye sende hence far countreyes amonge gentyles pthey gaue audience vnto worde lyfted vp theyr boyces sayed away suche felowe yearth reason liue cryed casle theyr clothes thrue dust ayer captayne commaunded broughte castel bad shoulde scourged examined might know wherfore cryed bound hym thonges paule sayed vnto centurion stode hym lawfull scourge man romayne vncondemned whan centurion heard wente tolde vpper captayne saying entendest thou manne citizen rome iewes peaceably suffred paule speake mynde vntyll spake wordes yt wyll sende farre coutreyes among gentile wordes renewed eftsones euery man griefe iewes beare great despite wunderfully abhorred gentile cause dyuerse also whiche despysed ghospell would wyse gentyles shoulde haue made partaker gracious benefite rummeth ghospell yf nedes shoulde receyued shoulde receiued vnlesse woulde circumcised say man might bee good man fauour god vnlesse wer iewe wherefore whan heard gentile preferred inhabitauntes hierusalem great clamoure noyse interrupted paules tale sayed vnto marcyall rydde felowe worlde pitie lyueth whan iewes many token vttred outrageous griefe theyr myndes cry castyng garmentes finally throwyng dust ayre marciall supposed haynous crime commytted occasion wherof people thus stirred vp straunge sorte specially seeyng licence gyuen hym vnto paule tell tale come nought el inconuenience comaunded souldiers bryng paule castell waye examinacion whyppe hym ende meanes least wise might owne confession get cause people tooke vp suche exclamacion whyles commaundemente marcyall byndynge towardes whyppynge paule sayed vnto vnder captayne standing whiche appoynted see hym examined tormentes thing lawfull whyppe romayne yea cast founde giltie trespace whiche woordes whan pette captaine heard spedely went vnto marciall shewed hym heard saying intende ye doe man whome ye haue commaunded whypped citizen rome vpper captayne came sayed vnto tell arte thou romaine sayed yea captayne answered great sum obtayned freedome paule sayed free borne streyght waye departed haue examined hym high captaine also afrayed knew romayne bounde hym assone marciall heard came paul himselfe saied vnto tell true petie captayne hath certified art thou citizen rome paule affirmed citizen rome marciall aunswered great matter thou speakest coste great money could franchised made citizen rome sayed paule matter chaunce better borne citizen rome lawfullye parentes lykewyse furthwith whiche ready haue gotten trueth meane tormetes departed paul marciall also himselfe feared owne parte perceiued hym citizen rome bounde greatly name romaynes feared morowe would haue knowen certaintie wherfore accused iewes leused bandes commaunded high priestes councell come together brought paul forth set nexte daye captayne beyng desyrous knowe matter iewes accused leused bandes commaunded chiefe priestes shoulde assemble togyther whole councell lykewyse furthe brought paule matter myght entreated heades without commocion multitude xxiii chapter ppaule behelde councell sayed men brother haue lyned good conscience god vntyll daye hye priest ananias commaunded stoode smyte mouthe sayed paule vnto god shall smyte thou paynted wall sittest thou iudgest law commaundest smitten contrary law stode sayed reuilest thou god hye priest sayed paul wyst brother hye priest written thou shalt curse ruler thy people paule hauyng iyes fixed stedfastly set ye councell begon speake wyse haue conuersaunt sight god onely gyueth rightful iudgement vntyll present day beating selfe vpryghtly good conscience matter whan high priest ananias heard boldly speake freely howe streyght wayes declared auouched himselfe gyltles iudges reprofe accuser takyng matter greuously reuerently spoken hym neyther thinge cloked matter commaunded stoode buffet hym face whyles speakyng lorde certified paul whan saied shall receyue thy wytnesse tha paule one syde disdeynyng mynde iniury whiche neuer vsed iudgementes heathen syde certifyinge hym punished god hande afterwardes time come manifest tiranysittest thou iudgest c sayed vnto god shall smite thou whitelymed wall syttest thou wyse whan thou hast heard matter thou mayest geue sentence accordyng lawe requireth commaundest thou bee smitten thou hearest matter contrary lawe whiche forbyddeth man shoulde punyshed excepte lawfully conuicted cast whiche stoode nexte vnto paule sayed vnto hym doest thou wise reuyle god high priest suche extreme tyranny priesthoode iewes come claymed thing lawfull againste right equytie euery man hurte yet would permit freely speake whiche euidet token priesthood shoulde long continue come extremitie mischiefe paul perceyuing nothing furder cause vnder iudge thought best onely seke occasion howe assembly myght dissolued wherefore aunswerd brother vncertayne man high priest el remembre well written booke exodus thou shalte speake euyll prince rewler people aunswere somewhat appeased warned hym thereof ymagined occasion howe myght auoyde tumulte murmouring people lawfull voyde peryll crafte wheras appereth hope profityng whan paule perceyued one parte saduceis phariseis cryed councell men brother pharisee sonne pharisee ye hope resurrecion fro death iudged wha sayd arose debate betwene phariseis saduceis ye multitude deuyded ye saduceis say yt resurreccion neither aungell spirit phariseis graunt wherfore paul consideryng congregacion two sortes menne one sadduceis phariseis whiche agreed one sayed loude voyce audience counsell euery man might brother pharisey parentes phariseis arrayned preache dead shal aryse agayne thus sayed arose dyssencion betwene phariseis sadduceis multitude also presente seeyng variaunce varyed among themselues sundrye opinion partes sadduceis asmuche beleue soule dieth body neyther alowe resurreccion suppose spirite aungell phariseis part beleue resurreccion shalbe bothe angelles spirites wherefore multitude great clamour began make trouble arose great crye whan scribe whiche phariseis parte arose stroue saying finde euil man though spirite angel hath appered let v striue god whan arose great debate ye captayne fearing est paul shoulde haue ben plucte sundre commaunded souldiers go downe take among bring castle meane space certayne scribe phariseis secte arose contended fauour paule sayed perceyue nothynge wherein man hath transgressed yf holy ghoste aungell hath spoken vnto oure parte contende ne striue god sayed vpon occasion paule day shewed lorde appered vnto hym vision temple muche doeth auayle case alredye r wled determined secte whan dyssencion encreased reason sadduceis cryed sore phariseis matter seamed lyke growe nothing el extreme deadly commocion marciall fearing lest paule shoulde plucked piece among commaunded souldiers go downe take paule throng bring castell againe night folowynge god stoode sayed bee good chere paul thou hast testified ierusalem must thou beare witnes also rome tyme god shoulde somewhat coumforte manfully wrastled hym seyng trouble sore yet sorer wer hande wherefore nexte night againe lorde stoode hym saying good courage paul trouble shal make end tyme death yet come yet come euen thou hast valiauntly borne witnesse ierusalem shalte thou witnesse rome also thou hast doen thy parte citie whiche chiefe iewry remayneth nexte thou rome whiche head citie worlde whan daye certayne iewes gathered themselues together made vowe saying would neither eate drinke tyll killed paul moe fowertie men made conspiracion thei came chiefe priestes elder sayed haue bounde selues wt vowe wil eate nothing vntyll haue slayne paul nowe therefore geue ye knowledge vpper captayne councell bring forth vnto v morowe though would knowe thinge perfectly euer come nere ready kyll hym soone day certayne iewes made conspiracion cursed selues deuyll damnacion yf dyd eyther eate drinke slayne paule greate malyce conceyued againste hym small noumbre made conspiracie aboue fowertie person wente high priestes elder shewed entente purpose sayinge haue moste depely cursed selues perpetually damned hell eyther eate drynke shall haue slayne paule nowe must ye lykewyse put vnto helpyng handes furtheraunce request maye easely bryng passe thinge whiche desyrous doe sende ye woorde highe marciall name also name whole counsell bryng paule againe pretendynge ye wyll enquyre dilygently forasmuche yesterdaye ye coulde reason commocion shall prouyde shall
