come safely castell againe yesterdaye dyd come place counsell shalbe kepte wyll ready slay pwhen paules syster sonne heard laying wayte wente entred castell tolde paul paul called one vnder captaynes vnto said bryng young man vnto high captayne hath certaine thing shew toke hym brought high captaine sayed paul prisoner called vnto prayed bring young man vnto hath certaine matter shewe hygh captayne toke hande wente waye asked thou hast tell sayed iewes determined desire yt thou wouldest bring forth paule morowe counsel though would enquire sumwhat perfectely folow thou myndes lye wayte moe fowerty men haue bound selues vowe wil neither eate drynke tyll haue killed hym nowe ready loke thou shouldest promyse vpper captayne let young man departe charged hym saying see thou tell man thou hast shewed thinges whiche craftye trayne deadly daungier certaine young manne neuewe vnto paule sister syde perceyued thought matter woulde slepte forthwith entred castell vttred vnto paule daungier hande whan paul knew called one vnder captaynes vnto hym sayed bryng younge man vnto marciall certaine matter hath dysclose hym captayne toke young manne desired doe led hym marciall sayd felowe paule holde desired bryng young man vnto saied certaine matter whiche desyred talke marciall toke young man hande wente asyde asked matter thou wouldest speake aunswered iewes haue conspired death paule haue thus agrred among themelues wyll entreate bryng paule againe councell morowe vnder pretence wyll dilygently make enquirie hym forasmuche yesterday coulde well saye al woulde haue sayed vnto hym entende matter wherefore ye nede take hede ye vnawares graunt desyres haue layed theyr heades together vtterly purpose destroy paule yea aboue fowerty haue cursed themselues depely yf eyther eate drinke haue slaine euen nowe ready commit mischiefe loke aunswer whan marciall heard let young man departe chargeyng shoulde tell man vttered matter vnto marciall desyrous saue paules lyfe yet myght auoyde yll wyll iewes pand called vnto two pet e captaynes saying make redye two hundred souldiers goe cesarea horseman three score ten speare men two hundred thirde houre nighte delyuer beasles may set paule bring safe vnto felix ye high deputie wrote letter maner claudius lisias vnto moste mighty ruler felix sendeth gretinges manne taken iewes shoulde haue kylled came souldiers rescued perceyued romayne would haue knowen cause wherefore accused hym brought foorth counsel perceiued accused question lawe giltye thing woorthy deathe bandes whan shewed howe iewes layed wa e sent streyghte way gaue commaundemet accuser thinges haue tel fare well wherefore called two petie captaynes vnto hym sayed make ye readye souldiers two hundreth foote men three skore ten horseman two hundreth speare men may go cesarea soone vpon thirde houre nyght prouyde also horse ye maye carry paule safe presydent felyx cause marcyalles preste dilygence onely cause purpose saue mannes lyfe man suche conscience desyre dyspatched paul whome neyther coulde defende maynteyne sette malice whole counsell yet durst commit beyng citizen rome vnto furiouse handes therfore commaunded shoulde forth away nyght great bende men fearynge leste yf gone daye small company iewes woulde haue taken away iourney kylled faulte haue lyen necke woulde haue thought betrayed citizen rome sente also lettre vnto felix tenour wherof foloweth claudius lysias vnto moste woorthye president felix gretyng iewes layed handes man would haue laine vnlesse vpon knowledge citizen rome cummen bende men taken forasmuche desyrous knowe cause wherfore accused brought owne councell whome founde cle e without faulte eyther worthy death el wherfore deserued emprysoned sauyng certayne question iewes lawe layed charge nothinge el soone certifyed iewes appoynted lye wayte sente forthwith vnto admonyshynge iewes withall whiche bee accuser yf haue thing laye charge shoulde take theyr iourney plead matter thus fare ye well pthen souldiers commaunded tooke paule brought night antipatras morowe left horseman go returned vnto castell whiche whan came vnto cesarea deliuered epistle ye deputie presented paul wha deputie red letter asked countrey vnderstoode cilicia wil heare saied whan thyne accusars come also commaunded hym kept herodes iudgement hall souldiers accordyng commaunded marcial beyng charged paule brought night antipatras citie nexte daye asmuche cesa ea ferre supposed great daungier feared footemen returned hierusalem castell agayne horseman wente paule vnto cesarea whyther come delyuered letter vnto presydent brought paul also whan presydente perused letter asked paul prouynce whan paul answered cilician borne wyll heare sayed whan thy accuser presente commaunded kepte herodes iudgement hall xxiiii chapter pafter fyue dayes ananias high priest descended elder certayne oratou named tertullus whiche enfourmed deputie iust paule whan paul called forth tertullus began accuse saying seyng yt lyue great quietnesse meanes many good thinges doen vnto nacion thy prouidence allowe euer al place noble felix hake notwithstading tedious vnto thee pray thou wouldest heare v thy curtesy fewe wordes haue found man pestilet felowe mouer debate vnto iewes whole world maynteiner sedicion sect nazarites whiche hath also enforced pollute teple toke would haue iudged according law high captaine lisias came vpon v great violence toke awaye handes commaunding accuser come vnto thou mayest yf thou wilte enquire knowe certayntie thinges whereof accuse iewes lykewyse affirmed saying thinges euen within fyue dayes ananias whiche high prieste certaine elder came downe cesarea hauing traine certaine oratour named tertullus whiche shoulde pleade matter earnestly set slay paul whiche men spoken presidente required prysoner myght brought foorth felix commaunded paule called forth appere tertullus beeing endre base defendour protectour euyll cause beganne wyse accuse paule maye thanke matiers haue quiet peaceable emonge v long space many dyuerse soondry thinges ryghte well gouerned common weale wysedome tymes place knowelege sette forth goodnesse towardes v moste noble captayne felix nowe therfore doe tendre vnto moste herty thankes redynes right gentle herte towardes nacion putteth v great hope confidence ye wyll consydre tranquilitie cou trey concernyng cause also whiche nowe bryng lest retaine kepe awaye soondry weighty effayres ouer long processe cyrcumstaunce woordes shall desyre accustomed gentilnesse v speake oure myndes fewe woordes haue perceyued manne bee deadly enemye countrey muche hath sette debate betwene iewes onely inhabite siria others also countreys worlde wheresoeuer resorte iewes makynge hymselfe brynger new secte whiche called nazarene contented afrayed come hierusalem bryngyng temple men circumcised sticked prophane suspende temple tooke dede doyng would haue iudged accordyng law lisias hygh marciall came greate bande men toke hym handes leauyng examynacion matter vnto willed hys accuser come marciall hymselfe canne testifye vnto matiers true whiche laye charge wyse slender liyng oratour sayed iewes presente accusacion affyrmed euen tertullus sayed paul debitie beckened vnto speake answered quiet mynde answer selfe much vnderstand ye hast bene many yeares iudge vnto people thou mayst know yet twelue day sence wente vp ierusale worship neyther found teple disputing man neyther raysyng vp ye people neyther sinagoges citie neither proue thinges wherof accuse paule whan presidente kenyng willed hym make answere hymselfe began defende owne part wise shall great dele quiet mynde answere selfe asmuche knowe ye haue bene manye yeres enbuisied emong thys people reason decisyng matiers belongyng iewes ye ygnoraunt lawes later matter hath n whereof men accuse muche certaynlye maye ye enquirie knowe yet twelue dayes synce accordynge custome iewyshe relygion came vp ierusalem make prayer purifie selfe taken vowe accordyng solemne manier fashion iewes ye call violatyng pollutyng temple knowledge faulte offence neyther founde teple disputyng wyth man neither making ye people flocke together sinagoges yet place citie neyther dewlye proue reason faultes laye vnto charge confesse vnto ye waye call heresy worship god father beleuyng thinge writte law prophetes haue hope towardes god ye resurreccio ye dead theselues lo e also shalbe iust vniust therfore study haue alway cleare conscience towarde god towarde man poyncte whiche laye vnto concernyng secte nazarene wyll denye true yet myne accuser haue nothing doe therwith forsomuch iewes haue condemned secte agayne autour therof ye bee desyrous heare secte professe wyll shewe doe according tradicion ye pharisee secte wourship god commonly wurshipped countrey autour new religion kepe thynges haue receyued forefather dylygentlye beleuynge thynges bee truebeleuyng thynges whiche written ye law prophetes wrytten lawe prophetes whiche thynges al moste pa te inasmuche god lyke promysed hath fulfylled doe fully beleue thynges also wyll cum passe whiche hath promysed cum say dead shall ryse againe tyme cum well badde good good receyue gloriously lyfe euerlasting badde euerlastyng punishement thynges waueryng belefe earnestly perswaded asmuche knowe time cumme shall appeare god ye place iudgement shalbe rewarded according dedes endeuoure selfe earnestly lyue nothing offende lawe god may haue pure clere conscience sight god examyneth man herte also syght man haue dyligently obserued folowed euen vntyll thys day therfore haue nothyng wherof accuse touchyng lyfe past whereby suche matiers laye vnto charge maye appere probably true many yeares came brought almes people offerynges founde purified temple neyther wt multitude yet unquietnesse howbeit certayne iewes asia oughte present thee accuse yf oughte againste el let saye yf haue founde euyll whyle stand councell excepte one voyce cried standyng among resurreccion deathe iudged daye whan lyued vprighte wythoute faulte many yeares laste came hierusalem make deliuery certayne money gathered asia helpe poore nedye folkes countrey parte malefactour helpe poore countreymen bestowyng benefite wyll acknowledge laye charge meane time lest sought occasion might make trouble businesse shaued heade went teple purified accustomed ceremony doyng nothing wherby anye trouble businesse mought aryse began newe thing ceremony vsed whole countrey vseth buth commocion made reysed vp certayn iewes asia bene expedient haue bene present debating triall hereof forasmuche worker matter shoulde accuse yf anye thyng laye charge greate suspeccion haue smal confidence cause forasmuch absent themselues iudgemente perceiuyng matter pleaded whiche presidente yf offended myght haue bene conuicted el quitte albeit feare manne euer accuseth yea let themselues whiche present speake seing stand counsel haue sene thing otherwise lawful god standyng wyth lawe lawful iudgement kept accordyng law plaintie laie charge transgressour defendaut owne man lawe proctoure knowe thei haue nothing excepte thei wil laie wordes teathe whiche loude voyce spake pharisee poinct accused preached resurreccion ye dead agayne vnto lyfe whiche wordes sayed forasmuche standyng dyd emong permitted marcial vtter mynde saw nothyng doen vpryghtly lawe passe vpon playne hatred malice whan sayed contended betwene themselues vntill marciall tooke theyr handes spake nothing trueth mete multitude knowe wherfore endaungered counsell forasmuche sawe helpe loked handes chiefe rewlers whan felix heard thinges deferred knewe wel way sayed whan lisias captaine cum downe wyl know vtmost pour ier comauded vnder capitaine kepe paul lette haue rest forbid none acquayntaunce ministre vnto cum vnto whan felix hearde well acquainted secte pharisee paule professed minded deferre examynacion matier vntill tyme sayed forasmuche lisias knoweth al whole matier standeth whan cummeth hyther heare gaue commaundement vnto vnder captaine shoulde meane season kepe warde yet myght gentely ordred myght dyuerse tymes ly ertye hys familiar myght freely repayre vnto hym bryng suche thynges lacked certayne dayes felix came wt wite drusilla iewesse called furth paul heard ye faith toward christ preached right wisenes teperasice iudgement cum felix trembled answered go thy way time whan haue conuenient season wil sende hoped also ye money haue bene geue paul might leuse wherfore called ofreuer comoned two yeares festus porcius came felix roume felix willynge shewe ye iewes pleasure lefte paule pryson bounde whan good sorte dayes past felix came cesarea wt wife drusilla whiche iewe borne sent paule beeyng desyrous haue farther knowledge concerning ye sect professed paule opened vnto way saluacion ye gospel thing spoken saluacion obteyned obseruing moyses lawe iewes supposed beleuynge iesus christe whome beyng many hundreth yeres loked iewes cru yfied baptisme synnes committed whole time course mannes lyfe washed away suche regenerate christ lyue sincerely holyly accordyng rewle ghospel thence foorth vntyll suche tyme iesus hath geuen redempcion manne dyd gloriously returne syght menne power father iudge quicke dead whan paule talked wise large suche matter wete gracious fauour god man cummeth faythe euangelical iusticie temperaunce sobernes spiritual life latter iudgement manne coulde escape felix afrayed somuche moued therewith foorthwith dyd acquite paule feared iewes knewe dyd deadly hate hym paule meane space kepte holde gentle orte vntyll myghte haue occasion delyuer hym matter also caused hym streight wayes quitte hym trusted paule woulde gyue hym readye money myght delyuered cause often sende paule commoned hym myght gyue occasion profer money vpon famyliar acquayntaunce gentyll entertaynement ye president myght put awaye shamefastenes whiche thought dyd staye paule durst profer money emperours lawes doe punyshe iudge suffereth malefaciour escape brybery meane tyme whan paule continued two yeares cesarea emperoure aero sent certaine man named porcius festus succede felix roume good occasion dimisse paul thought woulde departe prouynce mennes displeasure willing rather shewe ye iewes pleasure vpryght conscience deliuer innocet lefte paul bound harde matter great men rewlers world behaue themselues matter vpryghtly xxv chapter whan festus receiued office three day ascended f cesarea vnto ierusale enformed high priestes chief iewes paule besought desired fauour agaynst hym would send ierusalem laid awaite way kil festus answered ye paul shoulde kepte cesarea himselfe would shortely departe thyther let therefore sayd among able cum doune wt v accuse faulte man within three dayes festus came hys prouynce went fro cesarea ierusalem whan iewes hearde tel yt newe president cum malice newely kyndled agayne byanby high pryestes chiefe rewlers iewes came vnto desired fauour ye myghte please sende paule ierusalem forasmuche comodious haue ye matter pleaded cesarea trusted ye president reason late came prouince ignoraunt thynges yt bene done would soone smal matter shewe fauourand la ed await hym waye kyll hym iewes p ynete yf festus grauted theyr request would haue layed watche haue slaine paule way festus beyng indyfferent woulde shoulde haue bene made answere yt paul remaine custody cesarea within fewe dayes would repaire thyther heare matter wherefore sayed anye amonge mete men folowe matter leate go downe cesarea shal arrayned yf man speake giltie maye accuse hym whan taried among ten day went vnto cesarea next day sate iudgement seate comaunded paul broughte whan cum iewes come ierusalem stoode aboute layde many greuous coplayntes agaynst paul coulde proue long answered selfe neyther agaynst lawe iewes neyther agaynste temple yet agaynst cesar offended thing whan continued among ten day wente cesarea nexte daye sat place iudgement commaunded paule brought brought forth iewes whiche came ierusalem stoode rounde laiyng many sore matter charge none hable proue paul answered himselfe euidently declared neyther offeded iewes lawe forasmuche diligently kepte neyther yet prophaned suspended churche seyng purely peaceablye conuersaunt therin offended againste themperoure time pfestus wyllyng dooe iewes pleasure answered paule saied wilte thou go vp ierusalem iudged thinges tha said paul stande cesars iudgement seate ought iudged iewes haue harme doen thou well knoweste haue hurte comytted thing worthy death refuse die yf none thinges wherof accuse man maye deliuer appeale vnto cesar spake festus deliberacion answered thou haste appealed vnto cesar vnto cesar shalte thou goe whan festus perceyued thone parte innocencie paule hatred iewes bare paule whiche neuer woulde bee satisfyed endeuouryng himselfe gratifye iewes myghte seme yet doe partye whiche accused wronge sayde vnto paule wylt thou go ierusalem iudged supposed woulde please iewes well forasmuche theyr owne request paule beyng assured thyntent iewes made aunswere see cause wherefore matter shoulde dyfferred vntil tyme let euen may eyther quit caste attained nowe barre themperours officer citie cesarea nedes muste receyue iudgement haue doen iewes hurte iniurye selfe knowe right well yf haue noied thinge haue committed thing whereby haue deserued deathe well content dye yf thinges men haue layed charge false parte iudge contrarye ryghte iustice permitte handle accordynge conceyued malyce hatred would desire doe iudge fauoure person condemne man attained appeale themperoure festus communicacion councel iewes made answere vnto paul seyng thou hast appealed emperoure emperour shalte thou goe iewes better content ye paule sente themperoure quit trusted thing woulde chaunce whereby last might ryd waye pand certayne dayes ynge agrippa bernice came vnto cesarea salute festus whan good season festus rehearsed paules cause vnto kyng saying certaine man lefte pryson felix aboute whome whan came ierusalem hye priestes elder iewes enformed desired haue iudgement againste answered maner romayn fauour delyuer man shoulde peryshe accused haue accuser haue licence answere concerning ye crime layed therefore whan come hither together without anye delaye morow sate geue iudgemet comaunced man brought furth whan accuser stode vp brought none accusacio thinges supposed certaine question owne supersticion one iesus whiche dead paul affirmed alyue douted suche maner question asked whether would go ierusalem iudged matter whan paul appealed kept vnto knowleage ceasar commaunded kept til might send ceasar meane space within fewe dayes kynge agrippa whiche succeded herode father kyngdom aungel god striken came cesarea wyfe bernice salute welcome newe presydent festus continued good sorte day festus occasion rehersed vnto kynge paules matter wyse felix whiche predecessor hath left certain man holde high priestes chief rewlers iewes complayned whan hierusalem defired sake geue sentence unto made answere ye romaynes wer accustomed geue sentece death fauour person accuser appeared gaue sufficient euidence liberty answere thinges shoulde layed againste soe whan accuser cumme hyther without delaye sate nexte daye iudgement wylled prisoner accused appere whan accuser came foorth laied matter charge thought would haue doen certaine question demaunded concernynge theyr owne supersticion layde charge shoulde affirme one iesus whiche dead arisen death lyfe also alyue perceiuyng leste parte myne office make enquirie question neyther wel knowing might saye ye matter asked whether willyng go hierusalem stande iudgement concerning thynges layed vnto hym forasmuche priestes scribe phariseis knew better matter stoode paul refused appealed cesar wyll arrained comaunded yt meane space kept custodie vntil time ye might haue occasio send cesar agrippa said vnto festus would also heare man self morow sayd thou shalt heare morow wha agrippa cum bernice great pompe wer entred councel house wt captaines chief men citie festus commaundement paule brought foorthe festus saydt kyng agrippa ye men whiche present v ye se manne multitude iewes haue entreated hierusalem also criyng ought lyue longer yet found nothing worthie death yt comitted neuertheles seyng hath appealed cesar haue certaine thing write vnto lord wherefore haue brought vnto specially vnto king agrippa examinacion might haue sumwhat write thinketh vnreasonable sende prisoner shew cause whiche layde whan agrippa heard saide vnto festus haue late hearde much speakyng iesus disciple therfore would self heare felowe goe cesar saied festus morowe shall heare nexte day yt agrippa wyfe bernice much pompe great trayne entred captaynes chiefe citie common hall festus commaunded paule brought festus iest yt seme haue brought furth paule onely get fauour kyng spake wyse king agrippa present ye se man al iewes haue complayned well hierusalem also citie haue great clamour cried pitie life haue made enquirie see hath waye deserued deathe albeit forasmuche hath owne free wil appealed emperour full mynd sende hym thyther yet cannot wel tell maye certifye vnto maiestie wrytyng wherfore haue brought furth especially kyng agrippa may examyne haue sumwhat wryte thinketh standeth reason sende prysoner shewe withal layde charge xxvi chapter agrippa sayed vnto paul thou art permitted speake thy selfe th paul stretched foorth hande answered himselfe thinke selfe happy king agrippa shal day answer al thinges wherof accused ye iewes namely thou art expert customes question whiche among iewes wherefore beseche heare paciently kyng agryppa turned himselfe paul stoode bounde said thou hast pardon speake thy selfe yf thou haue thing saye thine owne defence forthwith paul holdyng vp hande began defende hymselfe wyse maketh litell matter opinion kyng agrippa iudge man indicted pleadeth cause whose confidence wholy innocencie desireth nothinge haue suche iudge eyther knoweth cause well already el soone perceiue yf iudge bee ignoraunt matter pleadeth shall vayne go set furth fyne painted termes therefore althoughe iewes haue layed dyuerse trespaces charge yet thynke selfe happy cause shall day pleade matter whiche knowe ryght wel customes ordre also doubtfull question poyntes concerne law iewes wherefore wyll desire heare paciently liuing yt haue led childe whiche firste amonge myne owne nacion ierusalem knowe al iewes knew beginning yf woulde testifie ye streigth secte religion liued pharise stad iudged ye hope promyse made god vnto father vnto promyse twelue tribe instantly seruing god day night doe hope cum hope sake kyng agrippa accused iewes first formoste wheras laye vnto charge haue trespaced lawe howe false al whole lyfe whiche haue hitherto led shall declare although borne tarsus yet haue euen chyldehode brought vp among iewes ierusale diligently applyed lawe feete gamaliel iewes know wel ynough syncerely godly dyd lede lyfe among countrey men royal citye knewe many yeres agoe sence yt fyrste conuersaunt iierusalem yf would speake knowe true dede onely kepe iewes religio dilygently professed secte also whiche excelleth reste bothe obseruinge religion also moste perfecte knowledge lawe saye secte phariseis thing doen without al shame accuse iewe seeyng euen yet present also pharisee profession say yt man could denye iewe borne ierusalem among iewes ye secte phariseis especially doeth beleue body shal arise euery manne shalbe rewarded according liuing dedes world neither haue tyme shronken phariseis secte euen artayned beleue shalbe great felicitie haue lyued well accordyng god made promyse forefather faulte looke god promysed wurship onely many one moe faulte twelue trybes countrey wurship god daye nyght onely trust ye shall come blisse hath promised therefore scarcely worthye called iewe trusteth god hath promised yet kyng agrippa cause chiefely beleue nowe endicted iewes pwhy thought thing incredible vnto god rayse agayne dead also verely thought selfe ought doe many thinges contrary cleane againste name iesus nazareth thing also ierusale many sainctes shut vp prison receiued authoritie hye priestes whan put death gaue sentence punished oft euery sinagoge compelled blaspeme yet mad vpo persecuted euen vnto straunge city thinges wot damasco authoritye licence hye priestes euen mydday kyng saw way light heauen aboue bryghtnes sunne shyne round iorneyed knowe many wil thinke thing impossible yf man affirme bodye whan dead putrified shoulde aryse againe many thinges seme menne impossible whiche afterwarde yet finde true manne saye ye one manne might rayse death lyfe might iustely seme speake thing impossible without cause wherefore shoulde thinke impossible god whiche hable doe whatsoeuer shall please raise dead lyfe againe whiche gaue euery manne lyfe restore lyfe whome shal please shal thinke lyar breakyng promyse whiche hath made yea selfe haue supposed thinges impossible whiche afterwarde proued true thinges bee contrarye oure lawe vngodlye tried afterwarde bee principall pointes perfeict godlynes religyon somuche mynde towarde discyples iesus nazareth iewes towarde stryued al power thaduaucing name thought wonderfull godly whan persecuted professed vttermost coulde euen ierusalem many holy men caste pryson hauyng commission high priestes doe pronounced ye sentence deathe whan suffre punyshed onely ierusale al sinagogues whersoeuer could heare assembly purposing earnestly bring veracion suche pointe make speake dispite moste blessed name lyke selfe dyd dayes neyther thus contented madly raged insomuche rode forein city suche farre ierusalem thentent myghte punyshe suche professed name vpon tyme whan sette bent cruell businesse whiche dyd yet malyce onely zele bare lawe countrey mynde tooke iourney towarde damasco supported authoritie high priestes eue mydde day king agrippa sawe certayne light whiche muche clerer brightnesse sunne sodainlie shine heauen shyned round aboute pwhan fallen yearth hearde voyce speakyng vnto saying hebrewe toung saule saule persecutest thou harde kycke againste pryches sayde art thou lorde sayde iesus thou persecutest ryse stande vpon thy feete haue appered vnto purpose make ministre witnesse thinges thou hast seen thinges whiche wyll appere vnto delyueryng people gentile vnto whome sende open iyes maye turned darkenes lyght power sathan vnto god yt may receyue forgeuenesse synnes inheritaunce emong sanctified fayth towarde whan beyng amased reason brightnesse lyght fallen doune grounde hearde voyce speake vnto sayd hebrue tong saule saule doest thou persecute hard wynche againste prycke aunswered arte thou lorde spake againe sayed iesus nazareth whome thou persecutest aryse stande vp thy feete therefore haue striken downeunto send open eye beyng persecutour may set thy feete againe preacher name haue appered vnto ende beeyng chosen thou mayest beare witnesse execute suche thinges thou hast sene others hereafter vision shall shewe vnto whiche thinges wyll bee thy defendoure deliuer people barbarous nacions heathen far whither wyl sende legate lyke thou art delyuerauce thyne errour made blinde man perfecte sight thou maiest preachinge true worde ghospell open theyr iyes synne ignoraunce whiche haue hitherto holden withall lykewyse may bee conuerted lyght gospel suche haue heretofore geuen ydolatrie reason therof haue become subiectes vnto sathan maye made seruauntes god lorde thinges hitherto haue defiled al kinde fylthinesse nowe faith credence geuing gospell may freely obtayne remission sinnes suche hytherto haue called electe people separated god deuyded companye good men may nowe haue parte amonge sanctifyed circumcision obseruing lawe beleuynge geue credence gospell nowe none way remaynynge whereby man maye bee sanctifyed pwherefore kynge agrippa disobedient vnto heauenly vision shewed first vnto damasco ierusalem thorowe coastes iewry getiles shoulde repente turne god suche workes become repent cause iewes caught temple went kylle seyng therfore haue obtayned helpe god vnto day continewe witnessyng small great saying none thinges whiche moyses prophetes say come christ suffer bee first arise death shewe light vnto people gentile thinges kyng agrippa doone eyther night tyme dreame whan brode daye many v sawe clerenesse lyghte heard voyce distynctlye speakyng wherfore beyng assured doen god heauen dysobediente heauenly vision lettyng passe businesse taken hande authoritie high priestes tooke cleane contrarye waye thynkyng expedient necessarie put execucion god commaunded hyghe priestes wylled forth preached ghospell damasco hierusalem afterwardes throughout partes iewrye shorte emong dyuerse nacions countreyes beeyng farre sunder wyllyng repent lyfe paste shoulde turne dumme idolles true lyuyng god baptised shoulde worke thencefoorth suche workes became suche persones earnestly hath repented cause iewes whan sawe temple tooke woulde haue slayne neyther haue hytherto defended weapon yet ayde god whose commaundemente dooe dooe yet alyue testifying bothe greate smalle thinges commaunded preache men without respect person feynynge newe doctrine myne owne head preaching onely thinges moyses prophetes affirmed cum passe iewes also wont dyspute wyse christe prophecy prophetes whether messias shoulde cum man subiect misery death whether fyrste shoulde begynne rayse dead lyfe whether shoulde preache true lyght fyrste israelite gentyles whiche thinges euery hone forasmuche spoken prophetes moyses hymselfe messias preache muste looke none messias thinges fulfylled iesus nazareth nothing nowe remayneth menne penaunce puritie lyfe prepare themselues againste cummynge whan shall cum iudge whole worlde pa thus spake himselfe festus sayed loude voyce paul thou art besyde thy selfe muche learning make mad paule sayed madde dere festus speake forth wordes trueth sobernesse kynge knoweth thinges whome also speake freely neyther thinke thinges hydden thinge doen corner kyng agrippa beleuest thou prophetes wote wel thou beleuest agrippa sayed vnto paul sumwhat thou bringest mind beleue becum christened paul sayed would god onely thou also heare day wer sumwhat onely together suche excepte handes whan paule spoken muche owne defence festus whiche coulde nothing skylle iewes religion estemynge dotage spoken visyon arysynge agayne dead sayed loude voyce thou dotest paule often chaunceth men muche knowledge learning hath taken thy ryght mynde clene paule answered dote moste noble festus dotynge called whan man erroure mynde swerueth reason sober speake truth whiche trueth knowe veraye witte dede thinges vnknowe kyng doe muche frankely talke mattersfor thing doen corner suppose ignorante none poyntes haue spoken thing dooen corner openly rumour sparsed throughout iewry paul turned agrippa sayed kynge agrippa beleue ye prophetes bee true knowe ye doe beleue beleueth cannot chose beleue ghospell sheweth cum passe prophetes sayed shoulde cum agrippa breakyng communicacion sayed vnto paule thou doest sumwhat perswade becum christen man sayed paule veraily would wyshe god herte ye shoulde beleue onelye sumwhat throughly selfe onely also men heare daye shoulde lyke thing onely excepted would wyshe bee thus bandes pand whan thus spoken kyng arose vp deputie bernice sate whan gone aparte talked among selues saying man doeth nothing worthy th bandes sayed agrippa vnto festus man might haue let leuse yf appealed vnto cesar whan paul saied kyng presydent bernice arose late whan gone asyde common matter agreed euery man opinion sayed paule hath committed nothing worthy death ne yet imprisonment wherfore cum passe paul dimissed kyng agrippa sayed vnto president festus man myghte haue quytte yf appealed vnto emperour xxvii chapter pwhan concluded sayle ita delyuered paul certaine prisoner vnto one named iulius vnder captaine cesars souldiers entred shyp hadramicium leused lande appoyncted sayle coastes asia one aristarchus macedonia ye countrey thessalonica ratiyng stil wt v next day came sydon iulius courteously entreated paul gaue libertie go vnto frendes refreashe whan launched thence sayled hard cypre wyndes contrary whan sayled ouer sea cilicia pamphilia came myra whiche licia kyng agrippa geue suche sentece euen paul appealed emperoure shoulde goe italy deliuered paule certaine prysoners handes vnto ye vnder captaine emperours souldiers named iulius tha entred shyppe whiche came fro hadramicium citie affrike whiche shoulde set v vp asia lesse forasmuche iourney laye coastes asia time aristarchus macedonia thessalonian borne contynued v would nedes beare v company iourney nexte daye leused cesarea arriued sydon captayne iulius forasmuche entended handle paule gentilly permitted goe shyp goe visite frendes yf sidon ende might better bee refreshed wha leused thence also aduetured maigne sea tooke left hande shored sydes cypre wynde v passed ouer sea whiche righte againste cilicia pamphilia came myra whiche standeth sea syde licia pand vnder captaine found ship alexandria ready sayled italy put v therein whan sayled slowely many dayes scarce wer cum ouer guydon wynde withstode v sayled hard coastes candie ouer salmon much worke sayled beyod came vnto place whiche called fayre hauens nygh wherunto citie lasca whan muche tyme spete whan sayling nowe ieopardouse also ouer log fasted paul put remembraunce sayed vnto syrs perceiue vyage wyll hurte muche damage ladyng shyppe onelye also lyues neuerthelesse vndercaptayne beleued gouernoure mayster shyp thinges whiche wer spoken paul hauen commodiouse wynter manye toke councell departe thence yf meanes might reache phenice wynter whiche hauen candie lyeth towarde southwest northwest wynde southwynde blewe supposyng obtain purpose leused vnto asson sa led past candie met capitayne shyppe whiche cum alexandria citie egypte readye sayle italye shyfted v thesame sayled many dayes slowly scarcely last cum ryghte againste guidus reason wynde v turned ylande candie nighe citie fame ylade whiche sytuate sea banke called salmon sum menne called sammonium muche dooe passed salmon came hauen candie called fayre hauens place far citie lasea spent long season nauigacion saylyng paule perceyuing daungerous sayling onely forbecause could kepe course would haue kepte reason winde also ouer long absteyned meate admonished warned mariner wyse syrs perceiue saylynge wyll daungerous full damage peryll onely burden shyppe shyppe selfe lykewyse lyues wherefore better cease saylyng forwarde captayne gaue mayster ship sterne man rather paules sayinges muche conuenient hauen might couch lye rode beynge wynter season manye mynde yf possyblie coulde woulde sayle farre phenice whiche hauen candie hangyng sea towardes southwest northwest wynde meane tyme south wynde blewe trustynge might obteyne purpose might reache phenice leused sea coaste asson citie candye shored coastes candie long arose againste theyr purpose flawe wynde northest whan shyp caught could resist wynde let go draue wether wer carryed yle named clauda muche worke cum boate whiche toke vp vsed helpe made fast shyp earing leste shoulde fal syrtes let downe vessell carried within shorte space arose sodeyne boysterous wynde whiche shyppemen feare moste wether call whyrle wynde pierrie thesame cummeth betwene north east called northeast wynde wynde taken shyppe shyppe could withstande tempest let go al aduentures whither soeuer ye windes waues would cary v whan last brought certaine yland whiche south syde candie named clauda much worke get boate wherby myght succour selues thing chaunced otherwyse wel wha last drawen boate vp shyp vsed police preserue ship feare lest chaunce breake beatyng shalowes flattes thei girded shippe rope thei feared lest wynde shoulde driue syrtesfearing lest shoulde fall syrtes c whiche certayne flattes quicke sandes farre south warde seyng pierie blew droue waye therwith let downe certaine vessell staye ship runne fast forwarde suche meanes beeyng sumwhat holpen droue wind caried forwarde nexte daye whan tossed exceading tempest lightened shyp thirde day cast ou handes tacklyng ye shyppe ye last neither ye sunne starres many dayes appeared small tempest lay vpon v al hope escape take away long abstinence paul stode furth myddes sayed syrs ye haue harkened haue leused candie neyther haue brought vnto v harme losse nowe exhorte good chere ther shalbe losse mannes lyfe amog saue ye ship onely stoode night aungel god whose serue saiyng feare paul thou must brought cesar loe god hath geuen ye sayle wherfore syrs good chere beleue god shalbe euen tolde howbeit muste cast certayne ylande tempeste styl continuyng whan tossed waterbeaten daungerouslye nexte daye went extreme shyftes vnloded shyppe caste sea lyghten sumwhat ease shyppe whan tempest styll contynued thyrde daye caste awaye ouer boorde owne handes tacklyng shyppe forasmuche neither sunne ne yet starres appered space manye dayes tempeste styll waxed euerye manne despayre looked none deathe moreouer reaso troublous sayling eaten meate long space tha paul standyng mydle amonge sayed syrs ye haue folowed councell whan gaue warning ye leuse sea coaste candie yf ye hadde doen ye hadde escaped daungier also losse goodes forasmuche nowe cannot vndoen againe paste begynne yet laste folowe councell waxe wyse good chere one shal peryshe shyp onely shal loste dreame speake aungell god serue wurshyppe stoode night sayed paul afraied thou shalt perishe thou muste firste appeare ceasar onely thou shalt escape safe god hath heard thy praiers geue vnto shyp wherefore say good chere doubt shal cum passe god hath promised aungell yf ye wyll knowe howe shall escape safe lyues wil tell shalbe cast vp certayne yland shal saued without shypwrecke wha fowerteth night cu wer sailyng adris mydnight shypmen demed appered countrey vnto sounded found twenty adoms thei go litle sounded againe found fiftene adoms fearing lest shoulde haue fallen rocke cast fower ankers sterne wished day shypmen flie ship whan let downe boate sea vnder colour though woulde haue cast ankers foreshippe paul sayed vnto vnder captaine souldiers except abyde shyppe ye safe souldiers cut rope boate let falle away whan fourtenth nyght cum well saylyng sea whiche called adriaticum mariner lokyng furth aboute myddenight supposed saw lande beyng mynded proue whether might safely arryue thyther let downe lyne plummet whiche shypmen call ye greke toung bolis cast water sounde founde twentye fadoms depe sayled litle farther let downe againe plummet sounded founde fiftene fadoms whan perceiued wexed shalower shalower fearing leste hytte vpon sharpe rockye place caste fower ankers sterne wysshed day might certainely perceiue countrey appeared ye mariner hauing smal hope saue shyppe forasmuche perceyued farre lande first thought saue themselues cause lette downe boate sea feynyng semblyng went aboute conueigh selues away pretendyng would lette ye ankers foreparte ye shippe tempest great paul perceyuyng entended knowyng ye mariner could missed must nedes helpe saue reste wer shyp warned vnder captaine saiyng except men abyde shyppe ye saued whan souldiers hearde worde swerdes cutte rope boate hong lette fall sea wha day began appeare paule besought al take meate saying fowertenth day ye haue taryed cotinued asting receiuing nothing wherfore praye take meate doubte elth shal heate fal fro head whan thus spoke toke bread gaue thankes god presence whan broken begonne eate tha al good chere also tooke meate wer altogether shyppe two hundred thre score syxtene soules whe eaten ynough lyghtened shyp cast wheate sea whan nyght litle litle vanyshed awaye day began breake paul exhorted eate sum meate sayed fowertene dayes sence ye eate thing ye styll fasting wherfore woulde councel take summe sustenaunce health dooe lest whan ye haue escaped tempest ye bee daunger lacke foode ye muste thinke mynde shoulde nede eate seeynge shall streyght wayes dye wyll promyse somuche heare heades shall peryshe whan paule hadde thus sayde tooke breade handes gaue thankes god syghte whan broken ensample iesus lorde began eate others beyng sumwhat reuiued encouraged partely paules exhortacion partely ensample began also eate noumbre shyp two hundred threscore syxtene whan taken susteinaunce eased shyp myghte approche nere vnto lande cast great quantitye wheat whiche brought egypt towardes italye egipt long continuaunce sure storer furnysher rome wheate grayne daye knew land spied certaine hauen banke whiche mynded possible thrust ship whe taken vp ankers thei comitted themselues vnto sea leused rudder boudes hoyced vp maine sayle winde drue land wha chaunced place sea side thrust ship fore part stucke fast moued dy der parte brake violence waues yt day sawe lande knew countrey thei perceiued certaine creeke reason banke stretched furth bothe sydes whiche creeke purposed yf possiblye might dryue shyppe toke vp ankers committed selues sea leused withal ioyntes sterne rudder ye intent might vse also pleasure ease guide turne ship whither thought best thei set vp ye saile thei turned also crosse piece wherupon sayle hangeth wynde hauyng ye wind hastened toward ye shore whan could ge creeke purposed violence wyndes wer driue place ye hong great way sea pytched ship ye fore part shyp fastened ground shalowe stoode stiffe hinder part leused asunder violence waues none remedy euery man shift swimme furth pand souldiers councel kil prisoner lest whan swimmed runne away vnder captaine wyllyng saue paule kepte purpose commaunded could swymme cast themselues first sea scape land oth commaunded go boordes broken piece ship came passe escaped safe lande souldiers thoughte best kyll presoners leste whan swimmed furth lande happen runne awaye captaine cruel vnmerciful counsel beyng desyrous saue paul forasmuch meane bene preserued lest one perishe commaunded ye suche coulde swymme wel first leape sea swymme lande could swimme partly take boordes lye partly help themselues instrumentes shyppe escape lande meane ye last came passe euery one came safe lande xxviii chapter whan escaped knewe yle called melite straungers shewed v litle kyndenesse kyndled fyer receyued v euery one present rayne colde whan paul gathered boundell stickes layed fier came vyper heate caught hande straungers sawe beast hang hande sayed amonge themselues doubt man murtherer whome thoughe haue escaped sea yet vengeaunce suffereth lyue shooke vyper tyer felt harme howbeit awayted whan shoulde haue swolue fallen downe dead sodaynly looked great whyle saw harme cum chaunged myndes sayed god whan wer gotten land knew yland afterwardes enquited inhabitours heard called melite thesame melite situate lyeth betwene epirus italy towarde northe parte sicile people therof pietiyng myschaunce entertayned v gentilly made great fier v brought v al together beyng sore handled meate coldthere came vyper heate caught hande whan paule gathered great boundel stickes cast fyer vyper whiche euen styffe colde laye hydden beyng stiered vp heate crept forth stynged hande paul inhabitauntes melite seeyng venemous beast hangyng styng hande paule sayde vndoubtedly must nedes bee true yt felowe sum murderer whiche though haue escaped ye daungier sea cast vp tempest yet vengeauce god suffereth remayne lyue soone paul perceyued vyper styng cast fier hurte people looked supposed would cum passe ye poison would get vaines body would strayght waye burne swell woulde sodaynly fall downe dead strength poyson percyng furthwyth hearte whan marked greate whyle see woulde becum paule sawe hurte stynging vyper like lyghtnesse eftfones chaunged mynde saied god inhabitours melite yet hearde fame iesus whiche gaue al professed name strength poyson wer neuer extreme deadly myght hurt quarter wer landes chief man yle whose name publius receyued v lodged v thre dayes courteously fortuned father publius lay sycke feuer blouddye ix paul entred prayed laye handes healed whan doen others also whiche disease yle came wer healed also v great honour wha departed laded v suche thynges necessary nere besydes shore arryued laye lordshippe belonging chief man yle named publius receyued v house space thre dayes entertayned v gentilly tyme publius father sicke agewe blouddye flixe sore kepte bedde paule hauyng mynde commaundement mayster came dyseased person whan made hys prayer god layed handes hym healed hym whiche thyng bruted abrode ouer land others lykewyse wer sycke came vnto paule healed wherefore long continued shewed v muche gentilnes whan made readye selues departe brought shyppe maner necessary three monethes departed shyp alexadria wintred yle whose badge castor pollur wha came syracusa taried thre day fro thence fette coumpace came rhegium one daye south wind blew came nexte day puteoli founde brother desired cary wt seuen dayes came rome fro thence wha brethre heard v thei came mete v appii forum three rauernes wha paul saw thanked god wexed bolde wha came rome vnder capitayne delyuered priesoners chiefe capitayne host paul suffered dwell hym selfe souldier kept hym wha continued three monethes ylande gotte shyp alexandria al winter harboured melite baner paynted castor pollux theyr badge whome grecian doe call dioscuros suppose prosper ye sayle sea whan appeare sitting ioyntlye together one crosse pyece whereunto sayle fastened whan entred shippe leused melite yt arriued syracusa citie sicilie harde vpon sea taryed three dayes leused syracusa shoring coastes sicilie came rhegium citie ye border italy situate liyng wythin ye territory belongeth brutians thence smale iourney sicilie syde bothe sicilie italy sumtime ioyned together vntyll suche tyme vyolence sea dyuyded one countrey breakyng betwyxte myle halfe cause grecias called rhegium thence day chaunced v haue good wynde saye sowthwinde sailed toune called puteoli mette christen men desired v tary certain space wherfore satisfyed request remayned seuen dayes thence wente streyght rome forasmuch brother wer rome heard wer cummyng thyther name paul wel knowen among al christen men rome reason wrytten afore ye time epistle vnto certayne came forth citie place called appii forum certain place called ye three rauernes mete v whan paul sawe muche coumforted perceiuyng yt also sum hertily fauoured gospel geuyng god thankes toke bolde hert hoped wel whan cum rome vnder captaine deliuered others wer bodes vnto chiefe captayne army paul libertie abid remayne libertie sauyng onely one souldier kepe three dayes paul called chiefe iewes together whan come sayd vnto men brother though haue comitted nothing agaynst people lawes ye elder yet delyuered prisoner fro ierusale handes romaynes whe examined would haue let goe cause death wha iewes spake contrarye constrained appeale vnto cesar haue ought accuse people cause haue called eue see speke hope israell bounde theyne forasmuche brought rome bandes wyth others lest iewes shoulde suppose thus serued sum trespace thyrde day called together heades iewes ye abydyng rome spake vnto wyse brother sayeth whereas haue commytted nothyng agaynste countreymen el tradicions forefather beyng cast bandes hierusalem deliuered handes ye romaine brought cesarea president felix afterwardes festus examyned matter would haue quitte asmuche eue themselues graunted founde nothyng worthy death whan ye iewes maliciously renouced cried agaynste compelled appeale cesar offended wyth countreymen matter yt intende lyke maner accuse anye thynge cesar encrease ye hatred beareth agaynst defende myne owne innocencie wyshe well men wt pure herte wurshyp god accordyng lawe countrey cause bearynge good affeccion zele towardes yet reason bandes beyng suche case ye myght come vnto visite willed sent syght comunicacion withal myghte somwhat coforted israelite earnestly wurshippe god despising idolles gentile trust fynall resurrection rewarded theyr good dedes hope countreymenne well nowe thus bounde ye see cheynes fault laye vnto charge saied vnto neither receyued letter iewry pertaining vnto neyther brother came shewed spake harme wyll eare thou thinkest concernyng secte know ye euery spoken appoynted hym daye came many lodgyng expounded testified kyngdome god preached vnto iesus law moises ye prophetes euen fro morning night beleued thinges whiche spoken beleued unto chiefe iewes aunswered wyse thou purgest thy self vnto v though man accused thou assured man hath much wrytten letter vnto v fro iewrye concernyng hurte done thy parte neyther hath anye man come thence hyther spoken hurte yet desyrous heare thy mynde euen thyne owne mouth cocernyng newe secte iesus nazareth whiche arose lyfe agayne assured euery man constauntly cryeth agaynst vaine thyng thou shalt therefore v good pleasure yf thou enstruct v certaynlye thy mynde therin thyng whan paule aunswered woulde gladlye vpon daye appoynted iewes resorted vnto hym agayne hys ynne taryed mo hadde cumen vnto hym vnto expounded doctrine ghospel witnessyng kyngdome god come ye messias ought longer loked forasmuche iesus nazareth proued figure moises law foresaiynges prophetes euydently expressyng whatsoeuer shadowed lawe spoken moyses prophetes playnly wholly fulfilled iesus nazareth whan paul largely spoken matter mornyng vntyll euenyng sum iewes beleued woordes paul sum beleued agred among theselues departed ye paul spoken one word wel spake holy goste esay prophete vnto father saying goe vnto people say eares shall heare shall vnderstande iyes shal ye see perceiue hert people wexed grosse eares haue lust heare iyes haue closed leste see wt iyes heare theyr eares vnderstande hertes shoulde conuerted heale knowen therfore vnto saluacion god sent gentile shal heare whan sayd wordes iewes departed hym great disputacions among selues paule dwelte two yeres ful lodgeyng receyued came vnto hym preaching kyngdom god teaching thynges whiche concerne lorde iesus al confidence man forbyddyng whan variaunce among themselues began departe paul added vnto long sermon woorde twoo wherein reproued hardenesse belefe whiche coulde finde hertes beleue manyfest testimony lawe prophetes beyng playnely fulfylled iesus holy ghoste sayed hath well prophecied prophete esai speakyng vnto forefather who stubberne mysbelefe resemble goe sayd vnto people saye vnto theim eares ye shall heare vnderstande iyes shall ye see perceyue herte people wexed grosse haue hadde wyth theyr eares lust heare theyr iyes haue closed left see heare eares perceyue herte conuerted myght heale wherfore well assured yt health whiche offered vnto god iesus shalbee caried vnto gentyles asmuche doe reiecte reiecteth beleueth neyther man apte receyue fauour beleueth gospell unto firste gyfte god declared lorde commaunded ye ought chiefly haue beleued whiche professed law prophetes ye kepe iyes closed shut vp agaynst thinges eares stopped hert hardened styll gaynesaying euident light truth ghospell gentile whiche neyther knowe god haue lawe prophetes shall turne theyr wourshyppyng idol fayth shall obtayne fauoure god ye refuse beeing frely profered vnto whan paule spoken woordes iewes departed hym beyng great disputacio among themselues continued ye space two yeares house hyred ientylly receyuing al came whether iewes vncircumcised preachyng vnto kyngdome god teaching boldenesse doctrine gospell forbidding letting alleging prophecy many yeres sence spoken iesus conferryng dedes woordes promyses thereunto pthe ende first tome paraphrasis printed london edwarde whitchurche cum priuilegio regali ad imprimendum solum nonlatin alphabet printer publisher device
